We then hopped on board and after practicing some steering through a row of plastic barrels we were on our way. We headed off into the wonderful countryside surrounding the stables and enjoyed numerous walks, trots and canters through the fields and woods, with Adrian enthusiastically filming us and taking lots of photos along the way. The horses were very obedient and Adrian offered to swap with me so I could try out his sprightly Arab that he was training for endurance riding.After about 1.5 - 2 hours we arrived back at the yard, jumped off our horses and headed inside the house for some delicious empanadas.I'm very much looking forward to visiting Adrian's place again when I return at Christmas, with Julia & Daisy.

Amazing!!. New way to discover horse hicking! Adrian & Myriam share their passion with you!! No stress, they take time to explain and to learn how to dp horse hicking depending of your skill. I really really recommand this actvity to discover Argentina and local culture,

A must do . This ride is a must to. The horses are really well trained and the activity was based on my expectations. I spent 5 hours with Adrian, Miriam and John and was alone for the ride with Adrian who is a great teacher. It's not a "tourist ride" where the horses follow each other. No, it's a true ride experience in a Reserve near Buenos Aires! If you are beginner or not (I used to ride for 10 years and didn't want a slow peace ride), you will find you in good hands. I was able to ride two horses and would definitely come back ! Thanks a lot Adrian and Miriam for this experience! Marianne.

Best horse riding experience I've ever had!. This was completely different to the usual plod around in a line that I was used to when going on holiday! The hosts were so welcoming and served us local tea before equipping us and heading to meet the horses. All the horses were extremely well looked after and very friendly. I had ridden before but my friend hadn't, but in a short amount of time the two of us were cantering through the beautiful fields!! Honestly, this was the best horse riding experience I've ever had and would thoroughly recommend!!

5 star horse riding near the city.. Adrian picked us up promptly in Buenos Aires for the 30 minute drive to his estancia. We enjoyed mate and then saddled up and off on the most wonderful afternoon of horse riding. The scenery was magnificent and Adrian could not have been a better host. His horse skills are beyond compare and he has a wonderful way of transferring these skills.I cannot recommend this experience highly enough, this is the kind of experience which entirely encompasses all the greatness of Argentina.

Wonderful hosts, wonderful horses, wonderful philosophy and passion. Adrian picked me up near my hotel and drove me out to their place. We spent a good amount of time chatting and sharing Mate. Such interesting people with a clear passion and love of horses and their philosophy was awesome. Seriously I am so glad I visited them. Left as friends. If you want to experience horse riding, or want to enjoy the beautiful park which is on their doorstep book this trip.

What an experience - Hands down, the best part of our trip!. Caballos A La Par was an absolutely great experience. Miriam, was such a warm and lovely host, that we truly felt like we were part of the family. From the second we walked in the door and sat down for some Mate, we knew this would be a wonderful attraction. As a beginner who had never rode a horse, Miriam provided all of the skills and tools necessary to feel like I had been riding for years. My wife, who was an intermediate rider, and I were able to walk, trot, and canter together through the gorgeous country side while Miriam snapped a number of photos and videos for us. After our ride (2 - 2.5 hours), we experienced a traditional lunch with the tastiest empanadas that were hand made by a sweet older woman who lived down the road. After a tall cerveza, we were driven back to the city where we parted ways. If we could give this experience 6 stars, we would. An absolute must do when in Buenos Aires!

Helt unik oplevelse. The two hosts that runs the place are amazing, so friendly and varm. They made it a very special experience to do horseback riding. We learned a lot and enjoyed riding around in the beautiful nationalpark. They have a true passion for the horses and the horses are so healthy and well taken care of. It was my boyfriends birthday, so they went and bought him a cake that we enjoyed afterwords with coffee. We felt like we were at home. A really nice day.

The best part of my trip!. I have been riding for a number of years, but this was completely different from anything I've done previously. I learnt more in a couple of hours here than in years of lessons!! Both Adrian and Miriam were so lovely and welcoming, I instantly felt very comfortable with them - it felt more like visiting friends. The horses are beautiful and extremely well trained, and they have ones suitable for all levels. Even if you only have 1 day in Buenos Aires I would highly recommend spending it here!! Thank you for such a wonderful experience!! :)

Must-do when in Buenos Aires!. My mother and I had an absolute great time horseback riding with Caballos a la Par! I have done horseback riding in Argentina before but this experience was by far the best. Unlike other horseback riding activities, Caballos a la Par offers personalized rides, which means that the horses do not follow each other in a line and you actually learn how to ride. We spent a good 2.5 hours in a beautiful national park just 40 minutes outside of Buenos Aires and I feel I have learned a lot. We enjoyed a beautiful sunset on the way back to the ranch. Miriam was very patient and sweet and she also taught us how to gallop, which was amazing! The horses and stables are super well kept and taken care of with love. If you love horses and you want to spend a relaxing day outside of the city, this is an absolute must do when in Buenos Aires.

A lifetime memory. Spending a day with Miriam,Adrian and the horses is definitely an unforgettable event that is organised perfectly by Adrian. My boyfriend and I felt very welcome on the estancia. We enjoyed the meal and relaxing on the poach. We still smile when thinking of the horse riding in the national park- not in a group of 10 or more, but only the 2 of us and Adrian. The trail, the horses, the advise given by Adrian, the landscape, the possibilities to practise your riding skills with the horses - just perfect. Definitely worth going there - for beginners and experienced riders. For sure a Must-Do in Argentina! We would love to come back again.

Such a great day and ride!. My boyfriend and I love horses and have some riding history in Europe so we definitely wanted to experience horse riding while we were in Buenos Aires :)Our day with Caballos A La Par was excellent! The horses are healthy, kind and happy, and riding with them was very natural and easy. We spent around 3h riding in a beautiful reserve after a quick lesson on Argentinian riding style. Adrian gave us constant feedback so we could improve our posture and style along the way. Miriam and Adrian are great persons. They are passionate, dedicated and were very kind to us and the horses. They welcomed us wholeheartedly and were very attentive to our confort and expectations. A great experience that I hope to live again and that I would strongly recommend, should you be looking for genuine connection with horses and with great people!Thank you Miriam & Adrian!Melodie

What a wonderful horseback riding!!. I had a great time there. The hosts, Miriam and Adrian, were so kind and made me so comfortable. The horses are well trained, so you will enjoy much even you are a beginner. I also learned Argentine style of horse riding which was so interesting. Riding in beautiful nature must be an unforgettable memory for me. If I have a chance to visit Buenos Aires again, I will definitely do horseback riding again at Caballos A La Par.

Fantastic day!. I had the most fantastic day with Adrian and Miriam. The stables and nature reserve are beautiful and the horses are so lovely to ride. The first 30 mins was a quick lesson on riding ' Argentinian style' and after that we were off, trotting and cantering around the most beautiful reserve. I even got the chance to swap horses half way round and rode this gorgeous Arabian for the rest of the morning! Such a brilliant day and I would highly recommend to anyone who loves horses and riding. Thanks again Adrian and Miriam!

Wonderful day of horseback riding. We had a wonderful day with Caballos A La Par. Adrian picked us up in Buenos Aires and drove us to the stables. The location is beautiful. Adrian and his business partner Miriam were gracious hosts and it was enlightening learning about their lives here. They also spoke perfect English. After some chatting and tea, we mounted our horses. Adrian took us out, and was an excellent trainer. We previously had very little experience with horses, but he made us feel comfortable, and challenged us as our knowledge grew. The horses responded very well to us. We rode through a beautiful nature preserve for about 2 hours, and worked up to cantering. Afterwards we had delicious empanadas before heading back to BA. Overall we highly recommend this experience.

Highlight of Two Weeks in Argentina and Brazil. As someone who never writes reviews I felt compelled to do one for for this. My wife and I decided against the cliche groucho tour, where by all accounts you get whisked in and out of a ranch like cattle. I stumbled upon the Caballos tour and thought we would give it a go. I have to admit as a bit of a sceptic I was a little put off by how amazing the reviews are as they seemed a bit too good to be true but I needn't have worried. The day started with us being an hour and half late for our pick up in town (it wasn't our fault due to crazy protests) but when we arrived Adrian, one of the owners/instructors/and our driver, couldn't have been nicer. We drove for a short while until we reached their ranch. We sat and had some mate (argentinian tea) with the other owner and our guide for the day Miriam. We got to know a lot about the business and their way of life and it was the perfect start to the day. We are both novices and utterly clueless when it comes to horse riding but we both had excellent horses who followed our instructions and Miriam had us galloping and riding around the beautiful national park in no time. Her guidance and help was just right and we spent a few hours just riding around the woods. Afterwards we spent time with the co-owners Miriam and Adrian talking about our riding and watching back videos they took of us riding. In addition to our riding they were both so generous with their time, before and after our ride, and it give us a brilliant insight into the business and themselves. Words perhaps don't quite do this day justice, but for me it was simplistic, relaxed and unbelievably enjoyable. If you do one thing in Buenos Aires i suggest this, even if you've never been on a horse before. It's a million miles away from the obvious tourist attractions you see on a normal holiday and for me will be the thing I remember most when I look back on this holiday. Oh and don't be put off by the amazing reviews. They are right! :)

Wonderful experience, ideal trip. Caballos a la Par is a fantastic experience worth every penny. The horses are very healthy and well-oven, the farm and the business is incredible, and Miriam is a great instructor filled with the vibrancy of life. She takes many photos and videos (to be honest, that is very nice and appreciated, but it would have been nice to just ride without having photos taken for a while, too; but that is a small complaint) and is a very patient teacher. I had not been on a horse for many years but within an hour I was feeling at home in the saddle. The park is very beautiful and close to Buenos Aires. If you have a morning or an afternoon to spare, you should go for a ride. You won't forget it.

Great experience. We had a great experience here with Miriam and Adrian!This is so different from everything else and it was an amazing day. At first we tough it was a little bit expensive but after we agreed that it was worth it, no doubt. Would absolutely recommend doing this if you are in Buenos Aires!

Best Day Trip from Buenos Aires!. Our whole family had a wonderful time horseback riding at Caballos A La Par. Adrian and Miriam are fantastic hosts and teachers. I was apprehensive due to my limited experience with horses but our hosts told us exactly what to do and made us felt safe. Furthermore, the estancia was beautiful and the nature preserve breathtakingly gorgeous. Towards the end of the outing we were cantering and I felt at ease and in control. We made great memories that afternoon, learned about riding horses and Adrian took great pictures of us. I highly recommend horseback riding at Caballos A La Par, it's an unforgettable experience!!

AMAZING experience learning how to ride a horse + beautiful surroundings!. I have been horseback riding other places, and this was absolutely the best horseback riding experience I have ever had. It was both an adventure and educational and the nature and surroundings were breath taking. The horses do not follow each other on a line on trails like most other places I have visited. You actually have to learn how to control the horse and make it listen to you. I felt safe the whole time being on the horse, because Adrian told us exactly what to do and when to do it. Adrian and Miriam are both wonderful people, and it was really nice getting to know them.The best part was the way they treated the horses, with positive reinforcement. The sabels were clean and tidy and the experience was absolutely one of a kind, and I would definitely recommend it to others, both beginners and advanced riders - as Adrian adjusts the riding to your level.

Fantastic Day Out. This was the highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. The hosts pick you up from the city and take you out to the nature reserve about 40 minutes out of town. Here on the newly built estancia, Adrian and Miriam showcase their excellent newly built facilities. Starting with a traditional matte, they skilfully walk you through what to expect, a tailored experience for your party. I am not a horseman and was anxious. There was no need. These horses have been trained with a classical Argentine methodology. They respond to the minute commands you offer them and are simply sensational. It led to a wonderful afternoon out riding in countryside, and really learning something, at the sine time feeling safe. Miriam is an excellent tutor. Within a couple of hours she had us cantering. It was exhilarating and we got the bug for doing it again, surely the hallmark of great teaching. Returning to the ranch for coffee and cake, we left by moonlight after a wonderful day out. Big thanks to both for a great learning and memory from BA. Couldn't recommend it more highly.

Another fan . Trust me, you want to go horseback riding. And forget the group-based touristy ranches; you want to go horseback riding with Caballos a la Par if what you're looking for is riding in a beautiful nature reserve, with well-behaved horses and skilled teachers who have a lot of heart.Until today I had zero experience with horses (quite frankly I've always been intimidated by them - hey, they're bigger than humans and I'm tiny). But before the end of it I felt confident of my abilities in the saddle. Miriam and Adrian (who both own the place) are sincerely interested in sharing their love of the horses and of teaching you how to ride with proper technique, with great attention to detail from the mate they serve to the proper technique in horse riding to the delicious homemade empanadas. You're in very good hands here and you're paying for quality care and one to one attention. This is definitely a must do if you love spending time outdoors. Thank you for a very special memory!

One-of-a-Kind, Can't Miss Experience!. This was a highlight of my trip to Buenos Aires and an unforgettable adventure! Miriam and Adrian provide a completely unique experience, from their warmth and hospitality to the personalization of your ride. They consider every little touch, including food, gear, and even making sure you have photos and videos of your ride. About 30 minutes outside of the city (transportation is included), their facilities are beautiful and their horses are some of the happiest and healthiest I've ever seen. Miriam and Adrian's joy and passion for what they do is palpable... and contagious. The riding session was incredible and challenging. This is not a passive activity-- you will learn a lot and improve in only a few short hours, and you'll have a blast. That said, if you're looking for an easy, more mindless experience, this isn't it. The park is stunning and Adrian was a great teacher. By taking solo riders or small groups, the personal attention he provides is amazing and allows you to really get the most out of your day. This was an unforgettable experience and I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Great horse-riding experience in Buenos Aires. This was our first trip to Argentina. We spent around two weeks there and had a lot to do between visiting friends and spots we wanted to see.However, it was unthinkable to leave without the chance to get on a horse back.Out of sheer luck we discovered "Caballos a la par" and decided to organise for a ride with them.The first thing that strikes is how kind and dedicated to their passion Miriam and Adrian are. And they sure know how to share it with you.My girl-friend and I had different riding experience and hadn't ridden for quite sometime. But they took the time to see what we wanted and what we needed.After that, riding was just great even though it was very different to what we are used to in Europe. You can feel how happy the horses are and how important it is for their owners to share their passion for them.On top of that, we got to ride in a beautiful location which would worth visiting at different time of the year to see it change.We enjoyed our ride very much and would recommend it to anyone looking for an off-track experience.

Favourite Activity of Trip so far!. We had such a wonderful day horse riding with Miriam. Practically everything about the day was perfect. The day we booked far in advance was cancelled because of the weather and Miriam was great at keeping in touch with us and doing her best to rearrange for us to come the next day. Adrian picked us up and was really friendly on the lift to the stables. It’s such a beautiful relaxing place set in nice countryside and with big paddocks where the horses roam free and there are four very friendly doggies. This is more than just a bog standard trail ride and we really felt that from the very beginning. Miriam and Adrian sat with us and taught us the Mate tea ritual and we chatted and got to know them a bit, all of it helps you relax as we are both horse riding beginners. Then it was on to the horses, I had Indiyo and my boyfriend had Isabelle. Both were good horses for us as beginners, I think they had been trained to be so, as it was quite easy to pick it up. Not too easy where you felt like the horse was following another horse but where they listened and responded to your commands. We did a few exercises to learn Argentinan/Western style of riding which is so much nicer and more comfortable than English style of riding and then we went out to the meadows in the surrounding area. It was so pretty to ride through all the scenery and we loved every second. Very quickly Miriam got us to trot and canter, was really encouraging and kept reminding us to sit up straight or to keep heels down! We did lots of fun exercises like cantering without the reins and Miriam took loads of photos and videos whilst constantly helping us improve. It was just such a fun experience!Then at the end we relaxed outside eating some of the best empanadas of our trip (beaten by only one other empanada we had in Mendoza!) and then sadly had to leave. We were so happy after we left, we would love to go back to learn more when we next come.It is quite pricey but it is completely worth it and it helps keep them in business which they need to be. Also try to make sure you arrange enough time to use the swimming pool and relax after as the timing of our day made the end a bit rushed which was unfortunate as we would have loved to have stayed for longer. Don’t miss out on this!

Absolute, Hands-Down MUST for your BA Trip!!. Wow, where to start?! First off, let me say it feels silly to call this a "horseback riding activity," because in actuality it is SO much more than that. Adrian and Miriam provide a full Argentine experience, that just so happens to include horseback riding (which is amazing, might I add!) From the moment we arrived at the beautiful, scenic ranch, it felt like we were visiting friends in another country. We sat around the kitchen table with Miriam and Adrian, and shared Mate (traditional Argentinian tea), just chatting and getting to know one another. Then, Miriam introduced us to the horses, and gave a brief, yet thorough and simplistic overview of how to ride. "Be a rider, not a passenger!" I should mention that neither my boyfriend or myself had ever really ridden before, but in just two short hours, we were cantering through open fields, riding fearlessly - even without hands at some points! It was amazing! After the ride, we again, sat back around the kitchen table to enjoy some incredible homemade empanadas! We were so sad to leave the ranch -- it really felt like we made great friends in Miriam and Adrian. If you are in Buenos Aires and have a half a day, I STRONGLY encourage you to book with Miriam and Adrian! It is absolutely worth every penny (and then some). We left with memories that will last a lifetime!!

Brilliant. Adrian and Miriam are superb at what they do - enthuse people with their love of horses and riding. Let me start by saying I am not a great fan of this. I have been on horse treks with friends where the horses are slogged out and tired, you taken over a well worn track that each animal knows every hoof placement by heart which leaves you feeling like a sack of potatoes on a horse food train or on a fair ground carousel without the lights, the up and down movement and music. Adrian and Miriam insist you ride. The horses are well trained with character and discipline. You instantly feel that these are horses who are loved and can move. Adrian was fastidious ensuring that each undestood the key elements of riding. Position in the saddle, hands, feet and movement. Once horse and rider were sorted Miriam took us for a good ride around the enormous open park, encouraging and correcting as we went. As confidence and competance dictated, the rding standard was lifed. Shortly it was galloping. Having fun. This was no nose to tail slow dawdle designed to bore you as much as the horse. These horses took off. They slowed and stopped when commanded. Changed direction as the rider wished. This was horse riding. Over two hours of serious fun. Simple the best ride ever for me. I was deeply impressed by the professsionalism the love Adrian and Miriam have for what they do. A genuine experience by people who love horses, riding and inspiring people to see and feel what they do. You can't ask for more than that. I would highly reccommed Caballos A La Par, Adrian and Miriam to any and every one.

Highlight of our trip!. We had very little experience riding horses, but by the end of the lesson we were cantering through the field and felt totally comfortable! Miriam and Adrian are wonderful instructors and are both great people to be around. This is guaranteed to be an amazing experience and definitely worth the money...

Best experience in Buenos Aires!!!. Picked up with ease we arrived at Caballos A La Par to find a beautiful stable of horses walking freely about the yard. Indio and Isabelle were chosen for us and we the perfect match for our amazing riding experience where we were taught how to be good, capable and comfortable riders. The park where you ride is beautiful and expansive. You are taught different tricks to do on your horse once you feel ready. We were completely inexperienced but the horses were extremely well trained and so very respectful of this. My partner and I couldn't fault the entire experience, a must do for any horse loving people out there with any range of experience! On a final note, the trainers/teachers were the most kind, positive, helpful and fun people to spend our day - and with a distinct and beautiful Argentinian flavor! World class experience! Would highly recommend their horses and company.

Riding experience. Fantastic riding experience. We were met in a very friendly and professional way. Great stables and horses. As beginners we got an amazing introduction to riding and how to communicate with the horse in natural surroundings. A highly recommended experience while visiting Buenos Aires :-)

Highlight of our holiday. The Caballos A La Par team will pick you up in Buenos Aires and after just a 40 minute drive, you will find yourself in the beautiful national park Pereyra. If you are just on a city trip, it feels you did get a sneak peak of Argenita's country side. My friend had never sat on a horse and I had an accident last time I rode, so we were a bit anxious. But that was absolutley not necessary. The team is really friendly and experienced and the horses are very well trained. The nice thing of having a private ride, is that the pace is adjusted to your level of experience. The two of us actually ended up cantering whilst holding our hands up in the air! It was truly amazing! We ended the day with an empanada lunch after which we were dropped off in BA again.

A must do while in BA!. If you have even the smallest interest in horses, nature or seeing a part of BA that few get the chance to see, Caballos a la Par is for you! From absolute beginners to seasoned riders, Adrian and Miriam will have you riding at levels you cannot possibly imagine before you are collected from the busy inner city of BA and transported to the national park to the south. Their methods of teaching is very impressive and they know how to get the best out of you - the photos I have seen posted already do not lie as by the end of the day you can be cantering with your hands out like a seasoned pro! Adrian and Miriam are also extremely generous, love what they do and love the horses they keep. Not to mention after four hours riding through the beautiful national park they invite you to eat (the best empanadas I've had in BA) and drink with them, and they also have what must be the best pool in BA which you can swim in (just remember to tell your partner so they can bring togs and swim too...ha). A truly wonderful experience and I cannot recommend it enough. Muchas gracias mi amigos, Adrian and Mirriam!!

Amazing way to enjoy the equestrian spirit of Argentina. This is one of the best options for families (especially those with kids, even young ones) looking to experience the equestrian culture of the country. It is a wonderful day out and quite the adventure.

One of the most memorable days you will ever have!. You must go! You will feel like you are plucked out of the hustle of downtown Buenos Aires and transported to somewhere incredible. It is like you are let in on a secret. Everything about the place is unbelievable – the horses, Adrian and Miriam, their staff, the food (homemade Empanadas), the pool and the Argentinean countryside. Adrian and Miriam are awesome! They are two of the most interesting people I have ever met in my travels. They have a tremendous passion for horses, are open, funny, good listeners, smart and understand the true meaning of life. Quite incredible people!When I read the other reviews (which are all excellent), the common thread is that Adrian and Miriam allow you to step outside of your comfort zone in a safe environment. It is usually in those times that we create the most memorable memories. Beginners are able to canter across the fields, and often with no hands! I asked Miriam to teach me how to gallop on Indio! Something I have never done before and will never forget! They have spent years training their horses to take care of the rider so that people could experience the exhilaration of riding. I have two horses and I don’t feel as safe on them as I did on Indio. Make no mistake, these are not your dull trail horses either that have no life to them. They are horses who know their purpose and live very happy lives.I have been lucky to ride with different outfitters during my travels and Caballos A La Par by far is the best around! By the end of your day, you will wish you could take them and the horses’ (and dogs) home with you or quit your job and stay there forever!PS – If you go, be sure to say hola to Julio who keeps the place looking immaculate. He is the Rod Stewart of Argentina 

Wonderful experience!. This experience was the the highlight of our time in buenos Aires! Miriam and Adrian are wonderful people who clearly have a passion for their horses and their students! After drinking mate we started our lesson with Miriam. She showed an incredible understanding of our lack of skill and helped us feel comfortable on the the horses. During the lesson we were able to canter without hands. The horses are exceptionally well trained and we had a truly great time. If you ever are in the buenos Aires area we can't recccomend caballos a la par enough. You won't ever regret booking a lesson with them!

Perfect horse riding, even with limited experience!. We had a wonderful day of horse riding at Caballos A La Par, which is a beautiful place an hour from downtown Buenos Aires.Miriam and Adrian took really good care of us with their experience, humor and thoughtfulness! We are not experienced riders but thanks to Miriam/Adrian and perfect horses we really enjoyed the ride! We rode in a beautiful national park for a couple of hours and tried the canter. Very fun! Afterwards we had drinks and homemade empanadas by the pool. The whole experience was casual and easygoing - Miriam and Adrian had plenty of time, which we appreciated. Bring your camera and Miriam/Adrian will help you taking pictures. All riding equipment is available. Both Miriam and Adrian speak fluent English.Adrian picked us up in downtown Buenos Aires and drove us back to our hotel. Very comfortable! All in all - a very nice experience, which we recommend!Thank you Miriam and Adrian!!Viveca and Hans

The best part of our trip!. We can't say enough good things about our afternoon riding horses with Miriam at Caballos A La Par! Miriam and Adrian are two of the nicest people you could ever ask to meet. They clearly love their horses and are committed to making a personalized experience for every guest. We rode though a beautiful forest, trotted in a field, and walked a narrow path through bamboo. We created memories that we will cherish. I knew I wanted to go horseback riding around Buenos Aires, and I did all the research before choosing this company. Yes, you might find a little cheaper elsewhere (if you want to limit yourself to impersonal group head-to-tail walks on a ranch); but this is a steal for what they offer (real riding, personalized to skills and interest, in a beautiful setting). I am so glad I followed the rave reviews and chose to go with Miriam and Adrian!I don't see the pool mentioned elsewhere, so let me add that the pool was the perfect temperature and so refreshing after a long horse ride! The beer and snack brought out poolside was a nice treat! Book this. You will thank yourself later.-Matt and Nell

Most personalized riding experience in South America!. We spent the morning riding with Miriam (her co-worker was on vacation). She's super nice, super interesting to talk to (speaks multiple languages, well-traveled, intelligent, etc.), and really fun to ride with. Communicating with her about the ride is also easy. You are picked up somewhere near your accommodations, and driven to their land.I'm an average rider, my 11 y.o. daughter experienced. Miriam was great with both of us, and provided my daughter with an amazing riding experience (which is what I had hoped for, but did not specifically request) . The forest and meadows are fun to ride through, but the very best part is that the ride is really about you. She incorporates all aspects of riding: safety, growth, and fun. We were also able to mingle with the horses before and after the ride. Perfect.When you're done, there's a simple, but yummy Chilean lunch awaiting. And if that's not enough, you can take a dip in the pool too.Great riding experience, great life experience, great memory. Don't miss it!PS I think they would accommodate any age kids, adults, individuals, or groups beautifully

Amazing experience - must do. Thank you to Adrian and Miriam for an amazing experience. The horses were so well trained that even as non-riders we were able to trot and canter through the countryside. It was hard work, but so rewarding and such fun at the same time. Adrian welcomed us warmly and when we had finished riding there was time for a dip in the pool and some food. Could recommend this without hesitation and can't praise it highly enough. If this is something you think you might like to do, it's best to book for the start of your holiday as if the weather is not good you need time to re-book as you really would not want miss out on this experience.

The only way to actually ride in Buenos Aires!. Myself and a friend wanted to ride horses while traveling in Buenos Aires. This was the only place that would match you with an appropriate horse for your riding skill level and then allow you to ride the horse and not just follow eachother in a line at a walk. My friend had no riding experience, while I had 10+ years, so I was able to ride ahead and our guide, Miriam, taught my friend how to ride on a very easy, well-trained horse. The horses are great and the business is very locally owned. You are given drinks and food to eat before and after you ride, but be mindful that you will not be able to bring any water during the ride, so be hydrated! I had a great time and would definitely go back, as an experienced rider! Everything was easy and fun for the both of us.

A must do when in BA! . Me and my friend had a wonderful day at caballos a la par! It was the perfect end of our travels and I would definately go there again if I travel to Argentina. I've done a lot of horseriding in my life and my friend has not but this is a place that really suits both beginners and experienced riders, and you will both enjoy the ride. There is a lot of touristy riding places where they randomly put people on a horse and let them ride in a long line, and at the end the beginners will not learn anything and the experienced riders wont get anything out of it. This place is the total opposite of that! Adrian was a perfect teacher, riding side by side with us and teaching the style of riding (western) at the same time. And he works magic, my friend who hasn't been riding for 25 years time where able to trot and canter all by herself and in control of her horse! As for me, I really enjoyed the western style and also the freedom to canter ahead in the park. The horses were just so fantastic and beautiful! This place is really a must do! It's a beautiful way to spend a day from the busy city of Buenos Aires and get some countryside calmness whilst hanging around with friendly people and amazing horses (and dogs)! Thank you Miriam and Adrian for having us!

What a feeling !!!. What an experience, unbelievable. During my stay in Buenos Aires I spent one day at Caballos a la Par. Adrian and Miriam are perfect hosts.The trip started with a tea ceremony (In this part of the world it means: drinking maté and get to know each other). Then it was time to meet my horse. In my case: Isabella. Before hand Adrian and Miriam had figured out which horse was perfect for me. ( You don't have to be a perfect, experienced rider ). And then it was time to set off. Not in a group but only Miriam and me. This is one of Caballos a la Par specialities: You don't ride in a group.A ride through a national park, through beautiful nature: After 4 hours of great riding we're back at the stables. Time for a drink and empanades, mmmm. Afterwards they drove me back into the city.

Honeymoon Highlight. Myself and my husband spent one day of our Buenos Aires visit with Miriam and it was fantastic!! I, having never been on a horse before, was extremely nervous but after a mere 45 minutes I was at ease trotting through the beautiful forest park. Miriam is a lovely person, very friendly and confident with the horses. The horses are just lovely too! Add in the lunch and the swimming pool and this was the highlight of our visit in Argentina! I would highly recommend!

Fun, Friendly and Safe. Adrian and Miriam were wonderful! Adrian was a fantastic teacher for both this first timer and my wife as an experienced rider. They truly care for and love the animals and it shows in their instruction and facilities.

Riding has a whole new meaning for me.... We had the most wonderful riding experience ever at Caballos a la Par. Miriam and Adrian welcomed us like family to their stables. Our experience and training started the minute we arrived. Over Yerba mate, we discussed our past riding experience and level of comfort with riding (we were beginners!). They chose two beautiful horses that we perfect for us: Isabel and Indio. Adrian was our teacher and guide. We saddle the horses up and practiced a bit before the three of us headed out to some beautiful countryside. Literally before we knew it we were cantering with no hands across a meadow.... I can't say enough about this experience. My daughter and I both agreed that we would have paid double the price for this adventure. A special shout out to weso the greatest dog ever. In general, all of the animals and people at this wonderful stable have wonderful energy about them. Cheers Caballos a la Par.

Amazing day . My boyfriend and I visited Caballos A La Par to learn horseback riding. Adrian was a tough teacher but was very encouraging and care about us learning everything properly so we wouldn't hurt ourselves or the horses. They care a lot about the horses and the business and it was a pleasure being able to see their passion. The whole process from the pick up in BA to the welcome mate ceremony to the actual horseback riding was intimate couldn't have asked for a better day in BA!

Highlight of our time in Argentina. Caballos A La Par was the highlight of our time in Argentina. Miriam picked us up from Buenos Aires and drove us back. Besides making us instantly better riders, Miriam and her team were so much fun and made our experience truly unforgettable. Although we had ridden a few times before, the whole family left feeling confident and like we had reached a completely new level in our riding abilities. Thanks Miriam for giving us such a great time!

One of my greatest experiences in Argentina.. To meet Adrian and Miriam was something absolutley amazing. Their energi and hospitality was amazing. Riding horses with Adrian was one of a kind. He taught us so much. Never thought that i would ever be good at riding a horse. I felt extremely comfortable. I will be back.. definetley. Thanks to Adrian riding horses became a passion.. I will be back without a doubt. Thank you Adrian and Miriam for such an amazing experience. thank you for the amazing ride.

Best experience we have ever done - honeymoon highlight!. if you are thinking about doing a horse riding experience in Argentina - then you HAVE to go to these guys as they are amazing !!!! The tour was personal , relaxed , fun and so friendly - we had such a lovely time . The main difference here is that you do proper horse riding - wether a keen rider or little experience you are in safe hands. We can't wait to return and stay longer !!! Louise and Brendan Mills x

Muy Bien - a must do even for novice or expert riders. I am a complete novice but within 2 hours for the first time in my life I was riding with confidence in myself and the horse while my wife is more experienced she was riding with no hands on the reins as an exercise. I had never done more than a trail nose to tail but a la par means side by side across open and wooded terrain and you are taught how to do this and connect with the horse . The horses are exceptionally well trained but you still must learn how to communicate and control your activity.So this like a very private lesson just you and instructor not a group of strangersAdrian and Miriam are very welcoming and at no point are you made to feel you are running out of time - two hours means on the horse while we spent an hour before and after getting to know our instructor and of course the other way round so that the horse is chosen for you your ability and especially your character. If you like me have never connected with riding before try this experience - it is far better than a dude ranch unless you want a show etc this is very personal and enjoyable If you have time while in BA try this even before tango!Tip - allow time to get to pick up point and book direct to get all the details

One of the highlights of our honeymoon. We were heading down to Patagonia and wanted to try riding in Buenos Aires before we got down there. Neither of us had ridden before and we arrived with quite modest expectations about what we'd be able to accomplish. This experience was so memorable because, from the very beginning, Miriam gave us the techniques and the confidence to really take control of the horse. As novice riders this was a huge thrill, and we came away having trotted and cantered across the beautiful reserve for hours - vowing that we would do it again (which we did in Patagonia!) Caballos a La Par was one of the highlights of our Argentine honeymoon and will live long in the memory. Miriam is an outstanding teacher and a generous host - we felt in professional hands the entire time - and it's clear she has a love for her beautiful horses. Such a fun activity within easy striking distance of Buenos Aires - this is a strong recommendation.

A day out to remember!. As a keen horse rider back in my school years, it was great to be back in the saddle again and thoroughly enjoyed my day! Gorgeous location and beautiful horses to suit all levels of experience. Miriam the host is one of the friendliest and welcoming human beings I have ever met and this made the experience even better, I really didn't want to leave when the day had come to an end!! Highly recommend this to anyone passing through Buenos Aires on their travels!

Fabulous experience- a must do in Buenos Aires!. I've never thought of going horse riding but my friend did so I kept her company. And what an experience!!!!! Loved every minute of it! It was an absolute pleasure to meet Adrian and Miriam. Adrian is a fantastic teacher! I sat on the horse once in the past (when I was 12) and had no idea how to ride but after 1 hour with Adrian I was galloping and felt so comfortable in the saddle! Insane, I know :) We were welcomed with the best enchiladas prepared by their 90yo friend (I had 6!!!! Calories burnt riding came straight back at me, haha!) and beer afterwards :) we also got offered to use jacuzzi and the pool. The love and passion these people have for their horses is incredible! I will always go back when I'm back to Buenos Aires! Pictures and reviews don't do justice- you have to do it! A must in Buenos Aires!

Best horseback experience!. This day was very special! I was bucked off a horse last time in Hawaii and quite worried this time. Miriam is a masterful guide and our ride was more of a lesson, attentive and really fun. The pool afterwards and empanadas were great additions. She's an angel!

Wonderful Experience. If you love nature, horses, and great people - this is an experience you won't want to miss! We got picked up in Buenos Aires by a personal driver who took us to the reserve. Miriam and her happy dogs were there to meet us. We Sat around the table and got to know each other. We shared a mate. Then it was time to meet the horses. We Satoru around the table and got to know each other. We shared a mate. Then it was time to meet the horses the horses. Miriam takes great care to understand not only your height, weight and riding experience, but your personality. And then she matches you with a great horse.  Imagine riding in a natural preserve without a real trail. It's freedom and a horse! If you don't know what you're doing, Miriam is right there, being patient, and guiding you Ion riding techniques. After not being on a horse for over 20 years I was able to trot and Gallup. What fun! And what beautiful scenery.When finished riding, we enjoyed empanadas & a dip in the pool.The experience was personalized and limited to just our small group of 2. It was one of my favorite adventures while visiting Argentina.

Great Experience but $$. Don't get me wrong, this is a great experience for those travelling to BA and we loved our time with Miriam but having done some many rides around the world, we're not sure if it was worth the price? Let me explain... PROS*The tour is run privately, just you and your partner/family which means you get a lot of time to practice cantering, trotting and there is a lot of flexibility within the group. This meant we could canter on the way home and we loved it. The ride isn't a trail ride, it's more than that and probably the one ride which has allowed us to really want to do more riding when we return home. *Miriam takes some amazing photos and videos of your experience that you will keep forever. She is also a wonderful teacher who instills you with confidence. *Miriam rescues a lot of horses who aren't treated well and gives them a better life. She really does love her horses and treats them with so much respect. My wife thought of the extra cost as a "donation to helping the horses life a better life" and that helped her accept the premium.*The horses are great and very well suited to the experience. CONS*The fee had to be paid in cash. Given the current economic climate in Argentina, I understand the problem with banking, paypal etc. but withdrawing all those pesos is a nightmare for travellers and carrying that much cash isn't ideal.*Having paid a little over and above, we would have loved something a little extra - perhaps a wine or a beer upon completion? Or even the opportunity to sit outside by the pool? We're not really sure what was missing, but a little something extra would have made us feel more comfortable with spending the extra $$.*Miriam is lovely and we had a great day, but we noticed she did spend a lot of time on her phone. We understand she was running the business on her own at that time, but her full attention would have meant a few of our cons listed above were addressed at that time - enhancing our experience.  At the end of the day, we enjoyed our time with Miriam but the cost was just a little expensive given whats available everywhere else in the world. Would have happily spent the day with another couple to reduce the premium.

An Amazing Ride Through the Countryside. My cousins (16, 20 & 21) and I spent a wonderful afternoon with Miriam from Caballos a La Par riding through the Argentinian Countryside. We were picked up from the designated location in Buenos Aires and taken to the ranch about 35 minutes outside the city. Miriam served us traditional mate tea and snacks as we discussed our riding background. All four of us had some riding experience, but had not been horseback riding for many years. Horses were selected to meet our various riding levels, and we were soon geared up & ready to head out. The ride is through a beautiful park with trees, fields and streams. Miriam is an excellent teacher and we were soon trotting and cantering through fields and streams. It really is like a movie setting. We spent a week in Buenos Aires and this was definitely a highlight of the trip. I've already recommended Caballos a La Par to friends (as it was recommended to me) and hope to go again the next time I'm in Buenos Aires.
Yet Another Caballos a la Par Fan. It's all been said but I have to add my voice to the chorus. Great hosts, great horses, wonderful instructors. What a wonderful way to spend a day.

Awesome for riders of all levels!. My fiance and I had spectacular day with Miriam and Bart. I had only been on a horse two times prior to our ride- my skill level was basically Don't Fall Off. Miriam is am amazing and thorough instructor. By the end I was galloping! She is also a great videographer- my family couldn't believe the videos I sent them that she took with my phone! I learned a lot about the horses and came a long way in my confidence in riding. The route we took was beautiful and the ranch is also very nice. My fiance had ridden many more times than I had but he still learned a lot as well. Both of us enjoyed our rides and felt like we really got a true Argentinian horseback riding experience!

Amazing Experience for new rider!. I've only ridden a horse two times before this experience. Adrian made me feel completely at ease, with great instruction. My horse was clearly well trained and responded well. By the end of the lesson I was cantering and letting go of the reigns. Furthermore, Adrian and Miriam make you feel so welcome, sharing a mate and an after ride snack. I really enjoyed the day and couldn't recommend it more!

Amazing day! . After experiencing the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires for several days, it was an absolute pleasure to escape to the countryside for a few hours of horseback riding. My bf and I both considered ourselves to be extreme beginners, however by the end of the tour, Miriam had us cantering along without holding onto the reins! From the convenient pick up location in the city, to the incredibly delicious fresh beef empanadas and of course, the beautiful scenery, the day was simply perfect. Miriam was not only a great teacher, but also very friendly and welcoming. We would highly recommend this activity to anyone visiting Buenos Aires. You will not regret it!

Authentic Argentinian Horse Riding Experience. An awesome horse riding afternoon in a wild and peaceful park, with highly-trained horses and very dedicated one-on-one instructor. All within less than an hour from Bs As.I was not sure what to expect since that was my first horse riding experience ever. I learnt how to walk, trot and gallop, and I was able to fully enjoy it after a couple of hours.Miriam and Adrian were incredibly nice and welcoming, organised and responsive to emails, passionate about horses and devoted to delivering a personalised experience.If I go back to Bs As, I would certainly go for it again :)

Wonderful day in the saddle!!. We booked this activity based on high tripadvisor rating and we were not disappointed. The lesson was private for two of us (all lessons are private). I had never been on a horse before but by the end of the day Miriam had me cantering on Savio (one of the bigger horses). I started out on Lindo (a smaller horse) and Miriam took me through all the basics as we walked, trotted and cantered in the park. Miriam is very friendly and a great hostess. She will have you cantering on a horse by end of day. Loved the dip in the pool after and Miriam's 70 year old neighbour cooked delicious empanadas for lunch. Tip: avoid eye contact with Bert. He is a pro tango dancer working on the ranch and loves nothing more than a midday tango

An amazingly fun way to discover horse riding next to BA. We booked this horse riding experience on a Sunday morning. Adrian picked us up and took us to the amazing and peaceful domain where they take care of their horses. There, we had delicious maté with Adrian and Miriam and got ready (protections for the legs, helmet...).Then, we got on the horses and started the ride in a beautiful and wild park. We enjoyed the beauty of the place, the expert advice we received, Miriam's gentleness and the passion they transmit to each customer. With no previous experience of riding horses, we were surprised with how fast we were making progress. After the ride, we had a few empanadas with Adrian and Miriam, and enjoyed the pool for a while before Adrian rode us back to BA. It was a really memorable experience and we will recommend to all of our friends when they travell to BA.

Outstanding Argentinian riding adventure!. For anyone who loves horses or who wants to enjoy a fabulous ride through fantastically interesting and beautiful park surroundings, this equestrienne activity should not be missed! Adrian and Miriam are not only warm and personable people who truly love their clients, they are also knowledgable and incredibly skillful riders. I am an experienced rider and I learned new skills that made my ride a vigorous and exciting one. It was an added treat to enjoy the traditional drink of mate with them and to feast on home made empanadas afterwards. This is an exceptional experience that should be an absolute priority while in Buenos Aires no matter your level of riding. The pick up in Buenos Aires is very easy to get to and Aadrian dropped me off at my hotel so transportation is not required. Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful! I loved it! Kam from Lloyd Neck, NY

Enjoyable and worthwhile experience!. Really enjoyable experience....My wife and I have never done horse riding before and so we thought why not in the Argentinian countryside. Miriam and Adrian were so welcoming and made us feel at ease at the thought of cantering around their beautiful ranch. After sharing some mate with them and selecting the right horse for us, Adrian taught us how to communicate with the horse and within an hour or two we felt completely comfortable trotting and cantering around the beautiful countryside. Adrian was very patient in teaching us the basics since we were complete novices and we couldn't believe how much we learned during our afternoon with him. We loved the entire experience and would wholeheartedly recommend this activity. The price of the experience is completely worth it since the lessons are private with either Adrian or Miriam so you get all the attention you need according to your horse riding experience. A perfect day out in Argentina! Muchas gracias Adrian and Miriam!
The best experience! . The best experience I ever had! In 3h with Adrian I learned more than one year in the horse riding school.Will be only the reasons to come to Buenos Aires :)))

Best Western Riding Experience in Argentina . A must see and visit when in Argentina to learn and perfect western style of riding. Adrian and Miriam are very wonderful hosts. Highly recommended to everyone of all ages and riding abilities

Absolutely amazing!. Me and my mum did this our last day before returning back to Sweden. How I wish we would have gone earlier so we could have enjoyed this amazing experience earlier!As my mum is experienced with horses whereas I'm not I was fairly nervous before getting up on the saddle. I had no reason to be though, as Adrian was a great teacher and the horses extremely well trained. I learned a lot and would now love to continue horseback riding. Thanks to both Adrian and Miriam for your hospitality and for giving me and my mum a great ending to our trip!

Fantastic Experience. This is a must do if you are visiting Buenos Aires and if you're into horse riding. I was there on Friday the 20th of November. The owners are great people - they treated us with mate before the ride and with empanadas after the ride. The ride was long, really pleasant and very instructive. Miriam was my instructor and she was great.Definitely a highlight of my visit to Buenos Aires.

Fascinating riding experiense. It is amazing how the folks at Caballos make you master a horse so fast. It makes you wonder what the limits are and how they communicate the skills needed to perform. A must experience when you travel to Buenos Aires.

Not to be missed . Riding with Caballos al par is one of the best things we did in BA. They are extremely professional, very friendly and very patient. It was our second time we ride a horse and they tought us many important things on how to handle a horse and how to communicate. I recommend this experience to every person who visits BA and like horses.

Why would anyone NOT take advantage of what Caballos A La Par has to offer??. Everyone should take advantage of such a opportunity to ride in the beautiful countryside with well trained horses in the presence of a highly education equine specialist such as Adrian. I arranged this with Miriam, his partner before traveling to Buenos Aires. Adrian picked me up at the Cruise ship port and brought me to his beautiful ranch. We shared a traditional drink of Meta to start off, discussed what my expectations were. As a rider I was open to learning and experiencing everything that was offerred. Fantastic atmosphere to ride in, warm and delicious empanadas to eat and extremly loving and charming people to share stories with. I would of paid double of what they asked for to experience this. I wish I lived closer and would go there every week to ride and take lessons. This opportunity is a hidden gem that should be experienced and known to everyone that visits this area. I wish I could send my horse to be trained by Adrian who can read a horse's emotions and trains with humanity. This riding experience is the best I've ever had the opportunity to be involved with in my life and I've been riding for over 34 years. I didn't want to leave and can't believe there isn't a waiting line at the gate. Don't pass up this amazing experience to really learn how to ride and experience how you can become one with beautiful well trained animal. Thank you Adrian and family for making me feel special. Please rememaber to tip generously. I personally think they should be charging more for this experience. My heart is full after meeting Adrian, his family, and amazing ranch and horses.

Wonderful Experience!. We had an amazing time at Caballos A La Par! We were a group of five, some of us good riders and others without any experience. To my surprise during the last part of the ride we were all cantering together! The instruction is great and makes you improve your riding quickly. I am an experienced rider but also learned a lot. There are horses for riders with different levels of experience, all of them so well-behaved. The park is beautiful and the people are friendly. For all of us this was the highlight of our stay in Buenos Aires!

My favorite experience in Buenos Aires. I don't ride horses very often (just as an occasional vacation activity), and as such I don't actually know very much about it. After a half day riding at Caballos a la Par, I'm certainly not an expert, but I have gained an entirely new appreciation for the art of riding. The environment was beautiful, the people warm and welcoming, and the horses absolutely lovely. An amazing afternoon!

Excellent Horseback Classes and Experience. I'd ridden a couple times before but nothing formal, and wow did I realize I had been not doing things wrong per say, but missing out on quite a bit of very useful information, ranging from how to hold the stirrups, how to position my legs, to how to even just sit on the horse. Adrian was an excellent instructor who provided continuous encouragement but also corrections so by the end of just one lesson, I felt that I had improved vastly! You learn a lot each lesson, so with just a couple you already feel that like you're a experienced rider! The horses are all beautiful and clearly well-cared for. I had the joy of riding Indio, who was well-tempered and quick to listen to my commands. The park that you ride in is also just a treat with lush grass and beautiful trees as well. The A la Par staff are also incredibly friendly and accommodating, almost so that you feel like you're visitng a friend's house, and I greatly look forward to my next visit! I highly recommend you take advantage of this opportunity while in Buenos Aires.

Argentinian style riding! Brilliant !. My wife and I have not "sat" ( we could not ride ) on a horse for over 20 years, but after this experience we are hugely enthusiastic and will go again. The reception was warm, the horses are wonderful and the tutoring is brilliant. We managed to walk, trot and canter with the horses during the 2 hour + lesson. Riding (with the instructor at your side) through the National Park makes you feel totally free. Collected and dropped off from Buenos Aires in 30 min. Can not fault it. Highly recommended.

Efficient and wonderful horse riding course and experience. Exceptional horse riding individual course which allowed me to get out of Buenos Aires, improve my horse riding skills incredibly faster than anywhere else I could have tried and in a much better surrounding and meet interesting and passionate instructor, both dedicated and pleasant, with great discussions before and after the course and traditional mate experience and cakes! Couldn't ask for much more than that! Yes... there is also a swimming pool to enjoy afterwards!But, above all, special thanks to the one without whom I couldn't have made all these improvements... the beautiful, sweet and adorable Isabelle, who was very patient with me (couldn't be a coincidence that the horse chosen for me would have the same name as my great-grand-mother after whom I also named the historical novel I'm supposed to be writing!! :-))Precision: I had only mounted around 10 times in my life and never galoped; here after less than 2 hours, after practicing walking, trotting, galoping, I did galop without holding the reins!Don't hesitate as you will also help passionate people struggling in a country where things are not easy!!

The best horseback experience of my life. In short, if you're looking for a plain old trail ride, this is not the place for you. If however, you want to experience a true horseback riding experience, please read on.....To give some context, I used to take riding lessons when I was a kid but stopped riding as an adult and have probably ridden 5 times in the last 5 years. I spend about 1/2 of the year in Argentina and got the bug to pick it up again. I signed up for 4 private classes with Adrian and Miriam at Caballos a La Par and I am absolutely blown away at how much I have learned in such a short period of time. Their horses are impeccably trained. The park where you ride is beautiful and offers a wide variety of terrain (plenty of room to gallop, stream crossings, forests, etc). Their base where you are greeted is warm and inviting and you will feel like you are visiting friends while there.I have nothing but praise for the unique experience they provide and am so thankful that I found Adrian and Miriam. They are very special people who have followed their passion and do an amazing job at passing that same passion along to others.

Perfecto !. If you want to get out of the city to the countryside of Buenos Aires and experience some outdoor nature fun , this is the activity for you...Adrian picked me up at meeting point right on time...we drove 20 minutes or so to the ranch....Horses are very very well taken care of and barn is super clean...Im not an expert on horse riding just love them and wanted to learn how the horses were trained..etc...We trotted , posting trot , cantered...worked on posture and hand placement...things I needed ...the park was just starting to bloom and everything was green....we rode around creeks, bridges, bamboo forest....really nice trails...This is a very personalized lesson...anyone will benefit from the expert to the beginner rider ...we ended with a nice lunch...Adrian is very professional....has a gift for riding and teaching...teaching seems to be his passion....He truly loves his horses...a very kind man.. I highly recommend Caballos A Lar Par...it was fun and relaxing...If back in Buenos Aires I will do it again !!

Incredible experience with unforgettable memories! Highly recommened!. Having read previous review on trip advisor my father and I decided to book with Caballos A La Par. We were so pleased we did as we had such a fantastic experience, and learned so much more than would ever be possible in the UK and had loads more fun too! Overall an extremely highly recommend activity if you are visiting Buenos Aires!

Excelente experiencia!!!. I started to take private horseback riding classes in September with 'Caballos A La Par' and it did not take long for me to feel part of the ‘A La Par’ family. I had never ridden horses before and was quite nervous upon arrival. It only took a 15 minute chat with both Adrian and Miriam – who were incredibly welcoming and friendly - to calm down my nervousness. In fact, by the time I was on the horse Isabela (who is a lovely, well-tempered mare) I was eager to gallop! My first private class was with Adrian and he took the time to teach me the very basics of horse-riding; from getting onto the back of the horse, to holding the reins, and adjusting the stirrups. We then spent a good amount of time going over a proper riding posture. Till this day, I appreciate Adrian’s insistence on getting this posture right from the very beginning, because - now that I ride more frequently - I realize that such posture is very important to be able to ride well. The class was very fun and Adrian pushed me to my limits that by the end I was able to canter! I was honestly surprised with myself. I had thought I wouldn’t be able to achieve much in the first few hours of riding, but was completely wrong! I continue to take clases with A La Par and feel very much at home every time I am there. I would highly recommend getting in touch with Adrian, Miriam or the rest of the A La Par team for horseback riding lessons or any form of cabalgata.

Top Quality Horseback Riding Lesson near Buenos Aires. I had never been on a horse before coming to Caballos A La Par and ended the lesson cantering without reigns and feeling a connection with my horse Lindo! I never expected to learn so much in one lesson, even after having read the reviews on this site. Miriam and Adrian are great hosts and teachers. All the horses are very well taken care of. If you ever thought about learning to ride, you have to come to this place. Thanks Miriam and Adrian for an amazing experience.

Incredible horseback riding lesson close to Buenos Aires!. Usually, I don't do reviews, leaving it to the others, but I couldn't stay aside this time. This was an amazing experience.Firstly, Adrian and Miriam are very open people and amazing hosts. They make you feel comfortable along the way and readily go extra mile to accommodate your specific needs as much as they can.Secondly, this is your rare opportunity to actually ride a horse!!! Not just bang on its back as it carries you on a nose-to-tail trail rides where you are only allowed to walk, but trot, cantor and may be even gallop if you can. The horses are well trained and it allowed me to max on my abilities and I felt like a much better rider at the end of the trip.If you in Buenos Aries for more then 2 days, do yourself a favor and try horseback riding with Caballos A La Par and enjoy true Argentinian experience.Good luck to those travelers who will read this review and many thanks to Adrian and Miriam for the amazing time I had.

Incredible day in Buenos!. I went on a half day trip with Caballos a la Par last week and had the most incredible day in Buenos. They never give you group lessons unless you specifically request it so I had a one-to-one lesson with Miriam. Miriam is a very patient and caring teacher who focuses on and helps you to develop and improve your riding technique and I learnt so much from her in that half day.Although I was a complete beginner, I was already learning to canter by the end of my visit! It was lovely to be able to ride the horses freely in the huge reserve and to go through bamboo groves and forests as we pleased. Although only a short drive from Buenos, it really does feel like you've exited the hustle and bustle of the city and entered a realm of tranquility.The Caballos team, comprising Adrian, Miriam and Bart, is such a welcoming and friendly team. They included me like one of the family, taught me about the traditions of drinking mate, showed me around the stables and even drove me back to my hotel afterwards.It was a shame that I only discovered this place on the final day in Buenos - I would definitely have returned for more lessons if I had known about it earlier. Needless to say, I will definitely be dropping in again on my next visit to Buenos!

Unique stable!. This is an extremely efficient, beautiful and friendly place to learn horse riding both for tourists and locals. Being a complete beginner, I have taken three lessons with Adrian and will continue until I feel confident to ride on my own. One of his lessons is equivalent to several hours of instruction at more traditional stables.

Always wonderful!. I've been coming regularly to Buenos Aires on business for years, and always make time for a day of riding with Adrian. I've brought co-workers, friends and most recently my sister along, and they have loved it just as much as I have. It's completely different from ordinary "trail rides" where the horses just follow the leader, and maybe if you're lucky you get to canter for a bit at the end. Instead, it's just you and Adrian exploring the surrounding area, sometimes on trails and sometimes not, walking if you want to walk, cantering if you want to canter, with Adrian coaching you continuously on how best to control your horse and helping you improve, no matter how much you think you already know. Before and after your ride, there is pastry and conversation and a chance to wander around the beautiful grounds looking at the horses and playing with the various dogs and cats around the place. Every single time it's a perfect day.

Best day in Buenos Aires!. It is rare two find someone with such passion and joy for what they do as Miriam and Adrian. They are both so kind and welcoming, and this makes Caballos a la Par a truly unique place. We saw the good reviews at Tripadvisor, but the riding class was even better than we expected! We had little or no prior experience with horseback riding (my boyfriend had literally never ridden a horse before), but Adrian was a very patient instructor, making us feel safe and challenging us at the same time. The horses Indio and Isabel where highly trained, and where very easy to handle - even for us. After riding for a little while we actually felt we had learnt a lot about horseback riding, cantering without hands as a highlight. The national park was beautiful and huge (i think we only saw a fraction of it during our 3-hour ride) and ideal for horseback riding. Both before and after the horseback riding we spent time with Miriam and Adrian at their lovely house. First they introduced us to the traditional Argentine tea mate, and after our ride, we were served hot chocolate and pastries in front of the fire place. All in all we had a great time and only wish we had discovered Caballos a la Par sooner so we could have come again during our stay in Buenos Aires!

Highlight of my trip!. This was such a beautiful adventure and wonderful way to see a bit of the culture and countryside of Argentina. The horses are expertly-trained to be gentle and patient. I had a little experience with horses prior to my trip but felt event more comfortable and confident on my horse. Adrian is a great, patient instructor. Both Adrian and Miriam are so welcoming. I can't say enough great things about this experience!!

Amazing Adventure. You will find a very lovely place very close to Buenos Aires (Les than 30 minutes), with a lot of horses running free in the huge garden, a swimming pool and a lovely house, with very sweet people. Horses rides are very personalized, which means that if you have an experience with horse riding, you will be more than satisfied because you will gallop as you want in a very beautiful park (nobody excepted you during the week). Horses are used to this rides and they are very easy and pleasant. You can go with friends or alone, with or without experience, you are sure to have a wonderful moment at Caballos A La Par !

More than a horseback ride, this is the real Argentina Experience!. Our time with Caballos A La Par was more than a horseback riding event, this was a cultural experience that was the highlight of our time in Buenos Aires. Let me say that both my husband and I have very limited horseback riding experience, and the training I had as a child for typical western riding on "trail horses" left me with bad habits for this type of riding....however, Adrian and Miriam easily helped me to transition to the Argentinian way of riding. The first thing we noticed is how passionate they are about the horses and animals in general. If you are an animal lover, like we are, you will be very much at home here. The day began with a quick meeting point at the edge of San Telmo, Adrian picked us up and after a quick 20-30 minute ride to the country we were at the beautiful national park and their location....entering the gates we saw all the horses free and roaming along with the dogs and cats. We shared lovely conversation prior to the riding and enjoyed getting to know Adrian and Miriam, then off to the horses! The key to success is learning the proper balance of your body on the horse. The positions were discussed and demonstrated and within minutes we were testing our new skills around the yard, then off to the woods for a beautiful riding experience. Miriam helped us build upon new skills and pushed us to do amazing things - not to mention she is very talented at taking video while in a full cantor! If she had not taken the pictures or video our friends would not believe we actually did the moves on these wonderful horses! Riding with no hands? Yep, and not just once! The horses, the experience, the ability to ride side-by-side and not on a trail, makes this experience so unique. The national park and it beautiful trees along with the new friends we have made with Adrian and Miriam makes this the best experience of our time in Argentina. When we return, this will be the first stop for us! Thank you Caballos A La Par!

Amazing Horse Riding in Argentine open countryside.. Excellent! Very friendly owners, care passionately about their horses and guests. Their horses are amazingly trained and super responsive.They are not your average trail and riding school horses that just follow the leader. Suitable for novice or experienced rider as host (Adrian) took time to allocate the correct horse for level of experience. Whatever your level of riding you will learn something from their relaxed style of teaching whilst riding in beautiful Argentine national park. Local custom of mate pre-ride and delicious empanadas post ride. This incredible experience is something not to be missed on your visit to Argentina and will leave you wanting to return again!

A Must-Do in Buenos Aires!!. This was, by far, one of the highlights of my trips. I cannot stop showing off the photos and videos! Adrian and Miriam were the most hospitable and amazing people you could hope to meet and I learned SO much from them. It is a private riding experience and it was definitely worth the price and the time. It included a ride out to the ranch, my first mate tasting experience, rode TWO different horses, got the most incredible lesson from Adrian (he was definitely a coach, pushed me because he knew I could handle it, and I appreciated and enjoyed every minute of it), and then concluded my experience with some amazing empanadas. Simply the most memorable day during my trip to Buenos Aires.

Fabulous morning with 'friends' ...The 2 & 4 legged ones!. Brilliant day out! We're experienced riders & still learnt new skills. Our beautiful, gentle & kind horses , Indi, Sheikh & Isabelle were the kindest on our first meeting, almost like family. Our hosts Adrian & Miriam were warm, funny, charming & welcoming. After passing 'the interview'...ie finding a bit out about ourselves, & what we wanted to achieve on our day, Adrian tailor made the morning for us choosing the horses & activity. Everything was relaxed & at an enjoyable pace. The national park of 24000 acres was scenic welcoming and relaxed. 'Twas an excellent day and it will most definitely be on my todo list next visit. All was organised perfectly, pickup from a point in B.A. town, 30min drive to lovely country location, lovely enchiladas & soft drinks, helmets & chaps provided, and loads of photos so remember a small device, phone or camera. I'd advise to wear suitable clothing ie, jodhpurs and boots, and a few layers, chilly in the morning but soon warmed up. ( B.A. Winter) lovely pool should it be sunnier and warner to use too!

Very highly suggested. SO much fun!. I am a pretty regular horseback rider and I love taking rides when I travel as well. I went to a few places while I was in Argentina, this was by far the best. My mom went with me, even though she is not really a horse person. It was easy to contact Miriam and Adrian and Miriam came to pick us up, there was no confusion or trouble with the pick up. We didn't get to meet Adrian, but Miriam was a delightful person. Miriam talked with us for a while, as well as shared mate with us and made us feel very at home at her place. I had a great time, and my mom had a blast as well as a novice rider. The horses are trained incredibly well and are very easy to control. Miriam was very willing to let us do and try anything we thought would be fun, such as cantering, cantering with no hands, standing horseback etc. The focus here is having a good time. Highly recommended!

You have to go!!!. The sweetest owners ever. They were so patient and they were expert riders and we were novices. We felt like we really learned to ride. Absolutely enjoyed this, and a few of us in the group were nervous (and they really calmed our fears). You'll do a ride in a wild part of the city, and it was absolutely one of the best experiences we had in Buenos Aires.

Phenomenal day learning the basics of riding. Caballos a la Par orchestrated one of the best travel experiences I've ever had. Having never ridden a horse, I was slightly wary about our excursion, but Adrian and Miriam were the kindest and most helpful hosts imaginable. I had a ton of fun, and I learned so much---not only about riding but also about Buenos Aires---because of Adrian's expert tutelage and Adrian and Miriam's constantly engaging conversation. I cannot recommend the experience highly enough. I have Caballos a la Par to thank for memories that I'll be talking about for years and years to come.

Fantastic Argentinian Experience!. My friend and I had a phenomenal experience on our outing to Adrian and Miriam's lovely stables yesterday. We were lucky that the rain cleared up for a day where we could ride, and we had a beautiful and classic Argentinian day. Adrian picked us up from the meeting point in the city and was very interesting to talk to and learn from on the way to the national park and stables (about 30 minutes outside of the city).
