When we arrived we sat together by the fire and leisurely drank mate, gaining insight into how much the two love their business and horses. My friend was a beginner and I had ridden a bit years ago, but Adrian truly was a great teacher and picked horses that fit our needs. The outing was spectacular, truly riding side by side and not on a trail but freely through the national park for 2.5 hours (I'm going to be sore for days). Every now and then I had to pinch myself to realize that we were riding horses through Argentina, and we have great pictures and videos to remember our unique experience. Afterward, we had empanadas and Miriam drove us back to the city, never feeling rushed and feeling like it was more of a full day activity than a half day one, very personalized and tailored to our needs. Thank you, Caballos a la Par, for one of the best activities during our week in Buenos Aires!

Wonderful day out. Adrian and Miriam took a group of five beginners for an excellent day of riding. Their tuition is wonderful - it is far from the usual case of the horses following each other on a trail - they teach you how to control the horse rather than the other way around! The fact that all their sessions are private means there is much closer instruction than I've experienced before, and whether you are a beginner or an experienced rider the ride will be at your own pace. As well as the riding itself the couple are extremely welcoming, inviting us into their lovely home for mate and empanadas. Finally, do not worry if your Spanish is not what it could (or should) be - their English is excellent. Despite not being the biggest fan of horse riding beforehand it was one of the highlights of my two months in South America.

Wonderful hosts and excellent instruction. Miriam and Adrian, the co-owners, are very kind and welcoming. Adrian picked me up from downtown Buenos Aires and drove me to their place. The 3 of us had mate, and then they introduced me to the horses. Miriam took me out for my ride. I've ridden several times before over the years, but because it's private instruction, I felt challenged the whole time. It's a different experience being in the lead, rather than having the horse just following the horse in front of it, as is often the case on trail rides. Miriam had my camera phone and was taking pictures and videos the whole time. That's nice for souvenirs, and it was also a good learning tool, since I could get immediate feedback about what I looked like while riding. I think we were riding for 2 or 2.5 hours. Whatever it was, it was enough. (Honestly, I'm still a little sore now, a week later.) When we got back, we had empanadas for lunch, which were quite delicious. It was all a great experience, and I highly recommend it to anybody who things they would enjoy horseback riding.

Perfect in the Rain, Sun n' Shine. Wonderful Experience. Adrian and Miriam were excellent. Very practical in their teaching style and chatting with them felt like meeting old friends. The first day we came there was some rain and we ended up having a lovely 3 hour conversation. Even with the rain, Adrian and Miriam were both very accommodating and fit us in on the next most perfect sun filled day before our flight. They took the time to match us with horses which fit our own styles, levels of experience and personality. We rode just the three of us in the nature reserve (which is massive and filled with protected plants, trees etc.). This is exactly what we both needed to get away from our office desks! We highly recommend Adrian and Miriam and the family at Caballos A La Par. Regardless of the weather, give them a call to see what's possible. It was clear that they sincerely love meeting new people and sharing their wonderful world of horses!

Amazing experience. We went horsebackriding with a group of 7 people all with different experience of riding. The horses are amazing and well trained and looked after with great care. Adrian has wonderfull teaching skills and even people that were on a horse for the second time could go in galop carefully guided by Adrian. If you are more experienced you will get an appropriate horse. This is not like in most stables were the horses all walk in one line after eachother. Each horse will listen to the instruction that you give and the energy you bring with you.We all had a wonderful day and an amazing horsebackriding experience. If you are in Buenos Aires and love horses, no matter what your level is go and check Caballos A La Par. I've been to many stables all over the world but this one is my favorite.

One of the primary highlights of our visit to BA. Caballos A La Par is a diamond in the rough. I was amazed to see the attention to detail that Adrian and Miriam put into their work to host, prepare, personally supervise and follow up for feedback. They strive for nothing short of excellence and take every step to make sure that your experience is memorable. The experience takes you through a personally escorted ride through a neighboring (beautiful) park. Miriam did a lot much to acquaint you with the horses, to build that partnership. I had personally not EVER ridden a horse, and I was galloping by the end of the ride. I owe this quick progression to the patient, studied and care that Adrian and Miriam put into our riding. Quite frankly, of all the many experiences that I have had in Buenos Aires, this is among the best. And, I would certainly put their commitment to excellence as truly world class.

Absolutely the best!. We did this tour several months ago, but this activity is still very fresh in our minds. We are so fortunate to spend the day with the horses and the even more amazing people that take care of them.The tour is private and truly amazing. This is the first time I (or my girlfriend) rode a horse, but we were shown the basics and felt very comfortable. We spent almost the whole day riding the horses and even though it was warm the ride was not very difficult. One of the most special parts of this day was when we got to help a little on the farm (not a common request). We helped clean the horses we rode and helped with a couple small things. This was fun and I think it showed us a little more than just riding the horses.We were picked up in downtown BA and driven to where the horses (farm) are. We were dropped off at the hotel on the way back. We were provided mate and lunch; both of which were fantastic!This was truly a special activity and we would absolutely recommend doing this again and if we are ever back we will do this again too!!

NYC Tour Guide with nothing but praise!!. When you see 5 stars for something in todays world you might think reviewers are getting paid. Not true in this case. The owners of this place are first and foremost the salt of the earth. Now when I first met Adrian i thought he was very tough and technical but I ended up realizing how talented of an instructor he is.I work in the tourism business and I was impressed with his co owner Miriam And Australian female helper were very welcoming.My horse Regalo I believe her name was also patient with me. Lastly for those who are planning on seeing BA and Argentina the country especially for Americans feels like its in a economic time warp and you end up feeling for the people. All I can say is that Argentina needs less corruption and more entrepreneurs like Miriam and Adrien and it will bounce back

Great experience. We were in BA only 4 days but were told this riding experience is a must-do and were not disappointed. Great experience which you can't really describe before you sit on a horse yourself! Adrian is a great teacher and we had a really good time. Will go again on my next visit to Argentina.

Just do it and won't regret. You go ride a horse with a kind, responsive, open, and pretty teacher alone. Yes. Alone. This can't get any better. You are very welcome to ask questions, and try what YOU want to do. Also, you will have a lot of chance and good atmosphere to make a great conversation. They are very professional, yet friendly. Just go for it, and you will learn a lot about horseriding, and will have a good time.

A truly unique and rewarding riding adventure. This was possibly the best thing we did whilst we were in Buenos Aires. We were looking forward to riding horses whilst in BA but this experience as rewarding and memorable beyond all of our expectations.Adrian and Marian who own the establishment lead the rides and their passion for their horses and for teaching riders shines through the entire experience. They teach the gaucho style of riding and are excellent at bringing together all of the details to enable their riders to ride at a relatively advanced level in just a few hours. As a relatively inexperienced rider, I originally found it quite difficult to coordinate all of the subtlety of the positions and movements, but once it clicked it felt completely natural. It was also liberating as it was the first time I had ever felt completely comfortable on a horse.Our group contained experienced riders and beginners (one of our group had never sat on a horse before), but by the end of the day we were all cantering confidently. One of the experienced riders in the group said that it would typically take 4-5 sessions to achieve this level of competence. I get the feeling we could have had a very easy day out, but I we got the most out it because we were willing to challenge ourselves. The stables are on the edge of a national park about 30 minutes outside of BA but the team helpfully and happily dropped picked us up and dropped us off from a central location in BA. Adrian, Marianne and team are friendly and inspiring people and they clearly love what they do.If you’re looking to ride in Buenos Aires or just looking for something new this should definitely be at the top of the list!

Don't miss this!. If you want to horse ride, with people who first clearly care for their horses and second provide a wonderful time on horseback, then this is the best way to do it. We were a party of six, with riding ability ranging from none to expert, and ages from 26 to 62. Everyone was able to take part and have a great time together. Just 30 minutes from a pick-up point in Buenos Aires, riding in acres of national park, this was a highlight of our trip to Argentina. If you think you would like to try it, go for it; you will not regret it!

Not your typical tourist riding experience. This was a lot of fun. Before I left for my trip, a friend told me that if I hadn't experienced Argentina from the back of a horse, I hadn't experienced it at all. I came across this place searching trip advisor and being quite impressed by the overwhelming amount of positive reviews. This many people couldn't be wrong - and they weren't. It truly didn't feel like your typical tourist riding experience, where horses follow a path that they do 20 times a day, seem unhappy and apathetic. This experience was worth every centavo, and felt rather like hanging out with friends than a business transaction. It was a nice, relaxing break from the city, hanging out on the farm, drinking Mate and eating Empanadas, while chatting with Miriam about her interesting life story. I used to horseback ride quite regularly when a kid, but hadn't been on a horse in years. I regained confidence quickly though, and Miriam truly adapted to my pace, slowly making me rediscover my love for riding again. I would recommend this place to anyone and will certainly be back if I ever make it to the area again.

Amazing experience. Great day out of the city, perfect mix between a lesson and fun. Adrian was a brilliant teacher and we both improved a huge amount over the course of the morning. I went from having almost no experience to cantering hands free. Highly recommended!

Spectacular Riding Experience + Lesson. This was by far the most amazing riding experience I've had abroad. The value of the ride and personalized lesson along with the skills and freedom to trot and cantor are ideal for those wanting a true riding experience outside of the controlled lessons or trail rides you may be used to.Both Adrian and Miriam are wonderful, genuine people who truly love their horses and their calling. Adrian is an amazing teacher for those looking to improve or hone your skills.The mate prior to riding and empanadas afterwards was an unexpected, personal touch, which was a bonus to the incredible experience.KP

horseback riding is my new favorite activity. I never thought that horseback riding could be so much fun. Before my visit to Caballos a la Par I have never ridden a horse in my whole life. The experience starts with sipping some mate with Adrian and Miriam and explaining the safety rules to keep in mind. They are very passionate for the horses and teaching us how to properly ride them. This is not like a guided tour where you are just sitting on a horse and the horse does the rest, At Caballos a la Par you learn how to connect with the horse and it will make an unforgettable experience.

a MUST when you're in Buenos Aieres. Just thirty minutes outside of the bustling city lies one of the best experiences Buenos Aires has to offer, Caballos A La Par. There is something wonderful about riding horses through Argentine National Parks - and with Adrian's teaching and an hour of riding, you feel like an expert rider. Caballos isn't just a business for Adrian, its his life and his family. When you're there, you're a part of it. Truly a special day that I'll remember forever.

Fantastic day with a knowledgeable and friendly riding instructor. I really enjoyed the amazing experience these guys had to offer. The stables and house area were beautiful, and the ride itself wound through some pretty Argentinian countryside which reminded me a little of home due to all the gum trees. Through the lesson I was quickly familiarised with the riding style and was soon riding safely and well and really enjoying myself. We will always remember this as one of the most fun things we ever did in Argentina.

Awsome vacation. I have been dreaming my whole life of the perfect horseback riding experience.I have never had such an awesome experience.Adrian and Miriam are so friendly professional and courteous and only out to give us the experience of a lifetime.It took only a few minutes to develops a friendly relationship and me and my husband were taught how to REALLY ride a horse.we look forward to going back really soon. We started out beginners and left feeling exhilarated.such nice amazing people are hard to find. Yanky and Malky Frank

Wonderful day with horses - the highlight of my 3 months in Buenos Aires. I cannot speak highly enough of this experience - at first when I searched online I thought it might be out of my price range but I'm so happy that I decided to treat myself! It was very easy to organise via email, and Adrian arrived perfectly on time at the agreed pick up location - an easy drive outside of the bustle of the city the the beautiful parklands, it felt like we were a million miles away from the stress of the city. English is spoken for those who aren't confident speaking Spanish, safety equipment provided along with a lot of information shared in advance of the ride to ensure the best horse was selected for my ride. As somebody who grew up with horses I feel I learnt more in my hours riding with Caballos A La Par than in my lifetime - focusing on real horsemanship and how to communicate with your horse rather than a simple 'cabelgata' following round in a nose to tail formation. Cantering without reins, learning specific signals and correct posture were just part of the intensive lesson, alongside lots of fun exploring the parkland too. The ride is completely catered to your ability - I know they get a lot of beginner riders who all have just as much fun as those who have have been competing at competition level for many years. The horses are all looked after well, and are healthy and fit and very well trained to the Caballos A La Par style of riding. Not a bad word to say about this experience, I would do it every day if I could and it is great value for money - book in NOW!

Best horsebackriding lesson in my life - highly recommended!. A few days ago, I spent an amazing day at Caballos A La Par. Everything was very well organised. They asked me beforehand about my experiences, expectations and physical data to select the right horse for me. I was picked up in time in San Juan Avenue / Lima in Buenos Aires in front of the bar "Playas del Carmen". We drove some 30-40 minutes to the beautiful countryside outside of the city to the riding-stable of Caballos A La Par.They had selected Indio, their most experienced horse, for me as I had not had riding clases in some years and wasn´t sure how fit I was. I had no problems to ride Indio - he is very well-trained and patient. We did walk, trot, canter and many exercises like canter with free hands, sudden stops and double rounds.I have had many riding lessons in groups during past holidays. There the horses mostly ended up following each other instead of their riders´ commands. But this was a one on one riding lesson with just me, Indio, my riding teacher and his horse in the beautiful countryside. I realized Indio was really following my commands - at least when I gave them the right way - and not when I didn´t. This way I learned a lot in only 2,5 hourse. During the lesson my teacher would take fotos and videos of me on the horse so that I could see - and correct - my riding position and have beautiful memories of the day. Later we finished the day together with hot chocolate and pastries on the estate, before my riding teacher brought me back to Buenos Aires where I had been picked up. All transfers, food and beverages were included in the price. Unpayable was the hospitality, humor and the great conversations we had that day. - A wonderful experience!

Best part of the trip to Buenos Aires. If you want to get a real horseback riding experience, this is the place. Not only you get to see parts of beautiful forest reserves (it's only 30 minutes outside of Buenos Aires!), Adrian tailors the whole trip for you so that you get to learn various techniques on how to ride the horses. Adrian is a great teacher and he will push you to get to the next level. I've been to few horseback rides in the past but this experience was completely different from the others in the best way possible. In Adrian's words, "You are not just sitting on a horse, you are riding a horse!" Adrian and Miriam welcomes you as if you are part of their family – they are both very wonderful. There were no issues with the booking and they were very accommodating throughout the trip. I highly recommend people to go on this trip if they are in Buenos Aires.
Fantastic Experience. We were able to visit this horse region where we were introduced to the skills the local riders , Polo players and treated to the local (braai) of beef dishes

True horse riding experience in Argentina!. Adrian and Miriam were so friendly and welcoming, it was such a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires and we learned so much!Adrian was on time to pick us up from Buenos Aires and it was only a short drive into the country side. We chatted over mate tea and we never felt rushed by Adrian or Miriam. My sister and I have gone horse riding before but not on the level that Adrian taught us. We were on our horses on the reserve, freely trotting and cantering. We had such a blast and can't thank Adrian and Miriam enough! We highly recommend this experience to everyone.

Fantastic afternoon of the total package. The experience couldn't have been more perfect: friendly, easygoing people, beautiful and well-trained horses, all with a beautiful gorgeous of sunny meadows and breathtaking nature. We started the afternoon with a friendly chat and some mate, and then go right onto the horses where we received clear instructions on how to sit and handle ourselves. Then we spent a couple of hours improving our skills and enjoying the feeling of freedom as we got more comfortable with the horses. Once we got back to the farm we enjoyed pastries whilst looking through the gorgeous pictures we had taken. I highly recommend this experience!!

Highlight of a 5 month stay in BA. Living in Buenos Aires for several months with many positive experiences, it takes something above and beyond to inspire my first glowing review on Tripadvisor. It just seems like it would be unfair for others to miss out on an afternoon at Caballos A La Par. Adrian and Miriam welcome you to their ranch like family for a private and personalized day of riding that is both tranquil due to the beautiful surroundings and gratifying due to the expert advice that makes even an inexperienced rider feel like a pro. It's hard to pick favorites in this family though, because all of their horses are so well-trained and happy you'll wish to take them home with you. You are not signing up to sit on a horse that simply follows the one in front of it, you are getting a real riding experience in the company of friends. Thank you for everything!

Zero to Hero in a couple of hours!. Be prepared for an incredible day out with Adrian and Miriam, their beautiful horses and fabulous ranch. My friend and I have very very little horse riding experience. In fact our confidence was so low, we were debating whether to use a different company that catered more toward non-riders with horses that follow a well known trail and take directions from the cues of the leader. However, we made the right choice in selecting Caballos a la Par because Adrian and his method of teaching gives you the skills to actually ride a horse properly. When you ride with Adrian YOU are in control of your own horse. He teaches you exactly how to make your horse do what you want it to do. So you don't have to follow behind him. You can ride beside him, in front of him, wherever you want. My friend and I are both high school teachers and from a professional point of view Adrian's teaching method is top notch! He will push you to do things you never imagined you would do. Toward the end of the ride, he had us dropping the reins and cantering without holding on. As the title suggests we went from "zero to hero" in a few short hours and thats because of Adrian's effective teaching style. If you have no experience with horses, I promise you will walk away from this experience with the greatest sense of satisfaction and achievement. And if you can already ride a horse, this will be a great experience for you as well because the National Park is glorious, stunning and pristine.

Feeling Emotional. I have just woken up the following day, after having spent an amazing afternoon, here at Caballos A La Par. I have never properly rode a horse, and I did not know what to expect. Our hosts, Adrian and Mijam, are passionate people. Adrian has the most touching story about how he started this fantastic venture, which is both honest and beautiful . His passion for horses and their wellbeing is 100% commitment.By the end of the day, we were cantering, reins free , and have the most fabulous photos and videos of us riding, and having complete control of our horses. Exhilarating does not describe the feeling enough. I feel I have just experienced something special. Thankyou to you both.

A life changing experience!. I can only follow on from previous reviewers and endorse what an incredible day and experience we had with Adrian and Mirjam at Caballos A la Par. We were welcomed so warmly and I feel that we left Caballos having met 2 very special people. Their love of what they do, their love of horses, their passion for teaching is so evident. As a novice by the end of my experience I felt confident on a horse and was cantering through the fields with my hands off the reins. Exhilarating. A truly life changing experience. Many thanks to Adrian and Mirjam. I wish them every success with this brilliant venture..

Fabulous experience. from the moment you arrive, it becomes clear very quickly that this is somewhere where passion for horses and teaching are at the forefront of what they do. We where made to feel at home and a quick assessment was made of our riding capabilities after which we got to meet our horses and for the next 2.5 hours we were in heaven. I was rather nervous after some bad experiences but Adrian managed to made me feel completely save and I know my companions for the day felt the same. The horse I rode was a perfect match and by the time we returned all 3 of us were full of confidence and had done things we had not expected we would.A huge thank you to Mirjam and Adrian, your love for the horses shines through everything.

Fave Day of Trip to BA!. First of all, the ranch's location in the country is just stunning. The lessons were so much fun and they teach you about 10 riding lessons in just a few hours. I was terrified when I started because I'd fallen off a horse 10 years ago, but Miriam was beyond patient with me and gave me so much attention on the horse that I felt so safe. Maybe I wasn't the best at cantering, but I had a blast trying!After the lessons, we went back to the ranch, played with the horses, and Miriam let me feed them carrots. It was so peaceful! Then Miriam and Adrian invited us into the home and made us fresh coffee and mate (the local tea) where we talked and laughed for over an hour. They treated us like we had been friends for years. It was the best time we had during our 7 day trip in Buenos Aires.

THE BEST!!!. Such an amazing experience!!! The people and the horses were fantastic #! (We had Indio and isabel) we had only been on horses a few times before and that had been just walking around in a circle. This could not be more different. We were trotting, cantering, even riding with no hands through the most beautiful scenery!!! We have THE BEST pictures. A MUST do if you come to buenos aires!!! Muy bien!!!

An unexpected splendor in Buenos Aires. When the Four Seasons recommended horseback riding I thought this would be a nice way to spend the day outdoors. My expectations were exceeded from the minute Adrian picked us up from the hotel. As far as hosts go, he was wonderful. We started the morning with Yerba Mate before we went out for the day, which in itself was a lovely experience. Before we went out Adrian promised that we wouldn't be "sitting on the horse, we would be RIDING the horse" and he definitely kept his promise. My horse Isabel (out of respect I hope I'm spelling that correctly) was wonderful to ride. This took me completely out of my comfort zone, but I never once felt unsafe. I loved Buenos Aires but this was probably the best thing I did while I was there. If you are looking for a tour that's completely unpersonalized with a large group, this is NOT the excursion for you. This was as intimate and personal as it gets and they are able to provide a much better experience with private lessons. I HIGHLY recommend Caballos A La Par. This is an experience you will not get with any other company. Worth every penny. ...Oh did I mention there were empanadas waiting for us when we were done. The magic words.

A Day I will never forget!. My friend and I have already been in Buenos Aires for 4 days and this is the best thing we've done since being here! Miriam and Adrian (the instructors) are amazing! They gave us such a personal and customized experience. I was so impressed by how much my riding got better from start to finish. By the end of the riding lesson I felt like I'd been riding horses forever. The horses are beautiful and well trained. I felt very safe and had constant feedback on my riding. If I ever come back to Argentina, I want to visit Caballos a La Par first. I feel it's a steal for everything we get. I felt more like a friend rather than a customer. They were so welcoming and friendly and gave very good directions. I loved it! I hope you choose this as an attraction to experience while in Buenos.

Amazing day with great teachers, happy horses in a beautiful nature! . One of my best day! Still can't believe at first lesson I could already canter! And in such a beautiful open natural park - Parque Pereyra Iraola! All credits go to Adrian & Miriam's super professionalism with great passion & love for horses & teaching, and their amazing warm friendly personality with infectious positive energy! The concept/practice of one-on-one teaching in the beautiful nature elevates the horse riding into another level, beyond my expectations! Miriam responded my spontaneous booking very fast with very clear information. Adrian came to pick me up in town very timely with warm smile. We had amazing conversation on the drive about the country. The Mate Adrian prepared for me, relaxed my nervousness before the lesson. Don't be deceived by Adrian's super friendliness & easy-going style - he is very professional, tough & demanding while teaching - he pushed me to my limit (of course at my own request) so I made big progress. I also built up my connection gradually with Indeo with Adrian! But Adrian & Miriam won't give me Indeo next time as I have to learn with different horses! The lesson ended with a lovely Empanada lunch - super delicious! Miriam drove me back - and again I had great conversation! One half -day felt already like a wonderful mini-vacation! I'm so happy to get to know such great people just during my first week here & I'm already very much missing the lesson with happy horses in the beautiful nature, and can't wait for my next lesson!

A Truly Once in a Lifetime Experience. A one in a lifetime experience with a an authentic Argentine Master Horseman……Whether you have never been on a horse before or consider yourself an experienced rider I will bet you the price of this tour that your riding will improve…..Was so impressed that I am going back to make it a regular treat during my extended stay here….This is my fourth time here and nothing else compares to this….even better than Boca Football for this lifetime soccer fan……..

Excelent & unforgottable!. We loved the tour together with my wife!We were not expirienced in horse riding, but Miriam was so kid to help us at every step during several hours of the riding. We could enjoy as much time as we want. Recommed this tour to every tourist. Beautiful nature & nice horses!

Fantastic horseback driving at Caballos A La Par. A friend told me enthousiasticly about his horseback driving experience at Caballos A La Par and I knew I wanted to go there.Me as well, I had a great experience driving in nature in this amazing huge forest reserve, on different grounds, through different landscapes and in the lovely company of Miriam who was teaching very efficiently. In Holland I have been taking classes for about eight months in the "English style" but with the instructions of Adrian and the corrections of Miriam during the ride, I was able to drive these Argentine horses. At the end of the ride we changed horses to practise control, which allowed me to experience two different horses. You can feel the horses are happy horses, they are outside all day long and are very sensitive.Miriam is so skilled she is able to shoot a lot of pictures and videos while driving and teaching. Very kind!

Escape the city for some unforgettable horseback riding. Hands down, this was my favorite tour in over a month of traveling around South America. It’s not a conventional tour; this is a private riding lesson and you will learn a lot. My only previous experience was horseback riding tours, where you’re more like a passenger on a horse that is following the horses in front. Not here! In no time at all, Adrian had me out riding around the beautiful grounds and learning different gaits and tricks. Adrian is a fantastic teacher. It’s obvious he is passionate about horses and riding and he made learning really enjoyable. The “a la par” method forces you to lead your own horse. My horse Indio was very patient with me as a beginner and so much fun to ride. It was all very easy to set up and Hector picked me up from and dropped me off downtown. We drank some mate before the lesson and snacked on empanadas afterwards. A bonus: Adrian took pictures and videos on my phone while we were riding so I have proof of the lesson. Now I can show my family and friends that I can ride a horse! All in all, it was a great afternoon escape from the city. You will leave sore, but wanting to ride more.

10/10 Incredible horse riding experience 😄. WOW WOW WOW! If you are a person who loves horse's and riding in beautiful seneray then this is the place for you.from the moment I booked this ride everything was perfect from making the booking was quick& clear response. Miriam was great and picked me up from the city and very friendly and made me feel comforable on the way to there properly .when we arrive what a beautiful site lots of the horses where roaming around freely and the dogs run up to the gate to meet us. The properly is lovely,the horse all are well feed and lovely shinny coats.I meet Adrian and had my first Mate and a snack, when you book your ride you will be only riding with your group or your self and no strangers which I ablosluty loved. it was just me.Adrian show me how they hold the reins and sit correctly and then off we went, Adrian taught me some really awesome things to do on the horse,lots of cantering, we had a race which was amazing to ride at full speed.and Adrian was kind enought to let me have a ride on his geousous Arab! I felt I got more out of my two hr ride with Adrian then I have with 1 yr worth of private lesson in london.Adrian has an wonderful energy and a real passion for horses and people. And I fisinhed my ride on a real high.when we got back there was food and a cold drinks and I was offered to go swimming in there shimming pool which I would have loved to do but needed to get back to the city.Adrian drove me back into town and waited until I was safely in a cab before he left. What an excellent business Miriam and Adiran are operating and I only wished that I lived in BA so I could be a regularly rider. I ablosluty look forward to coming again and again.

Amazing Experience. I have visited Caballos a La Par 2 times already with friends and can not wait for the next time even though i just left the place 2 hours ago!! The place is amazing, the horses are the most beautiful horses i ve ever seen in my life and Adrian and Miriam are both doing a great job taking care of everything. You start with a pick up either in the morning or in the afternoon from Buenos Aires - which was really easy for us because Adrian was truely punctual. The ride is about 45 mins from Buenos Aires and as soon as you arrive, you see all the horses, dogs, cats living in a harmony together, everything is green and very well taken care of, there is even a pool for hot summer days, if you d like a dip after the ride. Traditional mate drinking is followed by a 2.5-3 hrs long lesson! You can immediately tell how a great teacher Adrian is. He sees every detail and corrects you everytime you do something wrong! Believe me take one class with adrian and it is 4 classes worth in anywhere similar in Europe if not more!!At the end of the class, you will be able to walk and run and do circles on the horse- on your own! After the lesson, i had tasted the best Empanadas ever and had a chance to chat with both Adrian and Miriam- both so lovely and passionate about what they are doing. I have been living in Buenos Aires for almost 3 months now and i did almost every activity you could imagine. This is by far my favorite and i cant wait to come back to Caballos a la Par❤️❤️ thank you Adrian and Miriam for this experience!

Amazing experience! Loved every moment!. My husband and I went horseback riding with Adrian a few weeks ago, and we had the most amazing time! We were both beginners, but with Adrian's great coaching skills and patience, we quickly became very comfortable on the horses. Prior to our lesson, Adrian warmly welcomed us into his home and gave us some mate (traditional South American tea). He chatted with us about Argentina and the culture and told us why he loves teaching and working with horses. We immediately developed a bond with him, as he treated us like family. His father, who picked us up and dropped us off in Buenos Aires, was also a lovely man. After riding for a few hours, we had learned so much and were so happy with our progress. Before heading back to the city, Adrian and his father kindly offered us a tasty lunch of empanadas. We truly enjoyed the entire experience and would highly recommend this activity to anyone who loves animals and wants to see the countryside. The property is beautiful and the horses are so sweet and well groomed -- the owners take great care of them! Thanks as well to Miriam for helping us organize this great adventure! Caballos A La Par will always be in our memories!

So you think you can ride a horse.... Ten days ago, my well traveled daughter and I went for our FIRST horse back riding lesson at Caballos A La Par. We were picked up at a designated spot by a well dressed gentleman. We arrived at the ranch not expecting the splendor that lay ahead of us. The owner/accomplished equestrian and all around Renaissance man, spared no detail in getting me to conquer my fears. Adriane is a unique gentleman who loves his 15 horses and is passionate about sharing his joy with new comers to his extraordinary ranch and home. My adult daughter picked up everything very quickly; I, however, needed constant supervision. At no time did I feel endangered and Adriane made certain that his horses obeyed his strong but loving commands. It was an afternoon that we will never forget and a personal trump for me. With appreciation to both Adriane and Miriam, JUDY ULMER

Definitely a highlight of our trip!. We spent almost 3 weeks in Argentina as part of our honeymoon and our day at Caballos a la Par was one of the best days we had there. Miriam was such a fantastic teacher and a lovely person to spend the best part of a whole day with. We started the day there with a traditional Mate and a chat which a really nice touch and a good way to get to know each other. We had not done any horse riding for over 15 years and by the end of the day we were cantering along with no hands! We felt like we really learned a lot and Miriam showed great attention to detail so we got the most out of our riding experience. The horses themselves were great and really well-behaved too.I highly recommend Caballos a la Par for anyone visiting Buenos Aires, it was absolutely fantastic!

simply wonderful. I don't even know where to begin. There are so many aspects of this experience that will stick with me for a very long time. Right from the start Adrian was a gracious and personable host -- he picked us up from the city and chatted with us about life in Buenos Aires and his love for horses. He rescues a lot of his horses from abuse and mistreatment and nurses them back to health. When we arrived at the stables, Miriam greeted us with warm hugs, Mate and pastries. When it was time to start riding, Adrian was patient and encouraging. I used to ride a lot as a child, but he certainly challenged me! It was so fun to learn the Argentinian way of riding. My boyfriend never had any riding instruction, and improved dramatically by the end. I loved riding in the park - so much open space and beautiful scenery. We were on horseback for over 2 hours (I'm still sore as I'm writing this!). When we got back to the stables, we had lunch and chatted some more. It's so apparent that both Miriam and Adrian love animals and enjoy sharing their life with visitors. I hope that we will be able to visit again soon!

If someone discovers a better ride in the world please let me know!. Caballos a la Par is a unique and special experience. For us it was the best part of the trip in Buenos Aires. For anyone who is a lover of horses do not miss the opportunity to live this moment that will surely be unforgettable. I will not talk much because I want to leave you hungry to go (laughs). Adrian and Miriam are very lovable people who love horses and added the spectacular scenery of the place ... oh my God ... is indescribable !!! Go and see what is good !!!

Great day with horses. We are a Norwegian family with 2 twelve years old girls who love horses. So when we went to Buenos Aires we wanted to find somewhere they could go riding and we found Caballos AlaPar which was perfect. Adrian picked us up in the city and took us to his beautiful place a short ride from the city. Our girls got two very kind horses and went off with Adrian for two hours while me and my wife were relaxing and enjoying the beauty of the place while we were chatting with Miriam, Adrians partner. After two hours they came back and our girls were so happy. They had learned a lot about horse riding the argentinian way. We recommend Caballos AlaPar to everyone who wants a great experience with horses and a beautiful day out of town.

wonderful experience!. If you are looking to go on a day trip horseback riding tour close to Buenos Aires, then look no further. Caballos a la Par is all it promises: authentic, personalised service, tailored to your wishes and horseback riding skills (I am not a very experienced rider and went along with a very experienced friend, and we enjoyed the day thoroughly!!!). Amazing scenery close to BsAs (30 minutes), really well-kept horses and the very hospitable Adrian and Miriam will make sure that your day will be wonderful! All is accompanied by delicious mate, empanadas and a dip in the pool at the end! Hope I will be going back soon.

Fantastic day!. The two of us were keen to do some horse-riding during our brief stay in Buenos Aires. Luckily we found the perfect venue, thanks to Adrian and Miriam. The house and stables are half an hour''s drive out of the city. Adrian picked us up at a pre-arranged rendez-vous in town and explained that we would be riding side by side with him through a national park of 24,000 acres. At the house he first introduced us to mate, explaining the significance of the 'mate ceremony', at the same time talking to us about his horses - putting us at our ease, since we are not experienced riders. He taught us the rudiments of handling the horses before we started, and then we began a wonderful afternoon's ride in beautiful countryside. After more than two hours' ride, during which time we gained confidence and skill thanks to Adrian's teaching, we returned to the house for a swim in the pool and tea and cakes. Miriam took us back to town after a truly wonderful day!

A day in Wonderland'***. wow,...what a day I had!I absolutely and very highly recommend taking a class with Miriam and enjoying the beauty her world has to offer! I had never really ridden a horse before and am now pretty secure about how to do it!Thank you SO much for making my vacation a special one and showing me the magic of riding horses <3This is a must do for everyone interested!!!!

An amazing adventure and unforgetable experience for my children!. When organizing my trip to Buenos Aires with my family I decided to include a typical Gaucho program, and based on previous review I selected the Caballos a la par. Adrian and Mirian, who run this business are amazing people and deserve all the good feedback which was already written about this tour. During 3 hours we ride 5 beautiful horses in a protected area very well kept, and with all the rustic style and local vegetation of the region. Even considering the few hours on top of the horses my children (9 and 11 years old) loved it, and for my biggest surprise, they were able to ride a horse very fast (galope), which was also a big surprise for Adrian. I strongly recommend this tour not only for the horse riding, but also to know this beautiful region of Buenos Aires, which is 40 minutes away from the city! My children still talk about this tour, and if you check the video of my boy riding a horse you will certainly understand why! Check it out: http://youtu.be/MbQFn3mq_kM.The command voice at the background is Adrian always correcting our posture and helping us to ride properly. :-)

Magnificent experience. Miriam was so friendly and welcoming and really made this experience so wonderful. The riding part was amazing in itself. My horse was so obedient and I trusted her completely within seconds! The scenery throughout the ride was stunning. What an enjoyable experience.

Great fun. I never thought I would be able to trot and canter but I did! Miriam was a great teacher and the horses carefully chosen to work with beginners. We were collected from a meeting point in BA and driven 45 minutes to the property. We rode for about 2.5 hours through the national park, tasted some mate, and enjoyed a cold drink and pastries before being driven back.

Unforgettable experience in BA. Horseback riding with Miriam has been one of the highlights of my trip to Buenos Aires. Having almost no riding experience I was amazed that by the end of the day I felt confident in riding independently. Miriamm is a fantastic instructor that made the day a blast. The facilities are beautiful as are the incredible horses. Riding through the beautiful Argentinian countryside was unlike any other horseback excursion I've been on. This is honestly an experience not to be missed, and a great way to leave the hustle and bustle of BA for a beautiful experience. Thank you, Miriam, and Adrian we will meet next time! Ciao!

We Can See Why Everyone LOVES This Place. We only took this activity yesterday, but were compelled to write this review as soon as possible, as we are still buzzing from the experience.We are a mixed ability group, including one who has NEVER even SAT on a horse before, however, we knew it would be special when Miriam met us in town, and we felt like we were seeing an old friend.We unfortunately didn't get to meet Adrian on our day at Caballos A La Par, but Miriam was the most amazing host, making us feel completely at ease, both before meeting our horses (perfectly matched to each of us) and during our ride out in the beautiful National Park.The horses at Caballos A La Par are clearly very happy and brilliantly looked after...their calm nature meant that we achieved more than we felt could be possible in one session on horseback...and Miriam kindly took pictures and video of the amazing experience.We should also note that Miriam and Adrian's home is completely relaxing with happy, free-roaming horses, the best behaved, most friendly dogs and chilled out cats.We even had a dip in the pool after our ride and empanadas.We can easily see why Caballos A La Par is so highly regarded by everyone who visits...unforgettable.If you are in Buenos Aires, we can not recommend this Riding School more enthusiastically...a must-do activity.

Great outing from the city!. Our family had a GREAT time during our day with Adrian and Miriam. I had doubts about leaving the great city even for a day but it was fun beyond my expectations. We had, in one afternoon, about ten weeks worth of private riding lessons. Adrian started us out at the ranch with some quality mate and chat. Then they picked the right horses for us even though all of is were different levels of riders. Even my son and husband cantered, without hands, through a wild field. We were so lucky to have that day. We will always remember it for the rest of our lives. The empanadas at the end were a nice touch.

The best part of our trip. My husband and I traveled to BA for our honeymoon and spent most of our time in the busy city. We were eager to venture out of the city to see the land and of course ride some horses. Once we arrived at Caballos A La Par it took our breathe away and we instantly felt at peace. We spent about 3 hours riding through fields, creeks and trails. Keep in mind this is not a guider tour, It was just my husband, myself and the instructor who rode side by side.. Sooo cool..It was the best riding experience I've ever had and we fell in love with the instructors which were very humble, kind, fun and professional. They also helped us a lot with our technique and form. This place won my heart over and my husband and I hope to travel back in the near future..

Way better than you would expact!. After one month of BsAs I really needed to get back on a horse. Caballos a La Par is close to the city so I thought, let's give it a try! I thought it would be the tipical touristic horseback riding. Well, it isn't. They have high quality, very well trained horses for riders of every level. You don't ride a trail the horses already know and they teach you a lot! Miriam and Adrian are lovely people who take good care of you and your safety. Go for it!!

One of Our Best Days in Buenos Aires. What an amazing experience! My husband, who had never spent a minute on a horse before today, and I are still smiling hours after our ride. Adrian and Miriam made us feel right at home and offered us mate before our ride. After teaching us a few basics, we headed to a nearby park where Adrian taught us how to trot, canter, then canter without holding on to the reins. This is more than a business to them; it's a lifestyle and a true passion. Both Adrian and Merriam have wonderful energy. They encapsulate the definition of hospitality. This is a must-do!

An amazing day at an incredible place. Awesome!!. This was one of the best things I did in South America and was the highlight of Buenos Aires. I hadn't rode before but the patience of Adrian (my instructor) helped me ride with confidence by the end, the fact it was one on one tuition helped greatly. I was given a beautiful horse who was incredibly well trained which helped a lot. The scenery was beautiful, such a great place to learn to ride. The hospitality was the best I experienced in South America, you are made to feel very welcome. I cannot recommend this activity highly enough, you will be missing out if you don't do it.

Great experience!. Thoroughly recommended. As I had only been on a horse once before Iwas slightly apprehensive but I needn't have worried with Adrian and Miriam's patient instruction and most of all Indio (6* horse - patient but cheeky) I gained enough confidence to canter without reins.

Best day in Argentina. We are not huge horse riders, but thought going on a ride would be a great way to see the Pampas. The day was a blast, and our favorite and most memorable day in the country. The horses were easy to ride, the staff were professional and very friendly, and everything was organized perfectly. Thank you!

MAGICAL DAY ON A MAGICAL HORSE. I have ridden horses in Australia since I was 6, and then for 4 years living in England. I have never had an experience like today's! I rode with my instructor, whose name, like mine, is Miriam. I was given an Argentine Criollo Horse called Indio to ride, and off we set into the very large parklands that Peron "liberated" from a private rancher.The style of riding I was taught involves almost no rein contact, just a forward movement of the hands to accelerate, and a backwards movement to stop. Before long, I found myself cantering with no hands at all, and minimal leg usage. By the end of the ride, using gentle neck reining, I successfully cantered between barrels.I cannot praise this experience highly enough. Others have spoken of the outstanding hospitality, the Mate and the pastries - all true!If you love horses, and riding, or even if you just want to try for the first time - do yourself a favour and GO!!!!

LOVED THIS!. My husband and I can't say enough great things about this experience. It was an amazing day. Adrian picked us up from our hotel. He is warm and friendly and explained many things about Buenos Aires during the drive to his ranch. The ranch is spectacular...and the horses are so cared for and loved! We spent the first bit getting to know each other and it is during this time Adrian is selecting one of the horses for you. My husband and I have both not been on a horse in over 30 years and even then it was a simple trail ride. Adrian will spend about an hour at the ranch teaching you a few basic and then it was out to the beautiful park. We spent close to 3 hours riding in the park. It was so beautiful and Adrian is teaching you during the duration of the ride. By the end of the ride he had both my husband and I cantering with no hands. It was amazing and the horses are so well trained. What was even more impressive is their love for the horses...they are so well cared for. As soon as we returned from our ride they were removing the saddles and taking the horses for a bath. This was an absolute dream...I would highly recommend this experience horse lover or not! You will fall in love with these horses and the people who own the ranch. Worth every peso!

Mom and her 20 year old daughter looking for adventure!. I came to Buenos Aires to pick my daughter up from her travel abroad program. With a few days to spare I mentioned ,,"hey, I think while in Argentina one needs to ride horses,,," She was up for this and the reviews for this site were stellar. So, we booked the trip. This was the most fun I have ever had riding horseback in my life!! It was a lesson, a workout, an education,,and an amazing one on one experience with Adrian and the horses. Gorgeous countryside, and as one reviewer mentioned,,, I felt like a child riding across the English countryside! Adrian filmed our instruction and we are having such a good time watching the beautiful Argentine instruction from this master!!So beautiful,, not commercial,, And, the happiest dogs I have ever seen.. Can't wait to come back!!

Surpassed all expectations!!. I was recommended these people by some horse friends in Australia. When I told them I was coming to Argentina they said I couldn't leave without going riding with Adrian and Miriam. I really wanted to improve my riding and wasn't looking for a trail ride. Meeting Adrian and Miriam upon arrival I was greeted with mate tea and delicious pastries. They showed me around and made me feel really welcome, like an old friend. Miriam took me out for my lesson and it really shows that she and Adrian are exceptional teachers and very experienced with horses. We rode freely through some amazing parklands and forest and that by itself would have been enough, but then she started putting me through my paces. Before arriving I had explained that I wanted to get better as a rider and wanted to be challenged by the lesson. Miriam was totally up for the challenge and I felt like I had learned so much by the end of the day. We spent lots of time laughing and getting to know each other, as well as bonding with our talented horses who were clam, alert and very responsive. I was even able to jump straight into their pool to cool down after my lesson before being driven back into the city. What service! I can't wait to go back to see them and ride on my next visit. Steve from Australia.

Saddle up. We truly enjoyed our experience with Caballos A La Par. Booking a reservation went seamlessly as they were prompt with their replies to emails. They arranged for a convenient pick up and drop off location not far from our hotel (and city center). Once we arrived, we were welcomed into their home and offered mate and pastries. We learned about riding techniques and they paired us with horses that met our skill level. They encouraged us to challenge ourselves but also remained patient with us. We rode through a beautiful national park and learned how to walk, trot and canter. My husband and I are both beginners but were really set at ease and felt comfortable under Miriam's and Adrian's instruction. They were both so pleasant and have such a respect and love for their horses. If you're looking for a unique experience and a quick getaway from the city, you must book them!

First time horseback riding - loved it. This was an incredible day I had with my girlfriend at "Caballos A La Par". It exceeded all expectations. I did have no horseback riding experience at all and my girlfriend only had a little. Nevertheless, Adrian is such a good teacher and the horses at "Caballos A La Par" are trained so well, two hours after our arrival we were riding the amazing park in which the hacienda is located. Side by side!! As mentioned on the Web-Site the horses do not just follow each other. You ride the horse.It really was worth it.But don't forget: Horse riding is a sport. I felt my muscles the next day, even though I did a lot of other sports for all my life.

the best horse riding experience ever. This is definitely a must-do if you are visiting BA. Adrian&Myriam are amazingly kind people who will make this experience unforgettable. Located at 30 minutes from BA, Adrian picked me up and made me discover his world and his passion for horses. Caballos alapar is a paradise for horses. everything is around their wellness. they are beautiful and very responsive. this is also a fantastic opportunity to discover a marvellous countryside with some iguanas crossing from time to time. Adrian will teach you the proper Gaucho way of riding showing you great tricks. It is truly my favourite experiences horse riding and this is great to meet such a lovely person as Adrian! I'll definitely go back!

This is riding. I had an incredible day riding with Adrian and Miriam--what a beautiful setting! They will cater to any level of rider, but I came in with an intermediate level of experience in Western style. "A la par" is not Western or English style. It's gaucho, and the switch was difficult for me, but Adrian was not going to let me go without getting it. He's a taskmaster who gives individual instruction, so it was not the relaxing, mindless kind of wandering in the countryside you might get elsewhere, but it was worth the work. The horses are so well trained, you know it's the rider who needs to adjust when things aren't right. If you're not up for the effort, you can stay back and play with the happiest dogs in the world, take a dip in the pool, drink mate, and wait for the empanadas to get there!

Muy divertido -- very fun! A perfect day trip.. We were visiting Buenos Aires for a week and wanted to visit an estancia out in the pampas for a day. We found this trip on TripAdvisor and were blown away by the favorable reviews. And guess what? They are 100% accurate.First of all, all of the logistics are built in. They arrange a pickup for you at a restaurant near the subway. They drive you in and out of town. They give you all of the training you need to be cantoring and trotting at decent speeds. It's really exhilarating! The horses are SO well behaved, as Adrian and Miriam are expert trainers. They also were very patient with our beginner's experience. It felt very customized for our skill level, whereas if we had had lots of experienc ethey could have given us an equally great experience.They don't rush you either. We were served maté to start and coffee/water at the end of the day. We were lucky to have brilliant weather, leaving us humbled and happy. We will 100% recommend this to all of our friends who come to Bs As, and cannot say enough nice things about Adrian and Miriam (and Hector, who picked us up in the city). I had so many moments on my ride where I thought "Wow. This is the most beautiful sight. I am so so happy." While we really adore Buenos Aires, the highlight of our trip was this visit to Caballas A La Par.

A unique and amazing experience. This is my first comment on any travel site as I am not the type to praise for no reason. I have to say the day with Adrian and Miriam was the best part of my trip to Argentina (without a doubt). I have had very little riding experience but Adrian takes the time to first talk to you, then pick one of his 16 horses that fits your needs and level. Even if you are a beginner, the horses are extremely well trained and you feel comfortable in the saddle. They teach the Argentinian style of riding and really push you to learn how to ride properly because they are truly passionate about all things equestrian. The park is large and diverse in scenery, the ranch a beautiful spot but it is really the people that makes this experience. It is so refreshing to meet people driven by their passion and not business. If you are looking for a truly unique activity, one in which you have to work but feel rewarded in the end, Caballos a la Par is the place for you. And so you know this is not a fake review... Only downside is I was a bit sore the next day BUT WELL WORTH IT!

The best ever, anywhere on the planet. What struck me right away was The care they give their horses, the way the staff takes the time to get to know you over a mata before they put you on your horse, who really is a member of their family. The property butts up against a huge 20,000 hector park, where you are not riding in a packed trail style ride, rather a free, do what you want to kind of way. They also give you Instruction if you ask for it. The park is beautiful and even has a small bamboo jungle in it, the temperature was mild. We enjoyed matta and pastries, a ride back and forth from buenos aires and the most loving, giving guides. I can't recommend this enough. If you are going to ride while in buenos aires, you must ride here.

Amazing Experience!. After reading the excellent reviews of Caballos A La Par here on TripAdvisor, I went ahead and booked my day trip. I had such a great time learning how to horseback ride with Adrian and Miriam. Both made me feel very welcomed and I can say I will go back and visit them next time I'm in Argentina. Before the horseback lessons we drank some mate and talked about horses and Argentine culture. Then onto the horseback lessons with Miriam. She was an excellent teacher! It had been a long time since I had been on a horse, so she was very patient with me and provided me with many suggestions and advice when riding horses. I can't wait to be back and visit my friends Miriam and Adrian. Don't miss out on this amazing experience when visiting Buenos Aires!

Ansolutely a must do when wanting to experience horseback riding. A very good experience. The owners know a lot about horses. The horses look very healthy and a very well trained. Facilities are very good and the owners are very open and friendly.

Wonderful Day in Nature. After I had quite some busy days in Buenos Aires, I liked the idea to leave the city behind for a day. I found myself back at Miriam's and Adrien's staples, where they gave a warm welcome to me and introduced me to the habits of drinking mate. Later on, Adrien and I rode out to the ecological reserve nearby, passing a stream, a forest and beautiful grasslands. In parallel, Adrien tought me the Argentine style of riding, which is so much different to the European :) Besides having fun to finally ride a horse again, the amazing nature and the nice company - the fact, that there were no other tourists (as it was a private tour), made it an experience I do not want to miss. What a great day!

Una experiencia inolvidable. Caballos A La Par is an experience like no other. By combining well-trained horses and personalized lessons, it’s an equestrian training centre that is favorable to students of all levels. Without much experience, Adrian guided us through the pristine park, while fervently teaching us to trot, canter and gallop. Caballos A La Par is an activity I would both recommend and aspire to return to one day. ¡ Gracias Adrian y Miriam !

Amazing horseback riding experience close to Buenos Aires. If you book a horseback riding trip with Caballos A La Par you won't be disappointed! I've been riding for almost 20 years and I was very happy to have found a place where they offer individual horse riding lessons. When arriving at the beautiful ranch, you can immediately feel the passion Miriam and Adrian have for horses and their style of riding. There are different horses available for experienced and non experienced riders, all the horses are in great condition. Adrian explained their style of riding while we enjoyed drinking mate, after which we went riding in the forest for over two hours. I enjoyed riding in the beautiful forest, where no paths have to be followed! We practized different exercises and it's surprising how much you can learn in one day! The hospitality and passion of Miriam and Adrian, their great horses, individual teaching, the beautiful ranch and forest made this an unforgettable experience which I would highly recommend to everybody!

An amazing day out. I cannot recommend Caballos a la Par highly enough. It is about 30 minutes outside of Buenos Aires, next to a beautiful national park. Adrian and Miriam are both lovely and were so friendly and welcoming. I was asked about my riding experience so I could be matched with a horse suitable for my riding ability, and provided with a hat and chaps.Having ridden for most of my life in the UK, it was strange to ride Argentinian style, a completely different style of riding than I was used to. However, after some instructions from Adrian, I was off for a beautiful ride with Miriam, who carried on teaching and helping me thought the ride. We rode through the gorgeous Argentinian countryside, walk trotting and cantering, even cantering without reins. Caballos a la Par do not follow set rides or tracks, so you are able to ride wherever you choose. Miriam was great, and very knowledgable, she helped me improve my riding throughout the day. I thoroughly enjoyed my time with Adrian and Miriam and would recommend it to anyone, whether an experience rider or a complete beginner. The horses are gorgeous, well looked after, well trained, and safe, and the riding is fantastic. I cannot wait to return to Argentina so I can visit them again. Go to Caballos a la Par, you will have a fantastic day and meet some lovely people and horses!

Most stunning experience during our Buenos Aires stay. We went for horse riding with Adrian and his team and just has an excellent day in the nature. Adrian welcomed us with Mate and we got to know each other first. Then we had a little ride on their property so Adrian could check our Level of expertise. After that we went for a 2.5hrs ride in the beautiful nature reserve which is located only 30 minutes aways from Buenos Aires. By that time we already felt disconnected from rushy Buenos Aires and just enjoyed the nature. My boyfriend and me have different Levels of expertise on horses but Adrian gave us excellent recommendations on how to improve our riding skills. We felt super comfortable on our horses Indio and Lindo. You can really feel the passion of Adrian (and his son and team :)) for the horses. For us, this was definitely an unforgetteable experience and certainly the best we had during our stay in Argentina. Adrian and team, we definitely come back!

Tailormade, non-touristy 5 star experience. I have travelled the world extensively and must admit that this is the first experience that convinced me of registering with trip advisor and write a review. Blessed to have lived in several countries of Europe, Latin America and Asia and a great hunger for traveling the world, I can say that I am very spoiled when it comes to rating value-for-money experiences. My girlfriend and me have spent a full day at the outskirts of Buenos Aires at this beautiful place and both improved our horse riding skills by far due to the individual advice provided by Adrian. It started with a uncomplicated communication and perfect organization by Miriam, a friendly pickup by Héctor (even though being 40 minutes late to the pick up point due to traffic and other reasons) and a warm welcome at the ranch. Adrian explained the art of drinking Mate while discussing our riding skills (mine equaled more or less none, my girlfriends were advanced) and after some rounds of revitalizing "hierba" we were already introduced to our horses and were doing the first rounds on the premises. Both our horses Lindo (the handsome) and Indio (selfexplanatory :-) ) were trained excellent and very, very calm - this stayed like that the whole trip. No rushing home, no following each other, no lazyness...nothing! - impeccably trained, friendly and chilled horses!We lasted for rough three hours and were absolutely done. Adrian pushed us through the exercises in a very professional way and improved our skills by far - we had to ask to stop due to being totally exhausted. Back a the stalls we still were allowed to train some basic moves, provided soft drinks and then taken back to Buenos Aires. This is by far the best horse riding experience in general, but specially when thinking about the value for money. I thank both Miriam and Adrian, but also the horses and the rest of the staff for this great day. Definitely one to recommend!RegardsRichard

Great experience. Searching for a pace to ride in BA I got in contact with Caballos A La Par via a colleague.Adrian and Miriam have set up a great stable. Nicely trained horses for beginners as well as for experienced riders both for young and old. They will take you for a wonderful privat tour. No riding in line with mixed inexperienced and experienced riders but a 1 on 1 tour in which you will get all the attention you need.As from the first moment on I felt "home" immediately. Everything is done to make you as comfortable as possible. Before you leave they will ask you for some details on your riding experience to select a horse which matches for you. During the tour you will get great instruction on how riding them in a correct way. I have some riding experience in English style mainly jumping. I discovered a whole new world in the western style thanks to Adrian and Miriam.I'm looking forward going to BA the next time. For sure this trip will be on the planning again.Thx Miriam and Adrian. And please don't change the format ........it's perfect

A must if you live or visit BA!. I heard of Caballos A La Par through a mutual friend when I had inquired about finding "a great, horse riding experience where I'd actually learn something and get to run horses, that wasn't too far from the city." So many times I've gone to a touristy-type stable and was trotted out with a group of city slickers, only to become bored 30 mins with the trip and annoyed with the scenery on repeat. This is not the case with CALP. The testimony of my friend was on point that day, but she far undersold it in my opinion. On 2.5 hour trip out that day with my best friends in tow (they only take private groups or personal trips,) we discovered so much more than just "a fun time on some horses," but instead we each received an intimate, specific instruction on our form with constant correction; how to connect and transmit energy to lead the horse personally assigned to us (Adrian is like the horse whisperer!); how to canter without hands!; and understanding the environment you navigate (ducking branches is tricky...) and why working with people who are passionate and in love with their profession can inspire you to live the life you want to live. It's not just about riding a horse. It's about learning about your limits, conquering a skill you didn't think you had and respecting nature and all its glory. In addition to Adrian and Miriam being so amazing as guides and hosts, they also allow the well fed, clean horses to free roam most of the day at their lovely, spacious compound; they have a spotless stable that smells more of fine leather saddles instead of manure; and have amenities offered like a playground for kids, cats and dogs to play with and a giant swimming pool to cool off in after a hard ride. I just came back from my 2nd trip out with another friend who was visiting from NYC, and she hasn't stopped talking about it. I am here for a bit longer, and I'm definitely going to return on a frequent basis. Apparently, my galloping / stopping lesson is next! Whoooo hoooo! Thanks again CALP for being here and doing what you do!

Amazing experience!. I can warmly recommend this place! The place it beautiful, the staff is very friendly and professional and the horses as well! The horses were in a very good condition. We were a group of friends with people who never had been riding before and people who have been riding for many, many years and we all had an amazing experience.

Great experience. For a 75 yr old who had never ridden a horse before to be cantering after 30 mins instruction was amazing.The teaching by Adriano is 1 on 1 side by side with you.The horses respond immediately & are bullet proofWe had 4 dogs rush out barking & the horses never even moved.This was a great 1st time experience for me.The equipment facilities & horses are 1st class.Thanks so much Miriam &Abriano

Fabulous - lovely to meet talented horseminded people - and well trained horses. Having owned horses and ridden all my life I always approach any sort of 'trekking excursion ' with extreme caution. I am often saddened by the lack of competence of the people providing the service and the lack of care provided to the horses. On this trip I can confidently say - if you are novice or experienced this will be the best money you ever spent ! . The hosts are professional. friendly and very competent. Clearly their love of horses is the driving factor in the whole business. The horses clearly loved as individuals, and cared for to a very high standard. They are also very well trained, very different from my dressage horses at home in England, it was like being a child again, galloping across open country on a cowboy pony ! . I had the most amazing time, sharing knowledge, experiences and the over-riding love of horses whilst I was there.I took home with me a set of great memories (videos and photos ) , a deeper understanding of other forms of equestrianism and more importantly, some new friends - all of which I will cherish

We need more excursions like this!!. This excursion was the highlight of our trip! It is so well organised and safe considering one of my friends never rode a horse before. We were picked up from BA and brought to the estancia which was a bonus because not all public transport is available on the weekends! We spent 2.5 hrs on the horses that are responsive to the rider and not to the horse in front, which is refreshing. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. Keep up the good work!! Overall the experience was worth the price!

A must-do!. When living in Buenos Aires without grass and nature, it was a good experience to come out in a relaxing and clean environment. The horses were really good, and the people were also very nice and service minded. And When i returned to the city, I could feel that I had used some muscles that hadn't been in use for a long time In my eyes: don't miss this opportunity.
Great!!. I absolutely loved it! We learned a lot and the people working there were magnificent! Everybody that wants to see the argentinian nature and loves horses should try this :)

Excellent adventure right outside of Buenos Aires. Excellent conditions for me as a beginner. We were taken great care of and my friends who had more experience enjoyed it just as much as I did. We were picked up in the city and after 30 min we were in beautiful surroundings at their new stables. Everything was ready for us when we arrived, but they made sure we were comfortable in the saddle before we went off. The actual riding was for 2,5 hours straight and the time flew by like nothing. It was a great feeling to feel my level increase for every minute. I will be back to learn more!

Worth every peso!. Such an amazing and different experience with horseback-riding. The best way to get a break from the city-life in Buenos Aires. Beautiful and well trained horses, wonderful surroundings and the most caring people!

Magnificent horses and a magical experience. Wow. I've had the best experience in Buenos Aires so far - and I've been here for a month doing all sorts of things. One thing was the incredibly beautiful surroundings not too far from the city. But the service, the hospitality, the horses, the atmosphere, the cheerfulness, the passion... I mean, it is true what they told us: You won't find any place like this. Incredibly dedicated staff, so great conditions for the horses and even for me, completely inexperienced with horseback riding, it was such a magical experience. I am SO going back to be inspired from this place in a way I had never dreamed of.

Unique experience. This is one of the best things I did during my week in Buenos Aires. Miriam and Adrian, who own and run the set-up, are such interesting and generous people. They really love and believe in what they are doing and really care about their horses and about your objectives and learning.We were picked up from BA and, on arrival, sat round the kitchen table, chatting and drinking maté (carefully concocted by Adrian) for best part of an hour before heading out. The horse you ride is carefully selected by Adrian and Miriam to suit your ability (which has been discussed over maté). I rode a lovely grey Criollo cross with a very soft mouth and smooth gait.I was taught by Adrian who grew up in the area, is a former gaucho, polo player and self-taught showjumper and now competes in certain gaucho reining games and also endurance events on the beautiful Arab horses that they have. It was very interesting to talk to him about how he came to be involved in all the different disciplines.The national park in which you ride is lush and beautiful with wooded areas, streams, long grasses and wild flowers (my visit was in early spring) and became all the more beautiful as we returned to the stables in the soft setting sunlight. Adrian used a mixture of teaching techniques: not giving you too many things to focus on at once. I was keen to improve my cantering technique in particular and he videoed me on my camera so that I could see what I was doing which was extremely valuable.I had originally thought it seemed like an expensive outing but for the 1:1 attention you receive and for the quality of the horses, teaching and beautiful nature, it is 100% value for money. It might be a helpful thing to do to gain confidence in the saddle before staying on an estancia elsewhere in Argentina where the gauchos are unlikely to give you tips on technique.

So good, I visited a second time.. I should start this review off by saying that I have been riding horses for years and have had many lessons (though admittedly it's been awhile). Caballos A La Par offered an amazing experience for me. Their horses are of the highest caliber, though everything they offer is of the highest quality, from the tack, to the pastries at the end of the day. But the horses...the horses were superb! There are 16 horses at their stables, and they match the horse to you after assessing your ability and energy. The horses are all extremely well-trained, beautiful, and happy. The first day I visited I rode one-on-one with Adrian, who is a first-rate instructor. His observations and directions were excellent; I feel I gained so much from our one lesson. While I was only planning on the one visit I decided to fit an extra in. The second time I rode with Miriam, who is also an amazing instructor and fascinating person. Both Adrian and Miriam worked me hard and I gained so much from our time together. A beginner rider would have enjoyed themselves and learned much; as an intermediate level rider it was incredible, a dream come true. Thank you Miriam and Adrian for providing such a wonderful experience!
