One word: Perfect!!!!. It just takes you 30 mins to get from Buenos Aires to the wonderful home of "Caballos A La Par". I only had one free day in Buenos Aires befor I had to return back to switzerland. Due to the fact that I'm obsessed with horses, this was the best desicion I could have made. Adrian and Miriam are two wonderful, caring persons. You can feel the passion, which they have for their horses and it's wonderful to see it. I've been horseback riding ever since I was a child, so I kind of know what a horse needs to be in a good shape...the stable looks amazing, bright and a lot of fresh air. The horses are in a great shape and couldn't be more healther. After I was introduced to Miriam and the horses, Adrian and I started our trip with drinking mate tea and talking about horses and what kind of experiences I've already made on a horseback. But even if you don't have any experience at all, Adrian and Miriam will take care of you! I felt so comfortable being there and couldn't wait to get on a horseback!!! I went on a trip with Adrian. After giving me a few instructions we were ready to leave. One of the most amazing things is, that you are right the middle of a national park which is called "Parque Pereyra Iraola". This park is just wonderful!!! I've been horse back riding for so many years but this experience was so unique!!!! I enjoyed every single minute on my trip with "Caballos A La Par". After a few hours, Adrian and I returned to the stable and there was Miriam , waiting for us with a surprise.I'm not gonna tell you what it is, but just let me say it was the best possible way to finish such an amazing day.I promised myself to go back and visit Adrian and Miriam again!!!! I will never forget this experience, it was so unique and wonderful!!! A special place to go.If you want to enjoy Argentina on a horseback, then "Caballos A La Par" it is!!!!Go and convince yourself. It is worth it!!!!!I will definitely come back and enjoy it again!!!!

A wonderful experience. I highly recommend Caballos a la Par, it has been an amazing experience. I had the opportunity to ride, on a private trip with Adrian (the instructor) on two very well trained horses, Indio and Shake. Both horses were fantastic to ride in a beautiful, wild infinite landscape. It is a paradise!Since the moment you get there, before the excursion begins, Adrian and Miriam welcome you and make you feel like home, with delicious traditional Argentinean cakes and its national drink, called ‘mate’. Both of them are adorable, very attentive, and speak perfectly English! Before riding, they will assign you the horse that best suits your level. The horses there are amazing in all terms. They are very well trained and treated with a lot of love and consideration, they transmit them a lot of passion and respect. Since the moment I started riding, Adrian made me feel very comfortable on the horse, he is a fantastic instructor who brings out the best of everyone while riding, no matter what level you have! I had the chance to walk, trot and gallop through the beautiful fields with two different horses (Indio and Shake) while Adrian kept improving my techniques and posture. And as well, he offered himself to take me fantastic photos and videos of me while galloping! It was great! I have honestly been riding for a few years, and this has been one of my best experiences on a horse. I have no doubt that no matter what your level is, you will live an amazing and unforgettable time while horseback riding. As soon as I am back to Buenos Aires, I will certainly repeat this wonderful experience.PS. The offer you transportation from Buenos Aires center!

Best Way to Spend Day in BA. I absolutely recommend Caballos A La Par to anyone who visits Buenos AIres, whether it is for a few days or for a couple months. Miriam and Adrian are amazing hosts and provide what I believe is the best experience in BA. Whether you have no experience of lots of experience riding horses, they have a horse that will be perfect for you. If you want to be challenged, they can help with that too. Aside from the horses, the rest of the day is great too. When you show up, Adrian whips up one of the best Mates in Argentina. After your mate, you get to escape to an amazing park, where you get to roam free. You walk, trot, and canter - it is truly an amazing ride. After the ride, if you go on the weekend, eat the best empanada in Argentina. The experience at Caballos a La Par was so great, I went back for a second ride. Next time I am in BA, it will definitely be one of my first stops. There is no better way to escape the concrete jungle for a morning or an afternoon than Caballos a La Par!

Thanks!. A big thanks to Miriam & Adrian for a great first experience on horses. It's been a wonderful afternoon, starting with the traditional mate, and then straight to business, with the encounter with the horses, instructions, and off we go: walking at first and then trying the trot and canter. It really is a great way to learn quickly, to have your instructor on a horse next to you. Our horses were fantastic and very forgiing: after a couple of hours, you don't feel like coming back...We recommend Caballos A La Par! Sam & Lis

Amazing!!!. I highly recommend Caballos a La Par to anyone who is visiting Buenos Aires! This was both a great riding experience but also just a lovely day spent with very special people, Miriam and Adrian. We would consider ourselves beginning riders and by the end of the riding session, they had us riding without holding the reins!! The horses are very well behaved/trained and we felt very comfortable with them. We rode through a very nice park/countryside with very beautiful scenery. We cannot thank Miriam and Adrian enough for a lovely day with them and their horses!!

You should try it. You will feel great.. I can highly recommend Caballos A La Par. Having zero experience horseback riding I did not know what to expect. Within short time, Adrian had me riding fast (as least to my impression) and in control of the horse with one hand and in one case hands free. Being a rookie, I was surprised how responsive the horses were to your guidance and direction. The horses are very well trained. Everything was very pleasant, the pickup, the introduction with mate-tea, the surrounding, the horses, the staff. I was a bit proud of my accomplishment that I have been showing around some of the video and photos Adrian took (and calling myself by my rider alias El Tronador). And of course I had to have a polo-shirt. You should try it. You will feel great.

Worth the trip to Buenos Aires alone!!!. Could not recommend this experience enough. I read about Caballos A La Par in Loneley Planet. Have always been satisfied with pretty much everything that these travel books recommend and this was certainly no exception. Miriam and Adrian could not have been more gracious, patient and experienced hosts. Miriam spent over 2 hours riding with us, teaching us the basics and more....horses were beautiful, scenery was beautiful....could not have asked for a better day.Thank you again Miriam and Adrian - will be singing your praises forever!

Amazing experience! . I can not recommend this experience highly enough. Booking was very easy and we were picked up close to our hostel which made getting there easy too. Miriam and Adrian were very hospitable and were incredibly kind and patient. The ride was through Buenos Aires' beautiful and expansive national park. As someone who has ridden horses since being a child, I learned so much in the afternoon ride as the teaching was specific and the horses very well trained and responsive. I would recommend this experience for any level of rider, even if you haven't ridden before but experienced riders will love it too. This is NOT a pony trek but a bespoke lesson through beautiful scenery. It was excellent and a wonderful experience which we will never forget.

Thanks Miriam and Ardrian!. As backpackers my boyfriend and I are skeptical of any kind of trips or tours and we would rather find a way to do it on our own. But since I love horses, I had to check this one out after reading all the reviews. My horseback riding experiences were mostly in SEA and they were very disappointing since the horses simply follow the trail or other horses or the owner.First of all, I contacted them through their website. Miriam was very prompt in replying to emails and answered all my questions regarding the tour cost, pick up time and location, and so on.When we got to the park, she brewed some mate and showed us the way to drink mate and asked us about our experience with horses. Adrian and Miriam decided which horses would suit us.You can tell they really care about their horses and love what they do. Miriam was our teacher and she was very patient with us. The horses are really healthy and very well trained. When we were "walking" through the park, we asked her which way we should go and she said just take your horse and roam free. If you've done other horseback riding tours before, you don't ever get to roam free.By the end of the day, we were able to walk and canter with the horses and sit somewhat properly. Since we are beginners and it was hard for us (well, more for me) to sit with curved back and heels downward. (Kept yelling at myself "Heels, Down!") This tour is not for a big group, they prefer to have 2-3 people in a group.They have two trips a day, one at 10am and second one at 2pm. Each trip takes about 3-4 hours.After we got back, Miriam made us amazingly decadent hot chocolate (submarinos) and served it with Argentinian pastries.As backpackers, we are all about saving money but I can honestly say it was worth every penny and especially if you are beginners, you get to learn how to ride a horse.

In one word "amazing " !!!. It was an amazing dayDo not miss it!! you should have it done at least once in a life. Another way to think and ride horses that are so well trained and in a specific way. Gently and smoothly. I'm very happy that I did it and the homelike and sincere welcome were great, now we are like friends now

The Best Horseback Riding Lesson In Buenos Aires!. Before coming to Caballos A La Par the only horseback riding experience I had were trail rides where you sit on the horse and it just follows the horse in front of it. I had never gone faster than a walk. I ended my lesson cantering with my horse Regalito without holding the reins! Even after reading all the reviews I did not expect this. The horses are beautiful, well-fed and happy. Miriam and Adrian make you feel at home from the moment they meet you. It was a perfect day!

Fabulous Experience-- Don't Miss!. if you want to see some of the Argentinian countryside and enjoy a wonderful afternoon of real horse riding (not trail riding) ...this is how to do it. Adrian will pick you up and return you to Buenos Aires, the stables are only 30 mins from the city and are next to a beautiful protected parkland where you can ride all afternoon. Don't worry if your party is of mixed ability--- they cater for beginners also.Your hosts Miriam and Adrian speak fluent English and are very friendly and experienced riders, they will assess your riding skills and give you a horse to suit your ability. We spent an afternoon at Caballos A La Par and loved it-- definitely one of the highlights of our visit to Argentina.Gracias y hasta pronto

Amazing horse-riding experience!. Definitely a must-try experience if you have a few hours to spare while visiting Buenos Aires! The co-owners of Caballos A La Par, Adrian and Miriam, are very passionate in horse-riding and in ensuring the horses are properly treated. They adopt a unique training method in which riders and instructors ride alongside each other instead of a line. We rode our horses freely in the national park which was beautiful and serene. As the training is provided in private group so Adrian and Miriam would personalise the training depending on your own level and experience in horse-riding. After 2.5-hour ride we were back to the house and Adrian and Miriam served us with a lot of scrumptious pastries and Mate! It was really an unforgettable experience as part of our honeymoon trip in Argentina!

Unmissable!. I spent an afternoon with my brother at the farm in July, we found it on Tripadvisor and were lured by the many great reviews on its page.Adrian picked us up from central Buenos Aires, and within 30 minutes we arrived to the stables, we were welcomed by Miriam and three adorable dogs, and a special cat. After inviting us to their little guesthouse and serving us Matte, we went to see the farm's horses. My brother and I are riders, and we were very impressed with their shape and fitness level.. There were a variety of breeds, Arabian, local, mixed and many more each with an interesting story and an interesting name! The riding experience was like no other, in the great plain fields of the suburb of Buenos Aires I was riding Indio.. the ride was unbelievably smooth, the beautiful brown horse was well trained, and needed no more than a light gesture to canter or change direction.. Adrian recommended a few exercises and tricks which made us enjoy the ride even better.. Another thing that I personally liked is the fact that Adrian was documenting every minute of our riding experience with our mobile phones, he recorded videos and captured amazing pictures of me and my brother throughout our journey (mom was very pleased when she saw them afterwards) After the ride, Miriam prepared some Argentinean style hot chocolate, which was of course delicious, and we enjoyed our hot drink with some incredible sweets fresh from the bakery! We had various conversations, and we felt a true connection to Adrian, Miriam, the horses, and the farm. We didn't want to leave.. I recommend this experience to everyone who's visiting Buenos Aires, wether or not you are interested in riding .. you will not regret it!

Lovely afternoon outside Buenos Aires. We will remember this afternoon for a long time. Both my husband and I had not ridden horses in several years, but our guide Miriam made us both feel at ease and explained how to do everything . The scenery on the ride was spectacular and very relaxing. Thanks for the lovely day!

The best way to spend your vacation with hosres.. The farm is only half an hour far away from Buenos Aires. When we reached the farm we met Meriam and Adrian who were in charge of the farm. We drank 'Mate' the Argentinan tradional drink and eat some delicious sweets. Adrian and Meriam were very warm and friendly. Adrian then started talking about the horses and the park that we were going to ride in for today's trip. I went with my sister; we road wonderful horses. A traditional Gucho horse called Indio and mix breed buetiful horse called Lindo and Adrian was riding Sheikh and Arab horse. We learnt how to ride weatern style which is much easier than the European style. It was very fun riding Lindo. All the horses are very calm and easy to ride. We tried to Canter without holding on anything. The horses are very well traned. We did a lot of fun activities you will never regret coming to this farm. After we finished we went back to the farm and were suprised by some hot chocolate along with amazingly delicious sweets. We were then drived back to Buenos Aires. You would never regret this amazing experience!

For Horse Lovers. If I had only one day left in Buenos Aires, I would spend it at Caballos a la Par. I really can't recommend this enough.It's only half an hour outside of the city, but the place is so beautiful, with all the different trees and sprawling fields. Miriam and Adrian are both passionate about horses, and it shows in how they care for their animals and how they teach their students. Going there made me feel like I was that horse-crazy kid(!) again -- it's definitely a place for horse lovers.

Fantastic experience!. Caballos A La Par was amazing! Miriam taught us the intricacies of maté beforehand, then we rode through forest and meadows for four hours! I hadn't ridden in years, and Miriam was patient in helping me get back up to speed. We all cantered and galloped. And, not a trivial thing, Miriam took our phone and took tons of great action shots and video, leaving us to just ride and enjoy the wonderful day.Can't recommend this enough. You will have a blast whether you are beginner or expert as you ride open range, not single file. You can ride however you wish. Miriam and Adrian were awesome and would love to do it again!

Amazing Experience!. I really enjoyed my time at Caballos a la Par. I went there knowing nothing about horse riding and after around 3 hours, I was very much more confident. Had a great sense of achievement! It was a wonderful experience with lovely hosts and beautiful horses! Miriam helped us take great shots on the horses as well. Would highly recommend this :)

A wonderful and unique experience. Caballos a la par is easily one of the best riding experiences I have had traveling anywhere. I ride regularly but our group was of mixed riding experience. We went on a four hour ride and it was fantastic. Miriam, our guide, was fun and knowledgeable. The scenery was lovely. The horses were interesting and well trained but still with their own personalities. We had fun riding across the beautiful park land and picked up some riding tips on the way. Before and after the ride, they served warm drinks and pastries. The atmosphere is fun and the food is delightful. I even had my first experience with mate. Overall, this is well worth the time and will really add to your time in Argentina. I hope to come back soon and ride with Miriam soon.

Highlight of stay in Buenos Aires. We went for an afternoon ride with Caballos a la Par on our last day in Buenos Aires, and it was truly a highlight of our stay. They were super responsive when we emailed them and all the arrangements were incredibly easy to organize. When we arrived at the meeting point we were met with Adrian's smiling face, and upon arrival at the stables Miriam served us pastries and mate and started getting to know us both as people and as riders. Our ride through the park with Miriam was a joy. She is such a lovely person to talk to, and she gave each of us personalized attention to improve our riding. She also offered to hold our camera and take action photos for us so we could just enjoy the ride. The park itself is beautiful, and riding through it side by side (a la par) was a huge step up from the usual single file trail ride. After a few hours of riding we were more than ready for the pastries and hot chocolate waiting for us back at the stables. I could not recommend Caballos a la Par more highly. My only thought now is when I can return in summer time so that I can jump in the pool after the ride. Seriously, do yourself a favor and make an afternoon of riding part of your visit to Buenos Aires.

High point of my Argentina holiday!. I've done some horseback riding but always found the lessons boring. This was perhaps not an actual lesson (and it certainly didn't feel that way), but at the end I was riding better than I ever had before and had fun doing it! The park we went through was beautiful, we switched between galloping and just pacing to enjoy the scenery and through it all Miriam gave me some pointers to help me improve my riding. Before and after the riding both Adrian and Miriam took time making us feel welcome. In everything they say, it shows very clearly that they love providing a special time to their guests and, most importantly, that they love their horses. I would definitely do this again if I ever come back to Buenos Aires. Hopefully I will...

AMAZING !. I loved it! thankyou so much Miriam for the best time of my vacay. Enjoyed a nice cup of Matte and rode Indio (beautiful horse) for hours and it was fantastic ! Received real training and tips the entire time. Got amazing video and photos from Miriam who was able to capture them using my camera as we rode. really beautiful provincial park and scenery. HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT ! excellent for beginners or experienced riders since it's a private ride. if you don't even like horses you should go just to meet Miriam ! this Canadian will definitely be back !

A Once In A Life TIme Opportunity. I have traveled to many countries in this world doing some of the most adventurous things possible. This was by far one of the best and most beautiful experiences i have ever done in my life. Your day starts by getting a one on one private lesson on how to ride a horse by some of the best trainers in the world. You need no experience at all but for the people that do ride horses a lot like myself its some of the best terrain in the world. They have horses that suit all peoples skills that are very gentle, well trained, and really cared about. After you select your horse that fits you, you then leave the grounds and explore the country side of Buenos Aires, Argentina. There you see some of the most magnificent things to life. Caballos A La Par is something everyone must do if there are in Argentina. I can assure you that the owners Adrian and Miriam will show you the time of your life. here is a link of a glimpse of what you will do and see http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rmBVt3gqhBo&feature=youtu.be

Excellent time with the kids!. Just got back from a fantastic time with the kids at caballos a la par. Adrian did a great job teaching my kids. They learned a ton and had a wonderful time. We can't wait to go back!!

My best horseback riding experience! Simply the best.. I just moved to Buenos Aires and was looking for professional, yet fun horseback riding classes. After the first class, I signed up for 7 more classes because I learned more in two hours riding with Miriam (one of the owners of Caballos A La Par) than I did after years in a traditional manege in Belgium. I will try to go the whole year round, because riding with these horses in free nature is the perfect relaxation after a week in the city. Before class or if it is a one time experience, you get served the traditional mate and after class I got a hot chocolate with pastries. Delicious! The instructors are both passionate and fun people! Both speak perfect English, which helped as I don't speak Spanish yet. The horses are trained well and "El Palmar" and Bosques Petrificados are breathtakingly beautiful to ride through! I am taking all my friends and family there who come and visit me in Buenos Aires!I cannot wait to go back this weekend!

A great adventure. A morning spent riding Indio and Isabelle was the high point of our trip to Buenos Aires, they earned their carrots along with Adrian who provided good firm coaching and advice to improve our posture and skills in the saddle. For anyone looking to escape the congestion and noise of the city and feel more "at home" rather than being a tourist I can't think of a better activity. The park and the stables are just far enough from the city to feel like a different country but still be convenient for a half day. The animals are well cared for and our two horses adjusted rapidly to being ridden by visitors with almost no experience. Before and during the ride, Adrian took the time to talk to us about our experience and expectations and matched up horse and rider, putting us at ease and always making sure we were comfortable and secure while pushing us to improve and achieve more. The one on one approach (Adrian and Miriam never mix groups) keeps the focus riding without competition which makes for a relaxed atmosphere. Throughout the day, Adrian's passion for the horses and for riding is clear and heartfelt as is his interest in his guests experience. I can strongly recommend Caballos A La Par for anyone that has an interest in riding (not just sitting on a horse but wanting to learn to work in partnership with a horse) and wants to have an authentic personal experience in Buenos Aires.

More than perfect!. For all the people like me, who are searching a REAL horseback riding experience: come here and enjoy! On my whole trip through Brasil and Argentina this is definitely the best place by far! Really and seriously very very well treated happy horses on a beautiful spot and of course the gorgeous owners Miriam and Adrian who are running this place with a lot of passion and their personal relationsship to every single horse. They do not focus on their profit like most of the other places; first the animals then the rest and this is how it should be. Best empanadas on my whole stay in ARG, too :) An adorable place where you don't want to leave from.

Amazing. I am not very experienced at horse-back riding, but I wanted to experience the thrill of riding. Believe me, if you want to ride a horse which is completely at your command, Adrian and Miriam have the perfect horses for you. Four hours of incredible horse-back riding through a national conservation reserve. Adrian gives you his undivided attention so that by the end of the ride, you feel exhilarated on the horse galloping comfortably through the open fields. You certainly deserve the wonderful snack and mate (Argentine tea) waiting for you at the stables. Well worth the effort!

Highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. We had a fantastic afternoon with Adrian and his beautiful horses. Our experience surpassed all expectations, which were high to start with having read all the trip advisor reviews. My husband and I were intermediate "vacation" riders and with Adrian's excellent, enthusiastic and patient schooling, and of course his horses' brilliant temperaments, I think we have come back much better riders and had the most excellent time. Learning to ride the "side-by-side" and neck reign method in the beautiful national parkland was a real treat, with the bonus of experiencing "no-hands" cantering under Adrian's tutelage towards the end of our ride. If you love horses, love nature, love riding and want to spend some time out of the bustle of BA, this is the trip for you! Adrian will tailor the ride to your ability and your wishes - we asked him to extend us and are really glad we did, as we learned so much in the three hours we were out riding with him.

Amazing -fabulous horses and riding - lovely people. I visited here on 28 may to escape Buenos Aires for a few hours. I have my own horse at home and wanted to squeeze in a ride I had a private ride with Adrian, who showed me how to ride in the local style and we hacked out for the afternoon on a Criollo and an Arab, which I rode English style. The horses we're beautifully schooled and so responsive, which was perfect for me. We had a fabulous ride for around three hours in the National park which was so blissful after a hectic time in BA. Adrian made me feel welcome and I relaxed easily into the way of riding there, I could have stayed for much longer but had to leave for the evening in BA. I would absolutely 100% recommend this place. The horsemanship and quality of the horses far exceeded my expectations for BA and indeed was better than many places I've ridden overseas and at home. It was fabulous and I felt very happy there.

A great day out in BA. We have recently returned from BA. We live on a farm and I was keen to improve my riding skills and experience the local " style' of riding. Adrian arranged to pick me up in town and drove me out to their property where I met Miriam who welcomed us with morning tea. Everything was very well organised and after some safety tips and preparation, Adrian and I headed out into the nearby national park. It was fabulous. Adrian challenged me all the way The horses are very well trained and once my horse was receiving the correct signals (with Adrian's advice) we were away. The park is beautiful and unspoilt. It was just wonderful to be able to ride with freedom and with no one about. We had a good long ride and on return had a light lunch with Miriam. Then Adrian brought me back to BA. All in all a great experience and I take my hat off to them for the effort they have made to make the experience unique. I am looking forward to going again next time I return

Horseback Riding Like It Is Meant To Be!. This was the best horseback riding trip ever! I went with a group of friends, we had different levels of experience and all of us felt like riders when we returned from the ride. My horse Bandida was amazing, she was responsive and very well-trained! I was surprised to see what my friends without prior riding experience achieved in a short time. I have no words to express how much we all enjoyed our day with Caballos A La Par. We will be back next time we are in Argentina!

Amazing experience, unforgettable!. It was an amazing experience from the start until we came back to the city. Miriam & Adrian make this kind of experience very unique. We didn't had that much experience with horses, in fact in my case I had no technique, and we managed -thanks to them- to really learn in a few hours and make the best of the day. Honestly they are good! They are very friendly, very professional and passionate about what they do, plus, the horses are very healthy and nice and the views where we where riding were just beautiful. It was the highlight of my trip and I am definitely coming back on my next visit to Buenos Aires!

Highlight of our trip to Argentina. Miriam and Adrian and their wonderful horses gave us a day to remember! From first contact before we left home to the end of our day with them we experienced excellent communication. It was everything we expected and more. We shared the traditional Mate ceremony before our ride. The facility is clean, equipment excellent and safety helmets provided. The horses are very well trained, safe, and responsive. We were matched with horses that met our experience levels. After 2 hours of riding my husband, who is a novice, was cantering with no reins in this beautiful UNESCO National Park. And Mariam did a great job taking pictures and video on our phones so we have the memories forever!

Thank you for the unforgettable experience!. Riding horses with Caballos A La Par was the perfect break from bustling Buenos Aires. On the drive home, Adrian told us that he and Miriam simply have a passion for both horses and teaching. He didn't need to tell us- their passion is truly evident throughout the whole experience. You are absolutely not allowed to feel like a stranger at their stables, as they couldn't be more personable or welcoming hosts. The private lessons allow for a lot of teaching time, which meant we became fairly capable very quickly. We were both total beginners going in, but by the end of the day we were comfortable in the saddle (though we paid for it the next day, as three or four hours of riding for beginners meant some sore muscles for us!). The horses are lovely, and are chosen to match your skill and personality. The park that we rode through is truly beautiful, though there are a lot of mosquitoes, so apply a generous amount of bug spray before going in! The experience was relaxing and instructive, and we didn't feel rushed at all. We will gladly recommend this to anyone we know going to BA, and we would love to go back if we ever find ourselves in BA again!

Absolutely Outstanding. An experience I shall never forget, beats the Polo playing trip done the previous day. What can I say? The day before I had booked the polo day experience which did not live up to my expectations. Given the opportunity of doing this or the polo then I would opt for this above anything else.Miriam and Adrian were absolutely fantastic hosts who have a Real Passion for what they do. It was an absolute pleasure to spend time with them. I have been on horses before and later this same holiday also went on an Estancia horse riding tour, but as pointed out correctly by Adrian this is not horse riding, as one is guided by the horse on their usual route from a to b. Where as Adrian and Miriam take you from being a beginner to feeling like one can actually ride a horse, trotting, cantering after only an hour into our journey through a beautiful national park on a route you choose riding side by side with either Miriam or Adrian. Eagle eye Miriam can have an interesting conversation with you, then gently remind you about how you need to hold the reigns, arrange your posture etc this enables you to stop creating bad habits before they start.The empanadas and the mate were the best I have ever tried. Watching Adrian's children bareback on the horses was a real pleasure as you can see how the love of horses permeates through the whole family.Such wonderful people and a memorable experience that I will always remember. If I ever go back to BA this is the first thing I will do on my return. There is no hype, this is No1 because it is No1.Thank you again. I wish you all the very best in the future.Kerry

Really just felt like a magical day!. From the first email contact to being dropped back in Buenos Aires in the afternoon, I was impressed by the efficiency and enthusiasm of the Caballos A La Par duo. Adrian and Miriam love their horses and their lifestyle and want to share this with anyone with a similar passion for horses, riding or a desire to learn to ride. During my ride I felt like I really learnt a lot and loved every minute of that. Adrian was a great coach and his love of riding is incredibly infectious. I've done quite a bit of holiday riding (but am definitely no expert at all having had very few lessons) and am regularly a little disappointed about the lack of individuality from the guides. However, my expectations were far exceeded here and I felt like I had a very tailored ride that was suited to me and my abilities... and no clock watching either! Loved my day riding side by side on a fabulous horse in such a beautiful place!

What an experience!. We spend a day with Adrian & Miriam. My friend and I are not very experienced riders, but Adrian explained everything very well and the horses are very good trained! We started the afternoon with a "Mate" and later we went for a long ride with Miriam. They have a lovely place, horses for beginners and experienced riders and a beautiful area!!! We will remember this day for a long time and recommend it to everybody who loves to join the nature with horseback riding! We felt like real cowboys ;-) Adrian and Miriam obviously love horses and working with them very much. They are very nice people, to you and to all their horses!Monika&LisaThe Netherlands

Excellent riding near Buenos Aires. Last week I had the pleasure of going riding at Caballos A La Par. I rode a lot and helped out at local stables in my teens (basically I was obsessed with horses) I still ride a few times a year so I was really looking forward to riding in Argentina. I rode in a few places and this was by far my favourite place to go horse riding.Situated half not far from BA. The horses were beautiful and very well kept. You also get to enjoy the presence of dogs and cats. Miriam and Adrian who run the stables and train the horses (most of which for competition) were super friendly and passionate about what they do. They take the time to assess your level when deciding which horse you should ride. Some of their horses are brillant for beginners as well as being great fun for experienced riders. Indeed the horses are sensitive to who they have on their back and adapt to their riders' skills.The stables are located next to this really nice and huge park. You will get to ride through lots of different sceneries (Fields, woods, leafy areas).I had a really great time riding there and it made me realise how much I missed riding on a regular basis. The horses were interesting to ride, the scenery superbe and I felt safe. You will be able enjoy a nice easy ride but also work on your riding skills and if you've never ridden western style the staff will ease you into the stume/I really recommend Caballos A La Par to any horse lover be they experienced riders or beginners. Going riding there was one of the highlights of my stay. Marjorie (France)

Horseback riding in Argentina - don't leave Argentina without experiencing!. While on a business trip to Buenos Aires, a co-worker told me about this horseback riding experience. I decided to check it out and am so glad I did! After they drove me from the city to the stables, they welcomed me with mate and introduced my to my horse named Indio. I hadn't been on a horse in years, but was able to progress quickly! Because my instruction was one-on-one, I was able to take things at my pace. My instructor was patient and helpful, and offered to take pictures and video footage of my horseback riding experience. After cantering the morning away, I was offered some delicious empanadas once we returned to the stables!I recommend this experience to anyone regardless of your riding experience---you won't regret it!

Amazing horseback riding experience!. Went horseback riding with a friend in May and it was the best, most relaxed day ever. We got picked up in Buenos Aires and went to the ranch just outside the city. Arriving at the place we drank some mate and Adrian picked out horses that suited our characters. The horses are great and there are horses available for everyones wishes. What's also important to mention is that the horses are treated like kings. Adrian and Miram are really good hosts and you can choose if you want to have a more laidback trip, or if you want to teach new skills. Closing the day with some empanadas, I can only say I will miss the ranch in Buenos Aires very much!

Outstanding riding experience!. This is a great all round personalized riding experience and so close to Buenos Aires for a relaxed day out of the city. The focus is on spending time on the horse with a good degree of instruction/guidance so if you are looking and want to improve upon your existing riding experience as well as have a half day of actual riding time this is ideal. Not the typical follow my leader experience although there is some trail riding most of the riding is done in expansive open areas, the scenery in the National Park is fantastic. I felt that I had improved significantly from stepping on the horse to getting back. Felt very natural to let go of the reins and canter hands free. This is the most comfortable and pain free that I have felt on a horse, they use custom made saddles and it clearly makes a difference. Adrian and Miriam the owners are very warm and open people and you are made to feel welcome straight away. The day started with Mate around the kitchen table and ended there with some fantastic empanadas. Highly recommended!

Great Day! . My partner and I have very different levels of horse riding experience and by the end of the day he was a pro :p. Beautiful scenery, everything was really well organised and I'm so glad we went! really good day out!

Great time to enjoy. After spending several days in Buenos Aires, we were really looking forward to spend some nice time out of the city, so making a horse riding in Caballos a la Par was really a great choice! The nature where you are riding is amazing, the horses are beautiful and well trained! You can be the beginner or experienced, it doesn't matter because Adrian will give you all necessary tips to teach you the most important things or to improve your riding skills. So, we really enjoyed our time there and because it was my birthday, the cool people, the horses, the nature really made it more special!We will return with pleasure!

I wanted to do this everyday!!!. This was the best horse experience I've ever had away from home. Adrian and Miriam are so welcoming and lovely I didn't want to leave! I visited their beautiful facility which borders a 24,000 acre UNESCO park where we walked, trot, and cantered to our hearts content. I am a more experienced rider but my partner is a beginner and neither of us felt either hindered or pressured to do more less or more than we felt we were capable of. In fact, it's the first place I've been where I was a) allowed to canter wherever I wanted solo and b) where I seen any beginner that has learned how to canter successfully by the end of the day. Adrian joined us later in our outing and took my partner to the side and really got him to be aware of the horse's movements to the point where he felt like he really learned how to control the horse and got a good sense of how to hold his body/position. And Miriam definitely schooled me on my out of practice position, though try as she might I was still sore for days from an exhilarating day of riding! I would move there in a heartbeat to work for them if they'd have me!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED activity in Buenos Aires.

Fun and interesting day trip from BA. I visited in very early April 2014. As an absolute beginner, I was a little nervous about horseback riding. However, the experience turned out great. Adrian provided me with attentive one-on-one instruction, meaning that I was not forced to (try to) keep up with a more advanced rider's pace. The method seems to have worked -- by the end of the day, I felt very comfortable on my horse and I was able to canter with no hands. Adrian and Miriam made me feel like a guest rather than a customer. We enjoyed mate prior to the ride, and then had a nice, relaxed homemade lunch afterward. Both provided interesting conversation that helped me to learn about life in Argentina, both in the eyes of an Argentine and an expat living there.Overall, this was a very enjoyable experience, and I left feeling as if I had accomplished something while on holiday!

A MUST if you're visiting Buenos Aires! Fantastic riding experience!. We rode with Adrian and Miriam and couple of days ago and it's difficult to describe how wonderful the overall experience was but I'll try! From the start, Miriam was extremely responsive in her communications on email and clear with instructions and what was required. Our pickup from downtown Buenos Aires was right on time and we whizzed to the location in about 1/2 hour. Our time with Adrian and Miriam started with MATE! This was Adrian's special brew of mate with his "secret" ingredient which I won't give away! Warm and friendly conversation all around that put us at ease. My wife and I rode with Adrian. This was personalised instruction and attention to the level I've never experienced. Adrian is clearly an experienced instructor who can teach all levels...beginners to advanced riders. My wife and I started gingerly and covered basics such as walking, turning, instructions and then onto trotting and cantering! By the end of the 3 hours, we were cantering without hands on the horses - all under Adrian's watchful eyes and clear directions of course! I learned more proper technique from Adrian than I ever did with previous instructors! Adrian also helped Ing and I take some fabulous videos and photos on our camera during our ride- be warned, bring a small, point and shoot camera Adrian can shoot with using one hand as he's riding on a horse beside you when he's doing so. Your big DSLR will not work....We rode in perfect weather...through beautiful changing grasslands. We ended the day with a cup of hot tea and pastries. I will not change a thing...we had a beautiful time and great experience with Caballos A La Par and riding with them again is top our list when we return to Buenos Aires! I should end with one more thing...their care and love for the horses was clearly evident by how well they kept the horses and the relationship they have with them. Beautiful, well trained horses in great condition. Just wonderful.

Our best day in Argentina. We went riding at Caballos A La Par on 31st March 2013 and had a fantastic time. Miriam was a wonderful host and excellent teacher. She matched riders to horses perfectly and even the inexperienced rider can have fun and go on a proper ride in wonderful surroundings.

Whatever your ability, make this trip a priority - faultless.. I went on this trip having only been on a horse on 3 other occasions with a group of experienced riders. Frankly, I was nervous at the thought of the difference in ability and worried I would hold the rest of the group up. This was not the case. The horses are so incredibly well trained that even a complete novice can move at a decent pace. This coupled with the huge expanse of countryside we went riding in meant the more experienced riders could move about freely whilst the guide gave me excellent instruction, thus keeping everyone happy. It's worth stressing that at no point were we just following the horse in front at a trot. We were give free 'reign' (there had to be one pun) to go at our own pace. Miriam was a superb host, keeping the conversation flowing, instructing us whilst riding and even taking photos on our camera from the saddle. In short;- impeccably trained horses- 3ish hours of riding - the perfect amount; not so long that it got boring or too tiring but adequate to get to grips with your horse and feel like you've got your moneys worth- not your average 'follow the horse in front' riding experience - excellent host- beautiful countryside only a short distance from BA; and - decent empanada lunch. This was the highlight of my 10 days in BA, hands down. Thank you Miriam.

It is a must for any rider. My first horse riding experience in Argentina proved to be absolutely awesome. Very good and well-trained horses, beautiful and picturesque park where we were riding and - of course - Adrian who was so god at instructing that my wife who had ridden a horse a few times before was cantering without hands by the end of the day! Adrian, thank you very much for the best horse riding we have had!

Do This!. The short; Relaxing, interesting, fun and at times challenging. A great way to take a break from the city or just enjoy something different.The long; From the moment I was picked up in the city until I was dropped off (very close to my hotel) I was welcomed and put at ease. Adrian and Miriam are warm and genuine hosts. They take the time to talk to you and figure out what you need from the day. They are excellent and attentive teachers but not overly involved. They will give you room to enjoy the scenery, which is great, the horse and good conversation. However, don't mistake this for a walking horse train tour. It is not. Their passion is to get you to ride and they excel at tailoring the experience to the individual. I enjoyed everything from the "mate" in the morning to the empenadas in the afternoon and everything in between. It was a perfect way to spend the day and take a break from the noise and bustle of the city. As soon as I left I kept thinking about coming back again and would have if I could have rearranged some things. Since returning home I have found myself thinking about this more than any other experience that I had during my time in South America and it always brings a smile. If you are anywhere near Buenos Aires, this is a must!

What a find!. Fantastic day! Came away feeling inspired even as a novice. Great teachers, with personal one to one coaching, which pushed me to do more than I ever thought I could, so that I came away with a huge sense of achievement. Coaches were fun and very friendly, so much that you felt like one of the family. Loved riding into the park and cantering through the long grasses, surrounded by the autumnal colours in the trees and sunny skies. The owners have the most amazing grounds that are shared by humans, horses and the dogs alike, so that they are all one big family. The horses are all in great condition, and the teachers make sure that they match the horses to the capability and personality of us as guests or pupils. I had India who was a perfect match for me. Thank you to Miriam and Adrian for an incredible experience. I am so glad that I was recommended to come to you!

Best day in Buenos. Would recommend Caballos A La Par to anyone visiting Buenos Aires—from couples and groups to families with young children—searching for an authentic, unique and personalized experience. One of the highlights of our trip to South America, riding in the countryside with great company and beautiful horses was unparalleled by any other event on our diverse and packed itinerary. I was amazed that our entire group was able to cantor by the end of our half-day trek through the a national park just 30 or so minutes outside of the center of BA. While the horses were majestic, the real magic is credited to Miriam and Adrian, who made the entire day a truly once-in-a-lifetime experience. As a beginner ride, I never thought I could feel so at home when I was so out of my element!

PERFECT day trip from downtown Buenos Aires!. A group of 7 of us have been looking for an awesome one-day outdoor experience ever since coming to south America as cruise ship employees, since we never have more than 10 hours in any given port.Caballos "a la par" delivers just that! After agreeing on a date, Miriam gave us a location to meet where they would pick us up and take us out to their stables. They were prompt, friendly, and all smiles from the beginning to the end of our experience with them!Of the 7 of us, there was only one experienced rider, and by the end of the day EVERY SINGLE PERSON was cantering with no hands! They are a no nonsense, hands on, immersive riding lesson through a gorgeous 10,000 hectare reserve with responsive and well trained horses. Most riding experiences consist of sitting on a horse as they walk down a trail..not here! You literally get a four hour riding lesson that people generally pay hundreds of dollars for back in the states!Adrian begins the day by sharing "maté" (a traditional South American tea) with each rider, using history and the prospects of the day to come to open up conversation--and to get to know his riders a little better, to pair each personality with a suitable horse. After riding, everyone came back to the house to have hot chocolate or beer (or both!) along with some amazing pastries before reluctantly returning to the ship and going back to our everyday lives.Miriam and Adrian -- THANK YOU!!!Great for groups of 2-10, everyone gets individualized as well as group instruction.

Incredible Outing!. My wife and I attended this after a two month trip of South America and even when including Machu Picchu, Salt Flats, Rio etc this was one of the best things we did.We got a really easy transfer from San Telmo and arrived to meet Miriam and Adrian for some mate and biscuits. We talked about various things but concentrated on our riding experiences so they could match an appropriate horse to us. We then started in the grounds of their ranch for twenty minutes or so while we got to know the horses, learnt how to ride gaucho style and how to control these beautiful horses.After that we then headed out into the national park for 2/3 hours of riding bliss. Learning how to turn, walk in line with each other, trot in line and then canter. We also learnt how to ride no handed which was an incredible feeling!!!Adrian was amazing, he is always making you feel reassured and helps you learn the tricks of riding. I had only ridden twice before this and by the end I was cantering around without a care in the world.We then returned to the ranch for mate and cakes before they drove us back to the city.I can't recommend this enough to all of you, one of the greatest things we've ever done. It's totally safe, all the equipment is included and even if you are an experienced rider or a novice they will give you a fantastic experience.DO IT, YOU WON't REGRET IT....

Fantastic. Never had such a good experience riding horses in a foreign land. The horses are very well trained and the environment is amazing. This is the best tip for horseriding you can get if you want to have an unique experience riding very good horses in a small and personlized group.

What an exellent day!. Please come and gain this experience, it was my best horesback riding I ever have done. The organisation is perfect: pick up in Buenos Aires and transfer to the stable where you hear about their work drinking a mate in a calm atmosphere.The ride is in realy wilderness, pure natur and the horses are well-trained and in good condition. You don't ride in a big group - only you and your friends - so that they can teach you how they do handle their horses.After our ride they even show me how to get on a horse without saddle because I saw it before when Luis prepared the horses. Really, such a professional way to handle the horses and their guests, i was impressed and recommend it to you!Kurz auf deutsch: Super Tipp und jedes Geld wert, da man wirklich nicht wie ein geldbringender Tourist in einer großen Gruppe einer hinter dem anderen hinterher trotte(l)t. Super nette Menschen und Pferde in einem ausgezeichneten Zustand, die im Wechsel immer mehrere Monate "in Urlaub" auf die Wiese gehen. An diesen Tag werde ich mich bestimmt noch lange mit einem lächeln auf dem Gesicht zurück erinnern!!

Best Day in Buenos Aires. This is not the traditional follow-the-horse-in-front-of-you riding experience, it is much more. We are beginners, and we learned how to ride. Even with no experience, my 9 year old daughter and I were in full control of our horses - walking, trotting, cantering through the meadows and along the trails. It was a perfect day - with warm and friendly hosts and well-trained horses. We would highly recommend this for individuals and families interested in a fun day of real, authentic Argentine horseback riding - at any skill level.

Highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. Caballos a la Par was absolutely the highlight of my trip to Buenos Aires. The ranch and countryside are stunning, the trainers are warm and encouraging, and the horses are extremely well trained (not to mention beautiful). I am a beginner rider and by the end of the ride I felt comfortable trotting and cantering (something I never thought I would be able to do). It is very clear that Miriam and Adrian are devoted to their horses and this company. I loved every moment of this experience and highly recommend Miriam and Adrian to others visiting Buenos Aires!

Riding at its BEST!!!. None of this nose to tail, spend most of the time watching the trainer help others - this is a one on one country ride where the trainer (Miriam) kindly provides observations and tips to help improve ones riding abilities. All the horses (and they have several) are well mannered, well trained and comfortable. The equipment is in excellent condition and there is a serious attention to safety. Based on what I've seen, they can accomodate the most accomplished rider to the 'never been on a horse' rider - and each will have a wonderful time because the ride is tailored to the guest. The country is beautiful as well. I'm going back!

Great ride for experienced riders!. I went horseback riding at Caballos A la Par this past November (2013). I am an experienced English-style rider (rode 2-6 days a week for 9 years and competed in Big Eq. division in high school). Since high school, I have been riding about once a month on average for the last 14 years. The Caballos a la Par lesson suited my needs perfectly. First, Adrian and I had an extensive conversation about my riding experience and how people ride in Argentina on the way from Buenos Aires to the stable and over Yerba Mate (delicious!) once we got there. Once Adrian and Mariam selected an appropriate horse for me, I did some practice gait changes and turns to make sure I was comfortable and that the horse and I got along. Then Adrian really let me ride. Unlike a typical trail ride, he did not try to force me and my husband, who have very different levels of experience, to ride at the same pace the whole time, or to ride completely separately. We spent some time walking and trotting and talking side by side, but for most of the lesson, I was completely free to get my legs back, and then have fun galloping through fields and practicing hairpin turns, while Adrian went over basics with my husband. I usually horseback ride on vacation whenever possible (and I'm usually disappointed), and I can truly say that this is the first time I went with an inexperienced rider, and we got to ride together yet we both felt safe and challenged. And Adrian was such an effective teacher that, by the end of the afternoon, I was cantering side by side with my husband, a first time rider! Most importantly, all of the horses were beautiful, well-cared for, and responsive to riders' commands, and the stables and facilities were impeccably clean. I highly recommend Caballos a la Par for experienced riders looking for an excursion from Buenos Aires that is completely focused on the quality of the riding experience. The lesson and horses were appropriate and enjoyable whether you are going with other experienced riders or with a mixed group. And, if you are experienced but rusty, don’t worry about getting pigeon-holed by your demo performance. Once we had been out for a while and I had gotten my legs back (and, in my husband’s case, the basics down) we all switched horses for even more of a challenge. I should also note, the park was beautiful, and had all the scenic pleasures of a vacation trail ride without the typical frustrations (like lack of riding!). I highly recommend Caballos a la Par…. You will not regret it!!!! (Side note: I'm not checking "food available for purchase" in the review because Adrian and Mariam provided sandwiches after the ride--no additional charge. This was in addition to the yerba mate and light biscuits before the ride.)

The absolute highlite nr. 1 in BA. If you doubt wether to do this or not - DO IT! It is definitely worth it. We were two girls who had never been on a horse before and by the end of the day we were galloping without holding the reins! Miriam and Adrian are so good at making you feel safe and comfortable. The horses (mine was Isabel, the best!) is also amazing. So well trained, and you can feel that they are happy horses. This is not a touristy horse show on the pampas, this is the real thing. You feel like home at Caballos. Also, Adrian serves you real mate and local empanadas. At the end of the day you can have a refreshing swim in the pool. What a lovely getaway from the busy city!

Amazing Experience - Gaucho for Newabies. We were flashed of the big City of Buenos Aires - right time to take a half day as a gaucho. A half hour away from Buenos Aires is Iraola parc (UNESCO protected, beautiful, fantastic, with a high diversity of trees and birds and ... and ...). Miriam and Adrian have a ranch next to this parc. We mailed them and they picked us up near our hotel in buenos aires, we had a great half day and at the end they brought us back to the middle of BA.In the half day we got to know a lot about, Mate (the traditional tea of LATAM) Horses, Riding, troting, Cantering, Empanadas (the tradional meal of LATAM)...In a nutshell: Just do it, which ever experience you do have with all, they will learn you everything you need in the lovelyest way, we got to know in our complete holidays on the continent.

Want to learn how to ride? - Forget any other option! This is where you want to go!. What an extraordinary day away from the city! Miriam and Adrian at Caballos A La Par are the highly skilled, warm and enthusiastic owners and instructors at this beautiful riding school. These people build their business from the heart with a genuine wish to teach, and they will make you feel at home in 5 minutes!This is not a riding tour on a fixed trail, where you just need to sit on the horse doing nothing. You will not learn to BE ON a horse - you will learn how to RIDE the horse! So put on your long pants and enjoy a wonderful experience in a beautiful park / forest! You will have your own private instructor the whole time and you will be amazed how much you can learn in a few hours! You will be riding on your own from the very beginning - and you will feel capable of doing it. This was only my second time riding (first time in the Norway on fixed trail and with no instruction) and I left Caballos A La Par capable of riding alone in different styles and paces. I was over the moon about this experience and felt I just have to be a gaucho some day! Or at least come back to this place for a week or two :o)Just two peaces of advice: Plan for relaxing activity the next day - you will be sore, since you will actually be riding the horse. And don't bring someone (not even your hot fiancé), who don't really want to ride. Let them go do something just as great for them instead. This is too precious to let anything limit your joy!

Don t miss this experience while in BA!. One of my favourite activities when I lived in Buenos Aires in 08/09 was horseback riding with Adrian and the Caballos a la Par team: beautiful horses; enjoying the outdoors; amazing connection Adrian has with the horses through which he is able to teach you something new or help you improve on your skills - whether you are beginner or advanced level; the fun and hospitality. I remember that during my last week end before moving, I organized a horseback ride with some 20 friends. It was simply an unforgettable afternoon. What impressed me most was seeing my friend -who was afraid of horses- galloping at ease and with a huge smile on her face thanks to Adrian’s horse-magic.When I returned two weeks ago to Buenos Aires I definitely had a horse ride on my mind for the week end with Caballos a la Par. To be honest: I was a bit disappointed to learn that we would be going out riding with Adrian’s new business partner Miriam instead of himself that day. However, that feeling was washed away within a few moments as Miriam seems to have the same gift that Adrian has. It was simply magical again with the familiar lush greens, the beautiful horses, enjoying and learning with the horses during the ride, the hospitality that Miriam showed us, as well as Adrian and his beautiful family, the team at the stables and the fun we had together. Simply unforgettable, still and again.

Great Horseback Riding for our Honeymoon!. After reading TA reviews, my wife and I decided to book this activity during our honeymoon. We have no regrets at all. Miriam was very responsive via email days before our booking since we didn't have a cellphone that worked during our time there. Adrian was very punctual and picked us up the morning of the ride and we had a great conversation on the way down to their land, we didn't speak much Spanish but his English was great.The experience from start to finish was great, I've ridden horses several times before but my wife had not. Adrian knows how to read the horses body language as well as ours, and was able to teach us and push us to get better in such a short period of time. Most other tours allow you to walk in a line only, maybe trot towards the end. Adrian taught us how to walk, trot, and cantor including how to maintain the proper posture and communicate with the horses. It was so much fun cantoring throughout the forest reserve freely without much restriction. Adrian's passion is teaching, so make sure you are want to listen and get better!We enjoyed also the mate before and empanadas afterward. I'd recommend this trip to anyone who wants to learn, improve, or perfect their horseback riding... And for those who want to push themselves to the limits! We are recommending them to our other friends (also in their early 30's) who are visiting BA later this year.

Perfect day away from the city!. I have been in Buenos Aires for about a month and knew that I needed to get some "air". I contacted Caballos A La Par, because I thought it would be nice to get out on a horse (although I am a beginner). Miriam wrote me back promptly and we had plans to be out in the following days. She picked me up in Buenos Aires (in a very easy location to find) and drove me out to the stables. It wasn't at all what I expected, nearly 100000 times better. She didn't have me learning in a typical arena, but out in the opens fields of a wonderful UNESCO reserve. I thought I wouldn't be as comfortable on a horse as I was, but I immediately felt safe on Indio (the horse), as he and Miriam both have many years experience. We had a few nice hours out in the fields, then came back to the barn/stables for some wonderful (possibly the best I have had in Argentina) empanadas from a local woman. Miriam felt more like a friend than a tourist instructor, she even introduced me to the Argentinean Mate! I would recommend this trip to anyone (and I plan on going back for some repeat lessons).

The Best Day!. I love horseback-riding especially with Caballos a la Par. Both Miriam and Adrian are great instructors. The guidance, teaching and transmission of their knowledge makes it a superb experience. No boring trail-rides in huge groups but riding freely in the beautiful surroundings of a national park. Feeling safe because of Adrian at my side teaching me the tricks. Fun also to get some real Argentine insight on habits such as the drinking and sharing of Mate. Eating of the so-called " facturas" or "empanadas" after the ride. I was lucky with the great weather and cooled-off in their comfortable swimming pool in the middle of the "campo" with the horses walking freely around us. The end of a wonderful afternoon!

What days out are about.... These guys have nailed it! The horses are wonderful, so responsive, and the surroundings are gorgeous. Miriam is a superb instructor but also good company. The whole experience is so easy; they pick you up from town, they saddle your horse, they give you a drink, they never rush you, they never try to get rid of you. You do everything in your own time. You'd be a fool to miss this!

"Wonderful and unique riding and learning experience". My husband and I always enjoy going horseback riding when we travel internationally (both of us are beginners). We saw the excellent reviews for Caballos A La Par and knew we had to try it. After we emailed for information about available times, Miriam quickly responded. Our adventure started with Miriam picking us up at a convenient meeting point in BA at 3 pm. Miriam was very punctual, which my husband and I both appreciated. This was the first time we had ventured out of Buenos Aires, and the scenery was beautiful. Adrian was waiting for us when we arrived, and we went inside to chat. Miriam and Adrian told us about themselves and provided some history of the stables and horses. It was evident right away how much they both love the horses and consider each one of the 13 horses as a family member. Though we are comfortable with the basics of horseback riding, we had no idea truly how to ride as none of the other places where we had ridden horses in the past ever took the time to teach us the correct way. The other places where we rode (Aruba, Jamaica, South Africa, and Hawaii) typically had horses that followed one another, and though fun, typically resembled more of a Disney ride than a true horse riding experience. After discussing with Adrian and Miriam, we quickly came to realize this was a different type of experience, which is why this is constantly rated as the top activity in Buenos Aires.Before beginning, we received very detailed instructions on the proper riding position and how to properly tell the horse where to go and at the desired pace. Adrian then selected Indio for me to ride and Isabel for my husband. Miriam rode Bandito. Both were on the smaller side with very gentle demeanors. Adrian chose those horses for us because we are beginners. However, if you are an experienced rider or have trained in equestrian events, then Adrian, who himself has competed in and won many equestrian events, has horses that can jump and can provide a challenge to even the most experienced riders. Once our ride started, Miriam watched us extremely closely to ensure our riding form was proper and instruct us where appropriate. The horses are very well behaved and make you feel relaxed. We then left their beautiful property and traveled across the road to a lovely state park where we rode for a little over 3 hours. The park had so many great trails for riding. While we were riding all over the place and doing so with the proper balance and technique, Miriam would take pictures so we can remember the ride. The park’s landscape is very peaceful and diverse. There are many wooded areas to go through and open space where you are able to trot and canter. Miriam started us with fast walking and then we worked our way up to trotting and cantering on our own. It was so exciting because my husband and I were in control of the horse and most importantly truly felt comfortable on top of the horse. As I noted earlier, we had been horseback riding before in other countries, but those trips were more Disneyesque in that there was a set trail and even if you did something wrong the horse knew where he was supposed to go so we truly weren’t doing anything except staying on the horse—much like a Disney ride. That is not the case here, as Adrian and Miriam truly want you to leave understanding how to ride and direct a horse and want you to be able to feel comfortable on a horse when you ride again. This is the magic that truly sets this experience apart from the other riding experiences that we had been on. Beyond the lengthy park ride, we received non-stop individualized instruction and coaching by the highly experienced Miriam and Adrian. At the end of the ride, my husband and I got to feed our now tired horses carrots and see the other 11 horses that are being cared for in the stables. After the great ride and feeding the horses, Miriam fixed us hot chocolate and we enjoyed very tasty pastries. Miriam also took some excellent photos for us while giving us instruction and riding at the same time. Adrian drove us back to our hotel, and we arrived around 10:30 pm. The price for the park riding adventure is the bargain of a lifetime when you consider round-trip pick-up and drop-off and the hours of riding and instruction. In fact, the amount was extremely reasonable per person, but if you consider that my husband and I were the only riders, that Adrian and Miriam provided these beautiful horses to ride in the wonderful park setting with hours of personalized riding instruction throughout, and that they spent 7.5 hours with us from pick-up to drop-off, then they are only making a small amount an hour and are taking care of 13 horses and many other animals, including dogs and a then pregnant cat, at their farm. We are going to return to Argentina in the future and will definitely ride again at Caballos A La Par again. After spending the day with Adrian and Miriam, my husband and I both now feel comfortable on a horse and can actually ride. More importantly, we felt we had made new friends. What a wonderful experience that we highly recommend to anyone!

"Best day of my life!!" ...spoken by our 3 children. It truly is a riding experience like none other. Would give it a 10 if we could! We came to Argentina from the United States (New Hampshire), and knew we wanted to go riding a couple of times. We found Caballos A La Par online on Trip Advisor - thankfully - while we were in Buenos Aires, and it was a last minute decision. We booked easily with Miriam, got picked up in B. As. and were on our way on a short drive to the ranch. Everything about Caballos A La Par is warm, friendly and inviting. But then we started our ride. It was NOT a typical follow-the-leader ride... it was a professional riding lesson while enjoying our ride. I cannot say enough about how much time and energy that Adrian and Miriam put into our family on our AMAZING ride through an AMAZING and beautiful park. Keep in mind, our children are 7, 9 and 11, and Adrian had them trotting and cantering with ease at the end of our afternoon spent together. The time, thoughtfulness and care that they spent on our little family was heartfelt and not to soon be forgotten... we all felt a connection with both of them. About 1 week later, we travelled to Patagonia and went on another horseback ride... yes, a typical follow-the-leader ride... our kids were bored and not impressed. They kept saying they wanted to go back to Caballos A La Par. Unfortunately this amazing experience will have a negative effect on any future horseback riding experiences we have!!Am typically not a major reviewer.. just wanted others to share in this. Don't think twice.. book it!

Best you can do for an authentic experience. If you want to make a trip on the back of a horse: go there! The horses behave very well, they don't just follow each other and you will get an individual lesson/experience concerning your skills and preferences.. The atmosphere is very familiary and nice. As well the horses are allowed to move freely on the beautyful terrain. Highly recommended for everyone who is looking for a genuine experience !Not only for beginners, I've been riding for 15 years and I loved it and learned much!

Wonderful day riding. I went booked to go riding with Mirium in January 2014 at the start of my South American adventure and what a start it was. I booked alone and was nervous in the beginning that I would be hard to please. I have ridden since I was 2 and always worry that riding schools will feel restricting and dull. This was not the case! I started out riding Indigo, who having seen reviews on here I worried was a beginners horse, it turns out he is just very responsive to a riders needs. We rode all day long and walked trotted , cantered and galloped over mixed terrain. Half way through the trip I swapped onto Sheik The centres Arab (I love Arabs and he didn't disappoint). My day with Mirium was so much fun and talking to her really inspired me that people can follow there dreams and make them a reality - great horses, great company and a beautiful landscape - what more could you ask for! If you prove your ability as for a go on Sheik he's magnificent. Thank you Mirium, Indigo and Sheik for a wonderful day I will never forget. Naomi (Snuggyhoods) x
Superb. A fantastic day out and a "must do" in Buenos Aires. I hope to be able to go back again this year. Adrian is brilliant, great for both first time riders or experienced riders.

Awesome experience. I actually did a trail ride with Caballos A La Par back in December of 2010 (which wasn't an option in the "when did you visit" question on the review), and never wrote the review I meant to...I thought of it out of the blue today, and I'm so happy to see that it's now the #1 activity in BA on TripAdvisor!! I went with a friend, and we had a really amazing experience. Adrian picked us up downtown in BA and took us to his beautiful ranch, which I think is pretty neat--definitely representative of the personal experience you get when you go. The horses were super sweet and Adrian challenged us; I've ridden for several years, but it had been awhile since I had jumped, and he had me jumping over logs in the forest with no problem. I also galloped several times, which was tons of fun. My friend was jealous because Adrian didn't let him do these things, since he had never been on a horse before. He did, however, have him ride without reins, which I think he enjoyed. The scenery was amazing--it was really cool to ride for hours through such a beautiful place and not see a soul. Adrian was kind and pleasant, telling us about the land and how he started the business, and offering us food and drinks before and after the ride. I would wholeheartedly recommend this experience.

An unforgettable experience!. We visited Buenos Aires back in May 2013 and I have to say that our experience with Adrian at Caballos A La Par has persisted as one of the most memorable experiences to date. My husband and I are city dwellers, we were in Buenos Aires on business and thought it would be great to get out and experience something less urban. Of course, everyone recommends horseback riding but we have had weird experiences in other areas of the world that just seemed kind of lame. Then we came across all the awesome reviews for Caballos A La Par and it just felt like it would be a different experience. Well, all the reviews on here are spot on. Adrian and Miriam are absolutely lovely, and when you meet them, the passion that they have for both horse riding and for teaching are apparent immediately. Adrian picked us up in Buenos Aires and on the journey told us all about his life story, including how he left the corporate world and pursued what he is really passionate about - it's a really inspirational story. Once we arrived at Caballos A la Par, we sat down together, got to know each other, learned all about Adrian's polo and endurance racing background (ask to see his photos!), shared some mate, and then took a short tour to meet all the beautiful horses. From there, we enjoyed a 2 hour private session during which time Adrian taught us how to have the right energy, communicate, and direct the horses, before moving out to the huge trail area on the property. Well, by the end of the second hour we were were cantering and galloping across fields. At one point Adrian even traded horses with my husband to better facilitate a connection between the two...it made such a huge difference. As for me and my horse, Indiyo, we were quite content with each other and I eventually went solo down a path - which was something I never imagined would happen. In that short time, Adrian helped us go from being incredibly awkward around and on horses, to feeling confident and able on horses. And yes, afterwards there is hot cocoa, which is genius. I recommend this experience whole heavyhearted - it is one of the coolest things I have ever done on my travels. To Miriam and Adrian - thank you so much for sharing your passion with us and for facilitating such magical moments which we will remember forever.

Great day, everyone should go!. We were lucky enough to find Miriam and Caballos a la Par when we were in Buenos Aires in January. We are a couple in our forties with limited riding experience but with Miriam's patient but firm direction we left we a strong sense of feeling like real gauchos! The horses were patient and sweet, and the park is serene and beautiful. It was a unique and fantastic experience that I would recommend to anyone with not just an interest in riding but looking for an overall wonderful Argentine experience. The whole day was more than worth it, we plan to go back when we are next in BA.

Very cool. I was traveling in Argentina for a month and I was horse riding with Gauchos bevor I decided, I wanted to do some horse riding in Buenos Aires. Adrian picked me up in Buenos Aires and we drived a short ride to the estancia, wich is in the middle of a nature reserve. I regularly do horse riding at home. But that day and those horses were amazing. The horse I had was called Indio. Lovely horse, very responding and you could galopp with him with you the reins. I never did it bevor, but with him, it was really easy, like sitting on the sofa and reading a newspaper. I was amazed and wanted to buy him right away :).Adrian and Miriam are great. Loving people and the estancia is so nice. They are constructing some rooms, so you can stay there overnight. When I will be back in Argentina, I will definitely go horse riding again. Thanks for a amazing day.

Don't leave Buenos Aires without doing this!. Let's just say that I'm not really into horses in the first place. I'm not even really into writing reviews (this is my first!).
