But I was dragged here by my friend on our last day in Buenos Aires and I have to share the experience. It made our trip unforgettable. First of all, this is for private parties where you can ride with your friend(s) and adjust the tour to your liking and needs. Secondly, this is a real home-grown grassroots operation, a business Adrian built from the ground up and you can tell by how much he cares about your experience.Adrian picked us up from our hotel and drove us to the stables (~20-30mins). We relaxed with some mata and pastries before saddling up and riding the beautiful natural reserves for a couple hours. It was so much fun but it can be a workout on your legs! Afterward, we headed back to the stables where some homemade empanadas and quilmes were waiting for us. A perfect way to end our trip before heading back on an airplane.Thanks Adrian and Miriam! We'll definitely be back. Hopefully sooner rather than later.

Better Than Ever!!. I lived in Buenos Aires for about 7 months in 2010 and was lucky enough to ride with Caballos a la Par pretty frequently back then. I'm back for a quick spin through the city and was able to ride and see their new facilities, so wanted to send an update! The riding is still fantastic, with plenty of chances to enjoy the scenery and trot/canter to your heart's content (I have ridden for 20+ years, including many spots in Latin America, and have worked at several Dude Ranches in the US and I feel strongly that Caballos a la Par is one of the best equestrian experiences out there), but now in addition to the world-class riding, guides and horses, they have purchased a new property which is absolutely spectacular! All of the horses have daytime turn-out pens, and they have a spotless and brand new stable for nighttime. More importantly for guests, there is a lovely pool (perfect for this hot, humid summer weather, especially after riding), a playground for children, and an indoor sitting/dining area with fireplace for cold days, as well as a picnic table to enjoy the outdoors when the weather is nice. Caballos a la Par is an ideal escape from the hectic pace of Buenos Aires, and if you haven't visited since they moved, I would strongly recommend a return visit! If you happen to be in Buenos Aires and have any interest in riding (and happen to be in BsAs), I would definitely recommend a day with Adrian and Miriam - whether it's your first time on a horse or you have ridden for years, it will be the highlight of your trip to Argentina!

Fantastic experience. A must-do activity if you are in BA, exceeding all expectations. Great value for money. Horses were very well looked after, facilities were excellent and staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. Adrian's passion is contagious and a great person to spend the afternoon with. Suitable for all skill levels. Will definitely go back the next time I am in BA.

Our Favorite Activity in Argentina!. My husband and I traveled to Buenos Aires in the second week of January 2014. I love the out doors and was hoping to find a fun activity to get my husband and myself out of the city for a day. Well, we did! and our experience at Caballos al la Par was perfect. Neither my husband not I have experience with horses, but our host Mariam was an excellent teacher and the horses were trained very well and they were gentle. Before long we were cantering through the open fields and exploring the reserve at our own pace. Transportation to the ranch from Beunos Aires is provided by their private driver. The pick up spot is close to a Subte line so you can take the metro if you want. A hat and half chaps our provided so you don't need to pack your boots. Your host are very gracious and provide you with matte before your ride and a refreshing beverage and snack after your ride. The activities will take up the majority of the day, and you will be getting a bit of a workout if you aren't use to riding. Both my husband and I had a fantastic time and thought that the experience was well worth the price! Thank you Caballos a ala Par!

Caballos A La Par is the real deal. Thank you so much for a great great afternoon!. I highly recommend Miriam and Caballos A La Par, if you're looking for an unforgettable experience and memory. I went on a private ride with Miriam during the first week of January 2014. This was definitely a highlight on my BA trip. The whole experience was great--from the time I emailed to inquire to the time she dropped me off in San Telmo at the end of the day. Mariam was professional and thorough with the organizing, communications and the instructions. The horses were sweet and looked well cared for. My horse's name was Indio, and he was an amazing animal. Miriam's passion for the sport and for being a great coach is the best part. I had a goal to learn better techniques and to have a very enjoyable afternoon flying through the forest on a great horse. With Miriam, I met this goal and much more.

A perfect day!. Highly recommended if you are looking for a fun day looking like a cowboy. The horses were very friendly and Miriam is a great instructor and is taking care of you the whole time.Thank you so much for the wonderful experiance in the warm argentinian sun.

Best BA day trip!. After being in Buenos Aires for nearly a week in the middle of the hot summer my wife and I wanted an escape for the day without having to venture too far outside of the city. We searched on-line and came across Caballos A La Par. The best part about the reviews we read on TripAdvisor were that they were all true!From making the reservation and the pick-up in BA to the drop-off at the end of our adventure, everything was friendly and professional. Adrian and Miriam were wonderful hosts and never stopped smiling the whole time. Adrian was an expert instructor for two novice horse riders: he was always encouraging and challenging us. By the end of the day we were cantoring with confidence -- going so far as to be riding hands free!The setting is perfect and the forest reserve beautiful. All the space allowed us to explore, ride side by side and move around freely.The best part was connecting with the incredibly well-trained and gentle horses. I rode Isabel and my wife rode Indio and we both felt that these horses were the perfect ones for us.The afternoon was topped off with a refreshing swim and delicious empanadas. Definitely an amazing experience! We hope to visit again when we're back in BA.

Horseback Riding the way it was meant to be.... Miriam was an absolutely fantastic guide. She met us on the southern skirt of the city center, near the intersection of Herrera & Av Gral. Iriarte, and drove us in her car out to the ranch, maybe 45 minutes or so. She's a safe driver, and that's saying something in B.A.!When we got to the ranch (using the term loosely, essentially a home with nice stables on a sizable piece of property), we leisurely grabbed a drink, put on sunscreen, and threw on some leather "gaiters" and an integrated helmet/hat. Everyone in the group had some degree of riding experience above and beyond your typical in-line guided horseback tour. Once mounted, we spent the next 20 or so minutes riding over to a very large park (previously an estate), learning the nuances of our horse, their tendencies towards pace, and attitude. We all had extremely well trained horses, each well attuned to the triggers for walk, trot, and canter. Once in the park, we were free to go where we pleased (while staying in a group) and where the ground safely allowed, bring the horses to canter. Even with it being a pretty warm day (in January, peak summer), most of the ride was tree covered and overall very pleasant. When we returned we left our horses with a couple of the ranch hands that promptly hosed the horses down and fed them several carrots. I mention as much because I feel like the horses are very well treated and not particularly overworked. Miriam had called in an order of wood-stove cooked empanadas that ended up being delicious. We cooled off inside, ate our lunch, and then hopped into another driver's car (arranged as part of the package) who drove us back to the edge of the city. Coming from California and having grown up around horses in Florida, this was a fantastic way to ride with autonomy and experience Argentina away from the wonderful hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires. I would 100% recommend this to friends and family.

Highlight of our trip to BA. My friend and I visited Caballos A la Par during our trip to BA and it was by far, one of the most exciting, fun, interesting and breathtaking thing we did while in Argentina.From the pre-arranged pick-up to the mate-sharing session before riding and the patient teachings of Miriam, it's impossible to regret a visit here. The place is beautiful (there is a great pool for a little refreshment after hours of riding), the horses are adorable (Indio and Isabel were the best!) and you feel so welcomed, it's almost like spending an afternoon with friends. Miriam spent so long answering our questions, giving us advice about riding and it really helped me feel more confident about my skills. Whether you're an experienced rider or a beginner, you will find what you're looking for here. After riding, we were offered some tasty empanadas which concluded our experience perfectly. I highly recommend Caballos A la Par be part of your visit ! Gabrielle and Raphaelle

Simply wonderful. This was the best horseback riding experience of its kind my wife and I had ever experienced. The setting is not far from the City. They pick you up and drive you there. It is a totally personalized experience. Miriam is great !!They take the time to get to know you and give you private instruction, and then continue to instruct and guide you the entire time. They push you to levels you didn't think you could go, and they do it in a safe and fun way. It was a great experience. It made me want to ride much more often in the future.

Wonderful!. I cannot recommend Caballos A La Par enough if you are looking for good horses and a great riding experience. I have ridden most of my life and basically went "along for the ride" to accompany a friend who was very nervous and just wanted to get comfortable on a horse. We couldn't have picked a better place or a better teachers for her than Miriam and "Indio" the Superhorse- both of them were extremely patient and calm, and by the end of the ride my friend was cantering along with a smile on her face. I thoroughly enjoyed the ride, the grounds are beautiful, and I loved my horse, Lindo. I wanted to take him home. Highly recommended! We will definitely go back.

Amazing day with fabulous scenery and people.. I am a beginner and nervous rider. A friend of mine recommended going, so we went. Miriam, who is lovely, very patient and experienced, was able to help me feel comfortable riding in a short amount of time. All in a very serene, beautiful place just 30 mins. outside buenos aires. I have been to other estancias, and have returned home sore with no understanding of how to ride, only sore. This was a fantastic experience for myself, a beginner, as well as my friend, who is an experienced rider. I highly recommend Caballos a la par! Will go back again soon. Thank you Miriam for a fabulous day!

Best day spent in Buenos Aires!. We spent our first day (out of 4) in Buenos Aires with Adrian and Miriam at Caballos a La Par. Safe to say that it was one of the most enjoyable experiences either of us have had!! By the end of the day, we felt like we were family. You can really tell that both have a genuine love for what they do and put a lot of effort into making sure the horses are happy and treated with a lot of love. As some of the other reviews have said, you will be cantering on unmarked trails shortly after leaving Buenos Aires. We were cutting our time in B.A. down by a day and had to decide whether to pay a visit to an estancia or Caballos a La Par. I am so glad we chose the latter. My parents had traveled to Buenos Aires a few months prior to our trip and highly recommended spending the day with Adrian and Miriam. (See my mom’s extensive glowing review of Caballos a La Par from Oct 5.)My wife considers herself a “beginner” rider. She was riding with no hands within hours of starting our ride. Miriam was great and made us both feel very comfortable. Not to mention, the horses were amazing. My wife rode Indio and I rode Lindo. It was the highlight of our 2 week trip! We especially enjoyed seeing Adrian ride when we got back. Both Adrian and Miriam are amazing people running a really great activity. Don’t think twice about this one!

UNIQUE HORSEBACK RIDING CLOSE TO BUENOS AIRES!. My husband and I have different levels of experience riding horses, so when we decided to ride with Caballos A La Par I was curious how they would manage this. Mails were quickly answered and we were picked up exactly on time at a centrally located and easily accessible pick up point in Buenos Aires. Adrian drove us to the ranch in about 35 minutes. After trying mate and talking about what we expected and wanted from the ride we got on our horses Lindo and Bandida. Adrian explained the basics to us (I am used to English style riding and this is a little different but I have to admit a much more comfortable style of riding!). We left the ranch and started our ride with Miriam. She helped me adjust quickly to their style of riding and within a short time she had my husband, who had ridden only once before, cantering comfortably. We had so much fun, it was great that we were the only people there (Adrian and Miriam never mix goups, the ride will be for you and the people you come with and no-one else). This meant we could ride at our own pace and do what we wanted. Because my husband quickly learnt to control the horse and walk, trot and canter, we could really enjoy riding together. I never expected this and it made the experience so much more special. As an experienced rider I also want to mention that Lindo and Bandida are amazing horses. They are so well-trained and responsive and genuinely happy to go out on a ride. All the horses at the ranch looked very well cared for and this is something you don’t see in a lot of places where you can go to ride. Adrian and Miriam said the horses are part of their family and it shows, no doubt about that! After the ride we had drinks and great pastries and without any rush were brought back to the city. It was a wonderful day that left both of us with a huge smile on our face and we will definitely come back next time we are in Buenos Aires!

What an experience!. Highly recommend. Adrian and Miriam are amazing hosts, not only for their knowledge and expertise with horses, but made us feel very welcome at their ranch. From start to finish, the day was truly perfect. The ranch is very clean and well kept and the horses are in excellent condition and very friendly. They take great care to match you with an appropriate horse for your skills - beginner to expert. You learn more about riding but in a fun way while you ride in a beautiful natural park. One of the highlights of our trip to Argentina!

Wow!. Adrian and Miriam are fantastic hosts and going riding with them is a truly special experience. They are focused on helping you understand how to ride and to be one with the horse and readily adapt their teaching to your level of experience. I've been riding in a lot of places and this place is truly unique in terms of the riding experience and teaching guests the art of horsemanship and the attention to detail. No boring nose to tail trail riding! They really got my 11 year old son and what kind of experience he wanted and tailored the sessions for his interests. We've been back five or six times since then and they have given us the opportunity to ride different horses and try different excercises. It's a delightful atmosphere with special people and all I can say is don't miss the opportunity whether you are advanced or a first timer.

Made me a better rider. Scheduling the reservation was easy. Miriam was very responsive over the phone. Adrian, one of the owners, gave me the riding lesson. Adrian's instruction greatly enhanced my riding skills. And best of all, the horse I was given to ride was the most beautiful white horse that I had ever seen.

Ride of a lifetime. This is not your typical tourist visit to an estancia or a trail ride. If you want a completely unique riding experience that offers one-on-one expert instruction while riding in a gorgeous nature preserve, this is for you! After spending two weeks in Patagonia, I have to say that this riding experience was the icing on the cake for my entire trip to Argentina. Adrian is a superb rider who will take you to the next level (or higher!) whether you are an experienced rider or a beginner. He has the ability to know exactly what your comfort level is and then to push you just gently enough to have you doing something on the back of a horse that you would never dream of. After you enjoy the Argentinian ritual of drinking mate` tea together, you will strike out into a pristine setting with no other riders in sight among the meadows, trees and streams of a beautiful preserve. On the back of an expertly trained horse, you will find your comfort and skill level with Adrian by your side. His expert skills allow him to advise on your riding while snapping photos and video of your experience. I was cantering with my arms out to the side through a meadow of blue wild flowers. Like flying through a surreal painting! I highly recommend this experience to anyone who wants the ride of a lifetime!

The highlight of our 10 day South America vacation!. We met Adrian at 9:30am at the pick up spot and set off for an hour to his ranch. Adrian is a very nice, genuine person who told us about how he went from a white collar job to following his passion, raising horses. The ranch is gorgeous and the horse are so beautiful. After enjoying some delicious matte with Adrian and Miriam, we headed off to learn horseback riding. Adrian started first teaching my wife. She is scared of animals and heights and only agreed to come as it was my birthday and I really wanted to ride horses ...a quintessential thing to do in Argentina. Within a few minutes she started to cry but Adrian calmed her down and helped her gain confidence and guide the horse. Soon we were in the beautiful nature reserve and Adrian worked with me to improve my posture and learn cantering. By the end of 2 hours my wife and I were cantering freely across open grass. The feeling of freedom on a horse is indescribable and Adrian is an amazing teacher. By the end , my wife was cantering well on the horse with a wide smile across her face. All the credit goes to Adrian. We even met an expat family from UK who were routinely bringing their daughter to learn horseback riding from Adrian and Miriam. Tired after the riding, Adrian ordered us some empanadas for lunch. We are vegetarians and the onion, tomato and spinach empanadas were delicious. They were the best empanadas we ate in Argentina. We left at 3pm and we were dropped off at the San Telmo street fair as it was Sunday. Horseback riding with my wife on my birthday was an amazing experience and Adrian gets all the credit for making it happen. He is a great teacher and with some effort anyone will learn to canter within hours. This is a must do when you visit Buenos Aires.

Excellent and exciting riding experiance!!. My wife and I where looking for riding possibility during our stay in Buenos Aires in November 2013. We have found the service of Miriam and Adrian via the internet.We have been foccussed on riding in the nature guided by an experiances instructure. We have not been looking for an folklore event as it is mostly the case when you visit an Estancia. We also did not want to Ride in Big groups in a line.Our expectations have been fully met and more than that. Her the details.Skills: riding skills have been evaluated in advance by MailAppointment: Miriam showed up at the meeting point ahead the time and gave us a Lift to the staples.Hospitality: we have been very warm welcomed by Miriam, Adrian and the staff. Beverage have been offerred and plenty of Time have been given to refresh before get startend and to share a Mate with Miriam. Also the stable and the horses have been shown and explained, before we moved to the already saddled horses.After thr Ride we have been offerred bevorages, coffee and a lot of Cookies.Horses: very healthy horses in good condition and well maintained including saddle ect. The horses have been calm and Not nervos. From the beginning there was an easy Communication between horse and riderRiding: We have been a Group of two plus Miriam. Therefore it has been very Personal and Miriam adjusted each horse before we started riding within the fenced area, watched closely by Miriam. She must have been satisfied, then we moved on very shortly into the nearby park.As it was not a Weekend, the Park was empty and wo took advantage for our three horses.Miriam gave very precise recommondations in using the One Hand riding or to improve the Own skills. She also made pictures and Videos by using my Owen camera. Therefore a small One is recommended. We did all different kind of riding including riding without using of hands. The pritty of the Park have been emazing. Wie turned back to stables safely after more then 3 hours.Security: Starting from the meeting point,the transport,dring the ride, the payment and the transport back to the Meeting point, everything have been Professional organized an executed.SUMMARY: When your focus is on a realistic ride in a nice enviroment, in small personal groups with nice horses and a friendly skilled instructur, Caballoalarpar is the place to be in Buenos Aires.Special thank to Miriam for tis unforgettable day. Conny and Eckhard

Awesome idea. I have been horse riding many times throughout my life but never took classes. This was the best thing I could have done for myself. Two hours, private lessons, doing various exercises and learning essential tips. The class was interactive, never dull. The scenery was beautiful. I wish I could have stayed longer to take more classes. Keep up the good work!

The best. 3rd visit to Caballos a la par. They are one of the reasons I keep returning to Buenos Aires. The new estancia is looking good. It's such a pleasure to drive up and have the gates open to see the horses wandering the grounds. Even peering in the window at you while you share mate. Adrian and Miriam will make you feel welcomed and at home from start to finish. Most importantly if your goal is to be more comfortable on a horse and you work with them this will become a reality. Looking forward to seeing my Argentinian friends on my next trip to Bs AsBook a lesson. You won't regret it

Must-do. One of my favourite activities from Argentina! Adrian and Miriam (the owners/instructors) were both very friendly and helpful. We had mate when I arrived, then Adrian gave me a quick run through of basic skills for how their horses have been trained. I rode alone with Miriam and she was always chatting and correcting my form. We rode through gorgeous fields and forests, alternating between exercises and leisure riding (Adrian had emphasized that the ride could involve whatever I wanted, I just had to ask). Miriam took pictures and videos with my camera the whole time. Afterwards we had pastries and lemonade. I was sore for two days after but it was so worth it!

Great day!. Had a great day horseback riding just outside Buenos Aires!!!Nice people, good horses, beautiful nature, good food.Got some horseback training and enjoyed the country side.I would recommend this to any one who wants to go out of the city!

A wonderful riding experience whatever your level in beautiful surroundings. I really cannot praise Caballos A La Par highly enough. They have a variety of horses and are able to match rider to horse very skilfully. I am an experienced rider so was able to take full advantage of the excellent going through forest areas and open spaces but, having seen Adrian organising some young children with their mounts, am sure that a beginner or nervous rider would have just as positive an experience.I enjoyed it so much that I went back a second time. Colleagues who saw me on my return commented on how chilled I looked and one immediately booked for the following week on my recommendation. It's a wonderful contrast to vibrant and busy Buenos Aires. Adrian and Miriam are both so welcoming and have a determination to make your day a positive one.

A great and fun day in the country side of Buenos Aeres. It was one of the highlight of our trip in Argentina!My husband & myself are in our fifties.We don't know to ride and I was very afraid because in my youth I had a very bad experience.To my surprise within a short space of time we started to ride like two gauchos!This was possible because Adrian is an incredible instructor and that his horses have an excellent character and are impeccably well trained.Our ride in the Unesco Park was amazing.Myriam and Adrian have passion and love for their horses and they know to communicate it!!!

An excellent experience. I made a reservation with Caballos A La Par over a month before we left for Argentina and right away I was impressed with Miriam's fast response and clear instructions. My wife and I had been looking for this type of one on one instruction and the opportunity of riding in the countryside. While my wife ( has had English style horse riding experience when she was younger I had only taken a few lessons prior to us leaving for South America. I am 64 and Laura is 62. Adrian picked us up at the designated location and an interesting aspect of the day was engaging in conversation with him on the drive out to their newly built stables and then talking with them both prior to going riding. We drank mate prepared by Roberto their stable groom and this friendly experience put us at our ease. Strap on chaps with our lace up walking shoes worked fine and they supplied stylish riding hats. We went riding with Miriam for over two hours and she provided excellent instructions such that I achieved my personal goal for the day which was to do extended cantering through the high field grass. We also gave our camera to Miriam and got some excellent videos and photos. While there was only a limited opportunity for us as travellers there is no doubt that one would be able to learn significant horse riding skills quickly using the teaching techniques that Adrian and Miriam have developed. Highly recommended.

Awesome, Excellent….."Just Do It"!!!. I don't know where to start….1. I grew up in NYC, I'm 44 and have never been on a horse (never).2. I emailed Caballos A La Par months prior to arriving in Buenos Aires and Miriam was so helpful in planning this for me. We also had to reschedule due to rain and she was more than helpful and so easy to work with.3. Adrian picked me up as scheduled in Buenos Aires and was early waiting on me; very prompt. We then drove @ 35 minutes out to his farm and we chatted all the way.4. Adrian & Miriam have been riding since they were small children & both play polo; enough said5. In addition to being expert riders & teachers, they are both wonderful people. We had tea & pastries before the ride and then took a shower and changed after my ride. 6. Don't get me wrong; its hard work learning to ride & Adrian is both patient & stern at times.I was at times getting frustrated, but Adrian knew how to push me and when to take a break.at the end I was riding like a champ and I have a videos to prove it! I was so proud17. We then sat down and had a few cold drinks before heading back to the city and a few good laughs. I felt like we were friends by the time I left. They are wonderful!I can't wait to share the pictures & videos with my friends and family!

Fantastic Riding experience. My wife and I had the pleasure of meeting Adrian and Miriam at Al La Par about 40 minutes drive from BA Argentina. It was a full day out with about 4.5 hours actually in the saddle. My wife had never sat on a horse in her life after a while with Miriam riding side by side my wife was cantering safely along. Myself a novice rider experienced my first canter within the first half hour with Miriam. Riding out in the open country with experts is fantastic. We had Mate dutiful Argentine pastries,and refreshments after riding. Picked up and dropped off in BA. A great experience at a very reasonable price for what is involved, great expert tuition of riding.

An experience of a lifetime!. Thanks to Trip Advisor, I was able to discover Adrian and Miriam. They are so kind and accommodating and best of all, they really love horses and teaching people. This is definitely unique from any other horseback riding tours out there. As a matter of fact, they made my standards so high, I am worried to be let down by other horseback riding tours in other parts of the world. Perfect for any level, everyone must make a trip out here to complete their Argentina experience.

Amazing time in the countryside!. Adrian and Miriam provided one of our favorite activities during our week-long trip to Buenos Aires. Adrian picked us up in BA and we drove about 40 minutes to their stables in the countryside. The car ride was a great opportunity for him to get to know us, and for us to learn about him, their business and riding. He made it clear that the day wouldn't necessarily be easy -- there is effort that is required and what we got out of the excursion would be equal to what we put in.We arrived and their ranch and had some snacks, drank mate and learned about the business, property, etc. They had horses chosen for us based on our size, experience, and the general vibe they got from us during our email communication. There was about 30 minutes of instruction from Adrian on their property before Miriam brought my girlfriend and I out into the park.We began with walking and learning about control, pacing, etc. We soon began trotting and eventually cantering. Miriam is a sweetheart and a great instructor! There was very little pre-determined paths or agenda. We rode all around the park, stopping for short instruction and exercises. With little more than 30 minutes of "practice" we already felt quite comfortable and were thoroughly enjoying ourselves. We rode and chatted for hours before making our way back to the ranch for beer and empanadas.Even if one has never ridden before, as neither of us had, Adrian and Miriam are able to very quickly get us acquainted with the horses and property. It was a fantastic experience and a pleasant trip outside the city. Highly recommended!

Incredible horse riding. This place was a great experience,Adrian & Miriam offered us a warm welcome in their beautiful place.The ride with Miriam in an UNESCO parc was amazing, Definitely a highlight, great tips, a very customised day, and the horses are very well treated We can definitely recommend it!Birke

Brilliant Day out of the city. We had the most amazing day learning to horse ride with Adrian. An absolute highlight of our honeymoon, even though we had been out for a few too many drinks the night before! Adrian was patient and clearly very passionate about what he does...within a very short space of time we were riding into the wind, feeling like we were in our very own cowboy movie. I really can't recommend it enough.

Fantastic experience. We booked this experience and ha da wonderful day with the horses, the team and the nature! We tell friends of this experience as One of the highlights of our Argentina visit, Even though we are both not riders, and my Partner Even never sat on a horse! We learned a lot about riding and can definitely recommend this!

A unique, enriching and fun day!. My friend and I were looking for something different to do on our last day in Buenos Aires and decided to try Caballos A La Par. What a special day it was! Adrian and Miriam were excellent hosts, providing personalized attention to two inexperienced riders. They purposely take just a couple of people for each reservation vs. a group so they can really teach and guide each customer. We were surprised by how much we learned and how quickly we became comfortable to canter on our friendly horses in the open fields. It really was exhilirating! We definitely recommend this experience to people of all levels of horse riding experience.

Fantastic Day Out. The highlight of our recent trip to Buenos Aires was our horse riding experience with Caballos A La Par. Adrian and Miriam were hugely hospitable hosts with an obvious love and passion for horses.Miriam provided excellent tuition throughout the morning, showing abundant patience and providing the perfect level of encouragement. My partner and I started as complete beginners but by the end of our session we were cantering across a wide open field side by side. At one point we were going through exercises without even holding the reins! We did not expect to progress so quickly and the lesson was truly exhilarating. Adrian and Miriam took care of everything, transfer to and from the ranch as well as great refreshments both before and after the lesson. They were incredibly welcoming and we could have sat chatting to them all day. We will definitely be returning for another lesson on our next trip over to Buenos Aires.

A tranquil afternoon riding a willing horse - what could be more enjoyable?. Miriam and i set off on our 2 Criollo horses walking, trotting and cantering through a large, grassy park which at this time of year (late October) was green and beautiful. After spending 5 days in the noise and constant movement of Buenos Aires, I was ready for this peaceful place. Miriam and Adrian are great people who love and look after their horses, and also want their guests to enjoy being with them in their home and surroundings. I think anyone from a beginning rider to an experienced rider will enjoy their time at Caballos a la Par.

Absolute must for adventure seekers outside of BA!. Adrian and Miriam gave us one of the most memorable days we had in Argentina! We loved meeting and spending time with both of them and of course, the incredible riding experience.We still can't believe what we were able to accomplish in just one afternoon!A brief ride from Buenos Aires, the transfer was seamless and we were welcomed by sharing mate - a very traditional experience that set the tone for the rest of the day. Neither of us had much (if any) experience riding, but by the end of the day we were cantoring without holding on. Pretty unreal. Miriam made us so comfortable and confident and the scenery is beyond spectacular. She also took amazing photos for us!Adrian and Miriam's passion for what they do and love for their animals sets them apart. An absolute must for anyone visiting BA!

Wonderful - so much more than just a riding lesson. This is such a brilliant experience and we highly recommend it to anyone with an interest in horses, Argentinian culture and spending time with wonderful people. The horse riding was excellent and nothing like a standard trail ride. As we were both experienced riders, Adrian was happy for us to ride at our own pace and more or less decide what we did (with some helpful tips and exercises thrown in for good measure). The horses themselves are very well trained and clearly well looked after. Miriam and Adrian were fantastic host. We very much enjoyed our chats about horses, Argentina and life in general over mate and delicious pastries. We look forward to being able to do this again sometime (hopefully soon).

Just do it!. Just do it! If you like anything to do with horses you will love this. ( or just after something different.! It is totally unique. It was fully personalised to my needs. I had the most incredibly amazing experience!  I couldn't have asked for better. What my dreams are made of. Like WOW :-) After being picked up ( and then returned at the end of the day) by Tito, I was greeted by very warm welcome by Adrian on arrival with a morning tea. No rush right into. Adrian takes the time to find out what you want out of your day, what your expectations are and to just get to know something of you. I just wanted to learn how to ride and have a fun day. That it was and so much more.There are several horses, Sooo well cared for and loved. You can see the passion Adrian has for his horses with the care taken with them and the surrounds. I had the pleasure to ride both Isabel and Indio. Such beautiful well tempered gentle horses. I couldn't have asked for better horses to learn with.... and Adrian an extremely knowledgeable teacher. Perfecto! I learnt to saddle, to then walk, trott and what seemed like no time I was cantering! Like OMG. ( I'm sure with a bit more practice I will be galloping in no time! Lol) The forest was SOOO beautiful to ride through.... Very special. It was exhilarating.... Freeing.... filled me with loads of feel good stuff. It is an experience I will carry with me always. Like I say, just do it. If you have half the experience I did, you will have a super fantastic enjoyable day.... And then some :-) Thank you to Adrian, Indio and Isabel and Tito ;-)

do you want a unique experience?. At only half an hour of Buenos Aires you have the impression of arriving in a piece of paradise; Hosted by Miriam and Adrien the ranch makes you feel like coming home. While the beautiful horses give you a sense of confidence, you go for a ride in the woods around the ranch like you have been riding your whole live through....so if you are an experienced rider or not this is the place where you can touch "el campo Argentino". Oh and by the way: if you come back and feel tired and sweaty, you jump in the pool, while you enjoy a "mate" or fresh drinks. Like I said before: it feels like a piece of paradise.

A truly memorable experience - An absolute must!. This was an amazing experience and biggest highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. Upon arriving to the ranch, we were warmly greeted by Adrian and Miriam, who welcomed us, by inviting us to join in the Argentinian tradition of Mate drinking which we had been really keen to try whilst in Argentina. We also enjoyed delicious traditional cakes and finger food.We were provided with half a day of private tutoring and went from never having ridden a horse to being able to confidently control, trot, and canter without hands! Adrian and Miriam are very warm and welcoming. Adrian is a wonderful tutor, very supportive and focused on helping you progress. His passion for the horses is evident from when you first meet him, and this comes through in every interaction. The horses have amazing temperament and are a pleasure to spend time with and the landscape - simply spectacular.My wife and I would highly recommend this; a truly memorable experience. Adrian and Miriam, we wish you all the best for the future. If we were living in Buenos Aires, we would definitely be a regular for ongoing lessons/rides.

BEST DAY SPENT IN BUENOS AIRES!. From the moment Adrian called out our name at our scheduled meeting place, we knew this was going to be a great day! His enthusiasm is contagious and his love of horses is evident even before we arrived at his ranch where it is all about the horses. During the 30 minute ride to the ranch, Adrian is already "feeling you out" as far as your knowledge and abilities involving horses and is setting you at ease regarding the horse you will be riding. I had grown up with my own horses but my husband is your typical "trail rider" where every horse follows the other no matter what you do. None of THAT at Caballos A La Par! I knew he was a bit nervous and had reminded me that we were in Buenos Aires celebrating our 30th anniversary and would like to celebrate a few more. Adrian was amazing at making him comfortable even before we arrived. Upon our arrival, we were met by Miriam, Adrian's partner in this amazing venture, a soft spoken, beautiful lady from Holland. The property is impeccable, the horses out in their own individual pastures. We were given a tour of the stables that anyone would want to live in and of course, the two friendly black labradors followed. We then were invited to share in the mate and biscuits and once again, Adrian was doing his "work" sizing us up to know which horses to pair us with. He had decided on Isabel for my husband which is a spirited but very gentle pinto mare and I got my choice of Bandido, a Quarter Horse and Lindo, a Criollo gelding. Adrian started off with a quick demonstration on appropriate techniques and then got my husband on Isabel and quickly set him at ease. I started my day on Lindo and midway, Adrian and I switched horses and I finished the day on Bandido who was a dream of a horse! We rode through vast areas of trees and parks, getting to ride at our pace with instruction from Adrian whenever needed. Very soon into our ride, my husband was trotting and cantering with the greatest of ease all because Adrian KNOWS how to teach and build confidence and reduce your fears. He has several drills that really work and once you perfect them, you truly feel comfortable in your abilities. Let's not forget that these horses are so well cared for and so well trained (not in the method of head to butt trail riding) that they actually listen to your commands as a rider. That is almost unheard of with horses that are used with so many different riders and their abilities. Throughout the whole trip, Adrian is taking photos and videos so don't forget your camera or smart phone! After almost three hours of riding, sadly we had to return to the ranch.After unsaddling the horses and watching them roll around, we got to go inside and enjoy our choice of hot chocolate, coffee and drinks and I must say, THE BEST PASTRIES I've ever had. We enjoyed about an hour of wonderful conversation and really felt like we were visiting with family. Adrian is so warm and outgoing and such a pleasure to have spent the day with. It is so obvious that this is not just their job but their passion. Unfortunately, Miriam had a prior commitment so we were not able to spend as much time with her but those who are lucky enough to do so will surely appreciate her.Sadly, our day had to end and we were driven back to Buenos Aires but with such great memories of Adrian and the horses that will last a lifetime. I got the best benefit of all and now have a husband who actually enjoys riding for the first time in thirty years!

Great experience all around. We spent a week in Buenos Aires and were looking for something to do outside the city (and I had been wanting to go horse riding for a long time...) - this was the perfect choice! It was a well-organised, friendly, professional and very welcoming experience that I can recommend to everybody. Organising this day was really simple, since Miriam responded to my emails promptly and we discussed various options. Already when Adrian picked us up in the city he made us feel really at ease and very comfortable and excited. Arriving on the estate this was reinforced through the warm welcome, the mate we shared, the relaxed atmosphere and the way Miriam and Adrian really make you feel that they enjoy spending this day with you. The riding experience itself was amazing - the perfect mix of being professional and relaxed. They explained everything very well (we are both complete beginners), and then we went on this amazing ride with Miriam. The feeling of riding through the beautiful countryside while at the same time improving our riding and the relationship with the horse was incredible. We felt very well looked after and the hours spent on the horse were really exciting. Back at the farm we enjoyed an amazing hot chocolate and a lovely long chat, really feeling very welcome and w we could have easily spent a few more days with them... We spoke a lot about the horses, which are very well looked after, but also about Buenos Aires and Argentina more generally!I can whole-heartedly recommend this to anyone looking for a day away from the city and for a great riding experience.

Amazing experience - exceeded my hopes!. My husband and I planned our honeymoon to Argentina and I really wanted horse riding to be an experience to share and fond memory for both of us. I have grown up with horses but my husband had only been on a pony once as a child. I was concerned that we would not both be able to ride out together and enjoy it due to our huge difference in ability. I did a little online research and came across Caballos A La Par. I was encouraged by the feedback left by others and the description on their website of the experience they hope to provide for you. I contacted Caballos A La Par and Miriam responded promptly, assuring me that they were able to provide an experience that would be enjoyable for us both. This was fantastic to hear although I didn't know quite how they were going to achieve it! Miriam also confirmed that we would be able to go out independently and would not be part of a group, which I was really excited about. Once we arrived I was immediately impressed and reassured by Adrian and Miriam's approach. The initial tuition before we headed out made it all seem so simple! However, this wasn't just due to Adrian's excellent ability as a horseman himself. The horses are wonderful. Such intelligent, gentle animals. They are so wonderfully trained and cared for that they make it possible for you to achieve so much in so little time. My husband took to Adrian's tuition extremely well and I was genuinely stunned when he was trotting and confidently controlling the pace of a canter in a few hours! I am so grateful for the fantastic video footage of us cantering side by side (a la par!) that Adrian got for us.You really are able to experience riding across open land and have absolute confidence in your instructor and horse. Unlike so many riding schools, you really feel like you're out with friends on horses you've known for years and the horses all respond independently to your instruction. There is no hint of follow the leader amongst them and in my opinion the riding style is the best of both worlds! A combination of UK and western, so very comfortable and manageable. The whole experience was so perfectly tailored to us and beyond my expectations. I haven't stopped telling family, friends and colleagues about it.From our collection to our departure we both had the most amazing time, words can not even describe the wonderful experience we both had. Adrian and Miriam are very warm, hospitable people and the location is fabulous. We absolutely loved every moment and I can't recommend it highly enough.

Spectacular!. We own a tourist business in the Turks and Caicos Islands. We are a hard customer to impress and would say Adrian and miriam were two of the best hosts we have ever had. First you are picked up and taken to a gorgeous ranch. The horses are in excellent condition as is the equipment. My partner had never riden before and by the time we finished, he was galloping through the endless fields of open space. No walk follow the horse trail. This is serious open riding with an excellent instructor who insures your safety and such a fun tim. This was the best tour of our entire month Argentina trip. I had not ridden in 20 years and learned more in 2 hours than in all the previous years of riding.Not only do you receive excellent instruction but are treated like family learning about traditional Argentina drink and then upon return, Real hot chocolate and pastries to die for. This is clearly an adventure not to miss. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this experience This .

The best experience!!. When you decide to go horseback riding at Ardian's ranch you really have now idea the experience that you are in for!! The first time I went it was at the recomendation of my friend Kirsteen and we arrived and had mate for the first time (which i had not tried yet since living in Argentina). The atmosphere is wonderful! the owner of the ranch Adrian instantly treats you like you are a long lost friend and welcomes you into the ranch and gets to know you before even taking you out to ride so from the begining there is a personal connection established so this makes it fell more like visiting your friend that happends to have a horse ranch. Once the mate was finished we went out to his beautiful horses which were already staged and ready to go. before even letting you on he makes sure you are confortable and asks you your skill level and then your off. while riding its not like those other turisty horseback riding "adventures" that you over paid for just to ride in a line and the horse wont deviate from what it sees the guide do. Adrian takes you to a field well many fields as you ride through the beautiful park that sorrounds his ranch while you are riding if you have little to no riding skills not to worry! Adrian will not leav your side until you are comfortable and confidant and then he lets you go off and do what he just showed you how to do! i have been riding off and on all my life and he gave me a few pointer and i was off. he really lets you do your own thing keeping vigilant of course and if he thinks you will do somthing unsafe then he will say something. but he rides with the group conversating and interacting all the way. the ride is probably the better part of 3-4 hours i loose track of time because riding with Adrian on his horses you forget the rest of the world and you just get lost in the moment. after a wonderful ride we returned to the ranch and had pastries and hot chocolate and then we return to the city. Adrian also offers personal rideing lessons which i am defiantely going to take him up on!

Good times with New Friends- Highly Recommend!. Anusha??!! said Adrian's booming and friendly voice when we met at the rendezvous point in the city. From that moment on, the energy between all of us was that of old friends meeting after a long time. We became fast friends during the 45 minute drive to the ranch which is located in a beautiful national forest. At the ranch we were greeted at the gate by Miriam, Adrian's inspiring business partner and Indio,the gorgeous & graceful steed. Over the next hour we got a tour of the ranch, learnt about Miriam's journey and soaked in their hospitality over maté! As we got into horse-riding gear, Adrian reminded us that we should be ready to put in some hard work over the next couple of hours and that it would make the entire experience all the more memorable. Soon, after some preliminary instructions, we were sitting gingerly on top of Indio and Isabel (Isa), a couple of very well trained, patient horses. For the next 2 hours, we trotted, we galloped and we cantored all while managing to stay on the horse..hallelujah!!! A big victory for us first timers. At the end of it, we felt like gauchos who had been riding horses since they were 5. The whole time, Adrian rode alongside us, sincerely encouraging and completely invested in creating a fun filled memory. The multi-talented Adrian was also our personal photographer. After the ride, we soon learnt that Isa was an impatient lover of carrots, a snack that we fed the horses as a reward. The day winded down over sweet treats and Miriam's world famous hot chocolate. Miriam drove our tired bones and happy souls back to the city during which there was more laughter. Everything about the day felt right and we were excited to have lived this day. At the end of our experience, my wife was convinced that we should name one of our kids Indio and move to Buenos Aires (Help Me). We left with promises of meeting again in Buenos Aires, New York and India!  To everyone out there: if there is one thing you are looking to do, consider spending time at Caballos with the team - it will be the highlight of your trip.

I highly recommend it!. Most perfect way to spend a Sunday afternoon! I went with three friends, a driver came to pick us up, and took us to the ranch. Beautiful place! We arrived, had amazing mate, which I am not a fan of, but this one I loved, and got ready for the lesson. We were provided very good equipment, and the horses are very well taken care of and trained. I was quite scared of riding, but Adrian made me feel very confident, taught me how to hold the reins, how to make the horse gallop, trot, how I should sit, etc. He made us do exercises I thought were impossible, but managed! What can I say...AMAZING!!!! All the experience was great fun, and I want to repeat!

Wonderful day out - for beginners and experts!. My wife and I took our honeymoon to Argentina, and spent a day with Adrian and Mariam at Caballos a la Par.My wife organised the day, as she has been riding for most of her life. I, on the other hand had sat on a pony once, when I was a child. I was initially concerned that I would be holding things up and slowing everyone down - I needn't have worried. Thanks to the excellent tuition of Adrian, and the help of their beautiful horses, I was trotting and cantering side-by-side ("a la par"!) with my wife and Adrian within about an hour and for the rest of our three-hour experience.The grin didn't leave my face for the rest of our trip - I have fallen in love with horse riding, thanks to Caballos a la Par.Our pickup went smoothly, the introductions, mate (like tea) and snacks at the ranch were a treat and - and this was a real bonus - Adrian carried our compact camera for the whole day and left us with some beautiful photos and videos to take home.I have no experience at all with horses, but my wife tells me that these were very happy and wonderfully cared for examples, and I can certainly vouch that they took very good care of a novice rider!Very, very highly recommended.

Hooked!. One of the best experiences in my life; exciting, refreshing and heartwarming. Both Adrian and Miriam are really wonderful hosts and, excellent and passionate trainers. It felt like home right from the start, they were so sincere and welcoming, certainly knowledgeable and experts at what they do. I had a great time riding with Miriam, she is so encouraging, energetic and just awesome. It was tough work like what Adrian warned me of, but nevertheless, it is all worth it (really!).The horses are well-trained and really lovely animals. I have no experience riding a horse and by the end of the day, I was cantering comfortably and confidently, and thirsty for more time with the horses. It wasn't just the time with the horses but also the quality time spent with both Miriam and Adrian that makes this whole experience so wonderful. I can't stop raving about them, I am totally hooked on horseback riding and I will definitely be back in the future!Thanks Adrian and Miriam for the heartwarming experience!

The difference makes the great experiences!. I am doing horse back riding for many years and I always feel nervous about riding in a different country with different standards of taking care of a horse. BUT then I went to Caballos a la Par. It is a very good place for every type of rider with the instructors, Miriam and Adrian, keeping care of the horses and if needed of you as well. Very good quality of equipment, well taken care of horses (no marks, perfect hooves, good equipment) and instructors who do really care about you AND the horses. I found a nice environment in which you can ride and not feel unfair towards your buddy, the horse. I do recommend because it is a super nice experience where the horse is included in the story! Additionally, the park is super nice to ride trough.

Great horse back riding experience in Buenos Aires!!. It was my first time riding a horse and I felt really comfortable as Adrian helped me along the way. We rode for about 2 hours and doing different activities. I totally recommend this place as it will be one of the greatest experiences you can have in BA, even if you are only a beginner. The horses are very sweet and very well trained.

Different world. We had a lovely day with Miriam and Adrian, they are excellent hosts and their warm personalities really add an extra dimension to a day of riding. Both are obviously passionate about horses and riding, and we found that everything they did was focused on giving us the best possible experience. It was a real tonic after the hustle and bustle of BA. We visited as a family of 5, and our kids immediately felt comfortable and confident under the gentle direction of Adrian. Within an hour our 3 kids were cantering, having previously had no experience of riding. It was a real pleasure to see them so happy and at ease on horseback. A really great day, we hope to be back very soon.

Great day. A fantastic activity, I am a relative beginner and my partner is an expert but Adrian and Miriam made the activity an amazing experience for both of us. We both learnt so much and ended the day by cantering hands free (I never would have thought that was possible).The location is beautiful and it was great to be able to ride freely without having to follow a specific route or the horse in front. The horses are so well trained and they were matched to our specific ability and riding style before we left the stables. Would recommend to all!

Amazing day. Before this trip I had no experience of horses and riding. With a great instructor (Adrien) and the horse Lindo I learned so much in just one day! To be able to ride out in a stunning nature is an experience I will never forget. I will defenitely come back next time I visit Buenos Aires and would strongly recommend this experience to all my friends!

Memorable experience. First time on a horse and it was an amazing experience! I had no knowledge on horseback riding before but by the end of a half-day session, I had enough confidence to even canter. Isabelle, the horse I rode was beautiful and so well trained! Thanks to Adrian and Miriam for making my first lesson so enjoyable!

HOT CHOCOLATE AND PASTRIES. OMG!!!. If you really like horses, and you really like riding horses, then this is the place for you. The horses are beautiful, the ranch is beautiful, the countryside is beautiful, the guides are beautiful,… you get it. Everything is beautiful!!! Yes, everything most certainly is.Caballos a la Par really lives up to its name, as the riding experience that you get is really side by side instruction, not your typical trail ride where the guide rides in-front of the group, and you are left to ride behind in the back. This is more of a 4 hour personal lesson on either teaching you from the ground up how to ride your horse confidently and safely, or improving upon the riding skills you already have. It’s about making you the best rider you can be within the limited amount of time that you spend there. It’s absolutely the best experience you will ever have if you are willing to learn and to put the effort into improving your skills when you show up to the Caballos ranch.We found out about this horseback riding experience along with a few others right here on TripAdvisor. So hopefully, my review will be informative and helpful to you as well. Since my wife and I both enjoy going horseback riding, we usually try to find somewhere that we can ride in each country we visit. Back home we try to go riding a few times each year. After reading a number of reviews about Caballos a la Par on TripAdvisor – both what others felt was good and bad about it – we decided that we would make a reservation.Very important: When travelling to Buenos Aires, try to have a cell phone that can browse the web, and send and receive emails. Almost, every attraction, or event that you can attend in this fine city can be reserved online. Email is also one of the most convenient ways to communicate, and be kept in the loop on event rescheduling, etc.After discovering Caballos a la Par on TripAdvisor, we clicked on the email link at the top of the page and were connected with Miriam. We confirmed our reservation and times via email. Miriam also asked to know how much each of us weighed, and what our prior riding experiences were, so that she could properly tailor the horses and the day’s activities for both of us. They would send a car to meet us near the center of town, and we would then travel to the ranch from there. We corresponded with Miriam a few more times before the event during which she informed us that Hector – a very personable and talkative gentleman – would be picking us up.On the day of the ride, we were to meet Hector at the intersection of San Juan y Lima at about 2pm. We left our hotel in Recoleta AN HOUR before our meet time thinking that we would get there early, relax and check out the café. O! M! G! The amount of traffic between our hotel and the meet point was un… be… lievable! It took us an hour and a half to travel 20 blocks by taxi. I think we could have gotten there faster if we had walked. I was so afraid that Hector was going to leave us behind since we were going to be late, but Hector was there waiting oh so patiently for us right at the meet point. Car on the sidewalk. Buenos Aires style. Some quick introductions all around, and we were off to the campo only about 30 minutes or so outside of the city. The drive out to the ranch was quick and smooth – well, smooth until we got to the road that turns off the main causeway, and actually takes you to the ranch itself. I think we spent a good 5 minutes just rocking back and forth, back and forth in the car on the rickety dirt pathway that takes you to the ranch entrance. Once there, however, as the car turns left and enters through the front gates of the ranch, we were greeted by lush plains, and three of the most beautiful and well taken horses we had ever seen standing off to the left, saddled and ready to go.But first,… let’s get to know each other a little bit. :-)After we got out of the car, we were greeted by Adrian. He was the owner of the ranch and would also be our riding instructor for the day. Usually, our experiences with many of the riding “places” that we go to the beginning or introduction is a very simple affair. We would usually show up, there would be other riders there as well. There would be some very cursory instructions on how to turn the horse left or right, and then we would set off. All in a large group, one behind the other. Today however, we were in for a very nice surprise.What we came to find out, is that each ride is very customized, and also very personal. You, or your party, will be the only ones on the ride with your instructor(s).Adrian greeted us, and took us inside where we all then sat down for some maté. Maté is a traditional Argentinian drink, that is prepared by steeping dried leaves in hot water. We talked for a bit while we drank mate together, discussing what our previous riding experiences were, and what our goals were for the day. I shared that I have always felt uneasy riding a horse while it was trotting. Walking I’m okay, but once the horse starts trotting, then I’m all over the place, and I just can’t seem to figure out what I’m supposed to do to get into a good rhythm with the horse. It was then that Adrian said that, not only is he going to help us with that, but by the end of the day we would be cantering without holding onto the reins.What?!!! Yep. That’s what he said. And, for sure I didn’t believe him, but we finished up our last round of mate, and off we went. Well not before we put on some chaps, and took some pics. Then, off we went. To the horses.It was a bit cold that day. Not unusual for winter I guess, but we hadn’t expected it to be so cloudy and windy this late in the day, so Adrian got us some coats and vests he had available before we set out on our ride.My wife was first. Adrian introduced her to her horse. Had her get on, and adjusted the stirrups and saddle. It was freezing, but I watched attentively as Adrian led her around atop her horse, and explained a few commands and such to her.I was next and because the hiking boots I was wearing were kind of big, we walked back to the stables to get some larger stirrups for me. Once I was on top and getting acquainted with my horse, trying to get it to walk gracefully. Well, the horse already knows how to walk. I’m the one that doesn’t know how to ride properly. Sure enough, my horse started trotting a little, and I couldn’t figure out how to keep in rhythm, or if there even was a rhythm. Ha-Ha. It was at this point Adrian pointed out what I was doing to my wife and said: “¡A ver! You see how he’s riding the horse now. Remember this moment, and you’re going to see. By the end of the day, you’re going to see a BIG difference. I promise you.” Me, I still didn’t believe it. We walked around in the clearing in-front of the stables for a few more minutes and then set off into the forest.The rest of the day’s riding, all five(5) hours of it was filled with practice, and learning. Along wide open plains of grass, between trees and bushes in the forest. Coming upon amazing wildlife – like the largest rabbit/hare I’ve ever seen (as big as a dog, and almost as big as the pack of dogs that were chasing it).There is so much more to tell from this experience. From finally learning how, to post properly while the horse is trotting, learning how to properly control the speed of our horses. Cantering, and… yes, cantering without hands! I couldn’t believe it either, but I have the video to prove it.I think one of the best moments for me on the ride was when Adrian prompted us to go off and practice what we had learned, and I ended up off, and alone in the forest, just me and my horse Lindo. I enjoyed that stolen moment of peacefulness a lot, but the slow sunset ride back to the ranch, which then turned into a moonlight ride was really enjoyable as well.Back at the ranch we were introduced to the entire family, and the entire family of horses as well. The day wasn’t over yet though as we all sat down for freshly made hot chocolate (a big thick bar of dark chocolate melted into hot milk on the stove, can you say de-li-cious!), and a wide array of pastries. It was a very yummy and delightful end to a very relaxing and fulfilling day.We talked for a long while, while drinking chocolate by the fireplace. It was all good fun, and we didn’t end up departing until well after 9pm.My wife and I left the ranch that night, with the feeling that we had just left our long lost extended family – the nice ones that you want to hang out with on vacation days. Wishing that, and wanting to go back to the ranch so that we could ride some more, but we were soooooooo sore. My butt, and my back. Oh my gosh. I really wish I could have gone back and spent some more time there, but my body definitely prevented it.We left there very, very, very satisfied. So satisfied in fact, that we plan to take another trip back to Argentina, just so that we can ride at Caballos a la Par with Adrian again.

THE BEST HORSE BACK RIDING EXPERIENCE IN THE WORLD. Some people say that the connection between a horse and its rider is magical and I never understood that concept until my experience at Caballos A La Par. My husband and I have ridden before but we were not properly instructed on the different styles and techniques. We arrived at the Ranch and were welcomed by Adrian and his dogs. He is a charming young man, whose love for horses is evident from the first few words he had with us. The horseback riding experience began with Adrian giving us a brief description of his Ranch and a nice cup of mate. He then asked questions about our riding skills and what we wanted accomplish on the ride. We began riding towards the park close to his ranch. Adrian began explaining the different ways to ride. We began walking our horses, and then cantering. The day was already chilly but as we began practicing we forgot about the cold and enjoyed the ride. We were having so much fun we completely forgot about the time and just focused on the horses and how much we were enjoying ourselves. Four hours passed and we didn’t even noticed until the sun began to set and the golden rays began dancing through the trees; then we knew it was time to return to the ranch. I had never enjoyed riding as much as I did at Caballos A La Par. This was the most amazing experience I have ever had riding.

Time for pleasure. I've been in many countries doing horse riding (mongolia, USA, India, ...) and then came my first experience in Argentina. Just perfect ! Everyone is nice and Adrian's horses are the best ones I've ever drive. He's got the just feeling for training his horses and you just feel his love for them by mounting them. Just go and share this wonderful experience with Adrian. Perharps will you meet Indio (the gentle Criollo) or Sheik (the spice arabian) I've been glad to mount. Have a marvellous day in Argentina !

Gorgeous time with nice people and animals!. I visited Caballos a la par last Saturday. Adrian is a great teacher, the place is beautiful and the horses are in great shape, as well as all the equipment.

Great experience with great people!. My wife and I planned a trip to South America which included a stop in BA. Not wanting to spend our entire stay in the city we decided to look for a more adventurous activity close to the city. We advised our travel agent that we wanted to go horseback riding. After researching on our own, it seemed that Caballos A La Par would be the best for us, and it was booked.On the day we were to ride, Adrian picked us up at the designated spot and we enjoyed the 1/2 hour ride to the stable. He was immediately very friendly and we were very at ease. Upon arrival we met Miriam who was also very friendly. After sitting down to a drink of Mate and more conversation in a room inside the house, Miriam went to the stable and picked our rides while Adrian got us outfitted.I have some riding experience and my wife has very little and is not very comfortable around horses. Any experience either of us has had has been on trail rides with one horse following blindly behind the other. This all changed under the guidance of Miriam and Adrian, who matched us perfectly with two of the many horses in their stable. Finally we were shown the correct way to trot, canter and post. After a couple of hours practicing we were both very comfortable and amazingly, not too sore (unlike other experiences). The horses were amazing and were so easy to handle. The property we rode in was great and there were no pre designated trails. Adrian took many pictures and some video of our experience, which we fondly look back on.After the ride we went back to the house and were treated to hot chocolate and pastries. We had made new friends in Adrian and Miriam and would definitely go back to Caballos A La Par to ride but also just to visit these two people who are very passionate about what they do.If you are interested in riding while in BA, we would highly recommend Caballos A La Par.

Best Experience on our Buenos Aires Trip!. We are joining with so many others in applauding this unique attraction: Caballos a La Par is a must do on any trip to Buenos Aires! Whether a novice or an experienced rider, a horse lover or not so much, the half day spent in the country-side atop well-trained horses and under the watchful supervision of Adrian or Miriam is sure to be among the very best memories you take home.Located about 30 miles outside of the city and nestled in a 10,000 acre nature reserve, we were picked up in a central location in Buenos Aires and driven to the stable—a wonderful chance to see some of the communities outside the core. Once at the ranch, we were welcomed by two handsome dogs and one of the proprietors, Adrian. Next step: we settled in to share a traditional Argentine mate ceremony (mate is an infused drink made by steeping dried leaves of the yerba mate in hot water and sugar). The process of brewing the mate and sharing it is as formal in its way as is the Japanese tea service, with each participate drinking from the same gourd and from the same straw. While a delightful cultural experience, the ceremony also allowed Adrian to ‘size us up’ to determine best fit with horse.In our case, I rode many, many years ago so was paired with Indio, a sweet-natured paint. My daughter had been on a horse before but never moved faster than a walk; she was teamed with Isabel. Once satisfied that I could sit a horse without falling, I was able to use the space to ‘do my thing’ while Adrian turned his attention to the novice rider. Within two hours he had her trotting, posting (rising to the trot) and cantering like a pro. Most impressive was how secure she became, with correct posture and complete confidence in her ability to control her horse. We returned to the stable happy (but sore); we concluded the day with excellent hot chocolate and a variety of pastries.The best news: Adrian and Miriam are completing work on an apartment which will allow visitors to spend one or more days at Caballos a La Par and explore the surrounding reserve in depth. That will expand the opportunity for adventure and the fun.Truly not to missed……

A wonderful day away from BA. Great people. Great experience.. My wife and I were in BA for a week and decided we wanted to escape the hustle and bustle, and see the country side. After over-researching it (typical for me), we decided to take a chance on Caballos A La Par back when it had far fewer user reviews. Like it's many ratings now reflect: it was perfect and exactly what we had in mind. The location: absolutely stunning on a large nature preserve. About an hour's drive - very easy and you feel worlds away from BA (in a good way) when you get there. The host: Miriam is simply delightful. She played the role of the gracious host perfectly. She was warm, welcoming, and genuinely interested in getting to know us while sharing about herself as well (very interesting background). We could have spent all day just hanging out and talking with her. And, just as important, she was incredibly patient, supportive, and at ease while in the saddle. She's a natural when it comes to teaching.The horses: There are several and all are very well-cared for and well-trained. We both felt very comfortable the entire time (and this was my first time riding a horse that wasn't trained to just follow the tail of the one in front of it - which I now know is a much more fun experience). Miriam matched us up with horses perfect for our riding level, too (me: beginner; wife: intermediate) and we had a blast. If you have even a half-day, we HIGHLY recommend a trip to visit Caballos A La Par. It rounds out the BA experience well and you will have a great experience. Also, were building a guest house when we were there - had it been an option then, we definitely would have done an overnight in the countryside with a morning ride.We hope to be back someday and a visit here would be at the top of the list.

Amazing!!. This was the best experience we had in Buenos Aires. We were not the most experienced riders and Miriam and Adrian made us feel so comfortable! It was just the 2 of us, so plenty of time for learning a lot! We had almost 2hours of riding in the beautiful park and it was amazing! Was the best day we had!! Miriam is the nicest person and a really good patient teacher! We really felt like we were friend even though we only met her that day! Afterwords we got traditional Argentinian hot chocolate milk and some nice pastries!! Miriam brought us back to town and also gave us a lot of tips of we're to go!! Thanks Miriam and Adrian for an unforgettable day!!

Great experience in learning how to ride horses. We took our three children for their first time horse riding and we couldn't have come away happier. Not only did our young children (all under the age of 10) have a great time but they also learned the basics of how to ride a horse. So did us parents. It wasn't a jaunt out in the countryside. While we rode, Adrian taught us all about horses and how to ride. Then he helped us overcome our fears about galloping to actually learn how to gallop. So we not only learned the basics of riding but we enjoyed the countryside and came away wanting to return. So did the three kids. They keep asking us when we are going back. It will be soon. Very soon.

Amazing hosts and experience!!. We were visiting Buenos Aires for a couple of days and we went on an excursion to this place. It was my first time horseback riding. It was a perfect combination of learning and having fun. The place and fields are beautiful and the horses are so friendly, especially Isabelle :) The hosts are amazing and very hospitable. The instructor/host was very patient and motivating. I had a great time!! Definitely a must-do if you ever visit BA!!

Not to be missed...!. This place is a must for those with limited time in Buenos Aires. It is only 30/40 minutes away. You are collected & returned & more importantly the horses are well cared for & trained. Ideal for those who are inexperienced, just as much as those who can ride well. Adrian & Miriam both speak perfect English & are genuine hosts who tailor the trip just for you. You will not join another group, do your time is your own. The best bespoked ride you could ask for. Refreshments, mate & lunch are provided & for summer time there is a pool. Enquire if it is in use. Your ride will be through a local national untouched park. The route will always vary, which the horses love & are keen to enjoy the ride just as much as you do. Whether you ride or not, this is an experience of a lifetime. I ride & would return & do it all over again on my next visit. I would be very picky if you are wanting to do a gaucho ride. There are a couple publicised by the hotels, many of which bus 100's of people in for the day & put on a show - very very touristy. Not advised.Hereat Caballos you feel like a gaucho on your own horse, learning more about your style, confidence & how to ride the horse at yours... & their very best. Trust me. You will enjoy this amazing day out!

Horseback Riding in Buenos Aires. I found out about Caballos A La Par through Trip Advisor and decided to try it out during my stay at Buenos Aires. Both the trainers, Adrian and Miriam, were very welcoming and friendly. The first time i went to Caballos A La Par was in 2011, and after that time, i tried horse back riding in other places in other countries and there was none that could match up to the standard, the training, the place, and the people of Caballos A La Par and that was what brought me back again in 2013. This time round, i went with my mum, my sister and my sister's boyfriend. What makes Caballos A La Par so attractive is its exclusiveness that it offers to its students or clients. The trainers are very dedicated to making sure that we rode in the correct position and that we rode well and safe. Just like any student, my mum (and myself when i first went) who didn't know how to ride a horse, managed to trot and canter within one lesson. In my opinion, i strongly believe that Caballos A La Par is the only place that offers lessons of this sort. On the whole, it was definitely a very enriching experience and one that I would want to keep going back for if I was living in Buenos Aires.

Amazing experience riding. I was picked up on time from the agreed location and then driven into a beautiful countryside. As soon as I arrived I was made to feel welcome by my host Adrian. We then shared a mate and had a friendly chat. He then took me out into the parklands which are stunning. Even though there were only two of us I felt very safe and at ease.
