He was very patient with me as I could not speak any Spanish. He taught me a lot in those few hours and made me feel confident being back on a horse. I would recommend this to anyone. I know I would go back again!

A great day's riding in Buenos Aires. Easy rendezvous with Adrian, on the edge of town and drive to Caballos A La Par. A few cups of the local Matte before we started and hear all about Adrian's passion for horses, and riding.The horses were carefully chosen according to our ability. Plenty of attention to detail in getting the saddle, stirrups etc just right......and off we went. The local park is as near to being in 'the outback' as possible, and 10's of thousands of acres in size. Very relaxed style of tuition by Adrian, giving one or two gentle pointers at a time leading to an overall improvement over time. The horses are absolutely fabulous; obedient, and very well trained.Back for a light lunch, and home by late afternoon. Lots of pictures as Adrian is kind enough to take our cameras and has an eye for a good picture.A fabulous day out.

A wonderful Argentinian experience.. I was picked up on time from the designated location. from the moment i was picked up i enjoyed excellent conversation learning more about life in BA. On arrival I was met by Miriam and Adrian who are wonderful and generous hosts. It was lovely to share a mate, and empanadas and chat with people who I had just met who treated me like a friend who they had invited into their home. I have been on horse rides many times but have never had any tuition which I was looking forward to but apprehensive about at the same time. Miriam provided very clear and supportive instruction and I learned more than I expected in the 2-3 hours of riding. The parklands were lovely and it was beautiful to ride as the sun was beginning to set. Miriam is a natural teacher who inspires confidence. The horses are clearly well treated as noted in other reviews which is one of the reasons I chose this company over others. The stable is gorgeous and the horses are obviously loved and respected. The horses are so responsive and well trained. Having been on trail rides in the past where horses just follow each other and appear bored it was fabulous to experience riding a horse that was so responsive.I enjoyed meeting the very kind and genuine Adrian who made the time to sit and chat after my ride with Miriam by the fire as we had a hot drink. He offered to drive me to a drop off area that was much closer to my downtown hotel.I hope to come back here when I get to BA and if they have the planned accommodation completed would love to stay a few days in this beautiful part of BA that is only a short drive from downtown but feels like a million miles away. I would highly recommend this activity to beginners and also to those with experience with horses who would like a beautiful Argentinian experience and advanced tuition from expert horsemen.

Share a matte and enjoy a beautiful day on horseback. A memorable day horseback riding at Caballos A La Par. This is a paradise for horses, the horses are well treated and the stables are impeccable. With some good riding instructions from Adrian you will ride a horse the proper way and enjoy the beautiful natural reserve. Adrian and Miriam are great hosts and make the whole experience easy and enjoyable. Loved it!

An excellent day out for first timers!. My wife and I decided to have a crack at horse riding on our honeymoon after we'd been talking about giving it a go for years and we were delighted with the results from a few hours at Cabollos a La Par!The day was a delight - kicking off with the meeting in at te prescribed meeting point very easy to find and you honestly couldn't miss Adrian. The drive back to the stables was pretty quick and doesn't really cut into your time, Adrain is very happy to talk and speaks excellent English which is always useful. Adrian and Miriam were a delight to meet, welcoming us to the stables with mate and great conversation. After a nice relaxing chat it was time for the horses... this would be my first time on a horse and the first time for many years for the wife, but with these horses it was easy to get started. Within a couple of minutes you could guide them around the paddock and then it's off into the countryside. It's a slightly strange experience for an Englishman to just be allowed to start trotting a horse out into the country but it seemed to be the done thing around here!The lessons are hard work (as my sore back 2 days later will attest!) but with lots of consistent feedback from Adrain we were soon able to master walking, trotting, standing in the saddle, "trotting up and down" and cantering! Overall I really enjoyed having the option to just "ride the horse around" cantering, walking and trotting wherever we please and it does give me confidence in riding more horses in the future.All in all this was a great day and one of the best things we had done in Buenos Aires. To Miriam and Adrain keep up the good work and good luck with the stables in the future, we'll definately stop by if we're in Bs As again!

Best Horseback Riding in Buenos Aires. I had such a great time riding with Miriam at Caballos A La Par. Everyone is fun, friendly and helpful. They speak fluent English and Spanish. The horses are beautiful, friendly and well loved and cared for. The weather was great, the park was lovely. I just had a really nice day and look forward to riding with them again as soon as possible!

Made me hooked on horseback riding (and Argentinan snacks)!. Bottom line: if you have a chance, visit and take a ride here. Key points of why it was amazing:- easy meetup/pickup from BA to the reserve- beautiful reserve and stables that were a perfect break from the city- warm welcome including delicious mate (tea) and snacks to relax before and after the ride - gorgeous, friendly horses (Isabelle and Indio were the best)- amazing, massive reserve where the park is literally your riding ground (yes, this was worth repeating)- really fun, relaxed yet amazingly constructive rideLast, but not least, Miriam and Adrian were wonderful hosts and incredible teachers. For someone who had never ridden before, their teaching style had me feeling comfortable cantering by the middle of the lesson. AND I'm officially hooked - just got home and have signed up for lessons nearby. Whenever I'm in BA again, I'm going back.

The BEST of Buenos Aires. My wife and I visited Buenos Aires as part of my graduate school international trip. After reading several positive reviews online, we decided to book the horseback riding experience with Caballos A La Par. Our experience began when we were picked up in BA (pickup and return trip are part of the overall fee). We took the roughly one hour ride to the countryside and enjoyed seeing the outskirts of the city. While my wife has some experience horseback riding, I had never sat on a horse, let alone rode one. I must say, I was a little apprehensive. That nervousness immediately disappeared when we met with Miriam and Adrian at their ranch. From the minute we walked in they made us feel like family. We sat down, shared the traditional Mate tea, and got to know each other. We were then paired up with a horse based on our riding experience and personality.The ride itself was incredible!! We spent 2+ hours riding through pastures and enjoying the beautiful weather. It was perfect mix of learning the proper riding technique from Adrian but he was never overbearing. I went from having never been on a horse to galloping with no hands by the end of the ride. I could not believe it! Adrian also took pictures and video during our ride. At the end of the ride, we were treated to hot chocolate and pastries back at the ranch house.The experience was well worth every penny. You could really sense how passionate both Miriam and Adrian are about their horses and teaching others this wonderful activity. We felt like we made lifelong friends and we will be visiting again next time we are in BA. This is a MUST for anyone living or traveling in Buenos Aires!!!!

Unbelievable !! Fantastic must do in Buenos Aires !!!. This amazing adventure is must to do while in Argentina, dont miss it !I was met by Edrian with a big smile at the meeting point, he escorted me to his car till we reached his stables about half an hour drive, once reached met Miriam who welcomed me the same way, had chats with them in their lovely office and bar, had offered me the Argintina Mate tea in their traditional way then asked me about my experience level for horse riding.They are the owners and they trained you one to one, and have customized it for you only, they are very flexible and friendly and they do this for fun and not for money. They treat you like a friend.After that i rode a beautiful horse along with Miriam after Edrian showed me some important tips and hints in the riding journey, and we left the stables ( equestrian training center) to the green open areas (national forest park), really amazing feeling, there you can freely ride the horse with no fair, as the horses are very smart and cool and don't fall you down. It was really great when Miriam gave me the tips and hints for riding in practical way and you just need to listen to her. And yes at the end of this journey i was able to do the cantering for the first time and with my free hands too.At the end of this course i have gained confidence and improved my riding skillls and learned new things.Highly recommended if you are in Argentine and love horse riding regardless of your level.Thank you Edrien & Meriam, you were great :)

Amazing experience!. If you're looking for an activity and wanting to spend time outside of the busy city of Buenos Aires, this place is the place to go to - what a find! Originally my husband and I had considered going to an estancia to spend the day, but as soon as we came across this place we changed our plans and I am so glad we did. From beginning to end the service was excellent, but really more than service it was true hospitality. Adrian and Miriam really put their heart and soul into the place and their horses, and it makes it an unforgettable day. Right when we arrived we were greeted with the social activity of drinking mate, which my husband and I were super excited about since we had only tried mate in tea bags and were yearning to try the authentic mate. Adrian taught us all about mate, how to prepare it and how to drink it. We had a lovely time chatting and drinking mate (and we made sure to buy a set during our stay in BA to bring back to New York!) Then we were introduced to our horses, who I must say are the most gentle and well trained horses. Neither my husband or I have much experience riding horses, but these horses were amazing and we never once felt nervous riding. We rode over three hours in the national park which was stunning! And the best part was that you are actually free to roam and ride in the open space. We rarely ever rode in a straight line one horse after the other. We learned how to trot, canter, and really control the horse. It was amazing how much we had learned and improved by the end of our ride. Miriam was an excellent teacher with so much positive energy. Bottom line, I would say that if you go to BA and don't spend a day with Miriam, Adrian and their horses you've missed out on a wonderful experience!

my best experience with horses!!. I went to Adrian and Miriam's this friday and i had a perfect time with them and their amazing horses.I am a french flight attendant used to travel the world and to try this kind of experience and i really have to say that this one is defitly different to any of the others.This is really not something to take your tourist money but great and true people who will welcome you open arms and heart. You instantly know that you can trust them and you will have a great time. The horses are wonderful and you can trust them too.This is the must important to me, i have been riding in France for years and each time had this little feeling that i really have to watch out with my horse when i go out.Adrian horses ( i rode Bandida, a ex professional polo horse and Shake , arabian full blood) are never stressed by cars or dogs or anything , they never never try to put me down of their back.so i felt very secure and i could be focus on Adrian priceless advice about riding , position, and sipirit to enjoy and to be connected with my horse.You can go it in this beautiful landscape of the national Park and you really feel free and happy to be there.My cousin was with me and he never rode a horse before and he was a little stressed out.After half an hour he was confortable and enjoying and 2 hours later ha was able to have a really really good control of the horse and him self thanks to the extraordinary "quality" of horses training and the right advice of Adrian.There are many other good things i could tell but i don't want to boor the reader being to long.The only feeling i had was this people and their horses put their heart in every single details for the person who come to them so don't choose another one. This one IS the best ...maybe on earth.Thank you Miriam and Adrian, i'm looking forward to seeing you again.Guillaume

An amazing Horse Riding experience. This has got to be the best horse riding experience i have ever had. The fact it was just in a group of 4 with two instructors meant that you get a huge amount of guidance which is exactly what i needed as i was a nervous rider having had an accident some 20 years earlier! The horses were so well behaved and are obviosuly cared for so well. I felt like i was truly looked after and given such fantastic instruction i came away feeling much more confident and even wanting to get back on a horse th next day! We trotted and cantered through beutiful park lands and forests. I never thought i would feel so comfortable cantering but through the teaching and guidance of the instructors i was able to do so. Thank you and i wil be back if i am ever in the area agsain :)

Skilled one-on-one instruction. After more than 10 years being on a horse, I am so glad to I chose to be reacquainted with riding at Caballos a la Par. Miriam is an excellent instructor and went at a pace I was comfortable with. She was patient and encouraging, and within no more than an hour, she had me cantering with confidence. My other two friends who have plenty of experience also got to try a couple new tricks. Important to note that the horses are extremely well maintained and happy (we watched them graze and roll around in the grass after we finished riding). Great fun and I look forward to going back!

An amazing day out!. Friends and I decided we needed out of the city and what better way to do it than go horse-riding! AND not that far from the City WE arrived to a super friendly welcome, where we relaxed and chatted about or horse-riding experiences. The horses are beautiful, happy and most importantly,extremely well cared for!After refreshments we set off . An important thing for me was that safety hats were provided (very rare in Argentina) and chapsMiriam led the way as we rode through the beautiful park! After accessing or riding "skills", Marian was happy to let us Canter on, whilst also teaching a friend with little experience to ride. Half way through the ride, she was cantering along with us (amazed at how quick she learned and how comfortable Miriam had her feeling on the horse)! Furthermore, Miriam carefully kept an eye on myself, pointing out where i was going wrong when needed! It had been a while since i was in the saddle and having a lesson whilst out on a trek was amazing!!We also had some fun once we were comfortable and we rode without hands! However, this is only done if you're feeling confident ;-)I cannot recommend Caballos A La Par more! My friends and I are now going to go on a regular basis

A great experience. The people are very friendly and as it was my first time, Adrian and Miriam made sure i was comfortable. Adrian very meticulously explained all the details of horse riding, after which I started trotting in the beginning to cantering in just 30 minutes in beautiful back drop and meadows. All the while, Miriam giving tips, suggestions and helping out. It was a great experience that I have thoroughly enjoyed and would recommend first timers and experienced people to check this place out.

Do not miss your pick up with Adrian. This review has nothing to do with the skills and experience that both Miriam and Adrian bring to the party, but what happened to me a few hours ago when somehow Adrian and I missed our scheduled pickup at the appointed place. Since I had done this before I knew were to go, and what time, so at precisely 8:55 am I was at Playa del Carmen, and sat at the base of a tree to wait for Adrian. Half an hour went by. I had forgotten my cell phone, it happens, so I figured maybe something had come up or we missed connections. I was not mad, just curious. By the time I returned to the hostel Miriam had called, and then Adrian and I got on the phone. Then the fun started. What followed was one of the funniest and most frustrating conversations I have ever had with anyone, anywhere, especially internationally.Adriane effectively spent about twenty minutes telling me the same story over and over, about how he was RIGHT THERE AT THE RESTAURANT, HOW COULD YOU MISS ME, WITH A BUNCH OF TOURISTS, DRINKING MATE, the clear implication being that I must not have been. I said over and over that I was not angry, it was clearly a simple mistake, not a problem calm down, can we move on. I got the same story at higher pitch which when repeated so many times made it clear that he was angry at me for breaking their perfect record of never missing a tourist before, messing up their morning because they couldnt book anyone else (I had booked this time almost a month earlier) and there was lost income (the 150 bucks was right in my wallet for them). It was very, very clear that this was more about making the customer the bad guy rather than simply saying hey, we missed each other, sorry, maybe another time.Now you have to understand that three Brits were privy to my end of the conversation while this was going on and there were times I was holding my sides when Adrian launched back into the story about the bus and the tourists and the mate and they were in hysterics, because I kept saying its in the past, it doesnt matter, I am not angry, this is not important. But to Adrian it seemed very important to be right, he was there, I was not, I was wrong. As a long time management consultant, an author of a book on language and leadership and how we wield our words with customers, clients and employees, this conversation was a perfect study on how to kill a relationship. In my third book Exchange I talk about opiates, or compulsions, and one of the worst is the need to be right at all costs. You simply cannot browbeat a paying customer who is not angry in the first place and make them the bad guy for ruining your day, your perfect record, or whatever else you are upset about. Mistakes happen, and we all make them, and a little graciousness can earn a loyal customer for life. But when you go after your customer like Adrian did with me today, it totally sours the experience for me and its going to end up on a travel blog. This is a very transparent environment we all live in, and when I mess up as a professional, people are going to write about it. I cannot afford that and neither can anyone who is in the customer service business. Your ego simply has to sit down, and courtesy must come first. When I was finally able to get Adrian to calm down enough so that we could agree that nothing could be done, that that was that, and we could end this meat grinder of a phone call, I hung up and literally slid off the couch onto the floor laughing. The Brits cracked up with me. This story is going into my third book as a classic. I can thank Adrian for that much. I gave Miriam five stars in an earlier review because I very much appreciated working with her, her skills, and her operation. As far as those things are concerned, this is a good concession. But you had better not anger Adrian because he will take it out on you. That is fair warning. An as far as I am concerned, thats a bad business practice. Terrible.

A great way to spend the day out of the city. I had a lovely day with Adrian and friends and would recommend this trip to anyone who appreciates the outdoors and the countryside. You don't have to be an expert rider as Adrian carefully explains everything from start to finish. His passion and enthusiasm shines through and is reflected in his teaching. The horses are well kept and easy to ride and the hospitality and facilities are excellent. Beginners to advanced level - you won't be disappointed!

Marvellous time to be remembered. After pick-up in the city and chatting in the newly built ranch the tour through argentinean forests began. The personal activity with Adrian (the trainer) was helpful, energetic and encouraging during all the time. Couldn't have experienced anything better. Isabel and Lindo (tho both horses I was riding) were just as perfect: calm and sensible. You find in this place everything, that enriches your stay: starting with drinks and sweets, toilets and washrooms, equipment for riding like hats and chaps and a very warm team that makes you feel immediately like a member of their family. If I get the chance, I will go there anytime again and advice anybody to do so.

Una experiencia inolvidable!. I reserved a full-day cabalgata as a birthday gift for my girlfriend without knowing what to expect. It turned out to be a hell of present for both of us. We rode solid, well-trained horses through a range of beautiful backdrops, including trails, meadows, wooded areas and sawgrass 10 feet high. Through it all we received a constant stream of friendly but necessary instructions from Adrian, who accompanied us on our journey. My girlfriend and I are complete amateurs, having only ridden a few times each. But this did not stop us from enjoying ourselves immensely while picking up some great lessons in horseback riding. By the end of the day, we were trotting, galloping and developing a good chemistry with our mounts. Overall, Adrian and Miriam were wonderful hosts. Before the ride, they made us coffee and chatted with us in English and Spanish about the park, the history of it and how they went into business together. Afterwards, we shared a bottle of beer and told war stories about the day. We got some great photos and videos out of the experience and are looking forward to doing it again in the not too distant future. I highly recommend Caballos a la Par for any rider of any age or skill level. It's a great way to spend a memorable day with good people, while picking up some valuable equestrian skills in the process. It's also just a short jaunt away from the concrete jungle of Buenos Aires, making it an idea weekend escape.

Authentic Experience outside the city!. I went to Caballos a la par last week during a day off from a business trip to Buenos Aires based on a strong recommendation of my boyfriend who had been there about a year prior (based on the tripadvisor ranking!). I was deciding btwn spending the day in Tigre, Colonia or riding... I chose to have more of an experience than sightseeing by spending the day taking a lesson with Miriam, and I have to say it was incredible!! I am not an experienced rider, but they have horses and patience to accommodate any level of experience. The lessons are 1 on 1, and they are real lessons...this isn't a boring walk in the park like some horse excursions when you're on vacation (unless you want it to be). I definitely will be back, and I'm recommending it to anyone I hear who visits the city... you won't regret the experience or meeting Adrian and Miriam.-Laura from London / New York

Horse riding near BA. This was one of my favourite days in BA. The teachers were great, the horses and so well trained and amazing. I never thought I would be able to improve my riding skills in such s short space of time. I highly recommend this riding school to anyone that likes horses as the teachers can adapt their coaching skills to any level. It's a must when visiting BA. They have built a riding school and I want to go back for a holiday and stay on the farm a couple of days. Thanks again for the great day :)

My unforgettable riding experience in Argentina. Caballos A La Par, Buenos Aires ArgentinaMy best friend took me horseback riding to this amazing place, that is located just 30 minutes away from Buenos Aires, located in a forest that has one of the most wonderful biodiversity in the entire Buenos Aires. I just have been riding a couple of times in my life, and I can tell that here, for the first time, my instructor Miriam show me even how to run and gallop! What a wonderful experience I had, a feeling anyone should experience. The place is beautiful, he horses are so friendly, the equipment they have were developed by the owners so is a unique experience and security. I strongly recommend any person who loves horses and nature, to visit this place, it has it all!

Best part of our trip to Buenos Aires. This is long over due. Caballos A La Par was the best part of a trip my husband and I took to Buenos Aires last year. We are not horseback riders :) But we certainly thought we were after a day with Miriam. It was truly amazing what we could do in only a few hours of riding! That was my husbands favorite part. Mine was talking to and getting to know Miriam and Adrian. They are such warm and interesting characters with fascinating stories of what led to the creation of Caballos A La Par. I've shared their stories with many people. And Everyone is moved by them! So much so that my friend and neighbor here in LA also went to meet them and ride horses. She had the same wonderful experience and now She's sharing their stories! Thank you so much M&A. I hope life is good to you both and business is getting better and better.

Magical horseriding experience in Buenos Aires - a Must Go!!. Amazing experience! If you love horses, love to ride or would like to learn in a relaxed and peaceful environment, this is the place to go!!I was looking for a place to go horseriding Argentina style during a short stay in Buenos Aires. I discovered Caballos A La Par on the web... all excellent feedbacks on TripAdvisor are true! All horses are in very good shape, you can tell they are very well looked after. I had the chance to ride Indio (see pictures), a wonderful criollo horse, we got along very well! After giving me a ride from DownTown Buenos Aires, Adrian and Miriam warmly welcomed me in their training center with a good Mate and pastries, and two horses were settled and waiting for us. I had a wonderful ride in the National Park with Adrian, who gently taught me how to ride Argentina style. We had a lot of fun galloping and racing in this incredible landscape, Adrian puts a lot of thought in choosing the best horse for his guests, and personalizing the experience! To date, best horseriding experience ever ;)

First class. Last weekend I had my first class of horseback riding at Caballos a la Par close to Buenos Aires. I arrived without any knowledge and ended up cantering after two hours of practicing. I never thought I would be able to do that! It's indeed an excellent place for beginners as well as for advanced riders. The trainers dedicate quality time to small groups of people and even offer single training. The horses are very well taken care of and part of the family. The atmosphere is very friendly and you immediately feel like a part of the family too. All in all, a great place which I can warmly recommend!

The real thing!. We currently live in Buenos Aires and we were looking for somewhere for our 9 year old daughter to both experience and learn horse-riding. Nothing we have come across compares to Caballos A La Par. The location is simply stunning, the concept of horse-riding is unique and after a few lessons, we have no doubt that our daughter hasn't simply found her passion, but she's living out her ultimate dream! She rides in the vast surrounds and parks alongside the very experienced, friendly and motivated Miriam. Adrian, who is extremely passionate about horse-riding is also on hand to offer expert advice and support.Visiting Caballos A La Par is also a great day out for the family and our younger son loves spending time at the ranch with the other animals.Our daughter has come a long way over the last few months and we have no doubt she will continue to excel under that watchful eye of Miriam and Adrian.Simply put, this is the real thing and no other horse back riding experience in Argentina comes close to what is on offer at Caballos A La Par.

One of the best things we did in Argentina. This was by far one of the best things we did during our visit to Argentina. Neither my fiancee or I had ever rode a horse before, and our instructor, Miriam, was able to get us from saddling up to a full gallop in a single afternoon.While the horse riding was exhilarating, and the park was beautiful, it was really the hospitality we received while visiting their ranch that made this a great experience. You will not regret spending the day here, and you'll walk away feeling like you've just visited old friends.

A must do while in Buenos Aires!. I can't speak highly enough about the experience my daughter and I had at Caballos A La Par! Arranging the service required nothing more than a simple email and quick response from Miriam. We literally contacted her the day before and she was able to accommodate us. After meeting at the arranged pick up location and about a 30 minute ride to their lovely brand new facilities, we were what seemed like a world away from the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires. The serene surroundings, fresh air and slower pace were just what we were looking for after 7 days in the big city. Adrian started us off right with all the appropriate gear and a traditional Mate tea and we were ready to saddle up. After having ridden in various ranches in the U.S. and Mexico as well as a couple places in Costa Rica and Puerto Rico and sometimes having witnessed mistreated, not well cared for horses in some poor living conditions, we were both very glad to see fat and happy animals and amazingly clean facilities. They were beautiful and very well trained horses. My 14 year old daughter, who has ridden less than a dozen times in her entire life was soon galloping and in complete control of her pretty pinto Isabel. We really had an amazingly wonderful experience that was designed just for us. We learned a tremendous amount from Adrian and felt we had every liberty to explore all that we wanted and to really take our time and enjoy ourselves.  At the end, after we had galloped all about, including with NO HANDS (a first for both of us!) we put the sun to bed by volunteering to help wash the horses and put them in their stalls for the night. That's when my daughter spotted the adorable, very playful kitten and was trying to devise a plan to take her home with us. Thankfully she was persuaded to leave the kitten with the promise of a submarino (Argentinian hot chocolate) and some delicious sweets. It was a lovely way to end the evening.  We were only in Buenos Aires for 9 days and we fit in a lot. We saw many historical sites, explored 7 barrios, watched a soccer match, went shopping in all the best spots, took tango lessons, attended 2 theatrical productions, took the ferry to Uruguay, and hit as many of the best restaurants, cafes and street fairs as we could, and without a doubt one of the best memories we have from our trip is going to Caballos A La Par. We had a really fantastic time! This is a must do activity if you are in Buenos Aires. It was highly personalized, authentic and worth every penny!

Just wonderful!. I recommend going to Caballos a la Par because you will experience riding a horse in a nice park. I have never ridden a horse before in my life, and Adrian thought me how to do it in one hour. He is very experienced and his horses are very well trained. I very much liked the entire procedure of the visit. First we drank some mate and Adrian and Miriam were making a profile of us in order to find an appropriate horse. I found it very esoteric. I got this beautiful horse Isabel (with one blue and one brown eye). Even though it was the first time for me to ride I could already do cantering without holding the reins. :) Also, Adrian was taking photos and videos of us the entire time which resulted in many nice photos marking our wonderful experience. I recommend you enjoy Buenos Aires through this activity as well.

Don’t leave Buenos Aires without GOING horseback riding with Caballos A La Par!. This was without a doubt our most memorable experience in Argentina. We are intermediate riders and go riding everywhere we go on vacation. We have never found a place where the horses were so well-trained and responsive and where the ride is so tailored to your skills and wishes. Caballos A La Par is located only 30 minutes away from Buenos Aires, the park you ride in is stunning. Adrian and Miriam are wonderful hosts and make you feel like you are spending the day with friends. During the ride they offer useful tips and instruction to improve your riding which makes the activity even more enjoyable. When we arrived we met the people that took a riding lesson in the morning. They did not have any experience and yet all of them ended the ride cantering. This is a must-do if you want to ride a horse, no matter your level of experience. After our ride we had hot chocolate and the best pastries ever. It was the perfect way to finish an amazing day. Next time we visit Buenos Aires we will come back for sure!

Off the beaten track. I'd been on horseriding day trips in several other countries, but found my day out at Caballos A La Par to be something else. Miriam takes time to get to know you to find just the right horse. There are horses to suit any rider: both beginners and experienced riders will feel comfortable and still enjoy the challenge really good horses can offer. The horses are extremely well looked after and seem to enjoy the ride every bit as much as the riders do. The ride takes you through some of the most wonderful scenery to be seen from horseback. A wonderful way to relax and completely unwind from the hustle and bustle of the big city: traveling at a different pace both with your body and your mind.

Great!. I strongly recommend Caballos A La Par to experience personalized horseback riding activities. I went to Buenos Aires mainly to dance tango, but I also wanted to do sightseeing. A friend had visited Caballos A La Par a few years ago recommended them to me. I'm so glad I went. It turned out that this was THE highlight of my trip!The registration process was quick and easy from their website and some emails to follow up. Adrian picked me up in Buenos Aires to drive to their location (30 minutes away by car). Miriam and Adrian were friendly and attentive to make my visit very pleasant. It was my first time on a horse, but, after 45 minutes in, I was cantering on a horse! I said "personalized," because they do not mix visitors, so you will have their welcoming hospitality to yourself and your group (family, couple, friends). I traveled alone, so I received a one-on-one lesson from Miriam. She was a great teacher!If you don't speak Spanish, don't worry. They are fluent English speakers. Put jeans and closed shoes on and take US dollar cash. Then you are on your way to have a great experience at Caballos A La Par.

Looking for a great experience?. You have come to the right place! At Caballos a La Par you will feel welcome and comfortable. Together with Miriam and Adrian you will have an awesome horseback trip with all the right guidance you need to become a good rider. Are you fed up with the city tempo and the traffic? You have to come out to ride and enjoy the park, the horses and the company. So far we have been out riding twice and we will continue to come as much as we can.Highly recommended!

Awesome!. This ranch caters for all levels, beginners will be cantering be the end for the lesson and feel completely comfortable doing so whilst those that already know how to ride will still learn new tricks! Adrian really takes the time to get to know the rider before the class and will match you with a horse to suit you level. All of the horses are fantastic, very well trained and extremely well cared for! This ranch is an absolute gem. If you go you'll have an amazing time! just remember your mozzie spray! Oh and you'll finish your class with the classic 'submarino + facturas!'!

Brilliant. My wife and I had an absolutely brilliant morning with Adrian at Caballos A La Par. Adrian and Miriam made us feel so welcome and the scenery was absolutely spectacular. The fact that pickup and drop off from our hotel was included was also very welcomed.I had very little experience riding horses, having only ever done one trail ride previously. This was nothing like that. Adrian was essentially a private horse riding tutor for much of the activity, which was absolutely brilliant. On a normal trail ride, felt like I was just a passenger on top of the horse, but here I actually gained the confidence to feel in control of the horse which was an unbelievable experience. Adrian also doubled as our private photographer for the whole experience which has resulted in some fantastic photos and videos to help us remember such a fantastic day.

Caballos A la Par. Really enjoyed this place! Adrian is a fantastic instructor and he genuinely takes the time to get to know the riders before starting the instruction and pairing them up with a horse. If you are in the B.A. area and are looking for a great ride along with some instruction and less of the packaged "guacho" experience, this is definitely the place. The surroundings where you ride are fantastic as well and definitely provide a unique experience. I can honestly say this was the highlight of my trip to B.A.

Brilliant horseback riding experience!. This is an amazing opportunity to ride gaucho-style, very close to Buenos Aires, in a beautiful park. I have experience riding in the English style, but I have to admit, this was WAY more fun! Two of my friends, who had never ridden a horse before and I mean NEVER, were cantering side-by-side through the park within 2 hours of setting out. Absolutely amazing!Adrian picked us up in the city and drove us to the ranch, where he and Miriam, and two adorable dogs, welcomed us warmly with cheesy biscuits and a round of maté. We were then introduced to the horses that were chosen to take us around and teach my friends how to ride. Adrian is an excellent teacher! He got both my friends to trot and canter in no time at all. They went from total newbies to confident riders in just a few hours.The horses themselves are also fantastic. I rode two, Indio and Bandida, during the course of our trip and they both have a beautiful gait. Even if you are a total beginner, like my friends, Caballos a La Par is an amazing experience. The groups are small -they will even take you out on your own rather than mix groups- which sets them apart from more touristy and less personal horseback riding trips elsewhere. After we got back famished, Adrian provided us with wonderful empanadas too!It may be pricey, but it was worth every peso to me!

An Unforgettable Expereince. When we look back on our four months in Buenos Aires, riding out with Adrian and Miriam will feature as one of our most memorable experiences. Fortunately, we do not have to be content with just one day of riding out with Caballos a la Par as we have just booked another three sessions over the coming few weeks. Adrian and Miriam’s method of teaching is totally different to any riding experience we have had in the past; their style is relaxed and easy going but at the same time constantly attentive to helping you improve your riding skills. By the end of our cabalgata, my three children (aged 13, 11 and 8) were cantering steadily ahead of us, totally in control and free. The horses are gentle, very well trained and responsive and in excellent condition. Miriam and Adrian made our trip out to them so easy; they picked us up in central BA and dropped us back in the afternoon. They fed and watered us beautifully with delicious treats from the local town before and after our ride. We would recommend Caballos a la Par to anyone who would like to experience riding in Argentina.

Amazing horseback riding lesson in Buenos Aires!. I can only say that if you want to learn to how to ride a horse, go to Caballos A La Par. It is close to Buenos Aires and they arrange transportation. The riding lesson was fantastic. Even after reading the reviews I never expected to be able to do so much in just one lesson. The feeling of controlling the horse and not just being a passenger is the best. I will definitely be back!
Really good horse riding clases. I you wanna learn how to ride a horse, than this is the place to be. Really friendly people, good horses and they know how to teach. I really recommend this place.

Looking for horse play?. These guys rock! They're very friendly and easy to talk to. The horses are in great condition and the park for riding is amazing (especially considering how close it was to B.A. ). Miriam taught me to saddle the horse, how to walk, trot and gallop. Her instruction was superb. At any point where something didn't feel quite right, she immediately had the solution before I asked. When it felt good, she immediately praised me. I feel I learned about a year of horsemanship in a day and enjoyed it immensely. Thanks callalos a la par!

Personal favorite, best ride ever!. We had an amazing ride with Mariam and Adrian from Caballos A La Par! Really special and a highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. I'm a below average rider and they really worked with me to develop my skills and confidence and it really payed off. Comfortable, gentle horses who really have some great trails. The horses really are fantastic - not scared of people, but not bored by doing the same trail every day. These horses really enjoyed us and exploring new trails in the park. The hosts were gracious and patient with me, being a novice and really great for my girlfriend who was more experienced. Thanks for the great time!

Always a wonderful experience. I was visiting Buenos Aires again after being gone for eight months. On my to do list were a couple of things. One thing was going horseback riding at Caballos a la Par. I lived in Buenos Aires for three years and was a regular customer back then. The biggest surprise was that they had moved to a great new place. The horses were wondering around outside feeling happy and looking well taken care of, the stables big and clean. There are also two dogs that have a doghouse painted in the same colors as the stables. Such a fun detail. Sadly it was to cold to have a swim in the pool. Otherwise I would have done that too.When I arrived we first began with drinking mate with some nice snacks. I was riding on a beautiful horse Bandida that I hadn't ridden before. She was so cute. We were riding through the park for more than two hours and I learned a lot again. The park was beautiful with autumn colors.When we returned to the stables we had something to drink and eat and a nice chat. It feels like visiting friends and it is always hard to leave. But I know I will return again. Thanks again Miriam and Adrian for a perfect day.

Amazing experience…a must-do!. How often can you say that you had incredible fun, developed new skills, enjoyed the beauty of the countryside, and made great family memories…all at once! Well, this was our experience with Adrian and Miriam—a true highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. The day was universally loved by all four of us (parents plus two kids). We had ridden horses before, but we learned more about horseback riding in a few hours than we had in all previous experiences combined. Within an hour we all learned to canter…comfortably. One of our lasting memories will be riding together, side by side, charging across scenic fields of tall grasses and wooded horizons. It felt like a movie scene!And we can’t say enough about Adrian and Miriam’s hospitality. From the moment we arrived, we felt we were among friends. Their love and passion for what they do shines through, and it’s contagious. The coaching and instruction were terrific…and adapted to all ages and experience levels. When we return to Argentina (or make suggestions for friends who travel there), Caballos a la Par will be at the top of our “must-do” list!

Brilliant company, excellent horses and lovely surroundings. This is the absolute best way of seeing a part of Argentina!We where picked up at our address in La Plata by lovely Miriam and headed to the stables, sitting down with coffee, mate and pasqua cake! Outside we could see three sweet horses waiting for us. After talking about everything and nothing, we went out and got to know our new friends. During our ride we got excellent teaching, felt really secure and where cantering like we where kids again! We had a great time and will certainly come back again. Thanks Miriam and Caballos A La Par for making our first month in Argentina a month to remember :)/Mia and Andreas

Wow! What a amazing way to spend a day in Buenos Aires!. Wow! What a amazing way to spend a day in Buenos Aires! I hadn't ridden a horse in almost 20 years. Miriam was wonderful! We spent time chatting and sharing mate to determine what would my make my ride most enjoyable. She listened and was able to determine the prefect horse for my riding ability. The horses are well cared for...once you get to the estancia, you can tell, they are truly loved. Then we hit the trails. In no time, Miriam had me riding as if I had just ridden yesterday. I can't wait to find another excuse to get to BA for another ride.Thank you for adding another wonderful day to my Buenos Aires trip.

A horse riding experience to remember!!. This was just such an amazing experience from the complimentary pick up from Buenos Aires, on time and as arranged; to the warm welcome on arrival complete with mate and sweet biscuits; to being matched to the appropriate horses all saddled up and ready for action to the teaching and riding until the coffee and pastries on return to base and back home to the city. Adrian and Miriam were so warm and friendly but worked us hard too. We really felt they trusted us and got the most from us. We really trusted them and the horses. After two and a half hours all four (two teenagers and their parents) in our party were walking and cantering and feeling in control. It was the best, most exhilarating and memorable experience ever. Would totally totally recommend it.

Fresh air and great company!. Beautiful day of riding horses and enjoying the countryside. Adrian is a great instructor and his horses are very well trained. Miriam is kind and quick to communicate. It was a perfect day away from the city and I highly recommend!

More than Expected. Thanks to Adrian and Miriam for an excellant afternoon of riding through the National Park. They were very careful to make our riding a fun and memorable experience.We spent time with them around their kitchen table like old friends talking and sharing mate together. We look forward to a return trip to Buenos Aires including another afternoon with them on the ranch. We never expected such an intimate atmosphere with them and their horses. Thanks again.Ross and Menerva from the USA

Unique!. This was just such a great, unique and awesome experience! Adrian and Miriam are awesome people and great at what they do. It felt like we were visiting friends. Adrian is an excellent instructor, we didn't have experience with horses and he teached us the basics, and guided us. We felt so confident after a while, and were cantering and enjoying the ride, side by side, not following a trail. Going thru a Beautiful area, getting to know the fauna. As we got back to the ranch we sat down and enjoyed more time with Adrian and Miriam, talking about Argentina. We hope to see them again!

Different experience!. Riding horses outside Buenos Aires was really a fantastic experience! Miriam and Adrian are very friendly and gave us a lot of instructions about the riding. The horses are in very good shape and the enviroment where we were riding was also great. The whole idea about caballos-a-la-par is that you dont ride one after another. We could ride beside each other and decide ourselves where to go with some help from Adrian. He also took some great photos of us riding! You can tell that Miriam and Adrian are both experienced and serious with the horses and at the same time they really want you to get something special.You can get all this only about 1/2 hour outside the city center, thats fantastic!

A Truly Fantastic Experience. We were in Buenos Aires in late January/early February for a week's holiday. We had seen a lot of the city over the first few days. A friend of mine was joining us for the weekend and my wife suggested that we go horse riding. I was a little hesitant at first but it seemed like a good idea to get out and see the countryside. We were picked up at our hotel and brought out to the lovely new stables that Miriam and Adrian have built out close to the National Park. When we arrived Adrian and Miriam made us feel very welcome. We sat and chatted and had Mate together which was a nice experience. They used this opportunity to determine our various levels of experience. After that it was straight down to business.The three of us went out to the National Park (which was a stunning area in it's own right) with Adrian. All of us have differing levels of experience ranging from absolute beginner to one of us who had quite a lot of historical experience. Adrian was a brilliant instructor and spent time individually with all three of us while also keeping an eye on us as a group. He has a very good method of teaching and all the horses were exceptionally well trained. I had not been on a horse in about 15 years but by the end of the lesson Adrian had us all cantering with no hands. It sounds like an exaggeration but by the end of the lesson all of us found ourselves wishing that the lesson would not end.I can unreservedly recommend this as a fantastic activity to do if you are in Buenos Aires. If we had been staying longer I certainly would have gone back again but unfortunately we were leaving very shortly afterwards. Adrian and Miriam are really lovely people who are very passionate about what they are doing. They have a great facility and their horses are well looked after. All I can say is try it out for yourselves - you won't be disappointed. It was one of the best holiday experiences I have had.

Beyond expectation!. I signed up to Caballos A La Par with the most minimal of experience - literally sitting on a horse that followed its peers along a beach in Morocco. Very nice, but probably something that anyone was capable of.From my initial emails with Miriam, the lovely and sympathetic co-owner from the Netherlands, I knew I was in good hands. Adrian, the founder and other co-owner, was welcoming but very clear that this was, while a fun activity, I would get out of it what I put in. "Prepare to work hard" he advised me, and suggested I would be "cantering with no hands" within a couple of hours.Of course I laughed at this, but after an intro mate session, an introduction to the horses, Isabelle and Indio, getting saddled up, off i went with Miriam into the most stunning national park surroundings.We had a lovely relaxed time, good conversation, and I was soon put at ease enough to, with strict direction and continual support, indeed get to the stage where I was cantering with no hands! I had a fantastic day, and will be going back for lesson number 2 upon my return to BA!Not the cheapest activity, if you are on a very tight budget, but excellent value, in my opinion.

Wonderful Horseback Riding Experience. I spent two wonderful days riding at Caballos A La Par. Pickup and transportation to the "ranch" were provided. I was greeted by the resident labs and the most gracious co-owner Miriam. We began with a brief discussion of my riding experience and then were off on a 2-1/2 hour ride. Most of my riding experience is the standard walk/trot one horse following the next. Miriam immediately instructed me to ride as their name states: "SIDE-BY-SIDE". The ride is in a beautiful park setting with varying terrain which allows for different "speeds" based on your ability and desires. Miriam's supportive instruction helped me increase my ability the first day, and I moved up two levels by my second day to a "quarter" horse, which was spectacular. I only wish I lived in BA and could enjoy this special experience more often. If you like to ride or want to learn, this is the only place to consider. Kudos to Miriam and her staff!

Excellent tuition and hospitality. Our day with Adrian and Miriam was so wonderful, our only regret was that we were flying out the next day and couldn't stay for longer. I had little (and quite scary experience) riding before, and was very nervous at the start, but Adrian's instructions were so clear and encouraging that by the end of the afternoon I was cantering with no hands. What an exhilarating experience! In addition to the fantastic lesson and the beautiful surroundings, the hospitality was great. We felt welcomed from the first moment, with chats over mate and snacks, to the last, with a refreshing dip in the pool before leaving. We couldn't have asked for more!Adrian and Miriam are lovely hosts, whose passion for what they do is evident in the quality of their care for their guests, and their beautiful animals.Can't wait until I can come back!

Fantastic experience. I was in Buenos Aires for work and only had one day off for fun. I couldn't have spent it any better! I started riding horses relatively recently and I was a little nervous about riding so far from home. From the moment I arrived, Miriam and Adrian made me feel at ease. After a quick bit of instruction, I was off riding in the wide open countryside with Miriam. I've done just a bit of trotting in a ring back home, but Miriam had me cantering comfortably. I keep watching the video she took to remind myself that I actually did it. The day was an amazing experience, one that I treasure, one that I would highly recommend--and one I hope to repeat in the future!!!

Fun day of riding!!. My husband and I have been on riding holidays at several guest ranches in the past and have received instruction at each of them. We improved more in a few hours with Adrian than all the others combined... and loved every minute of it !! The horses were beautiful and well trained and care was taken to perfectly match horse to rider. Miriam and Adrian made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived and even invited us to share a delicious lunch of empanadas after the ride. I can't wait to come back and visit Caballos A La Par again !!

Gaucho Style. We had a fantastically "different" riding experience with Adrian near Buenos Aires. This was not your average trip of being plonked on a hourse and following a well worn route. From the mate and snacks on arrival to the drinks and dip in the pool after the riding, we were looked after and made to feel welcome. The riding itself was a constructive lesson catering to our needs. We trotted and cantered through a beautiful park and were given instructions on how to improve our riding at every stage. This was not just a jaunt in the forest but a taylor made lesson which was both exhausting and fun. I would recommend this experience to anyone from complete beginners to people who want to improve their riding skill with an instructor who wants you to enjoy yourself but also takes a genuine interest in improving your riding ability.I would have gone back the next day if I hadn't already booked my flight!

Perfection!. This was without question the highlight of my trip to Argentina! Miriam and Adrian are exceptional hosts and take extraordinarily great care of their horses and facilities. For anyone who is seeking a true horseback riding experience in the Argentine country, this is the place to visit. My sister and I were looking to spend a lot of time riding and decided on Caballos a la Par after reading many positive reviews. We were delighted to find that the experience vastly exceeded our expectations. Miriam and Adrian are extremely passionate about what they do and their positive energy is intoxicating (even the horses are ecstatic!). We were carefully watched and instructed on form and technique so that within the two hours of riding I could feel myself swiftly improving. It was awesome! And we got to see pictures and video of our performance to prove that we had come a long way in a short time. After returning to the stables, we were happy to learn how to remove the bridles and saddles and help with cleaning the horses. It was a pleasure to be a part of the entire process from start to finish. Miriam and Adrian are pros at what they do. The fee for spending a day at Caballos is a small price to pay for a life-altering experience. I cannot wait to return to see my friends!

Warning: Once you go, you won't want to leave!. My sister and I recently visited Caballos A La Par on a whim during a 9-day vacation in Buenos Aires. We really wanted to go horseback riding and had difficulty finding a facility that actually let you ride for hours in the countryside. We easily booked a day of riding with Miriam, the lovely Dutch co-owner of La Par, via the internet. She was really easy to work with, prompt, and spoke/wrote perfect English. She arranged for a driver to pick us up in the city and we rode a quick 30 minutes to the countryside. Upon our arrival, co-owner Adrian was waiting for us with a big smile and tons of energy. We were treated to some mate and an explanation of what the day would entail. We met all of the horses (and they have so many beautiful horses), suited up in half chaps and helmets and let Adrian lead the way. Mind you -- my sister and I ride horses once a year while on vacation and aren't the most seasoned riders. However, Adrian is an incredible teacher...patient and encouraging...and we finished the day having trotted and cantered (hands free) with huge smiles on our faces. The park we rode through was enormous with beautiful views in every direction. Our instructor spoke perfect English and his passion for horses and teaching was evident. We finished happily tired from a long day of riding and proud of our accomplishments. A dip in the pool with a view of the sunset and some more mate and conversation was enough to inspire us to book another day later in the week. Our second round on horseback was much like the first, however, this time we were able to ride with the lovely Miriam as well. It was really hard for us to leave because they made us feel so much at home and we love to ride. The atmosphere is stunning....I can't gush enough about the experience and we can't wait to return!Note: No need to exchange your money -- they accept USD!

I learned to canter in one day!!. My horseback adventures were pretty scattered and diverse; mixed in with camels in Egypt, Morrocco and India, as well as burros in the Grand Canyon but my defining moment came here as Miriam trained me on how to really canter a horse, and I could let my horse truly run in the 24,000 acre preserve. What a thrill this was for me and I learned so much during this ride, surpassing all those trail rides that had come before it. The country, the beautifully tended horses, and the loving care we received from Adrian and Miriam idefined ths as one of my peak experiences. Travel is an adventure of the soul and this experience is the best definition of travel I can name.

Highlight of the holiday!. Adrian and Miriam were brilliant and the perfect hosts, horse riding with caballos a la par really was a highlight of our holiday. We wished we had more time to go back again! The horses are happy and healthy and great teachers, as are Adrian and Miriam who provide instruction throughout your ride through beautiful scenery! We really learnt a lot about riding, and never felt the horses were just following a routine, which adds so much to a beautiful and safe experience! Very easy to organise with included transport to and from Buenos Aires. We are so glad to have been & recommend it as the perfect outdoor escape from bustling Buenos Aires.

Amazing riding experience in the countryside!. I have to agree with all the great reviews, Caballos A La Par was the best riding experience I have encountered in my travels! Since I am travelling solo, it was so wonderful to be greeted warmly and welcomed into Adrian and Miriam's home, meeting their beautiful children and sharing mate tea while learning about its tradition. It was fun chatting about life in Argentina, getting a perspective beyond what is normally encountered in my travels. Adrian provided excellent instruction, providing constant but gentle reminders on posture, how to hold the reins and guide my horse Isabel during the ride. Soon enough we were cantering without holding the reins, and it was the most comfortable ride I've had in many years, using very comfortable saddles designed by Adrian. After the ride, I enjoyed empanadas and beer before cooling off with a quick dip in their new pool with jacuzzi. A very fun outing and a welcome relief from e big city of Buenos Aires!

No words to describe what a beautiful,unique and just wonderful day and experience.. It's not often that I find myself lost for words but it really is hard to find the right words with enough substance to describe this wonderful experience which was so genuine, unique and so different to what you see elsewhere.A combined wonderful riding experience with such a feel of belonging in company with people you have just met. Just beautiful...Adrian and Miriam's vision of this place goes beoynd what you'd expect and the whole feel is just out of any ordinary experience. To feel an instant part of the family( and with family I mean everyone is included: horses, dogs,cat, stable man etc.) this is what life's about and I sincerely thank you all for being you and making your vision a reality. Although the three of us had totally different riding experience Adrian managed to make us all feel so comfortable and show each of us ways to get the very best and much more out of this riding experience.( we could have stayed for weeks and done it all over again) and I would not hesitate, should the opportunity arise,to make the trip from Austarlia to Argentina again just to be able to visit Caballos A La Par again.

Happy gauchos!. Amongst many great activities available in BA, this is the best one! We went from complete novices to cantering with no hands in one lesson. Adrian and Miriam are fantastic teachers and superb hosts. We were made to feel at home and comfortable. Adrian knew we wanted to learn to ride in one lesson and so tailored the class to our needs. We definitely "rode" the horses, instead of just sitting on a horse and it following the leader. We worked the whole time doing exercises and riding through gorgeous bush - so a great focus on skill development in a lovely setting. Also, they only take very small groups of people who know each other, so you are guaranteed individual attention. Then we jumped in their new pool to cool off and shared some empanadas and beer. Best day in BA yet!

Great day!. We picked Caballos A La Par from the wonderful reviews we read on tripadvisor....and we feel so lucky that we did! Miriam picked us up (my husband, our 24 year old daughter,our 21 year old son and myself) and dropped us off at our hotel due to a miss communication on my part and drove us out to the countryside....the ride out was fun...laughs and comfortable! We were greeted by Adrian and a warm welcome as we enjoyed mate together and were taught all the rules and regulations of drinking mate...quites a few laughs! The horses were beautiful and well behaved and well kept. You could tell that Adriana and Miriam love the horses and what they do! My husband who says he never felt comfortable on a horse, even though we had ridden horses on other vacations, said he felt so good riding...Adrian gave him the tools to allow him to feel confident and comfortable! WOW!!! And after our terrific ride we were surprised by delicious pastries that we all shared together! Such a warm and inviting atmosphere! Great day!!! We loved it!

Horse riding. Getting there: Transport was easily arranged with a car fetching me from the city out to the park. About an hours drive from the cityExperience: Adrian and Miriam recently moved onto their new grounds which was about to be completed when I was there. They place a lot of effort into ensuring the riders and horses are well taken care of. I was treated to pastries and a traditional Argentinian drink, Mate.The horse riding experience was extremely enjoyable. The park grounds were in full bloom and weather was perfect (cool and cloudy). My horse was extremely well trained, both responsive and obedient.I would highly recommend anyone who is interested in horse riding (or trying out horse riding) to drop Caballos A La Par an email and have an enjoyable trip!

wonderfull experience. Adrian and Miriam are wonderfull people, who are your friends in the very first minutes.After some smalltalk the riding began, but without rush or hectic!It was my first time riding a big horse and after the first forty minutes the fear vanished through Miriam's very lovely way of teaching. Alltough she is pushing you further and further to have a great riding experience.She said she could also ride with the people slowly, but if you want to lern to ride a horse you need to get pushed!The way she teached me hit the spot!I had a gread day in nature with new friends!I think I will return!

Excellent horse riding lessons in Buenos Aires.. EXCELLENT Horse Riding! I am so pleased I choose to ride with Caballos A La Par. Not only do they pick you up from the city centre and take you out of the city smoke into the countryside, they provide an warm welcome and the chance to try a traditional Argentinian drink. The scenery is superb and the horses are well loved and looked after. Adrian is an excellent teacher and makes you feel relaxed and gives you the confidence and technique to improve you riding. I am looking forward to my next lesson:-)

A year later..... So – our heroine (me!) was last at Caballos A La Par a year ago and was so impressed with how well she did – even though she hated horses and riding! Her husband (the villain) arranged an overnight stay in Buenos Aires during a flight to Santiago solely to be able to ride and see Adrian and Mariam again. Our heroine was not pleased. But!!! I loved it. I can now finally say that I enjoyed riding and horses. Adrian makes sure that you learn how to ride correctly and that process has given me the confidence to thoroughly enjoy what I am doing and look forward to doing more. I can not recommend them enough if you really want to learn how to ride – correctly. My biggest disappointment (now) is that there are not more places like this anywhere so that I can continue to learn and improve. We are considering moving in with them. That is drastic, but one needs to do what one needs to do! :-) Seriously, they are a professionally run business that I recommend to all that want to experience horseback riding in Argentina!

Fantastic Riding, beautiful scenery and great hosts. My boyfriend has never ridden a horse in his life, not even sat on one so when I asked him if he wanted to go riding whilst in Argentina I thought he would say no, giving me a free pass to go and enjoy the riding myself but he said yes! so off we went to meet Adrian and Miriam. What lovely people they are, so helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The horses were an absolute delight - Isobel my horse was beautiful and forward going, she wanted to have fun but she went at my pace which was fantastic.My boyfriend loved every minute of it and under Miriam's fantastic instruction he was trotting within half an hour and cantering hands free an hour later. He then cantered at every opportunity he could! I wish I had had this kind of tuition when I started to learn to ride 30 years ago!The great thing about it was the big open space so we could all ride alongside each other and not have to follow each other down small trails, it was big open spaces.What a fantastic day and we don't even feel too sore after it. My boyfriend is keen to get back on a horse and that is testament to Adrian and Miriam making his first horse riding experience such a good one.Highly recommend this - don't bother looking anywhere else as you cannot find better.

Perfect Buenos Aires Day Trip. I was vacationing in Buenos Aires for 10 days and wanted to experience something other than city life. I landed on Caballos A La Par because of their fantasitc reviews and was delighted by my choice. It was extremely easy to book an appointment. They picked me up and dropped me off from my hotel and the entire day was wonderful. I spent several hours riding alone with one of the owners and enjoyed every minute of it. He refreshed my memory on basic riding techniques and was willing to do anything I wanted. We explored the different parts of a National Park and enjoyed the horses. I was cantoring in no time. Afterwards, he treated me to pizza on our car ride back into the city. It was an extremely unique experience. Not only did I enjoy the horseback riding but I got a rare chance to really communicate and get to know someone who grew up in Argentina. I loved it.

Best way to spend a day in BA. HIGHLY recommended. My husband and I were fortunate enough to spend several hours with Miriam and Adrien enjoying their gracious hospitality during our recent trip to Buenos Aires. While we had ridden before, we never received any instruction and were pleasantly surprised with the level of instruction that was provided and amount we were able to learn in one, all too brief, ride. Who knew we could canter without holding on to the reins! Our day riding in the park was truly memorable. Our only regret was that we did not have time to return for additional riding lessons. We will most definitely return on our next visit to BA. Drinking mate and enjoying beer and empenadas were added pleasures. Many many thanks for a truly special experience to Adrien and Miriam. All best, Debbie and Rick

Highly recommended. My wife and I visited Caballos A La Par on Jan 3rd 2013. From our pick up at 2:30pm to the drop off in the evening we were both extremely happy with all aspects of the day. We were very much novices when it came to riding but with a warm welcome and a chat over a cup of mate we were made to feel at home. Both Adrian and Miriam are great to talk to and show a clear love for their horses and life in general. We spent about 2 hours riding through the national park under Adrian's tuition, finally ending up cantering freely through long grass and around various trees. Once back we fed the horses and then went inside to chat again over a beer and some food. The enthusiasm and passion they show really makes this a unique experience and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for something special to do in Buenos Aires.

The best horse riding experience ever.. We were picked up at the cruise terminal and driven for 40 minutes to the East of Buenos Aires to the most beautiful national park. Time was taken to assess our riding abilities to ensure that we were matched with the perfect horses. This is no commercial operation, with the owners being focused on maximum revenue, it is all about ensuring guests get the best experience. Before we set off we were taught the Argentine style of riding, and the horses were very well schooled and a pleasure to ride. We rode for about two and a half hours and were given the freedom to ride where we wanted through the park across differing terrains. On our return we were treated to lunch with the owners Adrian and Miriam. Throughout the day we were made to feel most welcome, and would highly recommend Caballos a la Par as a brilliant way to spend time on any visit to Buenos Aires.

Real horse riding experience. We went from having zero experiences with horses in the morning to cantering freely by noon time. This is not your average sit on a horse and follow the line type of tour attraction; rather, you get the feeling that everyone at caballos a la par really wants you to excel in your riding abilities. Despite have spent only several hours there, you are really treated just like you are a part of the family. We visited the new location, where they have a brand new pool. So I'm sure the visitors will soon have the chance to take a dip after the riding experience. One suggestion is that riders bring a bottle of water with them since riding a horse for several hours is actually hard work and you will get thirsty.

One of the best memories from Buenos Aires. Friends of mine who had been to Buenos Aires a few months before me recommended Caballos a La Par. And just like their experience, this was one of the highlights of my trip to Buenos Aires. I loved the entire experience. It was a beautiful day spent getting to know Adrian and Mariam, drinking matte, and learning to ride a horse. Prior to this, my experience with horses was couple of trail rides. I can even say I had a slight fear of horseback riding and by the end of the day I was cantering on a horse - Indio - in the middle of a forest. I can honestly say this was just one of those magical, once in a lifetime experiences and it makes me want to go back to Buenos Aires just to visit Mariam, Adrian, and my awesome horse Indio.

the place to be for an Argentinian horse experience. Since 6 weeks i had been looking for a good place for a horse ride which is not the typical touristic tour where horses don´t have left any interest for people and running and know exactly where they have to go. I love horses and spend a lot of time riding in Germany and I had already made some bad experinces in Peru. But thankfully almost in the end of my travel I found what I was looking for at "Caballos a la par". Miriam was really helpful and could organize a horse ride for myself alone in 2 days including transport from the city. After arriving Adrian starts with a Mate ceremony because he first wants to know the people who ride his beloved horses to find the right horse for everybody. Then I could try three horses in the garden and choose two to take on the ride so I could change after the half of the time. And finally I started with Miriam on a 3 hours tour through a beautiful park where you just can go as you like without meeting anybody. You can freely choose how fast and where you want to go (as long as you don´t harm the horses and respekt the ground) and those beautiful, alert horses really love moving and running! Even if I usually ride the English style those horses " understood" everything I wanted from them and I really enjoyed my time and couldn´t stop smiling. After the ride I could help cleaning my horse (which I really appreciate!) and was offered some drinks and Argentinian sweets chatting about horses and riding with those warm hearted people. Adrian and Miriam have created a wonderful place with wonderful horses which they really take care of and which have just a perfekt life in their "garden". If beginner or advanced this is the perfekt place for an Argentinian horse experience!

a wonderful day. A wonderful day full of fun and sport and nature. We were not experienced horse-riders at all, and the guys of this neat and new "estancia" close to Buenos Aires just gave us confidence and security to spend a beautiful day.We will come back for sure!Duilio, Giuditta, flaminia e Valeria Amico

Must do in Buenos Aires!. What an experience to have taken away from our Buenos Aires trip recently. My partner and I had little to no experience at all in horse riding before this adventure and we would easily recommend this to anyone! Our hosts Adrian and Miriam were very genuine, honest and true people whom made the experience that much more. From the very beginning over a mate and throughout the national park (with our well trained horses, Isabelle and Indio) we felt very comfortable and at ease the entire journey! Undoubtedly, one of the best adventures we took away from Buenos Aires and would go back next time we are there!

Amazing Horse Riding Experience!!!!!!!!. My wife is Big Fan of Horses and booked this Experience after noticing this on Things to do in BsAs. Adrian picked us up in the city and took us to the Farm House. After a brief Mate drinking ritual Adrian walked us through the riding postures and directions on how to ride them. We have never sat on horses in our lives let alone riding them on our own!!!!Within few minutes we are off on our adventure with Mariam accompanying us. The horses were very well trained and we were very confident riding them. Mariam was a great instructor and let us ride the horses wherever we please to in the park. I never thought we could the ride horses like with did within an hour after we were trained. The Ride in the park was relaxing and the experience is amazing. Adrian and Mariam are great tutors and it shows in their passion to horses.They are great people and make you feel as you belong there. Thanks to Adrian and Mariam for making our day unforgettable. This is a one of the experiences that has to be done if you are visiting Buenos Aires and have a day available in your schedule.

PLEASE DO THIS. If you are in Buenos Aires and want to ride horses, like really ride horses, not walking in a line for an hour, don't think twice and go to Caballos a la Par. The other day my friend (who has been riding horse since age three) and I (who have very little experience) went to ride horses and get out of the city. We have been in Buenos Aires for about 2 months studying abroad and really needed to get away for a while. The park was absolutely amazing, and was such a breath of fresh air after spending so much time in the city. Adrian and Miriam were perfect, sweet, and helpful. We rode with Miriam who was such a great teacher and even though my friend and I were at different skill levels, she worked with each of us to make for the best experience possible. I came in with only experience ever riding on in line tours and by the end I was posting and cantering with no hands. Afterwards we ate lunch and then helped bathe the horses, which was a lot of fun. This was probably one of my favorite days in BsAs and I am definitely going back.Basically, this was worth it. You actually learn how to ride a horse, you spend time with amazing people, and I guarantee that you will enjoy it too if you go.

Wonderful experience!. I can only highly recommend this trip. Experience a day, that you will keep in mind and that will simply make you feel very, very happy!I've had no experience in riding horses, but really wanted to try during my 6-week stay in Buenos Aires. Adrian picked me up in the city, we had mate tea and a little chat together with Miriam before he gave me short instructions.
