Only ten minutes later I was sitting on the horse and we rode straight out into the park. Although I didn't have any experience at all, Adrian let me have full responsibilty of the horse. It was very challenging, which was perfect, because I wanted to learn as much as possible. However, Adrian will adjust the wohle adventure perfectly to your expectations and wishes. He is a very experienced guy, who loves his horses, his job and the contact with people. You can be sure, his only aim is to make you feel comfortable during the wohle ride. Afterwards you will feel exhausted and happy at the same time!It is the perfect trip to escape the rushing, noisy city for a while and to enjoy the horses, the nature and the warmhearted company of Miriam and Adrian.

Fabulous ride. Afternoon started with Adrian serving mate tea before anything else - no rush at this place. Then Miriam took me out for the ride. Relaxing, fun - and at times challenging, because I was really learning how to ride! The people, the horses, the environment and the experience were all great.

MUST DO. I booked my time with Caballos A La Par after seeing it as #1 on Trip Advisor. All of the reviews were amazing....however they just don't do the experience justice!I went with three friends, two beginners and one other person who, like me, had experience riding horses. All of us thoroughly enjoyed our day. We have been living in BsAs for 5 months, and our day with Adrian and Miriam was undoubtedly one of our top 3 favorite days in Argentina. Great for people of ALL experience! Adrian is a great guide, very helpful and really wants you to have fun and enjoy yourself. Definitely worth the money. If we can find time during the last month we have in Argentina, my friends and I want to go back and do another day at Caballos a la Par.Seriously cannot recommend this place enough. If you are in BsAs for a while, or even for just a long weekend, you should definitely make your reservation with Adrian and Miriam.Great people, great activity, great horses (best I've ever ridden!) and overall a wonderful day.

Great nature experience very close to Buenos Aires. We had such an amazing day riding with Miriam, yesterday 16 November. Both her and Adrian have such a great approach to horse riding and life in general. What made the day unique is the fact that you are not just sitting there, being the 'passenger' on the horse, the horses are responsive and don't follow each other. We were free to select where we wanted to go in the national park. The two of us had different experience levels, which was no problem at all. It is perfect for beginners as by the end of the day you are able to canter and control the horse. We would highly recommend the horse riding experience and we are sure it will remain one of the best highlights of our trip!

Best thing to do in Buenos Aires. On a sunny day in Buenos Aires we joined hundreds of locals doing outdoor pursuits on the edge of the city. Our choice was horse-riding with Adrian and Miriam at Caballos a la Par, which proved to be the best thing we did during our stay in Buenos Aires.We were enthralled by the world they welcomed us into - a professional working stables, an easy hospitality with the emphasis on friends, idyllic parkland, and beautiful horses waiting to serve and carry you away on your adventure.Although classifying ourselves as beginners, we'd both been on horses before years ago. However after a few hours under Miriam's watchful eye and on top of one of her horses, we both felt the confidence that comes when you realise you've learnt how to do something well. The penny seemed to drop why people, in particular in Argentina, were so devoted to their horses. It was quite an insight.Of course, the stars of the day were the horses. Patient without being docile, they were amazingly responsive and alert. Each one clearly had character and you felt that a strong bond could develop over time. Those lucky enough to stay for a night in the future may well find this to be the case.

Great Horseback Riding Experience Buenos Aires. My daughter and I had a special time riding here. The horses are calm and exceptionally well trained. We walked, trotted, and galloped through a beautiful park. We went through fields, tree lined paths and a few small rivers. The entire time we were made to feel at home by Adrian (our guide) and the horses. It was exhilarating at times and leisurely at others. It was scenic throughout. It was truly a joy ride. The transportation to and from BA was quick and easy, the facilities are great and improving, and the hospitality we were shown was second to none. If you have the time while in Buenos Aires, I recommend you check the availability of this special ride.

Paradise with Horses. In planning my recent trip to BA I had already read several hundred reviews classifying this as the number 1 attraction around Buenos Aires. I am a horse lover and occasional rider who finds most trail rides sitting on a walking horse boring. When I did book, I was hoping for green parkland, top horses and an individual lesson for as long as I wanted. What I found was paradise. The owners provided a superbly trained and gentle horse with lots of energy, an experience of a lifetime riding through beautiful 100's of acres natural park, and a friendship with individual attention that I will never forget. If I could wave a magic wand and transport this experience to home I would do this weekly. I have had many riding lessons but never a riding transformation such as this. This is not only the number 1 destination around Buenos aires it is the number 1 horse experience in my life.

Feelin' like a gaucho.... I knew this would be a different experience when I arrived and learned that I would be on my own with my guide (the director), Adrian, rather than riding in a line with a group of strangers. The next surprise was when we rode into the park and Adrian told me there was no trail; I should go wherever I wanted in the immense national park. Although I've ridden a lot, he taught me more about form, holding the reins, and leading the horse than I've ever learned.Once I felt confident steering my horse, Indio, while cantoring, Adrian told me to drop the reins. I thought he meant to loosen up on them. When I did, he told me again, "Drop the reins." While I tried to process what he was telling me to do, Adrian said, "Let go of the reins!" So I did. Then I held my arms in the air, as he instructed. It was an amazing feeling of total freedom, confidence, and safety. I left this trip in awe that I could do something I never thought I'd have the skill and courage to do.Adrian and his business partner, Miriam, are warm and hospitable, as well as wonderful instructors. If you ride horses, do this trip. If you want to ride, do this trip. If you never thought about riding, do this trip.

The best riding experience every!. I have never been able to do something like this in the US, let alone as part of a vacation. This was the best paid riding experience I have had ever and I have been on a lot of trial rides in different countries. I would recommend this for an experienced rider who doesn't want a borrowing trial ride or any beginner who actually wants to learn to ride on their own and gain confidence to do more than just walk. I got to ride for about 2 hours in the national forest. I never saw a fence, so Indio and I could have galloped forever! I love that feeling! Adrian was extremely helpful, kind and understanding. The horses were so good. Also, I forgot to put on bug spray and as it had just rained there were a lot of mosquitoes. But, without me even saying anything, Adrian radioed for Miriam to meet us out near a road and she brought me out some bug spray. I was bug bite free after that and really appreciated that extra kindness.  In addition, booking the trip was extremely easy and uncomplicated. They were the first place to respond to my emails. Also transportation from Buenos Aires was very reasonable which was a big requirement of mine.  I highly recommend Caballos A La Par!! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zmS3EFB8sMM&feature=channel&list=UL - for the video of me galloping on Indio!

My favorite day in BA!. This was a surprisingly wonderful day with amazing people! I was a bit nervous having never ridden a horse, but the instruction was great and I left wanting to take it up upon return home! The horses are great and very well trained. A quick road trip (with transportation to & from your hotel) and you are welcomed to their stable which is brand new, right on the edge of a huge beautiful park. Adrian and Miriam are so warm and welcoming. The best part is that the lessons are private so you get a lot of attention and really get to go at the pace you and your group like. I would recommend this to anyone visiting BA. Its for all levels and a great escape from the loud busy city. I was in BA for a week and this was my favorite activity.

Excellent!!. This was an amazing experience! I had never ridden a horse before and after only a couple hours was able to cantor with no hands. The horses were very well-trained, the instruction was great and the hospitality was amazing. We were the first riders to see their brand new stables and facilities, which were really nice and very close to the large, beautiful park where the riding took place. Adrian and Miriam are great hosts and instructors and we had a wonderful day with them! I highly recommend this if you are visiting BA!

Don't leave BA without doing this!. We are two experienced riders and were looking for a place where we could really ride. We did not want to be on a trail where the horses know exactly where to go and what to do. I can only say we found what we were looking for and more than that. We rode great, well-trained horses in a beautiful park and were free to go wherever we wanted and at the pace that we wanted. Adrian and Miriam made every effort to provide a great experience. We had an amazing day with them, it was the highlight of our trip to Argentina! Don't miss this!

Riding in Paradise!. Having read so many wonderful reviews on this site about Caballos A La Par, I decided I had to try it out for myself being a keen rider. And I wasn’t disappointed! Having been brought up in the countryside with horses, I knew Argentina was going to be a very special trip after not having ridden for years. I had done research into a few horse places and CALP stood out way above the others in terms of the feedback from people who had been. My experience started with Miriam via email who answered my questions not only promptly but thoroughly. She also picked me up at my hotel with the same efficiency which was an added bonus because I was very keen to get there and maximise precious time spent. It is a 40 minute drive approx to the ranch which is located inside a beautiful national park covered with old trees, long pampas grasses and gorgeous wild flowers. On our arrival, I was greeted by Adrian the other owner of the ranch and a local who immediately makes you feel you have known him for years. They kindly offered me a choice of drinks and naturally I had to try Mate, a local drink which is a huge part of the Argentine culture. Delicious too! After a leisurely chat about the horses and Argentina, i quickly came to the conclusion this was going to be a day to remember! After Miriam kitted me out in half chap leg protectors and a very cute cowboy style which is actually protective, we set off out to meet my horse, Indio, a horse with an adorable personality! After explaining the basics on the Argentine style of riding, Adrian checked my horses saddle, girth, reins etc. Being an animal lover, this was something I particularly appreciated as it is clear that not only is safety their priority but also the comfort and welfare of the horse is paramount. We then we set out for an amazing afternoon of wonderful riding through gorgeous woodlands, crossing through tracks in dense forest and cantoring across eucalyptus scented meadows. Indio is so funny and takes care of you! It is as if Adrian trained him to adapt to different styles of rider! The whole time I was riding Adrian instructed me when it was needed and with such encouragement and enthusiasm for me to try new things I had never done before even as an experienced rider. I felt I could have done anything that day with the confidence he instilled in me and also with such amazingly well trained and responsive horses! Half way through the ride, Adrian told me I could try his horse, Nahuel, a beautiful big horse I fell in love with and wanted to take home! I learned so much as it is totally different from English style that I have always been used to. In fact I would say that the Argentine style is much easier and certainly more free. The highlight for me was Adrian teaching me how to cantor without hands holing the reins. Thankfully to savour the memory, he even took a video so I can prove it to my friends back home. On our return we were greeted by Miriam who lit a cosy fire and was preparing coffee with delicious pastries. We then sat down for what seemed like hours laughing and chatting about all things Argentine! I also found it fabulous to see my cantor on video and Adrian told me how to change my posture to improve my riding. I know I could go on and on about CALP like most reveiwers on this site! All I can say is you have to go to really appreciate how wonderful it is!!! CALP is far more like being in the company of old friends rather than tourism hosts and it is such a laid back atmosphere where there is never the feeling of being rushed. Their priority from the moment I set foot on the ranch was that I spent a fabulous day and leave with a huge smile. They more than exceeded on both!!! Thankyou guys, I will be back again next year with any luck and shall bring my friends next time.

Excellent!. Great horses, great people, great fun! I was amazed that having never really ridden a horse before, I ended the lesson cantering without hands with a huge smile on my face. Very much recommended if you are visiting Buenos Aires!

Wonderful Horse-back ride near Buenos Aires. The husband and I were visiting Buenos Aires: he, for a business trip, me, for fun; he, a reluctant rider (to humor his wife), me, an avid, but nowadays, infrequent, rider. I was looking for an Argentinian equestrian experience that would be different from the Dia del Campo tourist-oriented attractions, and one where my husband would have a ride that he would enjoy rather than just tolerate, and where he could learn to handle a horse. Miriam at Caballos A La Par was able to give us just that. First of all, the arrangements were made by e-mail. Her responses were quick, informative and helpful. She arranged to pick us up at our hotel in BA, and arrived right on time. We drove approximately 45 minutes to the stable, adjacent to a huge beautiful public park the size of Buenos Aires in acreage. We were treated to Argentinian mate, which is difficult to experience if you are just on a business visit to Argentina, unless you visit someone in their home. We then geared up with chaps and a helmet disguised as a cowboy hat, which is a clever design, since it gives you the protection of a helmet, protects your face from the sun, and looks slightly cooler than a riding helmet.Miriam was smart enough to provide mosquito repellant. We were advised on close-toed shoes, but the husband would have been better off with pants that did not have such a prominent seam, since he learned the meaning of "saddle sore" the hard way. I wore comfortable jeans, but riding pants or even bike shorts under the pants would work.She gave us brief instructions, since we had ridden before, and we were introduced to our mounts, Indio (mine, really smooth and eager to go) and Isabel (also fine, a little more of a follower). We rode in the park. I was able to go off on my own, trotting, cantering, and Miriam provided some instructions on posture and position that made the ride more comfortable. I was trained on English riding, and the Argentinian saddle is more of a cross between English (no saddle horn, thinner stirrup) and Western (deeper saddle), and the position of the leg is different. She spent more time with the husband, providing instruction on his position and also getting him to tell the horse what he wanted her to do, and making her do it. Miriam had him trotting, cantering with great control, and he felt and looked like a real gaucho. Miriam was very good about documenting our ride with our camera, but the memory card failed, so our friends will simply have to believe that the husband rode so well.She had me ride without reins, and even gave me the chance to out and out run the horse across a field, something I would never be allowed to do in the states. It was exhilarating.We rode back to the stables, dismounted and enjoyed more conversation and pastries. Miriam has an interesting story, coming from the Netherlands, working for the government, traveling around the world, and now, teaching visitors to ride and appreciate the culture and countryside of Argentina. We were able to briefly meet Adrian, who is busy working on their beautiful future home and stable. Their love of the horses, and their kindness and generosity were impressive and unique. I would highly recommend this experience, and hope to return soon.

Real Horse Back Riding Lessons!. This was a fantastic experience and the highlight of our time in Buenos Aires!! Miriam was so flexible in meeting our desire to horse ride. Our chosen day had a high chance or rain, but she was willing to pick us up to give it a try. In the end we had no rain and rode! Miriam and Adriano were perfect horse instructors. They worked to understand our skills and personalities and actually chose horses that would work well with us. We then proceeded to learn walking, trotting, and cantering. It was the first time that we had truly learned to ride, and Miriam was very patient with us. We were able to learn all techniques and had a wonderful time. At the end Miriam made us cafes and hot chocolate and shared local pastries. Adriano had a fire going by the table and we spent time reviewing our videos and photos (which Miriam graciously took!!). It was a wonderful experience! Overall this was a true five-star experience! We will definitely return if back in Buenos Aires again.

Fantastic Experience. We read so many great reviews that we went back to Buenos Aires a second time just for this and we're happy to say we were not disappointed. Previously we had only mounted a horse once in our lives and it wasn't much more than going around in a circle. Our objective was to learn to ride a horse and make it go where we wanted it to go. After arriving at the stables, the day started with a nice chat with Adrian over a cup of traditional Argentinian Mate. We then were fitted with our gear and had a quick introductory lesson on how to ride. Once Adrian saw we were reasonably comfortable on the horse, we were led out of the stables by Miriam into the adjacent park. Miriam was great as she really nitpicked our form as we rode. I can still hear her in my head shouting at me like a drill sergeant, "Keep your back straight!" and "Press down with your heels!". We were delighted to have an instructor with high expectations of us.  Ad the end of the day we left having learned much more than we ever expected and we had fun doing it. We can now comfortably mount, maneuver, walk, trot, and cantor. If you're serious about learning how to ride a horse we highly recommend this place.

AMAZING RIDE!. I was travelling to Buenos Aires for one-month work and was hoping that I can have a chance here to go horseback riding. I have done it only twice in my life (in a two different parts of the world) a I strongly believe that my third time will change horseback riding from “a random rides” to a hobby. I have heard about Caballos A La Par from my coworker in my first week in the office and immediately decided to go riding the following weekend, which made my first weekend in Argentina the most exciting one, and also the most special, since now I have two more friends – Miriam and Adrian. I truly looking forward to have more visits to Argentina, and even if it won’t be for business purposes, it will be to meet with my new friends, spent a day or two horseback riding, sit next to the fireplace in their soon to be brand new house and listen to their stories, tell some of my own, and simply spend time with my special friends. Since I heard about horseback riding opportunity through my coworker, who already communicated with Miriam about her upcoming visit, I really haven’t done any research and had no idea where I’m going, all I knew that I’m going to ride horse for the third time in my life. When we were picked up in BA by Miriam, first a few minutes where enough to realize how great my experience would be. Miriam already knew me by name, even though we haven’t communicated before. When we came to the barn, we were greeted by Adrian and spent some time near the fireplace trying mate for the first time, eating pastries and of course talking about the horses. Adrian and Miriam are AMAZING, and their life stories are truly amazing as well, and certainly made me think more seriously about what is it that I want to do in my life the most. These people are absolutely not in a rush to provide you with a required service and move on to the next customer – THEY ARE TRULY DEVOTED TO SPEND THE ENTIRE DAY WITH YOU, no matter how busy their day schedule could be. Miriam and Adrian are very focused on providing quality personalized experience to each rider, for every lever of prior experience, from very beginners to experience riders. My friend was an advanced rider and Miriam was able to provide training in a way that we both were always fully engaged in learning new skills – advanced and beginner riders at the same time. My two prior horseback rides were in the mountains, I was worried in the back of my mind that riding in the flat surroundings might be boring. The nearby park where we went riding was beautiful and very diverse in the scenery – many types of different trees and vegetation. The nature here is amazing in any time of the year. We went during the winter time and the pictures are gorgeous, I can’t even imagine how beautiful here during the spring time. Miriam and Adrian are really focused on teaching you the riding skills, rather than just ride the horse. They are very patient and encouraging, as they have so much passion for what they do and love to share their passion with others. I learned cantering within the first hour of ride, and this is truly AMAZING. More so, Miriam also thought me how to canter without reins, I had no idea I would be able to do it. Miriam and Adrian have many horses that are well trained and can fit all levels of riding experiences. Throughout the entire time, we never just followed one another, but were free to ride on our own, change to a different riding type as we liked it. And even when the ride was over, Miriam and Adrian were not in a rush at all to take us back to the city – they treated us with an amazing hot chocolate, more pastries and showed us around their new facilities, which make me very anxious to come back in a month or two and be one of the first riders to enjoy a nice evening next to the fireplace after a day of riding. I am looking forward to visit Miriam and Adrian again and again. Thank you guys for such a special experience!

REAL HORSEBACK RIDING, JUST GREAT!. We had a wonderful time riding with Caballos A La Par! The best thing is that you really learn to ride. The horses are amazing, you get great instruction and the park is beautiful. We felt like we were spending the day with friends and will definitely be back next time we visit Buenos Aires. Highly recommended!

Lovely experience. We went to visit Caballos A La Par with really high expectations because of all the positive reviews and we were not disapppointed! We were picked up on time and drove about 35 minutes out to the stables. There we met Adrian and Miriam. After drinking traditional Argentinian mate we went out to meet our horses and ride. The horses were excellent and very well trained, no trail ponies at all. We have experience riding horses but still learned a lot from the instruction we were given during the ride. The most fun is that you have the possibility to walk, trot and canter when you want, this is definitely no programmed trail ride. It is like riding your own horse in the company of friends. Afterwards we had hot chocolate and pastries and watched the pictures and videos of the ride. It was a wonderful experience!

FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE. After reading all the reviews, I went to Caballos A La Par with high expectations and am happy to say I was not disappointed at all. It was my first time on a horse and I feel like I actually learnt how to ride. Adrian was coaching me all the time and telling me how to improve my riding. I finished the lesson cantering free in the park. It was hard work because the horses don`t follow the same trail every day and you have to learn how to tell them what you want them to do. But it was so rewarding when I got it and was able to ride off on my own. After the ride I had hot chocolate and some delicious pastries with Adrian and Miriam, while talking about the ride and all kind of different things. I felt like I had spent the afternoon with friends. Thank you guys so much!

Best part of our trip.. You know how when you travel, you have an "ideal travel experience" in your mind's eye? One that's filled with laughter and adventure, where you're learning something new, or being exposed to something beautiful or outside your comfort zone a little bit? Maybe you're making a meaningful connection with someone who has unique insight into the culture in which you're traveling? You know, that experience where there's an acute attention to detail? That elusive "authentic" experience that you tell everyone about when you return?THIS IS IT.This isn't just a few hours of horse riding -- sitting passively on an ornery horse in a long line of people -- this is a private tutorial with incredibly competent, warm, passionate and personal teachers.I really can't say enough good things about Miriam and Adrian. It makes us want to schedule another trip, just to do this again.Oh, and truth be told? I'm actually a bit scared of horses.

BEST Experience while Visiting Buenos Aires!!!!!. When I first learned I would be traveling to Buenos Aires for work, I began researching places to go riding. I have horses of my own and could not imagine going weeks without the opportunity to ride! I read the reviews of Caballos A La Par and began communicating with Miriam via e-mail. She was incredibly responsive and answered all of my questions. Upon arrival in Buenos Aires, the rain caused us to delay the ride by one week-end, but it was worth the wait to experience the beautiful sunshine we had on the day of my ride! A couple of days before my scheduled ride, one of my colleagues heard I was going riding and wanted to join. I e-mailed Miriam to see if we could add anothe person and she eagerly invited her along! Even though my colleague had less experience riding than I do, Miriam assured me we would both have an excellent time as they were used to accommodating groups with multiple skill levels. On the day of the ride, Miriam picked us up and drove us to the country. I immediately felt at home at the barn around all the horses. We met Adrian and sat by a fireplace drinking Mate, eating pastries, and talking about many things. Adrian then helped us get saddled up and sent us on our way! The ride with Miriam was AMAZING. The horses were incredibly well-trained to listen to their riders and not just "follow" the other horses. There was no set trail - so we were really free to ride wherever we wanted in the park. Miriam rode all around us and spoke words of coaching and encouragement. We saw so many different types of vegetation and trees on our ride - it was truly wonderful and very beautiful. Throughout the ride, Miriam carried my camera and took so many great pictures of us. One of my favorite parts of the ride was when Miriam let us canter without the reins. She rode alongside each of us and took video footage with my camera! It was such a wonderfully free moment and I love having it on video. Being an advanced rider, I felt COMPLETELY satisfied with my ride. I was able to do everything that I wanted to do and I even had the opportunity to ride two different horses with very different styles. I thought that with my friend being less experienced, we may have to hold back on cantering, but that was not the case. The "A La Par" style worked great for my friend and under Miriam's excellent coaching she was able to ride with us and have an amazing time :) After the ride, we fed carrots to the horses and sat by the fire again. We had more pastries and hot chocolate and relaxed. It truly was the best experience - to sit around with friends and talk after an extraordinary ride. The best thing about Caballos A La Par (in my opinion) is the personalized approach to the ride. Riding together in the car out to the country, sharing hot drinks and pastries by the fire, riding horseback side by side (rather than in a line), being able to control the horse on my own (rather than having him already know the path) - all of these are just a few examples of the great personalized experience. Adrian and Miriam are passionate about providing this type of experience to their riders - and they do an EXCELLENT job. After that day, I can now say that I have friends in Argentina because Adrian, Miriam, and their beautiful horses are the BEST!

Awesome activity!. I had a wonderful time horseback riding with Adrian and Miriam. They were both very much encouraging and I learned a lot about Argentinean style horseback riding. We went galloping through the beautiful National Park and bought some delicious Argentinean sweet pastries from a local vendor on our way. All was very well arranged and the company of Adrian and Miriam was very pleasant. Unlike other horseback riding experiences I have had, I never got the feeling that the horses were just following each other, I really was riding the horse. This is a genuine recommendation if you are visiting Buenos Aires!!!

INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE!. Adrian and Miriam are amazing! A friend and I went to go horseback riding on a gorgeous Friday and I really can't say enough about this experience. Miriam drove us about 40 minutes outside of Buenos Aires to the ranch and we spent some time drinking mate and learning about Argentine customs. Afterwards, Adrian took the two of us out for a ride in the parks. He made sure to tailor the ride to our experience level and by the end we felt like pros (probably not the reality but that's ok). It is a unique experience because you learn about Argentine culture, have a private horseback riding lesson in a beautiful setting, and spend time with wonderful people.My favorite thing I've done in Buenos Aires!!

Wonderful experience. I knew that I wanted to go horseback riding whilst visiting my daughter in Buenos Aires. I looked at some estancias etc but the description of the riding experience on offer at Caballos A La Par encouraged me to arrange a visit. The trip was easy to schedule via email with Miriam. A meeting time was arranged and Miriam picked me up in Buenos Aires. I was introduced to Adrian (the owner) when I arrived at the centre. Miriam and Adrian speak English very well, which is a bonus because I don’t speak Spanish. The three of us chatted whilst drinking Mate (a traditional tea like beverage) and eating pastries (Facturas). Afterwards I was given a pair of half chaps and a specially designed riding hat to wear then I was shown my horse, Indio. Adrian gave me instructions on how to turn the horse, make him go faster and halt whilst holding the reins in one hand, which I had not done before. Miriam was my instructor for the session. We went out into the public park, which is close by the riding centre. I was a little apprehensive as I was quite rusty but Miriam put me at my ease and soon had me riding without reins whilst cantering across the fields. Indio was well trained and willing. The Instructors don’t lead from the front but ride alongside you giving advice, instruction, support and praise. There is no set route through the park so the horses are not used to trotting and cantering at specific points on the tracks or fields. This gives you more confidence and makes you feel in control of the horse. I was encouraged to go where I wanted at a speed that I was comfortable with. Fantastic! Once the ride had finished and the horses had eaten their carrots, we shared some cakes and had a hot drink in front of the lovely log fire (it was winter after all!). Miriam and I discussed the ride with Adrian. Miriam had taken videos of me whilst I was riding so that I could study my position and make corrections where necessary. This was really helpful. Adrian looked at the videos and made some observations which I will remember when I am riding again. Miriam also took some photos of me with Indio. I hadn’t taken a camera so Miriam used hers and sent the photos and videos for me as a keepsake. At the end of the session I was dropped off at a Subte station so that I could make my way back to my daughter’s flat.If you would like to sample some of Argentina’s countryside with attentive, friendly, and welcoming hosts who are passionate about their horses then look no further than Caballos A La Par. If I go back to Argentina I will definitely return to A La Par for another adventure.

Yippee!!!!. A day spent riding with Adrian and Miriam is the perfect antidote to busy Buenos Aires and a great way to see some of the natural beauty of Argentina.We were picked up at our hotel and driven to the stable by Miriam. We were lucky that the weather was lovely and as we got out of the city and into the countryside we felt ourselves relax.When we arrived at the stable we were greeted by Adrian, he is pretty spectacular, right out of the mold of Nacho the Polo player. (as a side note). He got us outfitted in half chaps to protect our legs and hard hats and off we went to meet our horses. The horses were clean and in great condition. We mounted up and headed into the park which is spectacular.My husband is a total beginner on a horse and within 20 minutes of Adrian's instruction he was cantering along and I was blown away! We have video evidence of this because I knew that no one back home would believe it! Adrian is a great teacher! He had us riding without hands, racing along and in general having loads of fun, all in a beautiful natural setting.After a couple hours we went back to the stable and were offered hot chocolate, the likes of which I have never experienced ( I will not ruin the surprise here) and some fabulous pastries. We laughed with Adrian and Miriam over our adventures and then Miriam drove us back to our hotel.A perfect day with incredible folks that I now consider friends!

Always a great day. I went already a lot of times to Adrian and Miriam to go horsebackriding in the park. It is always a great experience and a great way to clear your mind. And it will never become dull. The park is big and there is always another route through the park.Living in Buenos Aires has it advantages. The horses are sweet, but you are the one that has to work. They are not docile horses that only know one way through the park. But they have horses for everybody. It doesn't matter. What level of experience you have.After the riding thereis always time to drink something with eachother and have some nice facturas. It is always a great day for me and I cannot wait to go again.

Fantastic experience. We had an unforgettable afternoon at the Caballos “A La Par”. Trying horseback riding for the first time, Miriam and Adrian superbly guided us through a three hour ride. If you are visiting Buenos Aires, we sincerely recommend the "A La Par" as a memorable and adventurous outdoor experience. Victoria & Oddmund (Norway)

Perfect escape from the city: get on your horse and enjoy the ride!. If you love the outdoors, and need to get away from Buenos Aires for some hours, or a day... this is the place to be. Reading some of the reviews I am not going to say anything new I'm afraid, just add a few more positive remarks!The horses are very well taken care of, you can notice that Miriam and Adrian love their animals. As they want everyone to have a great experience riding with them, it does not really matter if you never ever sat on a horse before. The horses are well trained and will be matched with your riding experience. I am an experienced horse rider but it had been quite a while since I rode for the last time. I just hoped the horses would not be trotting along the same route day-in day-out, as that could have been quite boring Turned out that Caballos A La Par have the same philosophy and explicitly try to avoid this kind of routine!So we had a bright sunny day exploring the neighbourhood (a whole nature park!) on horseback. It's a very diverse area with woods, open fields, small hidden tracks... Simply perfect for this purpose. Miriam shot a video of me galopping, I felt quite a gaucha! The huge park calls for many more visits. As I might be staying in Buenos Aires for a while still, I hope to have more of these unique and fun days, riding with Caballos A La Par.

Truly Unique. On our recent trip to Buenos Aires we found reviews for this activity online and it sounded like a good change of pace from all the city had to offer. We were picked up in BA and enjoyed a 45 minute drive out to the countryside. We were lucky that our day was cool with bright blue skies, and the location of the horses is a park full of towering trees and grassy fields. Really a beautiful spot. Adrian and Miriam started us off with a casual tea in the farmhouse that really helped our young daughter get comfortable before we climbed up on our horses. Never having ridden before, we were a bit nervous but they were great with giving instruction and getting us comfortable on the initial walk out to the open park land. Once there, the “serious” riding begins. Adrian gave one-on-one riding lessons to us, which were challenging. Our daughter wasn’t quite so brave, but she was talking non-stop for the next few days about how she rode a big horse and she controlled the horse all by herself. We certainly recommend this activity.
Very Good!. Great Riding School and Owners! Great place to learn and practice due to well trained horses and huge park area. Friendly and supportive staff. Cute stables with orange trees all around.

Loved every minute of it....amazing.. Caballos A La Par is a wonderful place to spend a morning or afternoon. It a a very different type of horse riding experience and is suited to any riding level which makes it enjoyable for absolutely everyone. Adrian and Miriam are absolutely the best they take time to make sure everyone feels comfortable and at ease each moment of the ride. The park is beautiful and makes for a very serene calm place to ride in at your own pace; a setting I much prefer to a standard trail ride where horses follow each other along the same path. The experience from beginning to end was wonderful and the service was top notch. I will for sure be returning to ride with Miriam and Adrian again very very soon. Thank you both so much for everything.

An Argentinian horseriding experience not to be missed. When our group of 4 friends signed up for half a day with Caballos A La Par, we were expecting a quiet morning of riding - perhaps just walking the horses on a trail around a park, and maybe some trotting for those of us who knew how.How wrong we were! Adrian and Miriam wanted us to do a lot more, and got us to do it too! The morning started slowly, and didn't know that the horses had been carefully selected to suit our previous riding experience. (Most of us had not ridden in years, and one of us had never sat on a horse before.) Suffice to say the horses were extremely well trained, even though we riders were not. The horses were also energetic, and seemed keen for some exercise, and a canter.Within 1 hour of enthusiastic coaching by Adrian, even our friend who had never ridden before, was cantering his horse like an old pro! I couldn't believe it! All of us had become much more confident in our riding in just an hour or 2! As proof, here is a video of how and where we were riding, at the end of that day ( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mFiKRqrNlKc )But a word of caution: After the riding, we discovered some leg and buttocks muscles we didn't know existed, which ached for many days following. But it was well worth it, for the great experience of riding in Argentina with Caballos A La Par!

The best day of my life. I am American and I am thirteen years old.The experience was beuatiful. The surrounding is amazing, all around you is green trees and grass. If you are lucky you will get to walk in the water while you are riding the horse. The coaches are so kind with you and when you do something correctly they say good job and that makes you happy. They have horses that are so nice and calm. And they even teach you how to trust the horse by making you trot on the horse without needing to hold on with your hands. when you leave from spending the day with Adrian and Miriam you will want to come back. Miriam talks English, Spanish, and Holand fluently. So do not miss out on this beuatiful adventure. I will defenitly come back.

Awesome Experience!. My husband and I went to BA for a week long trip. We love doing outdoor activities and this was the perfect activity for BA. We got out of the city for a day and enjoyed a great morning at Caballos A La Par.These are private riding sessions (they only have ONE group at a time, and never mix groups). This is in order to ensure a great riding experience that is personalized to every group. I had never ridden off of a trail before, but by the end of the day I was cantering and could control the horse.Adrian and Miriam are great teachers and excellent hosts - very hospitable and very knowledgable. They make sure each rider is safe and truly love what they do. This will be one of the best memories of BA.

Absolutely amazing experience. I did a lot of research into other options before I decided to try Caballos A La Par. I knew I did not want a very structured situation in an indoor arena. I did not want a trail ride in which one horse plods behind another horse. I ride a little at home, and I've had many lessons over the years in different disciplines. I knew that I wanted to learn and to ride outside, on horses that are well-trained and well-taken care of. This place -- Caballos A La Par -- was all I wanted and more.  The experience began when Hector, one of their drivers, picked me up in Buenos Aires, and drove me to the stables. The trip took about 45 minutes. The stables abut an incredibly gorgeous, huge park. The owners/instructors/guides, Miriam, a lovely woman from Holland, and Adrian, a native Argentinian, met me at the stables. They grew up with horses and are expert riders and teachers. After very successful careers in the "regular" business world, they decided to leave the rat race and devote themselves to a small, individualized operation in the countryside outside Buenos Aires. They are both passionate about horses and about teaching -- and it shows in all they do. To begin with, we had mate and merienda together, and they asked about my riding experience. Then we went out to meet the horses. The two leaders had prepared three of their sixteen horses for us to ride together. First, I was given instruction in the small area near the stables. Then we headed out into the park. They watched me carefully, and gradually they challenged me with trotting, cantering, and then galloping. I was given freedom to ride, but also many useful tips and helpful advice to improve my riding. Adrian and Miriam were warm and kind, and we laughed and talked -- but they also gave me wonderful instruction. In fact, I would say that I've never had better instruction. The park in which we rode was awesome -- although we apparently only rode through about 5% of the park. The horses were in top condition, calm, and extremely well-trained. I'm usually a little nervous about riding a horse I don't know, but I was not nervous at all with any of the three horses. After riding, Miriam and Adrian and I had something to drink and a snack again, and they showed me pictures and video they took of my riding they will send me later. Then I was driven back to my hostel in Buenos Aires.  The A La Par experience was my favorite experience by far in Argentina, and one of my favorite experiences in all my travels, anywhere. Miriam and Adrian are 5 star people. Their horses are amazing (people are often asking to buy one of them, but they are never for sale). Their instruction and company were fantastic. The park was fantastic.  This was an absolutely amazing experience.

Awesome experience for first-time horse riders.. My partner had organized this activity as part of a romantic getaway. Both of us had no prior experience with horse riding.What made Caballos a la Par so special and interesting is that this is not your average amusement park train ride where you end up as a "passenger" on a horse. Here you truly take the initiative and become a rider. Adrian and Miriam did a fantastic job, being encouraging but at the same time gently pushing us to actually learn a lot in a very short time. Each of us received individual coaching and learned a lot about horse riding. They are great teachers but also warm and generous hosts. This was a truly memorable experience!We took the lesson in Argentinian winter (July) and dressed well for the cold-weather. But as you'll be working hard, don't overdress of use layers so you can loose one or two if appropriate.

Caring, Compassionate & FUN horse riding. A much easier way of riding than in England (personally, only a short time riding as a very young girl in the UK). A fulfilling achievement doing a 'hands free' canter that I did not think that I was capable of! All lessons, I believe, are very different one from each other, based on individual needs from absolute beginners to experienced, which Adrian assesses beforehand and as the ride takes place. This is 'riding' not just 'sitting' on a horse, expect a quality, professional experience. Responsive horses with super calm natures that love carrots!!! Some riding stables can be a 'cold' experience but the Caring & Compassionate way that both Adrian & Miriam take care of their horses, like family members, is infectious and added very much to the FUN day out that both my sister and I had. Loved the style of stirrup, saddle and the 'cool' & stylish protective riding hats. Beautiful and spacious mystical forest surroundings that added to the feeling of well being and the joint connection with the calmness of the open air and Adrian & Miriam's horses. A wonderful & exciting time, full stop and would highly praise the ethics and philosophy surrounding this wonderful team.....

Honeymoon Horsebackriding.... It was a great experience. For beginners like us, riding was challenging, but Adrian and Miriam were very encouraging. They tailored their lesson to our needs, giving us individual advice and pacing the lesson according to how fast we learned. We feel we learned a ton. They are excellent teachers, but not only that, we found them to be generous and gracious hosts.They made us feel very welcomed and comfortable while we were there. *We should warn beginners - we were soooo sore the next day! Also, we noticed there were a lot of mosquitos (I didn't expect that many in June), so make sure to bring some insect repellent!

Not to be missed!. This activity was our most expensive activity during our time in Buenos Aires and it was worth EVERY SINGLE PENNY.Miriam arrived at our hotel right on the dot, and we had a nice drive out of the city. Before the lesson, we talked a bit and drank some mate so that Adrian could get to know us better. Adrian was a strict but very encouraging instructor, teaching how the correct way to sit, to position our hands and feet, how to get the horse to turn, stop, walk, trot, and canter. By the end of the lesson my husband and I were riding on the horses while they were cantering (we had maybe 2 trail rides before this lesson). It was an amazing 4 hours in the countryside. We handed our camera to Adrian at the beginning of the class and he took lots of pictures and videos for us. All of them turned out great. After the ride, Miriam made us submarinos because I had been talking about how much I love the drink. I was so happy and had two big mugs. There were also ample pastries, many of them stuffed with dulce de leche, for us to enjoy. Somehow the conversation delved into life and doing what you love, and it's clear that both Adrian and Miriam have a real passion for teaching people how to ride. If I can give them six stars, I would.P.S. I found this place on TripAdvisor. Miriam asked me to put up a review, but I didn't have an account. But after all the great service she and Adrian has provided, I finally caved and signed up. Besides, I guess it's time for me to give back to the TA community!

Great experience as an experienced rider. Caballos a la Par is one of the best riding experiences I have had. I have ridden hunter/jumper in the United States for over 15 years and am always unsure of what to expect when I go trail riding in another country, but Caballos a la Par truly lived up to the other recommendations on this site. Miriam and Adrian are friendly and genuine hosts- they provided mate (tea) and other snacks and great conversation and Adrian provided a wonderful lesson and opportunity to practice riding. Even with ample riding experience, I found this to be a new and rewarding experience, learning the Argentinean style of riding. The horses are very well trained and I will definitely do this again if I am in Buenos Aires! I highly recommend it.

"One of the best days of our BA holiday" Chris and Estella UK. We both enjoyed our horse experiene greatly and would have visited more than once. Adrian and Miriam are excellent teachers and a few hours later we were cantering through the pampas grass.We were put at ease with their warm and friendly manner. Both Adrian and Miriam understand horses extremely well, the horese are well trained and looked after supremely. Definitely an experience not to be missed.

A great time!!!. My husband and I went horseback riding with Miriam and Adrian from Caballos A La Par and it was simply amazing. This is a must when you visit Buenos Aires. They picked us up and took us to their location where they clearly explained everything to us. My Husband had never ridden a horse before so I was a bit nervous for him. Thanks to Miriam and Adrian my husband was riding comfortably within minutes. I had a bit of experience riding horses before but after this even I was a lot more confident. Their horses are great and the park where we went riding is beautiful open area. This is a highly recommended activity for your family. Lots of safe fun.

Best day of our BA trip. We visited Caballos A La Par as a family in early April 2012 during a 3-week trip to BA. We are two adults and two girls of 8 and 11 years old. None of us had ridden before. Our hosts were incredibly knowledgable and friendly. We spent the best part of a day with them and by the end we were all cantering our horses together. Quite an achievement and the ultimate testament to our coaches horsemanship. A Thoroughly well-deserved 5 stars.

Unforgettable experience. I can only agree with all the previous reviews! It was a wonderful experience riding through the park with so well-trained (and looked-after!) horses. Despite my partner never having been on a horse before and myself being out of practice we were cantering side by side after two hours! The unique method that Adrian and Miriam use obviously proofs to work very well and I wish there were more stables like this one. I especially liked the fact that when we first arrived we had a little chat so that we could get to know each other and Adrian could choose suitable horses for us. So whether you are an experienced rider or it´s your first time this is the place to go.

The best horse riding experience I have ever had. Imagine riding through the beautiful Argentinian countryside, better yet a national park with thousands of acres of woodland and rolling grasslands, astride a magnificent A La Par horse. If you can picture that you have experienced a fraction of the excitement and magic of riding a horse at the Caballos A La Par. Myself and four other friends were a mixed bag of riders ranging from advanced right through to novice, I had ridden a few times before but I was not a competent rider. This is not a problem at all as everyone is put on a horse relative to their ability, skill and temperament and then we all ride out at our own pace with constant instruction and guidance when you need it. It's the freedom of the learning experience that is so special, you wouldn't find this in the UK and it's for this reason that we were all so impressed. It's horse riding the way it should be.The horses were in excellent condition and very well mannered enabling everyone to settle into the ride easily and confidently. The instruction was delivered so well, friendly but focused, if you made a mistake it was ok but you need to learn from it. You are nurtured there not shouted at. Lovely people too.By the end of the day we all had smiles right across our faces, you couldn't explain how you felt, only that you had shared a truly amazing experience and learnt so much without really being aware of it.If you are visiting Argentina, especially Buenos Aires, and are looking for something special to do this is the place to go. Even if your not sure if you would like to horse ride, the instructors are warm and incredibly friendly and will make you feel so welcome and most importantly safe. I wasn't intending on returning to Argentina in the near future but I can honestly say that I will be back to ride again, it truly is an experience of a lifetime.

A Fantastic Experience in Buenos Aires. My friend and I decided to give Caballos A La Par a try during a trip in early April 2012 and it was the highlight of our stay in Buenos Aires. We went on the strength of ratings on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. Miriam and Adrian are wonderful hosts - picking us up in town and taking us to their wonderful homely ranch to meet the horses and take some instruction. Given I was an inexperienced rider and my friend an experienced rider I was worried that the difference in abilities would cause a problem but it was a truly amazing day - Adrian is a great tutor, very patient and gives you the confidence to try new things.The horsese are well trained, gentle and well cared for and the scenery is spectacular. The day finished with sweet and savoury pastries to die for. All in all, a truly wonderful experience for those with knwledge of horse riding and those without! Would highly recommend.

Highlight of Argentina. If you want to have a great horseback riding experience in Argentina, don't hesitate - just go!I love horseback riding, but hadn't gone in years. So in the land of the gaucho and polo, it seemed like the thing to do. We looked into various estancias, but they seemed like they were geared for meat eating and walking about a farm and I just wanted to ride. My partner had never ridden a horse before and was a bit nervous, so wanted a bit more instruction. I am so happy we found Caballos a La Par!Miriam and Adrian clearly love what they do and want to share their love of horses with others. We got lucky due to a last minute cancellation, we got to ride with both Miriam and Adrian. From they very first email they were professional and friendly. Miriam picked us up in BA and we drove to the farm. We got to chat and warm up with a bit of shared Mate and some tasty snacks, then off to the horses! They have very well trained horses and did a great job matching the horse to the rider (thank you Indio and Lindo!)This is not a follow along trail ride - it is a professional horse lesson! Miriam is a relaxed instructor with a good eye for details. Adrian is passionate with equal parts critique and praise. By the end of the 3 hours my partner was riding like he had been in the saddle for year. He was shocked by how hard it was and how much he learned in one day. By the end he was loving horseback riding. I worked on learning western style and with great effort broke my English riding habits (somewhat..)The day ended with more tasty treats and some coffee. This was truly one of our highlights of Argentina. It was worth every peso and in my opinion, for the level of teaching, is under priced. Thank you Miriam, Adrian, Indio and Lindo for a great day of riding in BA. I would go back in a heartbeat!!

Horseback riding paradise. I have been riding horses for a long time, and I always like to go riding on vacations. Far from the typical trail rides you will find elsewhere, this is an experience that every experienced (and not so experienced) rider will love. I had a one-on-one ride with Adrian and got to ride two of the horses (Indio and Sheik). I could tell that they were both very well trained, and most importantly, very happy horses! They are certainly not bored with their jobs and they will treat each rider well. The park where the riding takes place is like nothing I've experienced before on horseback- it is huge, beautiful, and you can go anywhere you want! Finally, Adrian and Miriam made me feel very at home and comfortable before and after the ride. Caballos A La Par is not to be missed, and I hope I will be able to come back and ride with them again!

Amazing Day !!. The best Experience ever, as an inexperienced rider found this to be the best, at no point did I feel unsafe, great teachers , beautiful well keep horses.By the end of the day I felt like an experienced rider. I would go back again again if lived in Buenos Aires. Thank you guys for a truly great riding experience .Maria

Amazing time! highly recommend it. Words can't explain the great time my wife and I had riding horses with Miriam and Adrian. I've never riden a horse before and with their great instructions I was having a lot of fun riding in a matter of minutes. If you're in Buenos Aires this activity is a MUST!Our horses were lovely and easy to ride. By the end of the day I wanted to adopt my horse "Nauel". The instructors Miriam and Adrian love what they do and they make this activity fun for everyone. We can't wait to return to Buenos AIres and do this again.

Horseback riding as it was meant to be!. If you really want to experience horseback riding, this is where you need to go! After looking at several options in Buenos Aires that sounded very touristy and bound to disappoint, I finally found Caballos a La Par. After talking to Miriam, I knew that I would get an authentic riding experience with them. Adrian and Miriam both love horses and love what they do and that makes all the difference. Although I had not ridden in years, they picked the perfect horse for me and tailored the day to my abilities, and it was perfect - getting one on one instruction, riding a great horse, AND being in beautiful wide open spaces! Absolutely fantastic! Don´t be intimidated if you go alone or if you´ve never ridden - you are in good hands. I learned so much in one day (thanks Adrian!) and had a great time with wonderful hosts. This experience needs to be on the top of your list for visiting Buenos Aires. I would definitely go back if I am travelling to B.A. again!

Amazing Experience. I can't say enough good things about Caballos a la Par. If you're looking to go horseback riding this is the way to do it! You actually learn to ride a horse and the instructors couldn't be more welcoming, engaging or informative! I highly recommend this to anyone passing through Buenos Aires!

Best riding experience ever!. As an experienced rider I have participated in many horse activities abroad and have always been highly disappointed. Always plodding behind another horse and never truly riding. My trip to Caballos A La Par was everything I could of hoped for and reignited my passion for riding. The experience was 100% tailored for our groups needs alone and I felt we really got a sense of Argentina and their horses. Miriam and Adrian who lovingly and passionately run Caballos could not of made our trip more wonderful. Their knowledge and understanding of horses and riding was infectious and each of us really learnt to ride that day. The horses are fantastically cared for, completely individual and chosen for you specifically. So much attention for the best experience has gone into this adventure and I can't stress highly enough how much I recomend this for all levels of riders, beginners to advanced, you will get so much from it.The day was just wonderful and I would visit Argentina again for this experience alone.

Amazing unforgettable experience. Well it's hard to write in few words all the intense feelings that I had during this day; it was just amazing: Miriam and Adrian are so lovely that we felt at home from the first minute! We talked to them about our previous experiences at the beginning: since it was my first riding experience I was a bit worried; but they took care of us and made us feel so safe that after few minutes on the horse my fear had been replaced by comfort and excitement at the same time! I will never forget this day.INDIMENTICABILE!!!!!!

Unbelievable, Unmissable, Completely Unique!. An absolute MUST for people of all riding abilities! I could not have felt more safe or looked after by these wonderful people, who took such care over every member of our trip. We arrived with a wide spectrum of riding abilities, and Miriam and Adrian looked after us so personally and attentively, that we all left feeling like riders for the first time. This is neither a passive "sit-on-a-horse" tour, nor a dull "riding around a ring" lesson, but a fusion of tuition and adventure that left us all elated. This was easily the most fun I've had on a horse, and I was learning the whole time! M&A take great care of both their horses and their guests, and I'm incredibly grateful to them for this experience.

Best riding experience ever!!!. I cannot recommend this highly enough...wonderful place; extraordinary hospitality; great people, first class tuition & stunning horses...this is easily the best riding experience I have ever had & even if you've had little or no experience you will end the day feeling like a rider rather than a passenger on horseback! All in beautiful countryside just outside of Buenos Aires. We arrived as customers and left as friends, somewhat overwhelmed by the warmth of our hosts. Oh & you get picked up & dropped off in Buenos Aires, a wonderful few cups of mate & hot chocolate & as many sugary cakes as you can eat. Perfect.

a MUST in Buenos Aires!!. A few of the cast from the Batman Live World Arena Tour were lucky enough to experience this incredible trip! we were greeted warmly, fed VERY well and given an experience that has made this trip unforgetable. Thank you Adrian & Mirian, it was an absolute pleasure.x

The best riding experience of my life.. I left Caballos A la Par feeling that I had ridden a horse for the first time, rather than being a passenger with an illusion of control. This is thanks to the superb instruction, motivation and encouragement from Adrian & Miriam. It was a day filled with boundless enthusiasm, friendship and the sheer joy of riding. I enjoyed it so much I am going again next week.

A must do while in Buenos Aires. After reading through all the fantastic reviews here I figured that Caballos A La Par would be something to consider when we visited BA last month, but I wondered, could it really be as great as everyone gushes here? I have to agree with a resounding yes. It was an excellent experience and a real highlight of our trip. If you want to learn how to 'ride' a horse rather than sit on one while it wanders around — then this is perfect for you. Adrian and Miriam are both passionate about their horses and the experience they provide which is the key to their success. The afternoon was hard work but also very enjoyable and rewarding — we quickly went from zero experience to being able to trot and then cantering through fields. I was amazed at how much we managed to do and on reflection it was because we had such an experienced horseman with us every step of the way, guiding us on our technique and correcting it as soon as he saw it was needed (allthough I have had nightmares of Adrian telling me 'Dave, keep your heels down' since). I cannot see how you would have this kind of experience with some of the cheaper options I saw advertised in BA.If you go make sure you take along your camera — Adrian used ours to take some fantastic photos and videos.

my first "riding" experience. after going on trail rides previously I expected similar. to be sitting on a horse as it walks along its same path. however this really was the first time I saw the difference between sitting on a horse and riding one. adrian is a great teacher and is as passionate about teaching as he is about his horses. this can be seen by the way he has re- designed his saddles and helmets to aid in guiding beginner riders.even though this was initially a girlfriend planned activity I plan to go again before leaving argentina.

The perfect day!. Agree with previous reviews. Amazing day horse riding with my partner. This is a intimate, tailored experience, with great hosts that are motivated by their passion for horses and sharing it with others. Do it!

Perfecto!. Thanks to Adrian & Miriam and the beautiful horses at Caballos A La Par, I had the perfect day on my 30th Birthday :) We were welcomed into the farmhouse with mate and a chat, and both Adrian and Miriam are down to earth people who make you feel at home. I had never had the chance to ride a horse before, so after learning the reigns Adrian lead my partner and I on a walk through the grounds which are just stunning! I quickly learnt to trot, and then with Adrian's guidance and patience I was trotting... Well, Indio was trotting! Adrian also taught me to ride without the reigns on my first ever ride, but I wasn't at all scared because I trusted Indio and Adrian completely.A million thank you's Adrian for making my day such a memorable one - I cannot wait to come back and ride again. I would recommend a ride with Miriam or Adrian to all - this is definitely my highlight of Argentina and BA.

Best of Buenos Aires. Caballos a la Par was to be a day of horseback riding / lessons but turned out to be much more than that. It truly was a unique experience that began when Miriam responded enthusiastically and thoroughly to my email request for information. I was pleasantly surprised at the speed of her response. I booked for my brother and I and should add that I think he agreed because of my interest. We were met promptly and warmly by Miriam at our hotel and she drove us out to the stables. She was informative as well providing us with information about Buenos Aires. We were greeted by Adrian and were I introduced to the Argentine ritual of mate. This alone is unique unto itself. You will see the gourds and straws in most shops but here you will have it explained to you and have the opportunity to partake in something uniquely Argentinian. It is during this time that you will get the chance to know both Miriam and Adrian on a more personal level and feel Adrian's passion for horses. Riding in the park provided a perfect setting for the lessons. We were warned that it would be hard work, but we started as follow the leader trail riders and ended being able to canter comfortably with arms outstretched. Both Miriam and Adrian stressed that they wanted us to connect with our horses and by the end of our time we certainly did. They pushed us only as hard as we were capable and worked to ensure we were better riders than when we started. Their positive energy and encouragement made us continue to strive harder. The day finished with empanadas, cold drinks and more than a few laughs. Regardless of your experience this is a must do in Buenos Aires. Both my brother and I agree it was a highlight of our trip. As with most things in life you will get what you put into it. However Adrian and Miriam will match your effort and then some. For me it was an experience to remember with the added bonus that I gained 2 new friends. Go, you won't be disappointed. Tell them their Canadian brothers sent you.

Lovely horses, great guides, a wonderful day in the country!. As someone who has ridden her whole life, horse trails can be a bit similar in that horses just follow each other blindly. This was completely different. I learnt a new style of riding, and my husband learnt to canter! the horses were well-trained and taken care of, and very good quality. Mirriam and Adrian were so interesting and helpful. The setting of the ride, a National Park, could not have been better, with long smoo0th stretches for cantering, and cool wooded areas. What a great day!

Experienced Rider From Uk A Wonderfull Day. Riding at Caballos A La Par was wonderfull. Adrian was a great teacher and Miriam was really welcoming. As an experienced rider Adrian gave me a free rein to ride at my own pace but was there if I wanted guidence. The horses are fit and well looked after and seem happy. The horse I rode was called Inigo he was sensitive in the best way and I feel lucky to have ridden him. I can highly recomend a ride with Adrian and Miriam, they obviously care about their horses and understand the intracicies of riding well.

Fantastic experience for advanced riders. Going to Caballos as an experienced rider, I was unsure of what to expect. However, I was blown away at how wonderful Miriam and Adrian were. They were both beyond accommodating, and did a great job of quickly assessing my skills and finding an appropriate horse. Coming from years of dressage, riding in the open park was a little overwhelming at first, but in the end you will love it. Not having arena walls to think about is a blessing - you can actually just focus on riding! The horses were incredibly well-trained, and I had more than enough confidence in Adrian's ability to take control if something were to happen (Which it didn't, but as an advanced rider, it's something you appreciate). True hospitality, and a must for any horse lover visiting Buenos Aires. Believe me, you will not find a better experience.

Not just your regular horse ride. If you like horse riding, you will love Caballos A La Par! Miriam and Adrian have created a lovely ranch with well cared for horses. They were able to cater for all levels and provided a very tailored service. So, I was able to canter around the beautiful national park at my leisure, whilst my friend who was relatively new to horse riding got some one-on-one lessons from Miriam and Adrian. There are no dull trail rides with this company! Very personalised and tailored service. But that's not all...we received a bit of the real Brazilian hospitality too with coffee pastries and empanadas! And lovely company too! They were so sweet to go out of their way to find me great vegetarian empanadas too so I wouldn't miss out! Tailored service!!! This was definitely the highlight of my Buenos Aires trip and I would certainly return and visit the ranch if I get a chance.

A day to remember!. A visit to Caballos A La Par is much more than just a horse riding lesson. Chatting with Miriam and Adrian over traditional mate and yummy pastries we learnt about how the riding school had come about and were made to feel completely at ease before meeting the horses and starting our lesson. We were both very much beginners, my husband had never even been on a horse before, but by half way through the lesson we were cantering and by the end we were cantering confidently together through a glade, Adrian filming us from afar. Although we obviously still have a lot to learn, we really felt like we could ride by the end of the lesson, a huge achievement in only 2 hours all thanks to Adrian's focused and reassuring teaching. After the lesson, exhilerated from our achievement and in awe of the beauty of the place, we sat and drank submarinos and beer and ate more pastries whilst chatting to Adrian and Mirian like old friends, a perfect end to a perfect day. If you fancy riding a horse and seeing some of the beautiful countryside around Buenos Aires you must visit Caballos A La Par.Booking and getting there couldn't have been easier either, Miriam was really helpful and let us know everything we needed in advance of our trip and picked us up in downtown Buenos Aires to take us to the stables.

Amazing experience learning how to really ride a horse!. If you're someone that likes to have an 'experience' when you travel - then this really is one of the top 3 things you should do when you visit Buenos Aires. We felt the real genuine warmth coming to see Adrian & Miriam.They really make the experience fit to YOUR needs - which is amazing! We never rode horses before so we were beginners. But Adrian knew that we were 3 guys that were athletic & in shape and could handle more. So he coached us into trying things we may not have usually done... which made our experience so much more memorable.Every step of the way they asked how each of us were doing. If we wanted to push to do more or less - they we agreeable at any time.They even took our cameras along the journey to capture photos and video of our riding adventure. The photos & video were just as amazing - it was as if Adrian had taken video camera training they were so professionally shot!We loved it all - from sharing a Mate before our ride to the end enjoying pastries & a hot submarino. It was a genuine experience we will always cherish.4/22/2012

Went from Beginner to Intermediate in 2 hours. I found Caballos a la par an option much better than going to an estancia and getting a 20 minute horse-ride. This was really personalized and geared towards getting you to be an independent rider. I really loved the company of Adrian and Miriam and used their pick-up and drop-off service, which was worth the extra US$30. Although a tiny bit expensive, it's completely worth it!! I now want to ride when I get back to USA but it will be difficult finding a place to ride in NYC!

Make sure you go. If you have ever riden a horse or wanted to ride make sure you go. Great instructors who are great company. The horses a so well trained and responsive and the park is beautiful. This ride is everything you could want it to be.

Quite simply the best..... Having been lucky enough to ride in different places all over the world I have no hestiation that the Ridoing experience at Caballos a la Par is the very best!Adrian and Miriam are true proffesionals and are exceptionally passionate about the Horses, i thouroughly enjoyed spending time with them both. The horses are quality, excellently schooled and enjoy their work - this is one of the most important factors to me.whether you are a complete novice or have years of experience with horses you can not fail to enjoy this experience - it is well worth the money!

The Best !. Simply the best horseback riding experience in all Argentina! Amazing teachers, great horses, beautiful landscapes: all the ingredients are there to make your day with A la Par an unforgettable one!Adrian and Miriam are lovely hosts, they take the time to get to know you before the lesson, so that all your expectations will be fulfilled (and more!)Adrian is an incredible teacher, obviously passionate about horseback riding, and eager to help you improve. A la Par is a unique place to learn to ride (or improve your riding) while having a great time. Definitely in my top 5 activities to do in Argentina !

Wonderful!. Decided to go horse riding after having read the amazing reviews. I was rewarded by a great experience with well-trained horses and great instructors. Miriam and Adrian are perfect teachers and hosts and made every effort to make the day excellent. The lesson is completely customized to the level of experience and one can learn a lot during the ride. Highly recommended!!

A Dream Come True!. I am still dreaming about my most wonderful horseback riding experience ever! The horses were well trained. The instructor, Adrian was excellent at pairing me with just the right horse for my level of experience. His instructions were easy to follow and before you know it, I was galloping at full speed through an open meadow with my arms in the air. We forded streams, went through forests and hills. I even learned how to stand on top of my horse for a great photo op. Such a beautiful park to ride in. I still love watching the movie of me riding that was given to me at the end of the ride. It was so well priced for such a rich and rewarding experience. I look forward to returning to Argentina to have more lessons.

Finally!. It has taken me 30 years to finally find a place like Caballos A La Par (which, BTW, means horses side by side) I fell in love with riding when i was in my teens, but throughout the years have never been able to find a place that would actually let me RIDE! All it ever was, was boring trail rides with a 30 second trot if i was lucky! Not so at Caballos A La Par! After making sure my daughter and i knew what we were doing, Miriam took us out into the national forest , and for 3 hours, let us trot and canter, and enjoy the beauty of riding! I was in heaven! Miriam is sweet, professional, and will welcome you with open arms. Her horses are well trained and gentle too. So if you are looking for a 1 of a kind horseback riding experience, look no further, and ride with Caballos A La Par!!

A private lesson of horse riding you wont want to miss. Caballos a la Par is probably not the cheapest option in town for horse riding. But after having spent a day with Adrian, I can assure you it is worth every penny if you fancy real horse riding activity and being on your own with an instructor. Adrian is giving very clear instructions which help you improving your posture and gaining better control of the horse. Even as a beginner with little experience, you may walk, trot and canter during the lesson. It was amazing to see how much I could learn in a days time! Carry a camera with you so Adrian or Miriam can take videos of yourt posture - it helps a lot! Overall, I felt rather like a friend than a customer!

A nice break from the noisy city. When you are in Argentina you really should go horseback riding. I hadn't been riding for years but I wanted to try if I could still do it and I'm glad I choose 'A la par'.I was picked up in Buenos Aires with another couple exactly on time and we drove half an hour to a nice ranch just outside town where we saw beautiful horses waiting for us. We were warmly welcomed by Miriam and Adrian. We sat down and had mate (argentinian type of tea) while they took their time to get to know us and to explain the mate-ritual.
