After that we got on our horses. I was riding Lindo, a very happy and sweet horse. I rode with Miriam while the other couple went with Adrian. Miriam taught me the Argentinian way of riding which is way different than the dutch riding style. A pleasant suprise for me was that she is Dutch as well so I was able to speak my own language. If you have some experience already you can canter and trot as much as you want while Miriam gives good advices. You won't be riding on a trail, but in a park between the trees and on meadows which is beautiful! Afterwards we had some beers with the other couple who went with Adrian and shared experiences. They were really excited as well and had been cantering while they had never been on a horse before in their lifes!I definately recommend 'A la par' for people with and without riding experience.

Excellent experience. Highly recommend it.. I highly recommend Caballos a La Par. The horses are high quality and clearly well treated and well trained.It is much more than simply a horse ride. Adrian and Miriam go out of their way to teach novice riders. With one single lesson my 10 year old daughter is way more confident than she was and riding much better.In short: This is a professional operation, run by great people and they really have high quality horses. It is a bit pricey but worth every penny. Keep in mind that to maintain horses in great health does not come cheap anywhere in the world.I recomend it for both. Begginners and experienced riders.

More than horse riding - precious memories!!!. I join all the people saying good words about Miriam and Adrian, they both are great instructors and beautiful charismatic people. The moment you see them, you are very much at ease and feel like you are good buddies and later you feel like you are good friends. To be completely honest, I enjoyed the hourse riding class already before I got on a hourse:) We chatted for a while with the hosts over mate tea, getting to know each other, which was a lot of fun.The horse riding is a lot of learning, but a lot of excitment as well cause you get through all stages from keeping posture and learning the very basics to cantoring and trotting which you often see just in movies:) I keep playing my video made by Miriam and it makes me so proud that it's actually me on a horse trotting so fast throgh the beautiful valley...a few hours ago being a complete beginner who tried to keep a balance and not fall off of a hourse:) Big credit to the instructors, I must admit! And finally, anyone who meets Miriam and Adrean can tell they don't take it as a business, they just love the hourses and enjoy sharing this love with others!

Horse riding for 2 novices. The highlight at the end of our stay in Argentina. Miriam and Adrian treated us like good friends and we were soon on horseback, out in parkland watching out for low branches and actually steering our horses! It was so different to just sitting on a horse in a line of others on a trek. We got to canter and had a real tour on horseback. Adrian was strict enough to get the best out of the time we had. We would love to go back and be more adventurous another time.

Muy Bueno!. As a rider, I had been looking forward to this trip all week and it did not disappoint. My husband is less experienced and I sensed a bit of apprehention as he had taken a fall at a previous holiday trail ride (they were badly organised). There was nothing to fear, Adrian is a brilliant host and passionate instructor. Miriam came to pick us up at the hotel and we had a good chat with her about the horses on the way, there was one other guest riding with Miriam that day. We enjoyed mate with them before we set off to ride Indio and La Pinta. The countryside is great, and was welcome after being in the city all week. We had a fantastic ride and Colin was cantering with heels down by the end. Adrian was great at keeping us on track on how to get the most out of the horses. I ride a lot back home English style and do 5/6 hour rides where we are galloping flat out. The riding here is very different and I had to adapt my style, so I was learning all the time which was great. I had a fun excercise cantering with no reins, while doing arm excercises. I could head off on my own while Adrian was working with Colin. All in all it was a brilliant day out and made the end of our trip special. We finished with Empanadas (vegetarian ones too) and beer. I would highly recommend this for both riders and non riders.

Horse riding like a real gaucho!. It was a perfect day in the pampa, riding through the lush grasslands and enjoying the company of our hosts Adrian and Miriam. In addition to being mindful trainers, guiding us where needed (always needed since I'm a beginner), they are heartwarming hosts who spent hours with us chatting about Argentina, something that I didn't expect but left a lasting impression that will make me want to return the next time I'm there.The best part about the riding was that the horses were so well trained that even a dummy like me trotted, cantered, and was just about to gallop (so I keep thinking), when I was reminded that form is more important than speed.You'll have an amazing time and a great memory. Absolutely recommend this place.

What a fantastic experience. Having seen other reviews on TripAdvisor I thought we would give this a go. It was fantastic!!!!! I can honestly say if we had any more time in BA we would have gone again.Adrian and Miriam are such lovely, genuine people and clearly love what they do. Both are excellent instructors. I couldn't believe how far I came along in just a few short hours. The ride was great, our horses were perfect for us and sitting chatting before and after made the whole experience feel like visiting friends. I have had very little experience riding while my husband is a very good rider. This didn't matter a the ride was adapted to suit both of us.If you have any time in BA at all come here - you won't be disappointed!

Great family outing. Adrian and Miriam provided a great outing for our family on the last day of our Argentine trip. We were pleased that the excursion turned into a real learning experience and not just a walk in the park. Everyone was cantering by the end of our session and the kids considered this one of the highlights of our visit to Buenos Aires.

Our best day in Buenos Aires. With no experience what so ever, we went to Caballo a La par hoping just to learn how to make the horse stop. What we didnt expect was the amazing service and a great teacher. We felt more like guests than paying customers, and as a teacher Adrian was strict, but just the right amount. We learned so much more than we ever could have imagined, and we have decided that if we have time we will absolutely go back. I would recomend this to anyone going to Buenos Aires!

A great day with a couple of horses. Firstly: the service is awesome! They picked us up from downtown Buenos Aires at around 3 PM, offered us some maté before riding and some pastries after riding. In the end they took us back to the center at around 9 PM and we had our well deserved rest. For students it wasn't very cheap, but when you go you will definitely get your money's worth of fun.I'm 22 years old and I was at Caballos a la Par with my wife. We had the most awesome teacher Miriam that really pushed us to try our best. It was great that Miriam offered to take my camera off my hands and she took as many pictures as possible. The best part was the fact that she realized that our camera could take video. She took videos of our cantering and everything! Not only did we get videos to remember the place forever, but also we got feedback from Adrian about how we did. I had never even touched a horse in my life so this was something completely new for me, but I was going around 20 km/h with the horse on my first day! The weather was amazing, the horses were kind, well trained and the place was huge to say the least. My wife enjoyed it so much, Miriam was laughing at her for having such a big smile on her face. :)We would definitely want to go back there if we have the time. I strongly recommend this activity to anyone from a baby to a senior citizen, go there and test your limits!

A Couple "CowPokes" from Wyoming learned some new tricks.. My husband and I were in Buenos Aires and tried this adventure. We have been riding horses since were were children, but recently only occassionally. This was definitely an enjoyable, learning experience. Adrian and Miriam were very welcoming yet professional. The horses were also professional, in that I mean they pay attention to your directions, they don't just transport you down a path. The saddles they use don't have saddle horns as we were used to, but Adrian soon had us relying on balance instead of holding the saddle horn, so we were paying more attention to the horses rhythm. This was the learning experience for us. The whole visit felt very safe, but authentic. This was by far the best riding experience we have had of this type and we wish it were closer so we could do it again. Thank you Adrian and Miriam for such a wonderful day.

One fine time!. We made contact with Miriam in advance throught their website, and she picked us up right on time at our hotel in Retiro. After a drive of about 40 minutes, we arrived at the ranch and met Adrian. We sat down over a gourd of mate and talked awhile so that Adrian could find out what we were looking for. I wanted a lesson, Tia wanted an adventure, we got both! The horses Adrian selected were well trained and perfect for what we needed. Adrian gave me frequent instruction as we rode and eventually had me cantering without reins! This for a guy (me) who had not ridden for 30 years! They were kind and generous and open to any question we asked. I highly recommend them! Tia will be posting photos soon. Craig

No one else could have gotten me to canter!. I had to have been their client from hell! :-) I do not like horses and was there only because my husband insisted. I had been on a horse before, but only those horrible touristy things where your horse if half dead and they just go in a line. At Caballos A La Par, you get individual attention beyond expectations. Both Mariam and Adrian are not only excellent and patient teachers, but they listen to you and what your concerns/needs are. They spend time meeting with you - and to get the city "rush" out of your system! - before even getting on a horse. My husband did better than I did (NOT tough!) but I never felt pushed to do more than I was confortable with - but pushed enough to allow me the confort to try. I think that the horses are specially bread to be brilliant. Mine knew exactly what I needed and I do NOT beleive it was my skill!! :-) We are going again next week. Can't say I love horses yet, but I now feel I able to start to communicate with them. Huge step for me. Thank you Mariam and Adrian.

Do it.. My wife and I recently retired and somehow decided it would be interesting to learn to speak Spanish. We opted to go to Buenos Aires for about 5 weeks and take language lessons there. We also wanted to use the opportunity to see and do as much as we could to enjoy our time in Buenos Aires. We checked TripAdvisor for things to do in Buenos Aires. Popping up number one was Horseback Riding Stables (Caballos A La Par). They had great reviews. My first thought: they must be paying someone to post these reviews. I was wrong. I agree with all of the prior positive posts. Second thought - my wife will kill me; she is petrified of riding horses. I’m still alive, and she didn’t file for divorce.First, aside from the riding, Miriam and Adrian understand that any business is providing a service and the provider needs to do all that is reasonable to provide a top-notch experience. They go out of their way to do that. From timely responses to emails, to offering advice on other activities in the area, providing snacks before and after the lesson, and just being wonderful advocates for their passion - horses!Adrian and Miriam were very understanding about my wife’s fears and did everything possible to assure her should would be able to handle it. With Adrian’s and Miriam’s gentle coxing she was able to learn how to control her Indigo and canter.My wife and I have gone horseback riding a few times, on prior trips. Those sessions consisted of getting on the horse, staying in line, following the horse in front , and dismounting on return to the stable. The difference between those experiences and the experience we had with Caballos A La Par is remarkable. At the outset they teach you the proper way to get on a horse, hold the reins, position your feet and legs, maintain correct posture and most importantly control the horse. Not at all difficult. But those simple techniques provide the confidence that you can learn to ride. Give it a try.

If you want to learn to ride a horse, Caballos A La Par is the place you are looking for!. My girlfriend and I love horses and when we are on vacation we always try to do a bit ofriding. So far every time we rode it was on a trail and always one horse following the other. After reading the great reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to take a lesson with Adrian and Miriam at Caballos A La Par. It turned out to be the best experience of our trip to Argentina!We were surprised by how much we learnt. Because of the instruction from Adrian andMiriam we felt in control of the horses for the first time and like we were actually ridinginstead of just sitting on the horses. At the end of the lesson we were walking, trottingand cantering wherever we wanted. It was so different from our earlier horseback ridingexperiences and so much more fun! If you want to feel what it is like to ride a horse and not just be a passenger on a horse, you have to come here. Adrian took pictures and videos during our lesson and when we watch them we still can’t believe everything we did! Adrian and Miriam, thank you for the amazing day!

Caballos A La Par. I completed a beginners lesson on Friday, February 24, 2012 with Miriam.A La Par arranged for a driver to pick me up in San Telmo at 10:30am. If you are coming from Palermo or somwhere equally as far, take the subway as traffic is horrendous during this time. The driver, Hector, drove the 45 minute route from Buenos Aires to the polo fields of "Caballos a La Par". Upon arriving, Miriam sat down with me and drank mate. She told some interesting stories explaining how she went from Holland to working at a horse ranch in Argentina. We then discussed the beginners lesson for the day.Miriam is a wonderful teacher who has a lot of patience as well as experience riding. During the 2-hour solo "beginners: lesson, we covered a great deal. By the end of the lesson I was able to cantor on the horse, "Lindo". We celebrated the end of the lesson with freshly baked empanadas from a nearby restaurant. On a side note: My camera broke and Miriam was kind enough to take pictures and video-tape me riding. She then dropped the discs off at my hotel in Palermo even though it was out of her way. Empanadas, mate, pictures (bring your own camera just in case), drive to and from Buenos Aires were all included in the lesson price!Make sure you bring cash to the lesson! There are no ATMs within a 45 minute radius of the ranch! Overall, a great experience!

Fantastic day out. My husband and I chose to do this activity as I used to ride horses as a child and I thought it would be something different and fun to do on our holiday. Miriam was fantastic in handling our booking she responded promptly with complete information. Unfortunately the weather was foul on the first day we had booked. We received a phone call early in the morning and she was very apologetic. She offered as to rebook for the next day and called us in the morning to advise the weather was better and we would proceed. The pick up location was very central. Miriam was warm and welcoming and makes you feel instantly comfortable. Adrian is also lovely and clearly very passionate about horseriding. It was nice to sit down and drink mate with him before we set off. The riding was great fun and Adrian provides lots of instruction. By the end of the day we were both cantering and having a terrific time. I think this activity can be enjoyed by all experience levels and ages. I would highly recommend this activity.

Don't miss this! Feel good experience!. If you are tired of touristy excursions, cheesy trail rides and inauthentic experiences then this is the place for you. Not only did we have an excellent riding adventure but we also felt as if we were welcomed guests at Adrian's ranch. My daughter and I try to fit in a horseback ride on each vacation. However, we are by no means experienced riders. By the end of our session at Caballos A La Par, we discovered a new and exciting confidence.We were picked up at our hotel in BA and enjoyed a delightful 30 minute drive. Miriam, a co-owner, was a kind and interesting driver. When we arrived we sat down with Adrian and he offered us some mate tea. He explained the customs and etiquette of drinking mate and while we were enjoying it we all got to know each other a little bit. After "sizing us up" Adrian matched us with the horse he felt suited us best. We were thrilled that it was just me, my daughter and Adrian heading out. What great attention we were getting!Forget everything you thought you knew about riding a horse. Adrian started with how to hold the reins, what angle the feet should be and posture. He was tough but kind and in no time at all we were shaping up. It was wonderful to canter freely through the national park. We covered a lot of ground. He taught us how to ride with confidence, control and technique. Adrian had our camera and took plenty of pictures and videos. He is an incredible teacher with a real passion for what he does and a desire to share that passion with anyone who is interested. Following our lengthy ride, we gathered around the table again to enjoy delicious empanadas and cold cerveza. We talked leisurely and no one was in a hurry to call it a day. We left feeling as if we had new friends. What a great day!

So well taken care of and without any rush to quickly end the program.. We experienced a horse riding program that was so well taken care of right from the beginning until the very end. Surprised to encounter a dutch speaking instructor at the meeting point, we quickly learnt that was just a coincidence, but a nice and comforting suprise for us dutch visitors. She introduced herself to us as Miriam and brought us to the ranch, meanwhile having a pleasant conversation on the city, its people and its culture. Both Miriam and Adrian, the instructor who took us horse riding are very laid-back and easy going. Adrian is a persistant and firm instructor, but even so nice and sympathetic in comforting you 'that you sure can ride a horse', 'make him listen to you' and indeed, we were amazed at the progress that we've made during the couple of hours of horse riding. It is a big plus that you go out riding in the free nature. And boy do you have proof to show your friends and family back home. Take your camera or smart phone with you. Adrian will make sure to take some great pictures and videos. You may not believe it yourself once you got home, but really it is you in the saddle with your hands high above your head while your horse is wildly cantering. Believe me, you do not doubt yourself when Adrian summons you to do this, because his calmth and faith makes you easily follow his instructions, not questioning yourself. Besides that you are so well taken care of (drinks and sweets included), you are not rushed through the program. Also, you will have loads of fun between yourself. Which is worth the experience already.

Four Hooves Up!. An absolute must-do experience for anyone - novice or expert - looking to escape the city for an afternoon! Easily one of our most memorable days in Buenos Aires, Miriam & Adrian went out of their way to be sure we had a great riding experience. We were a group of three beginners with less than four collective rides under our belt, but by the end of the day, Adrian had us cantering and riding with confidence. He's an incredible teacher who, thankfully, demands as much from students as he does from his expertly trained horses. If you've ever wanted to learn to ride, this is the guy to teach you.Todd

Great fun, great tuition and an all round top afternoon. After an informal get together with Adrian and Miriam and an American/French couple, Miriam took me off for my 1 to 1 lesson. We started slowly and gently built up the speed and my confidence with the horse. After an hour, I was cantering, not perfectly, but not bad for a semi beginner. Miriam taught in a fun manner and it was great to have her total attention and guidance. By the end of the lesson, I felt confident, and the most confident I have ever felt on a horse. 10 days later, in Paraty in Brazil, I went on anothe r horse ride, was given the 'difficult' horse, and felt 100% confident managing the horse through the tuitition Miriam provided. I would recommend Caballos A La Par 100%.

Not to be missed while in Buenos Aires. Our travel agent found Caballos a la Par as my friend Ralph and I wanted to go horseback riding in Argentina. What a find! We were warmly greeted by Adrian and Miriam and Adrian prepared mate which we all shared in a communal experience. We then went out for a ride with Adrian, who is an accomplished horseman, an incomparable teacher, and an insightful psychologist. Adrian coaxed us, two old geezers who rode horses in our youth but have been 'rusty' for a long time, into cantering with grace and style. In between our runs, we discussed horses and how to balance the stress in our lifes. Adrian and Miriam take great care of the horses and the horses know how to take care of the riders. Bring a small camera so that Adrian can take your pictures/videos while you ride. And do not be afraid even if you are a beginner or haven't ridden in a while. You will depart Caballos a la Par feeling accomplished as well as having experienced a highlight of your trip to Argentina!

One for the books. Caballos a la Par is truly an amazing experience! Even the beginning is organized so well. You get a pick up in Buenos Aires. They take you to this amazing place. Arriving at the estancia is like arriving at a friends place. Adrian and Miriam invite you into their kitchen and serve you the traditional drink mate and some snacks. After carefully selecting a horse for you they take you to the reserve. I was just by myself, so I only went with Miriam. It was so incredible! I've had some bad experiences in the past with horse back riding, so I was a little bit apprehensive at first. However, Miriam and Adrian have the capability to give you the confidence and trust to ride a horse; even cantering without hands! They reminded me on how great it is to ride a horse. It was such a lovely day! One you'll never forget...

Outback adventure!. My girlfriend and I had an amazing one on one experience riding through the Argentinean outback. Both of us were first timers, but that didn't seem to matter as the instructors were helpful and very accommodating to our abilities. Would definitely recommend if you want to give horse riding a go whilst in Argentina. Staff are very friendly and the horses are amazing!

A Magical Day. Incredible - Don't Miss This!. This was one of the highlights of our trip. We were in great hands with Adrian and Miriam. They are so passionate about what they do and this shows in every detail. They love teaching people how to ride and showing this beautiful landscape. They were beyond welcoming, and tailored this day to our interests and experiences. The horses are beautiful, happy, and well-kept.. I grew up riding and my boyfriend is a beginner. I was a bit worried this at first because I wanted to ride fast and my boyfriend preferred to walk. Because of Adrian's lesson, this was no problem. We rode beside him through forests and fields, and he gave us riding tips the whole say. Adrian taught us both so much, that by the end, we were both cantering through a field with our hands off the reins. Adrian is a great photographer as well and will capture the special moments of the ride. Make sure to bring a camera and to wear plenty of sunscreen, especially on your arms. Wow. This was a wonderful, unforgettable day!

amazing. This was one of our favorite activities in Buenos Aires. Adrian and Miriam are wonderful hosts, and very enthusiastic about spreading their intimate knowledge of horses. The one on one lessons were amazing, and we felt so comfortable with our horses at the end of the adventure. Not to be missed!!

Highlight of my trip to Argentina. Though the class was given in a very relaxed way, I really feel that I learned more during this ride than during all other classes I had put together. Miriam really challenged me to improve my posture and riding, unlike a ride I did on a ranch outside of BsAs, which was basically walking for an hour. And it was fun! The park was beautiful and it was great to be out of the city for an afternoon. I still feel proud on how much cantering I did and how well I was doing (proof is in the videos Miriam took of me!) I found the service from the welcome with mate and facturas until departure very hospitable. Most important: the horses are very well cared for. Thank you Adrian and Miriam! I'll definitely come back!

An Amazing experience for a couple of city girls!!. I first heard about Caballos A La Par via trip advisor. Reading all of the rave reviews I needed to check it out for myself. While emailing back and forth with Mirium, my enthusiasm for the trip grew. It was very easy to communicate and coordinate a time and place for them to pick us up in Buenos Aires. Hector, their usual driver was sick, so Adrian (the horse whisperer) came and picked us up. The ride out to the country was only 30 minutes long and filled with great conversation. Upon our arrival to the stables, Mirium and Adrian had us sit, relax and enjoy some traditional mate and biscuits. It was a very welcoming atmosphere from the very beginning. Once we were ready we went outside and met the horses we were to ride. Neither of us had any riding skills what so ever, however by the end of the day we were both cantering. Adrian's teaching skills were excellent. I am pretty easy going and can learn quickly. My girlfriend on the other hand is a bit more stubborn and gets frustrated easily. There was a point where she wanted to give up and cry. He was great in dealing with both our personalities in different ways. And she was also cantering by the end of the day. I was excited to be able to actually ride a horse freely in the state park (which is huge). Adrian was also very kind to video us and take pictures. So if you want to capture these moments on film bring a smaller camera you can put in your pocket, not a huge SLR. We ended the day winding down with a cold beer and pastries. This experience was definitely the highlight of my trip to Argentina. A MUST do for some city girls who wanted to be cowgirls for a day!

A great Experience. Two of us had a mornings ride here and had a great time. Neither of us had rode a horse in years, so started off slightly apprehensive, however Adrian quickly made us feel at ease, and by the end of the ride it almost felt natural!The morning session was long enough for to cover what felt like a decent distance across the lovely parkland.Would definitely recommend this as great trip outside of BA, however we did end up aching for a couple of days afterwards!

The highlight of Buenos Aires!!!. I came having zero background with horses, and I was a little nervous. I left feeling completely confident in a gallop: standing, sitting, and even letting go of the reigns. This was all possible because of the great team of Adrian and Miriam. From the start their hospitality sets me at ease. When it came time to ride, I was relaxed and happy to be surrounded by friends. Adrian has a real talent for picking highly sociable horses that compensate for the rider's lack of confidence. Adrian's instructions make up for the difference and in the course of the lesson a confident relationship develops between you and your horse. Make time in your schedule to head out to Caballos A La Par, you will remember it for the rest of your life.

Take the chance to get out of the city and experience life in the argentinian countryside. We had a fantastic day with Adrian, Miriam, Kirsty and of course Indio and Pintado. Adrian is a welcoming host, is knowledgeable about the area and of course all of the horses and riding techniques. We had a very personalised experience for both of us. My boyfriend had never ridden before and I have been riding for years yet Adrian had him riding through the park in no time. The attention and care they give the horses is wonderful, a truly wonderful experience for both of us. Thank you!

What a great day. Met Miriam In a coffee shop in town, Drove out to the farm - she was very informative about the area, met Adrian and he welcomed us with some Mate interesting drink -- thought it was yummy!Introduced us to the Horses and we went off for a few hours.....it was truly amazing . Could not recommend this highly enough - a must do when you visit Buenos Aires!! Thanks Mirian and Adrian.

Pure enjoyment. An excellent way to spend a day in Buenos Aires. Having never been riding before i was struck by the infectious enthusiasm of Adrian. Couldnt have wished for a better introduction. The whole thing typified the perfect Argentian experience for me and two friends, beautiful setting, made to feel so welcome, would definately recommend, and truly hope to re visit

A fantastic experience not to be missed!. I was visiting Buenos Aires on business and wanted to do something a bit different to the usual sightseeing tours in the city - Caballos A La Par did not disappoint! From the moment I emailed my enquiry about my booking, Miriam and Adrian's professional yet relaxed and friendly manner was quite apparent. After being advised what I needed to bring (jeans/trainers and a camera!) I was picked up by Miriam from my hotel and driven the half hour out to the stables where we were met by Adrian and offered pastries and 'mate'. It was then out to meet my horse - Lindo, a real gentleman! Being used to English style riding, I was given tuition in Western style riding before we left for our ride in the beautiful surrounding parkland. Miriam was my instructor/guide - she was encouraging, patient and knowledgeable and I learnt so much in the time we were out - not just about riding, but about the surrounding area and life in Argentina in general. Nothing was too much trouble - it was all about what I wanted from my visit. Lindo was just amazing - safe yet responsive - a perfect choice for someone unused to Western riding! On arrival back at the stables I was once more offered refreshments and a chance to look at the photos and videos Miriam had taken during our ride before heading back to the city. I would really recommend this half day 'adventure' - its a wonderful way to experience the beautiful scenery of Argentina as well as the friendly hospitality from Miriam and Adrian - you won't be disappointed!

a wonderful taste of Argentina. Adrian and Miriam are wonderful hosts and make you spend an afternoon forgetting about Buenos Aires, being with horses. Adrian is actually such an iconic Argentinian to me. We loved that he shared 'mate' with us. We then rode with him, and his enthusiasm, energy and spirit were amazing.My wife had never ridden a horse and I hadn't in more than 20 years. Yet Adrian made us feel really good, making us make rapid progress so that we were able to feel that we were truly horse riding. Adrian is really good a tuning his directions and rhythm to each and the fact they take people always in individual or very small groups guarantees that we always get his full attention.This is really an incredible experience, from beginners to more advanced, and one of the experiences we had that felt the most authentic in Argentina.

Amazing experience with my girlfriend!!. we had a great experience at caballos a la par. Nice people, great horses and lovely environment. started with a traditional mate and then went horseriding for at least 2 or 3 hours. you can do whatever you want, you get some advice to add to your skills and get some nice beer in the end. a great day to escape the city for a day!

Amazing experience not to be missed!. This was one of our favorite activities in Buenos Aires. Adrian and Miriam are wonderful hosts, and very enthusiastic about spreading their intimate knowledge of horses. The one on one lessons were amazing, and we felt so comfortable with our horses at the end of the adventure. Not to be missed!!

made with passion. Probably the most wonderful surprise I ever had during a trip.Anyone who have ever had an experience with a horse can see that those people just love what they are doing and this creates a fantastic atmosphere in the place.you shouldn't miss that opportunity...

A MOST AMAZING AND WONDERFUL HORSE RIDING EXPERIENCE. after finishing a business trip to South America i had a few days spare in Buenos Aires and was told about Caballos A La Par and thought i would be nice to do some riding in Argentina.As we have our own horses in Australia and having been to riding school in the past I was not sure wha to expect.It was on of the best experiences I have had.Adrian is the perfer horseman , we rode along tracks and thru bush, he let me pick the pace and as his horses were so great to canter we did so most places, and would have do more cantering except for my not being fit enough.Adrian and Miriam are good hosts they are casual but busines like in the running of the riding.I cannot express how good a time you will have if you are after a riding experience in Argentina from Caballos La Par , because you will not believe me unless to try it for yourself.no matter if you are old hand at horses or someone who has never ridden before i say give Adrian a try, you will not be disappointed .

A “rare” opportunity - not to be missed. It may not be difficult to encounter a skilled horseman like Adrian, but an expert like him who is so dedicated to “spread the knowledge” of equestrian, instead of keeping it to himself, is rare. He is a “gifted teacher” who exerts his best effort to transfer to you as much skills as possible, even in times when you want to give up. As a beginner, I had one-on-one lessons with Adrian. After merely two lessons, I was able to canter an unfamiliar horse in rough terrain in another ranch in El Chalten --- I think this proves that it’s not just Adrian’s well-trained horses that do the magic, I actually “learnt” and could apply these skills on other horses. That is TRUE satisfaction! Besides, Adrian’s relationship with his horses would just make every horse-lover envy. His ability to communicate with them amazed me. During the lessons, I can feel that his horses do not only obey him, they totally love him! If you have the desire to learn horse-riding like I do, don’t miss this opportunity. I guarantee you won’t regret one moment of it! *** MIRIAM DESERVES APPLAUSE! ***Miriam is also a horsewoman not to be overlooked. My friend, who swore she would never ever do horse-riding again after having a bad first experience in another country, was thrilled after with her lesson with Miriam. Miriam’s gentle but effective directions have helped my friend to gain confidence with horses. Within just two hours, she was able to canter with a big smile! Moreover, Miriam is also a great organizer. Her excellent time management skills enabled me to take one final lesson on the same day I depart for my home country --- without haste or worry. I truly enjoyed every moment in A La Par.

An Incredible Experience!. We booked a ride with Caballos A La Par after reading about them in Lonely Planet. We also saw the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor and thought it looked like a unique opportunity to experience some of the countryside outside of Buenos Aires. Both my wife and I have extremely minimal horse riding experience but we were assured that this would not be a problem at all. We scheduled a ride and were met by Marian in Buenos Aires. She was a friendly and fascinating person, and we had a great chat with her as we had coffee and then drove to the Caballos A La Par ranch. Upon arrival, Adrian greeted us with open arms. We found ourselves sitting around a table enjoying mate with Adrian and Marian and chatting about Argentina!After our visit and refreshments, we received a brief riding lesson from Adrian and then set off on a ride with Marian. The national park we rode through was spectacular and offered varied terrain and scenery. Instead of riding on a set trail, we were able to explore any area we wished and to practice trotting and cantering in meadows. We wanted pictures, so Marian took a camera and shot great photos and videos during the ride. We had a wonderful ride over 2 hours. When we returned to the ranch, Adrian was again waiting with refreshments. We chatted more about the experience and his philosophy. He said that his passion is horses and he wants to offer an environment where he can share this with others. He stated that they like doing private rides because it allows each group to focus on what they want to do and at their own pace. It was so refreshing to see someone who was more concerned with the individual’s experience as opposed to maximizing profits through large groups. His passion and sincerity are evident in every aspect of the experience. If you are even toying with the idea of doing this, you need to book a ride now! While you won’t be a gaucho by the end of the ride, it will be an experience you’ll never forget.

Fantastic experience. We had so much fun riding the horses! We were absolute horse riding beginners but after only one hour we were riding like the wind. Miriam and adrian are great instructors who made us feel very welcome. Highly recommended.

Great riding experience. Adrian is a gracious host and excellent riding instructor. I might even say a horse whisperer. Miriam, graciously handled the arrangements and told me where to meet the driver that took me to the location. I arrived to find a clean but humble stable. There I meet Elias, who made mate for us. We sat around a table and passed the mate gourd and discussed my riding skills, or lack thereof, and what I wanted from my riding experience. I was fitted with half chaps (gaiters) and riding hat and taken to meet my mount; a beautiful white horse named Lindo. Adrian's mount was a handsome Anglo-quarter named Pintado. After basic instructions on how to start, stop and steer Lindo we set off. The first few hundred meters of the trail were unimpressive. However, when we reached the pasture everything changed, The pastures and country side we rode through were very beautiful. Dirt lanes shaded by trees and large open spaces bordered by wild hedge rows. Adrian gave a steady stream of riding instruction and coaching. He is an amazing teacher and made the whole thing a delight. Within an hour, I was riding at a slow cantor. Lindo was very tolerant of my inexperience. With each riding exercise, I became more confident and improved my balance and rhythm. Lindo let me know each time I improved my skill. By the end of my three hour riding experience. I was ecstatic. I cantered Lindo the majority of the way back to the stable. I felt like I was in my very own Western movie. I was certain I looked like John Wayne or Clint Eastwood and expected the MGM logo with the lion to appear on the horizon at any moment. The photos that Adrian took of me don't match the image in my mind. Lindo lives up to his name in the photos. I, however, just look like a grinning me and nothing like John Wayne. But it doesn't matter because it was the best experience of my nine days in Argentina. I would highly recommend Adrian, his crew and his horses to anyone. It's been over a month and I am still grinning and talking about fantastic and memorable riding experience. Muchos Gracias Adrian

The Best Day in BA. Miriam and Adriene made our first day in BA our best day! My husband, daughter and I went out for the day on Saturday and had the most amazing time enjoying the coutryside and beautiful park with Adriene and Miriam. They were able to tailor our ride to all of our experience levels- I am an expert rider, my daughter is not and my husband had never been on a horse! Adriene even got my husband into a full cantor!There are no rings here, all open space riding and so worth the time spent with a wonderful group of people!We were celebrating a birthday and they took special effort to make sure we had an amazing time. Our daughter keeps asking if we can go back and we keep telling her, we can't wait to go back too.. This is a must when in BA...

Amazing experience with amazing people (and horses!). We spent the day out here yesterday after my friend found Caballos A La Par -- in short: it was simply an amazing experience. I grew up in New York and never spent any time around any animals and have always wanted to ride a horse (but couldn't bring myself to pay a ton of money for the pony rides that you get at most other places). I wouldn't have been more thrilled with my experience. Adrian and Miriam were great at gauging our skill level (read: none for me) and tailoring our experience to our needs - it was my first time on a horse and we walked, trotted, and cantered and felt comfortable and safe the whole time, and were never bored. Miriam and Adrian were excellent hosts as well -- so much so that I almost forgot about the horses! I really felt at home and felt as if I was learning from friends rather than participating in a business transaction. We started with some mate and ended with a beer, and had great conversation the whole time. Adrian also snapped a ton of photos and videos, which he gave us at the end, as a great souvenir. I cannot recommend this place enough!

Fantastic day with lovely people and lovely horses. This was a surprise birthday holiday for my partner.Having researched things to do in Buenos Aires this seemed like a fun thing to go and do even though our horse riding experience was virtually zero.From e mailing Mirriam to set it up,being collected in the city and being safely returned ,everything was perfect.Mirriam and Adrian treated us like friends rather than clients all day.Being slightly apprehensive at first about how long it would be before one of us fell off,it wasnt long before Adrian had us doing things that would have seemed impossible.Cantering at speed with arms in the air was a thrilling and satisfying experience.The hospitality was first class,on arrival sharing a mata to having delicious pastries and a beer afterwards.We would recommend this day to anyone,even those with limited interest in horses.A day out of the city in beautiful parkland is a delight on its own.We hope to return to BA and we would definitely book this again.
always a joy!. if one needs a day out of the city, that is the best to do , relax, enjoy nature and tranquility! best of best, thank you , lela

Worth every penny!. I really wanted to go horseriding in the "campo" but then without following the 1st horse lined up with other tourists... And this was just perfect!!! Me and my friend were being picked up from Buenos Aires with a private driver from Caballos a la Par. When you drive into the campo, there is this really nice relaxing atmosphere... Adrian and Miriam are waiting for you with 'dulces' and something to drink... there is no hurry with anything, and with a little talk Adrian will find the perfect horse for you. My friend, Adrian and I were only with the 3 of us riding through this beautifull countryside... it was really amazing! Adrian takes the time for you to learn you how to ride your horse. My friend is a really good horserider but he could still learn her how to ride 'gaucho' style... For me it was a great experience to go in 'galop' and ride so fast on this horse in 'the campo' without any tracks or without any other people...You really feel FREE! It is not really cheap the experience, but if you see how the horses are treated, that you have a private guide/teacher and a private driver that takes you there and brings you home, and you have something to eat and to drink... Then it is not expensive at all! One of the best things I did in BA!

The Best Riding Experience. I had one free day on a business trip to Buenos Aires and after reading some reviews on tripadvisor I decided to go to the A La Par ranch. I had never ridden a horse in my life but it was something that I always wanted to do. My adventure started with a hotel pick up by the warm and friendly Miriam who filled me in on what the morning would look like and kept me laughing all the way to the ranch. At the ranch, we had some traditional Argentinian tea called 'mate'. The drinking of mate is serious business in Argentina and Miriam filled me in on the proper way to do it. We sipped mate while waiting on Adrian to finish some training routines one of the horses. I felt as though I was part of the daily ranch routine and I LOVED it!Once Adrian arrived I quickly realized that he loved what he did just as much as Miriam and had the same ability to put you at ease and make you a part of their life for a day. He gave me some riding basics, suited me up with the proper riding gear and we headed out to the horses!Adrian mounted up and gave me some practical riding instructions and then Miriam and I mounted up and headed out.I rode a solid stallion called 'Indio' who would eat any grass within reach and as we rode of at a walking pace I became acquainted with the A La Par method (which means 'side by side'). This has to be the best way to learn to ride. Miriam constantly gave me pointers, corrections and lots of encouragement as we rode throughout the morning. I enjoyed every second of it! Miriam is an absolutely incredible teacher as only someone who loves riding and sharing the joy of riding could be. It was a gorgeous day and we walked, trotted and cantered through lovely scenery while Miriam progressed my lesson.In the end I was thrilled that I never fell but in fact was able to canter without holding the reins and even tried riding Miriam's steed which was a bit taller and slimmer and with a penchant for running (i.e. more difficult to ride).This is on my top ten of travel experiences ever!

Rewarding horseback riding adventure on experienced horses and caring instructors.. TripAdvisor Buenos Aires Things to Do ranking for Buenos Aires places Caballos a la Par #1 which convinced us to book the day with Adrian. The adventure started with a friendly ride from our hotel in Recoleta with the wordly Miriam from the Netherlands. Her love for Argentina really comes through. We learned of the culture differences she sees - expressive freedom could capture the spirit of the country.Immediately upon arrival, Adrian proves the friendly warmth that Miriam described. The welcome eased any apprehension from our two kids or frankly from ourselves of riding on horses - unfamiliar territory for three of four of us. The journey felt like one through our own private estate. There really was no one there. While it was winter in Argentina, it was easily 65-70 degrees when the sun was out. Perfect weather for what turned out to be more athletically demanding than I had imagined.Our two sons, 12 and 19, were taken on a steep learning curve. All at once nurturing, informative, humorous and tough, Adrian's teaching style was nothing less than effective. By the end of the first day, as many other reviewers have pointed out, they were cantering and controlling their ride with just their bodies absent the reins.The obedient and kind horses were part of Adrian's family. It was clear that he was sharing them with us. We became one family that first day in the park. Smiles, feelings of accomplishment and even meditative healing coursed through us on the winding path. Adrian provides a transformative experience unlike any other because it is a trip that he himself has taken in his own personal life. It was so enriching we canceled another tour and instead scheduled another day there! It's too valuable and rich experience just to have once for the adventure was unexpected yet priceless. Thank you Adrian!

Perfect Afternoon, peace and tranquility with great company and even greater horses. Only a stones throw from the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires is a little piece of heaven for me and thank goodness I have discovered it today. The experience I had today at A la Par caballos was simply firstclass. From initial emails with Miriam the service I have received from A la par has been first class, We arrived at the stables and met Adrian who is a great character and a fantastic teacher, I am an experienced rider but still felt like I gained so much from our ride together in the park, Adrian picks the right horse for you after chatting about your likes and dislikes and experience. From complete beginners to experienced riders there is a horse here for everyone and I believe all riders of any level and age will enjoy a ride here. The ride in the park lasted over 2 hours, the surrounding were tranquil and beautiful with sandy trails leading in and out of woods, over rivers and through fields, it felt like we were in the middle of nowhere and really gave me the countryside fix that I was craving after being in the city. I would not hesitate to recommend A la par to anyone that loves horses as it really does off a great experience and if your in Argentina your trip is simply not complete without a couple hours in the saddle, I'm so happy I've already booked my next visit.

Learn to ride and enjoy beautiful scenery. I did something I thought unimaginable - horseback riding with confidence and control. Adrián and Miriam provided a great experience from answering emails promptly, giving private lessons to making guests feel at home. Adrián spent a lot of time getting to know you in order to match you with the right horse. His emphasis on proper riding form led you to quickly trot and canter alone. Amazing! I felt I was riding for years. Even experienced riders learned something. Adrián and Miriam were patient and made you feel comfortable throughout the day. Be prepared to feel sore after the ride as you will exercise muscles you normally don't use. The park has lots of open space and nice scenery. Bring a camera.

The highlight of our trip!. Once again, Trip Advisor has not let me down. When we were picked up in a car by a nice older man to take us to our horseback riding adventure I didn’t know what to expect. 30 minutes later we were greeted in a green open field by a couple of happy dogs and our instructor, Adrian. We sat and chatted awhile and had some biscuits with mate, a popular, tea-like drink in South America. We talked about what we’d be doing within the next few hours.. and then we were off!This was my first time on a horse and I was a little nervous, but the horse I rode (Indio) was wonderful and sweet and actually listened to me when I guided him right or left. We started out with some basic instruction on our horses and then went right into the 20,000 acre park, which was a mixture of trails, woods and open fields. We got comfortable enough to start trotting and eventually even cantering, which was the most exhilarating experience. Towards the end of our ride, we even got to change horses to understand how different they all are. Our instructor, Adrian was very experienced and incredibly gracious and made our time riding a joy. The beautiful weather we had only enhanced the day.After we were done, we got back to the stables, fed our horses some carrots and had some snacks of our own.I’ve never taken a horse riding lesson, so I can’t say how this compares, but I can say after a week’s vacation, this day was my favorite. Definitely book this tour if you have the time in Buenos Aires. You’ll be sore for a few days, but it’ll be worth it!

A great experience. What a fantastic day, Adrian is amazing really teaches you to ride properly, i even got to ride his Arabian horse! The park is beautifull, it's very relaxing way to spend to the day, very authentic experience, many thanks!

Our very best experience in Buenos Aires - Excellente!". This was the most amazing experience that my family was able to share together. Miriam and Adrian are the two nicest people you would ever want to spend time with. They pick you up in town, they feed you, they treat you like family. It was incredible that they could put together an exceptional riding experience for a family of four, with all different riding levels and ages. I cannot believe that Adrian found a way to challenge my husband and ten year old daughter, who are both experienced riders, while at the same time, make a fabulous riding experience for myself and my 4 year old! Amazing and fun and the scenery is so pretty. Make sure to bring your camera, with video, and sunscreen because they spend hours with you, making sure you love every moment. We can't wait to go back and spend another day with them. We are so happy that we discovered this gem in Buenos Aires. It was the best day of our trip.
Fabulous day out in the country.. Adrian and Miriam are wonderful and this such a fun day. I feel like we made new friends in B A!

An Amazing Day Trip From Buenos Aires. The 3 hours I spent with Adrian and Marian was one of the better experiences I had in Buenos Aires. Learning how to ride a horse with the both of them was ridiculously fun.My only regret was that I couldn't stay longer to go for more lessons!

Awesome day out. Beautiful scenery!!!. Wow wow wow!!!!What Wonderful people and an awesome exerience. We had no horse riding experience but this won't stop you from doing this beautiful adventure. Highly recommended for a full day out in buenos aires. Shows a different side to the cityOperators are very professional and friendly, always happy to help!

Very good! Adrian gives you confidence to ride.. I had zero experience riding horses and I had a chance to explore the true felling of horse riding. At the beginning I was afraid of the big 400Kg horse, but with the confidence transmitted by Adrian, I was able to do the basic moves and really enjoyed the experience.Eduardo

Exceeded All Expectations.. I was very nervous, but Adrienne was so patient and understanding. Everyone was so accomodating and welcoming from the beginning - answered emails right away and helped us arrange to get to the airport after the ride was finished. I would recommend this to anyone!

An unique experience!. If you are into horses and you love nature, you just have to come to Caballos a la Par. Adrian is an exzellent teacher who can quickly asses the riding skills of a group before you go on a ride and therefore picks the right horse for everyone. We did a wonderful 2h ride in the park wich is protected by UNESCO and the home for an amazing fauna and flora, my favourite were the Eucalyptus trees. I am not an experienced rider but under Adrian's instructions I felt very confident and in control of the horse and was cantering with lot's of joy during the ride. The ride was beautiful and it was very hard to imagine that we were only 30 min outside of Buenos Aires. I highly recommend it and already booked my next ride with Caballos a la Par in 2 weeks.Tatjana

Great day!. A great day with great people and nature. Funny, interesting and nice people. You must go here! The riding experience was amazing (even though it was the first time on a horse). We definitely are going back!

Caballos A La Par - A name worthy of its reputation. For us it was the pinnacle of our trip; it was our first time in Buenos Aires and we were attending a conference. "Caballos A La Par" was our gate to serenity. We were looking up the top ranking 'to-do-things" in BA and "Caballos A La Par" is ranked as THE thing to do. So we were already hyped up, and it's so easy to get disappointed once the expectation is high....and it did surpass our expectations by far.Once we contacted "Caballos A La Par", the communication was welcoming, clear and effortless. They made every effort so we could get to the ranch with no hassle. The ranch is located about 25-30 min away from BA once you hit the Highway. Welcome the trainers, such genuine and invested people. Adrian and Miriam would not hold anything back to make us feel at home. We were greeted with Yerba maté - don't forget to ask for Adrian's special Maté!- and after a bit of socializing we were ready to mount the horses. It was our first horseback-riding experience and Adrian summoned the sleeping Cowboy in us! Such a fascinating experience on so many different levels. We were told there are no set-tracks and every time they would take the visitors to different locations. We were lucky to be there on a perfect Spring day and the nature looked breath-taking. Being first time riders, I am sure we could have easily fell victim to focusing on the learning part and forget to enjoy ourselves. Adrian and Miriam introduced a fair balance of learning while being mindful of the surrounding beauty. I yet have to see a trainer as invested in his students as Adrian. It was evident that it's a deep-rooted passion for him . We took few short videos and each time I watch them it brings smile to my face. On our way back to the ranch, we were riding as we are old-time riders, relaxed and engaged in a warm discussion passing other casual riders and greeting them. By the time we got back, there were two other tourists waiting for him. Call it coincidence, but we ran into the same people the next day in the Recoleta Cemetery and guess what; they had enjoyed every moment of their visit to "Caballos A La Par".After our ride, we sat down with Miriam, enjoying yet another special drink complimented by gourmet pastry. I think we sat together for an hour talking about everything and anything; and it felt like we knew each other for a longest time.I can only look forward to the day we meet again.

Everything was perfect. This organisation lived up to my expectations and more! If you want a different experience with horses, learn a lot, and at the same time experience beautiful nature, this is the place for you. Either you are an experienced rider or beginner. You will definitely be able to do whatever feels right for you. The teacher was great, and the horse I rode was obedient and wonderfull to ride. As a intermediate rider, and in my point of view, I got really good training, so I where able to gallop alone and independently. A dream come true..

This is an experience that you will NOT find anywhere else. We traveled from Colorado to Argentina to experience things that we could not or would not experience back home. We don't ride horses in Colorado, but we could, so we debated about whether or not to do this. We decided that we would do it for the change in scenery which was awesome.And the park is unique but not nearly as unique as the horseback riding experience. Adrián has an incredible talent and passion for horses, riding horses, and teaching people to ride horses. He was able to show 2 first time riders in my wife and I how to direct the horses and how trot and canter in a safe and challenging way. The attention was completely personalized to our comfort level and desire. The setting in the open park was fantastic and Adrián made sure to snap lots of pictures and videos with my camera so that we could document the experience. His love of horses and riding horses was absolutely infectious.We really felt like we gained friends in Adrián, Miriam, and Elias. And it was great to share maté with them in the traditional way, with the proper rules, before we began. We saw some great things in Argentina but we both rate this experience as the best one of our trip.Also, if you are concerned, English is spoken very well by both Adrián & Miriam. They provide beverages and delicious pastries. They had very comfortable & clean restroom facilities.

Awesome Experience!. This was one of the best experiences I had in BA. If you're interested in horseback riding at all, this is the best place to do it. The park is gorgeous, the horses are friendly and Adrian and Miriam are extremely nice people, who magically help you learn to ride a horse. They also feed you hot chocolate and pastries. Transportation is taken care of by them, and the entire process was easy and enjoyable. I am recommending this place to all my friends who are headed out to BA. Adrian also takes tons of pictures of you on the horse - so you'll have lots of great memories to take back home :).

Best horseback riding experience ever. I found this place in the top things to do in Buenos Aires and all the reviews were great. I really wanted to go horseback riding since I had heard you could freely ride your horse in most of the places. This one sounded legit and the reviews were all 5 starts, so I called them. It was for a saturday and since I called them only 2 days in advance they had no spots. That didn't stop Adrian (the owner -instructor) to find a way and move some people around so we could go ride that day, since we were leaving Saturday night. Miriam picked us up in the morning and drove us to the ranch and it was really nice to us all the time, answering all the questions, talking about how she got into horseback riding, etc.Finally there we met Adrian, he had asked me about our weight, height, etc so he could pick the best suited horse for us. He had them ready and anfter meeting us he decided he had to change one, he just try to match you with the best horse for you. My girlfriend was really scared and he helped her to feel more secure and in control of the horse. In my case I really wanted to gallop but I wasn't sure how to do it, he taught me and at the end I was just galloping on my own the whole time.We felt there like we were in family. Adrian treats you like that, he makes sure you get the best experience possible. Yesterday I was seeing a video of that day and I felt that I had to write this review. First review in this site so far, but I had to do it. If I ever go to Buenos Aires again, I'll definitely go to this place again.Muchas gracias Adrian & Miriam!

Fantastic ride, amazing guide!. I never expected that my husband and son would be cantering along the beautiful countryside given it was only their 2nd time on horseback. Adrian's methods are incredible and his horses are the best. His hospitality (we shared mate before our ride) and his love for what he does made it the perfect experience. It's no wonder they are #1 on Trip Advisor!

Unforgettable day with an amzing instructor. I took my Mum with me in an effort to show her how amazing riding in Argentina is. I've already had some great times on various ranches across the countryy, but this was a definite stand out experience.Adrian looks after you from the word go. Making sure you get the style of horse you like and the experience you're after. My Mum and I have a lot of experience but we haven't ridden properly for a long time, so Adrian eased us in gently. But before we knew it we were conquering the fields and cantering all over the place.He likes to balance the experience by giving you instruction but also leaving you free to do as you wish.My Mum went home saying it was her favourite experience and I think I have to agree.Plus Miriam and the pastries are a lovely added bonus!

Love at first ride!. Never would I have thought of going horse riding if not for my niece, who was very keen to go.... & it turned out to be the highlight of our 3-week vacation!! It was so addictive that we went back twice after the first experience. The first time we went, Adrian made an effort to know each of us better before he picked suitable horses for us. This really helped in building the chemistry between the rider & the horse. Under the expert & patient guidance of Adrian and Miriam, who taught us proper techniques and postures, we learned how to walk, trot and canter all in one lesson. With the beauty of nature, every ride is exhilarating! Thank you Adrian, Miriam & Elias for making this possible, you have truly set a very high benchmark for my future horse riding experience. If at all possible, we would love to come back for more!

If you like horses you MUST come here!. We have just returned from the most amazing day with Adrian at Caballos a la Par. The horses and the people here are very special. It is all about wanting you to get the absolute most out of the day and make a connection with the horses. Adrian does this for the love of it not as a commercial enterprise and welcomes you as friends. The park itself is beautiful and in such contrast to the city, yet it is only 30 mins away. Although we could both ride already, we were way better riders by the end of the afternoon thanks to Adrian's expert tuition. He videoed us with our camera (don't forget to take one!) so that we could see how we looked and what we needed to improve.We cantered and cantered around the park and through the woods on willing and responsive horses (I fell in love with Indio, who I was riding). We even cantered without reins.From the mate (made expertly by 'gaucho' Elias) to the pastries and the excellent conversation with Adrian and Miriam, it felt like a day spent with friends. I have ridden for over 30 years in many countries and have never experienced a day like this. I will have to return to Argentina (from UK) just so that I can come here again.

Horsebackriding Adventure!. I did not realize what a great experience this adventure would be when I signed up for it. Adrian is an excellent instructor and really tries to ensure that his students really experience horseback riding. This is not your typical trail riding; rides take control of their horses in open plains and learn how to communicate with their horses. Marianna is an excellent companion as well; I went with two sisters and my mom. One of my sisters decided not to ride at the last minute and Marianna stayed back with her. Overall, this was an awesome experience for all of us, even my sister who remained behind. The mate we shared with Adrian and Marianne also made us feel very welcome and much more at home.This is definitely a trip that one would not regret, but cherish.

An outstanding day..highly recommended. My husband and I are visiting Buenos Aires for an international conference. We knew that one of our goals was to take these lessons at Caballos a la Par. Again a wonderful connection made through TripAdvisor!!! Our confidence with this program began with the information gathering (pricing, availability) emails exchanged with Miriam. She was responsive in answering all of my questions and concerns. This confidence was reaffirmed as our day of adventure arrived…. from the moment that we were picked up at our meeting point in the city by Miriam, to our car-ride out to the ranch in the provincial park, to our meeting with our instructor, Adrian, our sharing/tasting mate for the first time and ultimately to our lesson. For those reading this who have never ridden a horse or who haven’t ridden in a VERY long time – these details are very important.My husband and I had little to no experience on a horse and so we opted to take the private lesson. As previous reviews have stated, this was not a “conga-line” lesson…it was just for the TWO of us… We were reminded step by step of how to hold the reins and all of the other valuable tips to working properly with our horse. On horseback we walked through the park further acquainting ourselves with tips and reminders of proper riding and then when we had reached a level of confidence we went from walking to cantering. What fun and exhilaration!!! Adrian was by our side every step of the way, complimenting us, encouraging us, gently correcting us….I think that I can most simply summarize our experience as having accomplished something that we didn’t imagine that we could do and all through the guidance and support of Adrian. He is a master!!!!! And the day was one that will remember for a very long time.Muchissimas gracias a Adrian y a Miriam!

A wonderful experience. My friends and I had a wonderful experience with Adrian and Miriam. Adrian is a gifted riding instructor. I was an absolute beginner and nervous, but after spending just a short time with him, I was cantering comfortably through the wide-open space that the park provides. I learned so much in just a couple of hours, and therefore would highly rcommend this half-day excursion to anyone.

If you want to learn to ride well, go here. Was in Bs As for business and had a day off. Went to A La Par to get out of the city and re-learn to ride since my daughters are now riding. Learned more in 3 hours than could possibly have imagined. Was a phenomenal day and after the ride, enjoyed a good time with the staff and made some good friends while there. Coming back to Bs As next year and will be riding with Adrian and "Pintado" again. If you want to be outside and enjoy riding or want to learn, this is the place.

The reviews say it all!. Our search on trip adviser for things to do in BA, brought up Caballos A La Par as number one. As we have enjoyed horse riding on a previous trip to Argentina, we booked. It was fantastic. Not the usual walking around on a horse, following the one in front of you....but actually riding a horse. Just as the other reviews - we were cantering no hands by the end of the lesson, and i think the big thing - not with fear. Adrian's calm positive encouragement and focus on posture, and balance was the key! Out of all the things we did in BA this trip - my biggest regret when leaving, was that i was not able to take more lessons with Adrian as I believe he has a unique talent. Strongly recommend - if you have never ridden a horse before or are an experienced rider.

Superb instruction in a beautiful setting. My fiance and I just returned from our trip to Argentina. One of the highlights for me was the time we spent with Adrian and Miriam at Caballos A La Par. We had planned to ride only one day with them but enjoyed the experience so much we went out with them again the very next day. I really appreciated how they quickly developed my skills so I was in control of the horse. The series of exercises we went through and the practical explanations they provided made the learning experience the best I have had. Added to that, riding in the wide open spaces of the park made for a beautiful setting. Not a "trail ride" in any way. After our sessions at A La Par we had the chance to take polo lessons from another group. I was very glad that I had furthered my riding skills at A La Par before I got on the polo horse. I felt much more comfortable and in control. The personal attention we got at A la Par was very different from other riding experiences I have had. The next time we are in Argentina we will definitely be paying A La Par another visit (or two).

Fantastic, must do experience!. I've just returned from a 10 day trip to Buenos Aires with my boyfriend. The morning I spent at Caballos a la Par was the highlight of the trip. My boyfriend and I were picked up by the lovely Miriam who drove us to Adrian's ranch. Although we had never been on a horse before, in a couple of hours we had learnt how to canter and could even do this with our arms spread out and on our heads! Adrian is a fantastic instructor, he is so kind and gives you great confidence. We finished and had huge smiles on our faces. Not only had we achieved so much but we also did it amongst great people and in a beautiful park. I am still thinking about the experience and just wish I had longer so that I could go back and do it again. I would recommend this a must do activity on your trip to BA. Now that I am back in London I am tempted to try to find a place to horseride but I just don't think it will be as good. I also tried mate for the first time, prepared by Elias (thank you!), and ate the most delicious pastries. Thank you for a wonderful morning.

An unforgettable experience :). I am currently on a vacation in Buenos Aries and wanted to go horse riding. Had one leson with Adrian and Miriam and the experience was extremely wonderful and memorable. There was a personal touch in the lesson that cannot be found in other horse riding lessons that have been commercialized. They took the time to ensure that we knew how to ride and to continuously look out for ways to help us to improve. Their commitment and passion to not just the horses but to teach is incredible and applaudable. It has been a wonderful experience and I look forward to going back for another lesson soon. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves horses, or who wants to learn how to ride horses, or who already knows how to ride horses- basically everyone! You won't regret the experience! It is "awesomeness" in a package.

Friendly patient instructors who teach you to canter in a day!. I live in Buenos Aires but have never gone horseriding here. As my sister and aunt are on vacation in BA right now, I decided to take them horseriding for a out-of-city experience. None of us has very much experience (if any at all) and I went there expecting the trip to be like most places - where you ride in a line and don't actually learn very much. However, Adrian and Miriam surprised us with their very patient attitudes when teaching us, and the trip was very personalized. We each had time to learn how to bring the horses from walking to trotting to cantering (all in less than 4 hours) and I felt so calm and confident at the end of the trip that I enjoyed cantering much more than expected!In fact, we like the service so much that we have already booked another round this coming Saturday! Everyone remotely interested in horseriding should definitely come and try this! Plus, the proximity to Capital Federal makes it so available!

I'd highly recommend it to anyone. I'm on a vacation in Buenos Aires for 10 days. After my friends left, I had five days to spend on my own. So I had three lessons from adrian in A la Par every other day. It is about 30-40 mins away from buenos aires and they pick you up by taxi. The air was very fresh there and the hosts were very friendly. Before and after each session, there's refreshments, including drinks and bakery. they really take effort to make you feel relaxed and at home. The room in which we were sitting was warm and cosy (I was there in winter). There were many horses and the one I was riding was very well trained. Adrian is an excellent teacher, he pushes me a lot because he thinks I can take it. He was right and I really appreciated that. After three lessons, I can canter even without reins (He taught me from scratch). For three lessons, I learned what I can learn in a month in the UK. At the end of the first lesson, I already felt we were friends. We talked about argentinian traditions and how he became a horse riding teacher, etc. I think if I have a long holiday again, I'd fly back to buenos aires from london and do more horse riding because I learn it faster and better there. Adrian doesn't work for money and he doesn't mix people at all, which is good if you want to improve quickly. But you still meet people when you arrive or when you leave, and those were interesting people. He also loves horses and loves his food. It was an absolute pleasure to be taught by him and to visit a la par whilst I was in buenos aires.

A Wonderful Day Out. My friend and I visited Adrian and his horses and had the most wonderful day. The surrounding area is stunning, his horses were great and Adrian was a fantastic instructor. It was the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the city and only a short drive. I would recommend this to everyone (even if you have never ridden!) The sun shone for the entire day and we will definitely be returning soon.

What an amazing day!!. I had wanted to go to Buenos Aires for a long time, and when I finally decided to go this August, I knew I wanted to spend some time horseback riding. I rode for many years when I was younger and while I don’t do it regularly anymore, I still love it and try to find a place to ride when I am on vacation. I love riding, I love taking care of the horses, getting dirty, and the wonderful feeling of being tired from being outside all day.When I started searching for a place to do a daytrip, I quickly came across Caballos a la par, and it turned out that a friend had visited them last year, so it seemed like a great option. The communication with Adrián and Sergio was great and we settled on a day. The day before I was supposed to go, Adrián called and suggested we meet in the afternoon instead of in the morning because of the weather. It was of course fine with me.I was picked up in the city by Hector, the friendly driver, and we got to Caballos a la par in less than 40 minutes. I was so excited when we pulled in! There I met with Adrián and also with Elias who works with him. We chatted for a while over mate and biscuits, before going outside. I got to ride a wonderful horse (Indio) and the afternoon was overcast, but not rainy – perfect! At first I was nervous, it had been a while since my last time and all of a sudden I felt a little anxious. But it didn’t take more than five or ten minutes before I was comfortable; with some instructions from Adrián I improved my posture and especially my leg position and before I knew it I was cantering along! It was an amazing feeling! Indio is basically the perfect horse – so friendly, easy to ride, receptive… I loved it! We were walking and running through the Parque Pereyra and it was so much fun. After a while we went to a more secluded part where Adrián had me do all sorts of exercises without using my hands or the reins. At first I was a little nervous but it ended up being just great. You know it is an amazing horse when you can do those things. It was so much fun to gallop with my hands up in the air! I think I had a big smile on my face almost the entire time; I was so happy to ride such a great horse and enjoyed every second of it. Back at the ranch we enjoyed tea and beautiful pastries in front of the fireplace, while talking about horses and riding in different parts of the world. I should also mention that Adrián uses special saddles that he designs himself. They are extremely comfortable; I was surprised that my legs didn’t hurt at all after being on the horse for a few hours.I absolutely loved my experience at Caballos a la par and would recommend it to anybody, beginners and experienced riders alike. The wonderful thing is that Adrián does not mix groups; i.e. I signed up alone, and I was the only one in my “group.” That means lots of individual attention and the opportunity to do exactly what you want and are capable of. For me, as someone who used to be an experienced rider but no longer rides much, it was just perfect – I got the time I needed to get comfortable again, and then I was able to do all sorts of interesting things. That makes the place very special – of course along with the wonderful attention to the horses; they are so well-trained and it is obvious that they are well cared for. I can’t wait to go back!! Thank you to all humans and horses at Caballos a la par for the best day I had in Argentina.
