A real delight: the best part of our trip to South America. This was the highlight of our trip to South America this summer. We consulted TripAdvisor and were impressed to see a riding school at the top of the attraction list for Buenos Aires. Our expectations were surpassed. Adrian is without a doubt the best riding instructor I’ve ever had. To top things, my partner Alex had never ridden a horse before. However, with Adrian’s skilful instruction, he was able to canter with poise (and confidence) within minutes. My own horse was extremely receptive; he responded to my slightest whim and moved like the wind. Adrian pointed out various technical defects in my posture and hold, and his tips proved extremely helpful. While I have ridden horses elsewhere, this was the first time I felt a true connection with the animal I was riding. In fact, for two glorious hours, my horse seemed practically an extension of myself. The park where we rode was lovely and the sunlight was streaming through the trees. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with Adrian and the horses and look forward to returning to Caballos a la Par in the future.

Most fun part of our trip. Adrian is a fantastic guide and instructor. I have been riding many times and my husband had never touched a horse in his whole life, and Adrian was able to create an experience that suited both of us perfectly. My husband was skeptical about horseback riding, but now he says that riding with Adrian was the best part of our trip to Buenos Aires. Adrian and Miriam are also exceptionally good hosts, offering us traditional Argentine snacks, mate, and hot chocolate. We would love to visit Adrian again in the future.

Amazing Day. My friend and I have just come back from a great day with Adrian and his fabulously trained horses. It is not your typical trekking experience just you and your horse and a whole park to play in. Adrian encourages you to do as you please whilst giving some valuable instruction and excercises to improve your riding.We will definitely be going again before the end of our trip!

Great experience!. We went with a group of 5, of which 3 had little or no experience. Adrian gave us a lot of personal advice and attention and made us feel comfortable riding the horses. At the end of the afternoon the 5 of us we were all cantering like we had years of experience. Absolutely a must-do when in Buenos Aires!

Best horseback riding EVER!. My husband and I went horseback riding here while staying in Buenos Aires. It was overcast/misty the day of our reservation so we did change from the morning to the afternoon session to see if weather was better at the company's advice. It was better, and we were picked up in Buenos Aires by Miriam at a designated time and place. We drove about 30-45 minutes outside of BA to a national park where the stables are. Before riding we had Mate (a traditional Argentinian tea) and cookies. Then, even though it started sprinkling lightly we mounted up to ride after basic instructions by Adrian, the owner. We were taught proper position for riding and how to hold the reins properly. Once into the park in an open field, we were taught how to trot and canter. There was individual instruction and it was detailed enough that my husband and I both were able to control the horse and canter without feeling like we didn't know what we were doing. We rode for almost 3 hours. After riding, back at the stables we had hot chocolate and pastries. By the time we left we felt like we had spent the day with old friends. Miriam, who also rode with us, drove us back to our hotel when we were finished.I would very highly recommend this experience. We were taught confidence and technique on horses that were not "follow-the-leader" horses. They did what you told them, and at no time did I ever feel like I was in danger or because Adrian or Miriam were by our side, hence the name of the company. Additionally, language was not an issue. Adrian and Miriam's English was fluent and we had no problem understanding instructions or conversations.

Lifetime experience for horse lovers. Had my riding at Caballos al a par today.. Adrian s an amazing instructor, very patient and understanding, my partner was a complete beginner, I had some experience and had cantered once for 30 metres probably... Today both of us cantered without reins... Cantered long distances... The park is massive 20 mns from the main city, loads of free space to canter on your own... Adrian picked us up from city in the morning, had mate (argentine tea) and started with the horses, simple techniques, no complicated process like u do in normally, obedient horses, I had an Arabian horse Samila, it's tail stands up when u ride so I often confused myself that it was about to pooh, but that's the way Arabian horses are, very obedient horse...Most interesting thing I feel looking back is that normally beginners have 2 issues- having to control horse and how to control your moves n positions. Today I had absolutely no worry of controlling the horse, it was piece of cake as the horses a well trained by Adrian.I could just concentrate on my positions.Feel great about my partner, she was cantering without reins in 1 hour, considering it was her second time on a horse ever I find it amazing. We did a lot of canter on our own.Adrian has an amazing crew, Elias could jump over the horses, also taught me to make mate tea, very pleased with that, Mariam lovely Dutch girl who fell in love with buenos aires was very kind and drove us to city.Me and Lakshmi will be back in few years, next time with our little one who is now 2.Wish u all the best- Paul Mandoli, paulmathewm@gmail.com

Wonderful experience. We spent a wonderful afternoon with Adrián and his horses. We're a family of four, and only our 8-year old daughter had experience riding; within 20 minutes all of us were cantering with confidence. Adrián is a terrific teacher, the area is beautiful. We´d highly recommend "A la par" to anyone.

Lots of fun for anyone regardless of experience or skill w/ horses.. My friend and I (both 20 yo), had little/no experience with riding horses and both of us were cantering freely by the end of the day. Adrian is a fantastic and experienced teacher with a great sense of humour and an even greater amount of patience! They also offer you the opportunity to have yerba mate and other traditional Argentinan refreshments. Riding freely on the beautiful, well trained horses through the national park- was a great way to spend the day away from the city, and my friend commented later that his face was hurting from smiling so much. That's a pretty good complaint to receive and sums up our experience quite nicely!

What a great time-learned so much!. I went with two friends from college and we had the best time with the owner Adrian. He is a great teacher. All of us were novice riders and were cantering by the end of the day. They also provided delicious refreshments. The best part is that there is no trail and you ride freely through the national park. This is a must do!

What a place!. We had such a wonderful time here. This is a must for every person visiting this wondeful country. Inspiring Argentina suggested us to come to this place and so we did. It was one of the best places we visited during our stay in Argentina. We really recommend Caballos a la Par.

Best Part of Buenos Aires Visit!. Caballos A La Par was amazing! It was a simple ranch were you felt at home right away. Also, a very easy trip to schedule. We were picked up at our hotel by a new employee from the Netherlands who had such interesting stories to tell us (made me want to move to South America). We arrived at the ranch about 30-45 minutes later where we were treated like old friends, not tourists. As a person who has never rode a horse, I was a little nervous for my first ride. Miraculously, Adrian had me feeling confident on the horse almost instantly. By the end of the day I was cantering like a pro (at least in my head) and my fiancé was even doing tricks like cantering with no hands! (note: she has ridden before, but it has been years). This was also my first time drinking mate (tea) and it was a great communal experience. We sat around and talked about our ride, had some laughs, and ate some good Argentine pastries. No rush at all (one of my favorite cultural norms possessed by the locals)! I believe the title of this review says it all. My Fiancé and I traveled to Buenos Aires after a stay in Brazil (Sao Paulo and Iguaçu), and we were getting a little bored in the city. Buenos Aires is a great city, but it was winter and we were missing one thing...some adventure. We needed to be active! Spending most of the day eating great steak and drinking wine is great, but I must say that this ranch was truly the icing on our South American Vacation Cake. If you're spending a few days in the city, book this trip!

Amazing, personalized experience in the Argentine outdoors. Caballos a la Par is definitely one of my favorite memories from my (lengthy) trip to South America. I am a university student that studied in Buenos Aires for about two months, and I highly recommend this as something you must do while here. I have not ridden in more than ten years and was never an expert, and Adrian had me riding a running horse without holding the reins! He was very patient and encouraging, and spoke English very well. The rest of the staff and the driver from the city to the ranch were very friendly and helpful as well. It was also a great experience to get out into the countryside of Argentina for a few hours, a nice break from the busy city. As I am not an experienced rider, I did the one-one-one lesson and highly recommend it because you get to learn a lot while still riding through an Argentine nature reserve. This is definitely a great memory I will have for the rest of my life - something I will do every time I return to Argentina in the future, and something that I feel everyone in Buenos Aires should do!

A Delightful Morning .... wish we had time to ride with Adrian again!. Horses are my passion and I wanted my husband and grown son to have a great riding experience. Adrian did a marvelous job of helping them feel comfortable on horseback and within a short time they were both cantering across the open fields, exhilarated and proud.We loved the whole experience, from the start with mate and facturas (Argentine pastries) in the cottage, the wonderful ride, and ending with a beer or soda visiting with Adrian and his staff. I had concerns about safety and was very pleased with Adrian's gear and instruction. He has hoods on the stirrups, so its hard for a shoe to slip through and get caught. Adrian designed his own style hard hat... very cool looking, and approved by the FEI for international endurance rides. His horses are well trained for the job. They are willing to move away from the other horses and act independently, so they don't object to cantering off across a field and leaving the group, and they don't travel nose to tail in typical dude ranch style.After a number of days in B.A. it was lovely to be out in the country side with someone as warm and genuinely interested in his visitors as Adrian.

Favorite experience from long trip to BsAs. Where to start? In a nutshell: Caballos a la Par was one of the best experiences we had during our nearly 3 month stay in Buenos Aires. They were very easy to book with via e-mail (in English or Spanish, at your preference) and our pick-up was smoothly coordinated. Once we arrived at the stables, about an hour outside of BsAs, it was peaceful and quiet. We were warmly welcomed and taken inside the little kitchen area for breakfast. Everyone (us, our taxi driver, the stable assistant, and Adrian (the owner) sat down and had a nice conversation; we spoke in Spanish but they would have gladly spoken in English. It was one of those rare moments in tourism when you felt that the business owner/operator genuinely enjoys that type of interaction, just a great guy overall. He takes very good care of his horses and takes a lot of pride in what he does. Our ride was a phenomenal experience. Neither of us had been on a horse in years, but Adrian was a very patient and skillful instructor. Within an hour, we were cantering the horses quite comfortably. The trails were through pastoral fields, very pretty and pleasant. The horses were very "kind," for lack of a better word; they tolerated our bad horsemanship with aplomb and were very responsive to inputs. Adrian took pictures and videos of us riding with our camera; they turned out really well and are great momentos! After the ride we were again invited into the kitchen for snacks and refreshments, and of course, more good conversation. Overall, Caballos a la Par was a really pleasant, friendly, top quality experience. We recommend this as a fun day trip for visitors and residents alike.

A great day and great experience. Like all the other reviews, this is a fantastic way to get out of the city and learn something new. We have been on trail rides before but nothing like this. Adrian was able to take us to the next level of horsemanship in beautiful surroundings. We had a ball.

A private riding expereince in a beautiful setting. This was a delightful way to expereince the countryside of Buenos Aires from the safe and stable perspective of a beautiful horse. I spent over two hours walking trotting and cantering through the park and it was an expereince I will never forget. Adrian was a very attentive guide and teacher.

Best horse riding experience I've had to date!. I wasn't sure what to expect when I signed up for this experience given that my previous experience was limited to several trail rides over a period of ten years and the fact that I was heading out by myself in a foreign country but it definitely exceeded my expectations. The driver met me at the nominated location at the correct time and drove me about 30 minutes to meet up with Adrian and his lovely staff. From the very first moment Adrian treated me like family and it is obvious that horses are his passion. Adrian matched me up with Indio. Fortunately Indio and I made friends straight away and was a very forgiving horse and got me out of trouble when this inexperienced rider made mistakes. We went riding in the national park and because his afternoon client had cancelled he basicaly said we could ride until I got tired. I didn't think I could do it but I too was able to cantor without hands by the time I finished. Adrian is super patient and if you are willing to receive constructive advice you will get a lot out of this. If you want to learn more about riding rather than just go on a follow the leader trail ride then this is the experience for you. If I lived in Buenos Aires I would definitely return to take more lessons. As for value for money, I've paid more for most of my trail rides and have never got as much out of it as I did with my day with Adrian.

Absolutely the best horseback riding ever!. The instruction and the kindness of Adrian were unsurpassable. He made us feel like family from the moment we arrived, to the amazing hot chocolate at the end. This is a must do when in Argentina. But, be prepared to fall in love with the horses and their owners. We were scared at first, not being very experienced, but the lesson we got during our ride had us cantering back to the barn, happy and proud.

Fabulous experience!!!!. Our two sons and us spent the afternoon riding and definitely learning. Adrian is an intelligent and charming horseman, who loves what he does and represents his country well. We all four thought it was a perfect experience, cantoring, sharing mate, and would recommend it as authentic. Even came home with photos/videos.

Best day of my life!!!. I had an AMAZING time at Caballos a la Par. Adrian is an amazing trainer and he matches your horse to the level of riding you are capable which makes it very fun and relaxing. I have been riding for 10 years so it is nice when I am able to ride a horse that listens and is very responsive instead of just following the horse that is in front of it. This was an awesome experience and not only do I highly recommend it, but I am going back for another ride next weekend!!!

The most amazing day....... I have just returned home to England from a short trip to BA.,I had decided to go riding here and,based on the reviews was expecting it to be good,but it surpassed all my expectations.Everything that has been said about the experience,the beautiful horses,wonderful countryside and the mate and pastries is all true! But for me the one to one professional tuition with Adrian was the best part.He truly is a wonderful teacher and his passion for both teaching and horses is infectious.If you do nothing else in BA,do this! I can't wait to go back.

A different experience, and one worth every cent.. From my first contact with A La Par I felt there was something special about this place. E-mail queries were handled promptly and informed me of every aspect of what they had to offer. It sounded good. And it delivered. I was picked up exactly when and where I was told I would be. Half an hour later, we were sitting around a table drinking yerba mate. Adrian asked me about my riding experience while the horses were being saddled. A la Par is on the edge of a National Park and within a few minutes of leaving their place we were trotting through autumn leaved trees. I had some horse riding experience so wasn't sure how much Adrian could teach me, but he was fantastic. I had never had such detailed tips about what I was doing right or wrong. Adrian watched me intently, pointing out my body position, the angle of my feet, knees, hand position. He told me if I was comfortable, then the horse was comfortable. I relaxed. But Adrian didn't. He watched me intently, continuously suggesting improvements. We trotted, then cantered and within half an hour he had me with my arms in the air while cantering. I felt completely safe at all times. My horse, Indiana, was excellent, responding perfectly to my commands. Clearly, this was a different riding experience to so many others. A la Par means side by side and Adrian is a passionate person who believes in what he is doing. The name is meant to describe the way the horses behave. There is no following the tail of the horse in front. I found this to be 100% true. Adrian encouraged me to canter whenever and wherever I wanted. I felt like I was riding with a friend I had known for years. He has designed his own helmet (looks more like a hat but is of endurance riding standard) as well as his own saddle. SInce instruction is personal and exclusive, I didn't see him with any beginners but I am sure he would be brilliant with them. Everything about this half day was brilliant. And safe. I would recommend this to anyone who ever thought they might like to try riding and equally to riders looking for improvement, or maybe just looking for a ride in a big park not far from the big bustling city.

Highlight of BA. I had a wonderful time trekking with Caballos. Lovely, very well trained and responsive horses. I have been trekking in many places and this was the most enjoyable experience with beautiful scenery and fantastic horses, it was a really unique experience and not just horses following nose to tail as you often come to expect on treks. Caballos has many horses to cater for all different experiences. Would recommend to all, from complete beginners to experts. Adrian was so welcoming and clearly very passionate and experienced. Big thank you to Adrian and Indio. Hopefully I will be able to come back one day soon!

Such a unique experience.... A friend from abroad was visiting and wanted to go horseback riding while being in Buenos Aires. At first I wasn't sure about joining him, my first and last experience on a horse having not been a memorable one. I decided to come along and see what happened. The minute we met Adrián and his assistant Miriam, we hit it off. I'm a local and know about our culture. What Adrián does is the real thing. He is passionate about horses and you can tell he likes to share his passion with you, passing on the real feeling of our culture. This is what, as a local, I enjoyed and thank Adrián for sharing with me and my friend. In a beautiful natural park setting, we had a real horse, personal experience, with Adrián teaching you, leading you and making you feel confident about yourself. He does so passionately, comfortably and safely. I came back home with the urge of letting everyone know that they can't miss this wonderful experience. Not only did he and Miriam introduce me to the the joy of riding... they made me come home wanting more!

Personlized horse riding experience!. When I made my booking for an outride at Cabellos A La Par I had several specific requests. The personalized experience that followed was truly exceptional. I was given a choice of 4 horses to try out, then I picked 2 horses that best suited my riding style and experience. During our 4 hours outride I had the opportunity to ride both horses at leisure. All the horses I rode were very forward going, soft in the mouth and very obedient. Adrian is a very passionate and knowledgeable horseman which became evident in the way he handled his horses and gave advice to improve my riding style. His grooms are also a pleasure to work with. I was also taught the tradition of drinking mate (a tea like herbal drink) which made the day with him a truly unique experience!

Highlight of our trip to BA - can't recommend highly enough. I can not recommend this highly enough - if you are in BA and like horses you simply must do this - I still can't get the smile off my face!Why is this such an amazing experience:*It's actually horse riding, NOT just following the horse in front of you on a set trail, with set intervals, being told when you can trott and canter. Adrian, the owner, lets you go when you want and do what you want. I have never been on a commerical horse riding experience that gives you so much freedom* The horses are really horses, not trail ponies that have been doing the same thing each day for the last 10 years. Adrian matches you to your horse when you arrive, so experienced riders can actually ride a good horse that still has a mouth and responds to the rider. I cantered to my heart's content.* Adrian caters for all levels. My husband came with me as he knows how much I like horse riding - this was my treat for the trip. He hasn't done much horse riding before and doesn't really like horses. Adrian was onto this straight away and worked with my husband to get his confidence up and learn to enjoy it. Adrian is such a good teacher, patient and makes it fun. I left them to it for 20 minutes whilst I went off cantering around the park and when I came back my husband was cantering (had only even trotted once before for a couple of minutes) and had a huge smile on his face. I nearly fall off my own horse! Apart from grumbling about how sore he his, my husband hasn't stopped talking about the horse riding since and how Adrian got him to feel confident so quickly.* the price is very good value for what you get - estimate the same experience would have cost about $400-$500 in Australia*The horse riding is in a national park, about 30 minutes from central BA. The park is very beautiful and as we were there in autumn all the colours on the leaves were changing - it was just heaven. You go to the park straight away and bascially have the full two hours there. Its not 90% of riding around a yard like so many other horse riding experiences I have been on.* Adrian is an exceptional person/horseman and instructor. He has a real way with horses and people and immediately you feel like you are riding with a close friend. His story is also very interesting and my partner and I found the things he said about life in general to be very insightful and inspirational.* Adrian also invites you try mate, which we were yet to try during our trip to Argentina, so that was an added bonus.* Transport is included and it was really easy to organise via email before we went on the trip.From our 10 days in BA, this is my highlight. I haven't enjoying riding horses so much since I had my own horses. We were both on a real buzz when we got back to our hotel.

Phenomenal - see it to believe it! An absolute must do.. I thought that I would be mad not to get a horsey experience being in Argentina, so was thrilled to come across the highly-ranked Caballos a La Par. I wondered if my time with them would live up to the flattering reviews. Let me tell you that it far superseded them.From the moment I got in touch with the company (run by the charming Adrian), I was impressed by it's friendliness, helpfulness and positive attitude. Nothing was too much for them.I got the transfer to the stables, which are set in the gorgeous green countryside and was introduced to Adrian and his assistant Hernan, over a cup of perfectly prepared mate tea. We talked about his business and how it specialised in offering personalised tuition, as opposed to vast groups (something which Adrian rightly prides himself on)I was introduced to the spectacular Tyson (sure enough named after Mike) and shown the ropes: how to use the reigns, break, turn, go faster, elegantly get onto the horse. Then Adrian and I set out side by side. He reassuringly told me what to do every step of the way - he was a extremely good, patient and encouraging teacher. We slowly developed into a trot and then a full blown canter, which was very exhilarating and great fun. And this is coming from a novice who has barely ridden a horse since I was a child. 0-canter in one hour is pretty impressive.We rode back (Adrian took lots of videos and photos, voluntarily, with my camera) and had a good post-ride chat over the most delicious pastries which he had brought (worth going just for them!)I ended up staying, experiencing the goings-on of the stables, and talking to Adrian for several hours. This demonstrates that this isn't a cash cow, rather a business he is passionate about and one which he really wants to give his customers the best experience with. There is no fixed timetable at all.It was an incredible experience - I really felt that I connected with my horse, who was immaculately trained. And I felt that I left with a friend in Adrian, who kindly drove me back to the city, which is 40 mins away.My advice would be not to miss this very special experience (one of my favourite, if not my favourite in my last five months of travelling in South America) - and learn to ride before learning polo (it is always best to learn how to walk before you learn how to run!)If there were six stars, the experience would merit them.

Just Do It. “We can ride horses anywhere. Why would we spend a valuable vacation day riding horses in Argentina?” So went my first thought. Well, its just one afternoon, I thought, and based on Trip Advisor comments – it might be fun. Friends, our experience far exceed anything I could have hoped for. Joe was the driver who picked us up in the city for the 25 minute ride out to Caballos A La Par. His English was fantastic (which was good for us) and he shared his keen knowledge of Buenos Aires en route. Once we arrived, Adrian, Joe, and Hernan, treated my wife and me to some local Mate and we talked about the region and the culture and swapped personal anecdotes prior to heading out on horseback - they are such a warm, authentic group. These men are wonderful representatives of their country and couldn’t have been more gracious.I’ll leave it to the other able reviewers to discuss the details and joys of actually riding the horses. It is the overall experience that has me writing this review. As an airline manager who travels around the world seeking out authentic experiences, all I can say is that this is a home run. Send Adrian and email if you are planning to visit Buenos Aires and just do it – you’ll be so glad you did.

THE BEST DAY OF RIDING ONE WILL EVER HAVE!. Let me start by saying this is not a trail ride! Adrian (the owner) believes in truly individual service and attention, therefore he keeps his groups small around 4 persons at a time. You ride through Argentina's version of a national park which makes for a beautiful setting. There are plenty of wide open spaces in which Adrian let's you ride freely be it walk, trot, cantor, or gallop. The only restriction is your own abilities which will definitely improve by the end of your day no matter if you are a beginner or an expert. Adrian creates an atmosphere which makes you feel calm, comfortable and most importantly SAFE! All I can say is Thank You!!! DO NOT MISS THIS WHEN IN ARGENTINA!

Fantastic day, incredible horses, amazing instructor...... Myself and my boyfriend have literally this minute just arrived back from a day at Caballos A La Par. We had such a great time that I felt compelled to write this review straight away!From the minute we arrived we were made to feel very at home with mate and delicious pastries. Adrian was very welcoming and we spent the first half an hour just chatting and getting to know each other,Neither of us had ridden before but as soon as we mounted the horses we felt well at ease and knew we were in safe hands. After a little training and guidance we were on our way. The stables are located in a huge national park which was incredibly picturesque especially as the leaves on the trees had started to make their autumnal transformation...really beautiful colours. We pretty much had free run of the park and Adrian was patient and knowledgeable and knew exactly when and how hard to push us to achieve more. I was riding Indio, who had such a lovely temperament and was just as patient with me as Adrian was! By the end of the lesson my confidence had grown so much that I was cantering with no hands!I think what makes Caballos A La Par such a different experience is the fact that Adrian truly does love his horses, so much so that he's practically in tune with them and he's such a awesome person too. Riding in those gorgeous surroundings didn't hurt either!I would highly recommend this activity. Thank you to Adrian, Hernan (for his yummy mate), and especially to wonderful wonderful Indio, who I miss already!Dawn and Pablo x

Amazing! Unforgettable!. Caballos A La Par is awesome! It was one of the best days of my life because I was having a ton of fun riding Indio. I enjoyed cantering freely. Adrian is a patient, yet firm coach. His love for horses was infectious. Indio was a kind and excellent horse. It was only my third time riding, but I felt like I had been riding for years. Visitors to BA, you are missing a great opportunity if you forgo this experience. Book in advance and plan to have an excellent time. Everyone associated with Caballos A La Par, including Jose, who drives you there, is just outstanding!!!Here is a short haiku to express my gratitude:Riding is much funThe Caballos A La ParRemarkable times!

Fantastic Experience!!!. We visited the Caballos A La Par having neither ridden before and we both absolutely loved it!Adrian and everyone associated with the day made us feel so welcome and comfortable. We were picked up by Jose from the centre of town and driven out into the beautiful parkland where the stables are located. When we arrived we had ‘Mate’ before getting on a horse for the first time and with some initial instructions we were heading out. We arrived at some open ground for our lesson and spent a couple of hours under Adrian excellent tuition. Amazingly at the end of the couple of hours, which flew by, we were cantering with no hands!! which Adrian videoed on our camera so we have evidence for our friends at home.We both had nailed on smiles for the rest of the day.After a hot coffee and cakes Adrian dropped us back in town where we continued to talk about the fantastic day we had had for the rest of the evening.We loved Buenos Aires but these few hours were a definite highlight.

the joy of sharing. Never had anything to do with horses but it seemed so natural to ride side by side, chatting along & enjoying the parque in its fall season beauty - that I wasn't even surprised that I am actually able to ride a horse. So thank you, Indigo, for sharing the joy of cantering and everything else (I am sorry that I prevented you from nibbeling at those wonderful trees as Adrián had told me, he can be so strict sometimes ;-) and thank you Adrián for your warmhearted and constructive way of teaching. I miss it already.

A Present to Yourself. If you love horses, then promise yourself one thing while you are in Buenos Aires - to go riding with Caballos A La Par.You will not be disappointed.All the reviews are brilliant and accurate , but you must experience it to really understand.This is more than just sitting on a horse. This is about feeling the horse and understanding the connection between the two of you.I think there is a little magic involved too.Whatever you need to learn, Adriån can help.And he makes a wicked mate too.Do yourself a favour and go riding at Caballos A La Par. It is an experience that you will treasure from your time in Argentina.I truly wish I could have gone again the next day, but sadly my itinerary did not allow it.Next time :) I will make it a priority.

Exhilirating! it made me sooo h-a-p-p-y! do it!!!. I am writing a review for the horseriding trip I took with Adrian about a week ago. What an absolutely fantastic experience! I had read some great reviews online, but was still quite surprised when we arrived at the park, and Adrian’s first question was “What do you want out of this day?”… this day is going to be unlike any other horseriding experience you’re likely to have had. There is no slow walking in circles, or following each other, or a particular regime- instead it is based on what you want and entirely personalized to your pace/style/ability/desire. I wanted to canter with the horses. Sure enough after a hour long lesson, in which Adrian made sure I had the necessary understanding, we were cantering and even galloping with the horses. It was an exhilarating day and fully met- and exceeded- my expectations of what I had envisioned. The lessons/riding takes place in a beautiful national park- which just envelops you in its sense of tranquility and endless nature surrounding you every side. We didn’t see another person or a car on any side- at times Adrian would encourage me to ride ahead alone, so I felt like it was just me and my horse running through this beautiful nature. Adrian himself was a very friendly and kind person and a very patient teacher- we got along like old friends! .. and my horse, Indio, was a delight- he was so well-trained, and so responsive to my instructions that it made the learning so very easy!I think this is a highly recommendable activity - not just because you're in Argentina/Buenos Aires, but recommendable to go on your bucket list for life- go, do it!!

I would love to do this once a month !!!!!. I think this one of the best things i have done here and if I could I would go every month doing it ! Sergio let my ride his "baby" horse this second time in March I went, and i loved it . New experience. Kirsten is the best organizer to go with as an Expat and one just has to love Adrian with his stories after the ride. He is a thoroughbred equestrian and one can see it on the horses, they dont only just look great, they really are and so well trained and maintained! As an animal lover and ex-rider myself, i was happy to see and experience that ! A MUST DO AND MUST GO THINGHY WHILE YOU ARE HERE IN LOVELY BSAS!

An Amazing Experience. I've never written a trip advisor review before, but this place really is something special.As others have noted here, Adrian's a very friendly guy with a clear passion for his horses and for teaching. His friendliness isn't just a bonus - it's an integral part of the entire experience of learning to ride with him. He wants you to feel completely at ease as early as possible, so that you're happy and relaxed - this makes it easier to learn but also, perhaps more importantly, to get in synch with the horse that he's picked out for you. This is important because all of the horses are extremely well trained, which means that they respond to the most subtle of suggestions. My girfriend thought that her horse was reading her mind, but actually she was just being really well taught by two teachers - Adrian and the horse she was on. I'm glad that places like Trip Advisor exist to report gems like this. Adrian only set up 18 months or so ago, and he's competing with large and established places (that have the backing of the large hotels) where big groups of tourists go to sit on horses and amble through the countryside. Our experience at Caballos a la Par couldn't have been more different, so it's important to point out why it's special.. Adrian never teaches groups of disparate people: only individuals, couples or very small groups of friends. He brings you breakfast, you get to know eachother, you drink some mate together and you talk about life. He's a great teacher so wil always adapt his style and approach to whomever he's teaching, but our experience involved standing on one stirrup and riding alongside our horses and cantering with no hands as he videoed our experience. We even had a nice lunch together afterwards.It's a very personal experience you get at Caballos A La Par: you'll leave with a friend in Adrian and a new found appreciation for horses (plus a real ability to ride them, Argentinian style).Couldn't rate this more highly. I tried, but 5 stars really is the maximum you can do. Which is a shame because this deserves 2 or 3 more: do it....

Great fun with an inspiring teacher!. We arranged our day with Adrian to give ourselves both a fun day out of the city (Buenos Aires) and an introduction to riding in Argentina (useful to those who have learned European style).Adrian exceded our expectations by providing an exilarating, fun and challenging day. A talkative and fun character, we were immediately treated like old friends. Adrian certainly knows his horses and his riding, and he looks to challenge his 'pupils'. He is perceptive of riding ability and confidence levels and he 'pushed' us just the right amount so that we rapidly improved in (what is to us) a new and easy style of riding - we were cantering free of our reigns within an hour! We were then tought tricks and stood up on our saddles. Adrian makes his sessions fun and engaging while being a firm and commanding teacher so that one's riding comes on very quickly.Adrian is a fantastic teacher to whom I would recommend riders of all levels wanting a fun new experience and to learn something new. His horses are all very well kept and trained, as well as well loved and this makes learning easy and quick! Whether you are a complete begginer, have ridden all your life, or are into polo, showjumping or any other equestrian sport, you will all learn something new in horsemanship from Adrian, whilst having a great time.

A great way to spend a Saturday afternoon in the Argentine sunshine. Feels like you're a million miles away from the centre of BsAs. Very well behaved (and cared for) horses, friendly company - a great way to spend a Saturday afternoon in the Argentine sunshine....even for the total beginner.

Very Special Experience. Before I went to Buenos Aires I looked for recommendations of interesting things to do and found Caballos A La Par. Definitely off the beaten track and a truly wonderful experience.I was picked up in the city and driven out to the country side where I found a warm welcome and three horses saddled and ready to choose which one i liked best. I was a little anxious because I hadn't ridden in over 20 years but with some extremely good suggestions I felt very at ease on the horse I picked. Driving alongside each other (a la par) and not in a specific track was great fun. I thoroughly enjoyed the environment (trees, flowers and butterflies) and the extensive ride. (Never mind the sore muscles the next day!) I would definitely go back if I could and I strongly recommend the experience.

DO IT!!. Last Saturday my husband Dave and I went on our first horse-riding class with Adrian, and it was great. We were picked up in BsAs near a metro station, and in 1/2 hr we were at the stables about 30 km outside BsAs. Adrian has good English and is friendly personality. The parkland was pretty and peaceful, the horses were patient, intelligent and VERY CLEAN. Saddles and all the paraphernalia was sturdy and of quality leather and other materials. They gave us half-chaps and helmet-hats with brims. It was seemingly long time before we mounted the horses, but I think Adrian wanted us to relax, or he was figuring our nature to later apply certain teaching style? Dunno. We shared mate and chatted for a bit. They took their time to perfectly adjust stirrups, sandle, etc. Adrian was not beating around the bush: he challenged each of us from the moment we mounted the horse -- but he gave praises as well, but no fake pity praises..His assistant, Kirsteen, a gorgeous Scottish lass with the sweetest personality was softening a bit Adrian's upbeat style with calm and attentive remarks on our position, reins hold, etc - -but also reflecting her own riding learning experience. In the end, it was a perfect blend of tough critique and friendly support from both of them. In about an hour we were cantering comfortably. Returning to the stables was most relaxing, and we randomly practiced different techniques -- and horses were now super responsive...or was it that we learned to lead them better after all? Adrian brought a pile of pastries and offered drinks and mate. My only cautious comment would be that Adrian needs to drive his car less aggressively. I highly recommend this experience from all other angles.

Thoroughly unique and fun horseback riding experience. I have only ridden horses on a few occasions and so when my friend encouraged me to try a ride with Caballos A La Par, I thought that it would be simple journey through the countryside around Buenos Aires. However, it was so much more than a simple ride! Adrian and his staff have an intimate knowledge of their horses, their equipment and most importantly how to help new riders enjoy the experience of horseback riding. It was part lesson with Adrian giving me instructions in mid ride, part thrill with me finding the rhythm to gallop comfortably, and part experiment with me riding without the reins and even standing on the saddle.I highly recommend it!

Great horse riding instruction and day to remember. Having ridden horse on trails before and never really felt in control a session with Caballos A La Par was a revelation. Unlike trail riding the session is fully structured on your ability and progress and I went from someone who was fairly nervous to being fully in control by the end of the session riding which ever direction we chose. I cannot recommend it highly enough, the national park scenery is a great change from Buenos Aires too, I learnt loads and above all the day was a lot of fun! Just a pity I wasn't around long enough to have some more lessons!

Unforgettable - would do it again.. It was a most unforgettable experience. Great service,g reat people and great views - not to mention the horses (Thank you, Indio, for you patience!). when visiting Buenos Aires I will definitely repeat this great experience.

Great experience!. Finally i write a review about the two trips i did with Adrian and his well trained horses. It was pretty hard to change my style off riding "English --> western, but with the proffesional help of adrian i start to feel confident, and then it went better and better. The endless galloping across the plains, and the exercises where both fun and educational. I have felt very welcome and i definitely go back when I'm back in BsAs! Good luck with the company!Hasta la próxima, Eline (en Gesine from the Netherlands)

Amazing experience - so pleased I made the right decision to go riding here. When I knew that I was going to be spending some time in Buenos Aires as part of my travels one of my priorities was to go riding. Having not been on a horse since I was a child (over 20years ago) my fear was that I might get up on the horse and immediately want to get off again! That was absolutely not the case with the beautiful horse Indio I rode under Adrian's amazing instruction. I was able to completely put my trust in Adrian and Indio and relax and more than enjoy the experience. It was fantastic and I still can't believe that in the 4 hours or so I felt confident enough to canter with and without reins and stand up on the horse. It felt completely natural as I was with a skilled and passionate teacher and such well trained and responsive horse. I felt an excellent connection with Indio and was very sad to leave him, the people and the beautiful surroundings.I am so pleased that I listened to all the fabulous and well-deserved reviews on here and made the decision to go riding again. The experience at Caballos a la Par has been one of my highlights in Argentina and I cannot recommend it enough. I am lucky enough to be able to stay a little longer here and have booked in for another lesson as Adrian has given me the confidence and desire to start riding regularly again. I am still smiling when I think about the whole day, the riding, horse, people, place and the welcomed mate and pastries afterwards. Can't wait for my next lesson and the progress I will undoubtedly make.

Great Instructor and Guide - Wonderful Horse - Perfect Day. 12 February 2011 - I arranged the day by email and Adrian picked me up at my hotel. I am a beginner but Adrian is a patient and professional instructor who loves horses and teaching riding. He promised an enjoyable day and he taught me a lot along with allowing me to do more than I thought I could do. Adrian got me comfortable on my horse, and challenged me to ride at a higher level. We had a great day cantering, trotting, and walking through this beautiful park. On one canter, my foot left the stirrup so I stopped. Adrian chose to teach me how to lose my stirrup, continue cantering comfortably and regain it again without stopping. Later, I was doing a fast canter and I kept coming out of the saddle. Adrian gave me advice and some technique and the problem was solved. Perfect! Adrian was a gracious host and I had a wonderful day. I will be back to ride again.

Marvellous ride just outside Bs As city limits. Went riding with Adrian and his well trained horses on a Sunday morning. Adrian is one the very few guides who gives real and helpful instructions. Great horses, good gear, very close to Buenos Aires, very enjoyable ride, outstanding guide and instructor - I definitely recommend "Caballos a la par" to beginners as well as to experienced riders.

Ethereal. My husband and I went for our honeymoon down to Argentina and Uruguay in November 2010 (yes, we are slow to post on this experience!). I saw the reviews for Caballos a La Par and thought it would be perfect to go horseback riding, given how long my husband has been talking about wanting to learn to ride. When he saw reviews for Caballos a La Par, he joked that reviewers on Trip Advisor made Adrian, the owner, sound like Jesus Christ. I laughed and told him to keep his expectations to a reasonable level. He didn’t though, and he wasn’t disappointed!I wish I had Isabelle Allende’s gift of the written word to describe to you the experience. Adrian started his horseback riding and teaching company about a year ago. He will take you riding through the outer part of a national park that borders his ranch. Weekdays, the park is largely deserted which makes you feel like you are riding in a private reserve.Adrian took us through beautiful pampas, idyllic bridges and fields covered in beautiful tall grasses tipped with purple flowers. He said that he never takes riders on the same path, as he does not want to make his horses complacent. That’s not too challenging either I imagine, given how the park (Otamendi I believe – but don’t quote me) is 2,600 hectares large (yes, about 6,400 acres!!).He taught my husband and I how to trot, canter, and canter without our hands on our reins (is that the right word?) all in an afternoon. He also had these awesome dogs, one of which has (had?) no survival instincts as it’s always chasing after the horses that in turn try to shake him off with a kick of the hoof.After an exhilarating afternoon of riding, Adrian took us back to and served us mate and desserts at his ranch. We became very endeared to him because he is just a great human being!! He is welcome at our home as a friend whenever he wishes to visit. We wish him blessings and much success with the future of his business. Do not miss the opportunity to experience Caballos a La Par!

Awesome horse-riding experiences and coaching from Adrian. This is the first time I am on independent travel in Argentina and also first time in learning horse-riding. Adrian is a fantastic coach and he is very patient with me and guide me along in all the practices. I wish I can have more time to learn more from him! Definitely one of the activities for any traveler to Buenos Aires must try and also to meet Adrian, the kind-hearted coach!Regards,Isabel (Singapore)

Caballos A La Par. I am writing this from Buenos Aires , just a few hours after an amazing horse riding lesson with Adrian . Everything you've read about this wonderful place on Trip Advisor is totally true. Both of us , not even beginner level , can canter hand free after 2 hrs with Adrian . He just a talented teacher .. We really enjoy the place so much . Riding a horse freely in the park without people around is quite an experience , an unforgettable feeling . Very highly recommended excursion while you're in Buenos Aires

Fantastic - i would give it 6 stars if i could!. Visiting Adrian's ranch was one of the best experiences of my time in Argentina. We did quite a lot of riding on our trip but this was really special as we were taught how to ride western style rather than just follow a row of other tourists on their horses!It is clear that Adrian has put a lot of love and energy into building up his ranch and training his horses. I did the half day ride and we were out for about 2.5 hours in a very large park near buenos aires. Adrian gave me a lot of coaching on how to improve my riding and he got great results in such a short space of time. We had great fun too - he got us cantering without reins and standing on the saddle!I would really recommend this experience - it is about 30 mins from BA but they arrange transfers so its really easy to get to.Thanks Adrian for a wonderful afternoon and good luck with the rest of the year!

5 stars are not enough!. I read all the previous reviews on trip advisor and thought that this place might be too good to be true, but it is absolutely brilliant, and is well worth the visit. We had been on several different cabalgatas during our trip to Argentina but this was the best by absolutely miles. What made it so special is that although we were experienced riders 'English style' we were actually taught to ride Western style rather than just sitting on a horse and hoping for the best! The rides are through beautiful parkland but during the ride Adrian spends time with each rider and quietly gives one to one tuition.Adrian is a great teacher - very patient and clear in his explanations, so that during the ride we were cantering without reins, and even played around with some party tricks such as standing on the saddles which was great fun - it really took me back to my childhood.The horses are absolutely brilliant as well. Really well cared for, and not at all like riding school horses. Each has their own personality and they really do what you tell them to rather than following each other in a line and knowing when to speed up and slow down - the control is entirely with the rider.All in all a brilliant way to spend half a day - I just wish we could have gone for longer. It is a definite must do for anyone visiting Argentina!

Just can't say enought about Adrien and Caballos a la par. I headed off to Buenos Aires with my friend with some idea that we were going to do some riding. I was totally put off by tourist attractions as my friend and I are both experienced riders in the US. Well, I found Caballos a la par on this site, read the reviews and when I got here, decided to set up a time for a visit. Yesterday, we were picked up in the city and taken to the most wonderful park that is a Unesco Heritage site.. there we met Adrien Di Stefano, the director, and his assistant Sergio. These guys are the best. Adrien assisted us in getting just the right horse, and he wasn't satisfied until we were comfortable.. He gave Lisa his horse, a polo beauty, because she is very experienced.. It was not too long before she was jumping "Gaucho"... I followed along on Indio who was delightful. I have never had this much fun with my own horses.. we rode for over 3 hours in the park filled with eucalyptas trees and other beautiful vegetation... An hour into this lovely ride Adrien told me to drop my reins and start cantering. I thought he was nuts... but I thought I would try this, fully expecting to land face down on the ground. Of all wonders, I found I could canter fully around the field without losing balance, and with no reins, my arms flapping around to prove the point. Lisa was next, and yahoo'd the whole way around... then, I was told to take my feet out of the stirupps... I saw pending disaster, but Adrien was riding along side coaching me, and again, I was able to try this trick and it worked. What a lovely day. I just can't tell you how much fun it was to ride this area with your own personal trainer by your side who is congenial and supportive... One of the best days that will go down as having been completed in my bucket list... When we got back to the ranch, Adrien introduced us to the authentic hot drink called Mate, that is similar to tea, and very enjoyable served among friends. I recommend that you try this adventure. We left the hotel at 3 pm and returned at 9 pm enthusiastic that we had such a great time with Adrien..

Justifiable cliche - Words are never enough.... This was by far one of the best experience I've had in South America. I was wondering whether I had too high of expectations after reading all the reviews on trip advisor about Caballos A La Par and Adrian, but from the get go he made me feel at home. I've had four riding lessons prior to this one yes I was cantering without holding on to the reigns but more satisfyingly I finally got a grip on the correct posture, which at the end of the day allows you to fully enjoy horse riding and last longer on the horse without getting tired or sore. Adrian made me feel as though the whole Park was my own and indeed for the time it lasted it truly felt like it was. I really had a connection with the horse i was given, Indio and so quickly got saddened by the idea that I could only spend one day with him. I even enjoyed cleaning Indio as a part of that experience made me feel as though the horse was my own and i was taking care of it. The sweet pastries of all sorts and special mate was sensational! Adrian really trusted me with the horse, which immediately put a lot of confidence in myself, the horse and Adrian. I cantered without holding the reigns and closing my eyes! The day ended so peacefully and with a new found love for horse riding. Adrian pays close attention to you and reads his horses so well, which really helps the instruction and catering the lesson to your abilities and pushes them far beyond imagination.After some time in South America I was pretty much ready to go home, but after this experience I already started to dream of the day I would leave Australia to return to this amazing place and atmosphere! They say nothing is perfect, but in my experience this was. He owns an English Sheep Dog, my favourite, the day just got better and better. Please, do yourself a favour and check it out! I couldn't keep this review short even if I tried.

awesome excursion from BA and the best way to learn horse riding!. My friend and I were total novice when it came to horse-back riding, and while we were excited to try for the first time we were definitely nervous. Adrian was really patient and understanding with us, and we soon relaxed because his horses were so well trained and totally under his control. Within 2.5 hours of our very first lesson, we learned how to walk, trot, and canter (even hands-free) all on our own! The entire lesson took place in a quiet, beautiful national park, and it felt like we were the only ones there.Adrian told us that some of his horses were rescued/bought out from poor conditions, which made the whole experience even more special. It was great to see his horses so clean (no flies around, really), healthy (shiny coats), and happy (mild temperament). For those wondering about gear, just wear long trousers & comfy, closed-toe shoes, plus sunblock. Helmet hat and chaps are provided. Adrian takes good photos & videos during the lessons, so feel free to leave your camera at the hotel. After most trips and excursions I get a "been there, done that" sort of feeling, but Caballos A La Par is a definite, rare exception. Even if I went back to Buenos Aires next week, I'd do this again in a heart beat and hopefully learn some new tricks!

FANTASTIC TIME!. Absolutely fantastic excursion! There is much to see and do in Buenos Aires but you should take a morning or afternoon and head out to Caballos a-l-par. It matters not whether you are a novice or experienced rider, Adrian will cater the ride to you. He is patient, knowledgeable and passionate about his craft. The excursions are private so if you are learning to ride the atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed, no pressure from people you have never met. And when I say ride, I mean ride. You are not a passenger on these horses, you ride them. These animals are incredibly trained and respond to small, simple movements that Adrian patiently teaches you. After providing basic instruction and all the gear you need, Adrian guides you to a national park where you will explore creeks, pastures and woodlands. The countryside is beautiful and I recommend the evening tour as the sunset is spectacular. My husband and I are novice riders and we had no trouble. Adrian even taught us to canter the horses with no hands. At first I thought why would I want to do this, but after the experience it was amazing to see how small movements with my feet and body weight could direct the horse. The fact that this is possible is truly a credit to Adrian's abilities as a horse trainer. He is extremely accommodating, if Adrian feels you can master it, he will allow it. You feel more like a guest than a customer to this man. Everything is professional, from making the reservations to the ride to the socializing over pastries. Do not miss this experience!

Fantastic horse riding in beautiful argentinian countryside with an amazing instructor. A visit to Caballos a La Par is an absolute must when you visit buenos aires. I'm an advanced rider but haven't ridden for a good few years, meaning my technique was a bit sloppy! Adrian was one of the best instructors I've experienced in my 25 years of riding. He sensibly wanted me to test the horse before taking him out. I was given the most amazing horse; gaucho who was absolutely beautiful...full of energy and raring to gallop, yet so responsive and well-trained and listened to me completely. Within the first hour, I'd done exercises to improve my posture and technique, jumped over logs in the wood and galloped from one end of the meadow to the other...amazing!! My boyfriend Paul who lives in Buenos Aires is a beginner and this was his 3rd lesson with Adrian. I was so impressed with his technique and confidence and couldn't believe he'd only had so few lessons. He was cantering without hands and cantering ahead of us without any trouble.The horses are so well-looked after and Adrian adores each in their own way. He showed us around the ranch and we got to meet his entire horse family, before eating our own bodyweight in delicious cakes and chilling out with a nice cold beer....bliss!

Truly Unique!. I have ridden in many corners of the world, but until riding with Adrian, have not experienced what he offers anywhere else! A truly "free" outride in beautiful country, with marvelous horses who are not demented trail donkeys, but who have the spirit to run free, yet sensitive to each instruction! Adrian has taught me to regain my riding confidence and I am learning more with each ride! The experience takes multiple hours. There is no sense of being rushed or watching a clock and Adrian is an incredibly interesting person with amazingly interesting stories and views to share on history and events in Argentina. Caballos A La Par is a service of passion!

Learning to ride a horse, Argentinian style. Not far outside the city of Buenos Aires, is a quaint farm and a charming horse riding teacher, Adrian, who takes you through the local parks and forest, on horse back. By the end of the day, I could, for the first time, trot and canter properly. It's a very relaxed day with very well trained and behaved horses, although at the same time you're constantly learning and taught about your horse. Followed by cold beer and pastries!!!Its highly recommended to get out of the city for the day and try it out!!
Great experience for the family. We are a family of 6 with children from 10 - 16 years and with varying riding experience. We had a great afternoon with Adrian and everybody's riding improved too!

Unforgettable and Fantastic Experience!!!! :). I rode with Adrian and Caballos A La Par last week, and it was absolutely amazing!First, the horses are extremely well trained. They are very sensitive to the rider, and also are very careful. I have ridden a lot of school-horses before, and these seemed very different. They were interested in new riders, and seemed to enjoy being out in the park as much as I did. They also seemed to me to be very well taken care of, and in excellent condition. My horse was very eager to race, and seemed to love being out in the park! I was a bit worried riding on my own, but I felt very safe riding with the horses and with Adrian!! He is very attentive to the riders, and takes care to make sure that the rider learns technique and how to handle the horses even better. After the ride, I felt that I had learned a great deal, and was able to see my horse reacting better to my changes in technique!! The park and nature there is also extremely beautiful!! The area is gorgeous, and it is amazing to run through it on the horses, and it makes a rider feel very alive :) There are different types of terrain, and the rider is allowed to just goes as he or she sees fit throughout the park. I really enjoyed the experience!! There is no trail, and it is unlike anything I've rode on before. I definitely felt it was very unique to Caballos and was something I would remember always!!Adrian is also extremely nice! He was great to talk to, and is extremely knowledgeable about horses and all types of equestrian sports. He is a great person to ride with! We chatted beforehand, and also ate some pastries and mate together afterward. I thought it was a very perfect day, and really enjoyed the experience!!!!If I had stayed longer in Argentina, I would have definitely gone again!!!! :)

An amazing and unique experience! Not to miss!!. I've been riding with Caballos A La Par twice and have had amazing experiences both times. I was a complete beginner but I felt at ease with the horses and Adrian’s guidance. At the end of the day, I couldn’t believe everything I had managed to do, especially cantering without reigns and standing up on a horse! Adrian makes sure each visit is personalised. Groups are very small so he can spend one-on-one time with everyone. He’s also a very welcoming host, providing drinks and facturas (pastries) after riding. I strongly recommend going to Caballos A La Par, whether you are visiting BA or living here. You will truly have an amazing time!

An experience not to be missed. Sometimes you get lucky, and get to experience something amazing. Sometimes you get lucky and get to meet someone amazing. With Caballos A La Par, you get to do both. If you happen to find yourself in Argentina, or even in South America, I highly recommend taking the time to participate in this wonderful excursion. This horseback ride is one that few will get to experience somewhere else, and much of the credit goes to Adrian. Adrian makes every ride a unique and personal experience. He takes you out into the open fields of Argentina and actually lets you trot and gallop with the horse, instead of merely instructing you to follow in line on a trail. He pushes you to accomplish what you think you can not, and in the end, you will find it to be one of the most rewarding experiences. Everything about this experience, the horses, the saddle, the ranch, and even Adrian himself, is extraordinary. If you are looking for a true horseback riding adventure, Caballos A La Par is the perfect opportunity.

Best horseback riding experience while traveling...Ever!. This horseback riding experience was simply in one word.."Outstanding". Personalized riding in a beautiful pastoral setting only 40 minutes outside Buenos Aires. The horses were in tip top shape and every attention to detail was handled beautifully from the moment I was picked up at the hotel. The owner, Adrian, takes great pride in the quality of his horses, their training and care and the beautifully maintained grounds. Best of all, though, is the riding experience. Horses, side by side, not nose to tail. Galloping, cantering, riding free with the reins on the horses neck...a truly exhilarating moment for the horse lover. I would definitely book this activity again when I return to Buenos Aires

One spectacular experience. I have gone on horseback riding excursions on many travels- but this was easily the best. Adrian is the perfect guide, with patience, a sense of humor and incredibly passionate about his horses and the Estancia. For any level of rider, Adrian makes you feel comfortable but challenges you to be your best at the same time. My friends and I had the most incredible day at the Estancia. Hope we get to return someday to that simply gorgeous reserve.

Excellent Riding Experience. Everyone looking for some nice riding in Buenos Aires should try Adrians Caballos A La Par. We were 5 friends from Sweden with different riding experience visiting Argentina for a few days in oktober and we wanted to go horsebackriding together. We chose Caballos A La Par because it seemed to be what we were looking for and we were not disappointed! For us it was a new way of riding but Adrian made sure everyone got hold of the idea of the Argentinian way of riding. We had so much fun that we had to go back for a second time and we would have loved a third time! I can strongly recommend Caballos A La Par!

A piece of my heart remained there... waiting for the rest to follow!. I am what one could call a "horse freak", raised within horses in a different continent from the one I live in now, and I've been doing the show jumping thing for many years, yet always feeling it wasn't enough.For that reason, I've always wanted to experience different horse riding ways, which brought me to Ireland for example, and then to any horse riding place I could find just to spend some time with those animals I love so much.Argentina was the destination chosen by my parents to go and celebrate their 25th anniversary, and thank God they ain't people who count out the kids :)I'm 24 years old, but out there in the fields riding under the sun with a horse I totally fell in love with, I was as happy as a toddler on Christmas morning.Adrian came to pick us up at the hotel, brought us to the property which is incredible on its own, with so much green and fresh air you can't belive it's right outside the city. After drinks, some chit chatting and getting ready, we met our horses and were off to ride. My dad and my sister who rode with me are beginners, and both of them hadn't ever cantered before. They were given two small horses who looked like they knew their thing, and it turned out to be so: smooth, gentle, and perfect companions to learn new things. By the end of the ride, my dad and sis had learnt to canter hands off and were having a blast.I got a bigger horse, young and wide awake: he looked like he was in for some serious running around and so was I. Looked like we were meant to be.Adrian explained right away his goal was to have us spend a great 2 hours doing what we wanted to, while he helped with whatever we needed. I ran with my horse through this incredible park and not believing it, so fast and so good.All horses looked healthy and were let loose after rides to run around the property, till it was dark. Moreover, they were perfectly trained and responded incredibly well. On the the we rode, the weather was good but very windy: the horses didn't notice at all :) When we got back to the property, Adrian offered us treats, more drinks, and then brought us back to the hotel.AMAZING AMAZING experience, and I can't wait to go back. To all of you who love horses and are looking for the perfect ride in an incredible landscape, go there. You'll want to stay.

Beautiful horses & great people. My wife and I enjoyed the experience very very much. The horses were very beautiful and friendly, and the people at the ranch were warm and welcoming. Adrian is a great guy, we really enjoyed talking to him after riding for two hours in forests and fields. My wife is a beginner rider, but he gave her a lot of advice because he wanted us to enjoy the experience as much as he did. He's a great teacher and you can feel how much he loves horses and how well the horses are taken care of. We're looking forward to spending more time at his ranch.Jim

Great riding in an unexpected place. My horse-crazy daughter had been living and working in Buenos Aires for about 6 months, and we finally decided to take a trip to Buenos Aires to visit her. She had mapped out our entire week for us, and insisted that we end our week with a ride at Caballos a la Par. She had been riding there throughout her stay in Argentina and had raved about it the whole time, but we didn't really pay too much attention to her since there hasn't been any time or place where she didn't want to ride.We were picked up on-time and taken to the stable, about 30 minutes away from the city. The stable was a nice change from hustling Buenos Aires, quiet and green, a nice change. We waited a bit, and enjoyed the nice weather while Adrian (the owner) finished up with another guest who had ridden earlier. We observed the horses too, and they were all very healthy and happy.After a few minutes, Adrian came out and we got ready to go. My husband and I rode two very pleasant, soft-mouthed, responsive mounts. They were truly wonderful. We have vacationed at a Colorado dude ranch for about 12 years in a row, and while their horses are nice, Adrian's mounts were truly exceptional. They were quiet and very well-behaved, smooth, and responsive. They didn't flinch when we encountered bikers, small children - nothing phased them but they would ease into a canter with the slightest pressure, and would slow down just as politely . Our daughter, an experienced rider, was delighted with her usual mount as well (Adrian's beautiful and energetic polo horse), and would have taken him home in her suitcase if possible. We were allowed to ride however we pleased, and didn't feel hurried or pressured to end the ride or ride for more time than we wanted- it was just right. We got to do some special and fun exercies, and our daughter got the chance to do some more advanced riding, which we know she appreciates. After we got back to the barn, we dismounted and headed to relax after the ride. Adrian offered us some very enticing pastries (the best all week, although we'd eaten so much in BsAs that we couldn't even make a dent in the pastries) and some ice cold beer. We chatted about horses and the ride, and thanked Adrian for the amazing experience!We would all highly recommend this side-trip from Buenos Aires if you have any interest in riding. It may seem like a bit of a strange excursion while visiting a big city, but Adrian's accommodating operation is outstanding and you will not regret it.

The ride of your life!. Adrian gave us one of the most memorable experiences of the year (in fact, of many years). My friend Leticia and I spent the week between Christmas and New Years in Buenos Aires together. When i asked if she was interested in horseback riding, she said "yes, but I am a little afraid as I have never been on a horse before." I called Caballos A La Par, and spoke to Adrian. He explained that he was incredibly busy but if he had any cancellations he would contact me. The following evening, Adrian sent me an email indicating that a couple from New York had to cancel as they were still snowed in. Unfortunately, by the time I had responded, someone else who was also waiting had taken the slot. Nevertheless, Adrian said that he would make a spot for us on Friday afternoon (New Years Eve). Thank goodness he said yes, as the experience with Adrian turned out to be one of the highlights of the year for both Leticia and myself. Setting: Caballos A La Par is located adjacent to the Parque Provincial Pereyra Iraola between Buenos Aires and La Plata. We arrived at a quiet, peaceful place and were greeted by friendly dogs, many horses and Adrian's associate Sergio. The ride passes down a dirt road, into the forest with most of the time spent riding through knee high grass fields. We saw numerous birds and a rabbit (but no other people) the entire time we were in the park. The sheer beauty of the natural surrounds is worth the trip alone. Horses:Adrian asked some questions up front to determine our level of experience and after meeting us in person and assessing our size and temperament, selected horses appropriate for each of us. I had some limited experience 15+ years ago while my friend had none. I am outgoing and comfortable being in control, she is more quiet and calm. Adrian selected horses that seem to be appropriate for each of us. Leticia's horse was smaller and well behaved, mine larger and a little more willing to test me. Both were perfect. One-on-One Training:More background here. I managed a technical training company for years and found that while many people understand a subject, only a few can teach it, and even fewer can teach it well. Adrian is one of the most effective trainers I have ever met. He starts by communicating the basics of riding, watching how you execute them and corrects your behavior in a friendly but firm manner. When you have mastered one step, he then pushes you forward to the next one. The appropriate mixture of education, encouragement and challenge, varied based on the needs of the person, and his desire to see you grown and reach new heights results in you accomplishing things you might never think possible. That is a spectacular teacher. Breaks through Boundaries:Adrian demonstrates a keen sense of each persons capacity to do more and works to move you beyond your on self imposed limits. He focuses on you individually. Works with you individually and challenges you individually. By the end of our lesson, I had ridden around a 10 acre open meadow cantering at high speed without holding on to the reigns. LETICIA HAD NEVER BEEN ON A HORSE BEFORE AND RODE HANDS FREE ALSO. Adrian inspired and pushed us to do things we never thought possible. Warm, Person Touch:Throughout all of our communication, Adrian proved to be a kind, generous, person interested in knowing more about us and sharing a lot about him self and his life with us. We felt like we had gone riding with a friend, not some stranger we met on through the internet. At the end, we finished off the day with some wonderful pastries and drinks before sadly heading back to the city for New Years Eve. A New Years Eve we spent talking non-stop about how much we loved and learned from the experience with Adrian.

A Great Escape!. We love this vibrant and exciting city, but during our second visit in Buenos Aires we decided we needed a break away from the big ciudad. We contacted Adrian at Caballos A La Par and had a day we will never forget! Although we had never been on a horse before, Adrian soon had us galloping thru meadows full of beautiful wildflowers and even crossing a stream. This was the most exciting and at the same time relaxing excursion we have ever experienced in our travels. We now have a new tradition for our next trip to Buenos Aires. Thank you Adrian, we can't wait to ride with you again!

Riding like it was meant to be !!. Bored of lame and aimless tourist riding experiences?? Want to relive that exhilarating feeling of riding free in the nature, on good horses who are enjoying their job, in good company and over beautiful and sometimes challenging terrain? Popping over fallen tree trunks, racing flat out across a meadow of wild flowers, climbing up and down riverbeds and rummaging through bushes... and then strolling gently home in the evening sun with a big grin on your face to the waiting after ride drink and a sizzling BBQ...Caballos A La Par gives you an unforgettable experience on horse back and you will enjoy it regardless of your level and prior riding experience. Adrian will carefully select a suitable horse that you feel comfortable with and will take you for a ride of your dreams through the vast and beautiful national park on the edge of the ranch. Instead of spending hours in the arena repeating meaningless excercises, you will be taken straight out into the nature, where you will learn as you ride. As you gain confidence in yourself and your horse, the ride will become increasingly challenging, fast and more fun, until you find yourself racing across the open fields or popping over those tree trunks just as you always imagined!In short, this is a riding experience above simple hacking. It is a great way to spend an afternoon away from the busy Buenos Aires and relax on a trail ride, learn to ride and handle your horse outside on a hack, and just to enjoy the peace and quiet in the gorgeous park. If you live in Buenos Aires, you will want to come back! Riding is well organized from booking to pick-ups to choosing horses and hacking, horses are well looked after and good tempered and people are friendly and very welcoming. Remember to bring your camera!

The highlight of our trip... a MUST DO in Buenos Aires. My husband and I have not been on horses in decades but we read the reviews and knew we wanted to try Caballos A La Par. I contacted them by email. The response was quick and efficient. They even setup our transportation from the hotel. The ranch was beautiful. Adrian took time with us to make sure we felt comfortable with the horses and we went thru the basics before we could leave for our adventure. Adrian is an exceptional trainer and exceeded our expectations! Before it was over, we actually were able to cantor without the reigns and even stand on our horses for a photo opp. I have never felt so comfortable with horses before.
