It's a one of a kind experience that will entertain and delight every member of your family! (Adrian supplies hats so your face is covered. If you're fair skinned and wear short sleeve shirts, make sure to put some sunscreen on your arms.)Make sure to bring your camera, there are so many photo opportunities!An absolute dynamic experience that shouldn't be missed!

Don't leave BA without doing this.. I wouldn't call it a tour or a private lesson even. Caballos A La Par offers what everyday should feel like when you are on a vacation: like you are spending an afternoon with a friend and their passion. I have always loved horses but my friend and i didn't have much experience and neither of us had even been on a horse in over 10 years. After 10 mins with Adrian you feel like you not only trust him and the horse but yourself as well. It is really a testament to Adrian as a teacher to be able to get someone to trust themselves in doing something they are so unfamiliar with(standing on a horse, cantering without reins) in such little time. The park you ride in is beautiful as well and the drinks, snacks, and Adrian's company are a perfect end to an exciting and relaxing experience unlike any other you will have in BA.

Highlight of Argentina. Not having sat on a horse before, I was not particularly excited when a friend suggested we go horse riding, however, I soon changed my mind and this experience became a highlight of Argentina, so much so, we did it again when we passed through BA at the end of our trip!The day was exactly how I imagined being a Gaucho is. Although we had to learn all the basics from scratch, before the end of the trip, Adrian had us cantering with no hands through the long grass meadows of the beautiful national park at sunset - magical! Adrian himself is a extremely friendly person, not to mention a fantastic teacher - he even offered us an authentic lomo steak BBQ should we ever return - something I am definitely going to take him up on when I get the chance to return to Argentina.I would definitely recommend this experience - you will never forget it!Andrew

Definitely recommended!!. We are already working for more than 1 year in BsAs and wanted to do something different in the weekend than hanging around in the city.And I can assure you that this is definitely something different. It was wonderfull just riding horses into 'the wild'. The park is really beautifull and peaceful. In the beginning it is not easy to ride a horse, but Adrian helps you constantly and give you tips on how to improve your style. It is amazing how fast you can learn and manage the horse on your own. After 2 hours it was fantastic to ride alone through the fields of the park. Adrian was at the back, so it was like we were riding all alone over there. Just wonderfull.Adrian is very friendly and always helpfull. he handles everything with patience and that helps a lot to be patient as well (important on a horse you never rode before).I can highly recommend this horse-riding expierence to everybody who is visiting BsAs and who is staying already a long time in BsAs and wants to do something else.

A fantastic day out!. An unforgettable argentine horse riding experience. Definately worth every penny. Adrian was a great teacher and really made us feel welcome on the ranch providing pastries and the best hot chocolate and coffee we have tasted in the 3 months we have been here! The ride in itself was worth its money as we were out for at least 2.5 hours and was very challenging for all levels. We learnt to ride without reins, stand on the saddle, even as a beginner i learnt to trot and cantor all within about 15 mins of leaving the ranch!! The horses had a great tempermnet too and were clearly well looked after. This should be a priority on everones to do list when visiting Buenos Aires. Lots and lots of fun out of the city in beautiful countryside. Highly recommended.

Exhilarating yet tranquil. If you want a 1/2 day away from the heat and bustle of the city. Head out to La Plata and spend it with Adrian, his team and the most wonderful horses. It is truly calming and relaxing and the countryside is glorious. Adrian is extremely welcoming and hospitable and a very able horseman. He provides riding at every level and is very patient and extremely encouraging with beginners -myself and Sophia! By the end of the day we were cantoring along the beautiful countryside. I highly recommend taking time out for this experience- one of the best, most memorable things we did whilst in Buenos Aires. It is 30/40 minutes by car or bus(129) from the city- Adrian can arrange transport too. We are still talking about the day.... -thanks again Adrian and also to your team. Susan and Sophia

One in a million experience! Absolutely Awesome!. There are not enough words to describe how fantastic you feel after spending time here with Adrian and his horses. The idyllic setting, well trained horses and Adrian himself all contribute to making this experience one in a million. I have worked in stables before but I learn't more in 2-3 hours than I ever experienced before, and at the same time as two total beginners! All of us cantering freely through tall grass in the fading sunlight with no hands on reigns, absolutely awesome! If you ever wanted to try horse riding, do it here! You won't be disappointed!

EXCELLENT HORSE RIDING ADVENTURE!!! with Caballos A La Par. Our riding adventure with Caballos A la Par was AMAZING! – It was such an enjoyable and unique experience – that we all made arrangements to come back for a second riding adventure before leaving Argentina!! We contacted Adrian (who is the horse trainer and riding instructor of Caballos A La Par) by email, and we were lucky to find an available time to ride during our stay in Buenos Aires. We were a family of 3; my mother, she’s in her sixties, my daughter almost 8 and myself 30 yrs old. We are all on a beginner level and have no previous professional riding experience whatsoever. What we do have, on the other hand, is a passion for horses and beautiful nature – and our wish to combine the two by visiting the Ranch in Caballos A la Par was indeed fulfilled. The transport from the city center of Buenos Aires (about 30 -40 min with car) was arranged by Adrian and is very practical. We felt at home on the beautiful ranch right away; the people and all the animals were so welcoming. Adrian is fantastic; he is so friendly and full of positive energy, he made us feel so comfortable! He gave us excellent equipment for safety – a hat that is actually a helmet and leg protectors. He knew exactly which horses to give each one of us, and provided very good instructions in the “A la Par” method and let us gets acquainted with the beautiful horses, before the riding adventure began. Adrian’s horses are exceptionally well trained for beginners like us as well; – they are calmed, yet strong and happy and unbelievably helpful at the same time. Adrian and Kristy rode next to us and gave us helpful tips along the way. We truly felt safe. Adrian told us we would be surprised by how much we would improve over the next few hours on the horseback – and we laughed and only hoped it was true! Little did we know that all 3 of us, were able to control the horses and ride in a way we only had dreamed about before!! It was so wonderful and more amazing than I can describe with words – but I will try: The ranch is located by Parque Provincial Pereyra Iraola; a unique Natural Forest and Biosphere Reserve (proclaimed by UNESCO). So, we had over 10.000 hectares of green nature and lush landscapes waiting for us. No boring and restricted trail to follow there! We were actually free to make up our own way as we entered into the wild nature of green tall trees and big fields. This gave us a unique feeling of freedom and exploration, which I believe is so unusual and extraordinary in activities like this! Adrian told us that no two riding adventures are ever the same – and we could see he was right! When we found an open green field we started practicing one on one with Adrian, trotting and even cantering! We had so much fun! We took lots of pictures and Adrian filmed us too. (He gave us the films later – just so amazing memories to have). My daughter was so happy and excited that she was able to canter alone on a horse for the first time in her life and she managed to stop the horse as well! She was so very proud and so was I! Not to mention my mother, she blew us all away with her quick learner skills! She looked like a Pro! She said she was able to do all these amazing things because she felt safe at all times – so true! Adrian is not only a wonderful instructor and teacher, he also gives you trust in yourself and courage to do what you really are able to do! We laughed so much and had such a wonderful time that we did not feel the hours passing by! I will not write about everything we learned in our adventure because I want to leave the magical moments as a surprise for everyone who will visit Caballos A La Par…After several hours of riding in nature, we returned to the ranch and Adrian and Kristy made delicious hot chocolate and Mate (my favorite) for us. The pastries tasted heavenly as well! We were so thrilled and enjoying ourselves so much that we asked Adrian to please find us another time we could go riding again before our departure! He was going to do what he could – and of course he did: so we spent our last day in Buenos Aires riding! We are so grateful that we met Adrian, Kristy, Sergio and their magnificent horses – these two equestrian adventures were beyond our dreams!I very warmly recommend visiting Caballos A la Par to anyone who has a chance to do so! We were a family of 3 generations, and we were given such a wonderful experience together- one that we will remember for the rest of our lives! - We wish you the same!!

Amazing, magical must-do horse riding just outside Buenos Aires. Not only is this the best thing I did in Argentina, but it's the best thing I've ever done!! To give some background, I had only ever done 1hrs horse riding on a trail before this. At Caballos a la par I was with 4 other friends of the same level and we had the ranch to ourselves. Having read the website and reviews of Caballos a la par I had high expectations - these were exceeded from the start. We were picked up by Adrian's dad at the exact time agreed and driven around 45 mins outside of BA to the beautiful ranch, a little oasis outside of the busy city. Immediately we were greeted by three very friendly dogs and Adrian who was also very welcoming. We had plenty of time to change and visit the bathroom before we put on our leather leg protectors and cool cowboy style protecting helmets (which Adrian designed and had made himself). Adrian gave a quick but very informative lesson on how to properly sit on a horse, hold the reigns, position your legs, start, stop and turn the horse. One by one we were called over to get on our horse. The horses were beautiful and in great condition (in stark contrast to some horses we rode in Mendoza which were skinny and very smelly!) Once on the horse we were adjusted and did a quick balance exercise - as much practice for us as for Adrian to see how we were with the horses, he really wants you to get the most out of the lesson and obverved us very closely throughout the day. Once everyone was on their horse, we started off down the road.As the website and reviews say, this isn't a traditonal horse trek where you just follow each other - the horses are completely at your mercy and will go where you direct them, so you quickly learn how to control the horse. Soon Adrian was encouraging us to speed up and we were trotting. We all received a constant flow of advice from Adrian on how to improve our position (again, very different to our trek in Mendoza where the guide didn't say a word and didn't care!)We made our way off the road onto the land (a beautiful national heritage site) where we were able to do our own thing a bit more. Adrian taught us how to move around on his specially designed unique saddles, to dodge any overgrowing trees. Once we reached a big expanse of meadow we had all been trotting for a while and felt very comfortable - then it was time to learn how to canter!! Adrian gave us quick demo and took us off one by one - with Adrian's help it was easy and the most amazing feeling to be riding the horse like this so quickly!! He called out advice to us as he rode along side us - how to slightly adjust our bodies so not to bounce etc. The horses are so well trained that small body movements trigger them to do something else, so it's important to listen to every word he says!After we had all cantered we were elated and had time to take pictures of each other with our new found skills. However, Adrian wasn't finished with us yet - he wanted us to canter without reigns!! I was a little dubious but, again, with tuition it was really quite easy!! We then had about an hour of doing laps of the fields whilst Adrian filmed us and took group pictures (one of us standing on the horses!) and generally messing around, before heading back to the ranch.Back at the ranch we had more photos, refreshments and pastries. We sat and chatted with Adrian for about an hour about how he started Caballos a la par (an inspiring story) and about his teaching of local children and his family. We were picked up at 3pm and eventually driven back at 8.30, although we were welcome to have stayed a lot longer. In summary, you have to go to Caballos a la par - it was the most magical and amazing experience, we were all buzzing from it for days! I even thought it was all a dream when I woke up the next morning!! Don't bother with any other horse riding, they're all touristy walks along a trail and a waste of time. Adrian has set out to create a quality learning experience and achieves that and a lot more. You don't have to go as far as we did if you are a beginner, Adrian will only push you as far as you'd likeyo go and is well aware of safety. My lesson has inspired me to go on a horse riding holiday next year - I think I'm addicted!!THANK YOU ADRIAN!!!!!!!Rachel

Could you have more fun on a horse in one day and learn heaps!. I was looking for a horse ride that would suit both me as beginner and my husband who can ride reasonably well. We wanted to gain some riding skills rather than just a typical group nose to tail horseriding experience. We definately found the place at caballos a la par. We went for a 2 and half hour exclusive ride with adrian and I noticed from the start the quality of the horses that were well trained, cared for and responsive. . Safety was also a priority with adrian something unusual at times in argentina. Adrian is a fantastic teacher that gives you great confidence and speaks english which is even better. I was a beginner and a little nervous but within a short period was feeling confident and could not believe I was cantering by the end of the ride. The scenery was beautiful reminding me of australia in parts. We have been on a few trail rides in the past but this beats any ride we have had hands down! If you are looking to improve your skills and learn how to ride argentinian style in great countryside - this is the place. He also serves great coffee and cakes. Best ride my husband and I I have ever had and heaps of fun at same time. If you don't believe me look at the photos.

An amazing experience!!! Don't hesitate, just do it!. Caballos A La Par is The Place to go if you want to have an excellent horseback riding experience. I started out being scared of horses and after 2 hours I was cantering without hands on the pampas.Adrian's passion for horses is contagious and made me feel confident for the first time riding a horse. The beautifull landscape, the great horses, the ranch, the excellent coaching by Adrian all contribute to an unforgetable experience. We ended up drinking maté together and had a wonderful evening. It was definate a highlight of our stay in Argentina.

Once a life time experience!. I never thought I could ride a horsey! Always been too scared to trust something that is so big and could not really talk to me. But Adrian and Kirsteen were so friendly, warm and caring that they helped me trust them to trust the horses. The station was also beautiful. The drive in just relaxed me. Beautiful and clean. I loved the hot chocolate, tea and pastries after the ride :)

Definitely the best part of my two week vacation in Argentina!. I spent 15 days in Argentina, going to the Iguazu Falls, Salta and Jujuy and, finally, Buenos Aires. My one-on-one horseriding lesson with Adriàn fell on day 13. A friend of mine asked me just before I left which part of Argentina had been the best for me. My response? Until Caballos A La Par, my favourite part had been the beautiful scenery in Northwest Argentina, but the fantastic five hours or so I spent with Adriàn (including the drive to and from Buenos Aires) had squarely catapulted Buenos Aires into the lead. That's how good it was.I had never ridden before, unless you count the ride I had being led by a gaucho just a few days before my lesson (and I don't), so I didn't have any expectations as to what I'd end up learning from this lesson. When I met Adriàn at the pick-up point, he told me that I had to trust in him, and that he wouldn't ask me to do something he didn't think I could do. It's very easy to trust Adriàn; he's patient, gives clear instructions, and has a very reassuring, and, most importantly, honest air about him. If he says you're doing well, it's because you are. And I'm not just saying that because he told me I was!During the three hour-ish lesson, he taught me how to control a horse, canter, canter without using the reins, all while either riding side-by-side or even riding ahead of Adriàn. After my first few successful reins-free canters with my steed, Indio, Adriàn asked if I wanted to switch to Caramelo, Adriàn's horse, a horse, I might add, which is considerably bigger than I am. I'm not one to turn down a challenge, so I switched, and, man, it was very different, but, nevertheless, still a lot of fun. It was such a thrill being able to apply what Adriàn had taught to a completely different horse.Of course, one of the best parts of this incredible experience was the part where Adriàn made me stand up on Indio. I was more than a little scared, but Adriàn taught me what to do in the event Indio moved (let's just say it's something I don't think any male would like to do), and I got me some pretty darn cool photos which bring a huge smile to my face whenever I see them.It's not just the lesson which makes this so great; it's also Adriàn's company. He's a great conversationalist and we ended up talking about a whole load of things. He also made sure I was well-fed, having bought a lot of pastries for the post-lesson chat, and made me a mean cup of hot chocolate (using real chocolate!). All in all, I had one hell of a time. I didn't stop smiling the whole time! I really wished I'd gone there earlier so that I could have returned for a second lesson before returning home.Muchas gracias, Adriàn, and I'm really hoping I get to go back soon.

Brilliant afternoon, brilliant horses, brilliant Adrian!. My girlfriend and I spent an amazing afternoon with Adrian and his horses a few weeks ago which we would encourage everybody spending time in Buenos Aires, to both experience and enjoy.Everything was easily arranged with Adrian via e-mail before we arrived in BA, and Adrian promptly picked us up from our hostel on the arranged day. Driving down to the National Park (30 mins max), we were able to get to know Adrian, who impressed us with his passion for horses and the incredible story of how his new venture came about. He also reassured us novice horse-riders that we’d not only be able to comfortably ride his horses but also be able to reach canter speed with them (and canter we did!)Arriving at his ranch, we were introduced to his amazingly well kept horses and told the basics of how to control them. The first thing that struck us, was the feeling that his horses were better trained and therefore more responsive to the horses that we’d previously had lessons with in the UK. This made things a lot easier and a lot more enjoyable!The three of us spent about 2-3 hours doing various exercises with the horses in the National Park, from trotting to being able to canter with no hands on the reins! From walking through rivers, to bending down to pick our hats off the floor… while staying on the horse! You really have to step back and appreciate the scenery as you ride through the fields as the sun sets. We finished the day on the ranch chatting, eating amazing pastries, and drinking Adrian's special submarino’s (hot milk with chocolate bar). The whole day is highly recommended, and it was one of the highlights of our Argentina experience!Thanks Adrian. Hope to see you again soon!Gareth and Sarah.

My adventure day of horseback riding at Caballos A La Par was the highlight of a wonderful trip.. I am an avid equestrian and was visiting Buenos Aires to dance tango. I was able to manage a day in the country to ride with Adrian and was utterly delighted with the experience. The horses are well cared for and Adrian makes a great effort to make the experience special and exciting and truly unique. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a day in the country and horse back riding.

Such a pleasurable riding experience. If you love and appreciate horses...enjoy the experience of riding in a beautiful place...value good conversation and companionship...this is really something you should not pass up. (I hope this doesn't sound like a travel agent's pitch, because it is not. This is the real thing.)My husband and I just returned from a trip to Buenos Aires last week. Truly, one of the best experiences we had was riding with Adriàn and his beautiful, gentle horses. We were picked up promptly in the early afternoon, and were on the ranch in about 35 minutes. Almost as soon as we entered the gate and were greeted with genuine hellos (and friendly eyes of the horses waiting for us), we began to feel at home. We spent the first part of the afternoon in conversation; getting to know each other and sharing our riding experience. I have ridden more than my husband, but neither of us is an experienced rider. Adriàn spent the right amount of time instructing on the basics of riding and getting our stirrups and reins adjusted perfectly, then we were off. We rode side by side (a la par) in the beginning, conversation blending with riding instruction. Adriàn was very patient, and made us both feel confident and competent within a short period of time. We were learning as we rode, but such a different approach! When the time came to canter without reins through a large field of tall grass, we trusted Adriàn and our horses when he told us to "leave the reins." After that, we rode for pleasure; walking, trotting, cantering when we wanted, riding through plants almost as tall as the backs of our horses and trails with nobody else on them. We often returned to riding a la par and enjoying the conversation that came easily. We rode for about three hours, and then returned to the ranch.Our experience didn't end there, though. I petted and rubbed down my horse Indio for awhile after the ride (no complaints on either end there!), then we walked to a gazebo at the back of the property and had Quilmes and pastries and shared mate. We learned that mate is more than a beverage. It is to be experienced with friends along with good conversation...and so it got dark, and we stayed pretty late. When it was time to go, Adriàn drove us back to the city himself. We said goodnight, but we felt that we had made a friend in Adriàn, not just spent the day on a horseback ride.It is very apparent that Adriàn loves his horses. He is gentle with them, but firm when needed. He was an excellent instructor, but let us ride independently once he knew we were comfortable. What a truly great experience!

the best horse ride of my life!!!!!. WOW...this was the MOST FUN I've ever had on horseback! I highly recommend Adrian and Caballos A La Par to anyone from beginner to expert. You will not be disappointed! Two girls in our group of four riders had never been on horseback before and within an hour they were comfortable enough to relax and really enjoy the ride. First, you get all the safety equipment and several minutes of instruction from Adrian, the owner. He speaks English well and is very patient and encouraging. The horses are extremely gentle yet spirited and not the usual broken down nags you get at some ranches. Then you ride for 45 minutes through a lovely park with trees, streams and sturdy bridges that are part of a 24,000 acre state park. Then you reach a large meadow filled with pampas grass and one by one you are taught to canter and gallop. Then, unbelievably, you will gallop without holding on to the reins....(they are used to guide the horse-- not for staying on the horse-- anymore than hanging onto your steering wheel keeps you inside your car!!!) Then we posed for a picture on a bridge STANDING UP on the horse's back...that's how gentle these horses were...they didn't move a muscle! After the 2 1/2 hour ride you will have refreshments in a nice glassed-in gazebo with a fireplace for cold days. Pick up and drop off are prompt and included with the price. I used to ride a lot as a child and this was just as much fun as I remembered! Truly the highlight of my 9 month stay in Buenos Aires...I'll be back for more next week!

Two great afternoons!. We spent two afternoons riding together with Adriàn and his team. At the beginning we were only planning one lesson, but since Adriàn was such a friendly and well trained teacher we soon decided to return for another class. Adriàn was a perfect teacher both for those of us who were more experienced and with a less experienced person such as myself. Adriàn had a balance between keeping our riding safe but still he offered us personal challenges. The horses were in a perfect condition and the whole experience was simply unforgettable. It was easy to get in contact with Adrián who also arranged with transportation to the park. We do recommend Caballos a la par!

An amazing day spent doing things you probably never imagined you could do.. I went with a friend recently to spend an afternoon horseback riding with Adrian and his team - and I have to say that this was the best part of my entire 3 weeks spent in Argentina. The ranch is about 30-40 minutes drive outside of the centre of Buenos Aires; Adrian organises a car to pick up his guests from the hotel and also returns them at the end of the trip (I think this costs extra, but your concierge at the hotel can probably check for you). For someone who speaks no Spanish whatsoever, this was a really big weight off my mind! The ranch itself is beautiful - there were around 8-9 horses that I could see. I was told there are usually around 12 at this site. Upon arrival, we were whisked into a conservatory, where Adrian introduced himself and offered us mate and pastries (mate is the equivalent of Argentinean tea - and it a very good experience to share). I was expecting to be in a group of 10-12 people for this trip, so was pleasantly surprised when we were told that the trips are kept to individual groups, so it would just be the two of us. We set-off after the rain stopped. Adrian is a very good teacher - showing us how to walk, stand-up, stop and balance on horseback (all very useful things for a beginner like me, who had never ridden a horse before!). The horses were also very well trained and very gentle (Sometimes naughty when they wanted to stop and eat!) When we had the basics down, we set off into the national park (which is beautiful!) at a walking pace. Before long, we got a clearing, where Adrian taught us to canter (and eventually canter without holding the reins - which on reflection is pretty terrifying! However, I'm really proud of myself that I did it - I never imagined that I could even canter on a horse!). We spent a long time getting used to the horses, letting them get used to us and practising the skills we were taught, while drinking in the scenery. Before long we had been riding for about 3 hours, and it was time to head back (it really does go very quickly!). When we got back to the ranch, we returned to the conservatory and had hot chocolate and coffee, and tucked into the pastries. We really felt very welcomed and enjoyed the day tremendously. My favourite part of the day (after the horse-riding, of course!) was spending time talking to Adrian and his staff, listening to the Spanish conversations around me and seeing a completely different world. My only regret is that I didn't have a bag that I could carry easily (like a backpack or a over the shoulder bag), so that I could carry a camera to take some pictures - that said, if you have to concentrate as much as me, you probably don't have time to take pictures! Luckily, Adrian is even prepared for that and took lots of pictures for us. All in all, I had a really wonderful day and can only recommend that you try it for yourself. I'd definitely go back next time I visit Argentina.

Great experience. Hello !We just had a ride a few days ago with Adrián and his team, and it was really great, I do recommend it !It's located close to Buenos Aires, in a beautiful national park, it's a 30 mn drive south. Adrian can come and pick you up in Buenos Aires directly if needed. It's a half-day experience. The ride can be either a private class or a ride with no more than 2 persons. Within 2 hours, even beginners like me can learn how to seat properly, manage the horse, trot and gallop. The great thing is that you are not mixed with people who have not the same level as you.... The price obviously depends on the activity, but it’s rather good. And you even have a more-than-welcome coffee/tea/hot chocolate with pastries after the ride, with a lesson on how to prepare and drink Argentinean mate at the end.So, my advice : just go and have fun !

Indescribable!! Caballos A La Par belongs in Tripadvisor’s #1 spot!. Caballos A La Par is the only activity in the top 5 to garner all 5 star reviews.I not only am a horse novice, I am an old, overweight horse novice who was very nervous about even basic matters such as whether or not I could get up onto a horse without completely embarrassing myself. And yes, I too ended up cantering through pristine meadows holding on to only the air between my fingers.I’m finding it very difficult to find the right words for this review. Although all the previous reviews are true, even when put together they still are not enough to convey the heart of what happens here. I feel like I need a better language. It--all of it--just swallows you up. It takes the sense you had of yourself when you arrived and scrambles it. It shuts off your brain while the rest of you frolics with nature. It bursts open your heart, and you feel a deep joy. And, when you return to the rest of your life, you may sense--as I did--that deep inside, you have been changed just a tiny bit in a way you never before imagined. And, even when in the middle of discordant events, you may notice that an ever-so-slight smile is rising up on your face. (I’ve attached a photo. It isn’t pretty.)

From scared of horse-riding to cantering with no hands in 3 hours. I first went horse-riding 5 years ago on my honeymoon and had a terrible experience where the horse bolted twice and I almost came off the horse. Since then I vowed never to go to horse-riding again. My husband finally persuaded me to try one more time and I am now 100% converted to horse-riding (and have been twice in BA) thanks to Adrian. Adrian understood my fear of riding exactly and helped me step by step build up my confidence and ability. By the end of my first 3 hour lesson I was actually cantering across a field with no hands!!! And loving it! I could not wait to go back for more and my 2nd lesson did not disapoint either. This is not your usual run of the mill tourist trail ride. You ride amazing, beautiful, well-trained horses in an amazing national park setting 30 mins outside of the city of Buenos Aires. Great for the first time rider, scared rider or experienced rider.

Not to be missed. We spent a great half day with Adrian teaching us beginners how to ride a horse, beeing able after 3 hours to ride even with hands kept behind the head. The national park is a beautiful place and the hospitality of our mentor convinced us to come again. The pastry with hot chocolate afterwards was great too. And the most courious thing was the fact that it was bucketing down all the way from BA, quit upon arrival and started again just right when coming back from the ride.

caballos-alapar.com. first i wrote an email to adrian, the owner of caballos-alapar. within hours he wrote back giving me all information needed, very kind and punctual. the pick up was already very nice with a warm welcome my friend and i got from him.the place adrian keeps his horses is just adorable, we felt like in a fairytale. the horses were in a very good shape and friendly as their owner. they were also well trained and would definitely obey the rider.it was a wonderful afternoon with a patient adrian as instructor. he loves to teach (and he's doing it very well!) and helps to improve your style, or if it's your first experience to master the "situation" in a very short time.once back, we've had a nice time talking and laughing with a warm cup of tea before our transfer (done by adrian) back to the hotel.i can't wait to go back to buenos aires to visit adrian and his horses again!!! i can just recommend this experience with adrian, you will feel like having a nice day with a friend!!!!! adrian, thank you once again ;o)

My best experience ever. I am not really willing to share this experience with all the people around the world, because I would like to keep this special place all to myself. But I know that would be selfish.As a person living in Buenos Aires I love to go outside the city and relax my mind a bit. After about 45 minutes by car you are in a great park bigger than Buenos Aires with all kinds of trees, people and of course us.Welcomed by Adrian and his staff, his 3 dogs and of course the horses you will feel at home instantly. This is not the normal estancia experience with docile horses that just go because the other horses go and that know the way.No this is an experience you will never forget. You'll need to work with the horses. After these few hours on a horseback you will know how to hold the reins, canter without holding the reins and lots more.After these few hours on a horseback you will have coffee, tea, hot chocolate or something else with some real nice pastry and a nice chat about the tour. As I am living in Buenos Aires I generally go horsebackriding in this park every other week. I think the fact that I return every other week to this place says enough about the experience I am having when I am there.

Fantastic- smiled the entire time!. A must do experience. The horses were happy, healthy and fun to ride. You have a personalized ride, not forced to ride in groups with varying experience levels. I was made to feel at home from the moment I was met in the foyer of my hotel (exactly on time) till I was dropped back after a wonderful ride and yummy hot chocolate. There were wide open areas and beautiful forrest paths to ride on and I received friendly riding tips through out the ride. I can't put in to words how much I enjoyed it.

Feel great Horseback riding - Buenos Aires. A Saturday afternoon out in the park. Everything just went fine, from punctual pick up to drop off and the horse riding in between of course was the best. Being total ignorant to this activity, we learned to ride the horse, which was not just following the leader, and to tell what direction to go, to stop, to gallop. And the ''profesoro'' Adrian and his crew were absolutely perfect in their guidance and teaching. thanks for a wonderful day out.

Everyone can ride a Horse. Easy and convenient pick up in Buenos Aires helping us to get money at the end of the month (ATMs are empty in BA) that's how it started the second time Horse back riding with Caballos A La Par. I did it November 2009, it started as a joke not thinking really able to ride. But as one year before it turned out as a real fun-learning trip, you get fun out of it and you learn something to improve your style in a very safe way. We caught a nice sunny day smooth winds. Just two of us with the instructor, first getting to know the horses and than after a few hints off to the park an amazing spot you wouldn't imaging to find such a lovely spot so close to this crowded city.Riding enjoying the surrounding as would have done many many times before, as you would do it every weekend.Looking forward to the next time.JK

Single best adventure in Buenos Aires! Outstanding! Wonderful!. Welcome to the single best adventure you can possibly have in Buenos Aires, Argentina! After an “Estancia” (ranch) outing, we decided we wanted to have a more in-depth horseback riding experience and found the highly recommended Caballos-Altapar riding outfit, no more than 30 minutes from BA.From the moment we arrived, our congenial, talkative, intelligent and friendly host Adrian made us feel instantly at home. This gentleman, his staff, phenomenal horses, exquisite 5 acre grounds and lovely even-tempered dogs then proceeded to show us possibly the best three hours of our lives.After politely inquiring whether we wanted instruction – which we wisely agreed to – we set off to a nearby 10,000 hectare ecological preserve on our extraordinary mounts. With personalized instruction, great humour and patience, we learned in the first HOUR how to hold reins, establish a cantor speed, control speed, communicate with the beautiful horses, descend steep inclines, and full-scale gallop, with complete confidence and safety at all times. We haven’t mentioned – yet – that the park has varieties of deciduous and coniferous trees unseen in North America, fantastic vistas, lovely trails and is removed completely from noise and pollution. It is tranquillity itself, and to do it on horseback, with confidence and poise, excellent instruction and such great camaraderie is not something to be missed.Extremely reasonable pricing. A 5-Star, must-do outing, capped off by fine Argentinian wines and delicious pastry and great conversation. You will fall in love with horses (if you’re not already), revel in nature’s magnificence and re-establish your faith that you can meet people who are sensitive, kind, brilliant and fun.Justin & JaimeMontreal, CanadaJune 2010

A must do day out in Buenos Aires. I left this day out on horse back as my last major thing to do on this, my 1st ever trip to BA.And what a wonderful day it was. I was collected from my hotel by Adriano at 9am and taken directly to the Ranch. I assumed i would be joining a larger group and was delighted to find I was spending the day alone on horse back with Adriano." I never like groups larger than 2 or 3" he assured me and me being alone was not a problem.I had not been on a horse for a decade but I felt safe and comfortable and it was like getting back on a bike.The surrounding countryside is so beautiful and full of wildlife that you are almost distracted from the joy of horse riding.It was a most memorable day and I shall treasure it...I would recommend this trip to everyone.

Our Most Memorable Experience in Buenos Aires. We chose this experience based on the previous reviews and also because we wanted to spend more time horseback riding than the estancia trips seemed to offer. My partner and I have never ridden horseback before but within two hours Adrian had taught us to walk, trot and canter (without hands!). Adrian is an excellent teacher who takes care of you from the moment you arrive. His friendly and personable approach quickly puts you at ease and it is down to his methods alone that we were able to progress so quickly. After the lessons we chatted over coffee and pastries and Adrian's passion for horses and teaching clearly came through. I have nothing but high praise for Caballos A La Par. If you are looking for a memorable experience in Buenos Aires then I would definitely recommend this one - we are still talking about it now we are back in London! If we are in BA again we will definitely be returning.

An absolute must if you want to go horseback riding near Buenos Aires!. The owner of the ranch Adrian will come to pick you up in Buenos Aires. It takes about 30 minutes to get to the beautiful park. There are different horses suited for all kinds of riders, from beginner to experienced. During the ride Adrian will teach you in a very relaxed way how to improve your riding. Even beginners will be cantering in a short time. Each time you will take a different track, it is clear that the horses are not programmed to take one specific route and you just have to sit instead of ride (as is the case in some other places I have been). When you finish the ride there will be pastries and hot chocolate at the ranch.The horses are fantastic, the people are great. I absolutely love the atmosphere. I will be back lots of times!!!

A neverland adventure on horse back!. I learnt in less than 2 hours how to guide, stop and gallop on a horse with no hands! A wonderful escapade into Buenos Aires' nearby natural park reserve, especially for families and couples.. Adrian is a perfect host and teacher. Live long Caballo A la Par!

Simply a great experience!. I came a cross A La Par at the Spanish school in Buenos Aires at which I´m taking lessons and thought I´d give it a try. I had been on a horse when I was little, being led around in a circle, but had no proper experience at all. Adrian and Kirsty picked me up (I was the only one on a Sunday morning) in the centre of Buenos Aires and took me to the ranch which is about 30 minutes away. I was really nervous at the start of the lesson and the first task, standing up while on the horse, I found quite daunting. I got used to 'my' gentle horse Indio in no time, though, and through Adrian's great tuition, lots of patience and encouragement, I slowly started to relax. The park is beautiful and a really great place to ride through, making you feel very much at one with nature. Adrian looks after his students very well and is really good with (complete) beginners. The other members of staff are very kind and helpful, too, and the fracturas after all the trotting and cantering are a real treat. Once you're there, don´t forget the ranch's dogs either, they love a cuddle! A morning or afternoon at A La Par is a great way to escape the city and have a wonderful time during your stay in Argentina.

Do Not Miss This!. I almost didn't go to Caballos A La Par because I thought the reviews were too good to be true. I had no prior horseback riding experience. Adrian and Sergio were superb instructors, took a personal interest in each member of the group, switched horses until each member was matched with the best animal for them, then led us on an incredible adventure through a huge national park adjacent to their property. I have never had such a great adventure on a travel trip. It was far beyond my expectations. We went through streams and woodlands as well as fields covered with flowers. Do not miss this. You will not be disappointed.

The reviews are real. Best Horse Back riding experience Ever. I really didn't believe that the reviews were unbiased. This was the best horseback riding expereince in my life. I have been to BA 5 times in the last year and wanted to do something different. My four other travel companions reluctantly agreed to accompany me. Adrian, the owner, picked us up and drove us the hour to his ranch. He really takes the time to choose the right horse for the right person based on age, experience, height weight, etc. At one point on the ride, Adrian switched horses with one of the indivuals when Adrian realized the person was ready for a more experienced horse.When we arrived he outfittted us with helmets and leather gaiters to protect our clothes. We started off trotting down ther dirt road and immediately I began to regret that I would have to spend the next 2 1/2 hours on a horse. It was painful. However, when we arrived at the first meadow, Adrian took each of us aside and taught us how to canter. One of my companions was in tears, because the last time she was on a horse was when she was 5 years old and she was nervous. Adrian spent time riding with her individually while the rest of us happily cantered along. When we reached another meadow, he taught us how to canter without the use of our hands. Admittedly, I was in fear and reluctantly did this. For the first time in my life, I was actually ""riding" a horse. Amazing. The lady in tears was all smiles now. We rode for 2 1/2 hours total. The whole time, Adrian's employee Sergio was there to assist us while Adrian took time with individuals. When we returned Adrian had fresh pastries and hot drinks for us. The total time for this excursion was about 5 hours. What an experience and a true bargain. Adrian only takes a few people out at a time so it is important to book in advance. One of the best travel experiences I have ever had. I love to ride on vacations, but usually you get some poor horse, too many people, and irritating guides. Not so here. Adrian cares about his clients and horses. It was wonderful to get out of the sitting. I will make this de rigeur when I return to BA.

An experience not to be missed in BA. Was only in BA for 3 days but after reading so many good reviews about this place, decided to give this a try and i'm glad i did. Didn't have any horse riding experience before this but under the guidance of Adrian (owner/guide), i was catering (with and without hands) around the park after half an hour. The park itself is a gorgeous place with lots of different terrains to ride on. Adrian doesn't mix groups and since i was there by myself, i got his full attention for the whole trip. The horses were very well trained and responsive. You can walk, trot and canter whenever you want and Adrian will either be by your side or behind you giving you tips and advice when needed. I spent an entire afternoon at the park and i highly recommend this place not just for the horse riding but for the Argentinian hospitality and culture as well.

AMAZING!!!! NOT TO BE MISSED. Adrian picked me and my husband up at our hotel within the time he said he would. We had a quick drive to his Estancia where we began to get to know each other. He and my husband became friends right away!!! When we arrived, It was an immediate feeling of being at home the minute we walked thru the gate. We met our horses, adorned our safety gear, and the teaching began. We have a deep appreciation for great teaching, as we are also teacher's. Adrian personalizes his method for each person being taught. For my husband, he was direct and firm. For me, he made sure I understood the importance of what he was teaching while praising me every time I did something well. Adrian had us cantering on Isabel and Indio in no time (without hands) and although I was scared at first, he rode next to me and held my hand until I felt comfortable. At the end of the ride, Adrian allowed us to help brush the horses we rode and feed them carrots before he offered us every type of drink including "mate" along with traditional Argentine pastries. We sat and talked and laughed as though we had been friends for years. We are a little soar, but it was worth every bit of it!! Thanks to Adrian, our honeymoon will be unforgettable!! This is not to be missed...we want to come back and ride with Adrian and his beautiful, well trained horses as soon as we can.Thank you Adrian!!!!! Erick and Katie Padilla

Caballos a la par, the real gem !!!!!. I don’t have enough words to express how amazing experience it has been. I was looking for a great place to horse riding in Argentina and I think I found the greatest place ever!!! I cannot stop smiling every time I remember this afternoon :)The location is ideal (30 mn from Buenos Aires and very close to a huge, awesome and none-touristic park); The horses are simply fantastic and adapted to any levels; Adrian is a funny and great teacher who knows perfectly how to be in adequacy with YOUR expectations. He does everything he can for you to spend a good time!! He loves horses and knows perfectly how to share his passion !!Besides, he doesn’t mix groups; that means that if you come alone, you will be alone with him, etc. I mention it coz it’s really unusual !!After the horse riding, we spoke a lot of the experience we have just lived sharing a hot chocolate with pastries (in front of a chimney fire in winter :)) ! I’ve been welcomed as a princess! Stop searching, you have found what you are looking for… at a very reasonable price.Just GO, you will love it !

Real learning and real riding.. I have taken similar excursions before, with the usual result: a poor, beat-down horse clopping along a well-worn trail. There was none of that with this tour. We rode all over and Adrian was truly working to make me a better rider and get some of the basics. If this was a regular lesson, it would feel more like immersion than standard rote learning. I've heard some people complain that proper horseback riding lessons can really string you along -- where you don't canter for months. But, I feel that it was an immersion experience that was fun and safe.

The best horse riding class in Buenos Aires!!. If you ever wanted to try horse riding or you are already experienced rider the Caballos a la Par is the best place to contact. They have several horses for every level of riders - from the beginners till to well trained riders. The ranch is located in the nature reserve Parc Pereyra Iraola, where you can enjoy outdoor horse riding in vaste space - only 30 km from the city. They speak English and provide pick-up and drop-off from Buenos Aires. I spent many beautiful afternoons on the back of a horse in the calm nature away from the crowded city. The hospitality of the personal and the cuddly dog are the bonus which I appreciate a lot. Highly recommendable to try!

What a great experience!. Adrian is an excellent host and teacher. My three teenagers and I had a super afternoon. None of us had any experience of horses before, but this was a real highlight of our trip to Argentina - thoroughly recommended.

Best horse riding experience in Argentina!!. I originally planned to do one ride with Adrian at Caballos A La Par however I was so impressed that I stayed on and rode twice in the same day! I have done several horse riding trips on my 20month round the world adventure and I can honestly say that this was one of the best. Not only do you get a great scenic experience riding through a beautiful and very large park about 30minutes outside of Buenos Aires but Adrian is a fantastic teacher offering advice on positioning & technique etc. I was offered the choice of 3 horses based on my comfort and experience which was a first, normally at this type of thing you get plonked on anything! The horses are obviously very well cared for and eager to work hard too, which was great. Adrian and his staff are all very friendly and you are well looked after during your time with him - from the right kit i.e. hats and leg protection to pastries and amazing drinks warming in front of a roaring fire after the ride! Adrian makes the best submarinos in South America (hot milk with a melted chocolate bar).I have since ridden in other parts of Argentina and they haven’t been as good as Caballos a la Par. It is a little more expensive than other rides but I think worth the money. I would strongly recommend this experience to any horse lover whether experienced or not it’s a must do activity whilst in Buenos Aires!!

Brilliant day out!. I recently spent a half day at Caballos A La Par and it was fantastic. I have never been much of a horse girl and was a total beginner - it was fantastic! I came away and wanted to go straight back! Adrian was a fantastic teacher and before I knew it I was trotting away into the beautiful countryside near Buenos Aires. He allowed us freedom in the riding, he was very encouraging and pushed us along (in a good/gentle way) so we progressed quickly. I would definitely recommend a day out here!

Great to be back in the saddle and on a REAL horse not a trail nag!. Over 10 years ago I had my own horses and was a regular rider, yet in the last 10 years I could count on one hand how many times I have ridden. What grabbed my attention about Caballos A La Par were the rviews indicating that you could enjoy a real ride not the usual follow the leader trail ride where the horses are unresponsive even for someone who knows how to ride. It was fantastic! The horse I had was both safe and had spirit and speed when urged, a rare combination. The skills quickly came back to me but until I got my confidence back the horse was very safe and the more I demanded from the horse the more it gave. And Adrian is happy for you to do whatever it is on the horse that you are enjoying the most in the beautiful natural surrounds of the large park. These horses are well trained and extremely responsive, yet at the same time have a certain bombproof factor which means I would also trust them with a child who has never ridden.The prices were very reasonable and the pastries and hot chocolate afterwards a real treat! Thanks so much Adrian.

A unique experience for anyone that loves horses and nature. I have gone riding several times but always been stuck with trail horses. I've always wanted to learn to ride properly but never had enough money to take classes so it seemed impossible to me to go beyond a trail horse (if you don't know trail horses are the ones that just follow the horse in front, know the trail and nothing you do will make them deviate from that route). I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to learn that I would actually learn to ride a horse. It was absolutely amazing. We were taught to canter and it felt amazing to be able to lead the horse and tell him what I wanted and when. Most of the time is spent in a large park-like area where you are free to practice what you just learned or just walk around. Anything really is possible, you are in control. Adrian will also make sure to guide you and help you learn riding properly which was extremely helpful. Without a doubt it was the most fun riding I have ever done and I certainly wished there were places like this where I live. Also, a fun note is that after you are done riding you will be able to relax by the fire, drink hot chocolate and eat pastries and just enjoy yourself. I highly recommend this place.

Beautiful ride just outside BA. It's great place all around, no matter what your level Adrian will work with you, and he is great. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. It's wonderful to get out of the city for a while, and transportation is easy. All around one of the most fun things I did in BA

Andale Andale!. Lucky enough to horse ride on my own with the teacher, being a novice I was a little weary of going out for the ride but loved it and felt very comfortable in the surrounds. Horses in good condition; Adrian quintessential Argentian / el campo style - a must do trip from the city of BsAs. Yummy treats for the after-show! Muchisimas gracias Adrian y Kelly, from Hannah NZ.

Awesome day away from Buenos Aires. As a life-long horse addict always dying to be in the saddle, when I saw the opportunity to ride in Buenos Aires I knew I had to take it! I have ridden several times in Argentina and Chile, and was expecting something similar, where the guides just get you on the horse and head out with little to no instruction on the ride. While the scenery was always breathtaking, the riding itself usually left something to be desired. The horses have usually done the trip a hundred times, and have the mentality of pack animals on auto-pilot more than that of a partnership between horse and rider, which is what riding is all about. This is what makes Caballos a la Par so special... Adrian can offer that partnership, which usually takes months or years to build and understand, to each rider who comes and rides with them for the day.I have ridden regularly since age 6, worked at several stables and 2 Dude Ranches in the Colorado Rockies, and ride whenever I get a chance. That being said, I can easily say that Caballos a la Par is a very special operation, and is THE best option for a horseback riding excursion that I have ever seen. I have been 3 times now, and each time have watched complete beginners who have never ridden cantering around like they had been riding for months. Adrian caters to all abilities and matches each rider with an excellent, well cared for, responsive horse. The park is beautiful and each person gets to actually ride freely; definitely not nose-to-tail sitting on a horse that's on cruise control!After the ride, the group gets to relax and chat over hot chocolate, tea or coffee and pastries (and a roaring fire in the winter!). Everyone is relaxed and happy from the wonderful day.I would highly recommend this activity for anyone who wants a true horseback riding experience. You will NEVER find anything like this in the States (I only know of 1 Dude Ranch that offers riding of this quality - but you have to commit to an entire week!), so if you are in Buenos Aires and are even slightly interested in learning to ride, or getting back in the saddle, GO!! You will love it!

By Far The Best Experience In Buenos Aires!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. I had never been on a horse before and decided to check out Caballos A La Par to experience something new. The property is gorgeous with a beautiful gazebo in which you sit and sip cafe con leche or a chocolate after a lesson in the park. The staff in unbelievably welcoming and patient and by the end of one lesson I was confidently riding a horse!!!!!! You would be seriously remiss to come to Argentina and not visit this place...I seriously could not stop smiling. If you are looking for an experience outside of the typical tourist traps and want a true taste of Buenos Aires with all its warmth beauty and splendor you have to have to have to check this place out!!!! It is something right out of a Victorian novel and the attentive staff and welcoming atmosphere are unlike anything I have ever encountered.It is conveniently located half an hour outside of the city and they arrange transportation for you so you don't have to worry about finding your own way. Please do yourself a favor and spend a day at this ranch!

An amazing experience and a great host, I wish I could ride there again and again. After tourist trips in Mendoza I was looking for someone to show me how to ride properly as well as see some of the beautiful scenery. Adrian and the ranch excelled my expectations!After offering to collect and drive me to the ranch, Adrian provided good coffee and pastries and put me at ease showing the horses and ranch. I then had a one to one lesson for 2.5hrs (I expected it to be a group session) and although Adrian said I could stay as long as I wanted, I was a little tired for the exhileration.The horses are beautiful and really well cared for, the park is stunning and Adrian inspires confidence that allows you to push yourself to make the most of the day.A big thank you!!

Not your typical estancia nose to tail experience!!. Incredible from start to finish. Picked up promptly from downtown BA by Adrian, an amazingly funloving and happy sort who put us all at ease and got us excited about the coming ride. The ranch is a well maintained and secluded down a long bumpy road but well positioned next to a giant park where you can go at your own pace and either walk, trot, canter or gallop to your hearts content. No set trails here... you are encouraged to forge your own path. Even got to jump a little over fallen logs. Pictures taken at every opportunity and... the best part as far as an experienced rider is concerned.... you get to switch up horses every so often to try them all out! It is awesome as as my first steed wasn't quite the go-getter that I wanted. The second one most certainly was!! Ride ended with all of us exhausted and happy and finished in a cosy atrium/yurt with roaring fire, coffee, submarinos (hot milk with a chocolate bar) and divine pastries. Ride back into town was quick and easy. Perfect day.

If you like to ride, don't miss this experience. I had a wonderful day riding with Adrian. Beautful ridiing area with lots of trees. Personal down to earth operation that can handle all levels of experience. Wish we had discovered this place when we first arrived in Buenos Aires, I would have returned for a second day. Jorge from San Diego

Great horseback riding right near Buenos AIres. After reading reviews on tripadvisor we decided that riding at Caballos a la Par would be a better and less touristy decision than going to one of the estancias. We are so glad that we rode here and met Adrian and his staff including Sergio and Fernando. Everyone was very friendly and Adrian has impeccably trained horses. As someone who owns his own horse I can really appreciate the skill and time it took him to achieve this. I enjoyed it so much that I went back a second day and truly consider Adrian a friend at this point. His instruction was so good that he had people who had never ridden before cantering with no hands before they were finished. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone who is in Buenos Aires.

One of the most memorable activities in Buenos Aires...a truly unique horseriding experience!. My wife and I booked this horseback riding trip based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. We are so glad that we did. We considered doing a side trip out of Buenos Aires to an estancia or to Uruguay, but felt those would be too touristy. After contacting a couple estancias, it seemed like they were just for show and herded tourists around like cattle. Our experience with Adrian's Caballos A La Par, was the best of our trip. Adrian picked us up around 10:30am (30 minutes later than originally planned due to some car trouble, but he called us at the hotel to let us know, so it was no trouble at all and gave us time to get some breakfast). We drove out of Buenos Aires for about 25 minutes to the National Park. At the end of a dirt road, we arrived at a horse ranch that was absolutely beautiful. The horses and a few dogs roamed freely across this huge estate. Sergio, who lives on the ranch had already prepared the horses with their saddles upon our arrival, so we began promptly. We were provided leather protectors for our lower legs and helmets. Adrian does not combine different groups, so it was like we had our own private lesson. Adrian taught us about the proper position on a horse and stressed that the horses are not trained to follow each other. Therefore, we need to take control of our horses using our body and our energy (reminded us of the Cesar Millan "the dog whisperer") and get to know our horse. We were taught how to turn, slow down, and stop our horses with the reins. My horse needed more encouragement (verbal cues and some kicks to get moving, exaggerated movements to turn), while my wife's horse acted on subtle cues (verbal cues were enough to get walking). We started out on the dirt road then we turned into a small trail off the dirt road through a small stream and into a large prairie with wild grasses. There were no trails in the prairie or in the wooded area towards the end of the lesson. We were taught how to stand on the stirrups while the horse was walking. My wife had a hard time with this, but Adrian held her hand until she was able to do it on her own. Adrian showed us how to canter with the horse, then he asked my wife to try it first while I watched. He guided her through it 5 or 6 times until she got it right. Then it was my turn for Adrian to help me canter. In the meantime, my wife practiced walking, turning, and stopping with her horse. We cantered for longer distances together. Then we learned to stop our horses by using only our legs. Eventually we moved on to cantering with our horse without holding the reins, with our arms straight out to our sides and stopping the horses with our legs. We have little to no experience with horses, so it was a bit intimidating but very thrilling. Adrian is a very good teacher and he can be strict with his methods, but he is effective and always encouraging. During the whole adventure, Adrian snapped photos and even videos as he rode next to us.After about 1.5 hours of riding some asado (chorizo, ribs and salad) was already on the grill for us back at the ranch. We were also treated to some mate (which is a tea-like drink that all of the locals have, but strangely, we had a very difficult time finding a restaurant that served it. If it did serve mate, it was only between certain hours and despite our desperate search we didn't have any luck.) We really appreciated this, as Adrian explained to us the cultural ways of preparing, serving, and sharing mate with friends (which is much better than any restaurant could do).After this, we were driven back to our bed and breakfast inn. Horseback riding is a physical experience, so we were a bit sore the next day. We were glad we did this after our tango lesson and on our last day in Buenos Aires. My wife and I have travelled to many places and try to take in the local culture as much as possible (Barcelona, Mexico, China, Philippines, Portugal, Costa Rica, etc.), and this is the most unique and memorable experience that we had. Adrian told us that this is a relatively new project for him (only been open for a few months), but we surely hope he will keep everything exactly the same, as his popularity will surely grow.

A wondeful experience in a beautiful oasis close to Buenos Aires. It was just me and my friend and the exellent Adrián, riding around in a beautiful landscape the sun was setting and it was just such a full experience. The horses, the setting, the lovley smell of nature and the excellent guidance made it a altogether a wonderful experience. / Tove Palén, Sweden

Experience to remember - the highlight of our vacation. What an inspiring day!Adrian is a superb host and teacher, and genuinely cares about his craft. Sergio, his right hand man, and superb rider and foosball player as well, was a delight. And the ranch itself was an oasis outside of Buenos Aires, full of exotic trees and birds.We were picked up at the hotel by Adrian (with my wife and two kids, ages 6 and 9). We quickly left BA behind and after almost a week of city vacation, it was the perfect tonic to museums and city tours.Adrian is an incredibly thoughtful person who went out of his way to personalize an adventure - what a treat for anyone who has the opportunity to experience it. As an example, as soon as we arrived, Adrian asked if we wanted a picture at the entrance of the park, and seeing a van parked at the castle entrance he drove onto a field where the van wasn't visible - to make sure we could get a picture surrounded by nature and the castle. He then asked if we'd be interested in going to a special park for the kids (where they can feed the animals) - it turned out to be only open on the weekends but he clearly was always thinking of how to make the trip even more special for his guests.As soon as we got to the ranch, our kids who love dogs (and miss theirs a lot), ran to play with their very patient and friendly dogs who were clearly loved and well taken care of, as were his horses - now that's a life that any dog or horse should want - and at least part of why he really is such a great "horse whisperer".We then had mate and Adrian took the time to show us how it was made and the rituals behind it (a tradition we'll definitely bring back home), which added to the rare authenticity of the day. He later showed us submarino as well (chocolate melted in warmed milk, which the kids loved). After a quick game of foosball, we were ready to go. In retrospect, I think part of that was so he could understand us better to match the right horse to the person, showing the care he took for both us and for his horses.We then put on mini chaps and his inventive protective hats, got on the thankfully soft saddles (perhaps all Adrian inventions?), and were getting ready to go. The kids were initially quite anxious about riding, but Adrian kindly and professionally led them to ride, and then quickly taught us to canter. He did this with four very different learning styles (I need quite a bit of continued reinforcement of good habits - keep those heels down! - my wife needed his firm insistence that she would be able to canter, our son initial calming and then encouragement as he started to canter on his own and quickly became more proficient than his parents - he now wants to learn riding when he gets back to the US) and our daughter cantered with Sergio making sure she was happy - which we all were.At the end of the day, they had each of us come back to the house and practice cantering with no hands on the smaller horse (even our 6 year old!) which gave us even more confidence. I should also mention that Adrian said ours was the only family that day (confirming that Caballos AlaPar - AlaPar meaning with individual attention - is a rare undiscovered find), and because of that he'd be happy to spend all day with us - which we were thrilled with since this was by far the best experience of the vacation - so instead of three hours together we left at 10:30 and returned to the hotel around 7 pm! By the way, I've never written a review on trip advisor before - but this day and Adrian are so special that they deserve to be much better known. I would recommend a day with Adrian to almost anyone - but especially for families, couples, or people who want a real adventure - and clearly it would work for all ranges of riders (as the other reviews show). So my advice is - please get out there and do this - it was the absolute highlight of our trip!!

The highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. When we went to Buenos Aires, we knew we wanted to have a horseback riding experience, but were warned that many of the estancias were tourist traps. After checking on Trip Advisor, we decided to give Caballos A La Par a try. If you have ever wanted to ride a horse like a cowboy or a Gaucho, this is the right place for you. My wife and I have ridden horses many times before but have never taken a lesson. In addition, on all of our previous riding experiences, running the horses was discouraged. We never felt like the cowboys (or cowgirls) of old. Well this all changed this April, when my wife and I and two friends made the right choice and visited beautiful Caballos A La Par, just outside of Buenos Aires. When we arrived at the ranch, Adrian, the owner was waiting for us and made us feel right at home. You will never find a person who is better with horses or a better teacher than Adrian. He and his assistant, Kristy, made sure everyone had a horse that was perfect for them. He provided chaps, helmets (that looked like cowboy hats) and all the instruction we needed to control our horses. We rode for three hours and Adrian and Kristy were always there to instruct and encourage us as we flew across the beautiful fields in the park. He even took videos and emailed them to us back home. After riding, we had tea, coffee, sweets and a lovely visit with them. Adrian even drove us back to the city that night. It was truly the highlight of our trip to Argentina.

Wonderful Experience. My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time horseback riding with Adrian. I have little experience riding a horse besides infrequent trail riding, but by the end of just a few hours, Adrian was filming us cantoring through a meadow. Adrian was more than friendly and willing to make us feel comfortable and happy with our experience. We were allowed to walk, trot, or cantor whenever we felt the urge. At the end of our ride, we shared Mate and then were dropped off at our apartment in the city of Buenos Aires. It was a great adventure we will always remember.

A great escape from the city and a wonderful activity for all ages.. I found Caballos a la par (horses side by side) on Trip Advisor and after reading the excellent reviews, I thought I would give it a try. Boy am I glad I did. This is one of the best vacation excursions I have ever had and i've been on several all over the world. I took my 64 yr. old father-in-law and my 12 yr. old son, neither of whom had ever been on a horse, and we all had a great time. Adrian is a fantastic and patient teacher and his horses are very well trained. This is not a typical trail ride where one horse follows another in a train and you have no control. Adrian teaches you how to control the horse and you go out riding through a park in the Pampas side by side. If you want to walk you can walk, if you want to canter, you canter, and if you like to trot you can do that too.Adrian had both my father-in-law and my son cantering in about 10 minutes, it was truly amazing. The equipment and the horses are 1st rate and everything is done with safety in mind.After the ride we went back to the mini-estancia and enjoyed our first submarino (Argentine hot chocolate) while chatting with Adrian. It was a great afternoon and I highly recommend this activity as a nice break from the city if you have a chance.Some tips:- If you take the bus, plan to leave the station about 1 1/2 hrs. ahead of when you're supposed to meet.- BYODEET - The mosquitoes can be bad in the park on some days, especially if the wind dies.- Wear jeans or thick pants that you don't mind getting dirty.

Great Place, Great People, Great Horses. What a welcome relief from the city (although we LOVE BA). Ranch is situated in a beautiful park, close to the city. Adrian, the director, takes great pride in what he does and only offers the best - beautiful horses, fantastic surroundings and wonderful hospitality. We went with a small group and Adrian obviously knew what he was doing and worked with each and everyone of us to ensure we got the most out of this experience both fun and knowledge about riding. We all had different levels of riding experience and he acommodated each of us based upon our ability and goals. This was one of the highlights of our trip and you MUST come here (versus a commercial ranch) for a true Argentinian experience!!

A very special experience that is about more than horseback riding - don't miss it!. Get out of BA for a day and have the experience of a lifetime. Whether you are indifferent about horses or love them - you have never ridden the way that you will with Adrian of Caballos A La Par.The riding itself is great - you will be comfortable on your horse and within a short time will be cantering confidently through wonderful open fields. Adrian has designed special saddles, special helmets and has selected ideal horses for his business. His obvious planning and thoughtfulness combined with a stellar level of professionalism are impressive. However, what truly makes Caballos A La Par a five-star experience is the manner in which Adrian (and his right-hand man Sergio) transform nervous tourists into confident, comfortable riders. He is the type of teacher who obviously makes an impression on everyone he works with. His style, manner and the depth of his understanding of people and horses and how to motivate both is very unique.Our family of four including our 23 year-old son (who had previously ridden very little) and 11 year-old daughter (who had some previous "pony lessons") all had different levels of enthusiasm about riding for the day. We were all completely comfortable and very happy after only a short time with Adrian. We spent the day cantering through very nice countryside, had great conversation, laughed with each other and returned back to BA very excited about what we had done.Adrian was warm, thoughtful and very professional. His communication prior to our ride was clear. The price was quite fair. (Be sure to bring cash.) Afterwards we had great conversation while enjoying special coffee and delicious pastries. Our son played a very competetive foos-ball game with Sergio and our daughter wanted to kidnap one of the very friendly dogs who are part of experience. When we are back in BA, we will definitely ride with Adrian again. We couldn't recommend Caballos A La Par more strongly - don't miss it!

A Must-do When in Buenos Aires! (Long Review). I must admit, horseback riding in Argentina was not on my list of things to do when I was initially planning my first trip to Buenos Aires. I planned on having a relaxing time absorbing in a new city: eating delicious steaks, shopping along Florida avenue, buying leather goods,...all in all, I was ready to be a tourist.I went on Tripadvisor; read about the positive reviews about Caballos A La Par; and decided that I would email to find out more information. I must say, I am glad I took that first step and emailed Adrian (the owner). I have never ridden a horse before and am happy to report that my first horseback riding experience was awesome!!!At first, the plan was for me to take a bus out to La Plata, a city that is about 30 to 40 minutes outside of Buenos Aires. Since I do not speak Spanish and was traveling alone, I was a little hesitant about leaving the city. Luckily, Adrian called me the night before and told me that he was picking up another customer in the city and that he can provide me with a free ride to and from. Adrian picked me up at exactly 10 am the next morning. As I entered the vehicle, I met up with a very delightful woman named Christy (sorry if I misspelled). Christy is a colleague who currently works for Adrian; she speaks perfect English. On the ride to La Plata, I really got to know Adrian and Christy not as tour guides or operators; but I got to know them as people who are simply passionate about what they do. Adrian loves his work as a horse riding instructor and Christy is a travel fanatic (she has traveled throughout Asia, Africa, and Europe). Also in the car was another customer, a friendly guy from Spain who is temporarily living in Buenos Aires.Although the weather forecast indicated that it will not rain until later in the day/evening, the rain started trickling in once we arrived at the ranch that morning at about 10:45 am. My heart sank as the realization of not being able to ride a horse loomed. Adrian suggested that we enter shelter, eat some pastries that he brought, and wait for the rain to pass. With my fingers crossed, we did so. This is where Adrian and Christy introduced me to mat-e (an Argentianian drink similar to tea), but that's another story. About 45 minutes later, the rain stopped,...my best adventure began...You are first asked a series of questions about your riding experience and personality. I later found out that this is done so that you will be matched with a horse that fits your skills and temperament. Then, you put on a cowboy type hat with a knob in the back that adjusts to the size of your head. I naturally have a big head, so I didn't need to turn the knob much.
