Thereafter, you put on these leather straps around your shoes. After the gear setup, you will be asked to climb the horse that Adrian hand picks for you. Adrian gives you a summary of how to: (1) get the horse to move, (2) make the horse turn right or left, (3) slow the horse, and (4) stop the horse. To be honest, I was a mess,...as I am one of those people that needs to over-analyze and study things before I feel comfortable enough to actually do it. Surprisingly, my horse had excellent manners and before I realize it, my horse and I were moving as one. We leave the ranch and head toward the park...I am a high school teacher, so I recognize a great teacher when I encounter one. Adrian is a great teacher because he is patient with you (I am a slow learner), he encourages you, he motivates you, and he compliments you when you earn it. What I appreciate most about Adrian is that he challenges you, without pushing you. He treats you like a student, not a tourist.Through Adrian, I learned how to understand and appreciate horseback riding. I learned how to gallup and cantor..., cross a stream on a horse, learned when to lean forward and when to lean back when a horse is climbing up or down a hill,...the list goes on and on...After about 1.5 hours of riding, it began to drizzle again. Most tour operators would have ended the experience and taken your money, Adrian and Christy continued onwards....they cared that I received the best experience,...and I did. Even with the rain, the horses were well-mannered and never nervous. The entire experience was well over 2 to 3 hours. Christy also shares with me that they intentionally take a different route on each tour so that the horses do not become complacent and programmed. The horse heeds to the rider -- you are controlling the horse, the horse is not controlling you.Intermittently, while Adrian is teaching my fellow horse rider from Spain, it was nice to have Christy also ride along to reinforce the skills I recently learned from Adrian. Christy filled in the knowledge gaps and also provided me with extra tips -- I felt like I was getting twice as much lessons within the 2 hour time period. I highly recommend someone who is looking to try something new in Argentina to try Caballos A La Par. Adrian and Christy are genuine people who loves what they do. For those in doubt, I hope that this review will motivate you to give it a try; I am confident that you will be glad you took your first step/gallup.

Riding in a forest of eucalyptus. I didn't even like horses. Now I daydream of my day with Adrian of A La Par galloping through a forest of eucalyptus tress. I was hesitant to try to control the horse but Adrian taught me how to do it and I felt so comfortable, as if I had been riding my whole life. If you don't like horses you will love A La Par. If you love horses you will be in love. What an amazing day and only 30 minutes outside of the city.

Wiithout a doubt the best there is. Have no hesitation if you are in Buenos Aires and want to ride for a day or want to really learn and understand riding and horsemanship then this is the place. As a former international sportsman I am well used to coaching. But I can honestly say this was one of my best experiences. Adrian is a true master of his art and a pleasure to be with. The location is both excellent and beautifult and so close to Buenos AIres. The horses are a pleasure to ride. All the instruction is done together riding in the open and with the expert guidance of Adrian, I found that all my worries and niggles with my technique just melted away. I left a more confident more apable rider. I am going back again next week .

Our BEST day in Argentina, horseback riding!. As Adrian explained to me; horseback riding is one of the very few things, that people of every age can experience together. We are 50-something parents of a 13 year old. Whenever we travel I try to give her the experience of riding but until Caballos A-La-Par she had never experienced the feeling of freedom and connection with a horse, cantoring in a open field.My husband said he would go with us but would not ride. Too many visions of American stables with their tired and moody horses. When we arrived and saw these beautiful horses waiting freely and patiently in a field, he agreed to ride. Adrian fitted my daughter and I with his ingenious half-chaps (foot to knee) and insisted my husband wear his own person full chaps (my husband had worn shorts).Adrian is a man honest to himself and others. He chose to leave the corporate world and pursue his passion of horses. This passion manifests itself in every detail of this riding experience, not the least of which is his partnership with his horses. He and his horses are supreme teachers. Adrian is skilled, insightful, encouraging and patient. The horses are equally patient, calm and responsive to riders of any ability.The park was beautiful with open fields, forests, creeks and not a sound other than nature. We had a a magnificent day riding. I agree 110% with all the positive reviews here, but I must tell you more about my experience, in the hopes you too will visit and experience the people and horses of Caballos A-La-Par.When we returned to the ranch from riding, I realized I had forgotten to take my allergy medicine. My family was fine, but with just 2 or 3 bug bites I began developing hives. Adrian had me cool my arms in water and drove us back towards Buenos Aires. Minute by minute the hives grew worse and spread (again....my fault for not taking my medicine). By the time we got to BA I was beginning to panic. Adrian, the teacher, calmed and reassured me. He drove us to a pharmacy, where they gave me medicine and told me to get to a doctor ASAP. I really began to panic while Adrian, again calmed me and took me immediately to a private doctor. He waited with my family in the office while I received a cortisone injection. Within the hour my hives began to disappear. He would not leave until he made sure that I would be fine!I think about what could have been a horrible ending to a dream day; trying to find a hospital, trying to communicate, hoping to get the right medication. Adrian's kindness, calm and concern saved the last 2 days of our vacation, and turned what could have been a disaster into a mere inconvience.

Great riding experience near Buenos Aires. I had an amazing day riding with Caballos a la Par, the highlight of my trip to Buenos Aires. The countryside is beautiful and you would never think that it was possible to feel so remote only half an hour's drive from the city. Adrian, the owner is a fantastic teacher and will have you cantering easily in no time. More than a fantastic teacher though, he is also a warm and friendly host with a great sense of humor. I had a great time getting to know him and the others who came to ride that day (mostly BA locals) in a very laid-back atmosphere. I will definitely be back and would recommend this experience to anyone, no matter what your riding experience or age or background. You can personalize your day however you like, according to your schedule and interests. In addition to the fun of riding in a gorgeous natural setting, it's a unique way to experience Argentine culture in a much more authentic way than most tourists would have an opportunity to.

Best riding experience ever!. I've been living in Buenos Aires for a few months now and the trip to Cabellos A La Par is one of the best things I've done here! The ranch is quite small and the atmosphere is very friendly and you can really tell that they love their horses. The surroundings were amazing and perfect for horseback riding. The horses were very well trained and Adrian, the owner that took care of us, is a very good teacher both for skilled riders and beginners.I highly recommend this place and I'm going back next week!Venke, Sweden

Great gaucho-style horseback riding next to Buenos Aires. Caballos a la Par is really a great and personal place to go horseback riding. First of all, the location is only 30min from central Buenos Aires in a beautiful parque natural where you ride in the woods and on open fields. You can also tell they really love their horses that all are in exellent shape and very well ridden. If you want, you get professional riding tips from the owner Adrián, I really felt I learned a lot in just 2 hours! This was one of my best BsAs expereinces during my holiday here, I really can recommend this place.Mia, Sweden

HIGHLY Recommended! If you want to ride horses, this is the place!. My two friends and I were very well taken care of by Adrian and his staff. I love horseback riding but had never experienced it like this before. By the end of the day, I was galloping with confidence...it was so exhilarating! Definitely one of the best things I've done in Argentina. Adrian is a very skilled instructor and made us all feel very confident with the horses, even though we didn't have much experience. I had such a great time that I'm going back for more lessons!

Horseback Riding in Buenos Aires, Caballos a la Par. I will put this simply; I don't ride horses, I have ridden maybe twice in my life. My circumstances were odd, but I had to go. Start of the Day: "This is how you hold the reins."End of the day: I was ?cantoring? which is one step shy of a full gallop! My "riding style" was analyzed, video taped (after my approval) and corrected. I'm not talking about weeks or months of riding, we're talking one day. The owner Adrian is a horse whisper, I swear. Every time he wanted me to cantor the horse would start cantoring. Impressive. I feel like I know what I'm doing on top of a horse!Beautiful fields and scenery. Who would have thought you could experience the country side so close to such a massive metropolis?Very creative and in depth teaching techniques. Class A service, you feel accepted and welcomed into the Argentine countryside! These guys are no joke.

A Once in a Lifetime Experience. We were on our last day in Buenos Aires, having returned from a trip to Explora (Torres del Paine) and were staying at the Four Seasons. The hotel had a daily flyer of attractions and I noticed the mention of horseback riding in a park only 30 minutes from the hotel. I jumped on the idea and the concierge made the arrangements for that very afternoon. When we arrived, we were immediately made to feel so comfortable and welcome by Adrian. He made sure we had the horses suitable to our level of riding and off we went to a fantastic park in Buenos Aires. He gave us each personal attention and in his unique and friendly way, he was able to actually combine the riding with low-key instruction to help us be better riders. And we were! After two hours, my boyfriend was cantering on his own through the forest and I was galloping across the flat ground with no hands! The horses, of course, are EXQUISITELY trained, very responsive, yet calm and trustworthy. I found I was actually more comfortable with the horse I was riding than either of my own two horses I have at home! The park that we rode through was amazing - I had no idea there was so much land that close to the city and Adrian knew all the right places to take us. Afterward we relaxed on his beautiful property and took some photos which will be keepsakes for me forever!I highly recommend Caballos A La Par to anyone interested in seeing a beautiful park while riding fabulously trained horses with a kind and personable guide and instructor. It was a once in a lifetime experience!Thanks, Adrian!Debbie from Washington, DC

My best horsebackriding experience ever!. I was staying in Buenos Aires for three weeks visiting my father and since I like horses and love seeing nature, I decided to find somewhere where I could go horsebackriding. I found the homepage for "Caballos A La Par" and got more and more interested the more I read. They had all information available in english (good for me when I don't speak spanish) and it seemed like a place that would fit me. And WOW, what an experience! Their place where not far away from Buenos Aires, me and my father took the bus for about 45 min and then Adrián from Caballos A La Par picked us up. I hadn't been riding for a while, though I've been riding a lot when I was younger, and I was really looking forward to this event. And I must say - I couldn't imagine what an amazing evning I would have! Adrián was a perfect host - I've never met a person as kind and hospitable as Adrián, we felt welcome from the beginning. After some traditionally mate and some pastries, we would start the riding trip. From the very beginning I noticed that the horses were very well-trained and attentive. The tour was all amazing, I can't describe it since I don't have all the words for it. The surroundings were wonderful, we were riding in a huge park and we didn't meet any other people. It was a very beautiful and calm place. Adrián was a very good rider and an excellent teacher. I found myself very comfortable during the whole trip. I haven't learnt that much about horses and riding ever before. It was very varied both the environment and the riding. We were supposed to be out riding for approximately 2 hours but we weren't back till more than 3 hours later! We had a lot of fun, and I think the horses had as well. I did even try changing horse as they're doing when playing polo! Jumping from one saddle to another, that was great fun! Adrián was very keen about me having fun and I really had. He really made me dare doing a lot of things I didn't know I could, and his joy and love for the horses really got me. After the riding, we had some more beverages and pastries and then Adrián drove us all way back to Buenos Aires. By then, we had been there all the evening and hadn't noticed that the time passed by. We had a lot of fun!This was my best experience of horsebackriding ever and I strongly recommend you to visit Caballos A La Par. It's personalized, they arrange the event just as you want it, and they really enjoy giving you a great experience. Thank you Adrián and Sergio that made my stay in Buenos Aires such a great stay, I hope we will meet again someday (and that we could play polo!). Good Luck with everything, I wish you the best!Lots of love,/Linnea

Best horse riding ever near Buenos Aires!!!. My girlfriend and I had been to several estancias in Buenos Aires where we had been sitting on some horses but not much more than that! However, at Caballos A La Par we really have had several wonderful experiences. First of all you just don't sit on the horse, you truly learn how to ride a horse. After the first time we visited Adrian, we both were already completely comfortable and able to manage the horses. A couple of weeks ago our family visited us here in Argentina and we really felt we had to share Caballos A La Par with them and so we did! After a 2-hour ride, they all left Caballos A La Par with great enthusiasm and all being able to really manage and ride the horses. They all returned completely surprised since they had never expected themselves to be horse riding as such, especially not after their first horse riding experience.Second is the diversity Caballos A La Par has to offer. You never take the same track and each ride you experience new things, or in horse riding or in the beautiful surroundings. Adrian and his crew are really able to offer something complete and special.Furthermore, one very nice aspect of Caballos A La Par is that you can go there throughout the whole year! In winter, spring, summer or fall, Caballos A La Par is an activity to be recommended throughout the whole year. In the winter, after a good 2 or 3 hour ride, Adrian prepared the best hot chocolates with 'medialunas' and in the summer we enjoyed with a big group of friends one of the best 'asados' after a beautiful trip. Just spoke to Adrian, made an appointment and we are meeting him again tomorrow! Already looking forward!

Best Ridiing Ever. Caballos A La Par is hands down the best riding experience I have ever done. I am an avid horseback rider and have been to many "horseback riding places to ride" in and outside the US while on vacation and Caballos A La Par is the best. Our adventure started with Adrian, one of the owners, coming to pick us up from our apartment in Buenos Aires, this made for a headacheless day. Upon arrival we were treated to delicious pastries and were introduced to our horses. My boyfriend is not as experienced as I am, but after some great instruction from Adrian and him getting more comfortable on his horse, he was riding like a pro! Adrian even got him comfortable cantering, something he hadn't done since he was a kid! Our ride all over the park was roughly 3 hours, I didn't want it to end!! The grounds are beautiful and the horses really listen to you. On our return, we were treated to Mate and then it was a US vs. Argentina challenge of Foosball. The day was lazy and the weather as ideal, nice and breezy. Sitting on the lawn chairs and look at the landscape with the horses munching on grass was the perfect end to our time in Argentina. If you know how to ride, want to learn to ride or brush up on skills while seeing a side of Buenos Aires you never thought existed, you must visit Caballos A La Par. Adrian truly loves his horses, his job and has a passion to teach and make riding a fun experience for all levels. I will definately return.

Fantastic day of horseriding. This is just a great thing to do in Buenos Aires. Excellent service and some really nice people. I had never ridden a horse before but our guide (Adrián) had me cantering in less than half an hour, and as he had promised I was no longer a beginner after riding with him. Our guide took pictures and video of us riding and even served us pastries and maté before and after the riding. Great people, great horses and just a perfect day.

Horseback Riding in Paradise - An Absolute "Must Do" in Buenos Aires. One of thee most memorable riding experiences I have ever had...the stunning ranch "A La Par" and is the brainchild of Buenos Aires local, Adrian.Set in the proclaimed Unesco site of Pereyra Iraola Provincial Park, A La Par (meaning side by side) enjoys privileged access to 10 000 hectares of beautiful mature woodlands 30 minutes from Buenos Aires. Adrian's aim is to share his passion for horses...he offers a unique riding experience which is tailor made for all guests, tourists and locals alike and his concept really does buck the trend.After meeting up in town, I headed out with Adrian to spend a day at A La Par and see for myself why this ranch is becoming a 'must do' in BA. It was evident to me within minutes of arrival and watching Adrian around his stunning Arabian horses, and indeed how they behave around him, that Adrian has a gift. We spent the day walking and galloping through stunning countryside and stopping half way through for a lunch stop to let the horses rest. Adrian has incredible patience for teaching and instills so much confidence even in the most nervous of riders. He was the perfect host and even went off to get me mosquito repellent after I had been bitten badly.The ranch is certainly like no others I have been to in my 3 previous trips to BA and I only wish I has known about it sooner!Words actually fail me to even begin to describe my day at A La Par and what I have learned, even as an experienced rider. Aware that I would love to learn polo, he even taught me how to improve some essential balance techniques. Late afternoon, Adrian offers me some yerba mate, (herbal drink), a daily ritual for Argentinians. Around sunset, Adrian goes over to his horses to say goodbye to every one of them. It's emotional watching because it's as if the horses don't want him to leave.Wow, a day in paradise!

WOW..The best day outside of Buenos Aires!!!. In short: I can't tell how satisfied,excited and inspired i felt after spending a day riding Cabalos a La Par. I went few days later again and brought my brother in law with me and we both had a blast again. The nature, the horses and the owner of the place made our day one unforgettable experience. Firstly, the place you ride is magical. It is a park -Parque Provincial Pereyra Iraola - between La Plata and Buenos Aires. The park is a mix of tropical jungle and argentinean pampas, trekking valleys on the bottom of in the White Mountains and wheat fields in Eastern Europe (i am Bulgarian leaving in US who spent some time in India and South East Asia::-). It is simply incredible that 45 minutes from Buenos Aires i was able to be in such a beautiful place. It was so green and lush that it made me forget the hustle and and the traffic of the city. Walking there would have been very pleasant too. Secondly, the owner/guide Adrian is a great guy who puts a lot of effort to make your experience pleasant and makes sure you learn to ride the right way while you "persue Apacchi" dreams:-).I am a person who is always in a hunt of the adventure and the action. Riding Pincho (the name of my horse) I felt like a cowboy or explorer or an american indian looking for bison tracks in the mud. I forgot to mention that I was an absolute novis in horse back riding but after one hour of hearing" Back Straight", "Relax", "Don't Pull", "Heels down", "Kick", etc:- I was actually galloping. Adrian was with me all the time and I thank him for the patience with my irrational moves at the beginning. Thirdly, the horses don't know the road and don't follow each other which was very important for me to learn how to control the horse and to make him go the way I want and the pace i want. I don't know if that was because of how they were trained or something else.What is most importantly I think is that Adrian is very passionate about what he does and is very hospitable and genuine person. The saddles we used were custom made for his horses with some additional improvements that make the saddle more comfortable for both the horse and the rider. He was not able to explain to me exactly what he had improved but he was very proud of his invention and I could tell that after 3 hours of riding i did not feel as bad as i expected. The same applies to the hats that we were wearing-they were his idea too. They look like cowboy hats but were made of helmet like material so you had the look of a cowboy:-) and in case you fell you would be protected. They had an adjustable plastic strap which made it very comfortable to wear. He said that he invented it but said he has no interest in making hats-he loves his horses:-). Most of all he didn't take our trip as one of the next business transactions where we were clients and he was the service provider interested in getting his money. He went out and beyond to make sure we feel like home and feel good. Very often when i am using the services of a guide or a company for anything extra i need to pay or you are put in awkward and uncomfortable situation. I dont mind paying for anything i receive. Don't get me wrong.But for example I went to a Boca game through a company that my hotel suggested for which i paid 6 times more then the face value of the ticket. The explanation was that the game was sold out and that they had to use some member's tickets and in addition after the game we would be taken for a dinner. Well..after the game they took us to a cafe next to the stadium where they gave us a cup of soda and one slice of pizza or a sausage. One guy was very hungry and after the pizza he asked for a sausage but they told him that he could only pick one or the other - a slice of pizza or a sausage. He could not have both. So he had to by the sausage for 10 pesos! Ha!With Adrian we rode 3 hours instead of 2 becasue i wanted to practice more, we played table soccer together, my brother in low used the shower in the ranch to refresh after the ride, Adrian arranged for our transportation back top Buenos Aires with friends of his, he picked us from Buenos Aires on the second day with his car, and he drove my sister to the best leather shopping store in the city where locals shop! No more comments about the guy.... When i went to the ranch I met a very pleasant German family part of a group of advanced riders group training their (actually the husband was argentinean who moved to germany and then moved back to BA). Their 8 years old daughter was training there too and she was a real pro. She was a nuturally born jokey. At some point se stood up on the horse which made her mother little nervous but she just laughed jumped back on the saddle, turned the horse as if she was turning on her heels and rode ahead. Amazing!After the ride was over Adrian took us to one of the parillas on between La Plata and Buenos Aires where locals go. The food was excellent and the beer cold! For 90 pesos the tree of us gained all those calories back:-)I don't want to compare Cabalos a la par to the well known estancias. I did not go to an estancia. I did get in touch with few estancias though and my impression was that going to an estancia would have been going to a very expensive country side restaurant combined with some horseback walking, relaxing to a pool or taking pictures of the area. When I asked one of the estancial close to DeAreco about what i can expect if I come there they sent me the menu! with some vague comments that guest can take part of teh activities of the gauchos. I know that many people are very pleased with estansias and i am sure that there is a reson for that. I doubt it though that you will be getting the horseback riding experience there that you would get otherwisw from Cabalos a la par. Again I have not been in estancia and can not make comparisons. So in short if you are novis or advanced and want to have your adrenaline up riding horses in a wild place and feel like home and among friends go to Cabalos a la par. This is amust do trip in Buenos Ayres for those who wnat something different and really fun. As they say a picture worth a thousand words. I am putting together my travel notes from Buenos Ayres and Patagonia and will publish them shortly. There i will put some pictures from my horseback riding moments so you can see the beauty of the place. if you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me.To get there call Adrian to pick you up if you are a group from BA. You can also take a bus from Retiro.The bus is 129 PLAZA (red buss with the sign PLAZZA) to the city of La Plata (for Camino Centenario). You have to get down in Rotonda de Gutierrez.(Its a big rotary and the buss stops there anyways but tell the driver. Takes 45 minutes to arrive there. Adrian will pick you from there.

Best Part of Our Trip to Argentina!. All we can say is wow - great experience, value and service for the money! Adrian, who will likely answer any email inquiries or calls, was a fantastic host who is not only passionate about his country and the horses/park in which you spend your time, but also about the people he takes care of (aka us). He and another colleague started the company a short time ago, planning for several years after he gave up his city job and decided to hunker down in the park where he's been riding for more than 30 years and open it up to tourists like us.For $75 pp, we got a truly personalized, private experience that we will never forget. It's such a step away from the city, yet not very far at all. We were both inexperienced riders, but Adrian was a fantastic instructor (with his colleague Sergio taking great care of the horses) - always encouraging and patient (you can tell he has kids). After arriving and sitting down for a pre-ride conversation that included some delicious pastries and a little lesson in mate (their traditional tea-like drink), we set out for several hours in the park - which went by quickly. We got some basics on how to just ride and steer, and within about 40 minutes, he was instructing us on how to gallop! Because the day was just for us, we developed our skills in light speed. The park was a mix of sun and shade, forest and open field, so there was a lot to take it.Again, just want to reiterate how passionate Adrian was and how he truly takes care of his customers. We took pictures while we were out there an emailed them a few days later even...a lot of nice touches. We wish him the best.The main tip is to not book something right after the tour, in theory, will end, so you can truly relax while you're out there. While the park is about 30 minutes outside the city, we dealt with monday morning rush hour, so it took us about 40 minutes just to get out of BA and another 30 to get to the park. If we needed to get back to BA for another scheduled activity, we would have missed out on part of what was an amazing time! All in all, we were picked up at about 10 and returned at about 4 - partly because we enjoyed hanging out and speaking with Adrian and Sergio before and after riding, we likely rode for more than two hours and a little because of the traffic.The second tip is to wear bug spray. It rained the day before we came, so mosquitos were prevalent. Adrian had some in his car, but we forgot to ask for some until it was too late!And, finally, prepare to get a bit sweaty in the sun and dirty from dust kicking up from some of the paths - but that's part of the fun!

Horseback Riding just 30 mins outside Buenos Aires. This ranch will provide many options for spending a magical time in the national forest in the most exciting way...you will be able to ride horses for 2-3 hour sessions or longer if you like...going through a beautiful forest and in the middle of nature....What I most liked about my experience was that you're flexible in your time and the instructors are happy to plan the day or session as you wish. Also, they will provide you with the best trained horses, having had some experience with riding in the US, I believe it's the best way to be introduced to riding or enhance your riding skills.....even if you have no experience riding, you will be easily galloping by the end of the session if you want!If you do end up going, I suggest planning a half day session where you can eat at the restaurant in the park in the middle of your riding session, they have the most basic and delicious meat/food and the most fresh salad you can imagine...I highly recommend riding in the forest...and I am certainly going back...!Best,BB

by far the best experience i've had. I've ridden horses in the past and I enjoyed myself but I never felt as comfortable as I did on this trip.Adrian is not only an excellent teacher who is kind and gives encouragement but he holds safety very high. He provided helmets; that we all wore, the equipment was in excellent condition and it was adjusted when needed and he always looked out for our well being (i.e. if a loose dog came towards us he would put himself between the dog and the group). Even though we were just on a group ride he would correct how we were sitting, holding the reins and how our feet were in the stirrups. In the end, these small adjustments made riding more comfortable.My first time riding with him he encouraged me to gallop. I tried but quickly decided I didn't want to and that I couldn't. He was patient with me and continued to demonstrate what I needed to do. I tried several times and was ready to give up when the horse started to gallop. To my amazement, I was doing it and I felt at ease, with such focus and i felt so in control. I'll never forget that moment.The property that you ride through is beautiful. There is a combination of thick forest and open fields (that you can gallop in. once you gallop you can't do it enough).Afterward coffee, mate and pastries were provided.Out of all the times I rode a horse I never felt this in control, safe and blissful.TIP:From Palermo you can take the 68 bus that goes down Pueyrredon to Rivadivia. At this intersection there is a Plaza (green area). This is where you can catch the 129 PLAZA bus (red bus with PLAZA written on the side). We had to buy the bus ticket before getting on the bus. It was 4 pesos. There are 2 buses that are called 129 PLAZA. Make sure you get on the one that says "Camino Centenario" (not autopista). Ask the driver to tell you when your at your stop "Rotunda Gutierrez". This is where Adrian picked us up.

LOVED the horses and the experience. A magical, memorable day! It was truly the highlight of my trip to Argentina. I can't imagine a more beautiful place or having a better day. The stable is at Parque Provincial Pereyra Iraola - 30 minutes (without traffic) away from Buenos Aires making it a convenient choice for riding. the Parque is an UNESCO protected reserve and one of the most beautiful places I've ever seen. We cantered through fields of wild flowers and grass and rode through amazing jungles. This was not a nose-to-tail ride. It was a truly unique and unforgettable experience. The horses are well trained and responisive. I rode 3 different horses (1 of them very briefly as he didn't fit well). The specially designed saddles and hat were extremely comfortable. I rode all day without soreness or chafing. Never before have I had the chance to canter more on a horse. It was exhilarating! One of the other unique things is the personal attention and training. Adrian rode along side and offered instruction to improve my riding skills. He is a gifted teacher and I learned much. This is an absolute MUST DO for anyone horse lover visiting Buenos Aires.

A great time with Tomas!. We spent a day and a half with Tomas and it was wonderful. Tomas is very passionate about his country and his job. He is knowledgeable about the rich history and loves to share. We spent 1/2 day on the delta that brought unexpected surprises. The rest of the time was spent discovering the beauty of the city. We highly recommend spending time with Tomas!

Delta Tour and City Walking Tour. My fiancée and I went on 2 tours with Tomas. Neither of us had been to Buenos Aires before and we knew that we wanted at least one city tour (to get us better acquainted for our guide-less travel) as well as one non-city tour. We choose Tomas because of the Tripadvisor reviews and could not be happier with our choice (thanks Tripadvisor reviewers). We started with the City Walking Tour on our first full day in Buenos Aires. Tomas picked us up from our hotel and took us on quite the adventure. We began the tour with coffee and a brief history lesson, which Tomas tailored to our questions and interests. We then walked to Recoleta Cemetary where we received a personal and detailed description of the many monuments. We then made our way to La Boca, where we had lunch and walked around the markets, taking in the sites. We ended with a drive back to our hotel taking the longer route, where Tomas showed us various parts of the city that he'd recommend we visit. His recommendations were perfect. We ended up visiting many of those spots, including Palermo Soho, the following day. We had such an amazing time with Tomas that we decided to do another tour the following week. We ended up choosing the Delta Tour and had a blast on the boat. Tomas drove us to the boat where we ended up on a private, 2 hour ride along the Delta. He stopped at several points to let us take pictures and point out various sites of interests. Tomas then took us to a local spot, where we had coffee and watched families picnicking in the park. We ended the tour with the ideal picture spot--Tomas took us to an area where the city of Buenos Aires was the background to our last picture. Tomas clearly enjoys being a tour guide. His tours are personal, layered with family anecdotes and personal experiences. He's never rushed nor does he try to force you to a "set" agenda. He has an outline of the tour, but often asked us questions in an effort to tailor the sites to our preferences. We had an incredible time on both trips!

Not a tour guide... a friend!. I traveled to Buenos Aires to combine a week of vacation sprinkled with a little business and wanted to enjoy the uniqueness of the city. Based on prior reviews, Tomas appeared to cater for a custom experience and I was not disappointed. Tomas incorporated my desire to visit La Boca, enjoy some excellent food and Malbec and tour the La Recoleta cemetery. What an awesome day focused entirely on me! Two days later Tomas invited me to travel to Lobos and Uribelarrea to experience the ranch lands and smaller towns. Amazing. By the end of our second tour I not only had an inspiring experience but a new friend. Thank you Tomas.

5 star review for a 5 star guide. My wife and I did 3 tours with Bonaventura - 2 full day trips (city tour and ranch) and a half day to ESMA museum.There are many people organising tours of BA but I cannot believe any are better than Tomas. The city tour was very well planned, covered all the major sites in just about the right amount of detail and allowed enough flexibility to spend more time in places of particular interest (in my case Boca Juniors stadium). The ranch trip was also wonderful, and rounded off our 5 days in BA perfectly.However, what sets Bonaventura apart from the others is Tomas and the fantastic care he shows his customers. It was just like being shown around by a friend - he's a really funny guy, and a pleasure to spend time with. He also knows his stuff and, if he is not sure of anything, takes the time to find out (for example, ESMA is somewhere not many tourists go and he spent time with his colleague Juan doing research to ensure my visit went perfectly. How many other people would do that?)He also taught us a few phrases in Spanish which will be very useful for our future trips in South America.Save yourself a lot of time and effort and entrust Tomas with all your tours around BA.A great guide, an even nicer person.

Best Tour guide and a new friend. I came to Buenos Aires in route to meet a friend in Brazil ... I wanted to see the city sights and Tomas was recommended highly. I can see why. We instantly connected and my time was such a great experience from beginning to end. He gave me all the options and let me guide the tour centered around what I enjoyed! He was truly a kindred spirit and a joy be around. He was so knowledgeable and his understanding of the region and its history was the best I have seen in a guide.When I am back in Buenos Aires I will be sure to reach out to Tomas!!Thank you Tomas!!!!

Very Helpful. Wrote to Tomas about half a day trip in November because I have a flight to catch later that evening. He wrote back promptly apologizing about the fact that he won't be available on that day. However recommended another company which he didn't have to. Really appreciate his helpful attitude. So even I won't get to do a trip still will give brownie points for this attitude.

One-of-a-kind tour guide, who made our trip memorable!. Thomas (Tommy) is a truly remarkable person. His sense of humour is amazing, and he is very knowledgeable about the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires. Tommy arranged discounted tickets for us for Rojo Tango (highly recommended!). He also took us on an abbreviated tour of Buenos Aires. Providing lively and informative commentary, we saw the most important sites in the city. Tommy is flexible and makes sure to take his customers' wishes and preferences into account. I cannot recommend him highly enough for anyone visiting Buenos Aires! We hope to return, and will hire Tommy again without hesitation (for a longer tour)!

Delta/Tigre Tour with Tomas. This was a very nice day and tour with detailed discussion of Argentinian history. All services were provided as promised: punctual pickup at hotel, safe drive to the delta, several hours out on the delta with a lunch overlooking the water, a toast while anchored looking over the water to see BA, and coffee and snacks after the drive through tour of El Tigre. I highly recommend this personal and small tour over the much larger tourist boats. Those may be cheaper, but Tomas's personal touch is well worth the difference.

Fun day with Tomas. For our first visit to Buenos Aires, we wanted to see a little of everything. Tomas listened to us and planned a wonderful and memorable city highlights day. He loves history and has quite the sense of humor which made the day fly by. We enjoyed our day with a local and cannot sing his praises enough.

Wonderful day in the Tigre Delta with Tomas!. We spent a great day with Tomas. Booking was easy via email. Tomas was very responsive, and answered all my questions. He was on time picking us up, and off we went to the tour. It was a beautiful sunny day, and Tomas took on a very relaxing tour around the delta. We cruised the waterways for a few hours, enjoying the scenery and the weather. We had a nice relaxing lunch on the water at a local restaurant. We were dropped off back at our hotel. Tomas has a great sense of humor, and is full of information about Buenos Aires and Argentina. It was a great trip out of the city, and we thoroughly enjoyed our time with Tomas. It's one of our favorite memories of Buenos Aires.
Great tour guide in Buenos Aires. Guide was very personable and you could tell loved sharing information about his city. Had a fantastic day with Tomas!

Tomas is an encyclopedia of knowledge . My fiancée and I did the River Delta tour this July. We knew going in that July does not lend itself to good weather in Buenos Aires, so we decided to just go ahead with the tour despite the rain and chilly weather. Tomas was elated with our attitude. He took us through the labyrinth of the Delta and we bought snacks from a convenience store boat. He showed us a variety of wildlife and shared his vast knowledge of Argentina history while we warmed up in a Cafe afterwards. Tomas was kind enough to arrange reservations and help me obtain my lost luggage - he is truly a class act with a great sense of humour. I highly recommend doing any tour with Tomas!

Amazing private tour of the city!. Tomas was a wonderful tour guide for a day in BA - he customized the tour knowing my dad's love of history and we visited all of the main sights (including what you don't find in a guide book) in one amazing and unforgettable day. Knowledgeable, friendly, funny, easygoing - this is a tour of Buenos Aires you don't want to miss!!

My First Trip to Buenos Aires. I found Tomas on trip advisor. He emailed me back in timely fashion. We booked a Tango dinner/show that he recommended and a day tour. He took payment in Paypal which was nice because we didn't have to use our US currency. ( because of the fluctuation of the peso many tours like US dollars and give a discount vs credit card or pesos) . The tango tour had a special event for the date we were available and he refunded the money immediately. He found another tango show made reservations but found out that the place would take even less money if we paid directly to the show. The tour: He picked us up promptly , drove us around , showed us the many areas and was very flexible about places and time. He is quite passionate about the history of Argentina and had lots to say about it. . What was very interesting to me was we spoke a lot about the present political situation and the currency fluctuations with the Christina Kirchner vs the Marci governments/inflation and how Argentineans have to deal with it. The weather was very cold and time was running out so he told us he would show us the Recoleta Cemetery the next day . If you want a flexible private tour I would recommend this.

Fun and unique tour with a die hard local. Tomás was a great tour guide for a day in BA, we had a great tour of the Tigre Delta, Recoleta and many other highlights of BA. The best part of the tour was hearing all of Tomás own stories of the history and how his own family's history evolved.He has a unique view and is very passionate about it. One tip for a much better day is not to bring up the F word....particularly if you are pommie.

Rainy day cancellation - prompt refund. To say we were bummed that it poured the day of our planned Tigre Delta excursion with Tomas - especially after reading the outstanding reviews - is an understatement. I want to give him kudos for being professional and polite - texting/calling to apologize - an for his honesty and integrity - the refund was provided by the end of the day. Hoping we get another opportunity to visit Buenos Aires just so we can experience Tomas and all that he has to offer! Hasta la proxima tiempo, amigo...ciao!

Tomas is the best!!!. We had a crazy, fun, informative, wonderful day in BA with Tomas!!!. He was so attentive to our needs and very kind to my Mom who walks with cane. I only wish we could have stayed a little longer - we will be back!!!If you are considering this tour - do not hesitate - DO IT!!!

After 30 countries - Best city tour I have ever had. I have had the luck to travel to over 30 countries and countless adventures. I met Tomas and asked him to provide me with a tour for a traveller who wants to experience Buenos Aires as someone who wants to immerse themselves into the city and the culture of the city. I had a city, history, food, football, everything tour. I had the single best day of my travelling life. Tomas has more knowledge, passion and a love for what he does than anyone I have ever met. He took extra time to make sure I was getting the experience I was looking for. As an added bonus his family has a long and rich history in the area and he is energetic and friendly. My only regret is it had to end. Tomas will meet all of your expectations and at a very reasonable price.

Tomas is part of the top 10 in Buenos Aires. Tomas gave my family an amazing tour of the city of Buenos Aires and the waterways of the Delta. He was very informative, quick witted and family friendly. We saw so much in just one day with him and learned so much about his country. I would highly recommend him to others and ask for his Tomas's top 10 things to see in the city that are not on your typical guide books list. Enjoy!

Tomas and Bonaventuratrips exceeded our expectations!. I found Bonaventuratrips through Trip Advisor and was impressed with the prompt and thorough replies from Tomas, regarding schedules and itinerary for our time in BA. He was flexible with our schedule, attentive to our interests....just the best! Our party of four enjoyed his commentary on the tour, and even more, he was just plain fun to be with. You can't go wrong by choosing him for a BA tour!

Tomas Saves the Day on the Private Tour of BA. Tomas is an incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, thoughtful, and hysterical tour guide! He has such a great grasp on how to perfectly plan a trip with your time constraints, locations, and site seeing desires. he also knows great places to eat all around town! i got back to my hotel after a full day with Tomas and then went out to eat on my own. I realized i thought i left my cell phone at a restaurant once i got back, full of panic i called Tomas who Saved the day! He found my phone and even returned it to me.and this was all at 1am! He has a family! and he did this for me after i was headed out the following day and my time with Tomas was complete. He is a class act and an incredible gentleman. I am indebted to you Tomas! Thank you for saving the day and for a few great days of tours in BA!

Tigre delta boat tour. We had a great day with Tomas. We had booked him for a boat tour of the Tigre delta. He picked us up at the place we were staying in the morning, and he showed us some interesting neighborhoods in Buenos Aires before we headed to Tigre. Once we got on his boat, we spent several hours on his boat touring around the delta. The scenery was beautiful, and it was interesting to see all of the homes that lined the rivers and streams. We stopped and had lunch at a great place with a patio and river view, and we got a kick out of seeing the valet parking for the boat. After boating we saw some more scenery and Tomas took us to a favorite hang-out of his for dessert and coffee. He pointed out more sights as we drove back to our apartment. The history lesson he gave was a bonus! Overall a great day and highly recommended!

Private Tour Tigre Delta. We were picked up at our hotel and drove to Tigre Delta. We spent the day in a private boat touring the delta and had lunch overlooking the water. Thomas was a fantastic tour guide very energetic and knowledgeable providing a real sense of area. His attention to every detail made this trip well worth it. He deserves the highest praise.

day tour of Buenos Aires. Having previously done the Tigre tour with Tomas in 2014, when I returned with a friend this year, he was the obvious choice as our guide to the city and he didn't disappoint. His enthusiasm for the history of the country is obvious and he is keen that you should feel as involved as he is. He also has a great sense of humour and makes the day great fun. As well as the usual landmarks he is willing to adapt the tour to suit individual interests and, when it comes to food, he certainly knows the good, more local feeling restaurants to visit. He even let the tour overrun so that we could drive out of town to go to a surfer's bar, where he treated us to a merienda to finish off the day. Many thanks Tomas

All tours should be as FUN as yours!!!. We did BA city tour and Tigre. We had an awesome time. We still talk about it. Loved the history 101. Enjoyed the restos you took us from the Empanadas/Sirloin Steak at Don Julio's to the worth the wait brochette at Gato Blanco and the mouthwatering dessert at Toien Beach Bar Peru. ❤️❤️❤️ Hope the Spanish Moss is still thriving in your garden. Thank you Tomas!

Pompas, ranch, horses, lake & Buenos Aires carnival with Tomas. We were looking for something "out of the ordinary," seeing the things tourists often miss and seeing more of the beauty, nature and culture of Argentina. Also, it was carnival time, and we only had a little time in Argentina, so hoped to see at least a little of their carnival life. After explaining what we were looking for, Tomas came up with a customized all day tour that was absolutely unforgettable! We could see it all and yet be as "lazy" or "active" as we felt that day without missing anything! A beautiful ride south, enjoying the scenery, culture & wildlife to & from the ranch; canoeing on the ranch lake; birdwatching; horseback riding; native drinks & food; & wonderful company. Then off to Buenos Aires for the carnival & wonderful dinner. This tour gave us the best understanding of the "real Argentina." The price was very reasonable & we did what we wanted to do for as long as we wanted, not having other tourists with us. Tomas was great company and always made sure we were doing what we wanted to be doing on the tour.

Fun Day At The Ranch With Tomas!!!!. It was a bit of a drive to San Antonio de Areco, but well worth it! During the ride we got to know Tomas and learn much about him and Argentina. I think that interacting with people who live in the place that you are visiting is the most fun. However, when we arrived at the ranch, we were greeted with delicious refreshment and many welcomes. We were soon on the loveliest of horses. The horses were wonderfully responsive and you could tell that they were lovingly cared for. We actually were able to go on three rides since we were having so much fun. We could have had a swim in a lovely pool, but the option for riding was much more alluring to us. There was a wonderful barbecue and a "Horse Whisperer" who was quite something to witness. All in all, it was a day that I wouldn't hesitate to repeat :)

felt like part of the family. We opted for a tour of Tigre when travelling through BA recently.He is expert, knowleageable and part Irish and we had a great day with him and his boat.Wonderful lunch and returned to BA after a full day.I loved that he rang his wife to see how she was doing and soon to deliver.Had a follow up short tour through Recoletta cemetary a few days ago ( baby born and congrats Tomas) where he had a great understanding of the various bods bured there. A wonderful experience. Would not hesitate to recommend and use again. next time a BBQ I am sure !.

Great day out with Eduardo. Tomas could take us out as his wife was having their baby, so Eduardo, his father took us out on his own boat. We saw lots and his is a gentleman, we had a great time and thank you Tomas for the free lunch. We saw way more than other excursion, he took us nearly to Buenos Aires.

Great privet guide in BA - Tomás E. Hughes. We booked Tomas for 1 day. We had a great privet tour in BA . We managed to visit most of the BA main attractions.Tomas is very knowledgeable, friendly, ENERGETIC and respond immediately to every request. We learnt a lot about Argentina and BA city and fun.Thank you very much Tomas and hope to see you again in the future.I would highly recommend Tomas for anyone visiting BA.

We were almost one of the family. Tomas is the best tour guide. We spent two days with him and he showed us so much and we had so much fun with him. He started by helping us map out our whole week in town, giving us ideas and offering to help us make reservations etc. The city tour was very thorough even though he was feeling a little under the weather but he offered to make up a whole other day with us if he didn't start to feel well. We gave him some medical advice and some 7-up and he started to feel much better and he took us to additional local places that are not on ordinary tours.The second day in his boat on the Tigre delta, we met his Dad and saw where he grew up and he told us all about the customs of the family. He took us to a grocery store and ended up visiting with us in our apt, making sure we didn't need his help arranging a taxi to the airport and even left us his phone number if we had any other questions.You don't find a guide like that every day and we really loved his personality and sense of humor.

Great Guide. Tomas can give you not only a tour of Buenos Aries but also give you the history so every place has more meaning. He is also willing to modify as your interests dictate.Great guide and tour operator

Delta delight. We had a great time with Tomas on the Delta Tour. I loved that it was very personalized. We saw places that tourists seldom see and ate with the locals. Tomas has excellent command of English and is very personable. Having lunch and mimosas in the middle of a river with the BA skyscape in the background was delightful. Tomas promises to shorten his history of Argentina next time:-)

Incredible Private Tour of BA. Tomas is an enthusiastic representative of his wonderful city! When I travel, I prefer not to tour with groups, and I prefer to be able to customize my experience and get off the beaten path a bit. Tomas provided exactly the experience I was seeking! Tomas picked my wife and I up at our hotel and was more than willing to modify our plans upon a moment's notice based upon what we wanted to see and do. Our experience was safe and unique. We saw sights and ate at places that other tourists simply don't get to experience when they use other companies. Tomas did a great job of educating us about the city and its storied past. We learned so much about the city from Tomas. Essentially, this custom, private tour was like being taken around the city by a very knowledgeable friend!

Buenos Aires Adventure. We have just finished two wonderful days with Tomas and wish we had a couple more days to continue our stay. Thanks to Tomas he showed us some unusual local places and unbeaten tracks, we think he helped us to understand the local charm of this wonderful city and his Delta Tour and lunch in the perfect location is unbeatable and couldn't be better.We were so pleased we arranged this just after we landed from London and we were sitting on his boat while he was doing all the work. We would definitely recommend his Delta Tour and City Centre Tour and are very grateful to Tomas who made us feel not like tourists but welcome friends in this hospital city.

Delta Tour and Ranch Tour. We were a group of six and Tomas took us on a tour of the Tigre Delta one day and to Estancia El Ombu another day. Tomas arranged very comfortable transportation and a boat transfer for the river tour. Tomas was on time and everything was on schedule. Tomas gave us a lot of information and was very funny and friendly and made us feel very comfortable throughout the two days that we spent with him. The Tigre Delta is very picturesque. I was concerned about mosquitoes but there were none. At the end of the day we had some time left, so Tomas took us on a tour of the Recoleta Cemetery, which was a nice bonus! The Estancia was a lovely place that is very well run. We rode horses, ate a wonderful parrilla lunch and rested under the shade of the big Ombu tree. Both outings were fun and we felt safe and in good hands with Tomas, who is professional, generous and goes the extra mile (he also went out of his way to help us exchange money). I highly recommend him!

First Time to Buenos Aires, Lucky I found this guy. My tour with Tomas was great. His knowledge of the cities history was insightful, and entertaining. He's a fun witty guy who keeps your attention. He brought us to some of the cities finest restaurants that I otherwise would have never found. My biggest complain about some tour guides is that they are boring. Tomas is not. I highly recommend Thomas to anyone that wants to have a good time and see the beautiful city.

Value for money and good to get out of the city. We did the visit to Tigre and the river deltas.The interaction from initial contact to tour completion was excellent.It is a great day out and was enjoyable as well as educational. Tomas the tourguide was so helpful and provided recommendations for a number of things during our stay, not just while on our tour.Would definitely recommend to anyboday wanting to do something a little different outside of Buenos Aires.

Excellent day with a great guide. My wife and I spend the entire day with Tomas doing a tour of the Tigre River, downtown Tigre, and around Buenos Aires. The boat tour was a great adventure, and we got many fantastic pictures of the city skyline and the river. If you're interested in South American history, he can provide very detailed and entertaining accounts of Argentina's colonial history, independence, and modern history -- I love that kind of thing and we talked about it for at least an hour throughout the tour (he even illustrates it with hilarious maps and pictures).We did a nice boat ride, an excellent lunch at a local restaurant on the Tigre river (accessible only by boat), went out for drinks, and then did a driving tour of Buenos Aires. My wife wanted some specific shoes (alpargatas) and clothes, and he knew exactly where to go to for her to get what she wanted (and at a really good price too).He speaks perfect English, is quite funny, and has a private car to take you everywhere. My only regret is not doing the tour earlier in our trip (we did it on the last day), as he pointed out lots of places we wished we could go back and visit and eat at.

Thomas is the best!. My fiance and I had a wonderful time with Thomas! He did a spectacular job individualizing the tour to our interests. Born and raised in Buenos Aires, he does a great job of giving both textbook and personalized history of the area. He is also hilarious and full of energy! We loved the boat tour, grabbing drinks and dessert at one of his favorite (and secluded) spots, and driving around the city. I was bummed that I didn't purchase some shoes at the market the day before and he brought us to the best place in the city to purchase them! I can't recommend him enough- it was the highlight of our week. We only wished we had scheduled our tour for one of our first days in city since he did such a great job of listing out areas we should see and restaurants where we should dine!

Trip to Estancia. Tomas picked us up an our VRBO apartment and immediately we saw from his winning personality that it was going to be a very fun day together. We drove the 90 minute trip to San Antonio de Areco to visit the world famous silversmith (who gave us a private demonstration of his creative process). From there we went to the El Ombu ranch and had a very relaxing day of riding horses, eating a traditional Asado and relaxing by the pool. Tomas knew the hosts at the ranch and they took very good care of us. Tomas gave us a great history of Argentina, the Pompas region and Argentinean politics. He is very transparent and a lot of fun. We have 2 teenagers, and the loved his style and the information that he shared with us. By the end of the day, we have become good friends. We highly recommend Tomas for a Buenos Aires City tour, the Delta tour, or the Estancia tour.

Tomas - a Truly Outstanding Guide. Having visited Buenos Aires before, we were very specific about what we wanted to see this time. We wanted to avoid the more touristic itineraries so I developed my own combining a visit to the Tigre Delta with a casual horse ride at the estancia Los Dos Hermanos in an adjoining province. Tomas was the only guide willing to work outside the square and we were so glad he was! Our party of four had a most memorable day thanks to all Tomas' efforts. He was an absolute joy - humorous, insightful and passionate about his local Delta area. We enjoyed a fabulous picnic lunch aboard his speedboat, complete with champagne, before heading off for the estancia. Tomas produced another lovely surprise for Sally who wasn't up for riding. We cannot speak highly enough about the quality of Tomas' services - he is fabulous. Tomas also recommended and booked a great Parrilla and Salon Canning Milonga for us - both were fantastic with a real 'local' flavour. Thank you Tomas!

GUNG-HO YE-HAA Thomas. when you keep talking about a certain tourguide with your girlfriend, friends and colleagues,that means that the guide has made impact on you! That is how Thomas is :). His english full of British (fancy that!) and Taxas (yee-haa) phrases and his self decription as a man full of jokes and humor must crack you up at some point!I was very sceptical at his style for first few hours of the tour, but once i realized it is best not to split hairs but to relax and enjoy the day with Thomas and his true Porteno (genuine BA citizen) style...He took us on a day trip all over BA, we saw a lot and gave us good insight in the town so that we can explore it on our own later. Thank you Thomas, you are such natural and sincere and funny guy...i still smile when i think of you - YEE HAA!P.S. Check prices in any places where you stop to eat and shop before you eat and shop...just so that you are not negatively surprised later on

Great Guide!. We spent three days with Thomas and we couldn't have been happier. On our first day, we had a long layover in Buenos Aires, and when our plane was delayed Thomas was wonderful about helping us adjust our itinerary to things that we were interested in. Our next tour was the full day City Tour, and it was really a full day! Thomas knows his history and loves his city. This day we were with another couple and we all had a fabulous time. On the third day, Thomas took us to the Tigre and after a perfectly charming boat ride he dropped us at the airport. Thomas provides personal attention for small groups. Be aware that he is a fount of information and talks very very quickly, but if you only get half of what he says it will be twice as much as other tours. And you'll have a lot more fun. Highly recommend Thomas with Bonaventura!

The best way to visit Buenos Aires and Tigre. Tomas is a truly great guide, with a lot of humor and a great knowledge of the history of Argentina. After a tour with Tomas you wil feel the city, know its anecdotes, taste fine local food and enjoy a lot of coffies. If you want to have a great day, you have to do a tour with Tomas.We did the city tour and the delta tour. We are still enjoying it!!!

Great Fishing trip in Tigre. My son wanted to go fishing in Buenos Aires and I had no idea where to take him. We had just 2-days to plan. Hotel receptionist put us in contact with Tomas and he put together a fishing trip for us within that short time for a very reasonable price. He picked us up from the hotel about 8.30am and drove to the boat. All fishing gear with live bait were ready to go. Guy in the boat was also very friendly. We had a great time on the river fishing and enjoying the calm waters. He brought sandwiches and setup a nice picnic lunch on the boat. I enjoyed couple of beers and sandwiches he had prepared while my son did all the fishing. He caught 2 small catfish. Tomas, I still have the Cigar you gave me. I should smoke it one of these days, On the way back to hotel, he went out of the way to show us some nice neighborhoods. He didn't have to do this as it was not part of the trip. He genuinely enjoy the work he does, very knowledgeable and takes time to make his guests happy. Thank you very much for the great fishing trip and the company you provided for both of us. We truly enjoyed it.

Great Delta and City Tours. The culmination of a cruise around the Cape of Horn, these two tours were to be our introduction to Buenos Aries and boy did Thomas do a great job. Delta/Tigre tour and lunch had just enough detail and then we got views of the city from the Northern edges. High tea and a history of Argentina/Buenos Aries made for a full first day. Thomas has a good grasp of the English language, so conservation with him were great! The next day started at 9 am and covered the cemetery, the city proper and then on to La Roca for lunch. More sites and tea and a history lesson finished the day. Highly recommended. Thomas supplied a clean automobile, fuel, tolls and parking for a reasonable price of about $25/hr. He does his best to not offend anyone, least of all his customers.Stayed at the Bel Air Hotel at a very reasonable $65/night with a great breakfast and attentive English speaking reception staff.

Excellent tour of Buenos Aires. We had a super day with Tomas touring BA. He picked us up at our hotel at 9.30 in the morning and we spent all day touring with him. We visited many of the interesting parts of the city and learned a lot about the history from Tomas,he is very passionate abut his city and it shows. We visited Plaza de Mayo, San Telmo, La Boca, Recoleta and some special areas of interest he added as we were his first Irish customers. We highly recommend that you book a tour with Tomas, you will really enjoy it and learn a lot in a fun way!!!

Fantastic Trip with a Great Guy. My parents, brother, and I went with Tomas throughout the Cemetery of Recoleta, into San Telmo (where we had an excellent lunch at La Brigada), to La Boca, and to River Beach. Tomas picked us up at our hotel and took us around the city, showing us and explaining to us statues, monuments, and various buildings while en route to our destinations. He was very knowledgeable of all the sites and areas of the city that we saw, and you could feel his passion for the history of each site and the history of Argentina as a whole. He enjoys what he does and it shows! Quite an entertaining guide as well! We highly recommend that you schedule a tour with Tomas as part of your visit to B.A.!

Fantastic Brillant And Absorbing. If you love history and want to enjoy history Tomas is your guide. He took time to explain and the Q & A,s were very imformative. I wanted more time on the trip. He was like a teacher who taught with passion and knowledge about his favourite subject, but never over the top with his answers.

Delta Tour in Tigre, Buenos Aires. This was a very informative and entertaining tour around the waters of Tigre. Not only that, but all transportation to Tigre was included in the form of a mini bus along with a brief history of Argentina on our journey to Tigre. Would not hesitate to recommend to anyone visiting Argentina.

Fantastic tour and great personalized attention. My dad visited me in Buenos Aires and we signed up for a one-day tour of Buenos Aires with Tomás. It was amazing! From the first contact (he answered all emails and messages very fast) to the pick-up and the actual tour, he was so sweet and knowledgeable. A small personal tour is a fantastic way of seeing the city because it gets tailored to your needs and wishes, and you can ask all the questions you want. He is also just really buena onda. What a great day! Highly recommended.

Excellent tour guide.. My husband and I booked a fishing trip with Tomas for a morning in BA. We did not catch any fish but Tomas brought food and beverages and we had a very enjoyable time on the water. He speaks very good English which made it easy to communicate. I think he felt bad about the fishing so on the way back to BA we stopped at a great little bar/coffee shop right off the water and he gave us an informal but helpful history lesson about Argentina and BA. He then took us to La Boca and we learned the history of tango. We ended up spending all day with Tomas and the following morning he met us at the recoleta cemetery for a tour. The history that we had discussed the previous day made the tour of the cemetery much more interesting. The entire time we spent with him was interesting and we were able to enjoy parts of the culture we definitely would not have experienced otherwise. Not sure I would go fishing with him but would not hesitate to have him show me around the area. We really had a great time with him!!

An unforgettable tour of the greatt city of Buenos Aires. During the course of the day Thomas gave me a very detailed introduction into the history of Argentina. Therefore all the Places we visited I had heard about in his little lecture, and was able to relate to them in a much better way than if I they had only been shown to me. His in Depth knowledge about his county and city impressed me, and as a retired history teacher I really enjoyed it. If you want a personal and torough introduction into Argentina, you,ll have to sign up with Thomas, He even takes you to parts of the town which you are not recommended to visit on Your own. But Thomas knows a lot of People there too, and I felt very safe all the time. The day With Thoas was just great.

Crusing the Tigre. Tomas made us feel very comfortable. He picked us up from our hotel and drove us to the Tigre area. He was knowledgable and personable and we had a thoroughly enjoyable day out on the water.

Cruising the Tigre Delta with Tomas. From the moment I met Tomas, I immediately felt the comfort of an old friend and knew it would be an amazing day! Tomas picked us up at our hotel and drove us 45 minutes to Tigre, time went by quickly with Tomas talking about Buenos Aires in an upbeat, knowlegeable way. Tomas is the perfect guide-professional and informative, passionate and funny.... The boat tour was absolutely amazing, the Tigre delta is breathtakingly beautiful, and even better on your own private boat. We dropped anchor in a beautiful open area of the river with the skyline of Buenos Aires as the backdrop, enjoying a snack of sandwiches and champagne. On the way back to Buenos Aires, we stopped for lunch at a beach restaurant, people relaxing in the grass, admiring the beauty of the river and soaking up the sun and a continuation of the history over burgers and beer. Tomas is one of the best people you will ever meet, full of life, kind and warm. He is the only guide I will ever use in Buenos Aires, other guides in other cities will always be compared to him and probably pale in comparision.

Outstanding tour - Thank you!. Thomas met us on time outside of our hotel. The trip had been organised for us by friends and I had never met him before but he immediately struck me as very easy going and welcoming.After providing water he started to give us information about the beautiful city of Buenos Aires while we were in the bus, setting the scene by providing a little bit of history of Argentina in general and the city in more detail. He is a very knowledgeable guy and was able to answer almost all of our questions. Where he didn't know he didn't bluff - but he went and found out the answers for us. Although he never even hinted about a gratuity he definitely deserved one.He is a great guy, really easy to get along with, in fact we invited him out for beers after the tour. Thanks Thomas!Go on this tour - it is definitely worth it.

Great Buenos Aires city tour. Tomas was able to adapt his standard tour to fit our needs, he was very knowledgeable about all aspects of the political and social history of the city. Delta Tour. What a wonderful tour. Tomas was so knowledgeable and I enjoyed all the history he entertained with. He was professional and very fun. The sun peaked in and out but Tomas had enough sunshine for everyone.

City Tour. Absolutely fantastic. Tomas was very professional throughout and had a real in depth knowledge of the history of each location. I thoroughly enjoyed the city tour and would recommend it to tourists who want to see the real Buenos Aires. Thank you.

Unforgetable trips. What an amazing trip to Tigre! We appreciated the boat trip on Rio de la Plata. A lot of interesting information helped us to understand history and people. On boat or going by feet, it is Tomás Hughes you need!

The only way to see the real Buenos Aires.. A supremely structured and very informative tour of all of the city`s prominent spots, in addition there is a comprehensive and no holds barred history lesson which is certainly an eye opener! Great private tour. Tomas was fun and very knowledgable about the city and the history of the country. He went out of his way to pack special vegetarian snacks to suit my diet and showed us some of the "local" hangouts. We had a great time and would definitely recommend him for a tour!

The best way to know Buenos Aires. You will return home loving Argentina!
Perfect Getaway. Tomas is a great guy and gives a lovely tour. He picked us up from our hotel and then we enjoyed a quick car ride to his boat. My fiancee and I really enjoyed it

The Perfect Delta Tour. Tomás picked us up in the morning from our hotel and brought us to the Delta. Once we arrived to El Tigre we had a little tour by car before arriving to the boat. river/city tour. took two trips with tomas on the 7th and 8th September,first one was on the river plate delta,second was a tour of the city,which included a tour of the boca juniors stadium! tomas is great company,and is very knowledgeable about the city of Buenos aires! highly recommended,if you want to take a tour with him!

THE Buenos Aires Expert and awesome afternoon on the Delta. Tomas was an excellent host helping us understand parts of Buenos Aires that we would not have experienced, gave us valuable insight on the currency (which is very different from the US and other countries), took us to neighborhoods with a ton of flavor, and a wonderful trip on the Delta. His upbeat attitude, great phrases, and knowledge made it a great investment. If your time is valuable, its a no-brainer to work with Tomas. Great job! Thank you for being flexible and trustworthy.

Relaxing River Day. The river ride in Tigre was unexpectedly relaxing with tour guide Thomas. He was resourceful and insightful sharing a bit of Argentine history and culture. The boat accommodated 3-4 people comfortably. Recommended time is 1-2 hrs on boat without restroom facilities on board.

Boat tour of Delta Tigres River, picnic, and History of Argentina. Tomas was great! Picked us up from the hotel for the tour. Throughout the ride he included information on history of buildings and important landmarks. The boat ride was private and very comfortable. It was great to learn so much about Argentina along the way and throughout the tour. His english is great. Highly recommended as a must!

Outstanding boat day on Delta/Tigre with Tomas! A Must in Buenos AIres. You cannot visit Buenos Aires without going on Delta/Tigre and Bonaventura trips is the best way to discover this unique district!! My wife and I love boating, so we found this activity through Tripadvisor in Canada prior to our departure for Argentina. After reading all previous positive comments, it was a no brainer that we wanted to try this tour. So 2 days after our arrival in BA we sent a email to Tomas. So we ride in their vehicle from San Telmo where we stayed to the Delta. From this point a true Buenos Aires history lessons started and that for the entire day. Tomas has so much culture he knows EVERYTHING about Argentina and South America! But the best is coming!After about 45 MINUTES we arrived at Tomas boat. A very comfortable, recent and well maintained bowrider 180. Their boat is perfect to discover the Delta because it allows us to go in all branch of the Delta even if water level is very low in some spot.In the Delta you feel like if your are in another world. Great Job. Must Order.. When we fly from Miami to El Calafate we stopped in Buenos Aires few hours. Tomas gave us a great tour around BA. Tomas took us to La Bocca, Puerto Madera, Soccer Stadium and Museum. We had perfect time with Him. Tomas, Thanks. Highly recommended!!!!

You want to go to the Delta with Tomas. We spent a day in the delta with Thomas. Even though it was a rainy day in early winter, Thomas made the trip memorable and fun. Great fun!. Tomas gave us a great tour in Buenos Aires during our stopover. He is great company, knows his history and inlcudes a lot of humor! Highly recommended!

Buenos Aires City Tour and Delta Tour. My wife and I recently spent a week in Buenos Aires and took two tours with Tomas. If you are in Buenos Aires, I highly recommend you connect with Tomas as he is the owner of his company and operates small to keep things personal. Great city tours!. We went with Tomas on 2 city tours with a small baby! Absolutly perfect! Tomas is a relaxed funny guy that really wants to show as much as posible of his city, at the same time he knows a lot of history that makes the tour so much more intresting. He has a good idea where to take you but he also does a lot of spontainius stops where not to much tourists goes. We went with Tomas for 2 days and he was also very good with the baby. The best way to explore Buenos Aires!. We found Thomas by a coincident and to go with him on a private guided city tour is for sure the best way to get to know the city! Awesome experience. Touring with Tomas is an unforgettable experience. He is professional, knowledgeable, accomodating, and overall an excellent guide. Seeing the Sights with a Friend. We did both of Tomas' advertised tours - city and delta. Touring with Tomas is like touring with a friend or distant relative. He tailors the tour to your interests. Since we were spending two days with him, some of the stops from the city tour were deferred until the second day to give us time to explore further. He does not expect you to pay his way at lunch; rather he will split the tab with you. I would most highly recommend traveling with him with Tomas and look forward to seeing him again.

Beat way to see Buenos Aires!. spent two days with Tomas touring The Delta and Buenos Aires - not only is he a lot of fun, but gives you a 'history lesson' about every area. I loved it, and my time in that great city would not have been half as good without Tomas.

Definitely a five-star tour in Buenos-Aires with Tomas. We had a two-days tour with Tomas in Tigre Delta and Buenos-Aires, with a six people group.
