Excellent tour guide!. My wife and I are very happy to have picked Cultura Cercana, and in particular Andrés, to be our guides during our recent visit to Buenos Aires. We were able to visit BA at our pace and Andrés did a brilliant job at adapting our tour to our liking. We will never forget the painter we met at El Caminito or the aged tango dancers in a club without a single tourist at sight.

Andres, best tour guide we had in years. We booked Andres thrue Cultura Cercana, for a full day (8 hours) on our first day in Buenos Aires. We saw not only all the highlights of the city, but we also get a feeling for the city, it's public transportation, places to visit on your own, tips for good restaurants and, Tango classes and performances, etc. We stayed a week in BA and all these tips helped a lot!Andres is a kind guy, who speeks excellent English and knows a lot! Not only about the history and highlights of the city, but also about economics, politics, gastronomy, art, architecture, smart deals, farming and Tango, as he is a tango-dancer himself!He has a nice, clean car and he drives carefully. In every city we visit we hire a private tour guide and up to now Andres was the best we had!Affordable also. We paid US $240 for the full day, including the car. (lunch and drinks are extra)Highly recommended!

The tour was going well, but then we were surprised with one attitude.. Unfortunately we only had 1 day in this fantastic city, which I strongly recommend you spend 3 days since there are plenty of things to do. The tour was going well, and it was a good option because our limited time in the city.But there was one thing we didn't like. We kindly paid the lunch of the tour guide, and he asked for the most expensive beef available on the menu, after saying he usually, on this occasions order the cheaper one. Unfortunately we confirmed the bill even directly with the guide and he confirmed his ordering, knowing he had just ordered the opposite he had said he usually does. That left us with a very bad impression. By the way the beef is really good, and you feel tempted to try all the options available. This was really unnecessary because the tour was going well that far. I guess in a business like this there are small details that are sometimes so important...Hope you find this review helpful

Cultura Cercana - Outstanding!. Based on TripAdvisor Cultura Cercana reviews, I booked my group of 52 passengers for Buenos Aires, Argentina (BA) full day tour on March 30, 2015. I contacted Fabian long before we went on our 7-night South America Cruise from Santos (Roundtrip), March 27, 2015 sailing date via RCCL Splendour of the Seas. Fabian always responded immediately to all my questions, like ‘must’ see in BA, tango options, lunch for the group, etc. When we arrived into BA, Fabian was prompt and escorted us to the two (2) air-conditioned big bus and a minivan. Grisel was the big bus tour guide and Andres was the minivan tour guide. Grisel and Andres were OUTSTANDING English tour guides! Both tour guides were very informative, enjoyable, professional, and want to share their extensive knowledge of history. We were lucky that Fabian was with us during our tour. It turned out that the city strike will start that day at 11 PM (it was announced at the ship) and some of the streets were closed. Fabian rerouted the bus and minivan drivers to take us to the attractions without a glitch! We visited the following neighborhoods/attractions, namely, La Boca, the first port, with its colorful houses, street art, football and tango atmosphere everywhere – Men danced the tango first! San Telmo, the old part of town, with its cobbled stone streets and antiques shops. Downtown area, with the Plaza de Mayo, the Casa Rosada, the Cabildo and the Metropolitan Cathedral (Pope Francis was the Archbishop), all witness of local and South American history. Recoleta, the traces of a luxurious past, with beautiful palaces and an amazing cemetery (interesting stories about Eva Peron, girl buried alive, etc.). Puerto Madero, the recycled former port docks are now the most modern part of town (our famous restroom stop). Palermo, the reinvented neighborhood, nowadays full of design shops, restaurants and cafes.  For quick lunch, as suggested by Fabian, we ate at the El SanJuanino famous for beef and chicken empanadas in Argentina.  I HIGHLY recommend Cultura Cercana for Buenos Aires, Argentina tour. Fabian, Grisel and Andres are great assets to Cultura Cercana!

A Tour That Didn't Happen. We had a tour scheduled for April 13. Unfortunately, after waiting outside for our tour guide for 30 minutes we finally learned that he would not be able to guide our tour due to a medical emergency. We fully understand that things happen and hope that he is fully recovered. What bothered us was three things.- An emergency number was provided to us and when we had not heard anything 15 minutes after our tour was supposed to begin, I called the number and it was a recording and all in Spanish. That was of no use to me.-As it turned out we saw his colleague about the time he was supposed to be there. She was holding up a sign for other people. We could not quite read the name of the company. About 25 minutes later she came over again and met her group and when we looked closer we saw she was from the same company and asked if she could contact our tour guide. Well, then she pulled out a second sign that was right before that sign that had my name on it. Now, why she didn't ask us 25 minutes earlier what tour company we were waiting for is beyond me.-When we did hear from our guide, it was via e mail. He apologized and noted he had been in terrible pain and had taken pain killers and as he drove towards the terminal he realized he was in too much pain to do the tour. My reaction was if someone has to take pain killers for severe pain it would not be wise to be giving a tour let alone driving a vehicle.Again, I fully understand that things happen but I think this could have been handled a lot better than it was.

A Great Day!. My Husband and I spent a fabulous day in Buenos Aries with Mirta! She was extremely knowledgable, had a great personality, and made our full day tour both educational and memorable! We felt like we were traveling with an old friend who shared with us many aspects of the greater Buenos Aries region that most tourists never see! After we were dropped off at the airport, we realized,too late, that we had left our jackets and my hat in the car! I can't say enough about how Fabian, Andres and Mirta bent over backwards and went out of their way to send us our belongings! What a wonderful company to employ, you couldn't do better!

Very Good Tour of the City. We booked a private vehicle and guide for our tour of Buenos Aires. The guide was very knowledgeable and the vehicle was comfortable. He spoke very good English. The guide provided very good details of the history of the area and general information. When asked, he picked out a wonderful restaurant with outdoor seating shaded by mammoth rubber trees near the Recoleta Cemetery.

Start your trip in BA with Andres!. Andres was our guide for a thorough tour of BA. We were lucky that we booked the tour for a day that turned out to have a city wide strike. I don't know what we would have done if we didn't have Andres, and he was able to take us everywhere with no traffic in the streets!Andres took us to all of the main spots in BA. I am still in awe of how much he knows - names, dates, history, etc. He really made the history of BA interesting and gave us a glimpse into life in BA. I am particularly glad we had him to take us to La Boca (can be dangerous if you go alone) and the Recoleta cemetery (he had great stories about several of the graves. Just be prepared - you can see the caskets!) He also drove through some areas to give us suggestions for places to visit on our own during our time in BA.My only frustration was lunch. I wasn't hungry yet when we were near a restaurant he suggested. We ended up eating late in Palermo and he didn't take us to a great place, and several other/better options were literally a block away (which we later learned). But I am not faulting Andres for that.*Be sure to pay in US dollars if you can. It's cheaper*

Half Day Tour of Buenos Aires. We had a long layover between flights, and wanted to see the city. It was a fabulous experience. From booking, meeting, and the tour itself, it was a very pleasant experience. Our guide was so flexible, and went way above and beyond. Would recommend this company.

Great way to visit Buenos Aires with a private guide. Did 3 tours with CercanaCultura during our stay in Buenos Aires. Spend 2 days with Fabian to visit Buenos Aires. We also did the El Tigre tour with Andres and Mirta.We were 4 persons with a private tour only for us. Fabian was a great guide and took the time to explain all the history of the city while showing us all the main sites. He spoke very good English and had full knowledge of the events and the dates during our tours. He took us in 2 local restaurants for lunch where the food was good and not pricey. Adrian and Mirta took us on a boat trip in the Deltas of El Tigre. We then went to Adrian’s farm house where they prepared a delicious meal for us. They are professional Tango Dancers. They performed for us before showing us how to dance the Tango. We have also booked other tours with CulturaCercana in Patagonia and they are very professional and trustworthy. I don’t hesitate to recommend them.

Best way to see Buenos Aires. Four of us booked a tour with Andres of the city highlights and enjoyed it immensely. The guide covered the main tourist areas of the city and gave us a good idea of which places we wanted to return to and see in more detail. Andres is a fun, knowledgable, high energy guide who both recommends the places to go and adjusts his itinerary to meet special requests or areas of interest. For example, he arranged for us to break off from his tour to join the guided tour of the opera house- recommended- including arranging the tickets and waiting for us at the exits on time. We enjoyed his tour so much, two of us did a second tour with him and his tango partner- another tour guide- which included visiting the north part of the city, taking a tour on his boat through the estuaries (best described as cottage country meets louisiana bayou), his farm on one of the islands, plus an excellent meal and some tango lessons. Sure beats the crappy tourist bus!

Great full day private tour with Grisel of Cultura Cercana Tours. We had a great Full Day tour of Buenos Aires with Grisel. Booking with Fabian via email was straightforward, we agreed a price in US$ to be paid in cash at the end of the tour. Grisel was waiting for us at our hotel at the appointed time, with Carlos and the car ready outside. Grisel spoke wonderful English and proved to be a delightfull and knowledgeable companion, whisking us from place to place and finding the special spots where two or three people are welcome where larger groups are not, such as the balcony overlooking the Boca and the little museum at the fabulous old Cafe Tortonu.

Overpriced for an average tour.... I took the 1/2 day tour and Fabian Ali was my guide, this tour was overpriced (USD cash only payment was accepted) and most of the time was in a car driving around to different locations... tour felt very rushed and was jumping from 1 location to another and felt like you spent more time in the car than actually enjoying or doing site-seeing or doing a real tour of a location...The tour was $150 USD for 1/2 day tour (4 hours) which payment is only in cash USD! with the exchange rate and economy this is way overpriced for the quality of tour... I recommend doing a walking tour of Argentina for free and will get a better experience for free (adding a few dollars for tip)! only for the reason of requiring to be paid in cash only and in USD I lowered my rating from a 3 to 2 out of 5...Overall highly disappointed with this tour... Would not recommend at all to do this tour... do the free walking tour instead or the other 2 tours I have done in Argentina which I have 5 star reviews for... the Parrilla Tour which involves food tour and the Tango tour which includes tango lessons, dinner and tango show!!!

My husband and I spent a few days in Buenos Aires and wanted to get the most out of the city and surrounding area.. Based on the reviews for Cultura Cercana on TripAdvisor, we booked two full days tours. Laura and Fabian were incredibly tolerate of my endless questions on what to do during our two days. We settled on a full day city tour followed by a full day in the Tigre Delta. Although Fabian was not able to be our guide, he did come to our hotel upon our arrival to introduce himself and finalize our tours. Our guide was Andres and he was absolutely amazing. He was extremely personable and knowledgeable of both the history of Buenos Aires as well as current events. Our first day was spent hitting all the top sights. It seemed that where ever we went, Andres was known by all the locals. Our second day was spent in the Tigre Delta. After a stroll in the town, we got on his boat for a ride up the river delta to his home. He and his tango partner prepared us a wonderful lunch, followed by a tango demonstration and tango lessons! It was one of the highlights of our trip. I highly recommend Cultura Cercana for your private tours in Buenos Aires!

One of the best tours we have ever taken. We were staying in BA a few days before our cruise and wanted an extensive city tour and Trip Advisor helped us find Cultura Cercana and Fabian. His knowledge of the city and Argentine history was excellent. For lunch he recommended and took us to an Italian restaurant where we had a most unusual (and delicious) pizza. He catered to our every need and desire. I sincerely recommend Cultura Cercana (and Fabian) for a private tour.

Outstanding tours with very personable guides. We used Cultura Cercana for a private Buenos Aires tour and, in retrospect, wish we had taken all our tours with Cultura Cercana. Our guide, Fabian, was punctual, highly personable and knowledgeable of his city and its history. His English is excellent. He took us to places of interest to us, but also injected some stops of his own that helped us understand Buenos Aires and its history a lot better. Fabian was also very diligent with email communications prior to our trip. I would hire them again in a heartbeat when I return to Buenos Aires.

Private tours in both Buenos Aires and Montevideo. Fabian, from Cultura Cercana Tours, arranged two fantastic tours for our private party of 5. First, Emiliano guided us for an entire day in Montevideo. He was so personable, easy to understand and so very knowledgeable. We learned so much about the culture as well as history of this city, this country and this area! He was extremely helpful in every way and we can't say enough good things about this tour!Alberto guided us for an entire day in Buenos Aires and was also excellent in every way - so knowledgeable, easy to understand, so very willing to help with our concerns for transportation the following day, and so very personable. Again, we learned so much more about the culture and history of this country, this area, and this city - and how both Buenos Aires and Montevideo and their guides compete with each other in interpretations of events and customs! We just can't say enough good things about this tour either!We highly recommend Cultura Cercana for setting up private tours in every city where they work! Thanks for fantastic memories!

Can't ask for better !. Incredible people ! They did not get tired of answering my e-mails at the first place. We tailored our program together. They arranged our airport transfers, restaurants and show reservations, Bounes Aires and Tigre Delta daily tours, tango classes and more. I feel lucky that we had them in BA, their service was AA :)) They are ready to do anything for you. The lovely guides and drivers did a great job. Muchas Gracias friends !

great tours. My husband and I and another couple were in Buenos Aires for three nights. Fabian took us on two separate full day tours and we feel like we saw most of the important sites of the city. He spoke excellent English and was very knowledgeable and very pleasant to be with. He spoke about the history of the city and also about ongoing current events. We were very pleased with the two days we spent with him and highly recommend Cultura Cercana and Fabian.

Fabian was an excellent guide!. We only had one day in Buenos Aires since it was a cruise port stop. We booked a private tour for four of us with Fabian based on his great reviews. He was excellent. We could not have had a better day. We saw much of the city, had a wonderful typical Argentine meal, learned about Argentine history and culture and did it all at our pace. Fabian has a great personality. We really enjoyed spending the day with him. He communicated well with us over numerous emails prior to our tour. I highly recommend Fabian.

Great two days with two guides. Laura was our guide the first day. She was indispensable for us on our first visit to BA. We came via air from Mendoza, and she picked us up at the AEP airport and drove us several places. She quickly adapted as she learned our passion for history and that we had some knowledge of Argentine and BA politics. So we spent quite a lot of time tracking down historical monuments, bullet holes in buildings even. She gave us great info on The Missing and told us no questions were off limits. Because there is publicity now on the 30,000 +\- missing now, it was easier to get more information now of course. We stopped at a cute place for empanadas as we asked for some good ones.She was an excellent driver, guide, and very thoughtful of the fact I have mobility issues and needed places to stop and sit!The next day, Griselle was our guide, as Laura had another engagement. She was an entirely different personality, but she was excellent as well. We had a separate driver that day, Carlos, who was one of the kindest men we have ever met. Griselle walked with us in a downpour throughout the Recoletta Cemetery, took us to the Alteo bookstore, and to LaBoca. I did not care much for La Boca, so she took us to see the murals we wanted to see and hustled us off to places we asked to see instead, such as the Evita Museum. She also kindly spent an hour with us navigating the Buquebus office to get ferry tickets for Colonia Del Sacremento where we wanted to go the next day(what a hassle and not a good trip really). Giselle is not as polished as Laura and a little weaker on her history, and her English is not as good, but she is lively and engaging and we loved having the contrast of the two guides. They also communicated ahead of time so we did not have redundancy.Neither pushed us into shops or to buy anything. Hooray!

Fantastic day in Buenos Aires. Booked this trip months ago and Fabian's communications were excellent throughout.Our tour guide, Andres, arrived at our hotel exactly on time and proved to be a very genuine, friendly guy who spoke great English. He made it quite clear that he was there to ma ke our tour a good one and he succeeded!The morning was a mixture of driving and walking in and around parts of the city and Andres took us to a local restaurant for lunch. Fantastic! A meal for 4 adults came to $23 (US) and the food and atmosphere was great.I would highly recommend this tour group as they definitely go out of their way to help you enjoy your stay In BA.

The Very Best!!!. My husband and I travel frequently and we always arrange private tours. The tour arranged through Fabian at Culture Cercana was the best private tour we have ever had. In January we were in Buenos Aires before starting a cruise. We were lucky enough to spend a whole day with Fabian as our guide. In the months leading up to the trip he patiently answered all of our questions and helped us choose places that we might want to visit. On the day of the tour he was flexible and quickly adjusted the itinerary to meet our needs. If you want to shop he will help you find exactly what you are looking for. If you want a nice meal he will select the perfect place for you. It was an amazing day that we will never forget.

Great tour with Fabian!. Loved out tour. Fabian was very knowledgable and we saw everything on our list.
Really enjoyed our time with Fabian!

Choose the Best. After a South American cruise from Rio to Valparaiso, with mostly private tours, we learned that the tour guide makes the difference! Fabiano was the best of the best. He really seemed to continually adjust the itinerary, commentary, stops,etc. based on who we were and what we were interested in. Started the tour in the Palermo section with walk through the Rose Garden. Perfect start after a few days at sea. He took us through each of the neighborhoods (San Telmo, Soho, Recoleta, etc.), giving us an overall sense of the city and the people. And he didn't stick to main streets! I love driving down residential roads which in BA are trees lined and very Paris-like. Also Fabiano did an excellent job of telling and showing us the history of Buenos Aires and its portenos. We stopped at the Recoleta Cemetary. Took us to a great local restaurant for lunch -- wine of course and steak and empanadas. We spent a lot of time walking in La Boca where we got to see some street tango. Also visited Plaza de Mayo and the landmarks there. Even took us to a wine shop so we could buy some to take back on the ship. When you only have one day to see a city like Buenos Aires, it is important that the person doing the showing is exceptional and Fabiano was. He is knowledgeable, warm, charming, and efficient.

a cut above other tours. we just returned from a 14 day cruise around the horn and had several excellent private tours.However, our tour with Fabian was on a whole different level. He is a really kind and interesting guy to converse with. We saw and did everything we had wanted to ( in spite of the difficulties posed by the Dakar race) and many things we had not even known about. He did a great job assessing what we would enjoy and making helpful recommendations.He consistently made the extra effort to make sure we were comfortable and to make our day go as smoothly as possible helping us exchange money, negotiate purchases, dropping us off close to attractions and giving us valuable insights. He answered questions before the tour and made suggestions for the remainder of our time in Buenos Aires. A wonderful experience in every way.

Excellent tour of BA. Our guide Laura spoke excellent English and shared with us not only a great tour of BA, but also the places and stories that she was passionate about. We came away with an understanding of the city, culture and history. Icing on the cake is that Laura looked for ways to accommodate and enhance our experience. Exceptional guide and experience.

Excellent Tour!. We spent 8 hours on Christmas Eve Day with Fabian. What an amazing guide! He did a wonderful job of showing us the city and teaching us quite a bit about the Argentine culture. He took us to some of the 'regular' places that you would expect and want a tour to take you, but he also showed us parts of the city we would never have found on our own. His English is wonderful. He did a great job of explaining why many of the things in Argentina are the way they are, but took a lot of time to answer our questions. He took us to a wonderful place for lunch (and helped us order food that locals would order). All this on Christmas Eve Day, when he could have been eager to finish his shopping (which he needed to do after leaving us at 6:00 pm) and get home to his family for the holiday. We really enjoyed the day with Fabian!

Amazing all-day tour. My girlfriend and I did an 8-hour tour around Buenos Aires with Andres and we were very pleased. In a single day, he took us to see all of the major sites and many off "the beaten path." Especially if you have a limited amount of time to see BA, we highly recommend this comprehensive tour! As a BA native, Andres was very knowledgeable about Argentine history, geography, politics and current events. We really appreciated that he was so flexible and could incorporate a special stop at the River Plate stadium, which is not usually on the Cultura Cercana itinerary. He was friendly and incredibly professional and even arrived at our hotel early to pick us up. He did an amazing job showing us around the city, even under torrential rains. We were more than pleased with Cultura Cercana (the administrator was also very responsive and flexible) and we highly recommend you book your Buenos Aires tour with Andres.

Great way to start our trip. My wife and I planned a trip to Argentina, going through BA, Iguazu and El Calafate. We gave ourselves four days and three nights in BA and we were not sure how to break the days down properly. After receiving a recommendation from one of our friends, we reached out to Culture Cercana to see their availability, etc. We heard back from Fabian right away and we discussed the best way to enjoy our trip. We were a little concerned about doing a tour on our first day in BA since we would be arriving 4:30am after an 8 hour flight. We decided that doing a tour on our first day would be hard but we knew that being driven around would lighten the load. After checking in and sleeping for two and a half hours, we met Fabian at 9:15am (our fault in being late) in our hotel lobby where he came to pick us up. Even though we were both exhausted, the next 8 hours flew by very quickly. Fabian drove us all over the city, told countless stories and took us to all of the major sites of BA. He was very flexible in terms of what we wanted to see, what we did not care about, etc. He took us to a nice cafe for a quick breakfast and a great place to grab choripan for lunch. He also gave some quick ideas and tips of places to go for other food or other places to explore during our time there. I think one of the advantages of taking this tour on our first day is that we got a quick overview of BA and we were able to get an idea of what we could do our next three days and two nights without having to worry if we had seen it all. BA is a big city and there is a lot to see, so this made it much easier. Like everyone else said, Fabian is very nice, funny and knows his way around BA. I drive all the time in NYC and I could not do what he does, driving through the city while telling all of the stories and pointing out all of the spots to people. And when we had a question while we were in BA, we emailed him and he responded and gave some good advice.

Buenos Aires City Tour. Our Buenos Aires City Tour was very entertaining and educational. Laura, our guide, was outstanding. She set up a tour that met all of our criteria and expectations. She was extremely knowledgeable about the history, culture and specific areas of Buenos Aires. While our tour was only five hours in duration, we learned a lot and, as a result, hope to return to Argentina in the future. Our guide was also very personable and made us feel comfortable and "right at home" throughout the tour. We couldn't be happier about this activity and therefore give our highest recommendation to Laura and Cultura Cercana. Bill and Kathy, Austin, TX

Sunday in the park, and everywhere else, with Fabian. Fabian is fun, fab and friendly...not to mention a bright and knowledgeable tour guide. We felt lucky to find him! He is a partner in a small company called Cultura Cercana. You tell them what you are looking for and they customize a tour for you. When I wrote about what sort of lunch I would prefer, Fabian picked it spot on. He is a great storyteller, so good in fact, that I tried hard to write down several of his quotes. He is funny and immediately engaging. If I had my druthers, I would have hired him for the whole three days we were there. He knew that we were staying on, and said that I could call him anytime if I needed recommendations for restaurants or anything else. In addition, the cost was very reasonable.

Like Touring with a friend!. We couldn't have been more pleased with our Buenos Aires tour with Fabian. He's very knowledgable and personable. Along with seeing the best sights and having a great local lunch, we had a lot of laughs! I also recommend Cercana Cultura's tours in Chile and Uruguay. All the guides were knowledgeable, friendly and eager to please. I found their rates very good and plan to use them again in South America. They also recommend the best restaurants! Email Fabian and he'll take great care of you!

Buenos Aires Tour. Subject: Buenos Aires Local ToursLocation: Buenos Aires, Capital Federal District, Argentina, South AmericaTitle: Cultura Cercana TourID#: 244426107I have just returned from a South American cruise. One of the highlights of our trip was a Buenos Aires tour we arranged through Cultura Cercana. Our guide was Laura Ortea Escandon. She was outstanding! She created a wonderful day for us. She far exceeded our expectations and was gift to us. Laura speaks excellent English and the tour was a great value. Laura can be reached at She has my highest recommendation.

Andreas, what a star!. My friend and I have been going to BA for years, but never managed to get round the tourist sites. Andreas took amazing care of us. The car was brand new (I had never been in a new car in Argentina) and impeccable. We did the 4 hours tour and agreed with him which sites we would hit. We did the Plaza de Mayo, La Boca and Recolleta. While in the car we chatted about history and tied together all the bits of information we had into a good understanding of how the country is as it is. The tour was excellent value for money. I would recommend them to anyone.

an insiders view of buenos aires. Fabian gaves us a detailed look at life in BA. He introduced us to the sights, sounds, tastes andViews of BA thru a local's eyes. He answered all our questions and anticipated our needs. The vehicle was very comfortable, the driver, Calos was delightful.It was a fabulous 10 hour tour.A great way to see the city. A very good value.

Best Tour in Buenos Aires!!!!. I visited Buenos Aires with my colleagues this May. Although it was a business trip, we were fortunate to have enough time to take a tour of the city. We couldn't have asked for a better experience from our tour guide, Fabian! He was extremely knowledgeable, funny, engaging and invested in our learning experience. He was right on time when we began that morning and did a great job of keeping us on schedule that day. It was so delightful to learn about the city and see the most exciting sites with a gem of a tour guide at our side! I highly recommend this tour to anyone thinking of seeing the best of Buenos Aires. Thanks, Fabian!

Buenos Aires City Tour. We were 5 adults traveling to BA. We used Cultra Cercana tours and loved It! It was an excellent experience and Mirta as a great guide. The private tour was based on our interest. Mirta was very knowledgable with history and friendly. ,it was like visiting with a friend (and expert guide). We ate lunch at a locals restaurant that was great. We felt like locals not just tourist. We were 5 adults traveling together as a family. But it would have been good for families with children too.

Buenos Aires --a memorable day !. Four of us were fortunate to spend our final day in South America in the capable hands of Laura --a most delightful guide.We had disembarked fromour cruise ship and were promptly met by Laura of Cercana tours. Our goal was to be immersed in Buenos Aires culture, architecture, neighborhoods and history and then catch our evening flight to Philly. In just one day we saw major sights, dined in a fun kosher restaurant, discovered the second loveliest bookstore in the world, and had answers to numerous questions thanks to our knowledgable guide who tailored the tour to our interests.We would highly recommend Laura to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Buenos Aires in a day. Three os us disembarked from our Valparaiso to Buenos Aires at (:00AM and met Laura of Cultura Cercana Tours at the Port terminal. She showed us the city and its neighborhoods, suggested a great local restaurant for a lunch of empanadas and got us to the airport on time. She was a fabulous guide and ambassador for Buenos Aires, very knowledgeable, able to answer our questions and was an enjoyable companion for our day. Laura's English was near perfect as she went to bilingual schools starting in kindergarten. Our most memorable sights were in La Boca, the old port where the Tango started and where the arts are flourishing.Fabian Ali, the coordinator for Cultura Cercana also arranged a similar tour for us in Santiago,de Chile at the beginning of our cruise and the guide there, Leoncio was also tremendous. We even had the pleasure of having Leo's 15 year old son ride with us from Santiago to Valparaiso so we got a real impression of life in that area of Chile.We would recommend Cultura Cercana for arranging driving tours in Argentina, Chile and Uruguay as they know the best in these countries and they are nthe best in Buenos Aires

Very satisfied.... We booked two tours (Buenos Aires city tour and Tigre delta tour). The booking process was easy. Laura, our guide for the city tour, was friendly and knowledgeable. She was especially patient with our 6 year old and her non-stop questions. Andres was our guide for the Tigre tour and he was also nice and we enjoyed our afternoon with him. Laura and Andres made our visit to Buenos Aires very enjoyable. I would recommend Cultura Cercana to my close friends and family!

Best guides in Argentina!. We booked a private tour in BA with Laura after having a friend recommend Cultura Cercana to us. We were not disappointed! Laura picked us up at our hotel and spent the day giving us a perfect introduction to this amazing city and its main neighborhoods. She loves her city and it shows. After our fabulous day with Laura, we then booked a hiking tour with Juan Cruz in Mendoza. He took us on a very challenging hike in the Andes! He was amazing. Careful, knowledgeable and totally prepared. He even brought a bottle of wine and picnic that we had once we reached the top of the mountain.I cannot say enough about this company and the level of professionalism offered by its guides. They are truly dedicated to making your time in Argentina memorable!

Great Day in Buenos Aires. What can I say about the wonderful day I had with Cultura Cercana Private Tours, my guide Grisel meet me at my hotel with a car and driver. Geisel was simply the most knowledgeable guide I have ever been with. She was able to make the day both enjoyable, and interesting. If I ever get back to Buenos Aires these guys are a must.

GREAT private tour of Buenos Aires!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!. My group of 3 booked our tour on short notice and this company was very responsive and accommodating. Laura ended up being our guide and she was FABULOUS - I really can't say enough about her. She picked us up in a spacious vehicle right from our doorstep, it was a rainy day and she had extra umbrellas! Laura was very knowledgeable and friendly. She had a great itinerary planned, but was also flexible when we wanted to grab coffee or when the rain was too heavy to fully explore a few spots. She was game for powering through the weather, but was kind enough to skip things when we didn't want to walk around in it and gave us very helpful tips for when we went back and explored on our own. This tour was a great overview of Buenos Aires and really helped us get a feel for the city. I highly recommend booking through this company and requesting Laura. THANKS!

Excellent service. We arranged our private city tour with them. Laura, our tour guide was excellent. Very pleasant, very fun and very caring. She understood what we were looking for and made our day so fun filled. Spoke very good English. Was very knowledgeable, gave us interesting facts through out. Would strongly recommend them. Fabian did a very good job of coordinating and arranging everything. Very reliable service, always kept us informed. She gave us tips on what to do in the evening, restaurant suggestions etc.

Spectacular tour of Delta Tigre!. While visiting Buenos Aires solo for business in October 2014, I found myself with some free time and looking for an exciting English tour of the area. My search immediately ended after finding Cultura Cercana (they offer various English-guided tours in and around Buenos Aires)! I decided to book a private half-day tour of Delta Tigre. My tour guide was Andrés; however, "tour guide" is an unfair description of him. Andrés was more like a great friend whom I hadn't seen in a long time. He was very friendly, accommodating, and happy to share his knowledge of the area with me. His tour of the Delta was very well organized and I will certainly request to do another tour with him during my next trip to Buenos Aires!

Buenos Aires in a day - Awesome!!. Me and 4 friends had only a day in Buenos Aires and we decided to take up a full day city tour of Buenos Aires with Cultura Cercana Private Tours after reading the excellent reviews here. Got in contact with Fabian to organise a full day tour for us as we wanted to see as much of what Buenos Aires have got to offer but with a limited time. Andres was our english guide and he was really awesome in showing us around Buenos Aires. My friends and I really enjoyed ourselves during the full day tour which was customised to our needs. Its a pity we only had a day in Buenos Aires but Andreas if we ever come around again, we would definately like to see your place in Tigre!

Excellent, very reliable. We booked several day trips with Cultura Cercana for a group of 15 - despite bad weather in Buenos Aires, Fabian and his team went above and beyond to help us, even picking us up in his own car one day when all the taxis were busy in the pouring rain. A wonderful introduction to Argentina - we would definitely work with them again.

Excellent way to see BA. I dealt with Fabian to schedule our tour of BA. We had only one day and while my husband and I had been there before, our traveling friend had not. Fabian punctually arrived at our hotel and spent the entire day with us including a trip to EZE at the end. It rained, sometimes poured, the entire day but Fabian made sure we saw the sites and gave us lots of information about the culture, religion, and politics. He was always smiling and trying to make the most of a miserable day. We had lunch with him at a little place in Recoleta specializing in empanadas which was perfect-El Sanjuanino. If you want a professional private tour, this is the way to go!

The Best City Tour in Buenos Aires - 5 Stars !. We scheduled a group tour with Cultura Cercana several days ago and had the best private tour experience of our lives! Andres was our tour guide and was extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and fun to be with for our 8-hour tour. Taking a Cultura Cercana tour is by far the best way to see the major attractions of Buenos Aires with the benefit of having an Expert in Argentinian history and culture by your side. The convenience of being picked up and dropped off at our hotel, while being driven around in Andres' clean and comfortable SUV made the whole experience very enjoyable and educational. I highly recommend Cultura Cercana and particularly Andres as he is a life-long Buenos Aires resident and expert tour guide. Excellent experience!

A totally unique day!. We had a limited amount of time to spend in Buenos Aires and decided for our first full day we would hire a guide. Andres and Mirta were brilliant and very entertaining and knowledgable. They took us to places off the beaten track as well as the obvious ones. We also learnt so much about the politics, economy and culture of Argentina which can only be gained from an informed local. Nothing was too much trouble and when we return to BA it would great to see the Delta on Andres boat! Would thoroughly recommend and also note Mirta is a tango dance teacher and we were very disappointed that we could not join her on one of her lessons despite her very kind invitation due to circumstances beyond our control.

A good way to get to know Buenos Aires. Our family scheduled a personal tour with Cultura Cercana in July. We received very prompt responses, directly from Fabian - who was helpful with a few other scheduling questions we had prior to our visit. Fabian is an excellent tour guide - very thorough, with lots of details on each part of the city we visited. He answered all of our questions, told us interesting tidbits and side notes about things. All in all it was a great tour! We were even interviewed in front of the Boca Jrs stadium by a Brazilian TV station - this was a couple of days after Brazil lost to Germany and one day after Argentina made it into the finals in the World Cup. So, that was something unique to remember!I will note one minor detail - one that was fine with us, but was not necessarily expected based on the tour description we had. We were told lunch would be on our own, and Fabian was kind enough to give us a few recommendations. We decided to go to the parilla he suggested, since we had not yet had a chance to go to one. Upon arrival, Fabian joined us for lunch - something we all thought was great and were happy to have him. Upon finishing the meal, however, we did end up picking up the full check. I only mention it so readers will can aware that this a possibility and be prepared.We highly recommend this tour company for a personal, informative experience. Well done!

Amazing tour of BA!. Thank you Fabian! We had a fantastic tour of Buenos Aires. Fabian is so knowledgable about everything surrounding BA's culture and history. We saw the Casa Rosada and all the key things we wanted to. We had a lovely lunch and Fabian went over and above for our group. It was me and two friends and my younger brother. We went to La Boca Juniors stadium and Fabian went out of his way to find him the vintage shirt he wanted. Loved every minute and would say this tour is a must for anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Wonderful Day! Highly Recommended. I took a tour with Andres today and it exceeded all of my expectations. I wanted to get an overview of the city so that I would know where to visit for the rest of the week. I'm in Buenos Aires alone, so I was a little intimidated and this tour put my mind at ease. I rarely go on professional tours, but now I wonder if I have been missing out. Sure, I can see all these things on my own, but all my information would be from Wikipedia. I was so impressed with Andres, who is very friendly, professional and personable. At the start of the tour, he asked me what I was interested in and he was able to customize his approach accordingly. I found the information that he shared extremely interesting and entertaining. I especially enjoyed his stories in the Recoleta Cemetery. The lunch was also quite good. Also, if Spanish is not your first language and you choose to take the tour in Spanish, Andres has a very clear accent and is easy to understand. It would have been impossible for me to get so much out of my first day in Buenos Aires without Andres. I am a teacher, so I will say A++++++++++++++++++++++++++!

Great Tour!. One of the best decisions I made was hiring Cultura for a private tour. Fabian is just great. He knows so much. He is full of history and dates and tells you the story as if he had lived it himself. He drove us to La Boca, Recoleta, Palermo Soho, Downtown and he also took us to The pink house. We got lucky because our tour was on a holiday "Flag Day" so traffic was light. He was kind enough to take advantage of that and perhaps do a little more than usual for a 4 hour tour. We finish at the Recoleta Cemetery. That was just wow! He's just a really nice guy! Thanks Fabian! You are great!!! Un abraso from Miami!

A great way to get the pulse of BA. We did two tours with them, the B-side and the Delta Tigre. Both were awesome. BA is not a spot where you can get by with visiting a couple of locations and taking a few pictures. A helping hand is needed to scratch the surface in order to really see the city for what it is and was. Both of these tours accomplished that. The tour guides were very friendly and focused on the tourist needs. At the end you feel like you made new friends with them.

A wonderful experience traveling in Buenos Aires.. We chose to tour Buenos Aires with this company, and our expectations were exceeded. The tours included two days in the city itself with Fabian, the Tigre Island area of the river delta hosted by Andres & Mirta, and a day trip via the Colonia Express Ferry to Colonia, Uruguay. The guides were friendly, knowledgeable and enthusiastic. We got to see the area in a way we could not have done any other way. If you are going to be in BA for a few days, don't miss this opportunity.

Friendly and accommodating tour company. My family and I took a tour of Buenos Aires in April with Fabian, and thought it was a wonderful experience. It was pouring rain when he arrived, so we weren't sure what we'd be able to see in the city. Fabian was very accommodating and took us for a private van tour around Palermo Chico and finally to Recoleta Cemetary when the rain calmed down. Though it was wet walking around the cemetery, it was nice being the only tourists visiting Eva Peron's grave. When the rain stopped completely, we were able to see a good amount of the city. Fabian was very knowledgeable about the history and culture of Buenos Aires. I never felt rushed, and he always presented many options for us to choose from. I would 100% recommend this tour company, and especially Fabian, when visiting Buenos Aires!

Outstanding Guides. We booked 2 tours with Cultura Cercana and could not have had a more positive experience on each occasion. Fabian met us at the airport, on time, with a great smile and an excellent command of English. The next morning, he met us at our hotel for a full day tour of Buenos Aires. Fabian was extremely knowledgeable, professional, courteous, and in general, a delightful guide. We also booked a Tigre Delta tour with Andres, who is also an excellent guide. We had a most enjoyable and informative day with Andres as well. We are experienced travelers with high standards and can honestly say that Fabian and Andres are tops! These gentlemen are outstanding guides and will provide you with an authentic experience.

Outstanding Tour Company. We used Cultura Cercana for several private tours in South America in January and February 2014. Booking our tours was easy and the office staff was very helpful in customizing our tours. We had memorable tours in Puerto Chacabuco, Chile; Ushuaia & Puerto Madryn in Argentina; Montevideo, Uruguay and a 2-day tour in Buenos Aires, The tours were all reasonably priced and they were all excellent. However, our tour guides in Montevideo (Bruno) and Buenos Aires (Fabio) were exceptional. All the guides were knowledgeable, friendly, adaptable and clearly enjoyed showing off their countries. We were picked up promptly in clean, comfortable vans and returned to our ship in plenty of time to make our sailing deadline. Do not hesitate to use this company in South America.

Excellent tours of Tigre Delta and Buenos Aires. We arranged two excellent tours with this small company. The first was a half day tour to the Tigre Delta. We were collected from our hotel by Andres in plenty of time. He and his partner, who has a very good command of English, drove us to the Delta, giving us a lot of local information and stopping on route for a walk around the fruit market. We then spent an hour on Andres’ boat. We were the only guests, so it was like travelling with friends. The boat has a cover, so you don’t need to worry about the weather. We enjoyed going through the narrow waterways that public boats don’t use. I think that we got a much clearer idea of what life is like in the area than we would have gained with a larger tour group. The whole trip lasted four hours. It was very relaxing and informative. We did this on the day we arrived in Buenos Aires; it was the ideal way to start our holiday. We then went on a cruise. On the day the ship docked in Buenos Aires, Fabien collected us from the port and took us on a full day’s tour of the city, which was excellent. Fabien has a very good standard of English and is very keen to ensure that his guests get the most out of their trip and so tailors how much time is spent in each part of the city to their interests. We have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this company.

Fantastic Tours of Punta Del Este, Buenos Aires and Montevideo. Our private tours of these cities with Bruno and Fabian were outstanding! Bruno showed us around the magnificent cities of of PDE and Montevideo and Fabian showed us all around the glamorous city of BA.Both Bruno and Fabian were professional, friendly, courteous and very knowledgable of the cities, they were prompt and very patient with our kiddos who we're trotting along. I cannot commend their service enough, we are very pleased and will definitely recommend both of them and Cultura Cercana.My hubby can't stop talking about the BBQ Bruno took us to in Montevideo, my son is still amazed at Fabian's "magic tricks" and I was so pleased with all the attractions and how they always answered all our questions!We will definitely return and will look them up again, if you are looking for private tours in these areas, look no further Cultura Cercana tours are the people to call!

Incredible experience - highly recommended!. We did the BA + Tigre delta tour with Andres in early April. We started off in BA and visited several amazing places including the Recoleta cemetery, La Boca, and a very poignant memorial by the river to the "disappeared". Later in the afternoon we drove up to the Tigre delta where we boarded Andres' boat. We then spent an hour or so exploring life in the islands. Apart from all the delta residences we also saw school boats, police boats, even a store boat! Some friends joined us in BA a few days later and on my recommendation, we all did the BA city tour with Fabien. Overall, we were thoroughly impressed with Andres' and Fabien's knowledge and enthusiasm. These tours are like spending a day with a friend showing you the sights of his home town.Cultura Cercana is a wonderful way to see BA and environs at a pace that suits your needs. The company is government licensed (not all companies are) and the vehicles are new, replaced every few years. Pick up and drop off is at the door step of wherever you are staying, so the convenience is unbeatable. These tours are very highly recommended!

All Day Tour of Buenos Aires. Great tour - highly recommended!! I booked 4 tours with Cultura Cercana on our recent cruise. This review is specifically about our all-day tour in BA.Our guide was Alberto and he did a fantastic job showing us the city. He had a wealth of knowledge about the city, the culture, the politics and the history of BA and Argentina in general. His English was excellent and he had a great personality and sense of humor. I had offered this tour up on Cruise Critic and one other person joined us. The van was spacious for the 3 of us (plus driver and guide). Our started with a visit to the May Park, the Pink House and the Cathedral. From there we went to La Boca and walked on El Caminito. That was followed by lunch in San Telmo at La Brigada (pay as you go) and toured an old market. From there we drove through Palermo Soho and Palermo Hollywood and stopped for photos at the Obelisk and the Opera House.the Obelisk. Next stop was Recoletto Cemetery and then Puerto Medero. We returned to the ship at 1630, just as promised.The tour was great, and Alberto allowed us to adjust the sites and the pace so that it stayed comfortable for all of us. It was a great day, and we certainly highly recommend this tour in particular, and Cultura Cercana in general.

Fantastic cruise tours!. We went on four cruise tours with this company and would thoroughly recommend them. From our initial correspondence with Fabien and Bruno right through until the end of the tours we were really happy with their recommendations and response to all our queries. We visited the Seno Otway Penguin Colony in Punta Arenas Chile, had a wonderful day with Andrea in Ushuaia visiting the National Park, visited the city of Buenos Aires with Fabien and had a wonderful day in Montevideo with Emiliano. Friendly and knowledgeable guides, great service and really interesting places to visit with this terrific tour company.

Amazing guide and tour of the delta!. At short notice we arranged a tour of the delta. Very friendly and efficient booking process via email, and even recommended changing the start time to make the best of the weather. Our guide Andres was spot on time and immediately engaged us with his cheerful, friendly, knowledgeable style. The day was tailored around our preferences but Andres really made great recommendations. It was a very "untouristy" tour of the beautiful delta. Many thanks to Andres for a great day!

Very relaxed, very enjoyable. Thanks to Fabian for making our tour of BA so enjoyable.He set a comfortable pace to suit our group and chose a great steak restaurant for a relaxed lunch.His knowledge and enthusiasm for his city made for a very memorable day.

Tour in BA. We originally tried to book a tour with bonaventure as they were first on the tripadvisor list, however they were fully booked and recommended cultura. We didn't end up booking anything before we left, which we probably should have done but it worked out perfectly for us. Fabian worked his magic and was able to get us a great guide.We did a city tour yesterday with Alberto. He is a very intelligent, knowledgeable and curtious young man. He arrived on time with a driver and greeted us. We couldn't believe the wealth of information he had to offer. His strongest area of expertise is politics as he graduated from university in international studies. So if this is an interest for you I would definitely recommend him. His English was great! And he can speak Japanese fluently, and some Korean, Mandarin and French. During the tour he also provided a place to change your money at a good rate. He was able to bargain for you when purchasing items off the street. He brought us to a nice steak house for lunch called Happenings by the river (not puerto madero location) and provided us with a recommendation for a great seafood and pasta restaurant called Sottevece in Puerto Madero for dinner. And at the end of the tour he said we could email him if we wanted any other recommendations or if we had any questions.We were lucky to have done the tour on a Sunday as traffic is a lot lighter. He said we probably wouldn't have been able to see g much as we did if it was during the week as you spend a lot of time in traffic moving from one place to another. If you enjoy markets, we would recommend to do the tour on the weekend as the markets are only on the weekend. However if you like to spend a lot of time checking those sorts of things out I would go back, especially if you want to get more in on the tour or do the tour on a Saturday so you can leisurely check out the markets on Sunday.We were fortunate enough to have nobody around when we went to Evita's grave. People tend to not be able to find it as her family name is in her maiden name. Alberto said its not that common to have nobody there. It was great because throughout the whole tour I found that we would arrive just before areas got super busy and as we were leaving different locations the crowds would start rolling in.All in all we were very happy with Alberto and Cultura and would highly recommend them to our friends and family.

Amazing tour .. Great knowledge .. Personal . We took the delta tour with Andres. He is great .. Amazing energy and knowledge. My son only spoke English but he would do English / Spanish because I preferred Spanish. The background knowledge he had and provided have us great insight about Argentina and it's leaders. Definitely worth it!

Great tour of BA. I set up a 1/2 day tour with Cultura Cercana. Favian was our guide.. He arrived promptly and toured around the different areas of BA and answered all of our questions about the culture and history. I would highly recommend.

Great Tour in Buenos Aires. We had a 1-day tour with Laura from Cultura Cercana and it was absolutely great! She knows the city like the back of the hand. She gave us many interesting and astonishing backround information and was simply able to answer all our questions. We only can recommend to take a guided tour with Cultura Cercana, much better than wandering though the city by yourself.Thanks to our guide Laura!!

Awesome personal tour. Andreas was fantastic! Picked us up at our apartment and spent four hours with us- went to the Recoleta and La Boca area. Only had a half day with him but he went through a lot of the history and we loved the personalized tour. Definitely a great way to see the city. Would love to do delta tour if I ever come back

Very nice trip. We used Cultura Cercana for an evening milonga in Buenos Aires and a city tour the next day before departing on a cruise. Both guides were excellent and we were able to customize the tours to meet our specific needs. Guides were professional and were waiting for us when scheduled. At the milonga we saw the locals dancing the tango and our guide explained the dance to us. This is not a typical tango show, but since we had done those on previous trips we wanted a more authentic experience. The city tour covered all the highlights and we did not feel rushed. Our guide recommended a great local place for lunch where we enjoyed some delicious empanadas and lots of local color. There were four of us and the vehicle for the city tour was quite comfortable. This company is very reliable and provides better, more personalized service than the typical ship shore excursions. We'll use them again if we return to Buenos Aires.

Perfect Tour. Fabian picked us up at the BA Port after a 14 night cruise on the Celebrity Infinity. The instructions on where to meet were impeccable and Fabian arrive promptly at the designated area and time and whisked our luggage to the waiting van. There were 4 of us in total and the van accommodated all of us and our luggage comfortably. We booked the entire day with Fabian as our flight was departing BA that evening at 9:45P and this was truly the best way to spend our last day of vacation. At all times, our luggage was secure and we got to experience a side of BA from a local’s perspective, which is truly the best way to experience a city. At the start of the tour, Fabian had asked us what we have seen thus far and what we wanted to do during the day. Being that we had already seen a few sights, we asked Fabian to provide his point of view of the city. Fabian brought us around to all the major sights while providing a comprehensive overview of BA as well as history. We even stopped to have a wonderful lunch at La Brigada. The day spent with Fabian was truly a highlight of our trip to South America and have already recommended this tour to friends!

Best Tour Company Ever!. My wife and I recently returned from a trip to South America where we took a Celebrity cruise from Santiago to Buenos Aires. We had pre-arranged several private tours with Cultura Cercana. Unfortunately our trip was marred by several mishaps including friends cancelling the trip at the last minute, several missed and changed ports, etc. Silvia, at Cultura Cercana, was EXTREMLEY accommodating, flexible, and very easy to deal with thru several crises. The highlight of our trip was a day long tour of Buenos Aires. Our guide, Antonella, was a GEM! She was everything a tour guide should be, (but usually isn't). Very intelligent, knowledgeable, candid, personable, funny, flexible and seemed to really enjoy what she was doing. By the end of the tour we all wanted to adopt her. Highly reccommended!

Fantastic tour of Buenos Aires with Laura. We booked a private tour with Cultura Cercana before we arrived to join a South American cruise on Celebrity Infinity. Laura picked the four of us (2 couples) up in her very comfortable people carrier from the Buenos Aires (BA) cruise terminal at 9 a.m. and we spent the next 7 hours being shown the delights of the city. Reading her previous excellent reviews on Tripadvisor I can only confirm that all the plaudits she has received are fully justified. With her perfect English she has a natural charm and being a "local" she provided great insights in the real history, culture and way of life in BA. We covered nearly all districts within the city and there are far too many highlights to list here. Laura was patient, courteous and nothing was too much trouble. It was obvious she proud of BA and her infectious enthusiasm rubbed off on us. She allowed us plenty of time to take photos and lead us on short walking tours where we saw some of the delightful quirky side of BA. She also provided us with some great local stories to give us an insight into the local way of life in BA. We lunched on some great local "empanadas" meeting some of the locals and we even had time to visit local craft shops and cafes. We had such a great day with lots of excellent memories that we were sad to leave BA. If you ever go to Buenos Aires make sure you book Laura to show you around.

Fantastic Mini Tour During Airport Transfer. We were flying from El Calafate to Santiago via Buenos Aires and instead of taking a taxi from the local airport to the international airport, we asked Cultura Cercana if they could provide a mini 2-3 hour tour of Buenos Aires and then transfer us to the airport. They suggested that a whole day or at least a half day tour is advisable but they were willing to accommodate our request at a very good price.As soon as we arrived at AEP (local airport), Laura was there to greet us and she asked what we would like to see since it was a customizable tour. I said any place except La Recoleta since that would take up too much of our short time. Laura took us by car to several places for a "drive-by" visit and we saw Casa Rosada where I was able to get out of the car to take some pictures. We drove a good part of 9 de Julio which is the widest road in the world where we saw Theatro Colon and the Obelisk. My kids said they were hungry and Laura suggested we stop in La Boca where we had a very nice walk in the "touristy" section and saw a lot of outdoor cafes with live tango dancing. We had a quick bite to eat (very tasty empanadas) and took some pictures and left for the international airport.Laura was very professional, full of knowledge and history of Buenos Aires and very excited to show the places. She speaks perfect english and is a fantastic tour guide. We discussed many interesting topics from current Argentinian politics to the world cup in Brazil. If and when we ever return to Buenos Aires, we will surely request Laura to guide us again......this time for more than 2-3 hours.

Full day private BA tour A++. We were looking for a private tour of Buenos Aires that would allow us to see/do more than just the quickie tourist stuff. It was easy to book with Silvia by e-mail and we were promptly provided with complete info. Laura picked us up in a private car at our hotel. She was a delight and spoke excellent English. We spent much of the morning touring Teatro Colon and surrounding area. It was great to have the car it was over 100 degrees this day plus one of our party wasn't feeling well. She found places for us to visit that were only a short walk or she would drop us off and pick us up. We spent almost the entire afternoon in Recoleta Cemetery. Her in depth knowledge of the cemetery was amazing. Could have spent the entire day there listening to her stories about those buried there. She did all we asked and more. Highly recommend this well run company and Laura as a guide. First class A++ all the way!

Amazing tours and people!. Took 4 tours with Cultura Cercana. All outstanding. BA City Day tour with Fabian, great guy, knows everything about the city esp places that you could never learn or go on your own. Delta Tigre with Marta and Andreas. When you go on his personal boat, to his own house/farm where he lives and grew up, what more can you ask for? Real culture and country. His partner Marta is terrific and a Tango Instructor which is why we also did the Feeling Tango tour. Don't go to a commercial Tango show, see the real thing with real people in a real club. A whole other world and not to be missed. Did the Colonia Uraguay tour with Bruno. Fantastic, so easy to see another country while in BA. He's a resident of Uraguay, full of facts and fun. Like touring with old friends, can't imagine doing it any other way. So worth the money it's crazy to not use them! Highly recommended, makes the trip hassle free and a lifetime memory.

great tour of Buenos Aires with Fabian. I booked the tour with Cultura Cercana through Silvia by email, she was able to find us a guide less than a week before our needed date. We had a flawless tour with Fabian. We were very glad that he gave up his day off (Dec 23) to take us on tour. He has excellent English (studied and worked in the USA), and is very knowledgeable. He worked hard with his driver in an comfortable air conditioned minibus to give our family group (ten persons, ages 16-85) a great experience despite the raging hot weather (37 Celsius= 99 F). He paced the tour to visit the busiest sites early on so that we could avoid the crowds. Fabian was extremely attentive to my 85 year old parents, to be sure that they were not physically taxed. He was able to balance that with making the tour engaging and interesting. For lunch he took us to a restaurant famous for empanadas, very tasty. I highly recommend this company based on our experienc with Fabian and his driver.

Buenos Aires 8 hr. Tour. Just returned from a wonderful and informative tour with Fabian. It was a very hot and humid day, so appreciated the comfortable air conditioned car. We had seen a few sights on our own the day before, so he made sure we saw everything else on our list including the Thurs. 3:30 pm walk of the Mothers with missing children in the mall near the pink palace. Had a lovely lunch of pizza in La Boca. Would highly recommend this as the price is not expensive and the local knowledge we gained has made us more aware of the country and some of the struggles it has had over the years.

Perfect Day Tour!!. We chose Cultura Cercana for a day tour of Buenos Aires at the end of our South American cruise & were extremely satisfied. They picked us up at the ship, and were there EARLY, something not common on this trip! Our guides, Andres & Milta, had a car big enough to handle our luggage, so we did not need to waste time getting a day room somewhere. They took us all over the city, including a stop at a local restaurant for amazing empanadas. At the end of the day they dropped us at the airport in plenty of time for our evening flight home. The people who had stayed with the ship group arrived barely in time due to bad traffic that Andres had anticipated. Having two guides was wonderful...it allowed us to hop out at different sites while Andres drove to find parking or simply waited for us. None of this would have been possible in a big group. We felt they made the very best use of our time in Buenos Aires and that we learned a lot about their history & culture as well as making two new friends! Working with the internet was great and we were very clear about pick-up site & times. Just a great experience....thank you!!

Wonderful private guides in Buenos Aires & Colonia, Uruguay. We used this guide service for our days in Buenos Aires & Colonia, Uruguay. Our guide in Buenos Aires was Fabian & our guide in Colonia was Bruno. Both were fun to be with, knowledgeable about their cities & helped us with our plans. Fabian & Silvia & Luciano helped us with our questions and plans & always returned emails very promptly.Fabian picked us up at the airport when we arrived in Buenos Aires & took us to our hotel. We did a half day tour that day & a full day tour the next day - we felt like we saw all the sights & had delicious lunch at La Brigada! Our third day was the tour to Colonia, Uruguay with Bruno was was fantastic. Fabian picked us up for the transfer to the ferry & was waiting for us when we returned to Buenos Aires. We did the golf cart tour of Colonia with Bruno which was perfect. Colonia is so different from Buenos Aires & very worthwhile to visit. When we left Argentina, Fabian even picked us up at the domestic airport & drove us to the international airport for our flight home.One night we did the Tango lesson & then went to 2 milongas to observe the culture. This was a very interesting evening for us - we don't have anything like this in the US. Our guides were Andreas and Mirta & both were wonderful & great fun - also need to mention that they are amazing dancers and teachers!The most challenging part of this trip was the Argentine peso issue. However, Fabian & Luciano helped us as best as they could but this was still confusing to us. We felt very taken care of during our time in Buenos Aires & very much appreciate Fabian, Bruno, Silvia, Luciano, Andreas and Mirta. Great team of professional guides!! Highly recommend Cultura Cercana!! Thank you!!

Safe-knowledgable tour guides. Just back from an amazing South American cruise which took place during the Xmas holidays. We decided to opt for private tours during our cruise, as this allowed us to custom design our places of interest. Searching Tripadvisor for competent, safe, reliable and knowledgable companies, we found Cultura Cercana. Contacting them was easy, their reply was prompt and from the beginning communication was never an issue. Silvia and her group, customed designed our points of interest, provided us with exact locations for meeting up with our tour guide(s), provided safe and comfortable vehicles for our family of 4 and mostly, insured that our safety was their priority. In all locations, Buenos Aires and Punta del Este, our tour guides were knowledgable, friendly, experienced and provided us with as much cultural experience/touring that one could take in during a cruise stop over. In our opinion, Cultura Cercana was fantastic in providing us with a wonderful experience in these locations, and we want to personally thank our tour guides: Antonella, Fabian (Buenos Aires), and Bruno (Punta del Este) for contributing to our fantastic-educational visit to their beautiful countries. Travelling to South American was a trip of a lifetime and for those who are considering a trip there, you will be extremely satisfied with the services provided by Cultura Cercana Private Tours.

Very friendly guides at Buenos Aires. My family and I had two days of Buenos Aires city tour (normal and side B) and had the pleasure to be guided by Fabian and Alberto.Fabian, a very experienced guide from Cultura, is very accomodating to our requests, we spent quite some time to hunt for a mobile SIM card provider store that can give nano-SIM for iPhone 5 but he was upbeat and positive all the way (I was already about to give up). He brought us to La Brigada for a nice Argentinian BBQ (Asado) and took us to a few very nice wine shops (we planned to buy some to bring back). Fabian's english is good, he can also speak Portuguese.Alberto, although younger, already commands great knowledge about his beloved city. His English is very good, perhaps better than Fabian. He also spoke Japanese and understand a little Chinese as well. He goes out and beyond a regular tour guide's duty when he actually involves his family (brother and father) in search for the best wines (not just the most expensive) of Argentina for us to buy. I agree with the other reviewer that raves about Alberto. He was the best guide we ever had in the few weeks we travel all around latin america.Kudos to Silvia and the Cultura Cercana team for the easy communication and prompt responses.

Alberto Sergo Anich - Excellent guide in Buenos Aires. The last leg of our cruise ended in Buenos Aires and we have arranged for a private tour with Cultura Cercana, like what we have arranged similar private tour in Montevideo and Punta del este. At BA, we were assigned Alberto - a young, energetic, pleasant and knowledgeable guide, someone who make us feel like friends. During the 8-hour tour of the city, we managed to visit all the important sights - downtown with the Plaza de Mayo, Casa Rosada, Cabildo, Metroplitan Cathedral, Recoleta cemetary, Puerto Madero, La Boca, San Telmo, Palermo and many more. When our tour ended and we were back to the ship, we realized that we left a parcel in the van. We contacted Alberto and he promised to send it to our hotel the next day. Indeed, he came back to the hotel after his work to return to us. For those who are travelling in a group and visiting Punta del Este, Montevideo and Buenos Aires, I would highly recommend to use Cultura Cercana for your tour arrangement. From my experience, I find them to be reliable and professional and I can rest assured that all have been well taken care of before the start of my vacation. Thanks to Silvia Setti from the Booking Support and Customer Service for all the assistance and advice provided in making our tour a very memorable one.

overview of the city. We truly think the tour with car and driver is an excellent way to get a first look at the city and have the different neighborhoods revealed to us. We are here for 3 days and am glad to have booked Antonella and drive Luis to show us their city. It was a pleasant experience as both are courteous and attentive. The car is small so to maneuver around and be able to find parking close to the sights. We went from 1:00pm to 6:00pm and had lunch at a famous local restaurant...frequented by famous people... El Obrero in Republica de La Boca.Antonella was very good with her explanation and Luis was very prompt with the pick ups.

Great tours of Montevideo and Buenos Aires. On a recent cruise we stopped in both Montevideo and Buenos Aires and wanted a solid overview of each city as we were only visiting for a short while. We were lucky enough to find a tour company that was able to arrange tours in both cities. Emiliano (Montevideo) and Antonella (BA) were wonderful hosts who each imparted their personal touch on our tours with the right balance of culture, history and their own pride and experiences from their home towns. We enjoyed wonderful local lunches and were able to have a very comprehensive tour of each city thanks to the drivers whose cars were clean and comfortable.

informative guided tour. Finished a cruise early morning in Buenos Aires and booked a city tour since our departure flight wasn't until late afternoon. Laura picked us up at the cruise ship terminal and was flexible in showing city highlights of interest to us including La Recoleta Cemetery, the Floralis Genérica and La Boca. Got to sample local cuisine including alfajores and empanadas. Laura was professional, knowledgeable and easy-going. We felt very comfortable around her, almost like an old friend, not formal at all.

Fantastic tour given by a knowledgeable interesting guide. Fabian was our guideWonderful helpful and full of information.We appreciated that he listened to our requests and was able to be spontaneous.Thorough knowledge of literature, politics, architecture and art.

Fantastic tour with Fabian-highly recommend. Fabian's tour with our family group of 9 was flawless.Dealing with him online was great, tailored to our interests. Fabian and his driver picked us up at our hotel, and were there a bit early.He was an engaging tour guide, great with English and took us to areas of interest to our group- he answered all our questions and was willing to go show us the crypts (for the Peron family) in the downpour even though he had forgotten his umbrella and coat- we're from Vancouver so we weren't bothered!

Excellent tour guides. Love, love, love this tour company. My fiancé and I did the Buenos Aires full-day city tour with Fabian and the Colonia golf cart tour the next day with Bruno. Both guides were a pleasure to work with…flexible, well-informed, professional. It felt like we were going out for a day with a friend, rather than on a formal tour. The vehicles used were comfortable and well-maintained. They also were not plastered with company logos, so we could travel "incognito" and not be recognized as tourists. Definitely worth the money.

This tour is a must do. Just had the most wonderful day with Fabian and Antonella .We were picked on time at our hotel and took the full day tour option. We given a great overview of the city, Fabian and Antonella are both very knowledgable and passionate about BA .We feel we now have a good understanding of the history and culture of this exciting city. This tour is ideal if you have limited time in BA ,or here for a longer stay and want to get your bearings around the city .Fabian and Antonella had the perfect mix of professional / friendly service and by the end of the day we felt they were good friends .Would we do this again ? ....you bet ! A great day out thanks Fabian and Antonella
Great overview of Buenos Aires!. Laura gave me a wonderful tour of the city and its many different neighborhoods. Highly recommended!

A great first experience. My wife and I went to Buenos Aires in 2011. It was our first visit to a country I wanted to visit since I can remember. We contacted Luciano weeks before our trip. He was very kind an willing to answer any of our questions. He picked us up at our hotel at 9:00 a.m. We went to the Barolo Building, the Justice Palace (my wife and I are lawyers), the "Casa Rosada" (Presidential Palace), Buenos Aires Cathedral, Plaza de Mayo, Recoleta Cemetery, and La Boca. We were amazed on how much he knew about Argentina's history, economy, politics, social movements, etc. He took us to lunch to a great place called "Los Platitos" (The small plates), there was nothing small about those plates. It was delicious. He even recommended a few places for us to visit and dine. We loved the tour, mostly because he treated us as we were his longtime friends.They can personalize the tour their tour according to your interests. We are anxious to go back and take de Mendoza Wine Region Tour.We can recommend Cultura Cercana without any regrets.

Worth Every Penny. If you have a short or long stay in B.A., this tour is absolutely worth your time to check out. I recommend you do this on Day 1 to get a feel for the city. The guides can give recommendations on where to eat, more things to see, cultural tips, places not go, and an unbelievable history tour .If you go, ask for Laura - she is phenomena!.

No doubt, one of the best guides for a city ever. We had a delightful, informative and very engaged day with Fabian. He knows everything, has excellent command of English (lived a few years in Miami) and has a very holistic view of the world. As a former manager he knows how to make clients happy. Warmly recommended!

Excelente!!!. Just had cultura cerana for airport transfers and tours in Buenos Aires and Colonia. What a great group of people.
