Fabian worked with us to schedule everything online before we left on our trip. He met us promptly at the airport and drove us to our hotel with some sight seeing along the way. He suggested sites to visit and gave us wonderful restaurant suggestions. He picked us up the next morning at 9 and gave us a intriguing and detailed tour of Buenos Aires. It was a terrific day. He dropped us off at our hotel and was back the next morning to whisk us to the ferry terminal for our Colonia, Uruguay tour. The tour there with Bruno was excellent as well. Bruno met us at the ferry terminal and drove to old town for a lesson in the rich history of Colonia. Very fascinating. Bruno is very professional and fun to tour with. He delivered us to the ferry terminal and made sure we made it to immigration and bid us farewell. We returned to B.A. where Fabian was waiting to take us to our hotel. All went off without a hitch. This is a great company to trust your tours and transfers with. We felt safe and we also made some new friends. Thank you Fabian and Bruno. You are the best.

Amazing.. My wife and I had the most amazing time in Buenos Aires. Our guide Fabian was great he is extremely knowledgeable, professional and corteous. He went beyond his role of a guide to provide an excellent service. He is a native Argentinian from Quilmes, BA. Although he is fully fluent in English and Portuguese we were looking for a guide that was native and able to give us a tour in Spanish. Thanks Fabian.We also had Bruno in Colonia, Uruguay. He was also great and made our trip to Uruguay an unforgettable experience. Thanks Bruno.

Incredible Time. We spent four days in Buenas Aires and had a wonderful time. This was our second trip to the city and it was much more enjoyable thanks to Laura our guide. She met us at the airport with a huge smile and a bubbly personality that stayed with her the entire trip. Her knowledge of the history and current events made our tours all the more fascinating. She came up with ideas for places to that we hadn't originally requested that were a real treat. Thanks to Laura for making us feel special!

The best you can get!. I had two guides from this Company-Laura in Buenos Aires and Bruno in Uruguay .I will keep this brief;If you want to spend time with really decent knowledgeable and honest people then go with this Company.Thet don't just show you sights, they are genuinely interested in ensuring you see all side of their country .I felt like I was being taken around by friends rather than guides.I would be very happy to have these two people as friends and if I ever make my way down their way again I certainly would try to re contact them.Laura- keep dancing ....I am sure one day your husband will join you!Thank you to all concerned for organising a great trip and being so professional in the way you conduct yourselves.Dr Paul Donaldson

Beautiful Day in Buenos Aires. Having hiked 10 days in Patagonia, my girlfriend and I were looking forward to some R&R taking in the sites of Buenos Aires. Cultura Cercana tour of sites, neighborhoods and restaurants of Buenos Aires was excellent. Our guide Laura met us at the requested time [even w/ last minute change since our inbound flight was cancelled]. Seeing Buenos Aires with Laura from Cultura Cercana, gave us a great feel for local flare, lifestyle, customs and history of the region. Laura was very knowledgeable and personable - highly recommend it.

Great Guide. Took a full day tour of BA with Fabiano. He was very knowledgable about the culture,history and sights. Took us to major sights and neighborhoods, as well as a local restaurant that we really enjoyed. He was right on time picking us up and dropping off. An ideal way to get introduced to the city. Highly recommended!

One company, many cities. Wow, this company has fabulous guides in Buenos Aires, montevido and Punta del Este. On the first night of our cruise, we were picked up by a tango expert and taken to a Milonga, a place where locals dance. We were educated about the ins and outs of the people who were there to dance the Tango and how they choose a partner for each dance.The next morning,Laura was our wonderful guide in Buenos Aires. Her knowledge of the city was superb. We loved going to the cemetery and listening to the fascinating stories of the families buried there. Shalako was our guide in Montevideo. He was an enthusiastic guide who loves soccer. Our lunch at Old Man and the Sea was delicious. Bruno escorted us around Punta del Este. We loved every minute of our tour and lunch at Caracoles. Pleas enjoy this company as much as we did, one stop shopping! One phone call, 4 tours.

Last minute gem!. We found Cultura Cercana on Trip Advisor and booked Laura as a guide for a 4-hour trip that same day. What a gem! She was so much fun and very informative. It felt like we had a friend showing us around town. She navigated the traffic, provided excellent history of the city, political insights and seemed as excited as we were to see the sights. Loved the tour and the opportunity to spend time with such a lovely person.

Fabulous!. We found Cultura Cercana on Trip Advisor and booked it for our stay in Buenos Aires. Luciano was our driver/guide. He was knowledgeable, kind and considerate. He provided an extremely clean and safe car. The taxi drivers are crazy scary in B.A. but we felt very safe with Luciano. He also set up a tango lesson one evening for us followed by a trek out to a local milonga club. It was an amazing experience! I would highly recommend this service.

Great People; great tours. We learned of this company through Trip Advisor and found the reviews spot on - this is a great company. We booked 2 tours with them. The first was a tour of the Tigre delta. We took a boat ride with Andres to his home, a lttle ranch on the river. He and Mirta provided information throughout the day and were most generous with this. Andres cooked a fine lunch for us and he and Mirta gave us a tango lesson. These are genuinely nice people that I would like to call friends. We had a wonderful and relaxing day on the river and got a sense as to how Portenos spend their leisure time. We also did a full day tour of Buenos Airtes with Laura. She is incredibly knowledgeable of the city and an excellent ambassador. She showed us the highlights of the various districts and was an excellent guide and another nice person. We saw more in one day with her than we would have seen in a week by ourselves. This is a reliable and honest company and I would recommend them to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Great full-day tour of BA - definitely a highlight of our trip!. Thanks, Fabian, for a wonderful day in BA yesterday. I highly recommend this tour to others coming to BA without a lot of experience in the city yet. He brought us all around the city and we had a very nice lunch at Café Margot in Barrio de Boedo. Fabian knows the history and politics of the city and is very eager to share his knowledge with others. The highlight for me was a trip to the Boca neighborhood - I probably took 300 pics of this colorful area. My husband's highlight was the Recoleta cemetery. I was also very interested in the stories he told about Eva Peron's legacy and the Mothers of Playo Mayo. If you are looking to change your USD for Pesos and get an exchange rate better than the ATM (5:1), Fabian recommended a safe place in a mall in Boca to change our dollars to peso and we got an 8:1 exchange rate. Fabulous! Thanks again Fabian!

Marvelous tours of Buenos Aires and Montevideo!. My brother and I recently spent a full day with Fabián Ali in Buenos Aires. Fabián showed us all around the city, pointing out unusual locations. He also discussed with us fascinating information on life as a Porteño, Argentine politics and Rioplatense (the brand of Spanish spoken in BA). We ate at a nice cafe (Café Margot in Barrio de Boedo) frequented primarily by locals, and ate sandwiches "de pavita en escabeche" (tasty marinated turkey on your choice of several different breads). We were very impressed with Fabián ...he was friendly, patient and full of information.A few days later we spent several hours with Shalako in Montevideo. He, too, was very friendly, informative and more than willing to answer our many questions about life, politics, and history in Uruguay. We had a great meal in the Mercado del Puerto, browsed some neat used bookstores on Tristán Narvaja street, visited Librería Puro Verso, a book shop in an elegant renovated pharmacy, saw the Centennial Futbol (Soccer) Stadium, and heard a lot about Peñarol...his favorite team.Overall, we were very pleased with Cultura Cercana, Fabián and Shalako. We highly recommend booking a personalized tour with them. It's well worth it.

Wonderful full day tour!. My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful full day tour with Laura the day after arriving in Buenos Aires. Laura introduced us to the city, pointing out many of the highlights. She was able to help us make decisions about which places we would want to return to and spend more time at on our own. In addition, she took us to see things that we would not have gotten to on our own. She even helped us to find a street where many of the houses were decorated with mosaics that my husband had read about, but that Laura herself was not familiar with. It was great to have such a knowledgeable guide who was willing to adapt the tour to our interests. We highly recommend Cultura Cercana and especially our guide, Laura!

Magic. My husband and I had, literally, a magical experience on our 8 hour city tour with Fabian Ali. Fabian took us to the main attractions and areas throughout the city while providing numerous political and historical facts. Fabian was very friendly and the tour itinerary was flexible depending on what we felt like doing. One of the highlights of the tour was enjoying Fabian's magic tricks in a cafe in San Telmo. A very fun day!

So glad we chose Cultura. We had never used a private tour company before, but felt that with just 5 days in Buenos Aires combined with our inability to speak Spanish - that we'd learn and see more of what we wanted to see with a private guide. After reading the reviews on TA and looking at companies web-sites we chose Cultura and so glad we did. We arranged for pick-up from the airport, a full day tour of Buenos Aires, an evening tango show, transfers to our ship, as well as private tours in Montevideo and Punta Del Este in Uruguay. I found working with just one company in multiple countries is so much easier. And from the moment we arrived at the airport, we knew we were in good hands. While many companies simply have drivers congregate in the entry hall, all holding signs and you spend time looking for yours, Cultura instead arranges to meet at one of the several private booths just outside the baggage claims area, It's a small but appreciated touch after a long flight. Our guide in Buenos Aires was Laara, she was personable,very knowlegeable and was easy to see that she loves what she does. She had an innate sense of what we were looking for and was able to manage time available so we could see key sights plus a few special interests. We love architecture and she made sure we were able to see some incredible buildings and homes. She also shared both keen and funny insights on life in Beunos Aires. Our tour was both by van and walking, we spent time in Boca, Recoleta, touring the cememtary, Puerto Madryn, San Telmo, an amazing bookstore that used to be a theatre, as well as Cafe Tortoni. The day of our tour was a Thursday and were also lucky enough to see the May mothers - who have been protesting every week since the 70', it's a fasacinating story. She chose a great local place for lunch that we never would have found on our own, the day just flew by and we really felt like we got to know and understand more of the people, culture and history of BA... After experiencing the Cultura service, they have now set the standard (for me) in what to expect from a private guide... I would defintely recommend and use their services again.

Excellent and Comfortable Tour of Buenos Aires. We booked a tour with Cultura Cercana after doing a little research and were very satisfied with the experience. Our guide, Laura, was great, from her knowledge of Buenos Aires itself to her expanded knowledge about Argentina as a whole. She was very personable and her English was fantastic. She made sure to ask us what we were interested in seeing and then tailored the tour to our interests. She even helped us arrange to go see a soccer match, but unfortunately the company that we used for the soccer match (Conexionbaires.com) (which Laura readily admitted she had not used before) was absolutely horrible and I would strongly recommend not doing anything with Conexionbaires.com (they have a stand in La Boca). But back to Cultura Cercana - they are a small but wonderful tour company and a tour with them on one of your first days in Buenos Aires is definitely worth it (if not just to help you plan out the rest of your days).

Day Tour of Buenos Aires. In January 2013 we were scheduled to fly from Arizona to Buenos Aires for a Princess cruise around the Cape. We flew in a day early and wanted to see some of Buenos Aires the day we landed. Because of the very positive reviews on TripAdvisor, we booked a day tour with Cultura Cercana who agreed to pick us up at the airport, tour the city, and drop us off in the evening at our overnight hotel. In a single word, our experience with this company was Excellent ! All preliminary tour set up was handled via email and PayPal with Cultura Cercana. Everything was explained and all questions were answered. As for the tour, our guide Laura was waiting for us at the airport, even though it took over 90 minutes to clear customs and immigration. Once she had us in her car we started out on a long day of sightseeing. We had no particular plans, so we asked Laura to show us whatever she felt was important to see in the city and she came up with many, many fascinating places to go. Along the way, she constantly reacted to our likes and interests, even helping us with our Spanish language pronunciation ! As long time football (soccer) fans, we even had some common ground to discuss with someone from this football mad country. Especially memorable was our tour of the La Recoleta cemetery, something I would not have imagined would interest us. Along about 6 PM we were feeling the effects of overnight travel and asked Laura to cut the tour short (9:30 to 6) and take us to the hotel. I think she would have continued the tour as long as we wished. In summary, we feel that we had an extremely positive experience dealing with Cultura Cercana and especially with Laura, our guide in Buenos Aires.

Two Amazing Days!. After several months of planning our cruise to South America I booked with Cultura Cercana our full day tours with Luciano in Buenos Aires and with Bruno in Montevideo, Uruguay at least six months prior to the date. We were a group of 4 and both days, they were there waiting for us, on time and it was like meeting an old friend. Luciano and Bruno were both excellent, knowledgeable, very friendly (then again so were we ... lol) Bruno provided us wealth of information even up till we got to the ship's gate. I trust the whole team is knowledgeable and would have no hesitation in recommending them to others! In fact, if we go back this way they will be the first we contact ... You will be in good hands for sure!

Wonderful tour!!. Thank you, Fabian, for a most amazing day in BA. Fabian made us feel welcome and at home in BA, showing us what we wanted to see, not just the usual places. He was patient with my constant photo-taking and showed us much local flavor and color. He went above nad beyond when he stayed with us and let us take him to lunch at LaBrigada to thank him for his expertise and hospitality! Highly, highly recommend!!

Perfect!. We were only in Buenos Aires a few days, pre-cruise, so it was difficult to combine recovery from jet lag and also schedule tours. And I waited too long to contact Cultura Cercana--they were booked for one of the days that we wanted to book them. So we asked them to custom plan an evening tour of Buenos Aires, to combine the evening city views with a taste of Buenos Aires tango. They were very accommodating, even though they did not have a "package" tour like we wanted. We also asked Cultura to schedule a tour of nearby Colonia, Uruguay. We scheduled a day tour of Buenos Aires with another agency for the day that Cultura was booked. The Cultura Cercana arrangements were perfect, and so were our guides. The price was very reasonable.Our guides for the evening tour of Buenos Aires were Mirta and Andres, both of whom are Tango instructors. They are very knowledgeable of the city, they are wonderful guides, and they are as accommodating as anyone could possibly ask. It was like visiting the city with old friends who proudly showed off Buenos Aires as only its long term residents know it: not a superficial "touristy" overview but an opportunity to enjoy local venues and cultures and participate with the locals as much, or as little, as we wanted to. The ferry ride from Buenos Aires to Colonia is easy and fun; the tour of Colonia was also fun. Bruno, our guide, is a charming young man who seemed like he might have been our son's best friend; we were just that comfortable with him and he was that much fun to be with. Like Andres and Mirta, Bruno proudly displayed his city with charm and candor. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our time with all three of our Cultura guides. They seem much more like our friends than our guides. Frankly, if we go back to Buenos Aires, it will probably be as much to see Andres, Mirta, and Bruno as it will be to travel and to see Argentina and Uruguay.I had read superlative comments on TravelAdvisor about Cultura Cercana before booking with them, and I thought that the comments were probably exaggerated. They are not. Andres, Mirta, and Bruno are really that good. Unfortunately, we had to schedule our day tour with another organization; it was not good at all. My wife and I actually asked to be taken back to our hotel early. I guess we just got spoiled by the Cultura guides!

Delta Tigre Trip with Andrea and Mirta. We just came back from BA. Had a great time! Wonderful city, good people. I was looking at a number of companies to take tours with, but my first choice was Cultura Cercana due to so many wonderful reviews. I can only tell you that you can trust all these reviews! We took Delta Tigre tour with them. Andres and Mirta were our guides. Both are English speaking, knowledgeable and pleasant to deal with. We were a group of 7, so they arranged 2 cars for us (which was wonderful, we did not have to be crowded in one car), picked us u right from our apartment, drove to the Tigre, then we took Andres’ boat and had a wonderful tour in Argentinian "Venice". Then we were taken to Andrea's cute little house and had a homemade lunch! Mirta and Andres danced tango for us and gave us a lesson too! The time we spent with them was one of the best experiences in BA, I HIGHLY recommend the company and this specific tour.

Made our trip exactly what we had hoped it would be !. Thank you to Luciano and Bruno for the wonderful tours my friends and I took with you in Buenos Aires and Uruguay last October. Everyone at Cultura Cercana was professional, knowledgeable, friendly and a joy to spend time with. We also thoroughly enjoyed the Carlos and Gardel tango dinner and show that you recommended and booked for us.I would highly recommend Cultura Cercana and will contact you again when planning a trip to the Latin American countries that you operate in. thank you for your assistance in making our trip exactly what we had hoped it would be.

A Triple Play with CC. Utilizing previous reviews on Trip Advsior we booked Cultura Cercana for three events while in BA. Our first event was a city tour with Laura. Laura was outstanding. She filled the day with all the highlights and history and you felt like you were spending the day with an old friend. She was willing to change the intinerary if there was something special you wanted to do. She even helped us with securing tickets for a day trip to Colonia. It would be hard to imagine someone doing a better job of making a visitor feel more at home! We were also lucky to have Andres along to add some tango spice to the day. Friends who came into BA later in the week also toured with Laura and enjoyed the same great experience that my wife and I did!We next utilized Bruno in Colonia. He meet us at the ferry and like Laura he is warm and personable and made the day fly by. His knowledge not only about Colonia but the history of Uruguay and its ties with Argentina painted a terrific historical picture of the region. After almost a week in BA the peace and quiet of Colonia was a most welcome sight. He is the go to guide for Colonia and Montevideo!Lastly we used CC for a late night visit to a milonga for an evening of Tango with Andres and his dance partner Mirta. While we only spent a few hours with them at a local spot they were warm and comfortable to be around. The explained the history of tango and what is currently going on in the area. We were able to watch them strut their several times on the dance floor. A great way to end our week in BA.Overall we cannot recommend CC highly enough. They covered all the bases with care and consideration and made our week in the area a highly enjoyable one. Thank you CC.

Thank you for the wonderful experience!. Although we were only on a 4 hour tour, I will recommend this company with a heart beat. Laura was our guide for the half day city tour. She arrived on time to our hotel. We had our baby son with us and having a car just made it so much easier. Laura catered to our interests and explained history behind each attraction throughout the tour. It's a great highlight tour of the city and is suitable for the beginning of your visit.

A real professional Company. This is the company to use for private tour of Buenos Aires. We a group of ten arranged a tour with this company. It was easy to contact in the internet and they pick us up at the Airport with our many bags. We have a guide named Fabian Ali, who was nice, honest and knowledgeable. He took us to La Boca, San Telmo, the main square downtown in Plaza de Mayo, and Recoleta. He provided a local prespective of his country, which we like. He also took us to a first class, and local football Parrilla in La Brigada and help as order the local best. More like a friend than a guide. What more can you ask for in a tour.

Booked 4 great tours with Cultura Cercana. We did a cruise from Lima, Peru to Rio in Brazil, and booked a number of private tours together with other travellers on our cruise. Four of the tours were with Cultura. The first was in Punta Arenas, Chile. Our guide Roberto picked us up at the port and we went to the Seno Otway penquin colony. He also took us to the cemetary to see the elaborate mausoleums, and the Braun-Menendez house museum, as well as the main square. Roberto was very accommodating, and even took us to a grocery store so we could buy wine. Our guide in Buenos Aires was Laura. She spoke excellent English and was a very good guide. She knows the city and history very well and had a good itinerary planned. We were fortunate that it was a holiday on our tour day, and we had little traffic and were able to see Casa Rosada, the presidential palace. She also took us for lunch at Care Tortoni, a famour coffee shop from 1858.In Montevideo we met Bruno. He had been our correspondent for booking all the tours, and also does guiding himself. I cannot say enough good things about Bruno. He gave us a very good tour of Montevideo, pointing out some really interesting things that we would otherwise have missed. He was not happy with our service at lunch (the restaurant missed orders, gave wrong orders, and was really slow). He arranged for us to have our lunch for free, and extended our tour time so we would not miss anything! Bruno was also our guide in Punta del Este. This is a beautiful resort area and we saw the town and some of the beaches. Bruno took it upon himself to find out that the Ralli Museum, which is private, had been opened up for the other cruise passengers, and he took us there as a surprise! Another highlight was Casa Pueblo, the home, restaurant, hotel, time share, and studio of artist Carlos Paez Vilaro. This was also a very worthwhile place to visit. Thank you Bruno.I definitely recommend booking tours with Cultura - we were very satisfied and would use Cultura again if we are lucky enough to visit South America again in the future.

A great time in Buenos Aires, Uruguay, Chile. We had communicated with Brunos with Cultura Cerana for several months as we planned our trip to explore southern South America Chile & Argentina. We were planning to spend several days in the Chilean Lake District before boarding the Seabourn Sojourn. We wanted to do private tours on all the cruise stops. Than we planed to spend several days in Buenos Aires as wells as visit Iguazo Falls. We used Cultura in numerous parts of Chile & Argentina on this trip and they all were excellent (see below). In Buenos Aires, our first experience was when they picked us up from the airport as we returned from Iguazo Falls. We had some miss communication when we got off our ship on Sunday and needed to get to the Jorge Newbery Airport to catch our flight to Iguazo falls but we managed to get there. To make it up the owner Luciano picked us up at the airport with his associates Andres & Mirta. He gave us their Tigre Tour which was fantastic. We drove from the airport past where the tourist tour boats to a private marina where Andres had his boat. We than boated through the canals seeing the homes, churches, schools and even a floating grocery stor. We got to Andres home and enjoyed some wondeful appetizers and drinks. Afterwards we took a walk throiugh the island seeing how the neighbors lived. When we returned we had a wonderful meal that Andres prepared. The vegetables were incredible. As night came and the stars came out. Andres & Mirta who made a wonderful Flam desert shared their experiences in living in Buenos Aires. It was a clear night so we looked at the stairs as we prepared to leave. The Southern Cross, Orien, etc were bright and you could appreciate what early explorers saw.The next day we meet Laura who gave us a wonderful tour of the city. From the Pink House,La Boca, Palermo neighborhoods, a wonderful lunch and a tomb by tomb tour of the Cemetary Recoleta including Eva Peron's tomb. It was a rich and fasinating tour and Laura is the best. She can explain the history and culture. She will custom the tour depending on what you want to see. She is a great guide.That night we did the delux Tango tour with Andres & Mirta. They gave us a private lesson in the basic steps of tango and explained "Show Tango" vs tango. After the lessons we drove into another neighborhood to join a Milango which is like a dance club with a couple hundred dancers dancing to a DJ spinning the different tango songs which create different tangos. It was another late night but again you experienced the real culture not just a tourist show.The next day we took the ferry across the River Plate to Colonia in Uruguay and reconnected with Bruno. We had a great time exploring Colonia which was settled by the Portuguese. I love history and Bruno is well versed. We visited a small family winery which was a lot of fun. I bought a wonderful bottle of a Merlot wine. Did you know the world record for the most #2 pencils is held by a farmer outside of Colonia? What a collection.The next day Laura picked us up early at the Hilton and took us out to International airport EZE.We had a great experienced everyday and felt we were treated as family like a distant Aunt & Uncle coming to visit.Other Places Where Cultura took care of us.We first meet Bruno when we did a tour with him in Montevideo, Uruguay. Unfortunately the Sojourn was an hour late docking. It was easy to meet Bruno as we got off the ship and walked out of the port. Bruno took us to the main plaza and spent about 6 hours showing off his beautiful city. We had a wonderful lunch with Uruguay beef & chicken which was one of the best meals of our 22 day trip. A great tour of a beautiful city that you should consider if you visit there.We also used Cultura to book our tour off the ship in Ushuaia. Our guide there was Gaston who was an expert on the birds and other wild life. It was full day tour that gave us highlites of the city plus we drove into the interior to see the valley's & lakes.They provided our guide for a day tour off the Sojourn at Chacabuco, Chile. The nature of that port means you will do a lot of driving to see anything. It was nice but not really memorable. The guide was good but just not a great deal to see. Although the Bar B Q lamb I had for lunch was a highlight.We also booked a guide Claudio when we stayed in Puerto Varas, Chile. Claudio and his wife took care of us from Friday until we got on the ship Monday mid day in Puerto Montt and than we met them the next day in Castro Chile. Claudio is a wonderful guide and his wife Ingrid is a pleasure. We explored Frutallar the first day. The second day we went to the river Petrohue, Rosales National Park, plus went up on Volano Osorno. The third day we went to the island of Chiloe and along the North coast saw some of the churches plus our first penguins at Punihuil.On the fourth day, we visited Puerto Montt and the fish market there. Puerto Montt is where the industry is located so it was not a charming as Puerto Varas.Again we meet Claudio & Ingrid as we got off the Sojourn and we explored the area around Castro seeing churches including one being restored that Claudio arranged. Which for me was really neat and very special. We also visited a boat builder to see how using wood they still build boats- very special. My last comments there were a couple of spots that Cultura could accomidate our needs and they refered us to other sources that were excellent.Thanks to Luciano, Bruno, Claudio & Ingrid, Laura, Andres, Mirta, Gaston for a wonderful trip.

Awesome Tour. We used Cultura Certana for a full day tour on our first day. Our guide, Laura, was amazing. She was prompt, extremely knowledgable, and seemed to know exactly where we wanted to go and what we wanted to do. We learned so much from her about the history of the city and it was obvious how proud she is of both BA and Argentina. We enjoyed being with Laura so much that we hired her for another tour on the last day of our trip. Working with Cultura Certana and Laura was a great experience. The company was very easy to work with regarding scheduling and we got exactly what we wanted with Laura as our friendly, easy going, translator/friend/guide. We were a group of 60ish year old women who wanted to shop, visit galleries and museums and see the sights. Laura accomplished this and so much more.

Personal tour of BA. We did the full day tour of BA with a personal guide. Great way to get oriented to the city and get a local's perspective. Got to see the highlights of the city. Drive from place to place and get out and walk around a bit at each place.

A First Class Operation. We used Cultura Cercana for three tours during our recent first visit to BA. In every case the CC guides were exceptional – friendly, engaging, professional, and thoroughly knowledgeable.Buenos Aires Tour. We booked this for our first full day in BA after recuperating from traveling from the US. Our guide, Laura, was fantastic. She was personable, knowledgeable, and very accommodating to our needs and desires. We got a great introduction to the city and many of its highlights from the Casa Rosada to the Cementerio de la Recoleta to La Boca. Laura even took time to take us to the Buquebus terminal to get ferry tickets for our upcoming Colonia tour. Highly recommended.Tango Tour. We wanted to see ‘real’ tango so engaged CC for their deluxe tango tour that includes an initial tango lesson followed by a visit to a milonga. Our guide couple was to be Andreas and Mirta. However, before our pick up time we got a message via our hotel that Andreas had called to say he was having car trouble and that David would be picking us up. David picked us up promptly (Argentines seem to be sticklers for being on time) and drive us to a dance studio were we met Mirta. Then Mirta and David taught us the very basic fundamental steps for the Argentine tango. From there we were driven to a milonga (in our case Salon Canning) where we enjoyed a couple hours just drinking in the atmosphere and talented dancers. My wife and I braved one attempt on the floor but it was short-lived due to our ineptitude. Again we all agreed that this was a wonderful evening and certainly recommend it to anyone wanting to get a feel for ‘real’ tango (versus the staged performances at the tango shows).Colonia. This was a full-day tour providing a much different experience from Buenos Aires. We took an early ferry (8:45) from BA to Colonia that is in Uruguay, about 45 miles across the Rio de la Plata. Our guide, Bruno, met us at the ferry terminal in Colonia. Bruno was great – a young local man studying anthropology who was humorous, personable, and very knowledgeable. The tour included a walking excursion around central Colonia, lunch at a local restaurant of our choice, a visit to the local bullring, a winery tour and tasting, and a visit to a unique museum. The history of the area narrated by Bruno was fascinating.

a good experience. Cultura Cercana is a good choice for a day tour of B.A. We had Pablo as our guide for our group of 8. We did almost all of the essential sites in a timely manner. What made the trip special was Pablo himself. He has a wealth of information to share. He is a very patriotic Argentinian with many opinions he was happy to share all day. There was no question we asked that went unanswered. He is a charming young man. We were lucky to have chosen this company and draw Pablo. By the end of the day, we had learned a lot about Buenos Aires and Argenina in general.The van was roomy, with an excellent sound system. We were taken to lunch at a neighborhood bistro absent of tourists except for us. We left the ordering to Pablo. Another good decision. Great typical B.A. fare.A wonderful day!

Not Just for Buenos Aires!!. Although we did not use Cultura Cercana in BA we did work with him booking us tours in the ports of Ushuaia and Puerto Montt. Bruno was amazing to deal with. he gave us options in each of these ports and provided us with outstanding local guides. Gaston in Ushuaia was knowledgeable and clearly had a love of nature sharing all the wonderful scenery outside of the city. We would never have had the chance to experience what we did if we had simply stayed in Ushuaia. Ingrid in Purto Montt, also a local took us on a tour to Osorno Volcana and Petrohue Falls. What a day. Pictures cannot properly show the magnificance of the area. Do not hesitate to use Cultura Cercana for all your port destinations!!

GREAT!! Tigre Tour with Andres and Mirta. My wife and I and our 2 children took a 14 day cruise that ended in Buenos Aires. As we got out of port Andres was waiting for us with his big smile. He is a very nice and enthousiastic man. He had organised transportation for our luggage to be sent to our hotel as we left to meet his partner. We met Mirta at the marina, she was very inviting. What a joy to spend the day with such a lovely couple. They prepared a wounderful lunch. Picada and their famous ravioli was on the menu. Mirta suprised us with her crème caramel accompanied with dulce de leche. We finished the afternoon with a tango lesson. I would recommend this tour to anyone planning on visiting Buenos Aires. We have made new friends in Argentina. As for Cultura Cercana, these are plaisant people to deal with. Thank you.

The best day in Buenos Aires!. Our day with Alex was better than I could have imagined. We saw everything, at just the right pace, with a sensitivity to the likes and dislikes of our party of nine people. Alex had a bounty of information which he delivered in a sometimes humorous and always interesting way. We didn't realise just how huge the city was, and really appreciated being taken around in a very comfortable minibus. We would never have been able to get around to it all on our own.

Great Day Trip in Buenos Aires. Laura was our tour guide for the day and she did a great job. She made the tour interesting and was very knowledgeable. She was the difference between an "OK" day and a great day. Thanks Laura.

South America Trip. I hired Cultura Cercana for a full day tour before our cruise left Buenos Aires. Laura was the best guide we had in our 14 days in South America. She gave us a remarkable tour and educated us on this beauftiful city. I would recommend using this company for your trip and be sure to ask for Laura. We had asked for side trip to the Jewish area and we go more than we expected, including the only Kosher McDonalds in South America.

Great job!!. We cruised through South America: Buenos Aires, Montevideo, Punta Del Este, Puerto Madryn, Ushuaia, Punto Arenas and Valparaiso/Santiago as a group of 6 people. The planning before we started the cruise was great. Once in the ports, the guides were excellent. Everything came off without any problems whatsoever. Cultura Cercana made it a trip to remember. As someone who does a lot of trip planning, I can highly recommend them as one of the best in the business.

A Perfect Day. Fabian met us on time at our hotel for our full day tour. He took us around Buenos Aires intermixing walking portions and driving. He spent time up front talking with us about where we had already been, what our interests were, and what we wanted to make sure and see. He tailored our day perfectly, combining park visits with Recoleta, La Boca, and an excellent out-of-the-way lunch with the locals. Fabian was extremely knowledgable and personable. His quote of the Argentinian people still sticks with me, "Argentinians are Italians who speak Spanish and think they are French." Getting set up with a guide for just the two of us was an excellent way to spend the day and get an authentic flavor of Argentina.Cultura Cercana was excellent to work with, used secure methods of electronic payment, had great follow through and even helped us get a reservation for Tango. If you are searching the web and trying to decide who to work with or book with for your visit to Buenos Aires, stop now and save yourself some time. This is the place!

Wonderful experience! They made our lives so much easier!. 6 of us, Americans, hired Cultura Cercana for 6 out 8 stops on our cruise from Buenos Aires, Argentina to Valparaiso, Chile. They were fantastic!!! Absolutely reliable, always on time, and delightful people. Everyone of them made their tour area come alive for us, with interesting history bits and anecdotes that we wouldn't have heard about any other way. Luciano was a wonderful organizer and sent us fantastic detailed info for every stop on meeting points and guides' cell phone numbers, etc. They all came in very handy more than once. And then, they put us in contact with another great tour operator in Chile, that turned out to be just as excellent.Wonderful job, reasonable and so enjoyable. I recommend them highly! Thank you Cultura Cercana! You all made it an even more wonderful experience.

Such fun personable tour guides!!. There was a group of 10 gals from Nova Scotia, Canada, cruising on the Azamera Quest on a South America cruise from Rio de Janiero to Buenos Aires from January 5-15, 2013 and we booked Ciltura Cercana Tours for our stops in Montevideo and Buenos Aires. On January 12 we booked a 3 hour walking tour of Montevideo and we were so lucky to have Shalako as our guide. He has a wonderful personality and his passion for his country of Uruguay was apparent throughout the tour. We had an absolutely wonderful time with him and we wanted to bring him home with us. Whenever one of us would like to stop at one of the markets he had no problem waiting for us to have a look around and buy some things. I told him my daughter was very involved in soccer so Shalako made sure he found a place for me to buy the official jersey for the Uruguay team. My daughter was thrilled to get this. Thank you so much Shalako and Cultura Cercana Tours is so very lucky to have you on their team. Thanks Shako for the great memories!! You are in the right business!We then arrived in Buenos Aires on January 13, 2013 and were met promptly at the port by Fabian. We did a full day tour with Fabian and we are still amazed at what he was able to show us. We saw all the big attractions and even had time for a wonderful lunch which Fabian booked for us. We saw the Recolleta cemetery, La Boca, San Telmos, President's Palace, Artisan's market, etc. Fabian was fantastic!! We loved both Shalako and Fabian. It was great to meet Bruno as well and thank you Bruno for ensuring our expectations were met and then some.Highly highly recommend Cultura Cercana and if you are fortunate enough to get Shalako and/or Fabian you receive an added bonus:):):)

Fun, Personable, Enthusiastic Guide. I had a 10+ hour layover in Buenos Aires, so I contacted Cultura Cercana about a private tour, asking if anyone else had a tour the same day and might like to share in order to reduce expenses. (All the private tours in BA are pricey, regardless of the tour operator.) They were wonderful in working with me to book a shared tour with another traveler. Then, to my chagrin, my flight times changed and I could no longer do the shared tour. They were very understanding, despite this being a royal pain in the neck for everyone. I ended up booking a private tour anyway.Unfortunately, my flight into BA was late, so that cut out some of the time I would have had to see more. Pablo was there waiting at the airport and I immediately felt like we had been friends for a long time. A demonstration going on in the city also cut down on the time we had to see the sights. However, I felt like seeing the demonstrators and hearing about the issues they were protesting helped me get a good feel for the real Argentina. The driving tour (with some walking and a stop at a local restaurant for an amazing steak) was whirlwind, but I did get a good sense of BA and I loved hanging out with Pablo. I almost felt dirty giving him money at the end of the tour--as if I was paying an escort instead of a guide! :) I had a very enjoyable tour, although I was disappointed not to have more time to see and experience more of the city. Cultura Cercana provided great service before & during the tour and I would recommend them. They always responded to my email questions quickly and they bent over backwards to accommodate my changing travel plans. Pablo was very friendly, enthusiastic, and knowledgeable. We never stopped talking during the entire time we were together. One thing that I was unsure of, so I would suggest thinking about this & asking ahead of time, was whether I was expected to pay for the guide's meal when we stopped to eat.

Amazing Tour!. We had Laura as our guide for a 4 hour private tour. She was fantastic! Am a fan! :) Since we had a walking tour in the morning, we had requested Laura to concentrate on specific areas of Buenos Aires like La Boca, San Telmo and Palermo. Laura listened to what we wanted from the tour and delivered exactly that. All the important sights, mixed in with a lot of interesting stories about the history and culture of Buenos Aires. The tour is highly personalized. Depending on your interests(me and my husband were very interested in the political history of the city), Laura will tailor the sights and the information. She also gave a lot of tips of what we can see/do with our remaining time in BA. And never once did we feel hurried! It was like finding a friend instead of a tour guide in an unknown city :) Thank you for the wonderful experience Laura! If any of my friends happen to visit BA, I am going to send them your way!

Great City tour, Unforgettable Milonga visit. Luciano took my wife and I on a full day city tour of B.A. . We had a good time and we learned a lot about the city and Argentina. One of the Highlights of the day was the tour through the Casa Rosada.Luciano was great and we recommend the tour.In the evening, we took a "Milonga"show tour. Andre picked us up at the dock and took us to the milonga which was located quite a distance away. So we had a nice tour of the town on the way there and back. The milonga was located in a neighborhood “hall”, similar to a church hall with a stage. We sat at a little reserved table located around the edge of the dance floor.Our guide, Andre, was a tango instructor and he brought his partner, Milda. They explained the tango and answered our questions all evening..about a wide variety of subjects.The dancing begins at 9pm and ends around 3am. We told them that we were ready to go after a few hours. They were very accommodating and would have stayed as long as we wanted to. The people in BA are late night people and we are not.What was really unique about this tour was that we were the only tourists in the room. One of the locals was having a birthday party so he shared his birthday cake with us.This was not a show, it was local people who were excellent tango dancers dancing in their neighborhood.I would say that this was one of the highlights of our South American trip.

Great tour on Christmas Day. My husband and I had a private half-day tour with Fabian on Christmas Day (we had asked for Christmas Eve, but apparently 12/25 worked better for Cultura Cercana, and we were happy to change). Given that it was Christmas Day and most Portenos were busy preparing for the holiday with their friends and family, we were extremely appreciative of Fabian's time with us. Also because of the holiday, pretty much the entire city was shut down, so we were able to zoom around town in Fabian's car without any traffic. Fabian was so shocked to find such great parking spaces in the tourist centers of town. At our request, we focused our trip on La Boca, Downtown, and Recoleta (pretty much just the cemetery). Fabian told us interesting stories about the immigrant experience and artwork in La Boca, about the political protest tradition Downtown (at the Casa Rosada, etc.), and about the specific people entombed in the Recoleta Cemetery. He shared personal stories about his own family background, too. He was very personable. He and my husband talked about soccer (sorry--futbol!) for nearly 30 minutes straight. It was a lovely morning and a great way to see the touristy sites--it was a richly interesting, personalized experience. We couldn't have asked for anything more. Thanks, Fabian!

Best tour we have ever taken, anywhere!. We spent around 4 hours with our tour guide Laura in Buenos Aires, on the second day we arrived, and it was such a great experience. We learned and saw more in those 4 hours that we would have seen in an entire week or two by ourselves. Laura was friendly, kind, and extremely knowledgeable and we did not feel hurried at all, even if it was the day before Christmas. Unlike big group tours, we could ask anything and talk about anything, it was like getting a tour of this great city from a friend. In 4 hours we covered the entire city, and saw the major attractions (which is what we wanted...because remember the tour is tailored to what you want to see), and then for the rest of the week we were able to visit some of these places again on our own more in depth, but armed with the knowledge gained from Laura.Do not have any doubts, book this tour guide immediately, if it is the ONLY thing you are able to do in BA, this must be it, because you will get so much out of it.Thank you Laura for a great time, and thank you Cultura Cercana !

Amazing tigre delta trip. We did few tours with Cultura in our stay in Buenos Aires. We did the Tigre Delta trip with Andres and Mirta. I highly recommend this. Both Andres and Mirta were wonderful hosts and it's simply wonderful to see the life in the delta area (with boats and water lanes replacing cars & roads). They taught us few basic tips on Tango and entertained us well.We also did the city tour with Andres and he was helpful and wonderful. His english is good (not fluent but he gets the information across very well and makes sure we understand the details).

Great tour. I joined Cultura Cercana for a full day city tour in Buenos Aires. Laura was our guide. She was professional, attentive and friendly. She was flexible and responsive with my requests. Her knowledge of sight-seeing places was informative and detailed. Her pleasant character made me felt like that she was my friend. About the arrangement prior to the trip, Bruno handled it efficiently. He tried partnering me with another single lady so that we could share the cost as min. tour fee is up to 2 persons. He needed to spend extra time for the co-ordination but with no extra profit. He also had good communication with his guide. Laura had been well noted what I expected during the trip. It was a pleasant trip and I had lots of fun. I would highly recommend my friends to join them when they visit Buenos Aires.

A happy half-day tour. Our tour, Fabian, took us to the Recoleta Cementary and La Boca in the afternoon. He gave very detailed and clear explanation about the history and was very much willing to answer all my questions (indeed I asked many many questions!) which covered history, social and economic status of this city. Recommend Fabian as your tour guide in Buenos Aires!

Great full day tour with Laura. Laura was one of the best guides we have ever had. She took us to all places you would expect and then some. She was friendly and full of interesting facts. Prompt and easy going we learned a lot and were very comfortable with her.

I felt like a VIP!. My wife and I literally just finished the full day tour with Fabian and I can honestly say that my knowledge and appreciation of Buenos Aires went from non-existant to my favorite city in South America.We went from Palermo to Recoleta to La Boca to Puerto Madero to Downtown and everywhere in between ( I know I am already forgetting places). Fabian did an amazing job of showing us these areas while also explaining how the contrast between the neighborhoods came to be.I cannot tell you how much I endorse Cultura Cercana and Fabian in particular!

Another Fan of Cultura Cercana. After reading all the enthusiastic reviews of Cultura Cercana on TripAdvisor, we booked a tour with them for the one full day in Buenos Aires that we were going to have during our three-week tour of South America. Laura was our guide for this day and she was the perfect person to take us to see the things we were interested in and to avoid the standard tourist traps. Because this was a one-on-one tour, we could stay as long as we liked at any of the points of interest or leave as soon as we wanted. Laura was totally flexible.Luciano, the owner of Cultura Cercana, met us at the airport the previous day (we had also arranged an airport transfer with his company) and told us a little bit about his organization. All the members are quite young (I would say in their late 30s or thereabouts) and appear to have an enterpreneurial spirit that is lacking in some of the bigger tour companies. All in all, we join the ranks of other TripAdvisor reviewers who have rated their experiences with Cultura Cercana as "excellent."

Excellent Service. We schedule our guided tour in Buenos Aires with Laura, She was extremely helpful and provided us a lot of information for touring around not only BA, but also argentina.Following her advise, our Argentina trip was full of pleasant surprise and satisfaction.Highly recommended!!!

Why I'll be going back to Buenos Aires for a study-abroad program in uni. Submitting an online critique never seemed to be a worthwhile expenditure of my time until now. A week with Cultura Cercana was enough time for my orchestra and I to fall in love with Buenos Aires. Luciano and Pablo are both great lads so I would definitely hit 'em up if you are planning to have a good time.The pictures I included speak for themselves. Take a look!

One Day Private Tour of Buenos Aires. We decided to reserve a private tour of Buenos Aires rather than use the hop on/hop off. It was one of the best travel decisions we have made. We were fortunate to get Laura as our guide. Laura arrived promptly, was very perceptive to our interests, was very knowledgeable concerning the history and the story behind the story. She was willing to talk about anything re: BA and went way beyond the highlights. It was a most enjoyable, full day.

Excellent guides. We did two tours with Cultura Cercana - the private Tango tour and the Colonia tour - while in Buenos Aires. The Colonia tour was great - Bruno, the guide, was funny and knowledgeable, and really showed us his hometown like we wouldn't have been able to see on our own. A highlight was going to a local restaurant for lunch, with no other tourists in sight! The Tango tour with Andres was also very interesting, we enjoyed seeing the locals performing tango. I would suggest, if you don't know how to tango, that you do the longer deluxe tour with the lesson included. While we enjoyed watching the couples tango, it certainly wasn't a show put on for us and we would've liked to have been able to join in. We did appreciate the fact that while the website said it was a 2 hour tour, we got 4 hours total (including transportation) and probably could have got them to stay longer if we wanted. Both tours were really good value for the money.

Great tour company. Cultura Cercana impressed from the very beginning of my correspondence. Luciano responded promptly and answered all of my concerns. Laura was a wonderful guide for my husband/ me for our last day in the country...very knowledgable about history, places for shopping, and a wonderful local place for lunch. The weather was terrible but her positive disposition made the day enjoyable. Thanks again Laura for ALL of your patience and kindness... If you are looking for a wonderful company to book a tour with - look no further!Ellen- Miami

Our best day in BA. Our decision to hire a private tour guide for our trip to Buenos Aires was one of the best travel plans we ever made. One would expect a guide to be knowledgable about the city's history and tourist attractions and Laura Ortea, our guide, was definitely that. There was so much about her tour we enjoyed, it would be too lengthy to list everything. Here are a few highlights:-At the beginning she asked about our interests so she could focus on those areas.-She gave us time alone at some locations (Cafe Tortoni, El Ateneo Grand Splendid, La Boca) yet was always watchful. We always felt safe.-We got to places and made stops that we probably wouldn't have with public transportation or a group tour.-She allowed us to set the pace, linger or take a break when we wanted.-She showed us some of her favorite places, told us interesting stories, answered questions & kept us entertained all day.This tour was like having a best friend in Buenos Aires show us the city she loves.

Tigre Delta. Took a trip up the Tigre Delta with Andres and Mitra and the trip was EXCELLENT! We were taken to the local market where they helped us shop, taking us to the best of the shops, toured us around until we had shopped out, then wisked us to the boat where we enjoyed about a 40 minute ride to the house on the river for a great lunch and walk on the small island that the house is located. The boat is very nice and comfortable. Although the house is minimal looking at first, when you go inside it is very well kept and updated. They have a kitchen area outside where you eat and learn tango. The food served was OUTSTANDING! Overall, it was an excellent trip and I highly recommend it. Andres and Mita were excellent company and very entertaining!

Excellent Guide, Fabian Ali from Cultura Cercana. I've traveled a lot on my own but am always too lazy to write reviews. However I need to mention about my great experience with Fabian Ali from Cultura Cercana. I met Fabian for a one day private tour around BA. A standard city sightseeing tour would have been too boring, so I asked Fabian to take me to all the good eats around town. Between restaurants and cafes, Fabian was able to show me important sites and explained to me the culture and history of his city. Throughout the tour, Fabian was very professional and knowledgeable, and tried to take me to as many places as possible. I enjoyed his company and learned a lot about BA and Argentina that day. I highly recommend Fabian as an excellent guide to show you around Buenos Aires!

Best travel decision ever. Our decision to hire a private guide for our trip to Buenos Airies was the best travel plan we've ever made. You would expect a guide to be knowledgeable about the city's history and tourist attractions and Laura (our guide) definitely was that. there was so much about her tour we enjoyed, it would be too lengthy to list everything. Here are some highlights:- At the beginning she asked about our interests so she could focus on those areas.- She gave us time alone at some locations (Cafe Tortoni, El Ateneo Grand Splendid, La Boca), yet always watchful. We always felt safe.- We got to places and made stops that we probably wouldn't have with public transportation or a giant tour bus.- She allowed us to set the pace, linger or take a break when we wanted.- She showed us some of her favorite places, answered questions told interesting stories. It was like having a best friend in Buenos Airies show us the city she loves.

A day in Tigre. If you have a couple days in BA, spend one in Tigre with Mirta and Andres. (if you search "tango in Tigre you will find more reviews on them.) Tigre is very different and adds an nice perspective and balance to a BA experience. Go on a weekday and you will have the place to yourself. Our best day in the area.

An overall amazing experience. I traveled to Argentina with my school for 8 days. Luciano and Pablo showed us all the usual attractions and museums as well as many other restaurants and locations people may not know about. While we were there, we truly felt like a family (pablo's band even played for us!). The guides are very friendly and are more then willing to give suggestions about what to do for the rest of your time in Buenos Aires. They also are great at giving a lot of information in a way that is interesting and relevant, but not overwhelming. Luciano and Pablo is very genuine and keeps in touch with us to see how we are doing and when we are coming back (which we are all hoping to do!). I highly recommend this tour whether you live in Buenos Aires, or are seeing it for the first time!

Awesome Orchestra Tour!. My high school orchestra traveled to Buenos Aires in February and was shown the city by Luciano and Pablo. It was an experience I will never forget, and they really are to thank for that. They made sure our trip was special, and every single one of us on the trip had an amazing time and would definitely do it again!

Second time as good as the first. I traveled with my husband and son, in August 2012 to visit our daughter, who was studying in Buenos Aires for the semester. We had the pleasure of Dr Luciano as our tour guide at that time. We had a very enjoyable and informational tour that provided us with the highlights of Buenos Aires. It is a huge city and difficult to see everything but we covered the most important tourist attractions and we were given additional information of places that we could visit on our own. It was a great introduction to an overwhelming city.I returned in early November, with my best friend . She had not been to Buenos Aires so I suggested the tour with Cultura Cercana. Dr Luciano was not available on the dates that we were available but he provided an excellent guide for us. Although I had been in Buenos Aires just a few months prior, the guided tour with Laura was just as satisfying and not at all redundant. Laura arrived at our hotel promptly and was ready to show us "her city". We talked and toured and had a wonderful experience. Laura also provided us with information about our visit to Iguazu Falls ( reminding us to take a change of clothes to the park). That information was invaluable !! She also suggested the new Tango Music show with younger musicians who have their own twist on the tango music. When we asked her about genuine Argentine cuisine , she was able to suggest a few places that we might enjoy with my daughter.All in all, I had two great experiences with Cutura Cerana and would not hestitate to reccomend them to my friends. They were very organized, had great follow through and tried very hard to accomodate our schedule.

Not sure why #1. I took 3 tours in 3 successive days while in BA. I can't say I was disappointed with this tour, just not as wowed by it as others claim. I had Fabian (?) I think, for the all day tour. We spent alot of time driving around to through several various city areas as well as an off-the-beaten-path area & restaurant. Perhaps because I had a in-depth walking tour with another providor the previous day, I had something to compare. I was disappointed with the lack of historical frame of reference of the various monuments (like the proximity of Las Malvinas war memorial in the face of the English tower) as well as the history of some of the Argentinian heroes (that San Martin died pretty much broke).So, if this was the only tour I had, maybe I would have been impressed more so, but in comparison to the others I had taken, it had less historical perspective than I desired. However, any tour from a local is better than just wandering around. I enjoyed being driven rather than walking or biking and I enjoyed the local restaurant away from the tourists. Coupled with the historical knowledge I had gained the day before, I enjoyed Fabian's tour & commentary and would reccommend this tour to anyone. They were on time, provided value for the money, courteous, friendly, down-to-earth, enjoyed showing off their city, was not 'bored' when dealing with the umpteenth same question (where is Evita's tomb?), and actually asked us what we would like to do rather than just doing the same-o same-o.

A very enjoyable day. We booked a full day tour (8 hours) with Cultura Cercana in November 2012. Prior to the date, I found them quite responsive, and they were more than willing to offer suggestions for the remainder of our stay in Buenos Aires. Our guide on the day was Laura, and she arrived promptly at our hotel lobby. The tour covered all the main sights, such as Recoleta cemetery, the Boca neighbourhood, and various historical buildings around the city.We found Laura to be an excellent guide. She apparently has only been working as a tour guide for a short period of time, but you would never guess that, as she was very knowledgeable about all the places we visited. Furthermore, she was very friendly and had a good sense of humour. We were able to chat to her about a wide variety of things, and really enjoyed the time we spent with her. I would highly recommend Cultura Cercana for anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Four hours of great conversation and site seeing. We scheduled a half-day with Luciano to tour Buenos Aires. I'm certain that we would have given the experience 5 -stars, with only Luciano. But we were especially lucky because he was training Laura - another 5 star guide. So we had two tour guides the entire afternoon. We didn't have a clue on what to see, but needed to run a quick errand at Teatro Colon. They assisted us with our errand and also took us to Boca, Casa Rosada, Cafe Tortoni, and Recoleta Cemetery. It was obvious that they would discuss whatever topics that interested us, usually with a pretty good sense of humor about it. We talked a lot about soccer and the rivalry between Boca and River Plate, and some of the differences between the fan bases. We ended up buying Boca jerseys. We were fascinated by the cemetery. It was a great background to describe some of the political and class struggles in Argentina over the past hundred years. Even though we went over our alotted time, Luciano and Laura never seemed concerned. Their love for their city was obvious. I strongly recommend this tour as the most efficient way to get a basic understanding of the city from the perspective of the locals.

Highly recommended - wonderful guides - #1 for sure. We booked airport transfers and Andre picked us up for both - very friendly and immediately my cousin & I felt very comfortable.We then booked a full day tour of Buenos Aires and were lucky to have (2) guides, Dr Luciano & Laura. Both were very knowledgeable on the history of buildings, politics, culture and made us both feel like we were friends as we walked to various sites.The tour is very flexible to suit your needs & interests - for us, we didn't have anything really planned out and this is where Dr Luciano & Laura excelled - they ensured we saw as much as possible....Thanks to all of you...and if you find yourself in Sydney Australia - would love to catch up with you again!

Buenos Aires tour. I went to Buenos Aires for a convention and had only 1 1/2 days to myself, so I contacted Cultura Cercana. I spent the entire day with Fabian who tailored the tour to my interests and our conversation. We started at Plaza de Mayo where I learned about Argentina's complex political history, saw other must-see tourist spots, but more important, went off the tourist path to a wonderful neighborhood restaurant, a tour of the Opera house and a long stroll through the cemetery. Fabian was a great guide, taking cues from me, deeply knowledgeable, and friendly. So glad I did this.

#1 for good reason!. Alejandro was fantastic! My mom and I had a half day tour due to our flight arrival and it was a wonderful experience. This was our first time in BA and I explained things that we like to do and see and I couldn't have designed a better tour. We got a great feel for the layout of the city and Alejandro was very knowledgeable and gave us some great history lessons and details on the city. I highly recommend doing this day 1. I was in BA over a week after and I felt like I knew where to go and what to see much better than I would have just with my own research. He also gave us recommendations on what else to do while there which we took him up on. Oh, and have him take you through Recoleta cemetery - his stories make the experience even better! Private, customized and fabulous.

Wonderful People & a Wonderful Tour. My wife and I booked this tour as part of our honey moon trip through BA. Very happy we did, a unique experience of getting to learn about the culture. The tour up the river was beautiful and interesting. The home made meal was fantastic and we enjoyed some wine and Tango later. I embarrassed myself with two left feet, but shared many laughs. As a younger couple (27&26) we appreciated the authenticity of it all, and had a great time. Much love to Mirta and Andres, great hosts.

Fantastic!!. My husband, 19 year old daughter and I have recently taken 3 days tours with this company in BA. I cannot speak highly enough of the service we received from all 4 of the tour guides we met. They showed us the most wonderful and informative time.. Not only did they make us feel so at home but also constantly checked in to ensure that our expectations were being fulfilled and that we were seeing what we wanted to see. This was not an issue for us as the guides were fully prepared and had a great plan of action each day to make sure we saw all possible in the time frame. To top it off, the guides had an awesome sense of humour and were happy to banter with us about all sorts of things including favourite soccer teams. This made us feel very valued and added to the experience. Their English was fabulous and we had no difficulty in understanding each other. I cannot recommend this company highly enough. Thank you to Bruno, Laura, Fabien and Andreas for a wonderful experience. We feel we have made four new friends.Sonja

Shopping, home cooked meal, boat ride, & tango! MUST DO!!!. We booked our tour with Andres & Mirta, who were at our hotel and waiting for us well before our 9am scheduled departure. This was a pleasant surprise for two gals who are hyper-on time. We had booked this tour after reading reviews on TA and neither are fans of "guided" experiences to anything. Andres and Mirta work together like a well oiled machine. They are tango partners who complete one anothers sentences like a couple who have been together for decades. We were driven from our hotel (we stayed in Palermo Hollywood) through BA and Andres gave us a nice history and explanation of the city. We were then taken to an outdoor shopping plaza where Andres & Mirta helped steer our purchases. When I saw something I liked, Andres was quick to tell me it was "over priced". He then guided me to a different store to find the object I had spotted at a FRACTION of the price. I couldn't believe it.From the shopping center, we boarded Andres' boat and rode the Tigre Delta for about 30 minutes until we arrived at Andres' beautiful home. He served us a 3 course lunch that was one of the best meals that we had while we were in the country. Being that I didn't have any desire to ride horses, we opted for a nice hike through the delta before our tango lesson and desert. Before we knew it, it was time for us to head back onto the boat and back to the city.Andres then took us back to our hotel. I couldn't believe it was 7pm when we arrived. We had an amazing day with Andres and Mirta and felt like we were old friends by the time the day was over. I would not only book this tour again in an instant, I would request Andres and Mirta. They are incredible, down to earth people who will make you feel like family.

No tour but positive experience. Unfortunately, due to flight cancellations, I was not able to go on the tour that I had booked with Cultura Cercana prior to arriving in Buenos Aires. However, I wanted to write this review to let others know that the company is very professional. They provided excellent information prior to the tour booking and maintained communication during my flight fiasco. When I had to cancel the tour, they promptly refunded my downpayment. I would not hesitate to book another tour with Cultura Cercana.
Enjoy yourself !. A real enjoyment during our business trip ! Smile, pleasure and dancing ! and authenticity, far from touristic sites !

Take this tour - on your first day in BA. My wife and I took the 8 hour private tour with Francisco in July, and it was amazing. Francisco is a really great guy. He is only about 25 years old (I think), but he is full of knowledge about Buenos Aires. You can tell that he is very passionate about the history and politics of his country, and we ended up learning more about BA in those 8 hours than we did on the rest of our stay in the city. To give you an outline of the tour, Francisco drove us around in his comfortable vehicle, showing us the highlights of the city. We also got out and walked around, exploring certain areas in more detail, like the port area, Boca, and Recoletta Cemetery, as well as some other places. The highlight of the tour was the walk through the famous cemetery. The cemetery is impressive, for sure, but only with a guide do you really get the most out of the experience. Franciso told us amazing stories about many of the people buried there, from Evita to some of the lesser known occupants. We basically received a history lesson about Argentina in the cemetery, but it was all done through Francisco's great storytelling, so believe me, you will not get bored. Last tip: book this tour on your first day in Buenos Aires. You will see a lot of the city, but you will also get an idea of the places you want to go back to visit in depth, or museums, etc that you want to go into. Francisco also gave us recommendations of local things to eat, and the best restaurants to visit. So by doing the tour on your first day, you can truly take advantage of all of your guide's tips.

great!. I took an 8 hour tour with Fabian the last day I was in Buenos Aires for business. He picked me up at my hotel, and dropped me off at the airport.The tour was wonderful! Fabian was very knowledgeable about the city and the history, which was great. I got to see many things I went into the tour wanting to visit, as well as things I didn't know anything about. We had lunch at a great local restaurant, and he was very patient when we visited the open air market so I could browse the goods for some souvenirs. Having the personal attention of a private tour was fabulous, I'd recommend it to anyone.

I would give Cultura Cercana 6 stars if I could!. I discovered Cultura Cercana on TripAdvisor and figured I couldn't go wrong with a company that had a solid 5 star rating. I was more than impressed from start to finish. From Dr. Luciano's professionalism in organizing 2 tours for me, to the fantastic Francisco, our city tour guide, who's knowledge, love and pride for his country truly shines through, to dancing and milongas with the energetic Andres and Milta, our tango tour guides --- Couldn't be happier!!!

Probably one of the best decisions you'll make on your trip.. You know how when you go on a trip without knowing anyone local there are plenty of hits but also misses? Well, Cultura Cercana helps you sort that out and weed out the misses. It is a great introduction to the beautiful city of Buenos Aires.One thing to note about Culutra Cercana is that they are very young. We were quite surprised when Francisco came to pick us up as this was something that was very different in that we are used to in private tours (which we always take because my mom has mobility issues). This was the first time that we have had someone younger than 30 tour us around. Don't let the youthfulness fool you however. They are great at what they do! Our day with this company was pure hits. Francisco picked us up and started our day out with great information regarding Buenos Aires. He patiently answered our questions and added others that helped us understand BA and Argentina in a way that guide books and the internet just would not be able to do. We went all around the city and Francisco waited patiently when we wanted to look around for souvenirs. He also graciously accommodated my desire to see La Bombonera and made sure that I was able to get a great photo of the stadium. He even emailed me a list of things we could do for the rest of our stay in Buenos Aires. Since he couldn't stay with us for the entirety of the tour, we ended the day with Luciano who owns the company. As with Francisco, he was very informative and animated. He let us decide on how much time we would like to spend in certain places and in general was just a great guide. The way that they both explained the city reflects their youth but the difference is that they are clearly very knowledgeable not only about the city but the world around them which makes the tour even better, in my opinion.Another great thing about Cultura Cercana is that they are so easy to contact with their website and Luciano will promptly answer emails. And the pricing is great -- most definitely bang for your buck. I could say a lot more about Cultura Cercana but instead I'll just say this instead. Stop reading now, go to their website and email to reserve a tour right away.

Absolutely the BEST. Touring with Cultura Cercana was the best decision we made while planning for our trip to BA. The positive reviews (like this one is going to be) are absolutely accurate. We spent two full days with the folks from this company, and it enhanced our trip immeasurably. Our first day was the full day driving tour of Buenos Aires, and our guide, Luciano was warm, funny, and a virtual encyclopedia of Argentine history, lore and personal tidbits of life in BA. We explored sights, monuments and neighborhoods all over the city.....but before we started, Luciano took the time to ask US questions about our interests and wishes. From the bullet holes in the buildings surrounding the Casa Rosada, to the history behind the nature preserve adjacent to Puerto Madero, to the "real" restaurant in an off the beaten path for lunch, he pointed things out that we would never have learned elsewhere or from some generic tour company. This tour is a must. Our second day with Cultura Cercana was equally amazing, and in fact, created lasting memories for our family that we still often talk about. We took the full day tour up to Tigre -- Andreas and Milta are truly wonderful people and we actually felt like portenos, going up to the "country" for a day. Stopping around San Isidro for a bit (we love real estate and wanted to see some of the spectacular homes), we arrived in the small town of Tigre and almost immediately boarded Andreas' speedboat for an incredibly ride through the winding rivers of this facinating part of the country. With literally thousands of tiny islands, many of which are lined with homes and docks, zipping around on our way to Andreas' home was a real experience. If any readers feel reluctant uneasy about visiting someone's private home, don't......these two guides make you feel so at ease, it is like you are with your own family. The house is clean and quaint -- but most of the time is spent in the outside covered living space in the back. Lunch was wonderful -- starting out with the homemade peperoni and sausages and cheeses, and followed by delicious ravioli, which is delivered daily by the "ravioli boat" -- there is an entire system of commerce that exists in this region, with different boats selling their wares and going from dock to dock -- good wine, good food and great people was a terrific combination. After lunch, a walk around the island, meeting a few of the locals and even having someone's puppy follow us all the way back to Andrea's house, who wound up staying with us for the rest of the day. (we nicknamed him "Pedro") who was heartbroken and chased our boat from along the shore when we had to leave.). What could be better? A tango lesson. Milta and Andreas are professional dancers and after a little demonstration, we actually tried ourselves and had so much fun. Eventually back to Tigre and then we were driven right back to our hotel in Recoleta. My point is that if you want to do something a little bit out of the ordinary, and have a truly amazing day, Cultura Cercana's day in Tigre is what you must do. We give our highest recommendation to this company, and to Luciano, Andreas and Milta for giving us experiences that we will remember for years.

Great day tour of Buenos Aires. We had a fantastic tour of Buenos Aires with Francisco of Cultura Cercana late January this year. We covered everything possible including an inside tour of Casa Rosada b/c it was a weekend. Francisco was wonderful and we both have already given his name and the company name to friends who may be going there next year. Recommend very highly!!

BEST tour company. We did a half day tour on our first day in Buenos Aires. Our guide, Francisco, was absolutely fantastic.
