We were able to see all the highlights and spend more time at the attractions we were interested in. Francisco was knowledgeable and entertaining -- and made important and interesting points in comparing Argentine history/culture with that of United States and elsewhere. The tour itself was incredible and we left with not only a great idea of all the things Buenos Aires has to offer but also a list of recommendations for the rest of our trip (including the best restaurants and shops!) I have already recommended Cultura Cercana to two others and I would continue to do so to anyone traveling to BA. A+!

Great way to see Buenos Aires, brilliant guide!. So we had just landed in Buenos Aires after being delayed in Frankfurt for 18 hours and to say we were grumpy was putting it mildly. Great way to start a honeymoon huh? Anyway, within 5 mins of meeting our guide Pablo and stepping into his air conditioned car, I felt like I was on holidays. Pablo our guide rocked. His English was perfect and he was fun, funky, interesting, good humoured and tailored our trip specifically for us. We're Irish and BA has a rich Irish history (which I found out via Pablo!) - he has a great grasp of the Argentine-Irish connection and brought us to some really fascinating places throughout our full day tour, who knew there was so many Celtic crosses in the Recoleta cemetery? Or that Admiral Brown, the father of the Argentine Navy was from Mayo?! I would have wandered around the cemetery getting totally lost if it wasn't for Pablo and his insider knowledge. We had some great steaks and local beers during a really relaxing lunch, asked tons of questions from mate to rugby which Pablo answered patiently and got to see loads of BA during our full day tour. He was very well informed and had really excellent English. I had never gone on a private tour before but I would recommend doing so if you have a few quid to spare; I couldn't have handled being on a bus with lots of other camera wielding tourists; was great to have our own guide who 'got' what kind of tour we wanted to do. So thanks Pablo! Hopefully we'll be back again some day :)

Excellent Tour Company!. We took their Evita Tour and we couldn't have been happier! Francisco, our guide, was excellent! He took us all around the city, including the Casa Rosada, Evita Museum and Recoleta Cemetery. I'd definitely recommend this!

great day at a great value. We have done many private tours around the world and these people are right at the top of our experiences. An exceptional day and at a very comfortable pace (including time for a relaxing lunch). Go for the whole day package...you will not be sorry.

Absolutely Wonderful Day in B.A.. A friend and I used Cultura Cercana in February of this year... We were not disappointed. Our guide was Pablo, who was one of the best private guides that I have ever met. His car was nice and clean, his english is great, and he is very well educated. We really enjoyed our time with him, especially our lunch at the cafe margot!I had an absolute blast in Buenos Aires, and I can't recommend these guys enough!Thanks Pablo!

Best Tour Experience Ever!. Listen, you there, yes you there... I am sure if you are anything like me, you have been scouring the internet looking for top notch hotels, restaurants, and tours in order to make your vacation, scratch that, most likely already very expensive vacation, the best it can be. Well trust me, if you are visiting the city of Buenos Aires, you will want to make sure that you get a tour hosted by Cultura Cercana, I am lucky, my family is Argentine and have visited Argentina every year since I was a baby, however, despite my knowing spanish this time around, I was traveling with my boyfriend and he speaks very little spanish. I don't know about you, but I am not very interested in those red open top bus tours, yes they may speak your language, but they are not really that detailed and you barely even get time to take pictures! When I go somewhere, I want to know what makes the historical sights important, and I most certainly do not want to be taken to the most touristy spots in the city. Cultura Cercana will do none of this. We chose the eight hour tour, we were picked up at our hotel at promptly the time we were told they would be there, and were greeted by the tour guide (and company owner!) Luciano. Luciano has his own car (with plenty of space, for you large groups) that will take you anywhere your heart desires in the city of Buenos Aires. For example, we did the typical plaza de mayo tour with pictures in front of the Casa Rosada, however, we were there on a Saturday, so we were able to actually go inside the Casa Rosada. We saw the equivalent of the Oval Office of Argentina. Like I mentioned before, my whole family is from Argentina and I can now say that I have seen the presidential palace on the inside, before my own mother... who was born in the country! Luciano asked us where we wanted to go for lunch, and of course, we said that we wanted something off the beaten path. Meaning, a place where tourists would not be, and a place where ordinary Argentine citizens spent there lunch time at. We were taken to a place that made its own homemade beer... most excellent! My boyfriend loves artisan beer, so this place was a hit with him. We were taken all around the city, the places which interested us, as well as some places that Luciano recommended as must-sees. He is a wealth of information about the city. To be quite honest, if we lived in a world where we didn't need to pay for a roof over our heads and food on our tables, I believe Luciano would do this for free... that is how much he enjoys doing this for a living. What I mean to say with this is, he is not interested in your money, he is more interested in you enjoying your tour of his dear city and taking in all the insight that he has to give. If you have done your research about Buenos Aires, I am sure many of you have read that some places in the city are dangerous and there are streets that you should avoid. The best thing about touring with Cultura Cercana is peace of mind. You are being taken around in a private car with a private tour guide... You don't have to worry about walking through a neighborhood or walking down a street that may be dangerous for stick-out-like-a-sour-thumb tourists. You are being taken around in a private car with a private Argentine tour guide. If there is one thing that I do recommend you doing while spending your time in Buenos Aires, it is to take a tour through Cultura Cercana, I swear you will not regret it.P.S. seriously, what are you waiting for?? Book a tour!!!

A great start to your visit. We took the eight hour city tour that started with Francisco picking us up at the airport and felt that it was an incredible introduction to Buenos Aires. With our visits to areas like La Boca, Recoleta, and San Telmo, we were provided the perspective and detailed background that you can never attain on your own. We also received solid recommendations on where to dine and the best areas for shopping for specific items. We felt that Francisco was extremely knowledgeable and focused on delivering an experience that was both flexible in meeting our needs and exceeding our expectations. If you start your visit with this tour, you’ll be well equipped to enjoy the remainder of your stay with all that BA has to offer. Highly recommended …

"Absolute Best Tour Ever". The tour conducted by Francisco was the most informative, passionate and unbiased experience. Francisco provided an insightful view into the Argentine culture filled with rich history and current events. The tour was in the form of 5 stars professional door to door, private, secured and customized service. You can not walk away from BA without this tour. I don't participate in much reviews but this tour deserves the attention of a most satisfied patron. Thank you Franciso for your kindness and knowledge!!! George Yang (Hong Kong)

Incredible Tour Company. My daughter and I were treated to an incredible tour through Cultura Cercana. Our tour guide, Francisco, was knowledgeable, funny, and made our tour a delight. We went on a half-day tour and he packed a lot into it. When our tour was completed, we felt we had an excellent feel for the City and had identified where we wanted to spend more time. We would highly recommend Cultura Cercana for personalized, excellent touring.

Best tour of Buenos Aires.... My husband and I were given a fabulous tour of BA -- we HIGHLY recommend Cultura Cercana for a great overview of the highlights in BA. Our tour guide, Francisco, was absolutely the best! Francisco was not only extremely knowledgable of sights and key spots to visit, but very well versed in the history, politics and other interesting info on BA. We were picked up on time and our tour was tailored to exactly the areas we wanted to see. Can't say enough great things about the experience overall -- a must do!

Wonderful insights from locals. We took two tours - a half day city tour with Luciano and a full day Tigre Delta tour with Andreas. The city tour provided an excellent orientation on our arrival in Buenos Aires. Luciano (the owner) is a mine of cultural and historic facts, and was able to customize our tour to meet our interests. He was professional, on time and responsive. Andreas provided wonderful insights into life in the Tigre Delta and was a very hospitable host. He brought a partner with him who spoke impeccable English (his usual partner was unavailable, but Veronica was fabulous), and we learned much from them about Argentinian culture and history. Andreas cooked a delicious three course lunch for us (accommodating to our dietary restrictions) and the tango demo was the cherry on top. Highly recommend this company!

Tours in Buenos Aires with Andreas and Fabian. Another couple and my husband and I traveled on an Oceania cruise in March that began in Buenos Aires. We arrived a day early so we could see a little more of the city. We had read about Cultura Cercana from your website and booked with them for two tours. The first was with Andreas. We spent a whole day with him as he took us on his motor boat thru the beautiful Tigre Delta and to his family home on one of the many channels. He was charming to be with and told us much about his family, his culture and the city itself. When we arrived as his house, he prepared a beautiful lunch for us with wine, ravioli, appetizers, and a beautiful dessert. The Finale was that he and his friend are tango dance instructors, so they danced for us and then gave us a dance lesson! (sort of a disaster but fun!) It was a beautiful, relaxing day, and I still can't believe we had Andreas all to ourselves. We truly felt like natives! The best part was that after the long day, Andreas took us to the ship only to find that there was a strike and trucks were blocking the port. He performed heroically to get us to the ship and Luciano, the owner of Cultura Cercana, who was bringing our luggage separately, almost got arrested trying to get through the police blocade. I don't know of too many tour companies that would have taken on that extra responsibility. We were very grateful. The next day, we toured the city with Fabian, who couldn't have been more knowlegeable. We got to see alot because it was a Sunday, and there was no traffic and he told us so much about the cities history past and present. The cost of the tours were VERY resonable, half of what the cruise line charged, and those tours were shorter and with 30 or 40 people. We highly recommend these tours!!!

VIP city tour. We enjoyed the tour in the City of Buenos Aires. Our tour guide was Fabian. He was very knowledgeable and professional but a lot of fun too. We would recomend this tour company for anyone taking a one day tour of the city.

This is the Company to use. Our guide Luciano met us promptly at the cruise terminal (he sent a picture of exactly where he would be!) and proceeded to give us a wonderful day of touring. The President's Palace, Recoleta Cemetery (with a wonderful history lesson) La Boca ,etc. He ended the day with a great suprise that you have to see for yourself!I can not recommend this company highly enough...do yourself a favor and book them!

Excellent All Day Tour in Buenos Aires. My wife and I just got back from a great trip to Argentina that was highlighted by a wonderful all day tour of Buenos Aires conducted by Luciano. What a great experience! Luciano was very friendly and professional. The tour was centered about our interests (history and culture) as well as our ability to get around (did not want to do a lot of walking). Our tour was on a Sunday and we were able to visit the Presidential Palace including the President's actual office. We saw many great areas including La Boca and the Recoleta areas and had a great lunch at a restaurant favored by locals in the La Boca area. Sunday is a great time for the tour as traffic is minimal. This was a safe and very enjoyable way to see Buenos Aires.Jerry & Rosemary - Gainesville, Florida USA

WOW! What an incredible experience. We booked the services of Cultura Cercana for our 2 day stay in Beunos Aires and one day in Punta del Este. We were met at the airport by Luciano who was our guide for the day. Luciano, was amazing. He showed us around town and never once did we feel rushed. Our guide on day two was Alex who was equally as good. I don't want to compare Luciano to Alex as they both were outstanding.Our guide in Punta del Este was Gonzalo. Gonzalo arranged to take us to points of interest that I originally told Luciano that I was interested in. We had a marvelous time with Gonzalo as our guide.We originally had a tour arranged with our cruise ship while we were in Montevideo Uruguay. Unfortunately, the cruise line cancelled our tour and I contacted Luciano at Cultura Cercana who arranged with another company a tour for us in Montevideo.Words can't describe the appreciation I have for Luciano and Cultura Cercana.The only thing left to say was that our experience with Cultura Cercana from the original time I contacted them to the conclusion of our tours was nothing short of sensational.They exceeded my expectations.ArthurToronto Canada

Wonderful way to see Tigre. Luciano gave us a fine half-day tour of BA,nicely tailored to what we wanted. But the really special trip out to Tigre with a driver and a guide was terrific, Andreas the driver who speaks some English has a charming house out in the delta. He gave us lunch that began with his home-made chorizo, salami, and other sausages that were the best we've ever eaten. Travel there and back in his boat through the narrow rivers went through another world, far far removed from BA,

Buenos Aires city tour. We had Luciano for our 4 hour tour and he did a good job. I wanted to doa longer tour with more walking but his staff was on break and he could only fit in a shorter tour. He picked us up exactly on time. We were hungry and said we wanted empanadas so he took us right to la boca. I'm glad we went with a local because I heard it can be sketchy and he had the locals Paid to protect the car. The empanadas were ok! I didn't feel like people go to la boca to eat empanadas, but oh we'll, he worked it into our tour and saved us time. He showed us some of the highlights and what to see from the car. We drove through San telmo, puerto moderno, the city center and then finally we went to the recolet cemetary. He told us to ignore the conman at the front who was pretending to charge an entrance( I don't know why they allow him there) his tour of recoleta was nice since we got some explanations and some history. The 4 hour tour was all we needed to give us an idea of what to do. It's easy to get around BA, we took the Subte from Palermo to the center.

Best custom tours in Uruguay and Argentina. After reading multiple reviews about Cultura Cercana i decided to book several tours with Luciano, who is very responsive and customer oriented company owner. We travelled with friends on the cruise that stopped in Montevideo, Punta del Este and Buenos Aires.We booked total 4 tours with Cultura Cercana, 2 in Uruguay and 2 in Argentina.Bruno was our tour guide in both Uruguayan cities and Favian in Buenos Aires. Despite their different guide styles both provided very informative, memorable and safe tours with some pleasant surprises that most tourist do not see or know about. Both guides were flexible with the tours time and sequence of visited places, helped to avoid being with crowds. You definitely want to eat great fresh seafood in Montevideo (Bruno knows where) and best steak in the world (La Brigada in Buenos Aires), just ask Favian.You will not regret about money spent with Cultura Cercana, specially when their custom tours are cheaper than most cruise lines offer. You don't want to be in the tour-bus with 45 tourists ...

An outstanding city tour with an extremely informative and professional guide.. I took an all day city tour which covered all the must see sights for my brief stay in Buenos Aires. My guide, Luciano, offered complete flexibility for our itinerary, including the location and type of food we ate for lunch, whilst suggesting a broad structure to ensure we spent enough time in each place. An excellent tour with a genuine and friendly guide.

Very comprehensive, informative and fun!. We got through SO MANY of our "want to see in Buenos Aires" checklist from Trip Advisor, Lonely Planet and the Wallpaper Guide (thoroughly recommend the Wallpaper guide by the way) in just one day. The logistics of having someone, with a car who knows their way around saved so much time and meant so many more sights to see. Items like the Cemetery in Ricoletta were hugely more valuable when coupled with a highly knowledgable guide and having the history explained for various important people and the significance of their crypts.The ONLY downside to the entire day was the lunch. We had asked for something authentic and Argentine and our guide had really talked up this place the locals ate at. It would have to have been the absolutely worst steak we have EVER eaten!!! There was possibly a kickback involved (I can't see another reason on God's green earth why anyone would eat there) but I would thoroughly recommend you chose a couple of good restaurants / eateries from the wallpaper guide or trip advisor and request to have lunch there rather than let the guide advise you on dining selections. It is a good tour and a great way to get a broad view of many facets in Buenos Aires. With a decent place to have lunch (you pay for your lunch by the way - it is not included in the 8hr tour) this would easily be a four star rating for the tour!

Best city tour we've ever done!. Absolutely fantastic 1/2 day tour of Buenos Aires by car and foot. Took us to all the interesting places that really gave us a great feel for the City and an understanding of the history and culture of Buenos Aires.Our guide, Puablo, was superbly knowledgeable, interesting and fun. He enthused us with his love for Buenos Aires and made us hungry to learn more. The best city tour we have ever done. Highly recommended.

The tour with Pablo was perfecto!. My wife and I visited BA for the first time and are glad we did. A colleague in my office suggested that we get a car and driver as the best way to discoveer the city. The Mine Hotel suggested Cultura Cercana. and we were fortunate to get Pablo. Not only did he know the facts about the places and events, he was able to discuss the context. To further exhibit his professionalism, he followed up with an email on things to see and do (and eat) in Bariloche -- a place he had performed as a musician. Thanks for making the trip memorable.JIm & Becky

Pablo's tour of BA made our entire trip meaningful. We were in Buenos Aires for 10 days and started with a 4 hour personal tour with Pablo Guzman. He showed us the main sites to explore further, oriented us to the city and gave us a great overview of the city. But most importantly, Pablo helped us understand the people, the politics and the history of Argentina. He's insights gave meaning to everything we saw and did for the rest of the trip. His stories behind the crypts in Recoleta cemetary were fascinating, but also told the history of BA and it's people's intense political involvement. He also introduced us to La Boca, and why it is more than a colorful tourist site. We can't recommend his personal guidance more highly. Time and money well spent! Sara and KirkColorado1/19/12

Excellent introduction to Buenos Aires - Highly Recommended. We booked a 4 hour tour with Cultural Cercana to give us an introduction/orientation of the city - In hindsight I wish I had booked a full day tour.Our guide, Pablo, was excellent. He spoke superb English and was friendly and enthusiastic with endless facts and storys about the history of Buenos Aires.Due to the limited time we had we concentrated on getting an overview of the city so as we could decide what we wanted to revisit over the next few days. We also spent some time at the Recolleta Cemetary which was fascinating due to the many storys Pablo related.Overall this tour was excellent value and I cannot recommend highly enough - If you have time in Buenos Aires book a tour through Cultural Cercana and ask for Pablo - you won't be disappointed.

Excellent Experience. My wife and I arranged the private Buenos Aires city tour and the Tigre & Delta tour with Cultura Cercana early Jan 2012. We enjoyed them very much and were very pleased with the tour guides. Highly recommended if you would like 1) To have someone treat you like a friend, showing you around the town2) Explore BA more in depth and with some local, unique and non-tourist experiences3) FlexibilityFull Story (For those who like to know more details)We arrived at the EZE early in the morning and opted to have Cultura Cercana picked us up from the airport (additional fee). We found our BA City Tour guide (Pablo) without any problem/stress.Before I continue, I must admit that I was a little worried because most of the review on TripAdvisor were referring to Luciano. Not much was about the other tour guides. But the rest of the day proved to me that Pablo was able to met any expectations that I had and even exceed them.Okay, back to the tour. We were led to all the key attractions in BA, along with in depth narratives by Pablo covering both cultural and historical prospective. On top of that, we stopped by a local market and were able to spend 20-30mins inside. Lunch was at a local cafe inside a non-tourist neighborhood. With Pablo's help on the menu (since we don't know Spanish), we enjoyed our first ever Argentinian steak. Delicious. We spent a good portion of the afternoon at Recoleta. I am sure that without Pablo, we would have got lost in there and wouldn't be able to appreciate the rich histories behind those graves (and which one belongs to whom).On the next day, we had Andres & Milta showing us Tigre (almost everything was close due to Jan 1) and Andrea's cottage in the Delta. The boat ride was pleasant and we spotted the "Supermarket" boat, "Ravioli" boat and the "Ice-cream boat". Milta led us to a short hike (~1hr) while Andres prepared our home made lunch. We had lunch in his gazebo, menu included Andrea's home-made sausages, Ravioli (from the boat) with home-made pasta sauce and dessert (Flan cake with Dulce de Leche)After lunch, we head out to the backyard, see some of his horses and then back to the gazebo for a quick Tango demo and lesson before heading back out to BA for a Tango Show (a separated booking through Cultura Cercana) in the evening.This was one of the most enjoyable day we had in our South America trip. (We boarded a cruise ship sailing around the Cape Horn next day)Thanks Pablo, Andres and Milta (Cultura Cercana) for a wonderful experience.

Everything you should expect and more!. My wife and I just finished our tour today with Fabian. He was a knowledge able and intruiging guid. Throughout the 8 hours, he told us about the history of Argentina. But it was not just a bunch of facts, he was able to weave stories together from site to site.He personalized the tour to match our tastes. This included an ice cream stop. I will not give too much away, but the tour was exactly what we needed to get a broad view of BA.

Wonderful and Informative Tour of Buenos Aires. In Buenos Aires, as part of a long cruise, I wanted the chance to really see the city that I’d visited on business only, so contacted Cultura Cercana based on reviews here. It was an inspired choice. My traveling companion and I were met promptly at the cruise terminal at a location that had been clearly described to me in emails. Due to traffic complications, it was the owner of the business, who wanted to make sure of a timely rendezvous and had arrived an hour early, that met us and took us (as quickly as possible) to connect with our guide, Pablo. From then on the day was a wonderful experience. Pablo was well informed, interesting and extremely personable. We learned much about the history of Buenos Aires, the politics of the last century, and the various architectural styles throughout the city. His stories were always entertaining. He suggested a small neighborhood restaurant for lunch which was terrific. Upfront we said that we wanted the insider’s tour and not all the tourist spots, and Pablo obliged in an amazing fashion. I can’t overstate what a fabulous day we had. I strongly recommend Cultura Cercana.

Comprehensive and customized personal tour experience.... My wife and I were visiting and staying with friends in Bs. Aires last week. I knew that I wanted a guided tour to really understand the city, it's culture, and it's heritage. I asked around and kept getting some recommendations to do an open-bus type tour. I'm from the NYC area and see these things all the time in Manhattan and I cringe at the idea of being herded around like cattle in this manner. Not to say that this type of 'open-bus' experience isn't good for anyone it's just that it's more of a 'Disney' experience than a truly immersive view of a place and a people.So to TripAdvisor I went and then gave Luciano at Cultura Cercana a call. Prompt response and easy reservation. We were met at our apartment at the scheduled time and off we went. He asked what we were looking for in our City Tour and after giving him our interests and backgrounds he immediately crafted a full day tour.I will say that it was extremely well done and crafted. He hit all notes I was looking for. And I will be honest in saying that I did have a fair amount of interests that I wanted to explore. We undoubtedly visited many great places during our tour; essentially everywhere you would want to hit on a stop through Buenos Aires. But for me what set this experience above the rest was the insight provided by our guide. When I travel I want to know what it's really like there. Not just what the National Tourism Authority has decided are the key selling points for the destination. Picking our tour guide's brain about the cultural history and the historic and present day economic/political landscapes was very enlightening. Getting a local perspective on why people may act or do things the way they do in a country is invaluable to anyone that is seriously interested in deeply understanding a place and a people.Luciano is providing a fresh take on tourism in Buenos Aires and in South America. Do yourself a favor and take a tour with Cultura Cercana. Get more out of your travels, gain invaluable perspectives and bring them back home with you. They will only serve to enrich your life and those of the people around you.Cheers,CF

cultura cercana. this review is about a guide, not a tourist attraction. we had 3 great days in ba and environs with luciano and colleagues in december 2011, including ba neighborhoods, the tigre delta, and the like. spent a wondeful sunday at a remote ba outdoor market, complete with roast armadillo--to look at. he provided young, knowledgeable guides, and wheels. timely pickup at our hotel in the recoleta. local restaurant suggestions. we could hot have hoped for a better introduction to a reall wonderful city.

A Must to Discover the City Quickly. One 8 hour tour with Francisco gave us a great overview of the city. My son and I spent the day with him showing us important parts of the city. Not just tourist sites, but how Portenos live. We had lots of walking time on a beautiful New Year's Eve Day. Spent time in the park, had the best Argentine empanadas as we requested, visited the Boca district, lunch at Los Platitos, an out of the way place that had the wonderful Argentine meat we asked for. The tour was personalized as advertised - very much like being shown around the city by a friend. Of course, we saw the presidential palace, toured the cathedral, and, of course, the Cemeterio. Never felt rushed or bored. Lots of conversation in the car as we drove from place to place. Highly recommended for anyone visiting for the first time who wants to feel they have seen the city and get good advice for follow-on activities.

Great team!. A couple of friends, my husband and I booked with Cultura Cercana for a two day tour of Buenos Aires (Dec 21-22, 2011)as our ship ended its cruise here. We apparently arrived during the busiest days of the city. Traffic was unbearable and shops were almost impossible to enter. Our tour guide was Francisco - a young 25 yr old with the knowledge of an older man. What a great personality! Believe me, it came in handy with some issues we dealt with that were beyond their control! All in all Luciano is a perfect businessman conducting his business in an excellent fashion. Thank you Francisco for such a memorable experience in your city! Hoping to return soon and will definitely contract with Cultura Cercana again! Gracias!

See the city with a local friend.... We arrange a 8 hr. tour the first day of our arrival to Buenos Aires. Our tour guide Pablo pick us at the airport. Very informal, natural and with a excellent knowledge of the city and its culture he drove us around the city avoiding traffic jams ( which are terrible) and visited wiyh us all the important neighborhoods not to be missed. We use his own unmarked car as we passed as locals hoping from place to place. They customize the tour to our interest and various request. This is a unique way to tour the city. I can not imagine trying to do that in a big bus as the traffic will make it last forever. We also did the Tango tour with the included lessons, a one of a kind experience. Visiting a Milonga (social tango ballroom) was the highlight of this night trip. They also offer tour to scenic Tigre region andthe town of Colonia across the river that are very recommended also.

A lovely day in BA. We booked a full day tour and it was time very well spent. We had Pablo as our guide and as some of the previous reviews have mentioned, it was like having a friend showing you the city. Pablo is passionate about his work and we had a fun day touring around the city with him. For lunch, he took us to a nice restaurant called the Cafe Margot at Boedo, which is a working class neighborhood, and we had a taste of the authentic Argentine steak sandwich. If you are looking for private tour in Buenos Aires, we highly recommend Cultura Cercana.

Luciano was great. we did a full day tour with Luciano and had a great time. we wanted an overview of the city with highlights and suggestions for things to see/do on our own. he delivered. we had a great lunch at a totally not touristy, local restaurant. we spent some time in a car, but the city is big and traffic is bad, but we had only a short time to see alot. would definitely recommend the tour. we also used Luciano to arrange a tango lesson and visit to a milonga (social tango) and it was so much better than a touristy show. just wonderful. we also had Luciano arrange a slightly different full day tour for our daughter and her husband who arrived too late for the first tour and they had a good tour as well. would definitely recommend to friends going to BA.

Knowledgeable, interesting and helpful. We had a half-day tour with Luciano and Pablo, and although it rained most of the time, we had a very enjoyable time touring the different areas of the city - which we definitely would not have covered without a local guide. Pablo is extremely knowledgeable and gives out enough facts and information without 'overloading' you. His knowledge around the Recoleto Cemetery was phenomenal and it drew together the history of Buenos Aires/Argentina in an entertaining way. He was also kind enough to email us twice with suggestions as to vegetarian restaurants, food and wine to try and Mate!, and also details of other places to visit - including the El Ateneo Splendid bookstore (was originally a theatre) - an absolute must not only for book browsers but also well worth a visit just to see and take photos (and there is a cafe on the former stage) - as Pablo said 'awesome'! Both Luciano and Pablo are very friendly and helpful young men who go out of their way to make their city an enjoyable experience, and we would recommend highly Cultura Cercana as tour guides in Buenos Aires.

A highly personal and personalized experience. Cultura Cercana's motto is "like visiting a friend in a foreign country" and this is quite apt. Aside from being extremely knowledgeable about local politics, economics and history, CC's guides are highly accessible and absolutely charming.We ended up going on three tours on three separate days, beginning with a look at the Tigre delta, followed by a general tour of Buenos Aires, and finally a visit to Colonia del Sacramento in Uruguay. Each of these excursions was a highly personal and personalized experience. On our first full day in Argentina we explored the Tigre riverfront and the tour proved to be an excellent, relaxing way to acclimatize following a 14 hour flight from Los Angeles. It included a drive to the outskirts of BA, a boat ride on the lower reaches of the Parana and then a walking tour of one of the islands. Afterwards Andres took us into his home for a delicious home cooked meal. He and Mirta followed up with a very satisfying tango lesson, specifically targeted to those of us who were not known for our dancing ability. The next day we embarked on the day tour of BA lead by Luciano and Francisco, an introduction to cultural landmarks, hip, arty neighborhoods and historical events. This was an excellent general orientation and well worth our time and investment. At this juncture I should mention that my husband and I were travelling with three other couples, a disparate and difficult group of eight. We were probably the most difficult group they had ever encountered, although they were too polite to say so. Some of us were very interested in touring and learning about the region while others only wanted to eat, drink wine and shop; one of us developed a gum infection and required emergency dental surgery. Luciano and Francisco handled this spontaneously and seamlessly; they split up, parked some of us in bars, escorted others to shops and dental offices, then lead the rest of us through the sights and sounds of BA.On day three, Bruno met us at the port in Colonia. He brought Maria, his pareja, and an extra golf cart to accommodate our unwieldy group. Once again, half of us peeled off in the direction of the nearest bar. Bruno handled these defections with great aplomb, even making sure that our friends landed in a restaurant that served lunch at 11:00 A.M. Luciano has assembled an impressive staff of tour guides who know their regions intimately and are thoughtful, clever and kind. The experience was unlike any tour I have ever taken anywhere before. We give Cultura Cercana the highest recommendation.

Our tour with Pablo was a highlight of our trip. My daughter and I are spending the holidays in Buenos Aires and we're so glad we took the 4-hour tour through Cultura Cercana on Christmas Eve. I know so much more about the city/country as a result of the morning, which was structured around places that I'd not been to yet. Pablo was a most engaging tour guide--his kindness, wealth of knowledge about and interest in Buenos Aires, and authenticity made the morning pass quickly. When we saw him at a drumming event a few days later, it was like meeting up with an old friend. I can't recommend Cultura Cercana highly enough. As dozens of others have shared, this is a first-class company.

One of the BEST tours I have taken. For starters, I will admit I make a concerted effort to take a guided tour (whether by bus or car) in every city I travel to. There is simply no better way to see a city than someone explaining it to you.We had Francisco serve as our tour guide. He was only 24 but based on how much he knew, I would have assumed he was over 50 and had been doing this for 30 years. He is pursuing a graduate degree in sociology, so is very knowledgeable about Buenos Aires both historically and socially.We hit the major sights of the city (La Boca, Pink House, La Recoleta) and ate what turned out to be the best meal of our trip (it was a diner on river near the airport - of course, I forgot the name). Francisco was very informative and allowed us to go at our own pace. He was also a lot of fun. This is one of the best tours I have taken and I would estimate I have taken over 50 tours in the past 5 years. I highly recommend using this company for a tour of Buenos Aires.

There is more to see here than just the city of Buenos Aires. We had a great day with Luciano, and can only ditto the many favorable reviews of his Buenos Aires tour. However, you should search his website for his other offerings as well. He arranged a trip to the Tigre Delta for us with Andres, and this turned out to be one of the highlights of our cruise to South America. You will visit Andres' home in the Delta, which can only be reached by motor boat, be treated to snacks and later have a great lunch, take a nice walk by the river, and even have a chance to take a Tango lesson from a great instructor. And did I mention the lunch? My wife, a food critic, pronounced the flan the best she has ever eaten.

As flexible as they are competent......and charming to boot!. Luciano and Pablo gave my husband and me a wonderful day in Buenos Aires. We had done a walking tour the day before, so they revamped their plan and took us to places we had not seen such as La Boc and Palermo. We also got to go through the Presidential Palace that was only open one day a week. We had a grand time with them and learned even more than we laughed (which was quite a bit!).............can't say enough good about Luciano and his company. Andrea organized everything beautifully; she graciously and promptly answered countless emails with fairly dumb questions from me ahead of time and made us dinner reservations and arranged transportation for the tango show. My camera battery died, so Pablo loaned me his and then emailed the pictures (LOTS of them) to me. They also provided fabulous guides for us in Montevideo (Bruno) and in Ushuaia (Gaston). I highly recommend all of them.

A Highly Recommended Tour Experience. My husband and I really enjoyed our half day tour with Luciano who is the owner of the company. Luciano's knowledgeable of local politics, economics and culture made the tour particularly interesting and educational. I appreciated that we were on a private tour that was customized based on my requests. Luciano was not only informative but he was friendly, engaging and very hospitable. I appreciated his passion for Argentina and his ability to share it with us! The great news about Luciano is that he's expanding because he has been so successful. He has carefully selected his new team of guides who will be well trained in his style and equally engaging and informative. I wish I had found Luciano earlier in our trip as I would have booked several days with him. I highly recommend Cultura Cercana for a fabulous tour experience!

Highly Reccommended. We opted for the Airport Pick up as our plane was landing early and wanted to get to the Hotel and begin our tour straight away.This in hindsight was a great option. Luciano was waiting for us when we got off the plane at the air side of arrivals. He lead us to his car and brought us to our hotel where we quickly changed and off on our tour. To have this when arriving in a new city was a great comfort. Luciano is extremely welcoming and from the time we got into his car he started telling us all about Buenos Aires and Argentina. We had a milion questions - his patience is long lasting.We were brought to La Boca, Recoleta, Puerto Madero, Placa Mayo and many other parts. It was also a rolling tour as he would tell us about the buildings we were passing. And this was all within a four hour tour. He also gave us great recommendations for restaurants, pubs and coffee shops. If you are arriving in BA for a short period do yourself a favour and book Luciano, you will not regret it and with his tips you will end up saving money over your trip.Thanks Lucciano Justin and Fiona

A great guide - great local knowledge. We were very lucky to get Luciano to take us around Buenos Aires for a morning as he seems to be very busy growing the business He is very knowledgeable about the areas he took us to and the country in general and could answer all our questions. He had lots of interesting stories to tell and in particular at Recolleta cemetary. He gave us a good understanding of the city very quickly. We would all highly recommend him and his company.

A Great Way to Start our visit to B.A.. We enjoyed a great afternoon with Luciano for a 4 hour, half-day tour early in September 2011. Luciano was quick to respond to my emails - I’m afraid I contacted him just a few days before our arrival in Buenos Aires – and he was still able to squeeze us in. Luciano gave us a great overview for our first day in the city. He picked us up at our hotel and we drove around with him to get the lay of the land and the neighborhoods. He was able to give us a good sense of the culture and the politics of the city and he pointed out major sights we should check out during our stay. We did more in depth visits at La Boca and the Recoleta Cemetery with him during our tour, and it was great way to learn insider and detailed information about two of the major tourist sights. (Luciano has his own car, making this tour is well worth the money in saved cab fair alone!) We’d definitely recommend meeting up with Cultura Cercana to get a personal introduction on BA from a real Porteño.

A great way to experience Buenos Aires. Our first time to BA and Argentina…saw a bit of the city as we spent some time with our friends there. Luciano took the time to find out where we had been, and what we had experienced in Argentina. Based on this information, he tailored the tour to our requirements. It resulted in spending a day with an intelligent tour guide who laced Argentina's historical, cultural & political stories with numbers (we like stats!). We saw things we don't think we would have seen if we had done a big group tour. And we made a new friend! The tour was personalized, and fantastic. We were picked up and dropped off at the end of the tour. He also gave us recommendations/suggestions for places in our neighbourhood to eat etc. Highly recommend this tour!

Excellent Personalized Tour. Our tour with Luciano was wonderful. He asked what we had seen already (we had spent time in BA with friends earlier) and about our interests, then created a tour on the fly that touched all the bases. He was knowledgeable, charming and full of interesting tidbits. We had a great time and we recommend Cultura Cercana without reservation.

Personal & Professional. My wife and I took Luciano's night Tango tour. We were picked up from our hotel by Luciano and taken to a traditional Milonga where we got to meet a Tango couple who danced for us, and were able to answer all of our questions. Luciano was very helpful, professional, and courteous. After the tour, he took us to see some of the city sights at night and let us take some photos - most unexpected and appreciated!We had also tried to take a city tour, but there was no availability. Of note, Luciano really saved us by identifying an error in our travel plans and offering us his assistance! This tour was fantastic, and Luciano was personable, friendly and knowledgeable!

Outstanding Tour. We read all the reviews on Cultura Cercana with Luciano and decided to give him a try. We booked two half day tours on two different days. The first day, he asked us our interests, if we liked to speed through and see everything or take it easy and see things more in depth. He took our answers to heart and took us places we would never have found on our own. I feel we saw the Buenos Aires which most interested us. Luciano is definitely worth the price you pay for a private guide. He uses a combination of his private car and walking tours in specific places as he gives you a good insight into the history of Buenos Aires. He also sent us specific directions for finding restaurants near our hotel--like "turn right out of the door of your hotel, turn on ... street, etc." so that all we had to do was follow his directions. And all his suggestions were great. Don't hesitate--use Cultura Cercana Tours.

Best tour in my life!!. I am from Puerto Rico but of Canadian origin- I have travelled to many countries and done many tours but this felt the most personalized yet professional out of all of them. The tour guide Luciano was extremely well educated and well versed in everything about Argentina from Politics to history to culture to geography, there was no question that went unanswered. Since he picked up and dropped off personally there is no worrying about getting somewhere on time or paying a taxi. The tour itself is very personalized, he made suggestions and so did we and he personalized the tour more and more as he got to know the personalities of the people present. We went to the areas well known for its tourism and areas more local that he suggested. He also recommended theatres to go to at night, restaurants and bars in aour area that were popular. I highly recommend doing the tour early on in the trip since he gives so many suggestions of other tours and things to do. We had the tour in spanish but he is also fluent in english. Midway thru the tour i felt like i was talking and touring with a good friend from college!! I highly recommend doing the 8 hour option since time flies on the tour. There is the option of 4 hours which we extended to 6 hours and we easily could have gone longer!! Whether you are doing a quick trip to Buenos Aires or a long vacation, this is a MUST DO in Buenos Aires without question!!!!!

Great day with Luciano ..... My wife and I went on a four hour tour with Luciano. He is a great guide and showed us very nice places, always with a good explanation (the jersey history of CABJ, for example !). Can recommend him 100% !!!

A feast of history and culture in BA. Despite the pouring rain (it seemed to start whenever we left the car, only to stop once we got back in!) we enjoyed our tour of Buenos Aires with Luciano, so much so that we booked another tour with his company during our 2-night stay in Montevideo a week later. We contacted Luciano after exploring BA on our own for several days. Generally, we are not much for guided tours, but we do take private tours from time to time. Both Cultural Cercana tours were chock-full of history and culture, and if you have a particular aspect of the city that is of interest to you (mine is neon) Luciano can research it and devise something rather quickly.

Very friendly and Knowledgeable with lots of interesting facts.. We spent a day touring Buenos Aires with our guide, Luciano and he was fantastic. Very informative and well worth going back to as he takes much pride in his individual tours. We had lots of input into what our day entailed and even as we went around town we were able to stay longer in any areas that interested us. He had amazing english and we were laughing and joking most of the day. In a city where there are more tours than you could shake a stick at Cultura Cercana is by far the best and most personal tour of a wonderful city.

Great friendly day trip. We had a great half day trip with Luciano. We saw some parts of the city like La Boca that we could not do ourselves. He also arranged a guide in Colonia for us which was fabulous and informative as well. Thank you very much. Jo and Tyrone.

Great day in BA.. Luciano led a a private tour for me and 2 other friends. Believe it or not, Luciano is actually a lawyer who got fed up with courts and decided to do something he was passionate about, which is giving private tours of Buenos Aires. While on the tour, it feels like you're walking along more with a friend as he'll take your around town based on your preferences. We hit some of the highlights around town, but also saw many areas most people who not even consider visiting. The highlights include visiting the Boca Jrs. stadium and the lunch spot, which is away from the tourist traps but served the best steaks in BA. Luciano is very knowledgable and speaks perfect English, so had was able to share the history about each site and also give us tips for the rest of the week. There aren't enough adjectives to describe the tour but I overall I had a wonderful time and look forward to see his business grow throughout Latin America! I would not hesistate to recommend Luciano to any vistors in the city. -Mike Atlanta, GA  May 2011
Couldn't have asked for more. Best tour guide ever, willing to totally customize for your needs. Worth every penny!!

Like having a friend show you round.. I have now taken two tours with Luciano (one with family, one with a friend) and cannot recommend him highly enough. With a great sense of humour and an even greater understanding of his hometown, he will personally drive you to see all the famous sights, and beyond that- to unbeknownst local spots: all the while giving a fascinating commentary and answering all sorts of questions I fired at him continuously.Tours are (amazingly) affordable, flexible and completely private so you can tailor each tour to suit your particular needs and interests. Buenos Aires is a very large city, drenched in rich history which makes it almost impossible to cover it all in one day. With Luciano however, it is possible! Luciano went above and beyond to help us: recommending (and booking!) particular restaurants, and organising other tours (the Tigre River). Taking a tour with Cultura Cercana should be everyone's MUST-DO when they visit this beautiful city. Thanks Luciano!

Entertaining as it is intelligent. Lucien Bullorsky is an impressive guide. Fourth generation Porteno and accomplished historian, he provides a great running commentary and efficient visit to Buenos Aires. I hired him for a half day tour as introduction to this fascinating city. Lucien was prompt for the appointed tour, quintessentially polite, and ready with practical tips for enjoying the City's highlights on my own over the following week. I highly recommend this sophisticated young man and Cultura Cercana.

Wonderful tour in Buenos Aires. We used Luciano for a full day Buenos Aires tour with our 4-year old daughter. It was the perfect tour because we saw what seemed like the entire city, got the perfect amount of background history on the city and neighborhoods and overall got a great feel for the city. A private tour with Luciano was perfect for our daughter because we went at a pace that was good for her instead of at a pace that was set by the tour bus/company. This meant eating lunch when we needed to, stopping for potty breaks and snacks, etc. It really was perfect. I highly recommend Luciano to families who want a more personalized and informative tour of Buenos Aires, as well as to anyone who wants more than the typical tour bus script. He has a wealth of knowledge!Luciano also booked us transport and a stay at the most beautiful Estancia we could have imagined, Estancia Villa Maria. In addition, he booked us a Tango night, which was very entertaining. He made everything so much easier for us, and we are grateful!HIGHLY RECOMMEND Luciano for all your needs in Buenos Aires!

Fantastic tour..highly recommended!. A very special thanks to Luciano for doing such an excellent job of taking us around and showing us the "hidden" treasures of Buenos Aires. I would have probably walked by some of the places that we visited without having a clue of the meaninful history behind it. Luciano certainly showed the love for his country as he vividly explained the stories behind every location that we visited. One of my favorite moments was when he took us to this local restaurant which has AMAZING steaks!! One of the best I've ever tried! Literally you only need a butter knife to cut the meat of how tender it is.What also made this trip very special is that it was a day before the May Revolution Day. We received good advice from Luciano on what to do the next day.

One whole day in Buenos Aires. We were diverted on our return journey to Australia via Buenos Aires, with a one day lay-over. After researching through Trip Advisor we contacted Luciano at Cultura Circana to tell him our interests and hear his suggestions.Luciano arrived at our hotel and we soon struck up a good relationship, with his good English and deep knowledge of Argentina and Buenos Aires history, major points of interest and its architecture and politics. His 8 hour tour took in all of our points of interest, including the pink Royal Palace and the amazing decadence of the Recoleta cemetery.His car is clean and his driving is competent. There was no trouble to stop to take photos or ask questions.Previously we had requested him to make reservations to an Argentine restaurant and a Tango Show, which were all in place.

Thank you for a most enjoyable day. My wife and I could not believe how much of Buenos Aires we were able to see and enjoy in one day. Alejandro went out of his way to ensure that we were able to enjoy the highlights of Buenos Aires and to gain an insight into the people and culture. I thoroughly recommend Alejandro as a guide. Great value for money.

Thanks, Luciano, for making Buenos Aires come alive. I was in Buenos Aires on a business trip and was feeling sad. I had come to this beautiful city and all I was experiencing was the hotel and the few streets in the immediate surrounding area. Lucky for my, my client recommended I call Luciano. He was so kind. He had personal plans that Saturday morning, but he volunteered to rearrange his schedule to accommodate me. Luciano drove me in his clean car to the key sites of BA that I would never have seen on my own. We had lunch at a great local restaurant and enjoyed some nice conversation. Thanks again, Luciano, for making BA come alive for me.Rob from Cincinnati, Ohio, USA

the PERFECT guide in B.A.. Luciano is the next best thing to having a friend who lives in B.A. show you the city. In fact, he might be better because he knows SO MUCH about the city's history, politics, architecture and more! Spending 8 hours with him made me feel like I got to know the real B.A. He also went above and beyond the call of duty to help us have a truly memorable visit in his home city. You MUST book a tour with him if you are going to B.A.!

Highly informative & enjoyable. I contacted Luciano 2 months prior to our visit & through emails was able to book several trips through him.Firstly we took an all day tour of Buenos Aires with Luciano. He picked us up from our hotel & drove us to various places around the city. We stopped & got out at several of them & had lunch & a great ice cream later. I was traveling with my 17yr old son & Luciano made sure to include interesting items for him, too. Luciano is a very pleasant & well versed guide. There seemed to be nothing that he didn't know about his city & he gave us many tips on places to look at during the rest of the vacation.We also booked a trip to the Tigre delta & this was a wonderful day out with Andres . We really got a feel for life in the delta as well as enjoying a great boat ride, wonderful food & conversation & a tango lesson from his friend.Our final trip was to an Estancia about 60km from BA. We spent the day with a working farmer/polo player & were able to learn a lot about the gauchos and life out on a ranch. There were horse rides, good food & great conversations.Every one of these trips was a delight & I would highly recommend Luciano for someone looking for a real taste of life in Argentina rather than the usual mass tourist tour.I would also like to point out that(due to external circumstances) when a problem occurred with a proposed(travel agent) trip, Luciano went out of his way to keep us up to date as to what was happening with regard to refunds and was able, through his mastery of law, to ensure that we recouped all of our money. He continued to work on this after we had returned home & did not give up until he reached a successful conclusion.

Fascinating, wide ranging, customisd tour with personal guide. Luciano's depth of knowledge and passion about Argentina and Buenos Aires was evident as he gave me a fascinating day tour. I understand so much more about the history, people and places than I could have gained any other way. We visited such a very wide and interesting range of attractions including the key palaces and buildings, the extraordinary cathedral, the artists at San Palermo, the Art Gallery, the old and new docks, the incredible cemetary where influential Argentinians have their mausoleums, the best steak restaurant, and so much else. Luciano listened to my interests and made sure that they were met. He is an engaging, articulate and seemingly tireless guide with fluent English. It was truly a day to remember and I recommend his personalized tours very highly.

Not your average tour.... Luciano's insight into the history and politics of the city and country are really amazing ! We have been on scores of the standard city tours in many countries and can say, without a doubt, that this is NOT one of those standard / average tours. Luciano tailored the day to be what we wanted - and the mix of architecture, politics, history & culture was exactly what we were seeking. Luciano has an easy going style and was a gracious host. It was a nice mix of walking and car touring - so even for our 50+ yr old bodies we covered a lot of the city and were not totally wiped out. We really enjoyed the ability to ask questions and go into many different topics with Luciano. He knows the info and is not confined to the 'script' of so many other tour guides. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this tour!

best tour guide ever. Luciano, ( a graduate doctor of law) is the finest tour guide I have ever encountered. He tailors the tour to YOUR interests, just 2-4 people but no mixed groups, and is remarkably well-versed in an extraordinary range of subjects..history, art, politics, architecture, etc., and has great wit and charm. This was our first visit to Buenos Aires (definitely not our last) and we learned and enjoyed more in our 4 hrs with Luciano than I would ever have expected. Martin and Beverly Weiss, Ft Lee, NJ

Outstanding time with Luciano. My mother and I spent 2 days with Luciano touring Buenos Aires, one day pre-cruise and one post-cruise. We could not have asked for a better guide. He is intelligent, well-educated and well-spoken, and provides a nuanced, "big picture" overview of Buenos Aires and Argentina in a short period of time. His love of his city and country is evident and we thoroughly enjoyed our time with him.He was prompt to pick us up on our first day and completely planned the day around what we wanted to see. The day was well planned and not too strenuous, with a nice lunch at one of his family's favorite restaurants. At the end of the day, he even took us shopping for purses at his mother's favorite stores.Our flight home after the cruise was not until late so it was a relief to know that Luciano would be picking us up and, really, taking care of us all day before our flight. How he managed to fit all our luggage into his car, I'll never know, but it all went in. We spent a lovely day seeing the rest of the city. Luciano went above and beyond, even cruising up and down the streets of Palermo Soho searching for a particular street vendor whose jewelry my mother had admired at the beginning of our trip.Truly an outstanding experience. I would definitely recommend Cultura Cercana to anyone and look forward to returning to BsAs with my husband so that we can do the tango tour.

Luciano is a first-rate guide and a great guy to hang out with. My wife and I totally enjoyed our last day in Buenos Aires utilizing Luciano's expertise in showing us around Buenos Aires and, then taking us to the airport, all for a very reasonable fee. He has so much knowledge and so much passion for B.A. and it makes for a great tour. He is extremely flexible about where he will take you, and, at the same time, has many ideas on where and how to show you the city and its surrounding areas. The only regret I have is that we waited for our last day to use his services. Better to start out with Luciano. Either way, well worth it, and he is just a fabulous guy!

a great Tango tour with Luciano !. While in Buenos Aires, my wife and I wanted a personal experience of the Tango and the Tango tour offered by Cultura Cercana was just what we were looking for. When Luciano picked us up from our hotel, we were instantly at ease with him. He was very knowledgeable and spoke English very well. He drove us to a dance studio in one of the outer barrios which also gave us a chance to see a bit more of the city. At the studio we met with two very nice and very talented dance teachers. We had a private Tango lesson which gave us a very good foundation for continuing with the dance. Then, we all went to a nearby neighborhood "milonga", where people of all ages danced Tango well into the night. It was great to have an experience of the people of the city just enjoying the dance they love rather than seeing more of a commercialized show. I might add that while we were there we also snacked on the best empanadas we had while in Buenos Aires. Luciano provided for us a great experience of the Tango and we definitely recommend it.

Lucian superguide. Luciano Bullorsky is a wonderful guide, eager and able to adapt his tours to the individuals he guides. His English is very good, and he is intelligent, charming, knowledgeable and fun. Well-educated, energetic, enthusiastic, with a fresh and interesting perspective on history, politics, economics and culture, he is keen to engage in lively conversation on just about any topic, and added greatly to our understanding of Argentina and Buenos Aires. Always on time, he picked us up from and delivered us back to our hotel in his comfortable car, while including much walking throughout the city and its various neighborhoods. Luciano exposed us to the usual attractions, but always had an imaginative, unexpected, off-the-beaten-track treat for us. Highly recommended, without reservation.

Like travelling the city with a good friend!. Luciano was a brilliant tour guide. My cousin and I were visiting from Sydney, Australia and although we had a few days in Buenos Aires, we honestly couldn't have learned as much as we did without the seemingly-endless knowledge of our guide. Whether you want to take heaps of photos or learn about the historical depth of the city, Luciano tailors the tour to what you want—even if all you want is a big, fat juicy Argentinian steak. We had a lot of fun riding around the city in a comfortable, air-conditioned car — even listening to Reggaetone on request. The best part about Luciano is that he always tries his best to answer any question you may have, and goes beyond his duties of the day by suggesting places that you might want to see, or restaurants that you might want to eat if you ask! The day after the tour we went to a great restaurant in Palermo (upon Luciano's suggestion), where the lamb and pumpkin mash was simply divine. Some of the most memorable meals in Buenos Aires can be attributed to him!All in all, he will take you to see the sites — touristy, non-touristy, anything you really want to see and he will do it with a smile! He is a wealth of knowledge, and opened our eyes to many things that we never would have discovered about Buenos Aires on our own. I would definitely recommend Luciano to anyone looking to explore the in style!

Luciano, guide extraordinaire. Our trip to Buenos Aires in January, 2011 was made absolutely outstanding by having Luciano as our guide. We spent 4 half days with Luciano acquainting us with the city, its history, its culture and its people....a fascinating time. His expertise is only exceeded by his charm!

A must-do on any Buenos Aires visit!. My husband and I traveled to Buenos Aires for our honeymoon and were lucky enough to come upon Cultura Cercana. We did a half-day city tour with Luciano and loved it -- he was super nice and a wealth of information -- we were able to tailor the tour to particular sights and areas we were interested in, and he also made suggestions too. It was a wonderful way to explore the city and sightsee, and also just interesting to talk to Luciano about all things Argentine - culture, politics, history, food, etc. It was a great value for the price. We enjoyed it so much that we booked the Tigre tour for later in our trip - also incredible! We would definitely recommend these tours for anyone visiting BA.

We hit a Home Run!!. We enjoyed a wonderful day in Buenos Aires with Ezequiel Martinez on 1/29/11. He was certainly a breath of fresh air for touring. His knowledge of his City, its culture and its people provided us with a wonderful base for the remainder of our visit. He is a highly educated professional person. His English skills were excellent, and his planning made our day. Highly recommend this Company!

Cultura Cercana City Tour and Tigre Excursion - Two Thumbs Up. We took both a city tour all around Buenos Aires and a day trip to Tigre with Cultura Circana. Both were well worth the time and money spent.On the day of the city tour, Luciano picked us up in his air conditioned car and provided a broad overview of the city and its culture before arriving at our first of many destinations. Luciano's passion for Argentina and its history was both impressive and contagious. There wasn't any topic he couldn't cover; history, futbol (soccer), architecture, polo, economics and politics were just a sampling of what we discussed.On the Tigre tour, Luciano also picked us up and drove us north where our guide, Andres, picked us up in his private boat and gave us a water-view tour of the delta before arriving at his farm and retreat. We met his animals and sat down to a lovely, fresh breakfast. After a nice walk in the woods to get a feel for the area, we returned for some swimming, more boating and a beautiful homemade lunch.These are just two of the many tours that Cultura Circana has to offer. I would highly recommend them!

Buenos Aires & Tigre tours like visiting your best friend.. Luciano & Andres provided tours of Buenos Aires and Tigre (respectively) that were as fun and casual as visiting a friend in a foreign city. Luciano was instantly likeable and it became quickly apparent that he was a keen student of Argentinian history, culture, art, architecture, politics, and sports. He also had a great sense of humor and a quick wit. When I asked for a two minute explanation of the place polo holds in modern Argentinia life, he delivered exactly that and then quipped "was that two minutes, or do I still have ten seconds?"Our visit to Tigre was like hanging out with your frind who has a really cool vacation house. We boated, swam, ate, boated some more, and just overall really enjoyed a great day in this unique area of Argentina. A short drive from the city, but a world away. It is easy to see why this has been a popular refuge for city-dwellers for decades.Without these tours our visit to Argentina would have given us only the broadest overview, now I feel we have really BEEN there.

Luciano is a good tour guide. We used his service on December 25, he didn't mind to work on Christmas day.We had a very good time visiting the city and listening to his knowledge on Buenos Aires.It was a very interesting tour. We highly recommend him.

Beyond compare!. If you want the most comprehenisve exposure to Buenos Aires, contact Cultura Cercana immediately and ask for Luciano! As previously noted Luciano is an attorney whose love of knowledge and sharing his love of his city is beyond compare. We had the most wonderful 3 days exploring Buenos Aires in his hands. I tend to be a bit compulsive of what I want to see and do, but after a few minutes with him...I relaxed and let him take control. He is flexible so that we were able to make changes as we were touring.He will design the tour based on your desires and does not dominate your tour...it is personally created. We were very interested in the political situation in Argentina, Luciano provided a historical as well as an accurate representation of both sides. He makes you feel a part of the past as well as the present time...and even the future of his beloved country. I was continually amazed at the depth of his knowledge in all areas.Prior to booking his services, I emailed him my ideas. He responded with his suggestions to amplify what I had expected to see and thanks to Skype I was able to meet him before we arrived. The company also has a Tango division where they take you to the very best (non-tourist) shows in town I think one of the best parts of being with Luciano (besides his knowledge) is his warmth and love of people. His sense of humor is so terrific that we had many laughs along the way. Oh yes, he has a new car that is airconditioned for the hot summer days. We always hire private guides when we tour, and Luciano is at the top of our list!

Just like having a good friend show you around town. This is the best money we've spent in Buenos Aires!You know how it is when you visit a city to see a friend who's lived there all his life? He takes you under his wing, shows you his favorite spots, and really gives you a feel for life there. That's exactly how this tour felt. I cannot recommend it highly enough!

Incredible introduction to BA. We booked a private tour for the afternoon of our arrival into BA with Cultura Cercana to give us a good overview of the city, so that we could have an idea of things we wanted to return to. We were fortunate to have Luciano as our guide - what a true gem. He gave us a great overview on the city, and focused more in depth on things we showed an interest in. His passion for what he does is wonderful, and his personality is a delight. This was a great way to spend our first day.

Experienced the new Tigre/Parana Delta tour - AMAZING!. I have taken tours with Cultura Cercana and Luciano in the past and highly recommend all of their tours. This trip to Buenos Aires with some visiting friends, we took a 1/2 day city tour which was as usual, perfectly timed, professional, friendly and incredibly informative (Luciano is as knowledgeable about Buenos Aires and Argentina as any university history professor). We did something different on our 2nd day and took the Tigre/Parana delta tour. What a dream day it was for the 4 of us. After taking the short & easy 30 min drive from Buenos Aires to Tigre, we were promptly met by Andres our guide for the day. We then took a 30 min boat ride through the Delta to his beautiful streamside home. The beautiful scenery led to the perfect day. We had coffee and pastries - went on a hike through the island, interacted with his many horses. Sat on the dock relaxing, took a swim in the cool & clean river and had another boat ride later in the day to see the other areas of the Delta, including the large Parana river.We are only sorry that we did not partake in the available Tango lessons, which would have been wonderful. I would recommend this tour to anyone looking to enjoy the Tigre area and enjoy a leisurely day full of fun and time spent enjoying the area like a local. Far more interesting than the normal touristic tours offered at the main docks in Tigre.A beautiful lunch was prepared of homemade pasta and sauce with a tasty flan dessert. Beer, water & soda are all provided throughout the day.Thanks again to Luciano & Cultura Cercana for planning yet another picture perfect day in Argentina for us & our friends!

Fun way to get to know the locals.. Me and my two friends took the Tango Tour with Luciano and a sweet tango couple. They took us to a Milonga where they danced with more locals and explained in detail the proper etiquette and history of the Milongas and tango. Spending the evening with the 3 of them was such a pleasure. Staying in hostels or hotels you don't always get a chance to get to know the locals and their perspective but this gave us just that. They were delightful and knowledgable company. You felt like you were visiting friends from out of town and like they had all the time in the world to hang out and demonstrate what they are really passionate about.

Wonderful!!. Thanks to everyone who recommended Cultura Cercana. We had a wonderful tour of the city this afternoon. Luciano is a degreed lawyer who discovered he didn't enjoy the profession as much as he enjoyed studying it. But he loves his country and his city--and that shows during his tour. Just to give you a comparison: the on-off bus costs 70 pesos per person. When they're on schedule, they run every half hour. And if they're full, you just have to wait for the next one. The full tour runs about 2 1/2 hours.Today, we had a 4 1/2 tour with Luciano, geared to our interests and avoiding areas already covered in the two free walking tours posted elsewhere on this board, for 120 pesos each. And Luciano knows so much about the history and culture of his country and his city.We give Cultura Cercana 10 points out of 10! Do the two free walking tours and this. I doubt you could find better value for either your time or your money!

Memorable tours in Buenos aires. In preparation for my visit to BA, I searched the Internet and was immediately attracted by the title”Cultura Cercana.” I e-mailed Luciano, who promptly replied, and we discussed several option for my short stay in Buenos Aires. When I told him that I speak Spanish and am a ballroom dancer, he thought that a night at a Milonga dance hall with a tango dancer would be the best for me. He wanted to show me where the local people dance, a place not many tourist get to visit.The day after my arrival to BA, Luciano picked me up from the hotel and drove me to the Milonga in his car. There, he introduced me to a tango dancer, whom he hired for the occasion so that I have not only seen the place, but have also been able to dance and learn all about the history of the Tango. That evening at the Milonga was an unforgettable experience of my visit to BA.I soon learned that Luciano is not your regular, trained tourist guide, but an intellectual with a law degree, who is eager to share his knowledge of Argentina’s culture and history with the foreign visitors.Luciano’s personalized guided tours take you on a well trodden path, or completely off the beaten track. His personalized tours are meaningful and a memorable encounter with the rich heritage and history of Argentina.

best guide to the real buenos aires. my husband and i went to argentina for our honeymoon. and we had the great fortune of meeting luciano through marcos, from whom we rented our apartment.first and foremost, luciano has great oratory and interpersonal skills, so he's easy to understand and connect with. he is young and energetic but also laid back. he doesn't force you to see anything that you are not interested in seeing. he caters each tour to your needs and interests. we are history, art, and design-centric, so we asked him to take us on a tour that would highlight those aspects of the city. luciano picked us up in his car and took us on a short driving tour of the city's major highlights, which we would later re-visit on our own for more in-depth sightseeing. then he took us to recoleta cemetery. what a great place to start the tour!! luciano's knowledge of argentina's history and culture was amazing. he was able to spit out specific dates and names .. i don't think i know that much about my own country's history .. and i'm a history buff!! he took us to san telmo where he told us not to come back on our own at night time. he was like a friend who we were visiting. he bought us our first taste of alfajores. he snapped photos for us. he took us to a soccer stadium where he tried to explain the competing teams and the socio-economic reasons why some were boca fans, etc. he took us to the ecological preserve, where he posed the question to us of how a land that valuable [puerto madero real estate is like manhattan real estate in buenos aires] could remain untouched. we ended our tour with luciano as friends. he took us to los platitos, a REAL parilla where we enjoyed huge steaks for lunch. it was clear from the start that luciano is not in the business of being a tour guide, but interested in sharing his knowledge of argentina with foreigners. it was very satisfying to meet someone who takes pride in his culture and wants others to see what he sees, experience what he feels, and go back home feeling like you too, have experienced what it means to live and be an argentine. luciano doesn't push or sell any type of self-serving propoganda or agenda. his services are affordable and what you take away from the tour is something that cannot be measured by money. we also booked our delta tour with cultura cercana. i don't want to spoil the tour for anyone who is interested in going .. but trust us .. it is SO worth it. you get to experience and see a whole other side of argentine life that is inaccessible to most tourists. andres and mirta, our hosts, are very gracious and they will treat you like a friend. they will show you what it means to be an argentine .. to live life passionately but with poise, and respect .. in a state of relaxation. this, i would never have learned and experienced had i not booked our tours with cultura cercana. lastly, as our trip was ending, we booked the milonga tango tour with luciano. don't waste your money seeing an overpriced tango "show." go to the milonga with luciano and you will see what tango really is all about. the secret codes of conduct and courtesy .. it was fascinating. i have only the best things to say about cultura cercana, and all of the people we met through it .. luciano, andres, mirta .. they really made our trip and experience in argentina unforgettable.

A Great Way To See Buenos Aires. My wife and I recently spent 6 days in BA and by luck on our first night in town we started talking with a couple from California who had just taken an all day tour with Luciano. They couldn't say enough about him and so I asked for his email and cell phone. The next day we spoke and set up an all day tour for the middle of our stay.
