It was a great decision because Luciano showed us so many wonderful places that we could not have possibly covered during our brief stay. He took us all over town and into the outskirts of the city to places we would have never discovered on our own. His english is great, he has a law degree but discovered he prefered showing out-of-towners his wonderful city over practicing law, so started his personal tour business. A good choice if you ask me. We could not have had a more enjoyable day, he was curtious, knowledgable, articulate, and very informative. When we were done for the day he recommend several things for us do do off of the beaten path, gave us names of restaruants to try, and suggested Milangas that we should go to. I would highly recommend booking a day with Luciano, it is a truly great way to see this marvelous city.

Outstanding, a real insight into BA. Luciano is an absolute gem. He tailors the tour to your personal taste, picking up as you go along if you haven't given him much to go on initially. His enthusiasm and knowledge make it a real pleasure.Also, the driving in BA is quite hairy and the only time I felt comfortable in a car was when Luciano was driving.

Exeptional Experience. Work-related I'm a havy duty traveler. Two days before leaving to my first stay in Buenos Aires I browsed through different travel portals and sent Luciano an eMail - and got a very quick response. After arriving he picked me up at the Hotel and we drove with his car to areas I would otherwise never get to know. I never hat a guide with such a deep insight into country's history and international developments. A highlight was the vist of the Recoleta cemetery. It was a pleasure to learn a lot about the people and the history of the country. We stayed in contact also after this 6 hour trip for 4 days more. He sent me emails about all further questions I had and organized a great trip to the exeptional Feria de Mataderos. All these services after the first tour were at no charge. A quite different experience was my attempt to take part at one of the very popular 'Free BA Tours' (they are not free but tip based). They are at the other end of the spectrum of possible tours. I can really recommend Cultura Cercana for all people who like personal service bundled with deep insights.Otto from Ausria.

Luciano: Best Tour Guide of Buenos Aires. My wife and i went home to visit family in Bogota, Colombia. We took an excursion to visit one of the places in our bucket list! Since she was little, my wife dreamed of visiting Buenos Aires, Argentina for her Grandma came back from a visit, raving about this magnificent city! I also wanted to go for i always heard this was one city not to miss.To make a long story long, we went for five days and Buenos Aires took our breath away!However, what made our visit even more special was we contracted Luciano, a local who gave us the best 8 hour tour in the world. He spoke English which helped me but it was his passion, knowledge and not limiting us to any questions we had. He took us to various parts of the city i had not read in my tour reviews. We even had lunch at a local place that was far removed from the tourists that we loved! In essence, our bucket list wish was rewarded with a great trip but if it was not for Luciano who capped it with a special day, Buenos Aires would not have been as Beautiful as expected. We want to go back for two weeks next time and of course, look up our now friend, Luciano....the best tour guide of the Paris of South America!

The city tour with Luciano was like seeing Buenos Aires with a good friend.. We booked a city tour on-line with Luciano for our first day in Buenos Aires. Speaking next to no Spanish we thought it would be a good idea to book a private tour. Luciano responded instantly and made me feel comfortable with my choice. He met us at our apartment and charmed us immediately. He was so knowlegable about the city's history, and we enjoyed a spirited discussion of American and Argentine politics, as well. We told him we were interested in seeing the countryside, but not really keen on one of the more touristy gaucho tours. He hooked us up with Juan, from Casco Viejo, who owns an estancia in Canuelas, about one hour outside of BA. Juan picked us up and drove us to his farm, gave us the grand tour on horseback and cooked us a wonderful asado, which we ate amid the fruit trees on the lawn in front of the estate house. After lunch we had another ride before we headed back to the city. It was a wonderful, relaxing day.But we weren't done with Luciano yet. When our friends from Brazil joined us for a few days, we booked Cultura Cercana's "Feeling Tango" tour. With professional dancers Paula and Rodriguez we attended a milonga. They explained all the intricacies of the tango, and we watched them dance with the other couples. It really felt like an inside look at the tango culture.Throughout our 10 days in BA, Luciano kept in touch, giving us recommendations about places to eat and things to do, and helping us get airport information we needed, etc. We really felt like we had been shown around the city by a good friend.

Great trip, great tour guide, and a great time!. I contacted Luciano by email about trip prices and recommendations and he replied immediately. When we arrived in Buenos Aires, Luciano came to our hotel to discuss potential tour options and we immediately felt comfortable with booking a tour through him. He planned an unconventional tour based on our request and took us to Tigre and the delta for the day. After seeing a small artisan craft market we took a boat tour to a friend's house where we had a nice hike and an awesome homecooked meal. Afterward we took the boat back to explore the rest of the historical parts of town and arrived back at our apartment safe and sound. I would recommend Luciano to anyone going to Buenos Aires and wants to take an unique and fun tour!

Memories for a lifetime. We decided that for our Tango experience in Argentina, to go on a Milonga tour and see the tango through local eyes. We booked a tour through Luciano at Cultura Cercana that included the tango lesson beforehand, after reading about it on the trip advisor website. The tour was just our personal group of my 4 adult children and I although we all had 2 left feet, our wonderful instructors Paula and Rodrigo took us through the steps with lots of fun and laughter. We then set off for the Milonga where we had great empanadas and drinks. Luciano explained the local customs and gave us lots of information on Buones Aires and its people. We were very nervous about dancing the tango, as everyone on the dancefloor was so good, but Paula and Rodrigo calmed our nerves and took us through the dances and it was great fun! We were then delivered back to our hotel and Luciano even emailed us through suggestions for other things to do in Buones Aires and great places to shop. We had a wonderful experience and would recommend Cultura Cercana to anyone contemplating a truely memorable experience for the "real" Buones Aires

A delightful half-day overview of BA. We booked a tour with Luciano for our first afternoon in BA. He picked us up at the hotel on time and took us to all of the major "sights". We particularly enjoyed the stops at Recoleta Cemetary where he gave us plenty of time to wander through the amazing crypts and at the Ecological Reserve. His English is excellent and he has a great deal of knowledge about the history of Argentina as well as the architecture of BA. Would highly recommend his services.

Real argentinian tango & food. I'm argentinian, and I went with an americans friends to visit my city, and contact Luciano to participate in their activities. I can say that he really shows the argentinian culture, with real tango shows and our food.
Fernando

Excellent private tour without the huge price tag!. Luciano picked us up at our hotel and in the air conditioned comfort of his late model car showed us what we wanted to see, when we wanted to see it!Our friendly, aimable guide for the day answered all our questions on any topic raised. I am insanely curious, and am interested in all aspects of the culture and politics of the countries I visit, so this is no small feat, but Luciano came up tops.I have no problem recommending this experience to all people who want a real taste of the local culture, if you want refined or raw or live a day in the shoes of an Argentinian you won't find better in Buenos Airres.

spectacular tour company, fun, very knowledgeable, priced right and safe. We did not want to see the typical tango show (broadway style) instead we went on a private tour to see where the Argentineans themselves danced. It was an incredible night, we drank local red wine with empanadas, watch the local dance the tango and venture through a few clumsy steps of our own with the help of our guide. We felt very welcomed and enjoyed it very much. Bring comfortable shoes! Take a small camera. Ask to be picked up and returned to your hotel with their private car. We enjoyed so much Luciano's company that we booked a city tour for the next afternoon with him too. He is a very well educated young men, charismatic and fluent in english. Buenos Aires has so many old, beautiful buildings and monuments that is so contrasting to what we see here in the USA. In the city tour you make a lot of stops so take comfortable clothing and walking shoes, camera and a bottle water. For a great snack tell him to take eat a sandwich the lomito (filet mignon) in la costanera. My mouth is watering as I remember the best steak I have ever eaten.

The perfect (& perfectly priced) private tour of Buenos Aires!. I had the pleasure of taking a 1/2 day city tour of Buenos Aires with Cultura Cercana tour guide and owner Luciano this past February. There were 4 people in my group and we had the best day with Luciano guiding us every step of the way. A few really great things about the tour:1) It is 100% private. There is no bus full of strangers or waiting for the group to catch up/slow down.2) The Cultura Cercana tour guides are locals and know everything there is to know about Buenos Aires. There was not a single question we asked, from food, to government, to night-life that Luciano couldn't answer.3) The pricing for the tours are PER TOUR rather than per person - a really great deal.4) It's customizable. I live in Argentina and already planned to see some areas with my visiting friends on my own. I let Luciano know the areas we would like to see and he tailored the tour to our needs. We even let him know where we planned on having lunch and he set up the tour schedule so we ended up in that area at the end of the tour. (He even made the lunch reservation for us!)Luciano (who speaks perfect English) arrived at our hotel right on time with his car ready to start the day. We drove to several areas throughout the tour and would then park and take a walk around to see additional sights in each of the areas. We had the best time touring with a local who could really provide insight into the Argentine culture and sights.Since that tour - I have recommended the Tango Tour offered by the company to another group of American visitors and have received nothing by rave reviews for how much fun it was. It's next on my list.If you want to see the real Buenos Aires with a knowledgeable, fun and safe tour company - then Cultura Cercana is for you!

Unique experience, sneak peak into the real life of the Tango - like no other. Cultura Cercana and Luciano were recommended to me by a friend. I was definitely looking to see a Tango show during my first visit to Buenos Aires, but when I read the description on the website it was so much different than all the other tours I had seen. And, the experience truly was unique and one of my favorite memories from the trip. Cultura Cercana takes you behind the scenes of the real life of the Tango, not the pre-planned shows that run night after night filled with other tourists. Instead, you get a real view into the Tango that people participate in night after night – this is not a choreographed show, but just as amazing. We learned so much more about the culture of the people and the dance, and – we had the best empanadas of our entire trip. The best part was that we were the only tourists in the place, it truly was a rare glimpse into the culture, the people and the Tango, and coming with Luciano and our teachers we felt at home. I would recommend Luciana and Cultura Cercana to anyone who is looking for an authentic experience in Buenos Aires. Although we only booked the Tango tour, Luciano showed us a bit of the city on the way back to our hotel and had such a different understanding and insight about some of the buildings and stories than we had experience on our private tour of the city arranged by the hotel the day before. I wish we had used him instead!
Tours by locals in Buenos Aires. We had a wonderful tour conducted by Elizabet who is very knowledgeable. She made the tour a great memorable experience.

August in Buenos Aires. We used Elizabet Jeckel as our guide for 3 tours . She was wonderful. ( as was our driver Daniel ) We arrived from the states early in the morning and had an afternoon tour with her on the day we arrived in Argentina.We had a full day tour the following day. Our third tour was on the day we would fly out in the evening. We were traveling with our children 25 and 27. We had a very fun holiday and Elizabet made it that much more enjoyable. Thank you Elizabet!!!

Ten star Private Tour of Buenos Aired. Elizabeth took us around this beautiful city and treated us like family she is very knowledgeable very classy the best to guide in Buenos Guide in Buenos Aires. Everything tour she set up for us was great , the VIP tango show was worth every penny. She is very detail, just follow her lead. She showed us all the attraction and sites took us to the best place for empanadas and steak. Great trip

Wonderful tour experience in Buenos Aires. Elisabet was just wonderful. She was punctual, knowledgeable ,very tuned in to our needs and had a excellent command over the English language. She was more of a friend than a guide to us. Thank you Elisabet for showing us around Buenos Aires and for the lovely surprise at the end of the tour.

Buenos Aires was an amazing city and so was our guide Elizabet.. Truly a wonderful tour of a beautiful city, Elizabet was very knowledgeable and proud of her city and it showed in her attention to detail during our tour. It was interesting to see so many of the areas of the city in just one day. Highest ratings for Elizabet and the tour she provided.

Wish I could do 6 stars. My husband set up this driving tour of BA with Elisabet - what a treat. She and her driver were prompt, so so knowledgeable and interesting. We did a three hour tour since we had a plane to catch and saw so many sections of BA that we would have never been able to experience. Even though we had spent three days exploring, after our tour, we feel like we have a good flavor for this city which is in our top ten favorite cities! We can't recommend Elisabet enough - wish we had more time because we learned so much. She even helped in bargaining for a few street vendor items. Thank you so much

An excellent tour. We had a great day with Eli. She tailored the tour (even along the way) to our interests and provided informative commentary the entire way. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Eli to visitors coming to BA - and would also advise that you do a tour with Eli on your first day in town to help orientate yourself and to know which attractions you'd like to go back to.

Tour Guide BA. We spent three full days with Elisabet and the experience was outstanding. From our early planning to every place we went, all was flawless. She is flexible, knowledgeable and a pleasure to be with. If ever in BA again our first call will be to her.
Private tour of Buenos Aires. Elizabet gave us a great tour! She was very friendly and knowledgeable. She spoke very fluent English. I recommend this tour to anyone new to BA.

Lovely day!. Elisabet was very helpful in planning a great itinerary for a one day tour of the city. She was not personally available on that day, but sent lovely Barbie to tour with us. She was extremely professional, charming, knowledgable and delightful to spend a day with. Barbie also kept in touch during our visit and quickly answered any additional questions we had. We definitely would recommend touring with this company.

Spectacular Tour. My wife and I booked Elisabet for a 1 day overview tour of the city. Elizabet was very responsive and helpful in preparing us for our visit. One we arrived, she met us with a trip agenda including places we should visit on our own on subsequent days. Elisabet was just a delight to spend the day with, her tour was spectacular. She was more than happy to help us out with the balance of our trip and was very responsive to text messages requesting information . Every aspect was very professional and personalized for what we wanted to experience. You will love this lady!

Outstanding Guide. Contacted Elisabet several months before our planned arrival and she was responsive and provided suggestions on itinerary to meet our needs. She met us at the airport on day of arrival and gave us a city tour which included a number of highlights we certainly would have missed on our own. We spent another two days with her seeing other attractions outside of the city without a miss. We not only enjoyed the tours but also her personality and willingness to make us happy with her service.

An excellent city our by Elisabet. My wife and I had two days in Buenos Aires. I contacted Elisabet by email late night and she responded immediately. I booked for the following day after comparing her proposal to a couple of others. We had a great time with her thanks to her great personality and in depth knowledge of the city, its history, the best places to visit, a great lunch at a non tourist restaurant (we went back there on the following day..) and we still keep in touch with her. She is just a great person. Highly recommended.

Two good days in LaPlata & Buenos Aires. We booked late (our fault) and were unable to reserve any preferred guides. TPS owner (Elisabet) assigned us to Barbara (her daughter) for both days. Barbara is a delightful woman with an excellent command of English and very personable (a former international airline flight attendant). However, she is not a professional / credentialed tour guide who can bring that added dimension to a tour. For the money spent, our trips to LaPlata and thru BA were enjoyable, but likely not as informative or memorable as if we had had Elisabet for our guide.

Personal Estancia Tour. We had a lovely guided to tour to San Antonio de Areco and Estancia El Ombú de Areco. We walked around San Antonio and looked through some of the stores prior to going to the Estancia, the shops had some lovely goods and crafts. We then went to the Estancia had a ride on the horses and had a traditional barbecue lunch, which also included singing of traditional songs from one of the Gauchos. Our tour guide Elisabet, was very informative and answered all our different questions about Argentina in general. We had a very relaxing day out of the city on a beautiful Estancia!

"Made my wife and I feel like we were part of the family!". My wife and I visited Buenos Aires in December 2015. During our 4 day stay, we did the following: Visited an Estancia, did a horseback ride, attended a luxurious wine and food lunch, and listen to an authentic gaucho play guitar. Following this we drove back into Buenos Aires, then attended a cooking and wine class of regional cuisine by a chef/wife in their home! Wonderful! The following day we took a brief ride through Buenos Aires, followed by Delta de Tigre boat exploration. Had a wonderful lunch, returned back to Buenos Aires, and then attended a dinner and tango demonstration at El Querandi. Marvelous! The following day we did a city tour with Margarita that included Puerto Madera, San Telmo, La Boca, several churches, Cafe Tortoni, Plaza de Mayo, a local Market, and Recoleta Cemetary. On Christmas day Elisabet took us to church and assisted us to a wonderful wine tasting that evening.Elisabet, Margarita, Elisabet's daughter and husband were all so wonderful. Caring, friendly, excellent english, accomodating; we would have seen a fraction of what we did if we had attempted this by ourselves, not being natives. We felt very safe. In summary, we would use Elisabet's services again without hesitation. Her assistance made for a memorable vacation and experience for us.

1 day tour of Buenos Aires. Barbara was our very professional, knowledgeable, gracious, hard-working tour guide. She never looked on her phone. She focused on us all day. She was dressed very nice, and gave us a parting gift! We could understand her English very well. We feel like we made a new friend! WE ASKED HER LOTS OF QUESTIONS, AND SHE KNEW EVERY ANSWER.

City tour of Buenos Aires. Elisabet gave us a full day tour of the city, hitting all the spots I had read about. Puerto Madero, Pink House, El Caminito, the Cathedral Metropolitana, Recoleta Cemetary and others. I feel we got to see the entire city with the tour and the stop she made for lunch at the Buenos Aries Grill allowed us to have a great steak or pasta.Her English is very good and she the driver would always stop when we wanted to take pictures. If you want a great tour guide give her a try you won't be disappointed.

Beautiful day in Buenos Aires. We had a great tour with Margarita on February 28, 2016. We saw so much more of Buenos Aires than we thought we could see in one day! Margarita was very knowledgeable, professional and friendly. My sister and I had a great time! Thank you for setting up this tour for us and please thank Jorge again for giving up his Sunday to drive us around - he really knows your city and the best way to maximize our time there. Elisabet and Margarita were both very responsive to e-mails setting up this tour, and contacted us a couple of days before the scheduled tour date to confirm arrangements. Margarita was right outside the cruise ship terminal when we got off the shuttle bus from the ship to the terminal.

Our first day in Buenos Aires. We made our plans from home reading all the different company reviews and narrowing it down until we entered on this tour. While we have the whole week to wander around we decided an overview of the area was a good thing so that we would feel a bit more comfortable with getting around on our own. We had lots of questions about the area and received some very good answers and a follow up email with some details about things we would like to do that our tour guide was suggesting we might like. Marga, aka Margarita was wonderful. She arrived early to make sure she had the right pick up location and we were very quickly walking and talking and checking out the Plaza de Mayo. The weather is very hot, a heat wave, that will last the week, but we managed quite well. We would stop on the shade to take about what we were seeing or about to see and then venture out to explore more closely. Our driver was always just around the corner to pick us up and move us along. These moments of air conditioning were great. We stored our bag in the car while we were out exploring and had Some water while we drove. We stopped for lunch and had the set lunch at Buenos Aires Grill. The price for lunch was great and the food was really good! It kept us going all day. Jorge was our driver and he navigated the roads with caution and experience and I always felt safe and glad that I was not driving. We felt this was a good decision to start our visit with a city tour. Thank you so much for making our day wonderful.

Best way to visit a city/country. We were lucky enough to have Elizabet J. as our private tour guide in Buenos Aires. She was well organized, right from the start and provided us with information before we even boarded the plane. She was well organized, very prepared, well informed, a great story teller, efficient and fun to be with. She thought of everything. She took us to a variety of places to get the flavour of Buenos Aires. I would not hesitate to hire her. We highly recommend her. You will not be disappointed.

First Visit to Buenos Aires. There is no better way to get the most out of a trip to Buenos Aires than to have Elisabet as your guide. She was with us from the minute we arrived until we departed. Her suggestions as to what to see in the few days we had to spend in that area were right one. Her knowledge of the regions history is outstanding. A trip to the Gaucho Ranch is a must. Rode a horse for the first ttime in my life and then feasted on excellent Argentinean beef.

Buenos Aires City Tour and Hacienda Visit. Guides (Patricia and Barbara) provided by Elisabet on both trips were knowledgable, entertaining and spoke near perfect English. Lunches on both days were ones to remember. Thanks for making our stay in BA so enjoyable.

Pleasant tour of Buenos Aires. Elisabet provided my husband and I a very nice tour of Buenos Aires in early February 2016. The interesting neighborhoods and important sites were discussed. Elisabet picked us up at our hotel in a comfortable car with a driver who was very sweet and responsive. They had an excellent system of dropping us off with Elisabet to view a point of interest and then she would radio the driver to pick us up at the the other end. It worked very well, was convenient for us and far better that the torture of touring on a mega bus! We appreciate the time she devoted to us. Elisabet's goal is definitely to please the client. She did just that.

Very informative and professional.. We only had a couple of days in Buenos Aires and wanted to make the most of it, so we decided to book a private tour. Elisabet, the owner, was booked on our available day, but she set us up with Barbara. Barbara arrived on time and met us in the lobby of our hotel. We set off on our tour, starting with La Boca and continuing from there. At each stop, we were able to leave our non-essential items and purchases in the car (since the driver stayed with the car) so that was nice. Plus, we were each given a bottle of water at the start and we needed it because it was quite hot that day! Barbara spoke excellent English so there were no communication issues at all. She knows her stuff and was able to answer most questions we had. We hit the high points of the city and even saw a few things we would never have discovered on our own. Plus we stopped at a nice restaurant for lunch. At the end of the day, we were dropped off at our hotel. Everyone was courteous and friendly. I would recommend them!

First class. We had a brilliant day with Elizabeth - it makes such a difference to have the insight of a private guide - so knowledgeable and easy and helpful in every way. Our very good driver Eduardo never lost his cool through the traffic - and the temperature today was 39! Would highly recommend using Elizabet to anyone coming to Buenos Aires.

Visit to Buenos Aires. TPS Buenos Aires provided us with an excellent personalized private tour with a van. We visited all sections of the city and our guides and driver provided us with informative and enjoyable narrations about each area. Excellent guides driven by a safe driver in a modern vehicle. Great experience.

Buenos Aires. Elizabeth was knowledgeable except we felt a lot of time was just fillers. We really could have done everything in one day. The afternoon of the 1st day after lunch we had a trip to the library next door to lunch them we went back to our hotel. We could easily done the cruise that afternoon.

Excellent Private Tour of Buenos Aires! You will not be disappointed.. My husband and I took a day tour of Buenos Aires before our South American cruise. We were met at the airport by our wonderful tour guide, Margarita, who gave us a warm welcome hug and made us comfortable from the first second we met. She was extremely knowledgeable, patiently answered all of our questions, and showed us all of the wonderful sights of the city. We spent a most enjoyable day together. Also, Elisabeth (the tour company owner) was spectacularly efficient -- quickly answering emails and ensuring that everything went smoothly. I highly recommend TPS if you are considering a private tour. You won't be disappointed.

Wonderful Tour of Buenos Aires. We arranged this Private Tour for our stop in Buenos Aires off of the Star Princess Cruise Ship. Margarita was our Guide and she was waiting for us with a Sign when we got off the Ship. She spoke perfect English and was very knowledgeable about her City. We had a Driver that dropped us off at different Sites and he was back to pick us up when Margarita would call for him. We saw the beautiful City and had a wonderful Lunch. I highly recommend Elisabet's Company. A Private Tour is definitely the way to go.

Outstanding tour guide!. Elizabet is a phenomenal tour guide. She is extremely knowledgeable, interesting, and a joy to be with. She provides excellent insights and contexts so the traveler gets a thorough understanding of Buenos Aires and Argentina.I recommend TPS Buenos Aires unconditionally. You cannot go wrong with Elizabet!

Exceeded all expectations and my expectations were high!!. I normally don't write a review while am still,traveling, but I just can't wait to express my appreciation and affection for the wonderful tour guide we had in Buenos Aires, Elisabet Jeckel. My husband and I were fortunate to be able to spend 3 days in her delightful company, benefiting not only from her professionalism and vast knowledge of all things Buenos Aires, but her good humor and willingness to go the extra mile to guarantee that we had the perfect experience, in the process creating beautiful memories that will stay with us forever. Day 1 she took us on her city tour which included places in the city that were a bit off the beaten path, as well as the major sights one expects to see. Day 2, we went to San Isidre and Tigre, suburbs which are north of the city, and we took a boat tour of the Tigre Delta. This was fun and it was interesting to see how life happens outside of the city - it didn't hurt that the weather was spectacular! On our 3rd day with Elisabet, she took us to an Estancia in the Pampas and for me, this was the highlight - it was so beautiful, peaceful and the way the gaucho interacted with his horse, it was magical. Whatever you do, don't miss the opportunity to do this - and do it with Elisabet! I knew Elisabet was going to be great even before I met her because of her clear and timely communication with me via email throughout the months before our trip. She made arrangements for us to go to a private wine tasting/pairing that was very good and informative and if you have any interest in wine, I suggest you have her book this for you. I encourage you to go to her website to read more details about her tours and what she offers, but trust me, if you decide to use Elisabet as your personal guide while you are in Buenos Aires, you will not be disappointed. As a matter of fact, you will probably want to thank me, so I 'll just end this review by saying "you're very welcome!" PS - I would be remiss not to mention Carlos, Elisabet's wonderful driver. He didn't speak English but communicated with his smile and cheerful disposition. Carlos truly is a gem and his presence only added to the fun.

A great way to see Buenos Aires!. Elisabet is the perfect guide! She has an encylopaedic knowledge of Argentina and showed me some of the wonderful sights of Buenos Aires with a narrative that was at the same time hugely informative, entertaining and personal. A fabulous introduction to the city!

A great intro to BA. Elisabeth was charming, informative, thorough and extremely well organized. The day was an A+ in every respect! None of my BA acquaintances could believe all we saw in four hours.

Gem of Buenos Aires. We met Elisabet Jeckel in Buenos Aires in 2014 when she showed us around her beautiful city. We were so impressed by her knowledge and friendly manner we arranged to meet up with Elisabet again when we visited in November 2015. It was just like meeting up with an good friend. Elisabet arranged a special "tasting" tour of Buenos Aires in November as we had visited the many city sights last year. She also included some interesting city sights and provided very interesting commentary on places we were visiting. For lunch we went to a very small local steak house called "La Carniceria". What a unique and satisfying experience. Later that afternoon Elisabet had arranged for us to have a wine tasting and pairing experience at Anuva Wines. Elisabet takes care of everything and is a pleasure to be with. Her driver is also very courteous and helpful. Elisabet is a must if you are wanting to experience the real Buenos Aires. We are happy to call her a friend, as well as a very professional tour guide.

Buenos Aires in One Day. Very good tour of Buenos Aires! Not only the main attractions, but also some hidden gems in terms of buidings (and graves!) that you might pass by without seeing if not explained and given the interesting background story. Make sure that you take the full day of guiding otherwise you will certainly miss out of some nice parts of the city. Very good value for money (bring USD or EUR cash for payment). DE - Switzerland
Swift tour of Buenos Aires!. Elisabet showed us around Buenos Aires - we have a great time sightseeing all around town despite the rain! Thank you Elisabet :-)

Buenos Aires Tour. Our private tour with Elisabet was exciting and memorable. During our tour we visited La Boca, Tigre, and CaminitoWe were given adequate time to enjoy each of these lovely places of interest. Traveling time to each was efficient and friendly. Elisabet was very knowledgeable and shared interesting facts and history with us throughout the tour.

Excellent. Elisa was a great tour guide and she adapted to our needs. In addition, it was raining and she had umbrellas for us. Also, she provided us with water. She was knew w everything about Buenos Aires, I would recommend her to any traveler.

Beautiful Buenos Aires. Elisabet met me at my hotel. She was very personable and I felt instantly like I was with someone I knew and trusted. We spent a very enjoyable day together exploring sites in Buenos Aires as she filled me in on the history of what we were seeing. I feel as though I have a personal friend in BA and would look for her if ever I had a chance to return.

Elisabet Guide to a Perfect Trip to Buenos Aires. Elisabet was more than just a private tour guide. Without her we would have missed out on the true flavor of Buenos Aires, as she guided us to just the right amount of tourist attractions as well as local sites and local artisans Elisabet and her daughter, Barbara, took care of us prior to our arrival, during our stay and continues to help with the delivery of packages now that we are back home. Hands down they know Buenos Aires. Hearing that Elisabet was a personal shopper, I requested custom shoes. Elisabet and Barbara picked out several places and set up meetings before we even arrived. As a private tour guide, she and her driver took us to sites we would not have gone to alone and they were fabulous and exciting. They were so helpful in making reservations for us and Barbara even hand delivered our Opera tickets to us the day we arrived. I credit so much of the ease and success of our trip to their attentiveness, responsiveness and reliability. I hear there is an art tour coming up and I can’t wait to try that on my next trip to BA

A gracious and attentive host. My husband and I had one day in Buenos Aires with my 88 yr. old mother before we boarded a cruise ship. Elisabet arranged for a pick-up from the airport the night before, then arrived promptly to take us on a full day tour of the city that included lunch in a part of town frequented by locals rather than tourists . She was our guide for the day as she had a driver who dropped us off for the walking portions and arrived promptly to pick us up for transport to the next stop. We learned so much about the history of both B.A. and Argentina. She tailored our tour to include some shopping whilst showing us the main sights of the city - La Boca, the Recoleta Cemetery and others. We were most impressed with her concern that my mother was enjoying the tour and at the same time not overdoing it. A great and safe way to see a gorgeous city.
BA Visit. Elisabet is friendly, very informative and well organized. She and her driver are very good. We recommend her

Day tour of buenos aires. Elisabet and her driver were so welcoming, giving us a wonderful tour, taking us to places we had never been to before. Elisabets knowledge gave us an insight into buenos aires we had not thought of. We would not hesitate in recommending her to others. Her English was very good. Thank you Elisabet.

A Great Day In Buenos Aires. We were three couples docked in Buenos Aires for 36 hours. Elisabet arranged for a driver and comfortable van for our tour. She is a very professional guide who went out of her way to make our day interesting and stimulating. We were given an informative and interesting overview of the history of BA. Elisabet's narrative was the perfect accompaniment to the sites we saw. She perfectly balanced what we thought we wanted to see with expert guidance and suggestions. Elisabet was always courteous, patient and has an excellent command of English. It was a pleasure to be with her.On our second day in BA we took another tour through the ship since we had a late evening flight. There is simply no comparison. Elisabet got us to places and gave us insights into interesting parts of the city that were beyond our second guides awareness. While cost was not our primary concern, we got far greater value from our day with Elisabet for a lot less money than we paid for the ships tour. We recommend her professional service without hesitation.Elaine and Tom Potter

Elisabet Jechel - What a jewel!. In November, I contacted Elizabet 2 days before arriving in BA because I was confined to an orthodic boot and realized I would not be able to walk around as much as I usually do. I lucked out and she was able to make a couple of holes in her schedule to escort us with car and driver.First , we were grounded for 6 hours in Cordoba because BA airport was shut down due to rains.I was unable to telephone her( I did not have the correct country code in my phone), so i emailed my daughter in Pennsylvania who contacted her about the delay. Apparently she was very reassuring to my daughter who reported back that I would be in good hands. Sure enough, Elizabet had waited with the car and driver she had arranged for our pickup, and accepted no additional compensation for her time. With the crazy hoardes of delayed passengers in the airport this was truly a lifesaving service.She customized our itineraries "on the fly" once she realized I had been there before, but my husband had not, and since we had all day itineraries with her, but not consequetively, she gave us good sugggestions of where to go and what would be possible in my hampered state, on the days that we were on our own. Her love for her country was apparent in the pride she displayed in showing us around and giving us the background history. I appreciated that Much of what she explained was local knowledge and not just canned information from a guide book. The cars and drivers she provided were all efficient and courteous. What more can I say, she saved the day! I have no hesitation recommending her and apologise for this late review.

Private tour of Buenos Aires. Elisabet provides an excellent tour of Buenos Aires. She is very knowledgable about the various neighborhoods and cultural differences to each. She is also well versed in the political changes that have affected Argentina as it moved from one form of government to another over the last century. She arranges for a private car and driver so that her attention is able to be focused on her clients rather than having to manage the Buenos Aires traffic and try to provide a narrative at the same time. I would recommend her to the traveler who wants to see as much of BA as possible in a limited amount of time.

El Tigre- Estancia. We spent 2 days touring with Elisabet. My wife, daughter and myself, we were greeted at the airport taken to our hotel then a city tour. We enjoyed a lunch at a small local restaurant, followed by a tour of the Tigre delta. The next day we had a wonderful day going to the Estancia. Her English and friendly manner made for an experience to remember during our time in Buenos Aires. The tour was customized to suite our needs. i would recommend touring with Elisabet.

El Tigre. We used Elisabet for a day tour of Buenos Aires and El Tigre. She was flexible, friendly, had a great comprehension and use of English and was an all around great tour guide. She was able to adjust our tour due to the rain and wishes of out group. Recommended a great restaurant. Highly recommend her.

This is the tour of Buenos Aires you're looking for.. My family recently took a day tour of Buenos Aires given by Elisabet. Our group of 5 was from age 20 to 89. We had contacted Elisabet prior to our arrival and made arrangements for a customized tour. Elisabet picked us up from the cruise terminal. Her English was great, she totally understood not only what we wanted to see, but understood our family dynamic and made everyone in our group feel special. She had a nice mix of riding and walking, old and new, rich and casual. Even her driver was exceptional, slowing down or pulling over for photos, providing refreshments. The sights were great, souvenir shop we requested was perfect and Elisabet's lunch selection was incredible. It was the best food on our trip. Elisabet's knowledge is outstanding, we received a running commentary about the city, the people, politics, etc. By the time the tour ended we felt like one of Elisabet's family. Elisabet was absolutely terrific, a real gem; don't pass up the opportunity to use Elisabet's tour guide experience.

Elizabet opened Buenos Aires to us. We contacted Eizabet for a full day tour of Buenos Aires and also a Delta Excursion dayShe picked us up at the airport and commenced an enthusiastic, comprehensive, informative introduction to Buenos Aires. She showed us the highlights and made us feel what is like to live in the city. Even though the weather was raining and cold, Elizabet kept us interested and awake while fighting jet lag.... We had an authentic and very good meal at the Buenos Aires Grill and she showed us less frequented tour stops like the terrific Museum of the Bicentenial and the wonderful El Ateneo Bookstore.On another day she took us to San Isidro to see the lovely homes. We took a boat tour of the Tigre Delta with its many canals and had a lunch at a small local family restaurant (Home) with delicious local food.Elizabet was a wonderful knowledgeable companion tour guide

Elizabet is the best!. Elizabet gave my family a tour and she was wonderful. Very knowledgeable about the city and its history. She also went the extra mile to make sure we saw parts of the city that weren't originally on our to do list. She was helpful and so fun to be around.

Personal tour. I arranged the tour with high expectations as this was the first time my family had ever been to South America. Elizabet reached out to me before we arrived asking if we needed any assistance with our travel plans. She arranged a Tango Dinner Show and provided solid advice for our trip. I felt like we were friends before we met. My family had a fantastic day with Elizabet. She took us to all the major attractions, described Argentina history, politics, and culture. For the remainder of our stay, my family was always quoting her or recalling how special the day had been. She was professional, patient, kind, and helpful. If you are traveling to Buenos Aires, Elizabet's tour is a must do, she lived up to all my expectations and more.

Christmas tour. We had our Buenos Aires tour on 24, December with Elisabet. And it was very good. Just exactly what I wanted. She is very knowledgable. We received all the information we needed in a clear and easy way. Elisabet has very personal attitude to her tourists and ready to do exactly what you prefer and not just goes through the tour "check list" of mustang see things. Elisabet gave us a lot of practical information: where to eat, where to shop, where to walk on our own etc. And this is very important! We did not have much time in the city and we did not have time to find out all this ourselves. She also saved our Christmas. The restaurant that I had booked way before the trip cancelled our dinner 2 days before the trip. Elisabet found another very good and reasonable restaurant for us and even paid a deposit. If you go to Buenos Aires book some time with Elisabet. It's worth it really. Next time I'll do it for sure again!

Great local knowledge and excellent tour. Elisabet gave us a fantastic insight into both the well known and lesser sights of BA. Her local knowledge helped ease us in on our first visit to the Paris of South America. Would use her again for any service that she offered.

Elisabet's Buenos Aires 26 November 2014. Elisabet was our wonderful tour guide whilst in Buenos Aires 2 weeks ago. We were a group of six who were extremely happy with Elisabet's professional, friendly and very efficient manner. She provided the important history and city information of Buenos Airies in a factual and sometimes light hearted manner. She provided a unique tour for us that met all our expectations. We enjoyed her company. Elisabet also followed up with a phone call to ensure we all enjoyed our visit in Buenos Aires, especially the Tango Show she had also booked for us. An absolutely delightful visit to Buenos Aires that was made so much better by having Elisabet show us her city! We are planning another visit in 2015 and hoping Elisabet will be available for us.

Double the enjoyment!. On our initial outing Elizabet, with her extensive in-depth knowledge of Buenos Aires and environs, provided my wife and me with a rewarding overview of the city. Her resourcefulness proved invaluable under the challenge of navigating between rainshowers that particular day. She made it smooth and easy as we drove from section to section, popping into this and that out-of-the-way stop, We felt like we were portenos for a day, at the same time making new discoveries.On a second excursion we experienced the flavor (literally) of life on an estancia out in the countryside, including a full-course barbecue with a show featuring tango and high-stepping acrobatics, followed by a thrilling riding exhibition.All of this was done without a hitch within the planned time frame - not to mention the little extras like a cup of fresh-brewed mate along the way! Elizabet knows her stuff.

Tasty BA tour. We ponder the wonder of our recent trip to Buenos Aires as we sip on our mate tea. We now know what this is and the proper way to prepare it because our guide, Elisabet, taught us how. Don't go to this fabulous city without her- we enjoyed her Tasty BA tour and loved getting a first hand introduction to the cultural culinary delights. We are glad we did this at the start of our trip to Argentina as we were able to ask her all of the detailed questions that made our entire trip more fun. A must do!

Estancia Visit. This was one of the most pleasant tours we had. Elisabet was interesting and knowledgeable. I would whole heartedly recommend this excellent guide. She was pleasant and concerned that our age and that of our granddaughter interests were met. She is a lovely person. Betsy B

Estancia visit. I booked a tour with Elizabet to go out of the city to visit one of the ranches---estancia. She gave me several choices and an honest evaluation of what to expect. She is very knowledgable and a pleasant companion. Her English is great and I would not hesitate to hire her again for whatever tour she may be giving. I highly reccommend her.

very proffesinal guide. Our tour was at sunday, so Elisabet's husband was free and had the position of our driver. In addition to her proffesional guidness, we had Jorje's recommendetions about other sites in Argentina.Elisabet is very pleasant and explains nicely and according to our will to hear.She answered any request of us. She has unbelievable knoledge. Her English is excelent.We enjojed and recomend!!!

Two fantastic days in Buenos Aires. My husband and I spend two of the most wonderful days in Buenos Aires and surrounding areas. Elisabet is a fantastic guide with an amazing amount of knowledge to share. Our time spent with Elisabeth could not have been better and we could not have asked for more. We highly recommend anyone visiting Buenos Aires to book any tours Elisabet has to offer.We had already been to Buenos Aires and through very efficient correspondence before we left we organised to have our first day visiting a Gaucho Village and then lunch on a Estancia, both were amazing and very different. The last day was spent in the city and we visited many very interesting sites and Elisabeth had the full history and explanation for all. The tour was a little off the beaten track of the city as we had seen most of the main sites on our last visit.Thank you Elisabet for our great times together, we will always remember them and hope to see you sometime in Australia. Annette & Geoff

An Amazing Guide in Buenos Aires.. I had the pleasure of booking Elisabet for three tours while I was in Buenos Aires with my 75 year old mother. Elisabet is truly remarkable and made us feel like we were seeing the City with an old friend. The nice thing about her tours is that you can tell her what you want to do and see and she not only makes it happen but makes it happen flawlessly. We did an 8-hour city tour, a 3-hour shopping tour, and a 3-hour cathedral/Casa Rosada/San Telmo Market tour. She was so lovely with my mother and made sure that the pace was always perfect. When we wanted theater tickets before we left the U.S. all I had to do was e-mail Elisabet and she had front-row seats waiting for us when we arrived. She truly takes care of anything you could need even before you arrive -- that is first class service. When I mentioned my mother wanted to see some of the sights related to Pope Francis -- Elisabet made it happen.Her knowledge of the City and the sights is remarkable (as is her English). We could not have asked for a better guide here in Buenos Aires. If you are coming to the City I cannot recommend Elisabet enough.

Elisabet Jackel - Best Tour Guide in Argentina!. What a wonderful tour guide! More like catching up with an old friend. Elisabet knows so much about the area, is accommodating and will help you plan a tour around all your favourite things. She knows the history, great stories, knows the best shopping spots and all the little hidden gems that you don't find in tour books! Her english is perfect and she knows where to get the best empanadas! I thoroughly enjoyed this tour and would come back again in the future to tour around the other amazing spots in Bunoes Aires with Elisabet!

Tours by Elisabet Jeckel. Elisabet was wonderful! This was our first time in Buenos Aires. Elisabet was very helpful from the start. She provided helpful tips before our trip. The day before our tour, we had the opportunity to shop, dine and attend a tango thanks to these tips. The tour itself was very well planned and quite professional. She had given thought to many of the smallest details which makes the difference between good and great. On our next visit, we will definitely book a tour with her. Another plus, we had a personal driver along with Elisabet as our guide.

Elisabet Jeckel...there would not be a better tour guide. We in a group of 6 from Canada spent 1 day in Buenos Aires. Elisabet was our tour guide...she was most accommodating, arranging a pickup of our group at the Cruise terminal and taking us on an 8 hour tour of beautiful Buenos Aires. She took us to many attractions, afforded us a detailed history of the city, took us to a lovely non-tourist local restaurant with Argentinian menu for lunch, dropped us off at our hotel and even arranged a delightful Tango Show and Dinner for us that evening. Then she arranged the next day a shuttle for us from the hotel to the airport. She is indeed the best!!

Totally excellent guide/companion/friend. I (64) and my daughter (24) have just returned to the UK having spent three days in Buenos Aires, two days with Elisabet and her driver Daniel.They made certain that our trip was truly excellent; a full day touring BA - I think we really did see all the key places with an enthusiastic, intelligent and uninterested individual who soon seemed like a friend. The pace was relaxed, there was time to spend longer where we wanted more time - all in all it was great.We next went a couple of hours out of the city to an Estancia, horse riding, (or pony and trap) old singing gaucho who was charming, young handsome gauchos if that's your thing. Great food, variety, quality and taste.Elisabeth helped choose and book restaurants, a Tango Show and a tutored wine tasting.I've had guide services on tens of occasions around the world - this was truly excellent.Thank you.

Elisabet Jeckel - the best. We spent a day with tour guide Elisabet Jeckel who was the best tour guide we've ever had. She provided a great overview of Buenos Aires: history, attractions, shopping, dining, tips for taxis, money, etc. She was fun to spend the day with. Everyone in our group loved her. In addition to city tours she provides personal shopping, can arrange tango shows, cooking classes, wine tasting, or ranch visits. Find her at: tpsbuenosaires@gmial.com

When you find the right guide it's great. I found Elisabet during my research for a guide for Buenos Aires. I had read several of the positive reviews about both her tours and her English. We traded a couple of emails, and found her mostHelpful with other parts of our stay in BA. I asked her to give us a tour through her eyes and include some interesting places that may not be part of a regular bus tour. She did just that. Our day with her was just great. Her English is excellent , her knowledge of the city and country is extensive. I would highly recommend both her and any recommendations she gives you whetherIt's about where to see the tango or were to go shopping. I would also mention that she uses an excellent driver. The traffic in this city is exceptionally challenging, and thought he did a great job.

Excellent Tour Guide in Buenos Aires. On the recommendation of a friend we booked Elsebet, a local tour guide for three days of touring in and around Buenos Aires. She researched our interests and then gave us three full days of incredible tours - an all-day gaucho experience, a trip to El Tigre and the Delta and a customized tour around areas of Buenos Aires we had not seen before. Elsebet was a wealth of knowledge about locations, architecture, and culture. My husband and I had wonderful discussions with her and felt like she was a family member taking us around "her" town. She also had an excellent and a safe driver so she could provide share information about sights as we traveled. I highly recommend taking tours with her. You will learn so much, take way to many photos, have a great time and wish you had more days to travel with her. We will definitely book her again when we go back to BA.

Best Personal Guide of a Buenos Aires. My wife and I decided to look for a customized guide of Buenos Aires and we found Elisabet to be excellent in the conduct of her tour. She is a very charming lady who understands her country and city truly as a knowledgable local does and she shared with us not only about the places we visited but also about the country, the economy and her own views about politics. In a day we spent with her she had given us a crash course about Argentina. We acquired the local perspective about the country. Thank you Elisabet for taking care of us which make our stay much more pleasant.

The Benefits of a Local Guide. To Whom It May Concern: Elisabet, the bright, effervescent sun in the Buenos Aires flag showed me the cultural riches of this boundless, yet boundaried city. As soon as I contracted with her, she sent me nice, quick emails every couple of weeks as an introduction. They were valuable to a busy teacher such as myself. My plan was to slip a trip to the Southern Hemisphere during Thanksgiving break. I didn't want to lose a minute! Considering my wide range of interests (dance,education,art, geography), Elisabet had a difficult task ahead of her. She patiently and joyously considered each and every interest as she artfully danced us about the metropolis with Daniel at the helm. We saw: European Master works of art; the essence of Eva Peron in at least three places; the birthplace of Tango; the Rio de la Plata; the Casa Dorada; we rode on the widest road in South America; tried local fare for lunch; and more! Since she is a proud local, Elisabet knows all the hot spots, nooks and crannies, basilicas, cemeteries, country clubs, tea rooms, and just about anything you'd want to find in this exciting mixture that is Buenos Aires. Elisabet will take you on a journey that you won't forget! Don't plan your trip to Argentina without talking to her first.

Fantastic Tour!. If your looking for a knowledgeable tour guide who can answer all of your questions this is the person. She is smart, kind and knowledgeable. She knows where to go is flexible and will make you feel like a local.

Excellent Tour Guide. We were in Buenos Aires on a cruise ship visit and had arranged for Elisabet Jeckel to give us a tour. She was great! Picked us up early and we toured the usual sights ahead of the bus tours. She took us to out of the way places and to terrific BBQ restaurant for lunch. She speaks excellent English, and provided us with a terrific visit to Buenos Aires. Highly recommend her!!

Best guide in BA!. Elisabet is the best introduction to Buenos Aires and to Argentina that any traveler could ask for. Her warm and gracious personality, plus her knowledge and affection for her country and her city, made her a delightful companion for our two days with her. We had been to BA six years ago and had seen many of the usual sights on that trip, so Elisabet tailored our time to be sure we saw things that were new to us. One highlight not to be missed is a boat trip from Tigre through the Delta del Parana - Buenos Aires' version of a "little Venice." HollyK

Elisabet was the best!. We only had one day, but Elisabet made sure it was perfect. We visited all the major sites of Buenos Aires, had lunch at La Payuca, and she even served us mate (traditional tea) in the afternoon. She is thoroughly grounded in Argentinian history and culture, and made the day delightful --so many good memories. She has a wonderful sense of humor and a ready smile. We can't recommend her enough.

Made Buenos Aires come alive. Elisabet has a charming personality, accompanied by knowledge & patienceNothing was too much trouble for her during our 3 days together,Highly recommend her guide services for a visit to Buenos Aires,

GREAT BA tour. We couldn't take the tour offered by our ship as the timing wasn't right for our flight home, so we contacted Tours Buy Locals and found Elisabet--she was fantastic! Although we didn't have more than 4-5 hours, she showed us her city with charm, enthusiasm and grace as well as a lot of knowledge! She was flexible--adding another couple at the last minute (which involved getting a different vehicle)--skipping lunch so we could see more and getting us to the airport on time!She was wonderful

Best Tour Guide in Buenos Aires!. Elizabet from the moment of emailing her to the end of the tour was friendly, professional and a pleasure to travel around Buenos Aires with.Elizabeth customised a tour just for me, encompassing all my interests and requests and provided some lovely surprises along the way. Not only the great cultural sites but she also knows all the great places to eat and shop! I would definitely recommend Elizabet for a personal 1:1 tour to group tours. her English is perfect and she is very accommodating and can move at whatever pace you prefer.I ran out of time - but next time I want to see more of Buenos Aires or tour a few of the specialty shops I wont hesitate to book Elizabet again.

Superb pampas trip, gaucho culture. I did this excursion with my 12 year old son. It boils down to a trip to a historic town in the pampas, then several hours at a working ranch (estancia). It was excellent.Picked up dead on time from Puerto Madero by Caesar, who is a very pleasant man and offered many interesting anecdotes on the trip to San Antonio de Areco which took about two hours.The host Guillermo is delightful, energetic and a great ambassador for gaucho culture. His tour of the town took about an hour and was fascinating. You will be a person with great strength of character to avoid buying something from the silversmith shop towards the end of the town visit.The Estancia Ombu de Areca is picture perfect, an old low lying colonial building with high ceilings surrounded by shade trees. We enjoyed a short horse ride, then had an excellent asado lunch before being treated to the musical stylings of one of the oldest and most famous gauchos and then a superb display of horsemanship.This trip is not cheap but is well worth it for anyone seeking to get out of BA for the day and wanting to learn about gaucho culture. Guillermo is a fantastic guide and clearly loves his job. This was the last thing we did on a 9 day trip to BA and it was probably the highlight. PS we organised to be dropped back at the airport and this went smoothly.

Great day out, very well organised. Our 8 yr old daughter was looking for a longer horse ride than what's usually offered and Guillermo organised this for us so she was really happy. We were picked up right on time and ha d wonderful day. Laura was a fantastic and informative guide and as a local knows everything about the town and estancias. If I had my time over we may have tried to stay a night as the town is full of character and there's lots of great artisan shops to browse etc. it took 2 hrs from Palermo in the morning and 1.45 return so you really do need the whole day. It was a great way to appreciate some of the Pampas and Gaucho culture if you only have a short time and it was a. Eryn outrage experience rather than a big group so Inwould highly recommend this tour.

Excellent excursion day. We had a wonderful day with first interesting sightseeing and then out to the countryside for horseback riding and lunch.The have rooms and cabins for rent in the countryside. I strongly recommend to sleep over one night and do longer horseback tours. Juan Manuel is excellent company and very well educated tour guide. You will have a wonderful experience. We didn't know you could sleep over and we regret it.

Great day in country. We were hoping for a real contrast with the days in the city and that was certainly what happened. The town tour was a great introduction to the area brought to life by the explanations of Guillermo. This was followed by the hospitality and great food at the ranch. The demonstration of the trust between the horse and the gaucho was amazing.

Estancia Tour - Excellent!. A group of us visited Argentina and stayed for a week. We hired Guillermo and Jose Maria for a day trip to Estancia de Areco. He picked us up promptly as planned in a comfortable van. The tour was full of great information! We learned a lot of the town, culture, and people of San Antonio de Areco. The ranch tour was the highlight of our trip. The staff at the ranch were accommodating and extremely friendly. Guillermo made the most of our time and was attentive to our needs. He and Jose Maria speak excellent English. They are definitely recommended as tour guides for anyone who wants to get out of Buenos Aires and tour the old countryside, and learn more about the Gaucho lifestyle. Definitely top notch tour guides!
Excellent tour. We really loved our day with Camino Pampa. Great day trip outside buenos aires. Laura was an exceptional guide the whole day was awesome. Many thanks.

Fun with locals. Enjoyed the tour of San Antonio de Areco and Camino Pampa Estancia. Prompt and friendly transfer from Buenos Aries Hotel. Great local guide to show us around town and then a fun and relaxed horse ride and lunch with entertainment. Even though it was for the tourists, it was only a small group and felt like being part of the local families daily life. Highly recommend!

Brilliant Day In The Countryside. Bit of a splurge and a great tour. We were picked up by a friendly, pleasant driver named Jose Maria, who explained the route and pointed out sites along the way during the hour or so drive. Nice guy with engaging stories to tell. In San Antonio de Areca, we were met by our tour guide. Laura is a lifelong resident of the town, a retired English teacher, and a charming, energetic guide. She's a wealth of knowledge about the history of the town and during the tour she reminded me of the favorite teachers I've had. The town itself is pretty and we saw a number of the silver shops and then stopped at a great chocolate stop. From there, we went on a tour of an estancia where we had the chance to do some very calm horseback riding, followed by a traditional barbecue lunch, and a horse whisperer show. The estancia is lovely and the hosts congenial and efficient. I can't say enough about the lovely personalities of both Laura and Jose Maria. Both of them are very warm and absolute professionals, happy to share their opinions and knowledge. Well worth it.

Our Favorite Tour During our Stay in BA!!. We absolutely loved and highly recommend this experience! Our guide, Juan Manuel, was so engaging, funny and above all, knowledgeable. Both the town and estancia were gorgeous and gave a such a nice feel for Argentina outside of BA!! Highly recommended!

EXCELLENT Tour and Service. Our stay in Buenos Aires was limited and we knew we wanted to experience something outside of the city that is indicative of the culture and the area. We didn't want anything "canned" or super expensive. With such limited time we didn't want to rent a car and try to maneuver our way around. After reviewing a few of the reviews of Camino Pampa and other Estancias we settled on Camino Pampa. I reached out to Guillermo and I got an immediate response back with all of my questions answered. Our driver Jose (which was arranged by Guillermo) picked us up right on time. We picked up two other people (Mike and Mike) and off we went. It was a cloudy day with the occasional ran, but that didn't stop us. Our first stop was San Antonio de Areco where we met our guide, Juan Manuel Hernandez. He was amazing! We had family members who did not speak Spanish and his English was better than ours. Juan is a very interesting person in that he is well traveled, knows his countries history (and ours) probably better than most Americans. He is passionate about what he does and describes everything with enthusiasm that is most contagious. We walked around the town, church, silversmith, chocolate factory and then onto the Estancia. Here they greeted us with wine and delicious empanadas. Followed by the best Asado we had while in Buenos Aires. A Gaucho did a horsemanship demonstration that defies logic. I don't want to give it away, but I can't even train my dog to do what the horse did. Then we went on a horseback ride around the Estancia. I personally would have liked to have a longer ride but it did start to rain. Personally, this didn't bother more than it bothered my hair. I would highly recommend this tour. Honestly, when we go back to Buenos Aires, we will probably book this again. That is how much we enjoyed it.
Recreating the Batchlorette. Loved it! Super tour, great driver, delicious lunch, fantastic horses, picturesque ranch: highly recommend to all interested.

Great Tour for culture and fun. We loved the day! The tour of town was informative and the time at the ranch amazing! Loved our tour guide, Juan Manuel Hernandez. Shared lots of relevant info in an informative and interesting way. The town has an amazing chocolate shop! I recommend this tour.

Estancia tour.. This tour was by far our favorite. There was no attempt to sell us tourist trinkets, our pick up and drop off was on time and our driver Caesar was great. Our guide, Maria was exceptionally thoughtful and full of information about the region. The tour of both the town and the Estancia was focused on the historical and artistic qualities of the region. The food and demonstration at the Estancia was also exceptional. We really enjoyed every minute and highly recommend this tour!

Amazing place and people. This was a very professional and enjoyable tour - my favorite part of my first visit to Argentina by far. Everybody was friendly, informative, and went above and beyond to make our trip special. Laura shared her love of Areco and showed off many local vendors, where the prices for top-quality artisan work were incredibly affordable! Jose made a special trip when I forgot my sunglasses in his van. And the estancia staff made sure to highlight the parts of the tour I'd been most interested in (the horse work). It was a fabulous day and although pricey, it was absolutely worth the visit. Thank you to all!!!!

By far the highlight our trip. Five stars (dots?) are not sufficient to describe the experience of this full-day trip to San Antonio de Areco and the estancia! This day was by far the highlight of our ten days in Buenos Aires. The day began as overcast, windy and chilly, with the threat of rain. I feared the day would be a "bust." Instead, we experienced a remarkable day of history, architecture, food and horsemanship. Our guide, Juan Manuel, was incredibly knowledgeable, articulate and entertaining. He seemed to know and be known by everyone in the village of San Antonio de Areco, and kept us laughing the entire day. Riding horseback across the pampas was a "bucket list" experience. The mid-day meal was amazing -- such a variety of salads, meats and other dishes -- and ended with authentic songs by a working gaucho on the ranch. Many others have remarked on the magical horsemanship exhibited by the gauchos -- true horse whisperers! In conclusion, I can't say enough good about this trip. I recommend it without reservation to anyone wanting to see a bit of Argentina beyond the outskirts of Buenos Aires.

Outstanding tour. My wife and I had an outstanding tour with Manuel. He was extremely personable and it felt like we were with a friend and not a tour guide. The transfers were all on time and the meal was one of the best we ever had. It has been the highlight of our trip to Argentina

Fantastic day. We are sorry that we took so long to review- this was one of the favorite days of our South American trip. Juan Manuel is so engaging, knowledgeable and willing to discuss whatever. The Estancia was a wonderful experience we shared with a group of college students who were equally enthusiastic but we had our own space separate and were well hosted at the Estancia. We highly recommend the experience. Oh, and our driver, Caesar was so kind and very punctual. Just a really wonderful experience.

Wonderful day in the country!. Our Estancia tour was one of the highlights of our trip to Argentina. It was a blast hanging out with Manuel and getting to know the town of San Antonio de Areco, meeting some of the locals and just observing a different way of life. The Estancia visit itself was very relaxing and included a nice horseback riding excursion and a very good lunch complete with wine. The food served at the lunch was excellent and the portions were extremely generous. I would not hesitate to recommend this tour and would go so far as to say that it's a "must do" if you are visiting Buenos Aires for a few days.

Completely awesome experience. As I look back on my 9 days in Buenos Aires, the Estancia Day trip was by far my favorite experience. Manuel was our guide and he was so perfect for us. He was learned, funny, taught us a great deal and simply made the trip an unforgettable experience The horseback riding was fun and educational; The meal in the plantation style house was delicious, the music played on the guitar and sung by the oldest gaucho gave us a real feel for non-city Argentina. The tour of San Antonio de Areco was also very informational with silver and leather artisans showing us their skills, and a chocolatier with wonderful selections and a yummy taste. The history of the town was also very interesting. This was the highlight of my trip to Argentina!

Perfect day trip to learn about Argentinean traditions - must do!. We booked a day trip to Areco with Camino Pampa based on TripAdvisor reviews. We arranged everything via email with Guillermo and was very smooth. We were 4 Argentine people and 3 Germans. The driver Cesar picked us up from our house on time and drove us to Areco. He was a nice and friendly person who gave us information on the way. We met in Areco with Juan Manuel, our guide for the day. He showed us the town, church, silver craftmen where we could meet the owner and received may information from him and his craft. We were not pushed to buy anything at all there. We then went to the Estancia were some of us went horse-riding and others on a carriage. It was great fun and everyone loved it. We had an amazing lunch with other guests (empanadas, asado, great meat, chicken, a variety of salads, good wine and ice cream). We had some nice traditional music from a Gaucho that works at the estancia. Everyone at the estancia was extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful. We saw as well a demonstration of gaucho's skills with horses. Juan Manuel was very informative, witty and friendly, and even though we hired the tour in English, he gave some info in Spanish too. He was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions. We all had a great day and it was a memorable one for our foreign friends. But we can say that this will be as enjoyable for locals as well as for foreigners too.

A great day out of BA. We were in Buenos Aires for 7 days and did a number of day trips out of the big city to keep a bit of balance with our vacation. This was exactly the day out of the city that I had in mind. The driver and our tour guide Juan Manuel picked us up from our apartment promptly at 8:00am and we had entertaining commentary and discussions for the 2 hr drive (included picking up another couple at their hotel) to the town of San Antonio de Areco. In the town, we had a short walking tour and stopped at 3 silver craftsman (no pressure to buy) and the local chocolate shop. From the town, we did a short drive to the estancia at which we were warmly welcomed. The estancia is a beautiful setting, the lunch was excellent and we had a great experience. I would highly recommend this to those looking for a nice quite and relaxing day out of the big city.

Fantastic Tour!!. This was one of my favourite days that i had while visiting Buenos Aires. Guillermo was great right from the start when i emailed enquiring about the tour and during the tour. He was friendly, helpful and shared lots of knowledge about the area. I enjoyed walking around San Antonio, horse riding at the estancia and the Argentinian lunch at the estancia was amazing.This was such a great experience and I recommend this tour to anyone visting Buenos Aires.

Not to be missed. A taste of Argentina you shouldn't miss. The driver picked us up on time, and gave us a lot of info on the way to San Antonio. There we met our guide Juan Manuel. I usually visit places on my own, not using guides, but Juan Manuel proved to be very pleasant, interesting, interactive and knowledgeable, making the tour an experience. We visited local artisans and we were never pushed to buy anything.The actual estancia was beautiful and relaxing. We went horseback riding in the pampas, a wonderful experience even for a beginner such as myself. The food was superb and plentiful back at the estancia and was followed by a small demonstration of guachos' skills. I was really sorry to have to leave in the end, which says it all!

A wonderful day out in the Pampas. This was the highlight of our trip to Argentina and is not to be missed.Our guide was Juan Manuel and he was wonderful, witty and very knowleagable - and a local! We felt welcome, comfortable and enjoyed every minute of the tour.

A Fabulous Experience!. My husband and I spent a wonderful day with Guillermo. After being collected from our hotel in Buenos Aires, we visited the lovely town of San Antonia exploring the gaucho bars and the leather and silver workshops, not forgetting the very tasty chocolatier. We were then taken to a traditional family Estancia where we had the opportunity to ride out with the Gauchos. A fabulous lunch was served on the lawn while being entertained with traditional Gaucho music.This is a truly authentic experience run by people who are passionate about their history and traditions.

Great Side Trip to the Countryside. We took a day trip to the countryside from Buenos Aires. It was definitely another world! Our driver was on time for our pick up at the hotel and we picked up one other family in BA before heading out. We met our tour guide in the quaint town of San Antonio de Areco, and we walked around and learned about some of the history and visited local artisan shops. No one pushed us to buy anything. On the contrary, we got tours of the workshops where goods were handcrafted, and got to see some artisans in action. So it was more of a learning experience--very cool. One side note is that there are a lot of stray dogs in town and several tagged along on our tour. I like dogs and they were friendly, so it was no bother. But the other family had kids who were afraid of them so just be aware.Later, we headed to the estancia. It was beautiful and lovely--lots of trees, a beautiful villa, and of course, horses. You had a choice of either horseback riding, or riding a horse drawn carriage. We went horseback riding with a group we met up with onsite. The horses are trained to walk in a group, so as a beginner, I had no problems. There were several children who also rode on their own horse, and had no problems. The horseback ride was about an hour along the countryside. It made the trip entirely worth it! It was a relaxing ride, and all that fresh air, I couldn't stop smiling the whole time! After the horseback riding we ate. The meats were not great, but for me, the sides, made up for it. The Guachos gave us a short demonstration after we ate as well. Personally, my main reason for booking this tour is that I wanted to horseback ride. I got to do that, and the experience was wonderful. So for me, this was an excellent choice for a first time trip to Argentina. Some notes: Phone service is sketchy at the villa; Our tour guide did not ask us for payment. We had to bring it up at the end of the tour when we got dropped off at the hotel (Their way of being polite I guess). We also tipped our guide and driver, so be prepared for that too.
