A real value for money tour and full of interesting local snippets.. We were picked up by our driver from our hotel in Buenos Aires and driven to San Antonio de Areco where we met our guide. The guide was an ex teacher and spoke fluent English which was a great help. My partner and I are aged 60 plus and found the gentle pace of our tour around the town to just right (the guide was in our age bracket). Local spots of interest as well as the history of the area were explained and we were able to do some small amount of shopping. There was no pressure selling here either with the guide seeming to be completely unattached to any retail outlets, which again was a reassuring sign. We then met up with our driver and were taken out to the Estancia (ranch). This was a working ranch and although I was brought up on a farm in the UK I never in my life imagined that I would one day be riding through the Argentinian pampas! We had a delightful BBQ lunch with a bottle of good Argentinian wine and were taken back to our Hotel. Of all the trips we did on our visit to South America this was perhaps the best of them.
Estoncia Day Tour. This tour was everything we had hoped for and would highly recommend to friends and our usual tour operator. Thank you for this unique experience.

Just the right touch. Guillermo González Gueroño met us in San Antonio De Areco and gave us a rich tour of the colonial village then took us to an estancia for a sumptuous mid-day meal and horse back riding as well as demonstrations by Gauchos. His arrangements -- including the two hour ride from Buenos Aires with a drop off at EZE were a perfect closure to our time in Argentina. Not to be missed.

Fantastic tour of Argentina small town and estancia!. Our tour of San Antonio de Areco and the Umba Estancia was a highlight of our Argentina visit. We were picked up in Buenos Aires at 8:30am and driven to meet our charming tour guide, Guillermo Gonzalez Guereno. We loved seeing San Antonio maintain their culture and traditions of art, silversmiths, chocolate shops (samples were fantastic!), leather workers, etc. The only thing that could have made the tour better was to get a coffee to go. :) After the tour, we were taken to the estancia for a welcome drink of our choice (beer or wine) and warm empanadas. We then went horseback riding (some took carriage ride instead) around the pampa. We were lucky to see many calves in the grasslands that had just been born. After we were shown the grilling process for their meats. We sat down to an abundant meal of salads, wine, and meats including various steaks, chicken, and ribs. A generous helping of thetraditional Christmas dessert of dulce de leche ice cream was divine. Our tour guide joined our table for lunch which we enjoyed to hear more about his life and culture. A guacho played his guitar and sang folk music for the group. after we watched the horse taming methods used. The tour included the ride back to the city. I highly recommend this tour and guide!
Highly recommend. We thoroughly enjoyed our day with guillio pickup in Buenos Aries at our appertment was on time and the personal attention and information shared by our guide was much appreciated

Beautiful Estancia. A visit to this quaint town and the beautiful estancia is worth your time and money. The trip was booked via e-mail. The driver picked us up at our hotel and we drove an hour to San Antonio de Areco where we meet our guide for the day. First we toured this lovely town, learned the history and visited all the great little shops where everything is handmade including the silver jewelry. The cheese shop was wonderful with a varied of cheeses and crafts.We then drove to the Estancia and took a tour of the ranch. You can go horse back riding or take a horse driven cart.Lunch was served on an old fashion porch with live music and the best meats, wine, beer, soft drinks and plenty of side dishes.After lunch we got to see a horse show and enjoy the beauty of this estancia.

A Not To Be Missed Attraction Outside Buenos Aires. If you want to understand Argentinian culture, you must first understand their love for anything equine. We visited two different estancias in South America, but this day trip was indeed the highlight of our vacation. Our private guide first took us to San Antonio de Areco, a charming town, where we enjoyed delicious chocolates. The estancia was magical and elegant. We enjoyed a horseback ride with the gauchos, a gourmet lunch on the deck, were sereneded by guitar by a gaucho and treated to a masterful display of an amazing relationship between horses and humans. Don't miss this!

Gracious country estate - fabulous, relaxing day. I booked via the internet from Australia. Email communication was very easy and efficent. We were picked up from our hotel in BA and driven out to the estancia - I can't remember his name but our driver was very nice and spoke English well. We were then met in Areco by our guide for the day, Manuel who was amazing - very entertaining and great company. Manuel showed us around Areco before we drove out to the farm. Its a gorgeous little colonial town. Very quaint. Best chocolate biscuits I have ever tasted bought at the local chocolate shop! The farm was just as I had hoped- a gracious Argentinian country estate. Beautifully kept and run. It was very relaxing having a few wines, eating fabulous asado and chatting with Manuel in the estancia grounds. The horse riding was fun for the very basic riders that we are (saw lots of cows!). The goucho skills demonstation after our ride was incredible. Stunning actually. My daughter and I travelled for four months through South America and I must say this day was one of the highlights. If you are looking for a relaxing day and in a beautiful country atmosphere with gaucho charm, then I recemmond doing this day tour.

Fabulous day trip from Buenos Aires. We arranged this with Guillermo from Camino Pampa by email before we arrived. He then reconfirmed our pick up time before the day. We were picked up in a lovely big and comfortable 9 person van by Senor Jose who drove us through the city explaining features we were seeing, and answered our questions on football, politics and the economy along the 1 1/2 hour trip to San Antonio de ARECO. There were only 4 of us on this tour so we had a very personal experience, both on the trip to San Antonio de ARECO and with Guillermo on our walking tour there. He showed us some lovely old gaucho bars and I'd love to be able to stay here on a weekend when music and dancing fills these bars, both with locals and visitors. We also visited some local tradesmen, a leatherwork per, silversmith and chocolatier, where we tasted the most delicious alfajores and chocolates which we bought for Easter later in the week. We then went out to the Estancia El OMBU de ARECO. We were greeted with a cold drink, wine, water, beer or soft drink and a delicious fresh empanada. We opted for the carriage ride around the estancia rather than the horse ride, but the two ladies in our group took the horse ride, never having ridden before and were well looked after by one of the young gauchos. We then returned and looked around the beautiful old estancia house, now accommodation and visited the open kitchen where the Asado (BBQ ) was being prepared. The smell wafting over the estate was mouth watering! Lunch was served on the large verandah at the front of the house. It included white or red wine, beer, soft drinks and water. They served lovely fresh salads, lettuce and cheese and tomato and onion, fresh bread, chorizo and blood sausage, grilled chicken and then three cuts of beef, ribs, sirloin and fillet, all beautifully cooked and tender. 5* lunch and service. Dessert was a special Icecream which was delicious, with coffee to follow while we were being serenaded by an elderly original gaucho, moving and delightful. We then went to the nearby paddock to see two of the younger gauchos work their magic with horses, and that was a joy to behold. A fantastic day, one we will remember for a long time and one of our favourites in Argentina. Thank you Guillermo and Jose for providing us with such a wonderful day.

Relaxing and amazing. The trip was flawless from beginning to end. Our driver Cesar was on time and spoke great English (even though he said he didn't) telling about all the landmarks and facts on the way to San Antonio. We were then met by Laura (I hope that is right!) who was our guide. She was warm and very well informed, she made us feel like family. The town itself if very rich with history and the towns dogs follow you around like your own personally bodyguards and really added to the charm. We then went to the Estancia which again was lovely and the people so friendly Laura was amazing and made sure we were looked after. We had some wine and snacks and the went horseback riding with a group. The gauchos were fantastic and we had a great time.It was then time for lunch which included loads of red wine, meats and salads. The conversation with Laura was so relaxed and at ease, it was my favourite moment of my trip, She then brought back Mate tea which we shared which made the whole day complete. The gauchos and their horses at the end were exceptional and I won't spoil it, but the relationship between the two is unlike anything else I have seen.This private tour was perfection and I cannot say one negative things about it.

San Antonio De Areco. Much lie the other reviews, I agree it is a little expensive. But, I would also say it is well worth doing. It is a quick trip out of Buenos Aires. And it feels a world away. The town is a little amazing step back in time. Well worth it all.

Great Day Out!. I am so happy that I found this day excursion whilst browsing on TripAdvisor.From my first on line contact with Guillermo until to dropping us back at our hotel at the end of the trip, it was a great experience. On line booking, questions, additions to the group, etc. were all dealt with quickly and efficiently.The tour was well priced and we eventually ended up being a group of 8 people from our cruise ship.Sofia, our guide for the day, is a lovely young lady who knows (and is very passionate) about all aspects of the visits.San Antonio de Areco is a charming town about 2 hours outside of Buenos Aires. We visited the Silversmith’s workshop where we saw how some of the silversmith production works and learnt about the Gaucho history and traditions. This was followed by a walk round the town, taking in the main square, beautiful church and the very interesting gaucho bar.We then went to the Estancia El Ombú de Areco. There we had a welcome drink and empanadas and then we went off either to take a carriage ride or ride the horses! I was so happy to achieve a new lifetime 1st and ride a horse! Nowhere better to do that than in the Argentinean Pampas on a beautiful horse called Laura!! Thanks to those who helped make that such a great experience. This was followed by an ‘asado’ lunch with good food and wine, folklore music and a display of what the gauchos can achieve from the way the train their horses. Absolutely amazing!If you have a free day in Buenos Aires and want to do something a little bit different, this is certainly a day out that I would very highly recommend.

A day trip to Camino Pampa. I recommend this day out for visitors on limited time who want to see a little of the country outside BA.Only one small criticism, a stop for coffee would have been appreciated when we arrived at the town in the morning at 9.30. The guide was great and very informative, but kept us moving so we arrived at the estancia on time for the horse ride and lunch.

Great excursion to experience an estancia. This trip out of Buenos Aires was nicely balanced between a visit to San Antonio de Areco as well as a superb estancia. Seeing the life of the Gaucho and his horses was eye opening and well worth the time. The lunch provided to us was fantastic with freely flowing wine to enjoy. A short musical performance by Carlos Pereyra and his guitar completed the visit. It was a wonderful experience and well worth the money. By all means, if you have a chance, jump on this tour.

Great!. This was such a wonderful and memorable day!Our wonderful guide Laura met us in the town of San Antonio de Areco and showed us around explaining the fascinating history and making it all come alive. She then went with us to the estancia which was a wonderful place where we were greeted with a glass of wine and empanadas...that was prelude to a great afternoon, learning about the ranch, the house, and then for us, we chose a horse-drawn carriage ride - we then had an outstanding lunch - the barbeque, all of the food and wine - very good! We finished with a horse whisperer who got his horse to do amazing things. This whole experience is a great contrast to the busy and eclectic downtown Buenos Aires, and I highly recommend it as part of the total experience in this part of Argentina.

A Great Day. Even though it was a little expensive, the day and experience was lovely and worth it. After a 2 hr ride to Arreco, with a very nice drive, Rueben, even tho he didn't speak English, we were guided through the Silver museum and the town with a wonderful and knowledagable guide, Maria, and it was fascinating. Then we went to the estancia and were served appetizers and drinks, then a buggy ride (and they had to work hard to get my husband, who is disabled, into the buggy- but they did it). Then a quite large dinner, very graciously served, and a horse demonstration.Would certainly recommend having this experience. Met the owner of the company, Guillermo, and he was quite friendly and nice.All in all, a wonderful and worthwhile day.

Fantastic day!. We had a great day with Guillermo. He was a very knowledgable, friendly and entertaining guide. The town of San Antonio de Areco is beautiful and it was a great experience to ride a horse in the open environment of the Pampas. Plus, at the Estancia I ate one of the best meals during my whole trip. If you are visiting Buenos Aires this is a must-do activity.
Great. Great trip, lunch and especially guide. Glad to have a day in the country out of Buenos Aires. Wish they would take credit cards though and not just $US, which are difficult to obtain.

An incredible day. This day will remain in our memory for years to come. Everything from the drive to the Estancia, the reception we received upon arrival, the Asado lunch, entertainment, the horse ride through the property and the display of horsemanship by the gauchos. Special thanks to Maria Morgan who welcomed us in San Antonio de Areco where she lives with her husband, an amazing artist. Thanks to Guillermo and to our driver, whose name escapes me. Do NOT miss this tour.

A perfect day in the Pampas. From start to finish this was a magical day. Our guide Maria was absolutely charming and a fount of knowledge about her beautiful home town of San Antonio de ArecaGuillermo the owners and all the staff at the historic Ombu Estancia were delightful and lunch under the eponymous Ombu shrub a magical moment.Wide open spaces,, beautiful vistas, peace and quiet,, horses, cattle and, of cours,e gauchos with horse riding, horse training, and a young gaucho horse whisperer, followed by a BBG on the verandah, . What a lovely surprise to be serenaded by a gaucho guitarist and singer. A perfect end to a perfect day

A day with the Gauchos. We were picked up on time at our hotel by our driver for about a two hour drive to San Antonio de Areco a town near Buenos Aires. This town is the primary Argentinian Gaucho cultural center. We met our guide Manuel, a very friendly knowledgeable man who gave us great information about the town, gaucho culture and the country. He made the day memorable with anecdotes, history, stories and introducing us to several people in the town including the reporter for the local newspaper. We spent some time at the gaucho bar, the church and walked around the town square, getting a feel for the place. We visited several silversmiths to see some of the silver ornaments used with the horses and by the gauchos. We than drove to Estancia El Ombú a working ranch. We had a great lunch with barbequed chicken, sausage and beef. There were fresh salads, wine and beer. We were entertained by a gaucho singer and gauchos showed us how they work with their horses. At the end of the day we were driven back to our hotel. Manuel was a excellent guide and made the day very enjoyable for us. Guillermo was our contact with Camino Pampa, he was very responsive and helpful in making the booking and helping us. This tour is highly recommended.

Relaxing Day in the Pampas. Guillermo was one of the best tour guides I've ever had. After touring through the town that he lives in, we went to the Estancia and were treated very well by everyone who lived and worked there. I was a bit skeptical before booking that this would be a day not quite catered to a group of six 24 year olds, and that it therefore wouldn't be worth the price. But by the end of the day we were all so glad we went and felt refreshed after several days of partying during Carnaval in Brazil. I would do this again and recommend to anyone of all ages. Thanks, Guille!

One of the best days in Buenos Aires. Our driver Jose and our tour guide Sophia were the best and we had an extremely enjoyable day getting out of the bustle of the city and to the peacefulness of the country. We should have scheduled this for the last tour in Buenos Aires and spent the night at the ranch and then gone directly to the airport the next day. The accommodations and serenity would ve been a delightful end to the trip. We really enjoyed learning about the history of the gauchos in the little town and then the ranch and lunch and horseback ride was well worth the money. The gauchos at the ranch, especially Oscar, and their relationship with their horses was amazing. The welcome empanadas and drinks on the lovely grounds and the lunch on the veranda of the beautiful ranch house made the visit so memorable.
great experience. Tour quiet and very tasty.With horseback riding, food such as empanadas, grill and beer and wine.A very pleasant experience, relaxing and wonderful.
Camino Pampa: Tour San Antonio de Areco Town & Estancia. Wonderful tour! Manuel was a great tour guide! He explained a lot of the historic and non-tourist aspects of the locale. We had a lot of fun.
Great day at Estancia!. Really enjoyed our guide and driver. Sofia and Jose driver made the day very special. Wish we could have stayed a couple days!

Incredible Day. We were picked up exactly as promised at our hotel. The driver was delightful and kept up a conversation and travelogue until we arrived in San Antonio to meet our guide Manuel. Due to the fact that the rest of the Buenos Aires travelers slept in and missed pick-up time, this was virtually a private tour for my husband and myself. The driver went into their hotel, phoned the room and they cancelled at the last minute. He did not delay us by waiting for them to wake, shower, dress and get to the taxi. Everything that is said about this tour is correct. We enjoyed the stops in San Antonio, did not feel pressured to make purchases and loved the gaucho experience and luncheon at the Estancia. Juan Manuel treated us as friends. Perhaps it was that we were his only customers that day, but the conversations were phenomenal, knowledge of the area and its people amazing. It was a very special experience. We also need to commend our driver who navigated a very lengthy traffic jammed return to Buenos Aires on that late Sunday afternoon with great skill and patience.

Wonderful Day. We were a group of six travelling in Argentina. Our day in the Pampas was most enjoyable.Juan Manuel was an excellent guide. We first visited San Antonio de Areco which is a very quaint and interesting town. A visit to the chocolate shop not to be missed. We then went to the Estancia where we enjoyed wonderful food and were entertained by the gauchos. Great day had by all.

Ranch tour. Fun day seeing the small town and antiques. The silversmith was interesting. The ranch was beautiful. Horseback riding was fun. Food was good. The best was the gauchos skills with horse control and training!

Great day!. Cesar was our driver and picked us up promptly at our hotel in Buenos Aires. We spent a lovely day with Laura in San Antonio and met several of the local artists. The Estancia was so much fun!!! Laura accompanied us to the estancia and hosted our group at lunch, making sure that everyone had exactly the food they wanted. Two of our group of six senior adults rode the horses across the pampas and 4 rode in the carriage. The gauchos' work with the horses was amazing and something I had never seen. Laura even introduced me to "mate" which I found to be a delightful drink and social custom. The day was full of great memories for our group.

Camino pampas. We travelled to Chile and Argentina on a cruise to celebrate dad's 80th birthday. We wanted something authentic in Argentina and couldn't have picked better than camino pampas. We were picked up direct from our hotel and enjoyed a running commentary from our driver before spending the first part in an authentic town. Part 2 was a treat, horseback ride with the gauchos followed by a tasty Bbq and riding demo. Fantastic

Wonderful day with Camino Pampa!. Our driver picked us up on time and drove us to San Antonio De Areco where we met Guillermo. He toured us around the town and showed all of the historic buildings. He was very knowledgeable and told us all about the history of the town. From there we travelled to the El Hombre Estancia where we were taken on a cart ride, had an amazing meal which included many different cuts of beef and then we were entertained with folklore music and a horse whisperer. Guillermo walked us around the Estancia and talked about the workings of the ranch. At the end of the day we were driven back to BA by a very competent and friendly driver. All in all it was an amazing day!

A great day in San Antonio de Areco. What a great day!! Manuel did an excellent job acquainting us with the small town values of San Antonio de Areco. Then off to the Estancia where it felt like we got a real look at what life must have been like on the Pampas. Lunch was good. Empanadas were great and we were lucky enough to get a bonus show of the gauchos playing traditional games. Car service both ways was great. Well worth the time and money.

Highly recommended! Wonderful day. Laura was a very knowledgeable and patient tour guide. And Jose was extremely helpful and knowledgable too. We started off with a tour of San Antonio de Areco which was fascinating. We are the best Alfajores I have ever had there and shopped for leather goods. The estancia was very pretty and the asado was absolutely delicious. The day trip was worth every penny.

Day trip from buenos aries. A fascinating day visiting an unspoilt colonial town followed by refreshments, lunch and afternoon at a working estancia with the opportunity to view the estate on horseback or in horse drawn carriage or to just relax by the pool. The Gauchos provided entertainment in form of singing and demonstrating how they tame and gain trust of their horses. Interesting, enjoyable and informative. Would recommend.

A day to remember. It is different & interesting at the same time. if you travel to this part of the world don't miss this excursion. though it is set-up for tourist it is done well. the host of the ranch, she's very accomodating.the care we recieved was perfect, the horse show "Indian whisperer" was out of this world. had full course lunch,dress up according to the weather it was end of the year when we went to the estancia it was warm. wear a comfortable shoes good for cobblestone street don't let aching feet ruin your day because this place is not to be missed.lastly met a great couple

A Day to Remember. Thoroughly enjoyed a delicious asada at this beautiful estancia. A gentle rain fell during our horseback ride did not deter the beauty of the place. The food was delicious and we felt warmly welcomed.

Highlight of our whole trip. Two words..... Juan Manuel !!!!!!!!!!! What a guy!!!To start off our day we were picked up by our lovely driver in a spacious vehicle to make our way to San Antonio... straight away he offered us chilled water (it's the little things) as we drove through Buenos Aires he provided us with interesting information both historical & general, which was a pleasant addition to our journey.Once we arrived in San Antonio de Areco we were greeted by our AMAZING guide Juan Manuel..... there aren't really words to describe this man, the soul of an English thespian stuck in an Argentinian adventurers body...!! We toured the local village which was charming and beautiful and Juan Manuel took us to local silversmiths (one of which has made products for the Queen of England) and explained and showed us in great detail all the different processes of making the products and the history of the different parts that were created for the gauchos and their horses. Juan Manuel is passionate about his home, travelling, literature, history and generally just passionate about life, which made the whole day so interesting & enjoyable for us!After the village tour we made our way to the estancia where we toured the grounds and took a horse ride with the oldest & most respected gaucho in the town, we felt incredibly honoured and humbled to have this opportunity! Following this was a lovely lunch, and they even prepared a special vegetarian option for me which I was so grateful for, not easy when you're speciality is meat export, the food was great and was followed by traditional entertainment of music and a horse demonstration. During lunch we got to spend time finding out about the ever interesting life of Juan Manuel and honestly he is one of the most interesting, passionate, knowledgeable people we have ever met, one of those rare, special humans with a big heart!Once the day was over we made our way back to the hotel with our wonderful driver! A super well organised day that was great value for money!Definitely one of the highlights of Argentina if not our whole SA trip!!Thank you Juan Manuel!!!! We hope to see you again on our next visit!!

Highly recommended. This was a very enjoyable and informative tour. The reason it is a 4 and not a 5 is that there was some mismatch between my expectations and the actual tour.We were looking for a tour in a less touristy venue and I believe this trip delivered. Our particular group had 7 participants. Multiple small groups came together for the Estancia visit, but even then the numbers were quite small.I wish I had understood better what was going to happen in the town. It was really enjoyable and informative, but I think I could have gotten more out of it if I had better prepared myself.Laura was our guide and she was great.

Great Day Trip from Buenos Aires. This was the highlight of our family's trip to Buenos Aires. A guided tour in San Antonia was most informative and our guide, Maria, was great. An authentic estancia in the pampas. Horse riding through the pampas was a delight as well as the excellent parilla lunch. The staff was most accommodating -- from the van driver to the tour guide to everyone at the estancia.

estancia outside buenos aires. we had an outstanding day here- really enjoyable, learned a lot about the pampas, loved the riding the scenery, the town, and had and amazing meal! a highlight of our trip to argentina. my family (included 2 university aged kids) all thought it a great way to spend the day

Exceptional Excursion. The driver picked us up at our hotel at exactly the scheduled time. After one stop to pick up another couple, we drove directly to San Antonio de Areco. During the ride, the driver provided interesting comments and observations on the nearby areas along the route. Things officially began with a guided walking tour of the town that included buildings, a magnificent nearly 300-year-old church, artisan workshops. The guide was very informative. Afterwards, we traveled to the estancia where we enjoyed a welcoming glass of wine and empanadas, followed by horseback riding for those who desired, and a then a traditional meat-lover lunch. While we ate, an older gentleman played the guitar and sang some pleasant songs. The outing ended mid-afternoon and we were back at our hotels before 6 pm. A truly delightful trip.

Best personalized tour. Our guide Maria was beyond expectations. She was full of interesting information about the town and life there. The town is lovely. Maria was related or knew everyone! Then the estancia tour and lunch were also wonderful. This was our favorite excursion of our entire trip! Pricey but worth it!

Couldn't be any better!. It's hard to add anything more positive than other reviewers have noted. Highly professional - appreciated the email letting us know the name of the driver who would pick us up. He was right on time and provided ongoing commentary on the way to San Antonio where we met Juan Manuel. He, too, was great -- sense of humor, perfect English, etc. I should have realized that horses mean horse flies, and though the estancia provided "Off," they still bit me. So I would suggest that if you're the type targeted by mosquitos, horse flies, etc. that you wear long pants and socks! Food was great, everyone was gracious. Truly a highlight of our vacation.

Camino Pampa - Tour of San Antonio de Areco Town and stancia. This tour exceeded all expectations. My husband and I booked the private tour and we were very pleased with the service. Our driver Miguel (who picked us up at our hotel in BA) was excellent and our Guide Marie was fabulous - the fact that she was from San Antonio de Areco and that she and her family played a large role in the community made the tour especially interesting. We actually met members of her family and learned the importance and history of the craft of silver smithing in this area. After a very informative tour of the town we headed out to the estancia which was an incredible experience! We were welcomed with drinks and one of the best empanadas we had in Argentina. There was a choice of horseback riding and buggy rides (we did the latter and it was so much fun with Antonio as our driver!! - he was also the chef) and then came the Asado enjoyed on the beautiful wrap around balcony of the hacienda. Absolutely delicious and accompanied by their very tasty house label wine.Entertainment included a gaucho playing guitar and a local artist, Miguel Angel Gasparini, drawing gaucho sketches which were amazing. I was lucky enough to recieve one which is now framed and hanging in my dining room to remind me every day of that wonderful experience.There was also an incredible display of horse whispering after the lunch. You would have to see it to believe it!! Special thanks to Guillermo who organized this day for us. I would highly recommend this day tour to anyone going to Buenos Aires. It should not be missed!!!

San Antonio de Areco Tour / Estancia Lunch / Horseback Riding. My partner and I just returned from our first trip to Buenos Aires. It was a ten day trip so wanted at least one day outside of the city. After reading all the positive reviews we decided to book with Camino Pampa. Guillermo responded quickly to our initial inquiry and we set up the tour. Our driver picked us up at our hotel on time and we were off to enjoy a day in the country. We had a blast. First, our driver was wonderful. His English was great but he kept apologizing for it. No need, he was easy to understand and took the time to point out thing of interest during the trip. When we arrived at San Antonio de Areco we were met by our guide, Juan Manuel Hernandez. Here's where it gets really good. He's just amazing. Handsome, funny, knowledgeable, and seems to know everyone in town. He went out of his way to make our day very special and it was. The Estancia is beautiful. The hostess is lovely, the horses were well taken care of and fun to ride, lunch was very good. I could have easily stayed there for several days. We were actually sad to leave. Highly recommended.

Camino Pampa: Tour San Antonio de Areco Town & Estancia. I took the one-day tour - door-to-door service from Buenos Aires.Instead of returning to BA the estancia's minibus dropped me at my hotel in San Antonio de Areco where I spent the next day - Gaucho museum, town history museum, and relaxation. By chance my hotel (Panadores Draghi) is owned by, and part of the same building as the silversmith which the tour visits - right on the central plaza.

A day in the pampas. The four of us booked this whole day tour. We paid $160US by credit card and was asked to pay $640US the day of the tour. The official rate for the peso was 9.5 but we could exchange for a minimum of 14 pesos to the dollar. We were not given the opportunity to pay in pesos which we knew ahead of time. In light of a very strong dollar, we felt the tour was overpriced.We were picked up at our hotel at 8:15 and it took about 1.5 hours to drive to the small well to do town of San Antonio de Areco. Guillermo met us in the town square and was our tour guide for the rest of the day. He lives in the area and so had a wealth of information about the town's history. The historic town was a throwback in time with old originally furnished gaucho bars, general stores and silversmith shops/museums. It would have been nice to have stopped for a beverage and truly enjoyed the ambiance of a gaucho bar.It was interesting to visit the Museo Taller Draghi which is considered one of the best silversmiths in town. There is a small museum connected to the shop which showcases gaucho related silver pieces. We were shown original drawings that the silversmith designed to create these one of a kind pieces.We toured the church and a chocolate shop and then listened to a gentleman singing and playing his guitar.Our afternoon was spent at an authentic estancia or old working ranch. There was a wedding on the grounds at the same time so it was fun to listen to their music. We were given tasty empanadas and a beverage before our meal. We even tried mate but learned that it is an acquired taste! We were treated to a traditional asado served by gauchos. We did try the blood sausage which is an acquired taste as well. There were many servings of wonderful types of beef. A person could eat as much as they wanted. We were shown a horse and gaucho demonstration on horse taming. We were given the choice of riding a horse or riding in an open wagon which we chose the later. We arrived back at our hotel via van around 6:00 p.m.

Perfect day in the pampas. I took a day trip from Buenos Aires to go and visit San Antonio de Areco and the Estancia El Ombu. Picked up on time, I was delighted to find that my guide Sofia spoke perfect English and that she was exceptionally knowledgable about gaucho culture and the history of San Antonio de Areco. After a very comfortable 2 hour drive we arrived in San Antonio and walked the main streets and squares of the town. What a truly beautiful town it is with lovely little cafes, leather shops, silver smiths not to mention hand made chocolate shop. At El Ombu (around 4 miles from the town) our small group revelled in the natural beauty of the place, the lush gardens, exquisite horses and extraordinary gauchos who took us out on a ride and later demonstrated their unique skills. Lunch was a carnivore's delight with as much barbecued meat as we could eat. I wish I had stayed on a few days as I was really sorry to leave. Don't miss the chance to take the tour with Camino Pampa - it was the highlight of my trip!

What a delight!. This was the end of our three week visit to South America and I was concerned when considering a tour that it would be another commercialised, tourist event. I should not have worried! This was the best tour of our trip, extremely professional but warm and personal. We were picked up at our hotel by Alejandro, who was courteous and attentive, for an easy drive of around 90 mins to San Antonio de Areco where we met Guillermo, who was to look after us for the rest of the day. San Antonio is a fascinating town, which although on the tourist map, has managed to retain its culture and identity. Guillermo, a warm and charming man with good English, is obviously extremely well-known in the town and was able to show us places and introduce us to locals that I am sure others would be unable to do. The weather was excellent and we were able to visit a number of artisans from well known artists to silversmiths, leather workers and of course phenomenal chocolatiers! I was very envious of the locals who could live in such a delightful place. Next, Guillermo took us to the Estancia where we were able to sit in the shade with an empanada and glass of wine outside the main house and learn a little of the history and gaucho culture. We took a leisurely horse ride through the estate and returned for our parilla lunch. The food was delicious and plentiful (we were able to see where it was being cooked on the wood fire earlier) and it was accompanied by an excellent bottle of Mendosa wine while we contemplated our fortune to be in such wonderful surroundings. Oscar (?), a well-known and accomplished gaucho singer, played his guitar and sang to us a number of traditional gaucho songs. Finally, there was an impressive display of gaucho horse control with half a dozen horses (much to the delight of my horse loving wife!). At around four o clock it was time for our return to the city and it was with regret that we said farewell to Guillermo. It was a wonderful day and so refreshing to spend it with people who are genuinely passionate about their culture and the desire to share it with visitors. Thank you so much!

Fun day in the Pampas. We were picked right on time by Jose. It took an hour and a half to get to San Antonio and the van was pretty bumpy. We toured the town with Juan Manual, who was full of stories and personality. Would have liked more time in town to walk around, take pictures and shop. Estancia Ombu was fun and we were welcomed with good empanadas. We took the carriage ride which also was bumpy but fun. The meal was great, the beef as good as any in BA. It was a long ride back into town. Believe it was a bit overpriced.

Wonderful day tour, highly recommend! . We were picked up promptly at 0830 as scheduled by the spacious and comfortable van for the ride from Buenos Aires to the town of San Antonio de Areco. We spent some time walking around the town at a comfortable pace and had the opportunity to visit silversmiths and a delicious chocolate shop with time for shopping if we were interested. It's a beautiful and friendly town - - our guide seemed to know everyone. Definitely a world of difference from Buenos Aires. Next, we visited the estancia and we're greeted with an empanada and choice of drink while we had some leisure time before lunch. We had time to walk around and see the horses and cattle as well as the gauchos at work. Lunch commenced and was generous to say the least. We had dinner plans but ended up cancelling after having so much to eat at the estancia. Sausage, chicken, ribs, ribeye, sirloin, and tenderloin steak. And if you wanted a second portion of one (or all) of the courses, the gauchos were happy to oblige. We were also treated to traditional gaucho music by one of the veteran gauchos during lunch. After lunch there is an equestrian show in which the gaucho shows his ability to communicate and interact with the horse--very impressive and a chance for all of us to take photos with the gaucho and horse at that point. Next we were able to ride horses with the gaucho (about 20 minutes, or so) and that concluded our day around 1630.Last but not least, our tour guide, Manuel was spectacular. He is friendly, incredibly knowledgeable, and has very entertaining stories. A true Renaissance man. Of the dozens - if not hundreds - of tours I have been on in my life, I believe he is the absolute best tour guide I have encountered. The others on my tour seemed to agree. I recommend this tour, and especially Manuel, without hesitation

Fantastic experience. We had a wonderful day in San Antonio de Areco Town and at the Estancia with Manuel. Horseriding and barbeque, good beer and wine. The entertaiment was lovely, Oscar played the guitar and sang for us, and to see the well trained horses. The alfajores made it unbroken back to Norway, and we will enjoy them for Christmas. Thank you very much for a wonderful day to remember.
Wonderfull experience. The tour was a great experience from beginning to end. Very nice people and lovely food. It was an experience at the top of my list while on vacation.

Perfect Argentina Experience. This was a perfect day trip from Buenos Aires. Caesar picked up our family of 5 at our rental apartment and Guillermo met us in San Antonio. We had planned to go the day before but the weather was predicted to be rainy and Guillermo kindly offered to let us switch days. A nice tour of the town and off to the Estancia for a horseback ride with the Gauchos, a barbeque lunch and a Gaucho demonstration after lunch. Camino Pampa was just one of several tour operators at the Estancia part of the day. I was so glad to be with Guillermo, he was very attentive and even found some hats for us to wear while riding. At the end of the day Caesar returned us to our apartment. The whole day was one of the highlights of our trip.

Amazing Experience. From the moment we were picked up at our hotel by Maria our guide, we began an amazing adventure. We were in San Antonio in about an hour and a half and the city seemed very busy so the driver let us out in town. as it happened, we were the for the annual Gaucho festival and what an experience: we saw, the silversmith's shop and museum, an old gaucho saloon, a handmade chocolate shop & other town sites, but the highlight was the parade of gauchos from all over the country.We arrived at the lovely Estancia and enjoyed a lovely cold drink and then a horseback ride. The horses were really nice & well cared for and we were accompanied by several accomplished gauchos. By the time we were finished, we were very ready for our asada or barbecue and the food just kept coming. If anyone left hungry, it was their own fault. Afterwards we were entertained with guitar playing and horsemanship. we also took a tour of the Estancia because there are casitas that you can stay in. We thought it would make for a wonderful family get together if we can return one day. All in all, our day was really lovely and I can't say enough about Maria, our guide and our driver whose name I am sorry to have forgotten. We also met Guillermo, the tour director with whom I had corresponded. I will say again that this is one of the best tours we have ever taken and we have traveled extensively. We were a party of four and we basically had our own private tour & guide. If you are looking to get away from the big city, you should take this tour.

Fabulous day!. Earlier this month, my business partner and I were on an awards trips to BA with our husbands. Most of the week in BA was pre-planned by our company's owners but we had one free day. We were spending all of the other days with our entire group of about 40 wonderful coworkers and spouses but wanted this one day to be something special for the 4 of us. I found this tour on-line and it sounded exactly like what we were looking for...and actually it far exceeded our wishes! We were picked up on time at our hotel by a wonderful driver who had a very comfortable, clean van with water bottles for each of us. We met our guide, in the quaint town of San Antonio and she gave a 'behind the scenes' tour...she was from the area so she knew everyone which she introduced us to and then they would share their stories about their businesses with us...the chocolate shop, leather shops, original general store, etc. The town's church was also filled with history that you would never know without a guide. After our tour, we then drove out to the ranch...again our guide knew everyone personally since she herself lived on a nearby ranch. We again were introduced to the ranch's owner and offered wine or beer to cool off...we then sat in the shade on the wide front lawn and enjoyed the most fabulous empanadas in this world! Then after a short walk around the grounds, we dined on perfectly grilled meats and more Malbec! Although there were several others dining, each group had their own tables and never felt like a "tour". Lunch included a horse show and a gaucho playing his guitar and singing....unbelievable! The day ended with a leisurely hoseback ride with two gauchos and just the four of us. If you are looking to be spoiled and to get the 'real flavor' of the ranch life...this is the only tour to consider. This ranch offers rooms for rent which is something that we all hope to do sometime soon!

A great day on the Pampas. Everything about our day-trip was excellent. The arrangements by email with Guillermo were seamless and simple. We had a private tour for two. Cesar picked us up at our hotel and he is a great driver -- a welcome change from BA cab drivers. He dropped us off at the airport in time for our evening flight back to the the U.S.Manuel was our guide, whom we met in San Antonio de Areco. All the complimentary things said about Manuel in previous reviews are true. The afternoon at the estancia was almost magical. Lunch on the lawn under the trees was delightful.But the true highlight of the trip comes back to Manuel. He is deeply knowledgable about the fascinating country of Argentina and he loves to talk. Boy, does he love to talk!The tour is excellent. I would suggest a private tour with Cesar and Manuel.

Great little day trip out of BA. My wife and I did this trip. Both Jose our driver and Laura at San Antonio were wonderful, informative guides who spoke fluent English.This is a touristy tour, so do not expect a working farm. The farmhouse, lunch, horse ride and gardens are beautiful, it is more a leisure day in the country than anything else as the farm is too small to be fully operating.Lunch is nice, and the empanada I had was great, maybe a couple of extra would be appreciated.The only criticism I would note is that they need to allow more time in the town to shop, the town walk is a bit rushed so maybe leave a little earlier in the morning.Offering a 1 night stay option would also be good to allow that little bit extra time to enjoy such a special place.

Wonderful day out. Everything went smoothly. Although we had paid for a group tour there was the two of us. Great driver with good English. It turned out to be Election Day so some things were closed but Manuel showed us around the lovely old town and explained its history and we were invited in to the silversmiths workshop to see his incredible workmanship. The excursion to the estancia was wonderful, very gracious people, great food and wine, and songs from an elderly gaucho. The horse whisperer was most impressive. All the people we met were friendly and informative. Truly a highlight of our trip.

Estancia and San Antonio de Areco day trip. Absolutely great day from the on-time pick-up at our airbnb with the knowledgeable and friendly driver (even when asked for a potty break) to the tour of the charming small town of San Antonio de Areco. The afternoon at the estancia with horseback riding and a lovely feast accompanied by the gaucho strumming his guitar was near perfection!This was a most memorable day and I would highly recommend it!

Best most genuine trip of the Pampas!!. Genuine gaucho ranch with Juan Manuel who is the most INCREDIBLE and knowledge guide who speaks properly fluent English. We had an amazing asado (bbq), rode on horses and took in a genuine ranch at work. We even found out that the BBC had visited it recently with John Torrode for his A Cook Abroad programme (check that out too to get an idea as it's awesome!!)

Fantastic day out!. We wanted a gaucho and estancia experience and that's exactly what we got. From the first email enquiring about the day, there was useful information given to us. The pick up was on time and the driver explained what would happen over the day. The tour guide around the town was knowledgeable and proud of it all. Lunch at the estancia was amazing, horse riding was fun and meeting one of the oldest gauchos was great. We nearly didn't do this day out but are so glad we did, one of the best things we have done in South America. Highly recommended!

Highlight of our Argentina Trip!. We spent the day at Camino Pampa, and it was the highlight of our trip to Argentina.Mr. Cesar picked us up in Buenos Aires and drove us to San Antonio de Areco where we met the best tour guide in the business--Juan Manuel Hernandez.We can't say enough good things about Manuel--he simply made our day spectacular. We toured the town of San Antonio de Areco, then headed to the Estancia, where we rode horses before having an amazing "asado" lunch. Later, we were treated to an authentic Gaucho musical performance and a horse taming demonstration that left us speechless. Everyone at the ranch was beyond helpful and made us feel welcome. Having Manuel as our guide was the icing on the cake--he was full of information and made our visit spectacular. This tour is pricier than others we considered, but you get what you pay for--this is worth every penny. This is an actual working ranch with real gauchos who work on the estancia. It's a one of a kind experience.

Fantastic Day. Guillermo is a local who is passionate about San Antonio de Areco and he knows everyone in town,and gave an interesting tour. The estancia was a small family one who treated the guests like family with great activities,food and wine and the best empanadas we ate in Argentina Thanks from all our group of 4 Kiwis
Rod

Great Guacho Experience. Guillermo was excellent! We were picked up from our hotel in Buenos Aires and met Guillermo in San Antonio de Areco. We loved the tour of the town and found it very informative! We had a great time visiting the town and seeing all the different shops. We then went with Guillermo to the estancia. We had the most incredible afternoon! We went horseback riding, had some great food, loved meeting the guachos, and exploring the land. I would definitely recommend this to anyone interested in visiting the guachos and having a great getaway from the big city.
Absolute must!. Very well organised and a fantastic tour guide! An amazing and authentic experience for everyone!!!!

Wonderful Day Trip. This was a wonderful day trip away from the busy city of Buenos Aires. What we loved most about our trip were the people we met...our knowledgeable driver Jose Maria, our charismatic guide Juan Miguel, as well as everyone at the Estancia Ombu. We had an exceptional time visiting the local silversmith shops, trying some of the best alfajores, and learning about the pampas as well as gaucho culture. Our last stop at the Estancia Ombu was truly an amazing experience, with great food and a relaxing horse ride. If you have a day to spare, this tour is great way to relax and take in local culture.

Well Worth the Time. My husband and 7 year old son when on the Camino Pampa tour. It was a great break from visiting Buenos Aires.We were picked up by Mr. Cesar who was so friendly and told us a lot about Argentina. Then we met up with Guillermo in San Antonio and he was just wonderful. We took our tour of the town which was very interesting. Be sure to buy yourself some alfacores at the chocolate store - delicious.We had an adventure getting to the estancia as it had been raining for 9 days straight and the road was pure mud. We got to 4 wheel in which was great fun. The empanadas were delicious.Loved the horse ride - Javier was so nice to our son on his first solo ride. Lunch was amazing - do not be afraid to try the morcilla or any other things you might be nervous about - it was all delicious. Guillermo was nice enough to also make us some mate to try. 4 wheeled back out to meet Mr. Cesar for our ride home. We were a bit more tired out on the return !I would recommend this for any one but was especially fun for a family with a child for some good outdoor time. Everyone was so nice, great food and beautiful location.

Beautiful Estancia Ombu. We had an amazing time, I will go back for sure! The estancia is very welcoming and folks are very warm. The food was spectacular and the ride back to Buenos Aires comfortable and safe.

Great experience through Camino Pampa!. We had a great day that started with a very friendly and knowledgeable driver who picked us from our hotel in BA. We arrived an hour later at San Antonio de Areco, where we met Will (Guillermo), our excellent guide/host. We really enjoyed going thru the town and the highlight was meeting Gaspa, a local artist and town treasure. Our kids got a drawing each made by him. Will was very proud of the local heritage and he was a very friendly and engaging guide. We then went to the Estancia El Ombu which was fantastic. We had a great time horse-riding, eating great food and drinking excellent wine, and then being treated to gaucho customs including singing and horsemanship. Was a great trip for our whole family. Highly recommend this tour!

Nice day in countryside. Very interesting day in San Antonio de Areco town and estancia El Ombu, you really get an insight in gaucho life. Three of four in our family voted this experience as best in our one week in Buenos Aires and around.

Wonderful Experience, Great Guide!. We recently went on a excellent tour of San Antonio de Areco with Camino Pampa.The tour included a private transfer and an intelligent, kind, and local guide - Sofia. Because the guide had a personal connection to San Antonio de Areco, the experience was much more meaningful and rich. The tour included stops at the main square, the church, former pulperias, an artist's studio (wonderful!!!), silver shops, and a delicious chocolate shop. We also had traditional BBQ at Estancia Ombu -- this stop included a great carriage ride, beautiful farmland, live tradional music (milonga), and a mesmerizing horse demonstration. Highly recommended company that is a family enterprise. Definitely recommend Sofia as a guide too!

Highly Recommend for a Fantastic Day!. We really enjoyed the exceptional service and fabulous day yesterday. Our driver was a wealth of information on Buenos Aires and Argentina in general.Guillermo gave us a personal tour of San Antionio de Areco and then we were off to the estancia. We enjoyed the authentic experience of visiting a working, historical ranch. Food was outstanding and we were grateful for the attention given to my sons' food allergies. You won't be disappointed with Camino Pampa!

Great experience. Spent a lovely day, indeed a highlight of our stay in Argentinia, with Guillermo hosting us. We felt that it was authentic and honest. Started with a walk through San Antonio de Areco and enjoyed walking into shops, bars and a great artisinal chocolate manufacturing family business. Then to the Estancia where we felt at home, had fun doing an outride, a great asado with memorable music and good interaction with the owner, the gauchos and fellow travelers. We will be back.

Great time!. Loved this tour of a quaint gaucho town - we toured the siversmith's shop, painter's workplace, a chocolate shop (free samples), the central church, the main plaza, and had a great time interacting with the communal dogs who lived in this little town. Afterwards, we went to El Ombu Estancia which was this beautiful ranch. We had fresh empanadas, drinks, tours of the ranch and lifestock on horseback (or by carriage, for those who aren't comfortable on horseback), had a hearty barbeque with Malbec wine, and finally listened to songs from gaucho oral tradition and watched a demo of the one of the young gauchos performing horse whispering. Overall, it was just a great time, and a nice glimpse into the Argentinian countryside so different from from the busy city life of Buenos Aires.

A lovely day out of the city. We had a nice, quiet tour of a quaint town (great chocolate shop) and a refreshing afternoon at the estancia. Friendly dogs, horseback riding, some nice entertainment. What more could you ask for?

Loved it !. Laura and Guillermo. Sorry it took us so long to write this but life happens. We had a wonderful time and we cannot thank you enough for your hospitality and a wonderful tour of San Antonio and estancia. It was really special and unforgettable experience. When we are back in Argentina we would love to come back and maybe this time spend more time in the area. Thank you again. K & K

Fabulous day out of the city. Fabulous tour of an estancia outside if the hustle and bustle of the city. Our personal tour guide Marcelo Perez Montero was the best we have ever had. He was a wealth of knowledge as well as professional and polite. We first toured the town of San Antonio de Areco which was such a pleasant surprise. Then we got to the Estancia and were greeted with delicious empanadas and a glass of Malbec. After we went on a horseback ride with two of the gauchos, followed by a Fantastic BBQ lunch. The entire day exceeded our expectations.

A Wonderful Day with a Wonderful Guide. My wife and I went took the private tour with Guillermo to see his hometown and a local estancia. Guillermo is one of the best guides we have ever used. He truly loves his job. We were picked up on time and taken out of Buenos Aires to San Antonio de Areco. While on the drive, Guillermo gave us a great history lesson on B.A. and Argentina. It was wonderful. We then arrived in San Antonio and the tour of this beautiful town was excellent and educational. My wife and I could have adopted all of the town dogs! We saw the beautiful church, a great bar, a silver making shop, leather goods, and a bakery. All excellent. Then off to the beautiful Estancia El Ombu de Areco. It had rained and we got to go "mudding" on the ranch road. Most excellent! Then had a great tour of the beautiful ranch, went horseback riding, had an incredible lunch, good wine, etc. Thanks to Diego and his very friendly family! My wife and I are still talking about the day. Recommend highly.

A memorable day to see a contrast to the hustle bustle of BsAs. This is a tour not to be missed! As this was our third time visiting BsAs my husband and I decided to look into a side trip to take us outside of the city (we've done the buquebus to Uruguay a few times) and we are so glad to have come across this tour! We had a private tour where Mr Jose picked us up and was with us from beginning to end of the day. He was much more than the driver though, he provided tour commentary to the city, the history, politics, anything and everything you would want to ask someone who has lived in the area their entire lives. He gave us such insights it made the journey go by quickly. Once arriving in San Juan de Areco we were met by Maria who was born and raised in the city and gave us a wonderful tour and first person account of living there (vs the contrast of BsAs where she went to university) through the estancia (how beautiful it was - great horse ride and amazing lunch and live music) it was an entire day of amazing experiences from end to end. I imagine Jose and Maria have been doing these tours for years but nothing felt rehearsed or memorized. I highly recommend this tour!!

Exceptional Experience. The glowing reviews are warranted. Well done in every aspect, but Manuel was an exceptional guide (an angel - thank you!). This type of personal experience is the reason that we travel. Definitely a "must-do" for anyone visiting the area. Highly recommended.

A Great Day in the Pampas. My family loved our trip to San Antonio de Areco and the Estancia. Our driver, Jose Maria, picked us promptly and gave a nice commentary during the entire drive. When we arrived at San Antonio de Areco, we were met by our guide, Maria, who stayed with us through the tour of the city as well as the time at the estancia. She was so pleasant and helpful - even making requests for us to the servers during the luncheon. It was truly an enjoyable day - a great escape from the city!

Wonderful Day Trip with Local Flair. Our driver who transported our small group to and from Buenos Aires was friendly & informative. Our guide Maria was a local resident, born and raised in San Antonio de Areco. She shared so much with our group about her town, the history of the area, her own personal story and that of her extended family. The estancia we visited was lovely, the food very good (better asado than we'd had in BA), and the whole afternoon so relaxing and enjoyable (including horseback riding, gaucho music and horsemanship displays). Not your typical "touristy" experience.

A lovely, relaxing day. Taking notice of previous reviews, I booked this tour. I'm glad we did. Maria (our guide) took us on a tour of San Antonio de Areca, then we continued on to the estancia. We had a very enjoyable horse ride (most of us were obviously novices), then a great lunch in a beautiful setting under the trees. The gaucho music and horse-whispering was very interesting. It was lovely to have a relaxing day, after the past few weeks. It is quite a long drive, but well worth the visit. Thank you Guillermo - the whole feel of the estancia is one of peace and quiet.

Our favorite day in Argentina. My wife and I went to Argentina and Brazil for our honeymoon. We were only in Buenos Aires for 5 days and I wanted to take a day trip out of the city. Based on other reviews on trip advisor I decided to go with Camino Pampa's San Antonio de Areco & Estancia Tour, and I'm so glad we did.The day was so amazing and we really learned a lot about Buenos Aires, the surrounding area and Argentina. After getting picked up by our driver Cesar at 8:30 a.m. we traveled to San Antonio de Areco where we met our guide, Guillermo. He was very well-informed about everything from Argentinian history, agriculture and current events. He was very easy to talk to and very friendly. The day trip had so much to it. Part one of the tour was in San Antonio de Areco where we visited the town square, church, a couple amazing silversmith shops, a fantastic chocolate shop and a couple Gaucho bars.Part two was at Estancia El Ombu, which was even better. We were greeted with Malbec and fresh empanadas followed by a horseback ride on the property. Then we were served an amazing spread of meats along with some more wine. Live Gaucho music and a Guacho taming a horse were after lunch. The owner of the estancia and her many canine friends were nice and welcoming.I cannot recommend this trip enough. It is very well planned and you get to see so much, but it is also very relaxing and laid back. Guillermo was a first-rate guide. You can really tell that he loves his job and enjoys sharing his knowledge and enthusiasm for the area. After dropping Guillermo off, both of us fell asleep in the car on the return trip (due to what Cesar called "the Malbec effect"), arriving at our hotel around 6:00 p.m. If you have a chance to do this tour, it is well worth it. Thank you Guillermo and Cesar for a wonderful day.

Laura (our guide) was wonderful!. We enjoyed walking the small town of San Antonio de Areco and learning about the history of this town in Argentina. The Estancia was good with a very dusty ride around a field on horse back and afterwards a lunch. We were disappointed with the Argentina meat that was served to us. It was very tough and not very eatable. The best part was the horse goucho show after the lunch. I would recommend a different Estancia with better horse trails and better food.

Very Good Tour - LONG Drive. On arriving in San Antonio de Areca about 11 AM, we were met by Julia who gave us a guided tour of the city square with lots of information about the town's history and architecture. We also visited several silversmiths to view their shops and products. It was a display of artistry with no pressure to purchase - very nice. She then accompanied us to the estancia where we were greeted by the owner and offered empenadas and drinks of our choice. Then it was time to ride the horses - we chose the carriage ride to see the area and the crops - wheat, corn and soybeans (which are exported). As we returned the dinner bell rang. After washing up, we were offered several salads including a delicious one with corn, rice and tomatoes followed by a pork and beef sausage, blood sausage, chicken, and several cuts of beef. All were excellent and again accompanied by drinks of choice. Dessert was ice cream and coffee. Mosco Pereria, a nationally known gaucho who has led the town's parade of gauchos sang a series of traditional ballads. The owner explained that the gauchos in this area used kindness to "break" a horse, reminiscent of the horse whisperer. Then we watched as a gaucho demonstrated his techniques. It was amazing what the man could get the horse to do, just with kindness. I downgraded this to four stars due to the length of time involved in picking up the three couples. We were all located in different parts of Buenos Aires and it took 1.5 hours to complete the pick-up before departing for the estancia and same upon return to the city. I would have appreciated a lower price and instructions to meet at a single point. As the driver spoke limited English, there was no tour or pointing out highlights during our transit of the city in rush hour.

Nice break from Buenos Aires. The tour was a nice getaway from the busy Buenos Aires. We booked the night before the tour yet there were no problems. The driver was on time to pick us up from the apartment we rented. The drive was smooth, not too far. Maria our guide was very nice and informative. The little town was cute. The estancia was relaxing. A nice lunch was served under the tree with a gaucho serenading you. The entire staff was welcoming. It might be a little pricey $170 USD per person.. But overall experience was pleasant.

Enjoyable interesting day!. This was an excellent tour! We were picked up at our hotel and driven to San Antonio de Areco. Our guide, Sofia, spoke excellent English, and pointed out sites of interest as we drove through the city. We then had an interesting tour of this very quaint little town and had a chance to stop at both the local silversmith and at a chocolate shop. Both times, we had enough time to shop and look around but the tour kept moving at a good pace. At the Estancia, we went horseback riding, then had a delicious barbecue lunch (including empanadas) and a very interesting display of Gaucho horseback skills. This tour was a great way to see some of the area outside of Buenos Aires and a truly delightful day!

Highlight of our trip!. This day was the highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. Our driver Jose Marie looked after us well, with a great sense of humour, and Guillermo showed us around San Antonio de Areco and the beautiful Estancia Ombu with great pride and told us lots of intersting things. The Alfajores in the little chocolate shop were the best we tasted, buy some, you won't be disappointed! The horse back ride on the Estancia was lovely, gently plodding along through the fields and past the cows. The Asado was wonderful, I have never eaten so much meat, and the horsemanship display was just incredible. You will not regret booking this trip, worth every penny!

Outstanding Day.... What an interesting and enjoyable day! THANK YOU, Juan and Laura. The estancia is beautiful, the horseback ride was fun, the food and gaucho entertainment were excellent and we loved the tour of the quaint town. What a fabulous day....be sure to include this delightful to the pampas when you are in Buenos Aires!!!!

Wonderful Experience - Full day of history, beautiful sites, and entertainment.. Loved the experience - make sure you set aside the whole day and have a healthy appetite. You will not go away hunger and that is a guarantee. It is perfectly planned out. Our day started out by being picked up from our apartment in Buenos Aires by Jose, who spoke perfect English, and was very entertaining and informative about the history of the area. He dropped us off in San Antonio de Areco, where we met our tour guide, Maria. Like Jose, Maria was very delightful and knowledgeable. We toured the quaint town and its main square, along with the church, gaucho bar, silversmith shop, and candy shop. We were fortunate to go during the week - met Maria's husband who is a silversmith along with his employees. Their craftsmanship, art drawings,displays, and the museum are amazing. Then it was off to the Estancia, where you are met with a beverage and a snack. Here, there is a carriage ride or horseback riding, gaucho singing, a demonstration by a horse whisperer, along with a meal you won't believe. The scenery is just gorgeous and peaceful. The lunch tables were setup outside and it was just so surreal. It was a great way to spend one day out of the city and relax. I hate to go into details about any of the events, because the day is something that you really need to experience. Would love to have been there or to be there on November 10th. (That will be my cliff hanger - you need to do your research for the rest of the story.) After our day was completed, Jose drove us back to our apartment. We never laughed so hard. I would like to mention that we forgot to take a picture of the cook and his grill. Jose was so kind as to take a photo the next day and email to us. Thank you Jose, Maria, Oscar, Javier and all others for a very memorable and enjoyable day.

Don't miss this! Wonderful experience!. From start to finish, Camino Pampa was wonderful. We were picked up at our hotel by a private van, so there was no confusion about transportation and directions. Jose, Mario, the driver, was very knowledgeable about the area and made the commute enjoyable. Once we arrived in San Antonio de Areco, we were met by Guillermo, our wonderful guide. He showed us some gaucho bars and a silversmith workshop in the quaint town and we visited a chocolate store known for his alfajores. After our walk through town, we rode to the Estancia. There we rode horses alongside Oscar, the grandson of a historic gaucho, and Javier, a younger gaucho. After riding, we had a delicious lunch of a variety of meats and salad. After lunch, we listened to Oscar play guitar and sing traditional songs and watched Javier calm a horse. All in all, it was wonderful and a highlight of our trip. Camino Pampas is a great way to escape the city and experience authentic Argentine culture.

Loved this experience so much!. What a fantastic day we had with the Camino Pampa tour. Jose Mario picked us up at our hotel in B. A. and proceeded to give us an in-depth explanation of all things gaucho: the town, the people, the history, the estancia, the pride and honor. It was very eye-opening and he couldn't have been nicer. He also explained scenic things on the way to San Anonio de Areco, which was very interesting, as well as answered all of our many questions. Once we arrived in San Antonio, the wonderful Laura took over for Jose Maria. Laura is a wealth of knowledge and is funny and kind. It's obvious she loves her town and its people and takes pride in the gaucho tradition and the way the town supports the gaucho life style. We also lucked out as a 92-year-old woman on a 1,000 kilometer (or was it miles?) pilgrimage was ending her walk in San Antonio at the moment we were there, at the church. It was a very special moment to be able to greet this woman with all of the townspeople and church bells ringing. After the town tour, we proceeded to the estancia. Again, what a great experience! We loved everything about it: the snack we got upon our arrival (Malbec and an empanada), our horseback riding guides, Oscar and Javier, Oscar's singing and guitar playing once we returned, the fabulous lunch (!), and observing Javier's horse-whispering skills. The grounds and architecture of the estancia are also very beautiful. If you are in Buenos Aires, you need to do this. It will open up your senses to something completely different and wonderful!

"Great value for the experience". My husband & I thoroughly enjoyed our day touring SanAntonio and the desire to hold onto the traditional methods of craftsmanship. Cesar was our very friendly, informative driver that kept us entertained for the 1 1/2 hr drive to San Antonio de Areco. Guillermo was our guide for the rest of the day and also very informative and gracious. It was another 20 minute drive out of town, then we switched to 4x4’s for the last 20 minutes on a very muddy road. It had rained that day so it made for a fun ride. Horseback ride was very tame. First timers could do it. BBQ was outstanding! So much food, and delicious. We were entertained by Oscar Pereyra playing his guitar and singing. He is an old time Goucho that truly looks the part. I am so glad I paid the $5 to buy his cd. The Goucho display was not what I expected. It was the "horse whisperer" display, not the fancy riding and tricks. I was a little disappointed until my husband explained that what they were doing with that horse, a normal horse would never let you do. One tip.....don't wear good clothes or shoes if it has rained."Honorar la Tradicion es parte de neutron futuro"

No cows in the Estancia!. The tour of the San Antonio de Areco town and the gaucho museum was very interesting. Our friendly guide, Maria, did a great job explaining all the accessories used by the gauchos and their horses and how they are manufactured. Her husband's family has a long tradition on silver manufacturing. Our driver was also very friendly and knowledgeable. Unfortunately it rained and our tour to the Estancia was greatly affected. First we had to go on a military like vehicle on an unpaved muddy road for probably 1 hour each way just to get to the ranch. It was crowded and uncomfortable. Tha is after another 1.5 hours each way from Buenos Aires. Then at the ranch the horse show was canceled and replaced by a demo of a "horse whisperer" which was interesting but not what we expected. It turns out that they do not have cows to herd because the fields are used for agriculture instead. So no gaucho show. The food was very good and served by friendly gauchos. My husband did the horse ride but some of us that did not want to do that could not do the carriage ride because of the muddy terrain. The property is very beautiful. They did their best to entertain us in spite of the weather but it turn out to be more of an eating/drinking event that a gaucho event. I am not sure if it is worth the long trip to the ranch and the high cost.

Wonderful experience. Was a great day discovering in the morning the old colonial town and their old style shops. Then tour into the real pampa to learn the Gauchos culture. You can also ride quite horses even if your 1st time. But the top is the final with a deliciour bbq. The best meat i ve ever tried

A Gaucho day. If you have the time and money, it is well worth it. It is a Gaucho day. They pick you up from your hotel, give you a very interesting tour of San Antonio de Areco. Then to the Estancia (ranch) for empanadas, a horseback or carriage tour, a large asado meal, and Gaucho music and horse show. Lots of explanation in English from the time they pick you up until back at the hotel.

Fantastic day trip to the pamas. This a great tour that handles everything from pickup in Buenos Aires to a walking tour of San Antonio de Areco, an afternoon at a ranch, and return to our hotel. Our tour began the moment we were picked up. Our driver spoke perfect English and gave us some of the history of Buenos Aires, the neighborhoods & cities on the way to the pampas, and answered our many questions about Argentina. Laura was our guide for the rest of the day. She was insightful and entertaining. The tour of San Antonio de Areco was great. Loved getting to watch the silversmiths work. The ranch was amazing. Lunch was a traditional Argentine barbecue and was perhaps the best beef of the trip. The horse whisperer and gauchos were impressive. We even got to ride horses.

Wonderful. It was wonderful, we enjoyed so much all the day. Maria, our guide was so interesting and kind, all activities and discoveries great, the farm so beautiful and the meal amazing!!!!! A perfect day!!!!
Education plus entertainment. Great day to learn Gaucho culture and horse riding is fun and safe. I am not a beef fan, but the barbecue lunch is excellent that I try lots of meat. Don't miss it !!!

Great side day trip. This was a great experience, it was so worth it. My son had a great time and wanted to stay at the Estancia. Laura, our guide was full of knowledge and our driver Miguel was great. The food was excellent and the gauchos were so fun. If you have allergies, make sure you take your meds before you go....

A Different Perspective of Buenos Aires. My wife and I selected this tour, because it offered not only an opportunity to visit an Argentine estancia to get a feel of life in the pampas, but also to visit a small provincial town. Overall, we were pleased with this experience, and would recommend taking this tour.A driver named Jose Maria picked us up at our hotel in Buenos Aires at 8:30am. Along the way, he provided a near continuous commentary about various aspects of Argentine life, particularly outside of Buenos Aires city centre, and in the pampas. We had not expected this value added service, and it was much appreciated. Also, he was a skillful driver, and was very friendly and personable.After a two-hour or less drive, we arrived at the town of San Antonio de Areco, and were greeted by a guide named Juan Manuel. He too had a wealth of information and stories to share with us, as we tour a traditional bar, a church, a traditional and a modern silversmith shops, and a chocolate confectionary shop, each of which reflected a specific aspect of the history of this town, particularly as a melting pot of immigrants from different countries. Note that the silver jewellery in Patricio Draghi and the alfajores in La Olla de Cobre are good buys.Afterwards we headed to the historic El Ombu de Areco estancia. By this time, we had become friends with Juan Manuel, who was very charming, on top of being an excellent guide. At this estancia, we had time to walk around and explore the estate manor and grounds, take a horseback or horse-drawn carriage ride around the pampas, have an ample and tasty lunch of Argentine BBQ specialties whilst being entertained by a bona fide gaucho performing traditional milonga music, and watch an amazing "horse whisperer" achieve complete control of his animal. Along the way, we learnt how incorrect it was to define a gaucho as a cowboy, and what that culture truly entailed.Afterwards, we exchanged contact details with Juan Manuel, bade him farewell, and headed back to Buenos Aires. Along the way, Jose Maria was kind enough to stop at a mini-market so that we could buy some water for use back in our hotel. At around 5pm, we arrived back at our hotel.It was a day well spent.
Excellent Day Trip. Maria was an excellent guide. The estancia was beautiful. The food was delicious and never-ending. Highly recommended.
