The guide was fabulous, enthusiastic, extremely knowledgeable, and made a effort to include everyone. Even the children enjoyed the city tour and hearing some of the history. The estancia was beautiful, and had many types of farm animals for the children to view (horses, cows, sheep, chickens, dogs, and a cat). The asado, empanadas and wine were of terrific quality. The beautiful setting, the warm and corteous people, the wonderful food and wine and the relaxing atmosphere made this excursion worth every penny.Some practicalities:The tour was an all day affair. We were picked up in Buenos Aires at 8:30 a.m. and returned at around 7 p.m. in the evening. Although San Antonio de Areco is about a two hour drive, the journey was very pleasant. The van was comfortable and the driver provided very interesting information along the way. The walking tour of the town is fairly short and can easily be done by people of all ages. The town has several interesting shops were braided leather and silver items could be purchased (but the shopping was not pushed or even suggested by the guide.... in fact we had to ask for the opportunity to buy a few souvenirs, which was gracioulsy provided when we asked). You will want to bring a camera, and depending on the time of year a bathing suit (there is a lovely pool at the estancia). Also one of the activities on the estancia is horseback riding. The horses are very tame and seem to know the route by heart. It was terrific for the children, and a wonderful way to see the estancia's pastoral areas. I can't think of any downside to this excursion, except that there was no baby changing station in the restroom however they were very kind in offering other options. Overall it was a terrific experience.

Spectacular experience!. We just returned from our honeymoon in Argentina, and one of the highlights of our stay was our day going to San Antonio de Areco and a nearby estancia under the lovely direction of Guillermo! He made it so simple and hassle-free. A very professional and lively local driver picked us up and drove us to San Antonio. The town was delightful, and his knowledge of the town and familiarity with the artisans provided a very intimate tour. The time on the estancia was amazing, and the food and wine were first rate! It was just a lovely, and though very full, relaxing day.
Geart day out from BA - Pampa trip. We had a fantastic trip and would suggest anyone vising Buenos Aries should add this day out to their itinerary - a taste of the true Argentina

Highlight of my trip to Buenos Aires. We started the trip with a wonderful driver by the name of Jose Maria and spent the day touring the small town of San Antonio de Areco with our excellent guide Manuel. After the tour, we spent the afternoon at the Ombu Estancia where we were greeted with delicious empanadas and drink. The town was great but the Estancia was absolutely AMAZING. It was a beautiful ranch, the staff was lovely, the food was delicious and the horseback riding was great. Don Oscar (the gaucho that led us in the horseback riding and who serenade us) was truly lovely. I highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

A wonderful day away. First of all, I have to commend Guillermo - due to our poor planning, we hadn't even contacted him about joining the tour until 11pm the previous night, and he still courteously and quickly confirmed our reservation for the following morning (lucky us!). As for the experience itself - our tour guide Manuel really made the day special. It's rare to have an experience where you can't stop smiling for hours on end, but that's what Manuel brought to our day - with his fascinating tidbits about the local history and culture, his informal, charming style, and his warmth and genuine attention to everyone's experience - he's a special guy, and he added tremendously to our experience. As for the day itself - the local town was charming, and we enjoyed the tour of the local church, bar, and silversmith's workshop - it was not at all a tourist trap - there was no shopping involved! :-) The estancia was beautiful, as were the horses. The gauchos displayed great skill in their demonstrations, and great patience with those of us with little experience riding horses across the beautiful plains. My heart wishes the ride could have been longer, although my body feels it was just right! The food was plentiful, and if not quite at the level of the best steakhouses in Buenos Aires, it was certainly a very pleasant meal with good company. The demonstrations could have been a little longer (there was no music, as some had mentioned), and a little more explanations (in English) of what we were watching would have been nice. But I can't really complain, because this tour was exactly what I hoped it would be, and I'm sure you'll love it, too!

Highlight of Buenos Aires Trip. We loved this tour. Great town and Estancia. Wished we had arranged to spend the night here so we ccould wander the streets and spend more time.We were unable to book Guillermo for our tour and we were a little disappointed at first. Until we met Manuel, he is a very special person and any disappointment we had left as soon as he greeted us. So, so happy for our experience. He is a wonderful story teller as he guides you through the town and Estancia. It was a special day mainly because of Manuel and his words of wisdom. Highly recommend this tour!

Excellent Day Trip. This was a fantastic day which I would thoroughly recommend and Guillermo was a great tour guide. The town of San Antonio de Areco was really worth a visit and the estancia was brilliant. We were welcomed with cold drinks and empanadas before taking a horse ride. We then had a wonderful lunch and were entertained by the gauchos. This was definitely a highlight of our trip to Argentina.

Authentic!. We really enjoyed our day with Guillermo in San Antonio de Areco! He was very welcoming when we arrived in the town of San Antonio de Areco where we learned lots of history while visiting the church, a restaurant/bar, an impressive silvershop and adorable chocolate shop where we saw them making alfajores. El Ombu is the perfect estancia, just the right size, not touristy. We had a great meal, then rode some of the best horses I have ever ridden! This is a fantastic way to see another side of Argentina…the gaucho life!

wonderful and unique trip to San Antonio de Areco. We had a wonderful trip to San Antonio. The driver came to our B and B to the second and drove us to the city. Guillermo met us there and gave us a tour with a knowledgeable background. (Since we enjoy history that was much appreciated). He also took us to a few shops (silver and chocolate in particular) which were worth a visit; neither shop pressured us to purchase any thing, and were very friendly. From there we were taken to a working estancia. I rode a horse for a good while among the cattle. The tour was interesting. Then an asado for lunch of great quality. Then three gauchos came forward. One sang. Another showed of a horse trained literally to roll over etc. Finally, we saw another herd young partially broken horses.....all from our tables outside where lunch (and wine) was served. The explanation of how the gauchos differed from USA cowboys was also interesting. All in all its a great trip Guillermo has put together.....Would recommend this to anyone.

Don't miss this. This one-day attraction was the highlight of a 10-day visit to BA; our guide Manual gave a truly wonderful tour of Areco Town where he had grown up. He was the most interesting Argentine resident we met. The time at the estancia was fabulous; the hosts there are just wonderful. The place is beyond beautiful; had a great ride on horse buggy (others went horseback). The lunch was magnificent; and the entertainment by the gauchos was also remarkable. Take this tour!

A Highlight of our South America Trip. Guillermo, thank you for a most memorable and enjoyable day. The five couples in our group all agree that your Camino Pampa tour ranks right up there with Machu Picchu and Iguazu Falls as a highlight of our two-week South America trip. Your tour to San Antonio de Areco town and the estancia stands out as the most authentic and least touristy of all of our experiences in S.A. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants a taste of the Gaucho culture. The town is quaint and the estancia is glorious. Everything - from the empanada and Malbec greeting to the horseback ride, the amazing barbecue lunch and gaucho music, to the almost mystical horse taming demonstration - was perfect. You and the people we met in the town and at the estancia made this a very special part of our trip. Thank you. We have already recommended you to a friend who is traveling to Argentina in the near future.

Tour Guide Guillermo makes this a must do day trip!. Camino Pampa was recommended by our personal tour guide (Mariela from Buenos Aires Concierge) when we had requested a day at an Estancia. I had heard of others but she strongly recommended this one as so many of the others were very "touristy" and not what we wanted. We were picked up at our hotel at 8am and after one other quick stop to pick up 2 more people, we were on our way. Our driver made our 1 and a half hour trip very enjoyable and shared so much of his knowledge about Argentina in general and also the Gaucho traditions. The town of San Antonio de Areco is a very small town that truly holds on to it's Gaucho traditions. Once we arrived at the town square, Guillermo Gonzalez Guereno was there to meet us. Although we speak fluent Spanish, our other guests were from England and Guillermo was the perfect tour guide as his English is very fluent. The town was very interesting as we visited the church with it's strong Irish history and two gaucho bars that remain true to their heritage. Also visited were two silver craftsman where Guillermo explained the history of the silver used on the gaucho's belts along with the different knives used. It all makes so much sense when you understand the history and Guillermo made it all come to life. We then visited the silversmith that had made the silver ornamentation for our present Pope Francis. There it was very impressive to see them actually making some of the pieces on display and knowing that only three of each item would be made. This is a definite place you might want to purchase a small silver bracelet as a special keepsake. Their prices are very fair and they will accept USD. Of course, no trip is complete without a stop for chocolate and alfajores, the Argentinian cookie with dulce de leche in the middle. In this small shop, you are able to see how they are made and of course sample these delicious treats no doubt enticing you to purchase some which are worth EVERY calorie consumed! All of this takes place within 2-3 small blocks so there is minimal walking involved and you might be accompanied by several very friendly neighborhood dogs. We are picked up once again by our driver who takes us all on a 10 minute ride to the Estancia. These are beautiful grounds that also have a B&B. Upon arrival, we are met by Patricia who served us wine and empanadas that were delicious. We soon were on our way on horseback for a short ride around the vast property where most of the horses were your everyday "trail horses" that pretty much followed one another but if you wished and were able to, you were able to "break from the pack" and do some cantering around the property. If you are looking to REALLY ride horses, this is not the place to do it but more to get an appreciation of the life of a gaucho. Upon our return, we were served the BEST asado and it was never ending. My husband raved about the meat. Patricia was so gracious and made me a special salad as Guillermo had told her that I don't eat meat (but trust me, I did NOT starve in Argentina as there are so many wonderful choices of food that don't include red meat). Along with the different cuts of meat served by the gauchos, there were grilled potatos, salad, sliced tomatoes, fresh breads and wines. To top it off, coffee and your choice of flan with dulce de leche and homemade ice cream. All of it, wonderful. After lunch, one of the gauchos came running over on a horse that he has been working with for a couple of years. What he was able to accomplish with this horse was amazing and although this "show" might not be as flashy as other gaucho shows at different estancias, those that truly know and appreciate horses will understand and appreciate what it takes to do what this gaucho did with his horse. After, you are able to take a photo lying down with the horse and the look of serenity in his eyes is priceless. We then took a tour of the grounds with Guillermo when Patricia caught up with us again to serve us more treats of freshly made pastelitos filled with quince fruit and cream cheese...delicious! The warmth and friendliness shown by everyone made this a great day and Guillermo's knowledge made it all the better! I highly recommend spending the day with Guillermo and learning about the gaucho history. He is the ultimate host!

Interesting and Enjoyable day trip from Buenos Aires. Went after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. San Antonio de Arco was particularly interesting, espceiallyu the gaucho bars and craft workshops. The gaucho ranch was excellent as was the barbecue (pleanty to eat and drink) - the beef was delicious but it would have nice to see more of the gaucho skills demonstrated. Host was very welcoming and our guide was excellent.

Great Gaucho traditions day trip - best asado!. Tour Guide Guillermo González Guereño and our driver Jose Maria Lopez were outstanding English speaking guides, historians, and Argentine hosts. I highly recommend arranging this day trip with Guillermo. We learned so much Argentine history! Jose Maria picked us up at our Buenos Aires hotel and proceeded to point out sites, neighborhoods, and the history of the pampas from our hotel all the way to San Antonio de Areco. We met Guillermo, who lives there and guided us through the historical Gaucho town, the highlight being a visit to Artist Michelangelo Gasparini's Studio, where we found several paintings of gauchos on horseback we loved and had to buy. Guillermo took us to a Gaucho bar, where sure enough, there were retired gauchos relaxing there. We also visited a silversmith who explained the history and demonstrated the process silver making. Then we went to the Estancia El Ombu where we were greeted with empanadas and wine. We went on a trail ride around the ranch with gauchos. We were then served the best Asado we had in Argentina. A traditional gaucho played the guitar and sang songs. We then toured around of the Estancia, Guillermo explained the history of the trees and bushes and their origins on the Pampas. Then we toured the inside of the mansion. I wished we had planned to stay at the Estancia a night or two. I would recommend it to anyone who would like to slow down and relax away from the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires. Ask for Guillermo, he's the best!!! Thank you Guillermo for sharing your vast knowledge of Argentina with us!

Worthwhile day trip from Buenos Aires. We booked this tour with Camino Pampa after reading the reviews here on tripadvisor. I can only echo what others have said - it was not cheap, but easy to book via email, with good communication before the trip; the driver was on time, Guillermo was engaging, the estancia and all of its ex-street dogs beautiful, the food delicious, the goucho/horse whisperer performance impressive if somewhat bizarre...we were blessed with unseasonal warmth and sunshine, which might have helped making this day so wonderfully relaxing.

The best day of our stay in Argentina!. It was a bit expensive for us, but totally worth it! San Antonio is a nice place, the estancia is beautiful, the horse riding was fun and the BBQ was amazing! At the estancia there was another couple, but not a mass of tourists as some other estancias have. Besides, if you want you can stay at the estancia, it is a beautiful hotel as well! We paid 150 us dollar per person, inclusive a transfer from Buenos aires and back! We totally recommend this tour!

Enjoyable day trip from Buenos Aires. I hate to be the first to give a 4 star review rather than a 5, but I have got to be honest! In no way does it mean that we didn't enjoy the day - we did very much, and 4/5 is still a good rating!I can't fault Guillermo for his professionalism and communication, he was in touch constantly prior to the day keeping us updated. Unfortunately he emailed the night before our tour to say he was unable to be our guide and that there would be a replacement guide and driver. The driver who picked us up was very prompt and professional and our guide, a lady named Veronica was very nice too. The guys who run the estancia were great, there were two opportunities to ride the horses there and the food and wine was good. Overall, I'd definitely recommend the day if you are in Buenos Aires and would like to get out into the country for a change. I'd also recommend Camino Pampa as a company who are really professional and reliable. The reason I have not given 5 stars is that I feel our day lacked a few of the special touches mentioned by some of the other reviews which seem to have made the day real value for money (as it wasn't cheap!). For example, we were not greeted at the estancia with empanadas and wine, we just had the main bbq meal. Also, there was no gaucho singing and playing guitar there. (I do realise the estancia is not actually ran by Camino Pampa and so they might not have had full control over this). Also, although our guide was very nice, it sounds like Guillermo adds a special touch to his tours and with it being just the two of us during the day, it was a little bit quiet at times. For example, our driver, though polite and professional did not chat to us much and provide info on the journey like some other reviewers have said they experienced with Guillermo (language barrier perhaps, I'm not sure!). Having said all this, I do appreciate that it was the (cold!) winter season and just 2 of us on the tour, which may have affected things. We still had a great day out and would recommend both the experience and the company to others.

Amazing tour in San Antonio de Areco. This tour is amazing, i was looking for doing something different in Buenos AIres, and i found this tour option throguh a friend´s recommendation, i went with a friend and we both had an awesome time, Guillermo is just great as a person and guide, very knowledgeable and very friendly. Everything was fantastic, food, guiding, Pablo, horse riding, the ranch, everything.I would highly recommend this tour. If happens for Cesar Coppola to be your driver from Buenos Aires to San Antonio de Areco, he is a great aswell, try to practice your spanish with him.A must to do.

San Antonio de Areco & Estancia El Ombu guided visit with Guillermo. About our experience last June 1st of this year. Guillermo (our tour guide) arranged transfers for our family from Buenos Aires to San Antonio de Areco. We met him at the main plaza in Areco. He was very polite and spoke English very clearly. From there on we started a fascinating journey about the history of the area, the gauchos' life and the culture. We went to the Estancia El Ombu where we rode horses thru the open fields of the estancia which was beautiful and a lot of fun. We finished off the afternoon eating an excellent asado with folkloric entertainment by real gauchos. Our guide Guillermo is very knowledgeable and attentive. My wife and I and the rest of our family highly recommend the Camino Pampa for a real Argentinean Pampa experience. by Ricardo Aisenberg

Great Tour. Been reading the reviews and took a chance on the tour. It was great! Basically we had a private tour because it was the off season. They picked us up from our hotel by car, drove us there, got a tour of the town for about 1 hour, then took us to a working ranch. There we went horseback riding, ate bbq, watch a horse act like a dog, and tour the ranch. really nice, even found some pecans from a tree to eat!

Culture and skills in the Pampas. During our recnet vist to Buenos Aires we took a day trip with Caminopampma to see the town of Areco and one of it's Estancias. Our guide Guillermo was fantastic. He seemed to know everything we asked him and more. The tour around Areco provided inspiring insight into the local culture and their skills and trades. We visited the church, the bars, a silversmith workshop and a chocolatiere where we sampled the most delicious alfajores of all time! At the Estancia we were able to ride with the "guachos" followed by an asado. The "guacho" display after lunch was the only slight disappointment as it was a very limited display and we had expected to seemore. However overall the day was one of the highlights of our trip and if you take this tour please use Guillermo and Caminopampa and you won't be disapponted.Elspeth, Philip and Amy

A Great Experience. If you are looking for a fun day outside of the hustle and bustle of BA, consider Guillermo's personalized tour. You will walk the streets of his beloved town San Antonio de Areco then visit a working estancia. Ride horses or take a carriage ride around the ranch. Have a wonderful lunch of BBQ meats and all the trimmings, including wine. Then see a demonstrations by real Gauchos.

Camino Pampa. My partner and I had a most memorable and enjoyable day. Guillermo was a superb guide with a vast knowledge of Argentina/ecology,history and all sorts of interesting things. we loved seeing this sdie of Argentina after the hustle bustle of Buenos Aires.I thoroughly reccommend this tour to anyone vivisting the area.......a wonderfu, fabulous day!!!!!

Relaxing, fun, interesting. I second all the other great reviews! Guillermo's love of his town and culture was captivating. The quick tour of San Antonio de Areco was very interesting and the day the Estancia was just delightful! The food was great, the riding was fun, the entertainment was amazing! Nice to do something a little different.

Wonderful day!. My husband and I spent a wonderful day with Guillermo, our guide, and four others travelers. Guillermo picked us up at our rented apartment in Buenos Aires and drove us to San Antonio de Areco. Along the way we were able to see the countryside outside of the city. Guillermo was an excellent host and guide, sharing his hometown with us and answering our questions. Then he drove us to the estancia, a large beautiful ranch on the pampas. We enjoyed a horseback ride and then a delicious asado, a meal of assorted grilled meats, and fresh vegetable side dishes. After lunch, one of the gauchos, who cares for the horses, entertained us with gaucho songs. The day was perfect (even the weather!) and we felt like we'd had an excellent introduction to the history, culture, and life in a small town in Argentina and on the pampas.

A perfect day in the Pampas!. We were 5 days in Buenos Aires and wanted to see a little beyond the the city too. A day in the Pampas with Guillermo and Camino Pampa was the perfect choice for our group of 4. Guillermo was exactly on time picking us at our hotel. The van, was newer, clean and comfortable, for the roughly 90 minute drive from BA to our first stop in San Antonio De Areco. San Antonia De Areco is a small, very walkable and picturesque town. Founded in the 1700's, there are still many wonderful old colonial buildings, and it retains a gaucho vibe to it. We were able to go into a number of preserved historic buildings, and visit the back shops of artisans shops who make leather goods and create silverworks. And although these shops sell their goods - there was no pressure to buy (but we did) After leaving the town we headed out to the estancia, it was incredibly gorgeous and peaceful...We learned the history of the estancia and area, toured the stables, and guest rooms (it's possible to stay here also - maybe next time) before deciding to take the carriage ride around the property, none of us ride -but the horses were gorgeous. It's a very laid back and relaxing atmosphere, we met other travellers and shared stories, before having a wonderful asado (grill) and steak lunch in the garden. This was followed by what looked to be the quintessential gaucho, on his guitar strumming and singing the songs and of the pampas. If it were even possible to top this we were then treated to an incredible display of gaucho horsemanship... Guillermo is an outstanding host and this was one of the most wonderful days of our trip - I'd do this day again in heartbeat!

Fantastic!. This tour was a fantastic experience and probably our most memorable while in Argentina. Guillermo was a terrific tour guide and host! Very accommodating to our party of 9 even rescheduling our tour to later in the week due to rain. He provided us with fountains of information regarding La Pampa and the gaucho way of life. We couldn't have had a better day for the afternoon we spent at the estancia. The horseback riding and asado were great. The highlight was probably when the gaucho pictured above sung a couple of songs to the group with his guitar. The man may be the most legitimate person I have ever met. Highly recommended!

A Must Do!. My husband and I absolutely loved our day at the ranch. The drive was rather long getting there but the scenery was terrific and it was nice to get out of BA to see more of the country. We arrived and were greeted by the best empanadas we have had. We then chose to go horseback riding and truly enjoyed the experience. I just wish it was much longer since we didn't go very far. We were then encouraged to walk around the ranch and it was such a relaxing experience. This was followed by a terrific lunch with an assortment of meats - there was plenty of food and no one should go hungry from this feast. The staff was so nice and when we return to BA, we have decided that we will actually spend a night here since it was such a relaxing atmosphere with terrific food and great service. We would highly recommend doing this for those who like "out of the city" experiences and horses, it's worth every penny.

Awesome day at the estancia. After being picked up at my hotel in Buenos Aires, I spent an awesome day in San Antonio de Areco and at the estancia! Both the driver and the guide (Guillermo) were really great. I enjoyed the horseback riding, the asado and the whole experience there. I highly recommend this tour. One of the best days of my trip.

excekkent. I believe that this company may be the only organization that can provide both a tour of the gaucho town san antonio de acreco as well as a stay at a well known estancia for an excellent price. Originally I thought the name of the estancia would be camino pampa. I was happy that Ombu a very popular estancia was part of the pakage. Guillermo is a great host: this was a seamless experience, than van carried eight of us in total. There was narration during the drive to the town as well as guillermo conducting us through touring of the town. He also did the hosting at the estancia. If you wish to have 'gaucho' experience as part of your buenos aires trip with both visiting a gaucho town and an estancia as a turn key operation without going broke in paying for it; then, contact guillermo. We are glad that we did.

Excellent. I cannot but agree with earlier reviews. The tour provides an insight into the nature of Argentenian country life, the meals are excellent, the people very friendly, and my wife was even pesuaded to mount a horse - and survived. The tour of the town was very interesting too.Thanks to all who made it possible.

One of my most memorable days. I cannot recommend this day more highly. The other excellent reviews say it all. I will just say after a lovely week in Buenos Aires with my daughter this last day of our holiday was the icing on the cake. A wonderful day - thanks Guillermo!

Go Guillermo. After 4 trips to Buenos Aires we finally heeded the recommendation of friends to spend the day with Guillermo and visit San Antonio de Areco. WOW. Guillermo was a fabulous host and chock full of folklore. Arrangements for travel were impeccable. After being picked up at our hotel in the city we arrived in town to be greeted by Guillermo and visit local artisans. The day spent on the ranch was relaxing, fun and inviting. Guillermo planned the perfect day and did not miss a beat. As a reward we even taught him the art of a New York Egg Cream.

A Real Treat. This day trip was fantastic. Friends had taken it two weeks before us and said it was a must do. They were so right.Guillermo is the consumate professional. We were picked up at our hotel on time and headed out to the beautiful town of San Antonio de Areco where we learned the fascinating history of the settlement of the town. The countryside is lovely and we learned that the mainstay at the moment for the farming community is soybeans....After the town tour we arrived at the Estancia to a very welcoming staff. The gauchos were fabulous. The horseride was great and the food served to us at outside tables under lovely shade trees was perfect.Guillermo's command of English is nearly perfect. He is extremely engaging and truly loves what he does. I would absolutely make this trip a priority for anyone spending a few days in Buenos Aires.

An outstanding experience, one we won't forget. I won't go into a detailed description of the tour as you can read about it in the other excellent written reviews. Sometimes it can be difficult to find a really unique travel event, but finding Camino Pampa and Guillermo Guereno on the Internet made for a very memorable experience. The whole day was very enjoyable, relaxing and interesting with Guillermo as our guide all day. Guillermo also set us up with airport transportation and a great tour guide and half day tour in Buenos Aires. I can't say enough great things about our experience and would highly recommend Camino Pampa and Guillermo. The tour guide in Buenos Aires that Guillermo recommended and set up was Maria Panetta at (www.privatebatours.com).

A Terrific Day. We loved this day trip. Our driver and guide, Guillermo, were courteous, punctual and enthusiastic. The town was clean and charming. I loved the estancia, especially horse-back riding through the fields. Lunch was simple but fresh and delicious. Highly recommended for a nice day out of the city.

camino pampas day trip. This was such a great experience to get out of the hustle bustle of Buenos Aires and see the countryside. Guillermo picked us up at our apartment, on time and in a nice clean van with a good driver, which we appreciated. We had another couple join us and it was a great ride to the countryside with Guillermo giving us insight into the country. He was the first person we met who spoke good English which allowed us to ask a lot of questions. We got to the town and enjoyed the tour of a couple of restaurants and church. In the silversmith shops we were able to learn a bit about their trade and see some beautiful silver pieces. The town was quiet so it was good to tie the visit in with the estancia. Onto the estancia, which was wonderful with a large front porch where we had lunch. Lunch was good with the empanadas being the best we had all trip. You had time to either ride a horse, have a carriage ride or swim before lunch. Guillermo had a wonderful sense of humor and really did a great job in making sure we were taken care of.

A wonderful day away from the city. My wife and I, both long time residents of Buenos Aires wanted to show visiting friends a bit of the countryside and the pampas. Another well recommended place could not accommodate us on the date we wanted, and put us in contact with Camino Pampa. We were not disappoinnted. The driver picked us up at our apartment on time, and took the five of us to San Antonio de Areco. We were given a personalized tour of this historic town, and then taken to the ranchwhere we were met by the gauchos who took us on horseback around the estancia. The horses were saddled and ready for us. After our ride we had an asado lunch where the gauchos played the guitar and sang. We were the only day visitors this day, the rest of the guests were staying overnight at the estancia. It would be a nice place to spend the whole weekend. After a few hours of relaxation on the ranch we were driven in a minivan back to our apartment. There was a discount for paying in cash. All in all, a great experience for everyone.

Would Do This Again In A Heartbeat!. On my last day in Buenos Aires, I decided rather than sit around a hotel or airport killing time, it would be nice to see an estancia. After doing some research, I decided to take my Mom and spend the day at Camino Pampa. What a perfect way to end what had been nothing short of a perfect trip, which was a cruise around Cape Horn! Guillermo had a driver come to pick us up for the drive to San Antonio de Areco, which was slightly over an hour outside of Buenos AIres. Guillermo met us and gave a walking tour of this charming little town, full of gaucho history. In addition, there was an unusually large Irish population that had emigrated there, so in that respect, it was like being back in the states. He took us to the church, a silversmith, a jeweler, and the equivalent of a local "pub". Without question, it was one of the most atmospheric little towns, with the most engaging people, we had ever seen. Afterwards, he took us to the estancia where we were treated to an asado, a barbecue lunch that consisted of beef, sausage, chicken, salad and all kinds of great food, accompanied by beverages, including great Argentine wines. We spent time with one of the gauchos, Jose Antonio, and all but adopted him! Afterwards, there was a demonstration of how the gauchos train the horses, work with and interact with them. They have a way of communicating with them that I've never seen before, almost like "horse whisperers". The horses have a very gentle nature, and they are such that Jose was able to get one to lay down and have some of the guests, myself included, lay down on the horse like one with one's pet dog. It was quite an experience! For anyone going to Buenos Aires, if you have the time, the city is one of the most incredible on the planet, but you will need a break from it for a day, and this is the perfect opportunity to take advantage of that. Go to Camino Pampa and see how beautiful this wonderful country really is.

Reviews are true - Excellent tour!. What a wonderful way to learn about gaucho culture so close to Buenos Aires! Guillermo was very responsive to all of our questions via email and exceeded our expectations in every category. He made sure to let us know who was picking us up, what time they would arrive and confirmed our trip the day before. We met Guillermo in San Antonio and he took us on a tour of the town. He is clearly very knowledgeable about San Antonio, but also about about Argentinian history overall. We visited several shops in the city, but never felt pressure to buy anything. Later in the day, we went to the ranch -- the highlight of the trip. Upon our arrival, we were served delicious empanadas and our choice of beverage. We had a choice to ride a horse, ride a carriage, or just sit and relax. The ranch is absolutely gorgeous. We decided to ride the horses, which was a lot of fun. The horses were well-trained under the gauchos watch. After horse riding through the ranch, we had a delicious lunch with several cuts of meat, veggies, dessert, coffee, and wine. We highly recommend this tour with Guillermo. He is truly passionate about sharing gaucho culture and his knowledge and enthusiasm made this day very memorable.

A memorable day in the country in Argentina. This tour was one of the highlights of our brief visit to Argentina. Raúl and Laura gave us great insights into the culture of this country and we enjoyed visiting the beautiful town of San Antonio de Areco and the visit to the Estancia was wonderful. Everybody made sure we were well looked after and we were treated as guests and not just tourists. The meal was delicious and the opportunity to learn a bit about gaucho culture was very special. We will plan to stay longer in this beautiful place on a future visit to Argentia.The booking arrangements worked perfectly and the communication and email confirmations were very helpful. We were happy to do this as a small and personal tour with very comfortable transport.All the positive reviews are well deserved.

Worth every penny! Amazing day trip!. I'm a luxury travel writer for a living and I give this my seal of approval. I went with my husband and we enjoyed every single second of this trip. The town we visited first was beautiful. The Estancia was awesome, beautiful and fun! And the food was one of the best meals I had the entire time in Buenos Aires. And my guide, Guillermo was so professional, intelligent and spoke great English. To see my photos and read my full review:http://travelingpanties.com/2013/01/19/buenos-aires-travel/If you leave me a comment there I will answer any questions.

A Day in Estancia Life. I have traveled to Argentina in the past, but this was the first trip as an adult that my son had made to his father's homeland. We wanted to get out of Buenos Aires and see some of the traditional crafts and if possible an Estancia. We found Camino Pampa on the internet and booked the trip with Guillermo. Don Carmelo picked us promptly and we had a lovely drive out to the countryside. Guillermo shared the history of San Antonio de Areco, the gaucho lifestyle and culture and even taught my son to drink Mate! It was a very memorable trip and helped my son understand more of his "patria's" history. I enjoyed the country air, wine and food!Thanks Guillermo! Miguel will get you the film and pictures as soon as he gets them edited!

Fun day at the ranch. Taking a tour with Camino Pampas was such a great decision! My mom, sister, and I spent the day learning about gaucho culture, eating delicious food, and riding/watching horses. The Estancia itself is increadibly beautiful, and everyone we interacted with, from Guillermo (our main guide) to Carmello, our driver for the day, were incredibly warm and friendly. Everyone seemed to be genuinely excited to share their culture with us, and we really appreciated it. Thanks Guillermo!

Exceeded my expectations. As a solo traveller, with limited time and on my first trip to Argentina, I wanted to experience an authentic Estancia and the history of the Gaucho. I didn't want the commercially oriented tourist experience and I found the ideal day trip with Guillermo. A small group of three, pickup from the hotels and a pleasant ride to san antonio de areco. Guillermo gave us a very informative walking tour of the town followed by a trip to the Estancia with a welcome drink and best tasting empanadas in Argentina. A horseback ride, great lunch, gaucho demonstration and a walk around the grounds completed a fantastic day before being driven back to BA. The experience exceeded my expectations. This was a tour with a personal touch achieved by Guillermo's passion for what he does, the friendliness of everyone on the estancia and the beautiful countryside. You really got the feeling of what it is to be a proud Argentinian. Highly recommended.

Amazing Day. I had already visited an Estancia last year whilst in Buenos Aires for work. it was great ,but I felt it was a bit too touristy!. So this time being my husbands first time to Argentina I was looking for something truely authentic. Camino Pampa!!We were picked up promptly from our hotel in Buenos Aires by Guillermo, who is delightful and so knowledgeable. We visited the town of San Antonio de Areco - so beautiful and then onto Camino Pampa.The food was fantastic, the wine superb and the atmosphere priceless!After lunch Oscar sang and played his guitar under the shade of the tree....what more could one ask for!As a travel agent I am always looking for unique experiences to pass onto clients. Camino Pampa and Guillermo is definitely one of those experiences you must not miss whilst in Buenos Aires.!Thank you Guillermo!

Achievement of the Impossible. I was so surprised by our day in Septmber with Guillermo & the estancia. Guillermo's knowledge of the area & the gaucho culture was more than the translation of text from a history book. His pride in his culture was evident in every single word, it was more like the telling of a love story. I've owned horses for most of my life, worked in a riding school & ridden in many. The estancia that we visited had the most well behaved & well cared for horses in any that I've every seen. They were fat, healthy & happy.I'm very passionate about travelling, but most of the time my overall feeling is that I'm lucky to be Australian. The day with Guillermo made me wish that I was Argentine! My only question is......do they need an Australian stable hand???

An unforgetable day. While in Argentina we wanted to experience the Pampa and an Estancia. We looked at diffrent possibilities. Then we found Camino Pampa. This was exactly what we needed. An organized daytrip to the countryside with a friendly host and driver. Gulliermo started the tour by picking us up at the hotel and explaining a lot on the way to San Antonio de Areco. After a short tour through town we wen to the beautiful estancia. We were treated like kings with welcome drinks and delicious Empanadas. On a horseback over the estancia and then a real Asado. We were all the time acompanied by Gulliermo who explained and showed us everything. We were just 5 persons so it was very intimate. A great day and worth the money!

Horse Whisperer the best. A great tour. It had it all, gauchos, horses, great meal, tour of the ranch by horseback, music, demonstration by the gaucho of how well trained his horse was. You could feel the spirit between the horse and the gaucho. Don't miss this one................. There were only 3 of us on this tour.

Wonderful day trip. Camino Pampa was a great trip away from the crowded city. Guilermo started the tour the minute after he picked us up at our rented apartment. He started explaining what the buildings were and what part of the city we were driving through. The easy one hour ride took us to the small town of San Antonio de Areco which was dedicated and preserved for the gaucho traditions. Then there was a tour of a museum, a silversmith shop, and a section of the town. The highlight of the day was the estancia, a working ranch with horse rides or a carriage ride. There were empanadas and drinks and a terrific Argentine lunch under a large tree. After lunch we had a serenade and an amazing show of horse training by a gaucho.

The best guide we have ever had - wonderful!!. This is your review:We were collected from our hotel Own Palermo, they booked us a tour with an English Speaking Guide - Guillermo. We travel the world and he was the best guide we have ever had. He was thoughtful, polite, kind and very intelligent. I couldn't recommend him enough. Marcellis at the hotel highly recommended him for private tours.The estancia was wonderful, with a traditional Argentine ASADA and wonderful wine for lunch. We had an hour horse ride on the Pampas which was truly relaxing. The hospitality was wonderful. The gaucho sang at dinner and we saw tears in people's eyes, they really respect their traditions. It was a terrfic day, I couldn't recommend it enough.

Amazing day!. We had a fantasic day with Guillermo. His knowledge of the san antonio de areco area, the history of the gaucho's and angentina in general was terrific. The lunch was delicious and the horse taming quite amazing. Highly recommend!

The highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. Thank you, Guillermo! What a wonderful day we had with you. We generally don't like doing tours and prefer exploring ourselves when traveling. However, we are SO glad we chose to visit San Antonio de Areco and the El Ombu estancia with you. It was informative, personal and enjoyable and felt like we were traveling with another friend. We would recommend camino pampa and Guillermo to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires. Not to be missed!

Wonderful day. We have just spent a wonderful day with Guillermo Guereno on his San Antonio de Areco and Estancia tour. His English is perfect and his historical knowledge was unbelievably comprehensive. We had a wonderful tour of the town which included a tour of a well known silversmith, a visit to the beautiful Cathedral and a beer in the authentic,historical Gaucho bar of the town, amongst other things.We then visited a working Estancion where we went out on a horse ride with genuine Gauchos and were treated to a wonderful Asado lunch with Malbec, serenaded by a gaucho on guitar. We were then treated to one of the most unbelievable demonstrations of horse training.The experience far exceeded our expectations and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

Come for Gaucho life, Stay for the Meat... My boyfriend and I recently spent the day with Guillermo visiting San Antonio de Areco and had one of the most informative and interesting days. I am a teacher and always looking for a tour based in history and Guillermo offered all that and more. I've found that some of the city tours in Buenos Aires tend to tell the same history over and over, but Guillermo's viewpoints and information is completely unique and original. If you have any knowledge of Argentine history this tour is a must because you truly can't read all the information he provides in a regular history book on Argentina or Latin America. The day started when Guillermo picked us up at our hotel in Palermo and drove us out to San Antonio de Areco. From there we toured the colonial town. We visited a silversmith shop (one of the most interesting artistic presentations I've ever seen). While there Guillermo explained the traditional dress of the gaucho and the meaning behind the silver that adornes the gaucho. He also showed us how silver is transformed from its pure form into a piece of artwork. From the silversmith shop we went for a walk around the town visiting the San Antonio church and original gaucho bars. The whole time he gave us interesting stories of the area and introduced us to many of the locals. The whole tour was very personal. After our tour of San Antonio de Areco he drove us to an estancia in the area. Upon arrival at the estancia we were greeted with wine and empanadas. Then we were invited to horseback ride around the estancia with Gaucho Oscar (one of the most famous gaucho in all of Argentina). Afterwards, we got to watch the meat get prepared along with an explanation on Argentine cooking. We then ate a very delicious and plentiful meal. There was tons of meat (sausage, chicken, and steak) along with wine, dessert, and coffee. After our meal we got to listen to a delightful music display from Gaucho Oscar (we liked it so much we bought the CD he was selling so I could share it with the students I teach). After the meal and live music we got to watch a gaucho show off his horsemanship skills and were able to take wonderful pictures lying down next to the horse. We then walked around the estancia and were given a ton of information about the trees, crops, and natural elements of the Pampas. I have to say this has probably been my favorite experience while traveling. Guillermo is very attentive with emails, information, and hospitality. I would recommend this tour highly to anyone if they are in the Buenos Aires area. Also, I think the price was very reasonable for all the activities, food, drinks, transportation, and information provided. Guillermo is the best and the tour would be very hard to beat especially those looking to experience the culture and history of Argentina.

Unforgettable Gauchos. On a recent visit to Buenos Aires my girlfriend and I spent a wonderful day in the company of personal tour guide Guillermo Guereno . Guerillermo picked us up with his driver Carmelo at the Four Seasons Hotel Buenos Aires and we drove out of the city to San Antonio de Areco, a town that dates from the early 18th century and preserves a great deal of gaucho traditions and craftsmen. On the way Guillermo, in perfect Engilsh, gave us a fascinating history of Argentina and the pampas and how the gaucho, and estancion or ranch life had evolved. We visited a silversmith family, famous throughout the country (and to clients like Madonna!) for their beautiful hand wrought silver treasures. We rode out with authentic Gaucho Oscar, had an al fresco steak lunch at the wonderful estancion, and were treated to some gaucho folk songs by Oscar, and an extraordinary display of horsemanship on the lawn of the estancion.We could not recommend this extraordinary day more, along with our personal tour of Buenos Aires and the dinner and tango show at Tango Rojo, it was the highlight!!

optimal excursion. recommend this excursion to everybody who is interested in local historical site and surroundings.The family structure of the estancia is very sympathetic and generous to all foreigners;our small group of 4 with our excellent English speaking guide Guillermo Gonzalez Guereno -who made us profoundly understanding the history and the present situation of this lovely place -gave us the best impression and the best day in Argentina during our 14-days trip.A very good price-quality relationship! A comfortable one-day-trip by van from Buenos Aires.

Native knowledge, special access to gaucho area, sense of humor. My wife and I joined a group of six strangers from Germany, France, Peru and the US in Guillermo's comfortable van in Buenos Aires bound for San Antonio de Areco. His English is very good and he added commentary and answered questions along the way. He was born in San Antonio, grew up in Buenos Aires, and returned to San Antonio to raise his own family. Because he serves on committees that organize the gaucho festival, he has special "backstage" access. So after the parade, he drove us to the closed area where the gauchos (and we) had lunch. They had traditional music and dancing to entertain themselves during the meal. We were among the very, very few non-gauchos present, but we felt quite welcome. It was a special way to see an amazing spectacle. No other group offered that experience. If you're in B.A., do it!

Our favorite day in Argentina. This was the most memorable day of our 6 day trip in Argentina. It was such a nice, relaxing break from the chaos of Buenos Aires. A car picked us up at our hotel at 9 and drove us to San Antonio, where our guide Guillermo met us at the museum. He told us the history of the gauchos and the story behind the objects in the museum. We toured the historical district of San Antonio, then it was off to Estancia el Ombu de Areco. This estancia is very authentic and so beautiful. Guillermo gave us a tour, then we rode horses with Oscar (the famous gaucho), relaxed by the pool, then had a huge feast for lunch - multiple cuts of steak, chicken, chorizo, salads, sides, wine, desert. The meal was incredible. Oscar played some music for us on his guitar. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to visit San Antonio. Guillermo was a fantastic tour guide - very knowledgeable, friendly, knows everyone in town so he was able to introduce us, and he spoke English very well. We almost did a large group tour of a different estancia, but I'm very glad we went with Camino Pampa. It was personable and memorable, we will never forget it.

Wonderful Trip to San Antonio de Areco. We enjoyed our trip very much, and appreciate yousharing so much of your time and knowledge with us. We can see why youfeel so much pride for your town, and feel glad we had the opportunityto learn about it. We savored the chocolates for several days, andpurchased some mate to bring home and share with our families.Estancia Ombu de Areco was beautiful, and the entire afternoon therewas lovely. We will listen to the recording of Oscar's music, and alwaysremember the day fondly.

1/2 Day La Boca and San Telmo walking tour. This tour was absolutely what we wanted. We were unsure whether a tour would be fun and informative in the right way or a bit annoying as some other tours can be. It was 100% the former. Don gave us a great tour full of interesting information delivered so well. He was extremely generosity with his time.

Outstanding way to get acquainted with city. My 12 year old son and I booked in for the City walking tour, starting at Recoleta cemetery, walking through Retiro along Alvear to Plaza de Mayo. We chose the extension, so our walk was meant to last 4.5 hours and went for closer to 7!Our guide was Don, a very personable North Carolinian who has lived in BA for six years. He was a very nice man, amazingly knowledgable and pleasant to spend time with. We spent more than two hours at the cemetery and we felt we came away with a pretty reasonable basic grasp of Argentinian history, told through the stories of the characters in the tombs. Another highlight was coffee and cake at Cafe Tortoni, said to be the most famous cafe in BA. This is delightful place, old and witness to many of the greats of BA life over the years and an excellent place to rest up for a little while.I can't recommend this company or Don enough. The tours are not cheap, but are well worth the price and for anyone with limited time to spend, or looking to get a good introduction at the start of a longer trip, they are good value.My son highly recommends the tour with anyone his agePack good shoes!

Excellent service even when we had to cancel.. We had scheduled Buenos Tours for our arrival day as a way to learn about the city prior to other scheduled activities of a larger group during the week. Unfortunately our flight was delayed by a day and we were unable to arrive in time to go on the tour. I emailed Buenos Tours as soon as we learned of the flight delay and they responded promptly and gave us a full refund. I would have rescheduled with them but our week was already full. They are true to there word with regard to refund policies. I would recommend booking with them without hesitation.

Wonderful walking tour. Had a wonderful day tour seeing the lovely city of BA. We were able to visit all of the top sites while still having time for a great lunch and coffee break. Would highly recommend this tour...BA is much larger and more spread out than I expected and it was very helpful to have someone assist with navigating the city by taxi or subway.

Perfect overview for the first day. We had a very reliable, punctual and great guide in Jessica and appreciated all the information she shared about Buenos Aires. Walking, taking taxis, Metro and bus is the best way to get around the city and once you figured it our it is easy. Jessica can help with all that and she'll show you how to quickly get your bearings around the city. Recoleta cemetery and La Boca was our highlight. We also booked a Milonga Tango tour through the same company and again had an excellent guide and received very good and reliable service.

Excellent!!!. Did two walking tours with Ceri, one of Recoleta and the next day of the historic centre and San Telmo, both tours about 3 hours.Excellent! He has a deep knowledge of the City and is excellent at pointing out wonderful architectural details no quirks of the city.Book, walk, relax, enjoy
Excellent. A comprehensive of BAs neighborhood, Jessica is so knowledgeable and fun. Its like having close friend showing me around.

See Buenos Aires with New Eyes. Our walking tour was the highlight of our stay in Buenos Aires. The 7 hours were perfectly paced and felt like a short, thoroughly enjoyable, educational afternoon. We thought the city was a somewhat sad, grimy and threatening place before the tour. We finished the day able to celebrate our experience in beautiful, rich, vibrant andfriendly Buenos Aires.Thank you Ceri for introducing us to this delightful & wonderful city.

Great experience with a great guide. I was with my friend Mirella and we went with our guide Richard for this great adventure. As I say, it is not a tour but a learning experience. I developed my photo skills, learned about Buenos Aires and its people, how it was developed and took some amazing pictures. We laughed a lot. Such a great time. Now, I have great memories about this beautiful city. Thanks to Mirella, Richard and this amazing tour. If you are reading this, do it. Trust me, it is amazing. That is also the coffee that we took in the beginning, in the end, and the amazing wine that we had in the end.

Such a wonderful day. I did the full day walking tour with Jessica. I felt comfortable with her immediately and as the day progressed I became increasingly impressed by her intelligence and depth of knowledge of Buenos Aires. I learnt so much, but the time passed too quickly. Jess' reflexes also saved the day when she prevented me from falling hard when I tripped on an uneven pathway - a woman of many talents. I can't recommend this tour more highly. Try and do it on your first or second day in BA if you can, as it gives a different perspective and a lovely intimacy to this beautiful city.

Highly recommended. We did a 7 hour walking tour from San Telmo to Recoleta with Jessica. We had arrived the previous day and had organised ourselves an English tour of Theatro Colon and also visited the historic ships at Puerto Madero with their Spanish signage and explanations. We ended up being slightly unsure about Buenos Aires, wishing we spoke Spanish. Jessica changed our view entirely - bringing the city instantly alive. She explained how it had developed and fitted together, showed us many interesting sights, told us many stories and got us into a packed Café Tortoni for lunch despite their being a queue.This walk is most enjoyable and highly recommended. And, we ended up energised rather than tired - as it is not a route march.

Wonderful day in Buenos Aires.. We did the 7 hour walking tour plus La Boca with Oliver. Despite it being a drizzly day and our tiredness (we were just off a 12 hour flight) we had a wonderful day. Oliver was knowledgable, entertaining and flexible. We got an incite into the history of BA, life today in BA and some suggestions of other things we could do after our tour. He tailored the tour to our interests and we got to experience both bus and subway transport and a local restaurant. He saved the best until last. The tour of the Recoleta cemetery was fantastic. Highly recommended

Great experience - definitely again!. We arrived in Buenos Aires Sunday morning from the US and had no plans yet how to spend our 3 days there.I contacted Buenos Tours by email late Sunday afternoon to check availability for a full day walking Tour of the highlights of BA for the next day. It was short notice, and I didn't really expect to get a reply that evening, but Alan, the founder, got back to me within 30 minutes, telling me that yes, they do have a guide available for the next day, and we signed up for the tour.So we met Jack, our guide, on Monday morning at our hotel and he showed us the highlights of his beloved city. Jack is a very personable guy, he is fun to be around with, and he shared with us his wealth of information about the history of BA and Argentina and also patiently answered the many questions we had.We can only highly recommend Buenos Tours. It is very easy to do business with them, and you get a native English speaking tour guide, which was important to us, as we do not speak Spanish at all. We will book a tour with them again the next time we visit BA with friends.Karin, Clearwater/FL

Did 2 tours with Jack from Bueno Tours. I did the half-day – Off The Beaten Path and the full-day I think it was Buenos Aires 101. Both were great. The tour guide Jack was from the US and so spoke perfect English. He was super knowledgeable, funny and easy to chat with. This was not my first trip to BA but it was by far the one where I saw and learned the most. It was GREAT!!! Thanks Jack. Totally recommend l.

Fantastic walking tour of Buenos Aires!. We did a 7 hr walking tour of Buenos Aires with Oliver as our tour guide. Oliver was very knowledgeable about Argentinian history and culture and presented the information in a manner that kept us interested and entertained. He took the time to make it relevant to our interests and questions. Oliver was awesome! It was a very enjoyable day and it exceeded our expectations!

Good experience. We did a half day tour of La Boca and San Telmo with Richard. Richard was very informative and provided a lot of insights into BA and of course the places we visited. He even sent us a list of places to eat when he found out we like to try different food.

Very Informative and Helpful!. We did a two day tour of both North and South Buenos Aires and could not have been happier with our experience. We would never have found so many places or information on our own. We highly recommend the tour company!

Great experience!. Ceri, our guide was wonderful! Our originally planned day to tour was very stormy and raining. Ceri was kind enough to make arrangements to postpone our tour with him till the following day when the weather was much better. He is very knowledgeable and personable. We took taxis, a bus and walked around Buenos Aires. We shopped in the markets and viewed historical buildings, cafes etc. We never felt rushed. He was interested in our enjoying the city and the experience. I would definitely tour with him again in Buenos Aires!

Exceptional Experience. First, I have to say that I think my wife and I would have enjoyed touring a vacant lot with our guide, Ceri - he was that personable, engaging, and knowledgeable. Couple that with the beautiful and vibrant Buenos Aires and you have an experience that is essentially priceless. As I mentioned several times throughout the day, we felt less like we were on a tour and more like we were spending the day with a friend. My new favorite expression (that doesn't involve profanity, anyway) is 'Buen Onda' and that sums up the day, our time with Ceri and the entire trip.

What a great company!. We did a photography/city tour today with Richard. What an absolutely fantastic time. We was so knowledgable, fun, and energetic. My friend and I had the best time. We even did a wine tasting as part of the tour, which we absolutely loved!! Also, this company is amazing. They were very communicative, giving us detailed instructions, contact info and pictures for our driver and our guide. And when our flight itinerary got messed up, they quickly and efficiently rearranged our schedule to pick us up at the hotel and not the airport. I have traveled to a lot of places around the world, and this is one of the best tour companies I've worked with!

Fantastic walking tour of Buenos Aires. My husband, 16 year old son and I were fortunate to have Jack as our guide for an 8 hour tour of Buenos Aires. Jack was simply fabulous, he knows the history of BA and Argentina well and was able to make it relevant to all of us. We fell in love with BA, largely from Jack enthusiasm. I strongly suggest this tour.

Fantastic tour of San Telmo and city centre. Our tour has been the highlight of our family's trip to BA. We have young adult kids and thoroughly enjoyed wandering through San Telmo, seeing unique locations that we would never have found on our own, and meeting people that our guide Ceri knew. We lost all track of time as we toured hidden places while stopping in cafes and wine stores on the way through the historic city centre. Thanks Ceri!

We took the Tango and the City tours. Liz and Richard, our guides for the respective tours were wonderful. We learned so much in such a short period of time. We intended on a short night with Liz for the Tango tour because we were tired from travel but the orchestra was so fantastic that we closed the place down. We thought we would have a short tour of the City and learn some history with Richard but ended up spending about an hour extra because we drank Mate and had a couple of diversions. Great tours.

The best way to see Buenos Aires. I wanted to get a good sense for the city in a short period of time (I only had half a day free on a business trip). Our guide Don was very knowledgeable and packed a lot in our short time together. We focused on Recoleta Cemetery - what a great history lesson and snapshot of life in BA over centuries. Definitely walk the city and use Buenos Tours if you do!

Best way to see the city. We walked, used a bus, a taxi and the subway to get around most of the areas in BA. Took all day, was hot and sweaty but of so interesting. I would recommend this to anybody who wants to get a feel of the place and also find out where to go on other days.

Excellent walking tour for an overview of the city. Our guide, Oliver, was knowledgeable and fun to talk with. Two of us spent a full day with Oliver seeing highlights of several different neighborhoods and learning about Argentine history, architecture, culture, and more. He asked about our interests and customized the tour to accommodate them. We had a coffee break at one of the historic cafés and the best empanadas we ate on our trip for the lunch stop. We saw and learned much more going with a guide than we would have on our own.

The MUST do tour of Buenos Aires. . My tour guide Jack was Fantastic! I learnt so much about this beautiful city & the people throughout the day. I would advise everyone to book the Full day city tour when you arrive in Buenos Aires. It gives you a great overview & perspective of the city. I saw so much and got to know my way around the city. Jack is extremely knowledgeable with a passion for BA, street art and the culture. He has lots of great tips to help you during your stay. His tour of Recoleta Cemetery was brilliant & linked it back to many of the places & people I heard about throughout the tour. He also helped me navigate the public transport system. I advise everyone to book a tour with Jack, the best way to see this city. Worth every dollar & more.

Terrific Tour of Buenos Aires. The company was excellent and very accommodating to meet our needs. Originally, we had a large group of nine people at two different hotels. They arranged transport to pick us up each day for two half day tours of the city, and refunded us some money when not everyone could participate. Richard, our tour guide, has lived on BA for some time and shared lots of interesting history and personal knowledge about the city. We got to tour everything we asked for and more. Do not miss the feria in San Mateo or Cafe Tortoni, a classic tourist cafe. He also knew the lesser known, but really awesome cafes in other areas. Recoleta cemetery was amazing and we actually discovered relatives of in-laws are buried there! Our private walking tour was fantastic and at our own pace. He made sure we saw want we wanted and always checked to make sure we had options. If this is your first trip or a return trip, I recommend this tour.

This private walking tour is a must in Buenos Aires. Yesterday we did an 8 1/2 hour walking tour with Oliver. It was absolutely fantastic and we can't believe how quickly the time flew. We covered the majority of the tour on foot however we managed a taxi ride, bus ride and subway ride. We found this company on the internet and after extensive research decided they best catered for what we wanted to see and do. This has been a highlight for us (2 couple travelling together) and we truly thank Oliver for showing us the sights. We loved eating at a local restaurant for lunch (empanadas and delicious soup) and morning tea at a gorgeous cafe. Oliver was very interesting to chat with and well and truly knew his stuff. I would highly recommend this company. Everything went smoothly and we enjoyed the day immensely - thank you for your company!

Private Photo Tour & Walking Tour. We took a private photo tour with Richard, who has lived in BA for over 10 years and is also a documentary film maker, and had a blast. In addition to knowing all the best spots for photos he also made sure we gained an appreciation for the history and the architecture of Buenos Aires. We loved our tour with him so much that we followed up and booked a full day walking/photo tour with him for the following days. He conducts his tour like an old friend showing you the best parts of a city he loves. The next time we are in Buenos Aires we will book him for a tour again along with a midday coffee. If you want a typical "tourists" view of BA, he can make that happen. If you want to go "off the beaten path," he can make that happen. If you want to combine your tour with some farm fresh meals from a local co-op and then a pizza from a local shop, he can make it happen. I have honestly never had a better tour in my life and I have taken tours in over 20 countries. My wife and I were very pleased.

Full day private walking tour. OMG! We had an awesome tour. Oliver met us at our hotel and showed us around BA. Everything was personalized and he was an awesome guide. He's been in Argentina for 10 years and knows just about every corner. It was well worth it. I fell in love with the city through our walk.

BEST private tour ever, must-do!. I have had the pleasure and privilege of traveling all over the world, and this was by far, the best private tour I have ever taken! Jessica was extremely knowledgeable on all relevant touring topics including history, culture, arts, politics, food, etc. etc. etc. Her time in country along with her educational background and experience lends much credibility to her as a guide, right off the bat. Also importantly, Jessica was adaptable to mine and my traveling partners' varying sightseeing styles. I had a traveling companion who had not taken a private tour before, and this surpassed expectations! The tour of BA infused my short trip with a richness that was unexpected and much appreciated. Cheers to Jessica's office colleagues Justine and Frank as well. They were incredibly responsive to my emails and made my choice to book so easy. The touring staff were kind enough to answer questions before, in between, and after tours. I would say that this is an added bonus as a newcomer and non-Spanish speaker. I can't say enough good things... you won't regret the decision to book this tour!

START your trip to Buenos Aires with Buenos Tours. Make this tour the FIRST thing you do in beautiful Buenos Aires. It influences the rest of your trip positively because you won't be wondering what to do or where to go. You will already KNOW.Want to see what there is to see in one day? With a guide that knows all the great sights and insights--like how NOT to get ripped off?Book these people. They are FANTASTIC. Read the other reviews for more details. All true.

Excellent, informative and fun day! . (This review is a little late... Sorry!)We booked a full day walking tour of Buenos Aires with this company after seeing the great reviews on trip advisor and a friend's personal recommendation, and had a fantastic experience with Oliver, as expected. The tour was tailored to what we wanted to see and peppered with lots of cool facts to make it very enjoyable. However I also wanted to call out the FANTASTIC support the team provided ahead of time, from their website (what to pack / wear, security considerations, etc) to the personalized emails. We wrote back and asked for some restaurant and activity recommendations, and they responded promptly (and the advice was spot on). Would definitely recommend and use again! FYI - We also used them to book the Piazzolla Tango VIP experience (... Because it was simpler, we could pay by credit card, and got transport to and from the venue covered). Would also recommend that! - note the show is not managed or operated by Buenos Tours.

Great Sunday walk in Buenos Aires. In April we visited Buenos Aires for the second time. Our first trip was in 2008 and we ran around the city with the Lonely Plant as our guide. For this trip we wanted to get a more in-depth experience and better understanding of the city. Buenos Aires Tours delivered that and more. Since Sunday was the only day we had completely free we opted for La Boca and San Telmo tour. I know Sunday morning can be pretty sleepy around most cities but Jessica met us at our hotel and was ready to go. Jessica currently lives in the San Telmo neighborhood and had a lot of great local insight about the area and what it’s like to live in Buenos Aires. I particularly enjoyed learning about Republica de La Boca and the conversation on current events over a cup of coffee at El Federal. If you are looking for a great walking tour that does more than scratch the surface than this is the group to go with. I have been around the world and taken several walking tour, this one was one of the best.

Thank you Bueno Tours - Fabulous!. This review is overdue... Bottom line - FABULOUS!!!We read about Buenos Tours on Trip Advisor and we are so happy we booked with them.When you go to Buenos Aires, do yourself a favor and book an amazing tour with Buenos Tours before you go. We booked a private tour. Ask to have a full day escorted tour of the city. Guides are fluent in Spanish and in your language. Our guide was Ceri (pronounced as Kerry) and if the other guides with Buenos Tours are half as great as he is, you are in for a great time. With Ceri we felt like we had made a new friend! We did this "cab/bus/walk around" on a cruise day in port (last day before officially getting off the ship), and it gave us a great feel for this beautiful city and we were completely comfortable to go back to many of those places on our own after the cruise. Not only will you see the different neighborhoods, but also you will get to meet fascinating people of Buenos Aires as you tour the neighborhoods: like a wonderful lady who sells wines in San Telmo, the shopkeepers in the local food gallerias, along with various people you will meet along the street. We wanted to go to Boca and that is where our day began. You'll see the Recoleta neighborhood and its tree lined streets and park where you can learn to Tango. You will see the Casa Rosada (and if lucky changing of the guards) and the incredible cathedral across the street - where the guards from Casa Rosada also stand guard, a bookstore that used to be an opera house, and then you can taste the creamy gelato flavors in one of the fabulous ice cream stores. Want another treat? Go to lunch with your guide at the Café Tortoni, a Buenos Aires fixture for over 100 years (where you can also book reservations for a Tango Show that will not rip you off.) And who knew a cemetery could be so fascinating? Recommendations for dinner? Just ask. No pressure, no hard sell - just honest answers. My husband and I went to a recommended San Telmo parilla for dinner --and experienced a steak you could cut with a spoon, done just right, along with salad and a huge slice of grilled provolone -- all for less than $US40. Ceri knew all of the best places to shop -- without pressuring you to buy anything. They just tell you where the best shops and values are for what you are interested in. My husband bought a beautiful handmade reversible leather jacket (suede on one side, smooth leather on the other) for a fraction of what we would have paid outside Argentina. Whether you are going for a long weekend or for an extended stay, Buenos Tours will give you a great exposure to the neighborhoods, the people and a list of places to see and things to do. Ceri gave us great advice on money. We would have never thought to do this - write your initials on currency to make sure you don't get ripped off in stores, restaurants, cafes, taxis, others who might claim you gave them "invalid/old currency". And how to take a taxi. He also gave us great advice on what not to carry (big purse, big backpack) when waking around by ourselves. And not to carry a camera over your neck, an iPad in your hands or anything that someone could easily grab. Thanks to Ceri - we had a fabulous first day in Buenos Aires. And his advice carried us thru...

Excellent Choice. Based on very positive reviews of this company, we decided to book a private tour. Indeed this company displayed all the way from the booking a very professional attitude prompt reply and good recommendations regarding the intermarry (Justine from the office). We were given Jessica as a guide, who made this day in Buenos Aires the most unforgettable one! This energetic guide possess such a wide range of knowledge,about Argentinean history which she presented in a very vivid and interesting way , she knew a lot about Soccer , Jewish world, food, economics culture and more , so interesting . The all-day Buenos Aires tour (Including La Boca!) is a must!

Pre Arranged Tours. We would highly recommend Buenos Tours if you are looking to get the best out of your trip to Buenos Aires. We booked 2 Tours, 1. to a Groucho Ranch for horse riding BBQ, horse skills and a beautiful small town. 2nd was a 7 hour private tour with our own guide and driver. This meant that we could go where we wanted and at our own pace. They were very professional and kept in touch by email up until pickup at our hotel.

Informative and fun tour!!. My husband and I had an amazing overall experience with BuenosTours! To start, I sent an inquiry only 36 hours before we wanted to take a tour, and they we able to accommodate us with a special time frame so that we could make our flight home. The folks who handle booking via email are incredibly responsive and helpful. They worked with us to design a tour that would meet our time requirements and allow us to see the places we had in mind. They even sent us photos of our driver and our tour guide so that we would be prepared to meet them.Our driver, Nick, was very friendly and knowledgeable about Buenos Aires...wish we could have spent more time with him! Our tour guide, Ceri, was wonderfully funny, personable, and intelligent. The entire time we spent with Ceri he had us thinking deeply about history and current social issues while also laughing hysterically with his sarcastic sense of humor. He was an absolute wealth of knowledge about the city, and particularly knowledgeable about Recoleta Cemetery. Touring the Cemetery with Ceri allowed us to experience so much more than we would have if we visited on our own. Ceri gave us a comprehensive history of the Cemetery and was able to point out unique architectural details that we certainly would have overlooked on our own. Ceri was also very cognizant of our interests while on the tour, and frequently checked in to make sure we weren't feeling overwhelmed by information. Spending the afternoon on tour with him was like exploring the city with an extremely knowledgeable good friend. I wish we were in town longer so we could have taken additional walking tours with BuenosTours!

If you do only 1 thing in Buenos Aires... Do this.
