I went for a walking tour of Buenos Aires in May 2015 with Ceri, one of the brilliant tour guides from BuenosTours on my first full day in Buenos Aires.This was the smartest thing that I could have done, as it gave me the information and confidence to navigate many neighbourhoods in the city by myself for the rest of my trip.Ceri not only provided an entertaining and informative tour, he customized it entirely for me to make sure I saw the places that made sense to go with someone else, and essentially street-proofed me so I had a good idea where I could go alone and what I could do in Buenos Aires, and what was "normal" for BA.We visited La Boca, the Recoleta, San Telmo, and several other areas during our day. He showed me some good places for food and coffee, and ice cream, of course.It was so much fun and a highlight of my trip. Ceri is also a really funny guy, and a pleasure to travel with.During the remainder of my trip I took Ceri's advice, and I had a fantastic time. I went many places along, visited great neighbourhoods, and took reasonable precautions based on his advice. I also had a good idea of where to spend my time, what to eat, and because of that I was able to pack a lot of great experiences into my trip.I highly recommend that anyone who is going to Buenos Aires for the first time to go on a good walking tour with a knowledgeable guide and do not be shy to ask for advice and street proofing. It will save you so much time and prepare you for a wonderful trip in a beautiful, unique city.Thank you Ceri and Justine!

Really informative and enjoyable. We had Jack as our guide and we enjoyed our city-centre tour the first day so much that we booked a second half day tour with Jack of San Telmo and La Boca for the next day. We enjoyed the second tour even more and really loved the San Telmo area. We also did the San Telmo tour starting about 4pm which was great as the heat of the day was over. We had our two children with us aged 12 and 14 and even our 14 year loved the tour! The tour is a really great place to start when you arrive in BA for the first time as it gives you an orientation and feel for the city. Jack is a history major and we really enjoyed learning about the history of Argentina and it made us want to learn more about this intriguing country. Jack also brought us on the subway and on a bus ride which was very helpful and gave us more confidence in moving about the city. These tours were definitely one of the highlights of our wonderful holiday in Argentina. The only negative was that we had to book a private tour because of the children but it turned out to be a positive!.

Awesome, must do.. Our tour guide was Jack and he was awesome. We did the tour on March 21st 2016. There were 3 of us and only had 1 day to spare during a work trip and said we wanted to see everything. I had email correspondence prior to our trip to give an indication of what we would like to see and to get advice on restaurants and shopping, all advice was spot on and we really appreciated the time Jack took even before our tour which resulted in giving the best experience we could have. We did the full day private walking tour adding La Boca and hotel drop off. Even though it was a full day, the time flew. We didn’t realise how far we had actually walked and were sad when the tour ended. We had so much fun and cannot speak highly enough of Jack who understood our personalities and what we would enjoy. If I get to go back to Buenos Aires I would do this tour again, (and request Jack!) we had so much fun.

Like being show the city by a close friend who lives there. Our tour,guide was Jessica, who moved to BA about eight years ago from New Jersey and appears to have absorbed everything there is to know about this very interesting tourist destination. Or, as we put it in an email to BuenosTours, "Jessica ruined our vacation. We had six or seven private tour guides in an assortment of South American cities following our two days with Jessica--and none of them lived up to her level of cordial, informed professionalism.

Historical walking tour of San Telmo and Monserrat. Richard was wonderful. Interesting, native English speaker, spent a lot of time with us, introduced us to many local vendors. He imparted a lot of information about the area's history and culture.

One of the Best walking tours I've ever experienced!!. Where do I start?! I booked with BuenosTours after reading the fabulous reviews on Trip Advisor. Our expectations were far exceeded. Jessica was our guide for an 8 hr walking tour. Jessica met us at our hotel in La Recoleta and from there we proceeded to visit 5 different neighborhoods in Buenos Aires, including San Telmo, San Cristobal, Barracas and Constitution. Jessica was literally a walking history book! She explained the history of of the areas we were in, including fun facts and memorable dates. She was extremely well versed in the politics, history and culture of Argentina and South America. Jessica took us to places only locals would know, and made us feel so welcome. I could go on and on! Because of her, we had an unbelievable first day in BA. She and Justine (who was so wonderful to work with via email!) even took the time to email me places to go our next two days. BuenosTours is extremely affordable and an absolute must-book if visiting BA. Justine also arranged a driver (Nick) to pick us up at the cruise terminal and take us to our hotel, as well as a transfer to the airport. I highly recommend BuenosTours as one of the best tour agencies I have ever booked with. If we return to BA, we will definitely use them again!

Recoleta Walking Tour. We were guided by Oliver through Recoleta and neighbouring areas; the tour was very informative, well organised and enjoyable and Oliver is an excellent tour guide. We can highly recommend this agency. Guy and Caitlyn Baxter, South Africa

Lovely day in Buenos Aires. Nine hours and seven miles with Ceri (the name is Welsh.) Good conversation and the highlights of the city from La Boca to Recoleta. Saw places we wanted to revisit - and we did. Pointed to a great Parilla which we would not have found on our own - La Brigada, and to the terrace at the Park Hyatt for wine at midnight, and the amazing market on Sunday in San Telmo, and of course lunch at Gran Cafe Tortoni. We spent three days in BA (after seeing Patagonia with Mountain Travel Sobek - also outstanding and amazing) and saw and learned more thanks to spending the first day with Ceri of BuenosTours.
Great tours. We really enjoyed our tours. Our guide, Don did a great job. We went at our own pace and we had a wonderful time.
Full day private walking tour. The guide, Jessica, was nice and knowledgable. Excellent way to get to see the city on our first day there.

Fantastic Tour. We found BuenosTours through Trip Advisor. After reading the reviews we decided to book a full day private walking tour for my wife and I before boarding a cruise ship. Our day was terrific. Being in our 60's we were a little concerned about spending a good portion of the day on our feet, but that was not a problem at all. Our guide, Ceri, could not have been better. Besides seeing the main sites, he took us to an out of the way coffee shop as well as a great spot for lunch. All in all we spent 9 AM to 6 PM with him. I could not recommend this group more.

Wonderful way to see the city!!. When visiting a foreign city one should learn a bit of the language - that's what we knew a bit - a very small bit!! Thanks to our tour guide, Oliver, we were able to see and hear about this interesting city. Oliver was on time and provided a great tour in the afforded time that we had to spend before returning to the USA. He was very knowledgable about the history of the city. I would highly recommend this tour company for tours of Buenos Aires.

Two Full Day Private Walking Tours. We had a great time with Jessica in this two-days tour. She is a joyful person and made the tour very relax and enjoyable. She is well organized the itinerary and the schedule, and giving us a lot of information about Argentina and Buenos Aires. In addition, Buenostour.com also offered us a good follow-up service after we had booked the tour. We highly recommend persons to join this tour, especially for those only have 2-3 days in Buenos Aires.

Nice private walking tour. There are a number of free short walking tours available but we decided that a full day private tour would provide a better understanding of Buenos Aires culture and highlights. We selected Buenos Tours and were not disappointed. Our guide, Richard, did a great job, tailoring the tour to our needs and provided recommendations for the rest of our trip. He had an impressive knowledge of Buenos Aires. We saw other guides during our trip that confirmed we had one of the best guides. Great way to learn the city.

Great Introduction to Buenos Aires. We only had 3 full days in BA so, based on the reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to do the full day tour (including La Boca) with Buenos Tours (in Feb 2016). First, the booking process was seamless and the additional information provided by Buenos Tours extremely helpful (Spanish phrases, meat cuts etc).Our guide on the day was Jessica and she was of great assistance before we even got to Argentina giving us advice on our planned day trip to Uruguay (Colonia del Sacramento). It was possible to contact our guide ahead of the tour because Buenos Tours provides contact details on confirming the booking - a neat feature that we found very helpful, and Jessica responded to these additional questions patiently and with good advice (eg where to change money). Jessica is American and besides showing us the highlights of BA was also able to give us an ex-pats view of life there. She was enthusiastic and very knowledgeable. We mainly walked but also took a taxi and the bus to relocate during the tour (included in the tour price). We were glad that we had booked an exclusive tour just for the two of us - we were able to go at our own pace and linger over the things that interested us (like lunch in Cafe Tortoni).At the end of the day we felt we had really experienced BA and knew the layout of the city well. We thoroughly recommend this tour. [Don't forget to weigh yourself in the old Pharmacy].

Super Tour of The City. We had a wonderful tour of BA given by Oliver. The eight hour walking tour covered all of the important sites in the city. Oliver was extremely knowledgable, enjoyable, interesting and a real pleasure to spend the day. We have tour the world....ranks as one of the very best tours we have had! Highly recommend Buenos Tours and especially Oliver.

Great tour in Boca & San Telmo. Jack, whose been living here in Buenos Aires for the last 3 years, picked us punctually and took care of us during our 3 hour tour to La Boca and San Telmo - his historical knowledge & keen awareness of current affairs (all mixed with a dose of humor) made this tour a pleasure. We hit all the spots in a carry relaxed manner, stopping for great coffee & empanadas along the way. We thoroughly enjoyed the time we spent with Jack and Buenos tours (booking was efficient and hassle free)! Highly recommended.

Awesome Tour!. Our guide Jessica was incredibly knowledgeable, personable, flexible, and entertaining. She told us about the history, culture, religion, politics, and language of Buenos Aires and was able to answer all of our questions. She was the best tour guide we've ever had. The full day tour covered everything from La Boca to Recoleta. We took buses and taxis which helped break up the walking. We stopped at specific places for beverages and snacks that had stories that enriched the tour. We ate the best empanadas in Argentina. At the end of the day we really felt we had experienced Buenos Aires.

San Telmo/La Boca walking tour + Recoleta/Retiro. We had a wonderful experience with BuenosTours this past November (2015). I originally found BuenosTours in a guide book I purchased (I think it was Lonely Planet) for Buenos Aires. Then I saw the reviews on TripAdvisor and couldn't believe how overwhelmingly positive they were. We had never been to Buenos Aires, I have always wanted to go, so I was excited to get a "lay of the land" via Buenos Tours and decided to book a walking tour of Recoleta and Retiro for our first full day in the city. This turned out to be an excellent idea and I highly recommend this as an intro. into the city, but regardless of when you do the tour during your trip, it'll be great. We were staying in Recoleta so we decided to start with the walking tour of that neighborhood. I was so impressed by the booking process, thoroughness of the staff via email before we even left the U.S., and amount of info. and thoughtfulness that was put into the booking process that I immediately booked a 2nd walking tour for San Telmo and La Boca for a few days later in our vacation. Both turned out to be wonderful. Our guide was Jessica and she was great, full of information from both a local and an ex-pat's perspective, plus she was very welcoming and ended up being a wealth of knowledge for us during our stay in the city. I cannot express how great it was to be on a walking tour with just my partner and a guide.. no large groups, super one-on-one, easily tailored to your pace, etc. I cannot recommend BuenosTours highly enough and would actually do more tours next time we're in Buenos Aires if we're lucky enough to return to that beautiful city again someday soon! Thanks so much BuenosTours!

Stellar Customer Service & Tours. I've been remiss in writing this review but my delay should not reflect negatively on Buenos Tours whatsoever. I was in BA for business in June, arriving two days early so I could see the city. From the moment I first sent an inquiry to Buenos Tours for a quote for a 1.5 day private tour to after my leisurely weekend passed, Alan was quick to respond to my emails, provided very clear and abundant details, and was very amenable and friendly. As a project manager, I'm very organized and an information hoarder; Alan eased any concerns I had.My assigned tour guide was Richard. He met me at my hotel at the appointed time and waited patiently for me since I was running a tad late from my morning flight arrival. We went over our agenda for the day and set-off. We began at Recoleta Cemetery where Richard impressed me with his immense knowledge of BA/Argentine history & its prominent players. (Recoleta is an amazing place; a must-see!) We then spent the balance of the afternoon strolling through Recoleta & Retiro. While I admired the gorgeous architecture and charming neighborhoods, Richard departed many wonderful stories and historical tidbits. We also stopped at a quaint neighborhood eatery where we enjoyed a lunch of empanadas and a boisterous server who made my day. We also made time for a gelato shop whose interior was all marble and gilt. A great find! Our first day's tour ended conveniently in Plaza San Martin, right in front of my hotel. Our second day began earlier as we had a full day's agenda. We began in La Boca with breakfast at La Perla followed by exploration of the touristy area and warren of shops where Tango was infamously founded. We then ventured into the more residential area of Boca to see the futbol stadium and get a sense of the blue collar area of BA. We also visited a local fire station and visited with the firefighters. Our next destination was San Telmo for their Sunday Market. We spent the better part of the day here shopping, eating, learning more about history & culture, admiring more fabulous architecture, meeting some of Richard's friends, and enjoying Milonga dancing. (This area is where several scenes in the Will Smith movie, "Focus," was filmed.) We made a pit stop at a great Vinoteca whose proprietor gave us a lesson on local Malbec & Cabernet with a generous tasting. (Note: The tasting is not complimentary.) Late afternoon, we walked through the Monserrat neighborhood and to Microcentro to Plaza de Mayo. We explored the area, including Casa Rosada, Metropolitan Cathedral, Cabildo, and a local upcycled craft market. At dusk we chose to walk down Avenida de Mayo to see famous Cafe Tortoni and ended-up on Avenida 9 de Julio in a prime location, right where the Iguazu Falls fountain, another beautiful fountain, and an excellent view of the obelisk and Evita facade are located. There was only one more building I wanted to see - Palacio Barolo - but it was further east on Avenida de Mayo (opposite direction of my hotel) and we were already about 30-45 minutes past my allotted tour time. But, Richard was generous and wanted to ensure I saw everything I desired so we continued our walk despite it being dark. Unfortunately, right before we arrive to Palacio Barolo, we had an incident...a mustard incident to be exact. Luckily, I felt being sprayed and notified Richard immediately and thus did not allow the culprits an attempt to pickpocket us. (Poor Richard got it worse than I did, but it was still in my hair, on my jacket and jeans. Let me tell you, it wreaks horribly and is very difficult to wash out the smell and stain.) Richard offered to take me immediately back and pay for the cab. I declined because we were so close to the Barolo. We soldiered on only to arrive right after the building closed. It was disappointing but it was my fault for not mentioning wanting to visit the building earlier and planning our time accordingly. We then turned back west to find an easier spot to flag-down a taxi. When I finally found a taxi closer to Avenida 9 de Julio, I said not only goodbye to my tour guide, but my new friend. It was a disappointing way to end such a wonderful weekend, being doused in mustard/vinegar, but I refused to let it taint my experience. The next day I received an email from Alan who told me Richard informed him of the mustard incident. Alan offered his apologies and to pay to clean my clothes. I politely declined as it was not Buenos Tours fault (Richard's or otherwise) that we were targeted but I was immensely gratified by the gesture.Bottomline: Buenos Tours was exceptional to work with from the time of inquiry to post-tour. I would whole-heartedly recommend them and certainly hire them again, even just to visit with Richard for the afternoon, exploring neighborhood hidden treasures like a local. They exceeded every expectation, being knowledgeable, friendly, flexible, and customer-oriented.

Excellent tour!. I'm extremely happy with my tour! I was taken around by Ceri, a courteous and knowledgable guide with an excellent tour itinerary. BA is an interesting and beautiful city and I saw most of the major points of interest. I've no hesitation in recommending this company - go for it!

Far exceeded my expectation. I contacted Alan on short notice, two day, and he arranged a tour with our guide Jack who was absolutely fantastic. Alan also arranged our transportation to/from the hotel to meet Jack downtown. Fill out the questionnaire they send you ahead of time so they can tailor the tour to your liking. Not only did we see the tourist spots, but we also immersed ourselves in the culture visiting local cafes and off the beaten track sites. I can't speak highly enough of Alan, Jack and our driver Dario. It was like taking a tour of the city with a member of the family. If you're looking for a personalized guided tour of Buenos Aires, look no further. Buenos Tours is all you need to know.

Walking Tour of Buenos Aires with Alan. 6 hour walking tour of Buenos Aires which included subway and taxi rides. Alan was a fantastic tour guide making the city come alive for the three couples. We covered a lot of ground in a short time made possible by our guide who was so knowable about the history, politics, and architecture of the city. It was probably the best tour we have taken in years of traveling.

Outstanding Tour. My wife and I enjoyed an outstanding walking tour with BuenosTours. We arranged the tour with Frank, who was great about responding to my emails, customizing the tour to include sights and stops to match our interests and then providing additional information about Buenos Aires including restaurant and tango recommendations. Jessica was our tour guide. She is a U.S. expat living long term in Buenos Aires. She has extensive knowledge about the city and Argentina in general and is very good at transferring this knowledge in an engaging manner. Plus, having grown up in U.S., she was able to explain Argentinean history and politics relative to our frame of reference. Jessica met us at our hotel lobby, we reviewed the plans for the day and then we were off to La Boca by taxi. We started early and were able to tour the Carminito street area before it became crowded. A short bus ride brought us to San Telmo for a walk through the neighborhood. We stopped at a local café for a coffee and then walked on to Plaza de Mayo. Jessica explained the significance of the Plaza in Argentinian history and the principal buildings around it, including a stop outside Casa Rosada. We also visited the Metropolitan Cathedral and it was most impressive. Another short bus ride took us to Recoleta and a walk through this neighborhood. We stopped at a local restaurant that is known for their empanadas and sampled a variety. The tour finished with a visit to the Recoleta Cemetery, which was more impressive than anticipated. Afterwards, Jessica arranged a taxi to take us back to the San Telmo area where we were staying.I'm not able to compare BuenosTours to other agencies as we only used one during our visit, but I do feel very comfortable recommending them. You won't be disappointed with your tour.

More than we expected!. Frank was amazing! He was not our original guide but due to a mix up we were lucky enough to get him. One friend wanted to shop, the other see the history, buildings and culture. We got it all! Our half day tour turned into a full day. Frank was knowledgable, engaging and committed to our needs. The communication pre tour was beyond what we expected. It was a lovely day filled with crafts fairs, shopping, history, monuments, parks, striking architecture, lunch, and best and some of the worst this city has to offer. You can't see it in a day but you can get the best of it with BuenosTours!

A one day overview of Buenos Aires. Wow! We only had one day in Buenos Aires and it couldn't have been more well spent. It would be hard to say we missed much in our visit with this one day tour. It was a phenomenal tour! Ceri was wonderful showing and bringing usto some terrific sites. We really got a true sense of the history,culture, and way of life in Buenos Aires. In addition we took hisrecommendation on a restaurant for dinner and had one of the bestmeals of our lives. We highly recommend both Ceri and BuenosTours!

Superb. Our guide picked us up at our hotel and took us on a tour that felt personalised and at our pace. Excellent local knowledge. Also introduced us to the subway which is always useful in a city. Highly recommend.

Informative and interesting tour with a fantastic guide. Don picked us up at hotel on time and showed us all the sights of the city. His knowledge of this city and it's history is fantastic. Touring the city with Don felt like exploring with an old friend and he tailored the tour superbly to suit our interests and physical ability. We finished by sharing a few pints at a craft beer pub in Recoleta to round off our day. Thoroughly enjoyable day with the bonus of gaining a great new friend. Thanks for the wonderful memories Don!

"Best Way to Experience the City". My husband and I spent a week in Buenos Aires/Iguazu Falls, and I have to say that this full day private guided walking tour of the city was a definite highlight! Communication with the company beforehand was very thorough, down to giving us our guide's bio and contact information, and boy, was she fantastic!! Jessica is intelligent, personable, and knows the city, its history, and current politics/culture well! We were completely enthralled and hated to see the day come to an end. I will recommend BuenosTours to everyone I know who is visiting the city!

A Day Well Spent. I had booked a walking tour with a vendor I normally use and cancelledit once I read about BuenosTours. My wife and I met our guide CeriFoster at our hotel and ventured out on our full day walking tour.From the beginning and throughout the day it could not have beenbetter. Ceri might as well be the Mayor of the city as he kneweveryone we ran into and quickly made friends with those he did not.He took us to quality places that we would never have found includinga shop where my wife purchased a leather jacket that will open eyesback home, a stop for coffee at one of the best coffee spot in town, astop at a very interesting drug store where he was asked to translatefor some customers, to the oldest restaurant in town for lunch wherehe was able to bump the line and get me a seat inside away from theoutside heat, to a stop at a book shop you cannot miss, a break forice cream (Ceri had it planned), to the Cathedral where Pope Franciswas the Cardinal of Argentina, to the balcony where Evita gave herspeeches and the cemetery where she is buried. I could go on and onabout our day and left much out except to say that Ceri took most ofthe strain of a full day walking tour to use taxi's as needed to movearound on occasion. Like everyone else you would think the cab driverwas he brother or cousin as Ceri took control and directed the drive.You cannot go wrong choosing Buenostours and getting your moniesworth. Wish I was able to give them a 10 for each of the ratings. Safetravels.

Your own guide, relaxing pace, informative.... My guide, Richard, gave me a very good overview of the city, itshistory and current events. Most informative! Easy pace, goodconversations, and had lunch together in a place where the "locals" eat. A very enjoyable way to spend a few hours during my recent brief stop-over in Buenos Aires.

Don't miss this opportunity for the best way to see Buenos Aries. This tour was the highlight of our South American trip. Since this was a trip that took us to places with adorable penguin chicks that is saying quite a lot.Our guide Richard was wonderful, even if not as adorable as a Penguinchick. What he lacked in the cuteness department he more than made up for with an immense storehouse of local knowledge, kindness and attentionto our needs and preferences. We tucked into tiny interesting places that we would have normally bypassed without a second look. Richard timed the tour to capture the best of the city at the best times to visit. The fact that he is a native New Yorker gave him a uniqueability to compare life in Buenos Aires to that in the US and reallygive us a sense of what it means to be Argentine. He has a family andhas been living in country for over 17 years. He has made it hismission to absorb and relish Argentine culture and lifestyle. We sawit all and more in two days. I highly recommend this tour.There is significant walking, but sufficient stops are planned. I would take agood shade hat or even a lightweight umbrella for shade.

Terrific Walking Tour. It was our first time to Buenos Aires and our Spanish is minimal. We wanted to see the city and experience the culture but knew we couldn't do it on our own. Booking with BuenosTours was easy and lots of information was sent to us in advance to prepare for the private full day walking tour. We arranged to meet our guide, Ceri at our hotel. We wore comfortable shoes, hats, had water & sunscreen and of course, a camera. We had a very special day of seeing not only the history and architecture of the city but it's wonderful people. We had many conversations with people we met on the street or at a shop. We went to little known city gems that reinforced the feeling that we were not on a typical tour. We were with a very special gentleman, who was concerned that we got the best possible experience while visiting his city. Food: For lunch we wanted to try the beef the country is famous for & Ceri's local lunch choice was the perfect choice for us.. We had dessert later. Gelato at another local shop. Truly the best gelato I've ever eaten. To be sure we saw as much as we could, we did opt to take 2 taxis. The cost of the taxis was our responsibility. We knew this and it is explained in writing when we booked & with our guide. However, taxis are inexpensive and we had a guide who knew where we were going. It was a very good option for us on a hot day. We choose BuenosTours based on the reviews of tripadvisor travelers. We feel we made the correct decision to book with BuenosTours and will certainly book again the next time we visit this amazing city.

Our visit to Buenos Aires. My husband and I had one day to spend in Buenos Aires and were lucky to hire Buenos tours to take us around the city.Oliver was our tour guide and we feel he is one of the best. We took a taxi to the different neighborhoods, learned about theHistory, stopped at a cafe and ate lunch at a local restaurant.He made our visit interesting, a lot of fun and we really got to know Buenos Aires. We would definitely recommend Oliver and Buenos tours to anyone visiting this interesting city.

Great walking tour. Never having been to Buenos Aires before and being a bit intimidated by the size of the city and the number of varied attractions we engaged Buenos Tours for the full day tour plus La Boca spread over two days. In hindsight this was a good decision as the first half day tour lasted about 6 hours and as the weather was hot and humid trying to do everything in one day would not have been as plessant an experience. Our guide Jack was very punctual and his love of the city evident. He provided us with lots of useful tips and afterwards we felt much more comfortable in travelling the city by foot and using the Subte (underground rail system).

Best tour imaginable. If you are looking for a walking tour experience for BA you should look no further. We feel so completely fortunate to have spent two days with the most charming, well informed guide, Jack. We are pretty well traveled independent seniors, but the scope of BA was somewhat intimidating so we booked a full day Buenos Tour split over two days, with the Boca addition which is a must. Jack was professional, funny and smart and paced our two days so beautifully. Had I known what a joy it would be I would have added some more time with him prior to our evening departure on our third day. His affinity for BA was contagious and we feel we've seen The Best of the Best.

BuenosTours is AWESOME. We booked a walking tour of B.A. with Ceri who was wonderful fun, knowledgeable and just an all around nice tour guide! His recommendations for our "after-tour" was spot on and very helpful. We also booked a day at a Gaucho Ranch. We did not even feel we were on a tour but rather that we were invited to a friend's Ranch. BuenosTours looked after everything, was quick in their response to any questions or concerns. I've used several tour companies in my travels and B.T. is reliable, professional and good value for money. Thank you to Justine, Ceri, Maria, Guillermo and the many others that made our tours memorable.

Highlight of Buenos Aires. Excellent introduction to the city! Jessica was our guide, knowledgeable, flexible, fun to be with! We did the BA 101 full day walking tour and it covered all the highlights. Worth every cent we paid.

Great tour of La Boca and San Telmo. We were picked up promptly at our apt and Jessica met us in La Boca and showed us many things we had missed on our own. It was fun to catch a city bus and head over to San Telmo for the street fair and Jessica gave us a lot of history and showed us many places to eat and helped us in so many ways. She is a wealth of knowledge and I would highly recommend her to show your around.

Best Way to See Buenos Aires. I had 2 days to visit Buenos Aires and knew that I didn't want to spend a lot of time getting lost or being taken for a ride by a taxi driver looking to pad his wallet, so I decided to take a chance with Buenostours and I am so glad I did. The first evening, the guide took me to several milongas and was extremely knowledeable about not just tango, but the social conventions that go along with it. The next day, Richard, another fabulous guide, took me all around the city and was able to tailor make the trip for my special interests. I would highly recommend Buenostours to anyone looking to see a real slice of BA.

The best way to see buenos aires. We booked a 7 hour walking tour with buenos tours before we left for our cruise. Our guide Ceri was great. Very knowledgeable and funny. He was very passionate about buenos aires and made sure we saw every aspect of the city and it's people. We had a great coffee in the market and had lunch in a local restaurant which was very cheap. The tour was very interesting and not too exhausting We were given a great insight into the culture of Argentina and would recommend this to anyone visiting this city.

Excellent introduction. For a pair of fist time visitors to Buenos Aires prior to a cruise this company provide a great product.We did a full day walking tour with Ceri, excellent!!!! He has such a good relationship with so many locals we got to see inside so many places we would not have been likely to on our own. We thought Buenos Aires a great city with a rich history and European in style in places.  A great company to use, prompt responses to our e-mails and a credit to the people working in the office. Justine in particular. AuroraUK

Efficient way to see Buenos Aires in a Day. If you are short of time and if like us you haven’t been to Buenos Aires before then Buenostours “Full day walking tour”, maybe the answer, it is a great way to cover a lot of the city’s attractions and get a feel for the city. Our guide (Jessica) was very friendly, knowledgeable and informative, she walked us through the old city, showing us street art, sculptures, wonderful churches, the Evita balcony and finishing up at the cemetery (a surprising highlight with its eccentric tombs). Jessica gave us a few rest breaks along the way, with time to have a coffee at the local cafes and to discuss local politics, art and life as an expat. We had lunch at Cafe Tortoni, a beautiful art deco café, full of people and a great atmosphere (a must for lunch). I would recommend this tour as a great way to see the city, and if you do go on this tour ask Jessica to introduce you to Mafalda.

Probably the best money we've spent while in Buenos Aires. Well worth every penny we spent. Jessica was a wealth of information regarding Buenos Aires and Argentina. Art, politics, religion, she covered it all in our day-long tour. This should be on your "must do" list, especially if it is your first trip to Buenos Aires. I suggest a weekend when possible because the streets are much less crowded (we went on a Saturday).

Walked and saw everything, great day. Took the full day walking tour with Jack. He met us in the hotel lobby, and we taxied to the tour start. He was very knowledgeable, full of great information and set a very gentle pace. The tour was seven hours long and we saw all the important places in BA, and a whole lot more.Jack was also full of great information about others things (i.e., where to eat, where to see a good tango show, and more). He was able to answer all our general questions about the country, lifestyle etc. In many cases he opened our eyes so we could appreciate the Ar-gentian view of their city, country, history and politicians.Well worth the money we paid.

San Telmo & La Boca with Ceri. I'd been to Buenos Aires before and wanted to be sure that my girlfriend, on her first visit, would get the benefit of exploring all aspects of the city. Downtown & Recoleta are pretty well covered by some of the excellent free walking tours but for San Telmo and La Boca I booked a half day tour with Buenos Tours, and this proved to be an excellent choice.Ceri met us at our hotel and gave us a most entertaining and informative tour - he certainly knows his adopted city, and had done his homework on our background & interests. We became so immersed in his stories that we all lost track of time and had a bit of a rushed farewell as he left for his next appointment! A great tour of 2 most interesting suburbs, well organised by the tour company and brought to life by a most knowledgeable & entertaining guide.

Wonderful tour of Buenos Aires with a private tour. Four of us took a tour with Buenos Tours and had Jessica as a guide and Chris as a driver. They were both very good. Chris drove us to meet Jessica for the walking tour and then picked us back up to go back to the port. Jessica was very informative, provided a relaxing and interesting tour, and was very personable. We saw everything we wanted to plus a few additional things. I would definitely recommend them.

Outstanding Tour With Richard. I had never been to Buenos Aires so contacted Buenos Tours to arrange a Sunday tour of San Telmo and La Boca. I had such a fantastic time with Richard, a very interesting, personable, and knowledgable guide with similar interests who I related to perfectly. He is originally from New York but is married to an Argentinian and has such love and enthusiasm for the city, you would think he had been born there. He not only took me to the normal tourist venues but shared some more personal sites that I would not have experienced on a typical tour. We even shared a drink of mate, not my favorite drink, but worth the experience. By the end of the day, I felt like we had known eachother for years.Buenos Tours was also very detailed in their correspondence to me before I arrived in Buenos Aires and responded quickly to every question I posed.This was the best private tour I had during my vacation and I highly recommend both Richard and Buenos Tours for an outstanding experience. My only regret is not booking them for the other days I spent in Buenos Aires, however, I will definitely use them again when I return. Bravo to this company!

Fantastic way to see BA!!!. My mother and I did this trip for her 60th birthday. Before we even left for the trip, we were very impressed with the amount of information we were given to ensure we were prepared for everything! It was great to have our interests known in advance to assist in customizing the tour for us. We were paired up with Oliver, who is a terrific guide. He adapted to us,(realized we are not major photographers), ate some of my mom's sandwich that he didn't want, brought mate for me to try, and provided info, good humour and fun. We will be recommending this company to everyone. Thank you for giving us such a great tour!!!

Great Private Tour in Buenos Aires. We were two couples who have been to Buenos Aires before, but wanted to see the few places we did not experience. We corresponded with Buenos Tours via e mail and worked up an itinerary. When we met our guide, Richard, we were totally surprised to find he was an American from New York living with his family in Buenos Aires. Needless to say there was no language problem. We explored La Boca, San Telmo and the Jewish area. We found that Richard had many insights, and, to sum it up, we had an amazing day. We spent it exactly as we had hoped for. Walking through the areas, eating local food( we stopped in a delicious empanada place and another local cafe for lunch), riding the local transportation, and experiencing the tour through a local's point of view. If you want to see and experience Buenos Aires, I highly suggest you use Buenos Tours.

walking tours of Buenos Aires. We took three walking tours of different areas of BA. Our guide gave us good insights on the history and background information of each area, clearly imparting his own enthusiasm for the city. Very friendly and flexible when we wanted to go to a particular place. Very much enjoyed having lunch at the guide's recommended local restaurants - which we never would have found on our own.

Well worth the time and $. We took two half day tours on two different days....first of Recoleta and the second of El Boca. Being provided with the history and an insider's impressions of the city added a whole dimension to our visit. For instance, without our guide, we would have dismissed El Boca as just another tourist trap. He made it come alive with the history and proud heritage of the area. Our personal guide, Don, was excellent (an expat American)....very well informed, interesting and very, very personable. Highly recommended.

Buenos Aires Walking Tour. We went on 2 half-days walking tour with Oliver. Fantastic guide! A great way to know the history and streets of Buenos Aires. Very educational for my children. Highly recommended.

A personalised and fun introduction to Buenos Aires!. We did a day long private walking tour of Buenos Aires with Richard. He was very knowledgeable and a good personality match. He built rapport quickly and customised the tour to suit our interests.He even arranged an impromptu wine tasting and gave us great restaurant recommendations!A great way to start our visit to BA! Highly recommend it!

Fantastic tour guide. Our family of 3 did two 1/2 day tours with Ceri who was fantastic. He tailored the tour to our interests, developed a great rapport with our son, and was clearly knowledgeable about BA and Argentina's rich history. He took us to the best coffee place ever. I treasure my little horn bowl souvenir he helped me pick out at a street market. As a bonus, he gives great advice on restaurants, wine to drink and shops to visit.
Great time!. Had a great time with Oliver. Did the 1 and half day walking tour andwent to colonia for the day! Answered all our questions and showed usthe cool stuff.High;

Day long walking tour of Buenos Aires. We only had one 24 hour day in Buenos Aires because there was so much to see in Argentina and we wanted to see Iguazu Falls. I usually take bus tours or private tours with drivers with limited or no time at each site. I was a bit concerned about a walking tour for 8 hours so I divided it up into a PM session on arrival and AM session before our plane. The tour agency was very flexible as our plane was late so we were arrived to the hotel as the guide Richard arrived. He calmed our fears and told us to take our time checking in. Richard is an expatriate from NY who is married to an Argentinian and has lived there for around 15 years so he really understood our culture and homeland and had come to understand the history of Argentina intimately through studies and family relationships. As he toured he made many informational and humorous analogies between our home (NY) and his which made it interesting and fun. We saw every neighborhood in BA from the earliest to modern and came to understand their progressive history. We took buses and cabs and breaks in cute cafe's in between explorations. He made it easy for his two 65+ clients and I would certainly tour this way again. The second day he accommodated our plane departure so we had plenty of time to get to the airport. Thank you BA tours and absolutely recommend Richard. During high seasons he may not be able to be so flexible but if he can he will do anything to make you enjoy the tour.

Great Introduction to South America and Buenos Aires. I did two tours with Oliver the private walking tour and the trip to Colonia in Uruguay. Oliver knows Buenos Aires and Colonia so well and the tour took me to places that you could never get to on a different tour of the city. Oliver was exceedingly knowledgeable about the city and Colonia and was well prepared in advance for the trips. The two trips went so fast and covered a lot of ground. I learnt a lot about the city that I would not otherwise have learnt and the tours give you the confidence to be able to explore independently further areas of interest in the city. I would give these tours the highest possible recommendations for an amazing day out on holiday but also to acquire a knowledge and the inside local knowledge of the city and its history. Would take my two teenage children in the future when I introduce them to Latin America.

Best tour guide I have ever had hands down!. From super easy way of booking the tour to the most amazing tour guide ever I highly recommend Buenos Tours to anyone looking to expand their knowledge about Buenos Aires. I travel a lot and I have to admit that Jessica, our tour guide for the day was the best one I have ever had in my life hands down!!! She is absolutely incredible, her knowledge of Buenos Aires in terms of history, politics and architecture is beyond believe. She has not only presented it all in such a fantastic and easy to understand way but also we did not feel bored for a single second. We had million and one questions which she was able to answer with so many great details. Thank you Buenos Tours for making our day so fantastic and getting us familiar with the Argentinian history and culture so well.

Can't think of a better way to see the city!. Was in town for business and only had one day free to see the city. Based on all the great review of BuenosTours I decided this was the best way to get the most out of a day in BA and I was not disappointed in the least! My guide Ceri was extremely knowledgeable and very friendly. I learned a tremendous amount about the city from architecture to history to the best place to grab a drink. Couldn't possibly recommend this tour more to anyone interested in seeing and learning about the city! Thanks!

This Company Goes Above & Beyond. I wanted a day long walking tour and chose Buenos Tours on the basis of their reviews and what was offered. My guide, Jessica, arrived promptly as promised and we were off for a fun interesting tour. Jessica provided very interesting facts about the political scene which will enable me to understand the changes that Argentina might incur with their new government. At my request, the company confirmed a medication I wanted to pick up while on my walking tour was available in Argentina and did not require a prescription. Certainly an unexpected extra service. Thanks so much.

Wonderful walking tour, thanks Jessica!. Jessica is extremely informative and enthusiastic about her walking tours. Be prepared to learn much about Argentina and BA. She was able to answer all our questions and patiently took care of the 6 of us. We saw different neighborhoods and the cemetery. Ate at a typical bistro. After this tour, I felt I had a better understanding of BA and Argentina. It was a full day. Thank you, Jessica, for sharing your beautiful vibrant city with us.

Great use of valuable time... Traveling for business is a great opportunity to see new places; the downside is how much time you sometimes have to actually SEE a new place--we have learned to make the best of our time with a private tour guide. Typically we do our own research, determine what is of interest to us and style our time that way--other times, we are just on the road non-stop that we DON'T have time to research and just put ourselves into an experts hands letting them know our interests and then listening to their suggestions. Such was the case in BA....we had a WHOLE 6 six hours to spend 'touring' (Sad, I know after being there nearly a week, but we did do some excursions with our business guests) and we met with Ceri. Justine at the office was great in making the arrangements and working with our crazy window of time. We really like being on the streets as much as possible walking or taking public transit--to make the most of our time we did that AND a taxi and we were able to cover a lot of territory---We learned so much and discovered some great places to return and further explore. Seriously consider treating yourself to an expert 'friend' for the day--you really will enjoy it!

Best tour . Jessica made our day - and made our visit to Buenos Aries a very memorable and informative day. We travel extensively and Jessica is the best tour guide we have ever had. She is extremely knowledgable, informative and impartial. She has an incredible knowledge of the city and tailors the tour to attractions she genuinely believes will be of interest to her clients.Highly recommended.

Great Experience With Buenos Tours / Highly Recommended. Hi Everyone, My partner and I just returned from our first trip to Buenos Aires. We did tons of research before we left and due to all the positive reviews decided to book a private, all day, walking tour through Buenos Tours. We had a great experience from start to finish. Justine responded very quickly to our initial inquiry. Answered all of our questions, provided different tour options, and even included valuable information about the Reciprocity Entry Fee, currency exchange, etc.. On the day of our tour we were met at our hotel by our guide, Don Bodie. Not knowing what to expect we were a little anxious at first. He instantly made us feel at ease and began our walk around the city. Don was great. He has an amazing amount of knowledge and kept the tour very interesting. He showed us how to use the subway, ride the bus, explained how the currency exchanged worked, and was very flexible with showing us places and things that we wanted to see. One great example is our desire to try Mate for the first time. He took us to a great little place, ordered for us, showed us how to prepare it, and shared it with us. We wouldn't do that with just anyone. It was a great experience and we highly recommend it. Thanks for a great day Don and Buenos Tours!! Dan & Mike Los Angeles, CA

Great Day plau helped with the rest of our trip. My wife and I had Jessica take us around Buenos Aires in Nov. 2015. We had a great time all day and got along with Jessica great. She definitely knew her way around the city and knew all of the answers to our questions and I feel like she definitely tailored what we discussed and saw after getting to know us a bit. We saw a great mix of old and new Buenos Aires and its history and influences. When we stopped for a snack at one point we went over the map and saw how much of the city we had actually covered and were very impressed considering we never felt rushed at all throughout the day. We discussed wine a lot while we were on the tour (we were going to Mendoza after BA), after our tour my wife and I walked back to our hotel and Jessica was there in the lobby with a bottle of wine for us that she had gotten for us, talk about above and beyond.Also my wife and I were interested in going to a "closed door" restaurant in BA and Frank from the company made a list of recommendations for us to chose from which I thought was very helpful. All in all we were blown away with what Buenos Tours did for us, highly recommended.

A terrific guide and a great tour company.. Tour - Intro to Buenos Aires and Recoleta Cemetery TourWe had been on a tour 15 years ago and wanted to repeat the experience since the first tour in 2000 was with a cruise line and the tour group was about 60 people. It was a great tour but not very personal. My goal this time was that I wanted to be able to ask more questions, gain more insight and feel free to have a discussion about the aspects that interested us without fear of being rude to other tourists (as you would, if it was a large group). We communicated in August with Buenos Tours (BT) and submitted our request, talked about our interests, some of our history and even some limitations that we have while touring. Through those email conversations they paired us with a guide who had similar interests / background and we locked into the tour. The guide was Ceri and we found him to be intelligent, insightful, patient and very professional. He did a very good job of assessing us in the beginning of the tour to get a better understanding of who we were and what our expectations were. But he did this all in a way that was friendly and very conversational (the mark of a real pro). He listened as much as he spoke and was able to “cut to the chase” as to what we needed and what we wanted to do. Our first stop was an exchange location where we were able to understand and become comfortable with exchanging our US currency to Argentine peso’s. The famous blue dollar. He provided us a lesson in how / where to get a cab....the correct side and the wrong side for getting in and expectations on tipping. We stopped at a beautiful café for a quick coffee and bathroom break before we entered the cemetery. Recoleta can be appreciated on many levels. It’s an amazing cemetery, it’s a slice of history that will never be repeated, the architecture is very unique, the sculpture is amazing, the mosaic tiles are beautiful. Ceri was a great guide with insights from all of those perspectives. He has a great sense of humor which both Linda and I appreciated as we toured. He confided to us that he had done a quick refresher tour for himself a few days prior so he would be able to guide us to the multiple highlights. My wife and I are both architects and have a strong interest in cemeteries from this period in time. As we entered the cemetery, the first stop was to the guard desk where Ceri spent some time joking with them and introducing us. One of the gaurds was having a mate tea break where the tea is consumed from a decorative wood cup with a silver straw. It was shared by the group. Clearly, an experience that we would not have had on our own. Recoleta is so large and when you start to spend several minutes at each mausoleum ... our morning was quickly being used. I could tell that Ceri was “recalculating” what he wanted to show us so that we could see “the best of” before his time with us was concluded. Not an easy task when your audience is so keen to see it all. We were surprised when one of the Recoleta care-takers approached us as we were admiring a tomb and we had a conversation. Ceri has a way of speaking that shows a great deal of respect and before we knew it, the caretaker offered to show us some of his favorites and even joked about his large key ring, making him look like he was an earthly Saint Peter with the keys to heaven. Before we knew it, our time with Ceri had exceeded our tour, which Ceri was very generous with. He could see that we were still entrenched in our exploration so he recommended that we stay and continue to tour and directed us to the other areas that we had not seen yet. Ceri and BT exceeded our expectations. The informative emails in August to put the tour together were exchanged in a prompt time frame. The emails a week prior to the tour to coordinate the initial meeting were detailed and exact. The follow up after the tour has been a lot of fun too. A great guide, great tour and great tour company.

Must Do!. If you are visiting BA for the first time, I can't recommend this tour company enough. This was our second visit, so we wanted to do something different instead of riding the terrible hop-on-hop-off bus this time. I contacted Buenos Tours days before our visit and received an expeditious reply followed by a tour confirmation. We did the 3 1/2 hour city tour with Jack. Jack arrived at our hotel on time and was such a delight to spend time with. Being a history major, he was a wealth of knowledge and took us places we would not have seen otherwise. We learned a lot! Great tour, great guide. Money well spent!

Laughing & Crying in Buenos Aires. Before going into how special this tour was, I should state that my husband and I usually never take tours anywhere because we worry that most offer only cookie-cutter, superficial experiences to tourists. Having looked at the reviews for this company and the kinds of tours they do, however, we decided to try it out to see if this was the type of tour that offered a more intimate experience of the city.On short notice, I emailed Buenos Tours and had a very nice and friendly exchange with Alan, the company's founder, who quickly facilitated our interest in taking a half day tour (4 hours) customized to our interests. We were lucky enough to get a tour booked only 3 days from when we arrived (although I would advise that if you are interested in taking a tour, book well in advance and maybe even schedule something a day or two after arriving).On the day of the tour we met our guide, Ceri, at our hotel and discussed what we might like to see. We were interested in seeing most things and were open to wherever he thought we might like to go, which was the right decision. Not only did Ceri take us to some intriguing places (a wine shop in an art deco building, a used bookstore, a tango club, a cathedral, a cultural center, an anarchist craft fair, the Café Tortoni, and many others), but he engaged us in the kind of conversation that was an experience unto itself. In other words, there was a spirit of camaraderie and affinity that developed around us, a buena onda (good vibe) as they say in Argentine Spanish. Ceri is very funny, which lends itself to this spirit easily taking shape. But he's not just funny, he knows what a genuine engagement with people looks and feels like and tries to offer that on the tour. This was proven, for instance, when he took us to a club where older people dance the tango. There, I was moved to tears by the unmediated expression we witnessed (something that seems rarely to occur in the US). No matter how old or fashionable the people were in this club, everyone looked absolutely gorgeous. We looked upon them with admiration and appreciation. I don't want to spend any more time writing here as I'd like to sit back and savor the experience, but needless to say it is well worth your time and money. Do this. You will enjoy it. Perhaps you will even laugh and cry, too!

Excellent tour company and wonderful Tour Guide Oliver. My husband and I just finished our BA 101 tour with Oliver as our guide and were so happy we did! Oliver was so informative and personable. We really got the flavor and history of the city in the full day private excursion and felt so comfortable in this busy city. We visited four area of the city with stops for a snack and then lunch(best empanadas) within the 7 plus hours. He even departed from the routine to show us a building that we had a special interest in seeing as it related to our occupational field and other tidbits as it related to some of our personal interests. Thank you Oliver for all the memories. Additionally we took the Tango Show/Dinner with dance lesson and had a blast. The Piazzolla theatre was beautiful and we even got a private balcony table for dinner and the show. The dance lesson was fun and the shuttle bus that provided to/from service to our hotel was punctual and very clean. We would highly recommend this company and Oliver to all our friends and the trip advisor community.

Two splendid walking tours. We arranged for two private waliking tours during our stay in Buenos Aires. One to see some of the art nouveau and art deco buildings of the city and one to tour the Recoleta and Retiro districts. Our guide, Jessica, was a mine of useful and fascinating information – not just about architecture but also the history of Argentina, the current political situation and even the local football clubs. Both of our tours lasted longer than the advertised three hours and were very good value. We thoroughly recommend Buenos Tours to anyone visiting Buenos Aires and we will certainly use them again next time we are there.

Best way to experience Buenos Aires. We took the BA101 full day private walking tour on our first day in Buenos Aires. This was absolutely the best possible way to see the city. Our guide Jessica was enthusiastic and knowledgeable, and made the day a special event. She met us at our hotel and then we were off via taxi, subte (metro) and walking. Cafe and restaurant stops were based on our desires, but do not miss these opportunities. The tour format is flexible and can accommodate any circumstance or interest. Perfect Day!

Great way to see the city. We took the BA 101 Full Day Tour and enjoyed it very much. Having a personal guide and getting to see the city on foot was way better than doing one of those bustours or having to figure it all out on our own. Jessica was very knowledgeable about the city and it was a pleasure to spend the day with her.

Colonia day trip done with Oliver, and tango show, not to be missed. Firstly, we did the day trip to Colonia with Oliver, only the three of us so my wife and I had his undivided attention, we booked quite late but they still took our booking. Oliver was a very informative, entertaining character, his approach was unique and well enjoyed by us. He showed a high level of passion for his job and made the tour interesting despite the town being very simple and quaint. Fully recommend to do Colonia with Oliver.Secondly, we did a VIP tango dinner/ show through the same company. We had a private booth, private transfer and drinks with dinner which were all wonderful and worth the extra if you can afford it. The musicians made the show however as they played non stop between the dancers and really worked hard!The only criticism is that you are still expected to tip/ pay for the service at the tango show, which should just be all inclusive.

Holiday. Really impressed with the walking tour we took. We had been on a few over the holiday, trying some of the 'free tours' but this was leagues above. The guide, Jack, was fun and very informative and the tour managed to pull together the city in a way we wouldn't have been able by ourselves. Highly recommend.

Excellent Company and Fantastic Tango Show. From the very beginning, my correspondence with Buenos Tours was wonderful. Being in the travel industry, I have many dealings with tour companies and I felt the response and time given to me by Buenos Tours was one of the best!! We did the VIP Tango show at Piazzolla Tango. Our seats were amazing (we had a private booth elevated so we could see everything) and the food/wine was delicious!! We were completely captivated by the show...the dancers and the music. It was beautiful. There was a slight mix-up with the transportation to/from the venue (which was included in our VIP package) but I contacted Buenos Tours immediately and they were very receptive and helpful in making sure all was taken care of. I was impressed by their response time and willingness to help (no matter the fact it was in the evening and after business hours). I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this company to anyone wanting excellent service and experiences in Buenos Aires.

Fantastic Tour. We arrived in BA after a long flight from London feeling lousy - but we had to stay awake because I'd arranged a walking tour of the Retiro and Recoleta with BuenosTours. Travelling with two teenage boys I was concerned that everything could go wrong. In fact, I needn't have worried at all! Our guide, Ceri, arrived at the hotel bang on time and was friendly and engaging right from the start - even managing to get my boys interested in the Recoleta cemetery and the other sights in the vicinity (although best for them was a trip to an ice cream parlour). Not only was Ceri a great guide with loads of knowledge about BA and an opinion on everything he took us to see, but he also had loads of practical tips which helped us on the rest of our trip to BA and Argentina. Of course it helped a lot that he was a native English speaker.This tour was such a great introduction to Argentina that it really gave our trip a boost, right from the start - it was bit like taking a tour with an old friend. I really cannot recommend this company highly enough.

Great day with a lot of information. We get a great day with our guide who was knowing the history of the city and country. Very instructive. We spent all day walking around, learning the customs of the city; very informative as we were staying only one day in Buenos Aires. Our guide adapted the tour to our willingness...perfect!

Fantastic, cultural, informative - a must do!. We were shown around La Boca and San Telmo by our private guide Don. He gave he perfect insite into history and culture. We were very impressed with the content and places we visited. As this was our honeymoon we wanted it to be special and don certainly shared his extensive knowledge with us and also reccomended other activities and restaurants to visit during our stay. Being into photography there were a lot of great opportunities especially in la Boca. This is well worth the money and our guide even went over the time to make sure we saw everything.

Great tour!. My husband and I went to Argentina to celebrate my birthday! We had a full day tour with Jessica in the morning and Ceri in the afternoon. We saw so much of Buenos Aires and learned a lot about the culture too. They tailored the tour to our personal interests. We had a great time and it was the perfect way to see the city. We had one more day in Buenos Aires on the way home and went to Palermo as Ceri recommended. Thanks for the perfect recommendation for a shopping neighborhood!

PERFECTO !. Everyone should use this company....you can''t go wrong !! Look no farther if your looking for a private walking tour of the City...My experience setting up the tour was with ease , Allan was alway quick to email back and quickly...I was traveling with my husband on a business trip so I was solo on my tours...I was a bit apprehensive but that was short lasting after meeting my tour guide , Ceri..I did an half day tour and a full day tour...The tours are very personal to your liking ...you can do what interest you...I personally had a blast ...exploring and experiencing the people of Buenos Aires ...I was shown really cool coffee shops ..Café Tortoni was perfect for a morning latte and croissant ...an afternoon wine and cheese rest ..where we met an argentine and had a blast with him....I could go on and on....I was able to take my husband back to most of the places we went to and show him....I highly recommend this private way of learning about the Buenos Aires ...I highly recommend Ceri....He was knowledgable about the city and had a great sense of humor..If I come back to Buenos Aires I will definitely do another tour !!!

Richard was an excellent intro to BA. this is one good Guy!!We had a personal tour of the city with Richard. Besides providing a good insight to the life one can live in Buenos Aires, Richard was also excellent company and made the day a truly memorable one.Do not miss the opportunity to have one of these personalized tours. they can make or break your experience within a city

A Really Fun Day in BA. This was my first experience hiring a private tour guide, and it was amazing, from start to finish. My mother and I were visiting Buenos Aires for three days, and didn't really know what to do, and so we decided to take a tour based on all the rave reviews posted on tripadvisor. Buenos Aires is such a big, modern, bustling city, but I think it would be hard to see all the secret little gems that make it so enchanting to visit without a tour guide. Ceri was awesome, he took us all over the city, walking and in taxis, but we never felt rushed or tired. We had coffee, empanadas, we saw tango, and everywhere we went felt local and special. I especially appreciated the tour the next day, when my mother and I got lost and frustrated every two blocks because I am a terrible planner. It was nice to have a day planned out for us, especially when we got to look at art and architecture, eat delicious food, and have such a gracious host. We loved our tour, and I cannot recommend it highly enough.

The Ideal Tour!. Buenos Tours is an ideal way to see and experience the city, and our tour guide, Jack, was excellent! He was enthusiastic, well-informed, and hilarious. This tour remains one of the most memorable I've yet taken. Thank you, Jack!

Terrific Service on a Private Tour. Private tours are the way to see Buenos Aires. BuenosTours is exceptionally responsive and lazar focused on delivering customized service. Our tour guide, Ceri, brought his car for our WALKING tour because I mentioned in our correspondence that my wife had a knee injury. They also will help you arrange excursions with other companies if they don't cover the attraction.

Amazing First Impression. First time in a personalised tour, great first impression of the city and the best step to start a Buenos Aires visit. Great choice if you have kids and you need your own rhythm. Oliver was a very candid guide.

Excellent Tour Company with Excellent Customer Service!. We used Buenos Tours for 3 separate activities: A walking tour of BA, a day trip to an estancia, and a Tango show. All three were excellent. The staff at Buenos tours communicate very well with you via e-mail. They answer your questions and keep you up to date with the details of your tour.Our walking tour guide, Jessica, was outstanding. She showed us things we would have otherwise missed, all while giving us a fascinating look into Buenos Aires. I would highly recommend a tour with Jessica. It goes at your pace, and you learn so much.Our day trip to the Camino Pampa estancia was the highlight of our trip to BA. This tour is priced higher than other estancia trips offered by other companies, but it is worth every penny. We were picked up by a driver (Mr. Cesar) who gave us a very nice history of Argentina on our drive to the ranch. When we arrived at San Antonia de Areco, we were met by an absolutely amazing guide--Juan Manuel. We can't say enough good things about Manuel--he was wonderful. Knowledgeable, friendly, and he clearly loves what he does. That translated into an exceptional day for us. We learned so much, and really enjoyed our day on the ranch--horseback riding, having a traditional "asado" lunch, and listening to traditional gaucho music. It was all topped off with a display of horse taming that was incredible to watch. This tour is worth the price of admission.Finally, we used Buenos Tours to see the Piazolla Tango show. Tango shows are clearly aimed at tourists, but again, this one was a notch above the rest. The food was average, but you're not going for the food--there's plenty of excellent food available all over Buenos Aires. Where the Piazolla Tango show stands out is the talent. The dancing was outstanding as was the live band--really a treat to watch. The added bonus was the group tango lesson before dinner. It was fun to try to tango, but it just makes you appreciate the talent level of these dancers.

Excellant experience. You will not be disappointed!. My guide Jessica exceeded my expectations in every way. I had a wonderful two days that were filled with information, but laid back enough that I felt at ease and able to go at my own pace. I felt safe, learned a lot, was able to shop and enjoy myself, all while not having to worry about how to get from place to place. I would certainly book a tour with Buenos Tours and Jessica again. Thanks for a wonderful experience!

Great Tour with Richard. We had to schedule this tour at the end of our trip, which was unfortunate because Richard, our guide, had such great information and tips to share about the beautiful city. Even though we did the half-day Recoleta & Retiro tour, Richard really helped us get a glimpse of everyday life in Buenos Aires. He also gave us excellent recommendations on where to get good last minute souvenirs. This was a great way of learning about the city's culture, architecture, and history if you're short on time. We highly recommend booking this tour.

so much better than wandering around myself. My guide Richard really tailored the tour to my interests generally and those specific for Buenos Aires. It was a great way to take advantage of a bit of downtime on a work trip. I never would have learned about gnocchi Friday before pay day or even had it on my own without the tour.

Great way to start a visit to Buenos Aires. Our tour guide was Oliver. We had a Buenos Aires Full day + La Boca extension on the day after we landed in Buenos Aires. We had a lot of fun and learned a lot of history about the city. It was also a great way to find out where all the exciting neighborhoods are for the rest of our trip. Good safety tips that we kept in mind for the rest of the trip. Overall, you cover most of the main, interesting parts of the city during the tour. We highly recommend this company!

City Tour with Jessica. My husband and I had a very pleasant experience on a half day city tour of Buenos Aires with Jessica. She was laid back, attentive, and a wealth of information on the history of the city and all the fun nuances of its people. She took us to places we never would have discovered on our own. She picked us up at our hotel on time and off we went. A half day seemed to be a perfect amount of time with a guide, then we had the rest of the afternoon to explore on our own. Thanks for a lovely time, Jessica.

Informative, interesting, well worth it!. Since BuenosTours offers private outings, they accommodated our interests and combined the historical and Jewish tours for a full-day outing. Our guide, Richard, was excellent. He knows his stuff, set a good pace so that we covered a lot but not too fast for our energy levels. He is from NYC, so made some nice parallels to US history to explain some part of Argentine history. Also, since he's lived here for about 14 years, he also could explain a lot about the culture of Buenos Aires. I highly recommend BuenosTours. Worth the money.

Very Thorough & Informative. We chose BuenosTours for our tour operator during our honeymoon and found them to provide a very comprehensive overview of Buenos Aires' history and main neighborhoods. Jack and Don were our guides for the two days and both were extremely knowledgeable about the areas we covered. We enjoyed our time with them, learned a lot, and would recommend them to others!

Best Way to Tour Buenos Aires!. I had an absolutely great time with Jessica, my tour guide, during my two-day private tour of Buenos Aires. I loved feeling like a local and being taken to all the great spots by Jessica. I am so glad I booked this tour. Alan also made sure to answer the multitude of questions I had prior to my tour and gave me great recommendations. I cannot recommend this tour enough if you want to see all the important places in Buenos Aires with a knowledgeable, friendly, and all around great guide. There is only one way I would tour Buenos Aires and it would be with BuenosTours!

Great way to see the city. We recently moved to Buenos Aires and thought that a tour would be a great way to get to know the city - and we were right. Ceri was our guide and he was fantastic, incredibly knowledgeable of the city and especially its architecture. He adapted the tour for us given we are now living here and gave us a lot of tips on how to do things here which has proven very helpful to us nearly two months into our new life here. For a visitor this tour is a wonderful way to experience the main highlights of the city. I've recommended this tour to other expats and they've also enjoyed the experience.

Walking Buenos Aires. During our stay in Buenos Aires we booked two private walking tours with Buenos Tours. Walking is such a great way to experience a city. Buenos Tours has a number of half-day walking tours and we chose: La Boca & San Telmo Tour and Retiro, Recoleta & the Cemetery Tour.Compared with other walking tours we did in other South American locations, this company was superior - excellent pricing, our guide Richard was flexible, considerate and knowledgeable. Buenos Tours was the only company that sent us a questionnaire which enabled them to personalize our tours and avoid sights and activities which were not of interest to us.I recommend them highly.

Great guides tailor your walking tour to suit your needs and enjoyment. 2 of us enjoyed immensely the perspective of 2 guides and 2 tours on one sunny day — showed us every aspect of BA and Recoleta cemetery — answering all our questions and adapting the tours to our interests. Enjoyed a delicious snack at The Café Tortoni (food/drinks extra – not included in tour fee). Day ended in a lovely café which we chose (guide gave options).If you do not speak Spanish, highly recommend any English speakers' personal walking guided tour through beautiful BA. Guides will keep you walking and aware of time/schedule, but you need not be an athlete. Outstanding support from the team who will answer every and any question about your tour beforehand by email. Buenos Tours also offered great tips about travelling in BA. Well worth the expense. Well done Buenos Tours!

Second Time to Tour with BuenosTours. We had our first tour with BuenosTours a few years ago with Jessica. When we returned to BA in January we requested another tour with Jessica of Recoleta, and it was fantastic. She is a great guide and so knowledgeable about the city and Argentina. We can't wait to return to BA and hope that she'll still be there to show us another part of the city.

Great experience in Buenos Aires!. Our guide Don was terrific taking us through La Boca by foot and San Telmoright in the area showing the history and stories associated with this lovely city.Getting a personal tour gives it character and feel to the city.

Fantastic Way To Experience BA!. We had a wonderful time with Ceri. He was supremely knowledgeable, and helped us to see and experience so much more of BA than we ever would've been able to on our own. His flexibility and expertise really made for a special, highly-customized touring experience!

Certainly a trip not to miss. I had a full day tour with an excellent guide in Jessica who was extremely knowledgeable about Buenos Aires. She was American which meant that I had no problems with the language, coming from England. The pace of the tour was perfect, and we saw everything I had expected to see. Certainly a trip not to miss.
Terrific experience. Well worth the cost!. the guide was great--lots of insights about Argentina and Buenos Aires--very helpful to start are week in the city

It felt like a day out with friends. Our guide Don met us at our hotel... We were the only two on the tour which made the day more personal. We explored the sights of this diverse and colourful city. Fantastic buildings...quirky shops and cafes...interesting history and we used all available public transport including the Subway. The walking pace was as expected and we covered a lot of ground... The day was very warm so plenty of water is a must... If you can manage a full day of walking... Buenos Tours should be on your itinerary... Great Day!

Private Walking tr with Buenos Tours. OMG!!! What a wonderful tour, wonderful guide - Quincy, wonderful city!!! Quincy was a pleasure from beginning to end. I learned more and saw more and enjoyed the tour immensely. Quincy was polite, easy going, knowledgeable and a pure pleasure. There were only two of us on the tour and I enjoyed her so much that we asked if she was free for the afternoon so we could continue and see even more. I would recommend this company to everyone and especially Quincy for making our visit even better! We visited in February of 2015 but this date was not an option for visit months on the website.

Another great tour. This was my third walking tour with Buenos Tours in the last several years; each with a different guide. Each guide has been great, all with different insights. The tour feels like walking around the city with a local friend rather than a traditional "tour".

Highlight of our Trip.
