Walking round Retiro was also fascinating, learning of the past grandeur of all the mansions, the families who occupied them and the lifestyles they must have led. At the end of the 3 hours I felt I had a wonderful insight into the life and history of Buenos Aires.

Must Do while in BA!!!. We've just returned to our hotel after an information filled walking tour with Ceri. His local knowledge and very informative 'presentation' was brilliant. We did the full day walk (about 7.5 hours) and it was worth every cent. From being met promptly in our hotel foyer, to having a tailor made walk centred around the information you provide at booking, the day is filled with hidden gems of little known facts and insider information that is priceless. Not rushed in any way, we were able to stroll through various parts of old and new BA, stopping to admire the architecture and statues around the city. We stopped for lunch at a great little restaurant in Recoleta where we had the tastiest selection of Empanadas we've had while here.If there is one thing you do while visiting this history filled city, this would have to be it!! Thanks Ceri, was an exceptional experience.

GREAT 2 days with Buenos Tours. My husband and I spent 2 days talking the north & south with Buenos Tours. Our guide Richard was wonderful for the first day - made sure to tailor the tour to things that interested us, was very knowledgable and really went above and beyond for us (checked on us the next day and sent us follow up suggestions for the rest of our stay). Oliver was also great on our additional day, and he had communicated with Richard to know about us ahead of time. The highlight was the cemetary tour with Oliver as he included some really interesting (and spooky!) stories that aren't often told and is an excellent story teller. He is an actor as well so this really added to the experience when hearing about the history, etc. Overall, we really felt taken care of and that we got the most out of our short visit.The bookings team is also great - they were super fast via email with responses and sent a photo of each guide so we knew who to look out for (clever!). They are pricier than other companies out there but well worth it to us.Highly recommend!
Terrific tour!. BuenosTours walking tour was a wonderful way to learn about a delightful city. Our guide Richard was knowledgeable, gracious and entertaining. Terrific tour!

Excellent tours and personal service. We went on the Recoleta / Centro and the La Boca / SanTelmo tours in early August with Jessica. She was fabulous and extremely knowledgeable about BA and kept us enthralled with interesting stories about the history, culture and characters in BA history and present.Will treasure the memories and look forward to seeing the photos in a few weeks!Thanks for a great time!

A Great Insider's look at Buenos Aires. We booked with BuenosTours after reading a recommendation online in the Guardian. Getting in touch was easy and the booking experience both simple and intuitive. Excitedly we embarked with our guide, Ceri, and had a most wonderful, unique, and really 'insider's point of view' visit to La Boca and San Telmo. Though I had been to BA several times on my own on business, there is no way I could have created such a superb and personal visit. My family was elated, privy to things that many locals don't know, and absorbed more about the city than I had on several prior visits combined. Bravo, Bravo and an ecstatic two thumbs up!

Great way to get to know B/A. We took this tour and enjoyed it immensely. Justine was extremely knowledgeable about the history, architecture and politics of the area ( Recoleta). Walking is a pleasant and leisurely way to really get familiar with an area. I highly recommend this tour.

Informative and entertaining. I visted B.A. with a group of 8 (family), and we decided to take the full-day tour split into two days. Our guide Oliver was super organized and clearly knew a lot about the city, and we were able to learn so much more about the iconic sites than we would have touring on our own, guidebooks in hand. He also gave great recommendations for where to see and eat after.

Fantastic tour of La Boca and San Telmo. Ceri was an excellent guide on our tour of La Boca and San Telmo. Aswell as telling us about the history of the areas, he helped out withpurchases in San Telmo market, took us to the Pope's favourite caféfor tea, and went well over the time allocated for the tour. We allhad a brilliant afternoon! He also gave us a recommendation for amilonga venue, which we went to another afternoon and really enjoyed.Many thanks, Ceri!From Kate, Rachel and Immy

World travelers stamp of approval. My husband and I have traveled for over 50 years and we can honestly say this entire operation from the initial answering of our first email to our last tour (we took 4 half day tours) was top shelf. Justine was efficient in planning our days, fitting us with the perfect match for tour people, and even provided concierge white glove service in obtaining ballet tickets for us!!!! She exuded confidence and made me feel that this would be a wonderful, fulfilling experience.We had both Oliver and Ceri for our guides. They were prompt , informative, witty, flexible to shop or stop ,entertaining and knowledgeable. We would give this company a real seal of approval from picky Miami people.

BEST VACATION INVESTMENT, EVER!. BuenosTours did not disappoint. On time, smart, witty, informative, fun, and overall an excellent investment while on vacation in Buenos Aires. It doesn't get any better than this. Take it form a hardcore New Yorker, this tour is a great vacay tool when trying to squeeze in all of the historical sights while also leisurely enjoying the city over a couple of days. You won't be sorry and for the price, it is BEYOND worth it. Ask for Oliver, he was AMAZING!

Half Day Private Guided Walking Tour of the Historical Center of Buenos Aires for 2 people. Excellent tour. Our guide, Ceri, was extremely knowledgeable and professional. We walked around the centre of the city for about 4 hours. I would definitely recommend using BuenosTours and Ceri. Excellent experience.

Great way to tour Buenos Aires. Our group of 5 joined Jessica for a full day private walking tour around Buenos Aires and left the city with beautiful memories. We were lucky to have Jessica as our guide. She is very friendly and knowledgeable and made us feel right at ease with her. She picked us from our B&B in Palermo and we got to San Telmo in two taxis, where we started the walking tour at a leisurely pace. As our group had very little time in Buenos Aires, we travelled around in taxis to our destinations all the time. So we were thrilled when Jessica brought us for a subway experience, albeit just 2-3 stations in between the walking tour. We chatted like old friends with her over lunch and gelatos and had a fantastic day together in Buenos Aires!

BuenosTours with Jessica. We had four days in BA after a cruise and hooked up with Jessica from BuenosTours for a day and a half. Best decision we made on our trip. She showed us the city in a way we never could if we were on our own. We met up at our hotel and after talking about what we wanted to do, we took off on foot and had a great time. She showed us the sites, took us to great local restaurants, and filled us with all the local lore. We can't recommend BuenosTours highly enough.

Great walk through Recoleta!. My husband and I used Buenotours during our visit to South America. Our guide, Jessica, was excellent providing insights and local information during our tour of Recoleta. She assisted us in finding the best empanadas, shopping areas and local restaurants. Highly reccomended!!

Worth every penny!!. Jessica was the perfect guide!!! She had a lot of information to share, but did not overwhelm us with it. She met us at the appointed time in our hotel lobby, asking what we had seen, what we wanted to do. Jessica was very accommodating and wanted to be sure she tailored the tour to our desires.My husband uses a wheelchair and I can't push him as well as I used to. Jessica became cognizant of this and we went at a very leisurely pace. We stopped often where there were benches and she filled us in on interesting facts for the area. Lots of photo opportunities. Jessica and my husband enjoyed comparing "notes" from THE ECONOMIST about South America economics, Argentina specifically. We loved the "café" she took us to for lunch/snack just outside the Recoleta cemetery. (I will review this separately). She had wonderful stories to tell about various masoleums in the cemetery. Without her we would not have found Evita's resting place. Many other interesting "characters" and facts!Afterwards, she found us a taxi and even offered to go back to the hotel with us because the wheelchair did not fit completely into the trunk. We made it back without a problem and our taxi driver spoke enough English we felt comfortable and knew he would drive safely.Thank you very much, Jessica for a beautiful day!!!!

Highly Recommended. Never a pedantic dry listing of facts, this was a studied and care~full unravelling of the history and also the (simple and complex) cultural elements of Buenos Aires / Argentina. Lots of fun too.

The Best Way to see Buenos Aires. My wife and I had been to Buenos Aires before and had done bus tours and a private tour by car. This time we thought seeing a city through a window was like watching a video, so we choose to do a walking tour instead. We found Buenos Aires Walking tours on Trip Advisor and made our plans.Our guide Ceri (pronounced Carey) met us at our hotel and we took a taxi to La Boca, the home of the tango. It was Sunday and there was soccer match at the stadium and there were craft fairs in the streets. The air was electric with the sights, sounds, and aromas from the restaurants that had set up tables in the streets in front of their dining rooms. He escorted us around and filled us in with the history of the area and encouraged us to become part of the party.We took a bus to another area where the streets were full of street performers and live music and there were art shows and antique shops and restaurants. We felt that for the first time we were part of the fun of Buenos Aires and not just observers from an air conditioned bus.Ceri was an excellent guide who is well worth spending time with. He was born in Canada and raised in England (so the there is not language problem) and now becoming a citizen of Argentina. He and his wife are in the Theater and their story is a great one. We shared a lot in common.After the tour we took a taxi back to the hotel. We had the best tour ever in Buenos Aires and felt like we had made a friend too.My only regret was that we had not booked more tours!

Walking tour. A good guide who is funny, informative and not particularly time-sensitive can make the difference between enjoyable and dreary on a three hour walking tour. Also, how often is a Shakespearean actor your guide? There was drama, laughter, fun and information on our two half-day tours with Ceri. We would highly recommend this company!

Wonderful Day in Buenos Aires. Our group of 4 had one day to spend sightseeing in Buenos Aires before leaving on a cruise. We took a chance on BuenoTours because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and booked a full day walking tour with them. I emailed for reservations and they got right back to me. Their communication was excellent, both for our tour and any other questions we had. We spent a fantastic day with the lovely Isabel. We saw wonderful things, learned a lot and had lots of fun. I can't think of a better way to be introduced to Buenos Aires. If and when I am back, I will call BeunosTours! Without hesitation, I recommend this tour to anyone that can walk at a fairly leisurely pace for a couple of hours.

Great Day in Buenos Aires. We were on a cruise that had an overnight stay in Buenos Aires at end of journey. We wanted to see a bit more of the city, rather than just through a bus window, so had found Buenos Tours through trip advisor, and read all the great reviews.Booked the full day walking tour and had prompt response from Company , with name of guide and photo. Later we were advised that original guide had to return to USA at time of our tour, so we were then given replacement guide. We met Chance at Sheraton Hotel, which was close to the port, and started our day. We had said we were interested in looking at things away from main tourist areas, and Chance showed us some great neighbourhoods, with really beautiful old buildings. We went into one of oldest cafes, and original shopping arcade and the food market. Chance had an amazing knowledge of the city and the buildings. We had lunch at very popular restaurant(Café Tortoni), had to queue outside, and then waiters were bustling around . Also Chance took us into a very beautiful bookshop that had once been a theatre and all the original structures were still there. Had basically just removed the seats, all the private boxes remained, and the stage was now a café , but all the lighting switches and stage props remained. Was great to see that all that hadn't been lost, when the use of the building changed. We then we out to Recoleta cemetery, and saw all the enormous tombs and Chance explained all the different methods of storing the dead. Then it was time for a gelato and a sit down inside the gelato shop, which was great after all the walking, and it had been a hot day. Chance had however tried to find shady areas to stop when we were looking at the sights.We felt very safe walking around the city, and really had an amazing day.Would totally recommend this company and our guide Chance, thank you so much

Highlights of Buenos Aires. We are from Indiana and did not know what to expect. The tour was awesome. My teenage boys loved the tour and liked the history of the city. The lunch stop was excellent as well. You can't go wrong with this tour.

Wonderful way to see Buenos Aires. On a whim, we decided to book a private walking tour of Buenos Aires. Originally, we had planned to explore BA by ourselves, but having read some good reviews about Buenos Tours, we thought it would be worthwhile to do a walking tour and we are so glad we did.We reached out to Buenos Tours via their website and we had a prompt response about availability and options. We booked a half day tour of the City Centre & San Telmo, but after reading our traveller profile, Buenos Tours emailed us to tailor our tour a bit more based on our traveller profile (we were interested in seeing some Tango during the day). They suggested that instead of starting in San Telmo, we start in La Boca, where we'd have the opportunity to see tango dancers on the street and in some of the outdoor restaurants. I must say, it was a brilliant suggestion and ended up being one of our favorite parts of the trip.Ceri, our tour guide, met us at our hotel the day of the tour. It was an interesting day for a tour, as it was a public holiday and there was a peaceful (but major) protest in the city. However, Ceri, was able to maneuver us through the city with ease from our hotel to La Boca to San Telmo and finally into the city centre. As he got to know us, he directed us through the different neighborhoods to various things that we may find interesting and suggesting other things we may want to do / try after our tour (e.g. good wines, local parillas, places to explore by ourselves). One unexpected highlight was walking through the protest, which stretched from Casa Rosada to National Congress. As a foreigner, we never would have done this, but it was peaceful (albeit very large) and yet we felt perfectly safe with Ceri. It was truly an amazing experience.Thank you Ceri and Buenos Tours!

Great Overview of Buenos Aires. We had just a couple of days in Buenos Aires and wanted to get an overview of the city. Our guide Jessica provided us with a great walking tour providing insight into the different neighborhoods and seeing the more significant sights. The tour was well paced and we were able to rest at appropriate intervals. We would highly recommend this tour!

Excellent!. We did the Buenos Aires 101 full-day tour and it was excellent. Our guides were engaging and knowledgeable, and the day seemed to fly by. I would highly recommend them to everyone. The guides have so many interesting stories to share that you wouldn't learn about otherwise. Wear comfortable walking shoes, bring a bottle of water and GO! You won't be disappointed.

Awesome walking tour!!!. Had two 1/2 day walking tours with Chance. He was very informative on the barrios, culture, food, and history. A very good guide!! First time visiting BA, it was very enlightening to learn about this long standing city. I very much look forward in returning, and hopefully soon. I highly recommend Buenos Tours as they all treat you as their family. When I was unsure of what I needed, the services were all very personalized and always offered reassurance and guidance. Between Justine and Alan, they were extremely helpful with information via e-mails PRIOR to my trip and I felt well prepared. You'll have a great time! Don't forget good walking shoes and your camera! With Buenos Tours, I feel I made friends for life!!

Walking tour with Jessica. We really appreciated the tour. Jessica's commentary was excellent, and she made sure that we made the most of our short stay in Buenos Aires. It was great to be able to tour with someone who knew the city well and spoke fluent Spanish. We felt safe the entire time, including when on the subway. She showed us all the highlights and gave us recommendations for things to do the next day. It was also great to have a guide who understood our "American" background and outlook. We would recommend Jessica to anyone going to Buenos Aires, and particularly vistitors from the USA..

Great tour!. We arranged a half day tour of the historic city center with Isabel. Coordinating the tour via email was very easy and I was also given lots of great additional information regarding restaurants, entertainment options and other great practical tips. I really appreciated this since it was my very first trip to Argentina. The tour itself was great! Isabel had a great mix of information. She knew lots about the history of Buenos Aires but also tied it together with the present situation. Our tour guide had a prior career as a journalist and that really came through in her ability to make the story of Buenos Aires come alive. I came away from the tour really feeling like I knew the city and I can't wait to visit again. I would highly recommend BuenosTours and Isabel!

Private walking tour of Buenos Aires. I can recommend taking a private full-day (7½ hours) walking trip with Buenostours to really get to know your way around Buenos Aires. Our guide, Ceri, is an ex-Canadian actor who has been living in this great city for a number of years. Although English is our second language, his clear speech was easy to follow, even for a slightly deaf elderly lady. He has a relaxed, friendly way of imparting his knowledge of the city's history, architecture, monuments and customs without being pedantic. Wear comfortable hiking shoes and a hat, because the distance covered is 11-12 km. Don't forget your camera! Ceri took us for coffee in the restaurant the Pope used to visit for his coffee break ( when he was still the Archbishop of Argentine) . We even ate the traditional Brazilian biscuit filled with milk jam - not recommended - too sweet! He could help us change US $ into Pesos at the best rate found during our whole 18- trip. The trip to the grave of Eva Peron/Duarte was another highlight.

Great way to see BA!. We did a walking tour with Ceri at BuenosTours.com. It was a great experience and one that we highly recommend. Make sure to ask your guide to help you exchange US$ into Pesos using a trusted "underground" money exchange, you will get a lot more for your money! Read our complete review on CruiseReportDOTcom

Best way to see the real BA. Met with Ceri for a full day tour of BA. Ceri took us to a local cafe,a local restaurant getting ready for a busy lunch,a local supermarket and much more to let us see how the people of BA go about their daily lives. He is so knowledgeable and passionate about BA it is infectious. Ceri told us about the history of Argentina and the background that makes BA such a vibrant city.A certain "must do" tour when you go to BA.

Great time with Oliver. We and another couple were in Buenos Aires for a two days prior to taking a cruise and had set up two tours with Oliver, an American who has lived in BA for the last seven years. The first tour was on a Saturday afternoon and took us from the marriott to the famous cemetery, and the second was Sunday morning and took us down to the Rose house area. Oliver was extremely knowledgable and had many side stories about the places we visited. We all had a great time and learned a lot. Buenos Aires is a fantastic city with incredible history, and Oliver was fantastic in telling its story.

The best way to see Buenos Aires. This was my second visit to BA and was a transit stop between trips south and then north. I had limited time available but was really keen to do something and the La Boca area was one area I wanted to explore further.Looking at the options available, there weren't many that would allow me to do what I wanted at times that would work with my flights. I landed on BTours and am so glad I found them.Jess was just Fantastic and accommodated the 'standard' La Boca and San Telmo walking tour to fit in with the time I had. As it turned out, we managed to fit it all in including a coffee at a truly wonderful cafe that itself had so much history. An American expat, San Telmo was Jess's local neighbourhood and as such she was able to give those extra insights that only a local can give.I would thoroughly recommend Buenos Tours and will definitely look them up again when next visiting what is becoming one of my favourite cities.

Up Close in Buenos Aires. This is the first review I've ever submitted, but I want to share an outstanding "walking" all-day, personalized tour of the city's neighborhoods and key sites. Oliver, an American emigre to BA seven or so years ago, had a passion for showing us the real BA. He was interesting, had a sense of humor, was extremely well informed about all matters Argentine, organized, understood that safety was important to us, and committed to our having an excellent experience. Don't be put off by "all-day walking," as we are in our late 60s, in just reasonably good health, and had no problem with the distances or pace. There are opportunities for breaks in addition to lunch in an interesting BA restaurant. We were a party of two, so we could take a break by sitting on a park bench listening to Oliver for a few minutes here and there. We rode the subway, guided by Oliver, crossed busy streets on foot, took taxis to and from our hotel - in short, had an adventure, secure in Oliver's presence. And the price was surprisingly reasonable.The company is excellent at communications, arranged admission to a late night tango show for us, which was also exceptional.Believe me, we've taken many bus tours during our extensive travels in retirement with mostly positive results. This private tour up close in BA, on foot and using public transportation, with Oliver, however, was in a class by itself and uniquely unforgettable.

An excellent introduction to BA!. After researching several options for walking tours for a recent trip to BA, I selected BuenosTours. I definitely made the right choice.My positive experience began as soon as I submitted my request through the BuenosTours website for a “BA 101″ Full Day Tour. Throughout the entire booking process, the customer service was excellent. I received follow-ups, confirmations and travel tips from Quincy, Alan, Justine and Oliver. This high level of customer service made me feel very good after booking my tour on-line … from the other side of the world.On the day of the tour, Oliver, my tour guide, met me at my hotel at the agree-upon time. He was a wonderful tour guide. He is very knowledgeable about BA and has a great personality. He made me feel at ease in a strange city and he truly brought BA to life with his stories. Unlike other tours, where you can feel like you’re on a walking lecture, with Oliver I felt like I was exploring a beautiful city with a very knowledgeable friend.I usually don’t write reviews, but as I hope you can tell, I highly recommend BuenosTours!

Walking tour of BA a great way to see city. We had a wonderful time with Oliver, our tour guide from Buenostours. He was very prompt at meeting us at our hotel, and was even able to take us around the city on our all-day private walking tour in the morning rain without having our day be spoiled by the weather. Oliver was very knowledgeable about everything he showed us. We went to different areas of the city, and learned all about the history, culture, and people famous in the area, and how they contributed to Argentina. He brought the city to life with his stories and entertainment. We had planned to spend two days with Oliver, but it was pouring rain the next day, so we opted to cancel. Buenostours was very timely in returning our money because of the rain. Highly recommend Buenostours!

We learned a lot.. Jessica was our guide for this private walking tour. The reason to visit Recoleta is the cemetery and Evita's grave. But, it is not quite so straightforward. Jessica not only explained the cemetery and its history and rules, but she took us to Evita's grave and explained why it is where it is and marked as it is. All very interesting and well worth the effort.

We felt like family!. I discovered Buenos Aires Private Walking Tours on TripAdvisor. We worked with Alan to plan the full-day walking tour. He was very easy to work with and he offered many valuable suggestions for us to enjoy our visit. His written instructions for us to meet were detailed and perfect.We met Jessica on a rainy morning in Buenos Aires. The bad weather did not spoil our plans. She is an expat from New Jersey who has lived in Buenos Aires for years. We met in the San Telmo are of the city. Not only was Jessica an excellent tour guide but also very gregarious. It did not take long for us to feel like family on a visit to a long lost relative! :-)My phone serves as a pedometer so I know we walked 6.3 miles with Jessica. I never would have guessed. We talked and talked. She really knows the city and answered all of our questions whether about history, politics, religion..whatever. I was fascinated by her explanation of the tango dance. It made so much sense . It was fun to see her act out the dance as it was intended. I could imagine the young couple on the street dancing as she described it. What fun!We saw a lot but another highlight for me was to enjoy meeting some of her friends along the way. She is certainly well-known and well-liked. One stop was for tapas and a drink. The owner learned it was my birthday and sent over a birthday treat and congratulated me in broken English. Thank goodness for Jessica...she translated everything.We saw so much and enjoyed her company so much. The sun came out and it turned to be a most memorable day! Thank you, Jessica!

Like visiting with a friend.. This private tour is exactly what we were looking for. We were able to create the sort of tour we wanted by giving information on our interests and what we were looking to learn about and see. Touring the city this way is like traveling a foreign place with a friend. We learned so much and were moved by many of the stories. I highly recommend Beunos Tours.

Wonderful walking tour of Buenos Aires. Isabel was my very capable guide for Buenostours full day walking tour of the city. We travelled by foot, taxi, and subway and visited cultural, historical, and architectural highlights. We stopped for coffee at a tango café, had an empanada lunch at a locals café, and a gelato at an Italian ice cream shop. Because she knew so much about Argentine history and inside stories of the beautiful parks and mansions we viewed, Isabel was able to make our visits to the sites especially interesting. The last stop at the Recoleta Cemetery was made more understandable since she could relate tales of the people who were placed there. I am now inspired to learn more on my own. Bravo Isabel and Buenostours! I would recommend this excursion to anyone!

Retiro/Recoleta walking tour. My wife and I went on a walking tour of Retiro/Recoleta this past week with Jessica. She was extremely knowledgeable about all things BA and Argentina. She seemed "un-stumpable", not that that was our aim. We enjoyed her perspective on the city and the historical/cultural aspects on display in the barrios we visited. She took her time to answer all of our questions and made navigating the labyrinthine Recoleta cemetery a breeze. Professional stuff all the way around, highly recommended!

A Full Day of Fun. Since our time in BA was limited we opted for a full day walking tour. Our number one desire,as amateur photographers, was to capture the grace and excitement of Tango. We explained this to our excellent guide Chance and he adjusted the day to include numerous opportunities for getting excellent images. Of course the tour also included all the sights and beautiful architecture of this famous city. Chance provided well informed commentary, which was not only educational but entertaining as well.Kudos to this well run tour company with an excellent staff !

The Best way tour get a flavor of Buenos Aires. Had a walking tour with Jessica around the Recoleta and Retiro districts on on January 29 of this year (2014). She met us at our hotel and before we started, she gave us an overview of her planned walk to make sure we understand where and what we would see. We had had a private car tour of the city the prior day but wanted to get a better flavor of some of the city. Jessica was tremendous in providing a historical and cultural perspective and also just explaining the differences between our customs (we are from the U.S.), and those in Buenos Aires ranging from ordering ice cream at Freddo's and Volta (WONDERFUL), to understanding the cubierto on our restaurant bills, enjoying time at a cafe and what we may want to see and do on our own. She provided great guidance on getting around and what to watch out for. As with any large city you need to be aware of your surroundings. Had we more open time on our trip we would have taken another walking tour from her or her other team members. The experience far exceeded any of our expectations. Jessica obviously enjoys helping others appreciate a city she loves.

Outstanding tour. We had booked two 1/2 day tours but due to plane problems we lost a day in buenos aires. We notified buenos tours and they immediately offered modifying our day 2 tour to start a little earlier and last longer if we wanted...and they would refund any time we didn't use...it was up to us. Alan met us at our hotel and we quickly created a custom tour. It was terrific. Alan really loves buenos aires, but he views it objectively, being a Brit. We covered all kinds of topics while walking and he gave us interesting information....not just the typical guide facts and figures. I highly recommend Alan and his company if you want a private informative walking tour in buenos aires.

Don't Miss!. Don't miss this great opportunity to get familiar with the city, the culture and the history of this amazing and diverse place. My husband and I did the full day BA 101 tour with Ceri who not only tought us so much about BA but also provided opportunities to participate in the culture by sharing mate (a tea), enjoying a lunch of empanadas and finishing with some local ice cream. Immediately upon meeting he wanted to know about us so he could cater the tour to our interests. Buenos Tours is top notch and will gurantee your satisfaction.

Buenos Tours walking tours of Buenos Aires. Our time with Isabel couldn't have been better spent. She gave us a great sense of the history and culture of BA. Filled our heads with information and a sense of the city. Answered our questions with patience. Obviously loves the city and glad to share her feelings about it. All our communication with buenos tours was splendid--prompt, thorough. We walked a full day with Isabel and she never tired. We can't say enough about what a fabulous day we had with her. Thanks buenos tours.

Great luck with Buenostours. We just returned from a very enjoyable trip to Argentina. We booked 3 tours through Buenostours online and they added lots to our experience. We started with a private half-day walking tour of La Boca and San Telmo areas. Our guide was very knowledgable, friendly and fun. That night we had our tango tour to Piazzolla Tango. We had a great time at the pre-dance lesson, a very good dinner with wine, and a wonderful show in a great venue. That price was much lower than most. Don't miss this. Then we had a private day trip to an estancia. It turned out to be a highlight of our trip. Also, the ease of booking online and the service were excellent. I highly recommend using this small tour company for your tours.

Cultural and architectural walking tour.. Our tour started in San Telmo where we met up with our guide Oliver. Who was excellent and looked after the 4 of us like a mother hen. Hid historical and architectural knowledge was great, which was interspersed with lots of amusing anecdotes. He took us the the present popes favour it cafe for our morning coffee. We took our lunch break at The Tortoni Restaurant, one of the oldest in B.A. After lunch we took a ride on the metro, another good experience and our afternoon brea.k at the ice cream parlour in Recoleta, to cool down. We finished our day with a tour of the Recoleta cemetery' where we saw Eva perons final resting place. Throughout the tour Oliver travelled at our pace. Finally putting us in a taxi to our accommodation. A great day out, great value for money, highly recommended.

Excellent tour guide - lots of walking but totally worth it!. Booked this private tour for 6 people based on good reviews on Tripadvisor. Communication with Buenostours was very good - booked through their website and received a confirmation along with information about who our tour guide would be (including his picture).We were setup with Chance - and I have to say I was a little skeptical at first because he was from the USA and had been in BA for about 6-7 years. However, Chance was an incredible guide and extremely knowledgeable about the city, culture and history of Buenos Aires. He led us through an extremely thorough tour that included so many parts of this wonderful city - including San Martin square, Plaza de Mayo, San Telmo, Recoleta and more! This tour gave us so much information about all the wonderful buildings, structures, landmarks and more - and Chance was able to answer so many of our burning questions.We really packed in a lot in one day - it's a lot of walking but completely worth it. It gave us a great orientation of the city. Chance was one of the best tour guides we have ever had - he never rushed us from the stores we stopped at and was always accommodating to what we wanted to see. It seemed like every block we walked through, he had more information to share about what we saw. I cannot say enough good things about Chance. If all of the guides at BuenosTours are like him, then you cannot go wrong booking this walking tour.

Great tour of Buenos Aires. We spent a full day with Isabel, who showed us the highlights of Buenos Aires from an architectural, cultural and historical perspective. She was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the city. We got to experience a classical cafe and enjoyed wonderful food along the way. Isabel was willing to go at our pace and clearly focused the experience on our interests. She was a real pleasure to interact with!

Great way to see Buenos Aires. We used BuenosTours for 1 full day and 1 half day tour. Oliver showed us around San Telmo and La Boca on the first day, he was very accommodating as my wife and sons sidetracked him into the Sunday Flea Market to look for coins, maps, and antique military medals. . Alan then took us around El Centro and to my wife's delight ( she is a big Carlos Gardel fan and unfortunately the Tango show we had gone to the night before did not feature Gardel's music) he took us around the neighborhood where Gardel lived and played. This wasn't planned but Alan went out of his way to make up for my wife's previous disappointment.They both made sure that we hit the top cafe's in BA as part of the tour.The next day Oliver led us around Recoleta and the cemetery, what a wonderful experience, at the end Oliver dropped us off at a great Empanda restaurant.My family and I are very interested in history and geopolitics and Oliver and Alan did not disappoint us with their knowledge and enthusiasm.I would recommend BuenosTours to any visitor to BA especially if they only have a short time.Book Online in advance as they can get busy at times.

Architecture Walking Tour. Ceri was a terrific guide in taking us on a 4 hr walking tour of the city. His knowledge is very extensive and because it is a private tour, the pace can be tailored to suit your preference and the details are as much or as little as you are interested in. Initially thought it might be a little pricey, but after the tour we felt it was well worth it. We booked our tour for early morning so it wouldn't be too hot (it rained so heat was not an issue) but might suggest looking at specific days and times more carefully as some places we wanted to explore were not open. Ceri suggested some great restaurants, wines and other places to visit had he was really a joy to get to know.

Very accommodating. Both tour guides were very informative and eager to answer any and all questions we had. They stopped at locations that we passed on the way to enable us to shop which was great. Went out of the way to give us a great overview of BUE. A truly fantastic way to familiarize yourself with BUE as we stopped at several cafés and got a quick taste if local life...

Great overview of BA. We had a great tour with Jessica and Richard! They both were very knowledgeable about the city and great guides. It was very hot when we were there and they both did a terrific job of going at a slow pace and finding shade whenever possible. Our tour was a great overview of the city. We booked the tour from the US before we left and all communication was quick and easy. A definite must for a first trip to BA!

To Really Appreciate BA. My wife and I had taken a bus tour on our first BA visit, but decided on a private walking tour for our second visit. Isabel made us appreciate how much the bus tour was lacking. We learned so much about the history, culture and architecture in our day tour. Isabel was not only extremely pleasant and gracious, but also flexible in her sensitivity to our interests. She met us at our hotel and managed the transportation and pace so that we were not overly taxed. The coffee and lunch stops were perfect. I can still taste the empanadas. Would recommend Buenos Tours to everyone. Doug R

Walking in Buenos Aires. Oliver, our guide, met us promptly and directions for us to find him precise ...appreciated having his contact information just in case. Tour wasperfectly paced and very informative and enjoyable. Excellent cafe and lunch breaks with local Argentine flavor. Gave us a great introduction to BA.

Brilliant Full-day Tour. As a couple in our early thirties, we enjoy exploring cities on foot. Having read the reviews for this walking tour I have to say the tour exceeded expectations. Oliver gave us a tour that was interesting, well paced, and excellently delivered. He adapted the tour as we went along, making judgement calls based on our feedback and interests. As he's a BA resident originally from the USA (and us British) this offered a perspective we could relate to much more as a consequence - as compared with a tour we had in Rio by a "born and raised" local. I'd also say that private tours can be a little intense at times when spending all day with a guide, but Oliver was great company and had a really easy-going style which suited us well.

Cruise excursion well worth doing. We were given a starting point and disembarked the ship finding a taxi was chaotic but ok. Oliver met us he was friendly and knowledgeable.In a short space of time he gave us a feel for the city and we enjoyed it all. We later went on our own shopping and for lunch. Beats any cruise excursion organised by the ship that I promise you!Thanks Oliver

Private walking tour of Buenos Aries. Four friends in their sixties arranged a private walking tour of Buenos Aries. Our guide, Oliver, arrived bang on time, was friendly, articulate and very knowledgable. Our walking tour was enhanced by beautiful weather but I'm sure we would have enjoyed the experience whatever.Oliver took us to a great lunch time eatery and to Cafe Tortini for afternoon tea where he had the ability to get us to the front of the queue without appearing to try. All in all a great experience.Buenos Tours also recommended the Tango show at Piazzolla Tango which is simply one of the best things to do in the city. Don't mess about with the cheap seats, treat yourself to private transfers, private table in a box, very acceptable menu and food and a headache the next day from over indulgence in the free flowing wines. Both experiences totally brilliant.

Ex-Pat Guide Provides Insight On Buenos Aires. Five of us cruisers made prearangements with Buenos Tours almost a year in advance of our 12 hour sojourn there. They were amenaable to extending their normal day tour so that we could include not only the day tour but the tour to Ricoleta as well. We had an 8 hour tour by foot, bus, subay and taxi. We saw BA through the eyes of an ex-pat American who had an entirely different spin on the culture and acclamation to Argentine life. We saw the architectural, historical and political places of importance as well as the beautiful and perhaps not so beautiful aspects of life in this Argentine city. Oliver had the knack of having us at the right spot at the right time and had us take breaks at local cafes and then lunch at the oldest cafe in BA. We were all impressed by the waiters who memorize orders from 6 tables perfectly. Although the weather was ify, the 8hours passed quickly and we felt we had made a good friend as well as had the experience of a natural tour guide. He was knowlegable, prompt and courteous at all times and fielded our unending questions as the pro he is. I would highly recommend getting away from the expensive , large bus tours and get down and personal with a guide who knows more than the "kodak" moment spots.

Great Guides. We spent 2.5 days touring BA with Alan and Oliver and thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour with these two extremely knowledgeable guides. They were prompt, courteous and provided a comprehensive tour of the city along with information about the history, culture and politics of BA and Argentina. I highly recommend this company to anyone who is interested in getting an in-depth tour of BA.

Great tour around La Bocca. Although I'd been to BA before, I'd never really taken the time to learn about the history of the city, or the country. My friend and I booked a private walking tour with Alan, and it was the best day we spent in our 3 weeks in Argentina. Not only was La Bocca the most interesting and bright part of the city, even on a rainy day, but I felt as though I learnt about the whole history of the city though the eyes of an early immigrant stepping off one of those boats all those decades ago. If you want to learn about the history of Tango, I'd recommend this tour.

Wonderful day tour with experienced and personable guide.. My 20-year old son and I went on a walking tour of Buenos Aires with a very knowledgable and personable guide, Oliver. He was very thoughtful about arranging the tour to highlight the history, culture, architecture and politics of Buenos Aires, adding relevant personal observations of life as an ex-pat when pertinent. He was among the best guides I've had!

Terrific tour of Buenos Aires with knowledgeable tour guide. We booked a tour of San Telmo and La Boca when we visited Buenos Aires over Christmas. Our guide was terrific - very knowledgeable and friendly - and was happy to answer any questions we had about the area and about different aspects of life in Buenos Aires. We felt that we gained a very comprehensive overview of these historic areas; we also learned about the origins of tango, and got to see tango performed in La Boca. Being in the company of someone who was so informative (as well as being a native English speaker, fluent in Spanish) was an excellent way to see these vibrant areas of the city. Our guide was also very happy to recommend restaurants and bars in different parts of Buenos Aires - we took his advice and had some wonderful experiences whilst we were there (I particularly liked Floreria Atlantico cocktail bar, a 'secret bar' hidden in the basement of a florists, which has wonderful food, and well-made cocktails.)

Very informative, money well spent !. We were a group of 4 looking for a private walking tour and were really happy to come across this organisation. Really prompt reply and they couldn't be more helpful. Ceri was our guide who went out of his way to make sure we saw all the right things and gave lots of helpful info. Would definitely recommend this for anyone heading to BA. What a great city !

What A Day!. My husband and I only had 1 day to visit Buenos Aires and were lucky enough to have Oliver, our guide, show us the most important sights in the city (titled the BA '101' tour). Having lived a number of years in Buenos Aires, Oliver was able to give us in depth details on Argentinian history as well as share what current everyday life is like. We took taxis, the metro, and, of course, we walked! Our tour covered San Telmo, Monserrat, Casa Rosada, and Recoleta Cemetery; just to name a few of the places we visited. Furthermore, we enjoyed a lovely (if slightly touristy, by our choice) lunch at the historical Cafe Tortoni. During the course of the tour, my husband's interest in South American wine became known. As our tour ended, Oliver extended his stay with us and helped my husband purchase a few bottles to take home.Furthermore, all of my interactions with the staff at BuenosTours were prompt and comprehensive. They were even able to accommodate our change of tour date without any hassle. All in all, we wouldn't have wanted to see the city any other way.

Fantastic experience with well informed tour guide. We just completed a three days tour of Buenos Aires. We pre booked a walking tour with Buenostours. Cari, a British/Canadian origin greets us at the Plaza Hotel, on time (being on time not to be taked for granted in Argentina). I strongly recommend that you communicate your particular interests prior to arriving.We spend the first afternoon with Ceri and before starting the tour, he was kind enough to get us SIM cards.Be aware for US and EU visitors, that although the formal Excange rate is $1:$P6.8 one can get a much higher exchange rate in the "blue market".The old city is dilapidated and the sign of broken economy are everywhere.Our guide helped us with dinner reservations at La Cabrera steak house where the food was fantastic. Even with reservations you will wait over an hour, as time punctuation doesn't mean much here ( did I said that before?)Make sure to visit the cemetery as it is unique and gives one a glimpse of the society in buenos aires.We are stuck all day today at the local airport, trying to catch a flight to Iguazu Falls. No announcement nor customer service. one can not relay on internal flights as this is a third world economy and it feels very chaotic. When a flight finally boards, one could hear people cheering.Back to BuenosTours - highly recommended. Wonderful and reliable guide.

Fantastic insight to BA from native English speakers. On a Christmas trip to Buenos Aires, my partner and I had a fantastic private tour which included San Telmo, La Boca and Recoleta cemetery. Our guide was very knowledgeable about the local area both in terms of the history/anecdotes of the city, and the best places to stop off for food and drink along the way. It was lovely to have someone to take photos of us together too!We travelled through a mixture of public transport, walking and taxis between the locations on the tour - all of these options are very cheap in BA but it is nice to have the option to experience it all at your own pace, in your own way, rather than being rushed through as part of a big group.

Worth every penny and more.. I took the half day Historical City Centre tour today with my brother. It was most enjoyable and worth every penny. We tried to pay more but beyond a small tip our guide Ceri would not accept it. He was punctual, knowledgeable and a pleasure to be with. He was able to give practical advise about everything from safety to additional city highlights and hotspots. He clearly does this because he enjoys it. I would recommend this tour company unreservedly.

underwhelmed for the price. The tour guide was very nice (american living in argentina for the past 7 years) but was late. Note that any transportation will be paid by you (you'll need a taxi and probably bus to go to La Boca and then San Telmo.) I was hoping for much more history and fun facts about the barrio's overall and development over time. Instead it's much more focused mostly on recent history and only for a few spots along the way. Overall, the tour isn't bad or lacking knowledge, but it's definitely not worth for that kind of price. If you buy a local guide and walk around, you'll get close to the same amount of info.

Excellent! Very Professional!. We were lucky to meet two guides., Jessica and Chance. They both were outstanding. They were entertaining and interesting. Seven hours went by in a blink of an eye. I would highly recommend either one to anyone who would like to have a city tour.

A Great Way to Visit BA!. Our family of four thoroughly enjoyed the BA 101 full day tour with Oliver. This is a great way to immerse yourself into some of the varied local neighbourhoods and see things off the beaten track. Taking this tour with the engaging and knowledgeable Oliver is like having an old family friend or relative take you around. He also went out of his way to tailor and pace the tour to make it interesting for our two young daughters, aged 11 and 8. If you have only one day in BA we strongly recommend one of Buenostours walking tours. If you have more than one day you may want to supplement with a bus or car tour which will cover more ground and give you a different perspective.This company is first class all the way from the very first query I made to the nice farewell from Oliver at the end of the tour. Recommend without hesitation.

THE tour service to use in Buenos Aries!. As you can see from the other reviews, this company really is excellent and deserves the recognition. I met Alan for a half day tour and Richard for a full day tour. They met up with me at my hotel and it felt as though I was meeting long lost friends. The information was excellent and felt internalized by the guides. It wasn't just a script. I really appreciated the flexibility in what we saw based on who I am and what I like to see in a city. It was also helpful when I returned to the city in January for a few hours, I knew where to go.There were so many amazing moments throughout the tours. I just can't express how special my visit was.

Absolutely excellent service. Given the hype of potential pick pocketing etc, we decided to go with a personal tour to see the city and I must say it was a great decision, not from a safety aspect (we saw no issues) but from the quality and knowledge we obtained. Firstly was the prompt responses and helpful advice on what would be a suitable itinerary given our interests. Isabel was fantastic and we hadn't even committed to using them. We then had a flight issue which meant we were re-routed to Rio and we went through various potential changes to our planned itinerary and timings as consequence of this - again all dealt with quickly and efficiently - which meant we felt in control and would not lose out on seeing the best bits of the city. Our guide was Jessica and she was knowledgeable and had a nice relaxed way. I have no hesitation in recommending them

Excellent Way to Experience Buenos Aires. Booking was easy and very reassuring. I received prompt emails confirming details - name, profile, telephone number and email address of the guide (and a photo). I particularly liked being asked what my interests were, and to say a little about myself. On the day itself, my guide, Oliver, arrived on time at my hotel. He was a very pleasant young man, who obviously loved the city, and loved passing on his knowledge. He was eager to please, and I was very happy with the walk. Because I was a single traveller, this was expensive, but I would not have experienced BA on my own. I recommend this tour firm wholeheartedly.

La Boca and San Telmo Tour. We were a group of 10 and divided into two groups to do the La Boca and San Telmo Tour with Alan and Oliver. It was a Sunday so the antique market (Feria de San Telmo) at Plaza Dorrego was in full swing and people were tango dancing at some of the street corners. Both of our guides were very knowledgeable, personable and articulate. The knew a lot about the history and culture of the area and had some great stories to share. We loved the story of how the Boca Juniors chose their team colours. They were even able to clear up the mystery of the "blue" currency exchange! We stopped part-way through the tour for coffee and a break at a very atmospheric café. At the end, they took us to a maté shop where we were able to sample this iconic beverage. A wonderful experience all around!I was very impressed that they asked about us and our particular interests in advance of the tour and told us something about our guides. When one of our original guides had to be away unexpectedly, we were informed of the change and provided with a profile of our new guide.

Perfect Introduction to a Wonderful City. Our first trip to Buenos Aires was fantastic, and the Buenos Tour was the perfect introduction. Jessica, our tour guide, met us at our apartment rental and we headed off for a full-tilt tour of the city's big attractions and hidden gems. From the narrow streets of San Telmo, to the old-world luxury of Recoleta and its legendary cemetery, we didn't miss a trick. Jessica gave us brief but informative histories behind the beautiful architecture, the Casa Rosada, the ornate cathedrals, the nostalgic Cafe Tortoni; you name it, we saw it. We even had a very useful primer on riding and using the Subte (subway system) and escorted us until we found an ATM. All in all, a great tour, and a great tour guide.

A great walk around Buenos Aires. We booked a walking tour with BuenosTours in order to get a good orientation of the city. We split a full day tour into two half days. Our first day was San Telmo and the City Center with Ceri. Ceri was a terrific guide, he was knowledgeable, very personable and we enjoyed his sense of humor. He was very sensitive to our interests and gave us advice on what else to go see (some of our stops were closed because it was a Sunday, for example Manzana Las Luces). The second day we toured Retiro, Recoleta and the Cemetery with Alan, also a terrific guide who entertained us with his knowledge of local lore and gave us several tips on places to visit. I was especially impressed with the "personal touch" Alan (who learned from Ceri our interest in craft beers) gave by recommending a local "closed door restaurant" with craft beer dinners. Unfortunately our schedule did not allow this special experience but we truly appreciated the personalized recommendation. Both Alan and Ceri were extremely helpful with other recommendations and I suspect it is a core of the business practice at BuenosTours. I highly recommend BuenosTours for a private guided walking tour of BA (but bring good walking shoes!) I felt we left BA having made new friends.

Excellent walking tour - a great way to see the city!. If you are visiting Buenos Aires, I highly recommend booking a walking tour with BuenosTours. Retiro and Recoleta are such an interesting part of the city and our guide, Oliver really made the history come alive. Oliver has a very engaging personality and his knowledge of the city is impressive. If I am ever back in the city, I would not hesitate to book another tour with BuenosTours.

Great introduction to Buenos Aires. Our day was split between 2 guides, Richard and Alan. Both were very knowledgeable about the city, its people, its history and all the things a tourist might want to be sure to see. They introduced us to their favorite cafes and restaurants, which we went back later on our own to enjoy. Both guides were great human beings whom we enjoyed getting to know. In our 3 days there, we only touched a tiny portion of the city and can't wait to come back again.

Dynamite introduction to Buenos Aires. Sometimes you know you have made a great decision based in large measure on reviews here at TripAdvisor. That was the case with our one day walking tour from BuenosTours. Our guide was Oliver; he has a great personality, depth of knowledge and a kind demeanor, making us feel that we were receiving a personal guided tour, not some canned thing. This company has an incredible website with a huge amount of terrific information for first time BA tourists. Besides booking the full day walking tour to get us started we also booked several other attractions; all their staff are terrific. A great company you want to do business with. Absolutely every aspect of the walking tour was terrific, including the two stops for food and drink. For those of us with no Spanish skills having an English speaking guide is very much appreciated.

Number one tour in BA. What a tour! After a day in BA on our own, trying unsuccessfully to find our way around with our guide book, we booked a tour with Buenos Tours. From the moment Alan met us with a delicious breakfast of local pastries we knew it was going to be a good day. We learnt so much about the history of this amazing country and visited sites that we wouldn't have found on our own. We stopped for lunch at a cafe where we had the tastiest empanadas of our holiday and afternoon tea at the famous Cafe Tortini. The tour was definitely the highlight of our stay in BA and Alan such an accommodating guide,taking into consideration all our preferences. Would highly recommend it.

Great Tour. We scheduled a full day walking tour with Buenos Tours and we were not disappointed despite the bad weather. We had very bad weather on the day of the tour. It was cold and rainy,but our guide, Oliver, led us through the city and managed to find awnings and doorways where he could tell us about the various buildings we were seeing. As the morning went on the rain and the wind picked up and we just could not comfortably continue with the second half of the tour. Buenos Tours quickly offered to do the second half of the tour on another day. We continued with our tour on another day with a second guide, Chance, who was also an excellent guide. He shared wonderful stories about the sights we were seeing and also about his experiences of being an expat in Buenos Aires. Both guides were very thoughtful during the tour. If your are looking to familiarize yourself with Buenos Aires, I recommend this company. They are on time and responsive and they will work to ensure that you have a good experience.

Personalized tours. Our family or four booked a full day tour, but spread it over 2 days. One of our party has trouble walking long distances, so we knew a private tour was perfect for us. Our guide met us at our hotel. He arrived 15 minutes early and called our room to let us know he had arrived. Our guide was very knowledgeable about the area and he was a native English speaker. We stopped for a short break at cafes both days. No pressure to buy expensive food or drinks at either stop. Our family was extremely pleased with our tour. I would enthusiastically recommend this private tour!

Buenos Tours-Great way to see B.A.. Made an initial inquiry with Buenos Tours and got an instant reply with lots of information and recommendations. Booked a private tour for my wife and I. Oliver our U.S.A. born guide, who has lived in B.A. for years arrived at our hotel on time. We discussed our options of where to go and what to do. We asked to see the highlights, learn to use public transport and that we were interested in the history of the city, then left the decisions to him. We had a great day. You could see B.A. by yourself and still have a good time but doing this personalized tour will give you a very quick understanding of B.A. it's history, places to revisit and recommendations that will make your visit that much better. If you are a first time visitor I would highly recommend the tour especially if you have limited time in B.A. Thanks Buenos Tours and thanks to Oliver our guide for the day.

Above and beyond. From our first interaction with the owner, BuenosTours far exceeded our expectations. The scheduling was incredibly easy, the company was very responsive and - when asking for a quick restaurant recommendation - I received a page long email with restaurant details, locations and personal insights.Our tour with Oliver was incredibly informative and you could tell that he has put a lot of thought into the order of information he shares, the path you walk, and the overall stories he tells. We greatly appreciated this level of preparedness and passion for the subjects.Overall, our only regret was that we did a half-day. There is just so much to see and the experience visiting sites is much better when you have a knowledgable guide giving each location incredible passion and significance. At a minimum, do a full day tour...with Oliver if you can!

Simply the best way to see BA with knowledgeable guides.... These guides really know this city! If you are a first timer as we were and only had one day, then the BA 101 tour is the way to see the main attractions and neighbourhoods. Our lovely guide Jessica took our group of seven all over the city and consistently kept us enthralled with her knowledge of the main streets & avenues, the history plus a few unexpected quirky areas.We joined this group via a roll call on a South American cruise and as per the norm we had one-day in port. The cost split between everyone was excellent value compared to one or two people. However you would move a lot quicker or have more break time if doing this walk as a couple - just costs more. Having said that, it was great to share this scenic milieu with like-minded people.We shared the cost of a taxi from the cruise terminal to our meeting point close to San Telmo and again on the way back to the ship. Fares are a little higher coming from the port (of course) but it was a quick way from this industrial shipyard. Our guide was prompt and the meeting location got us into the San Telmo neighbourhood where she regaled us with its history. After seeing Casa Rosada and Plaza we walked to Ave. De Mayo where we had a delightful late morning break at the Café Tortoni. Ignore the pretentious waiter and enjoy the ambience, the coffee and delicious cakes! Frome here Jessica took us to Plaza San Martin on the Subte (underground), which is just a couple of stops. Located in the Retiro neighbourhood this leafy and up market area is simply beautiful. Everywhere in downtown BA there is superb architecture on a par with or even more stunning then Paris.We had a late lunch of tasty empanadas, wine & beer at a local restaurant (or anything else you wanted on the menu). Food and drinks are extra but worth getting into the Argentine culture. Our last stop was La Recoleta cemetery where of course we saw Eva Peron’s vault (Family Duarte). In the time we had there we also saw famous and fantastically designed tombs - on the other hand some crumbling vaults had exposed coffins which was a bit sad.Do yourselves a favour, if you are able to manage a walking tour try any of the tours on their website. They simply couldn’t have given us a better day out in Buenos Aires for the money - more importantly though, they gave us their expertise!We enjoyed every moment and you will too!
Walking tour. Had a great,informative, low key tour with Oliver. Strongly recommend this as a nice way to get an inside feel for Buenos Aires.

The Time Flew By. I booked the full day tour before we arrived in BA for an eight day stay. Buenos Tours was always quick to respond with a detailed email when I booked our tour and paid online. I purposely didn't fill out any info about our family of three ahead of the tour and we had an excellent informed tour. We were paired with Jessica, who arrived promptly at our hotel, and before we knew it the time flew by and we had walked from San Telmo to Eva Peron's grave in Recoleta. The tour was a great over view of the city and Jessica met our expectations and more when it came to explaining the historical and political background and cultural habits of Argentinians. I highly recommend using Buenos Tours and asking for Jessica.

Great private tours of buenos aires!. We had two fantastic full day tours in early August. One with Oliver, one with Jessie. Both great, both different.We walked quite a bit (which was good!); the only way to see a city.We were with our three kids, 20, 18 and 16. We obviously each liked best different parts of the town but everybody left very happy! Both our guides were a big help and talked about different parts of the Argentinian culture. It was our first stop in a 3 weeks 1/2 trip to Argentina, and lots of what we discussed with them was also useful after!

So glad we did all 3 private walking tours!. My husband and I enjoyed three private tours with Buenos Tours during our stay in Buenos Aires – the ‘Retiro, Recoleta & Cemetery’ tour with Oliver, the ‘La Boca & San Telmo’ tour with Jessica and the ‘Historical City Centre Tour’ with Chance. In terms of content, the ‘Retiro, Recoleta & the Cemetery’ tour was our favorite. Buenos Tours have you complete a series of questions when you book (about your interests etc.) and each guide actually took the time to pre-read this and had suggestions ready to modify our tour to our interests. This was really impressive! What was also great was being sent a picture and little biography on each guide before the tour so you knew a little about your guide also! We defiantly saw more of Buenos Aires doing these tours than we would have discovered on our own. I was pregnant and also love stopping to take photos and the pace of the tours was spot-on. We also asked Chance to help us exchange some money on the ‘blue market’ and he was more than accommodating. If fact, he was so ‘into’ the tour we run over time by over an hour. Time flew by on each of the tours, an indication of how much fun we were having. We also booked tickets for Piazzolla Tango through Buenos Tours and saved 10%. Do yourself a favor and book private tours with Buenos Tours rather than group / bus tours!

Great tour for Buenos Aires first timers. We flew into Buenos Aires on a Sunday and wanted to see the San Telmo street market. Jessica gave us an excellent half-day tour of La Boca and San Telmo. She was very informative about the history and area, and we most appreciated her suggestions for other sightseeing, shopping, restaurants, etc. During the next week we tried almost every one of her suggestions - they were spot on!

I am so glad I did this tour!!. Even though I have lived for 17 years in Santiago, Chile, this was my first trip to Buenos Aires. Considering we only had two days to go sight seeing, I really wanted to make the most of our time.I found BuenosTours on Trip Advisor and booked a half-day tour of Retiro, Recoleta and the Recoleta Cemetery. (Looking back, I wish I had booked a full-day tour!)Even before I left Santiago, Alan had sent me a personalised two-paged e-mail recommending how we should spend our time in Buenos Aires after the tour finished. His recommendations were based on a short questionnaire I had filled out during the booking process.Oliver, our guide, punctually met us at our hotel and took us by taxi to our destination. Oliver is a U.S. expat who has acclimated extremely well to the Argentine culture. He easily foresees needs, questions and doubts tourists may have and yet, I felt we were being shown around by a "Porteño" (someone born and raised in Buenos Aires). Oliver patiently answered a lot of my questions that didn't have anything to do with the tour itself, such as, how to use the subway, exchange money, and plan the next day's itinerary. Needless to say, the tour itself was amazing. My first trip to Buenos Aires was a huge success thanks to Alan and Oliver and I plan on doing a different tour with them on my next visit. Thanks guys!

First Rate Worth the Money. Extremely informative and interesting. Chance was a Great Guide. Waled by locations for days and never new the story about things near by our apartment. Extremely knowledgeable and great fun.

A must-do introduction to beautiful Buenos Aires for first-timers. We had a bit of a tricky time getting to Buenos Aires (airlines issues/lost luggage), but once we hit the pavement with our guide, Oliver, things began looking up. For anyone who has lost luggage, you know it's a drain, particularly after a full day in transit. We almost canceled our tour, and we are so glad we didn't. Oliver, a US expat, saw that we had little more than lightweight clothes while our heavier clothing meandered from the States to BA. Oliver made some adjustments, detouring straight away to Av. Santa Fe where we swiftly found some jackets for my two daughters (preteens -- not an easy task!). Within about 30 minutes we were officially on tour, garnering an extra site, El Ateno, for good measure.Oliver is enthusiastic and obviously loves his adoptive country. He enjoys history, local folklore and offers up a few curious urban legends during the full tour through San Telmo, Micro Central, Recoleta, to name just a few districts. He illustrated the major historical, religious, cultural (arts, tango, etc.) and political sites. He engaged not just the adults but made particular effort to engage our daughters as well, who took pride in challenging his knowledge of the symbols on the mausoleums in the Recoleta Cemetery. (Smile, Oliver!) The greatest benefit for us was that he provided an excellent foundation to create our own more detailed explorations geared to our personal interests the remainder of our stay. For these reasons and many more, I definitely recommend the full-day walking tour with Buenos Tours. The walk itself was not particularly difficult nor strenuous. The day was broken up by a snack/breakfast and lunch at some of the city's popular cafes.Buenos Aires was an incredible city with so much to offer. Not only would we return to the city, but we'd definitely give our new friends at Buenos Tours a ring to see what new offerings they might have at that time.

Terrific walking tour of San Telmo!. Our tour with Oliver was fabulous! He was friendly and approachable, and obviously very familiar with the area. He presented a great balance of cultural and historical information, and is clearly very knowledgable about the city as a whole, not just the areas we walked through. We never felt rushed or hurried, and Oliver knew the answers to all of my questions, not matter how mundane or seemingly off-topic they might have seemed :) I learned a lot, and really enjoyed seeing the sights through the eyes of someone who has such a firm grasp on the local culture. Oliver was also able to make recommendations about what else to see and do during our visit, which was super helpful. My favorite part of my trip to Buenos Aires!

Informative, Comprehensive and Fun. Our guide Oliver was a delight! He was very open about his personal history with the city and extremely well informed. He could speak at length on any question asked and it never felt like he was speaking from a script. If there was ever something he didn't know he would make a point of researching the answer and let us know later in the tour. I felt like we got a very detailed overview of the city incorporating all the classic porteño sights and some unexpected treats as well. And not only pleasing on the ears - a touch of Robbie Williams phwoar!

All-day Walking Tour of Buenos Aires. What an interesting and historical city, made all the more so by our guide, Jessica. Not only did we 'see the sights', but her personal reflections on the governing party, cost of living, lifestyle and the quirky, and sometimes bizarre outcomes of the decision-makers added to the feel of the city. Highlights were the morning tea stop at the atmospheric 'poets corner restaurant',the necropolis and for an avid junk fossicker like me, San Telmo. Our overriding impression was that we had barely scratched the surface and needed to go back for more, and our 2-day stopover was far too short !

Great Walking Tour in Buenos Aires. I took a customized eight hour walking tour on 13 June with Chance. The tour covered everything I wanted to see, along with some unexpected extras. This tour gave me a good perspective of the city and I then was able to go back to some areas on my own and explore them in greater depth. This tour was a perfect introduction to the city.

Buenos Tours- Buenos Private Walking Tours. My husband and 9 year old son and I enjoyed the sheer pleasure of 'Chance' our guide from 9am -6pm. The day started in La-Boca and then progressed and included walking, bus,and using the metro around some brilliant areas of BA like San Telmo, Reocletta and all the 'must see' areas of BA . Chance's history and local knowledge was empowering, comprehensible and so fluid. Nothing was above us, the whole day was so very interactive, and well orchestrated. The stops for morning tea and lunch were wonderful choices and not only the knowledge but the confidence Chance gave us on the streets in BA set our weeks holiday up to be so enjoyable. We truly experienced close to most of BA. This is a must do tour- a must do if you only have 2 days, just as much as a must do if you have a week- this tour really leaves you loving so much about the city and close lying areas.

An efficient and personalized way to learn about Buenos Aires. I've had great experiences with walking tour guides in small groups, and this one ranks high. Our guide was personable and helpful in giving us an overview of the city while being sure to show us attractions that specifically met our interests. She made time to help us overcome a travel challenge -- given that the overnight bus coaches were on strike, we had to make last minute air travel arrangements.

Amazing personal tours of Buenos Aires. We had a personal tour of the city with Oliver, it was great to have our own guide to get us around and explain the history. This made the trip so much worthwhile and interesting! We would recommend it to anyone. The tour enables you to see the city at your own pace and get the highlights and enjoy the architecture and some food specialties that are different. It was great! Thank also to Isabel who arranged our tour online as well, we made it complicated for her but she came through and accommodated us.

Buenostours Review from a New York couple - absolutely wonderful and memorable. It was a real pleasure having Jessica as our tour guide in Buenos Aires. We went with her two separate times during our visit. She is personable, friendly, knowledgeable, punctual and plans the tours extremely well. We saw what we expected to see and she was also flexible enough to allow us extra time in one place or another if we saw something we wanted to see along the way. She also plans the tour so that mid way we would make a stop at a cafe to rest, get a snack, talk about the city and have our questions answered. Jessica was also very helpful in recommending shops and restaurants for us to explore on our own. Besides her skills as a tour guide, the fact that she was originally from the United States and we shared a common background made it easy for us to relate to her which in turn made it easier for her to compare our culture and experiences with those in Argentina. It was like having a friend with us instead of a tour guide. The time we spent with Jessica went very quickly, was most enjoyable and we would most heartily recommend her to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires.

Family Walk in Buenos Aires. We took the tour in March 2013 and we had the good fortune of having Chance as our guide. While we visited a number of historic sites, what set this tour apart from any other tour is that Chance had us experieince getting around in BA which included riding the subway in rush hour! With an 8 and a 7 year old in tow he was also able to keep them engaged with his wit and humour. Not a small feat by any stretch. The day concluded with an insightful conversation on BA politics, religion and what it is like living in BA. We'll be back!Thanks Buenos Tours and thank you very much, Chance!

The best way to see Buenos Aires. Took this tour in 2010 and had a wonderful day. It gave me such a comprehensive tour of the city that I was able to confidently navigate my way around the remainder of my trip. The cemetary was fascinating.

A tour that prepared us for a whole week in Buenos Aires. Over the course of two days, Jessica and Alan gave us a fantastic tour of the city. What I was most grateful for was that they didn't just show us around the city, but they prepared us to enjoy the city on our own after the tour ended. They oriented us to the subway, they recommended they favorite out-of-the-way spots, and they explained the Buenos Aires dialect. By the time we parted ways, I felt much more like a local than I expected, which meant we could enjoy the rest of our week with that much more confidence and excitement. It's also worth noting that our flight was half a day late, yet Jessica changed her schedule to accommodate us. The folks at Buenos Tours we totally understanding and figured out a new plan on short notice. This is a great group of people.

Excellent tours. We visited BA for the first time as a starting and ending point of a Celebrity Cruise to Antartica.Looking at the reviews, and exchanging emails prior to arrival, we were very impressed before we arrived. To have a photograph of the guide, and make contact beforehand was definitely reassuring.We took a half day tour with Chance the day we arrived, after a 13 hour flight from London - he was amazing, we must have asked him so many questions and he tailored he walk, as he learned more about us.
