Best Tour Guide... Ever!. My girlfriend and I spent the first day of our three day visit to Buenos Aires with Liz. She is a fantastic guide! She started off by meeting us in the lobby of our hotel and giving us a brief description of the history of the city and the sites we were planning on visiting that day. Starting off with this overall brief really helped to put things into perspective when we were touring. Besides having a wealth of knowledge about BA's history, Liz is also well informed both economically and politically. It was really great to be able to converse with someone who understands the factors that play into these facets of the city. She isn't your typical tour guide regurgitating from a memorized script, she is an insightful and intelligent guide who is clearly passionate about her city and wants to share all of its brilliance as well as some of its darker sides with you. Admittedly, I'm not someone who typically enjoys tours because I'd rather read the script someone is going to feed me rather than pay to be read to. This was nothing like that and I'm very glad that my girlfriend booked Liz because I learned so much more than I would have ever thought. Not only did I learn a lot but I had a lot of fun! Liz is very sociable and incredibly charismatic that you can't help but adore her. She explains things in such a manner that what could be a boring history lesson from one person is a fascinating and interesting story from Liz. It was like spending the day with a friend showing us around the city. Although we were only spending one day with her, Liz also gave us suggestions on what else to do during the rest of our stay based on our interests. I would not hesitate to recommend Liz to any of my friends visiting BA and the next time we visit the city, I would absolutely hire Liz again for one of her other tours. Thanks Liz!

Best Day Spent in Buenos Aires. We spent our first day touring Buenos Aires with Liz. Terrific Tour Guide. My wife and I spent 3 days touring Buenos Aires with Liz and it was a great experience. Liz is great!. My family spent 2 days with Liz in Buenos Aires during the World Cup Final weekend. Liz was the highlight in Buenos Ares!. I love Liz passion. She gave us an awesome history lesson about Argentina then showed us places where we interested. She is knowledgable and professional. Liz, you are the best! Thanks for the wonderful time. All the best on Sunday!
Fantastic. We spent 3 days with Liz and had a great experience. We saw and learned more than our friends who were there for a week. I recommend her highly!

Wonderful Day with Liz. My wife and I recently traveled to Buenos Aires. Being that this was our first time to the city we decided to have a guided tour. Don't hesitate to call Liz for BA Tours!. On our second trip to Buenos Aires we brought six friends. Liz rocks!. Liz was a wonderful guide and companion while exploring this new (to us) city. She kept us informed, entertained and safe. Can't say enough good things about her and Buenos Aires. We will call her again when we go back!!

Liz Flores local tour guide. Liz scores a 10, again!. Liz knows the town; she knows the history and she knows the politics. She is a fountain of knowledge about Buenos Aires. We did a day tour with her and had an excellent time. Tour with Liz. We (four people) visited Buenos Aires for the first time. We spent with Liz two half-days. Liz told us about the history, culture, and traditions of this beautiful city. Lot of info and a nice woman to share the city with.. Liz will tell you a good resume about her country and details about the city from a local point of view. Great job Liz!. Liz is a local lady originally from Buenos Aires. She feels proud of it and will tell you all her knowledge that make the tour more interesting instead of visiting by yourself. She is professional with a good command of english.

She knows the culture and the history and puts it all in perspective.. Four of us spent a day with Liz. She met us at our hotel in Recoleta and we spent about an hour learning about the history and politics of Argentina from the Spanish conquest forward. She is facile in explaining the complex and tempestuous history of the culture and politics of this nation which are difficult to sort out for the visitor--even those interested in geopolitics. She was senstive to what we wanted to see and was very careful not to divulge her own politcal leanings until she understood our perspectives. Her family has been in Argentine for at least three generations, so she has experienced first hand or through her parents or grandparents' memories much of the last 75 years of tumult in this country. They came as hard-working immigrants (like almost all Argentines). She is a good teacher and gave us erudite explanations of all we saw, in an historical/political context, from the Recoleta cemetary, to the metropolitan cathedral, to the protestor in front of the "red house". It was a pleasure to hear her interpretation of ancient events as well as more recent gossip about Papa Francis and President Cristina Fernandez Krishner. An juicy and possibly true stories about the corpse of Eva Peron. We went to lunch in La Boca at a not very good restaurant, and enjoyed this part of the city the least. (Might want to skip this colorful, but touristy part of BA.) Liz is expensive, but we felt she provided good value. We were quoted a price of 100.00 a head and paid that even though we went from two to four clients. She is an Afficianado of the Tango and participates herself frequently, She referred us to Gala Tango with tango lession, dinner and excellent show. We enjoyed it--frist rate muscians and dancers. Know what you want to see and she will be better able to tailor your day's outing. We started at 10AM and finshed at 5PM.SInce in my opinion tourism at its best introduces us not just to sights but also to culture and different ways of perceiving and living the human experience, I think Liz is excellent and I can recommend her easily and gladly. I would use her again if I returned to this interesting, complicated culture of Tango and the Disapeared; of and Francis and Cristina.

Good guide and cute lady. Liz arrived on time at our hotel. She was very professional and really know what is she doing. In a while she understand your interests and become flexible to them. I really went into Argentina history and culture , is amazing. I arrived without knowing anything about it and in one day Liz was in charge to give us all the info so we could manage other days by ourselves. She is a good guide but the most important thing , she is a very nice person.

great 2 days. Got Liz' name from this site and a very good find........two days with her and learned A LOT about Argentina/Buenos Aires.......history, culture, much architecture, etc etc........and MUCH walking !!!!........she tried to teach me a lot about futbol (soccer), Maradonna, Messi, Malvinas as well, but being of English background all that fell on deaf ears !!!!! Great guide in Buenos Aires. We got Liz's name from some family friends who had toured with her before, and they were right to recommend her. We toured with Liz for two days, and she was great! Great Buenos Aires tour guide. Our group of 4 spent 3 days touring Buenos Aires with Liz in early February. Great guide for Buenos Aires. Energetic, personable, knowledgeable. We hired Liz as our guide for 2-1/2 days in Buenos Aires based on Trip Advisor reviews and Liz’s website. We were not disappointed. As other reviewers have said, her knowledge of history, politics, and culture of Argentina is encyclopedic and provided an excellent framework for our short visit. She knows the “ins and outs” for getting around town. There were four people in our group, and Liz was flexible enough to handle some changes in her original plans in order to accommodate us. She also had to make some revisions based on the unusually cold weather (by local standards) that we had during our stay in BA – we can confirm that Liz knows the best places to get hot chocolate! We were lucky because the big agriculture show was underway, and that was especially interesting – of course we would never have known about it on our own. I think that when you leave a place and the guide has made you want to come back, the guide has done a good job. Liz made sure we would all have good memories of Buenos Aires and a desire to return there to see and learn more. The only thing I would suggest is that if there are going to be 4 or more people in your party, think about working with Liz ahead of time to arrange a driver with a car big enough for everyone. We split up into two cabs, which worked pretty well, but it would have been more fun if we’d all been together. I just didn’t think of that while I was making BA arrangements.

We decided we would like a full introduction to the city right at the beginning of our stay so we could get the lay of the land for the rest of our trip. Liz was great. She met us at our hotel in Recoleta and we sat down with her for a good hour first while, in almost perfect English, she gave us a very informative historical overview of Buenos Aires as well as its current political climate. We then spent the rest of the day walking and cabbing around town, stopping for lunch in La Boca and coffee at Cafe Tortoni. Liz seems quite well educated and quite well-informed and is a tango dancer to boot so she can connect you with all types of Tango shows. Her website is: www.lizflor2.blogspot.com and we would highly recommend her.

Good Experience with a Local Guide!. Want to share that I found Liz Tour Guide at Trip Advisor after reading some comments. I wrote to her and we organized the best way to meet and spend time visiting places in Buenos Aires and local life. We did all and I found a new friend. She is very cute and flexible, good guide! Want her to improve her business!

Perfect idea! Get a tailored tour was the best choice for us. We travelled to Buenos Aires for first time without speaking spanish. We love to walk around and don´t get crowded tours with fixed schedules. We love to feel free. So we found Liz at this site and we hire her for 2 days and 2 eve nights. In 2 days we learn a lot about Argentina and its people and of course TANGO ! She prepared a plan for us according to our interests. We stopped for a coffee and lunch. We visited all the Evita History and all the Tango Life. We enjoy Buenos Aires a lot! Tks Liz! You can visit her at www.lizflor2.blogspot.com to see this or other options and her profile. Good choice for us!

Buenos Aires Liz Local Tour was a wonderful experience!!!!. Hi . Wanna tell you that for first time I decided to hire a local guide instead of an agency. I found this very unique as I was like with a friend who knows the city very well and with all the explanations on line besides sharing coffees and activities like locals do. I ´m so happy!!!!!!!!!! Tks Liz!!!! Do it! www.lizflor2.blogspot.com

Authentic Guide!. Liz Flores is a very experienced guide for Buenos Aires.  She was delightful and helpful at all times and we particularly enjoyed our time at the Milonga with her, especially when we were privileged to see her dance.Highly recommendedLisa Abrahmsohn

Great Idea to hire a Local Guide!!!! I felt like a local!!!. It was expensive if you compare with the group tours but It was so nice to have a local who explained all details , made me integrate with the local life (specific in tango world) and prepared a custom made tour adapted to my interests, weather, day, time, etc...Great Idea to recommend!!!!! www.lizflor2.blogspot.com

Argentina Peaceful Getaway. From the moment you arrive at Puesto Viego - you begin to relax! Excellent accommodations and first class service. Highly recommend anybody visiting this beautiful estancia!!!

Exceeds expectations. If you want for your polo day to be a real authentic experience, with top class instruction and great hospitality: look no further! Puesto Viejo has it all.Set on the beautiful countryside near Cañuelas, you will be taken to not just a single polo field facilitation to play, but a beautiful (not to mention huge) renowned polo club. After arriving, some coffee/tea and a tour, the day starts off with practising your swings on a stool. Not long after you will be practising your swings on very well trained horses under the guidance of Julio. After training follows a delicious lunch and a small polo match to bring into practise what you have learned earlier. Having been active in western competitions, I found Julio truly one of the most pleasant and capable trainers I have ever encountered. His great enthusiasm, experience, humour and ability to adapt to any rider makes him a outstanding trainer. Besides seriously wanting to improve, once I had to make sure I didn't laugh my way any further off the saddle because of his hilarious narration of our polo game.During your activities you will see other polo players at work as well, next to stable employees who seem to take wonderful care of the many horses that are present. Having been wanting to try out polo for a long time, my day at Puesto Viejo had long exceeded expectations and definitely made me fall in love with the sport. I will be looking for possibilities to continue back home. Thanks to Puesto Viejo for the wonderful hospitality and the great day! I will come back for sure.Emma

Day at the polo club. The facility is a large polo club where teams play. Several fields and stables, many very well bred and groomed horses. So, it is a not a polo filed on a backyard of a ranch.The drive picked us up at our hotel in Buenos Aires, then we drove for about an hour, could be less if there was no traffic. We are a couple with some riding experience, but there were two brothers with us without any experience. First we had a short tour, then we practiced different swings standing on stools. After we managed to hit the ball consistently we picked up helmets and jumped on horses. VERY WELL TRAINED horses. We rode many horses in the past and can tell you these were well trained horses with perfect mind. No running, no bucking, no other misbehavior. In the first lesson we just tried to hit the ball on our own, not playing yet. Not easy, but that is what makes it fun.Then we had a lunch with a glass of wine. After lunch we had a game! We were surprised how well the two brothers did considering that they jumped on horses first time in their lives. Was fun! Again the horses did perfect job, no spooking, obeying commands. we were running into each other and they were doing their job.After the game we watch a real game by two teams. Overall I think I am hooked on polo, need to check out polo clubs in Toronto. We may also come back for a polo holiday. The Puesto Viejo has a hotel and you can stay therre. Sort of like a skiing or diving vacation, but this time it is polo vacation.

The highlight of our time in Argentina. Our polo day was the highlight of our whole time in Argentina. Really unique activity that we had never tried before. Our instructor Julio was fantastic - spoke fluent English, had a wonderful sense of humor and was very patient and kind. His friendly and positive personality made the whole day so much FUN!! Day begins with a tour of the horse stables, and then learning the basics of polo - how to swing, etc. Then there is a fabulous three course lunch. It was home-cooked, delicious, and the staff were wonderful in catering to my husband's request for gluten free. Hour break for lunch to relax and explore the grounds, and then we had a match! We were all beginners, though our competitive nature must have taken hold because we were all pretty decent when it came to to compete against each other. Must have been Julio's excellent instructing!! We actually booked accommodation and stayed overnight after everyone went home at the end of the day. Highly recommend doing it that way. The property is gorgeous and there is so much more to explore. Top notch experience - you'll love it even if you're a beginner. Can't wait to head back to Argentina for another polo day.

Beautiful countryside. Perfect way to spend a day in a countryside. The hosts are very friendly and the asado was awesome. Nice oportunity to learn riding a horse, also to learn some basics about a polo.

Just Excelent. It's hard to put in words the great experience that I had, I used to play polo, so I choose Puesto Viejo to spend few days and play some chukkers, If you are looking for a place to relax, eat excellent food, play polo and be trated as a king, Puesto Viejo is your choice , look no further.

What a great day. Booked through TripAdvisor and was not sure what to expect. My wife was skeptical as we made our way out of the city. When we finally arrived, the facility was amazing. Our instructor Julio was fantastic. The lunch was delicious. I think she would have been ok staying there for the duration of the trip. It was definitely the highlight of our trip to BA. First time on horseback for me and had no problems. Only wish the polo season had started, so that we could have watched a match.

A truly amazing day!. This polo experience was the highlight of my trip. My instructor for the day was Julio and he was a splendid teacher and the most fun. I had experience riding horses before but do not fret if you have not! The horses were impeccably trained and Julio was such a patient and friendly instructor that you would be fine! The property was stunning and all the staff working there made me feel so welcome! I could not recommend this enough as part of your Argentinian experience! I was inclined to quit my life and start anew as a polo player!

A must do!. What a fab day! Everything was brilliant. It was so easy to arrange and we had a car collect us and drop us off back in BsAs. Hospitality was second to none, tea & coffee on arrival, a fabulous lunch and a tea to end the day. The wine produced for the club in Mendoza was terrific. Julio, our instructor gave us a detailed tour and first class lesson on the ground before we saddled up. He was encouraging and clearly a talented expert with years of invaluable competition experience at the highest level. We had riders and non riders in the group and he made the day enjoyable for all. It was a real thrill to end the day with a polo match. I really recommend this, worth every penny. A big thank you for making our day so enjoyable and memorable. Lucy & Dan

Taste of Polo. Some of us did the morning session, learning how to play Polo and 2 of us sat by the pool relaxing. The lunch was excellent and the place is absolutely gorgeous. The team is very friendly and we really had a lovely day.

Amazing Experience!. Was told by a friend to come and try a day at Puesto Viejo Polo Day, and it really was worth while. The staff were friendly, the grounds were immaculate, and the experience was even better than I expected. I have very little equestrian experience but Julio gave me a very informative and enjoyable debrief on how to use the taco (polo mallet) correctly as well as a lesson on how to control my polo pony. I was then suited and booted by other friendly staff members at the stables and sent to the open field to try it out. Julio made the experience really enjoyable for me and I'd highly recommend it to anyone. I was then served a lovely lunch and was greeted by Jeremy himself who was very good company. Then I was back in the saddle for a very relaxed "game" of polo with Julio and other riders. I'd like to thank Jeremy and his team for a great experience, I'll definitely be coming back again!

A day like a gaucho. Just wanted to write and say how much we enjoyed our polo day at Puesto Viejo.We were a bit apprehensive at first that we wouldn’t be able to do it because we have no previous horse experience but we were quickly reassured once we were up and out on the field hitting the ball.The instructor Julito was very kind and patient and the horses obviously knew what they were doing.The asado lunch was delicious and everyone was very welcoming to this beautiful estancia.Thoroughly recommend you do this activity, it’s great fun for everyone!

Excellent Family Polo Day!. My family and I spent a wonderful polo day at Puesto Viejo last week! We were four adults and two children (ages 8 and 6). In the morning we were greeted with delicious coffee and pastries by the friendly hotel staff and our wonderful instructor Julito, who made us feel immediately welcome and excited about the day ahead. What followed was an incredibly fun day of polo lessons, asado, and our very own polo match to conclude the afternoon. From start to finish, Julito made our day fun and informative. He was equally skilled at working with children and adults, and made everyone feel truly comfortable. My family was visiting Buenos Aires for a week and this was the highlight of our wonderful trip! If you are looking for a great, family friendly day trip from Buenos Aires, do not hesitate to visit Puesto Viejo!

Highlight of our Buenos Aires stay. My friend and I attended a polo day Puesto Viejo Polo club and had a fantastic day. We both have an equestrian background and were very impressed with the facilities and the overall condition of the horses. We watched wheelbarrow loads of grain being distributed to the horses as well as the most divine looking lucerne hay. Horse welfare was a high priority for us when selecting a polo day to attend, all the boxes were ticked here! This was our first polo experience, we enjoyed learning the swings before getting on the horses. The horses are exceptionally well trained. Quiet and safe enough for complete beginners or the most nervous riders to learn on, and then could go out in the afternoon and play a game of polo at professional level. Our lunch was delicious and we enjoyed watching a game from the shelter of Julio's car (it was a particularly cold day). Our own polo match in the afternoon was a lot of fun, and we were very grateful to Julio for taking our camera out with us and getting a lot of nice photos to remember the experience. A 10 out of 10 experience, we recommend to all, whether you are horsey or not!

Fantastic countryside estate outside of Buenos Aires. We had originally planned on doing the Polo Day & Stay, in which you are picked up in BA, go to the estate, have two lessons, lunch / dinner, and are taken back to BA the following morning. We ended up extending into the next day as much as our existing flight plans would allow, so that we could take more lessons.Our trainer was Julio, who is one of the most charismatic people I've ever met. As a teacher, he was also incredibly patient and helpful. My girlfriend and I had been on horses several times in the past, but polo is a different experience altogether. We had a lesson off-horse our first morning to get accustomed to the ball and stick, and then after lunch got on the horses for some horsemanship and to practice our swings from the saddle. The owner's wife joined us on the practice field for a pick-up guys vs. girls game, in which the two professionals were very good at trying to develop us without completely exposing our utter lack of skills!We also had the opportunity that to observe a long weekend tournament that was being played at the estate, and Julio and one of the hotel guests played on a team together. At the professional level, polo is exhilarating and very intimidating to watch.The grounds of the estate are very beautiful and, though it was cresting into fall when we were there (e.g. the pool was open but too chilly), it would be a delightful place to spend summers as well. We biked around the grounds during some of our free time.I would encourage people to not just come for the Polo Day, but instead stick around for the charming boutique hotel on the grounds of the estate. It's very small and intimate - perhaps 10 or 15 rooms - and everyone congregates together in the main houses for meals, happy hour, and conversation. The owner was around for several of these occasions as well, which was a nice gesture. Most of the people staying there are real polo players from around the world who have come to Puesto Viejo for a number of weeks, thus you can find yourself in over your head at the dinner table when everyone else is talking the minutiae of the sport. Though we had nothing to contribute there, it was still an interesting experience learning about everyone's background and how they came to be polo players.Overall, a great spot. I think by nature of booking a short-term stay and then extending it, we probably did Puesto Viejo as expensively (on a per-day basis, of course) as we could have possible done. I would definitely return but perhaps dedicate more time so that I could better develop my riding and stick & ball skills.

Fun but rainy!. My friend and I attended a polo day led by Juli at Puest Viejo in March. The lesson and farm was nice, but we happened to go a very rainy and muddy day. We were a bit worried about the horses slipping since the field was so muddy! The lunch was nice, but the meat was quite dry and tough. Overall it was a fine day, but from reviews there are better polo day operators in Buenos Aires.

So much fun!. I had an amazing day at the Puesto Viejo Polo Day :) Even with the rain I enjoyed it ! The activities are well managed and fun! The food and beverages are really good! You feel like at home :) Thank You for this experience ! And see you soon, probably this summer to try the swimming pool and bici !Maud

Hilarious polo adventure. Me and my friend wanted to do something special on our trip in Argentina. After doing some research we found Puesto Viejo and decided to give it a try. Our driver picked us up from our hotel in Recoleta. After an hour we arrived at the estancia, a gorgeous place with stunning views of the countryside. We were greeted by Julio, an excellent polo instructor who provided an in-depth tutorial on swings and tactics. We had very little experience riding horses and he was very patient and professional (lesson was taught in English!). The horses they picked for us matched perfectly our skill level. Food was delicious, traditional cuts of Argentine meat, malbec wine, empanadas and dessert (try the homemade flan with dulce de leche). After relaxing a bit after lunch we took a nice bicycle ride to the stables for the second part of the instruction where we ended up playing a hilarious mini match with the other guests. A well-deserved tea/coffee with assorted cakes and pastries was waiting for us after the match, while we enjoyed watching the club members play a professional polo match. Around 5.30 we were taken back to our hotel by the same friendly driver. This is a must do experience if you want to try something different. I highly recommend Puesto Viejo.

Perfect Polo Day: Highlight of BA trip.. We are a couple from NYC in our 30s, and this was a perfect polo day. We were picked up at our hotel in Palermo by a very friendly driver Freddy. We were whisked off to the countryside an hour away from BA to a beautiful Polo Farm and greeted by our Polo Instructor Julio with desserts and refreshments. We took a short bicycle ride to the stables where Julio first instructed us on usage of the Polo Mallets and the different swings we would use on the horse. Then we saddled up on the clean mild mannered horses that were very easy to control and had a practice lesson for about a hour on the horses. As we were the only couple enjoying the polo day on that day in April 2016 we had a private lesson with Julio. Julio was very knowledgable, patient, professional, and friendly. After our lesson, we had a nice steak lunch at the house. In the afternoon, we enjoyed a polo match/game against a father/daughter team that were staying at the ranch. Julio was the ringer for our team so we miraculously won by 1 point. There was a infinity pool amenity that was lovely that we would have used had the weather been warmer. After our match Freddy drove us back to BA city. As a parting memento Julio gifted us with a horseshoe, and later on emailed us all the professional pictures that were take of the match that day. This was the highlight of our trip to BA and we would recommend it to everyone and anyone who is even mildly interested in polo and or horses! We can't wait to return for a longer experience in the future.

Even better than we hoped!. The moment you arrive at Puesto Viejo you know you are in for a treat. We started with tea and snacks and a chat with our instructor, Julio. Just casually sitting on the porch talking about the estancia and polo....then hopped on bikes to the stables. We hit the "driving range" if you will to practice our shots. Then we mounted our polo ponies and took to the field to practice. After that we had a lovely lunch and then some free time to bike around the property and enjoy the views. We got back onto the ponies and started a game of our own with Julio! He and our seven year-old son took on my 11 year-old daughter, hubby and myself. It was great fun. Our ponies were slow (in a good, safe way) and knew how to play the game better than we did! Lots of laughs, smiles and memory making. They also took pictures of our family and sent them to us in a zip file. Service could not have been better. Finished the afternoon with more tea and recounting our stories. This was the best day on our trip. Julio was delightful and helpful and patient!

Incredible, Thrilling Experience! 5-stars!. A small group of us went out to Puesto Viejo for their polo day and it was by far, the highlight of our trip to Argentina. From beginning to end, the day was perfectly planned and there was never a dull moment. Our teacher, Julio, a former professional polo player, was knowledgeable, patient, and fun! Learning how to play polo was an absolute blast on the beautiful fields at Puesto Viejo. In between our polo lesson and polo match, we relaxed poolside at their infinity pool, feasted on a gourmet meal, and enjoyed the beautiful manicured grounds of Puesto Viejo. We finished the day with an epic polo match and then watched the pros play. It was a completely 5-star experience and would love to return!

Great family fun.. Julio was our polo instructor for the day and he was AWESOME!. Our family had never played polo before and he was patient, fun and helpful. Spending the day at Puesto Viejo has been the highlight of our ten day trip in Argentina. The facility and grounds are well kept. Julio and the entire staff are great. The lunch was wonderful and the sessions were fun. Better than advertised. Can't think of anything they could have done better.

Polo Day - Can I stay forever?. I've been Buenos Aires for a few weeks now and we finally decided it was time to get out and do something different. After stumbling upon Puesto Viejo Estancia, we decided it may be worth the trip... After visiting, I can confirm, IT IS VERY WORTH THE TRIP. The venue is stunning, relaxing, entertaining... all of the things you'd want for a day away. It felt like stepping into another world and it's only a short trip away from Buenos Aires. DEFINITELY recommend. :)

Excellent experience. I did this activity with my sister during our tour of Argentina and it was definitely a highlight of the trip. Located about 1.5 hours away from the bustle of busy Buenos Aires, Puesto Viejo was a welcomed departure to a serene ranch. Our experience was personalized to our (very limited/non-existent) skill set. We were picked up from our hotel by a driver. Once we arrived, we were treated to pastries, tea, and coffee. After a quick tour of the ranch, we began our lesson. Juan, our retired professional polo player, was our instructor and was so pleasant and patient with us. The horses were so docile and made us feel secure. After a practice round, we enjoyed an excellent, made-to-order lunch with dessert, a quick, refreshing dip in the pool, before we had a "match". After the match (between Juan and ourselves), we watched a practice match between some of the more experienced players, treated to more pastries and beverages, and driven to our Buenos Aires hotel.The staff even took pictures of us for us to enjoy after our day was finished. The were emailed to us the same day.From beginning to end, this was an amazing, unforgettable experience. Not a single negative thing could be said about it.

Highlight of Trip. This was the highlight of my trip. I have never been on a horse before and they made me feel extremely comfortable. We practiced in the morning, had lunch, played polo and watched a polo match. They even took pictures and emailed them to us. Every person should do this on their trip!

AMAZING DAY!! . Me and my boyfriend decided to book a polo day, I'm an experiment rider and my boyfriend had no experience, however they suited the horses perfectly to us. The grounds are beautiful and the horses are sooo well looked after, well mannered and very very well trained, they are immaculate! I could easily have spent a week here for a polo holiday it was amazing and had a little infinity pool too which you can use after lunch. Lunch was amazing too! All the polo teachers are very patient and really know what their doing. Couldn't recommend this place enough, a little pricey for us as we're back packing South America but you just can't miss out on this! Thank you for a great memorable day!!

Amazing day - highly recommended. This polo day was great, the staff and instructors were excellent and really helpful. The day was really relaxing, great food and the lessons and game was a lot of fun. Highly recommended for all ages.

Polo Day out of Buenos Aires. We booked from landingpadba.com and it was the best day trip we did out of our 10 days in Buenos Aires. They picked us up on time and we were greeted with coffee and pastries, a lesson, lunch, time for a swim in the pool and watched a professional polo match. Our instructor Julio was amazing! We had such a great time and recommend anyone visiting should do this trip. We thought of staying over night but you get the full experience and it is more affordable.

Polo Day. Julio Casares, the Polo Instructor, was incredibly knowledgeable, kind, fun, and professional. We were incredibly impressed by the quality of his teaching! His polo lessons were one of my favorite experiences in Argentina.

Way beyond our expectations!. My wife and I were looking for some active things to do in and around Buenos Aires on our vacation. We did the free walking tour, a bicycle tour, the Colonia day in Uruguay and spent a day with Julio and his Polo Ponies. Neither of us has much riding experience and I am 50+ (sorry can't tell you my wife's age!). We were picked up by Frederico at our hotel in Recoleta and after a quick stop to pick up another couple, we drove into the Argentinian countryside. Frederico is learning english and was very helpful in giving us a bit of a tour as we drove through town. The Polo Club/Ranch was very picturesque and well kept. The atmosphere was relaxed and gracious. we had a coffee and treats before heading on a tour of the stables. We used plastic stools to learn how to use our mallets and hit both forwards and backwards. We then had to use this newly learned skill on horseback... Julio was an excellent teacher and very encouraging. The horses were gentle and certainly knew how to play much better than we did!We had a wonderful lunch with lots of choice. We sat outside under a vine covered pergola... very Tuscan and relaxing. Then to get prepare for the big match, we had a lovely swim in the infinity pool overlooking the Polo fields. We played a 4 on 4 match in a half field configuration - Loads of fun and excitement. It was very challenging to hit the ball while others are trying to stop you. Next we watched the real Polo players from the club play. They sure moved a lot faster than we did. It was a great day and certainly our highlight from the time in BA... you don't get the chance to learn and play Polo in a fun and safe environment very often. We are so glad we decided to do this!

Fantastic polo. Had so much fun and learned so much! All grooms, hotel staff and instructor, Julito were first class. Great horses and amazing setting. Delightful lunch. Julito is such a committed teacher and motivator - the best!! No matter your level or previous experience he is sure to help you on your polo journey. He is attentive, patient, professional and knowledgeable! He is also a really nice guy!Cannot recommend him highly enough ! You have to try a polo day for yourself!! You will love it!

A wonderful experience . You cannot come to Argentina and not experience a polo day. Whether you are a total novice who has never considered riding or an experienced rider who fancies trying a bit of polo, it's a must do. This was my tactic to persuade my boyfriend to give it a go.... And it worked! Puesto Viejo is an incredible place and we had a great day. My boyfriend was given the perfect horse who didn't really like to go faster than walk and I had something a bit more speedy. He still can't believe he has played polo and after watching the boys play some friendly matches up on the beautiful club pitches, he can't wait to try it again. It really is quite addictive! The grounds of Puesto Viejo are beyond beautiful with so many different trees, myriad birds from hummingbirds and Falcons to burrowing owls, a modern looking clubhouse and maybe 5/6 perfectly cultivated pitches. All the people who work at PV were delightful and super friendly, helping us out whenever they could and providing us with a yummy lunch. If you're considering a polo day or even a polo holiday, this is the place to do it. It's got such a great vibe, I couldn't recommend it more. Thanks for making us feel like part of the club PV, we hope to come back again someday!

Fabulous day out!. This is great day out and you don't have to be an experienced rider to paticipate. Julio was a brilliant instructor and showed us the ins and outs of polo. The morning was spent learning swings and getting used to doing this on horse back. We were then taken back for a beautiful lunch and some time to relax in the beautiful grounds. Then we were able to put our learning into action with a fun game of polo. To finish off there was a polo session with the professionals showing how it should be fun.

Polo day with Julio - utterly fantastic!. My husband and I have just finished the polo day at the estancia with Julio, it was the most fun we've had in ages.Seemlessly booked and collected from our hotel in Buenos Aires.We arrived and were passed into the care of Julio. He explained the game, the history and his own career. A tour of the stables followed before we started on getting to grips with swinging the mallet. We quickly moved up to the ponies and head out for our morning lesson.Lunch was amazing, the inclusive nature was so welcoming. A quick snooze by the infinity pool and we were back out, recharged and ready for a match.We finished the day off with watching one of the club matches. Absolutely excellent!

Wonderful!. Julito was an absolutely phenomenal instructor. He is very patient with beginners while being able to teach more advanced players very well. Loved Puesto Viejo and I would absolutely go back again.
fantastic place. Fantastic place and Julito is a great instructor with time for beginners and inspiration for better players

Excellent polo instruction for any level. Our group came with a wide range of levels, from beginners to experienced players. Julito was really great at catering to all levels of players. He was really enthusiastic and made even the technical aspects of the game really fun! The Polo Club is beautiful with many polo pitches, and all the horses were excellent, and they had so many there was one for every level of player.

Just wonderful!. We visited Puesto Viejo for the day as part of a "día de campo" (estancia) package rather than a polo day. It was a wonderful day, offering excellent quality, service, value and a lot of relaxation and fun.Food - We were provided with coffee/tea and cakes upon arrival, an asado for lunch and a merenda late afternoon.Activities - Horse riding around the estate, infinity pool, cycling.The grounds are absolutely stunning and extremely well maintained. The Infinity pool offered gorgeous views and the food was excellent quality. I would recommend Puesto Viejo to anybody visiting Buenos Aires.

A fun day and a different perspective on BA. We had a lot of fun learning the basics of polo and visiting this lovely ranch. The people we shared our van and the day with were personable and, our instructor, Julio, high energy and infinitely patient. Lunch was light, but delicious and we enjoyed a dip in the infinity pool before applying our new found skills in a game. I suspect the horses are still laughing at how awful our playing was, but we had a great time.

Amazing experience - a must do!!. My husband and i spent a day at Puesto Viejo learning to play polo (polo day), and wow did we have a blast!!! Both of us had sat on a horse maybe a few times before, last time 10 years ago. We were a bit hesitant and wondered if we'd really get to play a chukka in the end. But yes, we did and it was so much fun!!The day started with a welcome coffee and pastries at the main building. We were greeted by the team by name as soon as we arrived - what a heartfelt welcome, we loved it!Our polo instructor julio joined us there and soon we were headed out for a quick visit of the estate. We then first did some exercises (without the horse) to learn different swings and also refreshend our memory on how to manouver the horse. Once we had the basics, we got on the horses and headed out to the field to apply what we had just learned. To our surprise, we actually managed to hit the ball and stay on the horse. We had such a great time and the horses were patient with our polo intents, we felt safe at all times. Our instructor julio would join us and give us advice as we hit the ball across the field - we had such a blast and learned quickly, thanks to precise corrections and continious encouragement from julio. We then headed back to the main house for a very delicious lunch, before heading out in the afternoon to actually play a three against three polo!! Liliana (the owner), her daugther victoria and her friend joined us for a game! They made sure to challenge us but also let us play at our own rythm. We scored a few points and had so much fun, we sure laughed a lot! Thank you for that experience!!Our instructor julio was with us throughout the whole day and also joined us for lunch. He was very kind, funny and made sure that we had an amazing time!This polo experience remains a highlight of our 6 week vacation through south america and we strongly recommend it to everyone!!!! Thank you Puesto Viejo - it was awesome!!

The best day of our vacation!. What a great experience! I ride horses, but my husband doesn't and we both had an equally great time. Julio was our trainer - he did a great job teaching polo basics and making us feel comfortable. The polo ponies were very well behaved and we felt safe the entire time. The grounds are beautiful! In between polo lessons, we had a great outdoor lunch and got a chance to take a dip in the gorgeous infinity pool. We were picked up at our condo around 9 am and returned by 7 pm. The transportation was great as well. Wear long pants and bring a camera!

Great Experience!. I was a guest at Puesto Viejo's hotel and also took polo lessons. Their hotel and polo staff are very fun and professional. Food was always very good and meal time was very social. Cleanliness was top notch. The great team & facilities at Puesto Viejo attract fun guests who make the experience even better. This is likely the part of your Argentina trip you'll talk about most often.

What a day !. My girlfriend and i just spent a polo day at the estancia and we had a wonderful experience.A very nice driver came to pick us up at our hotel In palermo and drove us to this impressive and charming estancia.We got a warm welcome by our polo teacher julio who was great and patient teaching us all he could the whole day eventhough we had barely horse back rided before.The morning session was about learning basics and after a great lunch on the outside terrace and a dive In the infinity pool we went on to play our first polo game !We had a great Time, fun, easy and felt really safe and taken care of the whole day.Thanks again to julio and the team we hope to come back one day !

Amazing time. This was a highlight of our trip. A car picked us up from our hotel in Palermo and drove us out to the polo grounds. Greeted with coffee and tea. Staff was very welcoming. Introduced to our instructor for the day who was great. Very friendly and happy to accommodate different levels of riders. We were given a short into on the basic mallet swings and then we were on the horses. Great polo ponies. Went out in the fields and given lots of space to rip around at your own pace. Came in after an hour or so for lunch. Very premium spread for lunch (tempura cheese appetizers, asado with mashed potatoes, full rack of desserts. Wine and drinks). Given some time to explore the grounds after lunch then got back on the horses for an afternoon match. Our instructor was Hulio who was a beauty but all the staff were very friendly. Everyone spoke English. Didn't need to bring anything. Can't want to go back.

We fell in love with polo!. My husband and I did the polo day as one of the activities on our honeymoon. It was the best! We both rode growing up and hubby had played polo once before but other than that we had no experience. Julio taught us everything we needed to know, his English was very good and by the end of the day we were able to play a game. Lunch was delicious, exploring the grounds on bikes was also great. We forgot to bring swim suits which I would recommend as the pool looked very refreshing. We loved it so much hubby is talking about joining a polo league in Toronto and we will definitely be going back to PV but for a longer stay for sure!

Playing Polo and relaxing by the pool.. For Christmas my daughter arranged for 5 of us to visit Puesto Viejo Polo Day. At first we were very cautious but ended up having a blast. My son and son-in-law learned to play polo while my wife, daughter and I watched while sitting by the pool. It was so much fun watching them hit the ball and ride horses and they did really well. I didn't want to play polo but wanted to ride so they gave me a horse and Martin gave me an excellent tour of the property. They also had bikes to ride and you could go for walks on the ranch. The horses were outstanding and the Bar B Q lunch was fabulous and highlighted excellent Argentinian cuisine. At the end of the day they had a real polo match for us to watch. It was the highlight of our 10 day Argentina visit.

A professional and exciting visit!. This was our first visit at Puesto Viejo Polo Club. During our 24 hour stay we enjoyed a deliscious outside BBQ served with nice Argentinian wine, with great company from other guests.The rooms were cosy with efficient air condition.The following day after a full braekfast and freshly squeezed orange juice we had a superb 2 hour introduction lesson to Polo in a beautiful , breathtaking scenery. Adults and teenagers felt very looked after and safe.The pool area was also located in a place where you could enjoy the beatiful nature Puesta.offered.We would love to come back to this freindly atmosphere and enjoy more Polo.

A Buenos Aires Must DO. Fantastic day at the PV CLUB. Went with my wife and our 20yr old daughter and had a great family day out. None of us had ever ridden before but the Instructor Julio made the day very accommodating for us and we learnt a lot. Wonderful meal at lunch in between sessions and finished the day off with a swim in the infinity pool watching the owner and his wife train with their friends. Would recommend for all ages and skill levels

Unforgettable experience!. My family and I had a fantastic experience at Puesto Viejo and highly recommend anyone who wants to have a genuine Argentinian riding experience to go. Delicious meal upon arrival from the airport, with the choice of polo or a ride the next morning. We had little/no experience with horses but the instructors were amazing and we had an unforgettable time trying our hand at polo. The horses are fantastic and the whole experience went beyond any expectation.. Thank you Puesto Viejo!
So much fun!. This is a great day and must do in Argentina. A less in the morning and a mini tournament in the afternoon makes it really special.

No experience with horses required. You don't need to be a horse person to fully enjoy this activity. We were a group of four and two of the group had only been on a horse once. Puesto Viejo arranged our transportation to their estancia. Julio and his team did all they could to make our group comfortable. We arrived to a light snack and then had a tour of the stables. After that, we moved right into a lesson. We began by donning our helmets and then, standing on a crate, we practiced hitting the ball with the polo stick/mallet. After several swing attempts and a many horse-riding tips, Julio selected a horse for each us, based on our riding experience. For the new riders, Julio selected very gentle horses that were happy to just walk their way around the field. Puesto Viejo has horses to meet every riders' level. Julio made sure that everyone got a chance to hit their ball up and down the field several times. After the first lesson we returned to the hotel and had a hearty lunch, where Julio continued to answer questions so we could better understand the game and the polo way of life. After lunch we relaxed for about 45 minutes by the pool - then it was time for our second lesson and a 'game.' Those who were nervous at first, quickly found trust in Julio and the horses. After our second time in the saddle, we got to watch a game played by professional. Lots of great action. By the end of the day, we were tired and completely content, just in time for their driver to take us back to the city. We can't recommend this activity enough. It makes for a great adventure to tell friends and family about back home.

Fantastic Outing!. The included pick up and drop from Buenos Aires, and then a personal training with a professional polo player on how to play polo, how to ride a horse etc. Julio was the best teacher, and for someone who was on a horse for the first time I was very comfortable! His lessons were informative, and then we got to play some mini polo & watch the real thing. The setting is beautiful, a lovely ranch surrounded by polo fields, an infinity pool and serene garden. I definitely recommend this as a day trip from BA. Also, apparently the ranch is close to the airport so sometimes people stay there the night before leaving BA.
Great fun!. Really great day out. Never ridden a horse before but the teaching from everyone was superb. We had an amazing time.

Friendly, informal and well organised . For my wife and I it was a great way of spending a day away from the city. We learned a new sport, watched a polo game, had a nice lunch with other polo players and played with friendly local dogs. Polo may be an elite sport, but everyone at the estancia was friendly and welcoming, and we 'turists' were made felt part of the family. A special thanks to Julio our instructor who managed to get my wife on a horse and abandon her fears.

Family Fun. What a fabulous time we had together! My husband is not normally a fan of horse activities, but when mixed with the game and the fun people there, he thoroughly enjoyed himself. The conversation at lunch was also great for him. Of course my daughter and I always enjoy horse activities. The facilities were need and clean, and made us feel special. Birds, friendly ranch dogs, trees and grass. The stable was large and very well kept. The food was exceptional. We even enjoyed some time in the pool afterward, which is positioned so as to be able to watch others practicing their polo skills while swimming and sunbathing. Very clean and roomy pool house with lockers, showers and restrooms.

Fantastic!!!!. First class experience. I am not much of a horse person, really did this for my wife and daughter. However, I had so much fun! Our polo match was the best, we all laughed and laughed. The food was excellent, the grounds are beautiful. The staff and instructor was superb. Can't say enough good things to explain how good it was. I think the only negative was that it had to end.

Fantastic Day in the Country!. Puesto Viejo is first class. From picking my husband and I up at our Air BnB in Buenos Aires to the top-rate polo lesson we received, we loved our day at the Estancia. There is no previous polo or horse experience required, and our instructor Julio easily tailored the day to each of us in the small group. I highly recommend this day trip to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires!

Best day in Argentina so far. After being collected from our apartment by the private car, we were taken to the beautiful Puesto Viejo. We were greeted with smiles and a delicious breakfast with an assortment of cakes to fuel us for the upcoming polo lesson. Jeremy, the owner of Puesto Viejo taught us for both the morning and afternoon lessons and was truly a great and encouraging teacher of the sport. The asado lunch with wine was equally as great and so were the hotel grounds. We relaxed and took a dip in the infinity pool before taking part in a 2 vs 2 polo game which has to be one of the most exciting sports I have participated in!The day finished with a professional polo game where we cheered from the sideline and were really able to appreciate the speed and intensity of the sport when played at such a high level.Thank you to everyone at Puesto Viejo for creating such an unforgettable experience!

An opportunity of a lifetime. I recently traveled to Buenos Aires with my brother. While I was searching for things to do, the Puesto Viejo Polo day trip jumped out at me. I didn't even know what I should expect; however, it was by far the best experience I had while on vacation! I will always remember that day. They picked us up in Buenos Aires drove us to the ranch (and drove us home), gave us a tour, and immediately started to teach us how to ride horses and play polo. Our instructor was welcoming, patient, personable, and funny. Although he was all those things he was also experienced and taught us so much about polo. We had a delicious meal for lunch then spent the afternoon actually playing polo. To this day, it is crazy to me that I can now say, I actually played polo. The horses were easy going and Puesto Viejo did provide me with a helmet to wear. By the end of the day, my brother and I were having so much fun, we didn't want to leave. This is an opportunity of a lifetime, day events like this are hard to come by in the U.S. and in some cases/places polo isn't that accessible as a sport so I was really thankful I had this opportunity. I do want to travel again to Argentina and if/when I do, I would love to go back to Puesto Viejo. Tips- it's a ranch people- make sure you do NOT wear fancy shoes. Come with an open mind and trust your instructor. The ranch/estate is a legitimate polo club so they know what they are doing!

Polo for all levels. Even if you've never ridden a horse, you should try this! My husband and I went for an intro day of polo and were very happy we did. We got individual attention from Julio, a polo professional and excellent teacher. He taught us the basics of polo and horse riding, and we practiced on horses. We even got to play a mini game! Lots of time on the horses playing polo in addition to watching a game and eating a delicious lunch. The ranch is lovely and not far from BA. We think it is the best way to spend a day out of the city! Thank you Puesto Viejo Polo!!

One of the best experiences in BA. We had an amazing day with a passionated teacher. I had been my third time on the horse, and in the end of the day we were playing an actual Polo game! How amazing! Well it might looked more like golf on the horse and my team Julio lost ;) nevertheless it was giant fun! Julio made as ride the horse and try to play Polo all along, cheering us up and making jokes all the time! Then to see a professional Polo game was fantastic! I can really say the people with their passion at Puesto Viejo made our day! The little present at last was the cherry on the top, thank you Lilly!
BA. Great time!!! Great teacher and great food!! recommend to be done when in Buenas aires! Great experience!!

Puesto Viejo Polo Day. We had an absolutely amazing time at Puesto Viejo. We we greeted with a welcome reception that had coffee/tea and pastries to go over the days agenda. We toured the club and then got right into the lesson of the rules of polo and hitting techniques. We were then paired with horses and had horse riding practice for an hour or so. We broke for lunch and had an amazing authentic BBQ three course meal (with wine!). The remainder of the afternoon included playing and watching actual polo games. The instructor made it very easy to learn (we were all beginners to the game and to horseback riding). The staff was very friendly and spoke both Spanish and English.The club is beautiful and is about an hour away from Buenos Aires. They provided everything we needed and could have asked for-- This was the best part of our trip to Argentina and we would absolutely recommend it to anyone visiting the area. It was a fun filled day that we will never forget!

Highlight of my trip!. I highly recommend going to play polo for a day. You don't need to be an experienced rider or even know a lick about polo to have a fabulous time. I couldn't stop smiling all day because it was such a blast!
A Must-Do!. This was the highlight of our trip! It was an overall fantastic outing, with phenomenal service! Everyone was so friendly. It was a true cultural experience.

Favorite day in BA. Absolutely loved polo day! It was a tough choice to take a full day from our BA vacation for polo, but it was so worth it. Incredible food, beautiful property, excellent Malbec, and the polo playing was really fun, even for someone who hadn't ridden a horse before. Julio was patient and accommodating and made me feel comfortable. Great attention to detail on site. Highly recommended!

A Must Do in BA. This excursion was an absolute blast!! We got to ride horses, play a polo game, ride bikes, drink coffee/tea, drink lots of vino, and eat a delicious lunch! They treat you really well and the property is beautiful. The staff is also fantastic

Must Do- 10 STARS!!!. Increible! Wow- what a fun time. Hard to choose between this and the Boca Jr. futbol game I attended but I think this wins for the highlight of Buenos Aires events. From pick up to drop off (9am-7pm) everything went like clock work- flawless. First class treatment all the way! After about an hour drive from Buenos Aires by mini-van, once we arrived we were treated to coffee/tea and pastries, then a tour of the stables with an explanation of what we were seeing, as well as some of the nuances of Polo and what is involved in maintaining your horse. We were then taken to an area and taught how to swing the mallet properly. The grounds are beautiful and expansive, impeccably maintained. After that we kitted up with helmets and leg protectors and mounted out horses. I have ridden many "stable" horses (not polo) in the past but these were the best trained and reasonably co-operative horses that I have ever been on. We ran through the basics of turning and stopping, then we practiced hitting the ball up and down a polo field. Afterwards, an amazing multi-course lunch featuring BBQ meat, salad, emenadas, tinto vino, and a tasty dessert. Really delicious food. After lunch, we watched the local pros put on an exhibition match for us, so we could see how it's done. Then, it was out turn. We kitted back up and spilt into teams and played a hilarious game of polo. So much fun! I was laughing so hard at times I got a side ache. Even if you have never ridden a horse in your life this is doable and you will have the time of your life. Our instructor/guide for the day was Julio, and I can't say enough good things about his patience, professionalism and enthusiasm for his sport. At the end of the day we once again were treated to coffee/tea and pastries, and then sadly it was time to depart. If you do nothing else while in Buenos Aires, consider this experience of a lifetime playing the "Sport of Kings" in the country that has the best players in the world.

Because the only way to learn polo is on the back of a real horse!. By now if you have read the reviews, you must realize that the Polo Day experience at Puesto Viejo is not to be missed. Neither my wife not I had ever come close to playing polo, but that didn't matter. Julio is not only a great polo teacher and storyteller, but also one of the coolest guys you will ever meet. The ranch itself is wonderful and it was a nice break from the city. They serve wonderful food- that steak was amazing- and take a look at the rooms they have available; if we find ourselves in Buenos Aires again, staying there is definitely an option. You have whetted our appetites for polo and we are now looking for places around our home to learn, but it will not be nearly as much fun as chasing that pelota around the Estancia that Saturday afternoon.

Saddle up for an awesome experience!!. First of all, i want to say that of the two of us that had visited one of us had never ridden a horse nor did we know much about the sport of Polo. We even were able to watch a Polo match. We had an amazing experience thanks to Julio and the entire staff of Puesto Viejo. This was the highlight of our trip! Wish we would have spent a couple of nights at the resort instead of just the one day. Through Julio and his staff we learned about the sport, his personal experiences being a professional player, and some of the rules of the game. The best part though was actually gearing-up and playing ourselves. We were taught how to handle a horse along with how to play the sport. We were also served two great meals. Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Buenos Aires. Again, even if you've never ridden a horse or don't know anything about the sport, we highly recommend you pay them a visit. Also the door to door pickup service was a great bonus (Thanks Serigo)

Highlight of our trip so far, book it now!. Food was amazing, polo was fun and hosts were unbelievable. Julio was informative and engaging. This is a MUST do experience in BA, unforgetable highlight of my travels so far.

Simply magical. This is an absolute must for anyone visiting Argentina. The surroundings were stunning, the staff were friendly and helpful, and Julio made the visit so special. After an hour long drive from buenos aires we arrived at the beautiful polo club for tea and cake. Julio talked us through the sport and his experiences, then taught us how to ride and play polo. We were treated to a barbecue for lunch and, after playing a polo match, afternoon tea. If I ever find myself in Argentina again I will definitely be back.

Amazing day trip. The polo day was incredible. I have never properly ridden a horse before but by the end we were playing our own match. Julio was a brilliant teacher and everyone at Puesto Viejo made us feel welcome. The lunch was awesome, the polo lessons were phenomenal and we got to see a match played at full speed and all while having a laugh. It is one of the most enjoyable experiences I have ever had and would recommend it to everyone spending time in Argentina.

Amazing day of Polo. We did a day trip from Buenos Aires to Puesta Viejo to learn how to play polo and it was a fantastic experience. The whole day was a lot of fun and everyone was incredibly friendly and welcoming. We were welcomed with some coffee, juice and snacks before meeting our instructor - Julio. He was brilliant, getting us up to speed with the basics very quickly and was patient, knowledgeable and friendly. We then had a delicious three course lunch before watching a high quality polo match. After the polo match we got back on the horses to try our own mini match to get a feeling for how to play the game. Overall we can highly recommend this experience and Julio is a brilliant instructor who we would definitely recommend for all levels.

Fantastic day at Polo!. This was a highlight of our trip to Argentina. I never dreamed I would actually try Polo, on a horse hitting the ball across a polo field! The horses were extremely well trained, we had heaps of fun. This was followed by a great lunch, then an exhibition match by the professionals. I can only say this is one of the best experiences ever, so I highly recomend booking it yourself, you won't regret it!!!

Excellent day. We spent a beautiful day on puesto viejo. The teacher was great because he was kind and technically efficient. My husband is a riding teacher and he really appreciated the professional skills of the polo teacher. He spoke Spanish, of course, and English. He was very welcoming and easily adapted his teaching to the different levels.the meal was delicious. In the afternoon we played a match and he made it great fun although some of the group were absolute beginners on horses. Our only regret is that we didn't ask for the teacher's name because he deserves a very special thank you. He really made our day. He very kindly answered our dozens of questions.Thank you very much to the teacher who welcomed the Franco-Anglo-Spanish group on Tuesday, July 21st 2015 and who did a great job. Brigitte

last minute polo day. Puesto Viejo was able to schedule us at the last minute. Because it was an off week in July the estancia was quiet, but Julio and the staff were attentive and very enthusiastic about polo. The polo was fun and we learned a lot and lunch was excellent.

A great experience in Argentina. Argentina offers a lot to be discovered and polo should definitely be one of them. A day spent in the Argentine countryside in beautiful surroundings, warm welcoming hosts, delicious asado and quality polo instruction and teaching makes for a truly unforgettable experience.The whole day was amazing. It starts with a friendly and courteous driver escorting you from the city to Puesto Viejo in a comfortable private car. The journey takes around an hour but its nice to see the change from city to country. You're then welcomed by your hosts who are so hospitable with refreshments and informative conversation about themselves, the place and the sport. The property is beautifully decorated in Old World style which makes you feel like it's a home away from home.The surroundings are breathtaking and there's an opportunity to use the bikes to really get into the outdoor spirit. There's a tour of the stables and an introduction to what will be taught throughout the day. As a complete novice, the lessons were so well taught that I felt completely prepared to get on the horse and get some swing action going.The horses are well trained and you are fully equipped ready to enjoy your polo experience. The highlight is getting to try all the new found skills in a match which is so much fun! It really exceeded my expectations as polo is something I've wanted to try for a very long time.If that wasn't enough, you get spoiled with a fabulous lunch spread with so much choice of empanadas, salads, asado, dessert and malbec. All enjoyed with a fabulous view and relaxed atmosphere and the group all sat together sharing the meal. You are also treated to an afternoon tea after your day to relax and reflect on your new found ability to play polo.It's definitely somewhere where I'd love to visit again both as a resident and to play polo and highly recommend Puesto Viejo for an unforgettable experience that goes above and beyond. I wish everyone there the best of luck and hope to see you again!Muchas gracias!
Company Team Activity. We had an organized and beautiful day at the Estancia. The staff is helpful and looking for ways for the group to have a good time. Thank you for a wonderful day!!

Very Pleasant Experience in a Fantastic Place. Play Polo for the first time was an incredible experience. The instructors are patient, competent and friendly. The place was really beautiful and the food good. Nice place to spend the weekend.
Ciena Polo Day. A fantastic day. Highly recommend. The food was great. The staff was excellent. And, the highlight was the Polo match. Thank you.

AMAZING. Such an amazing day. Being a strong rider myself learning polo was a fun and riveting experience. Having the chance to fly across a field in a canter and attempt to hit a ball was unforgettable. I recommend this even if you haven't riden before. Thank you so much. Can't stop smiling :)

Hilarious introduction to polo. Overall a really enjoyable experience that I would highly recommend. We got an instruction session beforehand but got to spend a perfect length of time on the horses. Despite never having ridden I managed to score and the competitive spirit only enhanced the atmosphere.

Incredible Polo Ranch. Had one of the best afternoons here. The grounds are huge and extremely beautiful. It was amazing to get back on a horse after so long without having ridden. The staff were very friendly and the facilities really good. The horses were perfect for beginners and we all learnt how to play polo in only one afternoon! Thanks so much for such a good day!

Absolutely marvellous day!!. Arrived here excited for the day, and certainly wasn't disappointed. The teaching was fantastic and I learned very quickly. After about 20mins I was fully comfortable riding the horse and then playing polo. The day was incredible and I thoroughly enjoyed every moment. The ranch is stunning and the day was finished off with a lovely spot of tea and cake. Thanks for the great day! I will definitely come again!

Best Polo day out!. Had the best experience at the Puesto Viejo ranch! The staff were incredibly friendly and took great care with the guest! I was especially impressed by how they could involve all people within my group to ride a horse even with some people never having got on a horse before! Would definetly recommend this to anyone near Buenos Aires!

best polo day EVER. Amazing location, with excellent instructors. Everybody was so friendly and helpful. Food was great and the grounds were amazing. We could not believe how lucky we were to have found this place. It was the highlight of our trip and is a definate must go.

Incredible . Absolutely awesome day! Had never ridden before I got there and by the end of the day felt like a natural. The ranch is stunning and the bird life is impressive. The food is excellent and the people are so welcoming and friendly. For anyone in the area, it's only an hour from Buenos Aires, it is well worth a visit even if you have never ridden before.

Fantastic fun!. What a wonderful experience!! I took a group of school children who were inexperienced riders we were greeted by friendly warm people. We all learnt how to hit a ball, ride a ball and then play polo. Some went on a really good horse ride the rest of us played a game. The staff are fantastic, the facilities are top class and the horses are clearly well looked after and loved. A very memorable experience I would recommend it people of all levels.

Beyond Awesome. I was traveling through Argentina recently alone on vacation and looking for interesting excursions. I found the Puesto Viejo Polo Day tour and made a reservation. It was a truly fantastic experience. My polo instructor was very friendly, helpful and put me at ease right away. By the end of the day being on the horse (whom I dubbed Caballo Fantastico) felt as natural as being in my car. The entire staff is so accommodating and welcoming and made me the greatest lunch I had during my entire stay in Argentina. The ranch is also extremely beautiful and peaceful. I'd only wish I'd known about that earlier and I would have altered the arrangements of my trip and spend a day or two at Puesto Viejo alone. I highly recommend this experience to anyone going to Argentina that can afford the time. It will be very worth it.

Awesome. Incredible experience. Julio was just wonderful. Great people, great food, great getaway. I've never been on a horse in my life, Julio made it seem easy. Only drawback was the driver... he was kind of cranky, and drove very aggressively. But look past that, because this really is a one-of-a-kind experience.

Amazing Experience Learning Polo. My girlfriend and I went to Puesto Viejo for the Polo Day experience and had a blast. Neither of us began with much experience riding horses or any experience playing polo. The instructor Julian really made the day special with his patience and excellent coaching skill. By noon we were riding the horses and practicing our half swings, full swings, and backhand. By the end of the day we were trotting in a 2 v. 2 chukkar. The food was a delicious traditional asado. I highly suggest this experience as a day of any trip to Buenos Aires.

Unforgettable Experience!. My boyfriend and I went to Puesto Viejo for the Polo Day experience and had a blast. Neither of us began with much experience riding horses or any experience playing polo. The instructor Julio reallymade the day special with his patience and excellent coaching. By noon we were riding the horses and practicing our half swings, full swings, and backhand. By the end of the day we were trotting in a 2 v.2 chukkar. The food was a delicious traditional asado with never ending courses. Aside from the fantastic essentially private instruction, the curbside service from our Buenos Aires flat and the tea time afterward in which we were able to meet the owner of the estancia were alone worth the price. The relaxed vibe of the estancia and teaching approach makes for a wonderful getaway from the city. Don't think twice about booking with Julio-I highlysuggest this experience as a day of any trip to Buenos Aires.

Excellent, high quality polo experience - highlight of our trip!. From the moment we were picked up from our accommodation, the service we received was excellent, and very friendly. I chose this experience because we received 2 polo sessions on horseback, and I wanted to maximise the amount of time we had on the horses. Our teacher for the day, Julio, was friendly, informative, patient and passionate about polo - the perfect mix! He really made our day. He did very well working with all of us, with our varying levels of ability/experience. The horses are of the highest quality, and very very well looked after. They were an absolute joy to ride, and knew that they did not have professionals on their backs! We felt like they were looking after us too! I've ridden a lot in the past and was not disappointed, as my horse was very responsive, (it was NOT like many riding experiences where the horses do the same thing day in, day out and just follow each other). My husband has only ridden a couple of times in the past, and was equally as comfortable and happy playing polo at Puesto Viejo.The property is beautiful, and the facilities second to none. The food we were served was fantastic, and we enjoyed it on a shaded terrace outside, overlooking the polo fields where the professionals were warming up for their afternoon game. Towards the end of the day we enjoyed watching the professionals play, this was also a highlight! All the staff we met on the day were so friendly and looked after us - this all contributed to a fantastic experience. We were really sad to leave, and wish we could have stayed longer!

Incredible, can't wait to return. A friend and I spent a polo day and night at Puesto Viejo in April 2015. Great rooms, food and camaraderie. It was my second time on a horse. They were amazing. I was very comfortable. Do not worry about your experience level the horses, teachers and trainers will make you feel like you are a professional. Don't miss the opportunity to spend a day or two in el campo. You will not be disappointed.I travel A LOT and this was by far the best weekend I've spent abroad.
Everyone should be able to do this at least once. The most fun I have had in years - the teaching was effective, the facility was magnificent and the day was utterly memorable.

So much fun! We loved every minute.. My sister and I were visiting Buenos Aires for the first time, and we decided that we wanted to spend a day visiting an Estancia. Puerto Viejo was PERFECT! We had so much fun. It had been a good 15 years since either of us had ridden a horse, but the lesson was a great introduction to both riding and polo. We were beginners in every sense of the word, but since the instructors are really skilled, I got the sense that you could tailor the lesson to your ability level. Lunch was delicious, the afternoon polo matches were great, and overall, it was one of the most fun and memorable experiences of our trip. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Fantastic fun day. I heard about Puesto Viejo Polo Days via LandingPadBA who booked this for me. It was one of the highlights of my time in Argentina. Everything went smoothly from pick up to drop off, a nice car was sent for the transfers from Teatro Colon on Cerrito, and it took around 45 minutes to get there on a Saturday morning (though this might be a little more during the week when there is considerably more traffic). The Estancia itself is large and the staff very warm and welcoming. Refreshments are there when you arrive, and then its off to the horses. I was a little concerned that as a singe traveller I might be a bit of a third wheel, but everything was very inclusive. Our instructor Julio could not have been more patient, encouraging, funny or informative. I haven't been on a horse in 15 years, but was at once made to feel at ease with a very calm horse, proper quality headgear and good instruction. It takes a while to get the hang of hitting the ball and not the ground, but by the end of the day I was playing a mini match with Julio and the other guests and spent the entire time laughing (and trying to get our breath back - it was actually quite hard work!). At the end of the day we got to watch the Pro's doing a practice match which was really fun. After working in BA all week, I was desperate to get out of the city and breathe some fresh air, and this was really the perfect way to do that whilst seeing a side of Argentinian life that you wont get in BA. The ranch also has hotel rooms, so if I ever return I will definitely stay a couple of nights, as even without the riding, the food was delicious and the pool very inviting.All in all, I cannot recommend this enough!

Great introduction to polo!. Our day started at Teatro Colon in BA, where the driver picked us up at 9:00, right on time. The drive to the estancia is about 45 minutes. We were pleasantly greeted by Maria Jose at the main office, a beautiful ranch-style building, who introduced us to Julio, our instructor for the day. After a brief rundown of the day's activities, we headed over to the stables for a tour and some basic polo education. There was an option to ride bikes to the stables, but since one in our party did not have much cycling experience, Julio drove us. We first had a tour of the stables and the ongoing activities, including watching the vet/dentist work and the farrier.
