There are stables for several hundred horses, and the facility is exceptionally clean and well maintained. Our first polo lesson was learning to use the mallet. We stood on stools as Julio demonstrated various shots, which we then practiced. Then, horses were brought out, we mounted up, got the stirrups adjusted properly, and were off to the pitch, to practice riding, controlling the horses, and connecting with the ball. After an hour or so, we were done with the morning lesson and headed back to the office for lunch. Lunch is served outdoors, was marvellous grilled filete de falda (skirt steak) with grilled vegetables and salad, then time for an afternoon rest. When we headed back to the stables after our rest, it was time to engage in our own little scrimmage. My wife, Kathleen and I were one team, and our class companion Rebecca and Julio were the other. This was simply a blast, playing on a half pitch, with Julio making sure everyone got shots in. We then were able to watch a practice session of club members, who played at high speed on the full pitch; very exciting to watch.Julio's knowledge of everything having to do with the operation, from types of grass used for feed or for the pitch, to care of the horses, to the intracacies of the game was encyclopedic, and his enjoyment of it all was infectious. He was the perfect host for our polo day experience. I would love to spend more than just a day here. The day ended with coffee, tea and pastries on the veranda, before our drive back to BA. We had a wonderful time and will definitely be back.

It's so much fun!! You don't wanna miss it!. Polo is not easy, but is better than you think !! Great instructor , horses are well trained ! We did it on our girls trip, if we can do it , you can do it too!! We still talk about it how fun it was ! You don't wanna miss it !! They provide shuttle for pick up and drop off where you stay , don't have to worry about how to get there or how to get back to your hotel!! After a long fun day, you gonna be tired , one less thing to worry about. If I ever go back to Argentina I would defiantly do it again !

Excellent. An absolute must in Buenos Aires.Every member of staff, from groomsman, to polo manager, to trainer, to photographer... Everyone involved in this business have got customer service perfect!

Wonderful Day!. My husband and I visited for our final day in Buenos Aires before flying home. I am an equestrian so the riding was right at home for me but I was worried about my husband as he does not ride. They not only had an amazingly calm horse for him but they kept things nice and slow and gave him one on one attention to help familiarize him with the horse and the sport. He spent most of the ride laughing and having a great time! That made my day even more enjoyable! If I were to return to Argentina I would come here for a week to stay and ride every day. This was definitely the best day of our trip and I cannot recommend this trip enough!

So much fun!. My husband and I visited Puesto Viejo for a fun excursion while visiting Buenos Aires. It was a wonderful experience and perfect fall day. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. Julio, the instructor, was amazing. He was so nice and patient and kept the atmosphere very fun but made sure we learned what we needed to know to get the most out of the experience. We had a lesson in the morning with our swings and the horses then a nice asado lunch where we relaxed and got to know everyone. In the afternoon we played a "match" which was soooo much fun. Since there were no games going on to watch after our play, Julio took us to check out the horse training grounds and explained some of that aspect of Polo to us. We learned a lot about the game and this experience definitely gave us a greater appreciation for the sport and the desire to learn more. We would do this trip again.

Fantastic Day of Polo. My girlfriend and I were looking for a few things to do during our stay in Buenos Aires and stumbled upon polo days as an option for a day trip outside of the city. We had already done a trip to an estancia and loved that experience, so we thought this would be a great follow-up to that experience. I had very limited horse riding experience prior to this (the first horse I had ever been on was two days before the polo day). I was surprised at how well the polo day turned out. I was not only able to ride and control the horse, but was also able to control the mallet and ball fairly well. We had two lessons, the first being an introduction of both the horse and the basics of polo. We broke for a nice lunch filled with empanadas, steak, and wine. We then had the chance to walk around the grounds, and learn more about the game of polo and learn about the lifestyle of a professional polo player. We had an overall great time - the weather was perfect on top of everything. The only downside was that we went on a Friday and did not get a chance to see a true polo match played at full speed.

Welcome to the world of polo. We booked unsure of what to expect. We arrived to welcoming faces and tea, coffee and biscuits. They made us feel instantly at home and at ease in the polo club. We met our polo professional in the morning had the opportunity to watch him play in a full game, had lunch with him and the other players and then had a full lesson. It was an incredibly relaxing day and the staff are very friendly and patient. We have never attempted polo before, but by the end of the lesson we were able to hit the ball and stay on the horse. It was fun through and through. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a fun and relaxing day in the Argentinian countryside.

Must do! Don't miss it :). Polo day is definitely highlight of our trip. The whole day was VIP, fun, and hands on learning experience about horse riding and the game itself.The compound is beautiful, photos on their website can't even do the justice. Pastries and refreshments are provided upon arrival and we get to know our instructor. We took a bike to the horses and all of us get our equipments and got saddle up for horse riding in the morning. The instructor was super patient and explain everything clearly. Horses were amazingly easy to control. They were super reliable and they follow our commend extremely well. Lunch was great that we were glad it was 3 course even with several options for dessert! Afternoon start with polo practice and mini game. We had mini match among our group and we all had so much fun that we yell and laugh till our stomach hurts :)We were able to see the real polo match in the afternoon. Don't miss to watch the real thing. Both horses and men got incredible skills and it was a lot of actions on the court. We were sitting with staff and they were really helpful with any questions you have. After the match, we went back to the patio to get some refreshments. Polo players were chatting with our group and everyone is at ease and having good conversation.The price is actually very reasonable considering you get round trip transportation, food, lessons, equipments, and a well trained horse full day.I would recommend all of my friend to visit Buenos Aires to do Polo Day at Puesto Viejoes Estancia ( I will do it again if I come back Buenos Aires) I would wear my bike pants next time doing it, since I'm such a beginner and after full day of horse riding, my rare would appreciate it if I put more padding on it :)

Best Part of Our Trip to Buenos Aires. Booking the polo day was the best decision we made while visiting Buenos Aires. No experience on horses is needed - Julio was a fantastic teacher and the staff was very welcoming. We began the morning with learning mallet techniques and the basics of riding, then got up on the horses to practice for an hour or so. After a delicious lunch, my husband and I spent the afternoon playing a 2 on 1 polo match with Julio, which was so much fun. He "played against us but also with us", if you know what I mean :) Following our game, we had the opportunity to watch polo club members in their practice matches, which was a very high level of play. This experience was unmatched, and the best day we could have asked for with significant time on the horses. I would recommend to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Highlight of my vacation- no experience required. My wife and I have never been on a horse before or seen Polo in person. We were picked up in the city and had a pleasant ride out to the club. Once there we were greeted with tea and coffee and met our instructor, Julio. We told him we had zero experience on a horse (except for riding a donkey up a hill in Greece) and he made us feel at ease. My wife and I learned how to swing the mallets and the basics of how to ride the horses before actually getting on them. We were quickly suiting up and on the horses. After practicing on the horses for a while (which was easier than we thought it would be), we started hitting the polo balls. It was extremely fun. There was a nice break for lunch we got to know Julio while having a relaxing meal. After some coffee we were back on the horses for a fun game. It was my wife and I vs Julio. (I think he let us in based on our skill level in comparison to his). This was so much fun and the whole time he was very supportive.After playing for a while, we watched members of the club play each other on the main field. Note, they weren't there for our tourist entertainment, these were actual Polo Players who came to the club for intense practice.We finished up with a late tea and cervesa. At the end, my wife and I felt like part of the family. I would definitely do this again and feel like a got a great value with this experience. I am now allowed to wear Polo shirts!

The best day you can have. With virtually no experience on horses and absolutely no experience with polo we had one of the best days of our entire trip to South America. Julio was our instructor and he wonderful. The entire staff made us feel more like family than guest of students. The setting is beautiful and the horses are gentle. The game is exciting and very difficult to be good at. But with an hours lesson we went at it and had as much fun as you can with you cloths on.

Incredible Day. Polo day was my favorite activity while in Argentina for two months. Good value, well-trained horses, great food and drinks, nice staff and polo is just fun. Julio was an awesome teacher and full of interesting stories. No complaints at all. I'd recommended this to anyone who has the slightest interest!

A dream realised!. An AMAZING day! Julio & his team certainly went above & beyond, thank you SO MUCH!We're STILL talking about it & can't wait to RETURN!And no matter whether you're an experienced rider or not, the horses are EXCEPTIONAL, so even a nervous rider will enjoy. Go for it!

Highlight of Trip to BA. Went here on a Polo Day and had a great experience. First of all, its a great deal. For a great price you get transfers to and from the estancia, a huge and tasty lunch and of course the polo. The staff was great. Everybody that worked there was super nice and very accommodating. The polo instructor Julio was great. Forget polo, I had never even ridden a horse. Left Puesto Viejo having scored multiple goals in a game towards the end of the day. Overall, a very relaxed, pleasant and fun environment. Would highly recommend. Definitely worth the drive.
A must do. This was the absolute highlight or my trip to Buenos Aires - Julio and the team were exceptional, I can't recommend this experience highly enough.

Wonderful Day!. I live in Buenos Aires and took my brother here on the last day of his visit. He said it was the highlight of his trip. Julio was an incredible instructor - patient and encouraging - and the entire day was seamless. First we did a bit of swing practice on some benches, then a bit of mounted practice before an incredible 3 course asado lunch. With our stomachs full we got back on the horses and played a practice game, which flew by. We were all super beginners at polo but had mixed riding experience and Julio was great at catering to each person's individual level of play. The grounds are stunning, too.

great fun!. I went to this place with my wife. I had the polo day, she stayed by the pool.We both really enjoyed the day.After a quick lesson our teacher had us on horses, practicing polo shots. After lunch, we even "played" a little polo match. We finished the day watching a polo game.All in all, it was a great day. Highly recommended!

HIGHLIGHT of our trip!. This was an AMAZING experience from start to finish for my friends and I! The grounds are so well manicured and beautiful, STUNNING, really. The staff was exceptionally friendly and great teachers : ). Julio was our instructor and was super fun and friendly. The horses are so well trained and even though I have VERY VERY little experience riding, I was able to play with my friends...and quite well I thought ;) THIS IS A MUST DO IF COMING TO BUENOS AIRES!
exhilarating!!. What a great day! Everyone was friendly and the horses amazingly behaved and well taken care of. Our instructor was kind and funny and I had a wonderful experience!

Much Fun & Laughter (& polo) on an easy day trip from BA. The stellar reviews from previous reviewers were spot on. My husband and I just spent a fun and wonderful day at beautiful Puesto Viejo. This place is one of the top polo facilities in Argentina. But if you are a novice like us, don't let that scare you! We were picked up promptly at 10 am from a central in-town location and then had an easy 1-hour drive to the ranch.The main house is charming and the grounds are immaculate. There we were greeted warmly by staff and treated to a cup of coffee on the beautiful veranda. Then we met Julio, the professional polo player, who was our host and polo instructor for the day. He spoke perfect English and guided us thru polo 101 in a few minutes. We saddled up and got more tips on how to ride and how to hit the ball! Then we spent about an hour on the Polo field. Around 1:30 we had a delicous lunch on the veranda again, followed by some leisure time where we took a walk. (There is a beautiful pool which we did not make use of) Then we rode bikes down to the stables, mounted our trusty steeds and played a polo match. Lots of laughs! After watching the real players play a practice match for an hour, we headed back into the city. We would love to go back to Puesto Viejo. In fact, we told our kids we'd love to go back with them. Thanks Julio and the rest of the kind Puesto Viejo staff!

Polo Days March 2015. My husband, sister, and I spent the day learning to play polo at Puesto Viejo in early March 2015. A driver picked us up from the apartment where we were staying in Buenos Aires and drove us about 1.5 hours out of town to Puesto Viejo (drive time varies depending on BsBAs traffic). We were warmly greeted by the staff on arrival and met our guide/polo trainer, Julio. After a scenic bike ride to the stables, we quickly got set up with our riding equipment and were taught the basics of hitting with the polo stick and how to ride the horses. We were a bit nervous but Julio did a great job of making everyone feel comfortable. After getting comfortable on the horses and doing a bit of practice, we sat outside and enjoyed a lovely asado lunch with empanadas and A TON of meat. After lunch, we went back out to the pitch to play a game. Although we won't be signing up for the professional leagues any time soon, it was a lot of fun and everyone was laughing & enjoying themselves. Throughout it all, Julio had a great attitude, was very encouraging, and definitely made the experience memorable. At the end of the day, we concluded by watching real professionals play a practice game. That really made us appreciate how difficult the sport is and how much athleticism it takes. Lastly, we finished up with some coffee and pastries before the drive back to BsAs. They even presented us with a good luck horse shoe souvenir for us to take home. I would highly recommend this activity to anyone visiting BsAs - was our best day in the city by far. Tip - Wear sun screen!

Polo lessons. My wife, baby and I went to the Estancia. It is a beautiful setting, the food was great, the house was rustic and cozy and the staff very friendly and helpful. I rode for a couple of hours and found the instructor very accommodating and friendly. I would definitely do it again.

POLO, POLO, POLO!!. Me and my wife took in one of the polo days and we are in love! Julio was a great instructor (being able to ride is one thing but riding AND playing a sport? Totally different!) The location is second to none. We will be back ASAP, in the mean time we have some great photos, thanks to the photographer Gaby.

The BEST place to learn polo in Buenos Aires!. I took a whole day of polo lesson and had an AMAZING time!!! I was so pleasantly surprised to find this greta place and great program here. This is the place to go if you really want a good polo lesson - other places are more for "having a taste of polo". The club is a beautiful places and horses are all very well maintained. The lunch and snacks are extremely wonderful!! It was a proper three course lunch that could have cost a fortune itself already. I really enjoyed it and hope to come back soon!

Julio is brilliant!. Thank you Julio for your patience, wit and practical tips and teaching. I have just returned from 2 weeks at Puesto Viejo - where I played polo everyday, twice a day. Each day started with a lesson with Julio - after spotting all the mistakes I make when playing, he slowly taught me the right way to hit a polo ball! He was brilliant - critiquing, encouraging and pushing me when needed, and some days just made me laugh. he is an excellent teacher - and 100% recommend his polo days to anyone who has never played polo, it is a great way to try it out, and Julio strikes the right balance of fun, tuition and safety........be warned once you try it, you will be addicted!
Julio is the best. We had an amazing polo experience - Julio was a patient and very positive teacher, and we also watched an amazing match!!!

Great experience great teacher. We had a lovely trip to Puesto Viejo, and really enjoyed trying out polo. Julio was such a nice guy and made us laugh a lot the whole way through as well as being a fantastic teacher. We were just two but it'd also be really good if you're a group to get a bit competitive!

A magical place. That's basically how my husband described Puesto Viejo after our Polo Day experience. We booked the Polo Day and also an overnight stay at the hotel. My husband and I have riding experience but have never played polo. While it was helpful to know how to ride, we found that most of the technique you learn in typical hunt/jump lessons go right out the window when it comes to polo. Our instructor Julio was very patient and encouraging and what's more actually made it very fun. After some basic instruction on the ground, we went right to practicing on horseback. After lunch we played a quasi match with Julio and his adorable daughter which was a lot of fun. We enjoyed the session so much that we signed up for an additional lesson the following morning (added cost). During that lesson we also got some additional help from another polo instructor working with more advanced players as well as some regulars who come to the club each year to play.At the end of the first day we got to watch a low-level match being played which was really cool to see. Over dinner we learned more about the sport from the "regulars." Although it does take some bit of financial means to get into polo, it was interesting to see that there is a diverse range of people who play and it's not just for the Prince Harry's of the world. Apart from polo the stay itself was very nice. We had a lovely lunch on the patio outside the day we arrived. All the food was well prepared and tasty. We also went on 2 "trail" rides around the property led by different grooms. They didn't speak much English and our Spanish isn't great so communication was a bit difficult but we managed. The grounds are perfect for polo although maybe not as interesting for trail riding, but it was still nice to get som extra time on the horses. Overall we had a great time and are now even talking about coming back to do a full week of polo lessons.The only hitch we had was with the pick up from Teatro Colon in Buenos Aires. We weren't given much information about the pick up process--just that someone would meet us outside the main entrance. I figured it would be pretty obvious until we actually got to the theatre and realized there were several entrances and a lot of cars lined up outside. We arrived a few minutes after the meeting time so were worried we had missed the pick up. Finally, in desperation I had to make an international call on my cell phone to the club. It took several tries to finally get through to someone and then they confirmed the driver was running a few minutes late. Finally a basic cab car pulled up and the driver called us over. There weren't any signs or anything so if we hadn't called the club I'm not sure how we would've connected with him. After that everything was fine. On the return they took us directly to our hotel which was helpful. But I would advise trying to make the pick up process from BA a little more clear.

Awesome experience. Puesto Viejo is a must do day. Everything was outstanding from pickup to drop - off. My day spent with Julio was soooooo much fun, he taught me the basics of polo & YES I did hit the ball!!!!! Food was outstanding, all staff where friendly & helpful, grounds just lovely. If time had permitted I would have loved to spent the night.I highly recommend this as an excellent day out of the city.

Unique experience!. This is an excelent Location where you can get either private or with collegaues from Business., to really live the world of polo in a great landscpae, and very close to the City of Buenos Aires.

An ideal venue for learning polo. Puesto Viejo is a highly efficient estancia, which goes out of its way to put visitors at ease and look after their needs. Polo which is its primary offer, is very well managed and facilitated for the novice as well as experienced player. Entertainment, food and hospitality is equally provided to a high standard.The polo training under 6 goaler Santiago De Estrada, and others, the horses (very important!), safety, along with the hospitality staff cannot be faulted.Jeremy Baker and his wife have put their stamp of quality in this estancia which POLOHOLIDAYS.COM is proud to partner with for its polo students to Argentina.

FANTASTIC FUN FAMILY DAY. We are a family of 4 adults with no horse riding experience, who travelled to Puesto Viejo to participate in a "Polo Day", and what a day we had. Julio our "instructor" took us through our paces, teaching us to "how to swing a mallet" and hopefully connect with the ball, and "how to ride a horse", somehow we were supposed to do both at the same time. Under Julio's expertise instruction, we managed to achieve both, at a slightly slow speed than the professionals. We were collected from Buenos Aires in the morning, and after a very pleasant drive we arrived at the lush green estate of Puesto Viejo Polo Club. Coffee and cakes were served as we filled out all the necessary paper work, then we were whisked off to the horses stables to begin our first ever experience with polo. The morning was full of laughter as Julio showed us how it should be done. We then retired to the main house for a very delicious and filling lunch and some much deserved relaxation time. In the afternoon it was time put our new found skills to the ultimate test- a game with some of Argentina's finest polo players, and we did ok !!!!. As the day wound down we watched the professionals participate in a practise match, followed by a well-deserved drink and then back to Buenos Aires. This day was one of the most memorable days we had in Argentina, and highly recommend it to everyone regardless of your horse riding skills or lack of them.

Absolute must if you're staying in Buenos Aires. My friend and I took part in the Polo Day and it was fantastic start to end. We were bussed to and from the beautiful property, and the hospitality of the hosts was exceptional. We were greeted with tea, cake and cold drinks and then promptly taken to learn the basic of playing polo and steering the horse, the instructors were extremely warm and helpful. We were then fitted out with helmets etc and introduced to our horses. In the morning we had a casual lesson in how to hit the ball and perfecting our grip of the mallets etc and after an amazing feast of Argentinian Barbecue and a dip in the beautiful pool we we're offered the option to stroll around the property, go on a horse ride or play a game of polo. We chose to play a game which was lots of fun and we really felt like we'd earnt our afternoon tea. We were then invited to watch a game played by professionals, which was thrilling and after playing ourselves we had a much greater appreciation for the complexities of the game. Tired but content we said a final goodbye to our lovely hosts and as a lovely gift we were given a polo horse shoe. I can't recommend this day trip highly enough, an unmissable day just outside of Buenos Aires.

Nice day trip. We did the day in the country option, but if we could have, we would have done the Polo Day. There isn't too much to do other than relax by the pool and walk the grounds, which are picturesque. The polo lessons, though, looked like a lot of fun.Nevertheless, the lunch we had was one of the best meals we had in Argentina. The hosts sat with us and it was a great time meeting them and hearing their story. The whole staff was very friendly.

MUST DO while you're in Buenos Aires!. The Polo day experience was absolutely fantastic! My boyfriend and I had a blast learning how to plan Polo, Puesto Viejo provided a delicious lunch, we relaxed in their infinity pool overlooking the Polo fields, and even got a chance to scrimmage a Polo game (boyfriends choice) or gallop horses (my choice). The hosts made us feel right at home and the group we happen to be with was very friendly. Everyone seemed to enjoy their time as much as we did. I would highly recommend doing this on your trip! :)

Great day in the countryside. I visited Puesto Viejo Polo Club & Estancia, which is less than one hour outside of Buenos Aires. A beautiful country estate, offering polo, horse-back riding, swimming ( & sunbathing!), great food and a place to have an afternoon siesta before the late afternoon polo match. Very relaxing, a great day out of the city. Thank you PV.

amazing day out of Buenos Aires. I did a day trip to Puesto Viejo for a day of Polo out of Buenos Aires.I played 2x sessions with a great instructor. The horses were in great shape and the hotel, estate (and lunch) was beautiful!I can only recommend this if you wnat ot get out of the hustle and bustle of BA for a day. Thanks*u

Amazing Day with Polo, Lunch and time for yourself.. I was able to book this special on very short notice (just 2 days in advance) for my little brother and myself. We've been picked up ahead of time in very nice car and made the trip in reasonable time. We were welcomed very lovely and got some refreshment and information. Soon Julio, our trainer, picked us up for the first lesson (just the 3 of us). He is a very kind and joyful guy and taught us splendidly. The lunch also stuck out and after that we could enjoy our 2nd lesson and watch some of the members and trainers play some practice matches. It was a lovely experience and the way back was as smooth as the first trip. I was just a little suprised, that we left roughly 50minutes earlier than what was announced on the homepage. All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our day there and will recommend it furhter. Best wishes from Germany.

Unforgettable - Best bit of our trip!. We visited Puesto Viejo over the Christmas holidays on our 2 week trip. You can't visit Argentina without experiencing an estancia and this place must be one of the best. We spent two days at Puesto Viejo with one of the nights staying in the hotel. I am a beginner at horse riding and was a bit worried I might not be qualified to ride there but they have amazing beginner polo ponies you can ride that are a world apart from the horses I rode in the UK. It's much more relaxed and the horses are used to beginners so I found it much easier. I had barely done a rising trot at home and was galloping within 20 mins! The scenery is beautiful too and you fee so free riding in such an open space. We also did clay pigeon shooting which was a great experience that you should really try. One of the most memorable moments of my travels - ever - was on a horse at this estancia with the sun setting. I will never forget it. Thank you to the amazing, friendly staff that helped make the experience so wonderful. See you again next year!

Amazing experience. Puesto Viejo is a truly amazing place. Jeremy and his team have created the perfect environment to learn and improve your polo. The estancia is 45 mins drive from BA which is ideal after a long flight and also allows you to pop into BA for the day/night during your stay should you choose to do so. The hotel is relaxed and extremely comfortable. The setup is very communal and inclusive. Meals are taken together so you immediately get the feeling of being part of the "family"; ideal if you are travelling alone. Jeremy and the hotel staff are exceedingly welcoming and friendly - nothing seems too much trouble. Food is excellent and plentiful. Lunch is typically taken outside in the garden, whilst breakfast and dinners are indoors. The grounds of the hotel are simply stunning - infinity swimming pool, stick and ball field, magnificent club house and four superb polo pitches; soon to be five. Days typically start with an hour or so lesson and S&B practice (with as many horses as you like, your body permitting!!). After lunch and a hour or so chill out by the pool, matches kick off from around 4pm onwards. Matches are either tournament games (if you have entered) or more relaxed club chukkas. Tuition is excellent - very insightful, patient and precise. The overall ambience of the place is total relaxation and tranquillity. I could not recommend Puesto Viejo more highly. Enjoy!!

Wonderful Day Trip!. My brother and I thoroughly enjoyed our Polo Day at Puesto Viejo. The weather was beautiful, and the grounds were very scenic. In addition, Julio was a terrific instructor, and our authentic Argentine lunch was superb. The highlight, however, was a recreational polo match we played with others in our group; it was so much fun, and minimal experience is required!

Great addition to any BA itinerary. I don't have enough great things to say about my experience at Puesto Viejo. Everyone was extremely nice and spoke exceptional English. The polo lessons were perfect for both beginners and experienced riders. We even had the opportunity to watch a practice match during our visit. I would say this experience was the highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires.

Excellent fun day out. Although I had reservations about the day being a little expensive, it was well worth it and we had a great time. To be able to actually play polo is not something you would be able to do everywhere, and the whole experience was great. The polo grounds and the house were beautiful and it was so nice to be out of the city for the day. Although none of us were particularly good horse-riders, we were still able to enjoy attempting to play, and the guide/instructor (en ex-polo player), Julito, made the day great fun.The lunch was also awesome and we were all stuffed by the end of it. And to finish the day off chilling in the infinity pool, and then watching a proper game of polo too.Awesome day out with a group of friends, and probably something you will never get the opportunity to do again, so if you can afford it, I would say it's a must from Buenos Aires!

Amazing, fun and relaxing experience. This is a great way to escape the intensity of BA and enjoy a day in the countryside. When we arrived, we were greeted by Julio and a lovely morning tea. Then we jumped on some horses to practise our swings. After a big lunch of asado, we were back on the horses with a little more courage (thanks to the complimentary red wine!) to play a game together. To say our skills were a little lacking is an understatement. Even Julio was in stitches laughing at our attempts to get our horses to simply move, let alone hit the ball. The swim in the pool was a perfect way to finish the day and rest our sore legs. I fully recommend a stay at Puesto Viejo. Give it a shot!

Polo Day. I had a one day outing at Puesto Viejo to attempt learning some polo. Jeremy was a gracious host and very patient instructor! We did a bit of stick and ball practice then got right on the horses and off to the fields. All the staff were fabulous and the food was incredible. Can't wait to go back again. Highly, highly recommend this incredible estancia!MichaelBermuda

Extremely Satisfied!. Just had my polo day and loved it! It is a great and memorable experience- a wonderful way to end your vacation! If and when I find myself back in Argentina, I will return to Puesto Viejo for another polo day or maybe even a hotel stay. Thank you Julito and the rest of the Puesto Viejo team for making my day amazing.

Chica in Argentina. Puesto Viejo's Polo days are a wonderful way of experiencing the sport of King's yourself learning from professional polo players in a perfect setting. Teaching is done with utmost patience and even if you have never even been on a horse, before too long you will be hitting a ball with a stick in one hand whilst controlling the horse with reins in the other!

Wonderful day in a Polo Paradise!. After watching a polo game on the Polo fiels of Palermo ( Buenos Aires), me and my boyfriend decided that we have to try polo ourselves as well! We chose Puesto Viejo after it's good recommendations in Tripadvisor and a reasonable deal for a Polo Day. We were expecting to have a nice day at the countryside of Argentina, but everything turned to be high above our expectations.Puesto Viejo it self, is a beautiful and cozy place. Our polo teacher Julio, was just wonderful. He was a grat teacher and had a great sense of humor, which made learning polo so much fun ( even though it's a tuff way of sport, actually!:).During the polo day we received a great hospitality from the personal of Puesto Viejo. We enjoyed a delicious Argentinan lunch, with other guests, whom also were very nice and made the athmosphere very laidback.I can highly recommen to take one day (or even more:)off from Buenos Aires to have a fun and relaxing day! Even though you don't have previous experience about horses, I can guarantee that you will have one of the greatest experiences in your life! :) Thank you Julio and the rest of the staff of Puesto Viejo! I wish you a really nice continuation of the summer! :)

Spectacular Day. We had the pleasure of visiting Puesto Viejo Estancia with a group from my husband's work. What a spectacular place. From the moment our group was greeted it was all first class. We had welcome drinks and appetizers, along with a wonderful show of dancing. We were then invited to try out some polo lessons or horseback riding or relax and enjoy some croquet. Lunch was then served...an absolutely amazing ASADO. The food was amazing. After lunch we then had the pleasure of watching a polo match. It was definitely a highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. I highly recommend visiting. Great day!!!!

Polo Week at Puesto Viejo. I have just returned from a fantastic week's Polo at Puesto Viejo. The Estancia is beautiful, the hotel rooms were definitely worth 5 stars and the food and hospitality were both excellent. I received fantastic tuition from Chino who is a 6 goal polo pro. Everybody went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable and nothing was too much trouble. Thanks to Jeremy and Liliana, Chino, the two Sabrinas and Natalie and Gaby. I would definitely recommend you to stay here.Steve Boyd

Great experiences, Scenic landscape, Best value. Located about an hour outside of Buenos Aires, Puesto Viejo is perhaps one of the best ways to spend a Saturday or Sunday away from the hustle and bustle of the city and in a serene and calming landscape of the Argentine country. My friends and I were all in Buenos on a 2 month rotation for our jobs and were looking for a weekend adventure, and figured why not give a go at polo. We signed up for a full day polo experience on a Sunday, and let me just say that coming from the US where similar types of experiences could be costly, Puesto Viejo provided a high quality experience at a great value - from transportation to/from Buenos, to the plentiful asado (bbq) at lunch, and finally to the horseback riding and polo playing (or at least our group's ATTEMPT at playing polo), our day had a seemingly event-filled yet relaxing pace. Jeremy and Lily were more than accommodating hosts, and made us feel at home from the coffee and cakes in the morning after being dropped off, to the end of the day celebratory libations before being sent off. Jeremy and Lily were exceptional teachers at polo, and despite our group's relative lack of skill at the game, we were all able to have a good laugh during our practice game. We also got to see a match between one of the Puesto Viejo clubs and a visiting club. Our group was going to play winner, but decided there wasn't enough light left in the day, so decided against it....we'll see you on the pitch another time Puesto Viejo!Thanks guys for an amazing experience and good luck Puesto Viejo in the tournaments this coming polo season!

Great Day in Argentina!. Jeremy and his wife did a fantastic job teaching a bunch of tax accountants polo. There was some skepticism in our group as most of us had no prior riding experience, but Peusto Viejo made us all feel comfortable and got us all hitting a the ball on the horse. The entire day was great from start to finish. Jeremy met us at the ranch and greeted us with coffee and cakes. He taught us to swing a mallet and had us on a horse shortly after our arrival. We practiced hitting the ball while on the horse in the morning and played a match in the afternoon after having lunch and watching Jeremy play in an actual match. The day was capped off with an afternoon beer and a few laughs. Everyone at the club was very friendly and happy to help with anything and everything we needed. Holly did a great job getting pictures of the event for us. Lunch was fantastic. The ambiance and hospitality were unmatched. The grounds were phenomenal and the staff was beyond amazing. I can not recommend this experience enough.

Awesome experience!. We did the polo day and it was so much fun. Gaston was a great teacher and we had a great argentine bbq at the beautiful estancia. Highly recommended to get out of the city and enjoy nature for a day. Bring bug spray though!

I Want to Live There. They picked me up from the city center and when I got there I fell in love with the place. The owner has set up a beautiful location with service and instruction from people who you can tell truly care about their job and the way the do it. Gaston Carrozzo was my instructor and gave me a lot of instruction on how to start off as a first timer and also shared a lot of information about the sport. My friend and I were served a high quality bondiola for lunch, but they were prepared to make a really great vegetarian dish as well if you are not a carnivore. We played and practiced again in the afternoon and had the time of our lives. I spent 7 weeks in Argentina traveling and living in Buenos Aires, but my most memorable day was spent at Puesto Viejo. The only thing you have to worry about their is leaving because you will not want to. My last day in Argentina is tomorrow and I will be spending it at Puesto Viejo for my second and sadly, last Polo Day, but there is no better way to spend my last day.

My first day of Polo!. First time to Argentina and after a week in BA, we took a car to Puesto Viejo for some time in the country. Had always wanted to experience an estancia and see a little Polo firsthand. PV was truly beautiful, and given that it was off season, the owners took us for a long ride around the property to see all manner of bird life (still can't believe the numbers and variety), giant hares, and sights we don't normally see here in Santa Barbara. They also put us on horses for a couple afternoons of Polo and even included their daughters in the game! Thankfully it wasn't filmed so I can recast the memories without any video record to spoil my illusions of grandeur atop Argentina's fastest polo pony. Anyhow, the food was fantastic, the company too. Can't recommend it more highly.

Fantastic excusrsion with all the trimmings!. We were three 50 ish gals from LA and Seattle celebrating the new year in Argentina and because one of us had played polo and worked as a groom in Santa Barbara in her youth we wanted to end our visit with a Polo Day!This excursion met and exceeded all of our expectations! We were picked up from our hotel in BA and driven 45 min to the Beautiful Estancia in time to share a lovely homemade breakfast on the patio with the Lodges actual guests (some of them were ranked Polo players!) before heading off with the patient and talented Gaston to our lessons. We were swinging Polo mallets in no time and having a wonderful time. All the Instructors and help were courteous and accommodating and really demonstrated true love for the animals and the sport. After an intro to stick and ball we had a fabulous BBQ lunch all included ( even the ice cold quilmes ) followed by a leisure siesta hour and half in the infinity pool before wrapping it up with an actual mini polo match. We all wanted to move in and change careers!Irene handled all our questions and scheduling dilemmas to a perfect T!!!

Fantastic day of polo. My group consisted of 2 people that had basically no horse riding experience (1 not being the sports type) and a person with polo playing experience. Gaston was great in handling the different polo experience/athletic experience levels between the 3 of us. We got to see part of a tournament match, which helped the non polo playing members see what it was supposed to look like. It also provided an opportunity to learn some of the rules. The whole day was geared more towards getting people interested in polo and playing polo, rather than just shuttling tourists to a polo activity. On top of the polo, the all you can eat asado complete with sides, dessert, and local wine/beer; the estancia staff; and the estancia dogs were fantastic.

Must do! Amazing Day Learning to Play Polo!. We loved our time at Puesto Viejo with Gaston. The place is incredibly beautiful, and the attention given to us was really perfect. The polo lessons were great, Gaston was very attentive and a very good teacher. Despite never having done any polo, and not been on a horse for over 10 years, we managed to hit the ball trotting after just one day! We were lucky enough to also catch a local tournament's final in between lessons and the asado lunch was just delicious... Hard to have a better day in Buenos Aires, highly recommended!

Great day in the countryside - perfect day trip from BA. So we did a day trip to do the polo day and it was so fun! It was a Saturday and it was very little traffic, so it took one hour from Teatro Colon to the estancia, which was perfect. We were super luck with the weather, it was sunny and nice all day. The asado was fantastic, I particularly enjoyed the sweet breads and the sausage yum! Oh and of course the brownie with ice cream for dessert. (Actually I couldn't decide for my dessert so I had two - panna cotta and brownie!) But of course the polo was the main thing for us and we LOVED it. There were four people total that day and two of us had lots of riding experience, the others a little, and it was really cool, it is totally fine for beginners too. We had a long class in the morning and one in the afternoon and in the second one we even played a game between us. Then we watched a game, as they had a tournament, and then we had tea, beer, cake etc. with the owners. Gaston is a GREAT instructor and we really just laughed the whole day. We were all super sore the next day but SO worth it! Thank you Gaston and everyone!!

EXCELLENT TRIP!! . We stayed at the estancia for 4 days and we are now leaving with a new love for polo even though we had hardly played before. In these 4 days we had a lesson with Gaston every morning where he taught us the basic skills you need. In the afternoon we would play chukkas with some of the other staff or guests as well as getting to watch a proper tournament when one was on. Gaston was a really patient teacher and always very encouraging. All of the staff were extremely friendly and always would say hello even if they had no clue who you were!! Jeremy, the owner, is very welcoming and hugely involved in the estancia, he joined us for dinner and even played with us! The food was amazing and healthy as well which was a bonus! The rooms are lovely and done up very nicely! The polo farm is beautiful and very well kept. The whole experience was one we will never forget and hopefully we will get to repeat it in the coming years!!

Wonderful BA escape, with VIP treatment. From the food, to the attentive polo lesson from Gaston, to the beers with the owners--- this seamless and worry free trip from BA was incredible. Only 1 hour via private car (included) lands you at a breathtaking estate with well cared for horses and a wonderful main house where you are treated warmly and cared for as if you are actually a member of the club.Highly recommended!

A brilliant day of polo. We arrived in the morning and were very soon starting our lesson with Gaston, who was a brilliant teacher. After a delicious lunch we had another lesson before playing a mini chukka with the other guests. It couldn't have been a better day and I only wish I could have stayed longer.

Good time had by all. This was a good day out for all of us. We didn't have much experience of playing polo (and some in our group had not much experience of riding horses) but that didn't seem to bother the team at Puesto Viejo much. Gaston was a really good teacher and with his encouragement we were all soon were able to hit the ball down the field and even at the end of the day play a very amateur game. Food was excellent and the setting lovely. Just sitting out in the afternoon sunshine gave you a feel for the atmosphere of Argentina. This was an excellent day out and we all really enjoyed ourselves.

The best real polo experience you could have... Anywhere. Argentine horses, handsome gauchos, beautiful grounds, fancy food with a vegetarian option and the most fun you could have on the Pampas. Gaston, the host and our instructor was easy to get in touch with. He and the rest of the staff made it such a fun, relaxed, well organise and unique experience. We had ridden before, but it was actually a beginner rider in our small group that eventually out scored all of us. I would recommend this experience to anyone, the horses are perfect and the tuition the best I have had... And I have had a few distracted, pretentious lessons in Australia... This is the real thing. It truly was the most memorable, hilarious and exhausting day of our Buenos Aires. And watching the professionals play as the sunsets over the pampas is amazing.Oh I wish I was there now

Amazing Experience. The entire experience from start to finish was well beyond expectations. Gaston was an amazing teacher and coach who shows great patience and is always positive while giving you the feedback you need to get better. The location was great and food good as well although make sure to not eat too much before spending several hours on a horse. I highly recommend doing a full day polo session with Puesto Viejo. It is a once in a lifetime experience.

Polo Experience in Buenos Aires. This visit to a polo estancia was a real highlight of my visit to Buenos Aires. The grounds are beautifully kept and it was interesting to see all of the polo ponies, one of which, Rosaura, a very gentle mare, was assigned as my steed. Gaston was a wonderful and fun instructor, and I actually hit the ball a few times! In addition, we learned about some of the rules of the game, why Argentine polo is superior to all others, and something about technique (of which I was greatly lacking). I had not been on a horse since I was a girl scout, but the saddle (English) was very comfortable and Gaston carefully guided me through all the moves. What a great time! Then, we were treated to a family style luncheon on the arbored patio o f the hotel and the food never stopped! At first, I thought the lunch was the little pastries (delicious) they call empenadas, and that would have been enough. But, then came salads, chicken, beef, wine, water, and dessert! And, the company was just as wonderful--all from the UK or Argentina (I am an American) and it was interesting hearing points of views from other parts of the world. I would not have missed this outing for anything!

Great time playing polo. I was a complete novice to polo prior to this trip.Gaston was great. Patient, yet able to laugh with us when we deserved it! After short time we played polo live and had a awesome time... the location is spectacular.Make sure you hang out by the pool a little between practice and playing,

Amazing experience. This experience has everything you could wish for a perfect day: Puesto viejo is a beautiful place, that would be worth going just for relaxing, but then you get lovely people, awesome food and the Polo experience on top. I never thought I would be able to ride a horse and swing a stick at the same time, but thanks to the amazing teacher and a great horse I did it. It was a great day with lots of fun. I can recommend it to everybody, even to those who haven't been on a horse yet.

Puesto Viejo: It's a MUST experience near Buenos Aires. Una de las mejores experiencias que una persona puede tener. La calidez y excelencia de la atencion en todos los ambitos de Puesto Viejo y el alto nivel de profesionalismo, especialmente del Polo Instructor Gaston, hacen que un Polo Day en Puesto Viejo sea una experiencia ALTAMENTE RECOMENDABLE para cualquier argentino o turista del mundo que pise suelo Argentino.One of the best experiences I have ever had. Super kindly people all over the club and excellent guest attention added to the high professional level of Polo Instructor Gaston, makes a Puesto Viejo Polo Day a MUST EXPERIENCE for any argentinian or tourist who visit the country.THANKS A LOT PUESTO VIEJO!!!

Best Day of Two Weeks in South America. We used LandingPadBA to book a soccer game in Buenos Aires. I spoke with the owner of LandingPad before the trip and he said 'of the hundred offerings we have in Buenos Aires, Puesto Viejo Full Polo Day is a MUST'. Thank you Jed!We were picked up at a central location in BA at 10am, with a British and a Canadian couple who were wonderful (the British we anticipate staying in touch with!) After a beautiful 45 minute ride we arrived at an alluring polo farm. As a note, I have never been on a horse in my life. In the AM we had polo lessons, covering rules, striking the ball, riding etc. This was followed by a huge asado lunch with every part of the cow chicken and pig you can imagine, and of course bottomless malbec. In the afternoon we played 4v4 polo, with the 6 of us guests, a professional and a local 10 year old (who was of course much better than all of us!) Afterwards, we watched a professional match of the estancia's team in a tournament game. The estancia was beautiful, charming, welcoming - we wish we had stayed the night in their hotel. All of the staff and guests were wonderful! We met the owner, a Brithish expat who unbeknown is an alum of the company I currently work for. He was a gracious host!If you are ever in BA, Puesto Viejo is an absolute MUST. #1 recommendation for the trip. We will absolutely be back!

Best day of our 2 weeks in Argentina!. We booked this Polo day for New Year's Eve & were amazingly welcomed into the owner's family & friends for a beautiful day of Polo match, polo lesson, asauda, carriage ride, pool relaxation in a beautiful estancia 45 minutes from Buenos Aires.Our day started with a beautiful drive to the Estancia when we arrived in the country, little owls were perched on most all of the fence posts as we drove in! We were greeting by Lilliana & Jeremy & Irene & welcomed to cake & tea. We then watched a polo match! We had never seen polo played & it was amazing to watch. We then took a lovely ride with gauchos in a carriage around the property where we saw a lot of birds & wildlife.Next we had a polo lesson where we stood on stools & learned to swing the mallet. Then onto the horses for the real deal!! We don't ride horses often so I was so surprised how quickly we learned & were able to actually swing the mallet & hit the ball!! After our lesson we had a marvelous asaudo & then rested by the pool. Then it was time for the mini match of polo! Jeremy's family was visiting for the holidays so the players in the mini match were children & family members so we were not intimidated by our low skill level! This was really great fun!Then we were welcomed to cheesecake & tea & then back to Buenos Aires.Polo is such a part of the Argentine culture & we were so glad that we were able to spend a day at Puesto Viejo & experience this in such a beautiful setting. We also want to thank Jeremy & Lilliana for letting us be a part of their family day & for being so welcoming! Thank you so much for such an amazing day!

Absolutely Fantastic. My family and i went out for a polo day at Puesto Viejo. It was phenomenal. The instructors were respectful and extremely knowledgeable, speaking quite a few languages if needed. The horses were absolutely magnificent and the polo was fantastic. Having only ridden once before, by the end of the day I played a pretty intense game of polo. I would recommend this to anyone.

HOOKED!. By accident I ended up at Puesto Viejo, having a delicious asado and my first Polo lesson. Without having any luck on horses (they don't seem to move with me on it, I was able to play a polo match after a 30 minute lesson by Chino AND I LOVED IT. The experience is great and Chino knows exactly what you need to do to loose your fear of horses and hit the ball. I had two lessons aftwerwards at different estancias, but they never came close to the one at PV. I will be back!

Argentina + friends = Polo at Puesto Viejo!. We went on a polo day as a group of eight filled with trepidation. My husband was a complete novice, and my last experience was before my twenties – which was a long time ago. We were welcomed with coffee and cake (always a good start, in my book), and then had the pleasure of watching a match from the sideline. It was fast. It was furious. It was a little scary. My husband went very, very quiet. We then climbed up on stools to practice swinging the mallet. Suddenly, most of the people in the group realised that there was something we could do! We connected with the ball! It moved more than a metre from where we were perched on stools! There was hope! Gaston and Jeremy were infinitely patient, correcting our stance (reminding me that I wasn’t playing golf, and that there would be a horse underneath me later in the day). And then – the moment arrived. We met our mounts. We put on our helmets, clambered on the back of sleek, well-cared for horses, and walked at a sedate pace to the polo field. Our initial training was learning the signals to make the horse go, stop, turn left and turn right – which are, I believe, slightly different to ‘normal’ horse riding. Then, we learnt how to swing the mallet. Then, in what seemed like an impossibility just an hour or so before, we learnt how to gallop. Towards a small white ball. Waving a big mallet in the air. It was incredible! At times, we even managed to move on the horse, at a pace, swing the mallet, and connect with the ball!That was enough excitement for one morning. We adjourned for lunch, which was a fantastically filling meat-fest and with more wine than was probably necessary – although of course it was our choice to drink it, and other options were available. We had a couple of hours to relax, before mounting up again and heading out to play a chukka! Each team had the pleasure of a seasoned player to ‘move things along’ – and we were off. It was enormously satisfying to realise that we were, actually, playing polo. Slowly, I grant you, but we were playing nonetheless. With a little help from Santiago and Jeremy, we managed to notch up a couple of goals between us, before turning the horses in for a well-earned rest. We were then given the freedom of the hotel pool until we chose to leave. I cannot wait to return to Puesto Viejo. The service in the hotel was second-to-none. The welcome was warm. The horses are responsive. The trainers are committed. It was an incredible day, and one that I hope to share with guests when they come to Argentina.

Great polo experience in Argentina!. We recently spent the day with a group of friends out at Puesto Viejo for a polo day and what a fantastic day it was! After starting off with an early coffee and tea we watched one of several polo matches going on that day at the club, during which Jeremy explained to us the rules and strategies of the sport. We then had a lesson, first learning to hit the ball standing still and soon later while moving on a horse. After a nice asado we regrouped and actually a played a match amongst ourselves. Truly amazing that after only a couple of hours all the members of our group were actually able to play some polo.We have visited several estancias in the greater Buenos Aires area, but having the chance to actually play polo with no previous experience was amazing. The owner, instructors, and staff were warm and attentive, making sure we got the full Argentine polo experience. Can't wait to go back!

SOOO FUN!!. Planning for my 6-month stay in Buenos Aires, I knew I had to play polo at least once! I found out about Puesto Viejo Polo Days thru Landingpadba.com (they always have great recommendations) and I decided this would be the perfect activity to bring my brother and his girlfriend to when they came to visit. We chose the full-day option and it was SO lovely being away from the hustle and bustle of the city for a day. Gaston is incredibly welcoming and knowledgable about all things polo...and not too bad on the eyes ;). We had so much fun with him! We also met other members of the polo club who were very nice and interesting people. We had a traditional asado with everyone and got to ask them a lot of questions about polo! The polo lessons were fun but definitely tough. I can't say that I was an expert when I left but I hit the ball a lot of times and even learned some trick shots. Although I was sore for 3 days after and I thought I was going to have to cut off my arm it was well worth the pain. My brother wasn't sore so I guess I just have to work on my upper body strength. But I highly recommend this to everyone! Probably better if you have had some experience horseback riding before, it was easier to be comfortable swinging the mallet because I was not worried about falling off the horse

Best group trip ever!. Went on a Polo adventure with 16 friends to Puesto Viejo, a country-chic Estancia in Canuelas, Buenos Aires. The staff is awesome, super caring and guest focused. Started our day with Gaston, the instructor, standing on benches practicing our polo moves. Later went on the horses, beautiful healthy and fit ones. After one hour on the field hitting the ball we had a barbecue and then hit the fields again for and actual polo match. Made 2 teams and after we learned all the rules the polo instructor coached us to have the best group activity of my life. Playing polo in Argentina is not the same if you don't do it in Puesto Viejo. It is a must to all travelers that want to leave the country feeling like a true argentine.

The only polo experience day I would recommend to my guests.. Having just opened a bed and breakfast in Buenos Aires I am acutely aware that any recommendations we make reflect on the guest's whole experience (and their subsequent trip advisor reviews of our hospitality). However, when a couple of guests with very limited riding skills wanted to try a polo day, I was happy to point them in the direction of Puesto Viejo. Given it was a nice day I decided to go with them. I've played polo for 15 years and the great thing about PV is that it has horses for all levels from total schoolmasters to competitive playing horses. In my time I have seen some horrors when people have been put on horses that were not suitable for them (the Argentines often think being able to ride is genetically inbuilt into all humans) so the assurance that PV's English owner has a more balanced view on safety is important. Of course no equestrian activity is risk free, but Gaston makes sure that his pupils pick up the basics quickly and are mounted on something that is not going to frighten them. For me he picked out a horse that was quick and responsive but easy, as I hadn't ridden for a couple of years. My clients were thrilled to be able to actually hit the ball at a jog by the end of a few hours and as one of them was a talented sportsman he ended up hitting further than I can, which led to a good ribbing during the asado and wine that was provided in generous quantities at lunch. Satiated, we sat in the sun on the clubhouse's first floor terrace to watch a practice match and then took a quick dip before making our way back to town. All in all a great day, well organised and in beautiful surroundings.
Best polo day ever!. Can't praise the staff, horses, location, food or attention enough at this place. 5 star attraction, a must for any traveller to Argentina.

If it’s Polo it has to be Puesto Viejo!!. If it’s Argentina it has to be Polo and if it’s Polo it has to be Puesto Viejo!! I have only ridden a few times, last time 10 years ago and was seriously worried about it all being beyond me but the family were keen so I reluctantly agreed. We were picked up on time and it’s really not that far from down town, about an hour or so. Gaston assessed our levels of experience and gave all of us some one on one time to make the most of our different abilities. My reservations about the day faded and we ended up having great family fun, by the finish it even got quite competitive. The lunch (much more my thing) was excellent; we sat under the trees on a spectacular property and soaked up the glorious weather. I also had a quick look round the hotel and wished I’d stayed the night. All in all a great day, I was sore and tired by the time we left but well worth the effort.I am extremely grateful to Gaston and his team for their care and attention but mainly for finding me the right horse!

awesome day outside of the city. My daughter and I were in BA in July, during the winter. We spent a day at Puesto Viejo and would not trade it for anything. As it was the "off season", we were aware ahead of time we probably would not get to observe polo players practicing and Gaston was out of the country during our visit. However, he arranged for us to meet with Emiliano while we were there and he was wonderfully helpful and knowledgeable about polo. He helped us during the morning and by lunchtime, we were trotting the horses and actually hitting the ball with the mallet occasionally! The lunch was wonderful and we dined with other guests in the beautifully ranch house dining room. The afternoon was rained out, so they offered a refund of part of our rate. This is by far a "must" for anyone traveling to BA. You feel like you're far away from the huge city, but it is actually a really easy drive. We would definitely go here again.

Perfect day outside of BA. Warm and friendly welcome at the Polo Club Puesto Viejo. No experience needed to have a load of fun. Excelent service and quality - Staff did a great job and you see that they are all professionals! Delicous lunch in a lovely garden! Will not be the last time at Puesto Viejo for me.

A completely brilliant day. A brilliant day in a wonderful place. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and horses organised to suit ability. I have ridden all my life and I rode on some of the nicest horses here. Gaston the polo instructor a complete joy - really good and so encouraging. He also managed to instruct, play and take photos at the same time! I actually stayed the night before which I recommend as it is very comfortable and you can ride more on the excellent horses. I couldn't recommend it more highly. A complete highlight of my trip to Argentina.
Pro. 5stars for puesto viejo team, excelent quality, excelent polo staff, wonderful country place, and all professional workers

Most Fun Day in BA!!. Hands down the BEST part of our trip to Argentina, which included sightseeing around BA, Iguazu Falls, and skiing in Patagonia. The day includes roundtrip transportation, some of the best food, great Polo action, and most importantly great company. The team at PV are very friendly and hospitable! If you have no polo experience - no worries. The instructors are great and the ponies are very calm. No trip to Buenos Aires is complete without a Day at Puesto Viejo!!

Very good. I was with my family in Argentina and we think we want to try something special typical from Argentina, so we looked for a place to try polo. We found Puesto Viejo in the internett and we decided to go. They sent a car to pick us up in the centre of the city, very nice and easy. It was around one hour to drive. Gaston our teacher met us and we had coffee and talked some about polo before going to try polo. We had one lesson in the morning and it was very nice! I ride horses in Sweden and these horses were very nice. My parents do not ride but they also liked it very much. Then we had lunch, it was typical Argentina asado, very good. It was a lot of food! After lunch we have another lesson and then a small game between the four of us. We won! :) Then we watched a practice game and Gaston explained to us what is happening. I recommend this to other travelers in Buenos Aires, it is very fun and so nice to go to the country from the city. Quiet and beautiful and good food, and Gaston is a super teacher. You can like it very much even if you dont have much experience with horses.

Best decision we made!!. What a sweet day trip. We would do it again for sure! Thanks guys for the awesome time! The experience was defiantly new and exciting. We were glad that we could learn easily and feel comfortable during the excursion.
These guys are the best! Don't miss out.. Great excursion. Even though I've ridden in Texas obviously, playing polo was totally different! Highly suggested. Don't miss it!!

Don't miss it!. Really fun. The food was great and riding the horses was easier than I thought it would be. Many thanks especially to Morgan. It's the people like her who went out of their way to make the day perfect.
Great! Top-notch from food to horses.. Loved it! They pick you up and take you on this awesome day packed with just the right balance of activity and culture. I'm still dreaming about that lunch...

AMAZING. Puesto Viejo is amazing! The venue, the people, the ponies were all exceptional - especially our awesome polo instructor Gaston! PV Polo Days provided for everyone, for those who have never ridden before, to those who were repeat customers!! The atmosphere is very friendly, with the opportunity to watch more fast pace polo provided. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recommend Gaston and Puesto Viejo to anyone. As far as Argentine experiences go - this was my favourite!

Do it!. I love this place! This was such a great experience! I'm coming back as soon as I'm back in Argentina! I was already a guest at the hotel when I decided to do this. When the other PV Polo Day guests arrived we were served tea, coffee and mate together with some delicious cake while being introduced to Gaston (the instructor) and the place. The beginners were taught how to swing the mallet and move in the saddle before we got on the horses. Gaston is a great teacher and the horses they use are amazing, very well trained and extremely patient. Gaston would correct my mistakes and I could feel the improvement after only a few minutes. The beginners learned very fast and they could pretty soon do a full swing! After our first lesson we were served a delicious lunch! After lunch we went to watch Gaston and his team play the semi final in the Farewell Tournament, which they won! It was amazing how fast they played and how well they hit the ball! Throughout the game people around us would explain the game, the faults, the rules etc. and they were so friendly and chatty. After watching the game we got back on the horses again. Before we played our own mini match we did some 'stick and ball' and practiced some tactics and went through the main rules. We played boys against girls. It was so much fun! Obviously the girls won 5-4! Several times during the day we were laughing so much we would almost fall off the horses and for sure miss the ball! I cannot recommend this highly enough. If you're in Argentina you have to try polo. It doesn't matter if you can ride or not, if you've ever sat on a horse, or if you've never tried polo before. Gaston can teach you everything! It's a beautiful place where polo is played at a high level. The people working there are so friendly and helpful and the food is impeccable! I would recommend everyone to stay at the hotel, as I did. It's lovely and so worth it! Jus do it!

Absolutely fantastic..would recommend it to anyone. Had a memorable and thrilling time when I visited Puesto Viejo for a polo day. Having needed no encouragement to try polo for the first time, I was pleasently surprised when I was introduced to my patient and willing pony and my equally patient coach! My coach, who was a pro, spent a great deal of time with each individual, endlessly trying to perfect their swing. Not only this, we had two people in our group who had never ridden before and our coach dedicated his time to building up their confidence on the horse. Once we had spent some time stick and balling, at walk, trot and canter, it was time for a mini match. I thoroughly enjoyed trying to put into practice all we had learnt, with the rules of the sport explained to us.After this, and having said goodbye and a big thank you to the horse, we went to the idyllic hotel for a traditional asado. It was served by charming waitresses and had a big family feel with our coach coming to eat with us, as well as an assortment of hotel guests. The food was to die for. Once lunch finished, we were treated to a polo match and it was a great thrill to understand more of the sport. Thank you very much PV! I hope to return soon.

The perfect way to experience polo. An introduction to polo couldn't be better than this, which includes door to door delivery from Teatro Colon in central Buenos Aires to Puesto Viejo, an estancia near Canuelas. You get to practise your swing with a professional coach, ride the polo ponies and even compete in a mini tournament. A great day out and rounded off with a traditional asado. A true Argentina experience close to the city.

fantastic place to learn or improve polo. The polo day was a brilliant experience, with excellent horses, atmosphere and tuition. Transport from BA and a delicious asado lunch are included making it a cost effective way to get out of the city and experience life on an estancia - you'd struggle to get the same amount of polo for the same price in the UK.Gaston is a patient and enthusiastic instructor who can expertly coach someone who wants to improve their polo at the same time as a complete beginner. He taught me years ago and I specifically came here because he's such a great person to play polo with.One of the best things about the day is that you get to watch the pros play matches at the club and experience the beautiful hotel and impressive clubhouse. I'd definitely recommend the day to anyone who wants to see just why the Argentines love their polo so much and next time I'll stay longer than just the day!

The perfect way to finish a trip to this great country. I was convinced by better educated friends to finish off my long stay in Argentina with an introduction to Polo, and came across this estancia within perfect distance from the airport and BA .This is not an easy sport to learn,but the relaxed atmosphere,where day guest mix easily with professionals and club members,make for a cool experience- highlighted by long social asado dinners where our group had the pleasure of being joined by the host and hostess.I left for the airport with a feeling of having touched a very essential part of Argentinian country living and as such, this was a memorable end to a brilliant trip to the country.In terms of the game itself- and probably thanks to very professional and patient trainers- they do give you a decent introduction and you're actually on a polo pony.Not bad !!

Simply wonderful - lost for words.... We spent all together 3 magical weeks in Argentina and both my boyfriend and I agree that our stay at Puesto Viejo was undoubtedly the highlight of our wonderful stay in this country. Neither my boyfriend now I had experience in playing polo but we always thought the sport fascinating. It already started with our pick-up service in Buenos Aires, our driver was fabulously entertaining. In the morning we then had our first introductory polo lesson followed by a mini game and then a game of the pros of the club. The traditional assado that followed was mouthwateringly delicous!! Even though we were already fit to burst, we didnt want to decline the afternoon tea that followed as it was too good... All in all, the poloday at puesto viejo is the perfect day trip for anyone whose looking for an adventurous and authentic Argentinean experience in outstanding surroundings!

Wow!!. I've been in Argentina for quite a while now, and wanted to do something adventurous and different, yet still near BA. Puesto Viejo Polo Day is exactly that!We arrrived at PV via private transfer, to be welcomed most warmly from a wonderfully international staff. We met Gastón and shared some mate while hearing about the basics of 'the sport of kings'. Then it was off to the field!Gaston is kind and patient and clearly enthusuastic and passionate about his sport! Having had no previous riding experience - never mind hitting a ball with a mallet whilst on a moving horse! - I thought it would be a rather tricky undertaking. But instead of being mortifyingly horrible, i managed to make contact with the ball on quite a few occassions. Gastón makes one feel at ease and the learning, fun!The asado lunch was ample, and the dessert even more so! After lunch, we had time to explore the beautiful estancia. Pristine pitches, a glorious pool, top-class stables... we even went for a carriage ride with Luis! A polo match amongst the club members followed, and what a spectacle that was! Seeing polo happen at such a speed!Thank you for an unforgettable day! I'd highly recommend PVPD for anyone wanting to have a mind-blowing experience!

A very friendly reception at Puesto Viejo. Neither me nor my wife play polo and we are rather too old to learn now but this did not stop us from having a really delightful day at Puesto Viejo. The hotel there is informal and wow what a reception from the staff and owners. A pool and horses all over the place! A new experience for us and so if you don't play polo don't worry go there just the same and have a real fun day. It's less than an hour from BA on a first class road.

A wonderful day in the countryside. My partner and I did the polo day last weekend and it was a fantastic experience. We wanted to do something unique and a little bit adventurous whilst in Argentina (I’d never ridden a horse before) and this ended up being the perfect choice. We chose Puesto Viejo over some of the other polo days that are around because it seemed less “commercial” and, being a fairly new venture, we thought we would get a great service and be welcomed by the staff. That is exactly what happened. Gaston was a fun host, clearly passionate about polo and horses, chatting to us all day about various topics and making us feel totally at home on the estate. We met a few of the hotel guests while relaxing on the property and watching a polo match. One of the staff volunteered to join us to make up a group of 4 so we could play a mini match towards the end of the day. The horses were beautiful and seemed very well cared for. Enjoying the pool and the grounds was very relaxing during our 90 minute down-time after lunch. All combined, this was definitely an experience we will remember and recommend to others.

Really good fun. We were looking round for something to do for a day out of BA when we came across this place. It turned out to be an excellent all round experience for all of us. Great facilities, good tuition, lovely setting and a chance to play polo - I couldn' t believe my luck to have hit upon it. We all agreed that it was great fun and as my son insisted on saying "epic". The food was very tasty and we felt welcomed and looked after throughout our day. I would highly recommend it.

Best day in Argentina. Puesto Viejo Polo Day was my best experience in Argentina. Thanks to the staff at the estancia and their beautiful horses. Gaston is an amazing teacher with a lot of patience and understanding. He makes the day extra special and fun. If at all possible I would be staying at the estancia (as they have a lovely accommodation too) much longer than one day as it was the most fun, fulfilling and memorable day. I would recommend this estancia over any other places in Argentina.

The Unexpected Highlight. My day at Puesto Viejo was the most fun I had on my trip to one of the most enjoyable cities in the world. The estate is gorgeous, the hosts more than welcoming, and the instruction superb. I'd only ridden a horse once before, but after a short tutorial, my group and I were having a ball. I would highly recommend this experience to families, solo travelers, or groups.

Learn to play polo in a day! No experience required... Puesto Viejo's "polo day" offering is a unique combination of excercise, fun, excitement and a challenge, all set in the beautiful surroundings of an Argentine estancia, its amazing... really !! Close to BA and the international airport, the estancia has luxurious amenities such as a swimming pool ( to cool-off in after chukkas..phew ) and carefully prepared, typical Argentine food and hospitality. Previous riding experience is not required, as we found out, indeed those of us who had not ridden a horse before took to the sport more quickly than the accomplished riders amongst us...something to do with having no inhibitions ! The instructors, Chino and Gaston were very patient, speaking both English and Spanish and the horses were calm and patient too!
