After our instruction we watched a full-on polo game from the clubhouse, so got a feel for the speed and skillful nature of the sport, overall a great experience, not to be missed on an Argentine trip.

Dream come true - day of polo and fun. I recently stayed at the charming Estancia at Puesto Viejo, for a few days before travelling extensively around Argentina and Brazil. It was the perfect relaxing start to a trip. Irene and Gaston were so friendly and welcoming, and we had a few rides with Louis on some beautiful horses.The highlight however, was a 'polo' day with Gaston, who is super-friendly and an excellent coach. Morning practice, and an explanation of the rules, ended with an actual 'game' in the afternoon, where Gaston and I were beaten by Team Norway who played superbly!Fabulous food, wonderful horses, a gorgeous setting and a great coach - the perfect polo day out!

Best day in BA. My most memorable day in BA and we weren't even in the city. Learning about polo with Gaston was certainly one of the great highlights of my two month long trip through Chile and Argentina. The level of personal attention certainly sets this day apart from all the other activities I have done. The day starts with a transfer from BA to Puesto Viejo followed by tea, coffee and a selection of small cakes. Soon it is off to the stables to meet the horses and a quick brief on riding and polo. The day is suitable for beginners or for people already comfortable on horseback as Gaston provides excellent individual attention to all of his clients. After the brief there is a one to two hour polo lesson focusing on the basic ball work and horse riding skills used in polo. Up next is a beautiful asado in the tree shaded patio of the hotel with your fellow polo players followed by an hour or so to relax by the pool or take a short stroll. After the high heat of the afternoon passes it is back to the stables, this time to play in your very own polo match. After a great deal of fun playing your own game with any luck you will get to watch the "practica" which is a friendly match among the excellent players who work for or are visiting the estancia. I was amazed at the skill and speed of the game, it is truly a beautiful thing to watch. After more tea (or a nice cold beer) and some good conversation with Gaston and the Puesto Viejo family it is unfortunately time to head back to the city. I promise at the end of the day you won't want to leave! This is a trip not to be missed and the attention to detail and relaxed atmosphere sets Polo Days apart making you feel more like part of their family than a tourist there for a visit. Thanks again for a great day Gaston!

Must do activity in Buenos Aires. The three of us had a great day out at the Puesto Viejo polo club with Gaston. The Polo Day was a full day experience with pickup and drop off from Buenos Aires, two polo lessons, a delicious lunch, time to go bike riding and swimming. We were also lucky enough to watch a polo match even though it is currently their off season. Gaston was very personable and full of interesting stories. We learnt a lot about the sport of polo and mate! We fully recommend Gaston and Puesto Viejo over the other polo day providers. It was definitely value for money and we had a very enjoyable time. Thanks for a great day!L/Z/R

Awesome day trip from BA. Absolutely one of the highlights of my recent trip to Buenos Aires. An outrageously fun experience, excellent food, and incredibly gracious hosts. Gaston was an amazing teacher and it was such a rush to actually play polo. Highly recommend a day trip for anyone visiting BA.

Perfect day trip from Buenos Aires. I recently did the Polo Days with three friends and it was the highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. Puesto Viejo is about an hour drive from the center of the city which makes it a perfect day trip. Even if you have no experience horseback riding, it only takes a few minutes with Gaston (instructor) to get you feeling comfortable and playing polo. This is the perfect way to spend a day outside of the city and will be the most memorable part of your trip.

Don't miss a day at Puesto Viejo!. What a memorable experience! We were in Buenos Aires for only a few days and we're so glad went to Puesto Viejo polo day. It was the perfect way to enjoy the beautiful countryside and experience the amazing challenge of playing polo! Lunch was delicious and Gaston was such a good teacher that my friends and I were able to feel confident hitting the ball by the end of the session. Luckily, Gaston was able to tailor his lessons for beginners so it was was fine that we didn't have experience riding horses. I've shown off my polo photos to friends and family and can't stop talking about the polo day since I've come back home!

Fun, fun, fun!. As you can see from my profile, I like to do some horseback riding when I am on vacation. Last year I rode outside of Buenos Aires and earlier this year I spent two weeks riding in Tuscany. So when I traveled to Argentina again, I knew I had to try polo this time! I decided to stay at Puesto Viejo and to do the Polo Day when I was there. It was fantastic! We started with some mate and some sweets while Gaston told us all sorts of stuff about polo. Then it was time to head to the stables! At first we were instructed in how to hold the mallet and practiced some swings while standing on blocks. Gaston showed us how to swing and how to position our bodies. Hm, how would I transfer this to an actual horse? The next step, of course, was to get on the horse. I rode a beautiful mare named Purita. And off to the field we went! At first I was nervous but after a little while it was just fun and very addictive. Since it was just my friend and I, Gaston gave us lots of personalized instruction. I was sad when the morning session was over! We then ate a delicious lunch with Gaston and other hotel guests before spending some time at the pool. (I stayed away from the wine since I figured it wouldn't be very helpful for my riding!) After lunch we watched a polo game as there was a tournament going on at the time. It was crazy to see the real pros doing this! Gaston was playing as well and wow, he is not only a great teacher but an awesome professional player... Then it was our turn! We went back to the stables and headed to the field. After some more practice, Gaston staged a little mini match for us. He brought in Juanchi, a fifteen year old who was already really good! I had the honor of playing with Gaston and yay we won! My friend will never get over it! Our day was so much fun and I can't thank Gaston enough. He is warm and friendly and made us very much at ease, plus he made us laugh a lot! He is a real star. Plus, of course, the fact that even though he is an international pro polo player, he still has all sorts of patience for people like me! The people in the stables were also great, gracias Luis, Julio, Matias! This was the total highlight of my trip and I recommend it to everybody.

One of the best things I've done!. I had such a great time with Gaston (polo instructor) the staff and other Guests that I decided to stay longer at Puesto Viejo! Gaston picked me up from the city promptly and by the time I had arrived at Puesto Viejo it felt like I had known him for years. We then had morning tea and then a polo lesson, followed by a lovely asado(barbecue) lunch. Free time in between polo lessons was spent at the infinity pool overlooking the polo grounds. The highlight of the day was the little mini match in the afternoon where I couldn't keep the smile off my face! Everyone seemed to have a fantastic time from total beginner to more experienced riders. I would thoroughly recommend Puesto Viejo Polo Days to anyone!Thankyou to Gaston and all the staff for such a great time!

AMAZING - will definitely be going back!!!. I have been to Argentina a number of times to play polo but my visit to the Puesto Viejo Estancia was just the best. They were so welcoming and I felt like I was at home right away.I was taught by Gaston who was incredible. He was a great teacher and really explained things well to me. He has infinite amount of patience and a great way of getting you to play so much better in a short space of time. I really enjoyed the chukkas with the other guests, Gaston and some other professionals. They were great fun and I really felt that my polo improved immensely!I would recommend Puesto Viejo Estancia to anyone from beginner up to playing higher level polo. For a fun, exciting and thoroughly enjoyable polo experience there is no where i would rather be!Hope to see you next year, it cant come quick enough! K x

Highlight of Argentina Trip. Puesto Viejo is an incredible Polo facility with incredible service. Having zero Polo experience (or horse riding knowledge), Gaston (our instructor) was a great coach and ambassador of the game/community! By the end of the day, we were all scrimmaging against each other. Overall, this was an exceptional experience and great chance to try a unique game. Additionally, the food & wine was fantastic, the infinity pool over looking the Polo grounds was amazing, and the service was A+.Thank you Gaston and team,-Cooper

Exceptional!!!!. The polo at Puesto was absolutely fantastic! From the moment I arrived I felt instantly welcome and at ease. Gaston is a fantastic instructor, extremely patient and knowledgeable and nothing is too much trouble. The variety and standard of the polo ponies was second to none and the organisation of the polo timetable was fantastic. I will definitely be going back! Thank you Gaston and all at Puesto Viejo who made my polo experience so memorable!

Exceptional Experience!. As others have said, this was a highlight of our trip to South America. We were picked up promptly in BA and driven out to the beautiful countryside surrounding Puesto Viejo. Although it had been raining hard that morning, the weather began to clear by the time we were graciously served mate, tea, coffee, and pastries on the beautiful terrace. Within minutes you feel you have known Gaston for years as he explains the history of the estancia and polo. After a tour of the property, Gaston took us to the barn where we became familiar with the sticks and swing techniques. Once on the field, Gaston worked with us until we were all feeling pretty good about our abilities to perform basic polo moves. At lunch time we went back to the house and were served an incredible asado on the terrace. As we sipped Argentine wine, Gaston talked us through the rules of polo.Following lunch we strolled around the property and admired the gardens, pool, and guestrooms. That afternoon, we actually played a match. How Gaston can teach absolute beginners to be playing a match in one day is still a mystery to me. Following our match, we sat in the garden and were served tea, mate, and pastries as we laughed about our adventure. What an experience. The most difficult thing about the entire experience was leaving Puesto Viejo. Gaston, Eirin, and everyone on the property went out of their way to make everything perfect. We cannot wait to return.

This is an amazing chance to experience polo in Argentina. Everything was perfect from beginning to end, which was a tribue to all of the staff who made the day such a unforgettable experience. From the moment I was picked up by Gaston my instructor who is genuinely patient, incredably knowledgable and kind, I knew I was in safe hands, he was very informative about the game and answered my concerns and questions all in perfect English which was comforting. All the horses were lovely natured but very responsive and the grooms patient and kind. I would recommend this day as a escape from the city to anyone and an unmissable argentine experience.

What an amazing unique experience. During my trip to Argentina i wanted to experience polo in a real estancia I couldn't have asked for a more welcoming place to spend ItWe were picked up promptly by a private hire car in the morning which took us on the journey to the estancia where on arrival we had a warm welcome by Gaston and the staff. Then with welcome drinks and snacks he talked us through what to expect of the day and about the basics of polo. Once we had settled in we then went to the stables to meet the horses and how to hit the ball and riding for polo and the tricks of the trade. After a well earned, very welcome, traditional asado lunch with some lovely Argentinian wine, we watched 'real' experianced polo players play before we remarkably played in a 'mini match' even managing to hit the ball a few times, something that I wouldn't have thought possible before!Gastons English, patience and teaching skills were impeccable along with all the staff, I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this as an unforgettable experience, if you are a beginner or experianced rider. I cannot wait to visit again!!

A fun day out in the country. Gaston met us at an easy-to-find location and took us to the estancia while informing us about polo and what to expect. The international staff was friendly and welcoming, and we enjoyed homemade goodies and drinks before our first polo lesson. Even though Gaston is a polo player of high caliber, he was patient and courteous to us beginners. We walked our willing horses through the basics which require a degree of coordination we didn't expect. After the lesson we joined other guests for a sumptuous lunch under the trees, followed by a pool swim. Another round on the horses followed, easier this time. Then from the balcony of the clubhouse we were enthralled by Gaston and other players on the fields really playing hard. It was a great day and we highly recommend this exculsion.

Best Experience I had in Argentina!. The Polo Days experience at Puesto Viejo was the most fun I had while in Argentina. The day is an EXPERIENCE, carefully crafted for maximum immersion and enjoyment.The whole staff is wonderful. Gaston is a skilled player, but more importantly an effective, patient teacher. His English is very, very good; and he is very personable.The grounds are a relaxing departure from B.A. and the food served is magnificent.The owner is quite personable as well.The day is tea, lesson, lunch, pool time, watch a game, play a mini game, and tea again. Personal car service is included. If you want a full immersion polo experience, this is the one. Incredible experience and a great value! My only regret is not spending the night at the hotel.

Great day out!. Our only previous experience of being on a horse is a couple of fairly sedate treks, both in Patagonia so this really was a new experience. Picked up from Buenos Aires by private hire car we were welcomed at Puesto Viejo by Gaston and explained that we would play a Polo match after lunch. This seemed a flight of fancy but sure enough, after a morning's lesson (and a good lunch with wine or soft drinks) we took part in a match that would probably have the great Cambiaso clutching his sides but nevertheless we stayed up top and managed to hit the ball whilst moving.....this we considered an achievement for beginners. Before this we spent a very lazy hour and a half watching real polo players in a competitive game from the comfort of the infinity swimming pool. Believe me, on a sunny day, life doesn't get much better. Gaston was brilliant, tolerant and a great teacher. Great guy also, he has played polo in UK so speaks good English. We would not hesitate to recommend this as a day out, the surroundings are beautiful. Great variety of bird life, we saw more species here than we did trekking in Bariloche! No experience required, the horses are gentle and understanding and the tuition follows suit.

What a day!. That was a truly fun and memorable experience! Getting us on a horse? and holding a plank!! It must rate as a highspot of our visit. Gaston was delightful and truly inspired confidence even for us middle aged women!!!The staff were friendly and helpful and I am going back!

More joy at PV. Went back to PV for our, oh I don't remember 12th maybe,time! Had a blast as always. This time however we really enjoyed some major improvements that the owners have made to the hotel ..... it really is better than ever. Cannot wait to come back again .... keep up th good work PV.

The Real Deal. As an American living in Buenos Aires, I was a bit weary to take my sister, who was visiting from the US, to what I thought would be at least somewhat of a tourist trap. Boy I could not have been more wrong! As polo and riding novices, Gaston was incredibly patient with us and really made the lesson fun. If you're looking for a great day trip from Buenos Aires, friendly, knowledgable people, lovely grounds and an authentic polo experience, then look no further than Puesto Viejo. I'll surely be coming back with all my future visitors as it is truly a unique and wonderful experience.

Wonderfull experience. If you have a whole day to spare in Buenos Aires definitely a must do. We had a lovely day in this very special polo club with great atmosphere. Nice people, good lunch and beautiful setting with around 200 horses. We came with two a little more experienced riders and two total beginners and at the end of the day all played a small match of Polo against each other. We definitely recommend this experience and Gaston our guide and coach. Thanks for the great day!

Fun and unique experience.... It was a great day from the start. The weather was lovely and I took it as a good sign when Gaston and I met exactly as we discussed despite the adjustments we had to make. The drive wasn't too long and the Estancia is a lovely escape from the bustle of the city. It is a simple enclave, designed just like an estancia from the outside, but with cozy and warm features inside. The people I met and mostly interacted with (Holly, Angie, & Lee) were very kind and welcoming. The lunch was overall, the best meal I had in Argentina. Gaston's a very patient instructor and our lesson was good fun. He explained a lot about polo which helped a bit while I watched the matches. I didn't think I would enjoy it as much (since it's rather an intimidating sport), but I really did. When my travels take me back, I will definitely come around again.

A gorgeous day in the BA countryside experiencing polo. You cannot turn down this opportunity to experience polo in Argentina. Gaston is utterly charming; genuinely kind, patient, instructive and informative ( &not just about polo!). Everything was so easy from beginning to end, so thank you to ALL the staff who made the day so lovely ( both front of house and beyond- kitchen staff, grooms included). We had instruction both in the morning and afternoon interrupted by a wonderful lunch where it would have been SO easy to finish the bottle but I knew I had to get back on the horse!  You 're in utterly safe hands with Gaston on the polo field (and the drive to & from BsAs) Thank you for your enthusiasm and encouragement as I assertively missed 90% of my attempts! The chat certainly gets going with maté Gracias a todosBrigid

The best day in Argentina so far. I have just spent the day at this ranch with my friend, neither of us have ever played polo before and both of us are novice riders. It was Fantastic! The organization of the day was easy, we were picked up and dropped off (to our door out of kindness) by Gaston, our charming and interesting teacher. He is a professional polo player and taught us much about the game. Throughout the day he was very attentive as were the rest of the staff, Angelis, Holly and the owner Jeremy, who all took time to talk with us and laugh about the aching muscles and very sore bones at the end of the day! If you don't ride or speak Spanish, don't worry this team is highly skilled and very able to support or challenge as needed. We were served traditional Argentinian food and wine made especially for Puesto Viejo (malbec-very tasty) all included in the very reasonable price. I absolutely recommend this experience. Gaston is a gem and made us feel great even when we spectacularly missed the ball completely!

WOW-best Polo experience EVER. If you want to spend an AWESOME day, you HAVE to go to the Polo-day or weekend. Not only will you learn how to play polo, you will also enjoy pretty landscapes, beautiful horses, really tasty food and the professional trainer Gaston and the other members of the stuff are really nice, speak many languages, care about you and make the experience perfect. You will also have a lot of fun - we laughed the whole day and really enjoyed it. The service is amazing, Gaston even picks you up and brings you back to Buenos Aires driving safely and sharing his polo experiences with you. The place is beautiful and everything is clean and nice. You even get fresh Argentinian Mate. I would repeat this experience anytime and really recommend you to try it out- you won't want to leave at the end of the day!!

Just one more reason to love Argentina. While spending the past two and half months in Argentina, learning to play polo was one of my top 'to dos'. After shopping around and talking to people in the know, Puesto Viejo appeared to offer everything I was looking for. So much so that I returned on four separate occasions and loved every minute of it. Gaston was a hugely fun, patient and knowledgable instructor and the beautiful surroundings and great food only added to an already super experience. This is a must-do activity for experienced and beginner riders a like!

The best Polo experience in BA. If you´re looking for a Polo-day or a weekend this is THE place to go. I had an amazing time there learning the basics of Polo very quickly while having lots of fun. The trainers, the Club and the equipment is highly professional while creating a very fun and exciting athmosphere.I can recommend this experience to everyone whether they have ever been on a horse or not. I went there as a complete beginner and was fascinated by the fact that at the end of the day we could even play a little match for fun. Pro: Trainers / equipment / food / fun & locationContra: Non - honestly, there is not a single thing I could complain about.

Amazing day!. The polo day at puerto viejo with Gaston was unsurpassable. We were a group of 8, Gaston Picked us up at the hotel, we rode some great horses in an amazing place. Gaston did an excelent job teaching us how to play. We had a spectacular asado with wine. We then played a very fun informal game to end the day. The ranch is beautifull. I can't recommend this enough everything was perfect. Thank you!

First class experience. Coming from Australia and having both ridden horses my daughter Cecilia who is 13 and myself had an amazing day at Puesto Viejo ...I had a fall earlier this year and fractured a vertebra and my daughter ,s pony had passed away with illness so we were tentative but once we met Gaston all that disappeared , we learnt the basics of polo we laughed and totally enjoyed our 2goals and had the best time . The lunch was superb empanadas, beef wine and we loved Angeles we felt so comfortable and well looked after. After lunch Gaston gave us a golf buggy and we buzzed all over the farm to the stables ..horses were excellent.Cecilia fell in love with Gastons dog we didn't want to leave coming back next year for a week. Anyone visiting Beunos Aries should not miss a polo day or days at Puesto Veijo

What a fantastic day!!!. Polo at Puesto Viejo was the highlight of our trip. The beautiful ranch, the fantastic staff, the calm horses and the excellent food made for a perfect day. Even if you have never ridden a horse, Gaston can teach you to manage the stick, hit the ball and not fall off the horse and break a hip.....all in one training session. Our four teenage kids look forward to following the polo career of Gaston, our instructor. We can't wait to go back!

Must do experience when visiting BA for a day out!. If you want to taste the real Argentinian culture this is your opportunity! We got highly recommended Polo day at Puesto Viejo by people we met traveling in Patagonia exchanging ideas and tips about things to do in BA. We love traveling and experiencing the real culture by locals and this was of the best we ever had. Great set up at Puesto Viejo farm with very knowledgable and polo passionate player/ instructor Gaston. Lovely staff members who looked after us and served us excellent food and drinks the whole day. We had morning and afternoon polo lessons finishing with a short game against an other couple :). Fun! We also watched few club members playing, showing us how the real deals is done.Thank you Gaston and staff for your hospitality, service, and fun we had today! Loved every minute! Veronika and Marek

Great first polo experience. A great day out. Gives a chance to get out of Buenos Aires into the most beautiful flat countryside and experience the thrills of polo. Gaston was a great teacher and a really nice guy. We had a lesson in the morning and then played a mini match in the afternoon. The horses were great - very well schooled to put up with novices swinging the sticks around haphazardly!I wish we could have seen a practice match but it was out of season so couldn't be helped. The food was delicious and loads of it. I would really recommend this day to anyone who wants to have a go at polo for the first time whether or not they are a rider (I am a fairly experienced rider and still really enjoyed it). Highly recommended.

Wonderful place, fantastic day - must do in Buenos Aires!. My boyfriend and I did a polo day at this estancia and as with the other reviews, from start to finish this is an absolutely fantastic day. Gaston is an absolute legend! He is a lovely guy, extremely patient (which was needed – neither of us had any riding experience) and a really good teacher – hard to believe that he takes people with no riding experience and has them in a polo match by the end of the day! The estancia is really beautiful and as it is actually a polo club so we got to watch professionals playing which was pretty incredible. The horses are beautiful and obviously well trained to deal with all levels of experience. Finally the food was delicious – so all in all a brilliant day out!I would highly recommend this to anyone – thank you so much!

Argentine Polo/Asado weekend. By far the best weekend in Argentina so far. Puesto Viejo offers opportunities to experience Argentina as it is meant to be. My first day was an absolute chill-out day; swimming in the pool, having amazing food, horse-back riding, and of course enjoying the sun. The second day was the best polo day I ever experienced in my life. There were many instructors to help everyone learning how to play polo. In the evening I enjoyed the traditional Argentine asado. The rooms are very comfortable too. Do not miss out on Puesto Viejo!

Highlight of our trip. We spent two weeks in Argentina and the PV polo day was the highlight of our trip. We had a lesson in the morning (Gaston is a total star instructor), a delicious lunch, watched a practice match in the afternoon and then had a go at playing ourselves, The pool looked amazing but we ran out of time for a swim.My only tip would be not to wait until your last day in Argentina to go to Puesto Viejo like we did because you won't want to leave! Would be great to spend a week there next time I'm in BA.

Amazing day of polo. I had the most amazing day, from start to finish. Our polo instructor Gaston was incredibly friendly and good at teaching, the horses were also very good.The food was very tasty, a traditional asado and mate tea. The day gave me not only great polo, but also a feel of the argentine culture.I will if I get the chance, go back and stay for more than just a day =)

VU University students Love Polo. Puesto Viejo Polo Days was really great. First we had to practice on tree trunks with the technique on hitting the ball. Than we went on the horses. There were a lot of instructors who helped us with the technique of hitting the ball, horse back riding etc. They take the time and are really nice. After a delicious lunch we played a match against each other. It was a lot of fun. The owners are really nice and very flexible. Tip: One tip that I can give you, is that it is better when you have practiced with horse back riding the day before, because then you can enjoy it even more. Enjoy!!

A perfect polo day. The polo day in Puesto Viejo was one of the most exciting activities I did during my trip to Buenos Aires. Just an hour away from the busy city centre, you can find yourself in a total different world. After the traditional "mate" welcome drink we got ready to get on the horses. Gaston, our lovely polo instructor, introduced us to the very basics of polo and we all successfully managed to hit some balls!!! After a refreshing swim in the pool we enjoyed a typical delicious asado with lots of meat. Our "mini-match" in the afternoon was very exciting and after that we were able to watch a full-speed match between club members. Thanks to all of that, and manly Gastons patience and ability to teach, our day was just perfect!!

Also great with groups!. We had a group polo lesson with about 10 of us. Even though most of us had zero experience with polo or with horse riding, it was still a great deal of fun! First we were taught how to swing the polo stick and before we knew it we were sitting on a horse riding around - slowly;) - hitting the ball. In the afternoon we did a mini-match which was a good deal of fun as well. Great way to experience this typical Argentine sport.

Gringa plays polo. It was so much fun, I went back again. Gaston is a very good teacher and managed to get my husband up on a horse. By the end of the day he was playing better than me! Fantastic time in the country. Fresh air. Unpretentious. Great adventure with very little commitment. I can't wait to go back.

A New Found Love - Polo Days At Puesto Viejo Estancia. What an amazing experience to learn polo with some Argentina's highest handicap and professional players. Puesto Viejo Estancia is set on an exquisite farm land only an hour from the centre of Buenos Aires. The day begins with the traditional Mate` being shared around whilst Gaston the Polo instructor warmly welcomes everyone to this infamous Argentinian sport.We saddle up on our horses suitably chosen for our riding skills and head to the field to hone our swinging technique... not as easy as golf, tennis or cricket. Gaston reminds us to relax and let the stick swing like a pendulum. A break for an amazing BBQ lunch under the trees, followed by a swim in the divine pool is the perfect way to gear up for the afternoon's lessons/practice match.If you're lucky enough you may get to see some of the professional 2-6 goal players battle it out on the field!As the sun is setting your escort back to Buenos Aires awaits and you wish you had of booked a whole weeks stay on the estancia.Polo Days At Puesto Viejo Estancia with Gaston Carrozzo was the highlight of our stay in Buenos Aires without a doubt.

Try polo with Gaston and have a ball. If you visit Argentina you must try polo. A day out with Gaston at Puesto Viejo was just the best. Gaston speaks perfect English and is so enthusiastic - he just wants you to be safe and have fun. You get to see the stables which are awesome and to ride real polo ponies - I have ridden a bit and loved it but even absolute beginners will have a great time. Puesto Viejo is a lovely spot with good food, a fantastic swimming pool for a rest between riding sessions and very welcoming people. As a real bonus we got to see the professionals and club members play properly before we were driven back to BA - I strongly recommend it for anyone who likes the countryside and is curious about polo.

City slicker and ignorant of all sports - highest scoring player on the field? Yes, indeed.. I had the lowest expectations possible for my performance on the polo-field. I had never been on a horse before and I barely know how to spell "sports" but with amazing polo-ponnies and very good instructions i managed to reach my most optimistic goal for the day - to stay on the horse and hold the stick and make the horse move. But not only that, I managed to hit the ball and make 4 goals! Amazing. I had a very great time that day, amazing food and really nice company. Getting out of the city and enjoying the serenity of the countryside was like therapy, even for a guy who usually doesn't leave the favorite barrio Palermo. While being in Argentina, it feels like a genuine experience to try on one of the things that they do best, Polo. Puesto Viejo was very professional with service and handling foreigners, bilingual staff and very responsive to customer needs - it made the whole venture out of the city to be very smooth and without hazzle.

Amazing experience. I decided to try a polo day at Puesto Viejo with Gaston Carozzo and Im glad I did. Gaston picked me up form Buenos Aires an took me to the estancia. We first started with a lesson. I rode a wonderful pony which was love at first sight. She was so easy and responsive, so I could really concentrate on perfecting my swing. After our lesson we had lunch, an argentine assardo. The meat was perfect!! It was also lovely been able to sit in a relaxing atmosphere with the other guests at Puesto Viejo, and really take the beauty of the place in. The afternoon consisted of instructional chukkas with other guests, Gaston and some other professional players. Again my ponies were awesome and Gaston and the other professional players were helpful, giving instruction and keeping the game open. To finish the day off, Gaston took us to watch one of the games at Puesto Viejo. Gaston was explaining all of the game plays and tactics that they were playing which was very interesting and inspiring.I would give Gaston, and puerto Viejo 5 stars and I will be definitely be going back next year!!! I think I may have to make it a week long stay!!

If you want a truly joyful, educational, tailored experience be sure to book with Joy. Joy is delightful, knowledgeable, flexible, fun and she tailored the tour to our interests and timeline. We had two great half days with her. We loved the walking tours using public transportation in areas we were interested in. From airport pick up by Franco - with bottled water, chocolates, map and welcome note - to the tour itself, everything was perfect. What a delightful entrepreneur who will, hopefully, continue to thrive. We will definitely book with her again!!

Lots of love for Joy. On top of getting to travel with my mom, turning 30, and getting engaged, we had the trip of a lifetime thanks to Joy. All of these memories combined made us fall in love with her city, Buenos Aires. Her knowledge and storytelling kept us intrigued and she had just the right amount of energy to keep us going throughout the day. She is even a chef (on top of a number of other talents) and invited us into her home to cook a special meal, a highlight and unique touch to our trip. I could go on and on about Joy—for someone that was hesitant to use such a service (thinking we could do it all on our own) I walked away very thankful for having Joy with us in BA. Thank you, Joy!! Until we meet again, xoxo.

The Best Tour Guide EVER!!!!. I had a great experience with Joy as my tour guide in Buenos Aires. She made me feel so comfortable immediately, like a family member. We explored the city together and she was very knowledgeable of the history of the city. She provided an accurate, detailed explanation of each historical landmark. I had many opportunities to ask questions, try local foods, take pictures, and go shopping! I never felt like an "out of place American". She made me feel like I was an true Argentinian. I highly recommend her as a fabulous tour guide. She was so much more than a tour guide. She was like family! You will love her!!!! :-)

Excellent cooking workshop!. What a great experience! We made delicious empanadas and alfajores from scratch - Joy is a great teacher, very warm and friendly and knowledgeable about all things Argentina and Buenos Aires. Was also very helpful with tips and ideas for the rest of our trip. Great way to learn about Argentina while enjoying good food and wine. Highly recommended!

Can't imagine a better introduction to Buenos Aires. Joy was a wonderful guide. She met me at the apartment I had rented and after a few questions about my interests we were off. We walked and took buses around the city. Because it was a Saturday, traffic was light and the bus rides were fast. Joy is very knowledgeable about her city and is proud to show it off. At times, I think she was having a better time than I was... And I was having an amazing time. She really seems to enjoy her job and it shows. This experience was the polar opposite of a tour with a guide reciting a boring script. I was introduced to many different areas of the city and learned about their history along the way. After my day with Joy, I was confident to explore the city on my own. If you are planning a visit To Buenos Aires, I highly recommend hiring Joy to show you around.

Joy made Buenos Aires come alive for us !. My wife and I went to BA for 3-weeks and the 1st 3-days were spent with Joy (2 of the Days were 1/2 Day Tours and then on July 9th (their Independence Day) we did a separate Tour to enjoy & begin to understand their Special Day). I would really recommend that (if you have the time) 2 1/2-Days is the way to see and learn Buenos Aires . . . .and Joy is the person to do it, she knows and loves Buenos Aires and it's history!Even after the Tours, Joy offered us help and some advice to make sure that our overall experience was perfect !!!!!!!!!!!!!!All-in-all, this is the best Tour we have ever taken . . . . and we have traveled and toured the world.

If you need someone to show you around....... Joy by name and joy by nature. Lovely bubbly personality joy was very helpful when I found myself with a Credit card that wouldn't work in the regular bank machines. Once we had that problem sorted we set out on our city tour. Her knowledge, enthusiasm and advice were very much appreciated. In fact her helpful notes and tips about where to go in my free time gave me the confidence to explore on my own.

Only if you want genuine warmth & knowledge. From the time we met Joy at our hotel in Palermo we experienced genuine warmth, an unhurried tour by taxi, walking and bus along with plenty of knowledge about BA and Argentina as well as personal conversation. I wish we had the opportunity to spend more time with Joy but she is so popular we could not. As it was Joy gave us much more than the time we had booked. What a delight she is and what a perfect way to spend our first day in Buenos Aires. Thanks Joy and we highly recommend you to anybody who wants a great and personal experience. Frank & Gillian Swanberg, Auckland, New Zealand

Don't miss the Joy opportunity !!!!!!. My husband and I have traveled extensively and no tour has come close to providing so much fun, local color, insight into a country's people and history as well as assistance!!!!!! Joy immersed us in local color with a trip to watch the sortija (a wonderful weekly competition by caballeros on horseback), a BBQ with all the traditional foods, and people dancing in the street on Independence Day.She showed us the way to take the metro and bus, helped us buy our cards to use on both methods of transportation and advised us of any cautions necessary. She is a delightful young woman who has contacted us several times since the end of our full day and 2 half days of tours, just to be sure things are going well for us. I cannot recommend her tour company more highly. It was truly a Joy!!!!!!!!Sharon UptonScottsdale AZ

History and walking!!. Did a walking tour with Joy while traveling solo pre cruise. She was not only a delightful person but her knowledge of the history of Argentina added to the pleasure of the tour. We walked, rode a bus, and I definitely got my ten thousand steps in! Price was affordable.

Friendly and knowledgeable tour guide. My daughter and I took an extensive walking tour with Joy through Buenos Aires. Because our time was short, we needed to be strategic. She made sure that we got to see what we wanted to see by talking through what we had already done. Each half day, she would present an itinerary and was easily able to adapt to our needs. She is very personable and loves to teach about the history and the culture of the city. She has favorite stops for empanadas, ice cream and a very special view of the city.

Absolutely wonderful....highly recommend Joy as BA's finest local guide!. I started my South American Dream in Buenos Aires. Joy was the 1st lady to be recommended as a truly awesome local guide. She didn't disappoint. Often, city tours can become boring & disengaging after a while, this was different. From start to finish (honestly didn't want tour to end) she was wonderful. Joy is so passionate about her city. By the end of the tour, I had inherited some of that enthusiasm & love of Buenos Aires. I would highly recommend Joy's tours to all types of traveller, as she caters for your needs. You come up with the route together. Perfecto!

Absolutely Fantastic!!!. Love Joy and highly recommend her to anyone that visits Argentina. We have travelled with many personal guides. The difference between the excellent and the average is the attention to details. Joy had every detail covered from secured taxis to local eateries. Her enthusiasm and love for her country exudes whilst on her tour. We also attended her drum workshop with Diego as he instructor. Love Love Love!! Thank you Joy for sharing a bit of your country.

Can't wait to see what tomorrow brings. Just returned from a day of exploring Buenos Aires with Joy. From the moment we were met at the airport this morning and transported to our hotel where she met us, everything Joy has arranged has been perfect and hassle free. She cheerfully accompanied us to exchange money and pick up opera tickets in addition to showing us the sights of her beloved city. Franco, her driver, skillfully navigated the city and was somehow always able to drop us off and pick us up steps from where we needed to be making the day very efficient.Joy's flexibility and enthusiasm were a bonus.With the basics under our belt we are looking forward to some "off the beaten path" adventures with Joy tomorrow.Advanced communication with Joy was easy and her prices seem quite fair.It is always a special and rare treat to find a knowledgeable local to show you a city as though you were an old friend visiting. That is Joy.

What a Joy! . We went to her cooking workshop and made empanadas and alfajores. I had been in Argentina for almost 3 weeks and these were by far the best empanadas I had tasted! And I made them myself!! Joy is such a wonderful character and this is definitely the real Argentinian experience. Such good value for money and if I were here for longer would have definitely booked more with her. Thank you Joy! I will be making all things Argentinian when I get home! :)

amazing experience. We had great time in Buenos Aires with Joy.Before we arrived in BA Joy emailed us that the weather is not promising for the day that we booked the tour and suggested that we move it to the next day.Because it supposed to be raining she had a few other options for rainy day and we choose cooking workshop with her. It was amazing, we made some empanadas (the best I've ever had)and few other things. We had some wine, we ate what we have made and we chat all day long. It was great introduction to the city tour on following day as we discussed a bit more about the Argentinian history, food, customs, music. We share some mate tea and to be honest we talked about just anything.The following day we had a city tour with Joy.We've seen amazing places, we found out great facts from Argentinian history, we had some great food and all with a lot of fun.We'll recommend Joy to anyone. She is very professional and passionate about what she does.

Joy, as the name implies…. Joy and her refreshing as well as enthusiastic nature gave us a marvelous one-day walking tour around Buenos Aires. As a local, Joy was able to give us a great insight of the history and culture of the city and the people (Porteños). Taking the local buses and walking to the sights was so much fun.I highly recommend Joy as a tour guide. Thank you for the great day!

And what a Joy she is! . Had a fabulous day with Joy as she whizzed us around her wonderful city. Joy really brings her city tour to life with her energy and her enthusiasm. In her own words, she's genuinely there because she wants to be - and it shows. She had an answer for everything and wasn't scared to give us all the details on the city's past, however unsettling some stories may be. She was great at highlighting links between certain sites and tying up the city's history for us. She was happy to create a personalised tour for us, encompassing all the sites we specifically wanted to see. She was a lot of fun and just radiates - well - joy! She is an absolute pleasure and I could not recommend a day with her enough! Happy touring guys :)

Enthusiastic and nice guide!. We sent to Buenos Aires with only a few days before moving on, and one day with Joy gave us a great overview over the city and its history! Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic guide, top notch!
Such a good tour! . Joy was great showing us around buenos Aires. We saw so much and got so much info. I really felt I saw buenos Aires at its best!

City Tour. Joy customised a days walking tour for our group which covered all the highlights of Buenos Aires. She is enthusiastic and super fun. Taking us on local buses and walking to the key sites as well as some off the beaten track. Joy is extremely knowledgeable and gave us great insight to the history of Argentina from a locals point of view, all the while with a big smile in her face. She was thoroughly engaging and Informative. I could have happily listened to her and talked to her all day! Hoping to do some more tours with Joy when I am back in Buenos Aires next week. Thanks Joy for an awesome day and fantastic introduction to your home town.

Excellent tour guide! . Joy is a proud porteño which makes a very captivating tour guide.She will take you around the different areas of La Boca, San Telmo, Recoleta and more, giving you a great insight into the past and present of Buenos Aires and its way of life. A combination of walking and taking local buses to the different areas makes for a great way to see the sights .I would recommend Joy of Buenos Aires to anyone wanting to get to know the sights and the history behind it all. 5/5Thanks for a wonderful day, Joy!

A great tailor made city tour!. We were a group of 12 from Iceland. Joy arranged our pick up from the airport and an excellent city tour with in her company. At night we had a marvellous tango show. Joy is an excellent and trustful guide, a real pro! She makes tailor made tours according to the wishes and time people have. Everything went as she planned and We had an exceptional time in her company!

Such a great Buenos Aires insight!. Joy is a young girl from Buenos Aires who offers different types of Tours in Buenos Aires City. Isn't the normal free walking tour that many companies offer in BA. Her style is unique as well as the knowledge she has about the city and Argentina. I totally recommend to join a walking tour with Joy!

Walking Tour and Drum Workshop - First Class!!. I wanted to see Buenos Aires from a local's point of view and from someone knowledgeable on all that this amazing city has to offer. A friend recommended Joy and to be honest I was very impressed, beyond what I was hoping for. I considered a free tour, but the lack of 'the personal touch' of these large group tours did not appeal. This is something you get in bucket loads with Joy! From the outset you appreciate how much passion she has for her home town and her depth of knowledge is really quite impressive! Joy was very accommodating in making sure that the tour included the key areas I wanted to see, and shaped it around local events to ensure we did not miss anything going on, and I came away more knowledgeable on this great city and very happy with the way the tour was organised and delivered. Communication leading up to the tour was spot on too, Joy could not be more helpful!Following on from my tour of BA, I booked the Drum Workshop that Joy also offers. I had been somewhat inspired by the spine-tingling sounds of the drums that you often hear around the streets and suburbs of Buenos Aires (plus the percussion show 'La Bomba De Tiempo' which is stunning and sealed the deal for me...!), so thought that the workshop would be a great follow-on experience. Again, I was not disappointed! Not being musically talented in the least and lacking in the rhythm department, I initially thought that it might not quite be for me, but nothing ventured, nothing gained....Our workshop host Diego, soon put any concerns at ease as we learned about the origins of the music of Argentina and in particular the various drums that you would hear around Argentina and even Uruguay. Soon we were having a 'jam' session on the drums and Diego quickly instilled rhythm that I didn't know I had...! I had such a fun and engaging experience that I even asked for the names of the drums that I liked the most so that I can buy some on my return to the UK. My neighbours will love me..! :)All in all, I can highly recommend the guided tour and drum workshop, both arranged with Joy, and when I return to Buenos Aires later this year, I have discussed further tours with Joy, including a Tango Experience and a visit to one of the local futbol matches, to complete the whole experience. As a guide and host, you will not find better than Joy, and I felt compelled to write an honest review as she really makes you feel like a friend rather than a customer. A++++++ Clive from Scotland.

Cooking Workshop. My two Friends and I learned from Joy how to cook empanadas. I liked it very much because Joy was a very good teacher. She taught us a lot about the empanadas and also some basic hints about cooking in general. We get mate and a very tasty red wine from Argentina. I recommend this cooking workshop to everybody who likes to cook and to enjoy a nice company with a very nice and generous Argentina. :)

Best way to start your stay in BA!. I am so grateful to have stumbled upon Joy of Buenos Aires on Trip Advisor! Joy was very easy to communicate and make arrangements with prior to our stay in Buenos Aires. She arrived at our hotel punctually on our tour date, and spent some time getting to know my friend and I before coming up with a plan that kept our interests in mind. Joy is fun, energetic, and extremely passionate about her city. She is very knowledgeable about the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina, and we appreciated hearing her perspective on the current state of politics as well. She gave us many helpful tips and recommendations throughout our tour, and even helped us arrange transport to other activities we had planned. This was the perfect way to spend our first day in Buenos Aires, and get acquainted this beautiful city. I can't recommend enough!

An awesome tour with a great guide. Joy took us on a bus and showed us many different thing in San Telmo and La Boca including the safe streets. We had an amazing day from beginning to end.Just a few notes about what we saw. The 1st firehall in Argentina. The firehall has museum pieces and new equipment.All firefighters in Argentina are volunteers The Boca Jr. Stadium re: 12 player The graffiti wall about the disappeared The immigrants bridge The memorial under the bridge for the disappeared who's personal effects were found when the police station was torn downThe old tenements in La Boca which are now stores but you can see where whole families lived in boxes.Another good coffee house. Coffee comes with a glass of water and small cookies. Milk costs extra. I love the little snacks and water especially because it was very hot.We saw the Rosa ! San Martin's crypt, The British flags taken when Argentina defeated Britain.The embassy for France, BritainWe walked and rode the busesGrabbed an empanada.......and moreAs we made our way down Defense to Plaza de Mayo we first stopped and Joy explained about Mate and made us some. I liked it very much.Then we began to meet union people. There was/is a big protest today over wages and a large number of people being fired from the government. We stopped and chatted with some. Joy lead us further and we met many leaving the plaza as their part was done. The plaza was still packed with people and it was a little overwhelming. Joy says this is only a small protest and we would be fine. The only time to worry is if the police get threatening. Also don't worry about big bangs it us only fireworks.Joy is energetic, articulate, knowledgeable and very proud of her wonderful city. Thank you Joy.

Fantastic customized tour. Amazing day with Joy. We had visited parts of the city already but Joy open our eyes to so much more. She was so willing to share her knowledge of the city, history and great places to eat. She shared her passions and favorite places with us allowing to see so much more of BA

Walking tour through La Boca and San Telmo. We had a fantastic day with Joy touring through La Boca and San Telmo. She is super friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Highly recommend. Go Boca Juniors!!

Amazing Walkingtour through Buenos Aires <3. The walking tour with Joy was the best walking tour I ever joined, Joy is amazing! She knows a lot about the interesting history of the city, she is very enthusiastic in the way she talks about Buenos Aires, she is flexible if you want to see something in particular she can arrange it and you just feel the love for that city which spreads to all participants of the tour.:))Simply amazingThank you Joy

Drum workshop was Amazing!!! . I had been told about Joy from some friends back in Australia and was told to contact her when we visit Buenos Aires. She was SO helpful and lovely from the moment we got in touch. It was so great to have local knowledge from a friendly and relatable person. She asked us about what types of activities we would like to do whilst in Buenos Aires and looked into different options and prices for us. These included Tango Shows, Yoga Classes, Bars and Restaurants, Walking Tours, Shopping, Gardens, Museums, Markets, History, Music Shows etc. Joy made a suggestion to do a drum workshop with a local drummer and also told us about a drum show that is really popular. We did the drumming workshop on a Monday afternoon and the show was on later that night. Joy met us in the city and showed us how to use the Subway system, which we used at least once a day for the rest of our trip. (So helpful) In the workshop we got to have some tea and chat about the history and culture of what drumming means to the locals. It was so nice to see the passion of our teacher Diego. We got to learn different rhythms and techniques and use a large variety of drums. Diego made us feel so welcome in his home (where the lesson takes place) and it was an amazing experience that not many tourists would get the opportunity to do. Later on, at the drum show we could really appreciate the drummers talents and understand the work of the 'conductors'. We had such a fun day and definitely recommend the workshop to anyone travelling to Buenos Aires. Joy is very professional and a beautiful soul who made our stay in Buenos Aires so much better. ❤️

Customized and passionate tour of BA. My experience with Joy far exceeded my expectations. She was passionate, informative, and provided essential cultural and historical context wherever we went. She demonstrated a sense of humour, which I appreciated. She catered to our individual interests as tourists and helped us learn about the city of Buenos Aires as well as the people. We were guided through La Boca, San Telmo and ended in Plaza de Mayo. She even provided additional suggestions for the remainder of our trip! I can't think of anything else I would have wanted from a city tour. I would highly recommend her to a friend!

Perfect day in Buenos Aires. My husband and I had super perfect day with Joy in Buenos Aires. It was the perfect way to discover Buenos Aires. Joy was really nice and she is very enthusiastic and flexible. We highly recommended the tour with her.

Walking tour of Buenos Aries. This was a wonderful tour of Buenos Aires and Joy was an amazing guide. Joy was so friendly and enthusiastic and was able to not only show me places I wouldn't have found on my own but also had so much local knowledge she could share. I learned so much about Buenos Aires that I would never have found out unless I did this tour. As a local she was passionate about the city and it's history. At the end of the tour Joy sat down with me and showed me places on the map to visit in my spare days based on what I liked. Fantastic tour and guide would highly recommend

JOY, JOY, JOY, JOY. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary in Buenos Aires, on our first-ever visit to Argentina and South America. Two days of our trip were spent with Joy of Buenos Aires. Although we could have crammed all the city tour spots into one day, which is what a lot of people do, we opted to do it over two whole days, giving us ample time to explore off-the-beaten path site, take unlimited photos and shoot videos, relax as needed and snack whenever we desired. Choosing two days (with a break in-between) was the best decision we made, and the 16 hours we spent with Joy, in a wide variety of situations, simply revealed to us that she is undoubtedly pursuing her passion! And there's nothing better than having a guide/friend who seems as excited about her tours (ones she's done numerous times!) as you are. It makes a big difference! And in this day and age, where websites and ads often exaggerate a person's or product's accomplishments or benefits, my feeling is that Joy gives you amazing value for your investment. And her website and Facebook page accurately reflect who she is and what she can do. Thank you, Joy!
Joy is amazing!. Terrific guide who loves to share her city. We learned so much and enjoyed her enthusiasm.Planning the tour was flawless as she maintains great contact.

Great tour of Buenos Aires. We had an excellent experience with Joy. She took us through La Boca, San Telmo and to Plaza de Mayo on a half day tour. This was a splendid way to see Buenos Aires. She added a lot of value through her energy and gave us plenty of useful insider information. She also gave thoughtful answers to all of our questions. The tour was well worth it. We are on our honeymoon and this was a great start to it.

The best way to tour BA!. I went with Joy on a trip through Bolivia and ended in Buenos Aires. Joy took us on an amazing day tour all through BA. Her passion for BA came through in every explanation. She had the perfect balance of telling us lots of information but not losing our interest. She took us to everywhere I needed to see in BA. Having already traveled with us for a bit, Joy knew what we wanted to see and chose places based on that. She balanced the historical with the fun with the beautiful. The highlight was visiting La Boca. The colorful buildings were great and we learned all about Joy's love of Boca Juniors. I learned so much about BA and had so much fun doing it. We packed a lot into a day but it was amazing!!I could not imagine seeing BA without the incredible Joy!!

Simply superb !. Traveling solo around South America by motorcycle I have seen and experienced a lot of the best and worst of cities and what they have to offer. My full day walking tour with Joy was quite simply by far the best tour experience I have had in my 4 months travelling. Joy's energy and love for the city comes across in bounds. Her knowledge of the history and culture of Buenos Aries was excellent and described with such passion too. Very flexible and happy to tailor a tour to your personal preferences, we did an impromptu your of Boca stadium which was just brilliant for me, Joy is simply the best there is !

Fantastic BA with Joy😊. I met Joy randomly on my G tour in Iguazú, Brasil and were told by my G CEO Seba, that Joy doing personal tours in BA ... exactly what I was looking for!I got in touch with Joy and luckily she had time during my 2 free days in BA. Another traveller, Elizabeth from USA, joined me for the BA south area tour on 22.02.2016 to La Boca, Caminito, San Telmo & Mayo Square using also local bus.It was a great experience to have a personal tour & guide to get to know BA city this way with many local insider stories like the fire truck in Boca Juniors colours, how you really prepare/process Mate tea for drinking and sharing it with friends and other history lessons, very interesting !!!Joy is fantastic, passionate about BA and her country to show people around her city. She takes her time to answer all our questions and listens to what we are interested in.Joy is a lovely and amazing person, very dedicated tour guide and I recommend highly go on a tour "BA with Joy"!!!Joy, thank you soooo much, will always remember our tour and can say:"Been there ... BA, done it ... tour with Joy, love it ... and will do it again whenever I return to BA"

All insights you need to enjoy this beautiful city.. Joy presented us on both days a variety of facts about history, architecture, art, food and drinks, activities, sports and news about the current economic crisis and political situation. The insight was really interesting and she presented all in a friendly and colleagual atmosphere.

A splendid day with the perfect guide!. Joy's passion, enthusiasm and dedication can be seen from the outset and she maintains this high level of service for the length of the tour, or in my case through back to back tours for the entire day! She is wonderful to talk to, her English is great and she is very knowledgeable but does not jabber - she notices if you aren't as interested in something and moves on to the next thing if so.Instead she takes the time and effort to engage with you and listens to what you need or want. I highly recommend her services and in particular, I would like to give a shout out to Diego and the drum workshop Joy facilitates with him. What an insightful and enjoyable experience, and I thought I was musically inept!

Best way to ENJOY Buenos Aires. On the evening we arrived, we met Joy at the hotel and went to a nice coffee-shop. There she told us on a map the must do's and local tips of Buenos Aires. We decided to do two tours with her (both for 4h). In the fist one we explored Retiro, Recoleta and Palermo. On the next day we went to la Boca and San Telmo. Both tours had a great mix of history, architecture, present political situation and personal experiences. It was a great way to get to know the city! Joy is a fantastic person, who loves to show her beautiful city and to help finding a great Tango place, transport to the airport or a great restaurant.

Wonderfull experience. Hey! My friends and I went to Buenos Aires in the beginning of January. I heard about "joy of Buenos Aires" from a friend of mine. He had a wonderful experience and highly recommended it to us. I was really sceptic about it in the beginning, but thought I might give it a chance. We ended up having a two days trip and learned a LOT about the city. She is really good, flaxible, dediceted and she did take a really good care of us.It was more than a tour, a memory I will remember the rest of my life. I highly recommend the tour with her. Don't miss it or you will regret it.

Joy is a pure delight!. Joy took me and my friend on a trip around town. This lady is a brilliant person who has so much energy and passion for her country. You'll be well looked after if you book on one of her tours as Joy has so much local knowledge. Joy will make your holiday AMAZING!

An absolute joy!. There is no better way to see Buenos Aires than with Joy. Her boundless enthusiasm coupled with her love and extensive knowledge of her city makes her and unbeatable tour guide. She is so caring and makes an effort to make sure everyone has the best experience. Highly recommended!

AMAZING. Joy is the most lovely and talented tour guide to see Buenos Aires with ! Not only is she wonderful company, but her knowledge and understanding of this city makes it all so much more exciting ! I 100% recommend this beautiful lady to guide you through Buenos Aires ! 10/10

Highly recommended!!. Joy truly made the trip unforgettable! She is knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and very passionate about her job. She really makes an effort to ensure everyone has a great time and gets the most out of their experience. I unfortunately had to go to the hospital during my trip but she was right there with me in the ambulance and translated everything so I got the correct medicine and I felt better in no time. I couldn't have done it without her!

A magical and unique way to discover Buenos Aires. Joy is a passionate local who shares the magic of her city so beautifully. She is full of interesting facts about places only locals know about and tailors her tour depending on your interests and availability. She showed me amazing lookouts, shared local food and we interacted with locals. She is a pleasure to be around and I highly recommend her tours!

Joy's enthusiasm, infectious smile and bubbly personality really inspired us. Joy was recommended by a friend and so a group of us joined her for a tour of La Boca. We were already keen to go on an official tour of the Boca Juniors stadium and Joy helped us tie this in with a tour of the local area.Joy met us at Plaza de Mayo and we hopped on a local bus for the short journey down to La Boca. We appreciated this personal touch and getting to experience a small snippet of the life of the locals rather than simply being herded into some private transport as many tour companies do.All through the trip Joy's enthusiasm, infectious smile and bubbly personality really inspired us and kept our attention fully, eager for more interaction. She has the beautiful knack of giving information and telling stories of the local area, peaking your interest without overloading you or feeling like you're being preached at like some overbearing tour guides do.Joy really does give the tour a local, personal touch and very much encourages you to interact and ask questions - The stop at the fire station to see the special blue and yellow fire truck was a highlight!If I'm ever back in Buenos Aires - which I really hope I will be one day - I'll look up Joy for another fun day exploring the city!

Perfection. Joy was born and raised in Buenos Aries so knows everything there needs to know about this beautiful city. Joy was energetic, enthusiastic, passionate and incredibly driven to provide us with an amazing tour of Buenos Aries. She picked us up from the hotel promptly and briefed us for the day's itinerary which was comprehensive yet concise. Joy immediately made us feel relaxed and excited for the day's activities through her passionate and bubbly personality. Safety was never an issue. Joy was able to interlock the historical and cultural significance of Argentina and Buenos Aries into the flow of events for the day. This provided a very fun filled tour that ended up feeling like you were walking through the past and present of Buenos Aries through an amazing story. Would highly recommend Joy for any tour of Buenos Aries.

A fun filled way to see Argentina. Travel has been a passion of mine for as long as I can remember, just as it is Joy’s passion to present to others the abundance of life and culture which Argentina has to offer. She has a bright and bubbly personality making her instantly loveable, and the excitement she exudes about being able to show off her beautiful country is contagious. It was such a pleasure to meet Joy, she made my absolutely amazing trip from Buenos Aires to Rio de Janeiro one I will never forget. I would recommend a tour with Joy to all!!

Joy-ful knowledge. I joined a great bunch of like-minded travellers on the Iguassu Beyond trip. We were expertly led by the ever energetic and passionate Joy on a most memorable 2 weeks starting in Buenos Aires and finishing up in Rio de Janeiro. Highly recommend Joy for her excellent knowledge not just of her home country Argentina but got to admire her energy, love of life and imparting that down to travellers who wish to experience a great holiday. Viva Joy and her beloved Boca Juniors at La Bombonera!
Great. Joy was a great guide for the short time we spent in BA. Knowledgeable, thoughtful and organised, would recommend her to anyone.

The only guide you'll need to experience the real Buenos Aires!. Joy really lives up to her name! She is such a lovely, fun and very knowledgable lady. The best!. Joy's tours are an amazing way to see Buenos Aires and to find the hidden gems the city has to offer you wouldn't be able to find otherwise. With Joy as a guide, it's like travelling with a friend rather than a traditional tour guide. Thoroughly recommend!

The best way to see BA!. There is no better person than Joy to take you around Buenos Aires! She knows so much about her country and loves to share that with everyone. You can sense her passion from the very beginning! She shares great stories and is the so lovely and funny too! GO WITH JOY!!!

Get some Joy in your life!. I had the best time with Joy in Buenos Aires and beyond! Her company brought the places we visited to life, with her great local knowledge and passion for her city. I would recommend Joy as your guide whether you have an afternoon or a whole week in this city, she added so much to the experience and even with a larger group like ours took great care to make sure everyone got what they wanted from the trip.

Great guide for all things Buenos Aires. Joy is a great guide that knows a lot about Buenos Aires. She is perfect for someone who wants to dig a bit deeper than just visiting famous place. Her deep knowledge of history and culture of Argentina and Buenos Aires will satisfy even the most demanding history buff and add unforgettable aspect to your visit of Bs As.

Best guide in south America . Joy made our trip very special she is a local and knows every part of this city. She is so full of life with a captivating smile I would highly recommend contacting this amazing lady for the true Buenos Aires experience.

Love this girl... Joy is an exceptional spirit, full of the same passion and heart found in the epic city she is hosting. She will go to great lengths to make sure your experience is beyond expectations and that you will love her city just as she does.

What a Joy!!!. Joy really is a joy to have as a tour guide! She is so knowledgable and passionate about her home country and city. I would highly recommend Joy to anyone looking to tour the beautiful city of Buenos Aires! Amazing, friendly and super fun to be around.

Joy's Buenos Aires experience. When you go to Buenos Aires, get Joy. It's that simple. She was brilliant and gave us the experience of a lifetime that we were looking for. We had a great time in Buenos Aires, the people were warm and friendly and the city is rich in culture, history, heritage and energy that leaves you wanting more. The reason why we had such a great time was thanks to Joy, who really did do everything possible for us, so that our experience was the best it could be. We sampled everything from the AMAZING food and wine to the tours of the city and the night life which was incredible. Don't leave it to chance, have the trip of a lifetime and get the maximum out of your stay by booking Joy for your stay. You won't regret it, we'll definitely be back thanks to her

the best guide i ever had..... just i can say that it was our best day in buenos aires with Joanna... the fantastic sense of humor, knowledge and always with a fantastic disposal to solve all our desires.....thanks and sure i will see you again....

The best of Argentina.... After spending two weeks in South America with Joy as my tour guide I felt very much well informed about local culture as well as enjoying traditional and authentic experiences. My time travelling with this lady was amazing, her local knowledge was often key to adapting to South American life. Joy's love of food was infectious from sampling food from the nicest restaurants to street food on the go her recommendations were always spot on especially on the dessert front ! Joy's passion for life and travel is what makes her a pleasure to travel with. ❤️

AN EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME. Johanna amazed me with her level of enthusiasm, knowledge, and dedication to her job. She elevated every experience to another degree and made my time in South America unforgettable. She gave us authentic experiences and lessons in the traditional culture – from taking us to tango lessons, to teaching us about ‘mati’ culture, as well as bestowing her in depth knowledge of Argentinian history and culture. It was obvious that giving back and supporting the local communities was also very important. She was there to make us laugh, but also when you needed extra support. I got quite sick on the few days I was touring with her in BA and she made the effort to speak to a pharmacist and make sure I got what I needed. After traveling to almost 40 countries Argentina holds a special place in my heart because of Joy!

A Joyful Experience. I recently took a tour of Buenos Aires with Joy and it was one of the main highlights of my trip. Joy is a wonderful person, bright, bubbly and easy to get along with. Her explanations are knowledgeable and her passion for what she does comes across in all that she does. I was able to taste the local treats and the places of historical importance. Joy was flexible to my needs and went out of her way to help as required. She is a selfie queen which ensures that you will go home with many great and interesting photos. Thank you so much for the wonderful experience which will be held with high esteem in my memories.

a 'must do' while in buenos aires. me and my friend visited buenos aires and we are glad we discovered it with joy, so glad that a friend recommended her, she gave us great insight and made a fantastic introduction of buenos aires on our short time there.
Best way to experience Buenos Aires . If you like to go to Buenos Aires - Joy can show you the city in a way you couldn't experience as a usual tourist. One of the best tourguides I ever met.

Fantastic Guide!. We did a San Telmo/La Boca tour with Joy with our two kids age 7 and 10. Joy was fabulous!! She was enthusiastic and knew so much about the area. She easily chatted away about what we were seeing, the history, and the people of BA. She could also answer any question we asked. We learned so very much in such a short time. We took the bus into La Boca. Frankly, we were chicken to do it on our own with the kids. With Joy we had so much fun and felt safe throughout.Joy was terrific with the kids. She spoke to them and included them in the tour, and even told them about some of the unpleasantness of Argentina's history in an appropriate manner. So impressive!We all left wishing we had more time in BA so that we could do something else with Joy.

Trip of a lifetime... I can’t recommend Joy highly enough. If ever being supremely professional as well as bubbly becomes an Olympic sport, she would run away with the gold medal. She loves her job and her home city, and it shone through, countless times going above and beyond the call of duty…I mean, who else would scour the beach stalls trying to buy a pair of speedos or “zunga’s” for one of her group?  I went on a trip with Joy in 2014, travelling from her home town of Buenos Aires through to Rio as part of a small mixed tour group. Many of us are still friends to this day. Much of that was down to Joy’s enthusiasm and attention to detail. Even on her days or evenings off, she still came out with the group as we wanted her with us. She has a great dry sense of humour and her local knowledge of where to go and experience the culture was second to none. You really felt you got the benefit of escaping the usual tourist traps and really seeing the city as it really is. She had a genuine interest in your life too and tailored the programme to what you wanted…whether that was taking a tour of the Boca Juniors stadium, or watching some traditional dancing. Joy just wanted you to make the most of your trip and for you to enjoy yourself, without it being forced fun. To me that was important. A trip out kayaking, seeing Peron’s grave, visiting a distillery or having a great meal was just as key as unwinding with a drink or two at the end of the day. Although I’m sure she would have shown us every spot in town and told us every historical fact if she could, she understood that a holiday is also about a bit of R&R and so the pace of it all was just right. One last thing..Joy is a great photographer, so don’t be surprised to come away with some good snaps as well as some great memories! Can’t wait to go back some time and see my friend again.

Amazing tour of the city!!. If you're looking to learn something about Buenos Aires, Joy is the only way to go. She is super knowledgable and so passionate about the city. Everywhere we went she was pointing out things and giving me the history on them. She likes to show you the city the way you should see the city, not as a tourist, but as a local. She wants to share the porteño experience whether it be food, sites, or even souvenirs. I wanted a máte cup and she took me to get a legit one, as opposed to one made in China, being sold in Argentina. She has a lot of connections throughout the city, so that she can take individuals and groups to certain restaurants and sites that you typically wouldn't go to with another guide. It was hands down the best tour I experienced in Argentina. Her English is perfect and it was like exploring the city with a friend.

The Joy of Johana. Johana, or "Joy", as she likes to be called - is warm, courteous, considerate, knowledgeable and, above all else, FUN. Joy escorted me and a group of 10 other travelers from Buenos Aires, down through El Chatan, across Tierres Del Fuego and down to Ushuaia. Throughout it all, Joy was attentive to everyone's needs and kept us all informed on how to prepare, what to expect, and what not to worry about.In every city we visited Joy had close friends, and they would give us the down low on how to get the most on any particular day.Joy kept everything organized and fun. Don't waste time and money on another bland bus tour, see Buenos Aires safely on street level with Joy!

Best guide of Buenos Aires.. Excellent level of English.She is pure positive energy. Her knowledge of her city (and South America in general) is impressive.Outstanding sense of hospitality, she would make you fell like part of her family while being super professional. If you are planning to travel through Argentina as a whole, you would be surprised by the amount of really good tips she can offer you.I totally recommend her.

The best tour guide I've ever had!. Joy is an warm, energetic and charismatic guide with a great sense of humour. She has seemingly endless knowledge about Argentinian culture and history - and if she doesn't know the answer to your question, she will find out.
