Joy goes out of her way to treat her clients like friends in a genuine and caring way. I would rate her higher than 5 stars if I could!

Iguassu and Beyond (Argentina and Brazil). Joy is an absolute JOY to have as a tour guide and as a friend! Her passion and thirst for life comes across in the way she describes the sights with such enthusiasm and knowledge. Joy's bubbly personality and fun nature encourages everyone to participate, feel comfortable and be part of the group. Joy's expertise ensures you have an authentic local experience and a rich, memorable journey.

Amazing guide. Joy is a super enthusiastic guide from Buenos Aires. Her English is perfect and she has a huge amount of knowledge about the city, especially La Boca. I would recommend a tour with Joy to anyone spending time in this exciting city.

Amazing experience. My wife and I had the best time with Joy! Joy is a ball of positive energy and very passionate about her home country. She also seems to know EVERYTHING about Argentina! I am vegetarian and all the restaurants Joy took us to were vegetarian friendly. Thank you Joy for making our trip so wonderful!

Your best friend in Buenos Aires!. After having an amazing experience travelling around Bolivia last year with Joy I couldn't wait to see her again in her home town of Buenos Aires. A group of 4 of us met Joy at Plaza de Mayo and her enthusiasm and friendly manner immediately made her very popular. She took us on a local bus to La Boca (something I couldn't have done alone) pointing out helpful attractions and sights along the way. Once there, Joy spoke to us in an engaging and insightful manner about the background and history of the place before allowing us to explore the stadium and beautiful parts of the area. My friends loved her and immediately wanted to spend all their time with her in Buenos Aires. I could not recommend her enough!!

Hidden Gem of BA. We had the pleasure of exploring BA with our wonderful guide Joy! She truly showed us an authentic experience while visiting. She made us feel comfortable the entire time. We told her what we were looking for, and like magic, she made it happen. I learned so much history I would not have known without her. Truly, a behind the scenes look at what makes the city tick.

The best travel guide in South America!. My husband and I met Joy in Bolivia last year, where we travelled through Bolivia and Brazil with Joy as our guide. We had a few tour guides before we met Joy, and she really made the difference to our trip. She stood out above the rest by a mile. Joy is so much fun, energetic, knowledgable and by far the best travel guide we have both ever had. My husband had two stomach bugs that needed medical treatment and Joy would not leave us at the hospital, staying with us throughout both nights. She looked after a big group with skill and made our experiences and safety her priority at all times. Her passion for her country and sense of humor is one in a million. We were sad to say goodbye as Joy became a great friend to us.

Awesome guide! . Joy is a Joy (yep. Punny) to have around. She will take you to the coolest places only locals know, all with a great smile and infectious laugh :) VERY knowledgeable, very friendly! Thanks!

Engaging, insightful and a unique experience. A friend suggested visiting La Boca with a local guide that she had met and I am glad she did. We met Joy in the downtown plaza and her enthusiasm and knowledge about Buenos Aires was immediately evident. Although I knew some of the history from a previous tour, listening to Joy as she described historical events was the start of a great tour. Joy organised and paid for a local bus to La Boca, which is hard for tourists such as myself because a travel card is needed and my Spanish is limited. I received warnings from other people I met whilst traveling to be careful in La Boca as it was a 'dodgy place', but traveling with Joy I felt safe. She took us off the beaten path and we visited places I would not have seen if I went by myself. Listening to Joy was different, I wasn't expecting to learn so much about the city. She is from Buenos Aires and her tour was fun but professional at the same time.

Customise your vision of a toir. The tours are awesome, let's face it I can't write a better review but what I want to really express here is the communication. Literally within half and hour of writing I received an answer and over several conversations these guys were able to present me with options for my time frame and my taste in tours. Penelope with whom I was chatting even suggested a rather exquisite Perfume House to me after noticing my email address which alludes to the fact I am connected to Perfume. I was very impressed with the suggestion. The Oerfume House is top class BTW. It's so hard sometimes to get part of the job right and in fact this part for me, is the most important . 10/10 Buenos Aires Local Tours. You've nailed customer service!

Do this on your first day. This was a wonderful tour and a great way to get acclimated to Buenos Aires. As someone who was brand new to South America and coming from the US, I was excited to see the city but had read things that worried me ('blue dollar' exchanges, fake money, pickpockets, etc). When we took the tour with Ceri, he put those fears to rest by teaching us some basic street smarts and giving us a sense of the city's vibe. We learned how to spot fake money, got around on the subway, and took quick trips to many different sites and neighborhoods - sort of like a 'sampler platter' of things to do. Ceri was also able to answer any question thrown at him, whether it was places to eat or where the great day trips outside the city are. I went by myself, but there were plenty of couples and a cruise ship group along with us, and we made a fun group. No matter what your plans are, spending a half day on this tour will make you much more comfortable in the city, give you new ideas, and answer any questions so you can really dive in. Plus, with it being 'pay what you want', the value is through the roof!Go for it. Highly recommended.

Fantastic tour. Took the local tour with Ceri. We definitely got our money's worth. Ceri was very knowledgable about Buenos Aires. He took us on the subway and showed us how it worked. He gave us hints for sightseeing in Buenos Aires. We covered a lot of ground in one morning. Ceri was very enthusiastic and made the tour fun and enjoyable. There were 12 of us on the tour, which was a very manageable number. Would highly recommend this tour.

TOURS BY LOCALS -- GUIDE ALEX. Alex gave us a wonderful full day tour of Buenos Aires. We zipped around town and he could tell our interests were history, culture and architecture. He knew it all. He organized it. He pickup us up at the ship and got us to the airport. Thanks Alex.

Patrick Lataillade - Transport & Tours. Referred to us by our host at our B & B. Patrick took us on a city tour, a trip to Tigre, and airport transfer.He is knowledgeable and fun to tour with. He knows the in's and out's of the city and navigates the crazy traffic! We appreciated that his english was great and we learnt so much. We could not have done this on our own. He made our experience in this citymemorable.

An excellent experience.. I went on the “Pay What You Want” Walking and Public Transport tour with Ceri, this past November and it was a very worthwhile experience. There were only 6 of us on the tour and we met Ceri at Puerto Rico Cafe in the city center. While we had a bite to eat Ceri gave us all sorts of useful information on how to enjoy and navigate the city. That alone was very helpful but the best was yet to come. For the next three hours Ceri showed us some of the highlights of Buenos Aires history, architecture, culture and off the tourist route dining on foot and via the Subte. He even helped one couple to exchange money on Calla Florida. This was worth the going of other walking tours plus a tip, which, in November of 2015, came to around $40.00. But you get to "Pay What You Want" ....

2nd Tour with Ceri Doesn't Disappoint. This is the second time in a year that I've done the morning microcenter tour with Ceri, and it didn't disappoint. You can expect a friendly, funny, and knowledgeable tour guide who will show you around and give you advice on money exchange, restaurants, and tango places, as well empart his knowledge on the important historical events of the country. But what you wouldn't expect from a tour guide is for him to go out of his way to help you out in a luggage situation at the airport, which is what Ceri did for us, and it was greatly appreciated. His philosophy on how to treat people was spot on and because we followed his advice to be friendly and respectful to the people we met, we found the Porteños to be very genuine and friendly. I will definitely take another tour with Ceri if I get the chance to return to BsAs some day.

Very informative tour of Buenos Aires!. Walking tour was very interesting and the guide Ceri, knew so much about the place, he gave a real good commentary and gave us tips for catching public transport, taxi's, exchanging money and recommendations for eating out. Gracias

Not your typical free walking tour . We reserved via email and the rendezvous was a little cafe just off plaza de mayo. There were only 7 of us on the tour which was a nice change from other free tours. We spent some time in the cafe talking to the guide and each other and asking questions. We then sauntered around the city taking in some cool places including a historic pharmacy, the palacio barolo and carousels. This was a tour by a local sharing what life was like in BA. It was not a rushed tick box of sight seeing. We really enjoyed this tour and the participants contributed to a fun atmosphere however the humour might not be to everyone's taste.

A great introduction to Buenos Aires. I had arranged for a long half day walking tour of the city and our guide Ceri Foster met us at our hotel. Ceri introduced to taxis and taxi etiquette as we caught a taxi to the La Boca neighborhood of the city. We walked around a huge soccer stadium and heard about soccer’s importance in Argentina. We walked through many kinds of neighborhoods, took a bus to San Telmo another neighborhood. We went in and out of grocery stores, liquor stores, pharmacies (they always had a green cross out front). We sat in a plaza area and had a grapefruit soda and watched a flamenco demonstration which are common around the city. We learned how and where to exchange money and walked through the city center to the park surrounded by historical buildings where we heard about the country's history. Ceri was a great guide and gave us a wonderful introduction to Buenos Aires and to Argentina.

Perfect early intro to the City. This was like having a friend meet you the first day in town and give you the local do's and don'ts. Ceri met our small group at a local coffee shop, and while strolling around and filling us in on history also told us where to change money, buy what you need, get a taste of wine, how to use the Metro, recommend a good Tango show and some places to think about for lunch or dinner. All with a smile and relaxed pace and an ease of a Portano (though he is from Canada/England). Highly recommended.

Highlight of the trip. Everything about Buenos Aires Local Tours was first rate, from the initial enquiry to the ease of booking online and the emails giving great tips on how to get the best out of the city. This was all surpassed by the private tour we took with Ceri. His passion for the city and its people was infectious and we learnt and saw so much more than we expected. Ceri tailored the tour to our wishes and made sure we went at a comfortable pace. I highly recommend taking this tour.

A great intro to Buenos Aires. Certainly a entertaining tour with Ceri, and his ( very British !!) sense of humour. He took us ( about 7 in all ) on a leisurely tour of the centre of the city starting at a very old cafe -- where I discovered I was sitting at the very table Pope Francis used to frequent ! As a solo traveller it was very pleasant to be in a group like this on my first day in Argentina -- gave me confidence to explore AND I met others who I teamed up with later In all a good start to my visit

Must do on your first day. So you've just landed in Buenos Aires, now what? This tour should be at the top of your list. We had the pleasure of Ceri as our tour guide and he did a great job of showing us the landmarks, explaining how things work, giving us some great restaurant recommendations and telling us how to get our touristy things done in an efficient manner. On most tours, I'm usually anxious for it to end so I can go out and explore on my own. With Ceri, I was hoping it would just keep going...it didn't feel like a tour, instead you were just hooked up with a friend of a friend who was just taking time out of his day to entertain you. I can not recommend this tour more highly...

Superb Authentic Buenos Aires Experience with Alan. Led by a very engaging and caring tour guide Alan, BA Local Tours gave us a rich overview of architectural landmarks through the lense of history. Alan repatriated to Buenos Aires from the UK 10 years ago, so we benefited both from his perfect English and his expertise as a local. We used public transportation to get around, which made the experience more authentic. Alan was very responsive and truly cared. He showed us the hidden gems that we would not have discovered on our own and recommended a ton of places to dine and to visit while in Buenos Aires.

Get Away From Tourist Traps. This tour was great. Guide was knowledgable and we went to some areas away from the crush of tourists, We visited La Boca area which was great to see.B.A. is like any large city some bad areas so a guided tour is a great way to go to get away from the tourist traps. Pay attention to your surroundings when walking or shopping on your own. They tried the old "pigeon poop" scam on me when a women covertly squirted some green mustard on my shoulder and then two rushed pretending to help me clean it off saying in broken English "pigeon, pigeon" while they attempt to pick pocket or steal packages. Knowing this scam I yelled "leave me alone" and man they were gone in a flash. So a guided tour was comfortable and fun

Not your usual "free walking tour"!. Our guide Richard was extremely interesting and fun. We felt that we learned history about BA that made our entire trip there more meaningful. He will take you to very non-touristy neighborhoods, and talk with you about whatever particular topics interest you the most. He is very knowledgable and entertaining! Our group all became friends throughout the morning because we were having such a great time!

Get off the beaten track with a local. Returning to Buenos Aires for another short visit, on my way to Ushuaia, meant that I had already visited most of the key tourist spots so I was looking to do something different this time. I had failed to visit La Boca on previous visits and a custom tour with a local guide seemed the ideal opportunity to have a more in depth exploration of the area and get off the beaten track without getting into trouble. On explaining what I was looking for, a photography focused custom tour involving the La Boca district, I was told that it would be no problem as they had a professional photographer (Richard) on staff and he conducted photography tours plus he was available on the only day I had to spare. As I wasn’t sure if jet lag would be a problem I arranged for a five hour afternoon tour of La Boca and left it to Richard to organise the details.After meeting at Fundacion Proa we brushed shoulders with the tourists at the “sights” before heading off into the actual neighbourhood where we didn’t see another tourist and finding the real gems, such as the La Boca volunteer fire department where we were invited into the station to have a look around and talk to the fire fighters, and then to an interesting local market for a refreshment stop before having an amusing encounter with some street performers. All in all a pleasant afternoon having fun with a great guide and highly recommended.

Not Your Typical Tour or Tour Guide!. I'd already lived in Buenos Aires for a year when my friend came to visit from the U.S. and we decided to schedule a tour with Ceri. This was my friends' first time in Argentina, and even though I'd lived here and knew the city well, we both found Ceri's tour to be incredibly entertaining, informative and FUN! We learned so much about the city, the buildings, the architecture, the history and the government that we wouldn't have learned in any tour book or standard tour. Ceri incorporates useful information that brings a lot of added value to the experience. Plus he's a great down-to-earth guy and a natural sense of humor. We enjoyed our time with him greatly and I highly recommend this experience. This is absolutely the BEST way to see Buenos Aires.

Amazing Way to See Buenos Aires. This is by far one of the best day trips I've ever done. Because we had lived in Buenos Aires for a few months (in Palermo Soho), we were skeptical of doing an "official tour" at first — what would we see that we had not already experienced first–hand?However, our tour guide Ceri quickly proved how wrong we were. Cheerful, intelligent and full of insightful stories, he not only showed us the main sights in and around centro, but had interesting background stories for almost every major building or monument we saw. Absolutely delightful! Oh, did I also mention he is Canadian? ;)It's a great way to experience the city. I highly recommend you book either the full–day tour, or two separate half–day tours (as we did). That way, you won't feel completely drained after a full day of walking in the scorching heat. Be sure to ask Ceri for some tips on local restaurants and bars — he might even take you to a secret rooftop bar.

History- Art- laughter and the Passion that defines Buenos Aries. My good friend Paul recommended that I take this tour with Ceri. The day after I arrived Argentina was perfect weather for this walking tour. Ceri gave this tour life as each location was described and discussed. Each stop had purpose and fun elements that shapes how we live today. I strongly recommend taking this tour as a clear introduction to the local culture. Ceri also went the extra mile to make sure I had all the info for Tango lessons. I hope this helps.

Fantastic, Fun & Essential Tours and Information For First Time Visits. I’ve been traveling in South America for 6 months (Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Bolivia, Chile, Argentina) and experienced just about every scenario possible in booking accommodations, transportation, and tours. Some I can’t remember. Some I don’t want to remember. Traveling solo with marginal Spanish is challenging and one lesson learned is you must go with the flow of how things work in a particular country. This is difficult for many foreigners, especially Americans, but it’s the only way to maintain your sanity. However, you do need the help of a good tour company!Buenos Aires Local Tours (http://www.buenosaireslocaltours.com/) has undoubtedly made the month I'm spending in Buenos Aires easier. They are the best local tour group I’ve interacted with on this trip. My contacts - Penelope and Jonathan - had excellent written English skills, responded to my e-mailed questions thoroughly, and always followed-up. Buenos Aires is a big city with many attractions and activities. The initial information Penelope e-mailed helped me get around and plan my time wisely to experience the parts of the city of most interest.The city tour with Ceri was fantastic – so much information and we went to parts of the Buenos Aires removed from the normal tourist crowd. Ceri was fun and his commentary was educational and helpful in understanding Buenos Aires, one of my favorite cities. The tour was thoroughly enjoyable!I recommend Buenos Aires Tours to anyone visiting the city, especially for the first time. They are extremely competent and organized and will help you navigate the city, take you to special areas of interest, and provide essential information required to organize your time well while visiting one of the world’s most fantastic cities!

Local Tour of Buenos Aires. This tour for us was an essential first day orientation to Buenos Aires. It allowed us to be comfortable negotiating the subway and bus system as well as providing an understanding of the quirks of the currency. Although we always felt very safe in Buenos Aires, Ceri provided tips for wandering about neighbourhoods safely so that we didn't stand out as tourists. Ceri also took us to many places that we would have never seen on our own and wouldn't have even known about. The architecture of Buenos Aires is very interesting and he pointed out details that we would not have even noticed. One of our favourite places was the Café Tortoni where we stopped to have a look at the beautiful décor which is modeled after a café in Paris. We ended up eating there twice on our trip and really enjoyed the meals. Thanks to Ceri for a great orientation to a beautiful city!

Relaxed, informative introduction to Buenos Aires. We, 2 seniors, but in good shape to walk, met Ceri, our guide, in a cafe near Plaza de Mayo. My husband had great doubts about anything I found on the internet. However, soon we were quite at ease and enjoying our guide's sense of humour and getting great information regarding history, getting around in BA and other things to do on our own. We saw highlights of BA and It was fun, not strenuous. Since ours was a 'Pay What You Want' tour we certainly got our money's worth. Highly recommended for easy-going travellers.

Great Way to Tour Buenos Aires. Other people, like the rental where we were staying, were trying to refer us to tours that seemed very pricey too me, so it was a relief to find this opportunity to pay what you want. It was very easy to make the arrangements, and we had an excellent tour guide, Richard. It was a very warm introduction at the cafe, and then we had a jam-packed morning of information and activity. Highly recommend this tour.

Great introduction to life in Buenos Aires. A group of 6 of us made arrangements to have 2 tours with Buenos Aires Local Tours. I contacted Penelope in the office via email and she was very responsive and helpful with suggestions. We ended up arranging two tours. On the first night we wanted to do a food & wine type tour where we visited a couple of casual local restaurants and experience some of the Argentine wines. On the second day we wanted to do a more traditional city tour capturing the highlights of the city and the various unique neighborhoods.Our guide was Ceri (pronounced Cary) and he did an amazing job of providing our group with just the experience we were looking for. Our food & wine tour were spot on what we had in mind and we had a wonderful evening getting the feel for what Buenos Aires is like at night just as a local would see things. The food and wine were excellent!Ceri met us bright and early the next morning for our walking tour of the neighborhoods and city highlights. Again Ceri nailed it and shared insights and knowledge that everybody in the group found very refreshing. Our time in Buenos Aires was short but Ceri certainly helped us get the most out of our limited time.Buenos Aires Local Tours did a great job for us and I would not hesitate to recommend them as a great option for getting familiar with Buenos Aires.

Great Tour for an overview of the City. We took this tour on the first morning of our stay in BsAs. Ceri was our guide, who we met at a cafe in San Telmo. There were 7 in our group and we proceeded to walk to the Plaza de Mayo and along the way we were told about the history of the country and its economics. Ceri gave us some good tips on safety, and counterfeit bills, neither of which we had an issue with during our stay. We enjoyed his sense of humor and he was able to answer any questions we had. We took a subway ride and we really appreciated that he took us to the place where he exchanges $USA at the blue dollar rate. We were wary of doing this on our own, but once he showed us a reputable place, we used it twice with no problems. This tour was a great way to be introduced to the city and its culture and the fact that you could pay what you want was great for us. Highly recommend.

Great introduction to BA. Timing meant that this tour was on my last day in BA which was unfortunate. There was a cancellation on the morning, so only two of us arrived. Ceri was a wealth of knowledge and although he was visibly ill on the day, he managed to conduct a tour that was relaxed, informative and one of my favourites from the trip. It was the perfect induction to the history of the city, some of it's landmarks and how to get around BA as a complete newbie. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to get up close and personal with the city.

Nice introduction and the price is right!. We visited Buenos Aires for just two days before a longer trip to Antarctica. I thought the walking tour would give a good overview of the city and hit the highlights, which was all we had time for. This worked out well for us. This company offers free walking tours where you pay in tips what you feel is appropriate. You do need to sign up ahead of time on-line so they have a head count. This helps to keep the groups small. You will receive a follow-up e-mail with the name and photo of the meeting point, as well as the name and photo of your guide. We landed in Buenos Aires at 4:30 am on a Monday and after a quick rest we were able to locate the Puerto Rico Cafe described in the e-mail. Our guide, Ceri, is a Canadian/UK transplant who has lived in BA for 7 years. He took our group of about a dozen people on a tour of Plaza de Mayo, where he gave historical background near the Pink House, famous for the balcony used by Evita Peron. We saw the cathedral and went back in later on our own--beautiful and worth doing! Outside does not look like much but the inside was very European-cathedral looking.Ceri's tours focus on making you feel comfortable with BA, so he took us on a bus and subway. He also took us to change money at a street newstand, where you get a better exchange rate. I have to say that was kind of creepy, though--seemed like we were doing something underhanded behind a curtain. Anyway, all was fine. Ceri was very entertaining and we enjoyed the experience. We finished up near the kiosk about 1:45 pm.I will say we did not see a LOT of BA on this tour, as this company's focus is helping you feel comfortable navigating public transportation, etc. We went on a different walking tour the next day (see separate entry) where we saw more of the city. Both have their positives and negatives.If you have time, this is a pleasant way to spend a morning.

Best Tour Experience and Introduction to the City. My boyfriend and I were living in Buenos Aires for a month and the first week we took the "Pay What You Want" Tour which gave us a great overview of the city and TEACH US ABOUT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION! We had Quincy as our Tour guide and she was phenomenal! Very knowledgeable and helpful with other questions to help us during our stay in the city. After the tour we had the confidence to conquer the public transportation which saved us a lot of money vs taking taxis!I wish the company offered more Pay What You Want Tours throughout other parts of the city because I would definitely go on them!

One of the best in the world !. We have taken more than 40 of these guided walking tours around the world and this one is probably the best so far ! Ceri , our guide , was very knowledgeable , funny , clear in his descriptions and had a loud enough voice to be understood by everyone . I was surprised that 14 of us showed up on a Monday morning but it is probably a good indication of how popular this group is . In comparison , we were 4 and 5 on 2 other tours that we took in Buenos Aires ! As described in other reviews , Ceri took us inside some private buildings , offered us free wine tasting ( one glass of white wine) , took us on a bus and a metro ride to get a better feel of the local life and most importantly shared with us his knowledge and love for the city ! At the end , he made some excellent recommendations for a local parilla , inexpensive tango demonstrations , places for wine tasting and places to visit . We strongly recommend to follow this tour at the beginning of a stay in Buenos Aires and then come back to visit in more details places like the Cathedral , Casa Rosada and spots recommended by Ceri !

Great Introduction. Ceri was our guide on this tour and he gave us interesting, informative, and lively information about Buenos Aires while walking us thru parts of the city. We also took the bus and subway to get some more local flavor. Ceri took us to his favorite wine shop, to a money changer, and gave us other good, helpful advice. His personality was engaging, his knowledge, vast and we all enjoyed the tour and learned a lot. If there was a downside, it was that he dwelled too much on the safety issue. I would definitely recommend this tour.

Excellent walking tour of both traditional and out of the way sights. We met Quincy as arranged by email in one of the old cafes in the centre of the city and she guided the small group of 4 around the traditional tourist sights in the centre of the city with lots of interesting details about the history and then took us by bus to Abasto to see some of the sites associated with the origin of the tango and the old market hall (now a shopping mall!), returning to the city centre by the subway. From the US by birth, she conveyed her love of the city and gave lots of useful tips for making the most of our time there. As we had not had an opportunity to change money before the tour she even paid our fares on the bus and subway, and explained how and where to change money with the best exchange rate. There was absolutely no pressure to pay any fixed amount for the tour, and literally it was 'Pay what you want' - Quincy did not even remind me I owed her for the fares! I would highly recommend this tour for anyone at the start of a visit to Buenos Aires.

1/2 day with Ceri. I was taking my good friend's son on a trip abroad to see the Foo Fighters in La Plata. We are from Seattle and this was the first time the young lad had been out of the country - we took a 1/2 day walking tour on our first morning in BA. We were grouped up with some very nice people - a solo Australian and a young couple that were circumnavigating the globe.I've been on plenty of tours in various parts of the world and this I have to say was my favorite. We met Ceri, and the others, and had a very casual trip through a few different areas of the city. Ceri knew his history and presented it in perfect bite size pieces. This was by far our favorite daytime activity of the whole trip. Our group had such a good time that all of us, along with Ceri, went out for lunch together.Well done Ceri, see you next time I'm in BA.Bob

Highly recommend. My husband and I took the walking tour on January 22 with Cary. First, let me say that we got a very prompt response to our request on their website, and they continued to respond very quickly to our follow up emails. We met at a coffee shop downtown in the morning. He started with a half hour briefing on the city in general and he provided some very useful safety tips. Many of them are usual common sense when one travels in a foreign city, but many were specific to the area and were very helpful. The group was fairly large that morning, with a few extras showing up, so we did not take the bus or the subway. We did walk around Plaza de Mayo and down toward Congress, and he showed us some very special buildings we would not have known on our own. We stopped for a money changer which we did not need, but if anyone needs to change money here, it's best to have some recommendation.We got lots of little details and some interesting insights into the customs and history. All in all, it was a morning very well spent. We recommend it highly for anyone who plans to spend a few days (we are here for a whole month) and who wants to be able to get around the city on their own.Great job and many thanks!!!

Not as enamoured as everyone else. We did the "Pay What You Want" walking tour with Ceri. It was okay, but I think his sense of humor was a bit too much for me. I also felt like there was a lot of mixed messages about crime and safety in Buenos Aires. It just left me feeling very ambivalent. Some great info and sights and some really weird, why-would-you-include-this-in-a-tour type stuff. But since it was pay what you want, give it a try. It might be more your thing.

Have not even gone yet and highly recommend. I am a world travelor and must say that this group has been the best in rapid response and complete response whenever I have contacted them. They are willing and able to give the travelor much information about their home town. BRAVO!

Excellent Walking Tour!. My husband & I did a two day walking tour with Ceri. A delightful young man with a great sense of humour. Our tour was at a nice easy pace, with stops for coffee, the pharmacy, money changer and more. He was very knowledgeable. He recommended La Brigada for lunch at San Telmos. We were a bit skeptical because the neighborhood didn't seem very appealing. We were not disappointed, the steak melts in your mouth. The best we've ever had. Also the wine he recommended, was beautiful. We saw so much, learnt so much and had a great time. We felt safe and well looked after. If you are deciding on a walking tour, don't hesitate. You'll have a great time.

Great Walk When Visiting Buenos Aires. This walk with Ceri was informative and helped us to understand life in Buenos Aires. We pre booked the tour as there is a limit of people on each tour. He helped us to exchange money and educated us about counterfeit money. Our 3 hour tour allowed us to visit Cafe Tortoni, learned about the history of Casa Rosada and visit Basilica del Santisimo Sacramento. Our walk also allowed us to appreciate the various architecture around the city. This Pay as you go tour allows you to choose your payment. I highly recommend you book this tour on your first day in Buenos Aires.

A fantastic way to experience Buenos Aires. We not only saw Buenos Aires but we experienced it. We spent two full days with Oliver and thoroughly enjoyed it. Oliver grew up in California and we're from the US so communication was not a problem. He met us at the port and took us to get cabs where they don't charge the inflated rate at the port. We walked the streets of La Boca while Oliver talked about football, early immigrants and the Tango. From there we caught a bus to San Telmo where we saw an entirely different type of neighborhood. He found us a great place for lunch where we had pizza unlike what we get in the states. From there we went to Plaza de Mayo where Oliver talked about the pope, Evita and the 20th century politics of Argentina. The next day we met Oliver at one of our hotels and took cabs to the Abasto neighborhood where we saw and heard about Carlos Gardel, the father of Tango. We then took a subway to Plaza San Martin and saw the mansions of the wealthy at the beginning of the 20th century. He took us to an empanada restaurant for lunch. We finished the day at the Recoleta cemetery where Oliver told us at least a dozen stories about people buried there including Evita. It was a lot of walking but a great way to see the city. I never would have tried the subway without a tour guide. Oliver is very engaging, extremely knowledgable and a great story teller. I highly recommend him.

No better way to see Buenos Aires. My wife and I spent a fantastic day with Ceri. He was a fantastic guide. He is extremely knowledgeable and entertaining. It was the best tour we have taking in a long time. I would not hesitate to recommend him to anyone.

The best of the best!. My husband and I took another walking tour and found it to be 50 people with one guide....really? We have taken tours all over the world and never experienced a cattle call like that. And then we found this tour and walla.............a truly wonderful experience! . Ceri, our tour guide, is a professional at caring for his city and his people. As he says "I treat you as I want to be toured" and he does not disappoint. The only disappointment is when it is over. We plan on signing up with him again this week because he personalizes each and every tour - You learn practical information to be safe, you learn reasonable places to see Tango, you learn history, you laugh, you truly have a great time with Ceri. Do not visit Buenos Aires without having this experience.

Great insight into Buenos Aires through the eyes of a local. This tour is billed as an intro to Buenos Aires and I think it's an excellent way to start your time here. They cover practicalities (getting buses, where to change money etc.) which is really helpful, especially if you don't speak Spanish, and then visit a number of different neighbourhoods, some of which you are unlikely to stumble across on your own. Our guide, Richard, was really informative and knew a lot of history and fun facts, about both major attractions and more niche offers. The tour gave us some ideas for other places to explore in more detail over the coming days.

wonderful walking tour with Ceri. I can only echo many previous extremely positive reviews. Great introduction to neighborhoods of Buenos Aires visitors usually wouldn't get to on their own. Ceri seems to genuinely enjoy introducing visitors to his adopted home. The best part was the time we all had to sit together and ask any and all questions about Buenos Aires. Highly recommended for all visitors!

Excellent Guided Tour. Having very little experience of guided tours, and none of BA, I can thoroughly recommend BALT for your stay. They respond very quickly on email, offer on-line payments and our guide (Ceri) was OUTSTANDING.Informative, interesting, relevant and courteous, Ceri guided around a lot of the central areas and spent some time with us 'after duty' too as we waited for a meal reservation. Excellent!BALT even worked alongside another tour group (BIKING BA) to avoid duplication and we recommend both routes to those who physically can.This was the most informative tour we have done with Ceri/BALT. Many thanks.

Amazing, informing, private. Can only recommend it. I literally had a private city tour as the other person didn't show up. A bit sad for richards pay, but very good for me. Richard was amazing! He showed me around, very interesting for me was everything about the tango (as I'm a dancer). He answered me all the questions I had and I did have a good time.He did show me a kosher mc donalds, went with me in a tango shoe shop and gave me insider tipps on what to do. Even though I can't compare it to a "normal" tour with other people, I enjoyed it a lot and I really can recommend doing it. Thank you so much Richard for showing me your city (and thanks for the tipps and connection in your old city :) )

Ceri Was Fantastic. We booked a tour on a Saturday, but due to travel delays we had to reschedule. The company was very accommodating and rescheduled at a convenient time for us. Ceri was our guide. We are two middle aged couples. He sized us up right away and was outstanding throughout. He has an incredible sense of humor, and we were laughing all day. Our trip through the cemetery was great, thanks to all of the information Ceri provided. The tour was completely customized to our interests, and it felt like walking through a great city with an old friend. I would definitely recommend this tour, and ask for Ceri - he is a gem.

Great for first day in BA. Our guide Richard showed us several sights, but we got the most out of the tips he provided on getting around and the many local tips on how to do things in BA, like riding the Subte. My wife and I took our tour on our second day. We went back to several places Richard pointed out. We'll worth the time.

Perfect introduction to a big complicated city. This is a great way to get an overview of the geography of the city, the key themes of the city and the hotspots of the city. Ceri is a laid back, organised guide who made me feel really at home and was very generous in his touring and general BA advice. The tour was less a presentation and more a conversation, it felt so friendly and natural. We covered both tourist areas and more niche locations which was great. Look no further than this tour if you want a perfect introduction to what can be a big and complicated city.

Excellent tour with experienced guide. We were 2 girls with only 1,5 days to spend in Buenos Aires. To get the maximum out of this very limited time, we decided to try a guided tour. We did some web research, wrote several emails and decided to try BA Local Tours. Why BA Local Tours? Fast reply on the email, very friendly text and with a designated guide (Ceri) and lots of recommendations of what to see in the city, incl links to other sites. We met our guide at 10am, and were happy to see that our group consisted of only 4 people! Almost like a private tour, and our guide, Ceri, let us take part in the decision where to go/what to see. Ceri has lots of knowledge of both Buenos Aires and Argentina - history, architecture, policy, economy, etc, and we learned a lot in 3-4 hours. We wandered around in the city centre, but also went with the underground and the bus to other neighbourhoods. I highly recommend this tour, in particular when you are so lucky to be in a small group!

great time. Had the best and most interesting time with Ceri. His knowledge and patience made for a relaxing and informative walking tour. Can thoroughly recommend the walking tour for anyone, from the young to the older (my parents are in ther 70's.)

Personal and extremely informative tour. We had a small group for the Pay what you want tour and had a great time with Richard. He showed us many wonderful places and was able to give us a very lively and fascinating view of the city. The little history excursions were great for understanding Buenos Aires.Of all the walking tours we have done in other cities this has been the most memorable and personal one. Thanks Richard!

We loved the tour with Richard.. Richard was our guide, and we loved the tour, so much so that we were thinking of signing up for another tour just so that we could hear more insights from him about Buenos Aires and his life in Argentina. Unfortunately, the only thing stopping us is we don't want him to feel stalked or worried about his safety. (^_^)/He also very kindly offered to let us try matte at his studio after the tour, which we would have loved to accept, but didn't want to impose upon his time or his kindness as no doubt he did go out of his way to accommodate, guide and share with us in that short span of time all he could about buenos aires and what he thought might be useful for us. As you can see, me and my husband are big fans of Richard! I would definitely recommend that if you want real insights, and a perfect guide, go with this tour!

Fantastic tour with local guide!. We had fantastic experience with our local guide, Ceri!! It was very informative, accomodating and we had a chance to get to know more about Buenos Aires from local´s point of view. Ceri is more like a friend who love the city where he lives and willing to share its culture by showing us around. Everyplace we went are very special and they became my favorite places in Buenos Aires! Tour lasts 4 hours and this is one of must do´s when you are in the city, highly recommended!!!!!!

"The first thing to do ”. Super- informative, funny, knowledgable, engaging.Very good walking tour. A great combination of history, sight seeing and handy tips of how to navigate and get a grip of the various transport systems in BA. Jess was a great guide and we learned so much about history.All the information they share with you will help you on the following days in Buenos Aires.

Great tour of Buenos Aires. We really enjoyed our walking tour of BA with our guide, Ceri, who was super knowledgeable and answered all our questions about BA and Argentinian culture. Doing the tour gave us a great overview of the city, and Ceri gave us loads of recommendations for other things to do and where to eat - much better information than a guidebook. We also liked that he showed us some off-the-beaten-track spots that we wouldn't have otherwise found on our own.

Terrific tour. We loved Ceri's tour of the city. He obviously has a passion for B.A. Very well thought out itinerary and great advice for places to eat, things to do. Definitely think about doing this when you first arrive, it's not only very informative but lots of fun!Anna and Thomas

Best S.A. Walking Tour. This tour should be on the top of your list to do when you arrive in Buenos Aires. This city never ceases to amaze and Jonathan can give you such a great insiders view. This was one of the best walking tours we ever did.

Fun Tour in La Boca. With jessica as our guide we ventured through the most colorful part of town, "la boca," learning along the way about the history, modern culture and bbq traditions. We are an older couple 60+ but had no problem keeping up because of the casually paced tour and fellow travelers we met along the way

Excellent Tours. I did a general Buenos Aires tour as well as a private tour of La Boca. Jessica was my guide in both cases, and she was wonderful! The group tour was great for getting an overview of some well-known parts of the city as well as a few of the lesser known. It would be very helpful to do right when arriving because Jessica showed us how to use the subway and bus system which came in very handy for my trip. Jessica was extremely knowledgeable and gave really interesting information on both tours. Lastly, the group sends out a list of recommendations for Buenos Aires which was invaluable. I did many of them and thoroughly enjoyed them. I highly recommend both the group tour and Jessica!

Easy to book online and great guide. Ceri was our guide for the walking tour.. He was knowledgable about the city and what we were seeing. Ceri has an engaging personality, and even though it was a very cold day, he kept us amused with interesting antidotes about the area, the history and the people of Buenos Aires. Our 4 hours with Ceri passed by quickly! He provided us with practical information for navigating the city, an interesting sense of the history, and a list of answers to all of our questions. It is evident Ceri loves this city he now calls home! We highly recommend him...
Great tour!!. A definite must do when you visit Buenos Aires. Richard is a great guide and offers a great tour for non-spanish speakers. Good Fun and a great introduction to the city!

Good Introduction to BA. I and my husband took this tour the first day we arrived BA. It was a good introduction to BA. Richard picked us up from the Plaza Italia and took us around by public transportation, mostly buses and by foot. He gave good instructions of how to use the map and the tricks to survive with public transportation.Richard is very knowledgable and fun to be with, and of course, perfect English! The tour is very laid back and flexible. We went to many interesting places and learned about their history. More importantly, the tips of how to stay safe in BA.The only drawback of this tour was walking distance. I normally have no problem walking distance, but I found myself very exhausted. (Might be the weather or the distance between each point of interests) But if you like to walk, I would definitely recommend taking this tour.

Great tour Richard is nice. I read about this free tour on trip advisor and I was really excited to take it because I wanted to learn more about the transportation system here. I have been taking cabs around the city and figured the bus system may be cheaper and a better way to explore the city. Richard did not disappoint with this tour. He was patient and answered all of our questions. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to know more about the city.

I highly recommend Pay What You Want. This tour with Ceri should be one of the first things you do in Buenos AiresI learnt how to get around on the transport and about the different areas that makeup Buenos AiresCeri is very knowledgable and so caring and giving of informationThank you Ceri for a wonderful morning out in Buenos AiresI will highly recommend this tour to everyone and you pay at the end what you feel the tour is worth to you.

Ceri is a great guide, knowledgeable and fun, what more can you want?. My husband and I have just visited BA this last weekend and the "Pay what you want" tour was the only tour we took. Our guide was Ceri and I have one word for him (amiable) see Ceri, I finanally got down to it! this is in fact my favorite word! :) Jokes aside Ceri was both a great guide, very knowledgeable about the city and its history and culture and a great fun person to spend time with. Also even this is a pay what you want they do make sure we have a small group and I thought the size was ideal. I enjoyed the sights we visited and I am very happy we went for the tour, it's a great way to get acquainted with the city, culture etc.Thanks Ceri and hopefully see you next time! xx

Great way to kick off our trip. My boyfriend and I are spending about a month in BA and we decided to take a tour to get to know some of the city. Ceri was a great tour guide; funny, informative, and made sure we made it to the Argentina soccer game. It was great to learn about Buenos Aires through his eyes and it was nice to get the hang of getting on a bus or train. I would highly recommend his tour as a way of introducing yourself to this city.

Brilliant. We had Ceri, who was great. Ceri is Canadian/ English therefore no language problems and had very good knowledge of city and history. He is also a Thespian, so very entertaining.This is a great introduction to a city. Lots of day to day tips which will come in useful for a stay in BA. A good route and use of public transport. At the beginning of the tour, maybe it would be good to be shown a map and an overview of the route we are taking so you can orientate yourself.

Buenos Aires: great way to see the city. A colleague an I took the tour with Ceri and we had a great time! If only we didn't have to go to the airport later that afternoon, we definitely could have spent some more time touring BA based on info we received from Ceri.

Great way to orient to Buenos Aires. My husband and I had a great time on Ceri's tour. We took it on our first full day in Buenos Aires, and it was a good way to orient ourselves to the city, its neighborhoods and its public transportation system. Ceri was very entertaining and made the tour feel more personal (there were only five of us on the tour). We highly recommend the tour to anyone visiting BA!

Definitely recommend. I did Jonathan's tour and was impressed at his knowledge about the city. I also liked his light hearted jokes.
Jonathan helped us get familiar with the city and made us feel like pros with catching local transport.
We signed up for a second tour of the Recoleta, which I would also highly recommend.

Different way to know Buenos Aires. The part I liked the most from this tour was that Ceri explains you how people from BA live and in order to do that, among other things, you use public transportation. I highly recommend this tour!

Great way to see BA! . The combination of BAs amazing history with Ceri's quick witted humour made it a fun and memorable tour! Would recommend to anyone wanting to gain a deeper insight to the city of Buenos Aires.
Really interesting. Ceri was our guide and was excellent. Had a lot of local knowledge and showed us some cool spots. Would highly recommend.
Highly recommended. Very informative and very professional. Gives you a different perspective that you do not get from the tour bus. Cari is great!!!

Great Walking Tour. We did several walking tours in South America and this one stads out as the best. Perhaps it is the charm of the city, the cheap public transport, or a combination of the guide and the people on the tour but we loved the walk. It showed us some great things to do while staying in BA and made the city much mroe accessible

Great Intro to Buenos Aires!. We are so happy that we booked this walking tour with Local Tours! Ceri was awesome. He gave us an overview of BA and helped us get a feel for the city. It really increased our comfort level! I really liked that we took local bus and subway(Ceri helped me get Subte card that has made it so easy for us to use the subway). Our kids ages 7 & 10 even enjoyed the tour! Thanks also for the awesome restaurant with $3.50 steaks. We have already been there twice!

Very valuable Introduction to Buenos Aires. We did the "Pay What you Want" tour with Ceri and found it to be very worthwhile to get a sense of BsAs soon upon arriving for the first time. In addition to highlighting various points of interest, giving experience on the Subte (subway) and the bus system was very helpful too. Additionally, the great deal of information that is provided via email such as recommended Tango shows, restaurants, wine tasting, and nightlife was also so very much appreciated. Would highly recommend anyone going to BsAs for the the first time to do their tour with this outfit.

Huge fun. We love a walking tour around SA & this one was up there with the best of them. Reasons:Ceri the guide is excellent at his craft. Funny, engaging, knowledgable, super-helpful and informative. He took took to engage with us all & the result was 3 hours of great insight and a lot of laughing. Useful intel - the bus system is not that easy to navigate but Ceri equipped us with the know how to use it, and the Subte, simply. Social, political & economic content- we could schlep around the key sights ourselves but having someone bring them to life with relevant content & context made it far more valuable. Unusual/unseen gems - BA is a big place & you don't always get time to gawp at the less obvious bits. Having someone lead you to (and inside) stunning buildings is a big advantageCan't recommend enough

Good way to feel the city. I did the "Paying what you want walking tour".Very good walking tour. Informative and fun. I like that we took some transportation (bus\subway) to do it because it made me feel a bit like a resident.The spots that they show are very good as well and Ceri always try to show something surprising about them. He also showed a good expertise in the way that he managed the tour and a heterogeneous group of people.

Perfect introduction to a perfect city. Whilst travelling South America I did quite a few city walking tours and this was by far one of the best. A great combination of history, sight seeing and handy tips of how to navigate and get a grip of the various transport systems, I felt it covered everything I wanted to know and more. The pace was perfect and not too rushed. Jonathan certainly knew his stuff and was always happy to answer any question. He also sends a really great email full of suggestions afterwards. I recommended this tour to pretty much everyone I met out in BA and would definitely suggest it to anyone planning on visiting this incredible city.

a must do on arrival in BA. I am so glad I found these guys on the web before we went to BA and took their tour on our first day. Jess was a great guide and we learned so much about how to get around the city on public transport (incredibly cheap) as well as seeing some things that I doubt we ever would have without her. By the time the tour was over we had a really good idea of what else we should see in BA as well as how best to get there. The Masters golf was on while we were there and during our tour someone asked which bars might be showing it on tv. Jess wasn't sure but by the time we got back to the hotel there was an e mail waiting for us telling where we could see it. She also left us contact details for if we had any other queries whilst out n about in the city ( which, by the way, we loved). She didn't have to do either of these things but just seemed to genuinely love this city and wanted us to enjoy it too. So, go on, take the tour ( which is free, you just pay what you think when it's over) and don't be stingy with the cash at the end!!

The first thing to do in Buenos Aires. Is a great introduction to the city. You will not only visit touristic attractions, but also you will learn about Argentinian history, architecture, how to use the subte (subway), buses, money exchange rates... information that will help you on the following days in Buenos Aires.

Great way to learn about the city. Whether you're just stopping by or looking to rediscover Buenos Aires, this tour is a great way to get to know the city. Our tour guide, Ceri, was funny, knowledgable, and engaging. I learned a ton, and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Great start to our trip to BA. Ceri, our guide, provided a good overview of the city. He showed us many spots, but also recommended other must-see places along the way. We did this the second day of our trip and have since come up with an itinerary based on the information the tour provided. Overall, an interesting and helpful experience!

GREAT tour. We have been on many tours in foreign countries and this one was one of the best. It was educational, practical, informative and fun! It is a must for tourists and a great place for them to start their visit, and even for those who have lived in Buenos Aires for a good while. We stongly recommend it for young and older folks. Ceri was a wealth of insight and information....a real pleasure to be with.

Fantastic tour worth doing. I turned up for this free walking tour expecting a brief overview of the city and it's sights, but ended up getting a brilliant, detailed private tour with Oliver. We started near Palermo and took both the bus and Subte all over town which was a good introduction to the city's transport. Stopping for lunch in Abasto we then went on to see some of the most beautiful and historically important sights in Buenos Aires, ending at the Casa Rosada in Plaza de Mayo. Oliver was charming and full of knowledge throughout the tour, and being an actor he had very clear diction and lots of humour in his delivery. I imagine this is why his tour is very popular with private group tours too. I would highly recommend you take his tour as an introduction to this amazing city.

Informative. thanks for all your knowledge. I would recommend to do a full day tour split over 2 days as there is so much to see and do. It gave us an overall understanding of our location and the history of BA.

Best Introduction to Buenos Aires. Jonathan provides an excellent introduction to Buenos Aires and the means to get around the city. We thoroughly enjoyed this tour. Only wish we could've stayed in the city a bit longer so that we could put all the info regarding the transit systems to more use. Jonathan has a great personality and a great knowledge of the city and its' history. Highly recommend this tour.
BA walking tour.... Fantastic way to introduce yourself to Buenos Aires!! Oliver is a fountain of information and really enthusiastic..

A glimpse into Porteño life. If you're going to do one tour of this wonderful city, then Jonathan is your man. He offers a laid back glimpse into Porteño life in the span of just four hours, with rarely a dull moment. I wondered how something could get such great reviews from everyone around, but I now know why. Simply great - that's all I have to say!

Walking Tour at its Best. An excellent walking tour that gave these two seniors an overall introduction to the historical sights and. Neighborhoods of this fine city, Johnathon gave us an good intro into the ins and outs of the bus and transit systems, particularly useful for touristsHis humorous twist as he regaled us with the minute historical details was much appreciated.He even tolerated our numerous interruptions and answered all our questions ....The best of the best!!! Thank you Jonathan ...

Highly recommend Jonathan's Tour!!!!. This walking tour is fantastic! I highly recommend taking it during your stay in Buenos Aires! Jonathan makes the tour relaxed, and you feel more like you're exploring the city with a good friend, rather than an new one! It is an easy walk, with rests in-between so no worries if you feel tired from a long flight, this tour SHOULD BE your mandatory first stop in the city! Jonathan's insight and recommendations will help enrich the rest of your time in Buenos Aires. Best tour period.Do it!

Great tour!. I did the walking tour with Jonathan and its excellent! I had already been all over the city and done another walking tour but this tour offered fresh sights and information. Jonathan is also an excellent guide, friendly, laid back and has all the historical information. It's also useful to use the buses and subway. Overall I was really impressed and enjoyed the tour.
Show and Go. Well, others have said it well. Fun, informative, and laid back tour. Just show up and get onboard Jonathan's tour. Highly recommended

Fantastic tour of B.A.. Jonathan is a great guide - and he has a wonderful way of showing you around the city. He is a great storyteller as well so he adds a lot to just seeing some of the sights. I recommended this tour to all travelers I saw in B.A. and would recommend it to everyone here as well. Enjoy the tour and tip appropriately! The tour is great!

Excellent tour. I have lived in BA for a few years and wanted to try something a bit different and find out something new about BA. Jonathan is an entertaining guide and is very knowledgeable about the history of the city. The tour took us through areas that I hadn't really spent much time in and the amusing stories and anecdotes meant I came away knowing much more about my adopted home than I had before. Highly recommended for those new and old to the city!

Best Buenos Aires Blackout tour ever!. Great introduction tour for Buenos Aires virgins. An intimate group the day I went, Jonathan's warm and friendly manner helped us to understand this very large and complex metropolis. When a tornado struck outside the city and a blackout caused the Subte to temporarily close down, Jonathan sprang into action & we hopped unto a local bus to continue the tour. Highly recommended.

The best walking tour we have ever done.. We were is Buenos Aires a couple of weeks ago and found this tour on the Internet. Jonathan was a very informative and entertaining guide. He has that dry UK sense of humour that make it as entertaining as watching a John Cleese movie. I have always avoided buses in unfamiliar cities but this tour actually show us how to use them to get around. The inclusion of bus and subway as part of the tour made it possible to see areas we would not have been able to see merely on foot.

Marvellous intro. to city. Jonathan 's tour was excellent in every way - informative, interesting, fun and entertaining. It is a great way to orient yourself in the city. Over the four hours you not only learn about Buenos Aires and its history, but also get the experience of traveling on the bus and subway. Jonathan clearly has a love for the city and imparts his enthusiasm to his guests. He happily answers questions, and follows up the tour with a list of recommendations of places to eat. The tour is free, but donations are gratefully accepted. In all honestly everyone should tip him - he gives you more information than you would get on many other tours for which you would pay a premium. If you only do one tour in Buenos Aires, do this one.

Highly recommended. An excellent introduction to Buenos Aires. Jonathan provided us with a very interesting 4 hours, full of information of life here both past and present. He included many stories which were highly amusing and was very aware for our safety and well-being.

Excellent tour as an introduction. Jonathan is a great British chap that gave us a great introductory tour of BA. I can only recommend this tour to everybody, since he actually explains things, especially about the public transportation system (we've had enough free tours that promise a guide to public transport and all they tell you which bus to get on to get to the bus terminal!). He also sent us an email with a ton of recommendations where to eat ecc. Great guy, good portion of humor, I can only tell you: do it!

Great tour with a routined and well informed guide. The tour was an enjoyable walk through different quarters of Buenos Aires and full of information. Jonathan did a great job in showing us some of the city highlights as well as some "offbeat" places... Very useful was also the introduction to the public transport system - especially for those who stay more than just 1-2 days. Thanks Jonathan.

A great orientation to Buenos Aires. Jonathan gave us a great orientation to the subte and buses as well as local color and history. This was a well spent 4 hrs and advice on places to eat, visit out of town as well as in and suggestions on places to taste wine were appreciated in an email after. Humor and advice intermingled, thanks.Bruce and Pam

Walking Tour Buenos Aires. This was our first walking tour in South America,and hope that the next ones are as good. Jonathan is very talented and informative as well as friendly. The 4 hourIs really enjoyable, we highly recommend Jonathan if you are in Buenos Aires,you won't be disappointed.

Thanks Jonathan (induction complete). We've done a few walking tours around South America and Jonathan's been the best this far. He's talented, funny and understands his clients needs. Can't ask for more... Cheers, James & Zoe

Great intro to BA. Took Jonathan's 4 hour tour this morning. It is a great way to get your bearings about the layout of Buenos Aires neighborhoods and the use of the buses and subways to get around. Time is spent on historic figures, tango singers and political and architectural history. Quick stop for lunch in an architectural marvel broke up the walk at just the right time. Highly recommend!
Terrific. BA is a dynamic and interesting city. Jonathan made it even more enjoyable. The tour was just the right length, not too much standing around and very informative. Even the jokes work!

For seasoned travelers and first-time visitors to CABA!. Navigating Buenos Aires is a challenge even the most experienced traveler. Therefore, I highly recommend investing in Jonathan’s bilingual (Spanish/English) time and wisdom. A few tips that truly aided: a) obtain coins for public transportation (only coins accepted) and other minor transactions; b) bring an umbrella during the summer season; c) flexibility and humor are great! But so is awareness and following Jonathan’s advice on where to go, when to go, and _how_ to go (he will explain); d) research in advance your interests – Jonathan will add breadth and depth. Enjoy la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires (CABA)!

A must do. Whether you're in Buenos Aires for just a few days or for an extended time, Jonathan's tour should be a must on your list of things to do. The tour only lasts 4 hours but the information you get on using the Subte and bus system is great, and the Jonathan's stories about BA history are both informative and amusing. This tour was a great introduction to BA!

Free walking tour in Buenos Aires! Very good with guide Jonathan. You go to a lot of interesting places in Buenos Aires and learn how to take the bus in BA. Very interesting and funny. I can totally recommend that free tour!

Best guided tour in BA. Jonathan is an excellent tourguide. At the beginning he showed how to navigate in the Bussystem which is nearly impossiple to handle without such an explaination. the first stop was in Abasto about Carlos Gardel, the "father" of the tango. After lunch we headed to Plaza de Mayo where Jonathan told about the History of Argentina. Nothing more to say than that it was an excellent tour, I ejoyed it.

be there. if you have 24 hrs in BA,and had to choose between all this city has to offer,i would suggest this to be the one and only attraction to do in this limited time,since it gives such a great combination of BA daily life and it's rich history that you feel yourself like you finished BA 101 at the end..But be advised that this is the tour not to be missed even if you have lots of time in your hand and probably more appreciated if you take it at the beginning of your vacation..

Excellent free walking tour of BA. I think Jonathan has the perfect combination of information and humor. I really enjoyed this trip as he is both very attentive to the needs of his group and does a good job of combining facts with myths and sparkeling it with a good portion humour.

Simply the best. Hands down,the most fun and informative (these don't always come in pairs) almost five hours i spent in BA this february.I am telling you,if you are not a wine crazed person(and heck even if you are) this is probably the only thing you need to do in BA...this is BA 101 to start with.Jonathan has set the bar so high that the only problem is we will need to evaluate the future guides to this one..and won't be satisfied...

Interesting and Informative. A friend and I started our 4 day stay in Buenos Aires with Jonathan's tour which was a great decision. We organized a private tour of the cemetery before the public tour and he met us at our hotel right on time. The tour of the cemetery was full of fun, interesting information and going with a guide included the added benefit of not getting lost! After our tour, we went to Plaza Italia for the regularly scheduled tour - our group was a manageable size (7) and Johnathan gave a great explanation of how to use the bus system as well as how to navigate the Subte safely. The tour covers the major historical sites in central BA as well as Abasto - an area we would have been unlikely to find/visit on our own. Post-tour he gave us helpful info on visiting San Telmo/La Boca on our own as well as sending out a post tour email full of restaurant and Tango suggestions. Overall, it was a great way to start our visit to the city and help get ourselves oriented in Buenos Aires.

Do this at the start of your trip!. A great, free tour of Buenos Aires. Jonathan shows you a lot of the major Buenos Aires sites, and explains the history and context quite well. The most unique and helpful thing that he does is teach you how to navigate the Buenos Aires bus system, which without his guidance is very confusing at best. And he explains it quite well. I'd recommend doing this on one of your first days. It will give you context for the rest of the sites you see through your trip, and will help you get around the city!

Great intro to the city. This was a perfect tour to start our 6 week stay in Buenos Aires. In addition to all the historical and landmark information, Jonathan set us up for success by teaching and letting us experience the transit system. Very helpful and practical tour with lots of tips and recommendations for further activities in the city. Thanks Jonathan!

Top Tour. Jonathon was a great guide.. he told interesting stories about BA with an English wit. And his advise on how to use the bus system there was invaluable! We had no idea how to use buses until he explained

A wonderful intro to the city. This (02-01-14) is our first day in Buenos Aires. Lots of rain but that didn't stop Jonathan. He gave our group of 6 his unique British perspective, 2 subway rides and a bus ride, with an e-mail follow up of lots of touring and eating tips here. It's peppy, informative, and he is the ultimate professional.

Highlight of Buenos Aires. I was in BA for the first time for five days and Jonathan's tour near the beginning of my stay was definitely a highlight. (I'd even recommend coming to BA just for his tour.) :-) He is knowledgeable, witty, clearly professional in leading a group through some of the complications of the bus system (his IT background helps, I think), and the subte. At the end of the "free tour" ( I agree with others - tip him as much as you can afford), he continued with our group on a private tour (previously arranged by a couple who were on the free tour) for two more hours. Even though BA was suffering a heat wave, he was as fresh at the end of the day as at the start. Even helped me with directions back to my Airbnb apartment as he was going on the same bus line. Thank you Jonathan!

Brilliant tour!. We took a free tour with Jonathan last december and it was excellent. He waited at Plaza Italia, sitting on the steps next to the statue with a small sign next to him. Pay attention in the beginning as he will explain the public transport system to you, which is just immensely valuable for your stay in Buenos Aires. Jonathan took us to a lot of interesting sites around the city, being able to provide lots of information at every stop. This is definitely a tour worth doing! Be sure to tip him at the end, as he does make his living doing these tours. You don't have to worry about bringing lunch, as you'll be making a lunch stop at Abasto Shopping Center in the middle of the tour.

Everything you need to know to get around!. Jonathan in an interesting man that tells a good story. His quick synopsis of the historical aspects of our tour gave us a real insight into Argentinian history. What we found exceptionally valuable was his tips on how to navigate the transit system in this huge metropolis. Although taxis are not expensive, getting around during the gridlock of rush hour is a bonus. Thank you Jonathan!

Excellent Tour. Took the tour on January 14, 2014. My husband and I had arranged for a private tour of the cemetary before the regular tour began. Jonathan was interesting, knowledgeable and relevant. After the tour, our random group of tourists hired him for an additional two hours of touring. Taking the bus and subway was another way to experience B.A. authentically.A must tour at the beginning of your visit to Buenos Aires.

Good intro. This was a good tour. I recommend you take it at the beginning of your visit to get some good tips, see the top landmarks (casa rosada, congress, palacio barolo, and the area around Gardel's museum) + it is FREE...just leave a tip at the end. Note, you will need to take a bus and the subte (metro) so have coins and cash handy.

Excellent tour with Jonathan. Jonathan took us to the most important parts of the city. He took us by bus and subte and explained how both work. He is extremely knowledgeable about the history of B.A. and has an excellent sense of humour. He is also amazingly conscientious and makes you feel he really cares: the following day after the tour, we received an email from him containing a bunch of websites of other places which we had asked about. He also told us to email him if we had any questions. Thank you so much Jonathan!Don't miss the local tour with Jonathan, it really is a must!D & D from Toronto, Canada

Great way to spend the day and get to know BA. The day starts 11am (still get to sleep in) at the Italian square meeting point which is very centrally located to most of the popular areas. You meet Jonathan and he explains the day and most importantly the essentials of the public transport system: Bus (Which in BA can be complex unless someone explains it to you) and metro (pretty straight forward if you have used other metro around the world).Sites: Jonathan first took us to the area where Carlos Gardel lived and now is a museum dedicated to him. You then have lunch at the oldest meat market in BA which is now a beautiful air con shopping centre but the building has been kept the same. You then head to see more popular buildings but most importantly for me was the Pink house where Evita famously sung to her people.As mentioned on previous post there is no pressure from Jonathan to tip and he is very informative of the history of BA and answers all questions.I highly recommend doing the tour on your first day as it teaches you the basics of the city.

Great way to start your stay in Buenos Aires. I know very little Spanish and will be living in BA for the next sixth months. On my second day in BA, I went on a tour with Jonathan. Jonathan not only gave a good introduction to some of the major sights in the city, he also smoothly guided us through public transport. I am now more confident about using the buses and subte and am more excited about my stay in BA. Thanks!

Good introduction. Can't beat the price...he really didn't put too much pressure on the group to give him tips, though everyone was happy to do so. Probably most useful for someone who wants to get oriented to using public transportation, as he spent a bunch of time on explaining the bus and subway systems, including giving you a bit of experience using both. Good but fairly basic introduction to some Argentine history and culture by way of some of the major tourist sites.

Excellent, Easy, Educational. Jonathan is a very pleasant, informative English expat who has been living in BA for quite a while. His tour is interesting, he is well informed and a pleasure to walk with. He has a good and well researched knowledge of the sights, significances and highlights of this city. He presents this information well, even though the fatigue of conduction over 800 of these tours must be beginning to tell., the delivery is fresh and stimulating.An superb introduction to the city and its culture.The tip for services provided is optional and well deserved ... it is also most tactful. One feels tha\t one has been walking with a friend.
Great intro to Buenos Aires and Argentina. Jonathan was great. Very informative, very interesting. He deserves as big a tip as you can afford to give him.

Excellent jump start to your days in BsAs. We took the tour in our first day in Buenos Aires and I gotta say it was an excellent way to start us off to the rest of our days over there! At first I was a little afraid of not being able to make it all the way to the end of the tour because I have a disability but the way the tour was designed it makes it for a very comfortable time. The tour was very informative and funny, we had a lot of fun riding the bus system and the subway, it got us ready to enjoy the rest of our stay only using public transport which was very cost effective.Jonathan knows a whole lot about BsAs and its history and attractions, we saw a lot of great spots, took pictures learnt about the historic of the places we went to.To top it all off, the opportunity to meet lots of different people from other countries was a blast!I definitely recommend this tour to everyone heading out to Buenos Aires.

Do this first!. I am so happy I took this tour with Jonathan! It was like having a really smart and funny friend walk me through the city, showing how to get around and pointing out some important and beautiful sights. Jonathan also made great suggestions based upon all of our own personal interests. I met great people on the tour as well and am so happy I did this first. Thanks so much!
