How to get your bearings in BA. Excellent introduction to the major attractions of the city and more importantly how to get around on both buses and subways. If you are a first time visitor to BA this information is invaluable.

Great Way to see the city. Jonathan (Brithish who has lived here for 5 years) brings an interesting view to all that is Buenos Aires and Argentinan. We took 2 other free tours which we also liked very much but this tour takes you places the others don't and with Jonathan wit and non Argentinan view makes it The Best! I would do this tour ASAP when arriving here as he explains the bus and subway system, so you can actually use them!! Great tour in an interesting city!

Great introduction to the city. The tour was a great introduction to the history, the highlights and public transportation in Buenos Aires. I recommend doing it upon arrival. Jonathan has a deep understanding of the culture and history of this city. His insights, anecdotes and sense of humor make it a great way to discover Buenos Aires.

Great Time. We had a great tour with Jonathan Evans. He was funny, very informative and made the tour fun. He taught us how to use the public transportation system which helped us on another day of touring on our own. He also provided several valuable links to other attractions and dinner recommendations. Highly recommend this tour.

A must-do. I definitely recommend Jonathan's tour. He will take you to some unusual places, tell you the history of everywhere you visit, tell you some funny stories, and is a very interesting person. It would be useful to do is tour on your first day in Buenos Aires as he will also explain the geography of the city an how to use public transport. The tour is FREE (wow) but I guarantee you will feel compelled to contribute to his admirable diet of steak, Malbec and beer.

Best free walking tour in Buenos Aires. My husband and I did this tour on our first day in Buenos Aires and we couldn't have started our stay there on a better note. I won't repeat what a lot of other reviewers have already said, but this is really an excellent walking tour, and largely down to Jonathan's personality. We did another free walking tour later in the week, which was also good, but did not match up to Jonathan's. Aside from the tour itself, Jonathan was also kind enough to mail us some additional information after the tour (recommendations for restaurants, tango shows, etc..) which was extremely useful.

a fun unique slice of Buenos Aires very rich, riveting life. Jonathan´s expert rollercoaster tour was great fun and a completely novel take on this amazing city. Not sure what to expect as non tour people Jonathan´s lighthearted very practical tour takes in some of the classic sights plus a bus and metro route combined with parts of the city we´d never have been to otherwise like Carlos Gardel`s fascinating tango neighbourhood and a palace's weird and very wonderful homage to dante. An enjoyable and informative 4 hours, we wished it could have been longer!

Addenda. I won't re-state the many plaudits already given this tour, but I'd like to emphasize Jonathon's clarity in presentation, his very sharp sense of humor, as well as his consistent energy and enthusiasm during the tour.

Great Overview, History, and Local Information. Jonathan is full of interesting and useful information. He starts his tour covering some of the basics of the public transportation in Buenos Aires. Buses and the subway are used to get around during his tour so it makes sense, but also makes getting around the city easier for the rest of your stay. During the tour he gives lots of back stories about the places you are seeing and leaves you with plenty of ideas for places to back and see more in depth later. While you are walking around you have plenty of time to talk to the other tourists (10 in our group) and the guide to find out what he and they recommend.It was very hot during our tour and Jonathan made sure to keep to the shade and offer water breaks when they were needed. It's a small thing you want to expect, but don't always get. He also will send an email with recommendations for restaurants, tango shows, day trips, etc after the tour. Definitely a 5 star free walking tour, make 4 hours to head out and learn about Buenos Aires soon after your arrival.

Jonathan is amazing. He is very knowledgeable and shared with us a lot of interesting stories. The places he showed us are very interesting. I totally enjoyed the tour, and it is the best part of our stay at Buenos Aires.

Great Introduction to the City!. A friend and I took this tour in December 2013. We found it a useful way to spend our first day in Buenos Aires - it gave us an appreciation of the public transportation (especially the bus) and the orientation of the city. Jonathan couldn't have been friendlier and answered all of our questions about the city! We went to an area that we couldn't have gone to on our own - but gained an understanding of Carlos Gardel, Tango in BA, and street art in BA. And very much enjoyed ourselves!! The tour is relaxed, very casual - our group was around 10, very friendly, and Jonathan escorted us efficiently through the city. Our tour was 4 1/2 hours. There was a lunch break half way through with a bathroom break. We found Jonathan right away - it was nice to meet in Palermo since that is where we were staying. We ended downtown near the Casa Rosada - which was an easy place to continue to venture around the city for a few more hours. Only complaint - wish there was a little more walking down the Calle de Mayo rather than taking the subway 2x! Jonathan sent out a helpful email after the tour with good restaurants to eat at, Tango shows to attend, and other tours to take.Highly recommend!!

A perfect tour with an excellent guide. We did this tour the day after we landed in Buenos Aires and it was an absolutely perfect introduction to the city. Yes, it is true that the tour is free, although everyone tips because they find him so great. Jonathon is extremely knowledgeable about Buenos Airies and answers all questions confidently and with a sense of humor. We even learned about how to get around the city via bus or subway in addition to getting a great tour, so this was an added bonus.We also enjoyed our tour so much that we took a private tour with him of Recoleta Cemetary later in the week. This was excellent as well.- Mark and Anna

informative and fun. Jonathon showed us interesting sites, told us the history of those sites, and also taught us several helpful hints on traveling in BA. It was because of him that we were able to travel easily by bus and save a ton on taxis while we were there. He was also really pleasant and funny. I would highly recommend this tour, especially at the very beginning of your visit. What I would not recommend is a terrible pizza by the slice place that is allegedly popular. Jonathon warned us (thank you Jonathon) but we risked it. We should have listened to Jonathon. :)

Excellent Tour. This tour is an excellent way to get to know Buenos Aires and to see a few areas that otherwise you probably wouldn't know about. Jonathan's knowledge of the city is great and the tour relaxed and enjoyable. The tour is around 4 hours long which is long enough to get a feel for the city and to also try out the cities buses and subway.A great way to start a stay in BA. Would certainly recommend it.

Recommended. We joined Jonathon's tour and found it useful. It was easy to reach the meeting point and find him. He showed us us around but what I found most useful is taking us through public transport and teaching us how to use it (the card/guia t).

Excellent and entertaining guide. A friend recommended Jonathan to us and we were not disappointed. His tour is very informative, entertaining and took us to places I don't think we would have discovered by ourselves.This is a great tour to do to get a sense of the city when you arrive, and to hear some great stories about Argentine history and culture.

Great Tour, Great Guide!. My girlfriend came across Jonathan's highly recommended tour on Trip Advisor prior to our trip to Buenos Aires so we decided to give it a shot. Conveniently, the tour started off in Plaza Italia off of Ave. Santa Fe which was a few blocks away from where we were staying. It was easy to find Jonathan and once there, he was very engaging with everyone as we waited for the tour to start. He did a great job of giving a brief history of each area in which we stopped and explained the bus and Subte systems to us and showed us how to navigate them. I highly recommend this tour, especially if it will be your first time in Buenos Aires. After the tour, my girlfriend and I had a better feel for the city and as a result, we were able to navigate around more confidently.

Free tour is a must!. We joined Jonathan's free tour at Plaza Italia and were impressed with him from the moment we met. There were 17 of us in this group (according to Jonathan, this is one of the largest groups) but he made everyone feel comfortable and important. We then boarded a bus after he gave us a lesson on the various bus lines in Buenos Aires and had the opportunity, later in the day, to ride the subway. Jonathan took us to visit key places in Buenos Aires and entertained us with informative tales about various Argentinians along the way. We were impressed with Jonathan's concern for our safety and with his wit and personality. His tour is in fact free but the majority of people tip him at the end of the four hours because of the quality of this tour. We had also booked some private time with Jonathan to visit La Boca and the Recoletta Cemetery, again very worthwhile. The cost was $ 35 per hour and well worth it.Highly, highly recommend this tour.

Great start to BA. Can't beat Jonathan when you get to BA! While the Tour is free ,people seemed to tip genourously, as this is a very practicval and imformaative way to start your love affair with this this City. At the end of the tour he emailled us heaps of infomation on where to go, eat, see etc . A must for any tourist ,particularly those ,like me, who had never been to BA before.

Just do it!. I found Jonathan here on tripadvisor and thought we'd give it a shot. We got to Plaza Italia and there he was. We waited for a few more folks to show up and off we went. His tour was very informative and fun. He had a great sense of humor and kept things light. The pace of the tour was great too - I never felt rushed, or felt like we were lingering anywhere too long. I never would have attempted the bus system, yet it turned out to be one of the highlights! This was a fantastic way to meet BA and the tour grounded us for the rest of our trip. Bonus: He e-mailed us a list of restaurants, clubs, tango shows and other tours - several of which we checked out and all turned out fabulously.

Excellent local tour of Buenos Aires. I took Jonathan's free walking tour of Buenos Aires and found it both information and highly entertaining! Jonathan really knows his city and it was a huge help to be taught how to ride the subway and the local buses. I recommend doing Jonathan's tour in the first day or so after you arrive in order to get a great understanding of the city, this tour will set you up with everything you need to know in order to further explore BA on your own. I also did a private tour with Jonathan and he was at my hotel on time and we had a great day together. Being a solo female traveler I would not have seen nearly as much of the city if I was not with Jonathan! Thanks for a great day Jonathan!

His humour left us in pieces.. Johnathan offers a great product in this free tour. Despite my lack of worldliness and after mistakingly asking if his accent was Australian, he forgave me and gave us a great tour. I agree with others who have posted on TA that taking this tour on your first day in BA is a must. I now travel the subte and the bus with ease but do look forward to the iPhone app for the Argentine bus system. Thanks also for the kosher big mac experience (only kosher McDo outside Isreal) . Despite my insistence I was unable to order it with cheese.

Very enjoyable tour that goes slightly off the beaten track. A group of four of us took Jonathan's tour last week and we all really enjoyed it. Jonathan has a great sense of humour, provides extremely helpful tips for staying in BA, and has chosen a route that gives a good introductory feel for the city. We loved the Abasto section which we wouldn't have seen had we not taken the tour, and the guide's ability to summarise a lot of the city's history in an interesting and succinct way is quite impressive. We were part of a large group of people from all age groups, and despite having to herd us on to a very busy bus and two very busy trains Jonathan was patient and helpful at all times. We would have liked to have seen a little more during the 4 hours but overall I would really recommend this free tour.

Great introduction to the city. I feel that this is a must-do when you first get to the city: you learn the basics about getting around, cultural and political aspects of the porteno life. We found it both useful and pleasant and would recommend it if you are at the start of your trip. Of course if you spend a lot of time you already learn that stuff, but using this tour you get a head start.

Excellent overview of this great city. In 4 hours (which seems to go really fast), you get to see the key places and get an overview and understanding of Buenos Aires. If something particularly strikes your fancy, you can return by yourself at a later day/time. Jon has a wonderful perspective of BA, it's culture, and its history. By the end of the tour, you will become a mini Porteno.

An excellent introduction to Buenos Aires. In the short space of the free tour Jonathan shared insights and history for BA that were extremely interesting and useful to my travel companions and I. He also educated us on the practicalities of using the somewhat complex bus, subway and train system here and freely shared his knowledge of additional interesting locations we then visited in our spare time, such as about Tigre. We saw several of the major attractions in the free tour along with history and stories we wouldn't have known otherwise. We ended up also booking him for a guided tour of Recoleta Cemetary and the area and would have booked more if we'd had the time. We highly recommend the free tour and also booking Jonathan to show you around additional parts of the city!

A great way to start your holiday in Buenos Aries. I haven’t really done any walking tours in ages, but if this is how it´s absolutely worth the 3 hours on Day one of your holiday in Buenos Aries. Jonathan has great insight to places and information just kept flowing which really helped us appreciate the places and get a sense of wow or aha! It really made a difference when we decided to see or do things later in the city. Plus he´s got a sense of humor which does help a lot :)Gladly recommend this walking tour to anyone considering it. Here´s a tip - Bring coins and small notes for the subway and bus. Very cool way to feel like a local for a day or at least half a day

Get your bearings and enjoy friendly guide!. Yesterday's tour was simply lovely. We learned how to use the nifty bus info book which will help me get around for the next 6 weeks, explored 2 lines of the subway and got some colorful and informative history of many city sites. I showed up for the tour not knowing quite what to expect and was thrilled with the 16 other travelers from various parts of the world who gathered for the journey. Some on the tour were only here for 2-4 days while several where at the beginning of much longer stays. All seemed equally satisfied, some so much that additional tours were scheduled.Thank you Jonathan for your warm welcome to the city and enjoyable 4 hours of learning / fun!

Fascinating insights into the city and country. Very enjoyable introduction to Buenos Aries and to Argentina. The tour is free but a tip is expected and justified. Nice pace with plenty of chances to ask questions of a very knowledgeable, English guide. I would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone seeking an overview of this fascinating city.

Awesome tour, great guide!. I have taken the tour on my first day in BsAs, and it was the best thing to do to start my stay! I can only repeat all the good things I had read about it before.It's not only about the places you visit (some you might not think to go to on your own), but also all the useful information Jonathan shares, not without a certain (brit!) sense of humor. He takes the time to talk with all the people attending the tour (and we were a big goup that day!) to understand better their expectations and give the best recommendations.I would also highly recommend his recoleta cemetary tour, full of great stories!Don't think twice, go meet Jonathan!

the best thing to do on the first day of your stay in BA. Everything that I can say have already been written in the earlier reviews, but once again - this really is an awesome tour, one of the best free walking tours I have ever attended (and I attended many). I feel like this city walk has been a solid foundation to exploring Buenos Aires further. No matter if your stay here is going to be short or long - take the tour and you either get nice idea where you wanna have a closer look next days, or, if you are leaving soon, you get a nice overview of the most important landmarks. Jonathan is a great guide, you will get tons of information about Buenos Aires and Argentina, their history, culture, politics, ... and also great practical hints! It's like a mine of information - seems that you can ask any questions and get the answer :) Thanks to Jonathan for a very nice afternoon in the city - sure I will recommend this tour to anyone who is visiting BsAs!

Fun & informative. 4 hours went by in no time with Jonathan's enthusiastic & informative guide of the central part of the city as well as the Abasto quarter. His detailed explanation of the bus system would help any newly arrived travellers get around this city with a large and very connected bus system. We can easily imagine his free tour to be way superior to conventional paid tours that are impersonal and over commercialized. Highly recommended!

Great ambassador for Buenos Aires. That was how my husband summed up the tour. Jonathan is as advertised. He picks you up where he says he will, when he says he will, takes great care with his charges, and shares his extensive knowledge (large and small) of Buenos Aires. It's one hell of a tour. Brilliant.

This is an excellent tour!. My friend and I had heard about this "tour given by an ex-pat Brit that starts at the Plaza Italia that starts everyday at 11am" from other American tourists. Jonathan came highly recommended and we weren't disappointed. The day of our particular tour it was overcast. When only 2 other tourists showed up for the tour we were fearful he might cancel but we were not disappointed. In fact, our tour was even more personal because of the small size. Jonathan patiently answered all of our questions. He also followed up with excellent recommendations and suggestions afterwards that were tailored specifically to us after he had gotten to know us throughout the day. I especially liked the stop at Carlos Gardel's house and lunch in Abasto. Who knew? I would have felt like such an idiot if I returned to the US without knowing about Carlos Gardel. Jonathan's patient advice on how to use the Buenos Aires metro and bus was especially useful for anyone planning on spending more than a few days in BA. An excellent tour.

Jonathon's tour is dead solid perfect.. We won't repeat the superlative in the earlier reviews since we agree with all of them. Jonathon's tour was excellent and is well worth your time. However, we will add something that was unique to our tour. We are elderly, and my wife has somewhat limited mobility. We were concerned that this would be a problem and explained this to Jonathon before beginning. He assured us it was not a problem, so we continued. All during the tour, Jonathon was very concerned about her limitations and made sure we were not left behind. Take Jonathon's tour. You won't be disappointed.

Amazing Tour! Not to miss. Went on the walking tour with Jonathon today and it was fantastic! We learned so much about the city, it's culture, and its history; the information has really provided perspective and added value to the rest of my experiences in Buenos Aires. Jonathon was extemely friendly and animated, and made the tour really fun. I'm definitely glad I didn't miss this - I'd recommend it to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!!
Brilliant tour!. Even as regular visitors and old inhabitants we learnt new facts and visited previously unknown areas. Thanks Jonathan!!

FANTASTIC!. After reading everyone's reviews, I am happy to confirm that Jonathan is the only way to go if you want to catch all the essential places in Buenos aires. We first did the private tour (recoleta- cemetery) and free tour in 1 day. I can really say that there is no way we would have seen (as well as found- we have map reading issues! HAHA) all the attractions we needed to see here. He is filled with a wealth of knowledge on the culture and history of Buenos aires, it is seriously impressive! I can promise you will not be disappointed with his service as it goes way beyond the call of duty (yes he does email really quickly, gives a list of things to do after the visit and you can always use him for more questions at a later stage during your trip.) He was so good that we did another private tour of the boca area. Once again without having read tons on the area, he gave us a mini history class in the space of 1.5 hours! Priceless really!!! Thanks for making our Buenos Aires trip a great one!

Top Day Out. This tour is pretty friendly and relaxed.Very informative and the trail allows you to explore some hidden gems of BA that you might not be aware of, as well as braving the public bus system!Well worth 4 hours of your time!!

BsAs sights & activity!!. A fantastic tour by a fantastic person!! Jonathon certainly knows his stuff!I've been to BsAs a number of times but still learnt new things, went to new places and did new things that I haven't done before.Well worth it! I'd thoroughly recommend Jonathan's tours!! The normal tour is 4 hours with a lunch and toilet stop but by prior arrangement with Jonathan extended tours can be accommodated. There is no fee but you should make a worthwhile tip for Jonathan's expertise and time!

1 day in Buenos Aires. Even prior to the tour Jonathan was so helpful and full of useful information. We only had 1 full day, but Jonathan helped us make the most of it, showing us the highlights and giving us some great advice on what else to do after the tour had ended in this great city.Thank you

Tour with Jonathan - excellent. Jonathan what a super guy - so interesting, so enjoyable - made us feel so confident to travel on bus & train. We covered a lot of area and were made to feel very comfortable walking around the city and what a city is it. Without a doubt you must take the tour - well worth whatever tip at the end you wish to give. We ourselves are in our mid 50's - we met people of all different ages and from all over the world - thank you Jonathan you have got it so right.

Two Enthusiastic Thumbs Up. A truly memorable trip around the city. Jonathan is the ultimate tour guide: knowledgeable, personable, and down-right entertaining! Tour was well paced and thoughtful. Ultimate insiders’ tour with trivia and stories to last a lifetime.

Really worth doing. We really enjoyed this tour. We learned so much about Buenos Aires and Argentina and saw so much that we would never have by ourselves. Jonathan was informative and funny and gave us great tips and pointers about places to go. Not too hard on the feet either!!

Good Overview to the City. I did this tour on my first full day in Buenos Aires, and I was really glad I did. I was staying in Palermo Soho, and even though I am a really good walker, it was just too far to walk all the time from my hotel. This tour gives you the skills and the confidence to use public transit in Buenos Aires, primarily the subway. While it is not as nice as the subway in other cities, is a very efficient way to get around. Another benefit of the tour is you learn quite a bit about the city, and it give you much more context for your visit. I enjoyed seeing the Abasto neightborhood, and its colorful murals and art deco shopping center. I doubt I would have seen this on my own. I also liked the fact that the tour ended at the Plaza de Mayo. Since it was a Thursday afternoon, I got to the see the Madres demonstration, which was one of the most moving sights I saw in Buenos Aires. Jonathan was a great guide. The only thing I would improve on the tour is to skip the last subway ride, which was very short and walk down Ave de Mayo instead. Otherwise it was perfect and highly recommend.

Do this once, it's a must. Even if you think you know BA this is worth your time. Jonathan knows the place so well and shares his knowledge in an informative and interesting way, pointing out the idiosyncrasies of life in BA and the mentality of the Latin American. Sharing knowledge of history with daily life in this amazing city.An absolute must very early on in any visit to get yourself acquainted with BA.

A measured and worthwhile overview of BA. Myself snd my parents: 25, 57, 65, took Johnathon's tour shortly after arriving in BA from Scotland. Armed with jetlag and only a few words of Spanish we visited some of the city's iconic sites and were also afforded an induction into the local public transportation systems. The tour sites are well chosen and varied, offering a snapshot of various suburbs. Johnathon's calm and natural demeanor allow you to tramp around like an honorary local, jumping on and off buses and subway systems and providing detailed descriptions of all cultural and historic sites. At 4 hours this tour is manageable without the usual tour guide overkill. Highly recommended, we will take on the pub quiz next time!

Great tour!. I took this tour last week with some friends and we all thoroughly enjoyed it! Jonathan is an excellent tour guide and his knowledge of the city including the history of Buenos Aires is so interesting. He took us around on the public transportation which is so beneficial to know how to use. We saw some places off the "beaten path" which we would not have seen otherwise. Put this on your "must do" list.
Awesome tour. I took this tour back in August, and it was great! This tour is full of info, fun, and humour. Jonathan knows everything about BA. Highly recommended, a must-do! Thanks Jonathan!

A 'must do' in Buenos Aires. A brilliant tour and an absolute must when you arrive in Buenos Aires. Jonathan very well informed and fascinating about the city with a number of amusing anecdotes to tell. I learnt all sorts of gems (how do you know the trains in BA were made by the English? - they all run on the left!!) and had buildings pointed out that I would not have especially noticed but would certainly never have known the story about them. It was very helpful to have the bus routes and underground explained and I felt much more confident about using them on my own after. Then to cap a wonderful 4 hours Jonathan then sent an email to all of us on the tour with helpful general information about where to eat, places to go to etc. Highly highly recommended.

A must-do tour. My husband and I took this tour yesterday and it was really great. Jonathan is an articulate, witty and hugely well informed resident of Buenos Aires and his commentary throughout the day was super-easy on the ear (unlike some guides!) and highly informative and entertainingThe tour is a good mix of social, political and historical info, well delivered in bite-sized bits. A lunch stop with bathroom break mid-way makes it comfortable and the time just flew by.We have a few follow-up outings planned as a result of the tour - things we would have missed had we not taken the tour and learned so much from JonathanA great way to spend a day in BA - highly recommended for any age group. We are in our late 60s and found it very easy.Mairead, Bristol

One of the best tours I've ever experienced!. This is the first thing a first-time visitor to Buenos Aires should do. The city is really big and quite sprawling - it can be overwhelming. Jonathan gives an excellent overview of the city before taking you through a few of the most interesting areas via bus, subway and walking. And he is a pleasure to talk with - full of interesting stories about the city's history and great recommendations for restaurants, sights, bars, etc.

Every city should have a tour like this!. This was the best tour I experienced in our two weeks in BA. I was skeptical of all the positive reviews and the whole idea of it being free but it is well worth your time and Jonathan definitely earned his tips. By the end, our group of 5 were all comfortable with the bus/subway system and had a great base of knowledge for our remaining time in the city. The email full of all and any attraction's websites/details we'd talked about after was much appreciated and was crucial to make our time great. Cheers Jonathan!

An amazing experience!. I went on this tour last week, and even though I had already been in BA for almost 2 weeks, he showed me a lot of new things and told a lot of interesting stories I didn´t know before. Jonathan is really nice, knows what he is talking about and makes the city even cooler than it already is. I would definitely recommend this tour!

A must do if in Buenos Aires. This is an absolutely fantastic tour – a must do if in Buenos Aires. Jonathan has a fantastic way of sharing historical data as well as giving a good sense of the current situation. All of this obviously comes along with a great British sense of humor. He gives fantastic tips on how to get around the city and also avoid pickpockets and other unpleasant experiences that may ruin your holidays in BA. Do it on your first day in BA!

Jonathan is a great tour guide...funny, informative and very gracious.. My friends and I went on this walking/riding tour of Buenos Aires on the first day we were there and are very grateful for Jonathan and all his information. He is witty and very knowledgeable about Buenos Aires and its history. I say riding because Jonathan teaches you how to ride the bus and the subway which will make your trip much more affordable if you need to travel throughout the city. Also the taxi cab rides can be quite an interesting experience. Kind of like Mr Toads wild ride on steroids!! We took an additional tour from Jonathan to Recoleta cemetery and were very happy we did or we would have never learned so much about all the symbolism on the tombs. Jonathan continued to help us throughout our trip answering questions by email on various things. He is a great resource and you would miss out on a wealth of information if you don't take his free tour...but tip him well, he's worth it!!!!!

great tour!!. The most informative tour we did in BA. Jonathan was our guide and he was very articulate, and knowledgeable. He should us how to get around so it's a great way to get grounded in BA at the start of your stay.

Excellent tour. Jonathan is an excellent tour guide, very well informed and funny. If you want to get a good introduction to everyday life in the city, get a feel for the Porteno mentality and an overview of the city's history, this tour is a must.

Easy and Fun. I got luck on the day, I was the only one who rocked up so of course I had a personal tour guide for the 4 hours. Jonathan was great, fun and informative. It was great fun to follow him around the city, he has in depth knowledge of Buenos Aires that most Porteño's would not have, Baires history just rolls off his tongue. Will certainly recommend this tour to friends visiting Argentina.

this Guy knows his stuff!. you know how you take a tour and its long winded and kinda boring? NOT THIS ONE! Jonathan was very friendly, quirky, and informative indeed! We had a great time! We would definitely recommend him to anyone. In actuality, we have friends joining us and are going to tell them to take this tour as well! Thanks jonathan (especially for the incredibly thought out jokes...)

Great tour!. Jonathan is a very knowledgeable, friendly, funny tour guide who is an absolute delight to follow around the city. It's downright stupid that this tour is free -- it's almost 4 hours of well-organized, well-guided sightseeing. Starts at 11, stops for lunch, and teaches you how to use the public transportation in Buenos Aires as well as the historical and cultural information that you'd expect to get on a tour. Great fun!

Excellent walking tour!. Thanks to Jonathan for a great walking tour. I was the only one who turned up that morning and it would have been perfectly understandable if he chose to call it off. Instead, Jonathan kindly took me along for a personalised tour of the city based on what I had already checked out. I had previously been on another Buenos Aires walking tour (from another company) and was somewhat dissatisfied, but this tour by Jonathan really nailed it - a great mix of important historical facts about the city, quirky legends, iconic figures, useful tips to navigate the city and several recommendations on bars, restaurants and activities. Thanks again!

The first thing you should do when you arrive in BA. Jonathan was a great tour guide, not only did he have great knowledge of Buenos Aires, he took the time to explain all there is to know about previous events in Argentina that had an affect on the Federal Capital. He was informative and approachable about any questions that we asked about the area. We would definitely say this is a must do, as you will know so much about the city after its finished.

Fantastic Intro to BA!. Jonathan has an excellent knowledge of the city, and this was a great overview. He is friendly and personable and takes you across central parts of the city to see some of the key highlights and tells you a lot of information/gives you great insight. It's a great way to feel more connected to the city. I also enjoyed how he showed how to navigate the city using the bus system. I highly recommend this tour!

Great way to see BA!. Jonathan is a fun and friendly guide and the tour takes you to some great spots and provides a good intro to Argentine history and politics. Definitely would recommend this tour!

Do this tour, and a Recolleta tour. We did 4 walking tours with different companies, and many of them overlap in what you see. This walking tour is definitely the one I would suggest going on. Jonathan has lived in BA for years now, and knows his stuff. He is English so can communicate with English speakers, but knows his Spanish too. The tour hit the hotspots of BA and any question you have is answered knowledgeably. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour, and learning about how to get around on the weird bus system. You get a chance for lunch in a fancy art deco mall, and end up in the main plaza of Centro. Great walking tour, you will learn a lot, be entertained and the tour will over run if you want to find out more.
Excellent!. A really great and interesting tour, a must do for anyone who wants to understand and enjoy more of the argentine history and culture. Not your normal tour. I highly recommend it!
Fun, personable, and well travelled guide. Jonathan is a wonderful guide who can share a plethora of knowledge about the city and Latin America. Highly recommend!

An excellent, informative real review... And ... It's free!. Arrived in Buenos Aires really early in the morning and when I got to the hotel, the room obviously wasn't ready. A bit of interweb play in the lobby lead me to this tour which kicked off near Palermo Soho, where I was staying. Jonathan was a really great guide, incredibly knowledgeable, and a good sense of humour throughout the tour. He offered great advice on the transport system, must see sights and money exchange, which can be tricky.

Top notch all around. Jonathan was an excellent tour guide. Friendly, funny, and very very knowledgeable. Terrific way to see the city, at a comfortable pace. It was very nice to get to know how to use the bus and subway, although i will stick to taxis haha. Really enjoyed everything about this tour and would suggest it to anyone looking to get to know this beautiful city.

Great Tour with an even better point of view. We learned a lot about Buenos Aires and had a great time doing it! Jonathan has a entertaining and honest way about him. It was loads of fun. Take this tour as soon as you can. You learn some useful tips as well as great locations to visit.

Great tour of Buenos Aires that provides a wonderful start to this city!. Jonathan, the guide, is super knowledgeable and really good guide. He is orginally from Britain but has lived in B.A. for some years, which makes for a really nice mix of (obviously) really good English, a fact and story-filled tour and a more unbiased view on the city and its people. Jonathan could answer all our questions, even the really random ones and tailored the tour a bit for us too. We liked him so much we hired him for a tour in Recoleta as well!

Get on the bus. This tour was first rate, providing a nice mix of information about interesting and historic areas of the city with practical and fun ways to move around. Jonathan knows BA like the back of his hand and went beyond the surface to provide an indepth guided experience. The guy is like the Rick Steves of Buenos Aires. He instinctively knows what visitors are really going to value and maximizes your time by getting you from point to point creatively. I'm definitely recommending Jonathan and this tour to anyone that has an interest getting off those big yellow buses and on to one with a bit of fileteado.

Informative; recomm for quick download of Buenos Aires. It was our first day in buenos aires when we went for the tour. Jonathan gave a quick brief of BA's history and a good orientation of the city. Jon is very knowledgeable esp since he has only been in BA for a number of years. Besides, taking us to various sites, he taught us how to take the buses and subway, which is so useful since the sites in ba are pretty dispersed. He also gave a host of recommendations, the only pity was that we didn't have enough time to experience more of them. I'd recommend this tour to anyone who is time-pressed and need a quick download of the city! And big thank u to Jon

Great Tour. I took the tour with Jonathan and enjoyed it very much. Since I was the only one who showed up it was a private tour. Jonathan took all the time we needed for the tour and it was a lot of fun to see some spots most tourists don´t see and to get some insight knowledge from someone who as been in BsAs for quite a while. He also answer some question and was great to talk to. I am still thankful for the useful advices he gave me apart from the tour. I can totally recommend the tour. It will not cover all usual sights but might give you a better feeling for the city itself. Thanks again Jonathan!!

Great, friendly tour. Jonathan is really helpful and nice and tells a great story about Buenos Aires and its history. We were the only people on the tour that day, and we went to a neighborhood (Abasto) that we never would have visited otherwise. After the tour, Jonathan sent us a great email with additional restaurant and excursion recommendations.

Informative and interesting tour!. I was in BA for a few days and decided that a walking tour would be a great option to get to know areas that I wasn't staying in - when I read the TA reviews, this sounded perfect. I was the only one who turned up on the day but it was better this way - Jonathan asked me if I'd prefer to go to Recoleta cemetery instead of his usual Abasta tour and I was happy to go with the cemetery option as I'd read about it, but not really wanted to go on my own. He was really knowledgeable about not only the cemetery, but also gave some great advice on getting around on buses and the metro and even food options. Definitely recommend if you visit BA!

Definitely take this tour ASAP when visiting BA. On our first day in BA we took this tour with Jonathan, and it really enhanced our experience in this wonderful city. Jonathan teaches you how to use the mass transportation system, the bus and subway, which is quite challenging to be sure. I would have to say the system itself is wonderful but understanding it is not very intuitive. Do yourself a huge favor and take this walking tour before you do anything else. Your visit will be much enhanced. I almost forgot to mention that during this 4 hour tour you go all over town and see many interesting sites and get a lot of interesting facts and history especially regarding Carlos Gardel and Gauchito Gil whom I have never heard of until the tour. He also spoke about the Peron’s, Evita and her husband Juan the former Argentinian President, who had a huge historical impact on BA.

Knowledgeable and off the beaten track. A truly recommendable tour with a seriously knowledgeable English tour guide who knows more about Buenos Aires than the locals. Shows you the lesser known parts of town, like Abasto and Congreso, and even shows you how to take the bus. This kind of info is gold dust! And it's free! (but give him a generous tip, he deserves it).

Great day!. Had a great time on the tour. I ended up being the only one, so it was a very personal tour. I've been in Buenos Aires for a few months now, but I had never been to see Gardel's house and it was really great to hear some of the stories in the Recoleta Cemetery. I definitely learned some new things about the city =]

Fantastic Walking Tour with Jonathan/B.A. Major Points of Interest. We greatly enjoyed learning about Argentina and Buenos Aires from Jonathan. He introduced us to public transit, as well as some history as we walked (and rode thru) major areas of interest from Palermo, to Plaza de Mayo. All was interwoven with his expansive knowledge and wonderful wit.He answered our questions, gave us suggestions, and was a great guide. We booked another tour with him which we are definitely looking forward to. We highly recommend him to other visitors.

Great introduction to Buenos Aires. We were lucky enough to have Jonathan to our selves for this tour. The tour itself was a really excellent introduction to the city, some key spots, the transport system, general safety and the history of Buenos Aires. I definitely recommend this tour to anybody visiting this amazing city. Afterwards you will feel more confident moving through the streets and begin to truly appreciate the city for all it is worth. Anybody visiting buenos aires should take advantage what this tour has to offer, it will enhance your visit here, so make it your first stop.

Very informative tour. We did this on our first full day in Buenos Aires. This is my first trip in South America, having spent all my holidays in Europe. It was done on May 7 and May is considered low season. We were four tourists, 3 from Canada and one from France. Our tour guide is Jonathan, an Englishman who has lived in Buenos Aires for several years. He started by explaining how the bus system works. He showed a map showing the bus routes and how to read it. This can be purchased in any magazine kiosk for about AD$10. Very helpful if you plan to use the bus to get around the city. Bus ride is about AD$3.00 for any distance you travel. He also showed how to use the subte (subway). This is even cheaper than the bus, charging only AD$2.50 per ride.Jonathan showed us some landmarks with accompanying anecdotes. They were very amusing. He gave us some insight on the culture and mores of the people. He was very patient in explaining things and spent more time than the usual 4 hours. We saw places and buildings that we wouldn't have known in our short stay in Buenos Aires. This tour is one of the highlights of our trip. Worth taking. A generous tip is also much appreciated.

Great Tour. I have just been on the tour with Jonathan and it was great. Great knowledge of the city, great pace and witty as well. I thoroughly recommend it. But don't be like me and leave it until your last day. After being on the tour I really wanted to stay longer and discover more, and the tips he has are great, from where to go and what to do, to safety, security, how the buses work, metro, etc. His tour should be everyones first stop when visiting BA.

Best way to both see and find out about the city. Jonathan was a great tour guide with a wealth a knowledge about the city as well as a great and fun atmosphere! Useful information also about how to use public transport and a great list of recommendations as well. There is literally nothing I would change about this tour as it was amazing and I will be recommending it to everyone who is coming to Buenos Aires as a must do.

Do This on Your First Day in Buenos Aires. Jonathan combines thorough knowledge of the city, the history of the city, the public transportation in the city and a sense of humor to provide a great tour and overview of Buenos Aires. If you are going to do his tour which I highly recommend, do it on your first day in Buenos Aires. You will then have more an idea of what to see and how to see it on the subsequent days.

Awesome Experience. Would suggest this to any first timers in Buenos Aires. Jonathon does a great job of not only showing you the highlights of the city-but also how to get around using public transportation. If you are going to do this-do it early in your trip! He is very knowledgeable and entertaining!

Excellent Tour. Jonathan was a fantastic guide and manages to combine both a history lesson as well as practicalities for getting around the city. As other reviewers have posted, it's a really good idea to take this tour early in your stay in BA, you'll be grateful for the tips you pick up! The 4 hours absolutely flew by and we visited some areas I probably wouldn't have seen otherwise such as the Abasto, where the Carlos Gardel museum is. I would highly recommend this tour to everyone.

Great way to start a trip! Private tour was the best money I've ever spent.. I was traveling to Buenos Aires and brought my wife along for the trip. We met Jonathan for the Saturday tour and were amazed all the things we learned in saw in such a short amount of time. We enjoyed the tour so much on Saturday with the group that we hired Jonathan for Sunday to show us around Recoleta, La Boca, and San Telmo. Wow! Best money I have ever spent. Walking through Recoleta is a must for any visitor, but what makes it better is having someone to share the history, explain the key tombs, and guide you through the cemetary. Then, the trip to La Boca was certainly much easier with a guide to ensure you navigate in and out of the area without issue. If you are only in the city for a few days, make sure you leverage Jonathan for the private tour. You won't be disappointed.

Great start to Buenos Aires: gets you comfortable with the city. On short business trip and local colleague was not able to tour me around because of conflict at weekend. Jonathan was a great fall-back after reading terrible reviews of the classic bus tour(which is pretty good in some cities but apparently not in BA). Agree with nearly all reviewers: Jonathan is excellent ...funny and knowledgeable about the city. He provides some nice touches with bus and subway travel along the way. His web-site describes it all: what you see is what you get.

You gotta have it!!. This TOUR was amazing, Jonathan is an excellent Tour guide, he will take you to the real Buenos Aires with all details about its history, major point of interest and brings you the understanding of the culture, I highly recommend to have this City Tour, besides you feel the real experience to know the city.anyone would not regret taking it.

Neat tour around the city. I'm not sure if I have much more to add than what has already been said. Coming off of two non stop days of flights and touring we didnt want to stress ourselves out too much in Buenos Aires so there was no tour or itinerary for stay there. A day before the tour I saw it in tripadvisor cities (excellent iphone app btw). I'm sure they do these kinds of tours all the time but i'm not really big on tours and tour guides so to hear of a 'free' tour was something new to me. Arrived a few minutes late to meet up location where Jonathon was awaiting us. I expected there to be more people but fortunately for us it was just us. I asked Jonathan and he said his tours can be anywhere from 2-20 people i believe with the average being around 10. This is key to note that everyone's tour can be vastly different from the others. In some aspects Jonathan remained very professional and composed which is good in a sense because it reminds you that you ARE on a tour. However, there were aspects that didnt feel pre-rehearsed or forced. These were my favourite parts because thats when it didnt feel like a tour, but justa friend walking me around an unfamiliar city. My only criticism, if any, would be for the tour to be a little bit more like this unstructured, but i understand the restraints and why this cant always be so.That being said we did diverge from the regular tour and went to Recoleta Cemetry. We also got to see the only Kosher Mcdonalds and house of Carlos Gardel. Jonathan was able to answer every question we threw at him, although i dont think we are the most inquisitve people. He def. knows his geography and knowledge. All in all, if you have 4 hours to spare then there isnt any reason not to go on this tour and get a more local experience of BA. Also remember tip well as its a 'free' tour!

Perfect to start your visit. I'll recomend this tour for your first day in Buenos Aires. Jonathan is a very nice and funny guy, so the four hours do not get boring at all. You don't get to see some of the highlights in BsAs, such as a San Telmo and La Boca. But still you get to visit some interesting spots like Gardel's neighbourhood, the Casa Rosada and the Plaza de Mayo.I think the highlight of the tour are Jonathan indications about how to move around Buenos Aires and some security tips.Really worth trying!

Fantastic Tour. Do this first. Not much to add other than what most people have said.Jonathan is a great guy andsuperb guide it really is a wonderful way to start a stay in this beautiful city.I could honestly not reccomend this tour highly enough,I am absolutley 100% sure anyone would not regret taking it.Jonathan sorry it has taken me so long to write these words about your fantastic amazinf tour.You're a star.Thanks also for inviting us to the quiz night.

Having a 4-hour city tour always helps !. We visited Buenos Aires in March, great weather! doing the tour helped us have a clear overview of the city and discover the places we wanted to go back to. My sis and I had been there a few times but it was the first time for our mom. I felt I should have done this in my first visit!We decided that Boca neighborhood was not interesting for us at all, but Recoleta, San Telmo, Retiro, Palermo, Belgrano and San Telmo were a MUST. We strongly reccomendWalking through RecoletaSunday fair at the San Telmo plaza, lunch included ! take cash, no credit card accepted !Palermo Saturday afternoon and evening Armenia Plaza area (also look for the Palermo square feria (Feria Artesanal Palermo Viejo) all year long saturdays and sundays form 11 to 21 hrs) Malabia and Costa Rica, Palermo. Take all the time in the world to walk the streets, have coffee and visit some beautiful shopps !Walking along the 9th of July avenue, Santa Fe towards Plaza San MartinWalking through Recoleta, looking at the old big houses (now embassies), lunch at the Palacio Duhau Park Hyatt (Av Alvear 1661) sitting outdoors with the greatest buffett in town, then coffee at the Hotel Alvear (just a few steps from the Hyatt)Recommendations: a great taxi driver Marcelo 54091115 64027367 and this beautiful store on Corrientes Ave. Cooparte (Av. Corrientes 1543 inside the Centro Cultural de la Cooperacion Floreal Gorini) www.welcomeargentina.com/cooparte

Buenos Aires Private Tour Guide. Jonathan escorted us during two 2-hr. tours of BA. He arrived on-time at the designated meeting location. Not only is he very knowledgeable of the city and its attractions, but we certainly enjoyed his company and highly recommend his services. Thanks a lot, Jonathan!!

Do this tour first!. Do this tour on your first day. It's a great way to orient yourself to the city and learn about how to safely travel around the city either via bus or subway. Jonathan is a great guide and answers any and all of your questions.During the tour, you visit the Abasto neighborhood (home of Carlos Gardel) and Congreso/Plaza de Mayo area. What I really enjoyed about the tour was visiting the Abasto neighborhood - I would never have known to check this out on my own and I'm glad we came.Tour is free, but tips are appreciated.

Most Excellant. I contact Jonathan as my hard to please group wanted an extensive city walking tour. Jonathan was simply delightful to deal with and very accommodating. Due to late ship arrival my group was very late getting to the hotel, but Jonathan was there waiting. The tour was nothing short of excellent and Jonathan adds a fun personal touch to every story. Joanthan made every effort to custom the tour to whatever I wanted, following the tour, I felt I knew my way around the city as Jonathan makes an effort to use local transportation. Terrific custom tour at a very reasonable price.

Brilliant!. We had a private tour of Buenos Aires, and loved every minute of it. Jonathan is amusing, very knowledgeable, and a great guide. Sadly it was our last afternnon of our short visit here, so couldn't see much more of this beautiful city.

Do this early in your visit to BA. We booked Jonathan for a private tour the day we arrived. It was the best thing we could have done. His in-depth knowledge of everything BA combined with his position as an objective observer on argentine history, culture and politics made this an amazingly valuable tour. He packs so much into 4 hours. We saw most of the city's highlights, got our bearings in the city, experienced BA buses and got some great bar recommendations. This is the only guy you should choose to show you this beautiful crazy city.

First Class BA intro and history. How on earth can anyone pack in a city in 4 hours, whilst giving one some depth of the history, culture, politics, architecture, and quirky wonders? Well Jonathan does a great job, and like all the others say, in a professional, fun and engaging way.

Must Do!. Must do this tour with Jonathan on your first day in Buenos Aires before you do anything else. He teaches you how to ride the buses and the subway. We found the subway the easiest to use and did use it all the time we were there. His tour, being in English, is very informative, and gives you a great start learning about the city. His is the best free walking tour in town.

4 hour walking tour of Buenos Aires - excellent. We took Jonathan's tour of Buenos Aires after we had been in the city for a week, but it's best to show up on the first or 2nd day of your visit. This is an excellent way to learn more about the culture, history and soul of the city. His commentary is full of dry humor and well informed observations about the ways of the people. You can reach Jonathan via e-mail. The tour begins most days at 11 am. Among the highlights is Jonathan's fine description of the origins of tango which includes a visit to the neighborhood where Carlos Gardel lived.

Highly Recommend. Jonathon has excellent historical information and it was a great way to get an introduction to the city and how to get around. We would recommend doing the tour early in your stay as it really helps you to adjust to the city, what to expect and how to get from one place to another. We probably wouldn't have taken the subte by ourselves without having been shown the way, now we will take it, at least back to Plaza de Mayo area if no other area. We have traveled a fair bit and found Jonathon to be friendly, outgoing, helpful and willing to answer questions with a great personality and we enjoyed ourselves. As mentioned there is no fee for taking the tour but this is how he makes his living and appreciates the tips.

You just have to do this one!. Join this tour as soon as you arrive to Buenos Aires. Jonathan is knowledgeable, engaging and full of good stories. He will take you off the beaten path but also show you the main tourist area. In addition, after the tour, if you provide your e-mail address he will send you recommendations for all the great things to do in and around the city. The whole group was great fun! Just do it...

Really great tour!. Just finished the tour with Jonathan, and it was truly wonderful. Full of history, great stories, lots of really helpful local tips and a great sense of humour, Jonathan is the perfect guide. Would highly recommend the tour!
A big cheer for jonathan. You've got it just right. We had a lovely time, finding the tour informative and fun. If we had more time we'd have booked a private one. Thanks

Excellent tour to get your BA bearings. We did this tour on our first full day in BA. The guide really knows his stuff and provides a really interesting history of the city, her buildings and many anecdotes on some of her more notable residents. I loved how unbiased he was, telling both the good and dark sides of this city. We also learnt how to catch buses and the metro which will definitely be helpful. Highly recommend as a great way to start your stay in BA.

Mystery of the buses. We spent 5 days in Buenos Aires in January and took Jonathan's tour on the first morning. Take his tour as soon as possible into your stay. He was just as good as the other reviewers have portrayed. Interesting, engaging, fun and best of all, a native English speaker. One of the best memories of the day was when Jonathon attempted to explain the incomprehensible bus system. His conclusion was that if you found it necessary to make sense of the illogical system, then Buenos Aires was not for you! We enjoyed our tour, our trip to BA and we simply took the subways and not the buses!

Fantastic!. What an excellent, informative tour. I highly recommend it for your first day in Buenos Aires. The guide knows his stuff and delivers the information in an interesting way. It's also a great way to get your bearings and learn about the history of the city.

Need to do this tour day one in BA to get the very best out of your holiday. Fantastic tour by Johnathon but far more than just a standard tour. Johnathon also provides lots of information on how to navigate the city, use the buses, taxis and the underground plus warns you of many of the scams and dangers Not only do you learn lots of Argentinas history, but also get to appreciate the beautiful buildings, the culture and the people. We had 6 days in BA and did this tour on day 3. I regret not going with Johnathon on day one would have known so much more and felt much safer. Thank you Johnathon, best tour we have done yet.

Great introduction to the city. We did Jonathan's tour our first day in the city and loved it. A fabulous introduction to neighborhoods we wouldn't have otherwise seen - as well as tourist landmarks such as the congress and the Casa Rosada. Just as welcome, he introduced us to the buses and the subway- making us comfortable enough with the subway, at least, to ride it happily on our own. Great storyteller and all around good guy. Our seven year old son, who loves a good tour, said this was the best ever.

Excellent tour!. Jonathan's tour of BA was one of the highlights of our trip. He's a great storyteller, providing tons of information in an enjoyable way. We really enjoyed the sights he took us to, several of which we would not have visited on our own or appreciated without the context, and found his intro to public transportation to be very helpful.
Great introduction to the city. Jonathan was great and fun tour guide. It was fun to ride the bus and see some of the important sites. a great walking tour for one of your first days in the city.

How do we get there?. Jonathan does a great job with providing a personalized tours as well as the free group tour. We promptly started at our address and the proceeded to the Ricoleta, Abasto, Avenue and Plaza de Mayo. He provided great stories and also educated us on traveling with the buses and subway systems. I would recommend is tour within the first day or two of you stay in Buenos Aires.

Must-do on your first day in Buenos Aires. Jonathan's four-hour tour is a fantastic introduction to Buenos Aires - packed with information and designed to instill confidence in first-time visitors trying to navigate the city. As a woman exploring Buenos Aires on her own, I found his practical tips on public transport and crime prevention particularly invaluable. And being English, Jonathan brings a particular brand of dry wit to the tour, that makes historical fact and legend more memorable: "edutainment" at its best (though that word would make him cringe). Five stars, two thumbs up, 10/10, full marks.

awesome tour and excellent tour guide. My friend and I took this tour our first day in buenos aires and it was great. I highly reccommend it! Jonathan was extremely knowledgeable and provided fun and interesting info about the beautiful city. This tour was great because Jonathan explained how to use the transit system and included that in the tour so we had a much easier time getting around during the rest of our stay. We enjoyed jonathan's tour style so much that we ended up hiring him as a private tour guide through recoleta and the cemetery and were so glad we did because again his knowledge and stories were priceless and made our expierence great!

Jonathan was great!. Jonathan gave an excellent, informative and entertaining tour. He taught us a lot about getting around the city. He shared a lot of Buenos Aires history and told humorous stories. I would highly recommend taking Jonathan's tour, especially if you're going to spend several days in Buenos Aires. He will show you how to use the complicated bus system as well as the metro.

Great Introduction to a wonderful city. We enjoyed this wonderful tour during the first week of our 6 week stay. He gave us so much practical information on the buses and subways that living as a local has been a breeze. The incorporation of so much practical information with a delightful overview of the city was priceless. We are not big on any type of tour but Jonathan made the hours pass quickly with his wonderful stories and insightful tidbits on a gorgeous city. We have followed up on many of his suggestions and enjoyed them all during our short stay. Could spend a year or more here and can understand Jonathan's extended stay. His love of the city is obvious and I totally agree. Bravo Jonathan!

Very interesting and entertaining. Jonathon gave a very pleasant 4 hour tour of highlights and neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. Between walking and local bus transportation we were able to see Centro, Recoleta, Plaza de Mayo, Boca and Caminito with informative and entertaining commentary and great stories about the history, the people and the events surrounding these places. Jonathon is a very knowledgeable, easy-going guide with typical wry British humor. We enjoyed our tour and would highly recommend his service.

awesome experiences. Although I live since 11 months in this lovely city it was worth to participate once too. During the tour I got a lot of informations, I visited new places/locations I didn´t know before and Jonathan told us stories about the locations and argentinos in his own, lovely and funny way - with a big portion of british black humor! AWESOME!!! ;)

Great walk and talk. Great stories, incredibly useful information, good overview of history of Buenos Aires.Did I mention fascinating stories?And then he sent me a list of amazing interesting things to do in Buenos Aires whilst I'm here. Highly recommended!

Great introduction to Buenos Aires. We met Jonathan at 11 AM at the Garibaldi statue in Plaza D'Italia. He quickly oriented us to the safety issues and that was extremely helpful. We then learned the intricacies of the bus and subway systems and how to use them. Jonathan is very knowledgeable about the history and lore of Buenos Aires and proceeded to take us on a 3/4 hour over site of the city. I highly recommend this tour on your very first day in the city. It will save you a ton of money on taxi fares by learning the bus and metro system and probably a ton of angst by listening to Jonathan's tips on safety!
Brilliant introduction to the city. What a great way to be welcomed to BA. A friendly informative gallavant around the city. Much needed intro to public transport too.

An informative and entertaining tour!. Jonathan was fantastic. We learned a lot. Afterward he sent us lots of helpful info about things to do, bars and restaurants,etc. And he offered to answer questions via email. This is a great intro to BA.

A snap shot of the city. Do this first to know where to go and where not to bother if short on time.We wanted to go to La Boca but after doing the trip are glad we didn't. Equally after the tour we revisited Recoletta many times

Get around like a local. After reading the reviews for Jonathan's tour, I decided to book the tour for 18 January. Once the group assembled at Plaza Italia, Jonathan explained that we'd be using local transportation to get around the city. He also explained how to decipher the "Guida T" (bus guide) to find a proper bus route and that the buses only take coins. I suffered a brief panic when I realized I had no coins; however, Jonathan quickly relieved the panic by offering to exchange paper for coins.Once everyone in the group had the proper coinage our tour commenced by queueing for the bus (the locals are very serious about queueing) and subsequently riding the bus to the home of the face of Tango -- Carlos Gardel -- in the Abasto district. After learning about Carlos and his various exploits we had a short break for lunch at the Abasto indoor shopping mall, formerly the Buenos Aires central market.From there we traveled by subway to congressional plaza. The trip didn't require coins since there were attendants on hand to make change. After learning about Kilometer Zero and other Buenos Aires history we walked down Avienda de Mayo (pronounced "MAH sho" Jonathan explained) to Casa Rosada, the offices of the executive branch of the Argentinian government. Along the way we passed several points of interest, including a reference to Dante's Inferno, Cafe Tortoni, and ultimately the symbols of the Madres de Plaza de Mayo.For anyone wanting to know how to get around Buenos Aires like a local and absorbing some Argentinian history along the way, one would be well informed by taking this tour.A few hints if you take the tour:* Have $2 and $1 pesos on hand for the bus* If you must carry a bag, carry an old one.* If you carry a bag, keep it in front of you when riding public transit.* I never felt unsafe while on the tour, but be vigilant. As Jonathan told us: "a little paranoia goes a long way"

Great insight into BA!. This tour is the first thing that you should do when you arrive in Buenos Aires- Jonathan shows you how to use the bus and train system which is extremely useful and can save you heaps of money on taxis- Very clear and easy to understand- A great insight into Argentinian culture and its history- Find about the main attractions in Buenos Aires and how you can spend the remainder of your stay.I would definitely recommend this for anyone who has just landed in Buenos Aires and has no idea about what to do and how to get around.

BUENOS AIRES 101. What could be better for anyone who arrives in Buenos Aires for the first time than to be introduced to the basics of the city by someone who also arrived as a stranger and then made the city his home.Jonathon's tour introduces you to the fundamentals of getting around the city - taking a bus, taking the subway - both intimidating activities for the uninitiated.He also whets your appetite for the history, both political and cultural, of the city. He is a natural and engaging storyteller whose wit and "outsider on the inside" take on the city is clearly influenced by his own love of Buenos Aires.Here's the short version of this review - take Jonathon's tour on Day One of your visit, and when you set out on Day Two you'll have the focus and the street smarts that would have taken you a week to acquire otherwise.

Excellent Buenos Aires City Tour. Excellent city tour of Buenos Aires. Jonathan is an enthusiastic tour guide, bringing life to the city of Buenos Aires. The tour was rather informal, which was very nice, and Jonathan adds his own interesting details and anecdotes as you walk through the history filled streets. He is a very knowledgeable tour guide and manages to provide a very detailed history of Buenos Aires while keeping the tone light and fun for the group. He also makes the effort to orient everyone with the different modes of transportation around the city to make the rest of everyones trip to BA more accessible and easily navigable. Overall, a very interesting tour that provides you with a great basis for your trip to Buenos Aires, a thorough history of the city and leaves you with the feeling of an afternoon well spent. Highly recommended.

Great intro to BA. What a great way to spend your time in Buenos Aires! Jonathan is well-informed and a natural teacher. Our small group had a wonderful time getting a great taste of this amazing city. I gained the confidence to explore on my own for the next two days.

Good introduction to BA. We toured with Jonathon the day after we arrived in BA. It was our first visit to Buenos Aires and it was an absolute wonderful introduction to the city. We were introduced to different modes of transportation and quite a bit of history. Jonathon is quite an enthusiastic guide and so well informed. I highly recommend this free tour though tips are expected.

Not to be missed!. This is an absolute MUST! Jonathan had organised a tour that introduced you to all forms of transport around Buenos Aries. It was interesting and informative and at a pace that was just right. Jonathan conducted the tour with wit, humour and panache! This was not our first visit to Buenos Aries but we went to places that we had not known about. Highly recommended

Hot Xmas Eve walking tour in Buenos Aires. Yes it was 43 degrees on the day of free walk - Jonathan kept it informative and entertaining too - what a trooper he is as well as the walk participants. This tour was particularly useful as Jonathan provided the pertinent info about individual travel plans and intro to the city from a unique perspective. A great discovery to take back home ranging from history en brief, life of famous figures from movies, street art tours, underground dinners and more. This is a city I am looking forward to return.
Great free tour. This was a great way to experience som of the attractions of BA! It was fun, interesting and knowledgable guiding. You should do this tour if you come to BA.

An absolute must!. My friends and I took Jonathan's walking tour shortly after arriving in Buenos Aires. What a wonderful surprise! Knowledgeable, witty and organized, Jonathan is a fabulous storyteller, mixing facts, anecdotes, and urban legends. We all highly recommend Jonathan.

Started my BA visit off right!. I can't say enough about BA Local Tours -- I arrived alone before my friends, speaking no spanish, and wondering how to occupy my first day - the answer? Jonathan and his tour. I hired him for a couple of hours for a private tour of Recoleta Cemetery, then joined him on his free tour. It was the perfect way to get oriented in a new city. Best of all - he takes public tranist, and explained the crazy BA bus system! We hired him again the following day to take us to La Boca and San Telmo. He was a great resource even after the tour, email us restaurant suggestions. Our only regret was we werent able to join him for Pub Quiz. Next time!

One of best travelling experiences... Ever!. My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to go on the free daily tour and also booked with Jonathan to go to Boca aftrwards. I cannot rate this experience highly enough. My only problem was that we did not do this sooner into our stay!He was a wealth of knowledge but not one second was boring, stuffy or dull - the whole tour showed not only how much Jonathan obviously loves this incredible city - despite it's sometimes-madness! - but also how interesting and quirky Buenos Aires itself is.We had a great time riding on the buses with the locals, learning the minutiae of what makes the city so unique, and talking about Porteno life, politics and culture. Definitely the best way to experience a city is to hang out with a local, albeit an adopted one, so your sightseeing isn't aimless. There is too much to do and learn in Buenos Aires to go into it with no clue, and the Congreso means so much more when you also get to hear the story of the over the top windmill cafe next to it. He was also extremely patient with my irritating shutterbug habit. If you do only one thing in Buenos Aires on your visit here, make sure this is it. Thanks again so much Jonathan!!!

Great intro to BA. Jonathan's tour was great - it was really good to incorporate public transport as we got to see some diverse areas of Buenos Aires. Deciphering the bus schedules was worth it alone :) he is clearly quite interested and passionate about various aspects and the tour kept moving at a good pace. We have done another free walking tour in BA but the group size was huge and we spent a lot of time at each stop, meaning we didn't cover much ground. We preferred this tour over the other one. The sun/heat gets strong during the day so bring some water, hat, sunscreen and sunglasses.

amazing tour. This tour is very carefully designed and Jonathan's story telling skills are amazing. We chose to do it on our first day in BA and it was the best time we had there. Recommend this tour without any reservation. Thanks Jonathan!

Great tour. This tour was perfect for me because I had only one day in BA. It's fun and informative. Jonathan s smart and witty which made it all even better. And now I know how to get a bus ticket and how to hold on to my backpack :D Recommend it to everyone, those with tight schedules and those who just got to BA because this tour is a perfect start as Jonathan has a lot of suggestions on where to go and what to see.

Perfect introduction to BA!. I can just repeat what other people say - Jonathan´s tour is a perfect introduction to Buenos Aires and how to get around the city.We were there at the beginning of November and Jonathan managed to do the tour with his broken arm! We hope you are well again, Jonathan, and we did use some more buses after having learned how to use the bus plan!

Highly recommended!. I've done both free tours that offered in the city and I can strongly recommend to join Jonathan tour. He is intelligent and knowledgeable guide and all idea of his tour is very informative and different from other. It was a rainy day and only 3 people were there to join the tour and Jonathan was more than pleased to do it in spite of bad weather. He also shares with you great suggestions about the city and places to visit, that are not usual and worth seeing! Don't miss it!

Great walking tour!. I am happy to enthusiastically recommend Jonathan's walking tour - a great introduction to Buenos Aires. He is very knowledgeable about the city and country and had lots of wonderful stories to add colour to the history, politics and culture. Definitely take this tour - you will be glad you did!!! We enjoyed his tour so much, that we asked him take us through Recoleta after the tour ended, for which we happily paid him.

Can't think of a better introduction to Buenos Aires. Having read previous reviews of Jonathan's tour we decided it would be a good idea to pop along and take the tour on our first day. So glad we did. Aside from being very fortunate that the wife and I were the only 2 people taking the tour on the day we got an excellent introduction to the city. Jonathan clearly loves living in Buenos Aires and that came across as he showed us round. It's the first walking tour we've done that gets you involved on public transport which was a nice change as it means you get to see a lot more of the city than you would on a normal walking tour. We kept seeing number 29 buses in the days following!Thanks for also arranging the trip to see a Boca Juniors match, we'd have had no chance sorting that out on our own.

A great welcome to Buenos Aires. We are a group of 8 friends who travelled to Buenos Aires to celebrate a 'milestone' birthday. We saw Jonathan's reviews on TA and decided to book him for a 1/2 day tour. We covered the Recoleta, the Plaza de Mayo and La Boca. In fact, had it not been for Jonathan, I would have skipped La Boca altogether. I'm glad the 1st timers in the group had the opportunity to see it.While we covered the main sights, I am also pleased to say that we all learned a great deal from Jonathan (despite this being my 3rd time in the city). Our group really felt like they saw not only the most important bits, but that they also gained perspective from someone who lives here and who understands what makes the place tick. We also enjoyed jonathan's wit and sense of humour. I will also say that the man has infinite patience - allowing us to stop for our many photos and bank machines attempts.I really appreciate the fact that we used public transport as it helped everyone see aspects of the city that we may not have otherwise seen.We have done walking / city tours before and I can definitely say that we would wholeheartedly recommend Jonathan.Thanks from Toronto.

Do this tour first!. We read about Jonathan's tour prior to arriving in Buenos Aires and made a note to include it in our plans. We are so glad we did! Jonathan was extremely informative, entertaining, and helpful. The history of the area came alive with his amusing anecdotes. We find subways pretty easy to negotiate but buses are more difficult....until Jonathan helps you figure out how to decipher the information. We are now ready to enjoy all the areas we are interested in exploring. Thank you, Jonathan for sending us such a complete list of recommendations! We can't wait to get started!Karin and Bill

Awesome Tour Guide and Tour of Buenos Aires. We are so glad that we did the free tour with Jonathan and saw a completely different perspective of Buenos Aires. We learned about the history of Tango, rode on the wood train (which is so cool) and met lovely people from the U.S. and abroad on this tour (Shout out to Marianne and Andrew). Needless to say, we had a great time!! Jonathan is super nice and he knows so much about the history of Buenos Aires. It was good to learn and to visit so many of the historic sites. He was kind enough to consider that we would need a food and bathroom break and we still had time to see everything of interest.
