What i mean by inexpensive is that although the tour is advertised as Free Walking Tour you can leave a tip. The tour is worth paying for so we did. Thanks Adam for the great tour, Richard, Rata and Shihan *New Zealand.

Join both tours!. I was in Buenos Aires recently and did both tours with Gonzalo. If you want to tour with someone who really knows the ins and outs of the city, go with him. It's the best way to get an introduction to the city. Even though the tours are free, we made a donation in Australian dollars as he's coming to Australia (Alice Springs, would you believe). Don't miss these walking tours.

Amazing experience to welcome me to Argentina!. Over two days, I did two tours with Adam, to the historic district and the Recoleta district. Adam was a totally lovely and very helpful guide. His knowledge about Buenos Aires is brilliant, and he obviously loves his job. He helped me with other advice too. A must do for anyone coming to BA! Thanks man!

Excellent, informative tour. Myself and a friend from New Zealand joined this tour and ended up having a fantastic experience. Adam is really informative and helpful and quite obviously loves Buenos Aires. Would definitely recommend to anyone passing through wanting to learn about this great city!
Totally Recomendable. Great way to discover the city, very good and motivated guide with a lot of historic background knowledge and funny stories.
Great way to see the city!. Adam was a really great guide with excellent knowledge of the city. Find out so much more about ba than in the guide books! Def recommend this!

super bueno!. Adam, our tour guide, made the historic tour super interesting and answered all our questions. It was a good length, and it was helpful for me that he spoke excellent English! Would definitely recommend this to other English speakers.

(Sh)ankee in Buenos Aires. Yankee in Beuenos Aires:We (my Aussie friend and I) found a flyer at our hostel and decided "por que no?!?" Adam (our tour guide) was easy to find and FULL of knowledge. His English was very clear. He was loud enough for our moderate size group and as we walked from place to place he was always exchanging ideas with us, answering questions, and suggesting the best spots for an authentic Argentina experience. He should charge a high rate for the quality of the tour but we weren't require to pay. If you want some history, some photo ops, and a good time THIS is your tour.

a well spent 4 hours. I did one of these free tours in Santiago through a different company so had high expectations of what to expect. And I wasn't disappointed. Adam's commentary was so imformative. This is a great way to get the flavour and history of Buenos Aries and Argentina. Just a shame I had to leave BA before I could do the Recoleta walk.

Wonderful tour. We were just passing by the Obelisco on Saturday morning and Adam was gathering some people for a free tour. After a brief chat with him, we decided to join his tour and this was one of our best decisions of our whole trip. This is an enjoyable and informative experience that we certainly recommend to any visitor of Buenos Aires. Michel and Helene, August 2014
Tour.... Adam was very interesting....I asked him many questions.....He knew many different issues and subjects about Buenos Aires...

Very informative walking tour. Our guide Adam was extremely informative and thorough :) We did both the historic city walking tour and the Recoleta walking tour, with no regrets for either. Adam knows a lot about Buenos Aires, making the tour a great way to start discovering in BA. Fully recommened the tour :)

Very nice and informative walking tour!. Very nice and informative walking tour! I did both tours: historic city and recoleta. I could understand a little more about BA - that has made all the difference to enjoy even more the city!

Great walking tour!. It was a very great and pleasant walking tour today, with an amazing guide, Adam!Really good to know a bit of Buenos Aires when you arrive; to know about the city's history and about its population. It is a good way to discover the city!I recommend!

One of the best Free Walking Tours!. I've done the 2 walking tours with Adam and highly recommend!Always with attention and explains all of the curious things that happens in Buenos Aires!!The guide love what he does, and this makes the tour much better!

Highly Recommended. My boyfriend and I did 2 tours with Demasiado Tours. Firstly we did the Historic Tour with Adam. We found the tour great, the sights were interesting, the stories were things we could not know just walking around the city ourselves. As for Adam as a guide, he too was fantastic. Friendly, informative, knowledgeable and engaging. When I go on a walking tour he's exactly what I expect from a guide. We enjoyed the tour so much that 2 days later we went on a second tour with Demasiado Tours in the north end of the city. We weren't originally going to do a tour of the cemetery but in the end i'm really glad we did because Adam had great knowledge of the people and stories of the Recoleta Cemetery. Yes you tip at the end of free walking tours but that is how the guides make their money. It is definitely worth it. They are called "free" walking tours because they are set up to appeal to all budgets and there is no guilt for how much you can or cannot afford to give. I think its a fantastic trade. Don't let the thought of tipping scare you away. DO the tour you won't be disappointed!

Excellent walking tour. We had a great tour with Adam on the morning historical tour of Buenos Aires. He was friendly, funny and informative, giving us lots of interesting information about the city as well as restaurant recommendations. The 4 hour tour was long but you get given breaks. We were shown the standard things like the Pink House, the cathedral, plaza de mayo and San telmo food market but also some other alternative things like the skinniest house in the city, the old style san telmo houses and the new Puerto Madera district. Overall a great intro to the city, highly recommended!
Amazing. It's a good way to know the city. I liked very much. The guide is very nice. You can also eat the best empanada in the city.

Don't miss them !. Thank you Adam for this tour, very interesting, funny and complete (4 hours is great to learn many things and see diferent parts of this big city).The idea of a tip is really good. Indeed, if I take our example, we are making a one year trip and we don't have a lot of money, but thanks to this guys, we could discover the city anyway.You can ask them where to buy a thing or eat another, they know many of Buenos Aires and are very generous in informations.

Amazing Tours!. This guys are great! The walk you around town and tell you about history, and fun facts. You can ask anything they will try to help you as much as possible. They know and love their city and their job! Would really recommend it as an introduction to the city especially if you are like me and you never know where to begin....

Best free walking tour I've done. I did the historical walking your first and was super impressed. So much information presented in a really engaging way. My whole hostel agreed and a big group of us then joined the recoletta tour which was equally great. I definitely recommend!

Best free tour!. We did the historic free walking tour with demasiado tours. It was Great!! Adam, the guide, told a lot of information about the history of the country, the history of the sights we visited and the current situations today. He was very enthusiastic and the tour was very interesting. We now joining him on his other tour as well. It was nice that after 1,5 hours he suggested a break for 20 minutes so that we could get some food and walk into a church for a closer look (and reading the other reviews, he does take the reviews on trip advisor seriously enough to improve his tour). In the end he gave us some great tips and answered al our questions. Of course at the end of the tour he suggested a tip, but that is highly usual for a 'free' walking tour (in every country) so you can pay whatever you think the tour is worth. Great tour for getting a closer and insight look on Buenos Aires and the history of the city. I highly recommend this tour!
Super!. Great tour! Very informative, but very funny and charming! Didn't feel like a tour, felt like hanging out with a local! Keep up the good work!

Avoid this tour and save your time. We joined the historic tour with Adam. He was not a very engaging guide, he knew the "encyclopedia" information but the tour was simply repeting a script and information was not given in an intelligent way. The "jokes" were just cliches and not funny. We had a very long tour of 4 hours that was overwhelming and could be more enjoyable just if the explanations were better. The tour is supposed to be free, but the guide recommended us a tip pretending to anchor a set price for the tour with a very bad attitude. Definitely wouldn't be rushing back for another tour with these guys.

Nice tour. We had a great tour with Adam. The historic city tour was perfect, a nice mix of history, jokes. I would definitely recommend these guys! The only problem is that the tour takes around 4 hour and we were starving at the end !!
great tour, lots of enthusiam, good humor. great tour . we spent 4 hours around the downtown area and ended up in puerto madero. Adam was very friendly and has several years experience as tour guide.

Engaging tour. We had a great tour with Adam. He was very interesting and engaging. The historic city tour was perfect, the right amount of history, jokes and current day information.
At the end of the tour, Adam even helped us book some activities after the tour.
I would definitely recommend these guys!

À la découverte de Buenos Aires.... We are a group of friends coming from Paris, some of us traveling since several months around the world. We did the Historic tour and the Recoleta tour with Adam and Gonzalo, and all of us really enjoyed both of them. They have been great introductions to the city, Adam and Gonzalo are awesome guides, showing us their city in an impelling way, with many stories about BsAs as well as lots of useful tips. We definitely recommend to anyone visiting the city to go for it.

Excellent, knowledgable, fun. The tour doesn't stop with the end of the tour. The tour was an excellent walk around town with Gonzalez. He not only gave us the serious facts, but also a nice lunch option and some funny comparison on Argentinians 'best' and 'biggest' avenues.But after the tour I goy some nice personal tips and q bit later he sent an rmail with even more things to do or visit.The atmosphere is relaxed and non-commercial. A good way to get your foot in the ground.

Great tours. Did two tours with Adam, I have to say that I really loved it! He is very informative, knowledgeable, funny, cheerful and pleasant guy. Really, best way to get to know Buenos Aires and many details of this beautiful and interesting city!

excellent tour with gonzalo. Excellent tour with many historic and cultural insights. Despite rainy weather and only four of us-the tour went ahead. Gonzalo was v. knowledgeable about the architecture of the city and cheerful and pleasant. would recommend.

Simply great!. My wife and I decided to do the free walking tour in BA after some though. We made both tours with Adam and they were just great. Although most free walking tours will just cancel the tour if no more than 10 persons sign up, Adam went on with just 7 persons. He was very knowledgable about the city and its best sites. I would definetly recommend Demasiado Tours to anyone looking for a good time in BA.

Great intro to BA. My friend and I did the historic old town tout with Adam. It covered the majority of sights we wanted to see in the South of the city and Adam was helpful in giving directions to other areas from the end of the tour (e.g. Boca). At no time did we feel rushed and had plenty of time to enjoy the sights and for Adam to provide an interesting and knowledgable history of both Argentina and BA. There were also fewer references to tips throughout the tour than on other free tours, which is appreciated as we always intend to tip. Would highly recommend!
a must do tour.. This is a must do tour for those love to hike and get to know BA.And tour guide Adam is very knowledgeable about history etc,

You should do this tour!. My tour was with Adam and it was excellent. He knew so much about the city and its history plus lots of useful information about how to make the most of our stay. He was happy to answer any questions we had during the tour too.The tour itself was really interesting. I had already walked around some of the places myself but it made a real difference being able to visit them with someone who actually knew the area as a local,

Smart, Knowledgeable, Great!. We met Gonzalo near the obelisk holding up his red sign. Joined in with a group of Swedish and Italians, us being from Israel' for a walk through Microcentro and San Telmo. Guiding was in fluent english with a cute argentinian touch and a quart of humor to put all that heavy history well in perspective. We loved it, so we joined in the next day walking to Recoleta... nothing much to add to that. Highly recommended!!!

A Great tour of Buenos Aires. Adam gave us a great tour through the streets of buenos Aires,I't was around 3 and a half hours long, and he told us a lot about the history and land marks of the city, and all from a real persons point of view.He gave us many tips about the city as well.We relly recommend everybody to take the Free walking tour.And don't forget being generous to him to :)

Great your!. Such a great tour of Buenos Aires- good choice of sights big and small, great detailed information, and Gonzalo has such a friendly and enthusiastic way about him! Gonzalo is very well informed about the history and origins of the material he presents and could also handle all the random questions (we like linguistics and history) we threw at him. He is clearly passionate about what he does and really wants to provide anything that will help to enhance the tour or your trip beyond it! The follow-up email with recommendations an extra info was a great touch! Thanks again Gonzalo!Amanda and Steve

Enjoyable but Long free walking tour! . We enjoyed our tour of Buenos Aires, given by Adam. He was knowledgeable about culture, history and architecture of Argentina. However at 3hr 45mins you certainly got your money's worth. A suggested tip amount at the start of the tour would be helpful.
Excellent. I loved this tour! Amazing choice for sucha a huge city! The guide was really witty and he gave us recomendations for things to do after the tour. Great value for my money.

Best tour. A very nice tour in San Telmo with people that truly love their city and know a lot about historical events of Argentina. Enjoy debats about the Isla Maladiva, the black market cambio, the revolution. You will learn a lot and understand Argentinian position. So thanks to the guide, very cool guy (forget his name..)

a really great tour. I´ve been to some other free walking tours, but this one has been the more complex and richest so far. Of course Buenos Aires is huge and a 4-hour tour is not going to cover everything and there are many different tours to chose from, but I thought the route we covered and the things we saw made it one of the best tours on offer. Besides, Adam was great and he explained so many things and in so much detail. An excellent tour, really.

What a great way to get introduced to Argentina in general and specifically to Buenos Aires. On the first morning in Buenos Aires we decided to take one of the free tours that are quite abundant in this town. We chose demasiado Just because it started at 10:30 while the others started at 11 and also because it seemed to be more comprehensive covering also San Telmo and Madero port while the others were doing mainly the center.I call only say that we were not disapointed. Alex, our young guide, spoke fluent English showed us all the sites providing us with more than enough information to make this a fruitfull introduction to the city and not a university course on Buenos Aires history and culture. The 4 hour tour took us through all them majot sites of the centro and some more. Alex was entertaining, informative as very helpful with all questions and requests.In addition the group was small (8 people) so all in all it was almost a private tour with fraction of the cost.I stronglt recommend Demasiado.

Great Tour. We strode around the sights of BA for around 3 hours and learned about the history of both the city and the country. Plenty of good hints and jokes, really very friendly. Top job and and enjoyable way to explore. Recommended!

Excelente. I would definitely recommend this walking tour to tourists but also to Argentinean people because it’s a nice way to get to know the city and learn more about the history and culture in Buenos Aires. The guide, Gonzalo, showed us several districts of the city. He tells lots of stories about Buenos Aires in a really interesting way and with a good sense of humor. For the people who don’t speak Spanish (yet), don’t worry; the guide speaks English perfectly well.

Perfecto. What a great tour! Gonzalo (the guide) seems to know everything about the city, the country and the people. He guides you around the city with great enthousiasm and great laughter, he can tell a lot about the city history, but he also knows a lot of the city nowadays. It is even possible to ask to visit different parts of the city, if you want to visit those. He is a very open guy and becomes your friend from the moment you meet him. I wish everyone that will (and should) participate lots of fun! And maybe I will see some of you, because there is a good chance that I will enter again in the months that I have left in this great city!

Excellent!. Our guide Gonzalo was very informative and spoke English very well indeed. We felt the tour lasted the right amount of time and the sights were great,alot of history learnt from this tour! Would recommend to anyone! Thank you Gonzalo!

Interesting, fun and well structured.. Out guide Gonzalo was very friendly, well informed and spoke good English. The tour was well structured, taking in many interesting sites. Overall a very enjoyable morning, and I came away feeling like I knew the city a little better.

More than the standard city-tour!. What a great tour this is! You get to see most of the important buildings, everything in manageable walking distance, and hear lots of interesting stories and funny side-facts about them. Even though it took us more than 4 hours (apparently the longest tour Gonzalo ever did ;-)) I wasn't bored for a minute. Gonzalo adapted perfectly to our wishes, including a stop at the best empanada-place in town :-) Really recommend this tour. If you stay in Buenos Aires for more than just a couple of days, do it right at the start, because you'll be provided with many additional tips on where to get good pizza and what milongas the locals choose!

Great tour!. We loved the Demasiado Buenos Aires walking tour! Adam was a great guide, really enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the city, providing the story behind its buildings and streets. It was well worth the 4 hours as he took us to some places that we probably would have missed ourselves! We'd definitely recommend it.
awesome walking tour. The guide Adam is very nice and interesting. He is very knowledgeable about BA and gives a really good tour.

GREAT TOUR!. My daughter and I just bumped into Adam in downtown Buenos Aires. We decided to try his freetour (having been on similar ones in Europe), and if we didn't like it after 1/2 hour or so, we would leave. Adam turned out to be a very knowledgeable and charming tour guide - we learned so much in the 3 hour tour, and enjoyed seeing places and learning things about the city we never would have otherwise. We highly recommend Demasiado Tours!!

Amazing Tour. Gonzalo was an amazing tour guide. He spoke enthusiastically about Buenos Aires and shared a lot of great information. He is proud of what he does and it shows. I learned so much and had a lot of fun too. I recomend it to everybody.

The best things in life are free....& informative!. ADAM was a fantastic tour guide. He showed us the main sites in BA, saving us heaps of time trying to read maps! He covered the main points of Argentinian & BA history, giving us a great overview. The walk itself was nice & there was enough time to take some fantastic photos. Adam also sent a very personalised follow-up email answering our questions which I found quite impressive. Demasiado Tours is a young company & will go far! Thanks again!

Fantastic free walking tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour with Demasiaso Tours. Gonza loves his city and it's wonderful to be around someone so passionate and knowledgeable for four hours. Although it is a free tour I was astonished that a few people didn't give him any tips, the guy worked SO hard and totally deserved a tip. He went way beyond the tour and also took us to a great, local empanada place for lunch. He then sent us loads of info about pizza and ice cream places. Fantastic!

Great tour in Buenos aires!!. We all really really loved the tour! It was very professionnal: very interesting: Adam knows very well what he's talking about and tells it with serious and fun, history of the country and the capital, important political, cultural and social events and personalities, traditions, customs. He loves his country and it was a very nice time we spend with him and learning so much! We are really glad to have known about the tour and i surely recomend it!

dont miss this free guided tour!. really good walking tour through the old parts of BA with a lot of information and really nice guide! i was really impressed, that they just started this free tours here, as they exist in every big city in eruope. wish you all the best guys! and thanks for the awesome tour!
awesome walking tour. The guide Adam is very nice and interesting. He is very knowledgeable about BA and gives a really good tour.

Great tour and free. I have to say this tour is very, very good. It really helps to get a grip on the city and the main attractions with lots of inside knowledge thrown in. The tour guide, Adam, was a really nice guy who is clearly very knowledgeable and passionate about teaching people about Buenos Aires. Although it is free of course it is definitely worth giving a tip for such a great tour. I wish I could have given more to be honest. Its definitely worth it. Thankyou

Perfect tour!!. Hola todos!!I usually don't like doing free tours but honestly inwas really impressed by Demasiado tours and the guides!! We visited the whole city, had a great time, get to learn alot of history! And all that with no pesos!! I would recommend this tour!! Muchas gracias boys!! From Montreal, Canada

Great talk !. The tour was great and very instructive ! It was very interesting to discover Buenos Aires with someone who is from the city and knows all the history as well as the good places to go out and so on....It was definitively worth it. Do it !

Very good. I had a lot of fun at the tour, I really recommend it. The guide Adam is very nice and knows a lot about the history of BA. He can speak excellent English, so if there is the need, he explains everything both in Spanish and English. This helped me a lot. I highly recommend this.
A friendly tour. Nice tour, I heard from it in Couch Surfing. Adam gaves exlpanation, just as I like : complete stry and history , but short as well.

Demasiado tour in Buenos Aires. This free walking tour was well worth a great tip! Adam was an excellent tour guide with a very informative commentary. He was engaging, answered questions and kept my attention for 3.5 hours. I had already been on a few tours but he offered information and stories I had previously not heard. I would highly recommend this tour.Monica from Canada

Demasiado tourt in Buenos Aires. We did the free tour of about 3,5 hours in Buenos Aires with Demasiado Tours after we heard some good comments. Adam was our guide and he really did a good job. As I'm a guide myself in Belgium, I can compare and I have a critical view. They know a lot of the history, show you things you can't find yourself and that are not in the books. I already recommended these boys during my trip in Argentina and I would recommend to every body going to BA. At 10.30 AM at the Obelisk. You recognize them on the red T-shirt and carrying a plate with "free tours". Of course, at the end, being a decent person that appreciate their free work, you give them a good tip just because they deserve it !!!Have a nice city trip in BA !!Elsy from Belgium

Great overview of the city and it's history. This tour was a great way to cover Buenos Aires' main sights in a few hours and learn about its history. Our guide, Adam, was very knowledgable and spoke excellent English. He was also very handsome, hehe. I would recommend this tour for first time visitors to BA.

The perfect city escape!. This was my 2nd time doing Argentina Polo Day and it won't be my last. I couldn't imagine a better way to spend a day outside of the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires... endless grounds to explore and cups of wine to drink, one of the most amazing asados served at one big table where everyone sits together like family, top of the line polo fields and equipment, and of course the beautiful horses and other animals running around (there were puppies this time)! I took a couple friends who were visiting me in BA. They absolutely loved it and we actually ran into a couple other folks there that were recommended Argentina Polo Day by a friend who had visited me and gone before. Word travels fast when so worthwhile :) I highly recommend Argentina Polo Day to anyone visiting BA or who wants to get some fresh air con buena onda!

Beautiful time in a Private Polo Club. I booked this last minute, the night before, not sure if this was a tourist trap or not. I got fast and complete reply and it is not a trap! It's a beautiful experience. Our guide Pablo was fun and smart, the day is well organized with a good pace. The food was incredible, the wine was good and in generous quantity. Horses are well trained, it's easy to learn, but beware the aches the day after lol! The location is beautiful. So glad I booked this!

Amazing. Once again Ruben and his crew made out a great day for us. I went with two of my friends and, despite a rainy day, we hand a great Asado, and had the chance to try Polo. "La carona" is a lovely place where you can breathe "campo". I highly recomend this program.

Great experience for third time. I visited Ruben and Celia already the third time. 3,5 years ago on the old camp it was just incredible, now on the new one its hardly to top. Organization, food, camp, friendliness are perfect. Will definetly come back and can recommend a day or more there to everyone who would like to escape from big city life, get to learn polo and enjoy some great food in a friendly atmosphere.Markus

Great vacation. This was the best vacation experience I have ever had. Celia and Rubin are incredible hosts and make you feel like part of their family when you visit. You have an incredible snack and wine on arrival, you watch a fun polo match and learn the rules, then you have a beautiful lunch with the family and then play polo. Everyone was wonderful and welcoming. I will absolutely go back.

MUST DO IN BUENOS AIRES. What an amazing day! This is an absolute must for anyone coming to Buenos Aires. Pablo picked us up from where we were staying in BA to bring us to the beautiful ranch where we were immediately served empanadas and wine. This was followed by first watching/learning about polo, an asada, and then us actually playing polo! I can't say enough about this experience and will do again anytime I'm in BA!

Such an awesome day!. We had such an incredible time not only learning to ride a horse for the first time, but to actually play polo was something we didn't even think would be possible. Pablo was an amazing host. He was prompt in picking us up from our hotel was a very patient teacher and returned us home in one piece with beaming smiles in our faces. The property was beautifully maintained and the staff were super helpful. This day out was the absolute highlight of our 5 week trip to South America and we have been raving about it to anybody who'll listen.If you are considering Argentinian Polo Day and are unsure due to lack of experience on a horse we highly recommend that you give it a go. You'll absolutely love it.
Amazing polo experience to recommend!. Perfect organization, nice people and excellent food. An amazing day when we could experience real Argentinian polo!

GLAD I FINALLY DID IT. I want to express my gratitude for the great experience of finally going to the Polo Grounds in Argentina. Being there numerous times over the years is one highlight that I have not encountered.The weather was perfect. You could not have asked for anything better.The service from the inception of arriving till the time we departed was exceptional. Everybody was friendly, hospitable, attentive and welcome you like family.The wine was plentiful and the food was delicious.Being there at the polo grounds was a treat as I had never personally been. I enjoyed it immensely and had the opportunity to learn how to play and participate later in the afternoon.If you think POLO is easy to play, guess again. It is more challenging and you need the horse to be your best friend.You need to make this a must on your trip as I will be back the next time I come there.Michael

Trip highlight. We deliberated over booking this due to the price but it was absolutely worth it. The setting is amazing, the BBQ was enormous and very tasty but the highlight was the polo lesson and game afterwards. Pablo and the stable hands are excellent with the horses and had us all working up a sweat which was much more than we expected.

never expected i would do this in this life!. the people of argentina polo day made it possible to actually play a game of polo on a real horse with the real equipment. on top of that they serve you a marvellous meal in a peaceful beautiful surrounding.

Must-Do in Argentina. This was one of the best experiences in my whole life. Something completely out of the ordinary to say the least. We were greeted with some delicious wine and empanadas and the barbecue lunch was beyond delicious. Still drool when I think of it. Second half of the day played polo for a couple hours and it was blast. Overall, this is not something to miss.

Must-Do. The day we spent at this ranch was the highlight of our BA trip. The hosts were so nice and the grounds were beautiful. It would have been a highlight if we hadn't gotten to ride horses. The food and wine were spectacular. It was such a relaxing and enjoyable experience. But riding horses and playing a little polo and learning about the sport were really amazing. I highly recommend this trip; our vacation would have been lacking if we hadn't made the investment to spend the day here.

A 'must do'! Put this on your 'short list'!. So - after making your list for BA - Recoleta, Teatro Colon, Ateneo, Fuerza Bruta, MALBA, historical sites, parques, maybe tango...lots of food, you need to add Argentina Polo Day! This was SO MUCH FUN! I love visiting BA, but wanted to break up our week with a trip to the country. I had to choose between a trip to an estancia or Argentina Polo Day. I chose Argentina Polo Day because of the great reviews and because I felt it would be nice to actually "do" something as opposed to walking and sitting and eating. What a great choice! I still get kudos from the fam. I am in my 50's traveling with my husband and 19-year-old son. Together, we've been on horses - maybe 6 times, so we are novices. The experience was delightful. We were driven to a polo club in the country where we learned about polo - who knew? and actually rode horses and actually played polo (albeit in a smaller area!) The wine flowed freely. The food was delicious. The teaching was excellent. Every interaction was upbeat and friendly. So, we learned something new, we got some exercise, we enjoyed meeting new people and we got to share this experience as a family.As you can see, I cannot recommend this highly enough. So, go ahead a sign up! On another note - it was refreshing to work with a company that was friendly and accommodating. (As you will see, or may soon know, the concept of 'customer service' is inconsistently applied in Argentina.) With so much trip planning, I messed up with respect to payment options and Argentina Polo Day figured out a solution and was very kind and everything worked out.

Best day in Buenos Aires!. Ruben and Celia have created a beautiful, well maintained polo club and are extremely gracious hosts with close attention to every detail of our visit. Poly did a great job explaining the game and patiently coaching a novice rider. I was pleasantly surprised to actually hit the ball with the mallot and stay on the horse! The entire staff was very accommodating and the lunch and empanadas were excellent (best beef we had in Argentina). Truly the most memorable day of the stay in Buenos Aires!! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a new experience with friendly, fun people.

Yihaaaaa!! . That was simply amazing! Loved everything about it. We were welcomed with open arms and treated like kings. We couldn't have asked for anymore drink or food and the entire day (despite raining) was great fun. Pablo was really upbeat and a great host and even the polo payers that joined us for lunch were chatty and good fun.The nicest thing about it was that regardless of ability they were able to cater the day to suit all. There was 4 of us (plus an Argentinian polo groom on each team). 1 of us couldn't ride at all, 2 could bob about and then we had one experienced rider. In order to cater for us all they helped the non rider and blocked the good rider to enable it to be an even playing field.When I come back to BA I will definitely be returning to Argentina Polo Day!

Such a unique, cool experience learning everything there is about Polo!. We had the BEST day at Argentina Polo day! Our transfer to and from the ranch, instructors on the day - Poly & Stefan were LEGENDS! As soon as we arrive, we were sipping on wine and eating empanadas. We watched a polo match in action and learnt the history and rules of Polo, getting a little hands on during breaks. We were introduced to the horses and riders then headed for a BEAUTIFUL lunch 'Asado'. Some of the best BBQ we had in South America! Although we didn't speak Spanish, lunch was served with some of the players and family on the ranch which was so welcoming and nice! After lunch and more wine :) we took to the polo field with Horses ourselves. The instructors were wonderful helping me along every bit of the way. My partner was very comfortable on horses, where as this was my second time - Stefan was patient and positive in his approach with me learning. I walked away so happy with my efforts but couldn't have done it without the help on the day from the team! THanks for a truly amazing and unique experience!

A great experience. We had a really fun day out with Argentina polo day. They picked us up & then it was about a 45minute - 1 hour drive away. On the way we watched a video all about polo, how to play, history etc. Once we arrived we got to watch a polo match & then practise our skills & technique. After this, we had a delicious lunch, a huge Argentinian BBQ & wine then we were able to get the chance to play polo ourselves. Despite having never played polo & rarely having ridden a horse, we had lots of fun. We then finished the day with a horse ride around the vast property. We had a great day & I would highly recommend this experience.

I don't like horses, but this was an AMAZING day!. My wife and I are in Argentina on a year-long traveling honeymoon and we decided on a whim to spend a day learning to play polo. To be honest, I've never liked horses, they're like the Kardashians: they are beautiful but they scare me. But I have to say this was one of the most fun days I've ever had (and I used to jump out of planes for a living). The Argentina Polo Day team are AMAZING, they walk you through everything until you're comfortable, and in no time you're on a horse charging down a field toward your wife waving a big stick at her: awesome! The food was great, the people were genuinely lovely, and whilst I'm still battered and bruised from falling off my horse (my own fault, I wanted to beat my wife, not with the stick, just to score another goal), I'd absolutely do it again tomorrow (if the bruises fade and I can walk by then). Highly recommend this!

Great experience. We had a wonderful time with Argentina Polo Day. We had very little experience with horses but our host Agostina was very kind and helpful. Lunch was delicious and the polo match was great fun, despite the wet weather. We were also able to go on a trail ride around the property, which was beautiful. Would highly recommend as a day trip while in Buenos Aires.
Awesome day. It's a beautifull place to stay, lovely hostess and great wine and food. But of all an awesome experience to practise Polo!!!

Wonderful Argentina Polo Day. A very professional and well organized trip from start to finish. An opportunity to watch, learn and play polo in a safe environment and on a beautiful Polo estate about an hour from Buena Aires. We enjoyed wonderful food and wine to! There was nothing not to like on this trip and would highly recommend it to others!

Fun filled day.. Polo day was one of the highlights of my trip to Argentina. The ranch is situated about one and a half hours outside BuenosAires and is definitely worth the trip.The entire experience is well planned and enjoyable. The atmosphere is very homely and a lovely meal awaits on Arrival along with an endless supply of wine. You then get to watch a polo match with short walking lessons between rounds. There after you a treated to a hearty lunch and then your off to mount some horses and get involved in a polo game of your own. It's really a once in a life time experience to ride such well trained horses and partake in such a great sport.They are very accommodating of food preferences however their main dishes are beef, so alternates should be requested earlier.The guides are energetic and helpful and contribute to enhancing your entire experience.Photographs are taken through the day of your different activities which are then posted to Facebook where you can then access them.I loved this day trip and would definitely recommend it to other travelers.

Fun and Fantastic-Even if you have never been on a horse!. This was the highlight of our trip to Argentina! Having no experience with horses, our hosts were fantastic and made us feel very comfortable and safe. The setting, food and company made this a wonderful day and because of this experience we are looking to attend polo matches in our area.

Great experience!. Definitively an amazing experience! Kids friendly, good food, relaxing , fun and amazing staff!!! If you can spend time, I would recommend to stay over night to really enjoy everything the place has to offer!

Wet day at Polo. All though the weather wasn't the best, we still had a good time at the polo, got to watch a match, learn how the game was played, the barbecue they cooked up for lunch was amazing, so much food, so i would suggest not eating a big breakfast. plenty of wine too. we got to head out on horses and play a game ourselves, such a hard sport, defiantly worth a day trip..

Great experience. We attending the full polo day in August 2016 and thoroughly enjoyed it! As a group of 8 we had different level of experience as riders, from confident and competent to complete beginner, they catered for all levels and every single member of the group played and enjoyed polo. From the moment we arrived they were great hosts, food was AMAZING (BBQ is a experience within itself!!) and our wine glass was always full. If you have a day free in BA I would fully recommend, its great to be out of the city and they pick you up and drop off at your hotel so hassle free!! ENJOY
Lovely day. We had a beautiful day at the argentina polo. Lovely place, delicious lunch and excellent service. The game with the horses was fun!

amazing experience . If you're in the area, this is a must do!! It was probably my favorite day in Argentina and one of my favorite of all time. Great value for money, beautiful place, and they treat you like royalty!

Best day of Argentina. This place is AMAZING. It is an absolute MUST do. And despite not being cheap, the value for money is incredible. The place is gorgeous, the horses are incredibly well trained, and the day is meticulously well planned. You'll drink plenty of wine, eat delicious food (the best empanadas I've had in Argentina - and that's saying a lot!) watch an amazing game (it's SO spectacular in person) and shock yourself with the fact that you actually CAN play polo. This day is 100% worth it - i recommend it to anyone thinking of more than a couple days in Buenos Aires! It's a perfect way to break up the city time and see the "provincia," get the classic "campo" experience, learn about the culture, and get some exercise. Enjoy!!

100% worth it. Our group of six were definitely skeptical going in to this, but Argentina polo day was the best part of our stay in Buenos Aires.Wine is close at hand during all parts of the trip. The ranch is gorgeous. The food is excellent and plentiful. Pablo and the other instructors are extremely nice and make you feel like a pro even though you have no clue what you're doing. Believe the reviews. This is awesome.

ABIERTO DE PALERMO / BUENOS AIRES. The best experience you can have in Buenos Aires if you come between September till December, You have 3 opens with the best players in the world 10 Handicap. Open Tortugas, Open Hurlingham and Open Palermo. At the 3 get to watch No.1 polo player in the World Adolfo Cambiaso-La Dolfina..you cannot miss watching him play and his team La Dolfina. Awesome, out of this world. I am Argentine so I spend those months watching polo.

Great Day out even if you don't ride. My 14 year year old and I had a great time. We haven't ridden much but this was not a problem at all. After arriving and eating a traditional pie baked on a wonderful BBQ we watched a match to get the feel for how it is done. Then after a great lunch El Campo style it was our turn. The horses were fantastic despite our lack of knowledge we all managed to play and even score goals. Highly recommended.

Fun polo day. I took part in this activity in May and had so much fun. We drove about 1,5 from Buenos Aires to the countryside. Our guide explained about the sport and we got to see how the professionals play. After a lovely asado lunch with wine it was time to give a go ourselves. It was so much fun, i don't know exactly for how long we played but it felt too short!! I would recommend this activity for everyone even though it's a bit on the expensive side. Was definitely one of the highlights of my Argentina trip.

Consistently amazing!. I live in Argentina now and recommend Argentina Polo Day to all of my friends that come to visit. Every time it is a huge success and a highlight that we talk about endlessly afterward! This is truly an all-in-one experience: authenticity, culture, tradition, activity, a beautiful part of the suburbs few tourists get to see, and in true Argentine fashion, a delicious asado with vino. Cannot say enough good things about Argentina Polo Day!
Contiki Argentina Polo Day. Absolutely fabulous - great people, great food and wine, and fun times. The drive there from Buenos Aires was a bit long but definitely worth it.

Best Activity in Argentina. This was an extraordinary activity, one that my family and I have never done before, it was completely different from any others and was an activity we enjoyed since it started. I would definitely tell you to buy your tickets for this Argentina Polo Day, so you get to know what you do in the best activity in argentina.

Argentina Polo Day - Fantastic experience. Went to the polo farm today and enjoyed every minute of it! The staff is very warm, welcoming and attentive. Food was great and the polo really good fun! Can only highly recommend it.

Fantastic!. One of the best days ever. Superb hosts, delicious food (and so much of it), and beautiful venue and surroundings.Watching the match was great...and then playing polo (when I'm new to horses) was a complete blast. Do it!

Full fun day!. We had a great day at the polo club! It was the off season so it was a little different playing polo on the dirt but very cool that even in the off season they can still accommodate you and they still have members of the club playing in polo matches everyday, (which is something not ever polo place has) Upon arrival we were greeted with wine! And more wine! Then a fabulous lunch with an endless amount of asado! Then you go out and engaged in a polo match yourself! Very cool. It's not like the pros.... Your not galloping around by any means... But still very fun and challenging! We had a fabulous time and highly recommend this activity. It is a very long day and you will be exhausted by the end of it!

Amazing day!. This was one of my favorite days in Argentina! HIGHLY RECOMMEND! My friend and I were picked up by a driver at 10am with two other ladies in the car. We drove out to the ranch and were greeted with wine and empanadas! After having a snack we headed outside to watch a polo game! We got to throw the ball onto the field to start the game, ring the bell to end it, meet the horses and players, and learn about the rules of polo. After the game, we went inside for an amazing lunch. Lunch consisted of more wine (because wine not?), grilled vegetables and lots of different grilled meats including sausage and steak. After lunch we learned how to play polo! I had never ridden a horse before, but the instructor was great at showing me how to ride and then eventually actually hit the balls! By the end we were playing an actual polo match! In the summertime, you can relax by the pool after polo, but I was there in the winter so we went back inside by the fire and ate some dessert. This really was a perfect day!

A lovely day!. This was such a fun day! We were picked up at our hotel in Buenos Aires and driven out to the polo ranch. In the bus we were asked in anyone is a vegetarian or gluten free. This thrilled me as I am gluten free.Upon arrival at the ranch were were served snacks (special gluten free ones for me) and wine then thought the basics of polo and watched a game. From there were served a delicious and plentiful lunch then on to learn how to play! The gradient in which we were taught was so perfect I think that even people who don't ride horses could learn.The ranch was beautiful, the food delicious, and the polo so much fun!

Great day!. Great day out learning to play polo!We were picked up at our hotel in BA and within an hour arrived at the beautiful polo ranch where we were offered empanadas and malbec. We then watched a polo match, whilst learning the rules and practicing with the stick in between chukkas. After a fantastic bbq lunch we mounted our horses and practiced with the polo members. We then played a match amongst ourselves and afterwards walked the horses around the ranch. I was very suprised at how much fun it is to play a polo match!! After dessert and more red wine we were returned to our BA hotel. All in all it was a great day and a memory to cherish!!!

Argentina Polo Day great for families!. Argentina Polo Day was a great experience for everyone in our family. My wife and I, her sister, and our two children, ages 9 and 11 all had an experience we will remember for years to come. Well worth the cost and time. It was an all day event where we all learned the game of Polo by not only watching club members play the game, but also had instruction on the basics. When we arrived they met us with wine, coffee and empanadas, I think I ate 8 empanadas. We then watched a very good game of Polo played by the club members. Most notable was that along with the five of us, there was one other person on the trip that day and the organizers were able to get all of us on horses after an INCREDIBLE lunch and play a game of Polo. I have not been on a horse since I was 10 (I'm 44 now) and my kids had not rode before either. We all had a great time. The staff that runs the place were all friendly and extremely gracious.I've been fortunate to travel to many places with my family and we've done some great adventures. Argentina Polo Day stands as one of the most memorable, best organized events we've ever participated in on a family vacation.

Amazing Experience. This was the greatest experience! They catered to a large group of us and were very attentive. The empanadas were amazing and the wine was superb! I loved playing polo for the first time and learning more about the game. I'd absolutely recommend!

You Must Do This!. Trust that you will not fall off the horse, that you CAN play polo and that you will have an experience you'll be talking about for years! This is the most fun you can have in one day. Just do it!

Brilliant day out at the polo. . The polo day was the highlight of my stay in Buenos Aires, it was so much funPicked up around 10, we were taken with 4 other guests to a ranch about an hour outside of the city. On arrival, we were told to relax by the lovely fire in the lounge (it was a cold day) and offered empanadas and red wine.Then we were taken to a small polo field to watch a game between some players to get an understanding of the game and a brief introduction to the rules. At breaks in the game we were shown how to hold the mallet, hit the ball and taken to see some of the horses taking part.A delicious lunch followed (either meat or veggie), more red wine and coffee and then it was time to put theory into action as we donned our polo gear and played a game. The guys are in the arena with you to help and you get plenty of practice on the horse before the game starts.We all had a terrific time, getting a great sense of accomplishment when hitting the ball! After the match we stayed on the horses for a trot around the grounds followed by a scrumptious dessert (and more wine).Highly recommended no matter if you've never ridden a horse before. They'll take care of you.

Fun outdoors day. I was born and raised in buenos Aires and came to visit with my boyfriend, who had never been. Wanted to have a fun day in the countryside and Ruben and Celia really nailed it putting together this wonderful experience! We not only felt like at home but it was fun and very authentic. You might be able to go to other places that are just put together for the "tourist crew". This ain't it. This was real. Great job!! A must to visit for everybody!!

Excellent Experience!!! . First time ever playing polo and very little experience horseback riding but I had an amazing time! Thanks to the great and professional teacher. All the other staff members were very nice too! Great food and unlimited wine made the day complete. I highly recommend this to everyone. It's also a nice way of escaping from the city centre. I will do it again next time I'm around.

Great experience. The entire experience was so fancy and adventurous at the same time. Watching the players and then actually playing the game was super exciting. Overall an unforgettable fun time from the beginning until the end.

So. Much. Fun!. This was one of the best things we did in Argentina! The experience feels uniquely Argentinian (as another reviewer said), and is so much fun! We did the complete day tour. Our pick-up was on time, clean and comfortable; transfer was about an hour. The estancia, which doubles as polo club and small hotel, is absolutely gorgeous. It feels like a completely different world just a skip away from the city. Upon arrival we were greeted with hot meat empanadas fresh off the grill and a healthy glass of Malbec. Pablo, our guide/polo instructor, was fantastic. He was funny and informative and totally knew how to calm me down when my horse got a little “excited” during our polo match later in the afternoon.The overall program… We spent the morning sipping Malbec and listening to Pablo explain the tradition of polo in Argentina and the rules of the game, all while watching members of the Corona Polo Club play a friendly game of four chukkers. We also hit a few practice balls (off horse) to get ready for the game in the afternoon. We then had a lovely asado (lunch) with the players, Pablo, the owner and horsehands; all of whom were very warm, welcoming and friendly. After lunch we then had a chance to play ourselves. Tito was my practice partner who patiently continued the ball for me when I would miss it completely or grow a little weary in the wrist. After a bit of practice we all played a short game which really made my husband and I appreciate the skill of the game. (We were terrible.) We then ended the afternoon more glasses of Malbec, a delicious tiramisu and transfer back to Buenos Aires. It really was a lovely day and something you will not really experience anywhere else. A must if you are in Buenos Aires!

Great experience, would do it again!. This was a unique and wonderful experience. The staff were very friendly and the location was beautiful. They actually let you get on a horse and play polo! I was unsure of how much action we would see, but it was the real deal. After some instruction, they put you on a real polo pony and let you play just like you were a member. From galloping after the ball to scoring goals and bumping other players. It was so much fun! The food and wine were also great.

Conitki Polo Day - April 2016. Had such a great time watching, learning, and playing polo!That along with the unlimited wine and steady flow of empanadas and steak was amazing!Highly recommend for a fun day in Argentina.
Great full day polo experience with private lessons. Fantastic day with pickup at hotel in Buenos Aires, polo lessons, great food and people. Will definitely come back
Polo Country. Had a really great time; great food, fun & weather. Our "group" was only three and we got along well. Though the horse didn't always do what I wanted it to do - we got along too!

Argentina Polo Day. My husband and I had a fantastic time at the polo day. Please see my review below.Positives: - The owner was extremely fast on all responses to my emails (much appreciated)- My husband had never been on a horse before but they were great with teaching him how to ride and placing him on an older horse- The food was delicious along with the wine (and quite a lot of options as well with the meat (the food kept coming at lunch)- The horses are rather old and easy to learn polo while riding (for sure a beginner activity). Recommendations- I recommend going with a smaller group if possible. We were there with two other ladies and it was perfect. - I recommend wearing/bringing rain boots to ride with (or boots you do not care about). We went when it was pouring down rain and very muddy). Despite the rain we still had a good time. Areas to improve:- The car that collected us was a 2 door car for 5 people (the driver, +me and my husband, +2 other individuals). It was a very small and could have been very awkward. Luckily we were with 2 other great people, but still very tight for over and hour to the facility and over an hour back. All around we had a great day and one of our highlights from the trip!

Awesome Affair. Every moment of this day was well worth it. From pick up to drop off. The host was awesome, the food and the day itself. I have a whole new respect for Polo. I loved the history behind it and the farm we got to watch and play polo on. The people were very nice and accommodating. Beautiful horses and a dog to play around with. Before I came here I was only a white wine fan. I actually walked away with a favorite red wine, who would have thought. Would do this again.

Amazing Day in Argentina. We spent a full Saturday outside of Buenos Aires learning how to ride horses, play polo, drinking wine and eating fantastic food. The estancia is beautiful, and the staff was wonderful. We were greeted upon arrival with wine and empanadas, and then got to watch a polo match. After the match, we had a multi-course lunch in the patio area, and then headed out to ride horses for the afternoon. Having never been on a horse before, the staff was extremely helpful and taught us everything that some of us needed to know. We played a pretend polo game and then rode the horses out into the beautiful fields. I loved this day and would highly recommend Argentina Polo Day for anyone looking for an unforgettable day trip outside of the city.
Amazing!. We had an amazing day! If you go to Argentina this is a must. Out in the country, with great wine, great food and can't say enough about the hospitality.

Perfect day on the countryside. Where to begin?We truly did not know what to expect when the bus came to pick us up at the hotel in the morning...but our friend who recommended this excursion deemed it a "MUST" - and we now absolutely agree! Wow, what a day.Connie, our amazing guide, picked us up in a bus and we took a nice drive to the country. Once we arrived, we were immediately handed a glass of Malbec and a warm empanada fresh off the parrilla (I had two and half of my father's...they were so delicious!). We then walked out to the polo field area on the sprawling green estate that had a little resident dog that was so friendly. Ruben, one of the owners of the estate kindly lent me a sweater because I was a little chilly.We were seated on the bleachers facing the polo field, offered more wine and refreshments, and Connie explained the game of polo to us. The players came out on the field, and we were able to watch a match and knock the ball around ourselves in between each chukker. After the game ended, our group suited up, got on the horses and played a polo game! Not easy! But the horses were sweet, and each team had a pro to assist in moving the game along.By the end, we were exhausted, laughing and HUNGRY.Of course the parrilla was already fired up, and they served us an amazing meal with more wine, amazing Argentinian meat, grilled vegetables, and chocolate cake because it was someone's birthday! At that point, the group felt comfortable and relaxed and it was truly nice to celebrate someone - as a friend, not just a stranger.As we ate outside under a roof, it started to drizzle ever so slightly, and it became such a perfect moment. It was like out of a dream. Ruben and Celia, the owners, collect artifacts that outfit their beautiful and rustic home there. It was very cool to see some Argentinian history as well.At the end, we were sad to leave. Back on the buses we went, back to our lives.I most certainly would love to return, and even do an extended stay.Connie and others took so many photos throughout and they send you a link on Facebook afterwards, which is amazing so you can look back on the incredible day with new friends.I cannot recommend Argentina Polo Day enough. It was complete, perfect, and so memorable. Very grateful for the experience.

Best BA Day Trip!. This was a perfect day excursion for the family. Well organized, the empanadas to start were delicious, the lunch off the parilla was excellent, and learning and playing polo was so unique and fun!
I highly recommend!
Fantastic experience. Great food, great people and fantastic experience playing polo. Highly recommended, no experience needed either.

Best Argentine Parilla!. The best thing about polo day is the food. When you arrive they great you with a glass of wine and empanadas fresh off the grill. These are the best empanadas I have ever tasted. They must be homemade by Ruben himself! The traditional Argentine barbecue is slow cooking on a wood grill right in front of you when you arrive. They serve several excellent cuts of "tiro de asado", "lomo," and "chorizo." You can select as many cuts as you like. All accompanied with grilled vegetables, fresh salads, and all the Malbec you can drink!

Unforgettable Day!. My wife and I went to Buenos Aires on our honeymoon and were told by friends not to miss out on this experience. We could not have been happier with the Argentina Polo Day team! They picked us up from our AirBnb in the city, drove us along with 3 other couples out to the ranch, treated us to empanadas, wine, a polo match, an incredible lunch of grilled meats and veggies and then we got to play real polo! Even though I didn't have a ton of experience with horses, these polo ponies are so well trained they make it easy. I had a blast and would absolutely recommend this to anyone!

A fabulous day, whether you ride or not!. A beautiful setting, fantastic food, lovely and friendly family. We watched a match and learned the basics, had lunch and then my daughter and I had a go playing polo whilst my husband and my son (allergic to horses) chilled by the pool / had a glass of wine. We rode around the club, met other players and guests and it was a great day out and a real experience. The family could not have been more welcoming and this was the experience of a lifetime!

Fancy a chukka. Fabulous day out, the weather wasn't the best, but still had an amazing amount of fun.Met some really cool people, all the staff were great, you must do this if you visit Buenos Aires.The polo is amazing fun, and you realise how hard after watching the real players, but anyone can have a go. Add the fabulous food, wine, and other really good fun people. Don't think about it just book!They even helped sorting some other events out for us too, like tickets at the BOCA.

Expensive but worth every penny!. Our full day of polo with Argentina Polo Day is one of the highlights of our two week trip through Argentina! The price was a bit shocking to us at first, but you truly get a lot for your money - transportation to and from your hotel in Buenos Aires, a full day of watching and playing polo, empanadas upon arrival, unlimited wine all day, and a lunch feast. The staff at Argentina Polo Day was extremely warm and welcoming, and they clearly had experience dealing with first time polo players of all abilities. My husband took quickly to riding the polo horse, bumping, and hooking, but I was much more apprehensive as it was my first time riding a horse. One of the staff members continually checked on me and gave me advice to relax and enjoy the experience. Argentina Polo Day is truly a gem and a great opportunity to experience the beautiful nature Argentina has to offer just a short trip outside of the city.

Perfect day in the countryside!. If you have the time, you HAVE to join Celia and her team at Argentina Polo Day! We were in BA on our honeymoon and friends recommended this place to us -- so happy we went! It was one our honeymoon highlights. They conveniently pick you up where you're staying in the city, you arrive to wine and empanadas, you're on a beautiful countryside property watching a polo match, you learn about polo and the horses, drink more wine, have a delicious asada bbq on a long table overlooking the green landscape, and then you're on the horses, getting comfortable with riding and play a 'kiddie version' of polo with other attendees. If the weather is nice, you can hop in their pool after the match! So much fun. Great instruction. Celia and her family and staff are so warm and welcoming! Full disclosure, I've never been too comfortable on a horse and my husband doesn't have much riding experience, but we had so much fun and everyone was able to take their time on the horses at their own speed -- I really appreciated this. The horses are so well trained and really responsive, and the Polo Day team is riding alongside the group helping everyone out and taking photos of your day. Do this. It will surely be a highlight of your time in BA!

Great Day. My wife and I had been in BsAs (Palermo SoHo) for 4 days, and we were looking for something different to do before the end of the trip. We stumbled on Polo Day, and boy were we lucky. It is a fantastic day. I am a cattle rancher, and assumed Polo Day would be like riding a pony at the carnival. It is not. They feed you a great meal, they explain the game, gladly answer all questions, watch a game. Then you hop on a horse. Get on the field. They throw out a bunch of balls. Practice for an hour. Then we played a 30 min game. The pros playing with us were great help and a ton of fun. YOU HAVE TO GO TO POLO DAY IF YOU ARE IN BsAs!!

Best Activity We Did in Argentina. I have never written a review before, but my family loved this activity so much that I wanted to share. I went with my husband and 2 daughters - ages 16 and 13. Hands down we all voted this outing our favorite day on vacation. The property is beautiful and the day is spaced quite well: snack, explanation of the game, watch a game, practice in between periods, lunch, and then play yourself. The lunch was fantastic - beef, red wine, grilled veggies - so fresh and just the best! I didn't think we'd all be able to manage playing on horses, but the fact that we all did and loved it speaks for itself. Our guide (Pablo) was wonderful and witty and our group was small - just our family and 2 other couples. Plan for a full day - the drive was about 1 hour from where we stayed in Palermo; we got picked up around 10am and returned at 7:30pm.

great day!. polo day was one of my favorite days in Buenos Aires! Upon arrival, they had the BEST empanadas ready for us to eat! Next we watched a polo game, then had lunch (very good!!), and played our own game of polo! Some of the people we were with had no experience on horses, and all went well! At the end of the day, you are welcome to use their pool. They have changing rooms and showers available as well. Also, they have rooms available if you wish to stay over night! I wish I would have known that prior to booking because I would have loved to have stayed! The only thing we didn't really like was that we were picked up at our hotel in a very small vehicle. We were traveling with 2 large American men, so it made for an uncomfortable start and end to our day.

So much fun!!. I had a marvelous time- the place is not too far from the city- lovely polo ranch- we watched a real polo match, had a great barbecue with lots of wine and the best came when we actually rode and learnt how to play polo! Had not had so much fun in a long time! Celia and Ruben the owners were very friendly and Pablo our host was very nice and knowledgeable- do not miss this day out in the Pampas and riding horses!!

Nice day. I love riding and horses and am always happy to be around them. There's like 200 horses at the farm so I was in heaven. It was nice to be introduced to polo and I scored a goal in our match :P The parilla was really good, I was worried that I wasnt gonna have much to eat since I am a vegan but I was happily surprised and very full after the lunch. The owner and his wife are very friendly and so was our guide.
Great Day of Polo!. I had a wonderful experience! The farm was so beautiful and relaxing, they thought of everything. I only wish I stayed longer!!!

Super day!. This was the best day in BsAs. Great to escape the city for a day, the weather was beautiful, the scenery amazing. Most surprising of all, I never drove a horse and still was able to play a game of polo! The horses are very well trained, they respond immediately. And if you don't hit the ball, the horse may kick it with its leg. Special thanks to the nice organization. Celia and her husband are trying to create an easy access and fun polo club, a very refreshing spirit in the world of polo. Many thanks for the nice experience.

Great day in Buenos Aires. This was a blast! Hour ride outside of downtown Buenos Aires, they picked us up at the hotel and took us to the polo farm. The place is spectacular - beautiful farm, three polo pitches and dozens of magnificent horses. You watch a match, then get a lesson - and have the finest lunch we had in Buenos Aires. Could not recommend this more!

I scored a goal ! . I visited Buenos Aires in December 2015 with my boyfriend. We were interested in seeing a polo match and I came across the polo day experience. I booked online through the website a day in advance. We were staying at an Air BNB in Palermo Soho and were picked up at a nearby hotel for the 40ish minute ride. This whole process was seamless. There were solo travelers, couples and groups. We arrived to the beautiful grounds and were immediately handed glasses of wine and parrilla before walking over to the field. The whole day was very organized. Our "leader" Fabio was extremely knowledgable and kind. After learning the rules of the game, watching a match, eating, drinking more and practicing we got on our horses. The horses were so well kept and easy to ride. I think I had the most fun just trotting around the field. The game was fun and I scored a goal but the mallet got very heavy after a while (I'm a 130 pound female). This was the type of day I didn't want to end and definitely the highlight of our 11 day trip in Buenos Aires.

Fantastic Day an Hour from Buenos Aires!. Comfortable trip[[great Polo grounds--Wonderful drinks and empanadas then watching a Polo match and learning to play. Given equipment then get up on a horse and practice for an hour before actually playing a polo match! Great papilla lunch and then swimming in a pool and relaxing before heading back to BA. Perfect day

Truly Amazing!!!!. First thing I would like to highlight is how much everyone wants to make you feel at home, far from a canned experience that you would expect from a group tour. Most gracious hosts, lovely healthy well kept horses and the staff really made you understand the basics without being overbearing. They have structured the event well so from an beginner to expert has something for them - our group had people who had never sat on a horse to novices and even sr. retirees. The steaks and chorizo served for lunch were as good as any steakhouse. We also toured the grounds and the guesthouse with exceptional antigues.
Excellent time at Argentina Polo Day. We all had a great time. It was a unique experience that I highly recommend. Got to play polo even though I had limited experience riding horses.

Tip-top Day!. Absolutely brilliant day out, smiles all day; will never forget it. I am really looking forward to visiting again.
Richard

The polo day was a lot of fun!. The polo day that was set up by Celia and Alfie was a lot of fun! The barbecued food was really good. It was really neat to watch an actual polo match and then actually attempt to play polo. My only disappointment was that we didn't get to play on the grass field. I would highly recommend it for anybody it was a really fun day!

Best day tour we have ever done.. We new it would be great but it exceeded our expectations.Actually played polo in a safe and fun environment.Got 2 goals and 1 assist. My wife got 1 goal and 1 assist. Gorgeous property, awesome lunch, wine, great team and 11 out of 10 for value.We would do this again many times if we could.

One of the best things we did in South America. We did this the day before our return home after three months travelling around Latin America. It was a great day out - the staff were excellent, the food was fantastic and the setting was beautiful. The whole day was done at a really nice pace and it was a shame when it was over. Highly recommend.

A fantastic day in Argentina's countryside.. We were picked up by a car from our hotel in Buenos Aires. The trip to the Polo field takes about one hour. On arrival we greeted by the hostess Augustine, a delightful young lady, who greeted my wife and I with a glass of Argentinian wine, a great wined too and some empanadas. She introduced us to the owner Reuben who welcomed us in the typical Argentinian friendly way. After finishing the great lunch we were introduced to the game of Polo. We practised at hitting the ball, and then we watched a real game played by some of club's sporting members. After this came the exciting time for us when we were taken to the mounting yar. ds and then started our own game. A truly fantastic day. Highly recommended as a full day of new experiences and enjoyment.
Great Experience!. Four friends and I took part in the full day experience and found it very enjoyable. The food and wine were phenomenal as were the lessons and the match. Would highly recommend!
Awesome time. Polo day was great. The staff was very friendly and the grounds are beautiful. Empanadas to start were delicious.

the best polo day !!!!!. As soon as you arrive to Argentina Polo Day ' s place you already feel that something great is going to happenAnd I was right! I had the best experience in my lifeThe food is very good Classic Argentina The horses are very well trained and I enjoyed a lot learning and playing with the instructors, other visitors and the owner!You won't believe how hard the owner Ruben works every day to make it every day a perfect dayI had the chance to talk to him. He is such a unique person! Love his horses, love polo, love what he doesAnd you feel that all the time in every detailAfter my first day here that although it rained at the end we had a fantastic time, I decided to come back and stay more daysI highly and truly recommend this place, horse lovers, outdoor lovers, everyone should come and try This beautiful experience!!!!!

What an amazing experience- A little gem! . A friend had mentioned this as a possible day trip for us, and when I ran it past a friend living in Buenos Aires- he was super positive about the day and completely recommend it. I ended up going alone and had a great day. You are given freshly baked empanadas and good wine when you arrive, you get to watch the Gauchos play a game of Polo, while our host Celia explained the rules, the history and tips we could practice before we got on the horses ourselves. Lunch was what seemed like a never ending Asado- which was truly scrumptious. And getting to play polo was the best part of a pretty awesome day- it was great to be apart of the experience. I've never ridden a horse before, but Celia and co's help made it a positive and enjoyable experience.If recommend this day to everyone who wants to do something that's a bit different, but very authentic.Thanks Celia for a great day!

Argentina Polo Day. Argentina Polo Day was an awesome experience! Well worth the price. We were picked up at our hotel by friendly staff. The drive out of the city was scenic and pleasant. Upon arriving at the estancia, we were treated as special guests. The estancia buildings and grounds are beautifully maintained. It was fun to watch the Argentines play polo first and then to actually saddle up, get lessons and practice, and to play ourselves. Swimming in the pool is offered as a cool down after the polo for no extra charge.The meal of wine, juice, roasted beef, potatoes, and vegetables was delicious and seemed never ending. Gracious owners and staff made this a top notch day.

best polo in argentina!!!!. As soon as you arrive to Argentina Polo Day ' s place you already feel that something great is going to happenAnd I was right! I had the best experience in my lifeThe food is very good Classic Argentina The horses are very well trained and I enjoyed a lot learning and playing with the instructors, other visitors and the owner!You won't believe how hard the owner Ruben works every day to make it every day a perfect dayI had the chance to talk to him. He is such a unique person! Love his horses, love polo, love what he doesAnd you feel that all the time in every detailAfter my first day here that although it rained at the end we had a fantastic time, I decided to come back and stay more daysI highly and truly recommend this place, horse lovers, outdoor lovers, everyone should come and try This beautiful experience
Fabulous!. Highly recommended. Stunning location, fabulous hosts and instructors, the swimming pool was definitely a highlight on a hot February day. Loved it!

cant wait to do it again. great way to experience the sport of polo...the horses were willing and tolerant even in the unusual heat. The food was plentiful and delicious, the staff tireless in their efforts

Perfect Day of Polo. From the moment you are collected from your hotel the treatment and experience is nothing less than first class. Have and will continue to recommend this one day unforgettable experience to all.

We felt like special guests.. What a great trip. Wine ,Lunch , swimming pool Watched a polo match and at 54 years old rode a horse for the first time. The staff were very good at getting me thru this great experience...We felt like special guests at the ranch. Dont miss this one

Best day of our trip. Warm weather, sun, red wine, amazing food, horses, polo, swimming, sangria! What more could you want!This was such an amazing day - the grounds were beautiful and peaceful, the staff were so helpful and made our day fun and exciting. Could not recommend this polo day anymore. Loved it!!

Tourist Trap - irresponsible. We were really loooking forward to our stay at the polo Farm. Especially as we spent the day before at an estancia nearby - which was awsome (family atmosphere, well kept horses, wonderful experience) Unfortunately the polo day was the absolute opposite. We spent a long time at the mediocre lunch although it already looked like Rain. When we finally startet riding the weather got really bad, and we had a Lot of beginners Who did not feel Safe on the horses. The horses were standing still trying to avoid facing the heavy rain but still nobody from the farm reacted to bring us in but they startet to Hit the horses with the polo stick while my friend, A beginner, was still sitting on the horse.Then we were heading under some trees to Cover from the Rain. All the beginners had to make their own way - on some spooked horses, because our guide was already under the trees seeking shelter from the heavy rain. We were absolutely not taken good care of and felt not save. Not even the experienced riders in our Group.We can just recommend to save your money and time and better spent some time with well kept and better treated horses on an estancia that is a bit more individual, not Mass-market-tourist-trap Kind of activity.

Highlight of our trip. What a great day—from the facilities to the food, to the excitement of watching a polo match, and then the unforgettable experience of getting on the horses and trying it ourselves!
What s day!. Lovely family run business, professional, welcoming, warm and fun. An unforgettable time. Thank you Celia

Polo day. We had the most amazing day learning about polo and playing the game our 14 year son had never ridden but he was well looked after and even scored the winning goal in our chukka. After polo playing we them has a lovely cool swim lunch was amazing Argentina beef and great wines.

The highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires.
