Tried is the operative word, but it was good fun. Unfortunately, some of the horses are not as cooperative and just loll about and it makes it harder to "get in the game". Staff are very friendly and professional. Not an inexpensive day, but worth it for us. We would remind those who attend to remember to provide a tip/propina to the staff. It is greatly appreciated, and unfortunately, we saw some groups did not drop anything into the tip jar. The staff on the ranch work hard to give you a nice day. We recommend this day trip. Celia was our contact to arrange this trip, was on site and was wonderful! Arranged pick up and drop off at the apartment we rented, on time. :)

Absolutely Outstanding !. Greeted with a red wine and and quick hello to the horses, then we were off to watch a fabulous match of polo! During the game rules are explain, every gets involved whether scoring, umpiring, drinks monitor, photographer and even trainee players between chucks. Then you get be your very own polo player! So much support for non riders and so much fun for even confident riders, you control the action! Then to sit down under the the serene tree with the best Argentinian BBQ, more local wine, juices and fabulous friendships, whether old or new! To finish up a beautiful day of polo, then you relax in the crystal blue pool with a tasty sangria or juice!Absolute perfect day, worth every cent!

Polo. Ton of fun. You get to learn all about Polo and then you actually get to play. I reccommed wearing pants. They feed you and treat you like family. The hospitality is amazing. There is non stop food, wine, and entertainment. Thanks Contiki

great day to experience polo!. I went solo and had an amazing time with the argentina polo day team! Everything was fone perfectly, the transfer from buenos aires, the explanation of the polo game, the argentinian asado with great wine, the polo game (where this time i understood what was happening ), and of course the highlight playing polo! This was so much fun!

relaxing, wonderful day out. wonderful experience and day out, the instructors and team avery good and bring you into the game with ease, even for young kids. Very well packaged, must come back again sometime.....
Best day in Argentina. Everything was amazing; horses, BBQ, wine and the empanada's!! Definitely I'll do it again. Special thanks to our host Pablo who was very kind and funny. He made our day!

Perfect Polo Experience for Novice. Argentinians are crazy for polo, with all the top teams in the world originating there. So, to complete a family trip to Buenos Aires, this topped our bucket list. We were not disappointed.My teenaged daughters both have riding experience, while my wife and I have done little more than trail rides in national parks in Western USA. The day was perfect for all of us. We were picked up at the flat we were renting and taken by bus about an hour north of the city to a private polo club. There, members pay for the ability to compete, in much the same way as folks in the USA might belong to a golf club. Once there, Pablo, our leader explained the game to us and why it is so expensive. For actual polo matches, the number of horses required is enormous. Each 4 person team has a fresh horse for every one of the 7 minute "chukkas (like innings in baseball)." There are 4 chukkas in a demonstration game with most regulation matches having 6 chukkas. That's 6 chukkas times 8 horses (4 for each team) for a total of 48 horses!We were greeted with delicious empanadas and wine. We then were provided a history of polo and the basics of the game. Then we all had a chance to watch a demonstration match. Between the 4 chukkas, when they were changing horses, we had a chance to practice hitting the ball with mallets. There was plenty of equipment, so we all had time to get the hang of it. After the match, we all sat down to an amazing barbeque lunch, with as much excellent Argentinian Cabernet as we wished to consume.After lunch we were assigned horses and equipment. The staff helped instruct us further as we began using the mallets to hit balls from horseback. After about 20 minutes of practice, we had an impromptu match. It was well orchestrated with the instructors prodding us along. We all had great fun (although I'm still sore a week afterwards!). The well trained horses did most of the work taking us along for the ride.When our match was over, there was more wine, swimming and an air conditioned bus back to BA. I wouldn't change a thing. The team has been doing this for a while and really know how to make their guests comfortable. They also did a great job keeping us all safe. I'd recommend this experience to anyone. At $175 per person, I feel it was an outstanding value.

100% recommended Polo activity in Buenos Aires!. I have been working as a tour guide in Buenos Aires for few years now and when talking about polo experience this should be your choice! Not only for the excellent service and entertaining activities but also because of the people working here, qualified professionals, responsible, easy communication and fun!

Great Experience!. We recently got married down in Argentina and decided to add this day to the week activities for all the foreigners visiting. There were 15 of us and I don't think a single person didn't love the experience. The food was great, good wine, people great and playing polo was definitely an experience that we will never forget. I am so glad that we added this activity to the week and I would recommend it to anyone who is looking to get out of the city for the day and try something new.

Excellent!!!! It's just what I was looking for!!!!. Great team, amazing location, the service and most important the experience!! The experience of sharing an asado with the polo players, Watch match and later on some polo lessons. The day finish in the pool of the estancia! I was a fantastic day

So much fun!. Had an amazing time at the polo day, such a different experience! Got to watch a game and then give it a go myself. Felt safe the whole time. Lots of yummy food and wine. Great way to spend the day.

Great day in Argentina. We highly recommend this activity. As not very experienced riders we were a bit afraid of risks connected to this sport however completely unnecessary. Horses are extremely well trained and staff very helpful. We had really good time, red wine and asado were excellent as well.

Great first Polo experience - Beautiful day outside the bustling city!. As we live in the city, we wanted a different experience in the outskirts of BA. The staff was always kind and at your service. Food was a great "asado" (barbecue), better than many of the top "parrillas" in BA.My kids also rode horses, always taken care by the staff.It was my first Polo match. I had never played before and was a bit anxious but had great fun.All is well taken care of, the day came to an end faster than we had expected.Highly recommended for those in the city of BA as it is a stone throw away, for groups of family/friends.

A wonderful day despite the rain. This trip was fabulous, from pick up from our hotel to drop off back, we had a great time despite a lot of rain. Everyone is so helpful and friendly and re-assuring, especially when you're climbing up on a horse for the first time in 40 odd years. Would recommend to anyone, just remember you're never too old! Just watch out for the empanadas, they're juicy!

Polo Day on February 18, 2015 - Great Highlight on our Trip!. We had an amazing day! We were picked up at our hotel almost to the second that they had promised, and an easy and fun ride to the "ranch." Wow - a great spread from the time we got there until the time we left. We were greeted to a wonderful room with comfortable couches and wine and a snack. From there we left for the playing field to practice our shots with the "mallet", watched a real game. Had an amazing lunch and wine and more wine. Geared up and we were on the horses and practicing. Then the game with our 4 players with the help of 2 of their best players - one on each side. Soo much fun!Lots of laughs and screams. To finish our day a late day glass of enjoyable wine and snack. We all loved the day! A pleasant drive back to the city - Perfect Day!

Everything you'd want from a day out of the city. This day was unexpectedly a highlight of my trip in Argentina. It is really well organised but casual at the same time. The whole day was well paced. A great mix of being entertained and interactive as well. We arrived and were handed a glass of wine and a delicious Empanada (vego option) on arrival. The flow of drinks was maintained throughout the day, including providing water at the right moments (I never once had to ask for something because they were so on top of the drinks situation!). The BBQ was delicious. I am vegetarian and the team did a fab job at catering. We got to watch a game, play with the equipment and learn the basics in between the quarters, meet the team, get up close to the horses, then ride the horses AND actually play a game of polo. So cool. I am a little scared of riding horses but these are so well trained and the staff are so helpful and attentive that after awhile i didn't even think about riding - i was just doing it!! Everyone was really friendly and knowledgeable but engaging as well. I learnt a lot but was always having fun. Honestly I never thought i would enjoy this as much as i did! A super unique experience and would HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Love love loved this day! Thank you :) :)
Unique experience and lots of fun. Great food, great people and a totally unique full day experience . I would totally recommend this .

Wine, food, fun & informative!. This is a fun way to spend a day in Buenos Aires and actually learn something about polo. It is very well organized from beginning to end. People who don't ride horses or are afraid of them need not to worry. The horses are extremely well trained and I don't think you could fall off even if you tried! Great to learn a little about the sport of polo (like golf, the rule book is extremely thick), watch it be played and then try to play it yourself (albeit, at a much slower pace)! Good food & good wine is served. Do the full day...the very best part of the day is when you get to play the game yourself...so much fun! The only minor drawback for us was that our driver & host for the day was texting in the car while he was driving us back to our hotel....not a good thing to do & made all of us in the car feel a bit unsafe.

Super informative and super fun!. This was my best day in a two week stay in Argentina. Very well organized and well run--with enthusiastic instructors and lots of great people to help our group learn the sport and play in a match. This is a small club of 12 members with a wonderful facility only about 45 minutes drive from Buenos Aires--and they pick you up! In fact, my driver was a member of the club and a great instructor himself. They believe polo is for everyone and they prove it. Oh, and the lunch was fantastic--traditional grilled meats and vegetables--and of course, lots of red wine. Yes, you can drink wine and play polo at the same time. Don't miss Argentina Polo Day.

Best day tour away from the big city!. This day is an absolute MUST! We arrived at the ranch to be greeted by friendly staff, a glass of wine & a brief introduction of Polo! You then get to witness a full game of Polo played by professional riders and in between each quarter enjoy some fun games/interaction. The sport is absolutely impressive to me so was very enjoyable to learn about the game & actually know how intense,hard & physical it is for both the riders and the horses! We then ate a beautiful BBQ lunch with homemade lemonade, more wine & fresh fruit! Vegetarian option is also delicious! After lunch we each got on our own horse all geared up for a practice & then our very own match! The horses are so well trained & although i found it quite difficult to coordinate everything it was the best fun! After the game we enjoyed some sangria and a swim in the pool with time to relax & chat!  This day was so well organised & the staff were exceptional! I can highly recommend this day out for anyone of all ages! I not only learnt a lot, I met some great people & thoroughly enjoyed some time outdoors and would do it all over again! It was certainly a nice change to the city & one of my favourite day tours so far in my travels!

Unique, Fun, Hassle Free. Easy day out of the city.There was only a small group of 5 of us for the whole day, and we were very well looked after. 30 - 45 minute drive out of city, gorgeous ranch. Greeted with delicious Argentinian wine and food all day (yes, drinking before riding!). Provided with education about the game, had fun learning skills, watching a match, and then playing. Horses were lovey, however I prefer to look at them rather then ride them, however they were pretty slow and safe and I really have an appreciation of the skill and effort of both horse and rider.The hosts took some photographs of the day, unfortunately it appears a majority of them did not make it to the facebook site or email to us like they said they would. Perhaps they can provide everyone with a USB of the photos at the end of the day (cheap costs which goes a long way).Would definitely recommend this day tour to anyone interested in having a true Argentinian BBQ and learning about the game of Polo.Good value for money and smiles all day!

Wonderful intro to polo... And a nice break from urban B.A.. We loved our 1/2 day experience. Personal pick up from our hotel right on time. 45 minute drive to a world away from downtown Buenos Aires.. It was amazing how quickly we could be in the countryside. We started with a glass of wine and an empanadas. Ten of us watched an exhibition game of four " quarters" which is half the length of a championship game. In between quarters (checkers) we learned about the mallet,practiced striking the ball and aiming at a target, and practice passing. All on firm ground. The people in the full day program actually rode horses later. We learned a lot and will definitely do the full day if we return to Buenos Aires.

Incredible Day Trip. I had an amazing experience with this company from beginning to end. We were greeted with wine and empanadas upon our arrival, had lots of fun watching the game, had a great BBQ, and way too much fun learning and playing the game. They were very accommodating knowing I had lots of experience with horses, but also very accommodating to the beginners. Super trip!
Lovely day!. This experience was great! Lovely wine, lovely staff, really nice!Only the BBQ was a bit disappointing. Not enough salad/vegetables for me.

Polo, asado, wine and empanadas. What else can you ask for?. Bus was on time. The place is beautiful. The food was amazing. We had a great time. Highly recommend this.Best thing were the empanadas, I have to say.

Great day. We had a great time on Argentina Polo Day and highly recommend it! The food was fantastic, and the place itself was beautiful too. We really enjoyed watching the game. My only warning is that if you are an experienced rider, you will find the horses to be quite dead-sided, slow, and un-spirited, but they are SAFE.

Fantastic day!!. The highlight of my trip to Argentina. Extremely well organised, Celia who did my booking was super helpful. We were a small group of five on the day I went and were so well looked after. Was picked up by Paolo who spent the day with us explaining the art of polo and was a great host. Delicious food and wine and the ponies were really well behaved and obviously well looked after. After spending time riding the horses and playing polo we got to relax by the pool before returning to buenos aires. Really can't recommend this excursion enough!! You will have such a memorable day, truly fantastic :)

Great service, but the weather is key.. Good day. They picked us up on time and took us to their ranch. Greeted us with wine and empanadas. Watched some polo with plenty of wine and water. Amazing Argentinian BBQ. Then they let us get on the horses to try to play polo. Could have been fun but it was 80-90 degrees so we were just dripping with sweat. Then relaxed with more wine and the pool and were home by 7pm. Plusses: great service, good food, plenty of wine. Downsides: weather dependent, I think they day is worth closer to $125 than $175.

Excellent Experience. We had a great polo experience on the day of event, which has been described again and again in other comments here. But I'd like to clap for their great customer service, even before & after the event day!I arrived in BA and emailed Celia (who is in charge of sales and customer service), saying I'm unsure if I was going for the Polo Day. She replied my email very quickly and kept a place for me until one day before the event. After the event, the photographer's camera was broken and all photos were lost. Celia sent sincere apology emails to all customers, and asked if any customers took photos and would like to share with us. Finally, one customer replied Celia with his own photos, after which Celia forwarded the photos to all of us!I really recommend this activity and company to you! You will definitely enjoy it, I believe.

Best. Day. Ever!. Being on a Contiki tour, you could say I wasn't in the best state that morning (copious drinking and very little sleep the night before). However, with a half hour sleep on the bus ride, the sun shining and Pablo pouring us amazing malbec red wine, I was in for a great day. Empanadas and wine while we were coached on polo 101. Wine while watching a few chukkas (polo periods) between Chilean families and teachers. Wine with an amazing lunch (I think I fell in love with malbec!). And finally, getting to ride the horses and having a huge game of polo between everyone! Now I've only briefly rode horses twice before this. I've got to say, these horses appeared happy and proud, were well groomed and super responsive to ride! I haven't ridden a supercar before but it felt like I was in a Ferrari. It was great talking to the horse, thanking him for letting me ride him (I'm ~90kg) and working as a team to get to that little ball and getting some good hits in!All up, it was a great day learning a lot about polo, and Pablo had a great sense of humour and was an excellent host. It was a group of about 14 of us and we were all very well looked after! Thank you Argentine Polo Day :)

Fantastic Experience- Well Worth It. I went with a group of 15 people. We had a blast and thought the experience was well worth it. They did a great job of taking care of us and giving an experience we will never forget. Ask to ride Diablo while you are there. She was the best horse during our game :)

Fun polo day. If you want to experience some true Argentinian polo culture, this is your trip. We spent the whole day at this amazing estate, with great food, lots of wine and introduction course to polo. Our favourite part of the day was when we got to try it our selves and go in the pool after. Our polo guide was amazing and fun, and including. I would definitely recommend this to people that want to see something else from Buenos Aires.

pricey but fantastic experience. The polo experience is right at the limit for being "worth it for the money" but, given that I'm a poor student and hate paying $6 for a beer, that's a pretty solid compliment. It's definitely a unique event that is worth being the big splurge of your Buenos Aires trip and the staff doing a fantastic job of teaching and supporting you. The unlimited red wine was a little unnecessary in the heat of the sun (cold lemonade or mango juice would have been more appreciated) but it was so cool to see experts play the game and then get your own shot. They do a great job of progressively bringing you up from hitting the ball to touching a horse to hitting the ball on an ambling horse to the real high-paced game. And the grilled meat and relaxing in the pool afterwards is soooo nice!

Contiki Jan 2015 Polo Day. Such an amazing day! Great food and wine. It was truely a once in a life time experience.The guides were really passionate and loved to help you out. The food and wine never stopped coming, and everyone got a fair go on the horses. It was nice a relaxing to hang around the pool for a couple of hours too.

Polo Day. It was a great day. The staff made kept it fun and funny. I would recommend it for people visiting form BA or as part of a trip into the "campo" as we did. One of us couldn't participate in the on horse polo class, so the staff made her afternoon lounging by the pool very enjoyable too. The three of us were a little late (no problem) and joined a group of six. It was the perfect number for the "game" we played at the end of the day and still small enough that we felt that we had personalized attention. The only problem: we had to get back to BA for something and had to rush out. Don't do what we do...take your time and enjoy it.

Play the sport of royalty. When I told my friends that I was going to play polo, they couldn't believe it. It's true! Even without any experience riding a horse, Argentine Polo Day will teach you to play polo.I had an awesome experience with Argentina Polo Day from beginning to end. Beginning months in advance, I contacted Celia from Argentina Polo Day, who was very friendly and helpful with making my reservation. Even though I was traveling by myself, Celia was able to accommodate me. Even when heavy rain washed out the polo grounds, Celia was quick to contact me about rescheduling. And even though I had to fly out of Argentina the same day, Celia made arrangements to have me taken directly to the airport.The Polo Day itself was a ton of fun. It was a beautiful day out in the countryside. The rules and terminology of polo were explained to me as I drank wine. I got to watch a live polo match, while sitting in the shade. Then we were treated to a delicious asado.Finally, once our bellies were full, we put on our gear, mounted our horses, and really did play polo. Of course, our game didn't look exactly the same as the one played by the professionals. Our game looked like it was played in slow-mo. LOL. But it was still a lot of fun.Pablo was a great host. He was very enthusiastic, encouraging, and gracious. And his english was excellent.I highly recommend Argentina Polo Day.

A must do BA!. Everyone should do this!!Its so fun and the staff were amazing (Cheers Pablo!). The best part was that you actually get to ride their own trained horses that were very responsive and it made it that much more enjoyable to learn and play polo.After polo you get to enjoy a really good bbq with the polo players and swim in the pool. Oh and also free wine all day :)

Lovely Day on the Polo Grounds. This is a great trip and something we would highly recommend for people visiting Buenos Aires. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, the wine and especially learning about, watching and actually playing polo. Everyone in our group was a lot of fun and our guide was knowledgeable and entertaining. This is a wonderful way to get out of the city and enjoy a beautiful day in the countryside with horses and lovely scenery. All in all, we thought this was a very good day trip and feel it would be appropriate for travelers of all ages.

Polo Day. Our polo day trip was definitely a highlight of visiting Buenos Aires. The entire experience was really fun and included round trip transportation from our hotel. My daughter and I were in a small group with two other visitors both of whom were really fun to meet. Our hosts at the ranch were attentive, gracious and very friendly. The ranch and the grounds were very nicely maintained and the food was delicious. The wood-fired empenadas and wine upon arrival were delicious. We then got to watch an exciting polo match followed by a lovely lunch and then the opportunity to play polo ourselves. The whole experience was well worth it. Thank you to all the staff.

All-round excellent experience. A great day learning/watching/playing Polo. The wood-fired empenadas are outstanding and the family service is beautiful. Thanks for the wonderful experience! I cannot recommend this enough!

Fantastic Day!. The Polo Day was an amazing day! They picked us up and drove us back to our hotel so we didn't need to worry about transportation. When we arrived at the beautiful location, we were greeted with delicious empanada's and wine. We sat in the shade while Polo was explained to us and we watched a match (with constant top-ups of empanada's and wine). We had an amazing bbq lunch and then got to play a match ourselves. The staff was wonderful. So friendly. They took photos of the entire day for us so we could enjoy the moments. I could not recommend this more highly. A fantastic day!

Awesome time at Argentina Polo Day. Celia was amazing to interact with when planning. Bit pricey, but well worth it.. See above for my thoughts on the experience.Awesome time at Argentina Polo Day. Celia was amazing to interact with during planning for the trip.

The best day trip you can have. My friend and I have been to 40 countries and have done day trips in every one.This by far is the one if not the best day trip We have ever done.They can not do anything better from the people working here who make you feel welcome to the instructions of marcel and his patience. it is a relaxing competitive (if you want:) refreshing day.The wine flows the meat is delicious the polo is so fun and after all that there is a pool to swim in.You can do this trip over and over an have a unique experience each time. The people who work here make playing polo not intimitading at all and they make you feel like family.Thank you Argentina polo day

Very fun day away from the city!. Argentina Polo Day was my favorite part of our trip to Argentina and I highly recommend this awesome experience! My fiance were looking for a day trip outside of the city and we were so impressed when we arrived at a beautiful ranch less than an hour away. We were immediately greeted with wine and delicious empanadas. We watched a polo game (so cool!) while learning about the history of the sport and practicing our swings. After a wonderful asado (BBQ) with the polo players, we got to try for ourselves. I was shocked at how quickly everyone in our group got the hang of it, and we had a wonderful time playing a mini game for ourselves. We ended the day with a dip in the pool before being driven back to the city. We were sad to leave after having such a great day!

Polo was great. Pablo did an excellent job with communicating everything associated with polo. Food was great, owner was a politician and helped us understand how Polo fit into Argentina. Our kids loved the actual polo match that they participated in. Wine poured the whole time, which certainly helped with the festivities. We would do it again.
FUN. WELL WORTH IT. had a lot of fun, everyone who puts on Polo Day was kind and made it a great experienace.

Wonderful experience. Our family spent new years day with Polo Day and had an amazing experience. This was a highlight of a two week trip in Argentina and exceeded our expectations. We would highly recommend this experience to adults and families with children. We had kids ranging in age from 9 - 14 and they all were able to participate in the polo. It was a once in a lifetime experience for all of us! The guides were fantastic and the food was delicious. A wonderful, unique way to spend a day in Argentina/BA.
Fun!. What an amazing experience, thanks to Pablo and his family we had an absolutely smashing day! Such a magical setting, great food and plenty of fun!!

Highlight of our trip. What a unique, fun and unforgettable experience! Our day far exceeded my expectations. The food was exceptional, the wine was delicious and ever-flowing, our guides were fun and professional and the polo was a blast. As I look back on my two-week trip throughout South America, it's this day I remember most. Muchas gracias to Pablo and the rest of the team. Highly recommended for gringos and non-gringos alike and for all levels of riding experience!

Most fun day we had in Argentina. Pablo, our host, was incredible - very nice, professional, funny, and knowledgeable. We had a great day meeting professional polo players, watching a match, learning about the sport, riding the beautiful horses and playing a match. Not to mention a hearty and delicious meal and a very welcome pool after 45 minutes of riding in the hot sun. Other guests were fun and friendly. Not only is this something I'd recommend to others, but I will do it again in a heartbeat when we return to BA.

What A Great Day!. It was pouring right up to the time we pulled up to the fields. The staff had poncho's for everyone to wear! Thank goodness we didn't end up needing them as prayers were answered as the clouds parted and the sun came out. To start us off it was endless empanada's, sausage sandwiches and red wind! Followed by a very through introduction to the game and it's rules.Due to the rain the players played on a smaller field for the safety of the horses and preservation of the fields. Still great to watch!When we signed up for this with agent we were told we'd be able to actually PLAY polo. I was highly suspect of this and didn't really think they would let us play. We got to play on foot with short mallets and I told everyone in our group....well there you have it....that was us playing....No so! They took our entire group of 20 plus and we mounted horses and got to play polo! And play we did for at least 30 minutes of real live competitive polo!Following the polo match was another feast served asado style with several different kinds of beef and sausage and more wonderful red wine!All in all is was truly a unique experience and one not soon to be forgotten!!!

One of my favorite days!. Amazing experience - would highly suggest for anyone. Great fun day for friends, or family!Time cut a bit short due to others having to get back which was too bad. Would have loved more time at the pool!AMAZING food

One of the highlights of our trip!!. This was a day we will never forget!!! Had low expectations but were so pleasantly surprised. Celia emailed us promptly having heard from a friend that we were interested in the polo day. Each time we emailed her, we received a reply within an hour or so, We were collected on time on the day and driven about an hour away to our location. Pablo was a fantastic host and was generous with wine all day and gave us great polo tuition. We watched a game and then they put on a really great lunch for us!! We met some great fellow travellers. Playing polo was something neither I nor my boyfriend had done before but the adrenalin soon kicked in and we had a fantastic time. All the staff were so friendly and so helpful. An excellent day out...well worth the cost. A day to remember......

Our favorite day in Buenos Aires. Everything was fantastic from the prompt and easy hotel pickup to the friendliest, most genuine staff I could imagine - it seemed like everyone really loved their jobs. The BBQ was one of the best meals we had the whole time in BA, and they kept coming out with delicious snacks like empanadas and wood fired pizzas, and the lemonade was the most delicious I've ever had in my life - I don't know what they put in it but I'd love the recipe! The instruction on the horses was really great, and they take excellent care of the polo ponies. I was worried about that because it was very hot and I grew up riding horses and know how dangerous that can be, but the grooms made sure to cool the horses off, get them water but not too much or too soon, etc. All the horses we rode (different horses, and at much lower speeds of course than those we saw the polo club play on) were fantastically well-trained and sweet. We played a game and each team had two ringers (polo club members) on our teams that couldn't score but helped move the game forward, making it a lot more fun than if it were just us newbies. Perfect for couples, a group of friends, or even a family with older children. Overall I couldn't be happier with my experience! Next time I'm in Buenos Aires, I'll be going back!
A pleasant surprise. What an amazing family day out. I would recommend this to anyone. A full day even with fun, learning about polo, riding, BBQ......

Unexpectly unbelievable experince. I never thought I'd every get an opportunity to play polo but what a day! Just the hospitality at the ranch was next to nothing else I experienced in Argentina. The polo playing was such an exciting experience to watch and learn about on top of it all, the food was exceptional and the tutorials were as entertaining as they were educational! Pablo and Sebastian created a great atmosphere, and we were all quite eager to improve our skills and become competitive with one another.Thanks so much for everything!

Fantastisch riding experience. Great full day experience. Puck up from the hotel. Start with a glass of red wine and a snack. See a Polo game and practice yourself in between the checkers. After the barbecue you ride and play a polo game yourself. Big fun! Then swim in the pool to cool down before you are brought back to your hotel.

amazing day...we talk to everyone about that fantastic day in the pampas!. we have been welcomed in this beautiful small polo club with empanadas and red wine, the guy who facilitated the day was really great and encouraging all of us to start playing golf after teaching us the basics in a fun way. we had great asado, I took a nap on the open air...Horses were really well behaved, nicely kept and gauchos who accompanied us really freindly and understanding.. You must go!

Pablo Was A Great Host. Argentina Polo Day is an absolute must. Pablo was a great host and holy $%!% my horse was FAST!!!! Great food for lunch and tons of wine. The van pick up was perfectly on time (the van driver even gave us his card for a graffiti tour of the city after which was cool!) .... I know Pablo said most reviews talk about the dog, but the dog was awesome! DO IT! Its awesome

fantastic experience!. We went as a family, and had a a fantastic day at the ranch, first watching a polo game and then being treated to a super BBQ! The afternoon was a fab experience, learning how to play polo and then actually playing a game, which is such fun!!!Don't hesitate to book a day at the ranch! The staff are great fun and so kind!

Full day of fun. Awesome day, they picked us up in the morning and after an hour drive we were at the ranch. We were given empanadas and wine nonstop that were both great, and then watched a polo match after being taught the rules. We then ate a ton of meat, everything was authentic Argentina food and we got really full. We then actually played a game! I was pretty bad but it was fun nevertheless. We also got some time to ride the horses freely on the fields. Hope that summarizes everything, it was a full day, we got back around 7:30 PM

Mostly great!. This is definitely something you should try out - even if you have never ridden a horse before (I hadn't). If you can afford the reasonable fee, then go; it's polo after all! Most of us will never have a chance to actually play, so this is a worthwhile excursion.There were only 2 bad things:1. The van was late by 45 minutes or so. They did extend our day, however, and we definitely got our moneys worth. It was just annoying. I believe they said they were using a new driver, and would likely not use him again. They also apologized for our delay, which was nice.2. They took photos of us with their company camera, so we refrained from taking a bunch of phoos on our own phones/cameras. However, there was a problem and most of our photos were not published on their FaceBook page. It was quite disappointing. I really wish I had a photo of myself on the horse with my gear on. Part of the fun of playing polo is, of course, showing your friends your kick @ss pictures!! I suggest taking your own photos as back up, especially a photo with yourself on the horse. This was an unintentional mishap, but still disappointing :(** TIP: Bring US Dollars, or pay in US Dollars through pay pal. It is cheaper than converting to Argentine pesos and paying in the local currency!Cheers, Nick

Fantastic Experience--Highlight of our Trip. I visited Argentina Polo Day with three friends, and it was easily one of the best things we did while visiting Argentina. After being picked up at our AirBnB in Buenos Aires, we were driven to a beautiful ranch outside of the city. We were immediately offered incredible empanadas (make sure to try the corn one) and all the wine we wanted. After settling in, we spent about two hours watching an exhibition polo match, learning the rules of the game, and practicing our skills (on the ground). Next was lunch--a feast of steak, ribs, grilled vegetables, and a fruit dessert that left everyone thoroughly happy. After lunch we were outfitted in our polo gear and spent the next two hours or so learning how to ride the horses and trotting around the polo field. Amazing. To conclude the day, we all took a dip in the pool (and were offered pizza and more drinks).Not only was the setting truly incredible, but the service was fantastic. Throughout the entire day, the staff took extra care to make sure that everyone had enough to eat and drink. It was also really interesting learning about polo and the horses. I'd recommend this to anyone visiting BA...you won't regret it.

Don't miss this one!. I did the full day program while on my Christmas/New Years vacation, traveling alone. There were some other single travelers, some families, a group of college kids, and a few couples - from all around the world. Hotel pick up was on time but unfortunately, there was a demonstration that had traffic snarled for about an hour so we spent a long time getting to the club. But once we were there, what a wonder day we had! Some wine and empanadas greeted us, along with our hosts. We mingled for a while and then were treated to a "lesson" on the rules of polo and the equipment, along with a Q&A of anything we wanted to know about the game. Then off to the polo field to watch a four chukker game, played my members of the club. This was followed by an asado and then we received our equipment for our turn on the ponies! We attempted to play a game but mostly just had fun! All the activities on our program were conducted in English (as we all had that language in common). After a full day, we were returned to our hotels. It was a beautiful, interesting, relaxing, and fun day. If you have the time (I spent a full week in Buenos Aires) I say don't miss this one!

Absolutely amazing. I went with my mum and husband and had the most amazing experience. The van was on time, food was plenty and delicious. As i am vegetarian i thought i would not have the same experience as barbecue lovers but i was so wrong! My corn empanadas and lunch were so good. Staff is so sympathetic and caring ( especially with mum who did not take part of the actual polo). Oh and of course all with a huge amount of wine and fresh drinks all the time. It could not be better. Thank you for the lovely experience!

Most Fun I Had in Argentina!!. This was an amazing adventure. It takes a while to get there (longer than I was expecting - more than an hour), but our driver was very nice and shared a lot of info with us. Once you arrive there are delicious empenadas and a glass of wine waiting for you. So amazing. Then you get a little background on the sport of Polo and then you head over to the other side of the beautiful estate to watch some Polo. After you watch the game, you head back and enjoy a really good, traditional Argentine lunch. Frankly, I could have just eaten more of the empenadas instead. After lunch you head back over and learn how to play polo. It is so much fun. I had a bad experience with a horse early in my life - but these were all amazingly well trained and really know how to play polo, so you don't have to do much. Definitely the most fun I had while I was staying in Argentina!

Amazing day - one of the best things we did in Argentina. My husband and I did the Argentina Polo Day excursion and absolutely loved it. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip and a "can't miss" experience. I really wanted to give it five stars -- the experience was amazing. I had to move down to four because although it was a truly fantastic experience, the ride there and back to the city were really uncomfortable. It is more like 1.5 hours (not 45 min) from Buenos Aires, which is fine, except there were four of us crammed in the small south american cars. I was literally unable to sit back in my seat because of the space issue in the back seat. The entire rest of the experience was a luxury, delicious empanadas and wine, an incredible lesson on a horse, and great BBQ -- but being so uncomfortable at the end of such an awesome day made me take it down to four stars. I would DEFINITELY recommend this to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Great time. I visited in October to watch a polo game and was treated to great, attentive service and a chance to ride and play some stick and ball. The horses, staff, and place were great. I would definitely visit again for a polo clinic!!!

Epic Adventure!!!!!!. This is a great way to spend a day!!!!! Starts off with tasty empanadas and wine and an over view of the sport then a chance to watch the pros play a game! Then they stuff you with delicious Argentinian BBQ! Then the fun really starts with a lesson and a game with you up on the horse! It was so much fun the staff are amazing and super nice!!! The food the place and the people and of course the horses make it an awesome experience! Nice way to get out of the city and enjoy some fresh air! A must do if you are in BA!
Superb day. Such amazing and welcoming people! We had the best day filled with good food as well! Loved the polo day :)

What a fabulous way to spend a day!. This is the best thing we have done in Buenos Aires. We took the full day tour which started with a pick up outside our hotel. Once there we were provided with cool drinks, seating under the trees, wonderful food and a spectacular polo game to watch. The grounds were beautiful. After the game we had a BBQ lunch with local wine and those who wanted to could participate in a short game of polo. Most people did even those who had not ridden before. We did not play polo but sat by the pool watching the game - lots of laughter coming from the field. The staff were very pleasant. I highly recommend this tour.

Superb Day!. Most people don't get many chances to experience polo, let alone play, and Argentina is totally the place to do it. This is a full day. You'll be collected at your hotel and driven to the polo club (the club is a good hour's drive from BA) enjoy good food, free-flowing wine (and water - we were there on a very hot day), enjoy explanations of the game, watch a game and after a relaxed bbq... get to play! We had plenty of time to practice, felt very safe on well-behaved horses - and it's incredible fun!!!!

Great day!. Fantastic thing to do, would recommend it to everyone who likes socializing and would like to see the countryside. The guides paper you with amazing food, cold drinks and you'll be well catered for.Such a lovely ranch about an hours drive from central BA. The actual polo game consisted of 30 minutes "learning" and a 30 minute game. The horses seemed well taken care of. If you have experience from riding it might be a good idea to tell the guide so you can get a quicker horse. There is a pool so bring swimming gear and jeans+sneakers for the ride. Have fun :)

Very Well Run & Enjoyable. They do an excellent job, truly: from pick-up to drop-off their hospitality is amazing and they've designed a great itinerary for the delay where you're never bored, hungry, to burdened. Our teacher Paulo was also wonderful-- great energy and a lot of fun.

This is an awesome Experience . Don't be put off by the price, this is totally worth the 1800 pesos... Learn and play polo (probably once in a lifetime opportunity) and the BBQ will be the best you'll ever have. Oh yea and watch out for Mr Dog... The coolest dog in Argentina... High on steak and red wine

Superb hospitality, great experience. I agreed to do this at the request of a friend but ended up having the best time. It is about one hour drive from the Recoleta district of Buenos Aires. They provided transportation and greeted us upon arrival with wine and empanadas. The host - Pablo - and staff were incredibly nice and accommodating. Also attending the same day was a couple with little kids and two elderly women. The staff completely accommodated everyone. The day includes a polo overview, sample match, excellent lunch, and then you get a chance to play. My plan was to ride on the outskirts of the game but my horse, Oscar, had different ideas and convinced me to get in the middle of the game. It was really fun and was my favorite Buenos Aires experience.

Absolutely awesome day . We had sooo much fun doing argentina polo day. My teenager rode. My two younger kids were walked around on the horse. Dad and mom competed really playing polo. So much fun for the family. Great experience and highly recommended.
A Perfect Day!. A wonderful window into Argentinian culture in a georgeous setting. The staff are so well organized and welcoming, making the entire experience relaxing and fun.

Argentina Polo Day. During my trip to Buenos Aires and Mendoza this was by far my favorite experience! The people that host you for the day are extremely fun and entertaining. Pablo, Ruben, and the rest of the squad are welcoming and wonderful people to be around. There wasn't a moment during the day that I wasn't smiling and having the time of my life. I highly suggest doing this if you are ever staying in Buenos Aires. You won't regret it!!

Highly Recommended Experience!. Argentina Polo Day is a great day out and a must-do if you have time while in Buenos Aires. We did the full day experience. It was nice to get out into the country and every aspect of the day was above expectations. The staff are wonderfully hospitable. They make you feel like they are welcoming you into their home, not a "tour". Their passion and enthusiasm for one of Argentina's favorite sports is genuine and infectious. The day starts with welcome wine and introductions, and a tour of the house. It is followed by an overview of the game of polo, the rules, riders and horses. We were then taken to the polo field to watch a live match. Amazing! Fast paced, exhilarating and exciting to watch, it was a great display of the power and skill of the horses and riders alike. In between chukkas, we were taught and practiced on foot the basic skills required to use the mallets and hit balls around the field. Lessons and the match were followed by a fantastic Argentinian barbecue. Great wine and so much great food! Again, this felt like lunch with friends rather than part of a day trip. After lunch, we were introduced to the grooms and taught how to ride a polo pony. Most of our group did not know how to ride but that was no obstacle. The staff's instructions were so simple and easy to apply that within minutes everyone was riding their horse around the field, chasing and hitting the ball. A few more minutes later and the competitive spirit began to show through and a 'real' (albeit slow-motion!) match was in progress. Booking this day was easy and efficient. Cecilia was very responsive and helpful. We arranged to be picked up from the hotel and the driver was courteous and on time. Throughout the day, the staff took photos so that we did not have to worry about multi-tasking photography with polo skills. The digital photos were shared with us at no extra cost. Note that there is a no-obligation request to leave a tip for the grooms, so bring some cash. They work hard to make the day successful so deserve it but we had not known this request would be made so we came unprepared. In summary, my husband does not ride and was not thrilled with the idea of a day with horses. He was reluctant to even join me and yet only a short while into the day, he was captivated, asking questions and enjoying himself. So much so, that he described this day as the best part of our trip to Buenos Aires. I couldn't agree with him more!

Once-in-a-lifetime experience. I was a bit skeptical going into our day of polo because I didn't know anything at all about polo. Argentina Polo Day blew my expectations way out of the water. The second we arrived, we were greeted with wine (made at their own winery in Mendoza) and the best empanadas I had in Argentina. Later, we had a traditional Argentine asado with even more delicious food.But this is Argentina Polo Day, not Argentina Eating Day, and the polo was fantastic. Paolo taught us the rules of the game, and then we headed over to the field to watch a match. I felt like Kate Middleton, watching polo while drinking wine. The whole experience was very hands-on, and I learned a lot. Paolo explained things as they happened on the field, and we got to practice our own skills between gameplay. We even got to visit with the horses and feed them some alfalfa.I could not recommend Argentina Polo Day more highly. It was a fantastic experience, and everyone who visits BA should try it.

Best Unique Experience. The Argentina Polo Day was amazing for several reasons:1. It is a nice change of pace from the city when visiting Buenos Aires. It's a great city with a lot to do, but there is something very nice about a drive into the country to enjoy some fresh air.2. The experience is very well organized. I expected to learn about polo and maybe see some gameplay. The program is well run; there is introduction to the rules, then you head to the field to watch a match. Between sides, you get to visit with the horses and you spend some time playing training games to get a feel for the equipment. There was never a moment that felt awkward, unprepared, or unprofessional.3. The family also owns a winery in Mendoza. Part of your afternoon is spent drinking great wine while you watch. Sipping vino tinto in the sun and watching polo felt very posh.4. The food is amazing. When we got there, delicious empanadas were ready and waiting. The team cooked a traditional Argentine asado with entirely too much food, wine, and good conversation.We just finished a 2 week tour of Buenos Aires, Mendoza, and Santiago. Argentina Polo Day was the highlight of our trip.

Best Experience out of Buenos Aires. Our group explored Buenos Aires, travelled to Mendoza, visited wineries, and dined like kings. Of everything we did, polo day was by far our favorite experience. Pablo, Ruben, and team were extremely warm and inviting, and playing polo was merely an added bonus on top of spending a day at the polo club. Pablo accommodated all of our requests and did everything to ensure that we had the best time possible. We were served tons of wine and cooked a delicious meal on an outdoor BBQ. Their expert polo instruction (amateur polo players played along side us) helped us achieve great results, athough we were terrible to begin with. Even though this polo experience is more expensive than other options, it was worth every penny. I highly recommend blocking off a day while in Buenos Aires to make sure you do not miss out on this memorable experience!

Wonderful Experience. Big thanks to your entire staff for making our day a special memory. We all loved the hospitality and especially spending time with "Mr. Dog" and the puppies. Argentina Polo Day is Highly recommended!
Awesome Experience. Can't miss activity in Buenos Aires. The staff was exceptional and made the day so much fun. A true highlight of my trip.

Mr. Dog and friends. What can I say, there is a reason this attraction gets the rating it does. Pablo, Juan, Manual, Mr.Fazzari, Celia and everyone of the staff were complete professionals. They were warm and informative...made the whole experience a blast. Bringing the family next year for sure!Eduardo

Great day, great people, great food!. My girlfriend and I had a great day at the Polo ranch. The day started off with delicious empanada snack and wine, and a basic explanation of Polo. After the the snacks and explanation, we all went over to the Polo field to watch real Polo players play a match. The match was fun to watch while Pablo explained different aspects of the game to us. During the match we relaxed by drinking more wine and water, while also practicing with mini-mallets during intermissions of the game. After the game we had lunch with the group including some of the players and staff. The lunch was delicious and the conversation friendly and interesting. I really enjoyed the chorizo sausage and grilled vegetables. After lunch, we suited up and played a fun, friendly match of polo. I have zero horse riding experience and I found it very easy because Pablo explained very well how to ride the horse and the horses are well trained. If you listen to what Pablo says, then apply it to the horse, anyone can ride and play. I recommend bringing a pair of pants and shoes/boots to ride, and shorts and flips flops for relaxing. I highly recommend this tour. I had one of the best experiences ever!

Amazing day in the countryside!. We did the full polo day and had the best day!! The game is first explained well and then we watched a game played before jumping on ourselves and having a go. We are very novice riders but felt confident and had a ball by the end! The horses are well taken care of which was important to me. The grounds are spectacular and a serious breath of fresh air from the busy BA city. The staff are all professional, helpful and lots of fun. Incredible yummy and fresh Argentinian BBQ for lunch with fabulous unlimited Malbec. And last but certainly not least - the Empanadas are the best we had in all of Argentina! Thank you for a great day and fun lasting memories!!

Incredible experience. This is a great value for an incredible experience. The staff are friendly, courteous, generous and fun. They feed you all the empanadas you want (which are amazing) and wine. The meal they prepared was fantastic. Do not worry if you´ve never rode a horse or about your age. They teach you and are very patient. This company really has it figured out and are very organized. The house and land is beautiful and they are working on making it even better everyday. I highly recommend this.

This place is awesome.. Must do event for people that like a little adventure. The service is personable , friendly and generous. The empanadas are the best we had on our trip and are all you can eat. Wine is great too. The lunch they made was great as well. Don't worry if you have never rode a horse. They make you feel comfortable and teach you. A great value.

I had an amazing day!!. I was really exciting to play polo at least once in argentina because since I'm a child I love horseriding (without any knowledge it's a bit harder bit still fun!) The whole day was really good organised, hostel pick up was on time, food was incredible!!! & really nice people and we'll trained horses. Would definitely do it again and recommend it to everyone! (:For families: in our group was a family with 2 small children and all the people in the club cared so much for them - so even with small kids I can recommend it!

Argentina polo day Nov 9th. Hello everyone, I'm from Costa Rica and i was visiting buenos aires 2 weeks ago. I have a good friend telling me about the polo… and i can't imagine how cool and incredible experience I could have in the polo day. Total surprise and great atmosphere with great friends and the BEST HOST PABLO FAZZARI .i really enjoyed the experience and i loved it ! i can't wait for the next time, big hug and congrats for an amazing job guys ! see you soon.Caty.

Fantastic day!!. This experience was recommended to me by my cousin and I will be telling all my family & friends who visit Argentina to get involved. Fabulous day!! The team were friendly, enthusiastic and the day itself was both informative and great fun. Plenty of vino flowing and a yummy bbq lunch with a veggie option :). The polo lesson and match at the end of the day was awesome and allowed our competitive streaks to shine. This is a must do on one's visit to Buenos Aires!! Thanks Celia, Pablo, Ruben & team!!!
Amazing day out. Such a great day!Fab host Pablo, great food, fab location, caters for all ranges of horse riding experience.Highly recommend this.

A highlight of our trip in Buenos Aires!. I did this Argentinian polo day along with six other girls as part of an extra for our Contiki tour. At first I was a little hesitant due to the cost, but I can assure everyone that this experience is worth every cent! Luscious green grounds stretched the property, and the accommodating and friendly hosts set up quaint drink stations we could help ourselves to. Huan and Paulo were so friendly and always made sure we were okay and were enjoying ourselves.We watched a polo match played by professionals then were taught how to play the game and ride the beautiful horses. The food was amazing too - empanadas, succulent meats and vegetarian options...I could go on. It was so delicious I couldn't stop eating!I can't stress on how amazing this experience was. We all enjoyed it. A must do in Buenos Aires!!

An experience I will never forget. Such beautiful surroundings, the hosting was top class (as was the food) and we were all made to feel welcome to share the joy of polo. To be able to ride a horse and actually PLAY polo is an experience, I certainly will never forget.Can't rate it high enough.
A Great Polo Day. We had a great day. Great hospitality, lunch and polo match. The best part was the actual polo matched that we played.

Great experience, even with no experience on a horse.. Greart experience the people treat you like you are part of their family! Food is very good and the polo is very exiting. First I thought it was a bit expensive, but it is totally worth it!!!!

Fun from the moment you arrive!. This is not a 'touristy attraction' but rather an authentic and thoughtful experience with a beautiful family who invite you into their lovely property and friendly way of life. It was such a fun day that was made unforgettable by feeling part of the family and polo club. Pablo was entertaining in his explanation of the sport and he made it easy for us to give things a go. There was never a dull moment all day and we were completely taken care of from the start with flowing food and drinks and photographs being taken for us so we could just enjoy the moment, which I feel everyone in our group did thoroughly. I wish to return again one day, and I sincerely hope anyone else visiting Argentina makes this day trip while you are in the country and have the chance.

Once in a lifetime experience!. Just go and do it! The whole experience from the booking, to the on time pick up from our hotel by Pablo, the day was amazing! Arriving at the polo villa, you are welcomed with a smiling Ruben, who was there all day to talk to the guests. You receive empanadas- freshly baked and wine upon arrival. Learn a bit about polo and the horses, before learning to play with the mallet, and watching a polo match. Beware it is it sunny and hot out, there is little shade while watching the match. It can get very, very hot. Water is provided though. Pablo ensured all were involved in the activities, rolling the ball for the match, feeding the horses, ringing the bell at the end of the chukker etc. Lunch is served at a large piicnic table under trees, the table was beautifully set, and the food just kept arriving, grilled meat, salads, vegetables, rice and dessert. Of course wine, beer, juice and water also provided. After a late lunch, you get your equipment on and go out to the field to get on a horse and play a game. We have never been on horses before, it was a little frightening at first, but the groomers helped us out a lot throughout. What an experience! It gives a whole new appreciation for the horses and the game and skill required. After the match, back to the villa for cold drinks, and photos.The whole day was very well organized, and there was a nice balance of activities. Amazing experience!! Where else can you play a game of polo while learning and embracing the beautiful countryside and the hospitality of everyone at the polo villa!

Polo and Much More. My wife and I were vacationing in Buenos Aires and wanted to experience this part of the Argentine spirit. We are very glad that we did!. My wife is an experienced rider; I am not a rider at all. It didn't matter at all. Celia, Pablo and Ruben embraced us into the experience, and Pablo was the teacher you were always hoping to find. We learned enough to really appreciate the sport, but in a relaxed, painless way - with great food along the way. This was a high point of our trip, and we recommend it to anyone. Even if you think that you will not be interested, you will be enthusiastic by the time the day is done.

My most favorite day outside of Buenos Aires. I will start by saying that I am not a horseback rider, yet....the day spent at 'Argentina Polo Day' was the most fun and wonderful addition to my visit to Buenos Aires.Getting away from this bustling, exciting city makes you understand and appreciate even more where you are.The warmth of the people greeting you and running this program is unsurpassed. We felt like coming into a loving family, spoiled with beautiful surroundings, fantastic food and a casual atmosphere. We left with the proud feeling of actually having played a round of Polo, and a day to remember with joy in our hearts.This should serve not only as the highest recommendation...but a MUST DO !!! when visiting BAGracias, Pablo and all who helped make this day so extraordinaryCarola and Toby

An adventure packed with memories!. Oh the things you'll learn and the fun you'll have. My heart is bursting with gratitude and love for the entire staff and all their horses. From the little girl in the kitchen rolling out dough, to the sweet and forgiving gentleman leading my horse - who I inadvertently clubbed with my mallet a couple times - I'll never forget the things I saw, felt, tasted, learned and experienced. More of an adventure than I ever could have imagined. If food and wine is what you're into - go! If a dose of history and perhaps your competitive spirit get you excited - go! If quaint country living and landscape tickle your fancy - you'll loving sipping mate and strolling the grounds. For any and very reason, make Argentine Polo Day part of your travel plans.

Fabulous Argentina Polo Day!!. Thank you Celia, Pablo, Ruben and all the staff for such an incredible day!! As I wedding planner, it was an honor bring the brides to celebrate their wedding and partake in such a fabulous activity!! Even though it was pouring rain, the staff invested all their energy on teaching everyone how to play - soaking wet! It was AWESOME!!! Thank you again and hope to see you very soon!

A fun day long introduction to polo with great food and nice people.. The experience was great, especially for someone who has no previous experience with polo. The day was a nice balance of activities and the food was great.

Outstanding experience. I can't add much to what has already been said - this is an excellent experience which we will not soon forget.The one thing that was different about our visit was that we went with a small baby - 7 months old. We were a bit wary of doing the trip and were afraid we would not be able to participate fully. All the staff were incredibly reassuring and made us and our little guy comfortable. They made him a little crib with couches and made sure he was always well-protected from the sun and the flying polo balls. They watched/held him for us so we could enjoy the excellent asado. When it was time for us to go play, they looked after him and kept him happy and safe for the whole game! I think we must have been out there on the field for at least an hour (probably more though) and our baby was happy the whole time.Obviously this trip is fantastic for solo travelers or groups, but I would add that it definitely can be done with kids or babies. It is an amazing experience and should not be missed!I will add my voice to the chorus saying that the host Pablo is top-notch - truly a world-class guy working for a world-class organization.

An exciting and informative day'. The day was great! We loved learning about polo. The wine kept on flowing. The food was great and having a go at polo was fun. The ranch is beautiful and Pablo was a great guide/teacher. Recommend to anyone.

Polo Day outside BA. Polo Day does not disappoint. We went with friends who only had one day in Buenos Aires and were initially kind of nervous about blowing that day outside the capital, but Polo Day proved the perfect way for them to experience a slice of this Argentine tradition. Pablo was a tremendous host.

Great day out of the city. The day was well organized great service, food and wine. Playing pollo for the first time is challenging but fun at the same time. Must do if you want a fun day out of the city
Best day out. Had sooooo much fun today. Pablo, Celia, Reuben et al were amazing hosts. Had a lot of fun, food and wine. Loved playing polo. Must do excursion.
The Best experience. We had a wonderful day at the argentina polo day facilities, great food, great wine, and best of all, a great polo experience.

Many great parts about this trip . What a day! First, they picked me up from my hotel, and then we drove to the estancia. It was a long drive due to traffic, but the car was comfortable and it gave the guests a good opportunity to get to know one another. We arrived at the comfortably furnished estancia and immediately were served orange juice and an empanada that was really good. We then learned about polo as we were offered more wine and snacks. The grounds were a nice change from the city. Wide open spaces, farm animals, trees and fresh air. Then we went to the polo concha to watch some of the clubs members play a match. I've never played polo nor watched it so I didn't know anything. They explained the rules and some of the finer points as we watched, which helped me understand the game. Then we went back to the estancia and had some really good barbecue. We ate with the members who had been playing, and they were eating the same food. It was good food. By far the best part was after lunch, when we mounted up on horses and got to actually play polo. What fun. And really surprising given that I had no prior experience. Where else am I going to play polo? For me it's not an easy thing to do. But I had so much fun whacking the ball around on the horse that now I might go to great lengths to find another opportunity. Tons of fun. Do it!

Truly one of the best days of our South American holiday!. How could we go to Argentina and not see Polo! Of our 4 weeks travelling around South America, this was, quite unexpectedly, one of the most enjoyable days we spent. All of the people we met were very passionate about Polo and charming hosts. The hacienda and surrounds were beautiful, the Polo match was exciting to watch and the lesson, including a chance to ride one of the horses and practice a few shots, was great fun. Then to finish the day chatting about our new experiences with our new friends over a delicious BBQ and very quaffable Malbec was just perfect (oh yes - and great empanadas!).Malcolm & Susan

Great Polo experience and upscale place. I have to say that I was really surprised by the Argentina Polo day experience.The place is fantastic and really upscale and world class accommodation. Very clean, organized and beautiful.As far as the Polo is concerned, they have plenty of good Polo horses and everything is made for you to have fun and play Polo in a fantastic atmosphere. Ruben and Celia are great and do all the best to make sure you have the best stay!Will certainly go back there as soon as I can...

It is for you!. While visiting Buenos Aires for a weekend, we decided to step out of our city dweller comfort zone and try Polo for the day. I myself am not big on horses, or any animal much larger than myself for that matter, but I was pleasantly surprised on how much we enjoyed our day!We didn't know to much about the sport, but they helped us build up some basic knowledge both visually and with activities, all while over a few bottles of wine - which really loosens the body! It all starts off on the ground learning the ropes, and towards the end of the day, you jump on a friendly horse and head for the field, culminating in a friendly game amongst the guests. As always, the Argentinian BBQ's are fantastic, so don't miss this!They take care of everything, so you only need to take yourself + company if present.

A True Argentine Experience. I could not have imagined a better way to spend my Sunday. The staff was incredibly fun. They were really helpful in every regard - refills on wine, serving food and drink for lunch and dinner, and especially in teaching you about polo and teaching you how to play polo. As a person who had never rode a horse before, I was astonished by how safe I felt and how well instructed I had been. I never fell off and was confident riding my horse, as well as in my playing polo. The super adorable and friendly dogs are a great bonus too! If you haven't already booked your Argentina Polo Day, trust me, do it right now because you will absolutely love it! I loved it so much I'm planning my next trip.

fun, different and safe. This is the third time I've visted Argentina Polo Day. The experience just keeps getting better. Not only it allows you to spend some time away from the hectic buenos aires but brings a fresher prespective into the countryside. The staff makes the experience not only fun but safe, which is big important plus for me.
Amazing!. We had the best time! This is a must do when in Buenos Aires. Pablo our guide was great! Food was amazing!

Not quite what I expected. The club is really not a club. I heard lots about things they are planning to build. But not much there now. The professional polo match really was just players at the club practicing. Imaging going to your local golf club and watching a foursome play golf. It wasn't like any professional polo match I've seen before. The BBQ was okay but not great. For the time spent getting there and back coupled with the time there. It wasn't worth it. Much better things to do in Buenos Aires.
So cool!. The experience is unique and incredible! We're treated like royalty. Everybody's nice and dynamic. I badly recommand this trip. It worths every penny, every second.

The best of Argentina!. We enjoyed every moment of it. Food was excellent, guide was nice and spoke english really well, horses were in good condition and happy to play and the wine was abundant! Plan to bring cash money though, they don't take credit card.

Highly recommended for all. Argentina Polo Day does exactly what it says on the tin. You will be hosted by highly professional, highly knowledgable and most importantly, highly passionate people from start to finish. The horses you get to ride are extremely well trained - it's like riding a pony with a joystick!On top of the polo experience, you will also treated like royalty - food, water, wine, etc all day. The staff are very friendly and create a chilled / relaxed atmosphere.Not only would I recommend this to everyone, but I would be back in a flash if only my trip was longer.Alan and Roz

Fabulous Day in BA. Polo. For most of us in the United States this word means a collared shirt with a little guy on a horse embroidered on the upper right hand side. We all know that the word means a whole lot more, but have never had the opportunity to see into the world that is Polo. Argentina Polo Day provides a total immersion experience into this incredible sport and cultural mainstay.From the moment Pablo picks you up at your hotel or apartment, you just know that you are going to have a day to remember for a long long time. All of the reviews you read are not lying, this will be one of, if not the highlight of your time in Buenos Aires.The day consists of to-die-for empanadas, informative instruction on the rules of Polo, up close and personal observation of a Polo match, a delicious lunch, and yes, your very own match...played by you and your group! I know! Are you saying to yourself 'but I have never ridden a horse, how can I even begin to play Polo?'. No joke, put your trust in Pablo, you will ride that horse, and you will hit that ball from that horse! It is incredible!!!Do yourself a favor and spend a day with Argentina Polo Day, you will NOT regret it!!!

Fantastic fun. Had a brilliant day watching and playing polo. The day was both informative and loads of fun with some great food (maybe the best empanadas) and wine thrown in.Pablo and Ruben are so friendly and welcoming and even though it was pouring with rain we had a brilliant time.The horses are amazing and even though I had never ridden a horse I felt extremely safe (even after a few glasses of wine) playing polo and had great funReally can't recommend the day enough

Polo in Buenos Aires. This was a great day out ,it cost 175 dollars and included as much food and wine as you could cope with ,Paulo made the day. fun informative and was a great host .We were given instruction on the game, the rules and its history . We met experienced Polo players who then played 4 chukkas and were then treated to a large lunch the only downside being remaining in a fit state to ride . On that topic they do take anyone ALL year but I think it is more enjoyable if you have ridden. The actual ,'game' we played was the best fun on a horse I have had in years.I laughed from start to finish people were hooking sticks and even martingales in a sense of mischief and enjoyment.The park surroundings were beautiful and we were made welcome by all from start ( picked up at our hotel ) to finish being delivered back . My only reservation was the charge for my wife, a non player was a little steep as she doesn't drink much or eat a lot of beef but that apart it was a super super experience .PS with picture to follow on line

Best Day!!. Had an amazing day at the Argentina Polo Day!! Pablo and the team really made such an effort to give us the best experience and we got the best experience!!The wine was crazy amazing!!The food was great!!! The Polo was great (especially trying it yourself)But most off all it was the way it was organized, totally professionalIs a must do while in Argentina!10/10 from me! Thanks again Pablo you legend!

Polo Day!. It was a day full of active participation into the sport of polo! We even got to ride horses and play a polo match! What an excellent way to get involved in the sport, and a great way to understand the sport. The food was very good too!

Highlight of Argentina. We had the most amazing day, was the common remark made by everyone who attended Polo Day. The empanadas were the best we had tasted, the red wine was delicious and your glass was never empty. Pablo was great, very entertaining and explained everything to us in detail. All staff were excellent. I would recommend this day to anyone. I also have to mention the spray that removes red wine from clothes... AMAZING!! haha

Unforgettable experience!!!!. If you're looking for something new and exciting.... or if you are looking for one of those unforgettable days in life: go to Argentina Polo Day!!!The day starts in a farm with perfect green grass, delicious home made empanadas and a good Argentinian wine. You are lectured through the basic polo rules, have the opportunity to watch a match with professional polo players and after an amazing Argentinian "parrillada" you are ready to rock on the field with your polo outfit!!!! You need no experience at all: the horses are very well trained and the instructor Pablo is just great on motivating you to get the best polo player out of you!!! It is soooo much fun !!!!I not only recommend but I'm also looking forward for my next polo experience!!!The staff is incredibly friendly: the owners of the farm, the instructor and the polo players...they make you feel part of their big polo family!!

Increiiiiiible!!!!!. Because everyday should be better than the previous days: if you like adventure and you are looking for one of those unforgettable days in life, go to Argentina Polo Day!!! It is a super complete day that starts in a farm with perfect green grass, amazing home made empanadas and good Argentinian wine!!! You are lectured with the polo rules, have the opportunity to watch professional polo players while still enjoying your good wine and after an Amazing Argentinian "parrillada" you are ready to rock: it is your time to play polo!!!! You need no experience with horses, they are prepared to take you through a super fun experience!!!! I just loved - the horses are very well trained, the instructor is amazing on motivating you to do your best, the farm is spectacular like an antique well cared country side farm: it is a very very complete day!!!! I not only super recommend, but I am alsoLooking forward to go back to argentina to take my 3-5 day polo course!!!!

Really interesting day. Host, Pablo, was very polite and entertaining. Warm welcome at the Estancia with tapas and drinks. It is really beautiful there. This is a very nice way to get introduced to the world of Polo in Argentina. Even if you are not into horses, the day is worth while going! We saw a polomatch, had a nice bbq and rode horses ourselves. Even did play a match ourselves... WONDERFUL ! Even is you don't like horse, the ranch is beautiful and a good way to relax ! DO IT!
Polo, polo and polo. Very nice people, very nice food, very nice poloI definitely recommend the place. Enjoy Polo!!!!!!!

One of my highlights in Argentina. It was a great way to unwind after a hectic week in Buenos Aires. Pablo was a fantastic host and made us all feel very welcome and comfortable. The food was excellent - a barbecue lunch was served (plus their empanadas were amazing!) along with fresh juice and wine. Also included are transport to/from the hotel/hostel, horse riding lessons and you finish the day taking part in your very own polo match.

All day wine, empanadas, a polo match and great company. Who would ask for anymore. Spent an amazing sunny day at La Carona and it was one of the best experiences of my adventures. We were greeted with so much warmth and wine from our local guide Pablo The morning started with a glass of red wine and fresh empanadas from the outdoor oven. I am a bug foodie so I was excited to see all the BBQ and wood fire oven starting up. We were given a small intro about Argentinian Polo, had a tour of the horses and players before going to sit down in the amazing sun drinking our wine and learning the basics of a polo match. After watching the pros on the field we got back for lunch which was situated outside in the open air. It was amazing and I had wished that one day I would be able to have this style of lunch, outside in the fields with amazing food. Ok I think I've written enough. A must when you come to Argentina.

Never ridden? NO PROBLEM!. After a few days in the big city, opted to book this experience in the countryside and learn to play polo. IT WAS AMAZING!!
