While we were watching the pros play it rained but they kept playing! We stood under large pine trees and did not get wet (they are HUGE). I asked why they didn't stop and the reply was "It is our passion". The rain eventually stopped, the pros changed and we had an amazing lunch with them. THEN it was our turn. After the lesson, we got on the horse and when we got on the field it began to rain....AND I didn't even notice! The exhilaration of hitting the ball and being on the horse made me forget the rain. It was only then that I understood why the Pros never stopped. The horses are geniuses! Do not underestimate them. If you have never ridden (or are have little or NO experience) you will be paired with a horse to suite your needs. Our instructor was excellent, the horses superb and our experience one of a kind; it was worth every penny! Overall a beautiful day in the countryside of Argentina, learning from amazing animals with an excellent staff. Cannot wait to book a longer clinic; I think my husband is hooked!

Highlight of my South American Trip. My whole day from start to finish was fantastic. Very friendly an hospitable, a great atmosphere with everyhting very well organized. The food was absolutely to die for. ( a testament to Ruben and Celine as I believe they previously ran restaurants which is why they are so good at this)The place is very beautiful, set in a great part of Argentina. I have riden a bit but the two other guests had never been on a horse and by the end of the day we all could play polo. It is certainly not cheap but polo never is and this was a great experience and one which I hope to repeat again with Celine, Ruben and their team. Great family vibe, genuinely fantastic family and staff, who take care of your every need. You wont be disappointed, we are all hooked on polo, with the 2 beginners planning toreturn for a weeks polo course! thanks to everyone at Argentina Polo Day! definitely a highlight of my 3 month trip across South America!

Once in a lifetime opportunity. We had a great day at polo. So close to the city yet felt so far away with the completely different scenery. Had the best empanadas in South America by far! Then got to watch a polo match and then had a BBQ lunch. All whilst drinking wine! We then played a game of our own. It was great fun and the horses are ao well trained. Best day out in Argentina!!

Amazing Day Trip. After a friends recommendation, we decided to try the Argentina Polo Day and it was one of my favorite days in 3 months of traveling. The entire staff was great and knowledgable. The meal is amazing and they are never shy to refill your glass of wine. Jumping on a horse after nearly 15 years of not being on one is a little intimidating however after a few minutes you realize the horses are so well trained there is nothing to really fear. The next day my friend and I wanted to go again and if I go back to Buenos Aires, I will definitely go back for another Polo Day. This is a must do if you are in Buenos Aires.

beautiful day at polo Club. Our polo day was wonderful! Everything was perfect: the polo match in live done by professionals and our polo training during the morning and finally our polo match made ​​by us in the afternoon!Thank you to all the team, especially Pablo... ;) Thanks Argentina and Polo !!!!Guillaume and Céline

Amazing polo and hospitality. I stayed at El Camino polo club for 2 weeks, and it was an amazing experience. I came to improve my playing, and certainly learned a lot while relaxing in a gorgeous location. Everything about my stay was amazing, from the horses to the food and especially my hosts Ruben, Celia, and Connie. Whether you're looking for a day trip introduction to polo or a clinic to enhance you're skills, I high recommend Argentina Polo Day. I look forward to returning in the summer season!

Wow - an amazing experience. I thoroughly enjoyed this experience from start to finish. All the staff were very professional and Pablo was a totally professional and passionate guide. I have ridden horses before but hadn't for a long time so I was a bit nervous, especially adding the need to play polo as well as ride! Pablo gave me every confidence that I could do it and he was right! I learnt so much about the game as well as how to play - this was more than I expected. The lunch and wine were tremendous as was talking easily with members from the club. I would totally recommend anyone travelling to Buenos Aires to experience this adventure!

Great - Club, Polo, Food, People & Fun. Argentina Polo Day - exceeded our expectations. I have had horses my entire life but I am new to Polo. What better place to learn than Argentina! The day was fantastic from pick-up at our hotel. Poly knows his Polo and everyone on all levels can learn. You are hosted by one of Ruben & Celia's lovely Polo Clubs - that they have generously brought their Argentine hospitality for all of us to enjoy. Don't miss this great opportunity to experience great club, great polo, great food, great people and just good fun.  - Bueno Bueno Bueno!
A Polo Plus. Awesome day with an awesome crew. The wine, food, staff, and the polo could not have been better. A definite must if traveling in BA!

Argentina Polo Days-Fantastic!. I had a fantastic time, beautiful weather, great food and wine. Celia, Ruben & Pablo could not have been better hosts. They made everyone feel right at home and gave us all top notch treatment. Big thank you to all the staff that helped out during the day, the cooks, horse handlers and polo players all worked hard to make the day so enjoyable. Be sure to try the empanadas they were the best I have tasted!! I would highly recommend this day to anyone who enjoys the fresh air, outdoors and horses!

A highlight of my trip to South America. We spent a wonderful day with the team from Argentina Polo Day. Poly was a wonderful host and taught us so much. The relaxed nature of the club and members made it such an authentic experience. Highly recommend the day whether you can ride or not. Loved playing a game after we had such great lessons from Poly and the team. Oh yes.... the food and wine was plentiful and delicious! My summary of the day was "when people are passionate about what they do, they share so much with others" Thank you - it was worth every cent!

Totally pleased!. Although we have chosen a risky season (winter) as the weather wasn't at it's best (cold, rainy and windy) it did not stop our enthusiasm of discovering this beautiful site and sport. We are absolutely going back in the future months to really enjoy it to the fullest. The instructor, Pablo, is a passionate guy and very dedicated and Celia, the coordinator is very professional. The place is authentic and the real gauchos are warm people! We are keeping a very good memory of our time spent over there... Despite the weather...

Fun day, good company, great asado. What a fun day - it started with the hosts picking us up at our hotel and driving the hour or so to the polo field. We were immediately given empanadas and offered wine while we learned a bit about polo. We were provided with more wine and ways to interact with the match while watching the pros play, then tucked into a lovely asado, complete with far more food than I could eat. After we were nice and full we played our own 45min match and with some help from the professionals, we actually managed to score some goals! Then it was back to the shuttle and back to our hotel late afternoon. Great day, so much fun, we were lucky with weather but I think it would be a blast even in the rain/cold!
Great day out. Great day, outfoors, great food,magnificent staff. Even for people who never rode a horse. End of the day you might score during a polo match !

A fantastic day out with warm, generous hosts. A super-fun day out, hosted by Celia, Ruben and Paolo, who could not do enough for their guests. I went to the day on my own and am quite shy, but soon got into the spirit of things, and integrated with others in the group, who had also come for the polo day experience. This was largely down to the atmosphere created by the hosts - you are made to feel so welcome and relaxed. The day starts with an explanation of the rules of polo, then an exhibition match. After that a beautifully executed Asado, with plenty of red wine for those who like a glass (or two). Then came our turn to ride. We got a full 1 hour 45 mins of riding - first practising stick and ball, then played our own match. I do ride at home normally, but there were plenty of others there who had not ridden before or not ridden for a long time and they were able to experience the benefit of the whole day too.At the end of the day, all of the participants agreed we should go out for dinner in Buenos Aires and Celia even organised this for us. Thanks! I will return!

Argentina Polo Day. I highly recommend Argentina Polo Day! Great food, great wine, great company. Just 45 minutes outside of Buenos Aires. Great day trip if your looking to get out of the city. First time a few of the people in our group had ridden, and they had a blast. Beautiful experience on the ranch. Polo players, staff and owners very friendly and treated you like family.Highly recommend!!
Must do activity in Buenos Aires. Great food, great wine, great service, great scenery and you get to play Polo as well.Was a day well spent.
Wonderfull. Beautiful day, great atmosphere! It was a great experience to join here and to be part of a group who loved their jobs in this way!!!!

Very nice day trip even if you know nothing about Polo or horse riding.. Very nice day trip to do when you're in Buenos Aires. It's just outside of the city and leaving the city behind for one day and being out in the open will actually do you some good. First time I ever rode a horse, but it wasn't less fun because of that! You even get to play a polo game with some (semi) professional polo players and you will be served wine and delicious football day long. Probably a bit expensive for the locals (at 1600 pesos) but a good price for foreigners when you change your money on the black market. Overall a fantastic experience!

Perfect experience, good food, nice people....... We really liked to expierence and now all about polo, in superb Argentinian countryside having a great asado, wine and some horseriding.....the people area great the owners (Ruben and Celia) take care of you themselves, you feel like home, you are treated like a "family guest" I feel like home.Highly recomended.JE

Amazing day.. Got out of the city for a day and learned how to play polo. I never road a horse before and they were extremely patient. Stephane was an amazing instructor. The whole day I was treated like family.

Amazing day. The day was absolutely perfect and an excellent escape from the city. There was lots of good wine, company and food. We really felt like we were visiting family friends. I was pretty scared to try polo as I am not confident on a horse. I felt completely supported by the staff and all the polo players and workers helped and gave me tips so by the end of the hour I could join the game properly. An truly unforgettable experience.

Outstanding day, highly recommended. Welcoming, friendly and engaging staff, great food and wine, polo brilliant fun. Might seem like a lot of money to spend on a day out but really worth every penny. I can't recommend it highly enough. Polo-wise, they seem to cater for a good range of riding abilities... great for beginners but also plenty of scope for charging around if you are a bit more experienced. Throughout the whole day, the level of effort that the staff put into making sure that everyone is well looked after is really exceptional.

Fantastic trip. I have spend many days in BA for work. This was my first time to visit a polo ranch. we had a perfect sunny day in between some rainy days. The setting was very nice in the countryside just outside of BA. Pablo, our host did a perfect job learning us about the polo game. After a demonstration of a polo match and a lovely BBQ with plenty of wine it was our turn. I don't have experience riding horses so I was a bit nervous. But there was no need of that. The horses are very calm and easy to ride. After a match we finished with more wine before they brought us back to the hotel. What a fantastic day!!

Fantastic way to spend a day. Me and my brother had never ridden horses, and neither of us had any interest in polo prior to this, but we had gotten it recommended by our other brother. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and likable, and so was the entire group of people we were with. It was a beutiful day weatherwise as well, which i suppose doesn't hurt. The surroundings was beatiful and it was the perfect break from the city. The food and wine was excellent and plentiful. Watching the polo game was fascinating and trying to play myself was also fun, Even though i am still convinced I'm the worlds worst polo player. As almost everything else in argentina, you will pay less if you have dollars. At least at the current rate. Even though we payed the peso price it was worth every single peso and so far the highlight of a very entertaining trip to buenos aires. Don't miss out.

Manuel for President!. What a brilliant day! The service was outstanding from start to finish, they have definitely got this family business fine tuned. The food was SO GOOD, best asado we had while in Argentina…and yes the empanadas are ridiculously good. You certainly don't get any closer to a polo match and the standard of the game we watched was very high. Pablo our host was fantastic, extremely professional and charismatic, while Celia, Reuben and Valentina were some of the warmest people we have come across on our travels and made us feel part of the family. Getting up on the horse itself was incredible , especially after a bottle or 2 of red. They teamed us up and we were on our way! Manuel (one of the players) was the most charming gentleman and took us to victory! Great day all round, would recommend to anyone and everyone.

Sooo much fun!!. This day tour isn't cheap but it's worth every cent and was complete fun from start to finish. Pablo our guide was just terrific, so warm friendly and entertaining he made everyone feel right at home. The country setting was beautiful and the day filled with amazing food and endless wine. I never imagined how fun it would be to watch and learn to play polo. All the horses are so well behaved and know what they are doing that anyone at all can play absolutely no riding experience needed.This is a must do in BA! ++recommend

Great day enjoying polo, wine and food!. We had heard of the high reviews for polo day on TA so booked in and was picked up at hotel in BA by Pablo. Excellent host who was incredibly knowledgable on Polo and also a great guy. Weather was perfect and such a beautiful area outside BA, fresh air and lovely country side makes you feel like in another country.there was only another couple from USA on the tour so 4 in total but make the experience more personal as everyone learned each other's names. Been travelling for 3 months through SA now and eating so many empanadas so can honestly and safely say they were the best of the trip, absolutely delicious. The wine was pretty awesome too. Polo was so much fun riding the horses and scoring goals, we had a blast. So much fun and something completely different to what we would normally do.
Highlight of our trip. Who lets you drink that much wine and get on a horse? In the rain? Brilliant fun, would recommend to anyone visiting BA

Highlight of our Argentina trip!. We so enjoyed our Argentina Polo Day on June 11! In spite of the monsoon conditions (a lake, not a field! MUD! Great rain ponchos!), we had one of the most memorable days of our trip to Argentina. Poly was truly central to making our day so much fun. From the moment he picked us up at our hotel in Buenos Aires to the time he dropped us off again, it was great! His title of “Experience Manager” is absolutely perfect because he managed our experience that day in a most superb way! Even with such a small group of 4 (3 in our family), and the terrible rain and wind, he was able to make it fun, educational and safe. The horses (and the Argentina Polo Day players!) were so patient with us, the asado was delicious (and the best empanadas of the entire trip!), the wine flowed freely, we learned about the sport and now understand and appreciate it better, and we thoroughly enjoyed every minute. Highly recommend this!!

Polo in the rain :). I booked through these guys after another company I had originally booked with repeatedly cancelled on account of the (admittedly very rainy!) weather. These guys still play, rain or shine, as they have another pitch for when the ground is wet. The weather on the day was absolutely awful but I still had an absolutely amazing time which I think is saying something! The empanadas really are as good as everyone says, your wine glass is constantly re-filled, and everyone is super friendly. They definitely deserve their fantastic rating on Trip Advisor. I've always wanted to play Polo so I was pretty sure I would love it, but even my non-horsey friends who booked this day said it was one of the best things they had done in BA. Do it!

Amazing experience. be ready for wine upon arrival, along with some more wine with a demonstration of the game, and additional wine with an amazing bbq lunch, then have a go at the game yourself, would recommend it to anyone heading to Argentina!

Fun!. This was a great experience from the beginning. They pick you up, take you to the ranch and take care of everything. The polo explanation and game were interesting and the lunch was really good! The also make sure that your wine glass is never empty! Pablo is a great host and really takes care of everyone. My husband and I were novices with horse riding and they eased us into it. I requested a short, calm horse and they paired me nicely. I got a few whacks at the ball and it was a fun time. My husband said it was his favorite activity of our vacation! It does pretty much take up one day, so save a day! Such a fun time!

Best. Day. Ever.. Brilliant day from start to finish- even if you're scared of horses! Everyone involved were friendly and enthusiastic. I loved seeing the professionals play and have Pablo explain what was going on. The lunchtime BBQ was excellent and I particularly liked that some of the players stayed around to chat. Best of all (of course) was actually having a go at playing. I can't remember the last time I laughed so much :)

Amazing - Highly Recommended!. My brothers planned our recent trip to Buenos Aires, and I was shocked to find out that they had planned a day for us to play polo. We hadn't ridden horses since summer camp when we were little, so I was prepared for a ridiculous (albeit hilarious) experience, watching my brothers try to play a sport we knew nothing about - while riding a horse! What I didn't realize is that we would have an INCREDIBLE guide to lead us through the day, teach us about the sport, show us how the pros play, and then several of the Polo Day staff members would give us one-on-one training - and then we would all get to play together! Oh, and all while sipping on wine and munching on the best empanadas I've ever had. It was amazing. Pablo greeted us at our hotel, and was an incredible guide from that moment through the end of the afternoon. Knowledgeable, funny, enthusiastic, and understanding, Pablo truly made this a wonderful memory we won't soon forget. I can't say enough about this sport, the wonderful club members we ate lunch with, the delicious empanadas, the relaxing atmosphere, and of course - our amazing guide! My brothers were beyond happy with the experience, and we all left smiling from ear to ear. My only regret? Not stretching before! Seriously, riding horses is tough! But it was well worth the pain, and I would go out of my way to recommend this to anyone planning a trip to Buenos Aires. If there's one thing you do while you're in Buenos Aires, make it playing polo with Pablo at Argentina Polo Day. In a word, it was perfect! If nothing else, you'll eat the best empanadas of your life - which is why we're all going to Argentina in the first place, right? :) 5 stars! Thank you Argentina Polo Day for the experience of a lifetime!

Great last day in Argentina. We chose this experience for our last day in Argentina, my friends and I were very satisfied with the experience. It started out with us being picked up at our hotel, then we were driven about 30 minutes or so out side of the city where we came upon the ranch. I personally had never ridden a horse before but wasn't too nervous to being with. Also the delicious never ending wine helped me to get on the horse. I will say that I spent an entire month in Argentina trying to find the best empanadas and these were it. First we learned a little bit about how the sport is played, then we watched a polo match of 4 v 4. They let us throw the ball into play and ring the bell to signify the end of each round. After we watched the polo game we had the most delicious lunch,Salad, asado, grilled vegetables, chorizo, and all the trimmings. By the end of lunch I wasn't sure how I would be able to ride the horse because I was so full, but I did anyway and it was a great time. I wasn't very good at making contact with the ball but I still managed to score a goal somehow. After the game we drank more wine while we relaxed and talked about our day. Overall my experience was top notch. I would definitely recommend this to a friend.

Fabulous polo day. Wow what a fabulous trip to the Argentina polo day I was so glad I did this as I was a little nervous before hand going on my own but no need to be single travellers as Pablo and the team made me feel so welcome set in a beautiful location about an hour from BA I cannot recommend this day highly enough ..on arrival at the ranch the glass of Malbec was very welcome ..and then well it was just such an interesting day learning about the tack rules history and ponies of polo ..throughout the day you just feel so involved ..off to the field to watch a few chukka and some photos with the players then it's lunch everyone sits down together for lunch and it was delicious lovely fresh plenty to eat and more of that lovely Malbec! Next up best bit of the day playing polo it was a blast! I loved it the horses are so well schooled it feels very safe and there is lots of professional help! but when it was match time couldn't help but get competitive! There is such a genuine welcome and enthusiasm from ruben Pablo and celia and all the team that you can't fail to have a great day ..I'm now back in Scotland with my polo mallet dulce de leche and great memories ..I've been travelling all over the world for 18 years and this is by far one of the best things I've done can't wait to go back ..go go go you won't regret it! Thanks Pablo ruben and celia !

Perfect polo day. A great day from start to finish, despite the cold weather we still had so much fun. Pablo was a great guide, really friendly and helpful. The food was delcious and our glass was never empty of wine. It was also nice to watch geniune polo practice. The only thing I would say, as a horse rider I would have liked to ride more - although it was very tiring! Thanks for such a great day!

The greatest activities in Argentina. It was an amazing day,Everything was excellent, food, people and specially polo game.it has been almost a week i have been there and i cant stop thinking of coming back.Outstanding day.

Great day tour!. This was a great way to spend the day! Pablo was a great tour leader. He was very personable and knowledgeable about anything to do with polo. It was great to see a polo match first hand, and even better to get on the horse and give it a go ourselves. On top of everything the food was amazing and my wine glass was never empty! Highly recommended.

Live like royalty!. This was by far one of the best days of my life. The most amazing hospitality by the crew and we all felt like royalty with our glasses of red always topped up and an incredible lunch. I have always had a fear of horses and the lesson was my chance to conquer that fear. The horses are so incredibly trained and my fear quickly disappeared and I got my polo on!!! It was a fantastic day and I totally recommend it to anyone!

Amazing location, great fun!. Argentinian hospitality at its best! Pablo was a great host, with excelent knowledge of the game! You do get to see a real game of club polo, and a polo lesson is a hoot!! We also visited their polo academy property, and it is incredible!!

Probably my favorite thing in Argentina!. This was maybe the most memorable thing I have done while in Argentina, aside from running into the national soccer players in a club on a Saturday night.... but that is besides the point. Pablo is a very cool guy and makes sure you are comfortable. He is witty and a genuinely nice guy who goes out of his way to make it great for you. The food is tasty, the game is fun and promised is some great company. Why are you not doing it already?

a great day.... I did the Argentinian Polo Day begin of May 2014 and it has been a very nice experience.I loved everything - from learning theoretically and practically about Polo, and yes, even if you are not a professional rider, you will manage and enjoy it a lot, over the big BBQ (assado) and lots of good wine and the best Empanadas I've ever had, the lovely ranch and that rural landlife feeling you'll have out there (just 45 mins out of Buenos Aires) to the professional office with its quick responds and feedbacks.I just got their coincidentally and I would ever do it again - absolutely recommendable!
Great Field Day. Good food, good company, good polo. Great day, overall! Pablo and all the team are great with tourists. congrats and TOTALLY recommended!
Amazing day out!. This was such a fun day out. It's really well-organised and good value for money. Great food and wine. The horses are really well trained and polo is so much fun!

Amazing!. Doesnt matter if you're a experienced rider and really into polo or never been on a horse before. You'll will for sure have one of your best days. Great and fun people. Brilliant service. Amazing food and wine. Stunning areas. And so much fun playing polo. The horses are perfect, and very well trained. So good I had to do it twice. Highly recommend this great experience!

Disappointed! Left with a bitter taste. Safety concerns, please note. Disappointed! Don't believe the hype, you may feel happy with the experience after copious amounts of wine however I do not drink so can give a rather sober review. The food was not of the quality I had expected, if I had know the quality food/drink I would have eaten before or brought my own. Provided with Concentrated orange/lemon juice when I had requested and been assured by Celia via numerous emails I would have fresh fruit juices as I do not drink wine and not a fan of gaseous drinks.Would definitely recommend the Horse riding experience that Miriam and Adrian offer and which rightfully claims the No1 spot at this point, as there passion for horses resonates through the trip, whereas this is trip is more of a money making trip In my personal experience. Would have been safer to have wine offered after the polo game, sooner or later some one will get hurt, as some people had drunk 1 to 1 and a half bottles of wine before getting on a horse. We saw a game before and witnessed an expert take a rather nasty fall, so the obvious risks are there.If I had known what the experience would have been like I would have saved my money and done some more horse riding lessons instead.Over priced for what was offered IMHO.
FANTASTIC DAY. only one word to describe this activity ... thanks !!! .. everything was amazing .. i will do it again!!!
Funnest day!!. Best empanadas I've ever tasted in my life. Unlimited wine. Warm staff. And I got to ride a horse!!!! Definitely recommend.

Lots of fun... and Malbec.. Fun from start to finish! Upon entering the the Polo Club, we were offered the most delicious empanadas I've ever had in my life and a healthy glass of Malbec. I should also mention that we were greeted by two adorable and friendly little dogs. Set the tone for the day. Pablo, our charismatic host, made sure our cups were always full and we had everything we needed all day. After an explanation of the rules, we watched a pro game and drank a few more bottles of wine. Then we had what I can only describe as a "meat feast". Every cut of cow and pig you can think of. And more Malbec. Then it was time to play. For real. While most of us just tried to stay on our horses, we were able to play a proper game with the pros assisting. A few people even scored goals. I don't think I've ever laughed so hard (from drunken terror). Good times.We did a lot of fun activities throughout our 2 week stay in Argentina. This was by far our favorite day. Thanks Pablo!

Favorite part of BA trip. I booked very last minute, and off the bat, was impressed by how warm and professional Celia was - extremely prompt and helpful without being pushy in the slightest. Sent an email at midnight, and she came back less than an hour later. What makes APD stand out is that you're made to feel like family as soon as you arrive on the ranch. Despite having zero experience with horses or polo, I felt safe and looked after the whole day - nothing but sincere hospitality, amazing food, a lot of laughs, and an unexpectedly gratifying amount of riding and playing time. Poly is hilarious and somehow manages to teach you all the rules and technique of the game while keeping you entertained, well fed, and your wine glasses topped - an impressive combination of host, instructor, personal cheerleader, and all-around fun guy. The team's attention to detail and thoughtfulness is evident in everything from the overall layout of the day to the small touches like having bug spray prepared and mate to pass around after the ride. There's a genuine passion for polo that is infectious, and after a day with them, I came away with a real interest to play more.A special mention to the genius behind the empanadas since I had to physically restrain myself from grabbing a third.. or was it a fourth? :) Can't recommend highly enough. Thanks guys for such a great intro to polo!

An incredibly amazing day!. Its been a wonderful day. Im not specially a big fan of polo, I went ahead and booked it because it was highly recommended to me. It was one of the best days of the trip. The whole activity is really interesting. You get to see actual polo players, you get theorical explanations and finally you get to ride the horse.Furthermore, you will be served food during the day in different opportunities, empanadas, amazing wine, bbq..The background was just perfect for the getaway from crazy BA that I needed. Special mention to Pablo the guide, he is so funny, friendly, will be looking after you all day! Nobody should miss this activity while in BA

An excellent day away from the city noise!. Thanks for an amazing day, from beginning to end! I was really surprised by how freely we got to ride the horses, however I didn't manage to get mine to gallop. The food and the atmosphere is great, and Paulie is a great guy!

An absolute must do!. As the saying goes 'when in Rome' or 'when in Argentina' you must try your hand at playing polo. The team at Argentina Polo Day couldn't have been more well-organized, professional, friendly or informative if they tried. We were picked up by Paolo in BA in the morning and watched an instructional/informative video about polo, its history and its rules along the way out to the polo field. Once at the polo field Paolo talked to us a bit further about the rules and equipment, poured us a glass of wine, served us an amazing empanada and then we headed across the field to watch the pros play. We were involved in the game by ringing the bell and throwing the ball into the field for the players all the while Paolo was teaching us further about the game (which was very high speed and excellent). After the game we enjoyed an asado lunch with the players which was delicious and relaxing. Then we put on our gear and headed out into the field to try our hand at the game. The horses were very well behaved and there was one pro to help each amateur. They really went out of their way to make sure that we were getting how to hold the polo mallet and to hit the ball (all the while somehow staying on the horse!). When we were comfortable we 'played' a match with a couple of the pros in the game as well. When they dropped us off in BA at around 7pm that night we were thoroughly exhausted and very happy with our day. Thank you sooooooooo much for such an amazing day! When we return to BA we will certainly be back!

A perfect day of polo!. The expectations prior to our day at the Argentina Polo Day were more than met! The day started off with an interesting introduction of polo, by our guide Paulo, followed by an interactive polo match were we got to watch and learn how polo is played. During this we were served as much as we wanted of wonderful, home made empanadas and local wine. After the match the players joined us for a really good BBQ-lunch. After the bbq we all put on polo gear and played an hour long polo match. It was the first time riding a horse for many in our group, but the horses were well trained, so few had any trouble at all. Playing polo was a really good experience and something I will remember for the rest of my life. I would definitely recommend Argentina Polo Day to anyone who visits Buenos Aires.

Argentina Polo Day. It was a very interesting and amazing adventure in Argentina with high service quality, absolute safety during the polo game and extremely friendly ambiance! Even the riders, who was playing polo for the first time, felt safely and comfortable on their horses and enjoyed the game. Everybody could feel like a polo-star :-)Thank you very much, dear team, and specially Celia and Poly. You are the best!!!

Absolutely the BEST!!. You can't go wrong at all spending the day on this absolutely memorable and incredibly enjoyable Polo Day! Pablo, our driver and guide, picked us up in Buenos Aires and during our drive to the El Camino Polo Club answered all our questions about Polo and showed us a video explaining different things about Polo. On arrival at the Polo club we were greeted by a handful of very friendly and welcoming staff members, offering delicious empanandas, wine and drinks as we took in the beautiful surroundings. Pablo then gave us a full and very entertaining explanation about the game of Polo, the rules, the care of the horses, the uniforms, the history, and the etiquette of the game. Then we had the opportunity to watch a real Polo match and even see the change over of horses between chukkers. We then enjoyed a delicious Argentine barbeque together with some of the players and staff, including one of the owners. After this wonderful lunch we were then given our Polo uniforms and saddled up on well trained horses to play our Polo match. We had so much fun and have gained a new understanding and admiration of the game of Polo. Thanks to Pablo, Ruben and everyone there that made this day unique, remarkable, and so much fun. You made us feel so "at home" and we all had a great time. I highly recommend this day trip to anyone, whether you know Polo or not!

Still Smiling !!!. 'Argentina Polo Day' is a wonderful experience and begins the moment you are picked up from your Hotel. The full day is very well organized the Polo Match is very exciting to watch also the food delicious. For many (many) years I had always wanted to go to Argentina and see the Polo Ponies and watch a Polo Match. Therefore the highlight for me was to be able to Play Polo on one of the Lovely, Gentle well Trained Horses that was a thrill that will stay with me forever. I was amazed that people who had never ever been on a horse before were able to ride, play Polo have fun and look the part. As I said the horses are very well trained and gentle. Lots of fun. The Instructor gave us excellent instructions about the Polo Match also Polo Ponies stressing the importance of Respect and Care for the Horse. The Staff are wonderful and take excellent care of their Guests. The grounds are beautiful and the setting is peaceful.I thought it was very good value for the full day experience. I would not have missed this for anything, feel very lucky to have experienced this and if I do return to Buenos Aires I would definitely go to 'Argentina Polo Day' again. Infact I am still smiling !! - The Thrill of a Lifetime. This experience is something not to be missed.(Thank you Celia for being very efficient)

Simply great!. As soon as we came out if the car, we were met with empanadas and wine, and already at that point we understood that this was going to be a great day. When I spilled some empanada-sauce on my shirt, and the first thing our guide, Paulo came with was a cleaning spray, I really felt like they had thought of everything. The polo match was fun to watch, and the barbecue lunch was great, but the best part was when we actually got to get up on our own horses and play an hour long polo-match! It was quite difficult (and here is the only small negative thing of the day: we all thought it might have been more fun if we just got to play on our own instead of some of the locals - being much better than us - always stealing the ball just when we were close to scoring) but still a great lot of fun, and probably the coolest experience of our Argentina-trip! This day is definitely worth the cost, and I would recommend it to everyone!

Great Polo day, Novices don't be put off.. An amazing Polo Day experience, it was exciting and trilling fun. During the day we played an actual polo game and also took a leisurely horse ride around the estate. After loads of activity, we had our fill of quality wine and tasty steak & bbq. Pretty much the whole group had no history of riding horses, we had a great time and not having riding experience didn’t factor in.I am really glad that we didn’t let the weather forecast stop us enjoying a wonderful day, the sun came out and we even had a chance to take a dip in the pool. The team at Argentina Polo Day were friendly, funny and sociable.
Great Polo experience. Great hosts, food and wine. Totally enjoyed the polo and I actually scored! A must go if in Buenos Aires.Well done guys!

Awesome!. Great empanadas, meat and wine. For those who want to understand and learn about Polo and try for the first time in a very safe environment this is a must!Pablo, Celia and Ruben are very welcoming hosts and put everyone at ease, Will visit them again with my family,Alessandro Scala

Fabuloso!. Argentina Polo Day is the real deal. We kicked off the day with wine & empanadas, learned the basics of polo, watched a game, enjoyed an asado BBQ lunch and then to top it all off donned the gear and played a game of polo ourselves. It was a great day filled with a lot of fun and laughter. The staff was very friendly, informative and generous. And seriously, the empanadas can't be beat. I highly recommend it. You won't be disappointed. Thank You Argentina Polo Day!

Don't Miss It. I won’t go into the details as they are pretty much laid out nicely with the other reviews. I can’t recommend it highly enough. I’ve been to similar types of activities all over the world and this beats them all hands down as far as authenticity and the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff. Even got to feed the horses! This should definitely be on your Argentinian bucket list.

Great day of polo!. Everything you want to experience about Argentinean polo and more! Empanadas when you arrive, a great overview of the history and rules of polo, watching real club members play a game, a fantastic real Argentinean BBQ and then at the end, getting up on the horses and playing an actual game. Everyone couldn't be nicer and you can tell they really love the game and sharing it with people. Fantastic experience from beginning to end!

MUST DO!. We traveled throughout Buenos Aires for over a week and the Polo Day was hands down the BEST DAY! In fact, it is one of the most exciting things I have ever done! You start the day drinking- perfect, watch a polo game with men on horses in white pants and mud- perfect, friendly staff prepare a wonderful authentic BBQ- perfect, then they saddle you up and teach you how to play- PERFECT! The staff speaks English and has outstanding customer service. I would recommend this trip for anyone!

Fabulous Polo day. I spent a fabulous polo day, I really love it. the people were very friendly and professional. Polo Day provided very organised activities into a real polo practice game.Many thanks to the Polo Day's team..

A Day That Goes by Way Too Fast. What a great day. From the time we were picked up at our hotel in the morning until we were dropped off in the evening we were treated like long lost friends. The wine, the food, (especially the empanadas) the new friends we made will never be forgotten. We also learned a thing or 2 about how to play Polo. This was by far the highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires.

Best part of our trip to Argentina!. We absolutely loved our trip to Argentina Polo Day!! We were provided with bug repellent, sunscreen, delicious empanadas, a parillada, and a great time watching and playing polo!! Poly was a great instructor and driver!! He made our day that much better!! All the players and our fellow newbees to polo were so fun and we had a great time! I recommend this super fun activity to anyone who is interested in having fun and also learning about polo as a sport and learning to play!!

Highlight of Buenos Aires. My husband and I talk about Polo Days as one of the highlights of our Argentina trip. Where else in the world can you experience an authentic polo match and lesson? The country side was beautiful, and Pablo our guide was knowledgeable, professional, and so much fun. Lunch, lots of wine, horses... for me, this was the perfect day. Worth every penny!

Just wonderful. First of all, I want to say thanks to all people of Argentina Polo Day. That was a wonderful event and we all were having a lot of fun!It was my first time trying to play polo so now I have some impressions and experience what polo is. The horses were very well-trained so even those who had never ridden before were feeling quite safe and relaxed. Food and wine were also very nice. I really did not want to leave that place! ;))I would recommend visiting Argentina Polo Day to all interested in having good time in Buenos-Aires.

Awesome Polo Day!!!. This was one of the highlights of our trip to BA. Pablo alias "Poli" totally immersed us in the basics of polo, from rules to historical facts. Stephan drove us to the camp and back to our hotel; polo is his favorite sport and he geared himself and played along other players. The whole staff, especially Celia and Ruben, were a pleasure to be around. Last but not least, you need to try their delicious empanadas! Totally recommend this to everyone!! JP
amazing experience. I went with few friends to take a quick lesson of Polo and was a new and great experience. The staff is very professional. Ask for Celia, she is the best hostess.

Best day ever!. I travel to Argentina frequently for work, and was looking for something to do one weekend. Having always wanted to try playing polo, Argentina Polo Day seemed like a great option based on the reviews online. Suffice to say, they did not disappoint!I was driven to and from my hotel in BA by their friendly staff, and was able to join another group, as I was an individual. The staff was incredibly friends with a great sense of humor, and really took the time to ensure each person in the group had a great experience and learned a lot about the sport. The wine and food were also fantastic!I highly recommend this to anyone seeking to do something outside the box while in Argentina!

Best activity I had the pleasure of doing in South America. From the minute we arrived we knew we were in for a fantastic day. The people were so accommodating and the man who was in charge had excellent English. We sat down with him and got to enjoy some of the best food, while he explained in detail the rules of polo. We were served red wine, and empanadas, no questions were too hard for the instructor. He looked after all of us so well and even though I was a little scared at the beginning to ride the horse, he encouraged us and made sure we were very comfortable. Polo was so much fun, especially after a few red wines. We all agreed that this was our most favourite day yet. I'm so glad I got to be apart of a very different and exciting activity. The horses were looked after well and they seemed to also love playing polo. Wish I could take part again.

Tons of fun. The highlight of my Argentina trip! Great service - The rain last night made the ground very wet and muddy to play but the polo team was still able to have a wonderful real game for us to watch aside. Amazing food - empanadas, wine and BBQ were all delicious and unlimited. Nice instructor - dedicated and caring. It was much easier to watch than to play, and finally I was glad to hit the ball and practice in a game. Plan ahead to save one day. I had to go to airport directly after the polo day and paid extra for a private car to drop me off to the airport. A final note to finish, it's totally fine to go there alone and enjoy the game with your new friends in the team. Tons of fun.
Fun day. We had a perfect day.everything was very well organized and the food and the wine was delicious.a real fun day i ll never forget:-))

Excellent day. Our whole day ran smoothly from pick-up to drop-off, and Celia did her best to help fit us in on a Sunday. Hospitality - wine, empanadas and lunch - was great, with the wine seemingly unlimited. Watching a game was fascinating, and the subsequent tuition had me riding and hitting a ball by the end of the day. I only wish there had been enough of us to have a game before we left!

"Perfect day"!. I would hands down recommend Argentina Polo Day to anyone visiting... it was an excellent day and everything ran smoothly from the pickup to the polo match, to a sumptuous Argentinian barbecue with excellent wine pairing, and finally getting up onto the horses and taking a shot at polo. Everyone was so friendly and welcoming, and it was amazing to sit down to lunch with Reuben, the members and polo players, and other guests. All in all a truly perfect day, and an amazing way to spend my birthday! Thank you so much!

A brilliant day trip!. I completely echo the great reviews on tripadvisor. Out of a two and a half week holiday in Brazil and Argentina, this was definitely the best activity - my friend and I had an amazing day! Pablo and Stephane were brilliant and the horses amazing. Watching a polo match is a thrilling experience - the speed and grace of the horses and the skill of the men is outstanding. You realise how skilled they are when you try it for yourself! You get a good amount of time on the horses and depending on how experienced/confident you are the guys will either let you ride around the polo field a bit more freely or stay with you. One of my favourite parts of the day was visiting the lagoon after playing polo and cantering through it with Stephane. A day I will never forget!p.s. see Facebook for their photos!

Unforgettable fun. I can't recommend Argentina Polo Day enough. One of the most unique and fun experiences I had in Argentina. And definitely no riding experience is necessary. Before the trip, I couldn't believe that by the end of the day, I would actually be on a horse with mallet in hand, chasing a ball down the field, but there I was! It was a blast! I would do it again tomorrow if I could.

Argentina Polo Day. This was one of the highlights of my trip. I was hesitant at first to ride a hide and give playing polo a try, but everyone made me feel at ease. The lunch and empanadas was excellent. The wine was good and free flowing. Horses are beautiful and well trained. I've been recommended this excursion to everyone.

Super fun experience!. I had such a great time at the Argentina Polo day! Definitely one of the best excursions i've been on in Argentina. Beautiful place and lots of fun with really great people. It was really organized and everything ran super smoothly from pick up to drop off and the excellent food was a plus!! couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Excellent day on the field. Such a fantastic day, we absolutely loved it. Was nervous at first to be riding but it's an absolute thrill! Pablo is a great instructor, informative and patient and you will have an absolute ball. The grounds are amazing, the horses are groomed and well trained, and to top it off the traditional Argentine lunch was delicious. Magnificent day out playing polo with great people.

Argentina Polo Day. Loved our Polo Day in Argentina. It was the highlight of our trip. I would recommend this excursion for children and adults of any age. We had a wonderful day including lunch under the shade of the trees, wine, beer, wonderful conversation and finally a great time playing polo.
Quality. Second time on a horse and absolutely loved it! Great teacher & great food! It's obvious that the horses are very well kept and the estancia is 5 star!

We loved #polowithpablo !. I cannot say enough great things about the polo outing-- it was definitely the highlight of our time spent in Buenos Aires! At first we were hesitant about committing a full day when we only had 3 to spend in BA, but it was absolutely worth it. We were greeted with delicious empanadas and enjoyed wine (and more wine) throughout the day. Pablo, the instructor, made the day an absolute blast. He is an excellent teacher -- very informative and made learning to play polo very fun and approachable. The traditional Argentine lunch was wonderful as well.. We had time to relax and indulge in all the meat and wine one could ever ask for before mounting a horse. Overall, we LOVED #polowithpablo and would highly recommend it to everyone!
Wonderful day with wonderful people and horses!. It doesn't matter if you do know how to ride a horse or not. A unique way to spend a day, way beyond my expectations!

What a spectacular day!. Don't miss this experience. It's a full day of wonderful activities --- from basic polo lessons, to a polo game to a fabulous lunch with the polo players ... and then ... we got on polo ponies and practiced using the mallet and scoring goals. What a GREAT day! Well worth the money. Don't miss this Argentine experience. I plan to come back and bring an entire entourage of horse people to experience the essence of Argentina: red wine, steak, tango and polo! It's truly magnificent.! Best once in a lifetime experience!
A Must Do!. Argentina Polo Day is a must do!From the time I was picked up to the time I was dropped home the team was fantastic! Funny, informative, scary it was an experiance I truly recommend.
Amazing. We did the Polo Day as an optional tour through Contiki. It was so much fun! Drinking wine all day, an amazing bbq for lunch and learning to play Polo with lovely horses.

Fun filled day and genuine experience. They pick you up from your hotelDrive you to the fields while watching an instructional video on the basics (great time saver)you arrive to #1 rule, Drink wineGet more lessons, watch club members play, eat an amazing steak dinner, then play polo.Best day of our trip

Highly recommended. If you like horse riding (or even if you don't) this day is great fun. Before you know it you'll be on the horse learning to play, that's after having watched a match by the pros and learning basic technique. Great barbecue provided and also a chance to canter in the fields afterwards. Great fun!
A must!!. Amazing!! Had such a fantastic day, greeted with red wine and the tastiest empanadas in all South America! Was fun, educational and highly recommend :)

Amazing Day. This place was the best! I recommend! Unlimited wine, gorgeous horses and mouth watering food. The hosts were so helpful and lovely and catered to your every need.This was an Amazing day with friends and worth the money.

Fantastic day. This place is so much fun - i highly recommend it! THey are really nice, attentive, and helpful to no end... We watched a Polo game, ate lunch (YUM!) and played polo which was a blast. Plenty of instruction, and afterwards we went to see the wild horses, a beautiful sight! Definitely should be on the top of your list when thinking of a visit to buenos aires or argentina.

Totally worth it!. This place is awesome! Spent the day drinking wine (my glass was never empty), learning the game of polo, watching polo, PLAYING POLO, and most important eating DELICIOUS food. The next day I couldn't move a muscle and spent half the day in bed from being so sore. Totally worth it! I was ready to hobble back and jump on a horse despite the pain:) The staff was best and made our day even more pleasant. Poly. I would have gladly listen to him talk about polo all day. And Stephane was a wonderful teacher/coach. Thank you for everything! We had a blast! Best day of our vacation for sure:)

Best Day of Our Trip!. My Dad & I were met at our hotel lobby by a friendly and informative guide/polo professional who drove us to the ranch about an hour outside of Buenos Aires. In the car journey, we learned the basics of the game of polo, polo horses, etc, and then met the rest of the team. It had rained the day before, but the game carried on dispite the wet conditions. We enjoyed wine, empanadas and many laughs on the side line as we watched the polo match. We tried our hand hitting the ball with a polo mallet both on the ground and on horseback (those willing!!). It was a fabulous day, one I would recommend to anyone wanting to learn more about an amazingly competitive and graceful sport. On our way back into town, ee visited a property where guests can stay for several days/weeks to learn more about the sport and refine their game. That's next on my bucket list!! Thank you to everyone at Argentina Polo Day for an amazing day!!

Awesome day!. This was one of the best things we did while in Argentina! The whole day was well organised from as soon as they pick you up to the time they drop you off. It's not even an hour drive to get there and once there they feed you wine and empanadas and get you settled in. The host was great, as were all the staff there from the volunteers to the polo players and even the guys cooking the bbq. The bbq was great, so much wine and food! After lunch is the actual playing and it's just so much fun! And they make it really easy so wouldn't matter if you'd never been on a horse. Would highly recommend this day to anyone. Even the booking process is made so simple.

Excellent Polo once again at Argentina Polo Day. This is my third time visiting Argentina Polo Day. It is a most to do activity when traveling to Argentina. Ruben and his team make you fill at home while enjoying a great polo atmosphere. From the time you get out of the car and they hand you a great empanada and a good wine cup you will be involved in polo and Argentine customs. Great food, great polo and great people.

Polo Day = Amazing!. Polo Day was such a fun, exciting and unique experience. The group's hospitality was wonderful providing us with great food, wine, laughs, and polo knowledge. We had the oportunity to do quite a bit of riding on the horses and played an actual game. Although none of us were avid riders it was totally fine and we had a blast. Afterwards we got to enjoy the pool and the amazing view. I would strongly recommend this trip; seriously Polo Day is a must!

Awesome day!. I am a fanatic rider (mainly dressage) and in Holland it is almost impossible to play polo. When I came to Argentina, I was hoping for a possibility to see a match - it didn't even occur to me that it would be a possibility to actually play polo myself. This was actually my boyfriend's idea, whose riding experience is non-existent (okay, to be fair he has sat on a mule once...). We looked into several places but Argentina Polo Day made the best first impression. When we sent them an e-mail we immediately got a very enthusiastic mail back from Celia, and she also said that my boyfriend's lack of riding experience wouldn't be a problem (which was something I was quite worried about). Her response made us even more excited and sure that we were coming to the right place. We got picked up in the morning and on the way to the ranch we watched an instruction video. When we arrived we were greeted by the most playful and happy dogs I have ever met (I'm more of a cat person) and we were handed some drinks. After some more instruction, we got to watch a training game and instructor Poly immediately got us involved in it, a.o. practicing with the ball and stick during the breaks. After the match we had a lovely asado lunch in which some of the riders also joined.Then it was finally time to ride! We had some practice time for about 45 minutes to get used to the horses and to practice with the ball and stick. Of course to hit the ball from on top of the horse is not so easy but the horses were very good about it. After that we played a low-speed game and it was absolutely awesome. Everyone got totally into it and I felt the game was relatively fair in the sense that everybody got enough time with the ball (more or less). I even got to hit the ball from a slow canter a few times which I thought was very cool. After that we were exhausted, so we took a jump in the pool before going home.I would definitely recommend this trip. Your stay in Argentina is not complete without it!

Amayzing unique experience @ Argentina Polo Day. The unique experience of Argentina Polo Day is unforgettable.Our visit was on Sunday Feb 2, 2104, it was a rainy morning, but that does not stop usand that was the right decision (the rain stopped around noon)!We highly recommend you to see the premises, ride the horses and to learn to play the polowith very friendly staff, to eat the delicious steaks and to degustate a high quality red wine.Eduard and Valentyna from Toronto, Canada

Great experience. The Argentina polo day is something you must do in when you visit buenos aires. Pablo picked us up by the hotel and drove us quick and safely to the ranch. Everybody was very friendly and we felt extremely welcome. Our glasses where never empty, and the BBQ was excellent. The horses are well trained and the staff is very helpful. I am very afraid of horses but they made me felt very comfortable and walked with me the entire time. Pablo explained the game very clearly in an enthusiastic way he made it a memorable day which we will never forget. We will definitely coming back!

Anyone for Polo?. No tourist visit to Argentina could be complete without a day at a Polo Club. That's what we thought as we came towards the end of our holiday and having spent a day with Ruben and his team we are absolutely convinced of this. Neither my wife and I are "horsey" but we now have an appreciation and respect of the game of Polo, the people who play it and the animals that make it such an exciting event. Good food, good company, good fun ( and the wine's not bad either!) . . . .we've got some great photos and even better memories.

It's an absolute must in BA!. I couldn't recommend this experience more.. To anyone considering it, do it! You won't regret it. I had a lovely day out here, so much fun, great friendly staff and something you'll remember from your time in BA forever.

A fun filled day even if it did pour rain!. It was the last day of our vacation and certainly the highlight for me. Empanadas were great! Learned a lot about the game of polo, rules, equipment, etiquette, etc. Enjoyed watching the game. The field was really muddy after a heavy rainfall but it did not diminish our enjoyment. Then actually playing polo for non horse riders was a real high! Excellent value and I would recommend it to anyone!

One of the best days of our 3 week trip. Okay, I must first preface this comment by saying my husband and I do not normally sign up for 'touristy' experiences. I was a bit dubious to take a day out of our trip to do something like this. But it was of the most special, unique and wonderful days we had on our trip, and memories we will cherish for a life time. I would recommend to anyone to talk the time to spend with them.There are many positive things to say, you can read the other reviews to see what I mean, but there is one particular point I want to pass on. The people that run the ranch, our host for the day, and the members of the club who play polo- are all truly genuinely happy to have you there. I felt like part of the family for the day, not just a tourist.The food is amazing and the ranch beautiful, so even if you're not a horse person go there for the lunch and day outside the city.As another note, my husband and I are not easily fussed, like all food and are fairly athletic and we had a blast. However a few of the other people in our group had a range of dietary restrictions, were uneasy about playing the game and had particular scheduled to keep - they also had a blast. Everyone was catered to, and the hosts were very genuinely concerned that we had what we need, and we enjoying our day.

The polo was great, the rest… not so much!. So, I'll start with the good: The polo - actually playing - was amazing. Also, the empanadas were great. I wouldn't change either and if this day was only polo and empanadas then it would have been 5 stars. However, there were some awful elements.We were told it was 45 minutes from pickup to the ranch. It was 2 hours. Two hours!!!! We drove around BA picking up other people and 2 hours later we were there, dripping in sweat as we weren't allowed to open the windows in the car because of dust but the AC only worked for the two people in the front. On the car - THIS WAS REALLY DANGEROUS - we were picked up in a car that fit 6 people, with 6 seat belts. However, 7 people were put in. So one person had no seatbelt and there were three people jammed in a seat for 2 people… for 2 hours. Uncomfortable and unsafe. Continuing with the car - It shut off, completely, whilst we were driving - TWICE! Yeah! So not only did we not have seats or seat belts but we were in a car that stopped working whilst it was in use. Awesome.The wine was nice, but they ply you with wine before putting you on a horse. This is weird. And dangerous. A bit off.The lunch was disgusting. The "steak" was inedible. You couldn't cut it with a knife. They should've just served empanadas again. Every person was taking the meat and throwing it on the ground for the dogs. Inedible.Then there's the toilet. The toilet with no water. The one and only toilet that had poop in it that I had to go pee on top of. Twice. As did everyone else.Not sure if I'd do this again or recommend it. It had great parts but the safety issues paired with toilet issues was a bit too much. If I'm paying that much money I'd like to at least have safe transportation and a clean toilet. Oh - lastly - heading back was again 2 hours. We were told that we'd be back no later than 7pm. We were dropped off at 8:40 pm and missed our dinner reservations.

Totally Unique and Amazing Experience!. The Argentina Polo Day was not even on the radar for my girlfriend and I before visiting Buenos Aires. We had so many other things planned, but when we saw the reviews, we had to give it a try. Despite being cash-only, the day was absolutely incredible. We were picked up by Poly at our hotel, driven to the club, and served wine and empanadas immediately (early and often!). We learned the rules of polo, watched a match, asked questions, drank a TON of wine, and then had a great Argentinian BBQ lunch. After lunch, it was time to gear up and mount up for some polo! We played for over 90 minutes, and although my horse was a pain in the rump, it was a great experience. It truly made you appreciate how talented the REAL players are. We took a dip in the pool and were driven back to our hotel. It was really a unique and unforgettable experience. DO IT!

Totally a MUST do!. I must confess I am happily surprised with this experience! Went totally BEYOND my expectations! Everything went great! Wasn't my first time horse riding, but it's been a while since last time, and this beautiful horses plus the amazing staff made me feel confident and really enjoy every minute of it.Watching a real Polo game, and the actually playing it, made me feel like a Pro!And words are useless to describe how delightful luch was. We had an Asado, with a colorful Side Salad and an amazing Malbec Wine. I was expecting fun and spending my afternoon nicely, but here I had a blast!!! Met intresting people from everywhere, laughed until I cried, and really learn something I never though was this unique, trendy an cool. Special thanks for the host Pablo, how took his time to explain us everything over and over again, answering every question with a smile (and some funny jokes too.) I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

Best day of our holiday. Without a doubt the best part of our 2 week holiday was Argentina Polo Day. The day was perfect, we were very lucky in terms of weather; although it was warm and sunny there was a nice breeze which helps with this activity. Don’t be put off this if you have never ridden before as there were many people in our group that had not and picked it up very quickly. The horses are great and are use to novice riders. When we arrived we were given wine and empanadas, which were lovely and you are supplied with wine the whole day which is brilliant. The lunch is also great and there was a great selection and plenty of food for our big group. The staff are amazing, so friendly and welcoming and go out their way to accommodate everyone’s needs. The day is also informative as well as a lot of fun. My only regret is not doing the polo day at the beginning of our holiday so I could have done it again! I would recommend this to everyone, great day and brilliant value for money.

Best day out!. This is one of the highlights of our 6 month trip in South America! For backpackers it was a bit on the pricey side for us but it was worth every penny! From private pick up, to yummy welcoming empanadas, to bottomless wine and beer, friendly staff, great guide, polo match and explanation, amazing BBQ and finally getting to play polo ourselves then chilling by the pool afterwards. Everything was perfect and so much fun, even if we did struggle to hit the ball.Don't hesitate, if you're in any way interested at all you'll love this. I love horses but my boyfriend has never ridden before and he enjoyed it more then I did!

Horsing around in BA. Even a bit of rain could not keep us away from the Argentina Polo Day. Luckily the rain cleared in time for our warmly greeted arrival and we were treated to the most amazing day! My highlight was Pablo our gorgeous guide who knew everything, answered every question and never let our wine glasses become empty (which is very difficult with 5 Australian girls!) The horses on the ranch were beautiful and friendly and they clearly enjoyed the game of polo. The match was very fun to watch and the games in between were great and hilarious with my now tipsy girlfriends. The food throughout the day was the best I had in Argentina. The empandas were the best I have ever had! Pablo can I please have the recipe!? The lunchtime BBQ was so good and more wine and great company made it even better. I loved getting on a horse and riding around trying to play polo. My horse was very smart - it would stop close to the ball to let me hit it! They know when the tourists are hiding them!After a fun game of polo we decided to cool off in the swimming pool with more wine and banter. It was truly one of the best activity days I've ever done during all of my travels and highly recommend it to everyone! Now when I go to the Polo in Australia I will actually know what I'm watching and how hard it is to play!

Everything was just amazing!. I loved the food, the activities, the people helping us, the place, the horses, the price. Everything was just great.It was great to experience Buenos Aires country side. It was just a fantastic day.

A memorable highlight to our time in Buenos Aires. This was the perfect compliment to our time in Buenos Aires. The guides were friendly and very helpful, the food even better. The day started with wine and ended with everyone on a horse involved in a group polo match (and more wine). If you're looking for a memorable, interactive experience, look no further.

just amazing!. loved it! such a perfect, relaxing day in the fields, learning, watching and even playing polo. they recieve you as you get off the bus with awesome "empanadas" and wine and then a very argentinian "asado" (bbq).the guides know everything you need to know, and they are happy to answer any kind of question you might have.pablo was the guide when i did it, and he makes you feel as a part of their family!i highly recomend this tour!

Best Part of Our Trip. Outstanding experience!! The staff is VERY kind, the horses are beautiful and well cared for, and the fields look like a postcard. Great adventure even if you have no horse riding experience. It was the most memorable part of our two weeks in Argentina. How many people can say they played polo in Argentina? I can...

Laughing the whole time. This was a truly great day. From all the good food, wine, fun games, and great instruction, I was laughing (or shouting to my "team") the whole time. The price in pesos is a bit stiff, but things with horses are always in pricey. If you have cash USD it is an excellent deal. Aside from learning a ton about the game from absolutely ground zero, our group of mixed experience was playing a full-on game by the afternoon. I loved that more experienced players joined us, to help pass to us when we were first starting, then to act as defense when we were playing, to show what kinds of things you have to watch out for in a real game. They were really good about making sure everyone was getting a chance to touch the ball or score.

Favorite activity EVER!!!. We have travelled a fare amount and done a lot of different things but this was by far the most fun I have ever had in a single day!! My husband, 21 yr old son and I were only in Buenos Aires for 1 days (in port on a cruise) and we wanted to do something memorable so we contacted Argentina Polo Day. Stefan picked us up at a hotel not far from the port and drove us 45 minutes to the ranch. We were greeted warmly then joined another group who had come out to spend the day. We were given instructions on the rules of polo then took our seats next to the field to watch a match. We got to participate by throwing in the ball and ringing the bell between chuckers (periods). While the riders were switching horses (they do this every 7 or 8 minutes) we were given shorter mallets to practice hitting the ball. This was lots of fun. We also got to talk to the players and ask them questions about their horses. The match was very competitive and exciting. Afterwards, we walked over to a several long tables that were set with platters of food down the middle. We were treated to a royal Argentine BBQ with a large variety of meats and vegetables. Since we had to leave earlier than the rest of the party to get back to our ship, Stefan came and got us suited up in our polo gear so we could start riding. Each of us was given a mount suitable to our skill level and size. For those who had not ridden before they were given instructions and time to practice. If we had ridden, we were given a mallet and sent out on the field to practice hitting balls. I love riding horses and was surprised to find that hitting a ball made it even more fun. My son, who had never ridden, had no trouble maneuvering his horse to steal my balls. Before long we had divided into teams and were playing a match. We would all very sad when the time came for us to dismount and head back to the cruise ship.  Celia was wonderful to work with. Stefan let me ride one of his own polo ponies, La Colorada. He was a delightful instructor. Pablo our guide was charming and very informative. I highly recommend this adventure to anyone headed to the Buenos Aires area. You will not be disappointed!

If you do nothing else in Buenos Aires, do the Argentine Polo Day!. The highlight of my trip to South America was the Argentina Polo Day with Celia and the rest of the staff. When I booked, I expected a relatively impersonal polo match, followed by a quick how-to for polo playing - was I ever wrong!! As soon as we arrived, we were greeted like friends, given a glass of wine and the best empanadas I've ever had. The atmosphere was warm and friendly, Celia and Pablo made us feel like family and introduced us to life in BA. After watching a fantastic polo match from the sidelines and meeting the polo players, we enjoyed a delicious BBQ with them and the staff, followed by an intro to polo playing. They gave us each a horse with a guide (if you needed one) and we spent about an hour riding around the luscious grounds getting comfortable with our horse and a mallet. Since there were only 4 'guests', they split us into 2 teams mixed in with polo players and guides and we played an actual polo match for close to an hour. I can't say enough about what a fantastic day this was...there is absolutely nothing I would change!! The food, the people, the guides, the polo playing...this will forever be one of the highlights of all my travels. If you like the outdoors, being active and seeing authentic polo playing, this is definitely a must-see and worth every penny!!Enjoy and say hi to Celia for me!Sonia Faucher (Canada)

Fun Day away from the city. We wanted to leave the city for the day and this was recommended by our concierge. We were picked up at our hotel by a car and driver (at about 11 am). I had thought it would be a bus, but it was a private car! The drive was about 45 minutes outside of Buenos Aires, up the highway, down a road and then down a dirt road! Where were we headed? There was a house where we left our stuff and met the other participants. The day was run by the English speaking manager. First there was wine/Coke and homemade empanadas. They were delicious and plentiful. He gave us some basic tips about the game of polo. We walked out to the polo field where there were chairs set up for us to watch a game and see the horses. More empanadas, more drinks! Lunch was served back by the house. All grilled-- short ribs, onions, zucchini-- all delicious. After lunch was time for us to mount the horses and try our hand at a game of polo. Fun, fun, fun! It was a warm day back to the house and there was a swimming pool. Everyone had fun. Our driver picked us up and we returned to the city (at about 7pm).If you know some Spanish try talking to the owner, Ruben. He sat under an awning drinking a beer and watching what was going on. I had a nice conversation with him, he is delightful but does not speak English.

A highlight of 3 month trip. Did it with my boyfriend, although a bit out of our travelling budget it was well worth it and great fun (1st glass of wine by 12pm :)).Pablo was a great guide, really energetic and enthusiastic and happy to give advice on other activities etc in BA. Empanadas are great. BBQ tasty but not the best steak in BA.
Nils. Best experiance so far in argentina in activites!Traveled all the way from sweden and the guide was the best around, everything was organized and good food.

Must See - Must Do Event By Buenos Aires. My son and I were in Buenos Aires for holiday and experienced Argentine Polo Day. They picked us up at our hotel in BA and took us to the farm about 45 minutes out of the city. We watched a polo match, ate, drank and then received a tremendous and unique experience of actually playing polo. After we ate some more, drank some more and swam. It was the best, must do experience in visiting BA. Yes, we were very sore the next day, but worth it. Our host, Pablo Fazzari was simply the best. A gracious host who was patient yet ensured we went away with knowledge of the King of Sports and the Sport of Kings. In the summer months remember your swim suits its a great way to recharge. 100% MUST DO!

This day made my whole holiday. What a brilliant day. Wine, wonderful people and a chance to learn polo. This day trip made my whole holiday. It was on a whim that I went and ended up having so much fun.

The surprise highlight of our trip!. My 3 girlfriends and I booked this day trip with no expectations. 2 of them were a little skeptical of the program but once we reached the "farm", we had no doubts we were going to have a great time!Before I continue about the day itself, I should mention and recognize Cecila - my contact at Argentina Polo Day. I researched and started corresponding with her several weeks before the trip and she was always prompt, courteous and concise. Her follow up was pleasant and never pushy. . . The booking process was very smooth and they delivered on every promise - Very grateful for that since not every booking experience from afar is answered or efficient!About the day. . . they picked us up from our home at precisely the time they said they would. The ride out to La Carona was nice and the countryside was a nice departure from the hustle and bustle of BA. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by the gorgeous Pablo and offered a glass of wine. We felt instantly relaxed, safe and at home!The colours and décor of the main house and surrounding farm was stunning. In the back of the house, there were tangerine trees brimming with fruit, a barbeque pit with colourful vegetables roasting and a nice long table set up for lunch. On the day we were there, there were 15 others from all over North America and it was great to meet fellow travellers!With a glass of wine in hand, we were seated and the origins and rules of Polo were explained. After this, we walked to the polo field and watched a very exciting polo match (while drinking even more wine!) Everyone really got into the game! Even though I didn't start the day as a fan of horse or polo, believe me when I say I have a huge amount of respect and love for both now!After a superb lunch of barbequed meats and vegetables and conversations with new friends, we actually got on the horses, worked on drills, and later had our own polo match (OK - so we THOUGHT we were having a match) Wow, what a work out but so much FUN! Most of us had not been on horses in decades but yet, we managed to hit the balls with our mallets and stay on the beautiful beasts! It was sad when our day ended. . . Many thanks to Pablo, a most handsome and charming facilitator! Thanks to everyone that took care of us - we know that there were many people in the background making sure every detail was perfect.If you are in BA, you must book Argentina Polo Day - You will have a great time! We are considering taking a trip back to Argentina so we can take a clinic there!

It was a nice birthday present!!!. Even I am from Argentina, our polo day at La Carona on 02Dic2013 was wonderful! It was a nice birthday present!!!
