The wonderful Rosie, who is the jewel in their crown at the moment (a young English girl who has lots of experience with horses and plays polo as well as any argentinian male), explained everything to us and helped us learn the rules of the game while watching a match between some club players which was a pretty full on passionate affair. As two girls with little or no horse riding experience it was encouraging to have rosie there to help feel less daunted by the prospect of playing polo!! Over lunch - a stream of barbecued meats and veg with plentiful wine - we got to know the family and some of their polo playing friends better and relaxed in the gorgeous surroundings. Afterwards we got kitted out ourselves and got straight on to the horses. Having never ridden in my life, Rosie made me feel totally at ease. I was initially disappointed that there were only 3 people in the group one of whom was my friend. But we got lots of attention and one of the polo players even took my camera and took lots of photos of us playing polo. We got a little instruction as to how to ride the horse but the animals are so well trained, within a few minutes we were being shown how to hit the ball. It was so much fun, although we played a limited game as my friend and I could barely get the horses to trot while the other guest was a show jumper. He was staying for 2 days to learn polo and improve his Spanish. All in all we got a bit of everything: a day out of the city, eating great food, learning about Argentinian life, watched a bit of polo and played some ourselves. Oh and all in the company of wonderful warm Argentinian people (and Rosie). We highly recommend this day!! Ps oh and if you don't want to get involved you can chill out by the pool so bring your swimming stuff!

Great day, fun yet relaxing. Really enjoyed our day, staff were really friendly and the polo was entertaining but I'm far from an expert! You can have a go yourself in the afternoon if you wish or just chill out by the pool. My husband loves steak and really enjoyed the BBQ but I'm a veggie and there wasn't much of an option for me at lunch, they could do with working on an easy veg option as it's not a cheap day!

Then do it!. A must! Best thing to do in BA and the only people in BA that didn't try to rip us off. Lots of tricky people in that town. Let's get back to the polo day. They picked myself and two friends from our hostel, we picked up other people along the way. I was a little worried that it would be lame because they picked up some unathletic types. It's about an hour outside the city. We arrived to a polo field greeted with best empanads I've eaten down in Argentina. The wine was legit too. As much as you could eat and drink. We watch a polo match, the rules were explained to us in English, but we were to busy stuffing our faces and drinking. Rueben, the owner, road over to us and said hello. He was playing in the match. After the match we went over to the farm house for an argentine BBQ. Here my friends and I ate like a fat kids in the candy store. Food was great! Talked and laughed. Chilled out for 20 min after the BBQ, then we suited up for Polo. I was wondering how it was going to go. The game or match was intense when we watched it. We are all athletic but have zero horse experience. Plus the other people that came had even less by the looks of it. They took us to a field after a short instruction on how to ride a horse, like a 30 sec on how to do it. We played with rueben and the other polo players. They helped us and played to everyone's level. I laughed so hard it hurt. Rueben is hillarious and cheats like crazy. I scored 3 goals, no big deal. Even the people that were really out of their element had a great time. One person did everything but played and she loved watching us. We played for almost 2 hours. I was tired and ready for some schlep. If I ever go back, it's a definite. The things I would do differently are bring a glove for your dominant hand that you swing the polo stick with. Like a batting glove or golf glove, wear jeans although my buddy wore board shorts, and if your have boots with a heel like cowboy boots. I wore sneakers and it worked. Just would've made riding the horse easier. The have gear but it's limited and plus it doesn't fit 3 meat head guys that well. It was awesome and well worth it. Plus I won't feel like a poser when I wear a polo shirt next time.

Great Experience. I was in town for business and decided to experience one of the famous sports of Buenos Aires during a free day....I'm so glad I did! First off, I'm afraid of horses and have never ridden one but I'm so glad I decided to do this. Everyone at the company is super nice and offered us wine/empanadas as soon as we arrived at the ranch. The next hour consisted of us watching them play competitive game of polo while teaching us rookies about the rules. The following BBQ lunch was delicious and it was fun to be able to kick back and learn more about the Argentinian culture from some true locals. We spent the last hour or so actually riding the horses and playing a "game" which must have looked ridiculous to an outsider since most of our horses were walking -- only because they knew we were beginers. The instructors were great! They were helping everyone individually and by the end of the session I was much more comforatable on a horse and really having fun. I recommend this for anyone with a spare day in Buenos Aires!!!

My Favorite Activity of my Entire Trip to Argentina. Hard to say enough good things about this....HIGHLY recommend to anyone traveling in the Buenos Aires area. The cost is $160 (at October 2011, the owners say they have to re-price things often due to persistent inflation in Argentina) which includes transportation to and from your hotel, all you want food & drinks/wine, private polo match as a spectator, one-on-one polo instruction and horse/equipment rental. They pick you up right at your hotel and the drive is about 45-60 mins with a friendly driver (if you speak a little Spanish). I knew right off the bat this was a very family-centric small business as one of our passengers was the driver's daughter. You're greeted with homemade empanadas right off the grill and a nice glass of Malbec, and after quick introductions and an explanation of the basic rules you watch a polo match between two amateur teams. The owners explain that they basically run this as a side business solely to cover the costs of team travel and caring for the horses - these guys are super passionate about polo and don't run this for a profit, just enough to allow them to keep doing what they love. After the match you have a terrific asado (grill-out/barbeque) which they try to keep feeding you until you beg them to stop. Some of the neighbors and polo players from the match joined us for lunch as well and were very friendly and happy to answer questions about polo and their country in general. After lunch you put on your equipment and get some instruction on how to ride / steer the horses and proper swinging technique. Then you're basically let loose to practice hitting the ball on the run as well as getting a good feel for your horse (its remarkably intuitive after just a few minutes, the horses are incredibly well-trained...and understanding of beginner riders). The instructors and staff ride alongside you giving tips, hitting the ball to you, etc. After about a half hour of practice you get to play your very own match on a shortened field with a mix of staff and pupils on each team. Incredibly fun and our match got pretty heated quickly, I hadn't ridden a horse in probably 10 years or ever attempted to play or watch polo and yet I got caught up in the game and immediately understood why the owners love it so much. They also run a week-long polo camp where you stay on-site which I would be sorely tempted to do if I can ever make it back for a long period of time (it also sounds like this doubles as an immersive Spanish course for those looking to improve their language skills). At the end of the day you're driven right back to your hotel....and I have been thinking about this experience ever since.
Perfect mix of relaxation, good food and wine and activity. Really great experience and absolutely worth doing!!!

Without Doubt the BEST thing to do in Buenos Aires. We were so looking forward to this most unusal experience and we were not disappointed. It was the best part of our time in Buenos Aires. We were picked up from our hotel and driven into the country. On arrival we were greeted with empanadas and drinks (the red wine was great). We then walked over to the field where chairs and unbrellas had been set up with more wine to watch a full on game of polo. The game was explained so we understood what was happening. The lack of spanish on our part and the limited english proving not to be a handicap.On completion of the game the players joined us for a great BBQ lunch. It was like having a family get together.After lunch our horses were saddled, we were padded up, handed our polo sticks and give some instructions before taking the field for our first attempts at polo. I say first because I would plan a trip to Buenos Aires just to do this day again.I would recommend anyone going to Buenos Aires to spend the day with these guys. It is absolutely brillant.

Argentinan Polo Day. This was without doubt the highlight of our stay in Buenos Aires. Collect from our hotel for an hour drive to the ranch greeted with the best red wine and meat pasties. Then sitting in the shade of unbrella watched a game of polo with our drinks and eats. This was then followed by a BBQ lunch with the players. Again brillant. After lunch it was our turn to "play" our horses were saddled and off we went for at least an hour up and down the field with a lot of help. Retruned back to the hotel. Not the cheapest activity in BA but by far the best. Although we spoke no Spainish we were mde to feel like friends not guests. Do take the insect repellent.Would certainly do this again cannot recommend highly enough

Do yourself a favour and book this if travelling to Buenos Aires. An absolutely amazing day. A friend found this a few months we visited Buenos Aires and we both held high hopes for the day. And the day didn't disappoint.Costs around USD$160 p/person for the day. This includes return transfers to your hotel, welcome glass or wine on arrival, empanadas. You meet the guys and make your way over the the polo field to watch them play some chukka's. From there you head back and have a Argentinian BBQ (a meat lovers dream) along with salad/vegetables. If like me you dont eat red meat you're in trouble however within reason email the guys and let them know any requests Im sure they will adapt if needed.After lunch you get a chance to mount a horse and under guidance they will teach you how to play polo. Im not the best person on a horse but they are really patient and give you about an hour to master the skills, and surpringsly not the hard to eventually hit the ball when on horseback.Contact Ruben who is really helpful. Google argentina polo day to find the details

An Absolute Must For A Trip to Argentina. Argentina Polo Day was by far the best experience I had during my two month stay in Buenos Aires. I had never ridden a horse before, but wanted to join some friends to travel outside of the city. We were recommended Argentina Polo Day, which ultimately surpassed all of my expectations. Travel was provided to and from the polo field, which is less than an hour from the heart of Buenos Aires. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the owners with wine and all-you-can-eat traditional Argentine empanadas. As we sipped on wine and delicious food, we listened to an introduction about the game of polo. It was not long until I was able to get on my own horse, ride her around, and then add in the polo stick to begin playing!! Having no prior experience with horses, I had never expected to be able to play. The horses were very calm and we had great instruction. After a few hours of getting acquainted, we took a long break to enjoy a classic Argentina barbecue ("asado"). It was absolutely delicious, and gave us the opportunity to get to know the rest of the group. The rest of the day consisted of more polo and horseback riding, chatting with other people in the group and the owners of Argentina Polo Day (who made the day a laid back, comfortable experience), and watching a live match! When our car arrived to pick us up in the evening, I did not want to leave! I would highly recommend this adventure to anyone visiting the greater BA area. It is an opportunity not to be missed.

Amazing authentic and unique Argentinian Experience!. Argentina Polo Day was incredible! It was one of my most memorable experiences in Argentina -- it combined polo, horseback riding, asado (BBQ), history, and a fresh breath of relief from the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires. My friends and I went on perfect Saturday. In the morning, Celia at Argentina Polo had helped arrange transportation for us from Buenos Aires to the estancia (ranch) which is about 50 minutes away from the BA city center.Once at the estancia, we were greeted personally by Celia and Ruben, the owners of the estanica. The welcomed us with freshly baked empanadas and delicious red wine and took us on a tour of their beautiful property. It was so picturesque - there were dogs, a little girl, a swimming pool, BBQ pit, and green pastures / clear blue sky...the air felt so much crisper and cleaner!!After an introduction to polo, we were soon on wards to our ridding lesson. We each got on a horse without much delay. There was a mix of different ridding levels in our group, but Ruben and his team made sure that we all felt comfortable on our horses (which were gorgeous!). They gave us tips on how to handle the horses and we were soon on our way to riding around the campo with our polo sticks. After our lesson, we headed back to the main house where an asado (BBQ) was being cooked for us on the outdoor grill. It smelled and tasted delicious! For the vegetarians in our group, there was also a great salad and freshly grilled vegetables.Overall, it was not only an incredibly relaxing day, but also one where I also felt that I learned something and did something truly unique "Argentinian". I would wholeheartedly recommend this, and have already been doing so with all my friends who are going to BA!

Great atmosphere and one of the must do things in Argentina. I read recommendation on Trip Advisor and took the advice. There were 4 of us visiting the ranch and it was great. A loot of very good food, we got an opportunity to watch British team play with Argentinians which was fun. Trying to play stick-and-ball was very cool too. I would have liked it to last longer to be fair but we spent all the day at the ranch anyway;-)Just one notice - if there are any vegetarians amongst you, make sure you communicate it very clearly, so that they are not presented with only meat options;-)

I had no idea Polo could be so interesting! - An alternative a regular picnic. During a recent business trip to Buenos Aires, I decided to stay one extra week-end to travel a bit outside the city (there are just so many times you can visit the same spots). A friend who is knowledgeable about Polo invited me to the Argentina Polo Day. It was a GREAT experience.... I am no connoisseur of Polo, so I wouldn't know how this compares to other places, but the opportunity to learn about the sport, have a great day on the outdoors and really have no pressure or rush. Plus the food ("asado") is to die for!I knew Argentina had interest in Polo, but I had no idea about the importance it has or the passions it creates among Argentinians. It is definitely embedded in their culture.At the end of the day, riding a horse around the fields and enjoying "La Pampa" is just great!

Parks & Plaza Tour - Fantastic!. I had a great tour with Rodrigruo. He was energetic, funny, extremely knowledgeable and informative...especially as he's been a world traveler and a student of political science. His insights are great. The bike was very comfortable, the ride easy, and lunch (included in the price) was at an excellent local restaurant. I highly recommend doing this as a great way to see and learn about parts of the city.

Best way to experience BA. Our guide Raymond made this 5+ hour tour really interesting. A lot of stories with some laughs and a great sandwich for lunch. We learned a lot about the city and its history even if we only toured around 3 neighborhoods. This bike tour is really a unique way (also the best way) to explore the city. We highly recommend it.

BA Bike Tour. Excellent tour of significant cultural and historical points of interest in this magnificent city. We signed up for the ultimate BA bike tour, and by luck, there were only two of us. We ended up having a private, intimate tour. Rodrigo was our guide. He helped design the tour. We got to visit fascinating neighborhoods and hear the historical perspective of a native Argentine. Rodrigo knows everything about the city, but he also delves into the lesser known historical events that play a major part in understanding the psyche of this country. It was the highlight of our days in Buenos Aires and set the foundation for the rest of our trip. Thanks again for this wonderful experience.

Biking with Biking Buenos Aires. I have done bike rides like this in Zagreb, Belgrade, Bogota and other places and this was one of the best. Santiago gave us a great introduction to Argentine history and culture and Lorenzo? was great at making sure there were no problems with traffic. It was so nice to see these parts of Buenos Aires on bike with an intelligent and interesting guide.
Fantastic tour. What a great way to see Buenos Aires! Our guide Ray was very informative and entertaining. The pace of the day was spot on and all the main sights covered. The lunch was delicious.

Que Bueno!. I did the all-city tour. Saw so much and learned so much about the city and nation. Our guide Santiago was very knowledgeable, experienced, and answered all my questions. What a perfect way to see Buenos Aires. The city is very flat, so there was no strenuous riding. And it would be impossible to see all the same things by bus, subway, car, or walking in the same time.

Awesome Day Out. Just spent 7 hours seeing and learning about Buenos Aires. This is the BEST way to experience a city, lots of interesting information about all facets of the area including history of the area and significance of the places we visited. Throw in some indigenous experiences, great lunch, fun hosts, comfortable bikes and you have an awesome day. Thanks to Kay & Sebastian, for looking after us. GEOFF AND LINDA.

Excellent!. As a student / scholar (15 yeas old) it was an amazing experience. Guide was funny and knowledgeable. Was great fun and way to learn the city. I learnt so much about Buenos Aires and its history on the tour. Excellent!

Great way to explore the city! Such Fun. BBA was a fantastic way to see the city. We got to explore all the major neighborhoods, had a very chill picnic lunch by the water and get all the inside details on the ins and outs of the official and unoffical history of the city. It turns out the day I went , no one else had signed up so I had a one on one with Ray and he was so funny and informative. And also gave me plenty of tips of where to go or eat in the city the rest of my time here. I totally recommend this to anyone, especially at the start of your trip to BA. Worth every penny!

Best way to see BA!. I had a great tour (graffitimundo). My guide Marcelo was so knowledgeable that I got a lesson in Argentine history,a lesson in art history, a tour of 3 neighbourhoods and a bicycle tour. It was a wonderful 4 hours. Terrific value for money!! It is sooo much nicer seeing art outside and from a bike rather than driving around or going inside to a gallery. I would highly recommend this. In addition, you get to go to Barracas where it is difficult to go as a tourist alone. Some of the best art is there.

Great way to explore the city and exercise!. I always look for biking tours when I am traveling - you can make the most of your time visiting several places and at the same time exercise. Rodrigo was a great guide and lunch was included - amazing empanadas!

Excellent Bike Tour - Well worth it!. My friend and I did the All-Day, All-Inclusive, All-City Bike tour of Buenos Aires with our guide Marcelo. We have done a number of city bike tours around the world and this is by far the best bike tour we have be on. Marcelo was an excellent guide with extensive knowledge about the city and it's history. Even though I have been to Buenos Aires before and have participated in a tour, I came away from this tour with a much better understanding of the history of the city, the different neighbourhoods and Argentina as a whole. Marcelo was also extremely friendly and helpful and was keen to answer any questions you had. The lunch stop was a delightful surprise. We stopped at a Parilla food truck and had the most delicious bbq pork and beef sandwiches which you dressed from a mind boggling selection of toppings and condiments. Both delicious and satisfying (we couldn't eat the whole thing!). The bike riding was done at a leisurely pace on flat terrain. While the streets of BA can be very busy and the driver's at times erratic, Marcelo was very conscious of keeping the group safe. The bike's themselves were in great condition and we were provided with a helmet (mandatory) and complimentary full water bottle. I would highly recommend this bike tour as it is a fun, interactive, leisurely way to explore Buenos Aires.
Awesome day with Kaylee Anne . Great time and very informative. KalyleeAnne, our guide was terrific. I highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires.
Awesome. Had an ace day with Rodrigo, our favourite day in BA. Learned loads and got a real sense of the city. Highly, highly recommend. Thanks Rodrigo!

Absolutely recommended. Despite the pouring rain, we had a great day with Rodri, who made our stay in Buenos Aires memorable! He's got outstanding story telling skills and is very knowledgeable about the city's hidden and less hidden gems.We not only got to see most of what the city has to offer during the ultimate city bike tour that we had but also went off the beaten track.Absolutely recommended.Thanks once again for that lovely day!Hicham & Issam from Morocco

Kirsten. I was in Argentina for two weeks and learned so much about history in the time I spent with Marcelo on the bike tour. We saw awesome murals and it was unlike any other tour I have ever been on. It rained on our tour, but the bikes were well equipped for rain!

Heart of the City Buenos Aires bike tour. Great 5+ hour bike tour of SAN Telmo, la Boca, Puerto Madero and Plaza de Mayo with our guide, Kaylee. Knowledgeable, safety conscious, articulate in English and Spanish, enthusiastic, with a good sense of humor and obvious affection for her adopted city.Bikes are 3-speed California cruisers. Well maintained. Ponchos supplied as we rode in the rain for the first 3 hours taking shelter at points of interest. Sunshine broke out for the final parts of the tour. Kaylee introduced us to the finer points of the Yerba Mate ritual. We also enjoyed gargantuan sandwiches from a food truck in the Puerto Madero district. Great bike and learn experience for those who like to explore parts of a new city on 2 wheels.

The Ultimate Full City Tour was 7 hours of fun!. We had a great day with the group. We learned a lot about the city and Rodrigo's story telling brought the history of Buenos Aires to life. We took the Ultimate Full City Tour which was 7 hours long and the day just flew by, it was so interesting. The bikes were in great shape, the riding was easy and we used bike lanes for part of the tour. We saw many diverse locations in the city from La Boca to Puerto Madero to Recoleta. And the Bondiola lunch (included in the price) at Parrilla Mi Sueno was fantastic! Thanks to the very friendly staff and guides, this was a super way to kick off our visit to Buenos Aires.

Excellent city tour. Our guide, Santiago, was fantastic. Very knowledgable about the city's history and he taught is a lot about BA and Argentina as well. Surprisingly, there are bike lanes in many areas of the city. We went from San Telmo (the office) to La Boca, then to the Ecological Reserve, had lunch (included in the $60 US dollars per person), by the government offices, then back to the office. Trip was ~5 hours long. Highly recommend this company.

The perfect way to see BA. My kids and I did the full experience one day and the graffiti tour the following. This is the best way to see this city. The guides are great value, entertaining us with Argentinian anecdotes and stories from the history of BA. We all loved it. Getting around on bike avoids the traffic as there are good bike paths, I felt like I had a grasp of the layout and character of each district in the city. I would recommend this experience to anyone who gets hives from bus tours and tour guides with flags! Such fun!

BBA is the best way to spend a day in BA! 🚲. My boyfriend and I took the ultimate city tour with Marcelo and it was great!!! Totally would recommend this bike tour while visiting Buenos Aires. We took the tour on the first day of our stay in BA which gave us a day of exploring so we could figure out which areas we wanted to explore later. The tour includes an awesome lunch at a food truck in Puerto Madero. I am vegetarian and they had a veggie option which was awesome! The tour also included mate (a popular tea) which was cool because we had been wanting to try it! The tour provided a bunch of great facts and history about Argentina. Marcelo was a great guide!!! He was extremely knowledgeable about the local culture but also kept the topics light with some fun jokes too. The bikes were super nice and comfortable. It rained during our trip but BBA was prepared and had ponchos for all of us. This was a great tour and well worth the money.

Ultimate city tour. Tour was great. Guide (kaylee) was really knowledgeable and fun to hangout with.I learned alot about the argentine history and definitely git mire than what i asked for. Definitely a recommended tour; Be prepared to ride all day.

Heart of the City tour was awesome!. My wife and I booked the Heart of the City (~5hr tour) about a week or two ahead of our trip to Buenos Aires. I highly recommend you do this tour on your first day in the city. It will give you a ton of perspective/direction/history in regards to the city. We took what we learned on day 1 from this tour and it made the next 7 days that much more valuable of an experience. Our guide, Rodrigo, did an amazing job with a full circle story about the history of the city and we felt like we got a true local's perspective. He offered tons of recommendations for night life/restaurants/pub crawls etc. All of which we took advantage of and loved. Lunch was awesome as well! Nom Nom. The ride was fun, not physically demanding as the city is flat. No complaints about the bikes whatsoever. Our group was small too, so plenty of opportunity to ask all the random questions about other aspects of our trip. We will definitely recommend to all of our friends.

Highlight of Trip to Buenos Aires!. I had a rough morning where I ended up losing my debit card at an ATM and arrived late because of the whole ordeal. It was an overcast weekday, so I arrived late expecting the tour to have already gone, but someone had waited behind for me. I ended up being able to get a private tour (light rain must have scared other tourists away), that highlighted things that peaked my interests (economics, politics, art, food, and of course fútbol), all while making a pit stop at the bank where the fatal morning ATM was located to recover my long, lost debit card. Anne was a great guide and a great ambassador of the Argentinian culture!!! She even gave me recommendations on what to do after the tour and during my trip to Chile! We had a typical lunch, maté, all while learning and biking around Buenos Aires. This tour is by far the best way to see all of Buenos Aires! Thanks so much!

Fast, Beautifull time biking in Bs As. With a wonderfull climate, rather chaothic traffic, it is a very good means to take a look at the city, specially the gardens, (Palermo, Belgrano, ) or even downtown SuipachaTake care to rent a helmet, and to tie your bike when stopping, or even better, all parkings are legally enforced to park your bike, so I could go arround stopping whenever I found anything attractive

Ultimate city tour, 7 hpurs. It was a fantastic day... We learned and saw a lot of the city. Our guides Raymond and Sebastian were wonderful. You need to be comfortable biking in the city. I strongly recommend.

LOVED our tour!. We went on the Parks and Plazas signature tour with Santiago. Not only was Santiago an AMAZING guide, but we got some exercise and got to enjoy the city from a whole new perspective. The pace was leisurely, even even after arriving in BA at 6am after a 9 hour overnight flight, we easily kept up. Santiago was so sweet and friendly, we felt like we were going for a bike ride with an old friend. Highly recommend this your for seeing some of the city highlights and also some of the beautiful scenery you might otherwise bypass!
Beyond expectation. A great option to know Buenos Aires and their stories from the point of view of the local residents.

Great tour, good information. Great guides with good historical information and good mate as well! It's been a while so I don't quite remember all the details, but I remember having a wonderful time biking through Buenos.

Great way to see Buenos Aires. The Ultimate City bike tour is a great way to see the city in a day. The tour is not too tiring, only need a moderate level of fitness.Guides were great, lunch was delicious, highly recommended!

Ruta 40 and City Biking Tour. We enjoyed both the Ruta 40 wine tasting with Kaylee and the city biking tour with Marcelo. The wine tasting is a great value and lots of fun. We had 3 different Argentinian wines paired with foods and an apéritif. It is very relaxed and a fun way to learn about Argentinian wines. The city biking tour with Marcelo was lots of fun. We traveled to many of the major landmarks of the southern and central portions of Buenos Aires (La Boca, San Telmo, Puerto Madero, and Plaza de Mayo) and had lunch at food trucks in Puerto Madero. Although you would not think that Buenos Aires is a biking-friendly city, Biking Buenos Aires does a great job of navigating the city on bike in a non-intimidating way. Marcelo had a great command of the history of the city. We enjoyed this tour.

AMAZING TOUR!!! AMAZING GUIDES!!!. Do this tour!!!!I was a bit skeptical about how much I would learn on this tour since I had already spent several months in BA, but I LOVED it and really learned a lot! It visits a bunch of the most famous areas and does a really good job explaining the history behind them and generally tying them in with the history of the city/country/region. Even though I had already visited most of the places, I still learned new information and experienced them in a new way. The tour struck the perfect balance of biking around, learning history, and free time to explore on our own. The bikes themselves were nice, with really comfortable seats and good suspension. The helmets they provide kind of look like polo helmets with various fabric coverings, which made me feel slightly better about the whole group tour, matching bikes thing. But the best part about the tour by far is the guides and the level of enthusiasm and professionalism they bring to it. Marcelo, Pepe y Renzo were so great!Marcelo began the tour by showing us where we would be going and what to expect. He got us interested in the information by giving us a little snippet of what we would be learning about in each place (e.g. "Here I will show you why the Reserva was a happy accident..."). He clearly knew a ton about Argentine history and was super funny and entertaining! During the tour, we always felt safe because Pep and Renzo would literally block traffic and make sure to put themselves between us and any car that might potentially be headed our way. They also went ahead of us to the lunch location to save us all seats! Lunch was a stop at a food truck, where we sat outside at tables and enjoyed a view of the natural reserve (do yourself a favor and get the sandwich they recommend -- its amazing!).Here is a real illustration of how great these guys are --- after lunch I (stupidly!) left my purse hanging on the chair. Luckily because the tour is so well organized, they had arranged for the next tour to come take our spot at the lunch place. So when I realized what I had done, Renzo just messaged the other group and had them bring my bag back to the office with them. Crisis averted! At the end of the tour, Marcelo followed up with the whole group via email to give us recommendations and advice for further exploring, including specific things we had asked about on the tour. All in all, a great way to explore BA, meet good people, and have a really fun time!
Great way to spend a spring day. I had a great day seeing BA without Marcello, Pepe, and the third guide. They kept us informed, fed, and safe from traffic. Highly recommended.

Fantastic Day Out!. Superb day out with the informative and entertaining Marcelo, Lorenzo and Pepe.All have detailed knowledge of the city and speak excellent English.Did the 'ultimate city tour' which took us 7 hours and covered all the best spots in Buenos Aires, with lunch included and plenty of opportunities to stop and take photos!
Full of rich culture, wonderful sites. Santiago was a wonderful host/guide, very enlightening on history, kind (he shared his mate) and looked out for our safety on the trip! We had a splendid time.

Best way to see the sights of BA. Saw all the main sites in my 7 hour bike tour, such an easy and relaxing way too see the city! Ray was a great tour guide and was a very knowledgable too ! Would highly recommend if you have limited time but still want to soak of the atmosphere of this awesome city

Best decision I made in BA!. By far the best way to explore the city and these guys know how to host a great tour. Our tour guide, Ray Ray, was knowledgeable and an awesome guy to be around. They are focused on getting you around safely and it truly is an experience not to be missed.

Excellent biking tour of Buenos Aires!. Heart of the City tourDespite the crazy winds & occasional rain rain, this was a fantastic tour of Buenos Aires.Marcelo our tour guide was awesome, incredibly informative, and we like how he linked everything together creating a historical picture of the city.It was a great way to see a lot of the city in 5 hours, and the story telling brought everything to life.Thanks Biking Buenos Aires :)

Amazing Tour of Buenos Aires. We were only in Buenos Aires for 3 days and we did the Biking Buenos Aires on the first day we were there. It was an amazing experience and it really set the tone for our trip. We did the half day tour and it went from 11 to 430 PMET. We saw everything in San Telmo which was great and we also learned a lot about Buenos Aires. Our tour guides were great and spoke great English. It was also nice to see the neighborhood of Puerto Madero we probably would have not gone there if we didn't do this tour. This is a must do activity for Buenos Aires better than a bus tour.

Great day (even with rain). Our objective for a full day, private, ultimate city tour, was to understand more about BA, Argentina, and South America in general, (and at the same time get some exercise). We had a great day. We felt very safe, and had excellent conversations and discussions with Marcelo, who is extremely knowledgable, and very pleasant. An excellent experience!!!!!

A fantastic and fun way to see the City. Myself and a couple of friends decided to take the "Heart of the City" tour while in town for short business trip. I have been to Buenos Aires once before and had taken an organised bus tour of the city but as the weather was so good for this trip I decided to take a cycle tour this time. Without a doubt this is the best way to see and experience the city. Our guides Marcelo and Sebastian were friendly, informative and entertaining, taking time to explain the history of each area we visited with the perfect mix of information and humour. They took their time to answer any of the many questions we all had about this fascinating city and made sure that we cycled in comfort and safety, even supplying sunscreen and insect repellant. Because of their friendly approach the group (which as well as us included 3 couples from across the globe) all had a great time and bonded over a traditional lunch then on the lawns outside Casa Rosada drinking mate. I would wholeheartedly recommend this as a perfect way to see and learn about this beautiful city and if we had more time here would be keen to experience one of their other tours.

Great experience!. Me and my friends did the Heart of the City tour with Anne as our guide. Had a great time seeing the city in a different way and learning about the history and culture. Anne was very knowledgeable and friendly. The rest of the staff was friendly and helpful as well and had towels and tea ready when we returned after a cold and rainy finish to the tour.

Great day with BIking BA. We had a fantastic day with biking BA. We saw so much of the city, the bikes were top notch and all our guides, Marcello, Santiago, and Sebastian were friendly and helpful. BA is a busy city and we were a big group but they handled the logistics, the traffic and the tour information really well. We are booking another trip with them this week. Thanks so much Biking BA!

Great bike trip!. My girlfriend and I did the heart of the city tour today (Saturday 9th September 2016). Signed up online and went down to meet the meeting point. Nine of us on the trip, but they had three "guides" which was really good level of service and they were all great - really good local knowledge. Great way to see the city on our first day here. Would highly recommend. Thanks Marcelo and Sebastian!

Urban graffiti tour was the best. I tried out the new graffiti tour that the biking BA guys offer and throughly enjoyed it. You go completely off the tourist route to discover some the of best murals and graffiti that la boca and barracas has to offer. Our host Raymondo was great, very knowledgable, friendly and funny. 3 thumbs up

Winter Ride. I really enjoy biking new cities and Buenos Aires surprised me a lot. The bike culture is growing a lot and you can find the paths for riding the bikes. Main spots are San Telmo, La Boca, Puerto Madero & Recoleta. I recommend having the private tour.

Expensive but a great way to see the city!. This is an amazing way to see the city in a short space of space. This tour takes you to all of the main spots all in one day whilst learning a lot about them.The retro bikes and decorated helmets are a lovely twist and the small group size really helped us to enjoy our experienceLunch was absolutely fantastic and the chance to have a cup of tea and a alfajores (argentine biscuit) when we returned after a full day biking through the city was perfect.Our guide was Ray-Ray, he was good fun and kept us all safe. The night after the tour we even received a group email from him with lists of good restaurants, night-life spots etc that we had discussed on the tour. We felt that for a biking tour this was quite pricey but then again we had a fantastic day, exploring all that we wanted in the city with an informative guide.

Great Day!. Thanks to Rodrigo for this great 7hour tour full of history, insights, recommendations, jokes, tasty lunch ... An absolute recommendation for getting to know the city in a sporty, convenient way!

Excellent tour of BA. Rodrigo was an excellent guide for our tour by bike in BA. We saw all the high points, tried mate and had a delicious lunch from a food truck in Puerto Madero. I would recommend this as a great way to see a lot of sites in one day. The biking was very safe and comfortable.

Fantastic way to see the city!. A group of us were lucky enough to go on a tour with Biking Buenos Aires while we were visiting last week. It was such a fun way to see different parts of the city while learning about the history and culture of Buenos Aires as well. I'd highly recommend this as a must-do activity for a visit to Buenos Aires!

Learn about the city while seeing a good part of it. Amazing full day bike tour! I was lucky enough to be the only one on the ride, and my guide (Marcelo) was absolutely great. He was very personable, shared some of his life with me, and gave very interesting and complete information about Argentina's history with some commentary. So, I learned a ton and had a great time doing it.Also, I got a wealth of detailed, CUSTOM information about what I should do in Buenos Aires while here from Kaylee via their newly started concierge service. I got great ideas I hadn't discovered with days of research, based on what I was interested in. It saved a ton of research time. Overall, great company, great people! One of the best choices I made. I recommend you do this early in your trip, as it will inform and enhance the rest.

Awesome bike tour of Buenos Aires. There is no way you could have more fun and learn more about both past and present Buenos Aires and Argentina than by going on this bike tour (I did the ultimate city tour). Learn about history, the economy, the politics, the food, the culture all while touring around this beautiful city with its many parks and plazas. Your man is Ray - he has encyclopedic knowledge of this place, its people, its traditions (like maté tea) with a wry, dry sense of humor and that twinkle in his eye that says "today's going to be an adventure" :-). The other staff were lovely as well and, even though I made an early morning decision to switch days, they sorted it out for me straightaway.Highly recommended!
Ask for the Ruta 40!. Can't say enough great things about Kaylee, Jonah, and the rest of the Biking Buenos Aires team... this is definitely not a place to miss when you're in town.

BA in a Day. I had just one full day in BA recently - its a huge city so I booked an all day tour (10am to 5pm) with Biking BA to fit in as much as I could. Rodrigo was my guide for the day, and the way it worked out I was the only guest on this particular tour. He was great from start to finish - we saw the colours of La Boca, I got an excellent overview of the history of BA and Argentina as we cycled, stopped off to admire the amazing and varied architecture, shared a Mate tea and had a great lunch. I think we covered about 26kms over the day so not overly strenuous, and I really felt like I saw a huge amount of BA that i would have otherwise missed. Great tour, great guide and really well organised. Thank you!

Great tour!. I really enjoyed my city tour with Marcelo! He showed us many highlights of the city and took the time to tell us the history and interesting stories about each place. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting BA!

Excellent tour. Perfect for first time visitors . I had a great time during the 5-hour bike tour. It started at the well located shop where Santiago gave me a quick overview of the city, its history and points of interest. We biked through San Telmo, la Boca, Caminito and Puerto Madero, where we had a great lunch (included in the price of the tour) and I ended my trip going to the mercado of San Telmo (right next door to the shop) what a great time! Highly recommended.

Fun, informative, interactive tour. I signed up for the Ultimate City Bike tour as a way to learn more about the city and history of Buenos Aires. It was a great decision. Granted, we had pretty much perfect weather (~60-65F/15-18C and sunny), but I think even if the weather weren't great it would still have been a lot of fun. We had a group of seven riders and two guides and did a very comprehensive tour of San Telmo, La Boca, Puerto Madero, a bit of Retiro, Recoleta, and Microcentro. Along the way we learned a mix of history old and new, something about the politics of Argentina, a lot of cultural information explaining how Argentina and Buenos Aires have become the distinct places they are today (Tango! Immigration! Dictatorships!), and how to properly have mate. Our guides were extremely friendly and helpful and watched us like hawks as we navigated the streets of Buenos Aires. And they gave us time to explore different areas on foot along the way. Combine all that with some great exercise, especially needed after the delicious lunch at a food truck in Puerto Madero, and it made for a pretty perfect day.

You need to do this. Did the Ultimate BA Biking Tour with my wife and grown son. It was a perfect way to get to know the diverse attractions and history of the city in a short time. There is so much to see and learn and being on bikes makes the city so accessible that you really get the feel of the neighborhoods. The ride was relatively flat and Kaylee and Jonathan kept us safe. And they gave us lots of ideas to explore for the rest of our trip. I'd highly recommend you do this early in your trip to help you plan where to spend the rest of your time.

Amazing Time w Biking Buenos Aires!. I had the best time with Marcelo! It was just him and I on the tour and it was one of my favorite days. He was super knowledgeable about the history and all the sites and mostly just enjoyable to hang with. I would definitely recommend Biking Buenos Aires and Marcelo to everyone.

Best Trip Ever!. This was by far the top activity we did in BA. The staff was very nice and provided a great insight to the culture and history of the city. With the land being flat, the route is ideal for beginners and families. If you are in BA, this is a must!

Fabulosa. What a beautiful and fun way to explore Los Bosques de Palermo y El Parque Rosedal! Our guide was so sweet and knew so much about the areas we explored. We all received authentic Spanish names before we left, shared yerba mate with the locals and received a special postre at the end! It was around 3 areas long, the perfect amount of time!

Fabulous day biking the the BA!. We had a fantastic day biking with Kaylee thru the streets of BA! We learned so much as well as enjoying the weather and the scenery. It was a great fun way to see the city through a different perspective. Kaylee was fun and very knowledgable. We visited about 5 sites and comfortably rode 17miles and found t believe it!! They use beach cruisers and it is leisurely, you don't have to be in the best of shape to do it although it feels great if you enjoy biking!! Definitely recommend this for a great day in Buenos Aires!!

Perfecto. My 13 year old and I did this tour with Rodrigo and Renzo and it was phenomenal. We learned so much and I was astounded with the guide's grasp on history and world affairs. Truly outstanding and exceeded my expectations.

Great way to see the city. I truly enjoyed seeing parts of the city I would not have explored. Beautiful day, fascinating city, and Rodrigo and Renzo (sorry if I spelt your names incorrectly) made it extra special with commentary on the history and evolution of the unique BA culture. Heart of the City was manageable even for those of us in our fifties, and the food truck lunch made for a tasty break. Strongly recommended for any visitor to the city.

Best tour ever. Thank you BBA for a fantastic tour. We feel we saw the real Buenos Aries and learnt so much about the history of the Argentina. The areas we biked through were so diverse it's hard to believe we were just in a small part of the city The biking was easy and good to get some exercise as well as seeing the sights. The steak sandwich from the food truck u provided hit the spot. We recommend this to all ages as a great way to see and understand the history of the city.

Amezing . If you want to see Buenos Aires on a good way is this the place to be. We had the tour for 7 hours but it is very relax. Very good englisch is spoken and you definitly see all the highlights. Very wonderfull to do and very nice and good company with very good bikes and fancy helmets

"An amazing tour and an excelent overview of the city". My husband and I took the "Ultimate Buenos Aires Biking Tour" and just loved it! We strongly recommend it to everyone. Our tour guide was Marcelo who was great and shared with us all his knowledge about the history of the city. Thanks for everything! We will be back soon!Saludos, Priscila & Wendell

Best part of our trip. My review in a nutshell: The absolute best activity you MUST do in Buenos Aires, this company is THE BEST. (Local tour guide: Santi, is EXCELLENT, speaks great English, and pretty much knows EVERYTHING). I'm 28 years old and was with my girlfriend, but the tour had 4 other people ranging from 22-60 years old, and everyone LOVED it.I highly recommend doing one of these tours. We did the Heart of the City Tour, which lasted 5 hours. I think that it is the perfect amount of time, and you get to see a lot of different parts of Buenos Aires, allowing you to soak in the culture. What makes this tour exceptional are the guides; they are SO nice, cool, and knowledgeable. They make the tour educational and fun at the same time. I really don't think there's a better way to explore this city. Just going to major landmarks would only give you a small feel for their culture. Having a local guide paint a beautiful picture of the history of Buenos Aires during your tour allows you to have a true appreciation of the city.You get a lot of biking breaks, and the terrain is pretty flat so it's an easy bike ride. By the end of the day, you feel like you've done a lot, but it's not very strenuous at all. All of the drivers in the city are very respectful of bikers, making the tour very pleasant (and there are lots of bike lanes). If you are still reading this, stop right now and book a tour with Santi (our tour guide) already, I guarantee you will be so happy you did.

Very welcoming & just enough time to see the city.. My first day in BA and this was perfect to get my bearings. Perfect English spoken by staff & so welcoming you'd think you knew them for years! Recommended for everyone wanting a taste of the city with a very good guide.

Biking Buenos Aires - The only way to go !. Fantastic experience of sight seeing Buenos Aires at ground level, absorbing all the senses which can't be captured by a bus tour. Leasurely pace with friendly, superb tour guide "Kaylee Anne" made everything fun and very interesting, incorporating history and culture of the sights we encountered, after which we felt confident in exploring this beautiful city on our own as everything became more familiar. Highly recommended...

Great way to get to know the city!. Excellent way of getting to know and understand the city. The tour guides were so kind and clear in explaining everything, very easy to get along with them. They are patient and go to your pace, highly recommended!

Must do!. This was the perfect way to see and learn about the entire city of Buenos Aires. I did the Ultimate Bike Tour (N&S) and had a full day of amazing adventures, despite light rain in the afternoon which didnt take away from the experience at all. Kaylee was an amazing guide and also helped me through their conceirage service with recommendations for the remainder of my stay in BA. She went put of her way to my trip a memorable one.HIGHLY recommended to anyone visiting BA, and go towards the early part of your trip to maximize what you can do/experience here.

Best way to see the city!! . Best part of my trip! Was the best way to see and learn about the city! All of the tour guides were amazing, Renzo, Marcelo and Santiago were helpful and made everything exciting and fun! I highly recommend this tour to anyone travelling to buenos aires!

Awesome!!!. It was sooo much fun! I am a pretty nervous bike rider but I felt very taken care of on this tour. I learned a lot while exercising, learning, and having a great time. Marcello, Renzo, and Santiago were very friendly, hilarious, and made the tour very entertaining. I felt very safe with them and would 100% do this again!

We did it!. We were two older women wanting a close-up view of the city. The day was cloudy when we started our tour, so Luke, our guide, gave us rain gear and warm scarves, head wraps, gloves and helmets. He carefully adjusted the bikes and gave us plastic seat covers, just in case. Well it ended up raining most of the day, but we powered through and had a great time. For lunch we stopped at a local restaurant for some yummy entrees, then continued on in the rain. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and accommodating and took great care to see that we were doing ok. Once, something blew out of my bike basket. I had to go back after it, and then I got stuck at a red light, separating me from the others. As soon as Luke realized this he circled back to make sure I was ok. At one rest break he fixed us a traditional hot tea drink, and at the end of the tour, when we were wet and cold, he fixed us hot tea and gave us Argentinian cookies and candies for a treat. We had a terrific time!

Best way to see Buenos Aires by far. What a fabulous trip! Luke was my guide and what he doesn't know about this great city isn't worth knowing. The pace was perfect, you get to see so much more of the city and the insights into the history brings the place to life. I took the full day tour which if you have the time is highly recommended. I truly could not fault the trip. As BA is so flat it wasn't arduous and lunch, described as a sandwich, sufficed for dinner as well! My only regret was I was here in winter; in spring or summer the city must be wonderful. Thank you to the team, who all made this a great day.

Great tour!!!. Marcelo and Santiago were great guides. First time to Buenos Aires. Quite a large city and biking was a great way to get around and see it. We learned information about the city and its history and got a snapshot of the best parts to see. Now we know where we want to go back and spend more time and have some knowledge on where and why things are they way they are.The guides also gave us a bunch of information after the tour on the best local bars, restaurants and coffee for us to test out before we leave.Highly recommended. Thanks Marcelo and Santiago and the guys from biking Buenos Aires!

What a great day. I did this tour with my partner and it is one of the best things we have done in Buenos Aires. Our guide, Marcelo, was interesting and entertaining, and he kept us keen to learn more about the city as we travelled through. We learnt a lot about the history of Buenos Aires from its founding (indeed, both of them) through to the present day and current culture. We also received a lot of recommendations for what to do in our remaining time, which has proved invaluable to planning the remainder of our trip. Having never done a city tour by bicycle this was an amazing experience and has made me keen to try this kind of tour again in another city.
City Tour. Awesome tour! Best way to get in touch with the city and its history. The guides are not only friendly, but know how to explore the city in a interesting way. A must do in B.A.!

Fun and Safe. What else to say, been to a few bike tour, but the charisma of the staff and the way they have you for the tour it's incredible, me and a friend did the graffiti tour, Santiago and Raymon took us in a small group making all the explanations of each detail, it was a great afternoon, had a lot of fun , we went to places off the tourist trap areas, which was awesome to see the city from a different point of view, thank you guys , as a expat living in the city, no words to describe the knowledge and quality of this tour, will do it again for sure.

Really Fun Bike Tour Of Buenos Aires. We went on the Heart of the City tour through the south of Buenos Aires and had a really great time. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgable and the tour itself went through a lot of interesting places, including La Boca, where I would be a bit nervous about going without a guide. From the initial meeting where they gave us tea and a quick history lesson about Buenos Aires to the cup of Mate they gave us in El Camino, they were very welcoming. Would definitely recommend.

Awesome tour, great fun and super informative. Great way to see the city!. I have done a number of different city tours here in Buenos Aires, but this one was by far the best. Biking is a great way to see the city in a short time - you get to see so much more on street level than you would with a regular tour. Buenos Aires Biking provided everything from stylish helmets, right down to water and gloves (it was freezing). Our guides, Kaylee and Marcelo, were super friendly and super knowledgable about the city. They did everything they could to make the tour unique, fun and safe. I learned so much about this crazy city. Thanks guys! Highly recommended!

Great tour!. We did the ultimate city bike tour, it was awesome! Since the weather wasn't great, it was only the two of us and Santiago. He was a fantastic guide! It was really interesting learning about the history of the city. The ultimate bike tour gave us the opportunity to see all the cool places in Buenos Aires that we wouldn't otherwise have time to check-out.

Took the South tour. Really enjoyed it even though it was middle of winter - don't let the time of year stop you. Fun guides, good bikes, and some fascinating insights into the real history of BA and its people.

Fantastic! Best Way to See the City!. This company and the 7 hour city tour are the best! We opted for the private tour for an extra $35 and we liked having our own guide. Our guide was Anné from Guatamela. She was friendly, upbeat, knew a lot about Argentine history and made the tour really interesting.The tour goes at a nice pace and the bike riding is quite easy. You stop for lunch and because our tour was private, we were able to tour the futbol stadium as well.I highly recommend this tour and this company. They also have Kaylee, a free concierge who has made great recommendations for our stay here. She has been better than our concierge at the Four Seasons!Thanks Biking BA!

AWESOME Secret Graffiti and Urban Art Tour!. I took the Secret Graffiti and Urban Art Tour with Ray Ray in early June and I must say I was thoroughly impressed with the over all experience. I've lived in NYC for almost 10 years now and fell in love with street art while living here. It was my first time in Argentina so I was both excited and happy to see there was so much street art when I arrived and I was even happier to discover there was an actual bike tour around the city to show and explain the history behind each piece. RayRay was great from start to finish- he was polite, friendly, informative and even invited me for a drink afterwards for a "chili-bomb," all of which made the day AWESOME. He also followed up with me via email on all the different pieces we saw that day- artist, background, location, etc. That too, was also much appreciated! If you love art when i'm back in a few months I plan on taking the northern Graffiti bike tour. Overall it was a great experience which I highly recommend it.

The best way to tour around Buenos Aires!. It was awesome to ride the bike around the city + get to know the history of the city and its tourist attractions + take great pictures. And the weather helped a lot, cause it was a beautiful and shiny sunny day. This tour was one of the best things I did during my one week trip. I really recommend it!

A brilliant introduction to the vibrant city that is Buenos Aires. This my and my two sisters first visit to any South American country and what a fantastic way to be introduced to such a special city as with the Ultimate City tour.Our guides Raymond and Renzo were informative and fun. Fellow Kiwi Raymond is so well versed in the city's history and culture. He did guarantee us that at least 95% of all he told us was true!The frantic pace of the city traffic was hairy to say the least but Buenos Aires has a great network of bicycle lanes. Not once did I feel I was in any danger - well maybe once, but that was due to my skills as a cyclist - or lack there of!We were lucky that although it was winter the day was sunny but still cold. Bicycling is done at a sedate pace so wear layers. All bicycles have a front basket to put any spare gear into.After a full day of cycling I didn't feel tired but invigorated by all I had experienced that day.

Great tour of the city. I did the Ultimate City tour and I'm so pleased I did! I was the only person booked in this tour , so it was essentially a private tour. As such I could ask as many questions as I wanted without worrying about annoying anyone else. My guide, Luke, was informative, knowledgeable and passionate about his adopted city. The day was well spaced with enough time to look around various areas such as La Boca, Puerto Madero (where we stopped for a great lunch) and Recoleta. The bikes are excellent and have a really comfy seat. They have a basket so you have somewhere to put your water and handbag etc. The cycling was easy because BA is so flat and because much of the time we followed bike paths. Even when we were on the road, I felt completely safe. I'd highly recommend this tour and in fact, I have just booked a second half-day tour.

Exceeded my Expectations - A great insider tour of the city. Kaylee & Anne took very good care of our group of 5, while giving us an insiders look into the city, its history, and some really cool local attractions. This experience was a highlight of my 1 week trip to Buenos Aires. Both ladies were extremely knowledgeable and were fantastic guides for our group. I highly recommend this experience to anyone who wants not only a fun but also educational experience that they will not soon forget. Thank you!

Amazing private tour by Kaylee and Anne. I arranged a private tour for my group of 6 and we had Kaylee and Anne as guides. They customized our tour to include stopping at 3 bars, each of which was great. We learned a ton about the city, culture, and people and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of the trip. The 3 bar stops were well planned out and we experienced a local drink which we all enjoyed. Our lunch stop was great and both Kaylee and Anne went out of their way to plan this event for us. If you are thinking of doing this, don't hesitate. After our ride was over, Kaylee and Anne followed up with a long email with restaurant and shopping suggestions and provided tips for a group of friends traveling to Chile. They went above and beyond to make our day.

Do this tour!. I booked the Heart of the City (South City) tour for my husband and I, and given that it was low season for tourism in Buenos Aires we were lucky enough to get a private tour! Our guide, Rodrigo, did an amazing job. He kept us enthralled with his interesting historical anecdotes and stories about futbol rivalries in Buenos Aires. One of our favorite spots was La Boca, a colorful neighborhood where tango was born and we had the chance to buy some hand-made gifts. We also loved biking through the ecological reserve and seeing the presidential palace. We saw parts of Buenos Aires (like the river shore and La Boca) that we never would have otherwise. We ate lunch next to the river at a choripan stand (choripan is a traditional Argentinian sandwich) and also got to try mate, a traditional Argentinian caffeinated drink. Rodrigo was professional enough to send us a follow-up email with a summary of the different locations on the tour, a list of Buenos Aires recommendations, and a youtube video we had requested. I highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires as a way to experience new parts of this huge city. When you book a tour you are advised to eat a large breakfast--make sure to do that, as we didn't eat lunch until around 2:30!

Great tour. I took the Heart of the City Tour (South City), which was excellent - the right amount of riding and stopping and talking. Raymond was a real character, and had great information to share. I loved being invited for yerba mate at the end.

Complete Tour of BA. Me and my girlfriend went on the Complete Tour and were very happy with our day out. Our guides, Ray and Kayley, were very friendly and took good care of us and the rest of the group. We didn't know much about the country beforehand, but Ray gave a nuanced view of the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires, from the city's foundation till today. The tour took 7.5 hours, but we weren't too sore afterwards, BA is a pretty flat city. The city has a lot of bike lanes that run along the streets. Ray and Kayley went first and last respectively and always blocked crossings to get us across safely.Money and time well spent if you want to learn about the city and its people!

Bicycle riding. Buenos Aires has a extraordinaries path for bicycle and big space for this activity. Go outside and enjoy the city is the best plan. Cheap and amazing. You is going to find a lot of Parks in anywhere.

Fascinating and well organised tour. Decided to do this tour on my first day in Buenos Aires. It was very professionally run with two experienced guides. We covered over 30km on the full day tour and visited most of the must see attractions within the city.The guides ensured that safety was paramount at all times and that all participants were safe. The bikes were easy to ride and well maintained. Would recommend this as an alternative sightseeing option that is far more fun and relaxed.

Like hanging out with a friend. Had a fantastic tour with Rodrigo, and definitely got to know the city much better. I had the advantage of booking during the low season, so I had a guide all to myself; his educational background added all sorts of political and cultural insight to the tour, and I honestly felt like I was hanging out with a friend rather than being a tourist. The Heart of the City route itself is easy for all ability levels, but be prepared to ride in traffic! Bikes are in great condition, lunch is good, and the company was better!

Great way to explore BA. We had a great experience taking the Heart of the City Tour with Biking Buenos Aires. The tour takes you through the complex history of the city while you visit the central neighbourhoods of San Telmo, La Boca and Puerto Madero. Our guide, Anne Marie, was wonderful ! She would adapt the tour to your needs, answer all of your questions, make sure you're having a good time all along. Highly recommended !

Sensational day out and the best way to experience B.A. My boyfriend and I did the Ultimate City Tour with Ray. Not only is B.A the perfect city to explore by bike, but Ray was a brilliant guide - full of interesting facts, great anecdotes and just a really fun and nice guy. Loved it!

This ride caused me to change my mind... I was given a throughout explanation of the days stops and locations by Santiago. He frequently checked on me and my comfort level of riding in the bike lines and in the few locations in the street. He was knowledgable and delightful in his explanations of structures, historical sites and the famous Portillos. We had a delicious lunch and a cup of mate later in the day. I was given water, helmet and a great comfy bike to spend my 7 hours enjoying BA. Overall great experience!!

Rocked my socks. Awesome people, great information, super helpful, super fun, couldn't ask for a better way to enjoy the day. Great suggestions for things to do after the tour (beer garden and chili bombs!) as well as with the rest of our time in BA. The FREE concierge service was super helpful and made our trip to BA even more BA.Thanks Ray Ray and Kaylee!
So much more than a bike ride.. Our guide was full of great information and stories. The ride was a blast and I left with a lots of excellent tips for restaurants, parks, tango etc...

Day Trip with Ray and Luke!. Wasn't sure what to expect when doing biking tour with Ray and Luke, but absolutely excellent and superseded my expectations once signed up. Ray and Luke are a fantastic team and very, very knowledgeable and friendly as well as making it fun to track around Buenos Aires. An absolute must do when in Buenos Aires with these guys!P.s - Thanks for the mate drinks guys!

Best way to get to know BA. RayRay and Kaylee were absolutely fantastic guides explaining a lot about the "real" Buenos Aires! I will be living in BA for three months and this was the perfect way to get a first comprehensive grasp on this city. Afterwards, they even followed up with some personalized recommendations for Buenos Aires and a couple of group members ended up at an asado afterwards - following RayRay's recommendation. It was a marvelous day! Thanks again!!

Biking buenos aires. We would highly recommend seeing buenos airies on bike with Rodrigo from biking buenos aires. It has been the highlight of our stay here. He was a fantastic host and very informative. We learnt so much about the history culture politics and people. And it was fun. The best. Five stars

Great way to see Buenos Aires. We did the full day tour with Kaylee and she was fantastic. Super chilled ride around most of the city and it really is a great way to get your bearings. She took us through the major historical sights and neighbourhoods and was super knowledgeable on the history of the city. You're not going to see all of BA but its great just to figure out the neighbourhoods and you can continue with a more in depth tour once you've figured out which areas you liked.

Fantastic guide, great tour, awesome time!. I took a tour with BsAs biking towards the end of a study abroad semester in which my studies focused partially on Argentine history. I had a GREAT time doing the full city tour and feel like it not only added to my base of knowledge, but also helped connect a lot of ideas. Our tour guide (Henrik) did an excellent job of adapting the tour to our level of knowledge and engaging us in great conversation all day.We did the full city tour (7 hours) and never felt bored. A+ tour experience.

Awesome bike ride!. I've done the bike ride with Raymond and it was a cool ride, very informative and definitely interesting experience. Loved the diversity of the city and the stories we've been taken through.
Amazing experience!. An excellent way to know an excellent city. Our guide (Anne) was very friendly and knowledgeable. If you are in BA don't miss this activity!

Excellent tour. We went on tour with Anne and it was awesome! She really knows about the city! Biking BA is a great way to get to check out the city's most important places and you also get to try a delicious bondiola.

A really fun adventure!. Luke is extremely knowledgeable about the sights and history of this city and adds so much meaning to all the places he takes the tour group to. I felt completely safe on the busy Buenos Aires streets even though I seldom ride bikes at home where the setting is more tranquil. Gol, Luke's point woman stopped traffic for us and made sure none of us dropped too far behind. She was a delight. I would highly recommend this tour as one of the best ways to see the city. Mary

Cycling tour of BA in late May. Our tour of the South with Gol was the highlight of our trip. Our tour of the South of B.A. was the highlight of our trip. She took us to places we would never have seen on our own. Also she guided us safely through this busy city staying in designated bike lanes for the majority of the tour. Gol has a great personality as well as a good knowledge of the history of the city. Pete and Judy

Awesome Day.. My friends and I had been in Buenos Aires for 4 days prior to going on a tour with Biking Buenos Aires, we thought we had seen a lot already just on our own. On the tour, with our lovely guide Anne, we saw and learnt way more than we could have ever done by ourselves. The team at Biking Buenos Aires really went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable. 10/10 would recommend to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires.

Awesome bike tour . Can highly recommend this tour to anyone who is coming to Buenos Aires. A great day out and even better tour guides! An awesome way to see the city and learn about its surroundings.

A most excellent experience for locals AND visitors!. We have been living in BA for nearly a year and I wish I had done a tour with Biking Buenos Aires as was recommended by a friend when we first arrived. My friend was visiting from the US and we joined a group with Rodrigo and Gol. Both were over-the-top amicable and knowledgeable about the rich history, architecture, and culture here. I liked it so much that I took my college aged son with me when he returned-- the same week! This time Kaylee made an accommodation for us with short notice after flying home just that morning. I learned different things taking the same tour and was amazed once again by the service, warmth, and professionalism. I have recommended it to everyone I know. Local or visitor, TAKE THE TOUR! You will be glad for it.

Definitely worth doing. We did the South tour with Raymond who was an excellent guide - he delivered the fascinating history of the city very well and kept us interested for 4-5 hours. The bikes and helmets were very comfortable and the lunch was delicious. We saw multiple sides to the city in one trip - from colourful, quirky La Boca to ultra modern and upmarket Puerto Madero - and you see the best of it all on a bike. Highly recommend!

Amazing. What an amazing day, did the bike tour Gol & Gus. Informative, interesting and exhilarating. This is an incredible way to see the beauty of BA. You are in amongst the people, the traffic and can feel the vibe of the city. Gol & Gus are great at taking care of you. Making sure you are safe as you travel the roads and the different suburbs.Would recommend this and would definitely take my friends back to do it again.

Covered so Much in One Day. Really enjoyed our full day with Henrik and Anne. We covered so much in our day but with plenty stops along the way that it was never an exertion. Lunch was excellent and the 'completo' was enough to feed us for the whole day. The BA crew were great and we went to the bar afterwards to watch the end of the Boca Juniors vs river plate football match which we had experienced the atmosphere at earlier in the day during our tour past the stadium . A great way to see BA especially if you only have a few days.

Unique!. Buenos Aires is a great city for bike lovers and not only, also for those who want to do a more authentic experience in its life style. Biking BA has an excellent logistics, its guides (Anne Marie was great) are truly enjoying accompanying tourists during the visit and have travelled a lot around the world. This last aspect helps to establish empathy with tourists and to estimulate their critical thinking on BA's life...above our expectations!!

You won't be disappointed!. I can't compliment this company enough! I just returned from my trip to BA and this was definitely one of the highlights! Anne was our tour guide and basically spoke perfect English, which was a plus since I spoke hardly any Spanish. We biked all around to several different neighborhoods and learned a ton about the history and culture of Argentina. It's a very easy ride, 1 hill (if you can even call it that), just over 15 miles in a 7 hour period that seemed to fly by. The bikes are in good condition and she even brought tools to fix anything if something went wrong. The lunch was great too, super authentic and super good! Tip: get the chorizo sandwich. This activity was so good that I even told the concierge at my hotel to recommend them moving forward. SERIOUSLY, do it!

Best Day Out . Bikes are hands down the best way to see a city !! We aren't usually into tours but had read good things about Biking Buenos Aires, and they did not disappoint. We did the City Tour (10am - 6pm) and our guide Luke was great - so knowledgeable and really engaging. The bike lanes and wide avenues make it super easy to navigate around the city, at no point did we feel unsafe (even without helmets). Luckily we had stunning weather, not sure how I would have enjoyed it had it been raining! Definitely recommend doing a tour with these guys !!

Awesome day!!. I really enjoyed this biking tour. Our guide, Luke was friendly and knowledgable going out of his way to give us local tips and tricks for the rest of our stay in South America. The tour included many points of interest and showcased the different types of architecture and vibes within the city. Would highly recommend! Also very flat and easy to cycle... Always a bonus! :)

Fantastic day out with in depth knowledge of history and politics of BA!. Had a great day out with Luke. Friendly and interactive.He had plenty of knowledge on this city and the history of it as well as answering any questions we had. Went overtime to make up for latecomers in the group and the like much was impressive and filling street food.Couldn't fault the tour at all and even took time to guide us on what else to see and how to get around. Even how to get around parts of the rest of South America. Recommendation paid forward. Keep up the good work!

Great way to learn about BA and its history. We took the full day bike tour of BA and it was definitely one of the highlights of our visit to Argentina. Good combination of history, sight-seeing, humor, and a little exercise. Our guides were Raymond and Gustavo and they took good care of the entire group. Highly recommended tour.

Best way to explore Buenos Aires. I booked a private tour because I had limited time and Biking BA were so accommodating to make sure they worked around my schedule. My guide was Gol who was so much fun, really knowledgeable as well as a fantastic story teller. Try a bike tour with BBA you will not be disappointed.

Heart of city. One of the best things we did in BA. Only two couples on this trip and our guide was excellent. It started raining towards the end and it still did not dampen the laughter and fun we had. Hubby and I are in our active early fifties we had a great time. Visited early in our week long trip and this introduction to the city enabled us to have a great idea where to go back to or tick off our been list. These guys are good and great value for money

A fun and informative day!. We decided to book the full day bike tour on our first day in Buenos Aires to get a good feel for the city first thing. This is something I would highly recommend! We had a GREAT day. As well as enjoying the ride and seeing most of the sites we had planned to visit anyway, Luke, our guide, was extremely informative, and it was great to have well-timed stops and to listen to the history of the area. I would highly recommend this fantastic tour, and to make it one of the first things you do in Buenos Aires. You will love it!

Best thing we did in BA. We are so glad we chose to do the 'heart of the city' tour. Kaylee went above and beyond - she was an AMAZING guide. Her knowledge of the city was vast, and she helped make our trip to BA a memorable one. Thank you Kaylee!
