Just Do It; You'll Love It. I am in no way in shape, and I still managed to find this tour exceptional. It's been years since I've been on a bike, and had no problems. The hours passed quickly, probably because our tour guide was so darn interesting! He was also very knowledgable and sensitive to our needs. We rode in the shade for most of the ride, we stopped often, and drank lots of water. The lunch was also one of the best we had on our trip, if not the best. We got to see a beautiful city from an whole new perspective. It was worth every penny.

Heart of the City Tour. Golmary was a great tour guide, she was very friendly and knows a huge amount about the history of the city. The tour is at a easy pace and allows for lots of time to explore attractions. The lunch was also excellent at a food truck in Puerto Madero along the riverside. I would recommend this to all travellers in Buenos Aires.

An amazing overview of the city. Buenos Aires is pretty flat overall, so the biggest "hill" to climb was actually a bridge over a busy road. Rodrigo was AMAZING as a tour guide - knowledgeable, funny, and super nice! My friends and I did the ultimate city tour, which was pretty much all day. Lunch at a sandwich stand in the Puerto Maduro was DELICIOUS, to boot. I highly recommend you do this at the beginning of your trip, as it would give you some good ideas on where you might want to revisit in depth on your later days. We didn't have the option, but it was still worth the experience. I just wish we did! If (or when, really) I come back to BA, I'd definitely be interested in taking this, or one of their more specialized tours.

Highlight of our trip. . We flew in April 6th and did the full day bike tour on the 7th. I have to say this bike tour kind of ruined the rest of our vacation. They showed us so much of the city we almost felt like we've seen it all in one day. Our guides, Ray and Gustavo, brought so much depth to the city and humour to the day. We wished we did one more tour with them but we will definitely go back with them if we're in town again.

Exceptional Tours. We did two 5 hour tours with this company: Heart of the City with Golmary and Parks and Plazas with Rodrigo. Golmary was so friendly and knew so much about BA. She was lots of fun and I was worried the second tour would be a disappointment but Rodrigo was fantastic too. He was a Porteno and a university student so knew so much of the history of BA. Both tours showed us so much of BA we would have been unable to experience any other way than on a bike. We had beautiful weather and were introduced to mate and Argentinian fast food on the beach.

Excellent full day cycle. Recently did the ultimate city tour which was a full day exploring the city. Our guide Henrik was brilliant. Very knowledgeable, fun, interesting and took good care of us throughout the day. Great mix of history about both BA and Argentina combined with a good insight into recent events and what it's like to live in the city now. The bikes themselves are comfortable and traffic around the city not a problem (most of the ride on cycle lanes). Lunch was also very tasty.

Excellent full day experience!. The Ultimate City Tour is a great way of spending a day, visiting many places and learning about amazing and often sad history and stories of Buenos Aires and Argentina. The tour guide, Rodrigo, is a great story teller and his knowledge is amazing!In 7 hours we covered 25km of the city which is a relaxing pace and leaves plenty of time for the guide to tell his stories as well as try the mate.

Ultimate City Tour is perfect day in Buenos Aires. I liked the way our tour was run by Rodrigo, our tour guide. Many interesting stories and insights of the city and the country. A lot of int resting facts and very well thought route of the tour. If you want to see the best of the city and if you like to know some stories behind the famous places, this is the tour to go. I did not find the tour physically difficult, despite 7 hours it is very relaxing and easy going. I would decently recommend Biking Buenos Aires as well organized tour operator.

Fantastic way to see Buenos Aires!. Spending the day cycling around BA is the perfect place to see this wonderful city. The route is well-though out, and Kaylee and her team were great guides. Lunch was a definite highlight - delicious!! Loved it, and would recommend to anyone visiting BA.

Wonderful tour in one day!. Buenos Aires is the perfect city to use the bicycle. Is flat and safe. In one day I could see almost all the major touristic attraction. My tour guide made an excelent job in explaining in perfect english about history, anedocts and facts of the city.

Absolutely phenomenal day - worth every cent!. I signed up for this tour after a friend recommended this to me. I am so glad that I joined up for this bike tour - it was a great way to see the city and discover the various parts of Buenos Aires! Henrik and Anna were fantastic - both were extremely knowledgeable, friendly and made the day even better. The lunch was delicious and was just what we needed after all that biking. If you book this tour, I'd recommend booking on a Sunday - traffic is less crazy. It also allows you to go to the San Telmo markets after.

Great way to see Buenos Aires. The two guides were nice, cool, and really informed. The tour was relaxed and the biking was the perfect pace, never too overwhelming or too much or too far. We stopped in the park for a mate/snack break and learned the proper protocol for "preparing" the mate. Would strongly recommend this tour, it was a great way to see the areas of Palermo and Recoleta as well as the many plazas in the area. Learned lots of historical things as well. Would definitely recommend the tour. BTW, both guides are fluent in English and Spanish.

Best Buenos Aires Excursion!. We heard about this company from friends who recently did their bike tour. So glad we found out about this company. Our bike tour was one of the highlights of our trip. You see so much more touring by bike, and our tour guide (Kaylee) was fantastic. We had already read the guidebooks about the history and sights in BA and already knew quite a bit, but I have to say that we learned a lot of new things and we were entertained in the process. We were initially wondering how it would be to bike a big city like BA, but we felt very comfortable and safe and that our guide was looking out for us and monitoring traffic. You really feel the vibe of the city biking versus being in a tour bus, and you cover so much more ground than walking. Plenty of stops and a great lunch. Our guide was very flexible in making additional stops where we wanted to and answering our questions. This is also a great option if you really want to get a nice overview of the city but you don't have a lot of time (we only really had one full day in BA). If we had more time, we would have liked to have taken some of their other bike tours, which also look very interesting and fun.

Good overview of city, but ill focused time. We love bike tours of cities we visit and enjoyed seeing Buenos Aires via bike. The guide was informative, however biased at times and interjected her opinion too much. We wished we had more time to explore the Boca neighborhood and less time spent explaining and drinking mate. The lunch stop was great and very tasty.

Must do while in BA!. Amazing thing to do - incredible way to see parts of the city and learn so much of the history. Our guide Ray, was incredible - so knowledgeable of all aspects of BA's history -learnt so much from him. Abisoulty loved the tour and would highly recommend!

The best way to see and understand the City!. We try to take a bike tour wherever we travel and Biking BA is one of the best! Gol and Timo were fun, interesting, and their insights and explanations helped us understand BA. And, the addition of the authentic food-truck lunch and group maté were extra fun (and good!). Thank you again!

Great guides make this trip an outstanding way to see and learn about the city. We were small group from all corners of the world with various interests on the full day tour. The guides Anne and Renzo put us all at ease and made the day a pleasure from start to finish. Highly recommend, in particular for history buffs since the guides are very knowledgeable about city and indeed Argentina.

Perfect way to see Buenos Aires with the whole family. We only had a day in BA before going to Bariloche and seeing the city on bikes was the perfect way to spend the afternoon. Kaylee gave us the usual pre-ride info and we set out (just the 4 of us... wife 12 yr old daughter and 14 yr old son). We spent about 4 hours and I felt like we got a very good intro to the city from La Boca to Puerto Madero to Plaza de Mayo. Our stop in Boca to take Mate with Kaylee was definitely a highlight for everyone. She was awesome with the kids and was very knowledgeable about the city and little nuggets of history that you wouldn't get from a book.The whole vibe of the Biking Buenos Aires shop and staff is laid back and immediately gets you into right frame of mind to experience this beautiful and friendly city.This is the 4th city which we've toured by bike. It's a great way to see everything and get your bearings. The kids love it, especially versus the alternative of getting dragged to museum after museum. I strongly recommend Biking BA if you want to see some off-the-beaten-path sites, hear some interesting history, and have a relaxing afternoon.

Great way to see BA. We did 2 tours with biking BA, the parks & plaza's and the architectural tour over the Easter weekend. They covered different areas and were a great introduction to BA for us. Our guide on both tours was Santiago who was fantastic, both friendly and informative. While the bikes are average, BA is so flat that it doesn't matter and with an extensive network of bike paths we found it really easy to get around. The lunch on both days was simple local fare but great introduction to BA favorites.

Fun and informative . We had a the best time with biking ba. Our tour guide Raymond was great and showed us some great sights and told us all about the history in a really funny way. 100% recommendation!They are setting up in Rio de Janeiro and will definitely go when i'm there next.

Do it as soon as you arrive in the city to get your bearings.... I love a good bike tour and I find that to get your bearings on a city, it is best to do it on arrival. The north and south tour was no exception to this. Kaylee and her sidekick were great. Personable, knowledge, friendly and got us through 27km of BA streets without incident.

Best day tour of the city ever!. We have been to Buenos Aires before but never did a bike tour. We booked the south city tour for our last day in this beautiful city. Our tour guide Golmary was incredible. She knew the city well and all the history behind the stops we made and was very keen on safety and signaling when we were on the roads and not the bike trail. She answered all out questions about politics customs history etc as if she were native. Her English impeccable and her sense of humor and outgoing personality made for a truly special day. She was very good at showing us things that we may not have picked up on or details that we may have missed. Since it was just my husband and I she spent extra time with us and was not in a hurry to finish. Lunch was amazing too! Thank you Gooool! for such a fun finale to our trip!!

Best way to see the city s. Temo and Kaylee were our guides for a full day tour of BA. What an awesome experience. They are both very knowledgeable about the country and of the various barrios of BA. Our teenage daughters loved seeing all of the sites and learning about the culture. Great tour. Would highly recommend. A fun-filled day of touring.

Bike tour is amazing. This is my second time in BA, and I didn't know this side of the city. The details were so nice, and on the bike was amazing!!! I Loved it!!! The guys (Gustavo and Luke) were so friendlies. Thank you guys!

A great day in BA, great value!!. We had a fantastic day with Henrik who shared deep knowledge on the history and local insights of the politics, architecture and culture as we cycled around the city. This was a great way to get oriented to the city of BA and Argentina in general.The bikes were well maintained and this company while more expensive than others has a policy to keep the guide to customer ratio low which was great for being able to engage with Henrik and gave great insights and great value. We passed other cycle groups that were much larger, slower moving and were all stuck with breakdowns. Go Biking BA!!

Easy access to insider knowledge about BA from friendly, well-informed staff!. My partner and I chose 'the ultimate city tour' which proved to be a great way to get a taste of what BA has on offer. We lucked out as the only two people booked on that tour, that day, which basically meant that we had our own personal tour. Our guide, Henrik, was fantastic! He was friendly, knowledgeable and willing to share his wisdom. He was also prepared to tailor the tour to our wants and requirements, but we left it to him to lead the way and we weren't disappointed. His historical knowledge was thorough and he provided a balanced overview of past events, a lot of which is not found in the guide books. Lunch was really enjoyable and more than ample in terms of quantity. Upon reflection, the quality of the bikes and the well-chosen route, which is nicely spaced and broken up between good bouts of cycling, stopping at points of interest, in-depth commentary and sharing of experiences over mate, provided a highly enjoyable and well-rounded day. The dedication of staff didn't end there as I later received a follow-up email recommending further points of interest. A great experience and one that I would recommend to others.

A terrific way to see the city and get a sense of the history. Our family only had a day and a half in Buenos Aires. Luke was a terrific guide. We truly got a sense of the city and its history. Riding a bike is definitely the way to go. He was able to accommodate our dietary needs with a delicious lunch as well.

Always a good way to see a city and pick what you want to see. Trusting trip advisor lead us to book this event and it didnt disappoint. A small group of 5 plus our lead, Annie, spent 5hours looking around the south of the city. Thincluded a twenty minute stop where tango originated and lunch 3 hours in. You get a helmet and a bottle of filtered water. We covered 16 kilometres in that time and always time to enjoy taking a photo. Mostly on cycle lanes and a little on roads, it felt safe the whole way around, enough for me to say kids would be ok.

Awesome biking tour with great food!. I went on the heart of the city tour and had a great time! The guides Kaylee and Anne were very friendly and provided a lot of information at all of the stops. They even went out of their way to help me find more activities to do in the city. There wasn't too much biking since we made a lot of stops, so the 5 hours flew by. We also stopped for lunch and had amazing 'bondiola' sandwiches. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone looking for an enjoyable bicycle tour.

This tour was one of our highlights in Buenos Aires - a must do!. The experience was outstanding on multiple fronts:-Experience more on a bike. Buenos Aires is a huge city. We were able to experience so much more than if we walked. And it was much more comfortable (cooler on a hot day than walking, no sore feet). -Top notch guides with expertise in political science and history. These were the most knowledgeable and engaging guides that we had in 2 weeks within Argentina. They don't just do this for the money. They LOVE the history and culture of the city and it shows. We felt like we were visiting the city with friends rather than hearing a dry lecture.-Unbelievably well organized. These guys had a second guide just to stop traffic and protect the guests on busy roads. And they brought sunscreen, water, etc. In their carrying bags.The experience was definitely worth the price. Check these guys out!

Fabulous Day. Our family of five did this tour on our 2nd day in the city and it was a great call. Ray, Renzo and Timo were our guides and traffic conductors and did a great job getting us around and introducing us to the history of the city as well as the many varied neighborhoods. Could never have covered this ground on foot in a day! Highly recommend this trip but expect to be tired at the end of the day if you do the Ultimate Tour!

fascinating overview of culture and architecture. Several months after I completed this tour, I still reflect on some of the culture presented during the tour. The guide did a great job of combining the physical aspects with the philosophical background; the city really came alive. I was sorry that I couldn't add the recommended "Grafitti Tour" to the trip agenda.

Best way to first see BA. Took this tour in February and the memories still linger. Absolutely fell in love with BA and this tour had quite a bit to do with it. Kaylee and Graz were outstanding tour guides-very informative and made sure we were safe. Can't wait to come back to BA!

By bike is the best way to experience BA. Henrik and the team were fantastic. We did the ultimate tour on a Sunday (less traffic) and the flat cycling was really easy. Great tour and information of places and history the bus tours don't go (plus the places they do!). A must to experience and not just see BA! Awesome lunch too!

Great way to see the city. This bike tour was a great way to see the heart of the city. The bikes allowed us to cover a lot of ground in a short period of time. Since, Buenos Aires is really flat, it was not hard at all. There are bike lanes almost everywhere, but in a few places, we had to ride in the busy streets. For this reason, I would not recommend this tour for small children. Our teenagers did well. Our guide, Gol, was very knowledgable about the history of Buenos Aires and skillfully guided us through several neighborhoods. Lunch at Puerto Madeo was delicious. All in all, it was a great day!

I dont understand why this Tour cost so much . We did the ultimative biketour around the most populær places in the City. - First The bikes (only female bikes) are very basic and a bit small compared to the tal men like my boyfreind that has to bike for 6-7 hours. When you pay 90 USD I would expect better bikes. - We also though we would have seen more of the City and more "secret/unseen" local places instead of having a so loong lunch break.- compared to what you can get for 180 USD in BA we think this Tour is overpriced. The day before we went to Palermo where we had an good coffee with brownie, an amazing dinner at one of the Best/finest steakhouse Don Julio and a very professionel intime jazzkoncert with a bottle of Wine at Thelonious club for the same amout of money. I know it is two complete different activites, but if we should have done it agian we would have rent the bikes for a day for 250 pesos and biked by our self and have done a free walking guided Tour an other day. Tour has been the most expensive we have done the last 7 month in South America. But we are also travelling on a backpacker budget, and we are used to bike a lot also in Big Citys.Positive thing:- the guides are super very very sweet and give a amazing service! They are doing an amazing job! - all the information about the City is very informative and interesting.- the sandwich for lunch is very good and local - the Company are very good to inform you before and after the Tour

Eugene Harrington . We (3) did the City Tour and really really enjoyed it. There was a great sense of fun in the group which was fostered by our fantastic tour leader Hendrik and continued by our safety "points" Gols and Caley who were always watching out for us, all three were witty and great fun to be with. Hendricks knowledge of the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina was impressive and we were all left with a greater understanding of this amazing city and country. It's not too strenuous but helps build an appetite for the lunch which is exceptional, a local food stall sandwich that makes Subway look like an amateur organisation. Also plenty of sunscreen and water available from the guides. Highly recommend this professional and friendly company.

Fun and very informative way to understand Buenos Aires!. Excellent tour with information on the history, cultural, political and socio-economic context. Well organized regarding safety, very professional. Fun way to see and get a feel of the city, plus know some essential things about Argentinians and the city!

Best way to see and learn about BA. We did the full day ride. It's really easy, and you get to see a lot of the city. The guides are all so knowledgable, and the best part was how much We learned about the history of the city, old and modern. Thanks To all the guides!

Great bike tour. This is a great experience to see Buenos Aires! We took the 4 hour morning ride on a new road bike. Our guide was very friendly well informed on the history of BA and Argentina. The mate ceremony was great. A must do in BA.

Simply the perfect way to get to know buenos aires. We (2) had a great great day yesterday doing the "ultimate city tour"! In my opinion there is NO better way of getting to know this city and its history in one day! Profound, informative and entertaining at once was the huge amount of informations regarding history and culture provided by our guide Henrik. Perfectly managed safety precautions by Timo and Lorenzo who did everything they could to let us not worry about traffic around us and simply enjoy the ride. We loved it, thank you guys for a wonderful day we will remember a long time!Highly recommended!

SO worth it!!. We went all-in and did the "Ultimate Bike Tour". SO glad we didn't settle for anything less. We saw and learned so much from the experience and from our very knowledgeable guide, Ray. While I can't speak for other bike tours in BA, I have taken many in other cities and Biking Buenos Aires is among the best I've experienced. They are very professional, the bikes are new and are checked daily to remain in top working order. Our group was only 5 on a Wednesday, but for larger groups they have a guide for about every 5 or 6 people.

Perfect way to see the city and meet great people . This was a fabulous trip around a fascinating city. It's a full day and definitely worth it. Beyond seeing great sights and getting some exercise, the history lesson is SPECTACULAR. Ask for Ray-Ray... he will not disappoint. The cycling is not strenuous and there are plenty of stops to take in the sights, sounds, tastes, and smells of the city. Afterwords ask about drinks at Red Door. It's a BLAST!!!!

Loved our day on the bike in Buenos Aires. We spent over 5 hours exploring the city up close, which you can do on a bike. Especially on a beautiful and day and with our terrific guide, Raymond, who was a mine of information, which he shared with his own brand of humour and passion. Being a somewhat older couple we managed the distance and pace easily and appreciated the frequent stops and delicious lunch. Highly recommended!

The best way to see the city.. I LOVED this tour. I feel like I got a great overview of the city in just one day. We had a great lunch with the group, and the guides were super friendly and very knowledgeable about the city and wider area. If you want to see lots of Buenos Aires but don't have a heap of time, then do this tour!!

Fantastic day of biking and learning about Buenos Aires. Our tour lasted eight hours on a beautiful Saturday in March 2016, covering 17 miles but let me preface that by saying it was an easy 17 miles of flat biking. The hosts we're extremely friendly and knowledgeable in the history of the city and in ensuring our safety and happiness. I have traveled in many many countries throughout the world and I always look for the best comprehensive tour available that also is physically active and this group does a great job at combining education, fun activity and customer satisfaction

Everything you need to know about Buenos Aires plus a delicious pork sandwich, all in one day. This city tour is the perfect way to explore Buenos Aires. Our guide for the day, Henrik, is as knowledgeable as he is passionate about the city and will make sure to tell you everything you need to know about the sights and the turbulent history of Argentina. The tour takes you by historic landmarks and through various neighbourhoods in a leisurely pace. There are plenty of stops on the way and the seven hours fly before you know it. The tour included a rundown of the proper way to drink the Argentinian national drink, mate, and one of the best pork sandwiches in town for lunch! We covered so many things in a day and it was a great opportunity to get a feel for the place. As a curious side note, Henrik is the driving force in promoting an active bicycle culture similar to those in Amsterdam and Copenhagen. Make sure to ask him about this if you want to know more about how bikes can help improving the quality of life in a city.

Amazing way to get to know Buenos Aires!. This was so much fun! It is a great way to see a lot of the city in a short time. Rodrigo is a great guide and he knows a lot (!) about Argentine's history. If you want to get to know the city, this is really the perfect way to do so!

Great day!!!. Did the whole city tour today...our guides luke and anne where fantastic, very friendly, helpful and fun. Gave even recommandaitions for the next days here in the city ecc. We were able to see loads of different areas and sights, the tour was never boring or monotone. Best way to see as much as possible in a short time... would do it again :)

Loved the Ultimate Full Day City Tour!. Biking tours are the best way to see a city and this tour was perfect! Taylor and Gustavo were great and we were able to see so much of the City and felt very safe. They were very informative and made it fun. Highly recommend them!

Fantastic way to see city.. Our tour guide, Kaylee was excellent. We learned heaps about the history of Buenos Aires and the different barrios. I thoroughly recommend that you do this tour as soon as you get to the city so as to get a good overall perspective of Buenos Aries and its people.

Excellent day!. Loved the tour. It was super fun and informative! Met some awesome people as well. Our guide Henrik was incredibly knowledgeable about the entire city of Buenos Aires and also the history of Argentina.

Amazing day!. I did the Ultimate Tour and it was a great way to see the city. We were able to see all of the highlights & Rodrigo did a great job of "educating" us about the history & political landscape of Buenos Aries. I would recommend this tour to anyone coming to BA.

Great way to see the city and learn some history!. We had a great time on the Heart of the City tour. Rodrigo was an excellent guide who provided a great perspective on the city and it's history and culture. I would highly recommend a tour with Biking Buenos Aires and will do another when back in town.

Amazing way to spend the day!. I did the Heart of the City tour with Raymond and it was fantastic! Saw so much and learned a ton. Everything was in English and they were so easy to work with. I definitely recommend it to anyone!

great way to see this most interesting city. Had a fun and educational day with Taylor bike touring Buenos Aires. Taylor was very knowledgeable. we asked a lot of questions and he was able to provide a wide variety of information concerning history, architecture, economics and more. Lunch was a leisurely break at a street cart. In many places there were bike lanes in the street to provide a safer place to ride. even on some of the older narrower streets. Our tour was on a Sunday when the traffic was less than weekdays. I know that this tour would keep you safe but the Sunday was especially nice so if there is flexibility in scheduling think about it. The bikes that we used were in good condition and we were provided helmets and water. Taylor carried a repair kit which came in handy as we did have one flat tire. Highly recommend this group while you are in BA. Don't forget your sunscreen

Great way to see Argentina in a day!. My fiancé and I went on the 7 hour bike trip today with Luke and Kaylee. We loved it! It was a great way to see a lot of the city in one day. You start in San Telmo and travel to La Boca, Puerto Madero, Retiro, Recoleta, and I'm sure some other neighborhoods that I'm forgetting. You see a ton of historical sites with informative guides. Also included is a delicious lunch from a parilla, a taste of Yerba mate, and an alfajore to finish it off. It's also a great way to exercise off all the meat and wine! Highly recommend, especially if you are in BA for a short period of time.

Best Tour I've done ... ever. I did the Ultimate Tour with Biking Buenos Aires back in Dec 2014. Yep ... I know, I took my time to write this review. But, I would like this fact to stand testiment to how much of a profound memory this tour left on me. I still remember this tour today as having been the best tour I have ever done and I hope that, me having been relatively well travelled, my enthusiasm carries some weight. I had no idea how interesting and complex the history of Buenos Aires was prior to doing this tour and I left this beautiful, energetic, romantic and sad city feeling as though I had emotionally connected.The tour guide I had (Rodrigo) was fantastically knowledgeable and there was no question that he could not answer. If I do ever have the opportunity to travel back to BA, I will do this tour again. I can not recommmend it enough, especially for the history buffs out there.
Seeing the heart of the city. Had one of my best days in BA on this tour! Golmaria is one of the most kind and well traveled tour guides I have met! Take this tour you won't regret it!

Best party of my trip to Buenos Aires!!!. LOVED, LOVED, LOVED this bike tour! I did the Parks and Plazas tour with Santiago in February. First- Santiago is the best. He is kind, attentive, knowledgeable and tells stories in such a fun and unique way. It was a pleasure to spend the morning and early afternoon with him. The tour is about 11 miles and was mainly flat. I had not rode a bike since I was little and I found it very easy to ride. It was a unique way to see the city and you cover a lot of ground. The parks and plazas you visit are STUNNING- so incredible. The biggest landmark you see is Recoleta Cemetery which is also something to see. We stopped for lunch and had empanadas which were also fantastic. This is a MUST DO when go to Buenos Aires!

The best way to see Buenos Aires. I did the 7 hour full day tour of Buenos Aires last week. There were 8 of us on the tour and 2 guides. Buenos Aires benefits from miles of cycle paths and when on road I felt perfectly safe as our guides would stop traffic to ensure that the group passed safely. The tour is led at a gentle pace with frequent stops for photos, explanations about the history of BA, and bad jokes (from Raymond our tour leader)! Awesome day out. Thank you guys.

Ultimate city tour. Thank you Taylor for being such an informative guide on our tour and Gustavo for helping with the gear, duh, and stopping traffic and all that safety precautions. Really enjoyed and highly recommend this tour. A good way to tour around Buenos Aires guided through what seemd to be really chaotic roadways.

Full day cycle toyr. Fantastic trip. A great way to see the city and get amongst it all. Our guide Taylor knew everything and was fantastic to listen too. Gustavo did a great job of blocking traffic and making us all feel safe. The trip was timed to perfection and catered for all levels. I would recommend this to everyone coming to the City.
Fantastic!. Good ride, good bikes, good crowd! Raymond and Grazielle are pros! Knowledgable about the history of BA and awesome blocking traffic. Love these guys. Best way to see the sights of BA.

7h day bike tour . We just got back to our hotel after spending our first full day in BA doing a cycling tour of the city with Biking Buenos Aires. It was the best way to see some of the best things that BA has to offer. Tour was well arranged, interesting and easy route with a lot of nice stops along the way , including a great lunch stop. Always felt safe in traffic (and BA traffic seems pretty respectful of cyclists). You certainly don't have to be an athlete to do this ...a nice relaxing day. Obviously, while day made a lot better by our excellent guides, lead by Luke. Even got to experience a nice taste of Yerba mate along the way!!:) highly recommend doing this!

Biking Buenos Aires. Our guide Rodrigo Hanche was great-he was excellent in explaining the history of Argentina. A great ambassador for Buenos Aires! We thoroughly enjoyed our bike tour. Thank youBrenda and Chuck Markham

Great way to spend a hot Buenos Aires day!. I had a great day biking around Buenos Aires with Raymond — definitely a highlight of my three weeks in South America! The bike was comfortable and I appreciated the good company, jokes, snacks, sunscreen and water. Biking is a great alternative to walking forever in this giant city. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Buenos Aires. Thanks again!

Great Day in BA!. Raymond was funny and educational and gave us a great 7 hour tour of BA. Highly recommend! Do it early in your trip so you know where to focus your time in this interesting and eclectic city.

Great day out on the Heart of the city tour. This is an excellent way to get to see the city, topped off with a BIG lunch. Raymond our guide was great. Easy ride across the city and felt safe on the bike. Definitely worth it!

Best way to see Buenos Aires!. Raymond Lee and Grazielle provided a first class tour. I learned a lot, saw a lot, and never felt unsafe. The bikes are comfortable and in really good working condition. Thanks again for a wonderful experience.

Knew it would be great.... We knew it would be fun, but the care and thoughtfulness that Ray and his team put into these tours made it more than just fun. We signed up for the full day (7 hour) tour and every minute felt curated, in the best way. With 30 degree (Celsius ) plus temps, the fact that we were always in shade when we stopped was just one lovely touch. Lunch, commentary and polite reminders that sun screen might be a good idea made the day memorable. Highly recommend this if you are considering a bike tour of Buenos Aires.

Heart of the City Tour. I booked the 5 hour tour at the last moment, because a different tour was full. I had a great time with Raymond, a native from New Zealand. He did an excellent job telling and explaining the history of Buenos Aires. I enjoyed it a lot.

Best bike outfit in BA!. We had the full day tour with Raymond, our English speaking native New Zealand guide, who has lived in BA for the past 9 years. If you want more than a tour of the city on bike, book with Biking BUenos Aires. We got a full history lesson and insight on recent political turmoil as well as Argentine history lesson! The website is easy to use and book and reservations process was seamless.

Heart of the City Tour. Definitely recommend. Heart of the City tour was very helpful in understanding the history of BA and was fun riding in the sunshine! Taylor (American) was very knowledgeable and patient with all our questions! Ride is on even ground - not strenuous. OK for a 12 year old. Keep in mind part of this tour goes into the Reserve that isn't open on Monday - so pick another day as it was a lovely part of the tour.

Must do in BA!!. If you're coming to Buenos Aires & want to know more about this amazing city then I'd highly recommend doing this instead of a bus tour!! Feels amazing to be in "amongst" it all & have the sun shining on you & a nice breeze as you ride. I did the city tour (5 hours)& made it private as the morning departure didn't suit my body clock...it's awesome to have the freedom to start when you want...go at your own pace & have a more intimate tour...having said that I know they only take a maximum of 12 so if I was awake in the mornings I would certainly have no trouble doing the "normal" tours with the public...communication was awesome...fast & clear responses to my queries prior to my arrival in BA...easy payment options & great directions including map on how to find them...Our tour guide was Kaylee who was very knowledgeable about the city & its history & awesome to spend the day with....if you're worried about how long 5 hours seems...don't be!!! The day flies past,you're so busy learning lots,taking in the sights & smells!! Lunch is delicious!! & I enjoyed it as much as my fancy restaurant meals. Also you don't need to be remotely fit at all...you're just cruising & never for too long...my Grandma could come on this tour!! All in all this experience was one of my fav's in BA & when I'm there next I'm going back for the other tours!! You will not regret doing this!!!

Great tour!. My friend and I booked a private tour and had Kaylee as our guide. She was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable and it was like we were spending the day with an old friend. The biking was easy and there were lots of stops for the sites. Loved the lunch stop with authentic food at a local sidewalk food stand. We were well taken care of at all times and Biking Buenos Aires thought of all the details, from water and a variety of snacks (and even hand sanitizer at lunch). It was also great that Kaylee sent us an email after with recommendations of other things to do in BA as well as some additional references for some questions we had asked. I have only the best things to say about the tour and would definitely do it again!

Amazing!!!. A must do tour!!! Great guides! Taylor the head guide was very knowledgable about History, politics, socio-economic welfare and other great information. I felt very safe riding the bike with this group! The luncheon provided on the ultimate tour was amazing! The matte was delicious and a great afternoon refreshment! Water provided during the tour, but I carried my own big bottle in my little basket! Tour guides were so helpful! That after the Tour my friend and I were walking around the streets of San Telmo looking for a Parilla place for dinner, stumbled across Gustav (it's what I have been calling him, hope that's his name), who recommended an excellent place to eat at!!! The three guides are so helpful and also willing to provide information about this beautiful city!!!! Highly recommend going with BBA tours!

Best tour I've experienced so far. This is a belated review since we did the tour early January but since it's the best one we've done in throughout our South American vacation it deserves to be written. My partner and I went for the full day bike tour in BA. The group consisted of 8 people +2 guides. The tour started with a brief presentation of the tour, the participants and safety and ended with a chat after the tour. Both my partner and I felt very happy with the Biking BA tour both after the tour but even more so after having done other tours in other countries. The guide, Luke, was very knowledgeable and, more importantly, could explain complicated issues, like argentine democracy and politics, in a way that's easy to follow and interesting. He also made sure everybody's questions was answered and those he couldn't answer on the spot he promised to find out the answer and come back in an email, which he also did. The second guide was in charge of stopping traffic when necessary and making sure nobody was left behind, and he did a great job. We felt safe throughout the tour. We liked the fact that it was a fairly small group which made it easier and smoother for everybody. We can definitely recommend this Biking BA for anybody, both young and old. It's a great way of experiencing a big city like BA

Such an awesome and informative introduction to B.A.. This is definitely a must do on the first full day in the city. It helped my husband and I determine where we wanted to go in the city in the following days. We took the Ultimate City Tour which was a little pricey but for all the information you receive including a ton of history it gives a good insider perspective to the city. MUST DO!

Biking Buenos Aires - Amazing way to see the city! . Fantastic tour, Kaylee was a great tour guide, very informative about the history of the city and she made the whole tour great fun. Lunch was delicious too!! I'm not the most confident on a bike but always felt safe as she kept an eye on the group and the route is mainly cycle paths so very safe. Loved seeing La Boca and all the architecture around different neighbourhoods and the ecopark is gorgeous to cycle around. Definitely our favourite day so far in BA.

Great way to see Buenos Aires and learn some of the history. We did the ultimate city tour. Our guide, Taylor, was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the history of Argentina and BA (he majored in history at college so was certainly qualified!). We learnt a lot and had a great day. Highly recommended as a way to get oriented to BA.

Ultimate Tour of Buenos Aires. What a day! Taylor was a fantastic guide. His passion and enthusiasm for history and Argentina was infectious. The pace of the ride was perfect, and we could not have asked for more information about the different stops. It was insightful but at times overwhelming (might have been due to the jet lag though). I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Buenos Aires as it is the perfect introduction to the city, it’s layout and history.

Brilliant tour!!. We were a bit early for our tour but were able to check in and the guide gave us a recommendation for some good coffee, a great way to start the day!! A great 1st impression :) After coffee we picked up our bikes which were fairly new and in great condition. Our guide, Ray, took us on a tour covering approximately 15km and including most of the key sights in Buenos Aires. Ray was a brilliant cycling guide, keeping us safe on unfamiliar roads/streets in the city. He also gave us a great overview of Buenos Aires and Argentinian history. Lunch was included, which was a delicious traditional Argentinian sandwich. I would absolutely recommend this tour, such a great way to see the city!!

Awesome!. The tour was very cool. The guide told us a lot about BA history and Argentinian culture - very interesting. We had great food and great Mate. 5 hours is a good time to see a lot of the city and a bike is the perfect vehicle to get around. Nothing to complain - absolutely recommandable!

If you have only one day in BA, try this. I had a fantastic day on the ultimate city tour, with Santiago. I had an extra day at the end of a quick business trip and this was a great way to cover a lot of the city in a relatively short period of time. I love starting out a visit to a new city with a bike tour, and this one ranks high on my list! Excellent guide, great bike, and a well planned tour. The breaks mixed in to stop and spend time in La Boca, Recoleta, Plaza de Mayo and other key areas were just right. Santiago was warm, knowledgeable and made this a really good experience.

All day (North and South) bike tour. Santiago and Gol were our guides for this all day (7 hour) bike tour. I cannot think of a better way to tour BA then this tour. Santi did a wonderful job describing the areas we biked in and filled us in on all of the historical background of each part of the city. He is a wonderful storyteller and very passionate about his city. Gol did a wonderful job of keeping the group safe and together. She even did a quick bike repair when one of our bikes had an issue. BA is very flat and with a bike you can cover a large area. The longest stretch we biked was probably 20 mins so you don't need to be a star athlete to participate. This tour runs every day and is the best way to see the city.

Great tour. We originally booked the ultimate tour but split it into two tours due to the heat. Taylor was our guide on both tours and he was knowledgeable and confident. We were the only two riders and covered a lot of the city. The ride was easy, mostly flat and much of it was on bike paths. Lots of time was allowed to walk in Recolleta cemetery and the park. Highly recommended as a way to see a lot of the city.

Simply the best - Heart of the City tour with Rodrigo!. There is no better way to explore Buenos Aires than this!! In 2010 I had already participated in one of their first tours with William and Rodrigo of Biking Buenos Aires and the day still remained as one of the best things we did during our stay back then. So recently, when I was in BA, I did the „Heart of the City“ tour with Rodrigo again and the tour could not have been more organized, informative and fun! I was thrilled to see how professionalism and the variety of bicycle tours have increased over the past six years. If you go on a tour, you will certainly get carried away by the enthusiasm they share about Buenos Aires and you will learn and understand a lot about the city's history plus that riding a bike in BA is a great experience. I hope to be back for another bicycle tour in the near future. :-) Couldn’t recommend more highly!!!

BEST way to explore BA!!. My friend and I signed up for the "Heart of the City" tour (with Ray ray, very funny and wry guide) because we are interested in history, and the tour did not disappoint. For about $60 USD, we had a 4 hour tour (turned into 5-6 hours) on beach cruisers (5-10 minutes of light biking, then 10 minutes to stop and learn from the guide), and this included helmets and water bottles. The bikes have a basket on the front but they cautioned against simply placing valuables/phones in there, since we stopped frequently and someone could just reach in and steal it. Some other people on our tour had small backpackets and either wore them or kept them in the basket. We were also able to keep things at the store itself. The tour also included a delicious lunch of bondiolas (essentially, pork sandwiches with lots of toppings; they asked if anyone was vegetarian and made accommodations!) and an alfajor at the end. The guides were happy to stop so we could take pictures and even took a few of us off the tour for a few minutes so we could find an ATM. No need to be a " real biker." Anyone from seniors to young teens could easily keep pace with the group - and there was always a tour guide in the back to make sure no one fell behind. Some of the roads didn't have bike lanes so we were rather close to cars and buses but it never felt dangerous.In fact we loved the tour so much that after it ended, we signed up for another one the next morning, Parks & Plazas (with Rodrigo, also amazing tour guide)! Coincidentally, no one else showed up for the tour, so we essentially got a private 6 hour tour of Palermo and Recoleta. This tour also included lunch of empanadas and alfajores at the end. We had to stop and respond to some work emails after lunch and Rodrigo was very nice and patient while we did that. He knows SO much about the history and culture of BA and Argentina, not to mention can recite literature from memory, and it was fascinating hearing his perspectives!

Fun and informative. Fantastic and fun way to explore the city. The staff was engaging kind and interesting from start to finish. I would recommend going on a Sunday when the streets are less crowded. We did a private tour for an extra $50 which allowed us to cater the tour to things we hadn't seen yet. They even engaged us in a matte making lesson after the tour!

Excellent way to spend a day in Buenos Aires. We had a great time on the Heart of the City tour. (We wanted to do the longer tour but it was all booked up!) Our guide, Stef, was fantastic - super friendly and knowledgeable. This is a great way to see the city and learn about the culture and history of Buenos Aires. Highly recommended!
Explore BA in a great way!. We had a fantastic day with our nice guide Taylor! I would recommend to do this at the beginning of your stay in Buenos Aires.

Fantastic Adventure. Ghettos, graves, misplaced monuments and manifestations in Plaza Mayo, Voldemort, huge sandwiches, our ride through the reserve, a stroll through the streets of La Boca, graffiti, ugly monuments, and of course those yummy alfajores. Thanks for the AWESOME tour with Raymond Lee today. We had a really lovely day out in the city with him and appreciated all of his incredible knowledge of history and of course his great vibes. Raymond made our trip to BA a lot of fun and a most memorable experience. Best wishes for continued success!
Tour with Taylor and Dominique. Had a great tour led by Taylor and Dominique! Great way to see everything in BA in just a day. Highly recommend!!!

Fun day !!! Great way to see the city !!!. We had a great day with Biking Buenos Aires.The staff is so nice a friendly -Thanks Ray.A private tour is a great idea, The staff customized a tour that worked for my family which included teens.I would do it again. Thanks Biking Buenos Aires.

Excellent Introduction to City. I heard about Biking Buenos Aires through travellers I met in Chile. They enjoyed their tour so I signed up. It is well organized with email payment and messaging. Reminder was sent regarding where to meet and what to bring (hat, sunscreen, water; although they provide helmets and water and even have bottles of sunscreen for you to use on premises and throughout the tour it's offered). I did the North/South full day tour from 10-5. I was one of three making it very pleasant. Santiago was our guide and his enthusiasm for the City was evident. He explained where we would be going and pointed it out on a map. We were given a bike and offered a helmet (although I preferred my hat). Bike seats were adjusted as needed. Each bike had a basket in front and I could also attached my GoPro bike grip to the handle bar. The seats are comfortable and the bike is three speed with hand brakes. The pacing of the trip was good although I wish we could've stopped more often to take pictures (but that's more my fault for not saying something as Santiago said we could stop whenever we wanted). There are several stops where you can wander around like in La Boca, Recoletta and Plaza de Mayo. We had lunch included (delicious pork, egg, ham sandwich; vegetarian option and vegan/Celiac available). All in all, it was a great way to be introduced to the major spots in BA as it's not a very walkable city (too geographically large) and although the subway is cheap, with biking you see lots of buildings and places you'd miss underground. There are designated bike paths most of the way making it safe to ride. I'd recommend you check out Biking Buenos Aires website for the various tours they offer. It was worth the money I spent.

Private tour. Did a private tour with Taylor starting at the Jardin Biologico and biking through the Palermo and Recoleta areas for 3 hours. He had great knowledge of the history of the city and loves his job. We stopped numerous times to hear about the sights and had an Yerba mate break where we learned about this traditional drink. Met a musical troubadour, a friend of Taylor's, who at 82 years of age was entertaining in the streets and selling his music. Very special day! Thanks Taylor!

Great day in BA. Four of us (two couples) booked a private Ultimate City Tour. Our guide was Santiago, a BA native who gave us a very good tour. I really appreciated all the info he presented to us from an insiders perspective. We talked history, politics, art and culture. It was a great beginning to our Argentina vacation and gave us a good understanding of the layout of the city. Buenos Aires is a bike friendly city with a lot of dedicated bike lanes.The only drawback was that one of our people was 6'5. The selection of bikes to choose from was limited because another large tour had just left. Our tall companion had to settle for a less than optimum bike.The staff was really great and I highly recommend this tour.

Great day . We had a fantastic day biking around BA. Taylor our guide was awesome and so knowledgeable. We learnt so much from him. He lunch included was great too. Just a warning it is tiring and around 3 pm I did start to get over it. So if you want something more relaxed do a half day and you won't be so exhausted from it. Highly recommend !!

Fun day - Argentina history in a nutshell. If you're in BA for a short time or need a very quick overview of BA's key buildings and Argentina's history in a nutshell - get on your bike and ride with Biking BA. The full city tour included a lunch stop for street food (really good), some time riding in parks and the cultural stuff.

Buenos Aires in the sun!. We took the Ultimate City Bike Ride through Buenos Aires on our 1st day here & loved it. It's a full day of riding with many stops along the way for info, refreshments & opportunity to wander as you wish. Our guides Hendrick & Gol were fun, full of history & stories of BA & took great care of our comfort ( it was a VERY hot day!). The ride & the detail Hendrick & Gol provided gave us a good sense of the city & what we want to spend time exploring. Would recommend it!

Nice way to see BA. This was a fun way to see Buenos Aires. It's really like you are part of the city on a bike. It's not as slow as walking, yet not as unpersonal as taking a bustour. They make sure you feel alright before you start the tour, they have water, fruits, (cool) helmets and even sunscreen in case you forgot. During the tour there were two extra girls that helped guide us through the city (made sure the cars stopped at intersections etc). Our guide Raymond (or ray ray or just ray :) was funny and knows his stuff. He talks about the city with a lot of love, though I'm still not sure what's true and what's not! The lunch at the Puerto Madero snackstand(sorry I don't remember the correct name) was good and plentiful. At the end we really felt like we had done a workout, which is good!

A Fun, Energetic Way to Learn and See BA's History. After hiking in Patagonia, my dad, sister and I had a quick layover in Buenos Aires. We wanted to pack in as much as we could over 24 hours and Biking BA's 5-hour city tour did not disappoint! With Rodrigo as our guide, we stopped at all of the major city centers and listened to the fascinating history of BA. Rodrigo was knowledgeable, passionate, and completely approachable -- which made for a fantastic tour. Everything was safe and well organized and the pace was perfect for looking about and taking in the city sights. I would 100% recommend Biking BA to travelers!

Amazing way to experience the city!. Took the tour of buenos Aires south city ("heart of the city") with Ray as our tour guide. It was a great way to see the city! Felt safe on the streets. Ray was very knowledgable so in the process of seeing so many sites, he really gave you a better understanding of the architectural and political history of the city. Great tour, highly recommend! Must be comfortable bicycling because my friend was nervous just sitting on the bike and in the end was not allowed to join the group.

See BA in one day and spend the rest of the time enjoying it!. We have been on bike tours all over Europe, Asia and a couple in South America but this was by far the best. We chose the Ultimate City Tour and although we thought it was relatively expensive at first, I don't regret a moment of it. The tour provides a really great opportunity to get an overview of the city, hit all the main tour spots, get to know some locals and have a lunch you wouldn't never have on your own. My partner and I were chatting at the end of the day and he asked me what my highlight was and without hesitation I answered the guide. He maintained an incredible, level of energy throughout the tour and really provided a great insight into what life is like in BA. We did this on our first day and felt that we saw the same amount in one day as we would have in 5 day if we were left to use public transport or walk. We also had a really fun lunch at a place where you would only visit as a local.The tour well above any other tour I have ever been on to make it as safe as possible. One of the guides constantly rode at the back of the group and then rode up beside us at every cross street to make sure no cars even came close to the bike lane. (Well above the call of duty). This day was incredibly enjoyable and a huge thanks to Santiago who led the tour!

Brilliant tour- well worth it!!!!. Me and my husband did the ultimate city tour today with Rodrigo who was brilliant, born and raised in Argentina, he has a huge passion for BA and brilliant knowledge as well! We had plenty of stops and had the best street food ever for lunch- was delish!!! Felt completely safe the whole time and you cover so much it would be a great tour for anyone with limited time in the city also- Rodrigo also gave us heaps of tips for restaurants for all the areas the group was staying so really tailored the info which was so handy also!Can't recommend more highly... Book it now!!

An absolute must for any Buenos Aires visit. We had such a great time on the Heart of the City tour with Ray Ray. The cycling was fun, and you always felt safe, especially in the stylish helmets they had on offer (I mean it they were actually pretty cool helmets!). Our group was small and it was easy to keep together and Ray Ray was always looking around him checking we were still following and keeping an eye on surrounding traffic. There's a little cycling on the roads, but most of it is on cycle paths. You gain a whole new perspective on the city, see some wonderful places as well as hearing about the history. It was liberating to cycle through the city, taking in the changing landscape, from old cobbled streets, parks and plazas through to skyscrapers and an ecological reserve - the city offers such variety. A highlight was enjoying matte and biscuits overlooking the comings and goings of La Boca - or maybe the best sandwich I have ever eaten - bondiola from a wonderful street vendor. Seriously if you're in BA - do this tour. You will love it!

Easy peddling, Rich history, Knowledgeable guide. We participated in the Parks and Plazas trip with Taylor, our guide.It was a 5 hour adventure around the city with lunch and drinks included.The cycling aspect of the trip was really easy and it was exciting to be out in a bustling city on a bicycle instead of a car! We felt safe at all times on the roads.Taylor was a wealth of knowledge on the history of Buenos Aires and the dramatic personalities that have formed her. It was a fun and comfortable day’s outing exploring the main roads and side roads of Buenos Aires culture!Their website and easy going communication via e-mail prior to the trip made it feel safe to book and pay for this trip online before we arrived.

Excellent tour. We did the full day tour with our guide Taylor who was a delight. We learned so much & Taylor had many wonderful stories. It was a great way to see Buenos Aires & we had plenty of rests so not taxing. I would highly recommend this company.
Biking BA Ultimate City Tour . Excellent day out with very insightful guide Taylor who gave us a unique perspective on BA. Thoroughly enjoyable and very enlightening. Would recommend to anyone.

Best way to see BA!. I did the ultimate city tour, 7 hours covering about 25kms and both the north and south sides of the city and loved it! The tour is at a really cruisy pace and had plenty of stops to have a drink and learn about the different areas. We were given plenty of time to check out La Boca and the Recoleta Cemetery. It was quite a hot day so our awesome guide Raymond made slight changes to our route and stopping points to keep us out of the sun where possible and was always happy to buy more water when we were out. Super informative and fun, and the lunch was fantastic! Absolutely loved it!

Highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. Can't recommend this highly enough. We did the South and City tour which was a great way to see the city. RayRay was a superb guide for our small group of 4 - fun, informative and passionate about BA which added to our enjoyment. Helmets were provided and while we did bike on some roads, we were mostly on cycle paths and felt completely safe at all times.All topped off with a brilliant Bondiola sandwich from a street vendor for lunch. I still have dreams about that sandwich. Get on your bike and book it now.

Worth it -- even if you're only in Buenos Aires for a short stay!. We were very impressed with how knowledgeable and enthusiastic our tour guide, Rodrigo, was about Buenos Aires. The tour provided a perfect introduction to the city and allowed us to explore neighborhoods we may not have seen during our short stay. Rodrigo took the time to thoroughly explain cultural and historical sites around the city. He happily took questions throughout the tour and made the experience quite leisurely. We were initially concerned that a 5 hour tour would take up too much of our precious time in BsAs, but it was worth every minute!

Everyone should Bike Buenos Aires!. My husband and I signed up for the 5 hour City Tour and it was so worth it! There were 5 total bikers ( the two of us from SF, a couple from Canada and young man from England) and two staff on our ride- perfect number! Raymond Lee and Graciel were our guides and they were fantastic, especially Raymond. He is a New Zealander, actor, entrepreneur, amazing historian and a genuinely nice guy. I cannot say enough about how great this bike tour was. It is the perfect way to see the city and hear about it's history all while getting a bit of exercise and wind in your hair- so fun! The bikes are cruisers and easy to ride. Don't overlook this activity!

Parks and Plazas. During our stay in Buenos Aires we decided to explore the city by bike. Booking was done easily. We met Taylor, our guide, at the entrance of the botanic gardens. A really funny and authentic guy. He offered helmets, water and sunlotion ;)It turned out to be a private tour, because it was only the three of us. Taylor did a really great job providing many interesting and amazing details about Argentinian culture and history. He showed us lots of lovely places all over Palermo and Recoleta and gave us time to take pictures and relaxe. We enjoyed our tour and can highly recommend it to everybody who wants to see behind the curtain!!

Great way to explore the city. Biking BA is a great tour and activity. You see all the great highlights and neighborhoods. The staff is super friendly and helpful! I learned a lot about the city's history and great local spots to check out.

Not to be missed! . We did the Heart of the city tour and it was excellent. Luke was our guide and he was fantastic so knowledgable and passionate about Argentina. It was a really fun day and a great mix of biking and exploring. I learnt so much and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Fun, A great way to see the city and learn about Buenos Aires and Argentina.. We booked the Heart of the City tour for a group of 6 of us. We had Rodrigo as our guide. They provide Bikes, helmets and water. We had our guide in the front and a spotter in the back to help stop traffic for us. It's a great way to learn your way around the city so book the tour in the first couple days you arrive in BA. Our guide was incredibly informative!!! I feel like we got a history lesson on Argentina. You ride from location to location then you get a wonderful talk about the history and it's cultural significance. We also stopped to have Mate and it was explained how to prepare it. We also stopped for a yummy lunch at a local food truck. You get a lot of information and a little exercise!! Highly recommended!

Amazing Tour Guide. If you are worried about your tour guide not being good with english you have nothing to worry about. They go into great detail about all the monuments and have a lot of fun facts to share. They food truck that they stop to get lunch is included and taste delicious. YOU HAVE TO GO!!!

My FAVORITE Tour in Buenos Aires. Thank you Biking Buenos Aires and Santiago Romero Negri for the BEST tour around. I came alone and requested for a private tour. It was amazing. Santiago took me everywhere. Because of my fitness level, we were able to combine two tours into one day! BONUS. I learned so much about the cities culture and history - many thanks to Santiago for making it so much fun and enjoying. He takes you to the BEST place for lunch too. It was a HOT day, so definitely pack on the sunscreen, and sunglasses.

Fab bike tour in Buenos Aires.. We did the 5 hour bike tour and it was worth every penny!Our guides for the day were Luke and Timo. Luke's knowledge of Buenos Aires and it's history was second to none he was like a fountain of knowledge. We learnt loads about the history, people and culture of the city, and it's ups and downs which was really interesting. The areas we went to were varied and some places such as the ecological reserve we wouldn't have visited without the tour. Lunch was delicious, a huge pork role with salads which was more than enough food. My girlfriend is a veggie and was also happy with her lunch. After the day we received an email of recommendations for restaurants, tango shows and other useful information which was a nice touch. Overall a great day and thoroughly recommended! John & Jordan

Great day! Very knowledgable tour guide!. Thanks Luke!My husband and I had a great day seeing BA by bike! Luke was a fantastic guide and gave us lots of interesting info about the sights and culture, as well as the politics and economics! A great way to see the changes between areas in BA!!!!

Best way to see and learn about BA!. My wife and I always try to take a bike tour of a new city when we first arrive. The tour guided by Taylor was exceptional. Knowledgable about the city and the history, Taylor made our day fly by. The bikes were easy to use and we loved all of our stops. One of the highlights was our food truck lunch stop to enjoy a typical Argentinian sandwich!If you are not sure what to see in a city when you have a limited time, this is the best way!

The best tour I've been a part of.. Ever!. I was in Buenos Aires for work, and had free time over the weekend. Asked the hotel where I stayed and some coworkers about a tour I could do, and everyone said take a hop-on-hop-off tour.. I was about to book a hop on hop off tour, you know being a single traveller for this trip to Buenos Aires.. thank goodness i didnt.. The full-day Buenos Aires Biking tour was by far the best i have ever had.. experiencing Buenos Aires on a bike was amazing.. To add to that Ray and Gol were superb.. they made is so much fun.. Not only did I get to learn a lot about the history, culture and people of Buenos Aires, it was fun to be part of a small group rather than some of the herds I saw during the day.. Ray was very insightful, albeit a bit cheeky at times (in a good way) and Gol was around to ensure everyone had a good time.. I intend to come back in February with my wife, and go on a few other tours with Biking Buenos Aires.Anyone coming to BA, this is highly highly recommended! Thank you guys!

Biking Tour - Parks and Plazas. I signed up for the biking Buenos Aires parks and plazas half day tour and found I was the only one booked in. However, Taylor, my guide did not seem to mind and gave me a private tour experience adjusting it to my requirements.He was very knowledgable and I gained greater insight into Argentinian history.The biking was relaxed and easy and a great way to see the city. I would highly recommend it.

Great introduction to BA . We did the 7 hour full day your on our first day in BA. Really good introduction to the city, and we learnt a surprising amount of the varied history of the city along the way Our guide, Rodriguez, was super informative and spoke perfect English. The Cemetery is on the tour, and it's definitely worth seeing. (Although it was very quiet on the roads (NY holiday period) we were very grateful for the support person who rode on ahead to stop traffic on many of the cross streets. It made a big difference to peace of mind in the face of taxi drivers that are without equal in any city we have been in (!). The tour would have been a different experience without that, particularly on normal traffic days.)

Excellent experience. Our family of 5 took an Ultimate private tour with our guide Raymond. Raymond was an excellent guide who was very informative and made the experience really fun. The riding is extremely easy and for the one small hill, Raymond pushed my daughter up while on her bike! I would highly recommend the bike tour as a great overview of the city if it's your first visit. Biking BA is a well organized company with very good bikes and a great staff.

Great Day Seeing BA. We did the North and South bike tour our first full day in the city and it was a great way to start our trip. Rodrigo and his partner did a fantastic job leading us around the city and giving us the history of Argentina and BsAs. I would recommend this tour to anyone.

Great city tour. This was a fantastic tour- our guides Taylor and Timo were incredibly knowledgable and took great care to provide an entertaining, educational safe and delicious (empanadas!!) experience. Only wish we had done this earlier in the trip, as it provides such great context for the city. Highly recommend for couples, friends and families with older children.

Great tour and very informative!. Great way to see and learn about Buenos Aires! Danish guide was very friendly, funny and taught us a lot (sorry cant remember his name). The also provide you with sunscreen and water! So wonderful!

Great way to see the city and learn about Argentine history. Taylor was a great guide. He clearly explained the history and importance of each monument we saw. The day was fun and it was a great way to see a lot in a short amount of time.

Friendly, Fun, and Informative. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Ray and consider it one of the highlights of our trip. Everything about the tour was first rate, from water and sunscreen provided before and during the ride, to the tour itself which had just the right mixture of history, anecdote, riding, and downtime. At the conclusion, we even received alfajores and mate! Highly recommended!

Awesome Day with Ray!. I went on the full day tour with Ray - such a fun experience! Ray expertly guided us around the city and shared some great history/stories. I felt completely safe and comfortable on the bikes. Great way to get oriented to the city or see a lot in a little time.

Awesome!!. The all team is committed and knowledgeable about their work ! Bike in perfect condition , guides dominate all content and sympathy out of the ordinary . I recommend to all TripAdvisor friends!Thank you Gustavo e Grazielle!!!

Great way to see the city. This was a fun and enjoyable way to see BA and to learn about the history and culture. RayRay was a great guide!The biking is very easy, and actually cooled us down from the heat.

BEST. TOUR. EVER.. My fiancée and I signed up for the full-day tour, and couldn't recommend it more. What an amazing way to see the city: on bike. Forget the bus tour. You want to do this. The biking was easy, there were plenty of stops along the way to wander off and take photos. And the best part was LUKE. I'm telling you, if you have an option of choosing your tour guide, this is the man. He is a wealth of information: he's an ex-pat from the States who knows more about Buenos Aires and its rich history than probably 95% of the locals. He was great. The tour was great. DO IT!

Great experience! Highly recommend!. We did the Ultimate City bike tour on our first full day in BA. This is a great way to see the city from north to south and learn about it's history and culture and try some authentic Argentinian cuisine! Our tour guide was Santiago who was very energetic and passionate - definitely made the tour worth our while!! The biking is not very strenuous, easy to ride bikes and helmets are provided. I would highly recommend this tour!! Try to plan in advance as tours were fully booked about a week in advance.

Great way to see the city. I did the full day Ultimate City tour. It was a full day, but not tiring and a great way to see the city. Travelling on the bike was pretty straight forward, there are plenty of bike lanes, even though some people seem to think they make excellent parking spots. Highly recommend the pork sandwich with egg for lunch!

Great all round tour of the city!. My husband and I did this tour in November. The weather forecast was poor so when we turned up it ended up being the two of us on the Ultimate City tour! this was fab as Ray was so knowledgeable and give us a great insight to the city which included politics, religion and history- fascinating. We stopped in all the main places and sampled some food as well. The city is so easy to cycle around with dedicated lanes everywhere. Would highly recommend!

Amazing way to see the city!. We booked the Ultimate City Tour (7 hours) and had an amazing time exploring the city on bike! Luke was an awesome guide - he's very very knowledgeable and provided a lot of little anecdotes and stories. The stop for lunch was delicious! We highly recommend this tour!

Whirlwind intro to the city. My private tour guide was well informed and really gave me a thorough introduction to Argentina and Buenos Aires. We touched on several aspects of culture, history, soccer, and modern life. And we rode through five different parts of the city. Bike seat was comfortable for cruising for several hours, bike was older but pedaled and stopped fine.

GREAT way to experience Buenos Aires. Just returned from a visit to Argentina. When I arrived, I decided to take, on the advice of staff member Kaylee, a biking tour of Buenos Aires. It was everything she told me about, and what I hoped for. Our tour guide was Luke, an energetic, upbeat, young man who knew the route well, the history and stories of the city. It was a fun, informative way to experience the city, all while getting some, a moderate level of, exercise. A great lunch was included. I have every intention of trying some of the other tours Biking Buenos Aires offers on my next visit.

Fun with a professional staff. We have done several bike tours in other cities and this is one of the best; good information, well planned itinerary, nice bike stroll and very friendly staff from start to finish. a great choice if you have an active lifestyle. Much better than bus tours.
We do recommend doing it on Sundays when there is almost no traffic.

Amazing way to discover the coty. We booked the ultimate city tour & had a fantastic time cycling around Buenos Aires. Luke and Gol our guides were fantastic & looked after the whole group well. We never felt insecure at any point of time. Luke was not only very knowledgeable about the history of Buenos Aires / Argentina but also super passionate. He never rushed us and always took time to answer every question the group had. Lunch was simple but good. We can't recommend the tour enough to anyone visiting Buenos Aires, it's a great way to learn about the history of this beautiful city / country. Beware, the tour is very popular so book well in advance.

A Difficult Group to Deal with. We were a group of 6, 2 young kids, 2 older people who were not strong bicyclists and 2 other adults, an odd assortment of skill levels. Our guide, Luke, did a wonderful job of keeping us together and showing us as much of BA as 3 hours and our relatively slow pace allowed us. Despite the traffic, we were very comfortable on the bikes and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

The most amazing and accommodating! . Yesterday my husband and I set off with Biking BA for their Ultimate City Bike Tour for 16 miles and roughly 7 hours. It's not a hard bike ride so don't let the 16 miles or the 7 hours till you into thinking it's super intense. You ride for a little, you walk around for a little, you have lunch, and ride some more. We have Luke & Gol as our guides and they were awesome. Very informative and both had a great sense of humor. They provide water, ponchos if necessary, sunscreen and even Gol carried granola in case you were hungry! I would suggest bringing a protein bar just in case. When you arrive to the Biking BA office they will offer you filtered water, banana or an apple, whatever you want! Helmets are optional and the bikes also have baskets so if you bring a backpack or purse you can leave it in your basket. The ride was wonderful and Luke was very informative. Lunch was great right by the water next to the Ecological Reserve. They also offer both vegetarian and regular sandwich options! My husband and I had a really lovely time and recommend it highly!

Brilliant day!. We did the Ultimate Tour with Biking Buenos Aires. My other half wasn't that keen but I basically begged/cajoled him into doing it and afterwards he said how brilliant it was and that he was really glad we'd done it as it was a fantastic way to see most of the city and learn the history. We covered 26km in just over 7h (BA is pretty flat, the largest 'hill' is 30m!) on excellent bikes with comfy saddles. Top tip: the white ones have gears! They also give you a water bottle and lunch is included.We had a nice small group of 7 plus Rodrigo, our BA born and bred encyclopaedically knowledgeable guide, and Timo our mechanic/traffic stopper. All the main bits of BA are visited and we learnt lots of history of Argentina also, which was so interesting but some of it absolutely dreadful. We started at their office in San Telmo, and headed down to La Boca (bombonera stadium - interesting even if don't care about football, the social history is good) - and la caminita, where we had around free time to wander and take photos. Then it was up to Puerto Madero, the modern 'port' area, and along the Rio da Plata and the nature reserve. We stopped here and had a great lunch included - huge pork Parilla sandwich. This refuelled us and kept us going through Retiro and on to Recoleta where we learnt the history of Peron and Eva. Here we also had free time to wander in the cemetery for about 15mins. There are no signs to show you where to go (probably as they'd rather you paid for a tour) but we managed to find her tomb. After an initiation the ritual of maté, we rolled down the rush-hour streets, between buses and parked cars (funnot scary) and on to Plaza de Mayo, our last stop before we headed back to the office for alfajores.We all said what a brilliant day it had been, and we really really recommend it to anyone coming to BA. 10am-5pm sounds long but it goes quickly it's so interesting.

fun, fun, informative fun!. Our large group of 15 booked the 7 hour tour. It was pouring rain at 10:00. They were very flexible and let us start late after rain slowed down. Santiago is THE BEST tour guide. So enthusiastic and full of fascinating historical stories. He knows it all. A great way to experience Buenos Aires! Some of the biking is in traffic. Would not recommend to young children or other inexperienced cyclers. Lunch was delicious! Really great lemony pork sandwich
