Must Do!!. My mom and I did the Heart of the City South Tour on our 1st full day in Buenos Aires. Our guide was great and personable. Not strenous and anyone can do this who can bike. Wear sunscreen! I was the only one who didn´t and got sunburned. Lunch was amazing and local. You have to use this tour group!!

A "must-do" when visiting Buenos Aires!. We had a fantastic day with the Biking BA team! A great way to see the city and learn about the history and culture. Our guides Santiago and Dominique were very friendly, excellent English and also safety aware which is obviously very important. I especially enjoyed going to La Boca and learning about how the traditional Argentinian mate (tea) is poured. For lunch, you are taken to a great spot where there are lots of food trucks. Everyone is invited to order a baguette filled with a meat of your choice. Fab little salads and garnishes to choose from that you add yourself. Included in the tour price. Would thoroughly recommend this tour. Good comfortable bikes that are easy to ride. Helmets of course are provided and also a bottle of water.

MUST DO!. Did a 7 hour tour on day one of 5 in Buenos Aires. BEST way to start the trip! Perfect way to see so much of the city, learn so much about it's history, and get a feel for all the different neighborhoods. The guides, Rodrigo and Raymond, were absolutely wonderful - full of knowledge and excited to share all they knew. I can't say enough good things about this company and the tours - JUST DO IT!!!

Worth the cost, Best way to see the city, KNOW HOW TO BIKE!. After our one day tour, we felt like we were grounded in the city, well informed by our fantastic guides, and able to make good decisions of what we wanted to see more of during the rest of our stay in Buenos Aires. Bikes are large, comfortable cruisers with baskets and water bottle provided. Our guides Sanitago and Gustavo were friendly, informative and clearly passionate about the fascinating Argentine political and cultural history – positive and not - explored on the tour. They also did a nice job of paying attention to each of us: due to a rain storm the day before, our group was on the larger side (9 riders, 5 of whom had rescheduled from the previous day) - smaller would have felt a little easier at a few intersections and road crossings, but at all times, Santiago and Gus were looking out for us and making adjustments to ensure our safety and allow us to see / spend time at all of the ride highlights. Riding on the street never felt unsafe – Argentine drivers were always paying attention to us. The key to safe bike riding in any city is riding with confidence and not wobbling and weaving – in our experience, if you do this and trust your guides, you’ll be fine – and you’ll have a great tour of the city. Please note – this is definitely a tour that’s on bikes, not a bike ride – even though it’s 26 km, the pace is slow – you won’t feel that you got a workout when you’re done. Tasty lunch and mate included as well as fruit before you start. Water bottles and helmet also provided

Do this day 1. Excellent way to get a fast track version of a complex history. I did the ultimate tour which covered most of the city highlights but leaves you enough to either go back and explore further or go further afield. Cycling is easy- mostly bike lanes, only one rise to speak of. Lunch is a lovely spot along the parade at a traditional food truck - great intro to BA meat eating! Will recommend to anyone on first trip

Great way to see the city!. I just came back from a trip to Argentina. We only had a couple days to spend in Buenos Aires so decided to do a bike tour with Biking Buenos Aires. It was SO GREAT! Our guide was Santiago and he was the best! He took us all over the city and we learned so much about the history and culture of Buenos Aires and Argentina as a whole. He was extremely knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and engaging the entire time. We had a great lunch together and left feeling like friends instead of tourists. It started to rain EXTREMELY hard toward the end of the tour but it did not put a damper on things at all. Santiago brought out the ponchos he had brought and didn't miss a beat! I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Argentina, especially if you only have a short time to see the city and want to get the most out of it!
Great tour . Great guide . Great lunch!!. Great tour . Great guide (ray and co) . Great lunch!! Would highly recommend for anyone traveling to BA looking for an intro to this amazing city!

Best way to see a city. I did two trips with BA Biking. I did the North City with Taylor and then went down to Patagonia for 10 days and then did the South City with Luke when I got back. Both guides were knowledgeable and flexible. I was teh only rider with Taylor and it was a rainy miserable day for a trip. But he was up for it and I wanted to see as much of the City as possible. The views were great (though a blue sky for just a little while would have been nice) and the tour was instructive and interesting and the lunch was delicious. Luke was lucky with a perfect sunny day and a bigger group, but we saw everything that I wanted and I learned a lot and again, lunch was good.

Fantastic Biking Tour of Buenos Aires. When I travel to a new place I typically search out a biking tour as I find it a good way to see some important sites, get exercise and learn about the heart of the city. Ray and the Biking Buenos Aires team did not disappoint. It was one of the best biking tours that I have been on - the bikes were comfortable and in good shape (you can even sponsor one with your name on it if you'd like), the pace comfortable and the sites were very interesting. Ray did a fantastic job describing the important historical and political developments of Buenos Aires over the last 150 years and was keen to answer all questions. Gol was a great guide too and handy with the tools when anyone needed a minor bike adjustment. The trip comes with lunch and while they suggest that you have a hearty breakfast, I would suggest something a little lighter as they provide one of the best (and largest) grilled sandwiches I've ever had. They even finish the day with chocolates! They kept us safe and made it very fun. Two thumbs up for this tour! Highly recommend.

Absolutely superb. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour. Saw much more of Buenos Aires than I would have on foot, and all of it was worth seeing. Santiago was an excellent guide, with an obvious love of his city. He seemed to take great joy in sharing his knowledge of the history of Buenos Aires, Argentina, and South America. His sidekick Goose was also very friendly and helpful. Can't think of anything they could have done that would have made me enjoy it more.

Wish I could give this a 6:). Highlight of my time in Buenos Aires!!! This is an absolute must! We did the ultimate city tour with Ray. We leant so much about the city (many WOW moments) and saw such amazing things. It is $90 per person,for 7 hours,including the most amazing lunch at the food trucks and all your water for the day. I highly HIGHLY recommend this tour...loved it!!!

History, Exercise and Fun. Great way to spend a day learning about the history of Argentina, getting a tour of Buenos Aires and a perfect way to wear off the steak and wine from the past few days! Santiago is a fabulous guide. We could have pedaled around another 7 hours listening to his stories Argentina. The bikes and helmets were in good shape. This company went over and above our expectations. I don't want to tell you everything….

Great family outing - best way to see BA!. Spent a fabulous day with our guide Taylor cycling through this beautiful city. Taylor was great fun and very informative, giving us plenty of information on history and culture. Our daughter enjoyed watching the city from the back of the bike with plenty of stops along the way. Can highly recommend this tour. Do not miss it!
Most excellent tout. Very informative and positive tour Santi and Gra did a wonderful job of keeping our group on pace and provided a great service for our lunch spot.

Top notch Santiago!. Biking Buenos Aires is an excellent way to explore the city as the weather and the topography helps on that direction. Nonetheless, this is not the reason why you should miss it. The primary reason is that the team behind the operation and especially Santiago and Maria (I think that's the name of the kind Brazilian girl) are really enjoying what they do and this manifests everywhere.. They are excellent on what they do and you get that kind of top notch level of experience. Moreover, Santiago who is a local is very knowledgeable of the historical, social and political context of the actual situation and communicates it in such a relevant and clear way that you suddenly immerse into it and everything makes sense! Great job !

City Bike tour was fantastic. We are a group of four Canadians who joined Taylor and Raymond for about a five hour tour around Boca and Puerto Madera. It was one of the highlights of our trip. Great way to see the sights and Taylor was extremely knowledgable about the fascinating history of Argentina and BA. I'd highly recommend this - great value!

Fantastic tour!. Our tour guide, Dom, was great. We learned all kinds of interesting things about buenos Aires and its history. Thanks Dom and Biking Buenos Aires! I'd recommend this for anyone who's interested in getting a little exercise while seeing the sites and learning a little while you do it. And in Argentina you'll need the exercise between the steak, the wine, and the dulce de leche!!

One word... Fantastic!!. We were the only ones on the Tour and the guide was amazing. Frustratingly I can't remember his name, but he is about to graduate from a degree in political science and was clearly passionate about the city and its guide was friendly and we learnt so much along the way. This is an absolute must trip!

Excellent review of the city. Staff were wonderfully friendly and knowledgeable. Excellent people, a very interesting and varied tour with fascinating stories about local history. Our team was a little worried about a bike tour because we were pretty tired but the route was extremely easy for otherwise pretty out-of-shape people =). Highly recommended!

Best introduction and tour of BUENOS AIRES. We came across this bike tour business quite by accident as we were staying just around the corner. Situated in San Telmo the tour begins with a greeting by the friendliest crew we've met in BA. we don't speak Spanish, but our guide Taylor does with the ease of a local. This paid off in diamonds as we felt safe, and Taylor ensured that we did not miss out on anything as we rode into all the areas that are recommended for the BA traveller. LOCAL LUNCH that was included in the price was very generous. We have to say that TAYLOR BRITT was outstanding in sharing his historical and local knowledge, it's one thing to look at a building, statue, park or avenue...it's another now knowing the history behind it. We appreciated that even though there was only 2 of us taking the full day tour (which we recommend cause you see it all) they still went out, so we felt like it was a private tour at a group tour price. The bikes were comfortable, and the route easy. Traffic was not a problem as we trusted TAYLOR to get us through. Thanks again, we highly recommend the full day tour and ask for TAYLOR if possible.

No better way to see BA. I was a bit hesitant to take this tour, but it ended up being hands-down the highlight of my trip to BA. I took the 5-hr tour with Ray-Ray and Dom, who interacted brilliantly with our group and made the experience unforgettable. Ray's enthusiasm and witty banter didn't make it feel like sitting in history class as his way of presenting keeps you enthralled for the entire day. An amazing lunch is provided along with snacks, tea and water. Stop reading these reviews right now and book this tour!

Bueno by Bike. On the spur of the moment Sunday morning I decided to try this tour. I called the office and Will was very helpful and accommodating. The Ultimate City tour was sold out so we joined 5 other people on the Heart of the City tour. We were very pleased with the tour, and judging from what I heard, so were others in our party. This is DEFINITELY the way to see BA! We easily and safely covered a lot of ground all the while experiencing the different sensations of the city. The tour began with a orientation session in the shop, lasted about 5 hours, interesting stops, and an awesome lunch from a food truck. The guides, Ray and Santi were excellent providing interesting information and perspectives on the history, culture, and life styles of Buenos Aires. BTW, this is a easy and safe tour; BA has fairly extensive bike lanes and the automobile drivers are tolerant of bike riders and the guides are very attentive to your safety and comfort. In my opinion, the best approach would be to book a couple of their tours to learn the city quickly, and follow-up on your own with the things that really catch your interests. Bottom line: this is the best way to tour the city and is a "Must Do" in Buenos Aires.

fascinating barracas bike tour. if you're looking for a slightly different bike tour, if you have seen the highlights of BA or if you know BA well, and you are a confident cyclist, then this is the tour for you. a new(ish) tour, developed by the informative and insightful Luke, really gets under the skin of the newly emerging design neighbourhood barracas and shows you a different side to this enormous and varied city. Luke was a great tour guide and guy: flexible, adaptable and easy going!we had some issues booking onto a tour with biking BA but the issue was soon resolved by the manager and we got to spend an afternoon hearing some interesting stories, seeing some amazing street art, taking in very variable architecture and tasting a fantastic sandwich at the end from a local parilla.the tour runs on request and is recommended for the weekends. book onto it now!!!

Great experience!. An excellent way to see tons of sights in one day! Our guides Santi and Dom were awesome, keeping us safe and giving lots great information. Did the ultimate tour which was 7 hours. It felt great to be active while taking in the sights of Buenos Aires. Highly recommend!

Heart of the City Tour with Biking Buenos Aires. Our family took this tour, guided by Taylor and Gustavo, and it was the best thing we've done in Buenos Aires. BA is the perfect city to see on bicycle and the folks at Biking BA are the perfect people to guide you. Taylor's knowledge of Buenos Aires history was encyclopedic and put every place we visited in context. We are hoping to do a second tour - the Graffitti Tour - while we are here. We highly highly recommend this company and their tours!

Awesome bike tour of the southern part of BA. Our guide, Rodrigo, was great. His knowledge of the history of the city and country added a lot to the tour. The place we stopped for lunch had amazing sandwiches - that only was worth the price of the tour. One of the best bike tours I've taken in many cities!

Best bike tour I've been on. Went on the full city 7 hour tour with Biking Buenos Aires and was so impressed. There were 12 of us and they had 3 guides looking after us, making sure we were safe at all times. The lead guide Taylor was fantastic - incredibly knowledgable about Buenos Aires and Argentina and an excellent story teller. Dominique and Henrik were the trail guides making sure we all stayed together and physically blocking traffic sometimes to make sure we could cross intersections. The guides were so well prepared with even little things like hand sanitiser at lunch and tissues for the bathrooms. Highly recommended - we had so much fun, felt incredibly safe and it was the best way to see BA!

Great way to see BA!. Whilst the weather wasn't on my side, I decided to go ahead with the cycling Nth & Sth city tour...which ended up being a private tour as I was the only one silly enough to cycle in the rain! Ray was happy to still take me out, sharing his in-depth knowledge of this historical city. Rays warm personality & charisma made the cycle tour more enjoyable, altering it a little to have a few extra breaks out of the rain, a hot chocolate stop which was a lovely surprise! Also the lunch was amazing, i can see why Parilla Mi Suena is so popular! There is so much see I this city, a bike tour is the way to go! Thanks for a fun day out & supplying a much needed plastic poncho!

A Must Do!. This was by far one of the best activities I've done while in BA - it is an amazing way to see the city while getting a ton of great historical knowledge and insights into the city. I really loved our tour guides Ray Ray and Gustavo - They made us feel incredibly taken care of and are so much fun to be around! I can't wait to do this again when I'm back!

Take this tour as soon as you get here.. I had been in Buenos Aires for nearly 10 days before I took this trip and wished I would have taken it sooner.First, piloting your own bike around the city you naturally orientate yourself and become accustom to your surroundings. Secondly, the traffic can be intimidating in the city, but the guides really helped me understand how the disorder is really just a different flow. Our guide Dominick was on traffic duty and seemed to control cars with a 'thumbs up' or a 'wait just a sec' wave of his hand. In the States, such actions would often be met with road-rage, but here drivers just nod and check their phones while they waited for us to pass.  The lead guide, Rodrigo, was simply amazing. He has a zest and appreciation for his hometown that can't be taught. He just naturally loves sharing the story of BA. A fun and cheerful character, he didn't shy away from sharing the difficult and at times tragic parts of Argentine history. Brutal dictatorships and wars are not easy to hear but absolutely necessary in understanding the culture and mood of this complex country. There was not a question I had that he did not seem to be an expert on and never rushed through an answer. My advice for your visit is to get off the impersonal bus tours and get out on a bike as soon as you can.

Best bike tour I've done.... The bike tour was for the entire day, we started at 10am and everything was scheduled and arranged prior to my arrival by email. I was provided with a helmet, and water, and lunch during the tour. The tour was very informative and learned a great deal about the city history while riding along at a comfortable pace. There were 3 of us in the tour and the tour guide Corine. Corine was from Belgium but her knowledge of the city and local history was amazing. She was very careful about safety and made sure to give us good directions about traffic and which side of the road to bike on. The bikes were in good condition and very comfortable. The pace of the tour was good, she kept asking us whether we were comfortable with the pace. I would highly recommend her as a guide if she is still in Buenos Aires. I really enjoyed the places that we visited such as Boca, San Telmo, Retiro, Palermo, Recoleta, Puerto Madero, Centro, etc. We pretty much saw a slice of the entire city in one day. Amazing tour and would highly recommend.

The best way to see the city. I signed up for The Ultimate City Tour at the last minute, about two hours before it was due to start, and was able to do this easily online. As a lone traveller, it was an excellent way to see this large city. Our guide Santiago was entertaining and very informative and made the trip really enjoyable. It's an easy ride — we were on the bike for about 10 to 15 minutes at a go, then stopped to see some sights, have lunch, go to the toilet etc. Buenos Aires is a suprisingly easy city to bike around. The vehicular traffic has great respect for cyclists and there are bike lanes in many parts of the city. It was a very stress-free and informative ride.

Tour gets 98 out of 100!. Great time on the "ultimate tour." Was able to book online with easy directions to meet in San Telmo. Sweet tour of the City seeing many must-see sites and explanations of areas to avoid later! Local guide (Santi) plus Ray and Gus gave a lot of info, history, and humor. The ride was not strenuous - it was much more tour than biking. But it was a great way to see the highlights!

Excellent way to get aroung Buenos Aires. I love biking tours and this was an excellent option for Buenos Aires. The city is quite easy to go around and the Biking Buenos Aires team is always making sure you are safe while riding your bike. The information given in the tour is good. It goes from history, economics and way of living, which makes it interesting and it gives you a good panorama of the town. I'd definitely recommend this tour to anyone who enjoys this activities, you won't regret it.

Great way to explore the city. During 7 hours - don't worry, there are plenty of stops on the way - 3 guides take you on a bike tour through a large part of some of the most interesting places of the city. Timo and Gustovo are great guys who kept us safe all the time and Henrik is an amazing guide. All three speak English very well, they all know their stuff and it's great fun to spend the day with them. Obviously, much depends on the dynamics of your group, but if it were just up to BBA and our three guides, this would always be a super fun activity. I can recommend it to anyone!

A fantastic way to see the city of Buenos Aires. For our first day in Buenos Aires this was a great way to get an overview of the city. We opted for the full day. The pace was easy with plenty of stops and even negotiating the crazy city traffic did not prove a problem, there are lots of cycle paths and the guides keep you safe. Rodriguez was a brilliant guide, we learnt so much about the politics and history of Argentina. There is an excellent lunch stop by th river, and Anna shared her mate with us when we had a tea stop! I would highly recommend this tour if you do not have many days in this great city, you will learn and see so much.

Amazing tour!. My husband and I went on the Ultimate City Tour and LOVED it! Our guides (Raymond and Gustavo) were knowledgeable and fun and did a great job explaining the plan and making us feel safe. The the bikes were in great shape as well. We learned a lot and had a blast-- this is the best way to see Buenos Aires! Plus-- lunch was fabulous!

Nice ride. Sometimes ignorance is better. . The guide was knowledgeable about the city's history and the ride was easy and safe despite the crumbling infrastructure and wild automobile traffic. The bicycles are in good condition. We did half of the full day tour, quitting in the middle because of the weather. I don't know if the second part is more cheerful. What I was left with was a sense that this is a bleak and violent, broken city and country. I'm sorry this is the reality for Argentinians. I wish I could unlearn everything and only go for a nice bike ride.

Very Interesting and Informative Tour. Rodrigo was our guide for what ended up being a private tour for the four of us. We did the South Tour making stops in Parque Lezama, La Boca (near La Bombonera and El Caminito), Puerto Madero, and Plaza de Mayo including a lunch stop at Puerto Madero. Some city traffic at the beginning and end, but very enjoyable and easy riding everywhere else. Rodrigo studied political science so he will literally give you an in-depth class in Argentinian politics and history. We truly enjoyed his explanations and points of view.

Fantastic and Fun Overview of the City. We did the full 7 hour Ultimate City tour. It was super informative and very fun! We covered way more ground than we ever would have been able to on our own. Our tour was led by RayRay and Dom. They kept us safe on the roads and made sure we had a great time. We felt like we got a lot of inside information on the city that would never have come through a guide book. 100% recommended!

Great day- fun tour!. Taylor was our main guide, and he was super nice, pretty knowledgable, and the two others on the team made us feel safe crossing big intersections as a group. He told good stories about the landmarks. They watch your stuff while you walk around to explore the sites, which is nice. We did the 7 hour tour that included a pretty comprehensive ride through the city...but it's all flat so it's easy riding. Bring sunscreen! Also - if you go to the Parilla food truck for lunch, I recommend the chori-pan :) noms. We had fun doing this early in our trip so we knew what neighborhoods we wanted to come back to later.

Heart of the City Tour. A great introduction to BA. Both Henrik & Jonathan were wonderful guides. Very knowledgeable & what a lovely way to get to know some history of the city. A great start to get me exploring further on my own. Many thanks. Helen

Best way to discover Buenos Aires. Took the Ultimate City tour on my first full day in Buenos Aires. I thought it was an amazing way to get to know my surroundings. Rodrigo was an excellent guide, so knowledgeable about his home town and gave us valuable insight into the history and politics of Argentina. A must do.

Geat Tour and Awesome Guides - Best Experience. When we travel my husband and I usually run the city early in the mornings to acclimate ourselves and see where all we want to visit later on the trip. This was our first time booking a biking tour - and wow did we wait for the best. Ray Lee is articulate, humorous, intelligent and blessed with a gift of gab and the ability to educate anyone. Dom aka "Bumper" was most helpful and a joy to meet. Together they provided the whole tour with an absolutely wonderful day and for us the highlight experience of our week in Buenos Aires. We highly recommend this tour and when you book specifically ask for Ray and Dom. The stories and history shared are like nothing you will get from anyone else. Also, it was a great way to meet other people with similar interests from all around the globe. We really had a great time.

Get a great overview of this diverse and IRONIC city. I recommend you do this tour on your 1st day in Buenos Aires. I did the 7h city tour with Ray and Dom, and it was the perfect way to get familiar with this city. It's not like you're riding your bike for 7 hours straight; it's a relaxed pace, you get a nice lunch and you hear great stories along the way. I guess more than 90% of them might even be true!
Heart of city tour. Taylor and Graziella were fantastic. Great info, very good way to see Buenos Aires. Not hard biking either. Would strongly recommend.

great intro on our first day in Buenos Aires. Great guide (Anne) - knowledgeable, very friendly and enthusiastic about her subject, flat terrain (surprised to see some dedicated bike lanes), saw all the key areas that we visited again during our stayYummy lunch in Puerto Madero.
Great 1st day option. The Ultimate City Tour covers all the key BA highlights and is an effective and informative overview. Lunch stop also was very good.

best way to stroll around Bs As!. Look no further! the amazing guys at Biking BA will take great care of you! we took the USD60 tour for 5 hour and had a great time with our tour guide Quique. really relaxing, entertaining and filled with history and joyful conversation. Don't forget to have a pint in the San Telmo neighborhood after you are done!

Very fun way to see and experience Buenos Aires!. My friend and I did the 5-hour day trip in September 2015. It was a lovely spring day and we had a up-close and personal view of this grand city, in a way you can only do on a bike! Our guides were so professional and safety was important- they made sure we had great day. We learned history and architecture and got a nice feel for Buenos Aires, including seeing La Boca and the Mate ritual. It is a well-run experience you will not forget.

Lovely afternoon in BA.. We loved the experience. In special our guide Raymond, who took us on the South Heart of the City tour on his birthday! Very informative and interesting. We highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires.

Best Tour of the City with the Best Guides. My boyfriend was a bit skeptical when I suggested doing a bike tour of the city, but it ended up being a trip highlight for both of us. Our tour guides Santiago and Taylor were amazing. They knew a ton and were really fun, engaging people. It was a great way to see the city, but also learn Argentine history along the way. We did the 7 hour Full City tour. 7 hours sounds a like a lot, but we could have kept going. You bike through the city (and most of it is really easy, they have bike lanes with concrete barriers so cars can't drift into your lane) and then stop and stroll around in the different neighborhoods. We also had an incredible lunch at this little sandwich stand along the waterfront. It was my most tasty meal of the trip, and that's really saying something.Anyway, if you go to Buenos Aires, and have a day, I HIGHLY recommend Biking Buenos Aires. If I could give more than 5 stars I would.

Awesome experience!. We loved the tour. Great experience to know Buenos Aires in a different way.We had been to Buenos Aires several times but had never experienced using a bike.Our guide - Quique - was great!Highly recommend!

Fabulous day biking the heart of Buenos Aires. We had a fabulous day biking through the old neighbourhoods of Buenos Aires under the expert guidance of Raymond - a Kiwi who knows a remarkable amount of history about this city! Highly recommend this as a way to get a feel for the city.

What biking tours should be. Our experience with Biking BA was just amazing. We called in last minute on a sunday for a bike tour. Other biking touroperators were either closed or full. The very nice english speaking woman on the phone was very excited to have us. On arrival we were greeted warmly and got introduced to Santiago our guide. Although I wouldnt mind her being our guide ughm ;-) But Santiago is the best! Speaks perfect english and told us all these background stories about the sights and history of BA and argentina. We really got the inside information that made us understand argentinian culture and society a little bit more. We did the ultimate city tour with amazing lunch and got to see all the hotspots. Thanks guys for an amazing day and keep up the good work.

Great day out. We had a wonderful day exploring Buenos Aires with our fantastic guides ray and dom. Easily the best way to see all of the city and learn some of the history,customs and experiences of the locals. Can't recommend it enough..

Excellent way to see Buenos Aires. My wife and I signed up for the 7hr full City bike tour. What a great experience. Rodrigo was our guide and we couldn't have asked for a better guide. He is very knowledgeable about the history and culture of BA and Argentina and made sure any questions we had were answered.If your coming to Buenos Aires make sure to do the full day tour, it's worth every penny.

Awesome tour!. I was a little nervous about biking through the streets of Buenos Aires, but our guides Robin and Taylor were awesome! The tour was the perfect length and provided a great overview of the city. The guides were very knowledgeable about the history, culture and politics in the city. It could not have been a better experience.

Great way to see the city and so much fun!. This was a fantastic way to see BA. My friends and I had a wonderful time, but only wish we would had done this earlier during our stay so we could return to some of the sites we saw and check out the guys recommendations. Robin was a great guide. Super laid back and 100% enjoyable. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting BA, even if you think your aren't the "tour type".

Wonderful Day Biking Heart of City Tour. Our tour guides, Taylor and Gustavo for the Heart of the City tour were great...Taylor, from Denver Co...was up on this history and showed very obviously leadership qualities ...Gustavo was our sweeper and always kept our safety first...He was a delightful person to be around....We never felt a moment of fear on the streets...had just enough breaks , not to mention a really good lunch...learned about the history of Buenos Aires and had plenty of time to ask questions and take pictures...From the moment we arrived the Buenos Biking Family were super nice ...you will feel welcomed from the get go...I found everyone very professional and personal ...If ever returning I will without a doubt do another tour....loved it..( I haven't been on a bike in couple of years , so I'm no expert) Thanks Taylor and Gustavo!!

Ray was fantastic for our all day bike tour around BA!. Ray was incredible with his attention to detail while showing us around the city. He was very patient with us and his concern for safety didn't go unnoticed. He really loves what he does and we couldn't of been happier to have experienced this tour with Ray.The Love Story made the trip!!!

Great overview of BA. We did the full day tour our first day in Buenos Aires. It was a great way to get an introduction to the city. Our tour guide, Santiago, was very knowledgable about BA and its history. After the tour we also received recommendations on things to do, where to eat, drink, and go out. I would highly recommend this tour!

Great way to see the city. Really enjoyed this guided tour. Santi and Gustavo are really enthusiastic and make the tour what it is. We did the north part of the city and it didnt disappoint. Some nice extras are the yerba mate and Empanadas for lunch. You learn a lot of different things that I hadnt on other tours from these guys. Would definately recommend on one of your first days so you can get a feel for the city.

An amazing tour (South City). Wasn't quite sure how a cycling tour could quite live up to its trip advisor reputation but this was fantastic! Our guide Rodrigo was so knowledgable (I believe he said he had a politics degree) and interesting. He knew everything about the history, politics and economy of BA and communicated it all superbly. The cycling itself was pretty relaxed and not nearly as nerve wracking as I had anticipated. Even the place they brought us to for lunch was delicious, as were the mate and snacks provided along the way. Absolutely worth the money and a fantastic introduction to the city. Also it was my birthday and they gave me a delicious Alfajore birthday cake to celebrate-such a nice touch! Thanks Rodrigo :)

Unique way to tour and see so much more!. We LOVED our bike tour through the parks! We only had one day to spend in Buenos Aires and chose to do this as a unique way to tour the city. Because of using bikes, we got to see so much more than if going on a walking tour. There are bike lanes that were mostly used and it is completely safe. You have to have some basic ability to ride a bike, but nothing more than that. The tour included a break that included sampling mate that the tour guide made, and a lunch with empañadas towards the end of the tour. They were delicious! Our tour guide was Estefania and she was very knowledgeable about the city. We learned a lot about its history and she had a lot of personal connection to the city as well. She was so nice; it was like visiting an old friend who was showing us around. We highly recommend this tour!

A great day.. A fantastic way of seeing the city and learning about its history. Our guide, Robin, was knowledgeable and engaging and his outgoing manner made the day enjoyable. The ride was safe and easy...we generally followed the bike paths and the city is flat! Great bikes, interesting landmarks and a delicious lunch along the way. Highly recommended.

Great way to see BA. We really enjoyed our day out. You can cover a lot of ground on a bike and it was made simple by the help of our guide Ray. It was easy to negotiate traffic as we just followed him like ducklings and had no problems. We did the 7 hour tour to take in as much as possible - Ray filled us in on the history of each stop and spiced it up with a bit of humour. Had a really good lunch and a bit of fun with Mate.Had a couple of hiccups with the bikes - they are not overly robust - but owner William came out to sort it straight away. It didn't detract from our enjoyment of the day.

You will not regret a second of it! Get on a Biking BA tour now!. Kick off your stay in BA with the ultimate city tour! It covers all of the main areas of the city and an amazing overview of the history and culture of Argentina. Cycling really is the best way to get around, no stress of trying to navigate, figure out public transport or taking taxis and you get to take in the sights and sound of this amazing city with the wind in your hair. Thanks again for a brilliant day out Biking BA!!!

Awesome bike tour! Amazing information!. Rodrigo was an amazing guide and told us tonnes about Argentina's history. It was an awesome way to see the city and the lunch was super tasty! Al and I would really recommend doing this trip especially if you have limited time in BA. Ideal doing at the beginning as you get an understanding of the city's layout.

Don't leave town without doing this!. This tour is an absolute must. Took the heart of the city tour on the only rainy day of our trip. It gave us an opportunity to see parts of the city we otherwise wouldn't have ventured out to on our own. Plus it was by far the most informative tour I've ever done. Gave us an extremely in depth view of the history of the people, the turmoil they've undergone and their incredible proficiency for recovering and redefining their culture. Recommend this tour to everyone visiting the city.

Fun day out with RayRay and Henrick.... What a great way to explore BA. From the initial briefing I knew it was going to be great craic. My new wife and I enjoyed seeing the city by bike and meeting the most lovely people. Even getting hijacked by an old Argentean in the park was fun, who then advised his Great Grandad was Irish...overall highly recommend and you will not be disappointed.

Great tour, fantastic people.. Went on this full day tour with guide Raymond. Great guy. Anyone who wants to have a real feel of the city, join this tour. It might seem long but time flies. We came back late simply because the crew cares more about you enjoying yourself than keeping time. Great local lunch off the beaten path. Nice stories about the city and its people. A must do when you are in town. Thanks again guys. Albert from Amsterdam
Great day out!. Just back from the 7 hour guided tour and would recommend this to anyone, especially if like me you have little time to explore the city. & thanks to the good group I was with!

Private Architectour with William. Very stimulating to sight & imagination. I highly recommend the Architectour to everyone. You can learn about the entire history of Buenos Aires just by looking at its buildings. The tour was awesome thanks to William. On a league of his own, he is the best guide ever. I was very lucky to be with him on a private tour. His was a highly intelligent and intellectual way of explaining the architecture along the itinerary. Not just from a design point of view, obviously, but from ones that are cultural, social, political, economic, philosophical and even mythical ... etc. In other words, from just about every angle imaginable. Will has a way with words and is very articulate, speaking in BBC English, the most elegant of accents. He expresses his ideas in a way very few people can. He is able to contextualize and put things in perspective. The entire four hours were like a constant flow of information which, together with all the amazing pictures I took, could be enough to publish a book with.

loved, loved, loved our ride through this city. We had a beautiful day to spend 7-8 hours riding through Buenos Aires. This city is flat so no problem on our bikes. We were a group of 7 with two very informative guides. We stopped a lot so that they could impart interesting facts about this area. Our guides were two brothers (ex pats) from Colorado (Robin & ?)...I would definitely recommend seeing this city on a bike!!

My favourite tour after 4 weeks in South America. Our guide Rodrigo's knowledge of the social and political history of Argentina was mind blowing, as was his English - there were some words in there I didn't even know! After this tour I probably know more about Argentina's history than England's!Rodrigo brought everything we saw to life and put it into context for us. Argentina's modern history is not the most pleasant and he got this across honestly.I felt completely safe on the bikes and the route we took (the heart of the city tour) was 80% bike paths.I would highly recommend! I'm just sad we do not have time to do their full tour.Oh, and the sandwich we had for lunch was incredible! Subway on steroids!

Brilliant full day tour - recommend . BA is pretty massive so unless you want to sit on a bus and spectate, a bike tour is a great way to see a lot of the city in a day. Our guide Roy was fantastic. Super interesting and good to get some proper exercise! Lunch was great too. Thanks guys!

Highly recommend this bike company. Biking Buenos Aires gave us great service. We got there late and they customized our city tour, making sure we returned on time to catch our taxi. Our guide Robin was very knowledgable and easy to talk to...really knows the history of the Buenos Aires & Argentina. I felt he kept us safe, explained his hand signals. Lunch was yummy! Biking is a great way to see the city.

10 STARS!. I arrived at the last minute and they went out of their way to find me a bike so I could go on the full day, 7 hour tour with them. Robin was our leader/guide and Timo was our go-to safety man. It was really great having 2 staff on the trip as we were riding in traffic at times; very professional and I felt safe the entire tour. The riding is very easy; no long up-hills or steep down hills. We stopped at so many "must see" sights; my favorite was the Recoleta cemetery. At each sight Robin would give a very detailed and complete history of what we were seeing; very knowledgeable and quick to answer questions with accuracy. Lunch is included and we stopped at a fantastic Parilla in Puerto Madero; giant pork sandwiches (or whatever suits you)- really delicious! This is a quality, first class outfit and I highly recommend them!

Best way to "feel" Buenos Aires!. I went on the Parks & Plazas tour with the excelent guide Luke. Bikes in good condition, with helmet included. The ride was easy, no need to be an athlete. We stoped in a typical restaurant for delicious empanadas (included in the package). The tour is safe and very interesting. I certainly will repeat this experience when i go back to Buenos Aires.
Great Tour!. Rodrigo was a great tour guide - super knowledgable and funny. It was great to see all the different areas and attractions of Buenos Aires. Will be returning!

Excellent way to see Buenos Aires!. I went on the Parks & Plazas tour with Rodrigo and a few other guides, and it was absolutely perfect. It was a good mix of biking, seeing the most important sights of Buenos Aires, and learning about the history of the city and country. The tour guides were all very knowledgeable, kept us safe on the busy streets, and answered any questions we had. Lunch was also included and delicious! I would highly recommend to anyone who wants to see and learn about a good deal of Buenos Aires in a short time.

Great intro to Buenos Aires!. Robin was a great guide around, and made the ride fun with a lot of info about the various places, as well as well-planned food and snacks. Totally recommended as a way to get into the city!

Excellent!. Best way to see the main attractions of Beunos Aires in one day. Raymond, our tour guide is an excellent tour guide and he is very funny and gave us special treats at the end of the tour (they are very delicious!)Also a great way to learn about the history of ArgentinaHighly recommended for ultimate city tour where you would be able to explore most of the city in 1 day

Best way to see a lot of Buenos Aires in a short time. This is the second city "biking tour" I have done and this one compared well with the one I did in Tokyo. For me, this is a great combination of 1) seeing parts of the city you don't usually see on a walking tour, 2) getting the inside scoop on the history and architecture and 3) eating local food from local places you might never know to visit.I went on the Ultimate city tour which was 7 hours long but not so bad considering that the city is very flat and very few uphill spots. I was relieved to see that all the bikes have nice "fat" padded seats - a must-have for an all day ride if you still want to be able to walk the next day. The folks at Biking Buenos Aires were incredibly friendly and helpful - I arrived early and was pleasantly surprised that there was only one other rider and the guide going with me. We all wore very stylish bike hats which were provided along with water for the journey.Santiago our guide was a mine of information on all aspects of Buenos Aires being a native of the city and very familiar with the more unpleasant aspects of its political history. We had plenty of breaks en route - the trip went from La Boca and the roots of tango and football, up to the Ecological Reserve (shame about the beach area which is really where the buildings from the middle of the city were dumped when they redesigned it as the Paris of the southern hemisphere) and then we had lunch at a parilla (grill) van - obviously frequented by the local office workers. After lunch we went through the very impressive Puerto Madera to Recoleta and a few minutes to visit the tomb of Eva Duarte (Peron) and to sample the delights of yerba mate - it felt a bit like passing a peace pipe from person to person :). The return journey was through Retiro down to the Casa Rosada or Pink House and back to the start.I really enjoyed the day and learned a lot about Buenos Aires history and its people. A big thank you to Santiago for being an excellent guide and making for a fun stay in the city.

Great few hours to open your eyes to the city. This is a great way to see Buenos Aires, cycling freely from interesting place to interesting place all the time being well informed of the history and curiosities of each location by the excellent guide Corina. I would highly recommend it to any visitor to the city. In addition to the tour, Corina and the other staff in BBA were very helpful with tips on where to do things and eat.
Great experience. The bikes worked properly and the staff were very knowledgeable. First rate experience and great way to see the city.

Great to get around and see BA. Easy and affordable to rent bikes by hour or day. The bikes had baskets, locks, and water bottles. We biked through the Reserva and around Puerto Madero on our own. Really nice, it wasn't stressful to bike on the side of the streets and felt safe. Occasionally a car would honk, but I think mostly let us know it was there.

Best way to see buenos aires. This was a great educated and fun experience.The guides were fun,knowledgeable and friendly.I believe this is perfect for someone who really want to experience the smells,sounds and vibes the city has to offer.Mor

Fantastic Experience. The guides were very knowledgeable about the history and culture of Buenos Aires. We did the full day bike tour which we were originally hesitant about given the time commitment but we were so pleased we did. Was by far one of our favorite activities on our trip.

Fun way to see more of Buenos Aires. My husband and I did the North City tour with Robin at the beginning of our stay in Buenos Aires and it was great fun! It'd been a long time since I had been on a bike, but Robin was very patient with me and Buenos Aires is well catered to bikes with many bike lanes. Robin was very knowledgeable and it was nice to learn about Argentina's history and visit some of the sights around Buenos Aires, including Recoleta Cemetary, Plaza Evita and the many parks. The lunch stop was also great, with some of the best empanadas in Buenos Aires!

One of the best ways to explore Buenos Aires. I joined the 7-hour Ultimate City Tour (right after a 25-hour flight) touring both the North and South of Buenos Aires city. My guide Rodrigo was very resourceful and is very passionate about the history of Latin America! I enjoyed very much learning about the history (especially the off-the-history-books part) of the city and each symbolic site. Rodrigo was extremely helpful and did all that he could to make the tour as enjoyable as possible (from the long list of restaurant recommendations and pointing my way to exchange shops).I would definitely recommend the tour to anyone who, like me, only have a few days on Buenos Aires and would like to have an in-depth overview of the city within a reasonably short period of time!

Loved this tour. This was my first time in Buenos Aires. I was looking for an active way to visit the city. Not only I visited the city, I met some very nice people, and learnt about Argentina's history, politics, and customs. Santiago was an amazing tour guide with a wealth of knowledge and Timo was a great host. I am happy I did the complete city your. I could have pedaled more and faster but I understand the tour is for everyone at all levels. It was amazingly good. Thank you for making this a very good and memorable experience.

Best way to see the best parts of BA in a day. Fantastic day - small group of us and lovely guide Robin - he was great at history/politics/ocal gossip and general info about BA and Argentina and indeed S/A. Really can't recommend enough!

Fantastic tour!. Highly recommended. Robin was fantastic! My last day in Buenos Aires I decided to book the bike tour and i really feel i got a flavour of the city. Robin was super insightful, providing the historical context but also different recommendations throughout the visit. We covered a lot of ground- La Boca, San Telmo, Recoleta, etc, with time for pictures and had mate and a steak sandwich by the river. Very enjoyable experience and the best way to end the trip :)

An amazing education and experience!. The Ultimate City Tour with Biking Buenos Aires was the best thing I've done in the city yet...it was such a wonderful way to see the city while also learning a ton about the rich and complex history of this beautiful place...the guides were extremely knowledgable and helpful and I left feeling energized and excited to continue my exploration of all that Buenos Aires has to offer!

Fun way to see and learn about Bueno Aires. Fun way to see some of the centre of Bueno Aires and learn about its history. Our guide Rodrigo was passionate about the history of his country and took time to explain the cultural significance behind the sites visited: we learnt a lot about the history and culture of Argentina. He took us for a sandwich at a cool food truck, which we really enjoyed. Follow up was fabulous - route map and local recommendations were promptly and freely provided. Bueno Aires is a very flat city so this was not a challenging ride and the tour can be done comfortably by most. I was surprised that Bueno Aires had quite a lot of bike lanes which made the ride quite comfortable (it was mostly on the bike lanes). Would recommend this young and energetic company to those visiting Bueno Aires!

Wonderful experience. This was an absolutely wonderful experience. I think it was the best thing we did in Buenos Aires. When traveling to a new city, it is always important to get the lay of the land and some history. This bike tour most certainly gave us that. Our guide (Ray) was fantastic, knowledgable, and funny. We did the Heart of the City tour which took us through La Boca, Puerto Madero, to the Pink House and more. Through all of the areas, Ray gave us a lot of the history of Buenos Aires (including that of the immigrants, disappearances, Yellow Fever, and the devaluation of the currency). We also got to experience the Mate drinking ritual and had a nice lunch (it is from a food stand outside so don't expect any warmth if it is winter).

Fun and thoughtful experience. What a great way to not only see the landmarks of Buenos Aires, but also to learn some of the "behind the scenes" and less glamorous facts behind them. My tour guide Will did a great job of recounting the context of each place we visited, always providing historical relevance and a very savvy perspective. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour, the service was great, and the guide made it even more interesting with his well-documented explanations.

Wonderful way to see the city. My husband and I were in BA for a short time and wanted a fun way to see the city with narration, plus have exercise vs. Sitting on a bus. The city is flat so this is easy and we enjoyed it very much. I think this is the only way to see the city! Our guide was awesome!

Biking through Buenos Aires is a unique experience. When you see BA on a guided bicycle ride, you have plenty of opportunities to get close to places and hear more about their history while getting a sense of the atmosphere in the city. Our guide was streetwise, handling the traffic with great ease, as well as very informative. The bicycles provided are of good quality as are the helmets. For anybody who likes biking, this is a great way to see BA.

Great way to see BA!. My sister and I wanted to explore the city via bicycle and we were very happy with our 7-hour tour though BA! Our bikes were comfortable, hand a handy basket for storage and we also had cute helmets. Our guides Anne and Angeles were terrific! There were only 6 of us on our trip and we always felt safe riding through the busy streets. Angeles and Anne always had their eyes on us making sure we were safe. The tour was well-organized and informative. Our lunch was AMAZING! We had a chance to explore some areas on foot such as Boca and Recoleta Cemetery which were places we wanted to visit. Biking around the nature reserve and learning about the history of the city planning was really interesting. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting BA. We also really enjoyed being able to ask our guides about the culture and history of BA. Angeles immediately sent us an email with helpful links to other activities. Overall, this was a great experience that was organized and professional!! Bravo Biking BA!! Do it!

Bike happy!. We found Biking BA through a recommendation from Parilla Food Tours (check out my review...another must do activity!) and I am so glad we found y'all! We did the Ultimate City Tour with Will. He was a fabulous guide with great knowledge of the city, history, culture, and people. A little tangental at times, but he made up for it with the yerba mate and an amazing lunch. :-) My husband and I are fairly experienced cyclists, but I was very wary about riding in the city with so much traffic. We took the tour on a Sunday, so definitely had much less traffic. Buenos Aires has been adding more protected bike lanes, and a lot of the tour utilized the bike lanes. Will did a great job of explaining each portion of our route so we would be aware of turns and lane changes, and then did a great job keeping the group together. They provided a lovely cruiser bike (I rode Leklider!), helmet, and water bottle. There is a basket on the front for a bag. We brought some granola bars, and I was glad we did because lunch wasn't until about 1pm. The tour is history and culture heavy, and it was all fascinating. I think the tour is a great way to see parts of the city that I might not have visited on my own (Caminato and La Boca, for example) but also took us to parts that I wanted to see that were further away (Recoleta, Palermo areas). We had a chance to walk around San Telmo and Recoleta cemetary. Lunch was street food by the ecological preserve and very good. The only thing that would make the tour better would be an ice cream stop!!! Riding was very easy as the city is quite flat. Thanks for a great tour, Will! Highly recommend this to anyone staying in the city. It definitely beats the hop on/off tours!

Worth every penny. My husband and I are staying in Buenos Aires for 2 months. We'd been here for 3 weeks before we went on the Ultimate City tour with Biking Buenos Aires, and now wish we'd done it as soon as we got here! We finally feel like we know Buenos Aires! In contrast, someone else in our tour was only in Argentina for the day. I feel like no matter how long you're here, a bike tour would be the perfect thing for you.Our tour was fun, engaging, and informative! We learned so much about the culture and history of Buenos Aires and its people and feel like we got to see so many of the sights we'd hate to leave Buenos Aires without visiting. While I was tired at the end of the 7 hour tour, it was certainly doable, as we stopped often.Our tour guide Ray was so funny, knowledgeable, and easy to be around. We'd highly recommend him. Ray made sure we were comfortable and happy all day and we were provided with helmets, water, and a fantastic local lunch out.This tour was the best experience we've had since coming to Argentina. Worth every penny and I would highly recommend it to anyone. Very English speaker-friendly.

City Bike Tour. This was a fantastic way to see the city. Rodrigo was our guide. He was a fountain of knowledge, and taught us so much about Argentinian history and culture. He took us to this amazing food cart for a scrumptious pork sandwich. The biking was fun, and not too challenging. We had just our family, so it was a very personalized tour. Don't miss doing this tour!

Fantastic day to see the sights of BA. Did the full day tour. The guide Santi was great. The bikes are in great condition. Very easy riding. Lunch was awesome. Definitely worth every dollar. A great way to see BA.

Perfect way to see the city. My family and I did the whole day city tour of Buenos Aires with Rodrigo. He was incredibly knowledgeable, the biking was easy, yet energizing, and we were able to see far more than we would've otherwise! I highly recommend it!

A 'Must-Do". Met up with Angie and Will for the 'Ultimate Tour - North & South.' Both of them were extremely charismatic and knowledgeable. It's definitely a great healthy alternative to seeing this city. The tour lasted roughly 7 hours with many stops which also included lunch.

Discover the real Buenos Aires. Bike is the best way to get to know any city. Having a local guide makes it even better. A guide that can also inform you about history, local customs, points of interest and recommend local eateries and other activities is fantastic!This is what you'll get at Biking Buenos Aires.Ange and Anna were the best. We never felt like we were just another tour group. Their enthusiasm and knowledge and love of their city were infectious.Best day ever in BA.Highly recommended!

Highly recommend . I thoroughly enjoyed the "Heart of the City" tour. My guide Angie did a terrific job of giving historical insight into the city, but what I most enjoyed was her willingness to share about the culture and society in general - not information that can be read in a travel guide. I'd highly recommend taking a tour with Biking Buenos Aires. Thanks again Angie!

Great Tour!. We enjoy visiting places where one can use a bicycle to explore. Our tour with Will did not disappoint as he did an excellent job of giving us a tour of the city. An important part of the tour was learning about the history behind the places we visited. Will's knowledge and enthusiasm to share information and tell the stories of the triumphs and struggles of people who lived and live in Buenos Aires. After the tour we had a better insight to how the past shaped this complex city. Thanks Will!

A Must Do!. Biking Buenos Aires was a fantastic was the see the city; we only wished we would have done it on our first day instead of our last.Reservation:Super easy! We did it on line and within minutes we were booked for the half day parks tour.Bikes:Good condition, brakes worked well, helmets and gloves provided.Route:Very safe, some uphill (you can do it!), and mostly bike lanes. Lots of beautiful parks, sculptures, monuments, and gardens were seen. Guide (I'm saving the best for last):RayRay was fantastic! I don't know how many characters tripadvisor allows on these posts, because I could go on and on forever about how awesome RayRay was. He's super relaxed and safe in the streets, very funny, and will go at a pace that's right for you. At one point we were approached by a stray dog that looked a little aggressive and RayRay was right there peacefully distracting the dog away from us. This tour was the highlight of our trip!

Heart of the City Tour. Travelled to Buenos Aires alone and did the 7 hour Heart of the City tour and it was the perfect way to see the city. Seven hours seemed like it would be a lot at first but I wanted to see as much as I could and it FLEW by! Will was my guide and from him I learned SO much about the history and culture of Buenos Aires...he was VERY educated and passionate about the city and was a great guide. I recommend this tour to everyone and if I ever return I would definitely do another tour with this company.

Easy to bike... A good way to know Buenos Aires. All the guides are friendly ,.Ours ,Angie was excellent. She was knowledgeable about the history areas and she took the time to answer all our questions.The bikes were in good shape and adecuates for touring.It's not an expensive service and it´s worth to have it with the family.The office is San Telmo in South of Buenos AIRES.

Palermo circuit, Buenos Aires. Palermo circuit is very safe and it includes the Palermo Park which is the best Green of Buenos Aires city. There also coffee bars, restaurants, museums nearby and other places to visit

A great and affordable way to spend the day. We did the LaBoca 5 hour tour with Will and it was OUTSTANDING! Will is a great guide who is originally from Britain but has obviously fallen in love with the history of Argentina. The tour consisted of many historical sites that were clearly explained by Will and he took the time to answer all of our questions as well. The bikes were in great shape and perfect for touring the city. Biking Buenos Aries is very professionally run and the staff was fantastic. I will be returning to BA again in the near future and plan on booking another tour with Will,

Private tour. Great company, prompt, friendly and very good service. Ben is awesome. Santiago is a fantastic guide, reasonable price and we had a good time. I highly recommend it for a family outing. The bikes are old with poor brakes but doable for a casual ride. BA had traffic and you will be biking at least 50% of the time with traffic. The office is in San Telmo so the ride is mostly in South BA.

Why walk when you can bike it!!. Our tour guide, Angie, was extremely friendly and was good at making us feel comfortable with the other participants in the group. The tour was in-depth and informative. Angie was knowledgeable about the history of the areas that we visited and was passionate about her culture and people. The bikes were easy to ride as were most of the paths. It helped that Angie had her offsider, Lucas, who rode along with us on the tour to deal with traffic (made sure the group was safe). One of the bikes has a flat tyre and Lucas was there to repair it. Lunch was delicious. We'd recommend the pork and chorizo completo! Definitely worth doing when in Buenos Aires for the first time!

Don't miss this.. I had a few spare days in Buenos Aires and I am soo glad I came across Biking Buenos Aires. This is a must if you are a tourist in BA. Seeing this incredible city by bike is far more intimate than a bus tour and yet lets you cover far more in a day than just a walk. Above all, it is a lot of fun.I started off with the “Heart of the City Tour” (South City) where Ray (Raymond) guided me through the rich history of San Telmo and Puerto Madero. We stopped to soak in the Street Tango in San Telmo, I picked up some street art and we drank Mate. It was good to open up the bike in the Ecological Reservation before a great and rather large lunch.I enjoyed the “Heart of the City Tour” so much that I signed up for the “Parks and Plazas Tour” (North City) later in the week guided by Stef (Estefanía). It was another great day out, seeing a very different side of the city. Starting off at the botanical gardens, and as the name suggests we rode through various parks and plazas. We saw the cementerio recolet, stopped to eat empanadas at lunch and passed several art galleries and museums. - I wandered back the next day to check them out in more detail.A really well run company - I thoroughly recommend it.

Best way to see Buenos Aires. Buenos Aires has an incredible system of bike paths. It's safe and beautiful. Our guide, Rodrogo, was informative and pleasant. A wonderful host who explained the often tortured history of this beautiful city with passion and intelligence. I Would recommend these tours to anyone. We took the Parques y Plazas tour. It was perfect for a family with younger kids (I have 10 and 12 year olds)

THE BEST!. My friends, my sons and I were fortunate to book a city biking tour with Biking Buenos Aires just last week. It was awesome! Comfortable, informative and a ton of fun. Angie and the crew do an upstanding job. Angie is informative, enthusiastic, and knowledgable about the fascinating city. She is emotional as she describes the ups and downs of Buenos Aires history. From the architectural feats and fails, and govermental dictatorship to periods of direct democracy, Angie is cogent and engaging. On top of this, the meal they include along the waterfront is totally delicious! We love you guys and we'll be back for all of your tours next time.Dan.

A great way to see BA. This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip! We did the south side city tour (5 hours) and it was informative and fun. Most of the tour takes places on bike paths or in parks. If you are worried about biking on busy city streets I would suggest booking the tour on the weekend when there is less traffic. My only regret is that we didn't do it earlier on in our trip. I highly recommend this company!

Best part of our trip. Amazing way to see Buenos Aires! Corine and Lucas were so knowledgeable, kind, and helpful! We did the heart of the city tour, which took about 5 hours. Definitely a must! You will not be disappointed!

Simply wonderful, all around. I highly, highly recommend this company if you are going to Buenos Aires, and better to do it at the beginning of your stay so as to get a general layout of the city, and also so that you can cover different landmarks early on. The employees were friendly, and knowledgeable, and Corina especially was simply marvelous. Definitely do this tour!

Fantastic alternative way to appreciate Buenos Aires (and opened my eyes to street art elsewhere). Did the Biking Buenos Aires Graffitimundo tour on a Sunday afternoon. Didn't hurt that it was a spectacular afternoon, but the tour was superb--mostly separate bike paths and the rest were quiet streets, great pace, excellent background on street art in Buenos Aires, and some fantastic pieces. Nice mate' stop toward end with a bit of info on that tradition. A true highlight of our time in the city.

Fun tour. We had a great day with Corine. The tour was a very good introduction to the city. Corine explained the sights we covered very well and provided interesting insights into BA's culture, which was lovely.

Best thing I did in Buenos Aires. A fantastic way to see the city. I did a 3 hour tour of boca and porto madero. My tour guide Santiago gave us a fantastic overview of Buenos Aires' history, culture and recent political landscape. I had been in BA for a week before I did this and learned more and enjoyed more those three hours than the entire preceding week!!

Great day. We did the ultimate tour 7 hours and Santiago was our tour guide his knowledge was excellent his stories on Argentinas history were captivating! I was hung over as death and still had an amazing day! Book it in soon as you get here!

great architectural tour. My husband and I did the architectural bike tour with Will on a beautiful Sunday in BA. Its a great city for biking - very flat and easy to navigate. Will is a very intelligent and easy going guy with a great sense of humor. The tour was well paced - we covered a lot of the city with a couple of stops built in for very tasty empanadas, and not so tasty yerba mate (but glad I got to try it). Left feeling very satisfied -- highly recommend this bike tour company!

Awesome tour!!. We did the Ultimate City tour and had a fantastic time touring Buenos Aires and learning all about the city's history. Our tour guide Rodrigo was super knowledgeable and a great guide! Overall, a fantastic tour that I highly recommend.

Safe and Fun Bike Tour. Loved the history lessons and the enthusiasm of Santiago. Our 5 hour bike tour was the best possible way to see Boca, Puerto Madeiro and San Telmo and the Argentinian history perspective made it that much better! Lunch place was amazing too - I would highly recommend this tour!

Fun!. A great way to see the city. Took the Heart of the City tour, which covered good ground. Buenos Aires is pretty flat, which made it fairly easy to get around. We did ride in traffic occasionally, but it was very manageable. Our guide, Raymond, was excellent. Knowledgeable, entertaining, and kept a good pace. Definitely recommend it.

A definite must in BA!. We did the Heart of the City tour during our brief stopover in BA. We only had limited time so I booked it as a private tour which was so handy to have as an option as I had my heart set on doing this tour. It was such a fun way to see the city. Had plenty of stops along the way - including an amazing delicious lunch. I was nervous on the bike at the start but i soon started having alot of fun and it was awesome going around the large roundabouts! We had Ray Ray and he was awesome and will certainly look after you!

Brilliant way to see the city - ask for Ray Ray as your guide. We visited BA last November and had been recommended to use Biking BA by a couple of friends as we only had 4 days to see the city and this was the perfect way to see a great deal in 1 day.Ray Ray was our tour guide and was extremely knowledgeable and made a huge effort getting to know everyone on the tour. (He even stopped us the next day to chat when we re-visited La Boca, great customer service!)I'd say you need a basic level of fitness and not be nervous cycling on main roads, which thankfully none of our group were. We visited La Boca, Rocoletta, the marinas plus many many more areas of the city.Would highly recommend.

Great way to get to know Buenos Aires!. I loved the Tour! Definately the best way to get to know the city. Raymond was a great guide and took care of the group on a very friendly , safe and relaxed way. The weather was fantastic and I will always remember our lunch!:) It was my first day in the city, and beeing traveling alone this was the Best way to start!All the best to Biking Buenos Aires!Marisa

Ray Ray gave us a lovely day. On our second morning in BA we decided to do a bike tour. We hurried to BBA HQ and found the staff really helpful to get us in Palermo with just 45 min left before the start of the tour. We did the North City tour with Raymond which is a very enthusiastic story teller. At every statue or monument he has an interesting story to tell and he shows you the beautiful sights of Palermo. I can recommend this tour to everyone visiting BA!
A Fun Afternoon!. Took the Heart of the City tour -- a great way to experience BA! Our guide Ray Ray was knowledgeable and the tour contained the perfect mix of cycling and learning about the city.
Very fun and bike tour of BA!. Angie and Anne were awesome guides... Very fun and informative.... And safe! Learned a lot about BA and they made biking around a big city very relaxing! 2 thumbs up!!
I "<3 of the city" tour. Angie & Anne were fabulous guides with a great sense of humor. Perfect balance of relaxed riding and interesting history.
Loved Biking BA Ultimate Tour. Santi was a fantastic guide. The tour could not have been better. The biking was relatively easy, we saw the whole city and learned a wealth of information as well.

Great Intro to the City. My wife and I did the Heart of the City tour and it was excellent. Raymond was our guide and he was very knowledgeable about the landmarks and the city's history. The included lunch was also very good and filling.

Great way to see the city. I did the "Ultimate" tour with Ray, and it was a great way to see the city. Don't worry about fitness levels too much - the city is very flat and it's very easy to cycle around. Going by bike allows you to see much more than you could ever see on foot - from Boca to Evita's grave to San Martin.

Highlights of Old BA. Angie did a fine job of mixing high interest and enthusiasm with personal stories and historical details as we rode from place to place. The weather also cooperated - the day provided perfect temperatures for riding and the sun exposure was a nice plus. The whole business has a very nice feel to it. Their orientation to the visitor-customercouldn't be better!

Excellent way to see Buenos Aires. I have lived in Buenos Aires for about one year. When a family member came to visit we wanted to see a lot in a short amount of time. The bike tour was a fantastic was to do that. I have never been able to see so much of Buenos Aires in a single day. Some of the many destinations that we visited included San Telmo, La Boca, Puerto Madero, Plaza de Mayo, and more. Our tour was 6 hours, but they have various options for tours of different lengths. From experiencing Argentine traditions like drinking "mate" and eating "facturas" to learning about the interesting history of the city, a tour with Biking Buenos Aires is the way to go! Angeles (aka Angie), our Biking Buenos Aires tour guide, gave us an excellent tour and explained a lot of the history regarding each of the places we visited. She was extremely knowledgeable and spoke English very well. This experience is highly recommended for anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Best way to see a new city. We love doing a bike tour when we go to a city we don’t know yet. It really offers a great way to cover a large portion of the city and get your bearings. We found the tour to be relaxed, interesting and with a very nice guide to boot. We did the Parks & Plazas tour and it really helped us to get an understanding and “feel” of the city.

Best introduction to Buenos Aires. Biking Buenos Aires' Ultimate City Tour lead us to architectural highlights, hidden gems and some of BA's best street art. To top it off, they introduced us to a part of the porteño life covering Fútbol, Maté and Meat.Our guides, Angie and Lucas were a pair of great storytellers who turned our day into an experience I would recommend to anyone.

Best way to discover Buenos Aires. Bikes are the best way to see this city because you cover lots of kilometers whilst being so close to the ground and feeling the city as if u were walking. I took the Ultimate tour, which is so much fun and is a visual feast with so much diversity. The guide was RayRay, who is an awesome guy. Very knowledgeable, informative. Kind, gallant and attentive. The group consisted of 5 tourists plus RayRay plus another really cool guide who joined us to watch over the U.S. From the back of the file, assist in case of technical needs ... And whip up a Yerba ceremony. I think this tour company is awesome I felt very safe & in good hands. I learned a lot & feel like I discovered it with locals. They gave us many tips & recommendations that were priceless. I'm actually going to ride with them again this weekend.

Best way to see BA!. We had a fanastic time on the Heart of the City tour today, led by the beautiful Angie! She showed us round the cool streets of San Telmo, gave us medialunas and Mate tea in La Boca, and told us lots about the history of Argentina. Cycling is a brilliant way to see the city but it was made even better by having such a friendly and enthusiastic guide!

Great way to see BA. This was out first trip to BA. We decided to do this tour when we arrived in order to get a lay of the land. This was an awesome way to quickly see a large amount of the city. Angie was our tour guide. She was great. Gave a nice historical perspective which enriched the experience. You really do get to see the highlights of BA in one day. The bikes are decent. The ride is long but it's flat and really wasn't taxing at all if you're in reasonable shape. Plenty of breaks. Lunch was included from a food truck and it was really good.

Nice Bike Tour. You can book this tour on line and pay with credit card (AMEX included). Good way to get acclimated to the city. Some interesting information about Buenos AIres provided as well. Good bikes, water bottles (and water) and helmets provided. Very friendly guides. Professional operation. Safe. Lunch is included with the "Ultimate" which is a 7 hour tour. Starts at 10 AM - you are asked to arrive 10 minutes earlier. You need to head to San Telmo Barrio (this is if you are doing the 7 HOUR tour). Be sure to check with them so you go to the right place. They have TWO locations depending on the tour you choose.. If you are using the Subte (Metro Train System), take the "C" line to the Independencia station. Once you arrive at the station, if you come out of the station at the first exit (set of stairs) then you should come out to a big playground area. Congratulations, you are on the correct side of the street. Estados Unidos Street is at one edge of the park. Walk down that street towards Peru Street (it's about 5 blocks), turn right and look for the bike place on the left (2 or 3 blocks). Can't miss it - you will see the bikes outside. Tall beautiful building.If you come out of the train station and there is a big gas station in front of you then you need to cross that wide avenue you are standing next to and you will end up at the playground which is all the way over on the other side of the avenue. Follow above instructions from there.You can buy single trip tickets for the train in any station. Very easy to use. Allow plenty of time for commuting depending upon where you are coming from. Cost today is 2.5 pesos per ticket.Bring a light sweater - you may want it in the shade. Bring sunglasses, sun block. If you think 7 hours is too long on the bikes - don't. It really isn't that bad. Have fun and you will learn and see some good stuff. You will get breaks. Bathroom breaks as well. 99% of the terrain is on flat surface.PLEASE, IF YOU FOUND THIS REVIEW HELPFUL THEN CLICK ON THE BUTTON BELOW: "Did you find this review helpful?" I TRY TO PROVIDE AS MUCH DETAILED INFORMATION AS POSSIBLE AND I JUST LIKE TO KNOW IF I AM HELPING PEOPLE ALONG THE WAY. THANK YOU.

One day in BA. I only had one day to spend in BA and see all of the sights. I loved the all day bike tour because the guide was very informative, I was able to see all the major sights, and get the key historical events in the short time I had. All the staff at Bike BA are super friendly and I would recommend requesting Ray Ray as you tour guide. He is very friendly, knowledgeable and funny. I would definitely recommend doing this tour!
