Great way to see the city!. I would highly recommend this company, we did the "Heart of the City" tour, it's a great way to see and find out about the city. Angie, was our friendly guide, she was fantastic. My boyfriend and I were the only 2 on the tour that day so it felt like a very private laid back tour. The city itself was very quiet due to transportation strikes. Please don't be put off if like myself you hadn't cycled a bike in 10 years, it was really fun!
Awesome!!!!. Fun, Informative, Professional, and Safe! Easy leasure biking. Lots of great stops and mate too. I laughed a lot and learned a lot from our guild Corine :) Wonderful experience!

Perfect way to see BA!. What a perfect way to see Buenos Aires! We took the 7 hour tour and we are glad we did. Our tour guide, Santi, was cheerful, friendly and incredibly informative. He did a great job of giving us enough information and connecting the dots of Argentine history. I could have listened to him all day. Fascinating. Our second guide, Timothy, helped keep us safe by blocking oncoming traffic when necessary. While I can ride a bike on a paved trail, I am nervous about riding a bike in even neighborhood traffic. Thanks to the able leading of Santi and protection of Timothy and bike lanes, I felt completely capable of riding in BA city traffic and enjoyed myself greatly. We did the tour on a Saturday which also reduced the amount of traffic we had to contend with. I would recommend this tour to anyone who can ride a bike and I would also recommend doing the tour near the beginning of your trip to BA as it gives a nice overview of the city and provides a lot of historical context for what you will see. They also introduced us to some Argentine customs like drinking mate.

Fun and Informative. My husband and I spent the day biking with Rodrigo on the full 7 hour tour. He was amazing. He was a very fun guy and the tour was very informative of Argentina's history (both positive and dark) and how the country has changed and is changing. We learned a lot and have a much greater appreciation of the city and country. It was also a beautiful fall day for a bike ride and to enjoy the different neighborhoods and sites. We recommend this tour if you are here for a short visit or if you just want a good orientation to a longer stay in Buenos Aires.

Incredibly enjoyable day! . My sister, father and I did the "Heart of the City" tour and were extremely fortunate to have had Taylor and Luca as our guides. The bicycles themselves were in great shape and Luca was able to fix any minor issues that arose throughout the day. In addition to fixing bicycles, Luca ensured that we stayed safe cycling through the busy streets of BA. Taylor's knowledge of Buenos Aires and Argentina as a whole was remarkable. The tour was interesting, informative and thought provoking. It was a great introduction to this beautiful city. It was a truly pleasant experience that we would highly recommend to bikers of all levels of experience!

Best Way to Get to Know the City. On our first full day in the city we booked the all day full city bike ride and tour and highly recommend it to all first time visitors to BA. The riding is ambitious just because it's a 7 hour day but never too strenuous with many stops for discussions, mate and lunch. We were two fifty something moms and my 20 year old daughter who was two months into study abroad. Even with her school experience, my daughter loved the bike tour both as a better orientation for the neighborhoods and the additional history and cultural info! We were a group of 6 and we had two guides who carefully navigated us through tight intersections without a worry. I got a flat tire and Annie quickly changed out the tube and leader Ray provided great in depth stories about each district and historical background. We loved the park side cafe parilla mi sueño where we ate the bondiola for lunch. That discovery alone was worthwhile!! We think just about everyone will love this tour.

It was the perfect day!. We took the ultimate 10-5 tour of Buenos Aires and it was perfect. Our guide, Karina, was so sweet and knowledgable about the history and what's trendy now around Buenos Aires. Every raving review written on here is 110% true, and it is the best way to spend your first day in beautiful Buenos Aires.

Nice and safe......good tour!. We came in by ship with our easy to book online reservation with Biking Buenos Aires. I booked transportation with the help of the biking company but others used the cheaper taxi service. The biking was so much fun with our 3 guides for the 11 of us. We went all over the city. We stopped often to hear anecdotes and information about the places. We went in the city and through a huge park. All relatively easy biking. Lunch was part of our tour. What really impressed me was always the concern for our safety. One guide always zipped ahead to block intersections so we could all safely cross. This felt like a really good company that knew how to run a safe and fun tour. Impressive!

Wonderful and active way to learn about Buenos Aires, Argentina and its folks.. Booked this trip with a friend after reading all the great reviews. All these reviews were right. What a great day we had. Very knowledgeable and fun guides. See the major city highlights and so much more. Very well organized tour. Would definitely recommend it.

Wonderful tour with one limitation. First of all the good things: Very nice and friendly guides, taking care of everything from sending an email reminder one day before including personal tips about what else to do in BA, the tour itself with pleanty of historical information about the city and how things developed that way. They make the tour a safe drive, are organized to handle smaller and bigger problems with the bikes, provide water (and food on the one-day tour) and let you feel that they are passionate about the city, even as they are immigrants from English speaking countries (group tours are provided in English only).The only drawback: On the full-day tour you will spend a lot of time in the ecological area outside of puerto madero, which is on one side a very nice area, but prevents you from visiting other important areas of BA. So don't expect to see BA "in one day" on that tour - there's much more to see in BA. I also did the Graffiti Tour on Sunday - just excellent. Both tours are highly recommended and worth their money, although not cheap.

An amazing experience!!. I highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires. I did the Ultimate City Tour - 7 hours long - and had a great time discovering the city and learning about Argentina's history. The guides, Taylor and Timo, were amazing!

The BEST way to see the city of Buenos Aires!. Will and Timo took my girlfriends and I on the half-day tour (approx 5 hours) which was AMAZING! We stopped at landmarks along the way where Will would give us interesting facts that weren't in the typical BA guidebooks. IT WAS GREAT! VERY friendly staff all around, great bikes, safety was a priority for them and we saw the city in plain air. And then, of course, we ate empanadas! I highly recommend it!
Bike tour of the city. I had a lovely holiday tour of the city, the tour guides were kind and very accomodating. The tour honored those that disappeared.

An awesome way to see the city. My friend and I booked the 5 hour city tour. Our guide Angie was extremely knowledgeable and a joy to spend the day with. The bike tour exceeded our expectations. A must do when in Buenos Aires.

A perfect day with a perfect guide. We spent a day with Angie on our Heart of the City tour and would highly recommend it (and Angie). The tour started in the oldest part of the city and Angie told colourful stories at every stop. Lunch was at a food truck near the ecological reserve and was delicious sandwiches topped with Chimichurri. We learned a lot about Argentina's history, culture and people and thoroughly enjoyed our day. A wonderful way to see the city (without wearing out your feet).

Great way to get your bearings!. We did the bike tour on our second day in BA and it was super - a really great way to get to know the city. Our guides Will and Lucas were great, really informative and passionate about the city and they really know their history! They also took us to the best place ever to get sandwiches! Id really recommend this tour as it takes you everywhere and tells you the interesting history. BA is so big it really is the best way to get around.

Buenos Aires experience. Biking on a lazy and calm sunday in BA was a Hit!I did the Architour alone, only with William, a very friendly and experienced guide. He showed and explained to me the old BA with the different eras and also the modern part.One week later I did the Grafitti Tour, a cooperation with graffitimundo. And that tour was an absolutely highlight! You must do it, if you are interessed in streetarts.

Great way to see the city!. A fabulous, short trip to BA shared with friends & what better way to experience the best of Buenos Aires, than with Biking Buenos Aires. Will & Timon were superb hosts & extremely knowledgeable guides. Happy to adapt to a few deviations along the route, it was GREAT FUN! Bikes easy to ride, so more than suitable for all. A fabulous day, thank you so much!

Parks and Plaza's. Great way of seeing a nice part of the city with all its parks and plaza's. Never expected BA to be so green... Also very nice guides with a lot of interesting stories to tell about the city and its history so much more than just a nice bike ride!

Buenos Aires Revealed. This is a great way to see Buenos Aires! Not only are you outside the whole time but our guide did a great job of bringing history to life and also sharing how past events shaped the current day city and lives of the people here.

North Secret Biking Tour. My boyfriend and I arranged with Robin, one of the owners of the bike shop, to have a private 'secret' tour. We were flying back from Cordova and had 8 hours to kill before our flight departed back to the states. He met us by Botanic Gardens, stored our luggage and we were off. It was a nice relaxing fun afternoon. We covered parks, the Gardens, passed by the zoo. We enjoyed street art "graffiti" art as he explained the background of the artists. We also saw stencil art. Went and had lunch in China town. He explained the history of the location and he is from Colorado, as we are. I would suggest this tour for anyone. The biking is easy and they provide helmets and water. Robin is fun, easy-going and I would highly recommend this tour.

Great into to the city - or for those with little time. I spent a week in BA and did the tour on the last day with a friend who was only there for 2 days. Even after a week exploring on my own I hadn't covered all the territory or gained the insights form the tour. I think it's great for an intro to the city (or even at the end of the trip) or for those who have limited time or you cover so much. The guides are so friendly and helpful and will go out of their way to answer any question you have - if they can't answer they will email you after. Some tips for those considering it (1) pay in cash in Pesos as it's cheaper than USD (2) chose the half day tour as opposed to the full day - we chose the full day as we wanted to cover La Boca as well as Ricoletta. We could have done with more time in both locations but in Ricoletta they really jus dropped us at the cemetery and gAve us 10 mins. Not rally worth the extra 3 hours and 30USD from the tour. With the money you save you can grab a cab directly to the location and probably pay for a guided tour.

Heart of the city. I had a fantastic time riding the streets and lanes of BA. Having not been on a bike for many years 5hr heart if the city was the perfect length of time. Rodrigo my tour guide was a mine of information that you could tell was passionate about sharing details about his home city. For such a young company biking BA ticks all the right boxes for me!!!

Enjoying BA from the seat of a bike!. Our day cycling with Ray-Ray, one of the guides with Biking Buenos Aires, was the highlight of our stay in BA. Experienced road cyclists, we decided that we could tolerate sitting in the saddle over the course of seven hours as we weaved our way through some of the more colorful neighborhoods in the city. They provide water and a helmut; you provide comfortable riding gear and a desire to have an adventure. Ray-Ray is a native from New Zealand but clearly is comfortable in his new home in BA. A master of many trades, including acting, he brings a certain flair to sharing historical facts and interesting tidbits about his adopted hometown. A word of caution. While the company provides at least two guides with every trip (we were a group of 7), you should think twice about signing up if you haven't been on a bike in a long time or aren't comfortable with urban biking. You will be sharing the road with cars and buses although much of the route is in bike lanes.

Ammaaazing Tour!!. This was just was I was looking for ... an easy and fun way to check out the city. I did the full day tour, so we got to see a lot of the city. Our tour guide, Ray, was both educational and entertaining, so we not only had fun, but also learned about BsAs. Any of their tours are worth checking out. Enjoy!

A very well spent day!. The full day "Ultimate City Tour" was a great way to see several neighborhoods and get a lot of background information and history on BA. Our family of 4 (2 adults + 2 teenagers) had a great time. Will and Sean were excellent guides. (Thanks Guys!) The biking was not very strenuous - we recommend this to any first time visitors to BA.

Great way to spend a few hours.. We went on the heart of the city tour with Rodrigo, a great guy, and passionate about his city.We had a wonderful time following him through the city. His explanation on each area were insightful, and really helpful in understanding this culturally rich city. So glad we spent some time with Bike Buenos Aires, it's a very thoughtful organization. Oh, yeah and the included lunch was AWESOME.

Biking BA? Awesome experience!. We loved Biking BA! Our guide, Luke, was very knowledgeable, engaging and fun, all the while keeping our safety in mind as we navigated through the streets of Buenos Aires. It was an awesome way to see areas of the city we might not otherwise visit and to learn about the historic, cultural and diverse areas of BA. Hats off to these entrepreneurs for starting this business, and running it so well. Definitely worth the time and money!

Highly recommend. Our guide Ray, was very funny, knowledgable and customer safety mindfulness. His easy going and positive energy made 7 hr on bike really pleasant and enjoyable. A must do for anyone wanting to get to know the city. Traffic was very easy to navigate and super duper bike lanes. Felt safe. Interesting history. We love BA.

Buenos Aires on Two Wheels!. An enjoyable crash course in the history and geography of Buenas Aires. Our guides were perfect and the company is young, enthusiastic and completely professional! A real high point of our vacation. If you are going to spend a few days in Buenos Aires, do this first. John & Leslie

Customer-focused all the way!. As a last minute thing, a group of 13 of us traveling in Buenos Aires decided to look for a bike tour of the city as a different way to explore. I have never been fond of biking around traffic in a large city and with some hesitation went with the group idea. I contacted Biking Buenos Aires about 24 hours before we wanted the tour. Given time constraints, none of the tours offered matched our needs. Biking BA showed incredible flexibility and speed to come up with a plan for a bike tour that matched our needs. The tour was ready on-time. Though a last minute and large group, the bikes were in top shape. Our guide Angeles was very knowledgeable and friendly; her English was really good too. Her supporting guides kept us safe at every moment but, just as importantly, made me FEEL safe at every moment, even the one or two crossings of large intersections. Unbeknownst to me, Buenos Aires has an extensive set of bike lanes in the areas the tour explores (I would say about 75% of the tour was on these lanes). So, my apprehension of city bike tours was dispelled quickly with this tour. The staff at their offices was extremely helpful, responded in timely manner to my questions, and was clearly customer-focused. I highly recommend this biking tour company!

Best way to visit BA. I did the 7h tour with the guide Raymond which was fantastic! I've seen and learnt so much more than while reading and walking on my own the days before! I definitely recommend this tour to everyone!

City tour fantastico!. A great way to see various neighborhoods, La Boca and the famous soccer stadium " La Bombonera", El Caminito, etc. Our guide brought history and politics together with stories about the Argentine people, truly inciteful. Lots of bicycle paths and a very leisure cycle ride. A lot of fun too and the lical sandwiches fir lunch were large and delicious.

the philosophy of BA. At first I thought that the guide being British person would be a disadvantage. Will Epps however proved me wrong - he was extremely knowledgeable on all the topics of BA and Argentina as a whole. And being a foreigner he had different perspective for the topics around.

Ultimate Tour of BA. This was a fantastic introduction to both BA and Argentine history. Will, our guide, was an amazing source of information. The path side lunch was a treat. The bike is simply an easy way to get around and through a crowded urban environment.

Great way to see BA in one day!!. Hi guys. I just did the ultimate bike tour and it was so awesome. Our tour guide, "Raymond" was so friendly and full of BA history knowledge. English speaking, easy riding, awesome lunch just to mention a few awesome factors about this tour!!! Must do!!! Definitely worth the money!!!

Great intro to Buenos Aires. We did the 7hr Full City Tour with Ray Ray. It was a great way to get your head around the layout of the city while learning interesting pieces of Argentina's colourful past. The tour was a lot of fun, perfectly paced and the best way to start your visit to Buenos Aires. Ray Ray did a great job looking after us by providing us with plenty of water and sunscreen and ensured we all navigated the city safely. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Buenos Aires for the first time.

Couldn't rate more highly. Attended the south tour yesterday and it was the best way to see the city. Not only did we get an intimate look at the city our tour guide angie was a wealth of information. Definitely one of the best tours I have done and riding through the city is the only way to do it.

Perfect introduction to Buenos Aires. We did the 7 hour city bike tour and can thoroughly recommend this as the perfect way to become acquainted with Buenos Aires. Don't be put off by the length of the tour - there are plenty of stops in shady spots and Buenos Aires is a very flat city so great for bike riding. Will and Anna were excellent guides and we felt we got a better perspective on the city and some of the complexities of Argentinian history compared with a regular tour. Would give this 6 stars if possible.

Great ride!. Did the parks tour on last Saturday morning. Had a great time. Our guide Rodrigo was very informative and had a great sense of humor. Did not feel that we were out for 5 hours. Bicycling is an excellent way to see Buenos Aires. The city is relatively flat and there are miles of cycle-paths. Stopped for lunch at regional restaurant with lovely empanadas. Congratulations!

Start off BA on a bike!. We did the ultimate city tour and had an awesome experience. We are not big bike riders but the tour was quite easy and safe considering how big the city is. The ultimate city tour is close to 27km and we barely broke a sweat between the stops and the level ground. There was "one hill" that couldn't of been more than a hundred meters. We did the tour as soon as we got to buenos aires and we would suggest that to anyone who is trying to make the most of a few days in BA. From the bike tour we learned the history and culture of the city. Because of the tour we were able to choose where to spend the rest of our days in learning more about the different barrio's that interested us most. Raymond was our guide. Be sure to ask for him if you are english speaking. You won't be disappointed.

Amazing way to see the city. On a bright and beautiful day on 2/16/2015, we did the full tour with our tour guides Will and Angie. They were so much fun to be with and showed their enthusiasm going through the history of the city and the country. The bike ride was a lot of fun as we were able to see beautiful sites and local neighborhoods. We had fun with both our guides as they were patient in answering the many questions the group had. We would highly recommend another tour with them. This is in one the best guided tours that we have been on! :) Muchas Gracias to Will and Angie and the entire Biking Buenos Aires Team.

I loved the Como Ser Porteno Tour!. I had an awesome time biking with Biking Buenos Aires! I took the Como Ser Porteno tour, and I had a blast. We talked to locals to learn how to prepare mate, we took some beautiful scenic rides through San Telmo and Puerto Madero, and all in all had a great time! The bike ride was easy, scenic, fun, and reminded me just how much fin it is to ride a bike! I enjoyed my experience so much that I'm considering another tour with them!
Excellent introduction to BA. A great day with an excellent guide. Covered 25km easy riding. Great lunch. Just right amount of riding, stops, information. Too much good street food. Recommended.

great was to see the city. We did the full day tour of Buenos Aires and really enjoyed the day. The trip was leisurely pace, the guide informative and it was a great way to see the city all in one day!

Great experience. I took the South Buenos Aires bike tour, which starts at 11 pm and lasts for 5 hours. The guys working there are very nice and outgoing, I was offered water and sweets at the start of the tour, and even sun screen, which I highly recommend for summer time in BA. The bikes are city type bikes conmfortable enough. The maps of the tour is nicely prepared to have a smooth ride without a lot of climbs. The stops are frequent enough and you will find a lot o interesting things from the guide, regarding the sights you visit. One of the bikes had a minor problem, that was taken cared of along the way by one of the guides. THere are 2 guides, 1 does the talking and leading the way, the other is the rear guard and stops and assures the safe passing at crossroads, also deals with any technical problems.Lunch is included in the price, in the form of huge sandwich at the best Parrilla kiosk in Puerto Madero, and a drink.I would recommended this agency to anyone. Biking is a great way to explore Buenos Aires!
The best way to see the city!. The bike tour was exactly what I wanted on my first day in Buenos Aires. It was a great introduction to the city and its colourful history.

Great way to see the city (Ultimate City Tour). We had limited time in BA (less than three days) and this was a fantastic way to cover a lot of ground in a short period of time. We booked our reservation online just three days in advance. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. It felt like our tour guide, Will, was an old friend showing us around the city! The day was a perfect combination of exercise, history, scenery, great food, and a lot of fun. Highly recommend this tour and company!- B & D, NYC

Great way to see the city. Really enjoyed our biking tour. Our guide, Santiago, was very enthusiastic and share colourful and interesting stories about the history of the city and his own experiences. We saw a lot of different neighbourhoods. And the lunch was delicious!

This has to be the best way to see Buenos Aires. This trek made for an awesome day. The guides are excellent, and while you get some exercise they take you through an in depth interaction with the culture, environment, and history of Buenos Aires and Argentina, touching on the incredible and difficult elements of the cities history, while highlighting the thriving culture and beautiful landscape. If you are looking for an excellent day, go on this tour. Request Corrinne

Great way to see Buenos Aires. I thoroughly enjoyed my bike ride wirh this company. I had 48 hours to explore Buenos Aires before heading to Mendoza for a business trip. This tour was a major factor for me feeling like I had the opportunity to digest some of what the city offered in such a short time frame. I did the 5 hour tour and really enjoyed the well balanced combination of well researched history, beautiful scenery, and great food and company. I definitely plan to do another tour when I come back to the city. For me the 5 hours was perfect. I felt like I got a lot for my money without feeling too fatigue. I apologetically forgot the name of my hosts. One was from Denver, Colorado/Houston, Tx and the other from Belgium. These guys really rocked!!

Best Guided Tour Anywhere. Heart of the City Tour. We loved this tour. Our guide, Corina, was very patient, enthusiastic, empathetic and made us feel like we really got to know the city in spite of the limited time we had on a cruise shore day.We would have liked a longer tour, but the cruise itinerary did not allow for us to start with the early group.In a nutshell - you get to see many city sites much faster than walking, but much closer than from an air conditioned tour bus. Our guide, Corona, was very eager to answer questions. Her knowledge and enthusiasm for Argentine culture and history made the tour wonderful. A delicious lunch was also included.I was embarrassed that we arrived 45 minutes late - time change when entering Argentina from Brazil. However, everyone was very helpful and allowed us to do the full tour in spite of the fact we had pre-paid. I can't say enough good about our experience.

Get on yer bike. I completed a Heart of the City (south) tour and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the tour. Taylor, our guide for the day, was extremely knowledgable about the local area, Argentinian history and contemporary politics. He was able to bring the streets alive with some fascinating insights into BA. He was also super easy going and friendly. The bikes were in decent condition and fun to spin around on for a few hours. I was a little hesitate about cycling through crazy traffic but I needn't be, I felt safe the whole time. The tour also included a delicious lunch and was capped off at the end with a refreshing drink, snack and recommendations for the rest of the city. These guys obviously care a lot about what they do!

Wonderful way to get the essence of Buenos Aires . We did the full day tour to orient ourselves. First time in Ba. Rodrigo was an excellent guide. Lunch was great too. We appreciated the way Rodrigo developed the history of BA and tied it back to the present. Bikes were great and simple to use. A must for first timers.

Best way to see Buenos Aires. The full day tour was a fantastic way to get to know Buenos Aires. I was hesitant because of the price, but it was totally worth it. You learn a ton about the city, they do a great job of taking care of your group and making you feel safe, and they obviously have put a ton of thought into how to make this the best experience possible. Would highly recommend!

Great experience!. We just took a 7 hour private tour today and had a fabulous time. It is a bike friendly city and we could not have had a better guide. Rodrigo was incredibly knowledgable about history and really enriched this tour. You get a taste of many of the neighborhoods and a good workout in the process, traveling 27K. Do this trip early in your travel to BA. Will definitely recommend them to others. Very professional and friendly.

More biking...less talking.... I love biking tours, the 5 hour Heart of the City gets rave reviews, so I decided to give it a try. It was exactly as described in the website write-up and both of our guides; Rodrigo and Shawn were very passionate about the history of BA and Argentina. I enjoyed it but didn't realized there would be such extensive explanations about the culture and history vs. biking. I would say that we biked for 2 1/2 hours, had a great lunch for 45 minutes and the rest was (about 2 hours) explanations; which were interesting but I just couldn't process all the information and was eager to move on and see more sights. I especially enjoyed about 35 minutes biking in the beautiful reserve. One interesting story about the "tango bridge" was about 20 minutes long in the hot sun and I simply couldn't concentrate. If you don't know any of Argentina's history this is a perfect starter tour or if you concerned about too much biking; don't be, there is really not a lot of biking. I agree with the positive comments on TA about the organization but just feel I would have enjoyed less talk and more biking.

adventurous & educational. great way to see the city & amazing staff. We arrived when it was raining and they provided us local (and delicious!) pastries until the weather got better. It didn't get better, but we were easily able to reschedule for the following day. Our tour guide, Will, was amazing. He reminded us of a young, cool, hip, interesting history professor. The way he explained the history of the city was very engaging, and informative. He also gave us great local recommendations and was able to help us feel like a local.

Best way to discover Buenos Aires. Being a tourist, but didn't feel like being one.Will was superb, what a great storyteller and super host. We enjoyed every minute of the tour, the sights and his stories learned us more about the history and culture of Argentina and Buenos Aires than we would have thought possible.We did this on our first full day in Argentina, great decision!Thanks to the whole team at Biking BA

Fantastic tour. This tour is an amazing way to see the city. Our guide was fantastic and knew a lot about the city. We were able to see most of the city in one day. If you have limited time this is the way to do it. But be aware it does not finish at 5. We finished at 5:45 pm. However the guide did check with all of us to ensure we had no plans. So make sure you don't have any plans for straight after the tour. Our guide was extremely pacient with some very rude and arrogant Americans who implied that the group would catch aids from sharing a tradition Argentinian drink. I suggest you do this tour. It is well worth it.

Best overview of city. Signed up after all the great reviews on Trip Advisor and was not dissapointed. It was a beautiful day and our group was maxed out at ten since it rained the day before. We were expertly and safely guided through bike paths, streets and major intersections through all the major neighborhoods with Corina and Timo as our guides. The ultimate city tour was a bit ambitious for us having not been on bikes in some time, lack of physical fitness added to minimal sleep and jet lag from arrival the night before. But running on adrenaline it got us into exploring this beautiful and diverse city. The pace was good for covering some 16 miles and the 7 hour tour. The stops were timed perfectly with our need to take a break. Plenty of water, food and sunscreen were graciously provided along with all the history and explanations we could absorb. Day two we are a bit tired but the good kind from a great activity and knowing we have seen all the major high points on our list we can relax and revisit one or two to explore on our own. If you have 2 days you might consider breaking it up in two tours.

Excellent activity. What an amazing way to explore Buenos Aires. Corine and Timo were absolutely fantastic guides/support. Corine's insight and knowledge of the city was wonderful - really enjoyed listening to her explain the history of Buenos Aires - fantastic for someone like me who is fairly ignorant of all things Argentina.I highly recommend this tour. I felt incredibly safe the entire time due to the wonderful way that Corine and Timo managed the cycling, crossing of streets and supervision of the riders. I chose the full day tour and was a bit apprehensive about the 27km however it was a breeze. There are only one or two minor hills which would be better termed slight incline and only last about 2 mins for the entire tour! There was plenty of breaks along the way.We had been rained out on the initial day we chose - rebooking for the following day couldn't have been simpler and we were even provided with suggestions of things to do on a rainy day. Fantastic service.Can't recommend highly enough.

Informative and Fun. We did the south tour and it was a great way to get your bearings and see La Boca and other areas that it's best to go in a group, but not feel like you're on a tour. The balance between informative and fun was perfect and always with a keen eye on our cycle safety. We have a discount voucher which made it really good value.

Do this first on your first day!. This is a fantastic way to see Buenos Aires! Do it on your first day. I did the full day tour with my friends and it was wonderful. You get to visit many of the main neighborhoods and will get a great idea which places you'll want to come back to and spend more time. Santiago and Rodrigo were amazing guides that gave so much history of the city and its vastly different neighborhoods. You cover a lot of ground, but in a relaxing way. It was fun and informative. The guides keep you safe on the busy streets. Well worth the price!

Best way to see Buenos Aires. What a fantastic way to see Buenos Aires, especially on a Sunday. Despite it being an incredibly hot day (35C), our guides, Rodrigo and Santiago, made sure that the day was comfortable throughout and we got to cover a lot of areas. From la Boca (spending 15 mins in Caminito was more than enough) to Puerto Madero to the ecological reserve to Recoleta to San Telmo to Plaza Mayor, our guides had stories in every place to bring the history of Argentina to life and really get a feel for how it has changed in the last 50 years. They were both passionate about the city and its history and their English was impeccable. To top it off we had a lovely lunch (my chorizo sandwich was delicious) as well as some Mate to finish the day. This was my first city bike tour but thanks to this I am going to see all future cities (maybe not San Francisco by bike). Thanks for a great day
Great Day. This is a wonderful way to see and learn about Buenos Aires. Low stress and casual. Ray Ray and his crew made it a fun and informative day.

Amazing tour. We were lucky enough to take the tour on a quiet day and had our guide, Estefania, all to ourselves. Our guide was exceptional - she was friendly, informative and a complete pleasure to spend the day with. We did the parks tour in the North part of the city and felt very safe, riding in separated bike lanes for the great majority of the tour. Estefania gave us an overview of the bikes before we left and we were provided with helmets and water bottles. We had a technical difficulty with the bike's kickstand, but Estefania was ready with her tools and a smile and fixed everything up while we visited one of the stops. It really was seamless. We stopped at a restaurant and had delicious empanadas for lunch. After the trip, Estefania sent us an email with some suggestions of places to go in the city and some links related to questions we had asked during the tour.We loved this tour and felt it provided excellent value for money. This is a great way to start your trip as it provides an excellent overview of the city.

Fantastic tour. My girlfriend and I did the parks tour with Robin. It was an awesome time with a great balance of history and an understanding of how the "prettier" side of Buenos Aires came to be what it is today, and honestly it would be tough to see that side of Buenos Aires on a short visit here without this tour. Robin was awesome.. great time. We're doing another tour w them tomorrow.. Definitely recommend them

Will gives a unique tour. My wife and I go on bike tours whenever we travel and usually find them to be a good way to see a city and learn a little trivia. Will's tour was different. You will learn in-depth history of the country as it is intertwined with the city and stunning facts about each neighborhood. We could not throw him off with any question no matter how seemingly obscure - from the 19th century through the Argentine default. I highly recommend spending the $90 and taking a full day for the tour. You will not be bored for a minute of it and the rest of your journey in Argentina will have a great foundation.

Great for a Sunday . I can really recommend the Biking Buenos Aires as a great first introduction to the city. Our guide, Santiago, was very good at explaining the history of the city, as well as giving tips about what to do next. The whole crew, the ones we met, was kind and helpful. A Sunday is perfect, as the traffic is not that busy, and you see the markets. Thank you!

Excelent, a great way to know the insights of Buenos Aires. Definitely the best 90 USD spent on tours on Buenos Aires.Ray Ray is a super guide, a guy that tells you a lot about the insights and past history of Buenos Aires, and with a great sense of humour to make all the stories funny.You have a chance to know the insides of Buenos Aires and lots of history, and a very funny tour.If you have the time don't miss this !!
Great way to see the city!. My wife and I had 48 hours in BA, and this was the perfect way to do it. They are very knowledgable and do a great job showing the city. Would highly recommend.

Great time exploring BsAs. I just happened upon biking as a way to explore the city and I'm really glad that I did. The guides were friendly, went over safety guidelines, & there was great conversation. Any inexperienced riders should not worry. It was also a great way to get oriented to where things were located and to learn a lot of history. I would recommend taking in the beginning of your travels.It's also worth noting that they offer to help you even after the end of the tour and provide great recommendations.

Perfect way to see the city!. We had an awesome time on the Heart of the City Tour. SEAN, BEN, and TAYLOR were excellent guides. My biking skills were a bit rusty and they were extremely patient and helpful. Taylor did a wonderful job explaining the history and significance at each of our stops. We hit all of the important places of the city and had an enjoyable lunch at Puerto Madero. Thanks for a great day in Buenos Aires!

Perfect to start your exploration of the city. Great way to cycle through town without worrying about directions and map. With all the info and the places you visit you get a great overview of BA. The tour is well organized and the guys know what they are doing

Loved it. Our tour with SANTIAGO was fantastic, even with two kids! We had such a great time. We stopped for lunch and had so much history sent our way. These guys are pros and we would do it again and again. We loved the passion they had for this great city.

Awsome way to see the city. I went here with my family in the winter of 2014 and it was by fasr the best thing we did when we were there our guide Santiago was very knowloageable and spoke perfect english. We went for a lovely meal at a empanada place courtacy of Biking Buenos Airies and it was divine. We saw hidden gems that we would not have knowen were there. 10/10 Amazing!!!!

Unlock Buenos Aires. Thoroughly enjoyed the day which 'unlocked' the city for me. Before I took the ride I thought it was dirty, terrible pavements and pretty ordinary shops - glad to know I was wrong. RayRay was very knowledgeable and fun, Taylor kept this old lady safe and confident but didn't make it look obvious (71), both were great. Seven hours isn't too long, you need all of it to see this huge city. The lunch was delicious, local and huge. Thank you RayRay and Taylor!

Parks with Santiago. We are a family of 4 with two teenage boys from Canada. We took a half-day tour with Santiago just before Christmas.Pluses:Santiago was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable with perfect English.Tour was mostly on bike paths and the bits that weren't were no problem.Bikes in excellent condition and everything on-time, etc. We booked way in advance with Robin who was very helpful.It included an awesome empanada lunch, and, (separate from lunch) Santiago brought mate for us to try.If we had had another day, I would seriously have considered doing another tour with them.I can't think of any negatives ;)
Super tour. Thanks Santiago and the rest of the team for a most enjoyable day! Very informative and felt really safe and comfortable riding the bike an discovering the city ,

Best Way to See the City. My husband and I did this tour in December on our second full day in Buenos Aires. We used the Ultimate City Tour - privately. The guide - Rodrigo was EXTREMELY knowledgeable. This was the best way I can think of now to see the city. Buenos Aires is extremely large. You could not walk it if you tried. So, getting on a bike and seeing everything was super easy. The terrain is flat. Most of the ride is on a bike path. Besides knowing the history of the city and what each neighborhood represents, Rodrigo was SUPER helpful in restaurant and bar recommendations. The company is run by a few partners and you can tell that they really care to do an amazing job and provide unique value to each participant.

Great guides!. Had an awesome trip with Santiago - what a great guide. I think he could have continued for hours. I did the full City - not hard at all. You get all the outdoor sights and great guides - go!!!

Fantastic. Thanks to Ben, Taylor and Sean for an excellent, safe, informative and fun ride! We did the heart of the city tour, which included a terrific lunch on the pier. The bikes were comfortable, the business is very professional, and the guides were insightful and interesting. Extra thanks for getting us to the starting gate of the Dakar race!

Make this your first stop!. Do yourself a favor and do this tour first thing when you get to Buenos Aires, it will give you a great overview of the city. The staff is so friendly and welcoming, and speak English as a first language. Will was one of the best guides that I have ever had anywhere, he is enthusiastic and very knowledgeable.There is a lot of historical information in his tours, which is great for understanding how the city grew the way it did. Don't let the length of the rides scare you, it is by no means strenuous, you'll be stopping a LOT for explanations. I did two tours, the Architecture Tour and the Ultimate City Tour, and both were fantastic, without much redundancy. Their location in San Telmo is great- there are many famous restaurants in the area, as well as the flea market on Sundays.

The way to see Buenos Aires. My boyfriend and I went on the ultimate city tour on our first full day in BA. Despite the rainy morning we had an incredible time. While we waited out the rain a bit in the morning, they ran out and got us breakfast pastries so that our time was still enjoyable. The guides are enthusiastic and extremely knowledgeable. I hadn't been on a bike in 10 years (not exaggerating) and they were really helpful and patient while I adjusted to being back on the bike. This was by far the best way to get a lay of the land at the beginning of our trip. HIGHLY recommended!

It's all about the guide. Just returned from a fabulous trip which included a couple of days in Buenos Aires. Although I had visited the city before, I decided to book a bike tour to revisit some of the city's highlights. I and 11 other guests were pleasantly welcomed and given some instructions before hitting the roads. Our guide, Angeles, was amazing. I loved how she took the time to share the history of the places. She was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic, which kept things very interesting. Definitely fun and worth the adventure!

Best day ever in Buenos Aires. We had a fabulous day on the Utlimate City Tour with Ray as our guide. Biking is a fabulous way to see Buenos Aires as there are bike lanes everywhere and the city is flat but fairly spread out, which means you can cover much more ground on wheels than you could on foot. The itinerary was great and we learned a ton; just the right mix of historical and quirky information to keep everyone (including our kids) interested. Thanks again, Ray, for a fantastic day.

Awesome day biking BA. My wife and I went on the heart of the city tour within two hours of touching down in BA and it was the best thing we could have done. From only having seen the city from our transfer from the airport to our hotel, we started the tour in a strange and new city and ended it in one of our new favourite cities of the world. We have been lucky in that we have done many biking tours all over the world, this tour with our guide Taylor was one of the best and most memorable. Super chilled, funny but also knowledgeable and professional of a dude. Thanks for a perfect tour mate.

This is a "must do". If you are in reasonable good condition this is absolutely the best way to see BA. We took the 7 hour tour and were very impressed. The guides were fantastic and the route covered a lot of thecity. I would highly recommend this company and their tours.

Do this on the first day!. We were so thankful that we took this tour. The guides are knowledgeable and fun. The bikes are great, and the ride is fun and relaxing. We did the all day tour and loved it.

Great way to see the city. This was a great tour by a great company with great people. Will and Taylor were awesome. This was a great way to get a lay of the land on our first day in BA which helped us explore afterwards. Even though things got off rocky with a downpour and lightning, we were able to hang out, drink some yerba mate and wait things out until the rain slowed down. Once we were out on the tour, we had a great time and learned a great deal about the city. Very helpful to understand the culture and history in a short time. I highly recommend doing a bike tour with bikingbuenosaires.

Fantastic day out in BA!. Such a fun way to see the city! I really enjoy seeing cities by bike and this didn't disappoint. The guys at the office were amazing, sorting out a poncho and some shoes for me as it was quite a wet day! Although the day started off with a heavy downpour, 3 of us and the guide, ended up having a superb day. I did the southern route exploring San Telmo, La Boca and the port. Our guide was a local and it was very interesting to hear his personal experiences of growing up in Buenos Aires as well as some of the most recent history. He was very knowledgeable!Great little touches throughout the day, mate, yummy pastries to start the day and a delicious sandwich washed down with a cider to see out 2014 and toast the new year.Would highly recommend- thanks for a great day out!

Ideal way to tour BA. Biking BA was professional and wonderful in every way. Our tour guide was Will-from California. Although I was surprised we didn't have a local, it was really interesting to hear his take on living in BA and the differences between cultures. He was extremely knowledgeable about the city and its history and also had fun, charming anecdotes. He brought along some delicious, authentic snacks and mate and shared the traditions and specifics of drinking mate. We did the parks and plazas route, which was perfect as I am not a fan of city riding, but we were on bike lanes and paths for the majority of the time, as promised. Also, we had already visited some of the planned route (e.g. Recoleta cemetary) and Will was very flexible about changing the route so we could see something new and different. I had let them know ahead of time that our daughter needed a smaller bike (she is not quite 5 ft) and on the day of the tour she had a brand new bike-not sure if they purchased it for her, but it was apparent that they really listen to the needs of their clients. Our tour with Biking BA was definitely one of the highlights of our week long stay in BA.

Fantastic day out. My day on the Biking Buenos Aries tour was one of the highlights of my fortnight in Argentina. My guide was Angie who was a perfect combination of fun, friendly and informative. The tour was a great mix of the political and cultural history of the city. I did the five hour South city tour which whizzed by in no time at all, always the sign of a great time. BA is a huge city so hopping on a bike is by far the best way of taking in as much as possible if you're only there for a short period of time. I highly recommend it. Ask for Angie!

Great Day with Biking Buenos Aires. My family spent a day last week touring Buenos Aires with Angie and Sean. What a fantastic and memorable day. After our five hours together, including a wonderful lunch, we felt that Angie and Sean were part of our family. The tour was the perfect length and itinerary and covered everything we wanted to see. The biking was relatively easy thank to the route they talk us on. We can not say enough great things about Biking BA and Angie and Sean. Happy New Year to everyone at Biking BA.

Excellent way to see Buenos Aires. We chose the 5-hour bike tour after completing two walking tours on our first day in Buenos Aires. We are so glad that we did -- there was no overlap between the walking tours and the bike tour, and we would never have seen so much of the city otherwise. Corina, our Belgian tour guide, was knowledgable, warm and friendly; Taylor, our second guide, expertly repaired a flat tire and watched out for traffic when we crossed busy streets. They followed up the tour with a long emailed list of things to see and do in the city.
Great way to see the city and avoid the traffic!. This is the best way to see the whole city, and the staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable. They also held our luggage prior to us flying out.

Perfect to see Buenos Aires. We did a whole day tour with crazy Ray and it we had so much fun with him! You don't have to be super sporty to do a whole day bike tour - there are a lot of interesting stops on the way. Ray told us plenty of stories about the city, the people from BA, the buildings and other places of interest. Within these 7 hours we saw a lot of different spots of BA and it's definitely a good way to get to know this lovely city. We highly recommend to do a tour with Biking Buenos Aires!

Biking BA Didn't Disappoint!. Found these guys here on Trip Advisor and the previous reviews were completely accurate! My husband and I were in town for the holidays and were looking for something different than the American "Hop on, Hop off" as we like to get a bit more history and more exercise than those provide :) Will & Rodrigro were extremely helpful and immensely knowledgeable. I would recommend this activity and both of those guys to anyone who comes to BA. Biking around was a great first day to see all that the downtown area had to offer (we did the 7 hr North & South combined tour).

Great way to see the city!!. This is a wonderful want to see Buenos Aires! We did the all day (10-5) tour with Will and Rodrigo. It was wonderful for many reasons:1-Will taught us so much about the city...and it wasn't just about statues and buildings. We definitely got that, but he also just had a wealth of information about the culture and the experience of Buenos Aires. It was one of the best tours I have ever taken in terms of content. 2-It is really well organized. I have taken many bike tours, but here is why this one was great. There are 2 guides for the 10 people. One guide is focused on getting us to the places and leading the way. The second one is at the back. This was great -- I was never afraid that I would get left behind or lost (something that is typical for me on bike tours). Also, when we would be passing intersections without stop lights, the second guide would park in the intersection so we could easily ride through. Seriously great company, seriously great experience.

Great way to see Buenos Aires and learn some of it's history. Cycling in a busy city might not seem to be a great idea but Buenos Aires is very flat (biggest hill 30m!) and there are many cycle lanes etc. This is a great way to see the city and learn about its history and appreciate the background to many of its idiosyncrasies (eg the graffiti). The only negative (not the fault of company) was two of our group seemed to lack watches so we had to keep waiting for them

The Good Samaritan Ray Ray. So I didn't have a trip with good day but I have to say a big thank you to Ray Ray who still changed the inner tube on my bike after I got a flat tire!We luckily pasted him and his group when they were having lunch and he happily helped offered his services, today Christmas Day! Thankyou Ray... By the way it also went flat after 5 mins! It obviously wasn't my day for cycling but thank you anyway :-)

The fun, healthy, sunny, friendly way to see BA!. We choose the Parks and Plaza Tour and were thoroughly pleased. Our tour guides Will and Santi were gregarious and informative (though a bit wordy); their passion for the city was clear, and it was interesting to hear the perspectives of both an ex-pat and a native. They were also considerate with their time, stretching the tour to give us all a little extra feel for each stop and suprising us with a mid-tour snack of some delicious dulce de leche-filled pastries. This is a great way to start a week in BA, and if you have the time, I'd recommend doing two of their tours.

Highly recommended. My wife and I did the full day tour. Because it was Christmas Eve, the roads were almost empty which made it a very pleasant ride. Our tour was led by RayRay with Will bringing up the rear. They made a good team. Ray is a New Zealander with a good sense of humour and Will seemed to be a fun guy as well. Because BA is so flat, the riding is very easy and you never go too far or too fast. Everything was well organised and well run. They were even able to deal with 2 members of the tour who kept going AWOL whenever the opportunity arose. This sort of tour is great for getting a really good overview of the area as well as finding out about the history. I found all of the information interesting (and consistent with the other information that I had read or been told). If you are looking for a fun and informative way to spend a day in BA, I highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires.

Perfect way to spend the day. What a great experience. As I'm traveling by myself for a few days, I decided to take the Heart of the City tour to get acquainted with Buenos Aires and chose Biking Buenos Aires since it was the top rated company on TripAdvisor. Everything was wonderful! We had 8 people total in our group (an extended family of 5, two grad students, and myself) and two terrific tour guides (Taylor and Santiago). The weather was perfect, the bikes were easy to ride and well maintained (with a large basket in front to hold all your stuff), and our guides incredibly knowledgeable. Would highly recommend!

Great way to see Buenos Aires. I had a great day with Angie on the South City bike tour. It's a great way to see Buenos Aires and you can cover a lot of ground on the bike. Angie went out of her way to make sure we were all safe and that we learned about Buenos Aires. We had a delicious lunch and took plenty of breaks so that we could enjoy the various neighborhoods. It was one of the best things I did while in Buenos Aires. Highly recommended.

Essential Activity. My chums and I had a superb time experiencing the sights and sounds of the number one city in Argentina.Professor Will, flanked by sidekick Taylor, guided us to not only the must-see attractions, but also some hidden gems not outlined in your average guidebook. Essential knowledge was delivered throughout; concerning politics, tragedy, culture, more tragedy, history and war amongst more recent struggles (and even some successes!). I didn't feel overloaded with information, and when asked a few questions, the Yorkshireman answered adequately.The 6+ hours flew by, and it didn't feel like much of a work out, indeed the ~25 km roundtrip stuck to many cycle paths, and enabled us to visit some tranquil hidden nooks and crannies for a cheeky maté/terere break.There are opportunities to dismount and stretch the legs/buy stuff/wander around. I felt safe the whole time.Do it.

The Must Do Introduction to Buenos Aires. I took the Ultimate City and Graffitimundo tour with BBA in 2011 when I was only there for a couple of days. It was so good that when I came back to BA this December with friends, taking the tour again was one of the first things we did.The Ultimate city tour starts at 10 and runs until around 5, and takes you through the city while providing excellent commentary, history and insight into this marvellous place. Buenos Aires is mostly flat and there are many stops to explore so there is no need to worry about your fitness level.The crew at Biking Buenos Aires are great and very willing to help make your experience in BA the best it can be. They are passionate about riding and Buenos Aires and it comes across in everything they do.

Deserves the 5 star rating. I've been on a few bike tours around the world, and this one really deserves its 5 stars. Everything that you read from other reviewers is confirmed with my experience: professional, safe, interesting, knowledgeable, friendly. I did the 7 hour tour, and really felt that I got to know Buenos Aires in that time. This is a superb way to experience the city - thoroughly recommended!

The best way to see the city. Knowledgable and friendly guides take you all through the city with timely stops for lessons in history and culture. Stops for lunch and drink are included and a great spot, out of the norm for tourist traps. A great way to experience Buenos Aires and get your bearings while making friends along the way. Couldn't be happier with the experience. Highly recommended.

Must do tour of BA. These guys are simply amazing. I did the ultimate (7 hour) tour and it was exceptional. The bikes were in good condition and a mechanic accompanied us on our tour. Our guide Ray Ray is an expat who stumbled into BA and never left once he discovered his passion for the city. He showed us the important historic and touristic sights of the city and gave us great insight into the culture of the city.They also went above and beyond giving us ideas for what to do after the tour for the rest of our stay in BA. I would have taken another tour with them but I left before I had the opportunity

Amazing day. We did the 5 hour bike tour with Angie and couldn't have been happier. She was fun, knowledgable and a pleasure to spend the day with. The whole process was easy. We arrived and immediately felt like friends. Angie made sure she told us about the things we wanted to know about, whether it was history, culture, sports, etc. We only had two days in BA and I am so glad we did this bike tour because we really covered a lot of ground.

Best city tour!. Try something different than the ordinary hop on hop off bus, go on a city tour on bike. You will not regret it! This was a fantastic experience, the guides know a lot of the history of BA, and are extemely skilled at telling the story in an interesting way. The bikes were sturdy and easy to handle, and the tour went along on safe bike lanes most of the time, and even though BA is a huge city, we rarely felt that we were biking in busy traffic.In our tour lunch was included, and it was a nice treat, even though the weather was not the best. Not a drop of rain during the entire tour though, just a bit windy.

Bike Tour around Buenos Aires. What a fabulous way to get to know the 'heart of the city' (that's what the tour is called). I was travelling on my own as a solo female and it was safe and fun! The guides Anje and Timo were excellent - a good balance between professional and friendly. Really easy riding too, can't recommend this tour enough! Especially if you only have a couple of days in B.A.

Best way to see Buenos Aires. I did an all day (7 hour) bike tour with Biking Buenos Aires. It was very well organized, safe and a truly educational tour of the various neighbourhoods in B.A. Their reservation process was effortless and they responded to all my questions promptly. The guides were extremely knowledgable of the history of the city. I am a professional tour guide myself and I enjoyed the way they explained the past, present and future of the various areas in the city with interesting stories that kept my attention all day. We toured on comfortable bikes and they used very safe bike routes that avoided as much traffic as possible. The tour which included lunch was good value for the money and I would highly recommend this company.

Vamos en biki! Fantastic Day Out :-). Had a really wonderful, fun & informative day - our guide Corine could not have been better/nicer. Very welcoming team. Have been in the city for 3 weeks already and only now did 'ultimate tour', but still so much to see and learn. It really is a great way of seeing the city and connecting places/areas. Bikes are good & sturdy, team is fun and knowledgable!

BA MUST!. Bike tours are the best way to see a city and Biking Buenos Aires is an exceptional example! Our tour guide, Ray Ray, gave us many local tips and was extremely versed on the history of the city. He made sure everyone in the group was keeping up, showed us cool street art and all the big ticket sights. I would totally recommend Biking Buenos Aires to any friend traveling to BA, if possible, sign up for a tour at the beginning of your trip so you will have the staff's expert local tips and also know your way around the city better for planning the rest of your days. If you are only in BA for a day or two, this tour is a great way to get all the main attractions under your belt and get a feel for the city in one swoop.Bikes were in great condition! We did the Heart of the City 4 hour tour. Also water is provided and there are opportunities for restroom stops along the way. Lunch is also included.

Seeing Buenos Aires from a diferent poin of view. I took the Parks and Plazas Tour and Robin was our guide. He's very nice and knows a lot about Argentinian history and culture.It was a lovely day that ended with us having great empanadas for lunch.I highly recomend the Biking Buenos Aires tours.

Wows on Wheels!. I wish I took this tour sooner to give me time to revisit some of the neighborhoods we explored. Will, the tour guide, was a wealth of information and provided an awe-inspiring foundation for the history and cultural significance of this ever evolving city and country.Also, the mere fact that we survived a bike ride in a city of self-proclaimed road kings and lawless motorways says volumes of the teams organization, safety standards, and professionalism. This tour provided my most memorable and enjoyable day in Buenos Aires.
Very funny!. Think about something really different to do on your travel. I had a lot of fun in the seven hour bike tour!!! Thanks Angie and Taylor! I'll never forget this wonderfull experience!!!

Great way to see Buenos Aires. My wife and I booked a private tour of BA through Biking Buenos Aires. We did not have a lot of time because we were flying out that afternoon and we wanted to see as much as we could in 4 hours. Our guide was Corina (who is great!). She arrived early at our hotel and returned us exactly on schedule so we could make our plane. We toured the parks of Palermo and Recoleta as well at the hip and old parts of Palermo, and also had a very nice lunch of traditional Argentine food.Thank you for a lovely day!

Best experience I had in Buenos Aires!!!. Very informative. Taylor, our tour guide, was very knowledgeable and accommodating. It was a pleasurable afternoon. I highly recommend this for anyone who is going to be in BA. It was the highlight of my trip. Everyone at Biking Buenos Aires was very nice. Thank you guys for providing such a great service.

Get on ya bike!. Doing this on the first day of my stay in Buenos Aires was probably one of the best things I could have done because not only was it a great way of learning about some of the history of this impressive city but it's also given me a bit of an orientation as to where things are, relative to one another (and probably in a more memorable sense than if I'd done it on a tour bus) but has also given my some ideas / inspiration on where to visit for a gallery viewing or what have you.

A must do if you're spending anytime in Buenos Aires.. We scheduled the ultimate city tour at the beginning of stay in Buenos Aires and we're glad we did. This tour goes through all the different neighborhoods and gives you a good feel for the city. It helped us plan our remaining time in Buenos Aires. Angie and Taylor were great guides. Angie goes into great detail about the history and culture at each stop. Taylor did a great job keeping the group together in some of the busier sections. Overall, a perfect way to spend the day. Great lunch stop too!

Learn A Lot While Cycling On A Biking BA Tour!. This was among the last activities we planned on our visit to BA and it was one of the most memorable, fun and informative things we did during the whole trip.Angie was our tour guide on the 5 hour (but actually almost 6 hour!) tour, and beyond giving a very knowledgeable but necessarily abridged account of BA's complex history, she was personable, helpful and answered all our questions- from places to go out on Friday nights to the best restaurants to try before we go. She even sent every person on our tour a document with lists of things to see, foods to eat and what to see outside of BA. Now we will have to return to take advantage of it all!The tour itself was great- we followed a southern route which gave us access to San Telmo, Boca, Puerto Madero and the heart of the city. We stopped for lunch in Puerto Madero, which was included in our package, and enjoyed delicious Lomo and pork sandwiches. Veggie options were available for vegetarians. Taylor was really helpful as our 'mechanic' and traffic stopper- so we always felt safe peddling across intersections without stoplights.All around a very recommended experience!

If you only have 24 hours in B.A forget everything else and do this. The sheer volume of knowledge in Will’s head astounded not only me but the rest of our tour group! I have no idea how he remembers so many facts and figures about the city but this was pretty much the best biking tour I have ever done. We started at 10am and didn’t finish until about 7pm. This was way over what we paid for because Will and Sean (our mechanic) were so enthusiastic. Some of the tour group even went to a bar down the road together afterwards because we had such a great day together. They were great tour guides and I highly recommend them. It’s a complete sightseeing, cultural and historical tour rolled into one and it covers the whole of Buenos Aires in one go. A must on everyones to-do list when visiting Buenos Aires.

amazing guide and great trip. At the end of October, at the start of our Argentina trip, we took a private ultimate city tour. It was an all day event. Lunch was included. The bikes were comfortable. Santiago was our guide and he was really great! The city tour was fantastic and we have seen a lot of the city during the trip. At Puerto Madero, we had a lunch stop at the river promenade. Santiago really took his time to go everywhere, not stopping telling us more and more. And this is what it made really special and memorable, his enthusiasm and knowledge. He was so involved and knew so much about the history of the city and the country. We were really impressed and for us it was a really good start of our trip throughout the country. During our Argentina trip, we thought often about all the things he told us and on our way back, when we had two more days in BA, we knew what to do because of all the suggestions given by Santiago.

Amazing guide, great experience!. Stephanie was fantastic on our Parks and Plazas tour! Her enthusiasm, knowledge and attention was unparalleled compared to my other bike tours. She took the time to give us the full experience, even staying an hour after the official end time to continue showing our group around and answering questions. This tour was a highlight of my trip!

very friendly guides. I highly recommend taking a bike tour in almost any city, and this one was a lot of fun. On my day it was raining and they offered us a chance to reschedule. I showed up anyway and got an individual tour. After an hour the rain stopped (rain is usually confined to mornings here) and it was a beautiful day. Ray was a great guide. I learned a lot, got to see a lot of different areas in succession, and enjoyed a pleasant ride as well. It's a great way to spend a day.

Worthwhile, but try do early in your trip. My husband and I took the "Heart of the City" tour one Saturday and thoroughly enjoyed it. The group stops regularly to sightsee and the guide gives information and context - you really don’t notice how far you have cycled. The bikes are comfortable and clearly well maintained. The guide gives a good overview of the City, its history and of some Argentinian traditions and customs - we also got to try Mate (Argentinian tea) We had a fantastic, and massive, Pork Bondiola (a pork steak sandwich) for lunch - it was simple but delicious. Our guide Ray was very helpful with suggestions for places to visit and even thoughtfully brought alcohol hand gel and tissues for us to use before lunch. I would suggest that you do this tour as close to the start of your time in BA. It is a great way to see the City and meet new people, but don’t expect the history to be anything more than a rudimentary overview - there really isn’t time for much else. Those who came knowing nothing about BA found it far more informative than those of us who had already spent a month travelling in Argentina and had previously read extensively around the history of BA. Thanks Ray, we had a great time.

Brilliant guide and a lot of fun!. Me and a friend decided last minute to get involved with this cycle tour and I am so glad we did- it turns out cycling for 4 hours is a great way to get rid of a hangover! We saw more of the city that we could have expected to on our own, and Ezequiel was the perfect guide- knew his stuff but didn't just talk at us, he really got everyone warmed up and asking questions. I am a travel agent back in London and I would 100% recommend this to any of my clients.

Fun, active way to sample city highlights. I enjoyed our bike tour of BA way more than I thought I would. We covered so much ground and the time flew even though it felt like we had just the right amount of time at each stop. Taylor was personable, funny and informative. Biking Buenos Aires is definitively the way to see the city. Less exhausting and quicker than walking. Less passive and more exciting than a tour bus.

Awesome guides and itinerary. 11/12/2014We went on the culture and history tour. Corina and Annie were awesome. Corina was knowledgeable and provided us with enough information but not too much. Annie was amazing at stopping cross traffic for a large group to cross the roads. It was a fantastic opportunity to get exercise, to get educated, and to eat at a great food truck. If I had more time, I would definitely sign up for the company's other tours.

Try Graffitimundo!. I have been living in Argentina for a few months now and did the typical Buenos Aires city tours. I signed up for Graffitimundo in order to see something different. I was extremely impressed with this tour? Biking Buenos Aires teamed up with a company that is very knowledgeable about the street artists in the city, the history, and significance of the artwork. I really enjoyed learning about the city's taboo community. Also, the guides were very good at using hand signals giving is ample time to make the appropriate turns and lane changes while biking. We were able to stop several times and take pictures of the artwork. Halfway through the tour a guide shared with everyone the tradition of drinking mate and having biscuits, a popular Argentine pastime. I highly recommend this tour for someone who is willing to step outside the box to learn about Buenos Aires from a different cultural perspective. Bonus: You get leisure exercise for a few hours!

Excellent way to see Buenos Aires. We had a couple days in Buenos Aires and decided to do the Ultimate City Tour with Biking BA. What a fantastic way to get a great sense of this incredible town. Our leaders, Carlina and Timo were fun,professional, knowledgable, full of info and interesting stories on the culture, history and current events of Buenos Aires. We went from Boca where street dancers mixed with artists and music to a beautiful ecological preserve...no way could we have covered the distance and received such a great overview of this interesting culture. I highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires ! It's great exercise too!

Great time on the bikes!. Tour was informative, fun and the best way to see the city and get a lot of insight stories! We enjoyed the company of our great tour guides RayRay. Was definitely worth the time. Highly recommended!

Best way to tour the city!. We had the best time. Our guide Corina was knowledgeable, passionate, and fun! She even had her coworkers ready to surprise me for my birthday when we got back to the shop. Everything about the tour went above and beyond what I expected. So ditch the bus tour and go with these guys

Great day with great guides. Our group of 7 booked the Ultimate Bike tour with Will and Sean guiding us. Will was very informative and stopped frequently to give us the history of Buenos Aires. The tour was through historic areas with interesting sites and people. Sean was always watching out for the group guiding us across very busy streets and through rush hour traffic. We appreciated their committment to our day. Thanks again Will and Sean

Highlight of my visit.. I have done a few cycling tours in different cities every time I get a chance and the "Ultimate City" tour by Biking Buenos Aires is right up there with some of the very best.You will get a chance to see a few distinct "barrios" up close and see how many different faces this great city has. Corinne, our tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable and Sean, our "guardian angel" was great at guiding us through some of the crazier intersections. All in all, a 5 star experience.

I love these guys! This is the best tour in Buenos Aires. I had the opportunity to visit Argentina a few weeks ago and on my last few days, I took at tour with Biking Buenos Aires. They were wonderful. When I showed up to their office, I met the owner and he was so kind and gave me great tips about the city. Later I met his brother, Dana who would personally took time out of his schedule to show me around. It was the best night I had in Argentina. Thanks my brother!The tour was amazing. I had the best guide. Her name was Angeles. She was very knowledgeable about Buenos Aires and the history. We were able to see a lot in the time we had. You really get the feel of Buenos Aires. And Angeles spoke with such passion and vigor. She was also very inquisitive as well and wanted to know about the people on the tour, where they came from and their experiences in life. By the end of the tour, I felt like I had a sister from Argentina . I will never forget my time in Buenos Aires because of the family I made at Biking Buenos Aires.

Great way to sightsee Buenos Aires. Our group of 4 booked a private tour with the company and we were really happy we did.Per our request Will was assigned to guide us. We saw all the sites leisurely and were given plenty of time to take pictures . At each stop we had time to chat with local people on a Sunday stroll, musicians who played on the streets, students on their day off school.Great way to see the city, great team to show us around.

Biking Buenos Aires. Will and Taylor gave an excellent tour of the city. Despite us being late the guys managed to show is around all he focal points and provided great insight into the history of the city. I thoroughly recommend the tour a great way to spend the day.

Highlight of Our Trip. My wife and visited Bs As to celebrate our 25th anniversary, and this was our first international travel. We originally scheduled our bike tour for our first full day, but needed to reschedule it to a couple of days later. This was handled easily with a quick email and the accommodated us with out a problem. We chose the Parks and Plazas Tour, and our guide was Steph. We were the only two in the group, and Steph took the time to really inquire into what we wanted to see, and customize our tour just for us. I really cant say enough about Steph - she was phenomenal - bright, cheerful, full of wonderful information, and so well spoken. After the tour was over, Steph followed up with a long email full of links based on our interests, and a suggested walking tour for some other areas of the city. We followed many of her suggestions, and were never disappointed. I very rarely give 5 star reviews, because nothing is perfect, right? This was. I would give it 6 stars of I could.

Great way to experience the city!. Santiago pedaled us around the city, all the while sharing his city's colorful history. This is a great way to get around and catch the highlights. Lunch is empanadas at a neighborhood cafe. Lots of fun!

Awesome way to see the whole city. I went on the Ultimate City Tour and loved it! We saw the various neighborhoods, including La Boca, Puerto Madero, Recoleta, Retiro, and San Telmo, and sights like the Ecologic Reserve and The Cementario. Our guide was incredibly smart and gave us perspective on current and past events of Argentinian and city history. The food truck sandwiches for lunch are so good too! Tips: I definitely recommend going on a Saturday or Sunday when traffic is reduced. It's a long (and great) day so stay hydrated and wear the sunblock they provide. Lunch is a sandwich and it's street food style; I loved loved it, but set your expectations so you can enjoy.

Great way to see BA!. I can thoroughly recommend trying these guys if you can ride a bike and want to see a great city.The booking and pre-tour side of things was excellent with Estefania responding very quickly, and they even worked with Buenos Aires Local Tours (another tour company on Trip Adviser) to work out which parts of the city we could cycle in and others to walk in, etc, to avoid duplication.That was a very helpful tool as we split a day into two, ie, a walking tour and a cycle tour (4 hours each/on separate days) which was great for our kids (aged 13/7).RayRay was our tour guide, and he was excellent. He made us all feel welcome and safe and he was great with our kids too.This is definitely one to try, even if you're not an accomplished cyclist. Thanks guys!

Biking is the best!. For getting really close to the city, taking a bike sight-seeing tour is the best way I have tried so far!
