We took the tour "Heart of the City" for 5h, and got to see many interesting places at a comfortable pace. It does sound a little dangerous to go biking in Buenos Aires, but we felt quite safe and had a really good time. I highly recommend it to anyone who is familiar with a bike and does not mind a little exercise….The owners & staff of Biking Buenos Aires are very friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. Thanks Robin (and the Belgian girl, I forget your name, sorry!) for the much-needed coffee and your thoughtful help&advice when we arrived in pouring rain and had to reschedule to the following day. Thanks above all to Angie, our wonderful guide! Sharing your knowledge, not only of Argentina, Buenos Aires and its history, but also of the people – and dogs!! – living there made this tour very special to us. The chocolates and yerba mate you recommended were great. Hope to be back some day, and to everyone interested in seeing Buenos Aires close up – Biking Buenos Aires is the place to go!

Excellent and fun way to see the city.. I recently returned from a week-long visit to the beautiful city of Buenos Aires, and a highlight of my trip was the Ultimate City Tour with Biking Buenos Aires. This tour is a full day at around seven hours, but it's an easy ride (almost completely flat!) and should be leisurely for most people. We hit all of the "hot spots" in the city, from Puerto Madero to the Casa Rosada to La Boca! Our guide, RayRay, was hilarious, and he knew so much about the city's history and culture that he probably could have led a 12-hour tour without breaking a sweat. I am inspired to ride my bike through my own city now, and to seek out other bike tours when traveling to new places. I'd highly recommend both the Ultimate City Tour AND Biking Buenos Aires if you're visiting the city!

Great intro to Argentina. We spent our first day in Argentina on the Heart of the City bike tour, led by the Will the guide. It provided all the context and background knowledge for the rest of our trip. Highly recommend it this group if you want to go beneath the surface of the tourist trail.

I learnt a lot. The easy to manoeuvre website made choosing and booking my tour very easy - Luke responsed to my initial enquiry very quickly even though it was a Friday night and outside of regular office hours. I booked a private tour, originally for my husband and I but sadly on the morning of the tour he wasn't feeling too great so I had to go solo but it was still a lot of fun because Will my guide took great care of me and was very good company. He knew so much about Argentina and its incredible history that I felt in just a few short hours I had learnt so much. I have taken cycle tours in Montreal, Sydney and Rio and would recommend sight seeing by bicycle to everyone - in my view it is the only way to go. Bike in Buenos Aires are a very professional and caring company, you are sure to have fun and if you have Will or a tour guide like him you will learn a lot also.

BA Street Art on Wheels!!!. I did the Graffitimundo tour and it was awesome!!! These guys are great and they take care of everything. It was nice to meet such people passionate about what they're doing. I didn't have much time to make the other bike tours with them, but if you in BA please don't miss the chance. It's an incredible way to see the city. Even if you are not used to biking, don't worry, BA is a flat city, so you won't get too tired. And the Street Art are outstanding. Totally worth your time!!! :)

Great way to see the city and learn something. We took the south tour only as we had walked much of the rest of the city.I found the roads safe to ride on and the guides were watching out for everyone any riding safely. We saw a whole area of the city we wouldn't otherwise have seen and it was great fun.The guide was great, very knowledgeable and likeable.Nice monster lunch too!

Best way to see Buenos Aires. We found this on the Internet and booked on line. Biking is definitely the best way to see a city; you can cover more ground than on foot but you see the city at street level.We took the 7 hour all day tour. This was excellent and included visits to Boca, the nature reserve and the Recoletta cemetery. Our guide Santiago was very knowledgeable about the history and politics of the city. Lunch was included.A number of shorter tours are available. The bikes are single speed cruiser style bikes and were well maintained. We biked on a Sunday which has less traffic but BA has good bike lanes and the guides are knowledgeable about navigating the traffic.Their office is easy to find in the San Remo district and is close to central hotels. The website was easy to navigate and we got confirmation right away.

Great afternoon tour. We were limited on time, so we took the three hour afternoon tour. We had an excellent guide and it was just the three of us. He took us around la boca, May square, and puerto madera. They provided helmets, bikes, Yerba mate, and ponchos. Definitely worth it, even on a rainy day. Very leisurely tour and a great way to see buenos aires.

Fabulous!. It's clear a lot of thought has been put in to make the tour as enjoyable as possible for you. They accommodated for all needs of the day (sun cream, water etc), so all you had to do was turn up and enjoy! Super safe with 2 experienced tour guides, both very passionate about Buenos Aires, and super informative! I would definitely recommend this tour for any age or fitness level. An awesome way to experience Buenos Aires. I only wish I had more time to do the other tours!

Fun, friendly, interesting - perfect way to see Buenos Aires. I had a wonderful experience. My friend and I signed up for the Heart if the City tour. We were greeted with coffee, mate, and water upon arrival. They provided everything I needed, including water bottles for the ride. I forgot mine, so this was very handy. Angie was an excellent tour guide. She was friendly and knowledgeable and happy to answer all of our questions. She made lunch very easy for us. We got to try one of the food carts - delicious. The ride was mostly flat with a leisurely pace, so I would rate it as easy. This was good, because there is a lot to look at as you ride. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a non-traditional, active city tour.

Great tour!. We had a private bike tour with Will and it was terrific! We visited key sites we requested, including graffiti spots and Palermo Soho. Will demonstrated complete control over the history of BA and Argentina, speaking fluently on a range of social issues, key actors, historical events, along with common misconceptions. We also learned a lot about drinking Mate, an enjoyable social endeavor and cultural identifier in Argentina. My husband and I give Will our highest recommendation. We plan to ride with him again on our next visit to BA. He accelerated out learning and enjoyment!

Great way to spend the day in Buenos Aires. I really enjoyed seeing Buenos Aires on a bike! The trip was fun and informative. The whole experience was perfect. The guide, Ben did a great job. The best part was that I got to experience Buenos Aires on a bike, and not on a bus!! So much more fun.

Just Do It. We did the Heart of the City Tour. Contacted them on the day, super fast response and even though we were the only two they still ran the tour for us. Bikes are easy to ride and helmets, water and rain ponchos, lunch and a stop for traditional mate were all provided. Even though it poured with rain all day we had so much fun. I can't think of a better way to see so much of one city. Santiago was our tour guide and he was just incredible- so friendly and enthusiastic and SO knowledgable. We now know so much history and amazing facts about BA. I usually have a 'but' to put on the end of my reviews but I can't fault this at all. Just do it.

Beyond Expectation!. I had a private "ultimate city tour" with William today and it's easily the best experience in BA so far. Within the well planned 7 hours trip, we stopped at all major places of interests in the diversified neighborhoods in the city. Will is the most knowledgable tour guide I have ever met, he gave detailed guide not only on places and stories behind them, but also organized and connected everything smoothly and narrated it from an interesting social science perspective. Everything is deeply customized and conversation oriented - so much information and amazingly at the same time you won't feel bored for even a single minute! During the bike ride I don't feel I am with a tour guide, it's more like biking with a friend ( to some extent better than a friend, because you paid so you are well taken care of all the time) . I strongly recommend him and biking buenos aires. It is the best way I can think about to start your BA trip.
Best Way to discover BA!!. Had a great tour with Corinne, she was extremely hospitable and loved showing us around the city. Excellent knowledge of BA and it's history!!

Why walk when you can ride, indeed!. Had a Great time with Robin, Angie, and Raymond. The ‘Ultimate City Tour’ was a particularly terrific way to see and start to understand Buenos Aires- and we enjoyed it so much we wanted to see more of this metropolis, so we did a second, shorter, tour! We try to do a bike tour every time we go to a new place- and we weren't disappointed with this crew. Guides spoke clear english, and each had his or her own perspective on the Porteño life. Not scripted, very personable expert guides. Book the Graffiti tour early - they keep group size reasonable (10?) so the less-frequent tour fills up quick.

Great bike tour with Santiago. Had a really fun ~7 hour bike tour through San Telmo, Boca, Puerto Madero, and Recoleta. Santiago was an excellent guide, narrating an abridged social, political and economic history of Buenos Aires throughout the city, answering all our questions along the way, and sharing some yerba mate. This is an excellent way to explore various neighborhoods of Buenos Aires.

Great day out!. My boyfriend and I loved the tour of the parks and plazas (north city). As the name of the tour suggests, lots of the tour was done in or around the parks/gardens which made for a great scenic ride. All the cycling on the road was on bike paths so made for an easy bike ride. The guide Estefania was awesome, very friendly, so much knowledge on everything BA and answered all of our questions. There was only us two on the tour so it was even better than imagined, and our guide tailored the places we went too based on what we had/hadn't already seen in BA. The price is very good for what you get on the tour, it includes traditional yerba mate tea tasting, a morning snack, and lunch which was yummy. Would recommend this tour to everyone, as it's a great way to see the city.

Best Way to See Buenos Aires North. Enjoyed my day biking northern Buenos Aires Parks and Plazas Tour with leader Will. Very refreshing to be on a bicycle and taking in the beautiful parks and the Palmero area while learning the history and idiosyncrasies of Buenos Aires and chatting about just about everything under the sun. Will is competent and friendly with lots of great personable touches (brought homemade brownies and a special vegan snack). Greatly appreciated Will's preparations—water, breaks for bathroom and for roaming about and his directions in traffic. Best vegan adventure in this city of carne. Discounts available after completing the tour on cycle-cities.com, which I will take advantage of because there may be no better way to tour a city than bicycling. Loved it.

Highly recommended. I enjoyed so much the tour riding a bike around buenos aires. The tour envolved visits to interestings architeture buildings in BAs that is wonderful. The guide, William, was excelent, explaining each places we went. I recommend so much the tour and the company to visit BAs in a different way.

Awesome Tour!. This is a fantastic way to get to know Buenos Aires! We did the full city bike tour with Santiago and we had a wonderful experience! Santiago was super friendly and very knowledgeable about the city. He answered all of our (many) questions with a smile on his face. The full tour is 31km but it's completely flat and very manageable. We visited several key areas and landmarks. We drank mate, ate a great lunch, grabbed some ice cream and snacked on alfajores. Highly recommended!!

Best way to see the city. Biking BA is a great way to see the city and get orientated quickly. Do it in the first few days and your time here will be much richer. The team are extremely professional, the bikes good and comfortable for city touring, the lunch not too bad and the destinations and historical perspective excellent. Highly recommended!

Great opportunity to see Palermo and Recoleta. I really enjoyed the Plazas and Parks tour with my guide Will. As I was the only person to book this tour on that day, there was plenty of time to get a lot of information about the argentinien way of life and history of argentina and Buenos Aires.As Palermo is the biggest neighbourhood in BA biking is possibly the only way to experience this area of BA. By using bike lanes most of the time there is also no need to feel insecure about the traffic.Thank you Will. I really enjoyed the tour.

Wonderful tour of Buenos Aires street art. We did the Graffitimundo tour on a Sunday afternoon. Great way to see the street art in Buenos Aires especially in areas that are not really in the touristic area. Our guides Ray and the Irish girl (sorry can't remember your name!) were really enthusiastic and knowledgeable. The cycling pace was just nice and we also got to try the local tea mate. All in all a very pleasant way to spend Sunday afternoon in Buenos Aires.

Excellent. A great way to see this fascinating city. The guides are very knowledgeable and their passion for the city is clear. The pace of riding is steady with plenty of opportunities for photos and soaking in the atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Biking Fun in BA. I did this tour on my second day in Buenos Aires, and I would highly recommend it as a way to both orientate yourself and enjoy all that this beautiful city has to offer. Our guide, Santiago, was very knowledgeable and really funny. I learned a lot and I laughed a lot. Lunch and a snack are included, both of which we enjoyed in the sunshine!

Just awesome. The people from my Spanish schools recommended me taking this tour. I´am very thankful since it was such an wonderful experience. Buenos Aires can be so beautiful form this point of view. There are some incredible building and everything is just beautiful. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. Overall great experience.

So much fun!. I took the North City tour yesterday with Will and had a great time. It was a bright sunny day, and riding through the parks was an excellent way to escape the congestion of the city. The ride was mostly in protected cycletracks so there wasn't much to worry about in terms of traffic. Will is very knowledgeable about the city and Argentina and put all the sites we visited into historical context. The little touches like providing water, snacks, mate, lunch, and even sunscreen were much appreciated. A super fun way to experience BA.

Great way to explore BA!. My husband and I did the Heart of The City tour today and absolutely loved it! I was fairly nervous as I'm not the strongest cyclist (and had never cycled through a city before), but ended up having a brilliant time. We did have to cycle with the traffic every now and then, and while it was pretty nerve-wracking for me to start, our guide Corine was really cautious and patient, so I never felt unsafe. Amongst other stops, we visited San Telmo, La Boca (a highlight for me), Boca Stadium (a highlight for my husband), Puerto Madero and Plaza de Mayo and throughout it all Corine showed great knowledge of the history of Buenos Aires and shared lots of interesting facts about each place. Unfortunately the Ecological Reserve was closed as a result of the previous day's rain so we couldn't cycle through it as planned, but we had a deliciously authentic Argentinian lunch overlooking it. Overall a really fantastic and fun way to explore and learn about the city - would highly recommend it to all!

Whole day tour - BA Highlight. Myself and my colleague Amy were in BA for business but managed to squeeze a days worth of biking (exercise as well as sightseeing). This was a great sunny day of cycling and Will was a great guide, enthusiastic about the city and very passionate about the history and culture. We managed to see the main sights and enjoyed the lunch especially. We were with a good group of people and this helped to relax on the day and let the sights and sounds of BA fill us with joy. We liked BA, admittedly a few too many days of beef eating though!

The highlight of BsAs. This tour came highly recommended from friends and it was excellent. We initially balked at the price (USD $60/person), but was totally worth it, Angeles was our guide and she definitely exceeded expectations. We did the BAs south tour (San Telmo, La Boca, Puerto Madero, Ecological Reserve, and Plaza de Mayo). At every stop, Angeles provided terrific history/context/background information, that made you truly appreciate each site. She treated us to traditional Argentine pastries and mate. Lunch was at a food truck in Puerto Madero and was delicious. As an FYI, it is perfectly safe, but you just need to have a bit of confidence while navigating the streets of BAs.

Great way to discover the city. Honestly Buenos Aires is fantastic. I've been here for the past 6 months and after all this time it can still surprise me. So much history and passion in every corner. The tour guide was super nice and very knowledgeable. I would like to do this again in the future.

Awesome way to see Buenos Aires. What a great day! Our guide Angie was awesome. Peddled around the city, saw the sights, learned much abt the city and it's history. Much better than a bus tour. We had lunch at a little local street food trailer that was great. Again don't miss this one!

Well worth it!!. I went on a tour that was only one other person and myself and I was pleasantly surprised from start to finish; the tour completely exceeded my expectations. Not only did our tour guide, Katherina, share with us multiple traditional Argentine traditions like how to prepare a yerba mate, as well as the typical snack of alfojores, but she also chose to share not only interesting but also relevant information about each of the historical sites that we visited while on the tour. Everything was very tasteful and relevant to the tour. The customer service was great and the guide wasn't hesitant to answer any questions about the city or give recommendations. The price is great when taking into consideration the fact that you're paying for an all inclusive, intimate 6+ hour tour.

What a fun time. Our guide was Ben who was really knowledgeable about Buenos Aires and prepared for any situation that might arise. I did a full day tour with two other people, and we were able to hit all the major sites in the city. The riding pace was very easy with no special clothing required. I rode in jeans and a t-shirt/jacket. Lunch was very delicious and authentic. I would recommend this tour to anyone who isn't going to take a walking tour and who likes to get out and experience the city. It was an efficient way to knock off most of the major tourist sites and get oriented with the city. I booked this tour about 90 minutes before departure time and the location was very convenient.

Too expensive and quite boring. I take bike tours in every city I ever visit. This one was definitely not good, neither fun.Although it was a bit expensive compared to other similar activities in the city, I decided to give Biking BA a go, as it had lots of great reviews and I thought there was maybe something special about it. I was wrong. I took the Park and Plazas tour with a friend. Ourselves and the rest of the group were very quickly welcomed by our guide on the street outside the Botanical gardens and simply took off with no introduction to the tour, which was a bit awkward to start with. The ride lasted five long hours, as the tour had no dynamic at all. We made around seven stops, where we would just hop off our bikes, be offered time to take pictures and hop on again to get to the next stop. No significant information related to the city and the sights was provided at any time. Even when we stoped at Recoleta's Cementery, one of the most historical attractions of the city, the guide stayed outside and we were left on our own, with no other choice than to guess the information (I had to go back there on a walking tour the next day!).Lunch was included on the price, which it sounded fair when we hired the tour, but we were never expecting to have to sit at restaurant waiting half an hour to place an order and almost another half to receive our -average- meal. Disastrous. Worst part of the day.Trust me, I'm not too demanding as customer, but paying so much for such an unprofessional, disorganized and boring activity, I guess it would make anyone unhappy. I was expecting a fun and informative bike tour, but either than that it felt more like a hop-on-hop-off tour just to take pictures.Make some more research than me and think twice before taking this bike tour. Totally not recommended.

Great introduction to BA!. I booked this tour last minute bc it seemed like a perfect way to introduce myself to BA, and vice versa, while avoiding the hop on hop off bus. It lived up to and probably surpassed my expectations. It was a great tour. Our main guide was Ben, and he gave great context to everything we saw. He definitely wants to shine a light on Argentina's good attributes. We also had Santi as a sweep. He was pleasant, interesting, kind, and very funny. Finally, we also had Joanna who was helping out during her last days at the office and in BA. The three of them were a fantastic team - all kind, knowledgable, and patient. The non-guides were just 3 bc 4 ppl failed to show. I would not have wanted the group to be any bigger. After reading other reviews before writing mine, I realize that maybe part of the charm of my experience was due to the intimate nature of the group. I really felt like I was riding with friends by the end of the day, and I was genuinely sad to leave in the afternoon. In terms of difficulty - this is for anyone. You only cover 26 km in 7 hrs, so it's not physically taxing bc you never ride more than a few km before reaching a point of interest. You see many of the main neighborhoods and tourist attractions that you would on a hop on hop off bus or other kinds of BA city tours. This was exactly what I was looking for. However, you have a much closer and intimate experience on bikes - both bc you are physically closer and the pace is slower, and bc the guides are fantastic and explain things in a more intimate manner (rather than someone on a mic at the front of a bus talking over a load of chatty chads). Finally, the whole operation over at Biking BA is top notch. After the ride, Santi, Ben, and another Guide went far and beyond to help me get home. Ben helped me w a Sube card, Santi found my route and was incredibly patient w my ignorance of BA geography, and the last guide actually walked me a few blocks in the direction of the stop and helped me find a kiosko to charge the card. Wow. Take away:Safe and fun way to get oriented w BAGreat group of patient and kind guidesThough $90 is expensive, I felt that my experience was worth the expense Caveat: I loved my small group. Not sure how I'd feel if it were the full 7 ppl + 3 guides.

Wonderful Bike Ride. This was a wonderful day long bike ride. My family and I took the Ultimate City Tour which is 7 hours in length; it takes you through all of the major sites of the city. Our tourguide RayRay and his team were wonderful. We had 2 kids with us (teenagers) and we felt safe even where there was considerable traffic. All of the guides were knowledgeable and friendly. It was a great experience and we would recommend them without hesitation!!

The Best of Buenos Aires. This was my absolute favorite tourist experience in Buenos Aires. The city is so expansive and beautiful, seeing it by bike is perfection. My guide, Katherina, was fantastic! I took a private city tour so I could focus on taking pictures and Katherina made the most of our time. She was really knowledgable about the city's history and architecture and i was glad to have someone there to tell me about it all. We had lunch at a great food truck by the eco reserve and Kat pointed out all the places I should visit based on my interests. This is definitely the way to see the city.

A fun day of biking!. Biking around Buenos Aires is a great way to quickly see many of the beautiful buildings and sites while immersing yourself in the rhythm of the city. We did the Architecture Tour with our extremely knowledgeable tour guide, Will. The bikes were thoughtfully outfitted with water bottles and gloves to prepare us for an enjoyable ride even in chilly weather. One of our favorite parts about the tour was Will, who discussed the origins of the buildings in such an enthusiastic and engaging way, throwing in intriguing political tidbits, and making history come to life for us. He also taught us how to make yerba mate, and we enjoyed the tea and cookies together as a group in a picturesque park under the sun. It was a very fun and memorable day. We highly recommend this!

Great way to explore BA. We did the Parks tour with Will as our guide. The city is totally flat and has dedicated bike lines so seeing BA by bike just makes sense! We found it to be a great easy ride, seeing lots of BA.Will, our guide, did a fantastic job of putting Argentina's history into perspective for us and showing us the sights. We left feeling like we had a much better understanding of the city and where to keep exploring with our other days in town.

A great day!. We did the full day bike trip with Angie as our guide. We only booked it the day before and it turned out to be just us and Angie so our own personal tour! From the start the day was well organised and fun. Arriving at their airy office to a cup of tea and an array of very comfy blue bikes. The tour was relaxed but full and detailed and you followed the up and downs of Argentine history in the places where it happened. Angie was great , friendly, enthusiastic, informative, fun and patient. Plenty of time for photos and exploring. Also a great lunch in a place you would otherwise not have found! You get a great feel for the city , its orientation, history and emotions. Definitely recommend.Angie also recommended Wes for Tango lessons so we booked a lesson with him and had a great hour and a half of getting a feel for the emotion and (very tricky technicalities) of the tango, if only we could stay for a whole course of lessons.....want to learn more! He website is tangoawareness.com.

Great day. A great time was had today with Ray Ray, Timo and Santiago. The weather was glorious, the group was fun and the guys were all super friendly and funny and accommodating.I did the "five hour" Heart of the City tour, which ended up being closer to six. A decision was made to have lunch in La Boca, which Ray organised quickly and it ended up being fantastic.Thanks for a fantastic day. It's such a great way to see the city, learning as you go along. Next time I'm in Buenos Aires I will definitely do another Biking Buenos Aires tour.

Great trip!. Such a great way to explore the city. Corine was our guide and gave us an amazing tour, letting us stop often to take pictures and explaining the history of every part of the city we explored. Exploring the city on your own doesn't do the city justice. She also took us to an amazing place for lunch! Highly recommend the tour!

Knowledgeable, friendly staff and such a great time!!!!. I don't usually do tours like this.. I tend to always just explore cities on my own and by foot. But I have to say, I'm so glad I decided to do a Biking Buenos Aires tour. I got to see all of the main parts of the city in one day and in style (the bikes are all the sky blue Argentinian color and have a retro vibe to them) I learned so much about the history of the city that I didn't know about, and I met some awesome people who I've been hanging out with since. Our tour guides Corina and Angie were absolutely fantastic (never mind the fact that they're both absolutely gorgeous!) Corina was our leader and history professor. She had this incredible way of telling stories of the past that painted such a vivid picture and really took you back. Angie was our protector and handywoman. She followed us, made sure traffic stopped for us (which is a hefty task here in BA), and got her hands dirty if anything happened with one of the bikes. Corina led and enlightened us and Angie kept us safe. Oh, and the included lunch was soooooo delicious. So grateful for this experience! Thanks to the whole team for being so awesome.

Great way to see the city and learn the history of Buenos Aires. Our group of 6 took the Heart of the City tour in early August and had a fantastic time. Corine and Angie were our guides and gave us a wonderful tour of the city. The cycling was very easy and there were plenty of stops to take pictures and walk around. The best part of the tour, however, was the history and background that was given to us throughout our ride. We learned all about the colonization of BA by the Spanish, and the evolution of the city over time. Past and current-day politics and societal issues were also explained in a very informative way. These were all things I had meant to read in all the guide books I had bought prior to our trip (but didn't have time to read), but they were covered in a much more interesting way.We highly recommend this trip as a great way to kick off your visit to BA.

Best tour experience we have had...Will our guide simply was hands down best guide we have had!. I recommend you don't debate about a Biking tour in BA as it is easily the best way to see this vast unique City. Secondly be rest assured Biking BA are the best biking tour company BA has to offer.Having done many local tour companies around the world from Thailand, India and Egypt and what will make or break any experience is the guide.We had Will as our guide and he was the most entertaining, informative and passionate guide we have come across on our travels.Having relatively little time in BA we went for the Ultimate City tour.It can only be described as being shown around this City by one of your best friends who knows every single detail of BA, it's history and people.Be prepared to bike yourself through a narrative story of BA and for Will to make you feel like you are actually transported to various milestones in time at each of its various landmarks. Don't leave without this unique experience!

One of the best things we did in BA. My husband and I found Biking Buenos Aires randomly through some web research in our hotel room. I'm so glad we did! It was just us and one other woman on the tour, plus our two guides (this was a few months ago…I think one of the guides was named Steph?). Our guides were easygoing yet attentive, and knew so much about the city. We went on the Plazas and Parks tour around the Palermo region and were amazed by how many bike lanes and bike paths there were! I felt pretty safe the whole time, especially because we always had one guide in front and one in back. It was such a relaxed and fun day. We stopped for a delicious lunch and by that time, kind of felt like we were all friends! We were able to ask our guides questions about Argentine and BA culture that had been burning on our minds for days. :) Also, the bikes were great and worked perfectly. I would absolutely, highly recommend this attraction! A great time and a great value. Oh, and we met the founder of the company while we were out on our ride, and he stopped for a mate break with us. When we told him we were about to move to Colorado (where he's from) he later emailed us and got us connected with his friends in CO to help us find a place to stay, etc. Totally went the extra mile!
great time with BA bikes. Did a tour of the north a few days ago with Zeek. He is the man - very friendly and informative. Knows a lot about the cemetery in particular. Had a great time - thanks man!

Wow!. Fabulous experience. While my husband was teaching for a few days at the Catholic University, my four teenagers (ages17,17,14&13) and I set out to explore BA. Fortunately we were on bikes from Biking BA with amazing guides Ray Ray and Cat. We had a fantastic experience. The kids and I learned a ton about the city, the history, the culture, the economy, human rights and we also burned off the energy that had been building up after sitting on too many planes. We did the complete city tour and had a blast. I would give 10 stars if I could. Very professional and worth every penny. (Although really not very expensive!) do this! And have fun!

Fantastic experience!. A friend of mine invited me to do the graffiti tour and it was great!. The guide is really nice and friendly. Definitely Buenos Aires is absolutely stunning. Incredible buildings a beautiful art everywhere. This is a must if you are in BA.

BEST EXPERIENCE WE HAD IN BUENOS AIRES!. I went to visit my daughter in BA and she picked out for me the most wonderful way to see the city. We took a tour with Biking BA!! On our first tour, we enjoyed nature. It was a great way to see the parks, lakes, and a nice overview of the city. Robin, our guide, was knowledgable, kind, and very enthusiastic. In fact, he made me, a nervous cyclist, feel safe biking with him through the city! It was awesome and so much fun that my daughter booked us ANOTHER tour (thanks daughter)!!! This time we met at their "local" and we were welcomed with coffee and fruits. They were all very personable and friendly. The second tour we took was the "Heart of the City." Just great! Corina was an excellent guide. Very informative and funny. She explained the sights, historic events, culture, politics, economics, and of course, the art of mate! Luke and Timo were very caring and professional. They ensured that we were safe throughout the tour so we could enjoy. It was also fun having Lucas taking pictures of our group. We had time to relax and the pace was fantastic. We stopped for lunch and it was plentiful and delicious. Thank you soooo much guys for your wonderful company and excellent tours! Will do next year but with the whole family!!! Definitely highly recommended!

Great way to see BA!. We had a brilliant day biking around the beautiful city of Bunoes Aires on the Parks & Plazas tour with the lovely Stef.Stef did a great job as our guide, telling us lots of useful information about the places we visited, and always with a big smile on her face. We tried local things such as Mate, and enjoyed some delicious pizza at a recommended restaurant when we got a bit peckish, and finished the day with a treat of a cookie with dulce de leche.Even better, Stef followed-up with an email thanking us for our custom and a link to the photos taken by the photographer who joined us for some of our day.Thanks for a great day, Stef!

Excellent tour with enthusiastic guide. I only had one day in buenos aires and took the ultimate tour. Although the tour is 7 hours long, it passed by so quickly and is well structured and led. Will has been such an enthusiastic guide who went out of his way to tell about the city but also about Argentina in general ranging from history to cultural aspects as well as economics and politics. He told it in a way that was easy to listen, was open for questions and took interest in the people on the tour. Will filled the facts with interesting stories and balanced it well from biking and making a few stops. The lunch was good too and the bikes are In good shape. I also found the crew behind the scene very helpful, the email response time was very quick and there was a reminder email sent out the day before which was helpful too! Thanks a lot for the great day!

Excellent tour of Buenos Aires!. Biking around Buenos Aires is a great tour of the city. Will was the guide on the architecture tour. He did an excellent job guiding the group across Buenos Aires. The tour included eight stops that highlighted the history of Buenos Aires. I would highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires to anyone visiting the city. I enjoyed the architecture tour so much I went on the graffiti tour the next day!
Lovely people -great day. A very enjoyable tour, with very interesting talks. Great to see the city by bicycle and our guides Stef and Ray were superb. thank you Giles

So much fun! Great way to see BsAs!. I went on a tour with Biking BA with my family & had a blast! My sister-in-law was nervous and Robin, our guide, went out of his way to make her feel safe. We got to see great views, sights, and learn lots about the city. My dad left 2 weeks in Argentina and Brazil saying that the tour was the highlight of the trip! Thanks for the fun!!

Great way to see the city in a day!. We only had one day in Buenos Aires and what better way to see it then biking around. I must admit we came prepared to bike pretty hard (wearing our biking gear) not understanding what moderate biking really meant, wear normal clothes. Ben did a great job giving us the history and politics of a variety of areas in the city. We enjoyed a great local lunch! It really was a great day!

The ONLY way to tour Buenos Aires. Will was the quintessential guide for BR. This is the only way to appreciate the city. A delight and truly professional organization. It is not rigorous and is extremely educational and delightful!

Fun way to see a fun city. My husband and I took the Heart of the City tour with Angeles and Ben. It was a fantastic way to see the city and a good opportunity to meet some other travellers. The guides were great and gave us an excellent insight into Argentina's history and politics.Lunch was absolutely incredible and something we definitely wouldn't have stumbled upon ourselves.

Fun way to know the city.. BA is a flat city and a bike and a group is a more personable way to orientate yourself in the city than with a hop on bus for example. Angie was an excellent guide and Ben made sure we didn't get run over by taxis turning left. They were both really knowledgeable about all sorts of other things to do in BA and were only too happy to help. Lunch was amazing too!

Perfect first day to delve into life in Buenos Aires (on two wheels!). Many, many thanks to Ben and Andre for excellent guiding and keeping us safe on and off the streets of Buenos Aires.My wife and I did the full day tour - this was the perfect introduction and orientation to Buenos Aires and all its varied locales. Ben was extremely knowledgeable, affable, and really passionate about Buenos Aires (and its food - too right!). Andre made sure we were happy on the bikes and safe - thanks!The full day tour is from 10-5/6pm and covers (amongst other things!) Puerto Madero, Costanera Sur (great lunch of a bondiola or build your own sarnie here!), Boca (including el caminito), Recoleta, Retiro, and Centro. So much history and Ben was very able at bringing it to life.Well worth it, very interesting, and we were very thankful for the stunningly sunny crisp winter day we had.Thanks Biking BA!

Great way to see Buenos Aires on a short stay!. Found this tour to be highly valuable for my purpose. I only had a short stay in buenos aires so time was of the essence. I thought that no better way to see this massive city then by bike as you cover a lot of ground in 1 day. This tour goes for the whole day but it is worth doing. You get a great insight into the past and present politics and social issues experienced by the country. I learnt a lot from the guide Ray which made the tour very informative as well as fun.It was very cold when we did the tour so we were supplied with scarfs and gloves which was nice!Definitely give this a go in Buenos Aires!

Great tour. Informative and friendly guide and a great way to see the main sights of Buenos Aires. We did the heart of BA tour which took 5 hours and cost $60 usd. Cycling was easy - all on the flat and mainly in cycle lanes. Lots of stops and information along the way - a great way to get an overview of the city.

They think of everything!. I did a 'private' version of the Heart of the City tour with a 9:00 a.m. start time -- quite chilly since June = winter in Buenos Aires. But, no fear, Raymond my guide supplied me with a thick scarf and toasty gloves that - coupled with my polartec sweater and riding helmet -- kept me warm until the glorious sunshine illuminated all for us to see in beautiful B.A.It's a great way to see some of BA's fabulous places--I had a 12 hour layover at EZE-- so, this was an excellent way for an almost 60 yr old solo female (and not a fluent Spanish speaker) to be 'babysat' for 5+ hours AND tour around B.A. (the cycling is very easy++)The lunch spot was excellent - full of locals enjoying local delicacies -- my kind of joint!Highly recommend.

Great day out!. We did the 'Heart of the City' tour and had such a good day out doing it. As soon as we arrived our guides Stef and Angie were so friendly, and throughout the day they were really easy-going, funny and knowledgeable. We did the tour from 11am - 4pm, which was a good length as it enabled them to show us a lot of different parts of the city. The cycling was always easy and we always felt safe with the guides even on busy roads. They also take you down to the riverside for fantastic food at lunchtime! I would highly recommend taking the tour if you want to see the city and have fun at the same time.

south of the city tour - excellent!. I was lucky enough to get an accidental private tour - since I was the only one signed up for the day! It's nice that they still run it even if there is only one person. The day started a bit hapharzardly, i'd probably recommend they find a slightly bigger sign for the meeting point - since the spot they picked was in an unexpected location outside a parking garage! The tour itself was actually surprisingly informative - the bike is a great way to get around easily between the major sites, and at each stop there was an interesting story of argentina's and buenos aires history. We do go through caminito, although if you want to take your time and stroll the tourist shops, you'll have to come another day. We stopped for about 25 minutes but that probably isn't quite enough time if you are souvenir hunting. The tour takes you through the conservation area - which is quite a nice bike ride and finishes with an amazing argentinian asado lunch...get the bondiola! My guide was even good enough to lend me some pesos since I only had large denominations.

Heart of the City tour.. My daughter and I took the Heart of the City tour with Corine as our guide. Abslolutely loved it and found Corine to be the perfect guide. Learned so much about the city as well as some of the history of the country. Highly recommend if you enjoy biking cities.

Heart of the City tour!!. After our original graffitimundo tour was cancelled(due to a ill guide) we were offered The Heart of The City tour for free as compensation, we were sceptical at first but we're so glad we took up the offer! A great diverse tour covering plenty of the great sights. It was good to sit and have lunch amongst locals on their lunches! The tour guide Carina was passionate, informative and interesting! Also pointing out some cool places to visit along the way! Thanks for the day and were glad we dodged the afternoon hail storm!Ben & Tasha

Great biking tour!!!. We had a wonderful tour of BA today with Steph. We were met promptly at 10 AM and she guided us all thru Palermo and Recoleta. I highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires...it's such a great way to see the city.

Excellent tour. I decided to book this bike tour because I only had a few days in buenos aires. It was well worth the time and money since it was extremely informative and it was a great way to see the city. When I arrived, I was surprised to be the only participant, which was actually a good thing because I got a private tour! The guide, Corina, was very passionate about the city and her English was perfect. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to see the city while getting some mild exercise.

Sights, history and more. We only had one day in Buenos Aires and decided to combine seeing the sights and keeping fit by going on a bike tour. Having read some great reviews we chose Biking Buenos Aires. I went with my wife and we both had a great time. Our guide Will was very knowledgable but also had a real passion for history, which made his talks very interesting. We always felt very safe, as they provide an additional guide - Andre who was equally good. The lunch we stopped for was authentic and very good, all in all a really great day out

Buenos Aires biking tour. Hi,I booked this on Viator website - so I hope this is the same company.I had the most fantastic tour with guide Bernard. He was so knowledgeable and also great fun the four hours passed by in a blink. And I felt I'd learnt more in that time than I could have done in a week wandering Buenos Aires by myself. Highly recommended way to see the city. And do request for Bernard as your guide if you can.Emma

Perfect way to see Buenos Aires. Some friends from my Spanish school invited me to do the extreme tour and I must say that it was a great experience. Perhaps a bit to many hours for me since I was not physically prepared for the challenge.

Great way to explore the city!. Girls where wonderful, kept us safe on the busy roads and where so very friendly and always had smiles :-D I couldn't finish the tour because I had a flight to catch, the boys came and collected my bike when it was time for me to leave, so kind:-) The different parts of buenos aires we went to were awesome!! I only wish I did this tour in my first few days and not the last :-) Thanks BBA, if I'm back I will see this great crew again!Jess

Fantástico. Someone from vamos Spanish recommended the tour to me and we had a super time here. Our tour guide was Rob and he was everything you want. It was amazing to hear all of Rob's stories, cool facts and figures about BA and he was very accommodating for different physical needs. Not to mention he's funny and made the whole experience lots a fun. Recommend the tour whole heartedly.

Amazing tour, see everything!. Our tour was a full day with our guide Will, we saw all the main parts of Buenos Aires and we even saw some parts that weren't included on the list, Will was amazing, he knows everything there is to know about this city and it's rich history. The tour was a very easy ride, the bikes were super comfortable and they even provided us with water, a scarf and some gloves. The food was amazing and the conversation even better, what better way to spend the afternoon than feasting on Argentinian food and sharing a beer.If you want to do a tour and see everything in one day then I can highly recommend this one.

North of the city bike tour. I've never been on an organised tour before, I don't really like the idea of being 'herded' around a place but, not speaking any Spanish and having limited time, decided to research tours in Buenos Aires. I did the north of the city tour with Steff who was a warm, charming and informative host. Cycling is a great way to see BA, I thoroughly recommend it.Caroline

The Ultimate City Bicycle Tour. My friend and I did the all day tour which I highly recommend for getting a comprehensive look at the major tourist sites and a historical perspective. Our guide was a young, super enthusiastic guy who knew enough about the city to cover two days of cycling. Speaking of cycling, Buenos Aires is really flat and the bike lanes are great. I was never concerned about the traffic or my safety, though a little caution goes a long way riding a bike in any city. Oh and lunch in Puerto Madero from the food trucks - yummy! I highly recommend it!

Excellent fun and a great way to see Buenos Aires!. We did the Parks and Plaza tour with Stef. We were lucky the sun was shining, but I think it would have been excellent in any case. Stef was great company and very knowledgeable about so many aspects of the city - its history and so much more. It was one of the best tours I have ever been on. I can highly recommend it.

Awesome. Ben and Ray Ray made it easy!. A group of ten of us did the Ultimate Bike Tour which lasted all day. It was an amazing way to see the city. We felt safe and had two great guides in Ray Ray and Ben.I would strongly recommend.Chris

Just perfect. Someone at my Language School recommended this tour to me. Personally I don't really like bikes that much, but Buenos Aires is so beautiful, that I wanted to experience what it was like to bike here. They have different kind of tours. There is one that lasts about 8 hours. I took the Architectural one because it was shorter and I love the old buildings in BA. Some times I feel like I'm in Madrid or Paris. My guide Robin was very good explaining the history and the culture. I really enjoyed this tour.

The perfect way to discover Buenos Aires. Someone at my Spanish School recommended me Biking BA. I had to say that the experience was fantastic, this is a great way to see Palermo, Puerto Madero and La Boca. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Thank to Willy for been so nice and explaining the history of Buenos Aires to me. Super recommended tour in Buenos Aires!.

Great Experience, a very fun day!. I went on the 'Heart of the City' tour. I was lucky enough to be the only one on the tour that day so I had my own personal guide! Raymond was great, really friendly & knowledgeable about the places we went to. The bike was in great condition & easy to ride. I felt very safe the whole ride, most of the time you are using bike lanes. The lunch was very tasty & filling. Overall a great way to see some sights of BA!Thanks Raymond & BA Biking

A really great experience!. Had a great time doing the south city tour on Saturday. Our guides Ben and Angie kept us entertained, informed and safe throughout. You've heard the phrase 'a woman who can stop traffic' wait till you see Angie at work. Ben was really knowledgable and easy going and delivered the information in a way that made it clear he loves BA and has genuine passion for it's amazing history. Just get out there and do it, you'll learn loads and get some good exercise with good people.

Best way to begin our trip to BA!!!. We booked "The Heart Of The City" tour, our guide was Stef and she was fantastic!!! Her English was perfect and her knowledge about the city was wonderful!!! Neither my husband or myself have been on a bike for years, but that did not matter it was a very comfortable ride and very easy going!We did this trip on our first day in BA and sooo glad we did, it not only helped us get our bearings and see some of the must sees (La Boca especially) but it helped boost our confidence in a new city!! We will definitely be telling people coming to BA to jump on one of these tours!!!Muchas Gracias Stef & Biking BA

Want to see Buenos Aires in a day?. My boyfriend and I only had 1 day to tour Buenos Aires, and we decided to do the Ultimate City Tour. Best. Decision. Ever. Not only did we get to stretch our legs and flex our calves for an entire day (which was needed after consuming so much red meat and wine), we got to see the city in a way that no bus tour/taxi ride can offer. Our guides were truly amazing. They were funny and very knowledgable! I was nervous about biking in an unfamiliar city, but they made us felt extremely safe! We used bike lanes for about 80% of the ride. When we didn't, the guide in the back would bike up to the front and guide traffic around us. The city is very flat which made biking all day a breeze. Bikes themselves are in excellent shape. This is such an exciting way to experience BA. A must do for everyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Brilliant way to see the city. These guys are great, our guide was full of knowledge and energy taking time to answer lots of good questions from our group. The bikes were brand new and touring by bike felt a great and very safe I way to see this wonderful city. Thoroughly recommended.
Perfect way to see Buenos Aires. Our tour guide Estefania was awesome. She was extremely knowledgeable and has a very pleasant disposition. Definitely do the tour and request her as your guide.

A great way to see Buenos Aires. We did the Ultimate City Tour of Buenos Aires. Corrine was our guide and Lucas was there to make sure we all stayed together and made it through the traffic safely. Both guides were lovely, polite and enthusiastic. Corrine's french accent is very endearing and she is a passionate speaker. The bikes were safe and comfortable. We were given helmets and a bottle of water. The tour makes lots of stops and is mainly on bike paths. Any road riding was done so very safely. The tour covered lots of different areas: La Boca, San Telmo, Puerto Madeiro, Recoleta etc and makes an enjoyable stop for a very hearty lunch. We enjoyed this tour and would recommend it as a good way to see Buenos Aires and hear a bit about its history. You do not need to be fit to complete the ride as the pace is very easy going and the guides speak English very well (I believe Corrine speaks about 5 different languages) so you can rest assured you will have a great time.

Fantastic tour. I'm 45 years old, by no means fit & it has been a long time since I rode a bike. I chose to do the ultimate tour 7 hrs. It was fantastic, easy & fun day with lots of opportunities to take photos, corine the guide was great she explained things well, had passion & Made it interesting. Lunch was excellent. When visiting BA biking buenos aires is a must, you won't be disappointed...well done biking buenos aires :-)

Best way to see Buenos Aires!. We went on the full day tour with Biking BA and had an amazing experience! We were able to see so many of the sights while learning a great deal aobut the history of BA. The guides are great and knowledgeable, and do a fabulous job of keeping everyone together while navigating the streets on bike. Definitely recommend this amazing way to see BA!

Bike tour in Buenos Aires. We had a great bike tour of Buenos Aires with Biking Buenos Aires. It was just a half day trip, but it was really good. Our route was mostly along bike lanes and carried us from the city into the less busy areas near the river where we had lunch. We had 3 guides for our group of eight. They kept constant care of us, riding in the lead and as sweep in the rear. They held up traffic for us at intersections where there was no traffic light. They were very informative about the history of Buenos Aires. I learned much from them that I would otherwise never have learned. Great job, you guys!

Best way to see the sights in BA. Booked the full day tour and found it was one of the best activities in BA! A fun way to see the sights and learn more about both the local and national culture and history...without being overwhelmed. Good to do on first day or so as it definitely helps you get your bearings. Bikes are comfortable and lunch is good, very filling! Liked the tour so much that I did it twice after recommending to a friend on a return trip to BA. Both guides were equally as knowledgeable so I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this company again. Thanks for a good day out!

Highly recommend "Biking Buenos Aires". I own a tour co, New Horizon Tours and I brought 70 people to Buenos Aires in April 2014 and 40 of the group signed up for the 5 hr bkie excursion and we had 13 to14 people per day over 3 days. Everyone of the 40 had a great and enjoyable time. The guides were very professional and knowledgeable. This is a nice way to see some of the city. You can't go wrong.Marc PresidentNew Horizon Tours

Fun Day Biking BA!!. My friends and I did the Ultimate City Biking BA tour on our first day in BA. It was truly a fabolous experience and wonderful way to get aquainted with the city. Our guides (Corina & Ray Ray) were friendly and very knowledgable. They gave the perfect amount of history and facts about the city and country. I would highly recommend this for all (even those who arent "bikers") B.A isnt a hilly city and you ride at a slow pace with many breaks so even the longer 7hour tours are totally fine. This is a fun and easy way to see the city!!

Best way to see and appreciate the city. I did this tour over a year ago now - it seems crazy to be leaving the review so late. But I often talk about the tour with friends and recommend it to people going to BA, and only recently realised that I never reviewed it on here. My partner and I visited BA over the New Years Eve period and found the city to be very quiet. We were at a loss as to what to do or where to go. Thank goodness we found Biking Buenos Aires, it was the highlight of our trip and completely changed our initial opinion of the city! Our two guides were so enthusiastic and knowledgeable, and happy to answer/discuss all our questions. We were able to explore such a large area on the bikes, and it really helped to hear the history and context of the places we were seeing to understand the city of Buenos Aires. Would do this bike tour again in a heart beat and highly recommend it.

Great way to see and learn about Buenos Aires. This tour was recommended to us by a few other travellers who had told us that the guides on these tours were much better than the walking tour guides and that they had learnt lots more on the biking tour.I was quite nervous about doing this tour to be honest as I am not a confident road cyclist. Fortunately most of the cycling was on bike lanes and as we went on a Sunday there was far less traffic. It's also quite clever the way they do it as one guide will try and block the traffic while the other one leads the cyclists so I felt quite safe to be honest.We booked online with a promo code from their Facebook page.We did the ultimate tour and our guides were Onno and Will - who were both amazing. Onno did most of the talking and told us loads about the city, I felt like I learned lots and he had a really clear and loud voice so we could always here him above the traffic at any busy parts. Both guides were very knowledgeable about the city and answered our questions and also gave us some good recommendations at the end so it's definitely worth doing at the start of your stay in Buenos Aires if you can.Will was also the mechanic if something went wrong with the bikes. I had a problem with my bike so swapped bikes with Will so that he could cycle my first bike to the mechanic and get another one which he managed to do really quickly. It was really good that he was there! Lunch was a delicious and huge barbecued meat sandwich with loads of salad it was very tasty and filling - I didn't have to eat for the rest of the day!If you don't have a long time in the city especially, this is a really great way to learn and see lots.

Perfect way to see BA!. This was such a fun way to see a lot of the highlights in BA. Getting around by bike was a lot of fun, it was safe, and so much better than a tour bus! We went on the Heart of the City tour and our guide Onno was awesome - he gave us a lot of cool information and made it very fun and interesting. Definitely take this tour - you can knock out all of the things you need to see in BA in one day and then spend the rest of your time there eating and enjoying the night life!

Most enjoyable way to discover the city. I loved my 5-6 hour bicycle tour of San Telmo, La Boca, and Puerto Madero. The cruiser was a comfy ride and came with a basket, bottle of water, and helmet. Our guides, RayRay and Lucas were very knowledgeable of the history of BA and would stop on along the ride to tell us about the neighborhoods and sites. The ride included lunch and we shared mate. It was such a great day! Since I am on an extended trip to BA alone, it was great to meet the other tourists and get the tour in English!

Most Fun and Unique Bike Tour in Buenos Aires!!. "Caught in the Act" was one of the most enjoyable and unique tours I've ever taken. What a great way to bring the historical moments of Buenos Aires to life! Don't want to give anything away as the enjoyment comes from the colorful and unique experience of the tour itself. Just want to say if you're looking for a completely immersive way to learn about the history of Buenos Aires while enjoying a safe and comfortable bike ride, this is the tour for you!! Will definitely check out their other biking tours as the bikes were great and the team always made us feel safe on the roads which isn't the easiest thing to do in Buenos Aires! Special thanks to Jonathan for leading an amazing tour!

Good Bike Ride and overview of Buenos Aires. Great day. We took the Ultimate City Tour and it was a great overview of Buenos Aires. I would recommend taking the tour early in your visit. Our guide Emma is very knowledgeable about the city and history of Argentina. The pace was easy and there were frequent stops which provided the opportunity for stories and history about the city and Argentina. The lunch was at a local food stand and was delicious. The bikes were in good condition and easy to ride. The one recommendation I have is better use of hand signals to make it easier to follow the guide. The guide did not use any slowing or stopping signal and limited turning signals. Since our tour was on the Wednesday before the Easter holiday there was a lot of traffic and pedestrians so the signals would have made the tour a little easier

Best Part of the Trip. So I have been living in Buenos Aires for a year and got the opportunity to be a tourist again when I went on the Ultimate City Tour. BJ (or Bshay as the argentinians end up saying) was hands down the best guide ever...I learned more about the city I live in during one day then I have in the last 12 months. Hilarious stories, amazing history, and those fun facts that stick in your head to show off to your other friends during random trivia nights are just part of the flawless tour my group experienced. Even get to check out the Czar of Chorizo's you are going to get a kick out of the place. Anyway, thank you again Biking Buenos Aires, when I have the next set of visitors, I know where I am going first!

If you only have one day in Buenos Aires, this is the tour to take!. My husband and I took a private tour, Parks and Plazas, on a Wednesday that happened to be a holiday. It was the best day of our 3-week trip! Our guide, Estefania, made sure that we would take in as much as possible within my limitations (I am handicapped-one leg in a brace). We were provided with comfortable, sturdy city-bikes, drinking water, perfectly adjustable helmets and professional care, so that we enjoyed every minute along the wide Avenidas lined with gorgeous old trees, some still blooming in white and pink. We stopped at the foot of monuments, at the entrance to the Rosedal (the charmingly landscaped rose garden), at some smaller hidden plazas, near the University of BA, by a sculpture museum, and also for lunch in the open air, all the while listening to our guide Stef who is highly knowledgeable and multilingual, and gave us the perfect insight to this exciting capital city. Next time, we will surely try to do all the other tours BBA offers! We recommend you to check out their awesome website. You will get the best advice from this friendly and competent team of dynamic young people. Perks include mate and pastries or lunch, as well as the ultimate surprise: you might be lucky and find a neat gallery of photos you can download from Facebook or Twitter-a photographer will meet the tour at some point along the way and capture your thrilling bike tour for you. We can only dream about our next opportunity...thank you Stef and BBA for making this possible!

Don't Miss in Buenos Aires. What a great day! We did a full day tour. Emma was our guide and was awesome! We saw so many highlights of the city. We learned about the city and heard personal stories in ways that you can't read in a guide book. Great equipment, felt safe riding and perfect pace. Lunch was delicious with traditional Argentinian fare. One of our best days in BA! Thank you Emma, you made our day!

Great way to see Buenos Aires!. The Ultimate City Tour is a great way to see Buenos Aires. Our guide, Corine, was very enthusiastic and offered good history of the city. Most of the city tour is on bike lanes and we felt safe the entire day (helmet is included). Simple but delicious “street food” lunch is included. We would recommend booking on a weekend when there is less traffic. Highly recommend this tour!

The Only Way To See Buenos Aires. Bike tours are at the top of my must do list for any new city I visit! "Biking Buenos Aires" provided another great peek into another fabulous city! 1. Bike friendly city with bike lanes 2. Flat city - no big hills3. Great bikes in good condition4. Knowledgeable guides, English speaking5. Great lunch provided on our 7 hour tour6. Hit all of the city highlights7. Helmets and bike baskets provided

Tan, Exercise, and Learn about the City. This was a great introduction to Buenos Aires! You tour the city, learn about the history and culture, and have a wonderful day being outside while getting a little exercise in. As I'm a beginner biker (been on a bike less than 10 times) I was a bit nervous about doing the Ultimate City Tour but honestly by the end I wanted more and was sad it was over. Corina and Ray were great guides and kept us safe through the traffic. I recommend doing the tour on a weekend as the city clears out and you don't deal with so many cars or pedestrians. Corina was kind enough to ask how much history we wanted to learn and was very knowledgeable.

Definitely recommend. Will and Ray were great guides and very personable. I appreciated that the tour information was conversational and not a canned presentation. The other people in the group were also great, so it made for a nice afternoon. MY RECOMMENDATION, however... is that you take the Ultimate City Tour. We opted for the "Heart of the City" tour because we weren't sure if we would like it enough to be trapped on an all day thing, but if I had it to do over again, I would take the longer more extensive tour.

Enjoyed the ride but not as safe. I was actually quite impressed at the biking infrastructure in Buenos Aires. Overall, we enjoyed the tour as you get a fantastic view of the city from a different perspective. The only disappointing part was our main guide seemed to be in a rush throughout the tour. At one point she crossed the intersection as it was turning yellow, leaving the rest of the tour group behind (although a few tried to follow in unsafe conditions). To be fair, it is probably highly dependent on which tour guide you get. We have done bike tours in other large cities like Paris, Barcelona, Berlin, etc, and this felt the least safe. Otherwise, it was a fun tour overall.

BEST FIRST DAY IN A NEW CITY. We have done similar tours in other major cities and I am convinced that this is the best way to spend your first day in a new city. We arranged a private 5 hour tour with Luke and we would have done the 7 hours if we had time. They have a perfect tour route, great bike paths, and if you are worried about being on a bike all day---don't be. The city is pretty flat and the bikes are cruisers and there is no rush. Luke gave us a little history at each stop and lots of interesting tidbits. Lunch was fantastic street food...we could never find this place on your own!

Good way to see BA. Great guide.. We were very lucky to take a tour on a public holiday. The city was very quite and it was easy to get around.Emmanuel our guide was fantastic. Very easy to listen to and full official knowledge. Great day a great way to see most things.
Anno is a great guide!!. Great tour. Anno was our guide, he had great insight into BA. Wonderful lunch. This is the best was to see the city.

Surprisingly easy (and safe) way to see BA. Although after riding taxis in the city, I was apprehensive about getting on a bike in the city, but the Biking BA tour was easy and safe. Our guide, Ray, was very good about picking routes that were mostly off the main thoroughfares and on designated bike lanes. His guiding was very informative and he added good bits of local knowledge and historical facts. We took the five hour tour through La Boca, Puerto Madera, nature reserve and Plaza Mayo. Well worth the time spent.

Great guides, lots of interesting facts and nice ride. We did the southbound tour in a group of five people with the guides Stephan and Nathan. Stephen was very knowledgeable about the history of BA and told us alot of interesting facts. Both guides watched out for the traffic really well so that it was easy to cruise around as a group. The Mate in La Boca was nice to try and the lunch authentic. I loved the sweet surprise at the end! Great tour, you see a lot in one day!

Great info at a leisurely pace!. I did the 5 hr Heart of the City tour and it was an awesome start to my trip in BA! Will, our guide, was great, humorous and serious when the topic called for it but very easy-going. A lot of historical and cultural info shared to really gain perspective on BA without having facts just shotgunned at you. Good info but with a flexible, nonchalant delivery and the biking was at a leisurely pace. Served as a fun and education outline to my whole BA weekend--Loved it!

Can't agree with previous review, was on the same tour and thought it was excellent. The Biking Buenos Aires tour was very enjoyable and would like to thank Onno and Roberto for a very enjoyable day. They were very knowledgeable and brought us to all the major sights of this fantastic city. Group size was fine, common sense and a basic ability to cycle are all that is required. There was only one hill so no issues with getting around. Great lunch included in the tour and would happily record this activity to anyone in BA as it covers all the major spots in an interesting and informative way.

Underwhelming & overcrowded bike trip. I'm usually a big fan of biking tours and love to take them in every city that I visit, but the "Ultimate City" tour in Buenos Aires is a bit mediocre for a number of reasons, many of which are unfortunately out of the hands of the company. Our guide Onno was absolutely excellent and very knowledgeable about the city, so no complaints there, but here are the other issues that really dampened the experience: 1) Buenos Aires has some lovely bike lanes which you spend most of your time on during the tour, but unfortunately when you're on a regular street, you have to contend with aggressive and slightly crazy Argentine car drivers who will cut you off, ignore stop signs, and swipe absurdly close to you while making turns. This made the experience a bit more dangerous than bike tours usually are. 2) Our tour had 11 people plus Onno and the sweep. This was way too many people, as our group would often get cut off at intersections, be dangerously crowded on tight turns and narrow roads, and couldn't be flexible with our stops (i.e. often I'd see something cool I wanted to ask about or take a photo of but didn't feel comfortable slowing down everyone else in our large group in order to do so). Given the price tag of $90, which is somewhat hefty for a basic bike tour, we would have preferred to be in a smaller group. 6 people max would have been ideal. Many of the issues listed above and below would have been avoided. 3) I would absolutely NOT RECOMMEND this tour for beginner bikers. There were several other riders on my tour who were not confident or not very skilled at group riding - i.e. they would abuse their brakes, wobble on their handlebars, slow down when they needed to speed up, or crowd up in narrow areas instead of biking in line. This led to several near-accidents and collisions with me and my friends, so we ended up trying to bike as close to Onno as possible to be in front of the trouble riders. Ideally on a tour, you should be enjoying yourself and not trying to avoid other riders. Unless you really love biking, I'd say save your $90 bucks for another activity in Buenos Aires and do bike tours in other cities instead.

Fun in the Sun - College Gals Get to Know the City. During the first weeks of my time in Buenos Aires, I was overwhelmed by the size of the city and how much there is to do. A friend of mine recommended Biking Buenos Aires to me and it turned out to be one of my most memorable days here. The Ultimate City Tour, with the best guides ever Stephen and Ray-Ray, was an amazing way to get to know the layout of the city. It ended up being a beautiful day to bike around and explore the areas I had yet to see. I would recommend Biking BA to anyone planning on visiting the area or staying for an extended period of time. Biking BA was a great way to kick off my study abroad experience and I definitely plan on doing another tour before my time here ends. Oh, and the food was absolutely delish. Great for college kids, families, couples, everyone!

Truly the ultimate!. Spent a beautiful Saturday on a 7hr bike ride through the city with a great group lead by Will and Ray-Ray! Biking though BsAs is an experience on its own that you must try! Will and Ray-Ray give you true insight, helping you not only see the charm and beauty of this wonderful city, but also why it came to be the way it is today. Highly recommended!
What an awesome day!. A fabulous way to explore this amazing city. Will and "Ray Ray" were knowledgable, friendly and fun. Hats off to all!

viva la bici!. had an amazing time travel today with Biking Buenos Aires. if you wanna experience argentine history in a alternative way, i highly recommend the 'caught in the act' tour. this is how history should be delivered! thanks again! 6/5 points!

It rained too hard -- but I was impressed!. So you should know... I never actually got to do the "Ultimate" tour with Biking Buenos Aires. I started POURING rain before taking off and while we did a few blocks, the trip was called due to the weather conditions. I had been really excited about doing this and was quite disappointed that the weather played against us, but that definitely is not the company's fault. The reason I'm rating it so highly is the way that the company handled the situation. They were very professional and tried to accommodate another date. Unfortunately my travel plans weren't as flexible as they were. So what I can rate as "excellent" was the condition of the bikes, the introduction by the guides, the professionalism displayed by both the guides and the administration, and my deepest respect for keeping me safe. I guess they could have continued with the tour and made their money, but they felt that the weather may be putting me at risk if we continued. I respect that! I will definitely seek them out the next time I'm in BA.

Excellent tour, even better guide!. I had one full day in BA, so the ultimate city tour (7 hours) was perfect to hit every major site. Ben was an amazing guide - super professional but also really friendly and knowledgeable. He was prepared for everything, from tools to sunscreen to toilet paper (which you'll find out, is not always available at public restrooms). He's also totally willing to take pictures for you, so we got some good ones of ourselves. This tour is the only full day tour that I could find, and though it's a bit pricier than the other bike tours, it's worth every penny. And after a week in Argentina, I've found that tours run by ex-pats are FAR better in quality and service than ones run by locals. (Some of the local-run tours I booked were cancelled without notice, cut short, or had little to no concern for safety!) The bikes have baskets, so bring what you need in a small bag, and you won't have to carry anything. If you have a limited amount of time, this is an easy way to see everything and get a feel for the city and it's history. The ride was really easy - almost all of it was flat, with just one hill at Recoleta and the bridge. (You can walk your bike up if you're tired, it doesn't take very long). Thanks Ben! If I'd had more days, I might have taken one of the other tours.

Great day!. Thanks to Ben for a great day. Cycling around BA was a breeze with so much to see and at a pace that was comfortable for all of us, with enough stops for photos and to hear the history of the beautiful city. A full day, with a fab lunch included a great way to end our trip to S America. Certainly value for money.
The best way to see Buenos Aires!. Robin was a great tour guide and I had such a great time. Definitely recommend Biking in Buenos Aires!

Must do in Buenos Aires. Did the parks and plazas because we didn't have enough time for longer one... Highly recommend, great way to see the city, awesome ride on the most perfect summer afternoon in Buenos Aires.

A winner in flat Buenos Aires. We did the Ultimate tour and loved it. 7 hours on a bike does take its toll on your backside but not really on the legs (if you are moderately fit). There was one obese, unfit person on our tour that did not make it to the end but that was predictable at the start.The bicycles are well cared for and most have multiple gears, not that you really need it in a city with almost no hills. With a group of about 10 clients we had a knowledgeable, pleasant and helpful guide with 2 helpers that shepherded us through any tight spots. Buenos Aires has a large number of cycle lanes through the city making it a lot easier than battling through traffic, however, even in the odd occasions where we did mingle with the traffic we never felt unsafe.The tour included lunch at a sidewalk café that serves local food. The choices were limited (but delicious) and also included a vegetarian option.Even though this was not our first visit to Buenos Aires, the tour provided a fresh perspective of the city and we also gained new insight into the history of the region.

Parks tour. I got really lucky with this tour - I was the only one who signed up and got a private bike tour around the city. Katerina was amazing. She was very energetic, happy and incredibly knowledgeable about the city. In the first 5 minutes with her I learned more than the entire morning bus tour I did the same day. She remembers not only important historic dates, but also the stories and details that make learning about a city interesting. I especially enjoyed my matte lesson lakeside. Thank you again Katerina, good luck with your tango!

City Center Tour- a fine introduction to BA. Amanda and Ono were cheerful and knowledgable guides and even though I've lived here a year the "Heart of the City" tour introuduced me to places I might never have seen and information I might never have known. I want to return to those places and learn more about the city and the nation. A great way to start or expand on your BA experience, and traveling primarily thru bike lanes, as a group, and with a guide and "traffic warden" I always felt safe and the included lunch was fantastic.Now, I must sign up for the Architectural tour, and, maybe see the best of BA's graffiti on that gourmet bike hike?
