The only way. Took the ultimate tour! Seven hours pedaled by very quickly. Lots of stops to see the sights and to take pictures. Knowledgeable guide. Safe. The pace was perfect. Weather was perfect. Went on a Saturday so traffic was perfect too. Em was great guide and provided many insights into the rich and colorful history of this fine city.

Great bike tour!. My friends and I LOVED the 7 hour bike tour of Buenos Aires! It's such a huge city and this tour amazingly was able to hit all the places we really wanted to see and gave us interesting and informative background information. The biking wasn't challenging and is suitable for most levels. The traffic was daunting at times, but one of the guides would often block the streets for us while we crossed. We felt very safe. An absolutely fabulous day and such a cool way to learn more about the city. I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this tour! The tour was $90USD and totally worth every cent.

Couldn't Be Better. I took the Heart of the City tour and it could not have been better. From the start, the staff was so friendly and excited to share their view of the city with us. My tour only had three other people (plus the guide) which was perfect and our guide, Amanda, was so friendly and so eager to share all of her knowledge with us. This tour was better than any other tour I have ever been on and I am very tempted to return for more. I will be living in the city for a year and this was the best introduction to Buenos Aires I could have asked for. I highly recommend it!

Tour de Buen Aire. This was an outstanding way to explore the city and see things in a different way. We have been to BA many times and in fact we had already visited most of the areas we ended up biking in our "Heart of the City" tour. But in the enthusiastic and wonderful hands of our guide Corine, we saw sections of those areas we had not explored before and learned many fascinating details of BA's history and development.We booked our tour online in the morning and we were riding that afternoon. We ended up as the only riders so it was a private tour and so we were able to ask many questions and engage with Corine easily, although from our understanding larger groups fare just as well. I'm an experienced urban bike rider so had no trouble navigating the streets of BA but if you have modest biking skills and are modestly in shape there should be little trouble riding (much of the tours is on bike lanes, although like in NYC those lanes are sometimes blocked with people strolling in them or cars blocking them). Overall we had a great time and maybe in another visit we'll try the Palermo Biking Buenos Aires tour to explore another part of the city.

Best Biking!. We booked this tour day-of: very easy to do online with no hitches. When we arrived at the meeting place, our guide Corine was ready, welcoming, and helpful to get started. The tour got even better from there! We've been to BA several times, but saw it through new eyes on this tour- the biking was relaxing and enjoyable; the information interesting and informative. And Corine was the best! Knowledgeable and passionate about her job. Highly recommended: Biking Buenos Aires!

Great Start to 6 Months. I am studying here in Buenos Aires for 6 months at a local university, and decided to try the tour in my first week in order to get a feel for the city. It has shown me so many great places to explore in the future, and was well worth the time!

Perfect way to be acquainted with BA. We did Heart of the City tour with Corinna on Feb 15 in the afternoon, 5 hours was just enough for us. Corinna was an awesome leader and so knowledgable about the City and it's history, a beautiful person inside and out ! Stef was the coleader and she alwaysmade us feel safe and well cared for, such positive energy plus she is a Yerba mate master! We enjoyed all of those who shared our trip, wonderful people. This is an absolute must to do in BA.

Fantastic Fun. Our family of 4, boys 15&12 had a great time on the parks and plaza tour in early January with Emma. Despite the heatwave, the afternoon ride was very pleasant, and we saw lots of BA sights. Emma also treated us to a Mate local drink, fantastic & informative information on local cultures.

Excellent tour of architecture in BA!. A great way to see the sites. Our guides Emma and Mandy were excellent. Very knowledgeable and very personable. Saw many interesting buildings that we would have missed. Highly recommend!

Think twice about a 7 hour tour, especially in hot weather. I did the 7 hour tour, on a very hot day, and really regretted it. I certainly can't hold BBA responsible, but just something to think about.The tour itself was fine. Grab a blue bike, especially if you are tall like me. I'm 6 feet, and the bike was so uncomfortable. On top of that, the handle bars have these little dots on them, and making it very painful to grip.

Outstanding tour! Really Nice People. We been traveling in south america for over 3 months and I can say that this has been one of the most meaningful experiences we had in Buenos Aires. Jona (our guide) was a very interesting person and also very knowledgeable in all matters regarding Argentina's history and culture. WE have a great time and recommend this to to anyone looking to see Buenos Aries from the POV of a local.

perfect way to get to know the city and some history. We did the 7 hours tour and it was great! Our guides spoke several languages and were so motivated that it was really a pleasure to cycle with them! Thanks to all of them!

Wonderful way to get a feel for the different neighborhoods of Buenos Aires.. We signed up for a full day group tour and ended up with a private guide, as we were the only ones who signed up for that day. Ben was knowledgeable, interesting, fun, and quite accommodating. We appreciated his enthusiasm and easy-going personality. I would highly recommend this organization as a way to see the city, as they are very professional and client-oriented and it is a more intimate way to tour.

Best way to see BA in a day. We spent a month in BA and this was one of the best days we had. It's a great chance to learn some of the history, do some exercise and relax all at the same time. Will was always willing to answer any questions...in depth!He also sent a useful list of recommendations to us after the tour.

Hands down best way to see city highlights. I am so glad that my husband and I decided to do this tour!! It was a last minute add to our trip after we arrived to BA and were overwhelmed with how much there is to see in this amazing city. We were fortunate to be able to reserve the full day ultimate city tour the night beforehand. They limit the number of people to 10 to keep the tour more intimate. I really can't imagine a better way to see the highlights of the city. Our tour guide, Emma, shared so much history and insight with us throughout the day. The city is flat, so the ride is easy. You stop nearly every 10 minutes, and Emma always found a shaded spot to stop and share his stories with us to keep us out of the sun. Another guide rides in the back of the group to make sure everyone stays safe, though we felt safe much of the day anyway since the city has so many bike lanes. The bikes are good, but my husband got a flat tire, and Steven (the other super nice guide) simply switched bikes with him and went to quickly exchange the bike while we continued the tour...excellent customer service! They also keep you hydrated throughout the day and provide a good asado lunch. Highly recommend this bike tour!!

A fantastic way to see this huge city. As many others mention, the seven-hour tour is a wonderful way to get your bearings on the city and get a couple of must-sees out of the way (Caminito, Recoleta Cemetery, Plaza de Mayo), while burning enough calories to enjoy steak and gelato and wine with less guilt. BA is a surprisingly bikeable city, yet it's not perfect, so the way the tour is arranged with a "support guide" who acts like your bodyguard in traffic as well as the mechanic is a huge help. If you can arrange it for a weekend or holiday, when traffic is a lot lighter, so much the better. The price was pretty steep, but I felt we got our money's worth!

Massage. My wife and I booked a bike tour prior to our cruise that left out of the BA port. The bike tour was over the top. Robin was a great guide and my wife described it as a massage on wheels. It was very relaxing and a great way to see part of the city.

Fantastic Start to a Vacation. My girlfriend and I went to BA for a weeklong vacation and had booked the full day bike tour on our first day as a way to get an overview of the entire city. We had figured that we could make mental notes on the bike tour and then spend the rest of our trip visiting those places that we really wanted to see more of. Our tour guide was Will Epps, and I don't think we could have gotten luckier. Will is in a PhD program at the local university and is studying anthropology, which couldn't be more appropriate for his insights during the bike tour. I think he was able to share a lot about the history of Buenos Aires based on his studies. Furthermore, Will, being British, was able to provide some interesting perspectives on the history of BA.I would highly recommend that you do a bike tour if nothing else while visiting BA. I can honestly say that we saw and learned the most on that first day. Also, BA is pretty flat, so I wouldn't be scared away by 7 hours of bike riding. Our group was very small, as there was only two other people with us.

Best way to see buenos aires. We had a 1/2 day private tour of BA, a day of the hop on hop off bus, but the best way to see the city was the bike tour. Easy cycling, but a reasonable workout by the end of the day. I felt very safe on the bikes as did my wife. The bike lanes are good and the drivers respectful. Our guide (Kat) was superb! We did the 7 hour tour and a great lunch was included. $90 may seem expensive but truly money well spent.

Ultimate City Tour a 'must-do' in BA!. We did the Ultimate City Tour which took 7 hours. We had already walked extensively around BA but the cycling tour showed us SO MUCH more, about BA's extensive and colourful history. Our tour guide Ema (Emanuel) was Argentinian and extremely knowledgeable, his English was excellent and he (very) patiently answered all of our questions. We would recommend it very highly.

What an amazing way to see the city!. I did the full Ultimate City Tour yesterday and it was awesome! Ben was very personable and gave us just enough information about each place we visited but not too much so that I started to get bored. I learned about the lovely history of the city, different parts of town, and more. Biking around town is the best way to experience the town because you get to see the art, people watch different towns, and hear and smell the culture. We saw the main attractions around town. It was also a fun way to meet different people visiting too, as our group had about 8-10 people.

Awesome way to see BA!. We did the full day tour a couple weeks back with Ben and it was a fantastic experience. I can't imagine a better way to take in so many sights in Buenos Aires in a day. Ben was a great guide telling us all sorts of interesting information about the city. I would recommend this to anyone visiting BA who wants to get a great overview of the city while getting a bit of exercise! (but don't worry...not too much exericse, BA is really flat!)

What a day!! One of our best experiences in Bs As. We chose the 'Ultimate City Tour' and it was absolutely amazing! Our guide Jonah was so proffesional and so funny!! He led us around the city showing us so many places,neighborhoods, parks, markets, and many other spots and hidden gems. Our guide also shared with us his knowledge about the historical, political and social background to the different areas. He made this day so much fun and interesting. We had a delicious local and authetic lunch together and also got many Argentinian 'surprises' during the day :) I can truly say this was one of our best experiences in the city so far and I highly recommend this to anyone coming to Buenos Aires and want to explore the city on bikes!!Also very affordable prices and worth every penny!

Great Way to See Buenos Aires. Corine and Will were great guides leading us around BA and giving much info on history past and present. We took the 7 hour tour of the city. I would highly recommend it as a way to get a real feel for the city.

Great easy ride around BA. Buenos Aires is almost completely flat, which makes cycling an easy and great way to see the city. I did the Ultimate tour, which took about seven hours and took us right round the main areas of the city, stopping at various spots where our guide gave a background of the places we visited. The meeting point in San Telmo was a bit hard to find, though. Four people in the group that day so we had a cosy and easy ride around town. Bikes were well maintained and the guide was informative and fun. Apparently they take on a lot of foreigh students as guides so there's an eclectic bunch. All in all a great ride and the best way to see the city. Suitable for all ages and fitness levels.

Excellent way to see sights, gain history, and NOT be couped in a vehicle. We had one of the two founders: Robin, an expat from Colo. EXCELLENT. What a wonderful way to see the parks and monuments, avoid the traffic, be outside rather than in the back of a tour van, and gain an understanding of the rich history of BA. Robin showed us important sights, with just the right mix of riding and history. The ride was not difficult and was much more efficient and pleasant than taking a tour bus. We were a family of 5: my wife and I, and our two grown sons and daughter-in-law. BA seems to embrace the bike as transportation and bike lanes made us feel safe without competition from pedestrians or autos.Cannot recommend enough.

Great way to see the city. We did the full day private biking tour of BA with Robin. He was a great guide, very knowledgeable and personable. We enjoyed his insights and commentary on the city and its history. He was very responsive and attentive to our requests. Highly recommended!

BA by bike. A fantastic day with Jonathan and Ben(with Steven)We had a beautiful sunny day and Jonathan gave us a locals insight into the city providing some of the local fare and drinks.The parilla we stopped at yesterday was fantasticHighly recommended as a way to see the beautiful city of BA.
BA by Bike - Bueno!. Had a fantastic day with Jonathan and Will - we went all over BA and got a great personalized tour with lots of history and insight into the city and country. Highly recommend!

Really Great!. Was truly a great way to explore the city! About 60% was on bike paths and Robin and Stan were extremely knowledgeable and super easy going. We took the long tour (7 hours) and even though it was hot, there were plenty of opportunities to rest and explore so no real problems with the distance and time. Thanks guys and would do it again in a heartbeat!

Christmas Day with Ben and Robin. A very pleasant four hour tour of the parks and plazas of Buenos Aires with Ben and Robin. Attentive, safety conscious, knowledgeable and humorous, we could not have been in better hands. A couple of the sites along the way were closed due to Christmas, but this was made up for by the lack of traffic along the route. We booked online and paid on the day, Seamless. I highly recommend this company.

One of the best things I did in Buenos Aires. I hadn't ridden a bike in a few years and was wondering how I'd handle it, but my worries were completely unfounded. I did the Heart of the City tour and the majority of it was on bike paths. And the parts that weren't were fine because our guide, Robin, kept an eye on the traffic and ensured that we only rode where it was safe. Robin was extremely knowledgable about the city and its history and his enthusiasm for Buenos Aires really showed. I could not recommend this tour more highly.

No Better Way to See the City. We took the four hour Palermo/Recoletta tour and enjoyed every moment. We took it on a Friday after already having been in BA for a week, and I wish that we had taken it earlier on. We saw/learned so much that I only wanted to see more after we were finished! Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and pointed out all the major highlights of a truly beautiful part of the City. The fee is well-worth the cost, and in the grand scheme of things is relatively inexpensive. I would highly recommend.

Whirlwind way to see BA. My wife and I took the full North and South bike tour of BA on Nov 30. We took the metro to reach there at 10am. We met Jonathan and ?. They were very entertaining and gave us a good overview. It was a long day with 26 kms of biking around BA. We started at San Telmo and biked though Boca and saw the sights. Caminito was amazing with the colors. Jonathan and ? prepared delicious matte with sweet biscuits. We also tried dulce de lecle. It was delicious. Next we biked through the nature reserve to the back of the Rio Plata River. It was a very hot day and the chain fell off the bikes multiple times. We had lunch in a road side eatery and tried fernet with coke. I enjoyed it but most others didn't like it. We pushed on and saw the giant flower installation, recoleta cemetary and biked down to Plaza de mayo. It was a long day but we saw most of the sights and Jonathan and ? were very nice and helpful. I will give 5 stars for the guides but the bikes broke down 6 times for 10 people. I think they have to maintain or upgrade the bikes. So I am giving 4 stars overall. With better bikes, this will be the best way to see Buenos Aires in a day. One suggestion I will make is to skip the nature reserve on the hot days as it is a long bike drive that adds little to see.

Best way to see BA, fun and great guide. This is the best way to see key parts of the city while getting exercise and fighting off travel fatigue! Very informative, easy way way to get around and seeing parts of the city you otherwise might not see (such as the reserve). Thank you and highly recommend this.

Biking BA Graffitimundo and Heart of the City tours. Did the Graffitimundo tour, really cool art and guide (Johnno) was passionate and informative - didn't expect to have such a great afternoon. So impressed that booked the Heart of the City tour a couple of days later.

Great, fun way to see the city. Our guide Ben was fantastic and the service from the company was great. We were arriving on an overnight bus from Mendoza which was delayed and they waited for us for 10 mins no problem. We only had one day in BA and so we did the full day tour which was ideal. We saw all over the city and much more than we would have done had we attempted it on our own. Lunch was great, really filling and yummy. The bikes were in good condition (best we have seen in South America) and although it was 7 hours long we didn't feel that was too long. Great day and Ben was a fantastic guide. Highly recommended!

A Fun Morning….... I did the "Heart of the City Bike Tour" (south city) and Corina was our guide. Corina was lovely & a wonderful guide; she could not have been more accommodating and cheerful. You could tell she loved her job & Buenos Aires! I'm very active and love to exercise, but you don't need to be fit to do this tour. The majority of this tour is on flat streets and there are many stops. The bikes are fine and helmets are provided.They do provide water, but its not bottled so I didn't drink it. Its probably fine, but I've been drinking bottled water since I arrived in Buenos Aires and didn't want to take a chance.It was a good tour; got to see a lot of the city and got some exercise. I recommend this tour.Also, I contacted Biking Buenos Aires prior to getting arriving and during. They are very fast to respond and also helped cancel & change a tour due to rain when I arrived; with no problems. A great group of folks!

Pretty much the best tour I did in BA. I've lived in buenos aires for about 2 years, I work in tourism so I've done pretty much every tour BA has to offer but I had never been on a bike tour of the city, I'd figured I'd been here so long and done so many tours I'd just be covering old ground, but when 2 friends came out to visit me here I thought why not take them along and get everything done in one day. How wrong I was about seeing everything! This tour was FANTASTIC. Our guide, Jonathan, a local argentine with impeccable English and a quick sense of humor was an absolute legend. We were made to feel comfortable from the very beginning with introductions and light banter it set the tone for a really fun day. The tour itself is pretty comprehensive, starting in San telmo, heading down puerto madero and the biological reserve, through retiro and recoletta, our guide took us to all the hotspots and was incredibly knowledgable and friendly, in spite of there being artery difficult guest on our tour, his enthusiasm and approachability never faltered, a true professional. I saw things I hadn't seen before as well as covering ground I'd been too but it was impossible not to have a good timeI took the 7 hour bike tour and if you do I have a couple of tips. Take sun screen, even though they provide it, it's always great to have your own as when I went it was a scorcher! Lunch is provided as is water but I swear my liter bottle of apple juice saved my sugar levels! Lunch is provided and I recommend the bondiola, it was amazing!All in all one of the best tours I've ever done anywhere, thoroughly recommend these guys, you won't be disappointed!

Fun and Easy Way to see BA. I was in town for a conference and wanted to see the outside of a meeting room, so I booked their ultimate 7 hour tour.It was a fun and easy way to see lots of Buenos Aires. Bikes are (to me) a much better way to get a sense of a city than a bus or car. The guides were kind, knowledgeable and fun. They steered us carefully through traffic and then cycling was in no way arduous. Do it.

Great Way to spend first day. Corina was sweet and so informative. Don't hesitate to ask her to stop anywhere for a photo. We covered a lot of territory and did it with ease and safety. So many bike lanes made the ride pleasant. We learned a great deal of history and cultural nuggets. Thanks Biking BA!

Fate was with us-a great adventure. We arrived in San Telmo for what we thought was going to be an all-day tour, but due to a last minute emergency with a tour guide we were left guideless and tourless. HOWEVER, founder Will was very responsive when we called and gave us a menu of options-refund, half-day tour, or reschedule. We picked the half-day option, killed some time by walking around the San Telmo Sunday market (highly recommend) and were soon greeted by Will himself. Although Will could have been annoyed for having to give us a tour on his Sunday, he was quite the opposite. Genuinely apologetic for causing us any inconvenience, and thrilled to share his insight on a city he has truly fallen in love with. It was also great to hear about the history of the company. The tour was great in its own right. We got several history lessons on how the city was founded, the different barrios, biked though San Telmo, Boca, and Puerto Madero. Drank Mate, ate some of the largest sandwiches ever, and met some very cool people. I highly recommend any tour you have time for, and do do it at the beginning of your trip, as it allows you a good overview. Thanks again Will.

‘A great active and fun way to get an overall feel and orientation to BA. This is my first time to BA, and as a solo traveller I wanted to spend my 2 weeks really getting a feel for the city and the Porteno lifestyle.I thought a bicycle tour was a great, active, and fun idea to get an overall orientation to the city and its barrios, to see some of the landmarks and help plan my stay.Initially I was unsure whether 7 hours on a bike, fighting and dodging BA’s crazy traffic, was going to be a bit much.What I found was that the use of numerous bike paths throughout this remarkably flat city and the regular stops made 7 hours very manageable and relaxing.The meeting location was initially hard to find being a little obscure with no signage. I was welcomed by Kat the tour guide and introduced to the bikes and the 3 other group members, then encouraged to take them for a test ride up the street to ensure everyone was comfortable and make any adjustments to seat heights, tyre pressure etc. After a quick safety briefing and discussion on what to expect the group was off.Kat was warm, friendly, approachable and professional. She has a great knowledge of the city and its history, and guided us effortlessly through the numerous areas, streets and paths. At the regular stops along the way, I really enjoyed the entertaining and informative back stories behind some of the monuments, parks and points of interest.Overall highly recommended experience, and a true highlight of my trip.

A great way to see Buenos Aries. This is a great way to start your journey into the big city of BA. The 7 hour bike trip with lunch at a traditional food joint (yummy!!!) was totally worth the time and money we paid for it. We got to cover a lot of ground, stop at any place to take pictures we wanted (hey, you´ve got to give a tourist what he/she wants). Good biking paths and sights not to be missed. Will happily recommend this to all coming to BA for the first time and need to get their bearings on the city.

Really good day out with no hills to climb!. Really enjoyed our full day, seven hour, cycle ride around the city with informative and helpful guides. One thing to note that the saddles aren't the most comfortable especially if you are doing the full day tour as we did.

Amazing day 1 or 2 activity to do in new city!. fantastic sightseeing, great historical context as well as art/architecture, and tonnes of fun! surprisingly safe (doesn't seem like it at first in such a busy city). guide Ben (English) was great, lots of local tips also and can't rate this enough! Did the half day tour - just enough riding and sightseeing for one day.

Best way to see the city.. Emma and Peter took great care of us. We got to see all the highlights on a seven hour tour. Expect a sore butt, however, you will get a wonderful feel for the lay out of the city, a peek into the neighborhoods you ought to see and a chance to discover which areas deserve more time. We ended our trip with this and it was okay. I recommend starting with it but whenever you can get it in, take the opportunity.

great way to see city. Neither of us are big bikers, but had a wonderful time on this bike tour while in Buenos Aires. We had two guides, one from Belgium and the other from the UK. Both knew a lot about the history of the city, and were happy to answer our questions. We did the tour around the southern region of the city. Most of the time we were in protected bike lanes, so don`t worry too much about safety. The bikes were great and worked well.

Great way to spend the day!. My husband I did this tour and i recommend it for anyone to get there barings in the city and learn a little history. We did this on our 3rd day and we had already seen a lot of the sites on our own, it was nice to get some background history. The guides Emma and Peter were great, lunch was good at the canal. Again, was a really nice way to see so much and cover a lot of ground!

What a sandwich!. Oh sure, there was other great stuff... An explanation of the origin of Tango, a competition to guess the sex of the statue, a docklands redevelopment created to look like Liverpool (seriously), regular spot quizzes with candy prizes, mate, a 25km bike ride around Buenos Aires without a hill in sight, a significant history lesson, more mate, alfajores cookies, a lecture about the history of Boca Juniors football club, each of us being christened with a Porteno name, and an excellent guide (Jonathan) who clearly loves his city and gave us a fantastic introduction to it. But that really was an awesome sandwich that we had for lunch. Awesome.

cycling with a twist of history. as an avid cyclist I found this an easy decision along with the great reviews on trip advisor. The experience reflected the reviews. The tour started in San Telmo and went along most of the barrios in Buenos Aires along with the landmarks and reserves. The tour was in English so i was skeptical of the authenticity of it. However, the tour guide was a Porteno with a great command of the English knowledge. I was happy to have a Porteno as a guide, and Jonathan provided the authentic perspective of the history of the city with objectivity. He also provided humor and a family atmosphere for us, without sacrificing the seriousness that came with many of the historical topics covered. He also was conscience of any cultural differences that might cause awkwardness during the tour (sharing mate for example) and made sure we were comfortable. My only issue was that we didn't really ride through Palermo. Otherwise the tour covered alot and is made for all riding types. As an avid cyclist i prefer more mileage, but then the tour would be exclusive. you can bring anyone along and enjoy the tour. you get to see the greenway of the city and travel through places you would never reach on foot. It's a highly recommended tour. and the lunch, from a streetcart, is as authentic experience as you will find on a tour of the city. Thanks again Biking Buenos Aires.!!

Great Way to see Buenos Aires. We did this tour on our first full day in BA with a view to finding our way around the city and identifying places we would want to revisit. We did the full city tour and it did not disappoint. Our guides were Emmanuel and Luke and they were very informative and helpful. The bikes were easy to ride and although seven hours sounds a long time there was plenty of stops at specific points of interest. Note though that you will only have time to take photos and maybe grab a coffee, if you want to spend time in say Recoletta Cemetery you will need to come back. We stopped for lunch at a riverside Parrilla and the food was fantastic. A huge roll with a choice of beef pork or chicken (also a lovely vegetarian cheese option that my wife said was delicious), and salad and all the relishes under the sun to add to it. The highlight of the tour was the visit to Camanito so colourful and full of life. A great way to see BA and we thoroughly recommend Biking BA

Excellent way to see BA. I´ve lived in Buenos Aires for several years and did the Recoleta and Palermo tour with Biking BA and had a great time. The tour lasted around 4 hours and visited several parks and plazas in the northern part of the city. The guide was very friendly and happy to stop whenever clients wanted to. It was well paced and a nice way to get some physical activity, but nothing too difficult. I also enjoyed it because it made me realize what a good city for biking BA is, and I will definitely use my own bike more often now.

buenos aires graffiti tour: so much fun!. my band was in argentina recently, doing gigs as cultural ambassadors for the u.s. department of state. on an off-day, we went on a street art/graffiti bike tour around the city, and boy was it incredible! it was well planned, thorough, thoughtful, educational, and a real workout!will epps was very helpful and protective of our group of weak, un-athletic musicians, and made sure that we reached our destinations without being run over by argentinian cab drivers. the tour guide lady (i can't remember her name) was SO pleasant, so bubbly, so knowledgable, and such a sweetie. she knew so much and she passionately shared everything with us in a clear, concise manner. the tour was absolutely a terrific value for the price paid ($35) and i would (1) do it again and (2) recommend these guys to anyone looking for a really cool, unorthodox way to see the city!mark stepro, los angeles, CA

Excellent tour: healthy, funny and extremely interesting!. Kat has been a great guide: enthusiastic, always smiling and knowledgeable about a surprising number of facts, figures, histories and anecdotes. I'd definitely recommend her to any friend wishing to learn a lot about BA, and to see many different places in just few hours. We took the full city tour (7 hours) and we were lucky to be the only two that day, having basically a personal tour! The presence of a good number of bike lanes makes the tour safe and enjoyable, despite BA's traffic can be hectic at times. I felt that the balance between the 25 km covered and the number of things that we were able to see and experience was quite good and couldn't have been reached with public transport or by feet, especially when we explored a huge park, the riverside, pedestrian areas, etc.Bikes were in good conditions, helmets were provided, and safety was taken into account throughout the tour.

Best way to get to know the city. Awesome bike tour. I've been biking around many cities and i didnt expect Buenos Aires to be a very cycle friendly city. But it surprised me. Really enthusiastic and friendly guide who made us feel safe whilst teaching us a lot about the city and its culture. Would definitely recommend!

Highly recommended! :). It was my first time in Buenos Aires and I'm pretty sure that it was the best way to get to know the city. My choice was the Ultimate Tour, that lasts 7 hours. Firstly I thought it would be too much to ride a bike for the whole day, but we had many stops with a very kind guide, Ben, that told us manymanymany interesting things about Argentina history! The city, that is completely flat, is also perfect for riding a bike... It couldn't be better! VERYVERY worth it! If you are in Buenos Aires, or planning to go there, seriously!, do not miss it, guys!

An amazing intro to an incredible city!. My first impression of BA was a busy, huge, congested city. The thought of exploring BA on a bicycle was a bit intimidating! Fortunately, these impressions were erased after completing a bike tour with Biking Buenos Aires. Exploring the city by bike with an enthusiastic and very knowledgeable tour guide opened my eyes to the vibrant and fascinating city that I otherwise may have not appreciated. I spent 6 days in BA and my day biking through BA was the highlight. I recommend Bike BA to anyone!!

The ultimate best way to see Buenos Aires!. There is no better way to see buenos aires in one day. Arriving in the city after exploring the countryside, navigating the bustle of the city was overwhelming. But, after a day on two wheels with Biking Buenos Aires, I not only had a much better lay of the land but learned a lot about the amazing city's history and culture. Our guide Kat was one of the best guides I have ever had. She was very engaging, interesting and extremely friendly. The bikes were in fabulous shape and the tour takes you along very bike-friendly, safe pathways and streets to all the best spots. We did the tour on a pretty cold and overcast day but we kept warm from biking. it was a very enjoyable experience and would highly recommend to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!!

Worth every penny. We did the ultimate tour with these guys and it was great. we saw the entire city uoclose in one day. The guide emanuel was awesome, he was friendly, knowledgable and have great BA travel tips. I would 100% recommend this to all my friends on your first days in BA to better orient yourselves and enjoy your stay long or short.

The best city tour ever. I was a little afraid of doing this tour, once I don't exercise regularly.... But the 5-hour tour is amazing and there are so many stops along the way that you don't get tired at all! I'll definetely recommend this tour to everyone I know, because it's a must-do when you're in Buenos Aires! Our guide, Ben, was very nice to us and explained all important facts about the city - I believe we couldn't get a better guide for this trip! Thank you, Ben!I would just advise to be careful about lunch - the bondiola sandwich is quite heavy and I ended up with a food poisoning from it, which was pretty bad. Maybe a light sandwich can be a better alternative.

Great way to see the city. Our family of four were the only ones on the parks and plazas tour we did. Our guide was lovely, as was the ride and the picnic lunch in one of the parks. BA is all flat and the roads have cycle lanes separated from the vehicle lanes by a kerb so there's no problems cycling around even if you're not used to it. We stopped off to visit Recoleta cemetery to see Eva Peron's tomb.

Best way to see Buenos Aires. Really nice trip. The guide was very on top of everything. Started right on time, I have to say super professional on my opinion. I would love to do it again some time. Thank you Robin!.

Awesome way to see and learn about Buenos Aires. I just went with it. Like a book with a nice cover. Found Biking Buenos Aires ("BBA" henceforth) on the Interwebs. Had an awesome time, put simply. Our guide Ben was knowledgable and informed us of what we were seeing. He was considerate, fun, a great guide all-around. We saw a lot of the city and enjoyed the whole experience. Now I feel pretty comfortable with areas, history of those places, not that I'm an expert now. But I did learn a lot! And had a pleasant time doing so. I recommend BBA. Excellent time!

Great day with lovely guide!. Since I was only in Buenos Aires for a weekend, I really wanted a fun way to see the sites. Kat, the guide, was super super lovely, fun and very knowledgeable about everything you could want to know about BA. I did the 7-hour tour, which took in all the sites, and wasn't at all physically demanding, especially with the really delicious and enormous lunch. Would definitely recommend!

World class and simply delightful!!. We have done "not the typical tour" tours all over the world - from St Petersburg, Rome, Panama, Stockholm, Prague, Florence with our adopted sons and this was by far the best. Cat - our guide - is an absolute gem who kept our pace and customized our tour to fit our needs. Our sons are 13 and 16 and were engaged the entire time. By far our best day in Buenos Aires. I would recommend BBA folks to anyone/everyone. We made our reservation the night before and Robin was accommodating and helpful.Special note - we are a gay family and we and our sons were made very welcome.

We had a great time!. Thank you for taking us on this adventure, we had an excellent time biking buenos ires. Great guides who spoke English and small groups made it more personal. Many thanks. Gracias.

Brilliant way to see BA. My boyfriend and I had a lovely day with Emanuel taking us around the sights on the Ultimate City Tour. He was informative, professional and full of interesting facts. I would certainly recommend the tour as a great way to see Buenos Aires.

Learning, laughing, and loving Buenos Aires. By far the highlight of our stay in Buenos Aires. I read about Biking BA here on tripadvisor and I'm so glad I decided to book a tour. I was apprehensive at first because it seemed rather expensive ($90 USD for the full tour), but it was well worth the money. We spent the entire day with our guide, Jonathon, biking around the city and stopping at both famous and lesser known parts of the city. The tour was good, but I think our guide is what made the experience truly excellent. He kept us engaged and laughing the whole 7+ hour tour. My brother and I loved the tour and highly recommend it to anyone who will be in BA for a relatively short amount of time and wants to see different parts of the city. We'll definitely be coming back to BA soon!

Selected parts of BA on a bike. Friendly welcome by two expat staff (why are there so few locals doing tours ?) The 'Parks& Plazas' tour was ably led by Kat, a German wannabe tango dancer, who was charming and delightful if a little scripted in the delivery of the accompanying commentary. Plenty of rest stops and easy off road riding for the traffic anxious

Cycling thru town. A fun way to see the city though you ride through some congested streets. Our guide Jonathan was great. Funny, engaging and took the time to explain the backstory of where we went. The riding was good but never strenuous. I think there just aren't that many landmarks like there are in European capitals so there aren't that many WOW moments. And BA is a gritty, dirty but vibrant city.

"Loved it. Highly Recommended".. We did the graffitimundo tour with Biking Buenos Aires this afternoon and LOVED IT. This is a very relaxing and fun way to view some of the amazing street art that Buenos Aires has on offer whilst also getting to enjoy biking through the picturesque streets of Palermo at a nice relaxed pace. Our guide Kirsty was very knowledgeable and passionate about the street artists. It was fascinating to learn about their history and inspiration and also start to recognise their individual styles. Nathan and Ben from Biking BA were excellent too - very friendly, professional, attentive and relaxed. My friend and I debated whether to do this over going to the Sunday San Telmo Market but I am really pleased we choose this.

An Absolute Must for Buenos Aires. A friend highly recommended doing a bike tour when in BA, and we signed up with Biking BA after reading all of glowing reviews in Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. We did the Ultimate City Bike Tour which was a 7-hour tour through most of BA's neighborhoods. 7 hours might sound exhausting, but the pace of the tour was so easy going that no one felt exhausted at any point in time. Our tour guides were super friendly and informative and made the trip very enjoyable. I can't imagine a better way to see all of the major sights in BA. It's an absolute must for anyone visiting this city.

Great Day. This was the ideal way to see BA. We had tried walking the previous day but it wasn't so easy as the sights are quite spaced out. We arrived a little apprehensive as we had encountered the roads the day before but there really isn't anything to worry about as 95% of the trip is on cycle paths, We were led by a great local guide and there was good company from the other participants. Lunch was also surprisingly good and from the sort of place you would probably avoid in the UK. 7 hours went in a flash and we finished off in the local English pub. Memorable day!

Best tour in BA!. We did the graffiti bike tour, which is linked with graffitimundo.It was such a good day! Our guide was Melissa, who was amazing. She knew so much about the art, as well as about the artists themselves. Nathan also came with us. He was really good to talk to, looked after our bikes, and made us some mate to try. Both Melissa and Nathan were so nice, and I loved the laid back vibe if the tour. The cycling was easy, with heaps of stops, and plenty of time for photos and questions.Great way to see more of BA too. Thanks for an amazing day!
A W E S O M E. As an avid cyclist, it was SO great to get out into the city and ride. Just such a sense of freedom when you´re biking in the city. And made me feel more connected to Buenos Aires.

THE BEST way to see BA in one day!. My wife and I took the Ultimate city tour this past Saturday with Amanda and it was the highlight of our 4 day weekend in BA. Amanda was fantastic guide who we found to be very knowledgeable about the sights and history of BA. The pace of the tour was also great in that we felt we got to see everything but did not feel like we were stopping every 3 blocks....The equipment was very good and the lunch stop was fantastic... Get the Bondiola! If you are in BA and have only a few days you would be crazy not to spend one of the days doing this.... It also doesn't hurt to burn some calories with all the steak you will eat in BA! :-)

Great in site into graffiti art!. We did the Graffiti tour by bike which we thoroughly recommendThe bikes were in good conditions and our guide Melissa was absolutely amazing. She was very friendly and had a lot of enthusiasm and passion for the graffiti art and its history. She was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions with a smile!The tour was around 4 hours with a good mix of cycling and stopping - a fairly easy ride aroundIt really gave us a good insight into the history of the graffiti scene in Buenos Aires

Want to see AND understand the city? Book this!. This biking tour is more than worth your investment! In one day, Emma showed me around the city and all the places worth visiting (and you see a lot more thay your guidebook reccomends). Very efficient way to see the city in one day ;-) Staff is extremely well informed, knows a lot and gives you these kind of insights you would never get if you decide to walk around on your own, and... they speak perfect English. I've booked many tours while traveling and often I ended up disappointed because the 'guide' only provided transport and almost no interesting info. Definitely not the case with this guys. If visiting Buenos Aires, book this. It's fun and interesting at the same time. Consider booking the sunday tour; there's almost no traffic then, which makes it way more easy to look around while biking.

A great way to see BsAs. Much more than I expected. There were only 3 of us on the tour as 2 didn't turn up but we had 2 guides Amanda and Emma. Because we all spoke English the tour was on English. It was very informal but full of information. We had a great lunch at a Parilla and the whole event was very social. I didn't feel like I had cycled for 7 hours and 28 km - even next day !

The BEST way to see BA in a day!. From the moment we arrived Jonathan and Will made us feel comfortable and welcome! They were enthusiastic and knowledgable and made us feel safe throughout.The majority of the tour is on bike paths and you ride at a moderate pace (with lots of stops). We got to see and learn about most key sights and were given a local's insights!Lunch was delicious and plentiful. We would highly recommend the tour!Thanks again for a fantastic day!!!Tanya & Andrew

Excellent and fun introduction to Buenos Aires. After a long flight and a day of stressful client meetings, this was an excellent and unique way to unwind and also see some of the key attractions within Buenos Aires. I went on the Parks and Plazas tour and my only regret is that I did not sign up for the full day tour. Brett (our guide) was very friendly and displayed good historical knowledge of the sites that we visited. I enjoyed it so much that the 4 hours went by really fast and I didn't realize we already covered 17km!In case you're hesitant to try this because you are worried about safety, I was too, but it turns out that most of the tour is on designated bike trails. Not once did I feel there was anything dangerous about this. The bicycles are also in great condition. Each bike has a name so arrive early so that you can pick the bike with the name that you prefer.Overall this was excellent value and I'm glad that I chose it over a bus tour. You'll learn history, take some nice photos, hang out with a fun group of people, experience yerba mate the Argentinian way and also get some exercise.

A definate must do, fantastic experience. We stayed in Buenos Aires for 6 nights, the day after we arrived I booked this tour so that we would get some history and get our bearings. The weather was dull and drizzling when we set off. Our tour guide was Ameira and there were only 4 of us on the tour. Fantastic trip, we learned so much from her about the history of the city and had great fun along the way. The trip also includes an amazing lunch. Would highly recommend anyone going to BA to do this trip.

Just do it - and do it with Biking BA. OMG what a great experience. We booked the afternoon before. The website is easy to use and payment etc super easy to navigate. One of the best features is when you select the tour you want, it shows you how many people are already confirmed - with the two of us, it added up to five so we knew it was going to be a nice and small group. Either way, the maximum is 10 per tour and it will not let you book once this number is reached - great touch, as we've heard of other companies that say only X number of people are allowed but they turn up and the groups are much bigger and get pretty unwieldy. We did the Heart of the City tour and ended up with Amanda, an American guide. Well, this turned out to be the best stroke of luck as she is AMAZING! So knowledgeable (honestly, I don't know how she keeps all that info in her head) and just the perfect mix of professional and casual. She's friendly, charming and positive... and not at all over the top - just an all-round great personality. She gave us a really well-informed tour of the sites, which included the Caminito in La Boca (where we got to share mate just like Argentinians and learn all the etiquette that goes with it); the crazy Bombonera stadium (we loved Amanda's description of the highly rivalrous matches and the pre-match shenanigans); the nature reserve at Puerto Madero, the Plaza de Mayo and the Presidential Palace; and - my favourite - the haunting half-built memorial to hundreds of people held, tortured and murdered in detention during the 80s. Amanda's delivery was great - no over-dramatisation or anything - just matter-of-fact, to the point and so well-informed about that part of Argentina's history. She also gave us some great tips about the city, like going to the San Telmo markets on Av Defencia and that was the best day we had in BA.The bikes are well maintained and easy to get around on. Water is supplied, as is lunch. We had an amazing (and simply HUGE) bondiola sandwich at a super local parilla out on a kind of boardwalk area. This was one of my favourite parts as well - getting to sit around with locals and eat what they were eating. The great thing about this tour is that you get to go places that you wouldn't usually (either due to time constraints or whatever). For us, that area was Puerto Madero which we had no real interest in but were very happy to see as part of the tour. If we'd had more time in BA, we would have booked another tour for sure.

What a wonderful experience!. We had already spent a week exploring the northern parts of Buenos Aires (Palermo etc.) so we decided to do the Heart of the City tour to explore La Boca, San Telmo and Puerto Madero. What a great way to end our week in the city - Amanda, our guide, was knowledgeable, fun and great passion about Buenos Aires. We got so much more out of it than if we went on our own as she was able to provide important context and history to what we were seeing. Highly recommended!

A wonderful way to see Buenos Aires!. Seeing Buenos Aires by bicycle is truly amazing! My sister and I did the Heart of the City tour and biked to La Boca, Puerto Madura, the Ecological Reserve, and Plaza Mayo. Our guide Amanda was very friendly and knowledgeable about the city and the history of various landmarks. It is a great way to see different areas of the city and get exercise at the same time. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone - highly enjoyable!

Great way to get your bearings. Not normally a 'tour' person, I like to explore cities on my own agenda, but I chose to do a bike tour because I thought it would be a quick way of getting accustomed to the city and getting my bearings. Well worth it. We explored the costanera which I wouldn't normally have gone to, and a little around microcentro. I was worried initially about safety on Buenos Aire's roads but it was all totally safe, I never once felt afraid. Great fun and great guides. Highly recommend

Fantastic way to see B.A.. My 11 year old son and I first took the Parks and Plazas tour with Katy and we enjoyed it so much that a week later we took the Heart of the City tour with Anza. Perfect way to get to know the layout of the city and how to get most everywhere in the main part of the city by bike, utilizing the many paths and parkways. Both of our guides were excellent, enhancing the experience with their knowledge and enthusiasm, and the mate tea breaks added to the cultural experience. And the tours included meal breaks at great choripan and bondiola carts-delicious! Fresh air, exercise, food, great guides, and Buenos Aires: a perfect combination!

Best way to see BA. Take advantage of flat terrain and fantastic guides to experience BA from the comfort of your bike seat. Amira was charming, educational and a superb hostess. I highly recommend the 7 hour tour...which includes a leisurely lunch, ample walking at interesting sites. It is definitely fun and easy to do... for anything athletic ability.

Fabulous. Did the tour on my second day in BsAs, it was a great orientation to get myself familiarized with the streets and barrios in DT. Our tour guide the Finnish guy was very knowledgeable and helpful, it left me wanting more after a 7 hour ride (with breaks in between of course). I would most certainly recommend this to a BsAs first timer!

Brilliant way to see BA!. A great way to see Buenos Aires. Our guide Jonah was really informative and friendly. You learn so much about the history and parts of the city. We did the Heart of the city tour, one of the best parts of the tour was the lunch time sandwich which was included. Nice touch! Thanks.

Loved every minute of it. I am so glad I heard about this activity from other travelers and decided to sign up. A great way to see some of the highlights of the city. My tour fell on a holiday so the streets didn't have much traffic but much of the ride is on bike paths anyway. The guides (Amira and Ricky) were both a lot of fun and their love for the city was contagious. By far, my most enjoyable tour in Argentina. A great way to spend the day.

BEST introduction to Buenos Aires. This is a fantastic way to get oriented in the city, while riding around and learning about what you are seeing while you go. It is not a difficult ride, all age groups can do this. Guide Jonah is informative and easy to listen to. Many people miss the Ecologic Reserve, which is a nice break from the intensity of the city. Highly Recommended!

Great Way to See Buenos Aires. We did the full day (7 hour) tour on our first full day in Buenos Aires. We don't normally do tours, let alone full-day tours. But it was a perfect way to become familiar with the city.As it turns out, we were the only two people on our tour that day. So we had a private tour around the city. We made stops all throughout the city, plus lunch.You don't need to be a very good biker. In all, it's only about 20 miles (which isn't much over 7 hours). There are plenty of stops to walk around and explore sites. And Buenos Aires has lots of bike paths.

Great way to get your bearings. While honeymooning in BA we decided to do this tour. We did the parks and plazas and luckily enough, it was just the two of us with our guide Jorrit. We got a great feeling for the city and some great insider info from our guide. Because BA is very flat, you dont notice the 3 or 4 hours fly by as you whiz around BA soaking up the culture. Well recommended!!

“Best way to see and feel Buenos Aires”. “Best way to see and feel Buenos Aires”This tour is totally worth it! The fun tour provides great history of the city, not just things you find in guidebooks plus you get to bike on some of the bike city paths, through parks and neighborhoods like La Boca, the Caminito, Ecological Reserve, the Recoleta, Puerto Madero, Casa Rosada...even saw and took pictures of the famous metal flower among lots of other things and places. We had multiple stops for rests, to talk about history and local facts. Our guide Jonah was amazing, he was personable, I felt like we'd been friends for a long time. For sure this tour was one of the highlights of our trip to Argentina. I highly recommend this tour.

holiday hightlight. Everything about this bike tour was perfect. The guides were bright, experienced, helpful, watchful and fun. Great way to be introduced to BA. The lunch stop was just at the right place and time. The tour made you feel like a native as you swirled around the important sites in BA. The fact that we did the tour on a Sunday was a plus but I would encourage anyone to take the tour regardless of the day of the week. Well worth the minimum effort on comfortable bikes and much more intimate and enjoyable that a bus tour. Don't miss it.

Great way to see BA. Did the 'Ultimate' Tour with Amira on a Sunday - our first full day in BA. Great way to see the city - although 7 hours/15 miles sounds a long way it was split into a number of short legs with stops to take photo's and have a relaxing lunch, which was included, with no real hills so tour was relatively easy. Amira was a great guide and was very knowledgeable about BA and spoke excellent English. Took in all the main areas of the city and although the stops were generally short and sharp it was a good opportunity to get an insight into BA and pin point areas/attractions to spend more time at ones leisure during remainder of our short stay. Some of the route is on main roads but as it was Sunday was generally quiet - can imagine it being a lot busier during the week. Bikes were in good condition and comfortable ride. Chance to stop and share some Mate at the cemetery with time for a very brief visit. Just enough time to find Eva Peron’s family crypt and take some photo's and as it was later in the tour/afternoon was reasonably quiet. We returned the following day and couldn't get near due to the cruise ship tours - would have had about an hours wait to take a photo. Great day out albeit a little tiring - was fortunate that tour started/finished close to the Sunday Market on Defensa - so that rounded off the day nicely

awesome way to know Buenos Aires. we had a fantastic time, the guides are really knowledgeable and friendly. The experience was great! I would suggest doing this in your first days in Buenos AIres, because it gives you a great bearing and sense of direction which come in handy if you like to walk.

Amazing Day and Tour Guide. We took the "Ultimate City Tour' as a private tour with two other friends. Our Biking Buenos Aires guide was Jo and he was fabulous. We were initially a little reluctant to take the 7 hour tour but, even though we were tired at the end of the day, it was well worth the time and effort. The bikes were very comfortable and Jo was extremently careful for our safety during the times we had to ride with traffic (the tour was 60% bike trails). He always watched for us and made sure we got across streets and that cars stopped to let us all pass. Jo was very knowledgeable about the history, culture and politics of Buenos Aires and we all enjoyed listening to him. His English was impeccable. Sampling Yerba Mate was one of the highlights of the trip! We certainly wouldn't recommend this tour to someone who wasn't comfortable on a bicycle. But, we highly recommend it to any experienced riders who want a different way to learn about Buenos Aires.

Informative fun day out. Enjoyed a really fun, relaxed day out with Brett, Amyr and other fun loving cyclists. Leisurely tour of the city, informative with time to do what you like. Must be one of the best ways to get an introduction to the city. Bikes were in good shape and they really look after you. Reasonable sized groups and a great way to meet a few other holiday makers in BA. Can't recommend highly enough.

Amazing Tour and Guide. We had the pleasure of going on the Parks & Plaza tour with the enthusiastic and knowledgeable BJ as our tour guide. Even after living in BsAs for quite a few months, we learnt a great deal of interesting history/facts/culture that the city is steeped in. Beautiful way to see the best parts of this incredible city. 5 star tour with a 5 star company. Don't miss out!

Great Introduction To Buenos Aires On Bike From Friendly, Informative Guides. We did the "Ultimate City" tour, which includes lunch, in late January 2013. Our guide was Brett, a young American woman who was so nice and knowledgeable about the history of Buenos Aires. This is an easy bike tour, as B.A. isn't really very hilly, and it goes at an easy pace. We definitely had a better sense of the neighborhoods of B.A. after this tour, and I really enjoyed talking to our guide and the other people in our group. All in all, a really fun day, and a great intro to the lovely city of Buenos Aires. I recommend doing this on your first full day in B.A. if you've never been there, as you'll have a better understanding of where you want to spend your time on subsequent days.

Take this tour!. This is an amazing way to see Bs. As. I was initially skeptical about taking a seven hour bike tour, but found that the day flew by. Really enjoyed spending time with the other guests on our tour and found the tour guides to be fun, friendly and incredibly knowledgable. Buenos Aires is such a big city, and this allows you to see it in just one day. The owner of the company was also incredibly nice via email, and scheduling/asking questions was easy.

Best way to see the city!. Don't take a tour bus- get on a bike!BA have introduced great bike paths and the guys at biking BA are exceptional! Our guides were knowledgable, knew the area well and literally stopped traffic so we were safe at all times! We saw the whole city on the 7 hr trip. You may think that 7 hrs is a bit much but it goes so fast and really is an easy ride! We met great people and went out for dinner and drinks afterwards.The lunch is AMAZING! Best sandwich ever!

Great fun way to see BA. Read all the comments on trip advisor for biking in BA and we weren't disappointed! We did the full day tour with Amira our guide who was entertaining and well informed with the history of BA. Quite expensive at 90 US pp, but it was well worth the money. Easy flat ride with only a couple of very easy hills! Highly recommend this company to enjoy a fun filled day of culture!

awesome bike tour. This tour is a really fun way to see many interesting sites of downtown BA and learn a great deal about Argentina's history as well. Some of my favorite parts about the tour were the very little things, things which I would never have seen on my own, that actually had amazing stories behind them. The bicycles provided were in great shape (compared to most Argentina bikes) and the route of the tour stayed primarily on sidewalks and well maintained bike paths. The tour guides we had, named Jonah and Nathan, made the experience especially joyful and uniquely pleasurable. They were extremely knowledgeable and ridiculously affable! It almost felt like we'd been friends for months! I highly recommend taking this tour!!

Perfect BA Highlights Tour. My husband and I are only in BA for a couple of days. We took the Ultimate tour yesterday on our first day in BA and were impressed with the number of sites we got to see in a single day. Our guide, Amira, had a great understanding of the history of BA and Argentina, which made it much more interesting than touring on our own and relying on a guide book. She told us many stories that we would not have found in a guide book. We also really enjoyed getting to know the other people on our tour and we all went out forma beer afterwards. I would highly recommend this as a great way to see the city and many sites in a single day. A couple of our friends took a walking tour (including bus and subway), but they didn't see nearly as much of the city as we did.

Excellent way to learn about BA in a short period of time.. My wife and I only had a few days in buenos aires, and the bike tour helped us see and learn about the city. We went on Sunday when there was minimal traffic, and spent the entire day enjoying Buenos Aires. Our guide was Named Koi, and he taught us quite a bit about the history. I would recommend this tour to help you get acquainted with the city, and scout out neighborhoods that you want to spend more time in. Really enjoyable!!

A backpackers must do!. Our tour was mostly older folks or people travelling for a short time. I think most backpackers turn away due to the price. This is a huge mistake! If your only in B.A. a short while, this is the only way to get the best bang for your buck. Worth every penny.

The best way to see BA. Getting around BA is difficult - unless you're on a bike! The full day tour allowed us to see a huge part of the city and our guides were amazing. Lunch was authentic Argentinian fare and was delicious! Much of the tour was on designated bike paths but even the segments in traffic were made easy by the guides. The day was quite long, but there were enough breaks that this tour is suitable for even casual bike riders. Would definitely recommend!

Is there any other way?. I took the Ultra, 7 hour tour and after doing so, I couldn't imagine a any other way to see the city. Its seven hours, but you have plenty of stops along the way to rest and look around and take photos. The guides knew their info and the bikes were all in great shape. If you like the outdoors and being active then this is definitely the tour for you.

Just book it!. The best way to experience BA for sure!Jonah and Emyr were our guides, Jonah's knowledge of BA is exceptional, from past to present.We took the ultimate 7hr tour which covered 19 miles, with plenty stops and a lunch feast!Overall top experience which I would thoroughly recommend.Cheers guys

Really, really worth it!!!!. So, I booked this for my boyfriend and I to take a group tour despite a tiny bit of resistance from him on the idea of a guided tour when we could just rent bikes and see things ourselves. Totally worth it! The tour provides great history of the city,not just stuff you find in guidebooks plus you get to bike on some of the new bike paths, through parks and neighborhoods. Our guide (joe) was also fantastic. He was personable, had great knowledge and you can tell took everyone's safety seriously. This tour was one of the highlights of our two weeks in Uruguay/Argentina trip. I totally see why people take multiple tours with the company, highly, highly recommend!!

Awesome!. Did a graffiti biking tour that was so much fun! One of the highlights of our stay in Buenos Aires. Tour guide was super knowledgeable and felt super comfortable on bikes with the guys. Highly recommend!!! :)

Best way to see Buenos Aires. Amira was a great guide! With the new cycle tracks around the city, the biking was safe and comfortable. They also provided tail guides to make sure no one got left behind and to help with traffic at busy intersections. Bikes allowed us to cover more ground than would have been possible on foot, but still slow enough to really feel the neighborhoods. Plenty of stops to walk around and explore in detail. I can't think of a better way to get a great feel for this city.

Like Biking With Friends. We just returned from our South American vacation and had to write and tell everyone they MUST go biking with Koi, M and Marina (I am sure I spelled their names wrong). It was liking biking with friends but friends who majored in History! We booked the "Ultimate City Tour" which was a full day including a fabulous lunch at a local place. We toured La Boca, the Caminito, Ecological Reserve, the Recoleta, even saw the famed metal flower among lots of other things and places. We had multiple stops for rests, to buy snacks or just talk about history and local facts. They were very very safety minded and even stopped traffic for us to cross and rode on the outside guarding us from the busy intersections. I felt extremely safe with them. They were a lot of fun to be around as well. We talked laughed and swapped stories all day long. This was an unforgettable experience and really brought together the city for us. It would be nice to do this toward the beginning of a trip to get an overview of the city layout. Dress very comfortable with a cap and sunscreen on and come prepared to spend the day riding with friends even sharing "Mate" in the park! Book with this company-awesome!!
Jorrit rocks!. Really great way to explore Buenos Aires. Informative, some laughs, and lots and lots of fun. I highly recommend this easy, safe, and fun way to sightsee and learn about the city!

best way to know buenos aires. I've been in Buenos Aires three times, and this biking tour was by far the best way to really get to know the city. My wife and I did the full-day tour that covers all the city in ~7 hours, and were very pleased. The guides are very knowledgeable and do everything they can to make sure everybody is safe and enjoying the tour. we could never cover so much distance in one day by foot, and driving would surely not be as much fun. we aren't very used to biking, and were indeed a bit tired by the end of the day, but in any event I'm sure most people can handle this tour without any major problem.

Street Art in Buenos Aires. I took the Graffitimundo Tour on a Sunday morning, organised by Biking Buenos Aires in association with the non-profit group Graffitimundo. For four hours we cycled at an easy pace through neighbourhoods (mostly in Palermo) where street art, aka graffiti, was on view. The quality of the work was astounding--these are serious artists with serious convictions, and their work is more welcome in BsAs than it is in, say North America. Our guide, Melissa, was very knowledgeable about the artists, the modes of painting, and the culture of graffiti shared by Portenos and the artists who visit from other countries. You get to hang out at a hip bar dedicated to exhibitions of the work of various BsAs graffiti artists, too. Safe, relaxed, truly cultural: a great combination and more than worth the $35USD price for the tour.

Excellent History!. The Biking Buenos Aires guides are thoroughly versed in the history and culture of Argentina and Buenos Aires, from colonial days to the turmoil of the 80's and 90's.One of the common problems with bike tours is that the bikes are often not really that good - not so with Biking Buenos Aires! Their bikes are strudy, well maintained and suitable for riders of all levels.

Great way to see the city.. I did the 4 hour parks and plazas tour. It was a hot day and yet I was completely comfortable the entire trip. Even though I had been staying in the Palermo neighborhood for several days I hadn't had the chance to see the various parks the tour took us to. I honestly wish I would have done the 7 hour tour at the beginning of my trip to see a large part of BA with a guide in such a quick period of time.

A fantastic day!. Co-Owning SoSF Bike Tours in San Francisco I was very excited to get a chance to ride with Biking Buenos Aires on my vacation. From the owners to the guides this company is top-notch, a standout from the rest. The attention to detail and care that they have for the customer is evident in all of the contact that you receive. Brett was our guide for the day and she did a excellent job managing a group that included me constantly asking her questions. She loves her city and loves her job and you can not ask for anything better then this. This is the best way to explore and get to understand both the culture and history of Buenos Aires. I highly recommend that you book this tour as the first thing you do in the city. Thank you for being one of the highlights of my vacation.

No better way to see BA than on bike- Good for you and good for the environment. We booked ourselves for the 7-hour bike tour through BA. Although 7 hours sounds like a lot, it didn’t seem like it at all! We stopped a number of times along the way for photos and snacks, and each time we stopped, we also had a reasonable time to explore different places by ourselves. Our guides, Karri and Robin were extremely knowledgeable and filled us in on Argentinean history and culture, as well as the local economics and politics affecting the country. Riding through the various neighborhoods was an excellent way to see so much in so little time. Definitely a must do when you're in BA!

Ultimate City Tour - MUST do. I did this tour on one of my first days in Buenos Aires and cannot stop talking about it. The tour was one of the highlights of the 10 days I spent in the city. I'm only sad the rain kept me from heading out on tour number two. The website is correct, the city is much to big to be seen on foot and way too beautiful and interesting to see from a tour bus window. Brett's knowledge of city history and her willingness to give more recommendations of where else to visit/eat/party made my visit. Most of my traveling companions were jealous. The Saturday ride meant that there was a little less traffic which made for the few road-only routes less intimidating. Lunch from a roadside stand was incredibly delicious and satisfying & interaction with local residents added a fun flair. Bottom line: Make a reservation now. This is a can't miss experience in Buenos Aires.

Will, Yorrick, Brett, and Karri absolutely have the heart of the city in their presentations.. We took 3 different 4 hour tours around various historic and interesting areas of this amazing city. If we never were exposed to the facts and folklore we might have only thought of BA as just another big overpopulated city. The BBA crew and their infectious enthusiam and knowledge truly brought it to life. Forget the Hop On, Hop Off bus. Anyone would be remiss by not taking in these gems of information. Plus you get a little exercise to wear off all those great steaks ans Malbec. We loved you guys!! :-)

Wondeful way to get to know Buenos Aires. We thoroughly enjoyed our biking adventure in Buenos Aires. This is a great activity to do as a family, as every member of the family is entertained. We chose to ride on a Saturday morning since there is less traffic but the guides were so good, I don't think it would have mattered. They know the city well and were able to make us all feel safe. Riding through the various neighborhooods was an excellent way to see so much, so fast and it's great for the environment too! Besides an excellent tour with interesting commentary, there was an introduction to mate, the local tea drink, a stop for the local bondiola, a classic BA sandwich and of course the ubiquitous alfajores! Really wonderful day.

The best of Buenos Aires. My wife and I came to Buenos Aires to a long weekend. As it wasn't our first time we choosed different stuff for those days. We did the bike tou through the parks... It was terrific!!! Katie, our Canadian guide was really helpful and also gave us great tips about the city and local food!!!We were lucky, the weather was amazing and we did the 4 hours tour easily. We never imagined we could have so much fun in a bike tour and we also never imagined BsAs is so ready for that..We strongly recommend this tour

It's a real experience in Buenos Aires style!. We did the full day(7hr) biking tour and it was an awesome experience. We got to see pretty much all the highlights of this massive city. Joho and Em were our guides for the day and the knowledge they had about the city was great. Also, they were really careful and paid lot of attention to make sure we are safe in this high traffic city. Great local lunch and had a reasonable time to explore different places by ourselves. Also, it wasn't cycling for long continuos duration, joho and Em managed to break the tour to give us a relaxing time and also enough time to soak the BA atmosphere. We strongly recommend and good value for money!Valerie (Switzerland) & Jay ( Melbourne- Australia).

Fabulous way to see BA!!. What a wonderful day spent biking BA!! I can only recommend it as a must do activity. It was a refreshing to actually feel connected with a city as diverse as BA. At first I thought 7 hours was ridiculous but it flew by without even a moan from me!! I will be booking another experience with Biking Buenos Aires. Loved it!!!!

Ditto excellent way to see the city. Definitely a much quicker way to visit the attractions, and being on a bike makes it that much more special. Guides were informative and were actually very attentive to the safety of our little 'peloton' of some 12 people. Would definitely recommend this for all ages and physical levels.

Just do it.. This is a great way to see the city. Despite the congested city traffic, I felt comfortable in the bike lanes that are physically separated from the traffic lanes. Riding a bike in the city really lets you feel the pulse of the Buenos Aires. The afternoon tour to La Bocca (Heart of the City) was so much fun that we booked another half day trip the next day to the north side of town. The guides did a nice job. Even a flat tire did not slow us down for long.

An excellent way to see the city.. We did the full day tour with Karri.It was an awesome way to see the city. On a bike you are part of the city, not just an observer.I cannot recommend this tour highly enough.

Ultimate Tour Was More Than Expected. I like to take bike tours in every city that I visit so I looked up tours in Buenos Aires and couldn't be happier with what I found. Our guide, Brett, was very knowledgeable about the city, the route was full of BA's best, and the sandwich which was included in the tour was outstanding! A must do if you really feel like seeing the city and getting some exercise!

One of the best tours I've ever done.. I knew Buenos Aires was a big city with lots of different neighborhoods so I signed my boyfriend and I up for a 7 hour bike tour on our first full day there. It was AWESOME! Super fun and got to see so many different parts of the city including La Boca(Caminito, La Boca Stadium), Puerto Madero, Recoleta Cemetery, San NIcholas, Playa Mayo, San Telmo. So much all in one day and then we got to spend the rest of our trip going back to the places that interested us the most. Got a great feel for the city and it was super safe. There are bike lanes in most places that separate you with a curb from car traffic. The tour guides are also really great and super engaging. Lunch was good and for a long bike ride it was surprisingly doable for someone who does not normally ride bikes long distances. If you're in average shape, this tour is just fine. A must do when you visit!!!

The Ultimate City Tour. If you want to see the city in a truely unique way I highly suggest you take a tour with this company and in particular "The Ultimate City Tour".The Ultimate City Tour is 7 hour tour around BA which my partner and I absolutely loved!What I loved about this tour: 1) The guides were fantastic. They took us around the city, explained about history and local customs and in general were very friendly and open to questions. It was actually more like 4 friends on a bike ride together (with one knowing a tonne about BA- LOL) 2) There was an excellent lunch included in the tour. 3) Although it was 7 hours long it was not a strenous bike ride (its so flat here in BA). 4) We had enough breaks and time to explore a bit on our own. I highly reccommend this tour!

A def. must while in BA!. If you want to see the city in the most fantastic way I highly suggest you take a tour with this company. We were a group of three and our leader Brett lead us all over the city (in the rain which was even more awesome). We had lunch, (the best sandwich Ive ever had!) and afternoon mata. She was extremely informative and I learned so much local history during the tour. Excellent adventure, I highly recommend!

great tour. I took the 7 hour tour around BA and it was great!
