The guides, who were native English speakers, took us around the city, explained about history and local customs and in general were very friendly and open to questions. There was a really good lunch included in the tour, as well as a crash course in making yerba matte :) We had enough brakes and time to explore a bit on our own. I highly recommend this tour.

Great Buenos Aires ride. We just finished our ride with Robin and Karri. We were in a group of eight with two guides on a 7 hour tour through of BA. Karri was a very informative and a friendly guide, we visited most of the main attraction with plenty of stops to relax and hear Karri stories. Both guides took care that the ride goes as smooth as possible. The tour is highly recommended.

Great way to get an overview of BA. We had an amazing time doing the Heart of the City bike tour today. Our tour guide (Brett) was very friendly and answered all of our questions. She even gave us some local recommendations of places to check out while we were in town. We did the 5 hour tour which was just the perfect amount of time. We started at 9am (would recommend if you are doing the tour in the summer to avoid intense heat).The bikes were a little older but they served their purpose just fine. The ride itself was not too strenuous but did include some smaller city hills. Overall a great experience.

I wish we had done this first!. My husband and I have just returned from 12 days in Buenos Aires. I wish that we had chosen to do our bike tour of the city FIRST, because this tour provides a great overview of many different neighbourhoods. To my surprise, there are many streets in Buenos Aires that have bike lanes, and when bike lanes aren't available, our guide, "Karri" chose routes that were logical. I would endorse this group in a heartbeat. Karri was extremely knowledgeable about the history of the city, he was accommodating when he found out that we had already seen many of the attractions that were on the planned route for the day. That is, instead of seeing things that we had already visited, he changed the route to incorporate sites we hadn't yet seen. We had questions about some of the graffiti we saw, or sites that we had seen or had been looking for, and he had answers that made sense. I was particularly happy to visit one of the memorial sites for the Disappeared. Our bicycles were great - no maintenance problems, and helmets and water were provided. I loved the lunch on the boardwalk by the Ecological Reserve, and the many very contrasting neighbourhoods and areas we visited. It was a seven hour tour, and it went by quickly. The ritualized "sharing of Mate" in the late afternoon was a nice perq.

Best thing we did in BA!. We loved our tour guide, Koi. He (along with the other two guides we met with prior to our departure) were incredibly knowledgeable about the city. The company personnel are personable, kind, and friendly. Our 8-hour experience was by far the most rewarding and interesting activity we had experienced. Highly recommended!

Arts in Architec Tour. We participated at the Arts in Architec tour, a half day tour covering the main architrectural hot spots including the new harbour area, Puerto Madero. Our tour guide Karri (from Finland) was extremely knowledgable and a very nice person. Given the large distances in B.A. biking seems to be a good way to move around in the city. Since the tour was on sunday and during vacation traffic was smooth. We can highly recommend this tour.

AMAZING and well worth it!!. Karri and Joe did an amazing job at showing us the city of Buenos Aires. Starting off in San Telmo, we rode about 26km that day but made many stops along the way. It was in no way tiring or exhausting and as long as you know how to ride a bike, you will be fine. We got to experience riding along the road with traffic, crossing 15 lanes and it was all done in a safe manner, with Joe usually the one stopping all traffic to let us pass. Karri was also very informative with the history of places we stopped at, and allowed us free time to roam the cities and take lots of photos. My favourite was personally Boca with the colourful houses and bustling atmosphere.It was indeed a greay day out exploring the city and as we were short on time, doing the ultimate bike tour was a perfect way to see the many different cities of Buenos Aires. I highly recommend this company if you are looking to do a bike tour of some sort!

Beautiful city!!. I must say, this city is stunning. I've travel a lot for work, this is the first time that I've saw a city that looks like, Madrid, Rome and Paris together. Thanks to the people of biking Buenos Aires for showing me the spectacular city. I'm a fan of bike tours, and this was a remarkable one.

Excellent ride with knowledgeable guide. We were fortunate enough to have a private ride with Will, one of the company founders. Will took three of us out for 7 hours. Toured San Telmo, Boca, Eco park, Recoleta, cemetery, Plaza Mayo, squeezed in delicious meal on the way. Entertaining, informative, witty. Made Buenos Aires come alive and placed city, its architecture and people in appropriate historical perspective. . Highly recommend.

Riding around the city makes you feel alive!!. My wife and I had the pleasure of taking the full day biking city tour of Buenos Aires with Brett yesterday. There is just something about riding a bike for 8 hours that gets the blood moving.If you enjoy getting out and breathing some fresh air while seeing a new city, please, please, please take this tour.You will want to be a descent bike rider--there were some turns and some hills that you might find challenging if you are just learning to ride a bike on this tour. This and the sun/heat were the only down sides to the tour. Just remember to wear something that you don't mind sweating in completely and bring LOTS of sunscreen and you will have a wonderful day.

best way to see city and get some history. Took the afternoon south of the city tour. Easy ride. We did the ride on the first day in BA. The tour gave us a good overview of the city and its history so we knew what to explore on the following days. Definitely would recommend.

Most enjoyable day experience of South America. We found out about this through our hostel - Milhouse Hipo. Our tour was conducted by Diego who was an awesome guide. He had a great way of conveying information to the group in an engaging and insightful way - not too heavy on the deep history of BA, but provided some fun facts that were easy to remember. We did the South side tour on a Sunday which was a beautiful, warm day. We got to experience the modern day culture of BA and see and chill at parks where there were local people playing football, dancing to music and chilling with friends. I have traveled a bit around the world and this is by far the most enjoyable tour I've done.

Do it first. Signed up for the Ultimate Bike Tour in advance. Thought I'd do it as one of the first things on my trip as it would be the best way to see the city. I was right. In the 7+ hours of the tour we saw everything, had a delicious lunch and learned a lot about BA. There were plenty of breaks along the way and both our tour guides were easy going and helpful.

Excellent for a sunny day. I did the ultimate bike tour. BA is a perfect city for a bike tour since it is relatively flat and the attractions aren't just concentrated in one place. The bike tour allowed us to cover a lot of ground which would've been too exhausting if we had gone on foot. Despite the sun, the weather was terrific for biking around; probably not so much for walking tho. Our guides Koi and Robin were extremely knowledgeable. Highly recommended as an orientation to the city.

Roll On BA; Roll On. We road the ultimate bike tour. It was a great way to see a significant amount of the city in a day and not have to sit on a bus. The stops were well planned and our guide was very knowledgable, which made the tour very informative, interesting, and fun.

Awesome Architec-tour. The Biking Buenos Aires Architecture tour was honestly one of the best days of my trip. The afternoon tour was guided by Karri who not only gave me a great overview of Bs As architecture, but put all the buildings and different styles into the context of Bs As history and compared what we saw to the broader trends going on in architecture and design throughout the rest of the world.In addition to that... it was just really fun. Karri is a great tour guide. He's really friendly and energetic and the afternoon flew by.I'd highly recommend this tour to anyone interested in getting a great overview of Buenos Aires architecture.

Ultimate City Tour. I did the 7hr Ultimate City Tour and it was one of the best days of my trip. We saw all the major sites of Buenos Aires at a relaxed pace. Our guide was very knowledgeable and fun. Plus, it was a nice active day on bikes. I would definitely recommend this tour!

Best Day in Buenos Aires. We went on the all day cycling excursion and loved it. Not only did we see the city and get a super tour but it was safe and easy cycling. The outfit is tops and I would highly recommend that tour or a shorter one, if you don't cycle much. It's easy and much better than walking or busing around.Do it!!

Great tour of Buenos Aires!!. Did the Heart of the City tour with Brett and Jorrit and it was great! Lots of interesting info about the different areas and stopped when needed so we could take photos; it's definitely the best way to see BA! I was really impressed with the bike lanes too, it makes riding in such a big city a little less intimidating...although I personally think the section riding through the ecological reserve was the best part :) Overall, really fun and I would highly recommend this tour!

Amazing way to see Buenos Aires. Did the 7 hour full city tour with Karri. He was absolutely amazing! Very knowledgeable and entertaining. Definitely good for any level of biking - beginner to advanced. Very casual and take a lot of breaks for photos. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting the city. Booking was also a breeze! William was incredibly helpful with scheduling and payments. All in all a great company and a great tour!

We highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires!!!. My wife and I took a private tour with Javi as our guide. He was extremely knowledgable about the city and was able to answer all of our questions except for one. Less than an hour after the tour ended, Javi sent us a detailed email answering that remaining question, as well as recommending a few restaurants and other things to visit while in the city. I work in the development/construction industry so Javi made a point to discuss specifics about the architecture and design of the buildings we saw, which was really interesting.Biking is by far the most economical and efficient way to see the city in a relatively short amount of time. I was a bit nervous about riding a bike through Buenos Aires but our tour was on a Sunday so there was no traffic. Regardless, most of the tour was in marked bike lanes so, in hindsight, I would've felt safe biking on a weekday.I can't say enough good things about Javi and the company. We highly recommend it!!

Beautiful day in Polermo and Recoleta.. Brett took us on a great bike ride today of parks, palaces, and monuments. She made what I had thought would be a challenging ride look fairly easy. If you've never ridden in a big city before, the bike paths here make BA a good place to start.

Fantastic way to see Buenos Aires. I recently did the ultimate bike tour with Karri as my guide. It was very enjoyable day. Karri did a great job explaining all the sites while keeping us safe on the road. The thing I liked about this tour was we hit a lot of neighborhoods and sites in a short amount of time. If I had to do it again, I would also consider doing more than one tour on different days.

So glad we did this!. Cannot recommend Karri and Biking Buenos Aires enough. We did the 3-4 hour parks and plaza tour as this was a part of the city we hadn't seen yet. It was amazing to cover so much ground in a short time but even better were Karri's anecdotes and impressions of life in BA which meant so much more than the information you read in a guide book. Thanks as well for his yerba mate cocktail recipe!

I want to ride bycicle!. Taking the "ultimate 7-hours city tour", one would hardly find a spot in Buenos Aires which was not visited by us, during our bike ride. Starting off in San Telmo, travelling via Boca and Puerto Madero all the way to Recoleta, the micro centro and back to our origin, I can honestly say that even after living in Buenos Aires for more than half a year, I learned more then I would have ever guessed about all kinds of different sights throughout the city. Little anecdotes, small stories involving the individual history of different families who lived in Buenos Aires over the past centuries created the perfect mix between physical activity and outdoor classes of Argentine history. Most of all, the staff ig Biking Buenos Aires is highly recommendable. The tour guides, the founders, everybody follows the theme: The world is a better place, if you smile! Dont worry about the traffic in the concret jungle of Buenos Aires, these guys have got everything under control. If you dont do Biking Buenos Aires, you dont do Buenos Aires at all! Thanks for the day!

Ultimate City Tour - Best Way to See the Sights of Bs As. I highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires tours for anyone visiting the city! I traveled to Bs As alone and the first thing I booked for my first day there was the 7 hour bike tour of the city. It was a lot of fun and extremely informative. Karri, our guide, was very nice, fun, flexible, and accomodating. Not to mention knowledgable about the history of the city, current events and portenos! A great way to spend an afternoon in Bs As and meet some friendly people. The city is very flat so it is not hard riding and the bikes are very comfortable. Could not be happier with how I spent my first day in Bs As. Thanks again Karri and Biking Buenos Aires!

Really cool!. I took the Arts and Architecture tour led by Karry who made a big effort to explain the group more about the development of the city and its buildings! Biking through Buenos Aires is the best way to get around the city as the whole are is pretty flat!We rode on a Sunday which also helped making our day even more pleasant (we didn´t have to worry with the traffic).

Fun. We took the all city tour and it was fantastic. Even though it was a hot day, everybody did well and the riding was just fine. We were really surprised on the amount of bike lanes or separate spaces for the bikes to go on. Our guide (Karri) was =very knowledgeable and clearly had a ton of information which hew wanted to share. Overall a great experience.

Perfect intro to the huge city that is Buenos Aires. Easy going pace. A great balance of meditative riding, interesting historical/cultural factoids, exploration on foot, and conversation. The full-day tour takes you everywhere (except Palermo, which can be done separately). American guides (i.e. fully fluent in English), but they've been living in BA for years and really know the city.

Fabulous Tour - Great way to see city. Four of us went on the "Heart of the City" bike tour with 'Biking Buenos Aires'. It was a fun and informative way to see the city. Our guide, Havi, was so personable and knowledgeable. WE could not believe that he had just started giving the tours. Robin, one of the owners, was also on the tour and occasionally added additional information but for the most part, Havi had everything down!! You will be impressed with the company and there desire to make everything fun and easy going as well as to share any information they have on the city and what else to do. Don't miss this exceptional way to see the city and learn about it.

Best Way to See Buenos Aires. We went on the all day tour and had a great time. They stop every 10 minutes or so and talk about the place you are in so it never gets boring or tiring despite being an all day activity. Also, some of the places you go to see might take a whole afternoon to get to and tour by yourself, and it is nice to zip over on a bike and be able to do it in no time. The guides them self were very funny and engaging and answer all sorts of questions. Definitely do this.

Best memory in Buenos Aires... Simply a MUST!!. Biking Buenos Aires is by far one of our most fondest memories! Our tour guide made us feel like it wasn't just a tour but a glimpse of how beautiful Buenos Aires is. It almost felt like time stopped and for once you had a feeling of being " present"You can not get on a plane back home until you do this... Add it to your Bucket list people!!

Best day in Buenos Aires - Heart of the City Tour was a delight!. I could not have been more pleased with Biking Buenos Aires' Heart of the City Tour. It was the perfect length (approx. 4 hours) and was *the* way to see San Telmo, La Boca,and Puerto Madero. Our tour guide, Brett, was knowledgeable and fun as she confidently steered us around the busy streets of BA. Really enjoyed the trip through the ecological reserve (with a stop for matte - nice touch!) and the stop for lunch at Parilla Mi Sueno was delicious and authentic We saw things we would have been unlikely to catch on our own - like the pensive stop at the Club Atletico memorial and the drive-by of the Boca Juniors' stadium. It didn't hurt that the weather was fabulous. Did this toward the end of my visit to BA and felt it was the best day of the trip and a great way to cap off a truly excellent vacation in this fun city. Don't miss Biking Buenos Aires!

Loved this tour. My husband and I set up a private "Ultimate tour" with this company. We scheduled it for the first day after we arrived in the city. It was the perfect way to introduce us to BA and to learn about he culture, history and to get a feel for the city and its layout. Will (one of the owners) was our guide and he was fabulous. Even though 7 hours sounds a little long, we found that the time flew by and the ride was not in the least bit strenuous (we are both about 40 years old and in good shape). We highly recommend this company!

Great Orientation to Buenos Aires. My wife and I did a full day tour of Buenos Aires with Will, one of the owners of the company. Will is extremely knowledgeable about BA - and gave us some great insight into the city. Plus, he is a good guy and pleasant to spend the day with.We chose to do this tour on our first full day in the city - which turned out to be a great choice. The orientation was invaluable - and helped us plan our remaining days there. We also did it on a Sunday - which was nice as the traffic was less than when we rented bikes later in the week. The stop for street food was also great - something we might not have tried on our own.All in all, it was a great tour and we could not have had a better guide. We will recommend to all friends heading down to BA.

Best way to explore the city!. Biking Buenos Aires gave me the opportunity to explore the city in a different way. I have been living in Buenos Aires for almost a year now and decided to take this tour; I must say that I saw and learned things that I never did before. Our guide Brett was very knowledgeable with lots of fun facts about the city and its history. She was always aware of everyone in the tour and our safety. Even though, we spent several hours in the bike it wasn´t tiring at all, since we had many stops and the city is completely flat. This tour is an excellent option for people all ages. I highly recommended!!!

Terrific!. I am now a 100% advocate of bike tours! You are a wealth of knowledge and the most wonderful guide. I felt confident in your capable hands and could not have had a better one-day experience of BA.Really, without it I would have returned to the USA having seen the inside of a hotel, eaten at several good restaurants and having discovered a liking for Malbec wine. Now I can honestly say I returned home with a good feel of BA and the wonders of the city.

Biking Buenos Aires, the BEST way to see the city!. The Ultimate City Tour was the best way to see the city! Our guide Bill was fantastic! He is fluent in English and Spanish, and he taught us so much about the history and culture of this amazing place. Some friends did the tour a few days earlier with another guide, Karri, and they said he was wonderful too, so you really can't go wrong. We were here for work and only had one day to sightsee, so this was the perfect way to do it. If you only do one tour while in Buenos Aires, do yourself a favor and make it this one. Muchisimas Gracias por un dia fabuloso!

Good orientation to Buenos Aires. We enjoyed our half-day bicycle tour of Buenos Aires. Although it was keyed to art and architecture, its principal value for us was that we got a good orientation to some parts of the city -- around Plaza de Mayo, Puerto Madero, San Telmo, and others in the center. Our guide, Karri, was hospitable and knowledgeable and was attentive to traffic conditions. We do think it was advantageous to do the tour on a Sunday. Might be more challenging on a weekday.

Best Way to See the City!. My mom, sister and I did the Parks and Plaza tour and Hearts of the City tour and had a blast. The guides are knowledgable, kind and easy to get along with. BA is a fascinating city and bikes are the best way to see the city. The bikes are comfortable and the ride is not difficult for people who know how to ride a bike. The guides answered all our 'touristy' questions and provided excellent restaurant recommendations. Bottom line: do this tour!

The Best Way To See the City!. I took the Recoleta Parks tour with my study abroad agency and loved it so much I took my family on the Heart of the City tour when they came to visit. Both times, the tour guides were fun, informed, relaxed, and really made the tours enjoyable. On the Heart of the City tour it was just us and the tour guides and we had a really great personalized experience. Its definitely the only way to see buenos aires. I took the tour buses before and they are a waste of time and money!

Well worth the money. A great way to learn about Buenos Aires. We took the Heart of the City Tour. Our guide was Karri. It was raining but Karri provided us with rain ponchos and the option to stop any time we wanted to get out of the elements. Karri was enthusiastic and outgoing with a great sense of humor which made the trip even more fun. He was very knowledgeable about Buenos Aires and passionate about the culture. We learned some fascinating facts about the city's history. I wish we had more time to take the full city tour. I would do that if I ever get to come back. This was a great way to see parsvof the city close-up without fighting traffic or taking public transport. The isn't strenuous. I highly recommend this tour and this company.

Ultimate City Tour. My boyfriend and I took the "Ultimate City Tour" with BJ earlier this month. BJ was so accomodating and flexible after we missed our original scheduled tour (due to my scheduling mix up). Biking BA is the definitely the best way to see the city. It was so fun and relaxing to roll around BA on the brand-new cruiser bikes. We cycled for ~9 hours and we were not even tired. We covered so much of the city and so many attractions in one day that we were able to completely relax and take it easy the rest of our trip. Also we felt completely safe, we mostly cycled on bike paths, and helmets are provided. We also really enjoyed spending the day with BJ and the other cyclists on our tour. We all ended up hanging out later that night! Don't waste your time and energy walking, the ultimate city tour is a MUST DO in BA!

City Bike Tour. My partner and I decided to do a bike tour of the City whilst we were in Buenos Aires. Karri our guide was absolutely excellent. He spoke perfect English and was hugely knowledgeable about the City. The bikes were comfortable and easy to ride plus we were provided with helmets and refreshments throughout the day. Karri made sure that we were always safe when riding in heavy traffic areas. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour. It was a fun way to discover the city and by being on bike it enabled us to see a much larger area. I would highly recommend this trip to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

An Amazing Tour!!!. Oh my goodness, the Ultimate City tour was simply the best thing I ever did during my stay in BA! Will was an amazing tour guide, I saw SO much and I certainly learned more about the city then I expected. Biking around BA with the sun on your face and the wind in your hair is definitely the best way to immerse yourself in the city. Book a tour - you won't forget the experience, I certainly haven't!

Fantastic day out!. Booked last minute for my one day in BA, and glad I did. Superb tour guide Karri knew everything there was to know about everything - how can one man know so much! Amazing! Had a wonderful day cycling round, he was very careful and made sure I didn't have to worry about traffic etc.Great photo opportunities, and great hidden gems that really no other tour could manage. Learned so much about the history of BA, Argentina and South America.Lunch was provided at a local Parrilla. Wicked day out - don't wait, do it.(Can you tell, I've just got back from the tour and am excited that I didn't waste my day.) :)

Family Vacation in Buenos Aires, Great day biking!. We spent a beautiful days seeing the sights of Buenos Aires! Our leader Brett, was well informed and fun. Brett gave us rules of the road so We felt safe and cared about. The ride was not arduous but more of a cruise through the historic districts. Great Follow-up!Thanks for a great time.

An AMAZING tour! Take it!. I took the Ultimate City tour and everything about it was great. I had already been in the city for a month when I did it, and had seen some of the places (Recoleta, La Boca) but I still learned new things from the tour guide. Plus seeing how all the neighborhoods connected together was simply amazing. Fabulous tour guides, delicious food, perfectly paced, worth every penny!Can't recommend it highly enough!

El mejor metodo de conocer Buenos Aires. Nunca en mi vida tenia una oportunidad asi. Creo que este manera es mejor conocer una ciudad en vez de omnibus con audiofonos jejeje. Antes de la excursion no sabia como funciona en una ciudad tan purada. Pero la guia Karri es numero uno, el nos dio una experiencia inolvidable, sus presentaciones de cada lugar son muy informativo y el tenia control de sus clientes y por eso yo sentia super seguro en trafico. Les recomiendo Biking Buenos Aires a todos visitantes que pueden montar bici, porque es la unica experiencia asi en Buenos Aires. MUCHAS GRACIAS.Biking Buenos Aires ROCKS, They have well informed guides, good equipment, and tasty treats that make for getting to know Buenos Aires a real pleasure. Before the tour i was a little worried, I dont do much biking, I am a bit out of shape and the city seems full of traffic. BUT I came to find out that the city has no hills, plenty of ample biking lanes and a variety of parks and open spaces. Also the tour is available in English, Spanish and even Portuguese. Thanks for an unforgettable experience y'all I'll definitely be back again.

This is the best way to explore the city!. This is the best way to explore the city! Notice the differences in architecture, street art and people as you move from one neighborhood to another. BA is the best! A ride on the bike through the city in the summer is really worth the time!

Take this tour! Great way to see the city!. This was fantastic! Our guide Matt was extremely knowledgable and enthusiastic. I took there northern route tour through the parks, Palermo and Recoleta and it was perfect. Best way to see BsAs. Great price too! Ask for Matt Perse.

A MUST DO ACTIVITY IN BA. Buenos Aires is a big, beautiful and diverse city. It is too big to see it all on foot, and too diverse to be missed in a car, therefore, the best way to get the flavor of this city is by bike. I highly reccomend taking a Biking BA tour. These guys are really knowledgeable about the entire city and they take you through beautiful parks and/or low-key neighborhoods if you choose to do the Graffiti tour. What I found most impressive is how professional and safe they are. They only use top quality bikes and the guides are very client focused. You are sure to have a fun time if you go on this tour!! ENNJOY!

The best way to see Buenos Aires just do it. A group of 8 hungover guys met up with Brett and Robin for their bike tour of Buenos Aires. It is testament to the guides that they held our attention for the whole tour and stopped us all embarking on yet another red wine frenzy.Really fun and interesting we saw all of Buenos Aires's major sights and they took us for lunch at a place where genuine Portenos eat. Knowledge with a heavy dose of humour is a great delivery style and they ensured we were all perfectly safe on our bikes.Forget tour buses this is the way to see BA.

The absolute best way to see the city. My friends and I went on this tour with Brett and Robin on a sunny Monday morning and we had the best time. Both guides were fun and very knowledgeable and steered our group of 8 around this very interesting city showing us many interesting sites along the way. We had a great (included) lunch and lots of laughs throughout the tour with our friendly and knowledgable guides. Group feedback was amazing and one of one of the group said it was in is top 10 day's ever so that's an outstanding reccomendation. Would advise anyone visiting the city to take this tour as it is a great way to see the city and get some exercise at the same time. Thanks again Brett and Robin.

A PERFECT WAY TO TOUR THE CITY. We loved this tour! Due to scheduling limits on both ends, we broke our tour of the city into two days- which was great. Will was incredibly accommodating and flexible. Buenos Aires is a very bike-able city, and safer to do so then you would think with all the traffic. The lunch they take you to is great, and the lesson on their Mate ritual was fun. We would highly recommend this tour!

Muy exelente!. Sorry my spanish is not that good so I will leave this review in english. All I can say is WOW!! This was such a fun experience and added to our trip immensely. I really loved being able to cover a lot of ground and it really was a beautiful ride. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Heart of The City Tour. Hey guys,I wrote a review when I went on a tour last year but I figured I would write one again because it was such a great experience! I live in Buenos Aires but my Mom and her friend were in town visiting me so we allw ent on the tour together to better show them the city. They loved it and so did I! My mom has repeatedly told me that it was the highlight of her trip. I learned so many facts about Buenos Aires I now feel confident I can impress a girl with them! For instance, did you know that Puerta Madero is the only place in Buenos Aires that has streets named after women? Well this one pretty girl didn't know that and when I told her it she kissed me! On the lips!So in short if you want to have a great time, entertain guests or make members of the opposite sex attracted to you then you should go on a biking BA tour. On all seriousness they really are amazing.

One of the highlights of our trip to Buenos Aires. Informative, interesting and fun. Highly recommend seeing Buenos Aires this way. It's much easier to see the sites and understand the highlights of the city with the guides' information.

Fun, Educational, and Interesting!. My friends and I did the Heart of the City tour and Karri was our guide. He was so knowledgable about BA and the sites! The bike tour wasn't too strenuous, a perfect amount of time to take in all the important places, and a nice enjoyable lunch meal with your group was a great way to meet new people as well. Overall, best value for what you're gaining!

Fun, active way to experience Buenos Aires. I did the Parks and Plaza tour with Robin and the Heart of the City tour with Karri and both were great. Both guides were very knowledgeable about the city and happy to answer any questions. I highly recommend if you like being active and would rather not sit on a tour bus.

Fun, Great way to get acquainted with Buenos Aires". We had a great time on the Heart of the City Tours enjoying the fresh air, and all the fun facts and history our guide Brett shared along the way. Fun way to get acquainted with the various neighborhoods of the city and learn. Wish we would have had time to fit in the Parks tour on another day.

Wonderful Day. This tour was a highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. Our guide for the Parks and Plazas tour was Brett, a fun and knowledgable student from the US who has clearly come to love BA and knows the history and anecdotes of the sights and city, not to mention the best places to ride. We began on the City's many bikepaths -- and within 1 minute, put all of the rhetoric about BA not being "bike friendly" out of our minds. We biked the many paths and roads through central BA's parks and green spaces, stopping along the way to hear about the history and personalities we had read so much about. It was a safe, leisurely ride, and families with kids would love this. Brett seemed to command a certain "presence" in the streets....the frenetic, harried drivers really did come to a stop for our little group, some folks even waived -- we imagine that bike tours are something fairly novel in this part of the world. We were able to stop, share some mate together, go through the beautiful rose garden, and much more. We highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires for a really fun, healthy way to see the city (and burn off some of the steak you've been eating.) Hats off to this company who had a terrific idea and made it work. We will be back.

Best tour in town!. So we did several different tours and types of tours while we were in BA for a very short 5 day stay. This was our first tour and we did it the afternoon of our arrival from the US. It was excellent. It was just the right length and was the right combination of exercise and entertainment. Karri was our guide and did a wonderful job of showing us the best of BA and what we could do after our tour. Overall this is in THE BEST way to get an introduction to BA that we could imagine and turned out to be the best tour experience while we there. Terrific job guys! Keep up the good work.John and Val

Can´t recommend these guys Enough!. At the end of the day, a good tour comes down to the guides. These guys love their job and it shows. Their knowledge of the city and bike safety made for an awesome time, and so far everyone I´ve met that have joined these guys have had nothing but great things to say. A must do when coming through BA.

Biking Buenos Aires Is a Great Way to Explore the City. I did the Heart of the City Tour. It was a great route combining both some of the top sights plus some lesser-known areas such as the Ecological Reserve. Being on bike, we covered a lot of ground during the tour.Our guide was very knowledgeable, and I learned a lot about the city, including politics, culture, and history.The bikes were in good condition. We got helmets and full water bottles. There was some street riding, but it was mostly on bike paths. When not on the bike paths, the guide did a good job making sure we were comfortable and riding safely and even stopped traffic for us when necessary.Overally, a great experience and a professional company to choose.

Fun!. The biking tour was a fun way to get to know the city! Since we were only two, it became a private tour, so go during the weekdays. Included was lunch on a nice, little parrilla and the guide brought water bottles for us. The guide was amazing, he knew everything, without making it boring, and we were able to decide how long we wanted to be in one place. It was great!

Excellent way to see the city. This was a great way to see Buenos Aires. My husband and I were lucky enough to be the only people to book the whole day tour that Saturday, so we had the guide, Karri, all to ourselves. Karri was very knowledgable about Buenos Aires and answered our many questions honestly. We cycled all around the city, which gave us an excellent orientation of the city, as well as all of the insightful information. The process was very easy, I felt safe the entire time, the lunch stop was yummy. Highly recommended, particularly at the start of your trip to B.A as you get to know the city and work out where you would like to visit. (And dont be scared of the cycling - it wasn't hard.)

Best way to explore Buenos Aires!. My tour with Biking Buenos Aires was the best sightseeing trip I have ever done - and I travel a lot! I got a solo tour with two guides, as one of them was still "in training". I wasn't even charged the price for a solo tour, even though I was the only tourist who had signed up for that particular tour on the day. When I arrived in the morning it was raining heavily and I was given the choice to postpone and come back in the afternoon or even do another one the next day, which I found extremely nice - especially considering that they already had the bikes ready and it stopped raining just half an hour later.... Anyway, I came back in the afternoon and got my private little tour through Buenos Aires. The guys were very knowledgable and friendly. It felt more like a tour with friends rather than with tour guides. I never got the feeling that they rushed the tour or give me a poorer treatment, just because I was by myself. During breaks we even stayed a while and talked, even when I was finished taking my pictures which made for a very relaxing tour. I was able to ask them a lot of questions and they answered them all willingly. I got the feeling that they really care and are interested in the people they meet through the tours, as they even remembered a friend who had done a tour with them before and had recommended it to me. They also gave me suggestions for what to do and where to go after my tour. I can only recommend Biking Buenos Aires to anyone. Do it, if you can! Thanks a lot again, guys!

Excellent and enjoyable way to see the city and learn its history. I did a full day solo tour and would heartily recommend this to anyone. The tour guide was friendly and knowledgeable, and I could set the pace and stop for pictures whenever I wanted. It was a great day and great way to see a lot of the city. The riding was easy, mostly flat and in parks or on bike lanes on roads.

Why walk when you can ride a bike. This was a very good tour. Riding a bike through the parks and parts of BA was an easy way to cover a lot of ground in an afternoon. The bikes provided were comfortable and easy to ride. Our guide Karri had excellent knowledge and was full of energy.

BA on 2 wheels!. I have been to Buenos Aires before but I have never seen the city from this perspective. An exciting journey through the major sites of BA from San Telmo to La Boca to Puerto Madero to the Ecological Reserve and more, we had a great time! The guides were informative and pointed our major sites with background stories. I highly recommend this to first timers to Buenos Aires and to people who have been here many times because you will see things you have never seen before. Thank you Biking Buenos Aires!

Heart of the City Tour is a Definite Highlight. After a rocky and disasterous start to my visit to Buenos Aires, I decided to take a chance on the Biking Buenos Aires tour which I had seen recommended here on Tripadvisor. Payment is easy, straightforward, and safe as I paid via Paypal using a credit card for a discount. In return, I got use of a bike helmet, bike with basket and a water bottle.I selected the 3pm Heart of the City tour which left from the San Telmo neighborhood. It was a revelation seeing Buenos Aires by bike as the sounds, sights, smells of the city are more immediate. Our group of three visitors and two English speaking guides went to the neighborhoods of La Boca, the clean modernity of Puerto Madera and the natural splendor of the ecological reserve, Casa Rosada and Plaza de Mayo and then finishing up more than three hours later back in SanTelmo. The guides knew their history and were enthusiastic about sharing their knowledge of Buenos Aires. On our tour, I appreciated the opportunity to even try some Argentinian cuisine: a choripan sandwich at a parilla, some sips of mate, and an alfajor (a cookie made with dulce de leche and chocolate).Biking in Buenos Aires is a challenge. The dominance of cars, buses, and people can be overwhelming, but there is a guide leading and one following in the rear. They also took the initiative to even ensure our right of way is safe and clear by blocking cars from moving into our right of way. You should be in reasonable physical shape and confident on the bike as there can be some steep climbs in the park, and the roads are not necessarily evenly paved -- some roads are lined in cobblestones -- so be aware. There were opportunities for strolling some neighborhoods like La Boca and Plaza Durrego as well as checks by the guides to use washrooms. My one little criticism is that they should be more consistent in making sure that there is a guide at the end as it is intimidating to be the last one in the line and to have the shock of Buenos Aires traffic behind you.Buenos Aires can be a very intimidating city for the first time and solo visitor, and so seeing through this particular tour and in a group setting was an advantage. It's easy to sit back on a tour bus, but I think it's more rewarding to see a city using an approach that gives you ample opportunities to see the hidden and not so hidden histories of its city and its residents. To sit down with fellow travellers at a meal too was an unexpected delight.In an age where (rightly so) there is a growing awareness of the effects of mass tourism, this tour of Bicycling Buenos Aires offers an ecological step and social step in the right direction.

The Ultimate Tour Was The Perfect Way to See Buenos Aires. We're in the midst of a stay in Buenos Aires, calling the El Duque hotel in Palermo Soho home. Yesterday we walked around the areas surrounding our hotel and were mostly unimpressed with Buenos Aires. Today we took the Ultimate Tour and, wow, we now realize that even 4-5 hours of walking yesterday wasn't close to exposing us to a quarter of Buenos Aires. Our guide, a guy named Karri, was excellent. He has a great personality to be a tour guide - laughing all the time and very helpful. He was also very knowledgeable and exercised the right amount of caution when leading us through the city. It can be a tiny bit intimidating riding through a major city on a bicycle but it certainly wasn't *very* intimidating as the majority of the ride is in bike lanes, most of which are protected by a concrete "lip" that prevents cars/motorcycles from entering.Overall the experience was excellent, with a lot of variety, including many stops to learn about Buenos Aires. The biking was broken up by some walks, including Caminito (sp?) and through the mammoth cemetary.I can't imagine a much better bike tour of this city. About the only nitpick I have is that we were provided a sport water bottle that was pretty grungy. Maybe Biking Buenos Aires could provide a factory-sealed 1 Liter water instead (even if it means raising prices by a USD$1.

The best way to experience the city. A biking company not like any others. No rush, lovely lunch included from one of the charming parillas, and a clever guide. We were a very small group, so it ended up to be like a private tour, so go on a weekday! They also brought water.

Great Biking Tour in Buenos Aires. It was our thirth day in BA, but we want to see more about the city in a short time. A biking tour is the best option, because you can stop and take some pictures!Biking Buenos Aires is great because it's more then just a biking tour. They show us typical Argentina things; like drinking a Mate, eating a bondiola at a Parilla and tell us stories about San telmo,you have to know to understand the city.We already say thank to Robin with this video, but then you have an impression of the Heart of a city tour: http://youtu.be/rQOcp8J9PhM

One of my favorite parts of the trip. The bike ride we took went through the richest and most historical parts of Buenos Aires. Our tour guide was knowledgeable and friendly and answered all of our questions. Buenos Aires is fairly flat and the ride was easy even for a twenty year smoker. I left the ride wanting to do it over again

Do. Not. Miss.. I've lived in Buenos Aires for almost a year - and thought I knew the city inside out. Apparently not! The full-city bike tour not only let me see the city from a whole new - and really fun - perspective, but the friendly and knowledgable guides took us to amazing places I'd never been to before, and never even knew existed. (A beach in BA?? Hello!! An ex- torture centre beneath a highway? Blimey!) The lunch was delicious, the guides super-professional and easy-going and it was worth waking up early for! I did get a bit sunburnt, but I feel really fit after a full day of cycling. As an all-round get-to-know-the-city-quickly tour + a fun day out, I think this is the best tour in the city. And without getting all corny on you, I'd say the tour made me fall in love with the city all over again....

Excellent way to see the city. You get the most bang for your buck!. We had a terrifc time with Karri, our Finnish guide. He was really fun and knowledgeable as well as safe & cautious on the road. We were skeptical of how biking in this city would be, but we did the barrio norte parks & plazas tour and were either on sidewalks, parks, or bike lanes 95% of the time. It was a really nice day and we're so glad we did it. We now feel like we got to see so much more of BA than we could have expected otherwise. It's a must do in BA!

Totally worth it!!!. Fantastic tour! Guides were knowledgeable and super-friendly and obviously passionate about what they were doing.We did the full City Tour with a decent sized group of 12. I was very impressed with how well they managed a group of this size. They had three guides to nine guests and kept us safe and rounded up, without treating us like kids in a school yard. William gets the Golden Glove Crossing Guard Award for handling the traffic issue so well.Biking through the bio-reserve, the mate tasting and the amazing street food for lunch were the highlights, something we wouldn't have accidentally stumbled upon. Totally worth it!

Great time with Biking Buenos Aires. We first went on the Grafittimundo bike tour and had a great experience, so we went on the Heart of the City tour. I was hesitant to do any bike tours at first because of the traffic, but I'm so glad we did. There are bike lanes all over Buenos Aires so you are protected and the tour guides are very good about communicating with the drivers at intersections. This is a great way to see parts of the city that you may otherwise miss.

Best way to explore the city!. I went on Biking BA's 'Heart of the City' tour and really enjoyed myself! The tour covered several not-to-miss sites of the city and really gives a dynamic perspective of Buenos Aires - from the tango traditions in La Boca, memorial sites from the military dictatorship, the beautiful port, the breezy and refreshing ecological reserve and action-packed San Telmo. Rodrigo was a very knowledgeable and friendly tour guide and taught us a lot about the city's history and current culture. Spending the afternoon on a bike was so much fun, it really is the best way to explore the city. I would definitely recommend this tour for anyone who wants to see and learn about the city while enjoying an afternoon bike ride!

A great way to see the city .... I am not a good cyclist and had not been on a bike for many, many years. Nonetheless, against my own better judgement, I decided to take the biking tour and I had to say I had a lot of fun. It is a challenging way to tour the city, especially given the traffic, but the guys made it a very safe and enjoyable ride. A big thank you to the team for a great day and for never leaving me behind!
Great tour, highly recommend. We really enjoyed our Southern tour with Rodrigo, he's a very knowledgeable and fun host. Will was also very helpful with tips. Thanks guys, we had fun!

Great Start To A BA Holiday. We did the Parks & Plazas tour after reading reviews on Lonely Planet & TA. Very professional business run by knowledgeable & personable young Americans. We were hugely impressed by the local knowledge, professionalism & enthusiasm of our young guide originally from Colorado. Great value & a terrific introduction to this lovely city. Definitely recommended!

Sensational tour run by people passionate about Buenos Aires. I did the Complete City Tour which took about 7-8 hours. Our guide Rodrigo was AMAZING! It was a privilege to be shown around Buenos Aires by someone so passionate & knowledgable about his city. As well as gaining an appreciation about the history of Bs As & its people, Rodrigo answered our general questions about life in the city, politics etc. I learnt more on the tour than I did in the preceding week I'd spent in Bs As. I found the cycling easy & the pace was relaxed. The bikes enabled us to get to places a bit off the standard tourist track such as the Nature Reserve in Costanera Sur. I enjoyed Rodrigo sharing his city with us. As well as a lovely day on the bike it was also great to meet like minders travellers who I have already met up with again.

Great Experience. We had tried another bike tour and were a little disappointed so we searched trip advisor and found Biking BA. Brett and Karri were a delight, professional, knowledgable, enthusiastic and just plain fun to be with. They also gave us some great tips on restaurants and other activities. We enjoyed the South Tour so much that we immediately made a reservation for the Graffiti Tour.

Awesome way to see BA and learn about the city. My girlfriend and I were interested in getting some exercise while touring and learning about Buenos Aires. Biking Buenos Aires couldn´t have been a more perfect fit! We covered a lot of ground on the Northern City tour, visiting a variety of historical sites (Recoleta Cemetary was particularly awesome), parks, and neighborhoods. Our guide, Brett, did an amazing job of showing us around, keeping us safe, and providing a wealth of knowledge about the city and history, full of entertaining stories and anecdotes. We moved at a mellow pace, stopping for helado and some mate tea, which was a nice way to cap a gorgeous, fun-filled day. The guides at Biking BA were great for hooking us up with restaurant, nightclub, and transportation advice and they´re responsiveness online is also much appreciated. I can´t wait to do the graffiti tour next time I´m in BA.

DO THIS.. We rode with Will on the full city tour during the third day of our honeymoon. This is definitely the best way to get your bearings in the city and learn all of the insider tips from the coolest ex-pats in town. Our private maté tasting in the ecological preserve down by the river is something we will always remember. Even after it started raining, we still had a blast traversing the city streets. This company is the best.

Great Gringo tour round BA!. If you have time, definitely check out one of the tours with BikeBuenosAires.com. I went on the North tour yesterday in the blazing sunshine with the cool Colorado chick; Brett. The tour was easy to book, quick email confirmation from Robin, and you can pay online and save 10%.The tour itself is great fun, it lasted for about 4/5 hours and we visited all the major sites in Palermo and Recoleta, including some stunning parks. There's plenty of time to wonder around the main sites and take pictures. The bikes are comfy, they give you a bottle of water, they're in good condition and they have basket on the front to put your belongs in. Once you've finished the tour, they send you a feedback questionnaire and ask your thoughts on how they can improve it - great idea.

Passionate expats who respect and love BA like it's there own!. Went on an amazing graffiti tour of BA which is something the founders of this bike tour company have started. They've located incrediably passionate art company 'graffiti mundo' and both have teamed up to do this tour. It's a credit to Biking BA locating a truly genuine organization to teM up with and show off BA in it's artistic glory! Sounds like they hVe more exciting projects on the go soon as well!Hoping to go on another tour tomorrow. Just book in! You won't be disppoainted!

Absolute must do....seeing the sites is a bonus.. I enjoyed the city tour so much that I signed up for the graffitti tour the very next day. Not only do these guys really look after you but they give you an excellent history/art lesson for each tour. I saw more than I could cover in a week's walking and it felt amazing to be riding a bike in such a busy city and feel so safe. A top recommendation for Buenos Aires. Cheers guys!

A lovely day in BA.. We took the Complete City tour, hoping it would give us a good introduction to BA's many barrios (neighbourhoods), so that we could go back and explore them more over the coming weeks. We were not disappointed. Robin, William and Brett took excellent care of us as we navigated the streets, each taking time to share their own particular passions for the city. The stops were a nice mix of famous sights and hidden gems. We appreciated being given time to get off the bikes and walk around places like the Recoleta Cemetary. Some of my favourite moments of the day were the little touches, like hearing about mate culture (and getting to try it out) while in the Ecological Reserve. I'm also glad that I brought an appetite - at lunch (included in the price) I tried a Bondiola, a beef sandwich as long as my arm to which I added my choice of fixins and sauces. Yummy. All told, a fantastic day, aided by warm spring weather. Thanks BikingBA!

This place ROCKS!. Not only is Buenos Aires one of the best cities to ride a bike around on, but Biking Buenos Aires is definitely the best tour company. Our guide, Robin, was extremely knowledgable about a variety of subjects, he answered all of our questions thoroughly, and because he has been in BA for quite some time, he was able to inform us about the stuff that 'only locals know'. We were skeptical at first about riding on the streets, but drivers are surprisingly considerate to bikers and the traffic is impressively organized when compared to other large cities. We saw all the best sites, would love to do another tour, and plan to take advantage of everything Biking Buenos Aires has to offer. My friend even got a free t-shirt! What more could you ask for?!

An informative journey of grunge, colour, style, hope and collaboration. This is a great afternoon's cycling through some of Buenos Aires' quietest streets, shepherded by knowledgeable, engaging and enthusiastic guides as you explore BA's exploding street art scene. This is like no other - it has come out in the open, engaged fully with the neighborhoods and communities it works within, and is on a scale and of a quality that may well amaze you. It's a story of artists who value collaboration and who have wanted to give to the city. This is likely the highlight of our several weeks in Buenos Aires.
Access Buenos Aires Street Art by Bike. Had a great afternoon. Easy cycling. Got to see "the real deal" away from tourist traps. Guides friendly and knowledgable. A great insight into the scene here.

Great way to see the city. After spending a few months in Buenos Aires, I thought I had seen most of the attractions, so when a friend came to visit, I decided to try out something new -- the bike tour. I chose the South tour, since I spend more time in Palermo/Recoleta/Belgrano, and I was blown away by how much of the city I had been missing out on. The South tour takes you through some seedier parts of the city, but allows you to feel comfortable with the protection of a bike and a guide. It also tours the lovely Puerto Madero and gives you a taste of the ecological reserve. Even though drivers in Buenos Aires can be terrifyingly aggressive, I never felt nervous on the bike tour -- you mostly stick to bike paths and a few side streets. Our guide, Rodrigo, was also great -- he was very knowledgeable about the city and attentive to our needs (water, gloves, etc.). I would absolutely recommend Buenos Aires Biking to anyone visiting the city!

Don't Leave Buenos Aires Without Taking Their Tour!. Biking Buenos Aires' 15-mile (5 - 6 hour) bike tour was the best part of my trip. After spending a week roaming the streets with guide book in hand and concentrating mostly on avoiding the dog poop instead of enjoying the skyline, this bike tour was extremely refreshing. The guide was knowledgeable and gave interesting facts without making you feel like you were back in a high school history class. Some of the highlights included Plaza de Mayo, Cementerio de la Recoleta, San Telmo and a stop in Puerto Madero for an authentic Parrilla sandwich. Make sure you start your trip with a Biking Buenos Aires tour!

Great day exploring the city. Just got back from the north city bike tour. We had a great afternoon. Our guide, Rodrigo was terrific, made us feel safe riding our bikes around the city and taught us so much interesting info about the city. We were able to get off our bikes and go an explore sights, which was great. Everyone at Biking Buenos Aires was so friendly and made the experience so terrific. Would recommend this to anyone visiting BA.

Excellent bike tour-full city!. The guys were lovely. The tour was very comprehensive. It was a wonderful day out. The lunch in Puerto Malero was great!! Barely felt like we were on the bikes- and they were very comfy bikes to cycle on!! Highly recommended!

Love me some Biking Buenos Aires Boys (and Girls;). My US family came to visit me in Buenos Aires and I wanted them to get to know the city I had been living, partying and playing in for three months. But as a gringa myself, I enlisted the help of these professionals for the Full Day Bike Tour. They were absolutely Amazing!Even with half of us starting off pretty hung over and sleep-deprived, we had a blast. They showed us the many wonders the city has to offer as well as the hidden gems. The guides were extremely knowledgable and obviously passionate about their jobs and country. All of them spoke English fluently and made us feel safe when biking through the busier parts of the tour. Lunch was also a treat. We all got to sit down, relax and enjoy local favorites like choripan and milanesa. Afterwards we tasted Argentine's drink of choice- a tea called maté. The guides told us the history behind it and even how to drink it properly. Overall, it was a great experience. The 6 hours flew by and we all learned so much. I would recommend it to anyone. Job well done guys! Besos

The best part about my vacation!. We had been in Buenos Aires for 2 days, getting lost and sightseeing, hailing taxis to get back to the hotel. In 6 hours we saw more of Buenos Aires than we ever would have on our own. The guides were knowledgeable, friendly, spoke great English, but were probably tri-lingual. We were in some heavy traffic areas at times, but they always covered our front, sides and backsides. Even if it had cost double, it would have been the best deal around. Thank you! Thank you Robin, Conrad, Haley, and Aussie guy that's really an Argentine :)Our family loved it. Billie Hodges

Great and green way to learn the history and attractions of Buenos Aires. These guys were great. We biked all over the city of Buenos Aires, thru parks and monuments. Robin and Willy are very knowledgeable about the history and barrios of BA. Biking is the best way to sight see. You cover so much more ground than walking, you're out in the sunshine and you can go at your own pace, unlike a tour bus. These guys took me all over, showed me the trendy districts as well as developing areas. We stopped and drank Mate, a traditional South American tea, then later had a Parrilla (grilled) sandwich in a park. At the end of the tour, we stopped in the Bar El Federal for micro brews. After riding all thru the city, those beers hit the spot. I enjoyed my tour of the South of BA so much, I came back and did the northern tour Biking BA offers, 2 weeks later. This is a really excellent way to travel. These guys do a great job. It is a must do, here, and probably any other city that you visit.

GREAT way to see Buenos Aires!. I've been to Buenos Aires a number of times and seen quite a bit of it, mostly on foot or minivan, but there's always more to see. This allows you to see BA a little more up close than riding around in a minivan, while covering substantially more ground (and sights) than you could on foot. The guides were considerate and gracious.

Biking Buenos Aires is the Best!. I have been on not one but TWO bike tours with biking BA!! Not only are they a great way to relax and see the city the guides and owners of the company are the nicest most helpful people around! Keep up the good work biking BA! I highly suggest everyone take one of their tours!

Perfect way to see the CITY!. These guys are the best! I actually used them for Masa Critica (Critical Mass) and they let me rent a bike and made sure I was well taken care of. The bike itself was in great condition and I was lucky enough to get Cosmo (they have special names for the bikes). They made sure that we all stuck together or at least knew where to meet up or how to get ahold of them if we were to seperate (considering the hundreds of people those possibilities were high). I recommend this to anyone and everyone who is interested in having a great day and spending it with great tour guides! I couldnt recommend this more!

I love Biking BA!. I highly recommend Biking Buenos Aires for anyone visiting or living in Buenos Aires. I recently went on the tour of San Telmo, Puerto Madero, and La Boca with friends who live here and with some friends of ours that were visiting and seeing the city for the first time. The tour was awesome! I saw the city in a totally new way, even after over a year of living in Buenos Aires. The bikes are brand new (equipped with baskets, bells, name plates, and helmets), and the routes are scenic and safe. And, the tour guides are great - super knowledgeable, they make sure you feel safe while biking, we had a really fun time, and ate yummy bandiola sandwiches. Definitely check out Biking Buenos Aires!
great tour!. the bike tour with Biking BA was great! the guides are knowledgeable and fun. there is no better way to see Buenos Aires than by bike! I would highly recommend them!

The Best of Buenos Aires by Bike. We took 3 walking tours in Buenos Aires, all of which were very good, but the most fun tour was the one we took by bike. The bikes are brand new with both baskets and rear racks, padded handlebars, very comfortable seats, and bells used to alert pedestrians of your approach. Helmets are provided and the guides bring water, rain ponchos, first aid gear, and the makings of mate (the local tea) which we enjoyed during a rest stop on the shores of the Rio de la Plata in the Reseva. The tour started and ended in San Telmo and lasted about 4 hours, but we stopped often (Casa Rosada, Puerto Madero for sandwiches, La Boca to see the soccer stadium and the colorful neighborhood) so we didn't experience any leg or fanny fatigue. There are new bike paths throughout the city which made riding in congested traffic areas easier, but most of the tour was away from busy streets. The guides are enthusiastic, knowledgeable, humorous, helpful and patient (we stopped often to take photos). The day we went one guide was a native English speaker and the other spoke Spanish and French as well as perfect English. We had such fun as a group that we all went to a pub after the tour where we agreed that seeing Buenos Aires by bike was the best!
